28.description: This new man they hired is in his 70s. I'm not discriminating but he can't hear so maybe he should have a job other than cashier. Also, he doesn't party attention. I paid with a gift card my friend gave me, she didn't know how much was on it.,I waited for the guy to offer me a receipt or just give me an ok on the card. I stood there like an idiot but he already switched to someone else. Then people in the line called me back and I went back like an idiot after he loudly announced that there wad no money on the card. Everyone looked at me like I was trying to get away with not paying. he should pay more attention and not just get away with stuff because he is old.

1.description: Do not go to this Starbucks. Never seem such disrespect shown by an employee before... my gf walked in ordering a coffee. When asked what her name was (usual protocol) the barista said, "you don't look like a Jessica." My gf is Chinese/Mexican.... he then proceeded with, "you look more like a Ming or a Ling.. or a Ming-Ling".... visibly upset, my gf silently waited for her coffee (already paid) the barista further demonstrated his utter ignorance, "don't be upset, I'm just stereotyping."Seriously Starbucks, classy employees you have there...If I could give it 0 stars.. I would. This place has forever kept me from your beverages. I will be taking my patronage elsewhere.

9.description: Hello  fellow Starbucks this place is so cool I am here now there website  says they  are open till 3:00 am but the staff just told me they  are open 24/7 and  right of Michigan  ave fantastic  so stop on in.

29.description: A very efficient Starbucks! During the morning rush, you tell your order to a guy with a headset, before you even reach the counter. Runs very smoothly.

23.description: I don't really review places like Starbucks, people are going to go there regardless of what I say. But I felt like I should really let people know how nice, quick and attentive the people who work here are. My boyfriend stopped in to get us coffee one morning and while pouring the coffee the barista spilled scalding hot coffee on her arm in some freak accident. She didn't utter a peep, smiled on through it and wiped it off and rang him up, (I hope she's OK!) But who in the hell is nice to a customer after seriously getting hurt? That girl is.  Seriously though, weeks later, I hope she's OK! I've also dealt with the older gentleman who works there and he's really awesome.  Unlike Maya P.'s experience, I gave him my card and he rang it up with ease, no problem, was super nice, quick and didn't have a problem hearing or answering my questions about free refills with a registered Starbucks Card. In my experience as a customer (not a barista, I don't have the social or emotional capacity for that) sometimes it's not always the person behind the counter that has a problem sometimes it's the customer. We all have off days, suggesting someone be assigned new tasks because you *feel" like they had one is a bit outrageous. Not to pick on anyone but I REALLY like that guy, and seeing him being called out for "being elderly"  or having some "elderly induced ailment" like hearing loss while also stating that they didn't ask for a receipt or card balance  and just stood there really miffs me, especially considering how great he was.

5.description: I ordered a drink, they got it wrong. I told the barista and he was like "oh, sorry, I know what you wanted." I'm thinking ok great, they're on it." Then - the supervisor comes over and says that I owe them an additional .60 cents. Really, You get the order wrong then you ask me to pay for it because when I said heavy  whipping cream you put whipped cream in my coffee? Really? Not only was the supervisor rude, she was unapologetic. Very "off brand" experience from the supervisor. The barista was lovely, however.Perhaps they should keep in mind that given their locale, some people are actually visit their dying relatives and need a kind interaction. It's a hospital Starbucks - I would expect some COMPASSION.

31.description: This is the only Starbucks I visit because I never feel like I'm inconveniencing the people that work there, can't say that for other Starbucks. It's inside Northwestern Hospital so the lines can get pretty long. They move pretty fast and they are always nice.

25.description: My home away from home !!  Love the staff and love the service ! gotta love 24hours when I'm working at the hospital !

12.description: I went in at night and maybe the 2 people working were tired, or simply hated life.  They were slow, rude and seemed irritated to be waiting on me.  I ordered the blackberry mojito shaken ice tea.  I noticed that advertisement said it had lemonade in it.  I asked the guy if there was a lot of lemonade because I didn't care for to much. He just sorta stared at me and after a minute said "yeah there is lemonade in it"  I repeated my question and he acted like he was just stupid? For lack of a better word.  I told him I wanted a grande and when he started ringing in my order he repeated it back "ice peach green tea, venti". I said NO I ordered the blackberry mojito and a grande.  The girl making it clearly was just as unpleasant.  She offered no communication and when my drink was done she put it in the counter...no calling my name, the name of the drink....nothing. If I ever find myself needing/wanting a Starbucks this late again I will Pass before I go back to this location

21.description: Absolutely clutch if you work in the hospital or live in the area. Caffeine 24/7.

16.description: Fast & convenient.... and very close to my inlaw's condo...... They are always busy, and keep the line moving.... They carry just about all the the pastry goods... except for anything that needs to be heated up! (Please get one of those ovens soon, I was dying for one of those great egg sandwiches yesterday morning!) They also are open for 24/7 for the medical staff there at Northwestern Hospital.... and for those in the are just needing a cup of Joe!I am happy I found them not so long ago.... (But get one of those ovens!)

17.description: Always open, clover machines, reserve blends, this Starbucks has it all.

10.description: Starbucks is starbucks, but the extended hours and friendly service at this location definitely makes it stand out. Even when they're super busy in the morning, I find that they're pretty well organized and I never have to wait too long for my drink. The caffeine is absolutely necessary to help me power through med school.

11.description: This place is going to get me through med school... open 24 hours! For those 4am caffeine cravings. The only catch is that if you want to study there, the lights go dim at 9pm, making it hard to stay awake.  Oh and if you can, avoid the peak times of 8, 9 and 10am. Or you'll be greeted with a looooong line,

26.description: Like many hardcore Yelpers, I love great coffee at quirky, locally owned coffee shops. Absent that, this Starbucks meets THREE of my road warrior requirements: (1) It's open 24 hours; (2) It has plenty of room to spread out and plug in, if you need a workspace to get something done before you head to your next appointment (or flight);(3) It stocks Starbucks' full food menu, so you can get a decent lunch or snackAnd it's easy to hail a cab because it's within a couple blocks of Michigan Avenue.

27.description: So, being a college student, I have many nights where I need to stay up late. Starbucks is always one of my first choices outside university libraries. This location is great because its relatively quiet and peaceful, and open 24/7.I didn't think I'd ever write a review for a Starbucks, but feel I that the outstanding service calls for itRyan, one of the baristas and cashiers recommended a coffee brewed by a machine (I believe it to be called the "Clover"). What it does is brew their specialty coffee in a cup sized serving. I recommend trying a regular coffee (or iced) using the other specialty roasts.When I asked for something delicious with a good amount of caffeine, he recommended the blonde roast ( my recent favorite). I had a Iced (blonde roast) coffee, sweetened, with soy milk. Best  coffee I've had in a while!Ryan's enthusiasm in his recommendation made my Gf and I's experience pleasant, and he even made us laugh a few times.Thanks Again!

0.description: The workers here are some of the nicest I've ever come across at a Starbucks. They have always been upbeat when I've gone through at all times of the morning, afternoon and night. The fact that they are open from 4:30a.m to 3:00a.m is amazeBALLS and extremely smart from a business perspective. I mean think about how much money this location brings in from family & friends visiting loved ones overnight, employees from all different departments of the hospital working the night shift, students pulling all-nighters and neighborhood dwellers like me who randomly need their Starbucks fix at odd hours.Definitely a fan and I plan on becoming the Duke of this Starbucks! LOL :-)

20.description: Their coffee is fine, their music is absolutely dreadful, their playlist doesn't even make sense

19.description: Horrible service every time I go. Always forgetting my order. I always seem to be asking if they can check on my order. I work at nmh so it's convenient, but c'mon, nmh has some standards to uphold. This place is a joke.

33.description: This Starbucks kiosk is conveniently hidden inside  the south east corner of the NU Med school building at 251 E Huron.  Sure, it's only starbucks, but it's a fantastic find for the undercaffeinated mba student who's sick of the burnt "Cafe Kellogg" coffee.

2.description: Awful and unprofessional! I stopped at this Starbucks 12/31/15 around 7:30 am. My order was very simple, a tall blonde roast. At this time I was asked to step to the side and wait for my coffee which I had no problem doing until I noticed the flow of people who came way after me getting their drinks while I was still waiting. During my waiting period I noticed that the employee who took my order was too busy talking to another customer who was either a friend or regular patron that she was not paying attention and had forgotten my order. They were engaged in conversation and I even heard the employee offer up a free breakfast sandwich and proceed to go make it. I don't care about employees giving out free food but what I do care about is having a paying customer waiting while you do so. I finally went to the counter and asked about my tall blonde roast which was obviously forgotten about and I was told to go to the other side of the counter, which I did only two have two more people served ahead of me before I finally got my coffee. I will never go to this location again!!!!!!!!!! too bad zero stars is not an option because I would like my 1 star back.

34.description: I cannot believe this hasn't yet been reviewed! This place is open 23 (or 24?) hours a day!Oh no - I might have just ruined it for everyone that works and goes to school here.

32.description: Rachel, Sarah, Jennifer, and all the other employees at this location have been kind and courteous to me every time I've gone here, which is very often. No matter how long the line is, if I see Rachel and Sarah working the espresso machine, I know the line will go very quickly. I've had bad experiences at other Starbucks in this neighborhood, so I go out of my way to go here when I need my fix.

18.description: Worst Starbucks I've ever been to. Even though its the most convenient place for me to get coffee, and I went there almost every day for several months, I've just stopped going to this starbucks because of the terrible service, and instead visit au bon pain for coffee in a pinch ,or go a few blocks away to the Starbucks on Ontario.Sometimes, the employees put out a few drinks and don't call out what they are, and if you ask if one of them is your drink, they will either legitimately YELL at you, or completely ignore you. I've gotten the wrong drink three times because of this, and when I tried to tell them, they were extremely rude about giving me the drink i'd ordered. A couple of times, they ran out of an ingredient, but didn't say so before charging me for a drink (I can't tell you how many times I've ordered a blonde roast or bold coffee and paid for it, only for them to tell me they don't have it).Also FYI, they don't have a toaster, so don't expect a toasted bagel.

13.description: Ugh! I love Starbucks but this location is the worst! The line is always long and the staff are rude and snobby. Get over yourself, you work at a coffee shop!! Also, I have never waited less than 7 minutes to get my drink. They have about a 50% accuracy rate on making it correctly too. I like the convenience of having this right here at work, but this is poorly run.

4.description: My favorite pick me upper morning and afternoon.  Service is always quick and friendly!

24.description: 24/7 Caffeination!!!If you're like me, then I stop in for a 3am hot cocoa break, followed by a post-work congratulatory cocoa for surviving through the night. There's usually a fairly decent line in the a.m. as you place an order through someone wearing a drive-thru-esque headpiece.You know deadlines/exams are coming up when there are people scattered nearby diligently studying. It gets a little too dim for my liking at 3am, but decent if you are in need of a quiet place at odd hours.

6.description: I absolutely love this Starbucks location! It was kind of tricky getting in since my friend and I couldn't find the main entrance but sure enough it is the main entrance of the hospital. The staff is so nice and boy, they know how to make good drinks even at 2 a.m.! My friend tried their tiramisu latte, and he absolutely loved it! I just got my dark black coffee. I like how you can use your Starbucks card here but be aware, they don't follow any of the promos! So sad. If you are looking for a good spot to study, this location is the perfect place! It has free wifi, good drinks, comfy seats as well as counter seats! It has such an academic vibe to it that it just makes it perfect! I definitely recommend this Starbucks.

22.description: Worst Starbucks I've ever been to. Even though its the most convenient place for me to get coffee, and I went there almost every day for several months, I've just stopped going to this starbucks because of the terrible service, and instead visit au bon pain for coffee in a pinch ,or go a few blocks away to the Starbucks on Ontario.Sometimes, the employees put out a few drinks and don't call out what they are, and if you ask if one of them is your drink, they will either legitimately YELL at you, or completely ignore you. I've gotten the wrong drink three times because of this, and when I tried to tell them, they were extremely rude about giving me the drink i'd ordered. A couple of times, they ran out of an ingredient, but didn't say so before charging me for a drink (I can't tell you how many times I've ordered a blonde roast or bold coffee and paid for it, only for them to tell me they don't have it).Also FYI, they don't have a toaster, so don't expect a toasted bagel.

15.description: Sometimes all you need to get through a rough 12 hour shift is that caffeine pick-me-up and a sympathetic Starbucks employee to make it for you! The drinks are very consistent, and the service is prompt.  Shout out to Sid for comic relief every time I visit!

7.description: Starbucks 24/7. Enough said. Just tried their new tiramisu latte and I wasn't disappointed. Of course my favorite still and will always be white chocolate mocha. Location is great here because of the hospital, keeps options open with so many locations to get coffee in this huge hospital.

8.description: One of the best Starbucks locations ! The staff are super friendly and already have your order ready when getting to the counter . Makes for a great way to start your day !

30.description: This is a 24 hour Starbucks, and the closest one to my place. Because this is located on the ground floor of Northwestern Memorial, the people watching is pretty interesting - lots of dudes frantically running around in scrubs. I don't like that there aren't very many outlets for laptops here, though. And when I was here at 10 p.m., it was almost totally deserted... and I much prefer the atmosphere at the Rush/Walton Starbucks, which is packed and energetic at 10 p.m. This place just makes me feel sleeeepy..I wasn't able to find a Starbucks wireless network here, but I was able to connect for free to the "NMHGUEST" network instead.

3.description: It's the only 24-hr Starbucks remotely in vicinity, and the coffee and espresso drinks are very well-crafted (like most downtown Starbucks). And there is an academic vibe, with med students studying for boards and hospital employees frequenting the location (though occasionally homeless people hanging out). My only other contention is that sometimes some of the employees can be rude. Unlike most downtown Chicago Starbucks, where the employees are ridiculously nice.

14.description: 24/7 Caffeination!!!If you're like me, then I stop in for a 3am hot cocoa break, followed by a post-work congratulatory cocoa for surviving through the night. There's usually a fairly decent line in the a.m. as you place an order through someone wearing a drive-thru-esque headpiece.You know deadlines/exams are coming up when there are people scattered nearby diligently studying. It gets a little too dim for my liking at 3am, but decent if you are in need of a quiet place at odd hours.

1.description: Tattoo removal session #3 in progress......  Once again I am excited knowing that my end result will be a great one!  Do not hesitate to contact them if you are interested in removing any unwanted ink from your body.  I know that there is someone out there who is looking for a clean, sanitized facility with professionally trained staff that are ready to help you achieve your long desired goals!

2.description: Nice staff and the ' Dr. Land team ' know their business  well when it comes to cosmetic laser procedures .  I feel at ease here and medically confident having laser procedures performed at my Physician's  office. The best news yet, is that their lasers are brand new with latest technology . I know that aesthetically desirable and long lasting results are contingent on laser functionality which is very important  to me with laser hair removal and tattoo removal.

0.description: I bought a Groupon for laser Hair Removal after struggling with dark hair and pale skin (which turns out to be the best combo for laser).I had no idea how awesome it would be! After two weeks, all the hair in my desired area was gone! I was amazed. I have never been more thrilled about the non-existence of hair before, lol. I actually think I might be addicted to this procedure now because of how well it works. In regards of the pain, it was very minimal... It felt as though it was a small warm pinch. Dr. Land was professional and made me feel very comfortable.

58.description: We found this restaurant hidden about 2 minutes from our hotel, it was the first place we ate at once we got to Chicago! The sweet potato fries were beyond AMAZING, they were so good and very crispy and crunchy but with all the taste. The burger was also amazing, I created my own because the other ones didn't seem to catch my attention but the burger was amazing as well. The onion rings were also delicious and very cripsy! Overall, I recommend you eat here if you can!

56.description: Excellent service and staff was extremely congenial...comped dessert was a nice touch as well.  Burgers, pizza, and specialty fries will do wonders for a hungry soul.  Einbecker NA beer was new for me (a bit hoppy).

29.description: A buddy of mine lives not too far from this joint and he thought it would be a good idea to come here for lunch. I've never tried it but any place with burger in the title is an easy sell for me.It was pretty nice out so we sat on the patio to enjoy. Our server Aoife who was pretty quiet came over and took our order. I got the bistro burger which came with lettuce, tomato, and pickles along with something called bistro sauce...I never figured out what that was but that burger was good as fuck! I was able to choose a cheese and I went with the creamy brie which definitely set that mf off! Definitely a burger to be reckoned with as it was a nice size and quite juicy...I like it that way!

42.description: I went here with my family while we were in Chicago for the first time! We were seated immediately and our server was so warm and outgoing! We had the bistro burger and veggie burger, both were great! Would come here again

23.description: Not sure how they only have 3 stars. The burgers alone are delicious if you like to keep it simple.If you like a unique twist to your already fantastic burger they have a variety of choices on the menu from a burger with Fried Mac n Cheese to Pork Belly with PB&J.Top the fantastic food with friendly and efficient service and you've got yourself a great value.Cheers to the Chef for keeping it fresh!

47.description: extremely embarrassed!! I brought my office of 15 people to dine today from Northwestern Memorial Hosp.  Six  of the lunch entrees were not correct as ordered or not cooked properly.  Had to send back an entree and still did not come back correct for the reason it was returned.  As a group we will not be returning.  We waited 45 mins. for our meals to be prepared and brought to the table.   The wait and inaccuracy was unacceptable.  Waitress was very nice.  Just found out 2 more orders were incorrect.  so a total of 8 meals were not prepared properly or as requested.  Very disappointing.

8.description: We decided to give them another chance when we saw Groupon was offering dinner plus wine for $35. We went today during the second half of the Bears game. Our server was very good and any disappointments I might have with the kitchen, is of course, not his fault. The wait was excruciating long for our bbq chicken flatbread and when it did show up, it looked very sloppy. It appeared thrown together & the crust undercooked. I would not recommend it.We also ordered two of the house "bistro burgers" and both were very good. Finally something to enjoy. The beef was a good portion & the house made bun was soft and held the weight of the beef, much better than when they first opened. The side order of onion rings were over cooked & quite possibly re-fried before coming out. I did notice the bartender seemed to be a lot of fun & made the round amongst the regulars. He brought a festive atmosphere to the place. I would say Chef's Burger Bistro is a solid burger joint.

31.description: I knew something was off the moment we walked in, and were seated at a table that was both wobbly and had a booth where no one was actually facing each other.I got the Lamb Burger, and it was very tangy and not very tasty. I ate half the burger before I gave up, it was just not good at all.Pretty good truffle frites though.

34.description: We 4 girls stopped in for lunch. We ordered the bistro burger, lamb and vegetarian burger.  All 3 burgers were great.  Our sides were onion rings and truffle frites. Our server was very informative and charismatic

16.description: Yowza!  This place is jumping!  And what I thought was going to be a casual  burger joint- turned out to be a happening place with a great patio, a full bar and some really good tasting food!Located where Blackies once stood, Chefs Burger Bistro offers up some pretty tasty burgers ( don't like beef?  Try kangaroo, camel or boar instead.  Yep!  I said kangaroo!!). Crazy, right?We went on a sunny Friday afternoon and this place was packed!  After about a 20 minute wait they found us a table for 4 and we were off and running!The decor is quite nice with big circular booths lining the bar area and high tops scattered about.  Hanging over the busy bar are these ruby red fixtures that are suggestive without being overt.  Upstairs- the rooms would be perfect for a party with huge windows open to the patio and skylights letting in the sunshine.  Big globe lights add a contemporary flair.We started with the shrimp ceviche- a little bland but still good.  But then on to the star of the show, the burgers!  And as good as the burgers were- know that they come served on these artisan rolls that are baked in house 3 times daily.  Delicious!I tasted the 50/50 (a burger made with 50% ground bacon and beef) which was the winner at our table for overall taste.  The boar burger was good but it came pretty rare for our table who liked things cooked a little more.  And the camel and kangaroo burger were both lean and tasty.As a side- we went with the duck fat fries and these were delicious!Service was spot on given how busy it was and management stopped by a couple of times to make sure we were all enjoying ourselves!Don't think that because it's a burger place that this is a cheap date.  Average check at our table was $25 a person and no one had a drink.  Guess those camels and kangaroos demand a high price!So if you are a burger lover- check out Chef's Burger Bistro!  Your taste buds will thank me!

13.description: We waited a few minutes to be seated on a Saturday evening on their nice outdoor patio. They have a huge space, two large floors of a building. I ordered a veggie burger, which featured a savory I think bean-based patty--nothing to write home about, but decently satisfying. I liked their bun bread, which is soft and rich. The boy got the turkey burger, which looked like a pretty sizable patty and thus a good deal, as all their burgers are ~$10-15. All the servers were pretty chatty, which was amusing.

11.description: Was tooling around the area with a group and decided to give this place a try.  Seated us pretty quick and thankfully turned the music in our side room down to a mild roar.  So 4 stars four our waitress.  Burgers were good but of the handful of burger choices the lamb and another burger were sold out.  Shame because the lamb burger sounded good.   Had the burger with an egg and manchego? cheese.  Asked for medium.  Got medium well. At least the meat seemed quality.  Price was high but the cost of the fries was silly.  Think McDonald small for 3 bucks. Good fries but with the cost of the burger seemed weird.  Beers range from 5 bucks all the way up to "your joking right?"Best part of the night was when a well dress maybe Russian hostess helped deliver the food to the wrong place setting only to accuse us of swapping seats.  Might have been offended if it wasn't so hilarious.  Might be back to try a lamb burger but would rather keep looking for a burger bar.

39.description: Good gourmet burgers. For a change I had the lamb burger they got to offer. The sauce offered with the burger was pretty amazing.

37.description: BEST BURGER IN TOWN the service is great and the burgers are phenomenal. I recommend getting the wings as an appetizer, and the bistro burger, in my opinion the bistro burger is the best burger in Chicago. Love it! Overall great restraunt!

0.description: Such a good happy hour. Especially the 50c wings and $2 sliders. The sliders come with a side included!! How good is that deal??I've read some of the negative reviews here and while I admit the service can be a little hit/miss and this place can be quite the tourist trap (I mean, come on, it's halfway between michigan avenue and navy pier), it's pretty stinkn good. The American Burger is a personal favorite, with a chunk of mac and cheese, bacon and of course burger meat!The beers are nothing to jump up about but if you stick with the happy hour, they do come at a pretty decent value for the area.

38.description: I really enjoy coming here for a plate of indulgence. I love hamburgers and they definitely know how to take the average and make it fantastic. Flavors you would not think of putting together (lamb burger) are combine to create a memorable dining pleasure. Each burger is unique and no one flavor over powers the burger. You enjoy the meat, along with seasoning, and the toppings. So many places over do one flavor which is all you taste. Not here. Great balance.  The duck fat fries are outstanding. Wings are great and service excellent. They make their own buns which illustrates the attention given to every part of the burger. For the price the value is superb.

51.description: Came here for a private event and was highly disappointed. We were served a salad that consisted of lettuce. Lettuce. No tomatoes. No cucumbers. Not even a carrot. The next course was pasta. Semi warm pasta that tasted like it was made with jarred sauce. My friend, who is gluten free, was served a bowl of bland risotto that left an awful after taste. Approximately 3 hours later, and we are waiting for the main course. My hopes are not high. My jack and ginger and the chocolate cake shots have been the highlight of my evening.Edit: got our main course. Our table of 12 received 10 thinly sliced, cold pieces of beef, some mashed potatoes, and soggy asparagus.

27.description: I would like to believe that I'm some kind of burger connoisseur, but I'm probably not... regardless this place makes a pretty nice burger.  I ordered the Bistro Burger as is, no special instructions other than being cooked to medium.  The meat was perfectly seasoned.  The onions were also perfect.  Usually they put too many on or they are too crisp and fall off after the ring is broken but these were done right (cooked down slightly I believe).  Also the romaine lettuce, fresh pickles, and brioche bun were a nice touch.  I ordered a side of fries which were also good, but nothing about them really stood out.  Next time I'll opt for the onion rings which someone else at my table ordered.  They were delicious.I'll definitely add this to my recommended list of restaurants for burgers in Chicago.  My only caveat is that it will cost you like $12/burger, $4/fries which seems a bit high, but then again this is downtown Chicago, so it's really not that bad.

32.description: not sure why the service was so bad. but wow. So terrible. The food was alright after they finally got my girlfriends burger correct. And the bartender was the best part. But dude, the service. The manager ended up being our  waiter and his attitude was appaling. then tried to save his behind at the end by offering free dessert. nice touch but overall I was still very dissapointed.

54.description: YUCK, YUCK, YUCK, YUCK, YUCK!!! I give this place a 5-Yuck rating. First, if you order delivery, plan on your order being wrong and the restaurant not caring at all that they just threw something at you that you did not order and would not eat (but your incorrect order will be delivered super speedy! Yay)... Have you ever seen those FB posts "You had one job... Epic fails," that is Chef's Burger Bistro. If you have a food allergy BEWARE, they do not adhere to a standard that would involve not killing you via anaphylaxis. Second, the fried pickles are not pickles, they are cucumbers (no vinegar, literally, cucumber) in a deep fried coating with zero seasoning. The ranch is a mayo-tartar combo that promptly made me vomit after two bites. The burger bun is the consistency of that "yoga-mat" bread and has a rubbery texture and appearance. The "Bistro Secret Sauce" is mayo, thousand island, and pickle bits and smells like egg salad that's been left out on a hot summer day. The meat was falling apart because whatever mystery grade beef they use has a dry, particle consistency and can not hold form like a cooked beef patty should. So the summary of this review is: If you enjoy excessive, warm, spoiled mayonnaise, not getting what you ordered, and paying to be poisoned at a super fast delivery speed- This is the place for you! If you actually value customer service, good food, and getting what you paid for- do not ever order from or eat at this place. Thanks Chef's Burger Bistro for giving me inedible food and involuntary bulimia! EPIC FAIL #EpicFail

48.description: Lamb burgers are delicious here. It's light and definitely will hit the spot. I didn't walk out stuffed and unable to move. A+

44.description: Service was not impressive to start with, it's obvious they were understaffed. Our appetizer, chicken wings was undercooked; practically half raw. We informed the server and at least her attitude was much nicer after that.  She took it back and mentioned it'll be on her. The entrée was decent, ordered bistro burger. When they brought the chicken wings, it was undercooked AGAIN! I'm completely speechless and definitely never been served undercooked food twice (same dish?!). The server apologized, do understand it's not her fault. It's the kitchen. But definitely would NOT recommend this place. Don't waste your money at this place. The sangria tasted like sugar water, undercooked appetizer (twice!!!), ok burger...Grateful the server was apologetic though. But again, don't waste your money and time at this place!

24.description: This is one of the best little neighborhood bars. The outdoor area is the perfect chill spot and the staff is extremely friendly. Not to mention Tommy--the best most sassy fabulous bartender east of Michigan Avenue!

7.description: A buddy of mine lives not too far from this joint and he thought it would be a good idea to come here for lunch. I've never tried it but any place with burger in the title is an easy sell for me.It was pretty nice out so we sat on the patio to enjoy. Our server Aoife who was pretty quiet came over and took our order. I got the bistro burger which came with lettuce, tomato, and pickles along with something called bistro sauce...I never figured out what that was but that burger was good as fuck! I was able to choose a cheese and I went with the creamy brie which definitely set that mf off! Definitely a burger to be reckoned with as it was a nice size and quite juicy...I like it that way!

49.description: Had the Paris burger with sweet potato fries. Asked to have my burger cooked medium..came cooked well. Dry and tasteless meat. Fries were a lil soggy. Friend had to send her order back which resulted in making my food colder waiting for hers to be prepared as asked. Won't be back,

40.description: We waited a few minutes to be seated on a Saturday evening on their nice outdoor patio. They have a huge space, two large floors of a building. I ordered a veggie burger, which featured a savory I think bean-based patty--nothing to write home about, but decently satisfying. I liked their bun bread, which is soft and rich. The boy got the turkey burger, which looked like a pretty sizable patty and thus a good deal, as all their burgers are ~$10-15. All the servers were pretty chatty, which was amusing.

53.description: Really good place in downtown Chicago...Excellent burger. .perfect medium. ..  nice beer...great service. ...

30.description: My friends and I were in the city for the day to visit Navy Pier and needed a place to eat. We found this place while we walked away from the pier and decided we were feeling burgers. First off, the table we sat at was a small booth that had us all awkwardly facing the same direction. If you like that, then this is the place for you! Service was good and the waitress was very nice. Onto the food... We ordered lamb burgers, the bistro burger, onion rings, and truffle frites. All the burgers looked good to begin with, but the taste was a whole new story. All our burgers tasted mushy on the inside and was extremely off putting. I'd equate the texture to wet dog food. The onion rings were fairly decent, until I ate another ring that was doused in salt. Poorly seasoned, but ok. The saving grace was the truffle frites. They were delicious and had a huge portion. Overall if you want a poor burger and severely overpriced menu items, then I totally recommend this place. Otherwise, pick any other place.

46.description: I read the reviews about this restaurant before going and was disappointed to see the negative review about the vegetarian burger, overall the reviews were good.  I decided to go and even ordered the vegetarian burger. I'm glad I did because it was delicious!  I spoke with my server and was informed they just changed their menu and that includes many new choices. I witnessed the chef bringing out their new menu items and asking customers to try the new items.  Great experience!

1.description: I ordered a burger - there were several options for more creative burgers, a bison burger, and vegan options. My burger was one of the best I have had in Chicago - sorry Chi town, Minneapolis destroys you when it comes to burgers still.I would have said this was 4 stars, but I ordered the onion rings. They were so bland I only ate two and let the waiter take the rest. The wait staff hardly seemed to notice I was disappointed. In fact I do not think they would have cared.In sum, the burgers are good, the sides are bland, and it is generally expensive for what you get. Maybe it is better for happy hour.

55.description: I would say that Burger Bistro is just fine...and it commits the crimes that most Loop/River North/Streeterville burger places commit as well.Stopped by for a lunch reservation yesterday.  Fairly quiet for a 60-degree Monday.  We had a half-moon-shaped booth and I ordered the Bistro Burger Your Way medium rare with cheddar, lettuce, tomatoes and onions.  My wife and I split the onion rings (fine) and the salted caramel shake (tasty, not mind-blowing).The burger itself was cooked closer to medium/medium-well...but the Crimes Against Humanity here are the prices for the burger and then the fact that those prices don't include fries.  So, as is, you are looking at about $16-$17 for a burger with fries here.  Sorry, not even close!I might come back with friends who work close to this location, but Chicago has a ton of great burger places that are cheaper!

9.description: Came here with a friend to use a Groupon, and we were well satisfied, but not blown away. The Groupon gave us the opportunity to have a drink each, share an app, a burger each, and share a side. That's a lot of food, and it was a very good deal.The beer list is decent, though not all of the beers are described on the menu, which for craft beers, I think is a necessity. At least tell me what kind of ale it is, or if it even is an ale. For our appetizer, we chose one of the flatbreads, which was probably a mistake given we were getting burgers afterwards. We went for the Liguria flatbread and were surprised to find out that those skinny shavings on it were lemon peels, and not cheese. Still, not a bad combination of flavors  with the chicken, roasted red pepper, and pesto. For our side, my friend chose the truffle fries. I don't like the truffle flavor, but I didn't say anything because I didn't really want to fill up on fries anyway. They come on a large plate, with an egg on top (which is not mentioned in the menu description), and you can find some non truffled fries among them, so I had a couple, and they were tasty. We both opted for build your own burgers, because their gourmet offerings all had both appealing and not so appealing toppings mixed together and it didn't seem right to pick them apart, when we could just make our own. I ordered a medium rare burger with brie and an egg. Loved the brie. The burger was perfectly cooked. The egg was a bit overdone. And yet the burger was still messy and impossible to eat as a whole. My friend ordered the special sauce on the side and she could pick hers up. Good to know. By the way, the special sauce is basically thousand island dressing. All in all, it overfed me and I enjoyed it, though it certainly didn't inspire any I have to come back here again cravings. The atmosphere itself was alright. The patio was still open and had a few groups out in it. But the restaurant was basically empty. Service was attentive, but then a regular walked in and created a lot of noise right next to us with the bartender, which was distracting and unpleasant. I'm all for old friends reuniting, but not when they're shouting at each other in a small space. With so many other excellent burger options around, I'm not sure I'd come running back.

26.description: This place major sucks, my husband and I came to eat here hoping to have amazing burgers but we were disappointed. Let me start with the service, our waitress never smiled at us wasn't helpful at all, but when we saw she was serving a all white family's table she was giggling smiling and stuff. We never got a refill on our drinks, the burgers are small for the price they ask for, ooohh the fries come separate. When we finally got our burgers 35 minutes after we order, they were a huge disappointment, mushy on the inside it was just gross . Ugh such a horrible experience in this place. Never coming back here.

25.description: This place was near our hotel and we liked the look of the outdoor patio so we made reservations for 7 people for 6 pm.    We knew we were running late so we called at 5 pm and asked if we could push back to 6:30 pm.  No problem.  We arrive at 6:30 pm sharp.  "Sorry, we gave your table away.  Our policy is to hold them for 15 mins."   No record of our call.   Hmmmm...odd.  Ok, we decide to wait.  We finally get a table on the very nice patio.  Nice server but really SLOW service.  Appetizer came out with the burgers.  Asked for ketchup for one of the burgers (the rest of us got our little stainless steel cup of ketchup but one of us didn't) and it was 10 minutes before it arrived.   It seemed like 15 minutes because we were halfway through our burgers when it finally arrived.  Had we known, we would have shared our ketchup.   The burgers were pretty good but not amazing.  As someone else pointed out, there are 4 burgers:  a classic, a beef brisket, a lamb and a turkey.  The burgers don't come with any sides.  The homemade coleslaw was lame.  No flavor at all.   The fries were good but small portions.  Everyone else had drinks (wine, sangria, etc.) and I had a coke.  Not one check in to see if I wanted more.  When my glass was empty, it was pulled off the table and that was that.  I drank my water.  They have great bussers who make sure you have plenty of water.  I enjoyed the patio and my burger was ok but I wouldn't come back again.

12.description: I would say that Burger Bistro is just fine...and it commits the crimes that most Loop/River North/Streeterville burger places commit as well.Stopped by for a lunch reservation yesterday.  Fairly quiet for a 60-degree Monday.  We had a half-moon-shaped booth and I ordered the Bistro Burger Your Way medium rare with cheddar, lettuce, tomatoes and onions.  My wife and I split the onion rings (fine) and the salted caramel shake (tasty, not mind-blowing).The burger itself was cooked closer to medium/medium-well...but the Crimes Against Humanity here are the prices for the burger and then the fact that those prices don't include fries.  So, as is, you are looking at about $16-$17 for a burger with fries here.  Sorry, not even close!I might come back with friends who work close to this location, but Chicago has a ton of great burger places that are cheaper!

59.description: I ate here yesterday for the first time and it was amazing! I got a BBQ burger and a Salted Carmel Shake. Both were just so good and I was very satisfied, the overall scenery is nice too, very good looking restaurant/bar.

21.description: Absolutely enjoyed lunch.  Lamb burger, bistro fries and Bistro Salad were great.  The side of seasonal veggies were freakin spectacular!Five stars from The Ross Grouo. GetRossNow.com

17.description: Absolutely enjoyed lunch.  Lamb burger, bistro fries and Bistro Salad were great.  The side of seasonal veggies were freakin spectacular!Five stars from The Ross Grouo. GetRossNow.com

10.description: Service was not impressive to start with, it's obvious they were understaffed. Our appetizer, chicken wings was undercooked; practically half raw. We informed the server and at least her attitude was much nicer after that.  She took it back and mentioned it'll be on her. The entrée was decent, ordered bistro burger. When they brought the chicken wings, it was undercooked AGAIN! I'm completely speechless and definitely never been served undercooked food twice (same dish?!). The server apologized, do understand it's not her fault. It's the kitchen. But definitely would NOT recommend this place. Don't waste your money at this place. The sangria tasted like sugar water, undercooked appetizer (twice!!!), ok burger...Grateful the server was apologetic though. But again, don't waste your money and time at this place!

5.description: Great ambiance, friendly staff. The PBJ Burger was very tasty and the truffle fries were delicious!

3.description: Turkey burger one of my favorites from the menu.  A solid patty, seasoned and cooked well, topped with a thick-cut piece of bacon, and fresh lettuce/tomato.  The garlic aioli isn't a strong flavor, overcome by the bacon and turkey, so you can order without or get ketchup with it if that's your thing.  The side salad is presented nicely, and is light on the dressing (a good thing).  It's already mixed up so the dressing has evenly coated all parts, just a beautiful salad.  Service is on point, especially if you sit at the bar.  The Apex Predator sounded like a boss beer, and lived up to its name with a golden body with a hint of fruit.  Was $7 though, which is high for a beer, even on River North/Streeterville area.

35.description: Decent burgers with nice flavor, but nothing amazing there. The truffle fries were nice albeit a bit more pricey, and made a nice sharing portion for 3. The wings were good, but again nothing out of this world. Service was alright, fairly friendly and responsive. Outdoor seating was pleasant.  The prices originally attracted us, with so many restaurants with ridiculously expensive prices around, but not the best value.  Food was alright, portions were okay, no big complaints though. The fries did come a bit cold, and the vegetables on the burgers seemed sort of just thrown on like fast food. Also be careful, the yelp free dessert offer is valid from 4-6 so don't get your hopes up if you're there at the usual lunch/dinner times (I also didn't see the dessert menu so not too sure what we missed).

19.description: Gourmet crafted burgers at a reasonable price. I was walking downtown Chicago and came across this burger place. I gave the menu a quick glance and was more than enough to give the place a shot. Burgers are sophisticated, including premium ingredients like Spanish Ibérico ham, and are overall well crafted. I order a Wagyu Burger with crispy onion, house sauce and a beet slice. I was overall very happy, I thought the beet gave it s very unique twist. Although the bun was a little dry and not at its best, that's why I give them 4 stars. I would definitely visit this place sometime soon.

28.description: I was very disappointed....took my boyfriend out to lunch for his birthday and it was an awful experience. We looked up the menu on line and was excited to see all the different burger options. When we were given the menu only 4 burgers were in the menu!!!  BUT they only had 3 options for the day, they didn't have any lamb burgers.  When I asked about the burgers that were listed online our server said they hadn't had any of those burgers in months. I also ordered two different glasses of wine that were not available. We ordered the turkey burger with the lamb set up and basic bistro burger medium rare, of course it comes out well done, we also ordered the truffle fries to share. The burgers comes back and it's perfect, but still no fries. Fries finally come out annnnnnnnd they are cold with no taste of truffle. The food took almost 25 minutes, fries 35 minutes!!!You could tell our sever was embarrassed by the food that came out, she stayed away from our table until we asked the busser to bring us a box. Not once did a manager come over to ask how our lunch was or if the second burger was made correctly, he didn't apologize for the fries taking 35 minutes to come out. I was excited to try a new place close to where I work.....should have went to Kuma's

45.description: We live next door to the bistro and it is our go-to spot for casual dining.  But no more!  In the past we enjoyed the excellent Paris burger, duck fat fries, kale salad and interesting cole slaw. Apparently, the chef has moved on and unfortunately the menu has dropped our favorite items. Even the cole slaw is not as interesting or tasty. And the Paris burger, which got rave reviews, is gone. The quality of the beef is still good, but my burger was medium well instead of medium rare, and the new fries (truffle) were okay but were double portion and had an egg atop with no warning of either.  I left much of my meal and there were no questions asked by the staff. Also, we waited much longer for our food than on previous occasions. All in all, A BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!

33.description: I don't know where to begin. The service was terrible from the beginning. We were quickly seated just to watch waiters walk past us without anyone stopping to take our order. Eventually we stopped someone who I assume is the manager and told him we would like to get some food. He responded by saying "well that's good because we have that here" and then just stood and stared at us. At this point we still haven't even gotten our drinks. We then ask if we can order and he rudely took our orders. I said I would start with water but he took the drink menu and never returned. I ended up ordering my drink from the bartender who was extremely pleasant and knew his mixology. The food came out in adequate time however the burger was well done when it was ordered medium rare. A server finally asked how we were doing and I was able to get my burger remade and it ended up coming out fine.The quality of the service at this restaurant does not meet the expected standards I had when coming to a slightly higher end burger bar. I definitely would not come back here unless it was just to have a drink at the bar. There's also files flying around me and landing on me as I type this sitting in the restaurant.Take your business elsewhere.

43.description: Was tooling around the area with a group and decided to give this place a try.  Seated us pretty quick and thankfully turned the music in our side room down to a mild roar.  So 4 stars four our waitress.  Burgers were good but of the handful of burger choices the lamb and another burger were sold out.  Shame because the lamb burger sounded good.   Had the burger with an egg and manchego? cheese.  Asked for medium.  Got medium well. At least the meat seemed quality.  Price was high but the cost of the fries was silly.  Think McDonald small for 3 bucks. Good fries but with the cost of the burger seemed weird.  Beers range from 5 bucks all the way up to "your joking right?"Best part of the night was when a well dress maybe Russian hostess helped deliver the food to the wrong place setting only to accuse us of swapping seats.  Might have been offended if it wasn't so hilarious.  Might be back to try a lamb burger but would rather keep looking for a burger bar.

2.description: I'm all about the happy hour here... Too good of a value and top that off with $10 credits they frequently have available via the Spring Rewards app that you can claim and I typically walk out the door with a $10 bill or less.On my last happy hour adventure, we opted to share 10 wings at $0.50 a pop, 2 sliders at $2 a pop, and a bbq chicken flatbread half priced at $6. That was more than enough food for two and in addition we grabbed two beers each at $4. Bill Total = $34. Bill split between two of us each having $10 credit and we each paid $7. What a deal! Just to recap in case you didn't catch all that, I had 5 wings, 1 slider, half a flatbread, and two pints of beer for $7... The gluttony is too real. Save money! Come during happy hour! 'Til next time, cheers cheers cheers!

18.description: We came here for lunch on a Wednesday,  1pm to avoid the rush. The service was impeccable. Everyone was very nice and helpful and our server made great suggestions. My favorite part was the truffle fries served with an over easy egg. Yum. The burger was decent and everyone else enjoyed their meals. I would like to come back for a happy hour and grab a drink, great ambiance.

41.description: May 26, 2015 UpdateI have to say Chef's Burger Bistro continues to surprise! On our most recent outing, we sampled their new Gunthrop Triple Breaded Chicken Wings - $8 for six wings (would have been enough) $11 for nine wings (enjoy and share). Absolutely amazing! Super crisp exterior and amazingly-juicy meat. Time to rename this place Chef's Super Wings! The wife had a moist and perfectly cooked Lamb Burger, topped with grilled gyro meat, tomato, raw onion and tzatziki sauce - we ate on it for two days. Treat yourself to the truffle fries for only $6 - they are worth the upcharge!

52.description: Asked for medium  rare got well done. I froze while they kept the door open moving furniture  in front of my booth. Service was mediocre. I had to move myself to another table to avoid the chill until an employee noticed and assisted. By the way I was one of few customers so they should have figured it out sooner. My meal was nothing to write home about.

50.description: Just stopped in for a drink. Great bar atmosphere because of the bartender. Menu looks great...too early to eat but may be back!  Food around me looks great too!

4.description: Hidden gem for happy hour; Chef's Burger Bistro has the best happy hour in River North/Loop area. $1 oysters, 50 cent buffalo wings, $2 sliders and half off flat breads. They also have decent $4/5 draft beer specials.Protip: you can pick most of their beef burgers as your $2 slider choice (the "american" has a hunk of mac & cheese & bacon as toppings and the "BBQ" has decent brisket as a topping). The wings aren't very flavorful (and a bit too greasy) but you can never go wrong with $1 oysters and $2 sliders. The oysters come with the standard lemon slices & cocktail sauce plus these pickled cucumbers that add a perfect salty crunch. 5 stars for happy hour!They also have $10 bottomless mimosas on Saturday/Sunday, which is *always* a good idea for brunch.

6.description: May 26, 2015 UpdateI have to say Chef's Burger Bistro continues to surprise! On our most recent outing, we sampled their new Gunthrop Triple Breaded Chicken Wings - $8 for six wings (would have been enough) $11 for nine wings (enjoy and share). Absolutely amazing! Super crisp exterior and amazingly-juicy meat. Time to rename this place Chef's Super Wings! The wife had a moist and perfectly cooked Lamb Burger, topped with grilled gyro meat, tomato, raw onion and tzatziki sauce - we ate on it for two days. Treat yourself to the truffle fries for only $6 - they are worth the upcharge!

22.description: Terrible service. Or maybe bartender was having a terrible day. Dk..either way won't be back

15.description: Upstairs closed due to private function, so seated in the bar on game one of Cardinals vs Cubbies playoff game. Crowed and service a little slow but sever was courteous and helpful with our ordering. All had different burgers and were well satisfied. Wish they toasted their delicious buns. Tried two kinds of fries and the onion rings, liked the fries loved the rings. A good meal.

57.description: First off I don't even know if we had a waiter/waitress. We sat down and then 30 minutes later we decided to get menus ourself. Then got attention of a "worker" got beer menu came back ordered drinks (overpriced) and food with an appetizer. Hour later we get our food never receiving our appetizer. They asked if we still want it (Are you serious?!?!). Decent food but not worth the wait and overpriced beer. No sorry. If you want to go to city to eat. Don't waste your time here.

20.description: We were in town for a conference and stumbled upon this place. They have a nice patio with very friendly staff. I can't remember our servers name but he was so friendly and seemed to actually care about us, in making small convo with our party of 8. All of our food looked delicious! I had the chicken sandwich and it was amazing! Pretty large portion sizes for lunch also. This was a great find for our lunch break! Highly recommend!

36.description: This place used to be a great place to get a burger or a salad, but it seems they have changed their menu.  The salmon salad that I ordered for carryout didn't even contain all of the ingredients listed.  The entire salad was also very small.  The salmon was shredded and did not taste right.  You used to get a whole piece of fresh fish!  Rarely am I unable to finish a salad, but I ended up throwing it away and that is $15 down the drain.

14.description: We were in town for a conference and stumbled upon this place. They have a nice patio with very friendly staff. I can't remember our servers name but he was so friendly and seemed to actually care about us, in making small convo with our party of 8. All of our food looked delicious! I had the chicken sandwich and it was amazing! Pretty large portion sizes for lunch also. This was a great find for our lunch break! Highly recommend!

0.description: The plus: Mariana's work was quick and efficient. The minus: She didn't return calls within a reasonable time frame (several days) and had difficulty scheduling me. Dealbreak: She brought up race issues several times during my three visits. On the last visit she asked me (a black woman) why black people talk like we are uneducated, and why can't we just go to school to learn how to speak properly? We have to know we're doing it wrong... right? I won't be going back.

58.description: I work right near here and am a sucker for a good donut, so I had to give them a try! Tried the Pistachio donut with Lemon icing... Delectable. So much flavor and didn't  feel as heavy as some donuts do. Would absolutely recommend! Their selection is vast and service is friendly and quick.

56.description: I came here with my friend who is a big fan. I got the chicken and egg sandwich and a donut. I can see why she likes this place so much. The place is small so I would probably not eat there. But the donuts are good...and I am not a breakfast person so that high ranks for me. Nice location downtown and customer service was adequate. I did enjoy watching the staff in the back make the donuts and prepare them.

29.description: The double chocolate old fashioned is my favorite donut in the world. It is good.  Really really good.  I have to intentionally block this place out of my mind because it's only one block up from where I park and I would get one every day if I knew it wouldn't make me blow up.I've also had the chicken sandwich.  When I first looked at it, I thought it looked skimpy for the price but there was enough meat for every bite of bread and it was delicious down to the last bite.It's small.  Donuts are made in SMALL batches.  Chicken sandwich made to order. Wait staff is super friendly.

42.description: Best donuts I've ever had hands down. There are so many doughnut shops that are raved about, but they are usually overhyped and more artsy than tasty. Do-rite has perfected the classics and makes delicious uniquely flavored donuts as well. They even have gluten free donuts. This particular location also serves Chicken sandwiches which are phenomenal.

23.description: Wow!!! Impressive Chicken Sandwiches Ladies and Gentlemen!!! I got the CBR SPICY Sandwich. 100% Magnificent/Tasty/ Amazingness that just melts in your mouth!!! If you're looking for the BEST chicken sandwich of your life for $7.00=CHEAP=with tax, look SERIOUSLY NO FURTHER!!!! ENJOY!!!!!!

47.description: Gluten-free donuts are pretty good. Nothing else available for the GF after noon. Husband said the chicken sandwich was amazing, and oh boy did it look tasty. This is a small place, good for picking up a quick to go order. There are a few bar stools for people who wish to dine in. Not great for groups who wish to dine together.

8.description: I walked by this place on my way to the Nike store and I knew I had to make a stop back here before I left. Me and my gf ordered a half dozen.-Buttermilk Old Fashioned-Pistachio-Meyer Lemon-Chocolate Glazed-Chocolate Old Fashioned-Glazed Cinnamon Crunch-Candied Maple BaconThey were honestly all delicious, but the Buttermilk Old Fashioned is by far the best one!! I will definitely come back here and try the rest.

31.description: My wife managed to pull me away from an Italian Beef and hot dog for a CHICKEN SANDWICH?  In Chicago?  Blasphemy!I grumbled all the way to the place, cussing under my breath, making fun of all the stupid people standing in line in the cold just to get some overpriced doughnuts or chicken.  I reluctantly bought a single doughnut, complained a bit more about the price, and scarfed it down.But then my wife gave me a taste of her spicy chicken sandwich.  In-credible.  Heavenly.  I have no idea what they did to that thing, but it was quite possibly the best (and unhealthiest) piece of chicken I ever ate.  Of course I had to tell her it was terrible.  I even held out walking a whole block away from the restaurant before making up some excuse to go back and get one for myself.Next time we're in Chicago, I'll still get an Italian Beef, dipped, hot peppers.  But now there's another piece of Chicago junk food on my must-have list, and it isn't a hot dog.

34.description: chicken sandwich with donuts as buns. messy? yes. delicous. OH YES!

16.description: My boyfriend and I went to this location this morning for breakfast. It's truly the tits. He got a chocolate iced donut and a maple bacon while I went with the apple fritter and the pistachio lemon cake donut. We're from the St. Louis area which has pretty damn good donuts; however, this donut shop may even exceed many of the donuts I've tasted back home. It was a little pricey but twice the size of a standard donut. The apple fritter was so large I could only take maybe two bites of the other ( if you're a pistachio lover, do it!) I did take a bite of the chocolate and that one was very rich and chocolate-y. The maple bacon is not my thing but my boyfriend loved! So 10/10 would recommend!

13.description: Good coffee, good donuts, and a good chicken sandwich.

11.description: I tried Do-Rite Donuts and Chicken for the first time a couple of weeks ago. This is by far the best kept secret in Streeterville! Wow! Location/Decor - while the restaurant may be located inside one of Northwestern Memorial Hospital many building in my hood, I never once felt like I was in a hospital building while dining. The layout of the restaurant was tucked in the corner so it gets very cramped during peak hours. There are no tables except outside. Clearly when it is cold outside no one wants to sit out there. Service - the cashiers here are always so funny! Especially the gentleman with the glasses. I have gone twice since my initial visit, and the last two times, he has given me a free donut! Wow! Any donut of my choosing!Drinks - basic soda! The second time i visited the diet coke was flat and the ice was out, but again, I assume it was because I went during peak hours. Food - was INSANE. Well, except (ironically) the donuts. but other than that I enjoyed the chicken sandwich and fries VERY much! * French Fries - how can you not love fries?! 4.5 stars. One time I went they were very crisped and too salty, but the other two times were perfect!* CBR Sandwich (spicy). utterly divine to the tastebuds. 5 stars. Chicken is crispy, seasoned to perfection, juicy, spicy, hot.* Old Fashioned. 2 stars. Compared to others like Stan's and Firecakes, you can definitely get better* Maple Bacon. Very nice! 4 stars. The donut itself is moist, the bacon is crisp and maplely, omg. perfect.* Lemon Pistachio. 0 stars. No. I was so confused. I tasted not one trail of lemon. I was expecting a strong lemon flavor so i was disappointed when I didn't get it.You all NEED to try the chicken sandwiches. So random that a donut shop serves fried chicken sandwiches, but gosh. They do these very well.

39.description: I literally left here about 20 minutes ago, so this review is hot and fresh. First off, let me say that their fried chicken patties are the stuff dreams are made off, although overly breaded. Get your chicken spicy. It's an added kick that definitely improves on the fact that despite being freshly made, the cheddar on my CBR (chicken, bacon, and ranch mayo, except minus the mayo for me) wasn't melted. The chicken should have been hot enough to take care of this, but whatever. I got my sandwich, fries, and a fountain drink. Total was about $10, which is about what you can expect from a fast food establishment. Now, I didn't order donuts and there's a reason why. When $2.50 is basically your minimum donut price, you've got a problem. I get that location matters here, but I think one thing that'll burst the donut bubble in this part of town is the saturation of overpriced, just ok donuts. When I've been able to get freshly made donuts for 78 cents and a dozen for about $8, I'm not going to be looking to pay $2.50 for one donut. Skip the donuts, get a spicy, crispy chicken sandwich instead. Love yourself.

37.description: ***I had to fly all the way to Chi-Town from Cali to have best donut of my life***The maple bacon donut here was ahhhhh-mazing.  I actually stumbled upon this place after the donut place near my hotel sold out of their famous bear claw donut.  I was disappointed on my last day in Chicago I would not be taking that delicious donut home with me.  With only a few hours left before my flight, I hopped on my Yelp app to seek out the best donut in Chicago, from the quick tips' hype and the Yelp star rating for Do-Rite Dounuts, I knew I had to make my journey to this place before I hop on my flight back to the San Francisco Bay Area.  I walked in like a slobbering hound dog and there it lie, the ***MAPLE BACON DONUT***~~~Candied maple bacon donut, French cruller style donut dipped in maple glaze and covered in candied bacon~~~I was I would have gotten more donuts to take back but I had limited room on my carry on, but I would've loved to try other donuts they had like Vanilla Bean Glazed Cinnamon Crunch or Pistachio-Meyer Lemon.  My next trip back to Chicago I will make sure I get a dozen to take back home.  If you are reading this and you live in Chicago, then stop reading this, and go try Do-Rite's Maple Bacon Donut...Gooooo....Go Now!!!!!?!!!!

0.description: I don't even go for the donuts. This place is so great that it's worth it for me to bike 10 miles down the lake shore path to show up before noon on a Sunday to get one of their egg sandwiches.  And here's the secret tip. It's not on the menu, but if you ask, you can *combine* an egg & chicken sandwich. Explosion in your head.See the photo and then get on your bike.

38.description: Found a short dark and curly hair in my apple fritter today. I'm not going to say I wasn't grossed out, because I was. So I removed the hair and finished my delicious apple fritter.

51.description: Gluten free SELECTION of doughnuts. Not just a one. The day I went in there were THREE different kinds. Not the very best ever, but how I really did appreciate being given a selection and not just one kind. Thank you so much, Do-Rite!

27.description: The donut shop was a block away from my hotel so I definitely had to venture out and try a donut (or two) before leaving Chicago. My husband and I tried the raspberry-filled and a vanilla glazed donut. I liked that they weren't overly sweet, but they were rather thick and too dough-y for me. Wish I had stayed long enough to try out the chicken sandwiches! Maybe next time.

32.description: Thank you fellow Yelpers!  We had just arrived in town for the Cubs Convention (GoCubsGo!) and decided to hit Do-Rite based off of all the positive reviews.  Can 326 people be wrong?  Um no.We had an original and a spicy chicken sandwich, along with fresh cut fries, slaw, and chocolate donuts.  The chicken is large and juicy.  The pickle and creamy slaw really completed the flavor profile.For far too many establishments, the bun is nothing more than an afterthought - merely a way to provide bleached-out bready handles for your food.  But I dare say I might eat Do-Rite's bun plain!  They are fresh and soft, with just a subtle crispness.  It really lets the flavor of the chicken shine.The fries are great.  Thick and fresh cut.  You can actually tell that they came from real potatoes.  Slaw was fresh and sweet.The donut, of course, was awesome!  We will be coming back!

54.description: Holy s$#$, this place is a RIP OFF. I went in to get a dozen donuts, the first time I was told they weren't open even though the hours were clearly 630am - to whenever and it was after 630. The second time, I figured, ok I'll try againThis time I saw the prices. I was SHOCKED. For donuts...So I bought one. Wow.Crap.

48.description: This is hands down the best place for donuts, breakfast sandwiches and coffee. Seriously great food, and best off its very reasonably priced! Me and my father got two donuts, two coffees and a huge breakfast sandwhich for around $14. What a steal!!! Try the veracruz sandwhich for a nice breakfast wake me up

44.description: I ordered four donuts and four coffees this morning. The coffee was great. I love that it's cheaper with a donut. ($1 for a small!!) We tried the pistachio/ lemon--exceptional! The crunch and lemon was so good. We also tried the old fashioned cinnamon crunch, chocolate peppermint, and bacon. All really well done--they were homemade, old-fashioned goodness. I'll be back!!

24.description: I was on Northwestern Hospital's campus one morning and happened upon Do-Rite. Ordered the egg sandwich on a brioche bun, AND a glazed donut for dessert later in the day. I was hoping to sit there and eat while doing some work, but the space is small and the seating limited. There is only barstool seating against the wall during winter. Summertime offers outdoor space. Because Do-Rite feels pretty much like a "to-go" shop that is exactly what I did. Being on the hospital campus gives you plenty of lobbies and hidden nooks to sit down and eat so don't be deterred if you were hoping to sit for awhile.  I walked over to Prentice Women's Hospital a couple blocks down and found an exquisite spot to eat and work remotely. The egg sandwich is large and brioche bun just my favorite. Given the bread itself can hover around 4-500 calories alone this sandwich sustained me until dinner. The vanilla bean glazed donut I saved for after dinner was so fluffy and yummy. I am not really a donut person like my dad is. He grew up with his mom fetching donuts from the local bakery every Sunday morning, and he upheld that tradition throughout my childhood and still does today. As a child our neighbors made homemade donuts and would bring us care packages filled with fresh donuts still warm from the fryer. I would sit on the porch eating a donut and listening to my dad and the neighbor, a Korean War vet, swap stories about their time in the service. When I went home for the holidays we had donuts from Greenbush Bakery in Madison, WI on the Sunday before I drove back to Chicago, and of course I was sent home with some excellent old fashioneds. All that is to say I think my dad would like the donuts at Do-Rite. When I go home next my dilemma will be whether to bring a dozen goodies from Stan's, Doughnut Vault, Glazed and Infused, Firecakes, or Do-Rite... Chicago is certainly not lacking in good donuts. Doughnut Vault may win.... If I find myself in this area for lunch I will definitely be stopping in for their chicken sandwich on brioche!!

7.description: Was on vacay in Chitown and gotta say, I love donuts in Chitown. Just passing by Dorite at night one day while it was closed and said we gotta go back and try this place.Tried the pistacio and maple bacon. Both were extremely delicious. i enjoyed every bite. Very sweet and savoury. If I'm ever in Chitown again I'll definitely be back for seconds.

49.description: Fried chicken sandwich for breakfast? Hell yeah! I got the spicy version which was packed full of flavor. The bun is deliciously buttery and the chicken is crisp and juicy. The sandwich comes with pickles, mayo, and lettuce. I also got the dark matter coffee black which was quite good and made for a great start to the day. The girlfriend ordered an old-fashioned donut and the breakfast sandwich veracruz. The sandwich came with avocado, jack cheese, egg, tortilla strips, and jalapeno. Great flavor and I loved the crunchy texture of the tortilla strips. Very solid joint to grab a quick bite for any meal of the day.

40.description: 4 Facts, 1 Question, 1 Assertion and 1 Philosophical InquiryFacts:1. Overindulgence in Donuts + Fried Chicken = Possible Diabetes or Heart Attack2. Do-Rite and Chicken is an approximately 7 second walk across the street from Northwestern Memorial Hospital. It is a 5 second walk if you don't bother looking both ways before crossing the street (it's a one way street after all).3. US News & World Report currently ranks Northwestern Memorial Hospital #7 in Diabetes/Endocrinology and #9 in Cardiology & Heart Surgery.Question:Is Do-Rite worth the increased health risk and certain destruction of misguided New Year's Resolutions?Assertion: YES. Diabetes and Heart Disease are quite manageable these days. Plus, Northwestern. Philosophical Inquiry: If you don't do right and take the risk to Do-Rite, have you really lived? Fact:4. The answer is no. No you have not. Even Northwestern can't fix existential crises.

53.description: The spicy chicken sandwich is actually better!!!.....

30.description: Vanilla bean donut tasted like heaven.  Krispy creme who.  Other than having minimal seating and being a very tiny place the donuts started the morning off right for us.

46.description: This place is where gluten free dreams come true. There are multiple flavors of gluten free donuts, and each one is light and fluffy like you never imagined gluten free could be. The cinnamon sugar, chocolate, pistachio -- I love them all! Although the cinnamon sugar is what I always go back to. It's like Auntie Ann's cinnamon sugar pretzel meets Dunkin Donuts' donuts on steroids. And the donuts are so big, I almost always end up saving half for later.What's more? They understand cross-contamination and ask if gluten free donuts need to be placed in separate bags and handled with fresh gloves. Thanks for being so aware, Do-Rite! Bonus: with the huge lines of people grabbing their early morning coffee and donuts, you'll feel normal again.If you have celiac and miss donuts, this place cannot be missed. And tourists, this is right off Michigan Avenue so you have no excuse to not stop by!

1.description: Urgh I want to say something was missing :(I bought a Valrhona Chocolate Cake Donut and that special kick was missing in the taste. Maybe I might not be a fan of Valrhona Chocolate.. to be honest, I never heard of this chocolate before, but the taste was definitely missing a special sugary kick. The actual cake part of the donut did not have a taste too. The donut itself was super soft and the chocolate looked awesome. I was super excited based on sight alone. I definitely judged this donut based on its cover. Sadly I braved through eating only half and threw away the rest trying to avoid adding any more guilt-ful calories. The place was nice & it smelled like donut heaven. I want to come back to try the famous fried chicken & another donut in hopes of updating this review to a five star one.Until next time....

55.description: Dou: Dou and Shiw here, reviewing Do-Rite Donuts in Streeterville!Shiw: So we LOVE this place. I used to live really close and come all the time. Can't say enough good things about this place. The chicken sandwiches are unbelievable. Don't know how they make the chicken so juicy, so tender and flavorful. They have this really cool open kitchen, so you can see the workers making the donuts and chicken sandwiches. The anticipation of watching yours being made is half the fun hahaDou: Their fries are the softer kind. I know a few people aren't fans of that, but I don't mind. They give you a fair sized portion too, although I definitely could eat a sandwich and a half because they're just that good. Shiw: And because you're a pig haha. Anyways, this place is great for lunch, but its also good for breakfast because they have donuts too, to give you that savory / sweet combo. The donuts are fantastic, they are a little bit on the sweet side (at least for me), so I'd recommend you order a black coffee to cut down the sweetness.Dou: Thanks for reading, and see you next time!

9.description: It's easy to miss this place because it's right next to Stan's, but Do-Rite Donuts & Chicken is definitely worth a stop if you're in the area. My friend and I stopped by for dinner one night right before they closed for the day, so the selection of donuts weren't amazing, but the one we tried (pistachio) was really good! It was more cake-y and the glaze was super sweet, with a TON of pistachio pieces on top. The chicken was just okay. I'd be down to come back and try the chicken and vanilla donut sandwich but that's kind of an afterthought. The sauce they use on the chicken sandwiches is really good though (almost like a Japanese spicy mayo), and the spicy chicken sandwich does pack quite a bit of heat.They were kind enough to give us a free box of a dozen donuts when we left because the shop was closing, and that was a really awesome surprise! If you're scoping out the Chicago donut scene, I'd definitely recommend dropping by.

26.description: True Story: There is a reason this chicken sandwich ranked #1 in Chicago! It's a well earned award and you will LOVE it.The bun, the slaw and the pickles unite on a sweet soft bun that practically melts in your mouth. Daaayum!I LOVE donuts and this review would not be complete without saying that the buttermilk old fashioned was epic; dense cake with a the slight sour taste of buttermilk and perfectly iced texture was mind blowing.  I'm from Seattle and they don't make donuts like this back home!

25.description: I tried Do-Rite Donuts and Chicken for the first time a couple of weeks ago. This is by far the best kept secret in Streeterville! Wow! Location/Decor - while the restaurant may be located inside one of Northwestern Memorial Hospital many building in my hood, I never once felt like I was in a hospital building while dining. The layout of the restaurant was tucked in the corner so it gets very cramped during peak hours. There are no tables except outside. Clearly when it is cold outside no one wants to sit out there. Service - the cashiers here are always so funny! Especially the gentleman with the glasses. I have gone twice since my initial visit, and the last two times, he has given me a free donut! Wow! Any donut of my choosing!Drinks - basic soda! The second time i visited the diet coke was flat and the ice was out, but again, I assume it was because I went during peak hours. Food - was INSANE. Well, except (ironically) the donuts. but other than that I enjoyed the chicken sandwich and fries VERY much! * French Fries - how can you not love fries?! 4.5 stars.
