One time I went they were very crisped and too salty, but the other two times were perfect!* CBR Sandwich (spicy). utterly divine to the tastebuds. 5 stars. Chicken is crispy, seasoned to perfection, juicy, spicy, hot.* Old Fashioned. 2 stars. Compared to others like Stan's and Firecakes, you can definitely get better* Maple Bacon. Very nice! 4 stars. The donut itself is moist, the bacon is crisp and maplely, omg. perfect.* Lemon Pistachio. 0 stars. No. I was so confused. I tasted not one trail of lemon. I was expecting a strong lemon flavor so i was disappointed when I didn't get it.You all NEED to try the chicken sandwiches. So random that a donut shop serves fried chicken sandwiches, but gosh. They do these very well.

12.description: True Story: There is a reason this chicken sandwich ranked #1 in Chicago! It's a well earned award and you will LOVE it.The bun, the slaw and the pickles unite on a sweet soft bun that practically melts in your mouth. Daaayum!I LOVE donuts and this review would not be complete without saying that the buttermilk old fashioned was epic; dense cake with a the slight sour taste of buttermilk and perfectly iced texture was mind blowing.  I'm from Seattle and they don't make donuts like this back home!

59.description: Ridiculously good! Had the Sweet Heat as a normal chicken because I can't handle spicy. It was soooo heavenly and the maple aioli sauce added an extra kick. Donut was soft and sugary, the chicken was nice and crispy, overall an amazing sandwhich. Open one in Miami!!

21.description: One of my favorite places in Chicago - HANDS DOWN! Always try to make a trip here as early as I can!  A lot of the more popular ones are gone by 3pm! My favorites are the glazed and the pistachio! One donut is around $2-4, but I think it's fair because the donuts' size are definitely above average! The interior is really small. They have really narrow bars seating areas inside but they also have outdoor seating areas which is great for the summers. It can get pretty crowded. But if you want to eat inside, a big party is not a good idea.Now their fried chicken sandwiches are hands down one of the best in Chicago. The spicy chicken sandwich is amazing. The sandwich is topped with some slaw, and DAT CRUNCH DOE (haha)! The fries were decent but definitely try the sandwich!One thing you should keep in mind is most of the good donuts are gone by 2-3pm!! Another great tip is sometimes when you don't see your favorite donut ask the employees, because sometimes ( very rarely) they are making some in the back so they'll grab it for you! I remember they ran out of glazed in the front, but they decided to make more with the jelly donut dough!  Also there's one particular employee there who is seriously one of the sweetest people I have ever encountered! I never was able to catch his name but he has brown hair and wears glasses. He is incredibly polite and so helpful! He's always there when I stop in, so big thank you to that employee! You seriously brighten my day!

17.description: HOLY DONUTS, BATMAN!  My friend convinced me to try Do-Rite when I mentioned that I was going to Stan's. Ever the skeptic, I went in with suspended disbelief - especially since this place also sells fried chicken sandwiches. How could they possibly have delicious donuts? Well, it's possible. And they do. Every donut I tried here was good. The cinnamon crunch (substantial!) the pumpkin donut with pumpkin cream-cheese filling (seasonal, so good and not too sweet!) and most especially the gluten-free blueberry lemon cornmeal donut with maple glaze. I think that was the best donut of my entire life... and I would like to take ten more. Right now.I will definitely make an effort to return the next time I'm in Chi-town, and the only knock I have is for the smell of fried chicken interfering with the deliciousness of the donut experience. Olfactory interference!

10.description: Do-Rite's was near where I was staying in Chicago and I saw the great reviews so I had to try it. Everything smelled and looked great but I knew I was in store for so many good eats in Chicago so I tried for once to keep my gorging in check. I meant to anyway, Got a fried chicken sandwich for breakfast. It was simple enough, fried chicken, spread, lettuce and bun. But it was moist and crispy. Great way to start a food venture in Chicago. I need to come back for the donuts part next time!

5.description: 4 Facts, 1 Question, 1 Assertion and 1 Philosophical InquiryFacts:1. Overindulgence in Donuts + Fried Chicken = Possible Diabetes or Heart Attack2. Do-Rite and Chicken is an approximately 7 second walk across the street from Northwestern Memorial Hospital. It is a 5 second walk if you don't bother looking both ways before crossing the street (it's a one way street after all).3. US News & World Report currently ranks Northwestern Memorial Hospital #7 in Diabetes/Endocrinology and #9 in Cardiology & Heart Surgery.Question:Is Do-Rite worth the increased health risk and certain destruction of misguided New Year's Resolutions?Assertion: YES. Diabetes and Heart Disease are quite manageable these days. Plus, Northwestern. Philosophical Inquiry: If you don't do right and take the risk to Do-Rite, have you really lived? Fact:4. The answer is no. No you have not. Even Northwestern can't fix existential crises.

3.description: Having now had their donuts, chicken sandwich, and a breakfast sandwich, I feel I can write a review under the same mandates that Phil Vettel does, namely that he visits the joint at least two times and tries a number of different things.The chicken sandwich ($5) is the best around town I've had. It's a Chik-fil-a style breaded fried affair with pickles and a light but mayo-like slaw. Soft chewy bun. Delish. I'd compare it to Roost's sandwich but I can't because Roost's hot sauce was so hot I couldn't taste anything...and I like hot.Had me the avocado cheddar breakfast sandwich ($4.6) yesterday morning. For the price it's quite a big and excellent sandwich. Their special mayo sauce makes it, gives it a pleasant and subtle flavor.I've stopped eating donuts but back when I had 'em, I loved Do-Rite's! That bacon maple cruller thing is crazy good but makes you feel sick it's so greasy!I think their coffee is Intelligentsia, which is titŝ!

35.description: Stoped by for breakfast breakfast offer just till 1045. The donuts are much better than at other places and the fries really good try the chicken sandwich and the choclate old fashion donut my husband loved it ao much he was getting a second one

19.description: I had to write about This place because it is too awesome. Came here On a whim, visiting from Miami, and their donuts are freaking amazing!!  My friends and I tried the vanilla bean glazed, the maple bacon, and the varona chocolate cake donut. All superb. But the most incredible donut to me is the buttermilk old fashioned.... It's like a light cake, I don't know what it is but it's delicious. Tried a Nutella hot coffee, recommend it too. Ate here twice, will definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago. Do rite donuts can you come to Miami? So dang good. Oof.

28.description: Had the breakfast sandwich with bacon. Delicious. Then had a cinnamon crunch donut. Delicious. Everything was fresh and that's the way it should be. I will stop at Do-Rite every time I am in Chicago going forward!

45.description: i wish they had this in the west coast. ordered the sweet heat - donut spicy chicken sandwich. definitely a place to try if you're ever in chicago. place is small, but just take it to go. did not try the other donuts. wish i did.will come back and try other things on the menu! check out the picture i posted.

33.description: Having now had their donuts, chicken sandwich, and a breakfast sandwich, I feel I can write a review under the same mandates that Phil Vettel does, namely that he visits the joint at least two times and tries a number of different things.The chicken sandwich ($5) is the best around town I've had. It's a Chik-fil-a style breaded fried affair with pickles and a light but mayo-like slaw. Soft chewy bun. Delish. I'd compare it to Roost's sandwich but I can't because Roost's hot sauce was so hot I couldn't taste anything...and I like hot.Had me the avocado cheddar breakfast sandwich ($4.6) yesterday morning. For the price it's quite a big and excellent sandwich. Their special mayo sauce makes it, gives it a pleasant and subtle flavor.I've stopped eating donuts but back when I had 'em, I loved Do-Rite's! That bacon maple cruller thing is crazy good but makes you feel sick it's so greasy!I think their coffee is Intelligentsia, which is titŝ!

43.description: I just went to donut and chicken sandwich heaven! Some of the best of both in my life! Vanilla bean glazed donut was amazing, CBR sandwich was so good! I will be back!

2.description: This is purely on the service. Something happened in the past 2 months or so. I used to come by a lot, as the donuts and chicken are pretty awesome. The service has been pretty bad the last couple of times, including this afternoon. There has been a curly haired young woman that has been running the front.Today, I was next in line and waited about 10minutes without any greeting or service. There was also a girl in the shop who was having issues with waiting too long for her order to come out. Unfortunately, I ended up having to leave. With the donut shelves being bare, I figured it probably wasn't worth going back to work late.Bummer.

18.description: A bit pricey but you're in downtown Chicago. The Bacon breakfast sandwich is awesome! Beware, it has a hidden tomato on it though!

41.description: Their doughnuts and okay but priced rally high.  Would not go there again.

52.description: I walked by this place on my way to the Nike store and I knew I had to make a stop back here before I left. Me and my gf ordered a half dozen.-Buttermilk Old Fashioned-Pistachio-Meyer Lemon-Chocolate Glazed-Chocolate Old Fashioned-Glazed Cinnamon Crunch-Candied Maple BaconThey were honestly all delicious, but the Buttermilk Old Fashioned is by far the best one!! I will definitely come back here and try the rest.

50.description: Expected: -Yummy spicy chicken sandwich original tasty and reasonable price! Unexpected: - dark matters coffee was so good I just wasn't expecting a coffee that good. I had my coffee black and I know I am going back to get it again - I had old fashion donut and it was meh which surprised me. I kinda expected wow from the reviews and it was recommended by the cashier. Tips: - small place but still able to sit down and eat for two people - no one rushes you so you don't have to feel pressured to vacate the seat

4.description: ***I had to fly all the way to Chi-Town from Cali to have best donut of my life***The maple bacon donut here was ahhhhh-mazing.  I actually stumbled upon this place after the donut place near my hotel sold out of their famous bear claw donut.  I was disappointed on my last day in Chicago I would not be taking that delicious donut home with me.  With only a few hours left before my flight, I hopped on my Yelp app to seek out the best donut in Chicago, from the quick tips' hype and the Yelp star rating for Do-Rite Dounuts, I knew I had to make my journey to this place before I hop on my flight back to the San Francisco Bay Area.  I walked in like a slobbering hound dog and there it lie, the ***MAPLE BACON DONUT***~~~Candied maple bacon donut, French cruller style donut dipped in maple glaze and covered in candied bacon~~~I was I would have gotten more donuts to take back but I had limited room on my carry on, but I would've loved to try other donuts they had like Vanilla Bean Glazed Cinnamon Crunch or Pistachio-Meyer Lemon.  My next trip back to Chicago I will make sure I get a dozen to take back home.  If you are reading this and you live in Chicago, then stop reading this, and go try Do-Rite's Maple Bacon Donut...Gooooo....Go Now!!!!!?!!!!

6.description: Thank you fellow Yelpers!  We had just arrived in town for the Cubs Convention (GoCubsGo!) and decided to hit Do-Rite based off of all the positive reviews.  Can 326 people be wrong?  Um no.We had an original and a spicy chicken sandwich, along with fresh cut fries, slaw, and chocolate donuts.  The chicken is large and juicy.  The pickle and creamy slaw really completed the flavor profile.For far too many establishments, the bun is nothing more than an afterthought - merely a way to provide bleached-out bready handles for your food.  But I dare say I might eat Do-Rite's bun plain!  They are fresh and soft, with just a subtle crispness.  It really lets the flavor of the chicken shine.The fries are great.  Thick and fresh cut.  You can actually tell that they came from real potatoes.  Slaw was fresh and sweet.The donut, of course, was awesome!  We will be coming back!

22.description: Stayed at the Hilton double tree just a few blocks south and decided to give this place a try. It was a bit hard to find at first, but once inside I knew I was in for a treat.I order the bacon and cheddar breakfast sandwich with an iced coffee.The sandwich was outstanding. Delicious scrambled eggs and bacon with tomato and cheddar oozing from the bun; It was very filling. The coffee was dark matter which is always amazing, so this only added to the experience.I also got a glazed old fashioned donut which was warm and melted in my mouth. The staff was super friendly and inviting as well! I will definitely be back next time I'm in the city.

15.description: DONUTS! I love donuts! I was very excited to see the ratings for this place since I haven't really seen that for any place back home, in NY. We went at 10am and the line was already out the door. There are limited seating inside but there are some tables outside if you don't mind sitting in the cold.I ordered the buttermilk old-fashioned donut. Although a little distorted in shape, it tasted amazing! Since it was my first time there, I wanted to try something traditional. It was very moist and tasty - not too sweet either. I also ordered a breakfast sandwich - the bacon sandwich with eggs and cheese. It's not like any of those whack sandwiches where you barely have anything between the buns. This sandwich was stuffed with a generous amount of eggs and bacon! I was very satisfied. I'll definitely be returning one day to try more donuts!

57.description: We decided to try a few .. Raspberry filled, chocolate, apple fritter, pistachio, maple bacon and another one that I can't seem to remember .. Lol Overall 2 thumbs up!

20.description: I am very disappointed with this donut place. I came 5 times and all I wanted was a chocolate glaze donut! They never ever have it!!! I was told it's the most popular donut. Well here is a suggestion  MAKE MORE OF POPUPAR DONUTS! The sign says open till 7 fresh donuts made till close. Not true! One time, I was actually  lucky enough to get chocolate  glazed donut. It was good. Do-rite donuts did not do rite by me! So disappointed!

36.description: Was on vacay in Chitown and gotta say, I love donuts in Chitown. Just passing by Dorite at night one day while it was closed and said we gotta go back and try this place.Tried the pistacio and maple bacon. Both were extremely delicious. i enjoyed every bite. Very sweet and savoury. If I'm ever in Chitown again I'll definitely be back for seconds.

14.description: Amazing fresh homemade donuts with a variety of selection, get there fast or everything gets sold out. I got there a couple of hours after they had open for the day and several of their signature donuts were all gone. But the cinnamon one and the maple glazed one (their most popular) was amazing. So soft in the middle but perfectly glazed and crusted on the outside. I also followed with a hazelnut latte and that had nutella in it! I love nutella so naturally I loved the coffee as well. Excellent donut spot, a must try if you are ever in town!

56.description: I'm writing this on opening day. Literally watching people filter in and out of the new location in between the Galter and Feinberg Pavilions. They've pretty much hit the mother lode on prime real estate. It's a wise choice. I'm going to be honest: it's good. I get why they're so hyped up-- the smoothies are AMAZING and they're great. I got the South Acai'd smoothie, and I pretty much downed that within 10 minutes. It's that good. However, they come in limited sizes (12 and 20 oz, I think?) and it's a little pricey. I also got the Spinach Pesto quinoa bowl-- which, while also pretty good, was also really pricey for the portion size (it's in a tiny takeout cup.) For the price, I don't get much, and it's average. It would be good to come in here for a good snack, or a light meal-- but don't expect to be completely full from this place. Small portions for a lot of protein. I get it, but I'm not full.It's good though, I'll give them that. Hoping that they'll be able to be less busy-- but they've only been open for an hour, and it's kind of exciting. It's a a great place to just stop by and hang out. They also offer Free Wi-Fi (in building, and the location offers their own wi-fi network as well) and ample seating outside. IT's a good place to wait and have a snack/smoothie if you're waiting for an appintment, or you're already down in the area.

29.description: This protein bar is located in Nmh. Sure does get a lot of traffic and I always come here after a hospital visit. Food is consistent but knocked one star for slow staff. I experience a longer wait here with only 2 people in front if me than I have at any other downtown protein bar locations.

42.description: I don't like having to walk through NWMH to get to this place.  Aside from that, 5 stars for the food, drink, and customer service.  Fabulous concept, love having healthy lunch options that taste great.  The Hi-5 raw juice is amazing.

23.description: This used to be my go-to lunch spot but too many bad experiences have soured it for me. The Hi-5 blend used to be so delicious but lately the pineapple they use is so underripe it stings my tongue with each sip. On my most recent trip the guy making my Hi-5 reached into the blender after it stopped and with his fingers pulled out the only branch of cilantro he threw in, since it was unblended, before pouring it in my cup. Gross, and i should have received a refund since it technically became a Hi-4. I asked for some dressing to go with my wrap and he told me I'd have to go wait in line and and tell the cashier I wanted dressing. Sorry, not worth my time. I'll just go somewhere cleaner and more accommodating next time. 3 stars because I used to have positive experiences here, back when they served the delicious Harmless Harvest coconut water. Those were the good old days.

47.description: I'm SO happy this place opened in Galter Pavilion (Northwestern Medical Faculty Foundation/Memorial Hospital).  I've only ever had their vegetarian chili because it rocks, so this review is mostly based on that.Also pluses: I like that they provide nutritional information, that you can order online for pickup instead of waiting in line, that they have a 10-punch card for a free item (including chili, yay!), and they are suuuuper fast.p.s. Just be sure to watch the sodium; a 16 oz chili has 1310 mg of sodium.  That's almost all of the CDC's "recommended adequate" level of 1500 mg PER DAY and more than half the maximum 2300 mg!  Could be better about this, imho.

8.description: Everything is Delicious! The staff is wonderful! Super fast and healthy! The Hi-5 and El Verde bowl are definitely my favorites!

31.description: 1 star deducted because their wraps use a tortilla that's really dense and not good tasting - takes a whole bunch of options off the menu for me.I love their salads and chili! Their marinated tofu is really good. I really appreciate having a lunch spot nearby that has plenty of healthy veg options. Superfood Vegan salad 4-evah. Don't let the name scare you away.

34.description: i love protein bar...their stuff always taste fresh and healthy. but i want to shout out to the staff who went above and beyond at this location to accommodate my silly order and made me regretted so much that i hadn't just stuck with the protein bar for my entire lunch.since i never had the stuff from their next door neighbour, i went to order my lunch there, but GRK staff was sooo rude that i decided that i didn't want to order anything more than what i already had to (so wishing i could just cancel my order), i came to protein bar to see if i could get something carb-related/bready item to supplement my lunch.Seeing flax-tortilla as one of the ingredients on some of the breakfast items, i asked if i could get it alone. Not only they didn't refuse my order since it was like almost 3pm, they also asked if i wanted it toasted, wrapped it nicely for me with a big smiles on their faces.Just the big smiles and the friendly services did wonder to brighten up my day.

16.description: Take the escalators to the second floor then hang a left and walk past Au Bon Pain and the Greek Kitchen.Main reason I wanted to hit up this location is because it's so close to work and the menu offers a little more variety than the Franklin local that I frequent.  I'm obviously drinking the cool-aid they are serving at the Protein Bar because I love, love, love everything they stand for.  It's fast-food I still feel good after eating.  They have healthy options, wholesome ingredients, display what's in what I'm ordering (i.e. how much protein, calories, etc) and when I decide on a whim that today I'm going to go vegan they can accommodate without skipping a beat.  Plus, PB introduced me to quinoa and I'm in love with that (I'm not a big pasta or rice fan).I got a HI-5 raw juice and the Southwest, my staple breakfast burrito.  O.Me.Geez, hear me Raawr!  Raw juice has change my life.  Aside from being eye popping-ly expensive it was mouth watering-ly sweet and satisfying.  Definitely tasted the pineapple and lime...the cilantro was a mellower flavor and I couldn't even tell they slipped me some healthy shit like kale and spinach.  So in love with the raw juice...I might need to invest in my own juicer though because at just over $6 for a 16 oz. cup I could own my own juicer by the end of the year.  The burrito was great as always, it felt bigger like it was a little extra stuffed than how they do things on Franklin...not that I'm complaining.

13.description: Another healthy option for lunch in the streeterville area. It's located in the Galter building of Northwestern Memorial - 2nd floor. The service is fast, all of their menu items can be made vegetarian. I had the Guac & Roll with tofu instead of chicken, which was 4/5 stars. I loved the cilantro lime dressing and the solid amount of guacamole.

11.description: When I'm looking for a healthy meal option for lunch I like to hit up Protein Bar. I like the fact that they list the calories of each menu option.My go to items at Protein Bar are:-BBQ (grilled) Bar-ritos: All-natural chicken, organic quinoa, shredded cheddar, house-made agave BBQ sauce, Super 6 Salad Mix wrapped in a whole-wheat flax tortilla, then grilled. This "Bar-ritos" is the best one that they serve...in my humble opinion. It's delicious, filling and only 570 calories-Chicken Chili: Hearty, chef-crafted chili packed with all-natural chicken, beans, healthy veggies and spice. This is a great option on a negative degree weather day. If you get the 16oz portion it'll cost ya 300 calories-Blended Drink: The Red Line, which consists of vanilla protein, choice of milk, strawberries, and banana. This is a tasty treat that washes down the BBQ Bar-ritos perfectly.I recommend you stay away from the:-Capone Bar-rito (grilled): All-natural chicken, organic quinoa, house-made marinara, spinach, and shredded parmesan wrapped in a whole-wheat flax tortilla, then grilled. While this sounds good, it didn't taste good.-Blended Drink: Millennium Perk, which consist of chocolate protein, espresso protein, choice of milk, and house-made cocoa malt. I'm a chocolate lover, but my stomach wasn't loving this drink. The cashier saw the look on my face when I took the first sip and was nice enough to let me pick another blended drink off the menu at no charge.

39.description: I used to be a big fan of Protein Bar (gave them a 5 star review at another location) but lately I'm getting bored with the food, finding some of the food rather bland, disappointed with some of the quality and turned off by notion that everything is healthy here. Once in a while PB offers a new item for a limited time but it's almost always a smoothie. Once in the past year a new salad was offered for a short time.  I can think of several healthy items for breakfast and lunch I've made at home that would be great additions to the menu.While most items are ok, nothing on the menu changes.  In this day in age with a strong movement towards healthier eating I'd expect better tasting items.  I'm glad there are a variety of items and options with ingredients for the smoothies (i.e. whey v. soy protein, almond v. skim milk), and I'm glad PB can be a healthier option (only some of the items are really healthy) but after today's buffalo salad, I won't be coming here except for an occasional egg white breakfast bowl or oatmeal.I've had this salad before and it's been fine, nothing to write home about but good enough for a salad.  The salad I got today for about $10 (a little high IMO) was bland, the chicken was overcooked and the lettuce tasted stale and old.  If I pay $10 for a high-end salad I really don't want an abundance of the white iceberg lettuce stems as the primary green in the salad. I'd expect more spinach and field greens. I work in the building so I'm often at the food court area but have been avoiding PB except for breakfast as the egg white bowls and oatmeal are adequate for a low cal option (the breakfast burritos are whatever), but after the salad today I should have gone back and asked for something else.The biggest concern upon looking into the ingredients more is the sodium content.  I think everyone should be aware when they assume because of marketing that PB is a healthy alternative.  Over 1300mg of sodium in the buffalo salad is flat out INSANE.  That's more than 50% of your daily sodium intake, in one meal, in a salad. And, the salad is 450 calories to boot. The salads range between 400-500 calories!  That's nuts!The sodium content is lower in most of the breakfast items because there's no sauce or dressing.  But, beware of the Sante Fe bowl and burrito.  Over 1000mg of sodium...thinking about it literally makes me want to drink a gallon of water.Kudos to PB for offering all natural sodas, and healthier snacks like Larabars, smart popcorn, kale chips, individual hard boiled eggs and fresh veggie containers. However, another thing that bothers me...I'd expect everything in the store to be organic.  The fruits and veggies are not organic.  I'm not going to pay $7-$8 for a pure juice that's not organic.  The chicken and beef is not organic, but apparently you can ask for organic beef for an extra cost.  For these prices you should get organic, there's just no way around it.  I know in this economy fruits and veggies cost more than things like chips and cookies but if you advertise as a tasty, healthy alternative, then make sure to stick up to that motto and not serve fruits and veggies filled with pesticides.  And if I'm wrong about this, then advertised where you source your ingredients from.  It's a bit maddening when I order an organic counter culture coffee and I see the employee pour GFS creamer in my coffee.  What's the point of organic, fair trade coffee if I can't get organic creamer or milk?I really hope PB refreshes their menu and offers some alternatives because it just gets old. I suppose the same thing could be said for places I go to often, like Chipotle, but the chicken bowl tastes good and I can get it down to 390 calories v. 450 for a mediocre salad that doesn't taste fresh.PB has a burgeoning local chain here that can really do big things but they need to rectify some issues.  I was so on board with this place that I was touting it with everyone I knew based on the high protein, low fat, lower calorie options.  Avoiding fried foods and eating things with more veggies or protein is not the only way to a healthier lifestyle.  You have to have the right balance in your meal options.

37.description: I absolutely LOVED this place. I ate here like every day while I was at a class in the city. Small concise meals that really fill you up! This place was always packed too which means you know it's good. I really wish they would open one of these down here by Naperville. I think it would do AWESOME if put in the right location. I ordered the quinoa salads for lunch everyday always a different one and they were all amazing. I also ordered some white bean soup with tofu that was light and refreshing.  For breakfast one day I ordered a peanut butter celery raisin yogurt thing that was super dope too. I highly recommend this place if you need a power meal that won't weigh you down!

0.description: "We do healthy, healthier." Yes, you do, Protein Bar. First of all, I think this place has a horrible name. Second, if you're coming from the street, it is a surprise that this is in the hospital (but there is ample seating and better wait times than other Protein Bars I've frequented). Third, their food is indeed healthy, and not more expensive than other fast-ish food. This is my go-to on the days I can't, or really don't want to, cook.Fourth, the staff here is exceptional. Friendly, patient, and make you feel like a friend by doing the little things. On time with my online orders?... never... but if you learn to show up five minutes late you won't have to wait.

38.description: When I'm looking for a healthy meal option for lunch I like to hit up Protein Bar. I like the fact that they list the calories of each menu option.My go to items at Protein Bar are:-BBQ (grilled) Bar-ritos: All-natural chicken, organic quinoa, shredded cheddar, house-made agave BBQ sauce, Super 6 Salad Mix wrapped in a whole-wheat flax tortilla, then grilled. This "Bar-ritos" is the best one that they serve...in my humble opinion. It's delicious, filling and only 570 calories-Chicken Chili: Hearty, chef-crafted chili packed with all-natural chicken, beans, healthy veggies and spice. This is a great option on a negative degree weather day. If you get the 16oz portion it'll cost ya 300 calories-Blended Drink: The Red Line, which consists of vanilla protein, choice of milk, strawberries, and banana. This is a tasty treat that washes down the BBQ Bar-ritos perfectly.I recommend you stay away from the:-Capone Bar-rito (grilled): All-natural chicken, organic quinoa, house-made marinara, spinach, and shredded parmesan wrapped in a whole-wheat flax tortilla, then grilled. While this sounds good, it didn't taste good.-Blended Drink: Millennium Perk, which consist of chocolate protein, espresso protein, choice of milk, and house-made cocoa malt. I'm a chocolate lover, but my stomach wasn't loving this drink. The cashier saw the look on my face when I took the first sip and was nice enough to let me pick another blended drink off the menu at no charge.

51.description: I went here because Izzy likes the place and she know her shakes. It is not  what I look for and I'd rather take a daily vitamin then spend near $10 on a wheat grass super duper hairy back muscle shake. LOL

27.description: Protein Bar is my go-to place if I'm out and don't have the time to go home for lunch. It is a definite healthy choice when compared to all of the other fast food spots around the Northwestern area. The service is always really quick (given that they are constantly busy during lunch time), and it's possible to order in advance using their mobile app.Personally, I'm a fan of the Original and Ivy "Bar-ritos" and the Quinoa chili bowl. I also really enjoy the Wrigley Peeled blended drink - a mix of chocolate protein peanut butter, and banana blended into a delicious, mouthwatering shake. The burritos aren't as tasty as say a Chipotle burrito, but I gladly sacrifice a little bit of taste to not feel awful afterward

32.description: LOVE this place! It's a block away from where I work and a much healthier option compared to corner bakery, m burger etc...I have loved everything I've tried on the menu so far. Oh, their raw juices are a must try! I recommend either the Greenberry or Hi-5

54.description: Take the escalators to the second floor then hang a left and walk past Au Bon Pain and the Greek Kitchen.Main reason I wanted to hit up this location is because it's so close to work and the menu offers a little more variety than the Franklin local that I frequent.  I'm obviously drinking the cool-aid they are serving at the Protein Bar because I love, love, love everything they stand for.  It's fast-food I still feel good after eating.  They have healthy options, wholesome ingredients, display what's in what I'm ordering (i.e. how much protein, calories, etc) and when I decide on a whim that today I'm going to go vegan they can accommodate without skipping a beat.  Plus, PB introduced me to quinoa and I'm in love with that (I'm not a big pasta or rice fan).I got a HI-5 raw juice and the Southwest, my staple breakfast burrito.  O.Me.Geez, hear me Raawr!  Raw juice has change my life.  Aside from being eye popping-ly expensive it was mouth watering-ly sweet and satisfying.  Definitely tasted the pineapple and lime...the cilantro was a mellower flavor and I couldn't even tell they slipped me some healthy shit like kale and spinach.  So in love with the raw juice...I might need to invest in my own juicer though because at just over $6 for a 16 oz. cup I could own my own juicer by the end of the year.  The burrito was great as always, it felt bigger like it was a little extra stuffed than how they do things on Franklin...not that I'm complaining.

48.description: My bf loves Protein Bar because it gives a lot of protein and less calories. I tried the  buffalo chicken with kee wah. It was better than what i expected!I will go back to it again!

44.description: Great veggie/fruit drinks and food is good but what really ruins it for me is that the temperature of the hot foods is barely even warm. I got chili and it was lukewarm. The next day I got a parm bowl and it was lukewarm. My friend's food was the same temp too. No good.  The workers said that is just how they serve the food. Who wants practically room temp food that is supposed to be hot? Not I! Yuck.

24.description: Although this is a healthy spot, the portions are little smaller than I would like.  The bowl size if you're exercising, makes you more hungry than full.  I got the bowl and the 16oz chicken chili and mixed it together.  That did the trick.  I also got the acai shake, which was not good at all.  I would say this is a decent spot for a quick fix on the road, but don't expect much more.

7.description: LOCATION: Inside Northwestern Memorial on the 2nd floor walkway between Galter and Feinberg.  (Can be hard if you're unfamiliar.)SERVICE: Our server was a ROCKSTAR.  That dude was hilarious!  Very easy to joke around with, he didn't miss a beat in jumping into a mock debate my friend and I were having.  That alone made for a good experience.THE GOODS: I was just in for fresh juice.  However, I was disappointed to learn that all the juices they had were bottled, not fresh. They had a single blended drink, the Hi-5 (which was delicious,) but I am disappointed to see that the location website's menu misrepresented the actual store.  I didn't have the food so I can't rate that.*Now I'm willing to be corrected if there actually was fresh juice here and I just misread the menu, but from my experience, the menu in the store was unexpectedly restricted.*OVERALL: A good spot for the health-conscious, but if you're looking for FRESH squeezed (i.e. not bottled) juice, there's not much selection here.

49.description: Adding an extra star just becuase it's a great healthy alternative when I don't have leftovers to bring for lunch. I cleaned up my families eating habits, and with that means limiting our eating out. It's not easy finding restaurants that offer food that help with your fitness and health goals. At least I have Protein Bar nearby for those rare days I don't bring my own lunch, or it's too hectic of a day to run to Trader Joe's to pick up a few things to make my own lunch back in the office kitchen.Today I stopped by to buy a pricey salad and post workout Wrigley drink for later. I spent $15 and some change. It hurt my pocket, but at least it won't cost me in prescription later on in life.

40.description: Protein Bar is fantastic.  I generally get the chili chicken or spinach pesto quinoa bowls depending on the day.  A few times I have had smoothies or juices - their kale juice with I think pineapple is really delicious!  It is one of the few places you can really go to get very healthy food very quickly.  I actually didn't know this whole food court even existed until I saw someone at work with a quinoa bowl from here and was really happy to find out they are in the neighborhood!

53.description: I've already been here way too many times, but i plan to keep coming back! It's great to finally have convenient healthy food in the hospital, instead of my usual routine of grabbing anything Starbucks has to eat and running off to something I'm late for. I'd say this place is better than Freshii, their competition for fast healthy food, the flavors are better here.I won't go into which burritos I like best, because honestly they all taste similar. Which isn't a bad thing, because I've yet to be unsatisfied with any of them. I usually go with the Guac & Roll, Ivy or Original. And don't forget to add some sriracha to give it a little kick, they have several bottles on the counter where you pick up your order. Juices are all great too with one exception: Cherry Limeade is just toooo sweet. I couldn't even finish it.

30.description: Pretty unhappy , I've been going to the one on lake and I've accumulated two frequent customer cards, well this one apparently doesn't take them for blended drinks even though it clearly states on the card they do and the other location wouldn't take them period! Why have frequent cards then! AND THE MANAGER is so rude! When The nice guy at register asked her to honor it she practically ripped his head off and mine! " this time fine but I'm not doing this BS again" really? Who taught u how to manage she proceeded to roll her eyes and be rude the entire time ! Hello u just gave u two cards full of punches and u treat regular customers that way?!?!?! Think there's a million other options not to come here again

46.description: Love love love!  Fast quick friendly service!  Food is healthy and amazing!

1.description: Fact: the only incentive for going to the doctor is getting to eat here. Yeah yeah, there's that whole "caring for myself" thing too, buuut I can't eat it sooooo...I digress.Anyway, Protein Bar is aces because it's fast, customer service is friendly, and their variety of food options are all delicious and healthy. Don't think you like quinoa? I don't buy it, my friend. Veggies and grains are hubby's kryptonite and even *he* adores their burritos. I don't know what magical crack they use to make everything taste so good, but these contemplations merely cut into my munch time, so I choose to remain in blissful oblivion. *My* personal faves are their chili and the spinach pesto quinoa bowl. Not only yummy, nutritious, but best of all they really keep me full for a while, which is a major plus because I don't like to feel hungry, but do like to fit into my pants. As other Yelpers note, it's within the galter building of Northwestern (675 N St Clair) on the 2nd floor, and not terribly fancy digs, but if someone as directionally challenged as me can find it, I have faith in you too.

55.description: I've been itching to check out the Protein Bar from the moment I heard they were putting one in at Northwestern Memorial Hospital. Protein Bar offers a healthy take on fast food which is a welcomed addition to the hospital food options. It seems like everyone else was as interested as me as the line when I came by at 10 to noon was out the door. Fortunately, it moved super fast and I think it was really helpful that they were handing out menus and moving people along. The wait for a raw juice was a little longer as they gotta prep those as you order and squeezing all the goodness outta those fruits and veggies takes awhile. As I wanted to try the juice I had to resign myself for the extra wait but was glad I did because the Hi-5 was a sweet mix of pineapple and kale-y goodness. The Vegan original bar-rito was somewhat disappointing. I'll admit a couple years in the Mission district of San Francisco spoiled me on burritos. At least the bar-rito doesn't really attempt to go toe-to-toe and changes things up with a quinoa filling and whole wheat tortilla. Still the beans are under seasoned and the rest of the fillings a little bland. I wish the protein bar came with an accompanying salsa bar. Still, the juice is awesome and their menu of other signature drinks looks appealing as well. I'd stop back by for a Bucktown Green Tea or Wrigley Peeled in their slower hours (if they have any) but not as eager to jump back into their other food offerings.

9.description: This is the perfect place to go to get a quick cold pressed juice for detoxing. I purchased two juices in the healthy park quinoa bowl. The bowl was satisfying but a little bland and the juice tasted as  expected.

26.description: The protein bar tastes great! And it's so healthy for you. Definitely get a bar-rito. So tasty. And it's loaded with protein. So nice to have a place like chipotle that is even healthier. I got their buffalo bar-rito and it was great. And the quinoa is so tasty. Didn't know it was loaded with so much protein!

25.description: Healthy. Nutritious. Delicious. I just feel good about myself when I have a protein bar meal (especially with my travel schedule and eating out all the time). There are plenty of options for the veggie, vegan, and meat lover...all at a reasonable price and without sacrificing your health, so why not try it?! Your body will thank you for it. Enjoy!

12.description: This update is for Protein Bar, in general, not this particular location.  The servicer who handles Protein Bar's customer service and billing, LevelUp, is a total mess.  I emailed Protein Bar/Level Up 3 times over the course of a week after a $36 charge from Protein Bar was posted on my credit card bill while I was out of the country.  I also tried calling them the following week.  I got no response via email and was automatically disconnected after listening to a recording on the phone.  After 2 weeks of no responses, I notified my credit card company that the charge was in error.  A week after that, LevelUp contacted me to explain the charge and asked me to call my credit card company and have the claim reversed.  BYE FELICIA.

21.description: Great tasting and reasonably priced kale shakes! I needed something to get me going in the morning, but I'll definitely be back to try other options.

17.description: This place is horrible and the workers are unprofessional and ignorant!! Other locations I've been to are great!

10.description: While I encountered a bad egg, Protein Bar reached out and made it right. They offered me REAL exceptional customer service and offered an apology for my experience. I was very impressed. I'll be returning! This was the kind of service I knew I could expect from Protein Bar.

5.description: I was excited to find out they had opened a new location inside Northwestern Hospital. I had coupons mailed to me to try their new fall menu. So I decided to do so at a new location. This place is small and has a few seats inside. I made the mistake of coming at 1pm thinking it would have slowed down. Today I tried the backyard bbq bowl. It was good but I fear the consequences of eating kale. It was a a little sweet and a little bland. I am glad I tried it but probably not going back to get it again.

3.description: Uptown Funk Dedicated to Protein BarIt is too hot (hot damn),Go to Protein Bar and get juice!It is too hot (hot damn),Make me wanna drink Avo Matcha!It is too hot (hot damn),Add Vanilla Protein and Almond Milk!It is too hot (hot damn),Am I bad to get Fruit Loop'd too,Drink it up! Market hit you with Kale (wuhoo),Outta Sight hit with you with Carrot (wuhoo),Beetbox hit you with Apple (wuhoo)!Cause Protein Bar gon' give it to you,Cause Huron St gon' give it to you,Cause Clark St gon' give it to you!Saturday night and we in Chicago,Believe me and just come to Protein Bar!

35.description: Protein bar provides the perfect breakfast when you're on the go. There are so many options and it's delicious. My favorites are the Millennium Perk and the Wrigley Peeled! Addicted!

19.description: This protein bar is located in Nmh. Sure does get a lot of traffic and I always come here after a hospital visit. Food is consistent but knocked one star for slow staff. I experience a longer wait here with only 2 people in front if me than I have at any other downtown protein bar locations.

28.description: When I am too lazy to prepare and pack my lunch, Protein Bar is one of my go-to places.  I absolutely love their chicken chili with parmesan, it's super tasty and delicious.  Their buffalo salad is also another favorite of mine.  Most of their products are quite good, but expect to pay extra for the quality of the ingredients.

45.description: Since I will probably end up at every Chicago Protein Bar at some point, might as well keep reviewing 'em? Sadly, this is their farthest north location- boo for northsiders who don't always work in the loop! What if I want some weekend or evening Protein Bar?This location is in a weird spot inside Northwestern. It's totally open to the public, but walking in it doesn't feel that way, and there are no signs to indicate that there are food options inside or where to find them. Which is unfortunate, because there's a bunch of good places in here that otherwise can only be found closer to the loop.It was EMPTY on a weekend afternoon. I just had a smoothie but I'd say this location meets Protein Bar's (high) standards. It's small but I think they serve the whole menu that other locations do.

33.description: Best place to eat at Northwestern Memorial Hospital! Delicious, flavorful, healthy. Love to spinach pesto quinoa bowl, sub out chicken for tofu. The Loop'd smoothie is amazing, as are all their other smoothies. They offer almond milk! Also egg white protein, if you're into that sort of thing. :) Only downside is the wait (although they are fast)... and the price. But- you get what you pay for. Makes my day 1,000x better when I get lunch here!

43.description: Honestly i wasn't that impressed. It's nice to have a healthy option for lunch, but I felt it was kinda overpriced. $7 for a cup of chili? Boooo

2.description: Located in Northwestern Hospital's food court area.  Can get confusing, definitely call the shop and ask for particulars if you are directionally challenged like me.  I asked the bellman at the hotel and he pointed me towards Michigan Ave.  I walked an extra three quarter mile because of it.  If I jay walked from the hotel, I would have landed neatly there.  I wanted a juice/smoothie in the mornings within walking distance, so PB was it.  The combinations are simple and they are willing to vary it as you please, if you are adding ingredients, it's $0.40/ea item, still under $13 for a large and a small smoothie, but due to the extras, they provided a whole extra cup for the overflow.  Love how they have almond milk.  Skip the vegan protein powder, disgusting.  They also have whey and soy protein.Not organic.  When asked, they said it was too expensive.  Sigh.  Juice was similar to a watered down smoothie, but still good, just not strained like juice.  It's green, so not complaining.  Overall, it served it's purpose, not sure how many nutrients and pollutants my body absorbed.

18.description: Although this is a healthy spot, the portions are little smaller than I would like.  The bowl size if you're exercising, makes you more hungry than full.  I got the bowl and the 16oz chicken chili and mixed it together.  That did the trick.  I also got the acai shake, which was not good at all.  I would say this is a decent spot for a quick fix on the road, but don't expect much more.

41.description: If you are into healthy foods that aren't proceeded, check out this place. Great juices and smoothies along with healthier alternatives to traditional burritos.A definite must.

52.description: Protein Bar, you are really simple and really brilliant. Fresh everything. Raw stuff. Gluten free options. Vegan stuff. Seriously non shitty ingredients. Fast, low-calorie, healthy, flavorful and only a teeny bit more expensive than a McDonald's value meal. Goddamn, Protein Bar, you rock my world. Long story short, this is the greatest ever fast food concept. This company should expand nationwide with drive through options. They'd probably cure the obesity epidemic.

50.description: Protein Bar is probably my favorite addition to the newly revamped Northwestern Memorial Hospital dining options up on 2. Vegan? Vegetarian? Gluten Free? They've got you covered. I love how Protein Bar offers a really simple menu and I finally have another gluten-free lunch option other than a plain salad or Freshii. My fave is the quinoa bowls (all gluten free) - the buffalo chicken one is excellent. They also offer a "burrito" which is like a wrap, as well as chilis, salads and raw juices and blended drinks - sans the artificial colors, syrups, etc. Tip: Don't be intimidated by the lunch hour line that typically goes out the door; the line moves fairly quickly! Also, there is limited seating indoors so you may want to take your healthy eats elsewhere to enjoy.

4.description: Very, very healthy.  I'll be straight up, it's so healthy that it occasionally borders on bland, which keeps it from being 5 stars.The restaurant is run well, although we're talking about a cafeteria type setting so don't expect too much.  I'm a fan of their salads, and their super seven mix is quite good although the inclusion of iceberg lettuce is a bit lame.There are a few things that I think they could perk up in their menu:- Buffalo chicken burrito with vegan dressing -- why do vegan dressing for a chicken dish?- More of the smoothies need greens

6.description: Any place that focuses on helping me eat more nutritiously automatically has a leg up on the competition. Protein Bar does just that, and serves up healthy, amazing food.  I opted for the black bean quinoa bowl. It came out within five minutes, and it was a huge portion! I can't believe it was only 360 calories. This bowl was simple - a bed of quinoa, topped with black beans, and garnished with a little salsa, cheddar cheese, and fresh cilantro - but the flavor was out of this world. I've officially been inspired to use more quinoa and black beans in my own cooking at home. This cafe-style eatery is clean and not quite inviting. It suggests a quick meal in-house, or (more likely) that you should take your meal to go. The staff was friendly enough, but not overly enthusiastic to be working here (at least at this location). I would definitely return and try more lunch items. Their raw juices looked yummy as well.

22.description: Any place that focuses on helping me eat more nutritiously automatically has a leg up on the competition. Protein Bar does just that, and serves up healthy, amazing food.  I opted for the black bean quinoa bowl. It came out within five minutes, and it was a huge portion! I can't believe it was only 360 calories. This bowl was simple - a bed of quinoa, topped with black beans, and garnished with a little salsa, cheddar cheese, and fresh cilantro - but the flavor was out of this world. I've officially been inspired to use more quinoa and black beans in my own cooking at home. This cafe-style eatery is clean and not quite inviting. It suggests a quick meal in-house, or (more likely) that you should take your meal to go. The staff was friendly enough, but not overly enthusiastic to be working here (at least at this location). I would definitely return and try more lunch items. Their raw juices looked yummy as well.

15.description: I loved the spinach pesto quinoa bowl. Refreshing, tasty, and still amazingly healthy! Will definitely get it again when working downtown. The portion was a bit small but the flavor and density of the bowl was enough for dinner.

20.description: Protein - keeps you full and helps with your gym goals! This place has loads of it! The food here is tasty and pretty creative for a place that focuses on putting as much protein in your body as possible. The salads are great, as are their quinoa bowls. Usually the salads last me two meals - which is good since they are on the pricier side for a "fast food" salad. They also have fresh squeezed juices and smoothies that are delicious. Just be careful when you are looking at the menu because some items are high fat and calories in addition to being high in protein.

36.description: While visiting Chicago on business in January of 2014, I came across several Protein Bar locations.  This one was just a couple of blocks from our hotel.  I "parked" in the loading zone leaving my buddy in the car to go in and get some fresh juices and a Denver burrito for him.  Extremely fast and friendly service.  The juices are some of the best I've ever had honestly.  I love the flavor combinations.  Ginger in the green and strawberry with beet is surprising and refreshing.

14.description: This used to be my go-to lunch spot but too many bad experiences have soured it for me. The Hi-5 blend used to be so delicious but lately the pineapple they use is so underripe it stings my tongue with each sip. On my most recent trip the guy making my Hi-5 reached into the blender after it stopped and with his fingers pulled out the only branch of cilantro he threw in, since it was unblended, before pouring it in my cup. Gross, and i should have received a refund since it technically became a Hi-4. I asked for some dressing to go with my wrap and he told me I'd have to go wait in line and and tell the cashier I wanted dressing. Sorry, not worth my time. I'll just go somewhere cleaner and more accommodating next time. 3 stars because I used to have positive experiences here, back when they served the delicious Harmless Harvest coconut water. Those were the good old days.

28.description: WOW. I'd say about 50% of the time they forget my order. Either they hate me or they just have really under-trained, incompetent staff.

1.description: Great location at the Northwestern Hospital Campus! This was my first time ordering from Argo and loved it! Ordered the tomato mozzarella quiche that was warmed and for only $5 you can't go wrong! Large seating area with large window and free wifi. Will definitely be back to take advantage of the weekly tea special. Buy any signature tea and receive a bakery croissant free before 9am. Offer runs until September 7th!

39.description: YUM, good tea even though it is a bit expensive. The quiches are also pretty yummy and reasonably priced. I suggest the salmon one :o].Bring your own mug and I think you get 10 cents off. Show them your student ID and get 10% off or something like that! If only they were open 24 hrs!

9.description: Large seating area lots of tables and chairs. The coffee and tea selection is nice. Good for a stop off while in the Gold Coast.

29.description: While reading a news article lately about how some coffee and tea shops are trying to balance out the time people spend on free wi-fi, hogging up tables, this is the first place I thought of.   While just walking around in the Water Tower area we decided to stop in here for coffee and tea.  It was packed out, there was a line and I didn't see anywhere to sit at all.  We actually did want to sit down and cool off as we had been walking for some time.  I guess being so close to the university this is a favorite place for students to get online.   We had to stand for a while, while waiting for our order but it wasn't that annoying as there were so many things to look at.  They have a huge selection of teas.   After lightening my wallet for something like $4 for tea and a few bucks for coffee, we were finally able to find a very narrow place to sit, with some other college students.   Apparently people don't mind having to share tables and I don't know what the solution is to having too many people using the Internet and all the tables, or if there is a good solution.  At least they have a lot of business.   And they must have a huge Internet pipe.

23.description: Still love this place, still go nearly every day. My review update is due to the fact that I just found out they are discontinuing the Northwestern discount at this Argo location ... probably because 80% of the people who go here are NU staff/researchers/doctors. Argo is, after all, a business that wants to make money. So no hard feelings.On another note, try the Espresso Chai ... holy crap. So good.

5.description: First time trying Argo Tea and I wasn't disappointed, I am more of a coffee drinker but their tea was tasty and refreshing. The first drink I got was a bit tart for me but they made sure I left happy and made me another drink which was the iced Pom tea and it was great. Friendly employees always make customers come back. My son will be staying at the hospital a few days so I will definitely be back to try more teas.

31.description: Wandered in here on the way back to the hotel this past weekend and ended up scarfing down a flatbread and drinking some type of chilled strawberry tea creme thing. I didn't realize it was a chain until I saw all of their branded merchandise (Argo tea strainer anyone?), but it was a nice experience. Flatbread was tasty. They warmed it up and it was cheesy and very satisfying after a long day of walking.The tea thing was a little sweet, but that's what I get for ordering something called a strawberry creme tea drink. But, when they originally gave me the wrong drink the staff was really nice and fixed it quickly.

25.description: Ah, bliss.There's nothing quite like that first foamy sip of a mate latte with soy.  Mmmmm...makes all your troubles melt away.I started going to this location a few months ago when I 1) discovered it's existence and 2) realized it was close enough to my office for me to sneak out without anyone noticing.  Nothing like a little intrigue to  make a tea latte taste a little sweeter .Very clean, very friendly staff, super-fast service.  True love.

12.description: Terrible customer service.  I would highly recommend the other Argo Tea on E. Pearson (just a five minute walk away) over this one.  I stopped going months ago after numerous bad experiences ("how was I supposed to know you were in line?").  Thought I'd give them another try today.  No luck.  Paid for an iced Americano, waited and waited, only to be told later  "Didn't you know we're out of ice?" I asked for a refund and was told I would have to wait until all the other customers were taken care of and their drinks made.

37.description: I go to Argo tea all the time to several different ones but this one is the most important, and this is because it is the one I go to in the morning before work. Iced Matte latte with soy is my am drink (wakes you up!) almondy and sweet.Mojitea is my pm drink minty and limey like the name suggestsiced tea ginger twist is my pm drink as well, it is spicy and delish Use your ID and if your like me and go all the time! get a club card and get points to earn free drinks.

21.description: ARGO ME. Preferably daily.Love this place. Every visit -  which is becoming more frequent - has been fantastic.If you haven't had the chai cherry panini, You Must. Terrific.Okay Argo, just don't go Starbuck's on us now.

16.description: Good coffee and tea.  Tea is much better then most coffee places.  I like the green tea and like the location.

17.description: I'm sitting here as we speak.This is my first time coming to this location since I was in the area and wanted a nice drink on this beautiful summer day.I walked into the Prentice Women's Hospital, took a right turn, and was greeted by the beautiful Argo Tea display.Drink:I ordered the Green Tea Strawberry Creme for the first time today and I must say it's really really tasty. I used 2% milk as the 'creme' base and maybe I should have used half-and-half, but it's still mighty fine. I've gone through a good portion of the menu over the past year and this is somewhere in my top 3 probably. Highly recommended.Service:The cashier and baristas shot through a line of 3 people in front of me with quick ease. I placed my order and had the drink and receipt in my hand almost simultaneously. Really impressive.Ambience:You're in a hospital. The lobby is full of all kinds of people. It's a little loud. This is not the fault of Argo, though -- this comes with the location.

10.description: I really want to like Argo Tea but the drinks served at this location are consistently terrible, mainly because they are always lukewarm. I have tried 2 specialty drinks in the past, both of which were mediocre. The descriptions offer intriguing and complex flavor profiles (who wouldn't want to try "red tea blended with natural raspberry and white chocolate"), but the actual beverages were somewhat bland and overly sweetened. So today I decided to get a Mocha - just so I could compare it to Starbucks.  It was AWFUL. It was watered down and had no flavor. But the worst part was that I asked for "extra hot" and it was TEPID. I would have thrown it away except that it was $4. So instead I microwaved coffee for the first time in my life, just to make it minimally palatable.The customer service here is fine - they are always courteous and smiling. But after 3 epic fails, I will NOT be returning to this Argo Tea ever again.

11.description: I love tea....Hot tea, cold tea, tea with milk, tea with lemonade, green, black, fruity, earthy....Just give it to me!I came by everyday....and in everyday, what I really mean is two, three visits in the day.  Just some personal favs..Hibiscus tea squeeze,  iced green tea strawberry, iced Pom tea, Chai and good old green tea. Their paninis are brilliant-the bread is fantastic. Love that there is a place just for tea and they have LOADS of it....really wished they had this in CA. Even got my last Argo fix at O'Hare. Score!

26.description: I love going to Argo Tea - their cafe is modern, clean, spacious, and with comfortable couches. Since they are only located in Chicago and NY, I like to buy gifts for friends here - they have tea a'la carte stations where you can pick from a large selection of unique teas, fill up bags to the amount that you like, and only purchase what you need! Their pre-wrapped gift packages of tea varieties is also very nice. Definitely a refreshing place to go to if you're looking for a change from the Starbucks located every 50 feet from your door!

27.description: love this place... there are so many types of tea to choose fromit is refreshing to drink something other than coffee everydayi am definitely planning on getting one of the cups they sell there so thati can try all their tea leavesi would highly recommend this place if you're looking to get a present for someone who like tea or is a tea virgin ... you can get a gift box with several different types of their awesome teaDuring the chicago chill, this place is a must~!

35.description: I'm so glad to have an Argo Tea location close to school.  A little bit of caffeine before class or something warm on a cold day is very much appreciated.  The perceptive person working behind the counter noticed my book bag and asked if I was a student, which helps when you're paying five bucks for a cup of tea.  I got the Hibiscus Steamer last time I was there.  I love hibiscus tea, as well as apple cider, so I can't figure out why they taste so unpleasant combined.  I won't get it again, but I know I'll be back to get something else.

8.description: Let me start off by saying that I L-O-V-E Argo Tea. I try to go to one when I have time to spare and luckily this one is right across the street from where I work. So...suffice it to say I'm here at least once or twice a week on average. Now, the drinks here are made well, and I've never had a problem with how my drinks tasted or were made, etc. They sometimes get confused with making my drinks hot when I want cold; but I won't hold that against them since I sometimes forget to tell them. My issue lies lately with their customer service. Twice within a month my drink has been forgotten, today pretty much put me over the edge since it made me late for work by 20 minutes. It was busy and there were a ton of people clamoring  for their drinks, so I couldn't say anything sooner or I would have asked for a refund and left. All I received was a sorry when most places would probably give you the drink for free for the inconvenience.  Whatever. I have never experienced a  problem here before but lately things seem to be a little lax. I'm hoping they start getting it together soon because right now I am going to take a break from them. I hope when I come back, things will start making sense.

0.description: Here's the deal. Argo's drinks would be forgettable, if it were easy for me to part with $5. As it is, $5 seems like a lot more money when you're spending it on something that doesn't totally delight you. The good news for Argo is that you can just skip the drink and spend that $5 on something totally phenomenal - just move three feet to your left. Over in the food case they have a pesto, spinach and tomato sandwich that they will warm up for you (I ask them to double the time, b/c it's usually a little cold in the middle). Or if that doesn't trip your trigger, try the Cuban sandwich. That's $5 well spent, friend.Consumer's Warning: I'd recommend their veggie lentil bowl thing, but if your GI is like my GI, your coworkers will HATE you afterwards.

38.description: Someone from Argo's main office apologized for my trouble and sent me a couple of free drink coupons, which I appreciated.  She said that only managers could give them to customers, which was why I wasn't offered one after the accident.  Not a great explanation, but there you go.

20.description: Let me preface this review by saying that I like Argo a lot. There are many different types of drinks and I have tried many and enjoyed most. That being said, this location.just.sucks. When I first started going here two years ago, the baristas were nice, quick, and efficient. Something changed. Management? Just those working there? Now they are TERRIBLE. My order has been wrong more often than not.They are also terribly slow. There have been times where I have left because even though there are 2 people in line, it took 15 minutes per person's drink... even though there are 2+ workers there. Hire better workers and I will be back in a jiffy!

19.description: Note: My ratings are in regards to comparing each Argo Tea location. My goal is to visit them all!Lucky for me it's not easy for me to get to Prentice Hospital, or else I'd be in their lobby all of the time with my books to the point where they might think I'm a lost grad student or have a sister who keeps getting pregnant. I have a lot of family in healthcare, none of whom work at Prentice, but I'm always really calm in a hospital setting. Add nice cushy chairs and this Argo Tea and wow, nice atmosphere and peeeeerrrrfect for when I need to study. Although, I doubt the general public can really come here and schmooze all that much. So my suggestion to you? Take a brief moment to pass by here sometime after a nice weather day of shopping on the Magnificent Mile, or perusing the Museum of Contemporary Art. Even better, grab a nice, chilled cup of tea from Argo (I suggest the iced Charitea or Carolina Honey...both of which, are by the way, very VERY sweet) and sit for a bit in the little park behind the museum. P.S. If I am fortunate to one day be a mum, I'll insist to go to Prentice for their outstanding healthcare and so I can assuage birth pains with sips of Argo Tea creations. Ha! I hope you're around for that long Argo!

33.description: Note: My ratings are in regards to comparing each Argo Tea location. My goal is to visit them all!Lucky for me it's not easy for me to get to Prentice Hospital, or else I'd be in their lobby all of the time with my books to the point where they might think I'm a lost grad student or have a sister who keeps getting pregnant. I have a lot of family in healthcare, none of whom work at Prentice, but I'm always really calm in a hospital setting. Add nice cushy chairs and this Argo Tea and wow, nice atmosphere and peeeeerrrrfect for when I need to study. Although, I doubt the general public can really come here and schmooze all that much. So my suggestion to you? Take a brief moment to pass by here sometime after a nice weather day of shopping on the Magnificent Mile, or perusing the Museum of Contemporary Art. Even better, grab a nice, chilled cup of tea from Argo (I suggest the iced Charitea or Carolina Honey...both of which, are by the way, very VERY sweet) and sit for a bit in the little park behind the museum. P.S. If I am fortunate to one day be a mum, I'll insist to go to Prentice for their outstanding healthcare and so I can assuage birth pains with sips of Argo Tea creations. Ha! I hope you're around for that long Argo!

2.description: I kept running into Argo Tea and I have to say I loved them. My favorite drink was the Hibiscus ginger ale. Such a refreshing drink to have on a warm summer's day, especially after you've been walking for 5 miles.

34.description: I wandered in here on my first ever day in Chicago, so forgive the totally non-objective excitement with which this review is written. Also note I'm English, and any kind of thing relating to tea genetically makes me want to hug someone. That's just the way it is. OK, so they have a MILLION KINDS OF TEA. I ordered Chai. it was good. I didn't know what all the different milk options even meant (I went and did some revision in Trader Joe's and now I understand - also, half and half?! That's genius), so I came across as a right idiot but the bloke behind the counter didn't seem to mind. He made my chai and heated up my brownie and I was very very happy. Now I have to go back (genetic pull) and try all the other millions of teas, even if they do cost $3 a go (which when you think about it is quite a lot to pay for tea...). But they sound more like tea cocktails anyway. And I'm new. Also I'm now ridiculously excited to learn that this is a chain and I can indulge in tea and brownies the size of my head all over the city. Like I said, I'm pretty easily pleased at this stage.....

32.description: I love Argo Tea - great variety of tea, great locations, and I've always had good customer service.However, their version of bubble tea is not the milkshake, blended type I'm used to:  It's iced tea with these little cubes of really sweet what-I-assume-is-tapioca.  I just got the mango green bubble tea, and the flavors are all there (delicious!) , but the texture is not the slushy blended consistency I was craving.  Again, it's not bad - just different.

18.description: Had a muffin one morning and almost choked when a long brown hair was stuck on the back of my throat, lesson learned, grossed out. Need to be a little more hygenic, I thought it was disgusting and will never go there again. People who eat here really need to look at the muffins in the middle before you bite into it.

41.description: ....just wanted to see if this one was on here.  It is now open...and it is in a handy location....what a great sneak.

13.description: Tired of coffee? What to avoid the line at Feinbucks? Come over to Prentice for some delicious and refreshing tea. Argo also has some nice little sandwiches. My personal favorites are the hot ginger tea and hot honey tea. Prefect for when it is cold outside!

4.description: This is located in the lobby of Northwestern's Prentice Women's Hospital.  Most people are not here for a happy reason, so you think they would be falling all over themselves to help you out.  Um, no.I was there early for an appointment and decided to grab something to drink.  I ordered a chai tea and hubby wanted some coffee.  The barista said "we make tea" although there were coffee items on the menu.  I don't get it.  Isn't a sale a sale?Anyway, I left to visit the restroom and came back and our drinks STILL weren't ready!  Hubby was reading the paper wondering what happened as others came and went.  Then my chai was missing some of the spiciness.  Just not good.Until the service picks up and the employees actually care I would say it's not worth the hassle.

24.description: I frequent several Argo Tea Cafes, but this is my go-to stop in the morning when I have time. The service is friendly and the tea is delicious. My new obsession is the green tea ginger twist--hot or cold. I actually have cravings for this drink. I also love the fact that they have vegan muffins--chocolate chip or lemon poppyseed. It's nice that Argo recognizes that vegans need tasty baked goods on the go just as much as everyone else!

6.description: I was a fan of Argo Tea.  But I had a horrible experience here.  For medical reasons, I can't have caffeine right now (as I'm sure is true of many women coming to this hospital). I wanted something caffeine free and milky; didn't seem like I'd have problems finding options at a tea shop (as opposed to, say, Corner Bakery, where I went beforehand only to find no options).  But, of their signature drinks, only two are caffeine free and only one is milky.  So, I had *one* choice.  I asked the person at the counter about other options and she looked up at the signature drink board and read off the same drink options (um, hello?  I can read). I again asked for *other* options. She recommended their hot chocolate drinks, even though they do, indeed, have caffeine.  I explained that I could not have caffeine--none, zero, zip.  We went around and around like this.  Another person at the counter stepped in to help, but again suggest their hot chocolate drinks (???!!!) They couldn't come up with any solution, so I finally ordered my only option, a Teapuccino (medium for $4.33), and asked for contact information to Argo Tea so I could complain about their options, especially in this particular location given that so many other women would have similar constraints.  I mean, even Starbucks (one block away and where I should have gone had I not already been to two other places and running short on time) offers a Vanilla Rooibos Latte.  I left, but later when I took a sip of the Teapuccino it tasted awful and I ended up throwing it away.I sent a message to Argo Tea headquarters telling them about my bad experience, including the misinformation the people at the counter gave me about their hot chocolate drinks--this is a serious problem for people with medical restrictions like allergies.  That's just asking for a lawsuit, imho.  I also told them the drink was awful and that I wanted a refund.They never responded.Instead, a couple days later I went back and demanded a refund, which thankfully they gave me.  But I won't ever be returning to this place.  I think they seriously need to rethink their product and how they train their employees.  Very disappointing, Argo.

22.description: These guys were great. No lines, great coffee and blueberry muffins. I went to the Starbuck's across the street in Northwestern one day and waited in line for at least 15 minutes. Not that they were slow, just long lines. Definitely try Argo Tea as an alternative coffee source. I recommend the latte and I had the chance to try the pumpkin chai, which was great.

15.description: This review is only on the customer service side. I love Argo tea! I think it is my favorite tea spot that I have ever been to. Today, however, I didn't receive any change after purchasing a medium Match Vanilla Green Tea Latte. I gave the gentleman a $20 and he didn't give me any change. I was so confused. I had given him my Argo card and though he added it to my account. I checked the balance and turned out he did not. I went back to the register and he told me I gave him a $5. I was upset and told him I gave him $20. I had to complain to another worker and they finally counted the money and returned the proper change, which took them a while. I wish they could of given me  a free drink for the hassle and wait. I don't think I'll be coming back to this Argo tea spot, especially that I was late to work!

40.description: My faves: mate latte and Carolina honey.$5 is pricey for some tea, though.Use your student ID for a discount!UPDATE 5/23/08:This Argo Tea is staffed by absolutely wonderful people.

7.description: I've been on a latte binge lately and the latte here is by far the best I've tasted.  Bye bye Starbucks!

36.description: Great drinks, and quick service. However, some of the people that work here are RUDE. One lady in particular. So watch out.

30.description: Stumbled upon Argo Tea while in the N Michigan Ave area -- found lots of people studying, chatting, business meetings -- seems like a good place for just about anything.Great selection of teas, iced or hot (they also have espresso options, but can't shy away from tea at a place with tea in its name, right?).  In a span of two days, I dropped by Argo 3x.  Tried out the Iced Sweet Carolina Honey tea -- awesome, light, and just a pinch of sweet.  Also tried the Hibiscus tea, which was a bit too sour for me.  And the Green Tea Ginger Twist -- which sounds good in theory, but was too gingery for me.  They also had a pretty large selection of loose teas, as well as a pretty comprehensive menu for ordering (everything from chai to pearl milk tea).  Only thing I'd take a star off for is price -- it's definitely expensive for even the smallest cup of tea!

3.description: I LOVE argo tea, but this location just does not do it for me. The baristas aren't always super friendly. I feel like they just want to do their job serving you as quickly as possible. Also, 90% of the time I've gotten a signature drink from here, it has such a bland taste like it's super watered down. Not cool :( If you want GOOD argo, head a few blocks to the one on Rush.

14.description: The tea is tasty, but it always takes sooo long to get my drink.

58.description: By far, hands down, the best way to explore Chicago! I would do the tour all over again in a heart beat! Too bad I was only in town for the weekend :/ Karen, thank you for being so informative and awesome throughout our tour. You rock!

56.description: The bikes bites and brews tour was great!  So much fun to ride around Chicago and taste some food along the way. Our tour guide, Gabe was awesome! He was super knowledgable and fun. Would highly recommend!
