29.description: Our family did the Bobby's TIKE hike bike tour.  It was a two hour tour of a total of 5 miles that covered the lakefront Lincoln Park zoo and part of the botanical gardens.  The tour was entirely on bike paths and never on a city street which makes it very safe in worry free.   The pace was very enjoyable for our entire family in a fun way to experience Chicago     We had children ages 6, 9 &11.  The outfitted us with great bikes in adjusted everyone well.  Our six-year-old had a tagalong attachment too.   Everyone in our group had an awesome time in all agreed we would do it again and look forward to doing other tours with Bobby's in the future.  Thumbs up to our guide Ben!!!  Ben attentive to all the children, he gave  us some good photo opportunities, and showed us some great sites! Most of all he was extremely patient with us!!! He really takes pride in giving a great tour and it shows.

42.description: My wife and our two kids did the Family/Kids bike tour yesterday and had an awesome time. Our guide, Nick, was very knowledgable about Chicago history and he was great with the kids. Having grown up in Chicago and moving away as adults, my wife and I loved the history. Great company, great ride, great time.

23.description: Wow! How fun! We biked the lake neighborhood tour with tour guide Eddie this past Friday morning and we had a blast! Eddie was hilarious but also very knowledgable.  We laughed at every stop. While biking Eddie made sure we were all together and safe. The pace was very relaxed. What a great way to see the city! This tour was the highlight of our trip and we did many really cool things, including a Frank Lloyd Wright tour, an architectural boat tour and the Art Institute. Thank you Bobby and thank you Eddie!

47.description: This is an excellent way to tour Chicago, even for someone who hasn't been on a bike in years. Our tour guide was Liz, and she was outstanding: entertaining, informative, and friendly. I would recommend this tour to anyone interested in seeing and learning about the Lakeshore neighborhoods.

8.description: I was looking for a good spot to get a tune up on my road bike before this weekend's bike the drive event, luckily these guys had a groupon and had a slot to fit me in very quickly. The shop seems to primarily focus on bike rentals and tours, but what better shop to go to for a tune up than one constantly fixing their own bikes?I went for the premium tune up which includes all the typical break/gears/wheels adjustments as well as a solid degreasing and cleaning of the entire bike. Dropped it on a Tuesday, picked up on a Thursday, not a single complaint. Bike looks good as new!Staff was very friendly and seemed very knowledgeable of the city for their tours. I overheard some rapidfire interview questions for new tour guides, very tricky questions which require a good amount of insight on the history and culture of the city. I may have to come back for a bike tour to learn some of this stuff!Great job on a tune up, great staff. Absolutely worth foregoing your normal shop to check out for tune up!

31.description: We had a great time with the lakefront bike tour with a female guide, ?Meg?, who had a great sense of humor and knowledge about the city's history.  It was a nice, easy ride with a nice ending at Lake Michigan.  I would love to try their food tour next time.

34.description: While I have not yet experienced a hike or bike outing myself, my best friend and I were just subjected to 30 mins of the Tour Guide blabbing nonstop for 30 plus minutes at a ridiculously volume about her life to the poor trapped tourists while they sat captive in a bar. (Yes, first thing I think of when going on a bike tour is alcohol.)Both the adults and the kids sat silent and, dare I say , in hell. Finally the shrieking harpy announced "well that was more than 15 minutes! Thanks for the Bloody Mary!" Before resuming her bike tour. While I realize the group may have signed up for the Masochist Special, if this is indicative of Bobby's tours, then no. Never.

16.description: Wow! How fun! We biked the lake neighborhood tour with tour guide Eddie this past Friday morning and we had a blast! Eddie was hilarious but also very knowledgable.  We laughed at every stop. While biking Eddie made sure we were all together and safe. The pace was very relaxed. What a great way to see the city! This tour was the highlight of our trip and we did many really cool things, including a Frank Lloyd Wright tour, an architectural boat tour and the Art Institute. Thank you Bobby and thank you Eddie!

13.description: This bike your is the best in the city of Chicago. Our tour guide a native Jeremy was awesome !! Very informative and entertaining and the locations we stopped to refuel our selves with the best food and beer that Chicago has to offer. We were also explain the true Chicago style pizza verses the fake.. And there is a difference !! I recommend this to any local and visitors to this wonderful city !!

11.description: Loved this bike tour!!! Probably my most favorite part of visiting Chicago. I went on the Gangster Tour and loved every minute of it. Felt safe and learned so much!

39.description: I thought it was the best way to see Chicago and many of its beautiful neighborhoods. The food was indulgent, and all the iconic items you wish to taste from the city. Our guide, Tim, was welcoming and very knowledgeable with lots of information to learn about the city. The ride was so much fun, and easy exercise for anyone that is reasonably in shape. I was sad when it was over because I could have ridden all day seeing the city!

37.description: We did a tour with DK and it as AWESOME!!!! I would highly recommend doing this tour if you want to see the Chicago neighborhoods up close and personal! DK was extremely knowledgable and did a great job explaining the history of Chicago!GREAT TIME!!!

0.description: My 11-year-old son and I took the neighborhood tour - it was fantastic! Our guide was Benjamin and he did an amazing job of both pointing out sights and keeping us safe. At one point my son got caught in a crosswalk filled with people at a very busy intersection and couldn't get out. He was panicking and Benjamin calmly dismounted his own bike and helped my son get back where he needed to be. Benjamin did it without scolding or shaming and was unbelievably encouraging and calm. Benjamin also managed to rein in the 10 high schoolers that also were in our tour group and keep them focused and where we needed to be when we needed to be there. That was no small feat! He never lost his smile or affable sense of humor. The sights on the tour are incredible and some of the best views of the city we saw while there. It's so much different than a bus tour - we were able to go into the parks and ride past some of the greatest Chicago has to offer. Chicago is super bike friendly as well. The price is totally fair and includes your helmet rental. The bikes are well maintained and were easy to ride. My only caution is that you do ride about 7 miles on the route. The breaks are often enough to give you rest when it's needed, but it isn't "ridiculously easy" if you're not in okay shape, as described on their site. I'm in horrible shape and I obviously completed the tour (and LOVED it) but I was really tired at the end! For most people it's probably totally fine, I just wanted to describe my experience. If we return to Chicago this will be tour I would gladly re-do. I cannot recommend them highly enough!

38.description: I took the Lakefront Neighborhoods Tour and it was one of the best experiences from my first trip to Chicago. Daniella was an awesome tour guide; she was very charismatic. She made the tour entertaining and very informative. I highly recommend Bobby's Bike Hike!

51.description: Awesome tour! Nice staff, good equipment, and Liz was an excellent tour guide. Lakefront tour was very nice. Highly recommend. Thanks Liz for a great tour. You have the perfect personality for this job!

27.description: We took the kid bike tour with our 8 year old and 6 year old and we all had a great time.  Our tour guides Ben and Liz were fantastic.  The tour was just the right pace for the kids.  We saw amazing views of the city and learned some interesting Chicago facts as well.  We highly recommend this tour company!

32.description: I can't recommend more highly! We found this treasure of a place on Yelp and took a chance this would be an active fun way to get to know Chicago more.  We did the Lakeview neighborhood bike hike with our fabulous guide Eddie on a Friday at 1:00.  The three hour tour was an easy one, exertion wise, so don't be intimidated if you haven't biked for a while.  It was fun riding through traffic in our pack of 25 or so people-and most of the ride was through very quiet, interesting neighborhoods.  Chicago is made for biking!  We stopped maybe 4-5 times to hear some interesting facts about the neighborhoods, and one of our stops was a 15 minute stop at a cafe in Lincoln Park. (A quick beer for us!). We ended with an amazing ride along the beachfront bike trail enjoying beautiful lake and skyline views.  I'll definitely go back and do another tour - the Gangster tour looks fun-- and will request Eddie as our guide again!  This was a unique way to cover a lot of city ground.  More ground than walking, and way more fun than a bus.   Definitely an easy, flat ride, probably even appropriate for our 6 year old.   Love this place!!!   Think nerdy fun!

54.description: Best part of our weekend vacation in Chicago was this bike tour of the city with Liz as our awesome guide!!!!  Can't wait to do another tour with them next time!!!!!  Highly Recommend!!!!

48.description: being in town for a just a few days for a conference, i wanted a way to see the city, fast, but not on a bus.  this was perfect.  i did the night tour.  our tour guide elliot was charismatic and made the tour fun.  the bike tour goes north on the lakefront trail, to gold coast, then through the downtown area on city streets, stopping at the riverwalk, then millenium park, buckingham fountain, and the field museum, where you can take beautiful nighttime photos of the skyline, then going back up the lake front trail.  this is perfect for the person who has short time and wants to see as much of the major sights as possible in a 3 hour bike trip.

44.description: The neighborhood bike tour was awesome! I used to live in Chicago and we actually went to places that I have never been. Liz was super knowledgable  about  the city. We learned a ton of cool interesting facts. I definitely recommend this bike tour if you come to Chicago

24.description: This was an awesome venue to see and experience Chicago. Liz was our guide and well worth requesting Liz, she is funny knowledgeable non stop source of fun facts about this great city. They have bikes in clean good condition and provide helmets and pouch to hold ID and wallet and even if needed have rain ponchos. Great friendly group .

7.description: This was a great way to see the city. The tour guy was funny and very knowledgeable about the city. The fact to get to see places like Gino's where there was a long line to get in was amazing. Highly recommend.

49.description: My wife and I took the gangster tour and loved it.  We were guided through many different areas of the city & given the full story on the inception & demise of The Chicago Outfit.  Our tour guide Deirdre was great. She knows her gangster knowledge, she's almost as gangster as my wife, which is a difficult feat.Tour ended with a beautiful ride back along the lake. We travel frequently & this was by far the best tour we've ever been on. Well be back. Thanks to Deirdre!

40.description: We did the bikes, bites, and brews tour with Mike and had a blast!  The stops were delicious and well organized.  Mike shared interesting information about various parts of Chicago and did a great job ensuring a safe and fun ride!  We had bikers of various levels on our tour and Mike did a great job in ensuring they all had fun!  I highly recommend this tour.

53.description: My parents, fiance, & I did the Neighborhood tour and it was FANTASTIC!My fiance & I live in Chicago and even we learned a great deal about the city and saw different parts of Chicago.  The staff is super friendly and our tour guide was informative & hilarious.  I am not an advanced bike rider by any means, but I felt safe the entire time!Tip:  The roads in Chicago should be a little less crowded on Saturday AMs if you are worried about traffic!

30.description: Chicago is an amazing city!If you want to complete your experience in this city you must do this bike tour!!We did it with Even, a really likeable,available and expert guide!!Enjoy your Chicago

46.description: We live in Chicago, but always book a tour with Bobby's when we have friends in town. We had booked a tour night tour, but because of unfortunate weather (lots of rain & lightning) the tour guide was forced to cancel. In exchange he gave us passes to use at a later date. As many of you know sometimes life gets in the way of making plans. Before we knew, it the passes we were given to use at a later date had expired. I quickly contacted Bobby's and they were EXTREMELY accommodating. After a few email exchanges we selected a new date and went on the City Lights tour on July 17th. Elliot was an excellent tour guide and remembered everyone's name in our group of 16 riders! He was funny and informative. I will keep returning to Bobby's year after year because of their excellent customer service from both the office and the employees. Bobby's is just another great example of a fantastic local businesses knowing how to treat their customers right. Thank you Bobby's for an excellent Friday night! Woooop Wooop!

1.description: My husband and I did the Neighborhood Tours on a Sunday at 1pm.  We had Liz, as our tour guide, and she was FANTASTIC!  She was super energetic and really shared her enthusiasm the entire tour.  It took us a little out of "downtown" into the neighborhoods, which was really fun.  If you do a tour, ask for Liz!

55.description: Being a Chicago native, it takes a lot to impress me when it comes to city tours - Bobby's knocked my socks off!  Jeff, our tour guide for the Lakefront Neighborhoods tour, did a fantastic job with pacing and keeping our very diverse group together, and shared some interesting tidbits about the city - my visitors from out of town were fascinated, and I even learned a few new things.  The tour took us through neighborhoods from Streeterville up to the Lincoln Park Zoo, stopping at various points for explanation.  Some of our stops seemed really random until Jeff went into his talk, at which point a new appreciation for the area was gained.  It gave us all such a unique and intimate view of the city.  On our way back down, we took the Lakefront Path, affording us some great views of the skyline and our gorgeous Lake Michigan.What's more, Bobby's is a small local company.  There's another major bike tour company in town, one that I've used in other cities, and while I'm sure their tours are also great, doing a tour through Bobby's assures that you're supporting a small, local company.

9.description: My girlfriend and I did the Bikes, Bites, and Brews tour on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and were led by Mike.  Over the course of 4-plus hours, we sampled Chicago style pizza from Gino's East, hot dog from Murphy's, tried a few beer samples in the shadows of Wrigley, before finally hitting a cupcake place and another beer tasting on the home stretch.  The people at Billy's are well-organized and well stocked with bikes that ride comfortably, and have 7 gears although we were rarely in need of more than a single gear.  We were outfitted with safety equipment and a small bag to store belongings.  Our guide kept us safely grouped, and I never felt unsafe, despite biking right to Wrigley Field through traffic minutes after a huge game between the Cubs and Cardinals.The highlight of our trip was definitely the guide, Mike.  He is a true service professional, knowledgable about not only the food places, but Chicago history and neighborhoods in general.  Several times we stopped so that he could describe landmarks that we happened to be biking by.  Totally not part of the tour for the day but greatly appreciated.  He ended the tour by taking us to several picturesque locations along the lake.  He was a total rockstar and we felt fortunate to have been in a group led by Mike.I'd gladly do another tour with this company, although based on how often the Bites and Brews tour sells out, I'm guessing it might be their most popular by far.   Overall, this was a wonderful way to spend about 5 hours on a gorgeous weekend Chicago day.

26.description: Dropped off bike for comprehensive tuneup (great Groupon deal). Less than 24 hours later I receive courtesy call from Tom advising it's ready for pickup. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Efficient service. Great location right off LSD/Ohio. Already tested out bike performance and everything appears perfect so far. Would definitely recommend this place and I will be returning.

25.description: This was an excellent tour with out excellent tour guide Tim! Tim was knowledgeable about the history of the stops and kept things very interestingfood and drink places were excellent. Not a rushed ride - nice pace for all.Bikes were good - lighter than expected and had nice pouches on them.Give you a bottle of water for the route.Recommended!!!Thank you guys!

12.description: Highly recommend their Bikes Bites and Brews Tour!  Daniella our guide was awesome. Riding thru the neighbourhoods  gives you a whole different prospective than you can get walking or driving a car. The food stops were awesome and truly Chicago.

59.description: I took my 4 kids, ages 5 to 10, on the Tike tour. The staff were helpful in getting us all set up on the right bikes and trailer for the younger riders. The ride was a perfect distance, through nice scenic areas and a touch of Chicago history as well. The four kids and I were very happy to have gone on the tour!

21.description: We did the Lakefront Neighborhood Tour with Eddy on Saturday, 09/19/15. He was witty, knowledgeable, and made group safety a priority. Highly recommend Bobby's Bike Hike as an excellent way to see a slice of Chicago.

17.description: Bobby's bike tours was recommended by a student of mine who insisted I check it out on my trip to Chicago. When my husband and I went online to book our reservations we were pleasantly surprised by the varied (and awesome!) tours. We chose the Gangster tour and I am so glad we did. Our tour guide, Dierdra, was fantastic. Knowledgeable, personable, and despite whizzing 13 miles around the city, she kept us feeling safe.  I highly recommend requesting her tours when you book. You will not regret it.Don't let the 13 miles deter you from booking this tour. It was the best tour we have ever been on & we can't wait to return.Dierdra- THANKS AGAIN!

10.description: This was an excellent tour with out excellent tour guide Tim! Tim was knowledgeable about the history of the stops and kept things very interestingfood and drink places were excellent. Not a rushed ride - nice pace for all.Bikes were good - lighter than expected and had nice pouches on them.Give you a bottle of water for the route.Recommended!!!Thank you guys!

5.description: So many reviews to write, so little time.  My girlfriend and I are becoming something of an expert at bike tours - what can I say, everyone should be good at something - having done 3 bike tours in 3 different cities in the past year (what?  how many bike tours should it take to be an expert?).  Anyway, we've easily done two 5 star bike tours - this one and Confederacy of Cruisers in New Orleans - and one awful tour in Austin (never got to that review).  We loved this bike tour - we did the lakefront neighborhoods tour at 9AM on a beautiful spring day.  I think this is key - do not take a bike tour in winter or your bits and pieces might freeze, and do not take one in the summer, at least not with me, or you will end up drowning in sweat - if not yours, then mine.  You need a nice day, Spring or Fall.What makes a good bike tour?  First and foremost, the bikes.  While not as critical as the tour guide and the stops you make, you want bikes with a bit of comfort in the seat.  Something that won't remind you of the scene in Little Nicky when the devil shoves a pineapple up Hitler's butt (am I the only one who saw that movie?).  When it comes to bike comfort, Bobby's is awesome.  Large, well padded seats, that won't make you feel like you just gave birth out the wrong end after sitting there for 3 hours.  The bikes themselves were well made, sturdy, seven speeds (which was plenty for a casual ride) and with fanny packs attached to store your belongings.What else makes a good bike tour?  The tour guide, of course.  Jeremy was awesome.  Energetic and knowledgeable about the city, taking us to a number of off the beaten path locations that we'd otherwise never have found.  He kept us entertained and importantly, kept us safe biking around the streets of Chicago.  Also afterwards, helped recommend places to eat and go out.  Fantastic tour guide.  He also keeps things at a nice casual pace, though some of that has to do with the group.  You want to go casually, but you don't want to be able to walk there faster.  We had a good group, but Jeremy kept us at a pace where we did not feel like we were over exerting ourselves.  It was a very relaxing and comfortable pace.Finally, you must also have a city with stuff to see, and this is Chicago, and there is plenty to see.  But what made this one (and New Orleans) different from Austin is that we were taken to places you might not have otherwise known to go to.  In Austin, we were taken to the places anyone would know to go to just by doing a "things to see" in Austin search on Google.  A complete waste.  Jeremy did take us to the Lincoln Park Zoo, but that was mostly just a rest stop of bathrooms and coffee and because there were baby gorillas we might not have known about had Jeremy not suggested it (we weren't planning on going to the zoo, but glad we did, because he was so cute and reminded me of me (I was a hairy lad - too much info?).  Otherwise, we saw old town, and the old playboy mansion, and learned about how much of chicago and the places we saw was actually built on top of garbage  We saw St. Michael's church (beautiful), a bit of the lakeshore (beautiful), some other rich areas and stuff.  Honestly, that description is terrible, but don't take it out on Bobby's because my memory and descriptive talents are about as good as my stapler.The rest of the people we met at the shop were just as great as Jeremy.  Helpful with the bikes, information, checking out, and even charging a tip on our credit card because someone named Todd was (is) an idiot and forgot his cash, again.  And they will allow you to rent a bike for the rest of the day for just $10, so its obviously best to do the tour early so you can get all day with a bike - and don't be fooled by the city of Chicago's bike-sharing program.  They say $7 for 24 hours, but you can only keep the bike out for 30 minute intervals or you get charged overtime.  Therefore, you'd have to bike for 30 minutes, return it, and then take out a new one - every 30 minutes.  The $3 extra at Bobby's is worth saving the inconvenience.I am positive that when we next find ourselves in Chicago, we will do one of their other tours. They still have the Bikes Bites and Brews tour, City Lights tour, Southside Gangster tour and the Museums and Parks at Sunset tour.  If any are as good as this one, then they will be well worth doing.

3.description: This is our favourite place to rent bikes in Chicago. It was our first time in Chicago and first time spending our Christmas there. We rented a bike to tour the city on Christmas Day but we received a call saying that the shop was going to be closed for the holidays. They hooked us up with a two days deal for price of one so that we can pick up the bikes a day earlier. It worked out well. One of the bikes had a crooked handed but they fixed it right away after I did a test ride. Overall, the bikes were great. We were given all necessary gears including the helmet and bike locks without additional costs.

35.description: Besides Wrigley field, this was our favorite part of Chicago. DK was a great tour guide. We hope to make it back for a longer tour. 3 hours was great, but we would have loved a 5-6 hour tour.  There is so much to see. Great times in Chicago.

19.description: Our July 4th tour guides were very, very funny & entertaining which make them so fun!Go. You won't regret it,

28.description: My sister and I were in Chicago visiting for the first time for a long weekend as part of an annual girls' getaway. Originally, I was apprehensive about taking a bike tour and reading that it'd be a 13-mile ride. I had also taken a bike tour last year while in Bogota and felt "out of my element" on that trip. However, do not fret novice bike-riders because the people at Bobby's Bike Hike are super professional, courteous, knowledgeable, and really make an effort to not only design a great tour, but to make you feel like you're being take care of in terms of fun and safety. We decided to take the Bikes, Bites, and Brews Tours, which was a great way to see a lot of the city in not a lot of time and a way to tick off a lot of items on your must-eats list. Our guide, Timmy, was FANTASTIC!! (That's right! I used ALL CAPS!) Highly knowledgeable about Chicago history, personable, friendly, responsible, and helpful with the picture-taking and with giving us plenty of photo-ops along the way. The tour has a good mix of bike-riding and food stops. The amount of food stops wasn't too much for us (we didn't have a chance to have breakfast before going on the tour, which I think helped us out) and the beer tasting was toward the end of the tour when you already had food in your stomach. Smart planning. Anyway, I'd recommend the tour, Timmy, and Bobby's to anyone going to visit Chicago. It's a beautiful city and seeing it on a Bobby's tour is great way to do it.

45.description: It provides great bikes and great service with a reasonable price.'Definitely would choose it again once needed.

33.description: My sister and I are visiting Chicago for these fees and we took part on a bike tour of Chicago and their great eateries and beers. Our tour guide-Tim was amazing! He always made sure that our safety was being met, while taking us to great places around Chicago and spoke on Chicago's history. I highly recommend! Go Tim!

43.description: Went in to rent a road bike to explore the Lake Shore bike path...glad I did.  While the tires were a little soft, the bike rode great and I was able to do most of the trail.  Was a bit disappointed that they offered a 2 hour rental then a 4 hour rental, but nothing in between.  Not that it was that big of a price difference, but since I was on a premium bike I would have liked to use an extra hour to sight-see or finish the trail.  As it was I came back about 15 minutes late but that was no big deal.They offer an evening tour which I would go back in do when the wife visits with me, as well as an architectural tour.Couple quick tips:Book through yelp and get the discount (I missed out on a 15% discount by not doing so and only checking in...bit of a rip!)Bring your own water...$3.50 for a "large" (think a 16 oz?) was a bit steep, but with the humidity a necessary expense.

2.description: Ask for Mike!  He's the best tour guide ever!- Super patient- Super nice- Super funny- Super chillThis was my first bike tour ever and at the beginning of it, I admit, I was pretty scared and overwhelmed.  After we got all of our gear, Mike gave us rules on how to ride in a group in the freaking scary streets of Chicago... like, downtown Chicago..  I'm not your seasoned, confident biker either, so yeah, I was not looking forward to the stress.But luckily enough, Mike made it super easy and stress free and we had a great time!  I felt super safe with him and our posse, and this tour really gives you a feel for the city.  There's so much history and we only got a taste of it (and a big one at that!)!  We biked about 15 miles total in 3-4 hours and had bites and brews along the way.  We ventured into different awesome neighborhoods and even got tips after the tour on what to do with the rest of our Chicago trip!  We even stopped to take pictures of monumental touristy Chicago things (because you know you all want to!) like Wrigley Field, Hef's Hall, and of course, the skyline from Lincoln Park AND the Waterfront!If you're short on time but you want to really get to know the city, please do the "Bikes, Bites, and Brews" tour (if you're 21+, obvi) and you won't regret it!  Trust me! ;)

18.description: It provides great bikes and great service with a reasonable price.'Definitely would choose it again once needed.

41.description: Let me start this review off by mentioning that I haven't gotten on a bike in probably like...what feels like FOREVER...so I bought the tickets and was like oh sh*t...hopefully I still know what I'm doing.GOOD NEWS - I did! Totally didn't fall. The End. J/KMy friend was visiting from DC this past weekend, and I thought a bike tour would be a fun way to explore Chicago. When we arrived at the venue, we met our tour guide (Brian) immediately. He was very charismatic and told funny jokes, which he mentioned he thought were corny but I got a kick out of them. Before taking off, we had time to adjust our bikes and go over safety rules of biking in the city. During the tour, we rode through River North, Gold Coast, Old Town, Lincoln Park, and down the Lakefront Trail back to the venue. We stopped several times at various locations to take in the surroundings, and I learned a lot of new facts about the city. Brian was very knowledgeable and answered questions from the group with ease. It is a three hour tour (cue the Gilligan's Island theme song), which sounds like a long time but I felt like the hours flew by and the ride wasn't strenuous at all. The only part that was somewhat challenging was trying to navigate around all the people utilizing the Lakefront Trail  that day. It was a beautiful day, so it seemed like EVERY PERSON IN CHICAGO was out that day.I definitely would recommend doing the bike hike if you are visiting from out of town, or even if you are a local! I know they do a food tour and gangster tour on the bikes too, so there are a few different options to mix things up!

52.description: In 20 minutes I experienced this bike tour going through the center sidewalk of Oz Park. It was full of pedestrians. The incessant bell ringing and use of that sidewalk was ridiculous. Surely you can use the perimeter walks??  The only reason there are 3 stars is that they had helmets on.

50.description: Bobby's bike tours was recommended by a student of mine who insisted I check it out on my trip to Chicago. When my husband and I went online to book our reservations we were pleasantly surprised by the varied (and awesome!) tours. We chose the Gangster tour and I am so glad we did. Our tour guide, Dierdra, was fantastic. Knowledgeable, personable, and despite whizzing 13 miles around the city, she kept us feeling safe.  I highly recommend requesting her tours when you book. You will not regret it.Don't let the 13 miles deter you from booking this tour. It was the best tour we have ever been on & we can't wait to return.Dierdra- THANKS AGAIN!

4.description: Let me start this review off by mentioning that I haven't gotten on a bike in probably like...what feels like FOREVER...so I bought the tickets and was like oh sh*t...hopefully I still know what I'm doing.GOOD NEWS - I did! Totally didn't fall. The End. J/KMy friend was visiting from DC this past weekend, and I thought a bike tour would be a fun way to explore Chicago. When we arrived at the venue, we met our tour guide (Brian) immediately. He was very charismatic and told funny jokes, which he mentioned he thought were corny but I got a kick out of them. Before taking off, we had time to adjust our bikes and go over safety rules of biking in the city. During the tour, we rode through River North, Gold Coast, Old Town, Lincoln Park, and down the Lakefront Trail back to the venue. We stopped several times at various locations to take in the surroundings, and I learned a lot of new facts about the city. Brian was very knowledgeable and answered questions from the group with ease. It is a three hour tour (cue the Gilligan's Island theme song), which sounds like a long time but I felt like the hours flew by and the ride wasn't strenuous at all. The only part that was somewhat challenging was trying to navigate around all the people utilizing the Lakefront Trail  that day. It was a beautiful day, so it seemed like EVERY PERSON IN CHICAGO was out that day.I definitely would recommend doing the bike hike if you are visiting from out of town, or even if you are a local! I know they do a food tour and gangster tour on the bikes too, so there are a few different options to mix things up!

6.description: Located in a tiny alley, this place is very popular on Tripadvisor and Yelp. I wanted to see some neighborhoods in Chicago and found biking to be very popular in the city. The person behind the counter was helpful and gave us instructions once we told him we are not frequent bikers. We were charged $22 per person renting Hybrid bike. Smooth transaction. They have a really cool way of naming their bikes. My bike was named TOM and the husband's Ellie. Pretty cute system. Loved our bike ride and Bobby Bikes.

22.description: My girlfriend and I did the Bikes, Bites, and Brews tour on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and were led by Mike.  Over the course of 4-plus hours, we sampled Chicago style pizza from Gino's East, hot dog from Murphy's, tried a few beer samples in the shadows of Wrigley, before finally hitting a cupcake place and another beer tasting on the home stretch.  The people at Billy's are well-organized and well stocked with bikes that ride comfortably, and have 7 gears although we were rarely in need of more than a single gear.  We were outfitted with safety equipment and a small bag to store belongings.  Our guide kept us safely grouped, and I never felt unsafe, despite biking right to Wrigley Field through traffic minutes after a huge game between the Cubs and Cardinals.The highlight of our trip was definitely the guide, Mike.  He is a true service professional, knowledgable about not only the food places, but Chicago history and neighborhoods in general.  Several times we stopped so that he could describe landmarks that we happened to be biking by.  Totally not part of the tour for the day but greatly appreciated.  He ended the tour by taking us to several picturesque locations along the lake.  He was a total rockstar and we felt fortunate to have been in a group led by Mike.I'd gladly do another tour with this company, although based on how often the Bites and Brews tour sells out, I'm guessing it might be their most popular by far.   Overall, this was a wonderful way to spend about 5 hours on a gorgeous weekend Chicago day.

15.description: This bike tour was a lot of fun. Daniella, our tour guide, was full of energy and kept everyone engaged. I felt it was just the right balance of getting some light exercise, taking breaks to learn about Chicago, and savoring a few local bites and brews. One mistake I made was to eat a big breakfast before going on the tour. They feed you a giant slice of deep dish pizza, pretty much right away, so it's a good idea to come kinda hungry.We cycled from their office, near Navy Piers, up through Lincoln Park, and back to the office along a different route. We were blessed with awesome, sunny weather, which made it that much more enjoyable. The view of the deep-blue Lake Michigan was breathtaking as we rode along the lakeside trail.

57.description: Our July 4th tour guides were very, very funny & entertaining which make them so fun!Go. You won't regret it,

20.description: This was our first trip to Chicago. There are so many different tour options in the city. The weather was perfect so we decided to take a bike tour, Bikes, Bites and Brews. PERFECT option. This was more than just a bike tour. Our guides Tim and David were incredible. They not only took us through quaint neighborhoods, fed us Chicago foods but also gave us so much historical information. It was truly 3 tours in one. As a side note , we are a couple close to 50 yrs old and found the pace very enjoyable. This is a tour for all ages. Highly recommended!

36.description: Excellent service. Brian was awesome. Good knowledge base and a great sense of humor!

14.description: Went in to rent a road bike to explore the Lake Shore bike path...glad I did.  While the tires were a little soft, the bike rode great and I was able to do most of the trail.  Was a bit disappointed that they offered a 2 hour rental then a 4 hour rental, but nothing in between.  Not that it was that big of a price difference, but since I was on a premium bike I would have liked to use an extra hour to sight-see or finish the trail.  As it was I came back about 15 minutes late but that was no big deal.They offer an evening tour which I would go back in do when the wife visits with me, as well as an architectural tour.Couple quick tips:Book through yelp and get the discount (I missed out on a 15% discount by not doing so and only checking in...bit of a rip!)Bring your own water...$3.50 for a "large" (think a 16 oz?) was a bit steep, but with the humidity a necessary expense.

58.description: Love love love this place! Employees are all very welcoming and extremely talented! I got a mani pedi eyebrow wax and lash extensions I'm super picky and Cindy was amazing she even stayed til 11 to take care of me!

56.description: The staff was accommodating as a walk-in and got me started right away for a mani, pedi, and eye brow wax. The eye brow was average- found a couple stray blonde hairs when I got home, but that's typical. The massage chair was the best I've ever experienced. It was kneeling right into the shoulder wings.. Amazing. Nails look great. Relaxing environment. And good selection of gossip mags - the only place I can justify spending the time to look through them!

29.description: Ms Cindy and her staff are fabulous. Kim, the receptionist is always on her toes taking care of every customer that comes in the door. The decorations and atmosphere is breathtaking. I really enjoyed my experience here. Ms Cindy took her time and did a fabulous job on my nails. I found this place on Yelp. Thank you so much. They have so many colors to choose from.

42.description: I had no problem walking on here at noon on Sunday, which scared me a little. Nail salons are always busy on the weekends! However, I got a great pedicure. She took her time and had attention to detail. A little pricier than I pay - I usually get a mani and a pedi for the same price - but I was happy with the results and experience. It's a cute little place, too!

23.description: Cindy is awesome! Knows regulars by their first name and has excellent polish skills! She uses a brush to remove any polish that's outside the nail, NOT her own fingernail like other salons. The salon is also very clean...and you can drink! Definitely recommend!!

47.description: Lily is great!!! Super friendly and gives the longest lasting no-chip manicure (up to 4 weeks!) and an amazing pedicure! Would recommend her to anyone!

8.description: I'm from New York and always love trying new nail places. This place was by far worth all the hype. Although I had to wait about 35 minutes to get my manicure, it was well worth the wait. The selection they have is very big! I tried their organic Zoya line. Highly recommend it! Next time I'm in Chicago I will definitely come back!

31.description: The worst. I get manis and pedis a lot, and I am not that picky. But this was one of the worst experiences I've ever had. They took me and my friend as walk-ins, which was nice. They started her pedi, and then a woman who I think was the owner started my mani. In the middle of my mani, they switched me to the pedicure station. Fine- not a crisis. But the guy doing my pedicure was not nice, had zero understanding of my English (just for things like "that hurts" I need them to understand!), and did a bad job on everything but the polish. He then went to finish my manicure and wanted to cut my cuticles again and cut my nails down even further when there was already nothing left!! He cut my skin and made me bleed, hurt my cuticles, and clearly had no idea what he was doing. I kept telling him no, I didn't want that- and he just ignored me. I was getting a gel mani, and he cleaned off my nails with alcohol, which is fine, but then tried to have me put my hands in the uv light when I didn't need to. I specifically asked for 4 fingers to be painted blue, and one finger to be gold- and he said he understood. He painted all of my fingers blue, and when I pointed it out, he did not care and he painted two coats of blue and then the gold- it looked awful. He and the owner kept talking about me in Vietnamese, which I found rude, since I was clearly unhappy and just trying to communicate. It was overpriced, not a great job, and the attitude was awful. I will never go back, and I recommend you stay away.

34.description: I was in Chicago and had a few hours before I needed to head to O'Hare, so I decided to visit Bedazzled based on its wonderful Yelp reviews. I went in for a walk-in, and Cindy greeted me and sat me down for a no-chip mani. My entire experience was wonderful - my manicure was beautiful, Cindy was kind, and I could tell Cindy and the rest of the staff were so greatly appreciated by the regulars who sat around me. I will definitely visit again the next time I'm in Chicago.

16.description: My usual go-to nail salon (Arbre Nails) wasn't able to accommodate me for a last minute mani/pedi so I decided to check out this place instead. Bedazzled is a cute, small salon which makes great use of space. I got a pedicure and no-chip manicure with Sandy, who did a wonderful job. She was very thorough and gave relaxing hand and leg massages.They have a loyalty card program in which you get $15 off your 10th visit (or maybe it's after your 10th visit).  Also, keep in mind that they give you a couple dollars off if you pay in cash instead of credit card.Overall I'm very happy with my experience and will definitely come back!

13.description: I stopped in since this is right around the corner from my apartment and brought in a picture of ombré nails that I found on Pinterest. Cindy spent almost 2 hours with me to get my nails to look as close to the picture as possible and was nothing but patient and kind. I would definitely recommend this salon as the staff was nice and the salon was clean and very busy. The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because I did spent a lot of time there but it was out of good intention.

11.description: This is the best nail salon around town! They have great customer service and make sure they please all their customers. Cindy, the owner does an excellent job as well as her staff! I highly recommend you check it out. Also, request Nancy, she is great!!

39.description: I'm on business in Chicago with my husband.  I NEEDED my nails done -- BAD!  I looked on Yelp and found Bedazzle. I called and made an appointment -- and was treated by Cindy the owner. What a wonderful, kind and gentle lady!  She was superb. She took her time with me from the moment that she sat me down to do my nails!!   I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND Bedazzle!  While I was getting my nails done, there were THREE people that walked in -- but not to get their nails done. Instead, to thank Cindy and tell her staff that they were the BEST NAILS they ever had!!!  When I am back in Chicago, I will be back!!

37.description: Quality no-chip manicure at a reasonable price. Would have given 5 stars but when I made the appointment for myself and three friends I was told we could all start our appointments at the same time. When we arrived they only had room for three of us and made one of my friends sit with her feet in the water for over 30 minutes before she was helped .

0.description: Soo glad I found this place on yelp!Cindy is FANTASTIC and dose an Awesome job..strong Attention to Details, which I Love!!The check-in girl Kimmy is also awesome & such a sweetheart!!!If you're in the Downtown area and looking to get your nails done, I would definitely recommend this place!!1.Go to this shop, you won't be disappointed & you get your $'s worth!!2.Call ahead AND MAKE A APPOINTMENT!! (can't stress that enough!!l Didn't even remember to use my 10% off, because I'm so pleased with my nails & because I really didn't need to.At 40$ for a full-set, this FABULOUS polish, With tip, This is a Fantastic bargain for Downtown!!!#louboutin #mynailLifestrong

38.description: The staff was really friendly and the atmosphere was nice. They had a lot of fun nail art and I'm super satisfied with my manicure. I had Cindy do my nails and she can do any design for you. I will definitely come back!

51.description: LaShun R.I came here for a mani and i love the service i receivedby Lily as long as i been getting manicures she is the firstperson to really grow out my nails i really love her workshe is a excellent nail tech.....

27.description: I've been coming here since my favorites at Elegant Nails left...My favorite here is Jenny and Lee. Make sure to book an appointment because they tend to become very busy at certain times. I've never had any issues here and I'm really picky.

32.description: Acrylic nail clients beware! I decided to try this place because it had 4.5 star review yet I only received 2.5 star service. I am visiting for the weekend so I thought I would pamper myself with a pedicure and get my acrylic nails filled. My pedicure was pretty good, average, I'd say. But my nails were a different story. The owner was super nice and has been in business for many years but I think it may be time for her to put down her dremmel. My nails were misshapen, rough and and had acrylic & glue stuck underneath them. I had to go to the drug store and buy nail polish remover, a file and buffer block to try to fix them. Thankfully I brought my own polish so that I could salvage my nails for the rest of my trip.

54.description: Best mani/pedi I've had in years! The salon is well laid out and efficient in design. Le is a great manicurist, with a great massage and nice results.

48.description: One of the very best gel manicure and pedicures I have ever had! Cindy prepped my nails, trimming my cuticles to perfection. Lilly gave me an outstanding massage with my pedi then proceeded to amaze me with the quality of my gel polish. Will definitely return!

44.description: I love this nail place! They are BYOB with a 7-11 right next door, and I don't usually have a problem with parking. I had a bridal mani/pedi party here with some bridesmaids. They decorated so nice  and even had cupcakes, little take aways and wine. I always go to Lily who is AMAZING. But everyone is sooooooo nice, helpful and accommodating. Prices are very reasonable!

24.description: Love the no chip gel!!! Cindy is great.I have been getting the no chip gel manicure for awhile no. I have always had short nails and because of the no chip I have been able to grown out my nails. They are now long and feel much stronger. I love the feeling of fake nails and when I get 2-3 coats of the gel they feel fake! So many colors to choose from! Definitely plan on continuing to come to bedazzled !!!! Love this place!

7.description: Cindy did my nails amazing and holly does a great pedicure!!!I found this Salon on yelp and I highly recommend it.....

49.description: I was very pleased with this salon.  Very clean.  I had Sue for a pedicure and she was very nice and wonderful.  I will definitely go back.  Great leg massage!

40.description: I've been looking for a nail salon north of the river and I've finally found it! Bedazzled did a great job with my gel nails. Care, patience and perfection! Great selection of colors. Nice, relaxing environment. Cindy was fantastic! I'd highly recommend it to anyone in Streeterville/Michigan Ave area!

53.description: My usual go-to nail salon (Arbre Nails) wasn't able to accommodate me for a last minute mani/pedi so I decided to check out this place instead. Bedazzled is a cute, small salon which makes great use of space. I got a pedicure and no-chip manicure with Sandy, who did a wonderful job. She was very thorough and gave relaxing hand and leg massages.They have a loyalty card program in which you get $15 off your 10th visit (or maybe it's after your 10th visit).  Also, keep in mind that they give you a couple dollars off if you pay in cash instead of credit card.Overall I'm very happy with my experience and will definitely come back!

30.description: Monkee is the absolute best pedicurist there is! I can be a very picky client, but she's so thorough that my pedicure looks amazing EVERY TIME. Not only is she polite and professional, but she exceeds my expectations. I always look forward to seeing her. Bedazzled is a clean and friendly establishment, with a very sweet owner. Highly Recommended!

46.description: This place was recommended to me by the concierge at my hotel. It was a lovely salon, that staff is very friendly and my nails look great!

1.description: This place is hit or miss. Most of the times I've come here, it's been ok for the price.Today, I had a new girl who told me she only works here once a week. The pedicure was ok, but for whatever reason, the manicure took a really long time (a lot longer than necessary, in my opinion.) We ended up staying 15 mins after closing time. Lastly, the hand massage I got was less than 20 seconds.  The entire experience was not relaxing.  I will not be asking for this nail tech again.

55.description: 1. Jenny is the BEST.2. If you have thin/weak nails, you probably want to get the no-chip mani.  Prior to the no-chip, I could never get a mani to last because my nails would bend and the polish would crack.3. Make an appt.4. Byob.5.  Relax and enjoy your mani/pedi. :)

9.description: Acrylic nail clients beware! I decided to try this place because it had 4.5 star review yet I only received 2.5 star service. I am visiting for the weekend so I thought I would pamper myself with a pedicure and get my acrylic nails filled. My pedicure was pretty good, average, I'd say. But my nails were a different story. The owner was super nice and has been in business for many years but I think it may be time for her to put down her dremmel. My nails were misshapen, rough and and had acrylic & glue stuck underneath them. I had to go to the drug store and buy nail polish remover, a file and buffer block to try to fix them. Thankfully I brought my own polish so that I could salvage my nails for the rest of my trip.

26.description: I've never given a place 1 star or walked out of a nail salon but I guess there is always a first and for me it was Bedazzled Nails. After finding it on Yelp, I made an appointment for a no chip manicure and after waiting for 20 minutes I was helped by a rude nail technician who filed my nails so vigorously they started to burn, not to mention she cut my cuticle from filing so hard. After she applied the acetone, she left and started working on other clients. At first I thought nothing of it because it usually takes 10 minutes or so for the acetone to work its way through but after 40 minutes of waiting and the burning sensation on my nails- I was done! I told the manager of the salon that I had been waiting for an hour and my nails were burning she said "you sit" after waiting another 10 minutes another nail tech came over and roughly removed the no chip. As soon as she was done removing it, I walked out with no manicure, burning throbbing nail beds and over an hour of my time wasted. This was by far the worst nail salon I've ever gone to.

25.description: First off my nails look great. But six girls in the shop and nobody talk to anybody . .. Well that's not true they talk to each other but the six clients which all spoke English seldom if ever spoken to.hello how are you do you like the color is this good.  I am not a chatty Cathy at all but it was one of the most uncomfortable awkward hour of my life today. Shop was clean. Paid $37 for full set of acrylic nails shortcut. One of the best parts of that shop is who I'm going to call their greeter named Kim she was fantastic they knew what they were doing when they hired her to add warmth and class to that shop

12.description: Went there with a girlfriend to get a shellac change . Good polish change but the woman tried charging me $28 for only a polish change. I notified her that doesn't sound right at all but she said I will give you discount of $25 .... But still didn't seem right . She saw the disappointment in my face a realized what she was doing was wrong . It was not right to try taking advantage like that .

59.description: Best mani/pedi in the city! Go there they will not disappoint !!! Friendly, professional , courteous and clean. A large selection of polish. Everyone is up to date on the latest trends. My technician is Jenny. She is very meticulous about her work. Love her!

21.description: I've been coming here for manis/pedis since Bedazzled Nails opened and have always been well taken care of. Cindy and her team are always efficient without compromising quality which is obviously important. Everyone is so appreciative of the continued business and aim to ensure I have a good experience. If you're looking for a clean salon, friendly staff, reasonable prices and good quality services, then I would certainly consider making a visit to Bedazzled Nails. TIP: if you go earlier in the week, and/or you pay cash, you'll get a discount, both are great perks!

17.description: Lily, the owner, offered to redo my manicure at no charge - outstanding customer service and it shows how far they will go to make sure their customers are happy with their services.

10.description: Sandi did a good job on my gel nails! I show her the Japanese complex nail style and she doing her best for me. And I really love it! As you see it is beautiful and elegant! Highly recommend ~

5.description: Fast, cheap, and long lasting- couldn't ask for more. Walked in on a weekday morning. there was no wait and was able to redeem a check-in coupon

3.description: I'm very unsure how this nail salon had such great reviews. I had made two appointments, one for a new set for my friend and myself a fill. We were there at 1 for our appointment and had to wait until 130 to start. We both get acrylic nails with coffin shape.. Only one lady out of 7 can shape nails a"and we have to go one at a time we are told. There was s group of office ladies there where we were there as well... Very crowded small place . I mean no disrespect but the main lady is older and has a bit of a shake... Probably has not brushed up on her skills in 20 years. .. So she does my girlfriends nails and they look okay, a few are not the same shape but she was just happy to have them done after we looked for awhile for a well reviewed place.Now for my nails, I travel all the time and generally in la, Miami & NYC it's very easy to find quality nail salons that are up with the times. She starts with my nails, I needed 1 fixed and then the rest reshaped & a fill (what I had booked for) as I had them done in DC and the shape needed some tweaking.. She filed my nails so much that the acrylic was almost gone and then starts to put the colour on... Wait what?!? I asked for a fill I said. She responds she's been doing nails so long just trust her.. I was honestly exhausted so I said ok.. I keep my nails long so knew these wouldn't last long but couldn't sit there any longer..! The colour goes into the Crease of my nail and it looks like my 5 year old cousin put the color on.... 4 days later and 5 of 10 fingernails are busted..I'm not hard on my hands nor are they extra long.. It was just an awful experience and waste of 100$ .. I would never go back.

35.description: Update:After posting my yelp review, business owner Lily contacted me immediately. She was upset with the service I received and took immediate action. She invited me back to the salon to chat. The next day I stopped by and shared my concerns with her about the mani pedi I had received. She let me share my thoughts, apologized on behalf of her salon and offered me a full refund. I was very impressed with her leadership skills and taking action. Lily encouraged me to visit again during my next trip to Chicago and I'll be sure to take her up on her offer. Original review:The saying goes "you get what you pay for" and at this nail salon I was paying for their rent-- not for their service.I'm not from Chicago and desperately needed a mani pedi during my stay. Yelp reviews helped me choose bedazzled nails because of the high reviews... But here's why I disagree:After calling ahead and being told there is "absolutely no wait" I ran over from my hotel to wait for just under 30 mins. It wasn't until I looked obviously annoyed that someone was sent to begin my pedicure. I felt rushed and was 100% treated differently from their regular customers. I guess I didn't look like a big spender. Only plus was I paid in cash and showed a coupon from yelp to save about $6-- which brought my high priced mani pedi to just overpriced. Needless to say I was disappointed in the services today. If this salon was back home I'd be sure to tell my friends not to waste their time or money.

19.description: Ms Cindy and her staff are fabulous. Kim, the receptionist is always on her toes taking care of every customer that comes in the door. The decorations and atmosphere is breathtaking. I really enjoyed my experience here. Ms Cindy took her time and did a fabulous job on my nails. I found this place on Yelp. Thank you so much. They have so many colors to choose from.

28.description: I've been here a few times and the service and atmosphere is amazing! Super clean, cute tropical environment with bar-style manicure tables. They also have an extensive selection of Essie and OPI nail polish/gel. Usually I would expect a nail salon like this to be pricey, but prices are comparable to most nail salons in Chicago. I always go to Cindy, who is great at doing my acrylic nails exactly how I want them. She usually gives extra service free of cost if you are a loyal customer (free repair/polish change, free design). I definitely recommend her for acrylic tips!

45.description: Was in the area and in desperate need for a mani-pedi. This spot was everything I needed, quick, efficient, reasonably cost and good quality manicure. It is definitely a no frills, basic utilitarian manicure spot, but done just fine.

33.description: Soo glad I found this place on yelp!Cindy is FANTASTIC and dose an Awesome job..strong Attention to Details, which I Love!!The check-in girl Kimmy is also awesome & such a sweetheart!!!If you're in the Downtown area and looking to get your nails done, I would definitely recommend this place!!1.Go to this shop, you won't be disappointed & you get your $'s worth!!2.Call ahead AND MAKE A APPOINTMENT!! (can't stress that enough!!l Didn't even remember to use my 10% off, because I'm so pleased with my nails & because I really didn't need to.At 40$ for a full-set, this FABULOUS polish, With tip, This is a Fantastic bargain for Downtown!!!#louboutin #mynailLifestrong

43.description: I got a pedicure and gel manicure with Lily, and all I can say is "perfection"! She took her time, and did a very thorough job. If I could give her a 6-star rating, I would; and this coming from someone like me who is very particular about my nails.

2.description: The ladies here are so nice!  Wonderful nail salon and they do a very good thorough job.  I got a mani/pedi - didn't feel rushed.The spa is nice and funky.

18.description: I love this place !!! Cindy does an amazing job and is so sweet and really makes you feel welcome !! They were able to take care of me right away! Definitely coming here from now on every time. Gel nails are w speciality service that I've been getting for years and it's hard to find someone that does it so well.

41.description: Very clean and courteous staff. Great color selection.  Foot massage was great and the chairs are the best massage chairs I have gotten at a nail salon.  We were a small group trying to make last minute pedi plans and needed to wait about a half hour or make a reservation for later, which was fine, we kept shopping then came back and got seated right away.  So make reservations if you are on a tight schedule!

52.description: From out of town and found them on Yelp. Went today for a pink and white fill and Didn't need an appointment and everyone was so friendly. The did the pedicure and fill at the same time which saved a lot of time. Sandy did a fabulous job on my toes along with a great leg massage. Very pleased with my nails as well. I will definitely be back when we visit again. Thanks for taking great care of me, ladies!

50.description: Cindy did a wonderful job on my pink and whites! Thank you so much Cindy! She was very careful to make them perfect!!

4.description: Cindy totally beat up my cuticles-- she pays great attn to detail but also shows no mercy. I am happy with the finish product though and she worked an hour after closing time to finish these claws off!

6.description: Emergency holiday nails done right! Thanks to the owner for getting me in just two hours after I arrived in Chicago with a damaged manicure. She took the time to properly clean off my old shellac, buff my nails, trimthose healthy cuticles and apply three coats of a beautiful, glossy fir green color appropriate for the holidays. I really appreciate the extra time and care taken on short notice. Will be back next year!

22.description: Lily, the owner, offered to redo my manicure at no charge - outstanding customer service and it shows how far they will go to make sure their customers are happy with their services.

15.description: Cindy is the one I've been looking for my whole acrylic life! Fantastic attention to detail, sweet as pie, and wonderful ideas! Happy New Year ;)

57.description: Best pedicure I've ever had! Overall my experience was above 5! This place was fantastic. Not only was it super clean but the pedicure lasted at least an hour and my calluses are 100% gone! I am an avid runner so my feet are always in poor condition, even after pedicures typically. Not the case here! The gentleman was the one who did my pedi. He not only removed all my calluses but the lotion they use to massage afterwards was mixed with hot oil!! The whole experience was heaven. I def recommend going here!!!

20.description: Cindy did my nails amazing and holly does a great pedicure!!!I found this Salon on yelp and I highly recommend it.....

36.description: I read two other reviews that are exactly my same complaint and I also usually only go on yelp to put good reviews and but this was so bad I had to write a negative one. As the other reviews stated-my nails are very weak and I needed to have a no chip removed and I got a regular manicure done.  they literally scraped away my nail when taking off the no chip and buffed my nails so rough that I have a red mark on my nail and it was hurting so badly.  she also kept saying it was just my nails and that it was my fault that my nail was now ruined. I really wish I had taken a picture of the nail before she put the nail polish on. I am attaching a picture of what the final product looks like (with a big bump/bubble from the injured nail).

14.description: It was fine. Nail tech was very nice but the space didn't look clean. The floor needed a good sweep. The clipper, cuticle cutter, etc. were sanitized but the tools they use for the feet looked dirty. There were pieces of hair stuck to the bottle of the base coat which, thankfully, she cleaned before using it. I asked for a buff manicure plus a regular pedicure and they said that a buff manicure would be a $5 upcharge. I declined.

3.description: I had made reservations at Spiaggia for my wife's birthday (this was the night I purposed). After making the reservation I realized I would be needing a new suit.  I went to Men's Suits New York, because it looked like a place with a lot of options (I didn't really have a plan, just walk up and down Mich Ave).  The salesman spent over an hour with me and picked out about 7 different suits, till we found the right one.  The best part was that since I needed the suit that day, they were able to do the alterations and have it for me in 3 hrs (after saying it would take 3 days).  And they did the rush alterations for no extra charge.  The customer service was great, the selection was great, and the prices were spot on.

1.description: You know all those sandwich-board models lurking around Michigan Ave and Ohio advertising "up to 70% off" designer-name suits and passing out little flyers?  Yep, we've all seen them, but most of us have probably never checked out what the shop has to offer.And I didn't either until this past Wednesday.Backstory:  I was invited to a "black tie optional" wedding that took place this past weekend.  The friend group initially decided that a nice suit and tie would be fine as opposed to getting tuxes.  Of course, 7 days before the wedding, minds were changed and black tie was in.  Not to be outdone by everyone else, I hopped on the tuxedo train.  I spent hours... and hours... and hours this past Wednesday... scouring the web and the shops downtown to compares prices and styles.  Can you believe it costs upwards of $160 just to RENT a tux (for one day, mind you)?  Adding in a "rush fee" at most places easily puts that number closer to $200.  Highway robbery, I tell you.  You could buy a decent one for less than twice that.  I checked out Macy's, Joseph A. Bank, skipped Nordstrom, and ended up at Men's Suits New York.The store itself is nothing special.  Suits, jackets, shirts, ties everywhere.  Salespeople with a Northeast vibe while still maintaining appropriate friendliness.  I explained my situation to the salesperson and he told me there was no problem and he could definitely accommodate my tuxedo needs.  Within 15 minutes I had myself a classy tux measured to my specifications and the turnaround time would be 48 hours.  When he rang me up for $160, I asked how much more it would cost just to buy a tux.  He told me that, for an extra $30, he'd just sell me the tux I was renting, and to let him know when I went to return it.  I stopped in Saturday morning and picked up a perfectly fitting tux, shirt, cufflinks, pair of shiny black shoes, and, of course, my black tie (all included in the priice).  I can be so hott sometimes.Turns out that maybe 25% of the guests went black tie, so although a tux wasn't necessary in the end, I don't mind looking super duper delicious every once in a while.  I ended up throwing down the extra $30 to purchase the tux.  It'll save me a lot of headaches in the future should I ever need another one again, now that I am an adult and getting invited to a lot more swanky events.  So, uhh... please invite me to your swanky events!  I am a happy customer and will definitely consider this place when doing more formalwear shopping!

2.description: This store is heaven for men searching for suits in all sizes (my husband wears a 54 long jacket)!  The prices are great and the sales staff is fantastic, the gentleman (I believe the owner) that helped us knew abut suit construction and fabric types and the tailor is quick, efficient, and alters the suit to fit your lifestyle.  Ie - he leaves the sleeves long for my photographer husband.Men's Suits New York is amazing.   They value their customers and it shows!  A place with variety, great service, AND affordable suits? We just purchased our third suit here and will definitely be back fore more.

5.description: When you buying Armani and Hugo Boss suit for a pretty "penny", and after their alteration you receive both of your suites with one sleeve shorter then another, not cleaned and pressed and being called "too picky" do you think we will give you 5 stars ??? Customer service DO NOT exist there this is the WORST place we have been to, and will never recommend to any one to go there. I believe that the guy that sells suits in the ally out of the van will give you better customer crevice! Be careful...

6.description: The worst experience in renting a tuxedo, poor customer service, arrogant, and no willing to deliver what was promised.  My Tux came in too big in the coat and to short in the pants.....was informed that it was too late to get another Jacket and what do I expect for $149 .... and proceeded to blame the groom for ordering this type of tux, the man also tried to get payment 2x and thank God I had my reciept!! NO PARKING NO SERVICE NO GOOD!!! STAY AWAY!!!

7.description: The "New York" must be in their name for their attitude ... I don't have a car, so I needed to find a place downtown that would take tuxedo measurements for me.  Most places that rent/sell formalwear offer this service for free as a courtesy, even if you're not renting/buying from them.  When I asked someone at the register if I could get measured for a tux, they were very unfriendly.  One sales associate from across the store eyeballed me and told me my waist size.  I said I needed more specific measurements.  The guy at the register than said it would be $10-20 (I forget the exact amount).  I wouldn't have minded paying, but they were so unfriendly, I didn't want them to get a penny from me, so I left.  I ended up getting my tux measurements at Nordstrom across the street, who not only were super friendly about it, but did it for free.

8.description: I had to go downtown to the DMV on Randolph and decided to take a stroll up Michigan Avenue. At every other block there would men wearing and handing out advertisements for this store. Pretty annoying I must say, but I decided to read the flyer. Men's Suit New York is right across the street from Kenneth Cole. Their flyer states that they were having a close-out sale. Designer brand clothing 30 - 70% off. Not bad, right? However, Men's Suit New York was not having a clearance sale as they are just wholesale retailers of men's apparel. If you're looking for affordable suits (i.e. less than $500), this is a great place to shop. I used to work at Jos A. Bank, and while I like their suits, they aren't as modern as some of suits found here (Calvin Klein, and many Italian brands including Hugo Boss). The sales associate wasn't too pushy, but was all too eager to bring new suits to show me. He was knowledgeable though (but I already know a bit about suits myself). I didn't end up buying a suit for Curtis, but I really will keep this place in mind when he needs one for an upcoming event.

0.description: CLOSED. (Clothes-ed?) Gone. Dunzo. Vacated. Too bad, they had some good deals.

4.description: You get what you pay for. Want first class customer service, selection, the newest styles, sizes ? Maybe a beverage when you enter? A personal shopper? There are places in Chicago to accommodate you. On the other hand, if you want to save a couple hundred bucks and still get a nice suit, and you don't mind poking around for a while, check this place out. Yes, the guys with the sandwich boards are annoying, but if you don't like getting stuff handed to you on the sidewalk 1) don't take Michigan Ave., or 2) go back to Skokie. We live in the city, deal with it. This place has some pretty upscale brands- Tasso Elba, Hugo Boss, Ralph Lauren, Joseph Abboud, Hart Schafner Marx, etc. The stuff is wholesale designer- just as advertised. I got a grey two button Joseph Abboud suit with tailoring (on site, what you would expect) for under $350. Not bad, considering that's about half of what you would pay for the exact suit at Nordstrom, Macy's, etc. Like I said though, you get what you pay for. If you don't like it, don't shop here, but at least try to be fair with your reviews.

3.description: I am an art dealer in Chicago, in business for 15 years.  I have worked with many framers, many of whom have mostly one idea in mind.  They want to charge you as much as they can.  Not here.  You are given options and the prices are more reasonable than most other places.  You canYou can also count on prompt service and orders are completed very quickly.  Even when ordering 30 frames at a time, the job is done swiftly, and with precision.  There is no one North of the Chicago River you should trust more than Paul and his team.

1.description: Their work is exceptional.  We use Practical Angle to frame and re-frame many pieces in in high end art collection.  We've trusted them with several originals, some worth several hundred thousand dollars and are more than happy with the care and end product from them.  Paul is very knowledgeable about the care and needs of fine art pieces...friendly, fast and perfect.

0.description: It's seems impossible that I've not already done this review. I've been a  client for 10+ years and they have never disappointed. Top notch creative and a good eye for what will help your art stand out. I've had them do personal work, memorabilia, collectable art and gifts for clients and family. All just fantastic. Pricing is very fair for this level of quality. Street Parking is a nightmare, but look for valet at TGIF. ;)

2.description: I just moved back to Chicago and have recently discovered Practical Angle, which is now my go-to frame shop for everything from photos to prints. It was kinda a big step moving from the Ikea-frame-made-from-fiber-board-and-tape to custom ones, only because of the steep price increase. But, as expected, worth every penny. Their patience is my biggest sell-point. I never feel overly rushed, even when a decision between two seemingly similar frames takes forever. And, their attention to detail is pretty great. I had a print with some pencil marks. And, with my permission, they ironed those out.  Now, that's art!

5.description: Why I love Practical Angle?  I never had any previous experience in getting anything framed, so when I went to Practical Angle, I was bombarded with decisions to make.  Other than the frame itself, you have to decide things about the glass, the bordering, different color combinations, etc.  Clearly, I was in over my head, but with the help and suggestions of the staff, I walked away knowing that I'll have an awesome frame to put up. Since my first visit, I've returned several times and always received great service and a great product.  It doesn't matter the size of the picture or art work, how ornate or simple you want it to be... Practical Angle is the place to go!

6.description: I went to Practical Angle with a bunch of posters I needed framed.  I used to live in NYC and always had a trusted framing place so my expectations were high.  These guys did not disappoint.  They gave me several options given my budget, which I appreciated.  Some places will try to force a frame on you or give you a super cheap alternative. These guys worked with what your vision is for the framing and are super nice. The turnaround time for four framings was about a week -- not too bad. They also had a ton of options to pick from and didn't rush me through the process. Definitely great service. The only issue I had (and the only reason I didn't give them 5 stars) is that the wiring for hanging were all different lengths so getting them to hang in a neat row was a pain. I probably should have mentioned that to them at first, but I neglected to. I definitely recommend Practical Angle!

7.description: Never thought I would love a framing shop, let alone write a review about it. However, Practical Angle is that awesome! It's location can't be beat (1 block east of Michigan Ave on Erie) - its in a beautiful old building which is just charming. I had a painting framed and couldn't be happier with the results. The staff is knowledgable, very helpful and patient. The frame selection is so vast so be prepared to be overwhelmed with choices - I was there for a while but thanks to Ketch, I found the perfect frame! Prices are competitive and turnaround time is typical. I would definitively visit Practical Angle again and will only trust them in framing important things.

8.description: Finally picked up all my pieces and the look perfect.  The sizing, craftsmanship and attention to detail are all lovely.  I could not be more happier with all three frames.THANK YOU!

9.description: Excellent frame shop! Excellent customer service! Super helpful and knowledgeable! Thanks so much!

10.description: Great frame shop and gallery, the staff is very helpful and can frame anything for you!

4.description: Great service, great work, nice people and good pricing!

12.description: Came here with a Groupon, got an awesome blow out!  Definitely worth the trip at regular price!

3.description: This was by far the best salon experience that I had in a long time! The place its beautiful, clean, with a good vibe! Everything new! But the best thing about Blo and Go it's the service!I had a mani and pedi made by Galina.. It's PERFECT! She is great!I will definitely go back! And highly recommend!

1.description: Their blowouts don't hold and look kind of messy soon after you leave.

2.description: A quick satisfaction with no long term benefits.  A true mid price haircut.WALK-IN -- available.SHAMPOO -- nice massage.HAIRCUT -- nothing original but comforting.  Lacks completeness as plenty of time and effort at the front and side of hair, and little or minimal efforts on the back.VENUE -- superbly organized and clean.  Very white.

9.description: I really wanted to like this spot, the blowouts overall have been good however the service has been sub par.  i was really excited about the early hours so I could pop in before work and get a blowout.  The first time I made an early appointment, I arrived and the salon was locked up, the girl that did my blow out arrived 10 minutes late and said her bus was late.  Ok, I dealt with it, things happen.  I made an early appointment about a month later and this time it was worse.  I arrived on time and waited for almost 40 minutes until someone arrived to let me in.  My stylist showed up almost an hour late and while the guy who let me in did my hair and made his appointment late so we were both late, it was a really bad experience and I was late for work.  they only charged me half which was the least they could do.  Good blowout but beware if you make really early appointments!

10.description: We were here for a Bachelorette party. There were 6 of us we all booked the Bombshell package - which according to website us mani/pedi, Blowout and full makeup.Overall, a great experience we all had a nice time. However, there are a few things that I wish had been cleared up or could have been better. I loved that this salon was a BYOB and food place! Our party loved that. I do think it needs to be clarified that the "party space" is not private.
