There is a table set up for food/beverages, but no chairs to sit on and you are open to the whole salon. 1 out of 6 of our girls actually got a wash and blow-dry. I was really disappointed with the blow out service. The other 5 of us just had our hair styled with flat irons. A Blow out is fun because it's not something that I do at home regularly but I do use a curing or flat iron. It was so disappointing. My stylist made me look like a Texas pageant queen and hair sprayed the crap out of my hair. (Not the look i was going for at all) nor what i wanted, which I said "a little curl with some volume". I couldn't wait to get home and wash my hair. It was a waste of money! It was awful. I've never ever had a blow-out where my hair is stiff with spray. It seemed like the salon didn't have enough people or time to do washes for all of us?The mani/pedis were half assed. We didn't get a soaking tub for the pedicure, no foot scrub, no lotion, no massage. Same for the manicure. The manicurest was wonderful and dud a great job...but the mani/pedi we received was pretty piss poor.Makeup was beautiful on all of us! Paperwork/contract to the salon stated that they would call 24 hours prior to event to confirm, they did not. I had sent in via email, the contract to Nicole and never heard anything from the salon after 2 emails, so I called to make sure we were booked. Salon is cash only tip. We were quoted $132 per person with gratuity added on... once we got to the salon we we told our total was $115 plus the 20% gratuity, which we had to pay in cash. None of us were prepared for a cash tip... would've been nice to know ahead of time.Overall, it was a fun day of getting "pretty". A few areas of disappointment, but not enough to stop me from recommending this to other Bachelorette or party. I would say, there are some areas of improvement. You should specify right off the bat what is SPECIFICALLY included in your packages. It seems like we got the "cheap and fast" version of the services I thought we were booking... but we all had a good time and walked out feeling glamorous for our night out.

13.description: I suffered through a mani-pedi there at my girlfriend's recommendation while I was in town for a wedding. She later told me she had only been there once and had a different manicurist. First thing I noticed was everyone looked miserable except the nice receptionist. My feet and fingers were in pain by the time I left from being handled so tightly. The manicurist I got stuck with was stern, unsmiling the entire time & very unprofessional. She barked orders at the receptionist. I asked the receptionist the offensive manicurist's name so I could write this review. She looked at me sympathetically and nodded her head like she totally understood why I asked. Avoid Galeana.

16.description: Cynthia did my nails today and she was fantastic.  Very talented, kind, and thorough.  She has done my nails before and her manicures always outlast any other manicures I have gotten.

6.description: The stylist dropped the brush on the floor and then tried to use it again... Seriously.Overall blowout was fair... I showed her a few different pictures of what I wanted and for some reason it still didn't help.. Do not suggest.

15.description: Was lucky to walk in as they just opened 2 weeks ago. Awesome space, cool decor, incredibly kind employees. They offer tons of services- I got a blow out from Alicia and it was awesome. This will be a new spot for me on the weekends for sure!

0.description: I had a great haircut by Angela.  The salon is nice and clean inside with good music playing.  Angela spent a lot of time on my hair making sure all the lengths were even and listened to what I wanted.  I walked out feeling very satisfied.  Price is typical for Chicago ($60) and included blow out.FYI- Cash tip only

5.description: Terrible experience start to finish. First impression, the place is dirty with hair left on seats and un-swept, dust everywhere. I ignored it because I thought maybe I was just prissy and continued my appointment. My stylist was inexperienced and had no idea what she was doing. She was not capable of doing a blow out. The place is called BLO and GO?! she just ended up drying my hair regularly with a flat brush and curling it was a curling iron....... that is not a blow out. I have a feeling she didn't go to beauty school, or just has absolutely no idea what is going on. I get blow outs about 3 times a month, I've been everywhere (Dry Bar, Blowtique, Blowout Junkie, any Aveda salon for a blowout) and know what to expect. If you want a blow out near here, go to Blowtique on Michigan Ave 5 min away- WAY better.  This place seriously sucks.

11.description: Just got another great blowout at blo and go plus a haircut! Fast, easy, relaxing. Must try!

8.description: Im from out of town came in for a blowdry and a mani-pedi. Loved my mani-pedi Lana was amazing!!!! My blowdry was a completely different story... i have very curly hair but she didnt blow dry my roots and when she ironed them it only made it worse. I left feeling worse about my hair than when i came in. It was left puffy and nothing like i expected. I honestly do a better job at home then when i left blo and go. If you have curly hair dont go. If you want the best mani-pedi youll probably ever experience go!!!

4.description: SKIP!!! Went in for a blow dry and first asked to pay in advance. I said that I'd prefer to have the service first. Come to find out the receptionist was getting her nails done and wanted me to pay in advance. Oooohk. I asked for a round brush blow out. Instead, I left with tight curls from a small round brush and a TON of hairspray. She left the dryer on the rolled hair far too long meaning today I have a lot more dead-ends than I did yesterday. I have been to blow dry bars around the U.S. and this one was hands down the worst.

14.description: Went here for a blow-out before my bachelorette party. Everybody said it looked fantastic and my friend liked it so much we went back the next week for her bachelorette party. Rick blew out my hair both times and was awesome! The curls stayed for days (and my hair never holds a curl). He is seriously a magician when it comes to hair.

7.description: My whole experience was amazing! Lana does amazing nails and such perfection! I for sure will be returning. Oh and their shampoo and conditioner smells amazing!!!

0.description: They had a sign posted that they didnt have certain fruits because of a recall. Ok - thats understandable, but then you need to prepare for the items you do have.  They had NO strawberries left so there were only like 3 drinks they could make!  I sure would think the manager would have taken any steps necessary to aquire enough strawberries to not run out considering that was the most popular fruit that wasn't recalled.

3.description: Awful.  It's a shame cuz the manager is nice,  but the cashiers are emotionless zombies who never say hi or anything for that matter.  They move at a snails pace even when there is a line of 10 people.  They always look confused like it's their first day.  Don't bother trying to collect on your Belly rewards cuz they won't understand you.

1.description: This 7-Eleven store is very busy.  Dropped by here twice during our stay in downtown Chicago.  Both times there was about a dozen people in line.  Maybe, that is why the store and staff were not very impressive.  The store was dirty and unorganized.  Staff was not friendly, but they were fairly quick.After the second trip here, I decided we would not return here.  Found another 7-11 store close by that was clean and crew was nice.

2.description: Store review:7-11 quick shop along the Mag Mile. I have been here before to buy random small items and checkout was fast. It is well lite and clean. There use to be a issue with panhandlers outside but they seemed to have fixed this issue now with cameras and better security.Pros: well stock, well lite, quick serviceCons: premium price for convenienceHidden deals: Sign up on website to get emails about discount. There is always food items being promoted and discounted

9.description: This is the worst worst worst White Hen/7-11 location I've ever been to in my life!! The staff is ALWAYS rude, the prices are ridiculous, and their window displays often reflect expired "deals." I gave this place multiple tries on my way to work when I needed a cup of coffee. I regretted it after every single try. I finally learned my lesson and went to the other White Hen on McClurg or Starbucks to get my coffee fix. There are other much better places in the area where you are treated with more respect. No thanks and I'll NEVER be back here again!!!

10.description: A 7-Eleven with a little more personality. Looks like from all the reviews, they have good sandwiches and salads. But I don't know, the thought of ordering sandwiches from a convenience store is a bit sketchy. But hey, maybe next time I am in Chicago, I'll have to check it out.

4.description: The line moves slowly

6.description: For a 7-Eleven I give this place four stars.Found exactly what I needed after a long night of drinking, Motrin and Gatorade. Prices were fair and the service was quick. Store isn't overly packed with merchandise so it's easy to get around too.

12.description: A pretty decent selection of drinks and sandwichs.  The lines move pretty fast and the food is fresh.  Not a bad one at all.

5.description: The 7/11 on 201 East Ohio Street, Chicago IL 60611-3629 has the SLOWEST CUSTOMER SERVICE in all of Chicago!  Try to avoid this location if at all possible.  The service clerks who work behind the counter are very scattered and are never ready to ring costumers.  They are known to have at least a 10minute to 15minute wait in line.  The sad part is, they are well staffed.  I've always seen sales clerks / cashiers everywhere in the store "NOT BUSY DOING ANYTHING BUT TALKING" and there is only ONE clerk slowly checking-out customers at one registrar out of 3 open registers.  One registrar, I assume is for costumers wanting only to purchase lottery tickets.  The ironic part about it, i think it's there to avoid standing in a long line.  BUT it's pointless because no one is ever behind it working and ringing up costumers.  The clerks spend all of their time focusing on gabbing and giggling while customers are waiting over 5 to 10 minutes to be checked out.  If you're on a lunch break around the area, PLEASE HEED THIS MESSAGE. So STAY AWAY from the 7/11 on OHIO STREET and McCLURG.  It's not worth the wait.  Especially when there is a super Walgreens just down the street with cheaper prices that can get you in and out in a jiffy. NO LONG WAITS or aggravation what so ever.  This is just a little friendly costumer advise. but do what's best for you.

13.description: i'm from michigan so i know nothing about white hens and i do see that they have breakfast sandwiches and stuff but it still seems kind of sketchy...i'm a good ole 7-eleven girl and the majority of 7-eleven's i've been in are a helluva lot nicer than white hen....but that's just me.  the people working in here always seem like they have a corn cob up the bum.

11.description: Candy Gum should be near the cashier not hidden in the middle of  the store.  The Clerks are slow.

8.description: I sometimes go to El Pollo Bianco . . . Le Blanc Poullet, for lunch, 'cos their made to order sandwiches are a good value, and tasty. However, the condiment assortment varies widely according to store.How &#$^&#*@ hard is it to have a $%$&#%$ bottle of BROWN MUSTARD available for sandwiches? And why are you $%$&#%$ looking at me like I told you to pour gas on my $%$&#%$ sandwich and light it? Brown mustard is what you SHOULD use!Keep that $^$&%&@ yellow baby s*hit away from my sandwich. AND your plastic gloves do nothing if you go from making sandwiches directly to operating the cash register. Not clear on the concept, are we?You know what? Forget it, cancel my order, I'm going to Jimmy John's.

0.description: Stopped in here on a Friday night looking for some coffee creamer.  We found it and we also found a long line.  Felt like this was the only 7-Eleven in the city and it was free Slurpee day.  Neither is/was the case.Useless fact:  There is a sink in here but it is for employees only.  I would use it if it were an emergency and pretend I didn't read the sign.

7.description: This 7-Eleven has the dubious reputation of absorbing a White Hen, like a giant slurpee that has become sentient and rolls out of it's cup, hungry for hen-flesh. Indeed, the traditional half-ass deli you might come to expect at a White Hen establishment has been replaced by a row of pre-wrapped food and multiple cases of rotating, cylindrical meats.The store layout is shoddy at best. There are only four aisles, all so short the selection is sure to disappoint. Want napkins? Kleenex? Well I hope you like the one brand this 7-Eleven endorses. Paper plates!? What does this look like, the Mall of America? Lower your standards, Rockefeller.And, of course, it houses an ATM machine for a bank thousands of miles away, ensuring an insane processing fee and a dial-up connection so distant that checking your balance will take up your entire lunch break.But, because this 7-Eleven is lodged in the aorta of Chicago's corporate ticker, it gets one massive thing right: energy drinks! They have lots and lots of goddamn energy drinks. You like Amp, Mountain Dew's younger brother with Asperger's? They have four flavors! Want to put a Monster inside you, but in an exotic flavor like "Kaos" or "The Mixx"? Back your truck up and make that beeping sound, because they have it by the CASE. And lest we forget the lewdly named Bawls, an energy drink with caffeine levels so high there is a warning message on the side... it now comes in fucking ROOT BEER!

3.description: Not for me.  Expensive for what you get.

1.description: Cafeteria food that is always clean and delicious. Salads by the pound and just about anything you want. Very nice for place for an easy lunch after an appointment.

2.description: It's all about managing your expectations. Honestly, I've been to other hospitals and cafeteria food is notoriously bad. Given that, this place is actually pretty decent and it reminds me a lot like my undergrad cafeteria with different food stations, etc. The price is pretty decent and I think it's a decent lunch place. As for the sitting area, well, that's another story.

0.description: Unfortunately, I spend a lot of time at this hospital and usually end up waiting between appointments so I end up coming here often. Au Bon Pain is good and all, but it's too expensive and you can find everything that it offers right across the hall. All Spice loses one star because the bacon is shitty, but! They DO have Frank Red Hot Sauce and that is a total win in my book. The food is always fresh and hasn't been sitting all day long because each little "restaurant" is open at specific times. The salad bar is pretty great and the soups are usually decent. For cafeteria food, not shabby!However, if you are ever a resident at this hospital, this is NOT the food you get. In fact, the food offered to resident patients is hardly even food. After being NPO for 4 days I was dying to put something delicious in my gullet, and what they had to offer was so unappetizing that I didn't even attempt to eat it. Do not get your hopes up for any spectacular entrees at this hospital! Ask a friend of family member to stop at All Spice or something before a visit!

1.description: I have been going to Christine for facials off and on over the last 8 years.  She was at the Garden forever and finally opened up her own studio late last year. It's small, but new, clean, and very comfortable. Christine was written up in Allure magazine years ago as one of the best facialists in Chicago and she really is. She takes her work seriously and is a true professional. She works on my skin for an hour and a half and her facials honestly make a difference. When I go a long time without seeing her, I notice a difference. I am almost 40 but still get breakouts and fortunately for me, Christine is a master of extraction. She uses the best tools and products but doesn't sell anything. Most places always try to sell you products. Your skin is in expert hands with Christine and I highly recommend her.

0.description: One of Chicago's best kept secrets is this boutique skin care salon right off of Michigan Avenue. The owner, Christine used to work nearby at The Garden, and I'm so excited that she now has her own place. Christine is an amazing eye brow artist and she was even once featured in Allure magazine! I get lots of compliments on my brows, and when people ask where I get them done I immediately suggest that they go to Christine.I haven't tried any of the salon's other skin care services yet, but I'm sure they are just as wonderful.

3.description: Yum.Farmer's Fridge is essentially a salad vending machine inside of 7/11. Except the salads don't look nasty, per usual vending machine standards. They actually look pretty darn delicious and are prepared in the morning and stocked daily in the vending machine.After seeing it pop up inside 7/11 a few weeks ago after the remodel, I finally decided to try one for a late night snack instead of McDonald's or something else unhealthy. There was only one salad left at 11 p.m., the High Protein Salad, so I ordered it. I was $8.00, which was a little more than I wanted to pay for a salad, but I ended up not regretting it. The salad itself was as fresh as it looked, delicious, and I was surprised as to how filling it was.The touch screen vending machine was very easy to use, and gave the option of adding protein sides (chicken or tuna) that were dispensed in a separate container. My only complaints about the whole experience: you need to obtain your own utensils as they aren't included, and the salad "jar" was a bit too small to mix up the ingredients/dressing properly. I'd also like to spend a bit less on one, but wouldn't we all?Four stars for the salad, but five over-all, because I really like ideas like this. Can't wait to try another!

1.description: I purchased the Gilt promotion they offered back in December for home delivery of 2 days worth of food. so this is a review of that.when ordering for delivery you have to book online over 48 hours before the delivery you only can get delivery on Mon/Wed/Friday. I live in lake shore east. I'm not sure of the delivery area coverage.  I got 4 different salads. 2 snacks, 2 breakfasts and 2 proteins. Overall the food is really nice and fresh for being prepackaged. As a vending machine option, I think this is wonderful and amazing. As a food delivery there is much better out there for the price. The salads are rather large portions I attached a picture of one of the salads so you can get an idea of the portion size. the meats are tasty, but VERY small portions. same with the snacks. I was very impressed with the "cookie dough."snack. tastes just like raw cookie dough. The salads have nutrition info on them, however the snacks do not.... so who knows....the fake cookie dough may have the caloric content of actual cookie dough. most of the salads came with iceberg lettuce which I'm not a fan of. the dressings offered with the salads were good and the salad combos are done well. I would not use them for delivery again.

2.description: A vending machine that dispenses fresh food?  Be still my heart!  Can we get one of these at O'Hare?I stopped into this 7-11 and was surprised to see that this 7-11 is being re configured for a new look (I'll write another review for that) but what was most intersting to me was this "Farmers Fridge" vending machine that dispensed fresh, wholesome foods in a high tech way.I got there early enough to watch the machine being stocked for the day (the sign says made daily and at least it was stocked that day with the old product removed and new product added)The salads run about $8 for the jar (about the size of a mason jar) and there are additional items that you can buy for "$2.95 (come in a small baby food like jar) like protein flax seed cubes, chicken and there was even a quinoa breakfast bowl that was quite good.Ordering is easy with the touch screen and you are immediately emailed a receipt.If you want a bowl to pour your salad into- those are avaialble on one side of the machine and on the other is a space to drop off the jar to recycle for the next time (or you can take it with you).Interesting concept that has several locations around town.

0.description: My GF and I stopped by it. We ordered different salads.We were both very happy with the quality and very fresh ingredients.

4.description: Just ordered a Farmer's Fridge over Grubhub and it was amazing! I ordered the Cheater salad, which is basically their low-calorie version of a cobb salad (even with the dressing it was under 400 calories). It was full of tasty ingredients like turkey bacon, white cheddar, egg, sunflower seeds, corn and grape tomatoes.The salad was delivered very fast and you could definitely tell how fresh it was. They have mastered the idea of layering their ingredients in a way that keeps the lettuce from getting wilted with all the heavy ingredients at the bottom. The dressing was a tangy honey mustard sauce and I thought the amount they provided was perfect.I thought the size of the salad was very generous as well as the portions of the ingredients and I felt satisfied after chowing it down. It's pretty hard to believe that a salad this flavorful was under 400 calories. This is seriously the perfect thing to order during the workday, very filling yet not heavy or unhealthy, I would definitely buy it again.

58.description: This shop is really tiny and cramped, but they are fairly fast and the location is good for those walking the mag mile. I'm not from Chicago so I bought five bags to bring back for other people. I only bought the combo popcorn (cheese and caramel). I love it! My friends also seemed to like it. The combination of cheese and caramel is perfect. If you're going to be walking around all day, you might want to make Garretts your last stop because the oil from the popcorn will start to seep through the bag. If I'm ever back in the city I would wanna try some of the other options available.

56.description: Honestly, a popcorn shop should not get 5 stars in my book but THIS IS THE MOST ADDICTING THING YOU WILL EVER EAT. I honestly am rating this  5 stars because if you have not had Garrett's yet you have no idea what you are in for. Get the Chicago Mix, get a small bag otherwise you will eat all of it in one sitting. (I've eaten an entire medium size in one sitting myself, not really my proudest moment.)The popcorn is best fresh, and you can ask them to leave the bag open when you get it :) It's the perfect balance of cheesy and caramely and I just can't stop eating it. Note that it is HEAVY and not your typical light popcorn. This should be obvious given that it's cheese and caramel, but just a warning, don't go into this expecting Smartfood (which I love too). Please just try this even if you don't like popcorn. Pricey for popcorn but worth the splurge.Also a fun thing to bring home if you're just visiting town!

29.description: Garrett is famous for making that popcorn that makes you want to want to eat more popcorn like you're some sort of addict.  This stuff is good and of all the things made famous known as "Chicago Mix" outside Chicagoland it's simply called Garrett Mix here or "mix" for short that is because when something is local there's no need to be redundant.  It's like when people in Philadelphia call cheesesteaks cheez whiz and onions "whiz wit" for short.  The address of this place if you're seeking to destroy is actually in the building of 625 N Michigan but the storefront is off Ontario street half a block to the east.  Deceiving?  Sort of but many places in Chicago do this.  I don't know why but I sort of get it.  It's like that big match stick building in NYC 432 Park Avenue.  An address on 56 or 57th street just doesn't sound as good.Regardless they are where they are and the smell of the caramel is literally fanned out into the street.  Where the storefront of this store is there is a fan that shoots caramel smelling sweet air into the street.  There is a particular spot if you stand beneath this fan where you'll get showered with this aroma of sweet caramel directly.  See if you can find it or not.This popcorn has NO preservatives.  Think about that for a second and decide what size you want to get because this stuff doesn't keep forever like the sealed bags of Cretors from Costco that can stay on the shelves for a year.  I ended up buying a jumbo back for about 15 bucks plus tax.  It's heavy and large and they bag it and then paper bag it and then handle bag it so it's essentially triple bagged for easy carrying but you can tell after the first day it starts to not be a fresh as it was when you first bought it.One gallon tins start at around 33 bucks.  That's right 4 quarts of popcorn for 33 bucks or 8 bucks a quart.  This stuff is expensive but hey it's amazing right?  Imagine the largest tin on display is 6.5 gallons.  That tin would be almost 215 bucks!  In theory if you were to fill an oil drum it would cost 1650 dollars!  OK enough of the imaginary costs of Garretts.  Mix is good.  It's sweet and crunchy caramel popcorn mixed with sharp cheddar flavored popcorn so it's sweet and salty at the same time.  Trust me it's not gross and if you try this good luck getting it out of your mind.

42.description: The popcorn here is good but I didn't feel like it was a drastic difference from normal tin popcorn. I did like the Garrett mix and the Caramel Pecan mix but again, not sure if I can tell the difference.I initially ordered a small caramel in a small tin but quickly changed my order when I heard, "That'll be  $43.47." The small tins are darn near $30! I asked the cashier about this and she stated the tins are expensive as they keep the popcorn fresh longer. No thank you. I ended up taking the tin out and  adding on 3  more orders and still came out to less than $43!So if you are a popcorn lover, this is a good place for you but bring your own tin :)Also, they call your  number out so its OK to awkwardly stand around while you wait and if they call your number, come up to them because even if they aren't done bagging it, you'll get some attitude for not being "ready."

23.description: Garret's popcorn lives up to the hype. Got the Jumbo bag for about $15 and it easily fed about 6 people. The cheddar popcorn tastes close to Cheetos and the caramel popcorn is not too sweet. Highly reccomend getting the mix of the two and eating it together. The fact that the corn is GMO free and has no trans fat is great. MUST TRY!

47.description: Dear Garrett's Popcorn, You won't hear me complain, because this is a Chicago legend and must have! Chicago Mix is now referred to as Garrett's mix and If you've never had this "popcorn crack"... you're in for a mouth orgasm!  Be prepared to wait in line.  Be prepared to be be addicted.  Be prepared to be in love!  The popcorn is always fresh and delicious.  You will want to take some home for your friends, however it will never make it past the the Chicago River.  You will stand in line in good weather or bad.  Just as long as you're in line.  One of the best things to get is a Tin of popcorn.  They make perfect gifts for the holidays. Garrett's I already miss you.  Signed.. Every popcorn lover

8.description: A friend of mine told me that Garrett Popcorn was a favorite of both tourists and locals, so we had to make a stop the day that we arrived in Chicago. Traditionally, I would go more for caramel corn with chocolate or nuts, but we decided to do things the Garrett way and ordered the Garrett Mix®. The Garrett Mix® includes their CaramelCrisp® and Cheese Corn. Though I enjoyed trying this Chicago classic, I wasn't overly impressed. The caramel corn tasted a lot like Cracker Jack to me, and the cheese had more powder on it than Cheetos. I think the flavor combinations are interesting but did not think the quality of the popcorn was anything to write home about.

31.description: This is now my newest addiction. I had friends that recommended this popcorn place to me and I promptly had to try it. The mix of caramel and cheese is perfection. Everyone in my group commented on how the cheese tasted like real cheddar and not "fake" powder cheddar. Just remember to have napkins on stand by as it is rather greasy and your hands will be stained orange.

34.description: After watching countless locals snacking on their bags of popcorn while walking along the Mag Mile, we decided to see what the hype was about, and checked out Garrett's on our way back to the hotel. Upon entering the store, we were immediately overpowered by the aroma of buttery, caramel goodness.Somehow, I got suckered into buying the $33 gallon tin of Garrett's mix because I was told it would last 8-10 days. While my fiancé decided to get a small bag to share. Loved the flavored of Garrett's mix! Who knew that cheese and caramel would pair so perfectly together. The popcorn in the small bag was slightly stale the next day. So you really DO have to eat the popcorn fresh!When I got home, the popcorn was just as good as I remembered, but after a few days it got stale. I guess that expensive tin I bought didn't really help :( At least I have a cool souvenir now? Stick with the bags and don't waste your money on the tins!

16.description: We had heard the hype of this Chicago institution, so we had to try it even though neither of us are super into popcorn -- but we are *really* into trying local foods. On an obligatory trip to stroll Navy Pier, we spotted through our Yelp app that of course a Garrett Popcorn Shop was near by (I mean, it's pretty much a Chicago requisite, so it makes perfect sense that one would be located at the ultra touristy Navy Pier). Tip: It's a bit hard to find. It's not located ON the pier; it's inside a shopping pavilion. We asked a security guard where it was and his face beamed up. He was definitely a fan.Despite the lore, Garrett's popcorn totally lives up to the hype! It's fantastic and I thought the price was quite reasonable considering all its fanfare. You can sample various flavors, but our favorite was the Caramel Pecan! It's just the right salty sweet combo! Delicious! We got a small bag to share for our plane ride home and we still had a bit left the next day. I really appreciate that this is more than a tourist foodie stop; locals totally dig it too. It's hyped for good reason. Try it!

13.description: I'm a lover of all popcorn, but this one is at the top of my list. It's always my first and last stop when in Chicago. The Chicago Mix (caramel and cheddar) is life-changing. It's so good, and even better with a Coke to wash it down. The popcorn is always fresh and stays fresh for a while as long as you seal it! I bring it home to my family as a souvenir and they are always begging for more. I would order it online if it wasn't so expensive to do so.On the plane ride home, I would say about 70% of the guests have their popcorn ready for their flight snack, me included. I feel bad for the flight attendants because they have to wipe all of the cheddar off the seats. They are probably jealous of the greatness that is this popcorn.

11.description: Everyone was saying how awesome the popcorn was and my husband n I tried it, n it was awesome!! We will different come back an come here!

39.description: A must try for any out of town'er. You'll likely smell this place before you see it. Either coming from someone's bag on the Mag. Mile or around the corner from one of it's stores. Once you find it, get your wallet out and prepare to pay a pretty penny for some out of this world popcorn.Guy in front of us: Can I get a gallon of Garrett Mix. A gallon of KettleCorn, and a gallon of CaramelCrips?Worker: Sure, is that all?Guy: YesWorker: That will be $100Guy: 100 what?Worker: One hundred dollarsGuy: Can I just get a large bag of popcorn please...Not sure what he was thinking but if you are not careful or aware you could end up spending an arm and legs worth on popcorn.

37.description: Eat your popcorn immediately. I ordered some in the evening before they closed and ate some of it that night. It was stale the next morning. I had closed the bag but I guess the packaging is inadequate to keep it fresh. There is a warning on the bag that says the popcorn is best when consumed immediately, so my bad!Butter popcorn is salty, yet sweet. Caramel is good. The only problem I have is how much you'd have to pay for the popcorn in metal tins. The size of a small tin is like $30, which seems to be the same size as the medium bag, which is significantly cheaper depending on the flavor of popcorn you get. So get a bag and eat your popcorn that day or night.

0.description: How did I not know that Chicago was known for popcorn? This pink shop is everywhere! I don't eat that much popcorn and when I do, it's from the microwave or the fanciest I would go is some fresh popped kettle corn from the farmer's market.Of course I had to try the Chicago Mix - the caramel and the cheddar popcorn combined. Who thought of this? It's an interesting combination - not my favorite, but the popcorn separately was really good. This isn't your light and air-y popcorn. This is more of a jammed packed with flavor and a pretty heavy snack type of popcorn. I could get pretty full from just a few handfuls because the coating on the popcorn was so rich!My favorite was the cheddar. And it didn't taste like the powder-y artificial cheese either. Then it was the butter and then the caramel. None of them were super salty or too sweet.Overall, it's a great snack! It's perfect for sneaking into the movies (which I did). And it even lasts a few weeks if you seal it up properly.

38.description: Love their popcorn so much - but get it together people. Just got a bag of the most stale popcorn I've ever eaten from this location. I tried the sample (which was stale) but figured it was that way because it was the sample and had been sitting out. The entire bag was the exact same. Make sure you ask to sample the stuff in the case before you waste $8 bucks on really stale popcorn.

51.description: A Chicago institution, I really like the popcorn here...it's a guilty pleasure, but the Cheddar Cheese popcorn is salty, savory goodness.  It's probably not all natural (hard to believe with the bright orange fingers one has), but it's really tasty.The Cashew Caramel is also very good.

27.description: - customer service sucks - apparently they forgot our orders which is virtually impossible, but none of the employees apologize for the inconvenience- the store is NOT on michigan ave, but on ontario st.- popcorns are just okay- just like we are obsessed with japanese food (or at least i am), japanese are obsessed with american food.  garrett popcorns was the hottest american thing in tokyo as i witnessed a line stretched out at least a mile long at the harajuku shop

32.description: After almost a year i'm still dreaming about their popcorn! Was it a sticky yellow mess to eat these? Yes it was! But it was so damn delicious, open one in europe soon!

54.description: It was recommended to us by family who have been here before, so we stopped by.  Good popcorn but expensive. We liked the Garrett Mix (mixture of cheese and caramel corn) and the butter.  They have samples that you can try first.  I wouldn't get more than I could eat in a day or two at most as I don't think it has any preservatives (which is actually a good thing) and our leftovers were stale by 2nd-3rd day, even though wrapped up in the bag when not being eaten.

48.description: This particular location didn't have a long time, so I figured I'd better take advantage and get in on this wonderful popcorn that I've heard so much about. I got a medium Garrett's Mix and WISH I'd gotten a larger bag. Thankfully, there's one in Novi, MI, so I can make the trek there when I have a taste for more.

44.description: Really the popcorn is five-star worthy as far as snack foods go... but the staff is zero stars. They were terrible. I've never encountered a more miserable, unpleasant group of people in one place. Not a single employee seemed to be in a good mood. There was no pleasant greetings and no smiles. I'm here like a psychopath paying $30+ a tin for some popcorn, and you can't even be bothered to pretend be nice to me? Geez. It's not MY fault you work here.I can't fault them for the line or the dumb people who filled it up. A man brought his handicap son in his wheelchair and left the poor boy right in front of the cash registers as he waited for his popcorn. I tried to get around the kid, but I couldn't quite get to the register, so I had to shout my order.The employee who took my order didn't hear my order properly and rang it up wrong. When I got my receipt and brought it to her attention, she snapped "YOU DIDN'T ASK FOR THE POPCORN WITH NUTS!" I was surprised by her reaction, but I assured her that I did and asked if I could get the order fixed. She was annoyed, but took my receipt and made the adjustments on the order. I never got my receipt back (with my order number on it), and when I asked her about the difference in the price, she stared at me for a second and said "Don't worry about it." Then she walked away to the back room and didn't come back out for the duration of my time there. I'm glad she didn't worry about the fact that she owed me 80 cents. Yeah, I know it's only 80 cents, but it's my money and I want it back.I'd rather order online and pay shipping than to ever be in a room with those rude malcontents ever again.

24.description: I couldn't stop eating the cheddar popcorn.  It was super addicting. I wish I lived in Chicago so I could get some more cheddar popcorn.  Love, love, love.

7.description: After watching countless locals snacking on their bags of popcorn while walking along the Mag Mile, we decided to see what the hype was about, and checked out Garrett's on our way back to the hotel. Upon entering the store, we were immediately overpowered by the aroma of buttery, caramel goodness.Somehow, I got suckered into buying the $33 gallon tin of Garrett's mix because I was told it would last 8-10 days. While my fiancé decided to get a small bag to share. Loved the flavored of Garrett's mix! Who knew that cheese and caramel would pair so perfectly together. The popcorn in the small bag was slightly stale the next day. So you really DO have to eat the popcorn fresh!When I got home, the popcorn was just as good as I remembered, but after a few days it got stale. I guess that expensive tin I bought didn't really help :( At least I have a cool souvenir now? Stick with the bags and don't waste your money on the tins!

49.description: Not sure what is all of the hype about their popcorn.  I purchased the buttery popcorn and the Garrett's mix.  To be honest, I have had better popcorn from Grocery stores!  They both tasted bland and was certainly not worth the wait in line.  If you must have the popcorn, buy the smallest bag.  That way, you won't feel too bad about the money you just wasted.

40.description: Good popcorn but I think I love the smell more than the actual popcorn itself. Price seems reasonable. I went with buttery and got my friend a bag of the caramel flavored one.

53.description: This place is a treat! A tradition every time I am in Chicago, for sure! I love how there is always a long line, but it goes by fast. Don't let the line prevent you from stopping in. And be sure to get the Chicago mix. I used to get it in separate bags, the cheese and the caramel, but I just tried it once together and now I am hooked.

30.description: I've heard for years about this mystical popcorn from Chicago. It was supposed to be better than any other popcorn out there. Yeah... we've all heard those claims before. This time however... it's true!I highly recommend the mix of cheddar and caramel. Or, just get the cheddar. It's the best cheddar popcorn you've ever tasted. It's like a cheddar glaze more than a cheddar powder. It's so good it comes in a wax bag to protect you from the grease.Pro tip - if you plan to bring some home, only get the caramel corn. The other kinds will not keep.

46.description: A Chicago Institution. This isn't for the popcorn, which is delicious, but the service. Yes, they're busy. they had 5 people behind the counter, One girl ringing up things and 3-4 people bagging and getting through the line.  They tried to control the line, tried to have people step down and wait for their order, but people are, in general, dumb and don't listen, so there was mass confusion.  When it was my turn, I did as asked, stepped down and waited.. And waited.  The 4 gentlemen behind me watched as their orders were being prepared and were asking all sorts of questions. After about 7 minutes I spoke up, they didn't even realize I was waiting for my order still. *shakes head* Yes, my order was smaller than the ones after mine, but at least take care of the orders that came before, don't just shove them to the side.

1.description: Despite all of the raving reviews, this is just caramel corn and cheddar cheese corn. It's good, slightly better than those giant tins that you get at Christmas time, likely just because it is a little fresher, but the product did not live up to the hype. If you want to be a tourist and do the touristy thing, go for it. It is expensive and perhaps worth it for a one time deal. I do not plan to go back.Also, just a warning, this location does not honor the yelp check in deal.

55.description: Let me make this short and sweet. Clean store. Long line. Fresh popcorn. Delicious flavors. Worth every dime!!! Believe the hype.

9.description: Let me make this short and sweet. Clean store. Long line. Fresh popcorn. Delicious flavors. Worth every dime!!! Believe the hype.

26.description: We had heard the hype of this Chicago institution, so we had to try it even though neither of us are super into popcorn -- but we are *really* into trying local foods. On an obligatory trip to stroll Navy Pier, we spotted through our Yelp app that of course a Garrett Popcorn Shop was near by (I mean, it's pretty much a Chicago requisite, so it makes perfect sense that one would be located at the ultra touristy Navy Pier). Tip: It's a bit hard to find. It's not located ON the pier; it's inside a shopping pavilion. We asked a security guard where it was and his face beamed up. He was definitely a fan.Despite the lore, Garrett's popcorn totally lives up to the hype! It's fantastic and I thought the price was quite reasonable considering all its fanfare. You can sample various flavors, but our favorite was the Caramel Pecan! It's just the right salty sweet combo! Delicious! We got a small bag to share for our plane ride home and we still had a bit left the next day. I really appreciate that this is more than a tourist foodie stop; locals totally dig it too. It's hyped for good reason. Try it!

25.description: I have never heard of this popcorn which apparently is a Chicago must do. My friend really wanted to go to get some so I figured I should buy some as well. I was pretty surprised that there was a pretty good size line out the door. The shop is tiny too. I got a large bag of the CaramelCrisp and last minute I got a bag of the pumpkin spice CaramelCrisp. It's pretty pricey, but very fresh. I probably should have just got one bag, but I am sure we will finish both and enjoy them.  My friend did the Garret mix which is the salty sweet mix. I like both, but not together. Instead I went for the seasonal flavor. We were able to find a self parking garage and ended up just paying $6 for this quick stop.

12.description: Maybe I'm expecting too much from a popcorn store but when you're charging that much and people are raving about your popcorn I anticipated better. I got the caramel crisp which is a popular flavor at Garret's but it tasted just slightly more bitter than other caramel popcorn I've had. Nothing phenomenal about it. I also noticed they do not really have any interesting flavors. All of the flavors there are "normal" and nothing out of the ordinary. I won't be standing again in that line for popcorn again.

59.description: My favorite popcorn joint anywhere. Get the Chicago Classic. It's cheese popcorn and caramel popcorn mixed together. The caramel is sweet, with strong caramel notes, and is delectably crispy. The cheese is much softer, but the cheese has a kick and isn't mellow. They use real cheese for their popcorn, so it would go bad if you left it out for a week or so -- make sure to eat it while it's fresh. There isn't much to be said about popcorn other than if you like it or not, and I love it.

21.description: The Garrett mix is a Chicago staple! A delicious salty sweet combo that is hard to put down. Great gift for friends and family!

17.description: I know that people don't like this location, but as a tourist who didn't even know what Garrett Popcorn was until about an hour before coming here, my experience wasn't so bad.They let me try samples. The samples were HUGE! They were the size of my tiny fists lol. I ended up getting the Garrett Mix and the Almond Caramel Crisp to take home to my family/ The Garrett Mix, which is essentially cheese and caramel popcorns, sounded so strange and weird to me. I didn't get it. Til I tried it. It's a perfect combination of salty and sweet! Overall, it's definitely worth a try for you tourists, as strange as it sounds!

10.description: The "Butter" popcorn is actually dairy free! Made with Coconut oil! That means it's Vegan friendly!!!! It's delicious

5.description: On our first trip to Chicago, we stayed at the Marriott next door to this shop and kept wondering what everyone was standing in huge lines for. The smells were amazing but we thought, it's just popcorn what's the big deal? My husband and I decided to give in to popularity and joined the line ourselves the next day. Once we walked inside I saw huge vats of cheddar popcorn, caramel popcorn with pecans, with almonds, plain, etc. People were buying it in bags, souvenir buckets, and even the mega sized buckets that you see in most stores around Christmas time. I liked Carmel popcorn, but I wouldn't say I was in love with it so we got a medium of the Carmel crisp with pecans to share and went about our day. I thought they were quite proud of themselves to charge as much as they do, and once back in our room we opened the bag to see for ourselves what all the fuss was about. Popcorn CRACK you guys!!! This is truly unlike any other Carmel popcorn I have ever had. Especially when it's warm as it will completely blow your socks clean off of your feet. We destroyed the bag and went back like the tourists we were to get a larger souvenir bucket to take home with us before we left. Since then we always make it a point to come when we are in town. We love it so much that we even had it as our party favors for the guests at our wedding. We chose the Chicago style mix for our favors which is a blend of both the cheddar and Carmel. I'm not a fan of mixing savory and sweet so when it's for me only I usually avoid the cheddar, but try the Chicago mix at least once because it might surprise you. My husband didn't think he would like that combo and it's now his favorite. You can order online but fresh is best. So if you've never had it before wait until you can try it for the first time in person. While it's still great a day or two after you get it, nothing beats the taste on day one.

3.description: Visited: 06/27/2015As delicious as the popcorn is, the lines are always out the door, around the corner and so on...so please be prepared to spend quite some time in line before even entering the line that's in the store.My brother is a popcorn connoisseur, hence why I braved the lines to get his favorite popcorn :) Of course it was worth it! Make sure if you are taking this back to wherever you are from, that you purchase this as close to when you're about to head back to keep this as fresh as possible. Yes, the popcorn will stale and not taste as delicious if you purchase it far in advance for a later trip back home.Of course our favorite is the Garrett Mix. Once you get in there is an interactive screen to your left where you can take a selfie and e-mail it to yourself ;) It was entertaining and certainly shows how you were there visiting.

35.description: Amazing popcorn!!!! The kettle corn was so good. It was not as expensive as I expected for being so yummy. The staff was very efficient and nice.

19.description: Line to order popcorn goes out the door! Didn't realize how popcorn was all the rage ... and curious how folks are  willing to pay premium prices for gourmet poprcorn. Popcorn is delicious and tasty .... & to buy it where it is freshly popped and concocted is a treat.

28.description: Not sure what all the hype was about! Tried the Caramel and cheddar corn, I think it tastes pretty good but it's definitely not to die for. The Caramel corn can get a little sweet if you keep eating it. Feel free to ask for samples while you're ordering but most people seem to recommend the Garrett mix. The popcorn is definitely on the expensive side and ordering the tins will make the prices sky rocket. I think I'll stick with the Chicago mix popcorn that's sold at Costco that is a huge bag for $6 which is how much the small or medium bag costs here!

45.description: Crazy good popcorn, got there just in time, no wait when I got there, but the line was wrapped around the block by the time I walked out. A bit pricy, but worth a try!

33.description: This place is amazing. Line is long but wait is moderate and we'll worth it! My favorite is the butter and the caramel. You will boy be disappointed. A must that began in Chicago in 1949

43.description: The popcorn is fresh and well popped, but overpriced for what it is.  The caramel corn tasted burnt. The cheese corn is weirdly salty and honestly unappetizing (coming from someone who loves popcorn, loves salt, and loves sharp cheddar cheese).  The worst part was the aftermath- fingernails stained yellow, my spit was a disgusting bright yellow... turns out their cheese powder is loaded with Yellow 5 and Yellow 6 food coloring.  garrettpopcorn.com/custo…I was so disappointed.  :(

2.description: Ah yes, Garrett Popcorn. It's a classic for a reason! It's not uncommon to see lines out the door, even in the winter, full of tourists and locals alike waiting to get their popcorn fix. I normally don't even like caramel corn, but Garrett somehow manages to make it delicious. I always get the same thing when I get here: the Garrett Mix. It's a combination of their sweet, crispy, buttery caramel corn and their cheesy popcorn. Have napkins with you; it's a really cheesy, messy blend that'll leave orange all over your fingers. That's how you know it's good!The only downfall is that it's kind of expensive. It's hard justifying spending the money on something as simple as popcorn. But, it just can't be helped here because Garrett Popcorn makes it so damn delicious and addictive.

18.description: Garrett's is a must stop if you're visiting Chicago. You can smell the sweet, caramel before entering the store. They have a variety of sizes to choose from and tin cans to fill popcorn up in if you're taking some home. This location can get busy but the line does move fairly quickly.The Garrett mix of the caramel and cheddar cheese seems to be popular but I can't get on board with the salty and sweet mixture. The cheese popcorn is softer and less crunchy than the caramel version. My friends and I ended up getting some caramel popcorn to bring home. I don't think I've ever spent so much on popcorn before! While this place may be overhyped, their popcorn is very fresh, tasty, and addicting. While you're in town, grab a small bag to share to get your popcorn fix. That is a good size for three to share.

41.description: On our first trip to Chicago, we stayed at the Marriott next door to this shop and kept wondering what everyone was standing in huge lines for. The smells were amazing but we thought, it's just popcorn what's the big deal? My husband and I decided to give in to popularity and joined the line ourselves the next day. Once we walked inside I saw huge vats of cheddar popcorn, caramel popcorn with pecans, with almonds, plain, etc. People were buying it in bags, souvenir buckets, and even the mega sized buckets that you see in most stores around Christmas time. I liked Carmel popcorn, but I wouldn't say I was in love with it so we got a medium of the Carmel crisp with pecans to share and went about our day. I thought they were quite proud of themselves to charge as much as they do, and once back in our room we opened the bag to see for ourselves what all the fuss was about. Popcorn CRACK you guys!!! This is truly unlike any other Carmel popcorn I have ever had. Especially when it's warm as it will completely blow your socks clean off of your feet. We destroyed the bag and went back like the tourists we were to get a larger souvenir bucket to take home with us before we left. Since then we always make it a point to come when we are in town. We love it so much that we even had it as our party favors for the guests at our wedding. We chose the Chicago style mix for our favors which is a blend of both the cheddar and Carmel. I'm not a fan of mixing savory and sweet so when it's for me only I usually avoid the cheddar, but try the Chicago mix at least once because it might surprise you. My husband didn't think he would like that combo and it's now his favorite. You can order online but fresh is best. So if you've never had it before wait until you can try it for the first time in person. While it's still great a day or two after you get it, nothing beats the taste on day one.

52.description: Cheated with a sample from here, and DANG, it was really good. Get the combo = sweet, cheesy, salty goodness.

50.description: Super long lines for Super Duper Amazing Popcorn! You can smell the sweet and savory goodness from blocks away. I recommend the Chicago Mix that comes with the cheesy popcorn and caramel popcorn. Soooo delicious and fresh! Buttery goodness with an addicting crunch. Free samples once you get to the front of the line, yay! Buy by the bag if you will eat it right away, otherwise it is worth it to purchase the tin to take home, and the popcorn stays fresher longer. Plus, the tin is so cute with different designs to choose from. We picked the 1 lb. Chicago skyline design tin, which was a perfect amount. They even seal it up in plastic for you. Super cool!Lines move fast. I loved the photobooth as you enter the store, which makes it fun for touristy memories of this Chicago Attraction. Meh service: The lady who took our order was a bit rude. Be ready to know what you want to order when you get to the counter, because these ladies will not tolerate the indecisive. I really want to give this place 5 stars for how amazing the product is, but will have to deduct due to the rude service and unprofessional attitude. The saving grace was the employee at the end of the counter who bagged up our final purchase. She was courteous and even gave us extra carry bags to distribute the popcorn we purchased as gifts for friends and family back home. Overall, AMAZING popcorn. Expensive but worth it. Lives up to the hype!Will definitely be back for delicious crunchy goodness next time we are in Chicago!

4.description: Garrett is famous for making that popcorn that makes you want to want to eat more popcorn like you're some sort of addict.  This stuff is good and of all the things made famous known as "Chicago Mix" outside Chicagoland it's simply called Garrett Mix here or "mix" for short that is because when something is local there's no need to be redundant.  It's like when people in Philadelphia call cheesesteaks cheez whiz and onions "whiz wit" for short.  The address of this place if you're seeking to destroy is actually in the building of 625 N Michigan but the storefront is off Ontario street half a block to the east.  Deceiving?  Sort of but many places in Chicago do this.  I don't know why but I sort of get it.  It's like that big match stick building in NYC 432 Park Avenue.  An address on 56 or 57th street just doesn't sound as good.Regardless they are where they are and the smell of the caramel is literally fanned out into the street.  Where the storefront of this store is there is a fan that shoots caramel smelling sweet air into the street.  There is a particular spot if you stand beneath this fan where you'll get showered with this aroma of sweet caramel directly.  See if you can find it or not.This popcorn has NO preservatives.  Think about that for a second and decide what size you want to get because this stuff doesn't keep forever like the sealed bags of Cretors from Costco that can stay on the shelves for a year.  I ended up buying a jumbo back for about 15 bucks plus tax.  It's heavy and large and they bag it and then paper bag it and then handle bag it so it's essentially triple bagged for easy carrying but you can tell after the first day it starts to not be a fresh as it was when you first bought it.One gallon tins start at around 33 bucks.  That's right 4 quarts of popcorn for 33 bucks or 8 bucks a quart.  This stuff is expensive but hey it's amazing right?  Imagine the largest tin on display is 6.5 gallons.  That tin would be almost 215 bucks!  In theory if you were to fill an oil drum it would cost 1650 dollars!  OK enough of the imaginary costs of Garretts.  Mix is good.  It's sweet and crunchy caramel popcorn mixed with sharp cheddar flavored popcorn so it's sweet and salty at the same time.  Trust me it's not gross and if you try this good luck getting it out of your mind.

6.description: Dear Garrett's Popcorn, You won't hear me complain, because this is a Chicago legend and must have! Chicago Mix is now referred to as Garrett's mix and If you've never had this "popcorn crack"... you're in for a mouth orgasm!  Be prepared to wait in line.  Be prepared to be be addicted.  Be prepared to be in love!  The popcorn is always fresh and delicious.  You will want to take some home for your friends, however it will never make it past the the Chicago River.  You will stand in line in good weather or bad.  Just as long as you're in line.  One of the best things to get is a Tin of popcorn.  They make perfect gifts for the holidays. Garrett's I already miss you.  Signed.. Every popcorn lover

22.description: Visited: 06/27/2015As delicious as the popcorn is, the lines are always out the door, around the corner and so on...so please be prepared to spend quite some time in line before even entering the line that's in the store.My brother is a popcorn connoisseur, hence why I braved the lines to get his favorite popcorn :) Of course it was worth it! Make sure if you are taking this back to wherever you are from, that you purchase this as close to when you're about to head back to keep this as fresh as possible. Yes, the popcorn will stale and not taste as delicious if you purchase it far in advance for a later trip back home.Of course our favorite is the Garrett Mix. Once you get in there is an interactive screen to your left where you can take a selfie and e-mail it to yourself ;) It was entertaining and certainly shows how you were there visiting.

15.description: My friend took me here after convincing me that this is a must-try in Chicago. I got the caramel crisp small size. The portion size is insanely big even for a 'small size'. Even 1/4th of the "small" will totally fill you up for a good 2-3 hours.They SHOULD have sizes which are smaller than the current small size. The popcorn itself tasted very good!

57.description: Always see Garrett Popcorn at ORD, but never tried it. I went to the one downtown and am glad I finally did! There was some construction on Michigan, so it was hard to find with my eyes. Thankfully my nose led me right to their front door.The scent on Michigan Ave is intoxicating. Definitely some of the best popcorn I've ever had and I'm not really a big fan of caramel popcorn. Do yourself a favor and just get a small bag, because you will eat the entire bag!

20.description: Maybe I'm expecting too much from a popcorn store but when you're charging that much and people are raving about your popcorn I anticipated better. I got the caramel crisp which is a popular flavor at Garret's but it tasted just slightly more bitter than other caramel popcorn I've had. Nothing phenomenal about it. I also noticed they do not really have any interesting flavors. All of the flavors there are "normal" and nothing out of the ordinary. I won't be standing again in that line for popcorn again.

36.description: The Garrett Mix is soooo good! It's the perfect blend of sweet and salty.. Never thought cheddar and caramel would go together so well. Only thing is it's best eaten fresh. Don't wait to eat it. We got it right before our flight back home and thought we could save it until the next day and it was slightly stale the next day.. But still REALLY good!

14.description: I love their cheese popcorn. Normally I get their large bag, which is about $13-15.  This location is very fast and clean. The only downfall is there isn't any parking really. I recommend trying this popcorn if you never had it. They also ship if you need them to.

58.description: Restaurant updateI visited again with a recent BOGO offer from Pei Wei website and decided to try the market size portion of seared crispy shrimp which was 6.95. The food once again was fresh, but the size of the dish was ridiculously small. Even my wife who is never a big eater was staring at me and said "why is there only 6 shrimps in my meal". This is overpriced and I think I will go to Panda Express instead next time.

56.description: Portions are way to small.  You will leave this place hungry.  Food was just ok.

29.description: A nice place for a quick bite in Chicago. Love Pei Wei! the service is friendly and fast!

42.description: I've gone to a Pei Wei before and needed a quick, healthy bite. There was a long line during lunch. It went by quickly and I ordered a bowl and edamame. It was pretty healthy and under $10 so I was happy with  my choice. It took a very long time to get the food out and some of the edamame was brown when I opened up the box. Don't know if I'll go back, not really worth it to me, when there are so many other options around.

23.description: Sushi was great got the kung pao sushi and California roll. Pad Thai wasn't that great but the staff was very friendly. Tips of my rangoons were burnt but filling was full of crab and the sauce accompanying was amazing.

47.description: Food is pretty bland, we got three different dishes and it all tasted the same. Portions are tiny! We ordered large and it looked like a small. Not worth the trip back.

8.description: Stopped by this place to get some sushi to go.  You can not beat the prices on their sushi, between 3 and 4 dollars for a half roll is a great deal.  The sushi is pretty good, will stop by this place again, when in Chicago.

31.description: Pei Wei has the best lettuce wraps!  The ginger dish is fabulous.  I have never been disappointed.  Their food is always fresh and it's cooked to order.  Please come back to the Inland Empire!

34.description: I went here for the take out, found that the food didn't travel as well as I hoped. Just wishing now that I had stopped next door at Potbellies or Epic Burger. Would have then at least been full after eating junk food.

16.description: Seriously has gone down a very steep hill!While having my order taken by an inexperienced girl, a male coworker came over while I was In The middle of ordering and asked if he could take a cookie for free.... She let him too!Ordered Mongolian beef, spring rolls, and a soda. $17. Restaurant was empty except for all employees sitting at a table hanging out. Sat down at a table which was sticky. Changed table 4 times before I gave up and just took a great deal of napkins! Went and got a soda. Almost every soda that I wanted on machine was unavailable! So I settled... There was a medium size liquid/water spill by machine. Instead of wiping up, they just put a yellow no slip sign up.Received my food, order was correct however received Mongolian beef, 2 minutes later the egg rolls, two minutes later the extra sauce on side I requested. Seriously?!Mongolian sauce was thick and gelatinous on side and on meat. There was no crispness to beef like before. White rice tasted left over. I turned me off the whole meal as I realized how horrible this place has turned. I used to love this place and always recommended it. Now I will do the opposite and never return too... This 100% are the leaders of this organization's fault. All team members are only as good as their direct report. Shame!

13.description: First and last time coming here! Staff are inattentive and cold, but that can be excused. Well the table we sat at was broken and rickety, and the second one we moved to was STICKY! I ordered a variety of "sushi" and a chicken wrap. The "sushi" was hard, tasted stale and fishy and so loosely rolled it was falling apart on the plate. I've had edible sushi even from walgreens compared to this disturbance.  As for the chicken wrap, the peanut sauce it came with was straight peanut butter, what a joke. My boyfriend ordered a chicken vegetable stirfry and was served chunks of deep fried, questionable chicken that was neither spicy nor flavorful but overtly salty.The first time I have ever been pushed to asking for my money back, we left after a few tortured bites. How is this place in business?

11.description: Decent ambiance and attentive staff (I visited around 6 pm on a Monday, though, and it was dead). I ordered the small (it was huge) tofu and vegetables lo mein, and while nothing spectacular, I thought it was pretty darn good. Simple, no fuss Asian inspired dishes at decent price points. And - unlike Panda Express - I didn't feel sick afterwards!I'd be interested in trying their spring rolls and other sides. Stay tuned.

39.description: The food is good but they could do a lot more to keep the line moving during the lunch rush. The slow guy on the register just can't keep up.

37.description: About as close, cuisine-wise to my old favorite, Ben Pao (R.I.P.).  Nice place--roomy, casual enough for an easy dinner but classy enough to be a lunch date kind of place.  It's a little more than just fast food, and the menu is confusing.  Work through it, and you'll understand.  Took me a couple times before I settled into a routine: Original chicken with Teriyaki sauce and steamed rice complemented with a 2-pork egg roll side.  Skip the fountain drink, and the whole meal is around $13.  They have noodle dishes as well.Tourists: this is NOT Panda Express.  Keep walking.

0.description: Great food everything's from scratch...idk why so many bad complaints...it seems like customer service is lacking here.....you should rehire me and I make it better...bye tony

38.description: Always short staffed with less than enthusiastic employees. They always take way too long and the food comes up short, either too dry or too greasy. The place needs a good cleaning and tables are left with trash on them for way too long before they are cleared and crumbs are scooped from the floor. No ambiance whatsoever. Given them more than one chance, they always disappoint. It's so obvi this place is a franchise, skip out and try a local Chinese place instead, I'm sure the attention to detail and customer service will surpass this place that looks like it's hanging by a thread.

51.description: Very clean and spacious.  The food isn't bad at all for Americanized Chinese food.  Even though everything is under $10, portions are pretty small, even the "large" size.  Their crab wontons are pretty amazing!  Definitely a good place to bring small kids or babies as well. :)

27.description: If there were a 1/2 star I would give that. Sushi, made hours ago... stale. I won't ever go back

32.description: Ordered mongolian beef and fried rice. got brown rice and some sort of strange beef jerky stips (see pic). I've compared it to the other times i've gotten mongolian beef as well as pei wei's own pictures and I can say with 100% certainty what I got was not mongolian beef. Vegetables had no flavor tasted just as bad as the beef jerky. couldn't bring myself to eat more than two bites of the meal. worst meal I've eaten in the past 2 years by far.

54.description: I want so badly to like you Pei Wei! You are located right around the corner. The restaurant is very clean and open. You are right next to an Epic Burger so that I can head that way and then feel guilty about my calorie intake and choose you instead. But there is an issue that we can never get past, which is your ridiculously SMALL portion sizes! I assumed that restaurants did research on these kinds of things so that they would know customer expectations, but obviously they saved some money by skipping that step. Unfortunate, those savings are not passed on to me since Pei Wei is super expensive once you take into account the portions - like $$ instead of just $ expensive. We are talking almost $14 for a meal that I will eat every bite of in one sitting, which is pretty crazy to me. This place is most often compared to Panda Express (which is a fair comparison) but they have much better quality and each item is prepared to order. While I'm on that subject, you can pretty easily add and remove ingredients from dishes, but when I tried to have the beef in one is my dishes prepared well done they had no idea what I was talking about! I mean, really? They had to go get the chef from the back and I had to tell him what I wanted. When you try to order online there was no way to write specific notes about preparing the meal, you only check off what you wanted and didn't want. Who designs a website like that? There isn't even a way to say, "extra napkins please." I was so excited when Pei Wei came here and now I just sad...cause the food is delicious! Mongolia Beef - I will miss you. Maybe can still see each other on my birthday and when someone else is treating?

48.description: Pei Wei is a run-off-the-mill diner serving their watered-down version of Asian food. I won't say it's bad, but it's not tasty. Fast service though. Great for take outs. Their "fusion" of Asian cuisines is a bit odd. We got spicy stir fried Chinese noodle that, literally, tasted like bits and pieces of different parts of Asia. But we were hungry!

44.description: I actually like Pei Wei for a quick meal, but this location is consistently bad.  The food is bland, literally no flavor whatsoever.  A simple veggie and brown rice meal came out swimming in Spicy Pei Wei sauce.  A soggy, flavorless, over-priced mess.  And the spinach I paid an extra buck for?  3 wilted leaves!  The location in Logan Square is good, I've stopped in there on occasion while shopping.  But I've given this location several tries and, despite being literally next door to my office, I will not be coming back.

24.description: I wondered if I visited this Pei Wei on an off day, but the reviews make me think otherwise.I came in here on a Saturday before seeing a movie; we wanted to come here because we thought a traditional sitdown restaurant would take too long. Well, as it turned out, this took much longer than expected as well. We came up and ordered, and it was clear they were very understaffed. In fact, the two stores are solely for the effort that the staff was obviously at least trying to put in. When I walked up, the woman at the counter had to take a phone call. I noticed that in the 45 minutes I was there, there were almost a dozen pick-up orders either called in or picked up, despite the handful of people in the restaurant. It seemed these orders were getting priority. A friend ordered ahead of my boyfriend and I, and it seemed that none of us received any food until AFTER the prior person had finished his/her food. I have had Pei Wei plenty of times before, and it was decent, but this was just ... bland. Absolutely nothing special. It seemed to me that not only were they understaffed.. a lot of people looked like they were training.Maybe this place is well-staffed during work-week lunch, but on a Saturday night? There were maybe five people working. Ridiculous. Pei Wei, step it up and hire some people in this location.

7.description: I've had Pei Wei in three different states and enjoy it each time.  This isn't your run of the mill greasy Chinese food.  The food is fresh, fast, and most importantly delicious.  There are also options for those of us who are health conscious such as brown rice and steamed meat.  My only beef is that they don't give you very large portions sometimes.  Otherwise, I recommend this to all of my friends and family.  Will be back in the not too distant future!

49.description: I came here for the first time last week and I was pretty excited to eat here and check it out.The restaurant has a nice set up, it's clean, lots of tables, big open kitchen so you can see them cooking your food. They have not one, but TWO Coke Freestyle soda machines (the machines with like 100 different flavors) so that's cool.Okay let's get to the food part.. I ordered the Pei Wei Spicy with steak. I like my food to have a little bit of kick. This had ZERO kick, it was not spicy at all! The steak pieces were also awkwardly big. They were too big for bite size, so I had to cut everything, but it was really difficult trying to cut through this awful meat. I almost broke a plastic knife cutting this steak, it was awful. The whole dish was kind of bland.. It seemed like it was frozen steak bits from Dominiks covered in glaze that was not spicy at all then piled onto rice and mixed in with a few vegies, it wasn't good. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing? I'll have to try one of their stirfry dishes IF I go back..Also it was expensive.. I think I paid like $11 for my meal and drink. No thanks.

40.description: While the lettuce wraps with traditional chicken are tasty, keep in mind they can be quite messy. (Better eaten while alone)

53.description: Expensive for what you get.  Not very good taste.  There is never enough sauce on your meal and the chicken was undercooked.  Wont be dining here again.

30.description: It was my first time here after getting a $10 gift card. This place is rather hidden on Ontario St as people don't seem to eat at the restaurants along this less-traveled street. The place is big with plenty of tables but there were only a few tables there on a 7pm weeknight. We were greeted by a friendly employee upon walking in. We took a few minutes to decide what to order. They were out of the sushi rolls with tuna in them. Bummer. We ordered Pei Wei Spicy Chicken Original and Thai Dynamite Steak Original with a fountain drink.The Pei Wei Spicy Chicken was super sour and sweet. t wasn't that spicy despite the abundance of bright red pepper flakes. We inhaled the steam from the food and coughed from the vinegar smell in the dish. The snap peas were super fresh and crunchy. The circle-cut orange slices might look boring but added a firm sweetness to the dish. It was served with plenty of white rice. The chicken was breaded and deep-fried so it added a nice crunch to the dish. There seemed to be plenty of chicken, too. Yay!The Thai Dynamite (Steak) was a favorite of the employee taking our order. I thought it was okay - I would try another dish next time. The steak was lightly breaded and deep fried and there was a small amount of thick sauce. The beef pieces were crunchy and settled atop a bed of sliced green onions and red peppers. The dish seemed to have a lot of salty seasoning and the green onion and red pepper didn't suffice to minimize the saltiness. The brown rice I ordered with the dish, however, helped balance out the saltiness but it was a bit dry. Luckily, I had a fountain drink.The fountain drink served to quench my thirst. One of the machines was almost completely out of order. Perhaps only 2-3 soda brands were available. The working machine, located closer to the kitchen and on the left side of the back counter, gave the drink a weird, almost algae-like taste to the drinks. I tried different drinks (orange coke, sprite, ginger ale, sprite with peach) and they all had this weird taste to it. I wonder if it was the pipe on the machine that had algae on it or the water pipe servicing the machine that had algae in it or the water source servicing the machine that had algae in it. I'm not sure what it was but the soda tasted off.The service here is excellent. The team members seem to get along well with each other and the server who brought food to our table told us what the dishes were as they brought them out to us. Service was quick and the employee who took our order asked us if we had any questions when we were ordering, which was nice of her.The ambiance is very nice. The lighting is great as it's very well-lit and bright. The dark tables go well with the brick walls and the restrooms are quite clean. I'd like to come back again to try out their other dishes such as the Pad Thai next time. I'll give the fountain drinks another try, too. Maybe I'll try the smaller-sized dishes (4oz vs 8oz of meat) since 8oz is a bit too much for me.

46.description: I'll be honest - I feel like I have gone through a love-hate relationship with Pei Wei. When the place opened about a year ago near my place, I was SUPER excited to have a nearby cheaper quick Chinese option, because I love me some Chinese food.But...the first couple times I tried it, the food was just not enjoyable. It wasn't the normal Chinese flavors you expect, the brown rice accompaniment was dry and awful and it was never satisfying. But I must be crazy because I tried it again to try and convince myself that it was good, and one day it all changed - IT WAS GOOD! They changed their recipes or something and it became addicting and delicious.Our regular dishes are the Caramel chicken with extra sauce, add spinach. And the Mongolian steak. I'm also a sucker for the Thai wonton soup, it's not the best soup ever but it's just something I like with my PeiWei.

1.description: Never again.The slowest moving line. The slowest preparation. The slowest delivery of my food. I came at the tail end of the lunch rush. There were no guests in front or behind me so I expected much better service. The food was hot, thankfully, however my rice was severely overcooked (crunchy!) and so was my chicken. The honey chicken was a huge miss for me. I am fairly certain that I would not have enjoyed any item on this menu now that I know this is just another Americanized "Chinese" restaurant. Simply not a fan. Totally not worth the time, effort, calories, or money when Chipotle is so close by.

55.description: Serving Asian food, this tastes like Panda Express, but they have their own gimmicks. Outside of the food orders, this place is essentially a self serve. The East Ontario location is clean which is a plus. Servings are rather small which is a minus. On the balance, it's an okay place for fast food.

9.description: Recently just discovered this place -how did it take me this long?!
