27.description: I have meetings in the neighborhood frequently, so I decided to pop into Spex not expecting to find higher end lines. I had been in the market for some premium designer prescription sunglasses for some time, but had not found the right frames. Previously, I had made the mistake of purchasing from the Oliver Peoples retail store and had not been able to get reimbursed from my insurance. I probably could have, but they couldn't do it directly at the store level, which created too much red tape on my end. At Spex, I only paid around $150 for Prada prescription sunglasses with my insurance.The service from start to finish was phenomenal. I had my exam elsewhere so I can't speak to that--only the customer service in selecting and purchasing frames. The friendly young gentleman was very helpful and in tune with what I was seeking. He even politely asked other customers their opinions, which he could tell I was open to based on my personality. I'm thrilled with the fashion-forward look of my frames yet they definitely are not over the top since they need to be appropriate in business settings as well. They arrived promptly. When I came to pick them up, the woman greeted me warmly, had me try them on, and the frames fit perfectly. When I was ready to go, she handed me a yellow rose for getting a new pair of glasses! I was completely surprised by the kind gesture! It was a simple act, but all day people asked me where I got the rose and I told them the story. Now I want more pairs of glasses so I can get more of these beautiful long-stemmed roses!  :)I've purchased designer frames from eyeglass boutiques in a number of large cities and Spex exhibited more genuine concern and friendliness in their service than any other shop. I will return the next time I need frames.

32.description: I went to buy two pairs of glasses. One fregular, the other sunglasses. The eye doctor Alexandra was awesome. The service is as good as it gets. They helped me select perfect frames. They made sure the glasses fit perfectly. The glasses were ready to pick up in a week or so.

54.description: The customer service is not helpful. They would not allow you to see your medical record once you are an established patient.  I have only been here once, July 2012, and it was crowded, with a very long wait (2.5 hours in total). The exam room looks like you are being brought back to a dingy closet, as there is only a curtain door.  Expensive exams are pushed on you, and you are not made aware that the Dr. will not see you unless you get these tests (and no insurance covers). Well, I had already waited about 90 min - so I said fine do the tests. Needless to say I am going somewhere else this year, and wanted a copy of my Rx - not a daunting task - oh except that it is $25.

48.description: Went to Spex on Chicago Avenue for my yearly eye appointment and to order new contacts. The optometrist I saw for my initial appointment was fabulous and knowledgeable, as was the other woman I saw at my follow-up appointment. The two gentlemen sales clerks were also wonderfully helpful and polite both times I came in. My contacts took under a week to come in, and when I picked them up, one of the clerks gave me a rose! Very sweet.

44.description: I just recently got a new pair of glasses from Spex. I must say that their staff there is phenomenal. They were all very attentive and personal. Viktor helped me pick out my glasses and did just a great job. He described my glasses as "geeky chic" Love them. Although the frames were pretty expensive, it was completely worth it. Thank you!

24.description: Some reviews require a lot of information and this one doesn't...here it is:1. Great doctor onsite with very practical descriptions and recommendations.2. Incredible consultation from Ric concerning my tests and what was being measured.3. Easy frame selection and realistic turnaround (glasses were ready 1.5 weeks early).4. Picked up today and I received complimentary cleaners, cloths, and accoutrements.5. Perfect Experience!!!

7.description: tl;dr: Prescription from eye exam was very wrong, was told they'd charge me $35 to redo it. Beware of getting a prescription here and glasses made elsewhere.I went to Spex back in February to get an eye exam done. I had intended to buy some frames and get glasses made elsewhere as Spex had told me that their frames started around $250 and ranged up to $900, which is way more than I wanted to spend, so I made an appointment for the exam and wanted to walk out with my prescription. I had a pleasant experience at the store and the staff was very friendly, and I walked out with my prescription (which I was told was slightly worse than my current pair of glasses), which ultimately turned out to be wrong. Not knowing that at the time, I ordered some glasses from Warby Parker from their store in Old Town. Given my high prescription, it took quite a few weeks to get my glasses in. Knowing that with my prescription it takes a few days to adjust to new lenses, I went through a few days of forcing myself to wear them, thinking something was pretty off. Nevertheless, I chalked it up to the adjustment period. 3-4 days later, things hadn't improved, and I put my old glasses back on, where things were much better. I returned the Warby Parker glasses and chalked it up to a mistake on their end. After some time of putting my frames search on the back burner, I went to LensCrafters, who made my previous glasses. Upon receiving them, I had similar issues - tried wearing the glasses for a few days, took them back to LC a few times and they tried a few adjustments, until ultimately they looked up my prescription history and noticed my that my old and new prescription were very different (new was weaker; despite Spex telling me my eyes had gotten a little worse, and the astigmatism correction was completely different). I called Spex and was told too much time had passed by (it had been about 6-8 months) and they would charge me $35 to come back in. I thought this was pretty unfair given the prescription is supposed to be valid for 12 months from the date of exam, and since I didn't really have a lot of trust in them, I opted to get a redo exam at LensCrafters instead, which showed that my prescription had not changed at all. The doc at LC even changed her exam tools to show me what the prescription Spex gave me was, and it was not even close. Since I remember being able to see pretty well at Spex during the eye exam, I can only assume that the doc there had written the prescription down wrong. Unfortunately, that led to a lot of lost time and confusion in trying to get new glasses, extra cost to me to redo the eye exam at LC, and while I can forgive the mistake, telling me they'd have to charge me extra to double check my prescription within the same time it was valid didn't strike me as the best customer service.

49.description: Yes it is that time of the year again, time to see my eye doctor, get new glasses. This time I was little scared because I have been doing a LOT of computer work and I feared my eyesight has deteriorated since my last review. The doctor also performed some exams on my eye and I even saw the back of my eyeball. Very cool.  Have you seen your eyeball today?The whole experience was very pleasant. This time Spex had a whole collection of "hipster glasses" which are not exactly for me but I totally fell in love with the Lindberg frame that just made me look soo good. My optician was so nice and patient with me measuring everything in such a detail. I can't wait to go back and pick up my glasses.

40.description: Just bought a pair of new glasses from the boys at Spex on Chicago Ave.  Top notch experience and Viktor and David took care of me from the time I walked in.   Highly recommend.

53.description: I too was a devotee of For Eyes for many years.  Then Spex opened in my neighborhood and I could see the advantage of supporting a local place and having them close by for those regular adjustments.  No need to get into what a dismal failure my local Spex was (you would think I would have learned after purchasing one pair of glasses), BUT THEN I FOUND VICTOR!  Yes, the store is small, but the service is fabulous!  Victor was patient, polite, and is truly an expert at his product!  I have never had such wonderful service!  And, I have never felt a need to write a review before now!  I am hooked for life and will now only buy my glasses from this Spex store!

30.description: As you can see, I am someone who doesn't often write reviews. So when I do, it's because I received really fantastic service. I've been going to Spex for about 6 years, but my experience this weekend is what prompted me to write this.I purchased a pair of sunglasses a few years ago from this location. Victor sold them to me, and they quickly became my favorite sunglasses ever. This past weekend while visiting New York City, I destroyed them in a most unfortunate accident. The frames were bent like a pretzel and one of the connectors to the nose broke off into a new piece. I went in with my pieces asking if anything could be done with the lenses, thinking there was no way in the world other than turning back time that could fix these things. Meg said that she thought she could fix them and would you believe, she did? In a day. They look brand new. She replaced the nose pads and they're wonderful. I asked her what it would cost and she said free because I'm a customer.If there are other businesses in existence that would do something like this, please point them out to me. This was just so above and beyond.

46.description: I actually went to the spec on Chicago Ave to see if they could fix a pair I had purchased at Spex on Clark and Belden ( which is no longer there)  The eyepieces were missing and the stems were so stretched out they could have fit an elephant. I walked in with no appointment and Victor took care of me immediately. I looked over frames while he iced my old glasses - perfectly!.  Then as an added bonus, he did not charge me.  A nice experience. Thank you very much.

1.description: For the past three years I've gotten my eyes checked here and always had a less than pleasant experience. I have no complaints about the doctor or the quality of my eye exam- Based on just those it would likely be a 4-5 star review. Its everything else in the experience that brings it down. There is always a wait that seems like its longer than it should be- and pressure to get things I don't necessarily want, and worst of all a surprise when I get the bill.  The last ones the worst- but consistently happens year after year.  Small things like a warranty on my glasses or an extra test to take a picture of the back of my eye. Worst was when they just decided I needed the most expensive lens possible despite a relatively week RX.  It be nice if they explained the charges rather than leaving me to figure out what everything is, and whats covered by my vision plan.

55.description: Absolutely horrible experience. I walked in the store, which was cramped and humid, and was asked "What do you want?" by an older man, Viktor. I explained that I needed new glasses and already had my perception and Viktor looked irritated and started handing glasses to me without asking anything about what I was looking for. I stopped him and explained the style of grams I was looking for, and he told me that with my "fat face shape" that I couldn't have what I wanted. He then continued to hand me outrageously priced frames. I desperately needed glasses, so I quickly found a pair a liked within my price range and tried to move on. Viktor once again told me that the pair didn't compliment my face and offered my an ugly $600 pair. I explained I didn't have time to keep trying on pairs and needed the glasses I likes ASAP. He then took 20 minutes typing on his computer and submitted my order before double checking my RX and without telling me the price. He told me the order total, which was through the roof, and said I wouldn't get my glasses for two months. When I asked to see the bill and details, I realized he didn't account for my insurance, which I had asked about numerous times. I told him that I know my insurance covers their services, and he literally said "you got me." This man tried to scam me, and tried to again with a second bill. Furious, I told him to cancel the order that I didn't authorize to begin with. He got visibly upset at me for not accepting his horrendous actions. The other clerk, who had been giving me sympathetic glances throughout my time there, didn't do anything to help. I left immoderately. This place was horrible! I would NEVER recommend them. All in all:Service: The worst I've ever experienced The frames: Overpriced and small selectionThe atmosphere: Awkwardly small and cramped. Bad store layout.On the upside, it's located next to a Forever Yogurt so I got some comfort food as soon as I left.

9.description: I have meetings in the neighborhood frequently, so I decided to pop into Spex not expecting to find higher end lines. I had been in the market for some premium designer prescription sunglasses for some time, but had not found the right frames. Previously, I had made the mistake of purchasing from the Oliver Peoples retail store and had not been able to get reimbursed from my insurance. I probably could have, but they couldn't do it directly at the store level, which created too much red tape on my end. At Spex, I only paid around $150 for Prada prescription sunglasses with my insurance.The service from start to finish was phenomenal. I had my exam elsewhere so I can't speak to that--only the customer service in selecting and purchasing frames. The friendly young gentleman was very helpful and in tune with what I was seeking. He even politely asked other customers their opinions, which he could tell I was open to based on my personality. I'm thrilled with the fashion-forward look of my frames yet they definitely are not over the top since they need to be appropriate in business settings as well. They arrived promptly. When I came to pick them up, the woman greeted me warmly, had me try them on, and the frames fit perfectly. When I was ready to go, she handed me a yellow rose for getting a new pair of glasses! I was completely surprised by the kind gesture! It was a simple act, but all day people asked me where I got the rose and I told them the story. Now I want more pairs of glasses so I can get more of these beautiful long-stemmed roses!  :)I've purchased designer frames from eyeglass boutiques in a number of large cities and Spex exhibited more genuine concern and friendliness in their service than any other shop. I will return the next time I need frames.

26.description: Walked in on a rainy day to look for new glasses since I've been wearing the same pair for years now. I was immediately greeted Ric. He was super friendly and helpful when it came to finding myself a new pair of glasses. He took time to let me try different styles. Now, I have a new pair of glasses that he recommended for me.

25.description: I had an excellent and personal service. Very professional yet friendly team. The optometrist was through and explained everything in details. I dealt with the store manager, very knowledgeable, accommodating, and friendly. No rushing or pushing any product, actually he saved me sone money by giving his advice as a caring person not a as salesman. I got the new glasses yesterday and I am very comfortable in them right away, All in all, it was and outstanding experience

12.description: So, this is definitely a business with a number of highly suspicious 5-star reviews...perhaps from someone who works there? I went here last year and didn't have a great experience. The doctor was competent but I was given a hard sell from the second I walked in the door--upgrade your exam, buy your contacts here, get LASIK, etc. It was a fine experience but no one was particularly helpful, aside from the doc. Frankly, I had that feeling I get at a car dealership!This year, I decided to call around to compare exam prices. Spex was significantly more than other businesses I called--over 30%. This would be palatable if the experience were friendlier.

59.description: I have never had a more unpleasant experience.  The whole place is entirely unprofessional, and they were so pushy when I said that I didn't want new glasses, only new lenses for my frames.  Additionally when they actually sent my frames out, they came back totally warped and the lens was sticking out, and then did nothing to fix the problem other than offer to send them back to the same place (which they blamed on the lab for "my insurance") that broke them in the first place. I  will never go back and would not recommend this place to ANYONE.

21.description: Broke my glasses. They fixed them right there for free using other parts they had. Friendly low key and no pressure to buy new glasses just because i broke mine.

17.description: Some reviews require a lot of information and this one doesn't...here it is:1. Great doctor onsite with very practical descriptions and recommendations.2. Incredible consultation from Ric concerning my tests and what was being measured.3. Easy frame selection and realistic turnaround (glasses were ready 1.5 weeks early).4. Picked up today and I received complimentary cleaners, cloths, and accoutrements.5. Perfect Experience!!!

10.description: They were super helpful and adjust my glasses even though I didn't buy them there. If I'm ever in need of new glasses or an adjustment I'll definitely be heading here again.

5.description: My glasses screw fell off in the morning and I was wondering around the city in fear that my glasses arm would eventually fall out.  I walk by Spex and thought maybe they will repair my glasses.  I walked in and ask if they would be so kind to repair my glasses.  I was fully expecting to pay, but they were so kind and repaired my glasses and also adjusted them for free.  I know where I will be buying my next glasses.  Thank you Spex for being so kind to a stranger.

3.description: Tony and Ric are awesome! I just picked up my new frame, as well as two others with an updated prescription. Through out the whole process, they have been so helpful and took the extra time to address all my questions/needs. I also like this Spex location, as it's really close to work. I think they are open until 7pm on most week nights, so that is definitely another big plus. Will definitely be coming back again.

35.description: What a sweet little boutique! From the moment I called them, the team at Spex (especially Mag) was extremely pleasant and accommodating.  I truly received excellent customer service throughout.  Also, big bang for my buck!  I was VERY pleasantly surprised that my designer glasses and appointment were so affordable!  Granted, I have decent insurance-- but with this same plan, I've definitely paid more for less in the past.  Looking forward to next year's appt!  Thanks

19.description: The Only Place to Go For All your Eye Wear Needs........Great Selection, Spectacular Service, and Nice Environment.... Tony Kaehny is the Absolute BEST.......So Personable and gave me the much needed direction to Find the Perfect Frames for my face.....A True Professional....Go see him.........

28.description: First time customer/patient, new to Chicago and I must say I was quite pleaed.  Top notch customer service.  No wait for an appointment either.   Very professional doctor as well as staff to assist with the selection of frames.  Fun, outgoing and professional.  Would reccomend and I will continue to be their customer/patient!

45.description: I'm absolutely baffled by the negative reviews below.Spex was, quite literally, one of the best customer service experiences of my life - from the initial phone call to schedule an appointment to my last trip in to pick up the glasses. Each of the staff members, as well as the optometrist, went out of his or her way to answer all of my questions, give honest feedback about styles and colors, and ensure that I was absolutely happy with what I was buying.

33.description: So, this is definitely a business with a number of highly suspicious 5-star reviews...perhaps from someone who works there? I went here last year and didn't have a great experience. The doctor was competent but I was given a hard sell from the second I walked in the door--upgrade your exam, buy your contacts here, get LASIK, etc. It was a fine experience but no one was particularly helpful, aside from the doc. Frankly, I had that feeling I get at a car dealership!This year, I decided to call around to compare exam prices. Spex was significantly more than other businesses I called--over 30%. This would be palatable if the experience were friendlier.

43.description: I needed some new eye glasses and I went to the Pearle Vision store in River Point Center as I always do.  I had my heart set on getting a pair of prescription Oakley's.  Pearle told me over the phone that they accepted the vision insurance I had but when I got to the store I was told Oakley company policy did not allow the customer to use insurance.  That sounded strange to me so I called Spex and was told using my insurance was no problem.  I went to the location on Chicago and WOW!!!  The eye exam I received was very comprehensive and everything was explained to me in great detail.  I was issued my prescription so it was time to shop for frames.  I dealt with David and he was a real pleasure.  He was extremely knowledgeable and gave me some really good suggestions.  They did not have many Oakley's to choose from at that particular store so David just gave me the Oakley catalog and told me to pick out 10 or 12 frames that I might like to try on and he would order them in and let me come back on try them on and make a decision.  Really!  Who does that anymore?  I picked a pair that I liked and yesterday they came in.  I am so happy and so pleased with how they came out.  Spex will not only get all of my eye care business but my entire family's business as well.  Don't pay attention to those TV ads about glasses in an hour; go to where you will get first class service; go to Spex.

2.description: My experience at Spex was luxurious.  The team was professional, and exceptional.   From start to finish I could not have been more pleased.  I just had knee surgery, and was hobbling around the Spex boutique.  Everyone was kind, and they shared their best guidance with me when making my selection on my new glasses.I love my glasses, and appreciate that they painstakingly worked with me until the next time it rains. Thank you Nellie and Tony!  I am happy to recommend your salon to a friend.

18.description: Yes it is that time of the year again, time to see my eye doctor, get new glasses. This time I was little scared because I have been doing a LOT of computer work and I feared my eyesight has deteriorated since my last review. The doctor also performed some exams on my eye and I even saw the back of my eyeball. Very cool.  Have you seen your eyeball today?The whole experience was very pleasant. This time Spex had a whole collection of "hipster glasses" which are not exactly for me but I totally fell in love with the Lindberg frame that just made me look soo good. My optician was so nice and patient with me measuring everything in such a detail. I can't wait to go back and pick up my glasses.

41.description: My husband and I both purchased glasses here 18 months ago and again just recently purchased new glasses.  David primarily helped us...he brought us both several pair of glasses  in multiple styles that he thought would look good on us.  This was very helpful and we quickly found a couple of pairs of glass that we liked....not too big...not too small for our face.  David will tell you if the glasses are too big or too small for you face...I very much appreciate this.  You will end up with 2-3 pair of glasses that look really great on your face...then you choose.  David was very organized and I felt he was very diligent in looking for the perfect pair of glasses for us...that were to our taste.   The eye doctor was experienced and I thought the eye exam was thorough..see was really great; my husband brought in his own prescription because he has an unusual eye problem requiring special expertise...this was not problem.   We have received may complements on our glasses...we can see better too.  This was our experience the first time we went there and it was again our experience.  We will surely go back when we need glasses again.

52.description: Walked in and shortly after walked out due to the arrogant attitude of the sales person. I understand Spex is on the expensive side, but to me that is all the more reason they should have stellar customer service considering the amount one would spend on there.  Ill take my business elsewhere

50.description: I have been going to Spex for over 3 years and every time is a great experience. Both Victor and Dave are always pleasant. I have a toddler, so getting into the store isn't easy but they are always willing to help with the stroller and have even offered to come outside to adjust my eyeglasses, so to lessen the hassle. Evey consultation is honest and centered on what is best for me. They are never pushy or arrogant. Definitely a place to go long term, where they remember you and what you like.

4.description: I would give this place less stars if it wasn't for the how nice Dr. Plummer was. No complaints with her or my eye exam. It's the other staff members at the counter who do not care about your needs and just try to sell, sell, sell. I clearly told them that I was just there to get a new contact lens prescription and order a supply, but the sales staff were being very pushy and kept on trying to get me to purchase a pair of glasses as well. I do not appreciate that. I witnessed another customer who had wanted a copy of their prescription to purchase contacts elsewhere arguing with staff who wouldn't give it to them. Not right or very professional..I do not think I will be returning to this location.

6.description: Wonderful eye doctor - the optometrist is fantastic, she is very nice and knowledgeable. Makes sure to have everything perfect and comfortable with glasses and contacts.The rest of the staff is also wonderful - helped me pick out great frames and gladly adjusted them after the glasses came in (whenever I get a new pair, it takes about 3 times of adjusting them to get it right! - they were absolutely understanding about this).Switched over to this eye doctor when I started working in the area and so glad I did!

22.description: Pretty awful experience. Doctor was very nice, but I couldn't believe the bait and switch tactics and direct lies by omission about my insurance covering the costs of my exam. What should have been a $10 copay plus contact exam cost me $150 before I've even purchased contacts. To make matters worse, Viktor, the manager, was about as abrasive and rude as anyone I've ever seen in a social setting. He stormed into a calm conversation between myself and the gentleman at the counter and started shouting at me. The whole thing was just so over the top and ridiculous. No clue how they have such good ratings. Their Google reviews are much more consistent with my experience. I would avoid at all costs.

15.description: Pretty awful experience. Doctor was very nice, but I couldn't believe the bait and switch tactics and direct lies by omission about my insurance covering the costs of my exam. What should have been a $10 copay plus contact exam cost me $150 before I've even purchased contacts. To make matters worse, Viktor, the manager, was about as abrasive and rude as anyone I've ever seen in a social setting. He stormed into a calm conversation between myself and the gentleman at the counter and started shouting at me. The whole thing was just so over the top and ridiculous. No clue how they have such good ratings. Their Google reviews are much more consistent with my experience. I would avoid at all costs.

57.description: Convenient, got my prescription right, easy process. Had Rx sunglasses ordered. Victor was very thorough. Called as soon as the glasses came in. Small shop, but the staff knows exactly what they are doing. Also, sales tax is ~2% because its a doctors office and not a retail store. Will be back for my glasses in the future. Spex under promised and over delivered.

20.description: This Spex location is excellent. I've been wearing glasses for 33 years and this was the best experience I've had in an optical shop. Ric's great humor, patience, and excellent customer service made it an awesome experience--and even fun!I have a challenging prescription and a host of other eye issues, so I bought the "safe spex" (cute, huh?) plan for $30 I think. Totally worth it. The first pair of frames ended up just not working for me--and my prescription had to be tweaked. And guess what? It wasn't a problem! I got to get another pair for the modest fee of $10 and just paid the difference between the two frames. Amazing! They gladly did what they needed to to make sure I was happy--no guilt, no shame, no trouble!They have a nice selection of frames, they handle the administrative side of the shop well; and you can't beat the service. Best spex you've ever had!

36.description: Just went to Spex for the 1st time and have nothing but positive reviews. The store is extremely organized and the selection is great. Their most unique quality, however, is their outstanding customer service.  The staff is so warm, outgoing, and accommodating. I will definitely continue to go there for all my glasses needs.

14.description: Thank you so much Tony for fixing my reading glasses. My husband and I are on holidays and I was lost without my glasses. Wonderful complimentary service with a smile.  Really appreciate it.

58.description: Very nice restaurant, great service. I had the skirt steak with mashed potatoes for dinner. I have dined here several times before and had great meals. Excellent quality. Great location next to the Courtyard by Marriott right off Michigan Avenue. This is a real plus if you are staying at the Courtyard. Not the best breakfast choice when in Chicago.Vital Statistic: If you are a Marriott frequent stay member you qualify for discounts at this restaurant. Not sure if this is a promo or regular gig.

56.description: Oh, Viand.I have such fond memories of this place because so many friends and myself have come to cherish it for both the food and the time that we spend together there.For starters the food is simply amazing.  Some of the most deliciously simple things, I've had at Viand.  The ravioli in truffle oil and balsamic reduction is simply the most amazing combination of flavor, texture, and meltiness.  The tomato soup with goat cheese is similarly amazing.However, I will completely agree that the service is abysmally slow.  I too have been a victim of the 45-minute lunch burger.  I really don't know what the issue is, it isn't like they are freshly slaughtering cows in the kitchen.  Dinner waits can also be unbearably long.The only thing I wish they would stop doing is giving you a little beakerful of soup and calling it an "amuse".  It's a little beaker of soup, and it's usually one of the two soups on the menu that day, so I really am not that impressed by it.  And if you happen to order a soup, then your "amuse" is a sample of the other soup, which can be rather hilarious if it is a soup you didn't like and were avoiding.I'm also very disappointed that they eliminated the junk food cart from the dessert menu.

29.description: We got the hookup with a recommendation from our hotel, the Red Roof Inn across the street. We went for a birthday and the "recommendation" became a private room, comped bottle of champagne, and 20% off coupon. The food was delicious and well priced and our waiter, Eric, was also the head of the bar. Amazing service and the drinks were extra incredible as he tested out new recipes for the menu on us! The appetizers and desserts were just as fantastic. We had a phenomenal time and would definitely be back!

42.description: I came to this restaurant expecting the mediocre food I've come to expect from Chicago hotel bars. However, I was really pleasantly surprised by this place. The service was excellent from start to finish- our waiter was very attentive, but not in an overwhelming, annoying way. Also, I mentioned at the start of the meal that I don't eat pork, and he made a point of letting me know whenever he brought something out for someone else at the table that had pork in it. Our water glasses were always full, and the food came out relatively quickly, and all at the same time.As far as food goes, this is one of the only places I've been for dinner that has a full sandwich/burger menu for dinner (other than burger places). There's a build your own burger bar, with some really interesting toppings. I got a beef burger with caramelized onions, fried cheese (parmesan and cheddar) and truffle aioli. There are a ton of sauces to pick from and the burger was really delicious. My husband got the panini, which he really liked, and our friend got a salmon burger with some toppings, and also loved it. We also shared the chipotle potatoes and new zealand mussels and appetizers, and both were really tasty.All together, 1 beer, 2 appetizers, and 3 entrees came to $60 including tax and tip- at $20 a person for a delicious friday night dinner, I'll definitely be back for burgers.

23.description: Amazing doesn't even begin to describe our experience with Viand. We traveled to Chicago for our small, destination wedding. Viand hosted our 20ish guests and was so accommodating to our needs and wants. Erica, who coordinates their larger events was just unbelievable. I've had some exceptional service in my life, but Erica took above and beyond to a whole new level! Thank you Viand for hosting us on our biggest day, we truly appreciate everything!

47.description: Another great place that my boss took me to.  She has very good taste!  Viand is a nice and quiet place to just chill and have a meal.   They have some good selections here that can appeal to any taste (salmon, burger, salad, etc.)  It's also a nice place to grab a drink or two after work.

8.description: Started out great, really went downhill. My wife and I decided after 4 days in Chicago we'd do an "appetizer meal". Started with the beet salad-Fantastic! Perfect balance and great presentation. Next was the charcuterie plate. While good, for the price it was skimpy on meat, only 2 choices? Marmalade was the bomb though. Next came the wings and the cheese fondue. The cheese fondue was thin and really flavorless. The "croutons" we're quartered sourdough bread slices. The wings, while having a good glaze, were cooked to death and dry as a desert. The side of broccoflower (the waiter said it was cauliflower, so pleasant surprise) was cooked to perfection. Waiter was like the food, overall pretty good, very pleasant but for the amount of patrons could have been better.

31.description: Had the Sirloin steak (Medium rare). Was done to perfection. And for only $19. Very cost effective. Service was great as well.

34.description: i have been coming here for like a year and a half mostly on my way back home from work like say about 6 or 7.I find the staff to be very attentive to my needs even though I am not the biggest drinker in the world but I do occasionally enjoy a glass of vino with their awesome hamburgher. Although the burgher cost $15 it is well worth it.Those of you who hang out in the mag mile area will note that it is way hard to find a glass of wine for under $12 at 5 or 5:30 pm besdies for flemings.at that hour.This place has 4-6 glases of wine for $7.50 that are of good quality.  Yes that includes a sparkling wine from France.They also make a mean mojito.Its not too croded on most weekdays after work if you are looking for a place to chill out.A good place to watch MNF-otherwise known as Monday Night football

16.description: Delicious late breakfast on vacation/ work trip. And a free glass of wine with Yelp check in (even before noon)! Eggs Benedict were amazing and perfect.

13.description: I really like Viand.  I had breakfast and dinner at the restaurant.  The scrambled eggs with the cheese was outstanding.  I can't remember the name of the cheese but it wasn't the usual cheddar or jack.  It was fabulous.  The staff was top notch.  When the waiter made a mistake with our order, he apologized, quickly resolved the matter and moved on.  That meant a lot to me.  I would definitely return.

11.description: Had a great meal after making a reservation for 7. Great staff and got seated in a private room which I highly recommend for big groups. On the brunch menu I'd recommend the sourdough sandwich

39.description: Service was attentive at first but went to sparse. The place was dead so I think there was only one server so that may be the reason.Food:Caesar side salad: fresh but the dressing was very mild.Spinach: Excellent - nice and garlicky!Mac 'n' cheese: where's the cheese? really, there was almost no cheese.Pizza: I'm pretty sure it was a frozen pizza you can get at Dominick's hot stationI will say that the menu has a good range of selection: a hot dog to a selection of steaks (hence the Viand title).We got the 15% discount through Savored.com but for a meal like this I think a 30% discount is more appropriate.

37.description: Nice place for a drink after work. Servers are really friendly and ours helped us figure out how to "checkin" for  half priced drinks.  The cucumber martini was great.

0.description: Limited menu but connected to our hotel....great staff. Friendly......Good food.  Great drinks.

38.description: Went there for late breakfast/early lunch and the place was empty, but it took us 5 minutes to get water once we were seated.  Had to chase somebody down for coffee.  When we were finally served, the server didn't know who each plate belonged to.  Not rocket science when we're the only customers in the place.

51.description: We were staying at the Marriott so after a late night of meetings we decided just to stay in and eat here. So glad we did! The food we excellent and the service attentive and helpful. My steak was done exactly as I had asked and we even scored a bonus Yelp check-in surprise!  If you are in the area and looking for a nice place to have dinner I would defintely check out Viand.

27.description: At times service can be slow, but the food is great.  The dessert alone is worth stopping by for dinner.

32.description: I work in the area and always love stopping over at Viand for a lunch meeting or a quick bite.  They have great lunch specials (fish tacos are a favorite) and a great bar, including great wine that isn't way overpriced. Also, their burger selection is so good!  I'd rather have a great burger cooked to temperature here than other nearby fast food restaurants like Epic or M Burger.   The staff is very attentive, and a manager always comes over to chat and ask how things are.  If you work in the area or are just shopping on Mag Mile, check this place out! You won't be disappointed.

54.description: Standard Hotel food - pass unless your stuck. Pricey enough for the quality too.

48.description: Just had drinks here as we were staying next door at the Courtyard.Will try a meal sometime.Selection of draft beers were minimal.............Green Line was the best available (my opinion).Staff was nice.

44.description: Good spot for a business lunch- very quiet [at least for the Michicagn Avenue scene], kind of a cool interior design. The food is somewhere between mediocre and nondescript, though it comes quickly and is at a VERY reasonable price point. Service was attentive.If you need a place that's nicer and less busy than Corner Bakery, with food at about the same level, this is a perfect spot for you.

24.description: I had the broccoli soup... Overall, it was pretty salty. The service was slow despite the fact the that restaurant was nearly empty. Our server wasn't very attentive but amiable enough. I wouldn't return while traveling in the city; there are too many other great dining options available.

7.description: GREAT brunch! I had the salmon eggs Benedict & it was SO good! Very savory hand crafted Bloody Mary! Wish I could return!

49.description: I had walked by this place approximately 574287328732 times before finally venturing in - da boyfriend and I were looking for a nice, quiet spot to have a drink on a Friday evening after dinner, which can be quite a tall order in this neighborhood. I was immediately wooed by the nice wooden decor and the sounds of torch songs on the speakers, and was then further delighted to learn that they had quite a few wine specials! I enjoyed a couple of glasses of wine, seated on a couch next to my favorite person, and listening to the music. If you're thinking I sounded blissed out, you are correct because I was. What an unexpected gem!

40.description: For the location and the price of the food, we were hugely disappointed.  My NY Strip steak was 30% fat and the waitress did not tell us that the burger was served with fries and allowed us to order another side to go with it.  Great location, great atmosphere, very overpriced food that I can get a million other places in the city.

53.description: Really good place to eat. Decent service, and spacious. I suggest going here on Tuesdays for lunch because they have half off burgers and their retro burger is really awesome. Mashed potatoes and gravy piled onto a burger. So good. I only give it 3 stars because I judge things based on what they are trying to be. If a place is trying to be a 5 star restaurant it will be judged on a different scale than McDonalds. I still recommend trying the cheap burgers though. They have a good selection

30.description: We went here because we stayed at the hotel attached to this restaurant, and did not want to venture out too far after walking around all day exploring in the cold. I had the filet  (medium-rare) with bearnaise sauce, and a side of whipped potatoes. To drink: a lemon-ginger martini. The steak was excellent, perfectly cooked with a tender (but warm) pink center, and they gave me plenty of sauce to smother it in (I'm a sauce-freak). The mashed potatoes were okay, but nothing special; they didn't have a lot of flavor, and some garlic, parsley, chives, or potato skin (if red skin potatoes) blended in with them would have gone a long way in helping jazz them up. The martini had a smooth flavor, with just the right amount of flavor: the lemon was not too sour, and the ginger was not overpowering. The prices were reasonable ($29 for an 8 oz filet + $5 for a side).   The atmosphere was warm, cozy, and relaxed. We were glad we stopped in here.

46.description: The food here is good, but there's nothing about Viand that makes it worth a visit. When my friend and I arrived we were five minutes or so ahead of our reservation. There were plenty of empty tables, but no hostess to be found. A couple came in after us and got so frustrated they started to make a stink and eventually a hostess arrived. Needless to say, Viand didn't make the best first impression.The restaurant itself is nice. It has a hotel vibe, but it's neither too fancy nor too casual. Food is on the upscale side. I had a pretty decent beet salad and the pork chop was great. Service was attentive at first, but after the first drink order was finished it took a while to get a second one in.All in all, I would say Viand is just OK. There's absolutely no reason to seek this place out. If you're in the neighborhood, you can probably throw a rock and hit a place you'll like better. That said, if you do find yourself at Viand, you'll find that nothing is terrible--just that there is plenty of room for improvement.

1.description: Bar top dinner here last Friday night while in Chicago on business. The bartender was friendly and attentive. Mixed a great vodka martini to start off my meal. I liked the bar has a center island where the bartender works the mixes. Very interesting. I had 2 burger sliders for about $6 - wanted a light meal - and washed them down with a pinot noir. The sliders were solid, juicy and the tartar sauce was excellent. Bacon strips' consistency was in between soft and crunchy, I actually liked that. The menu is limited, and I would come back for solo dinners, but not necessarily with company.Looking at the tables, ambiance is pragmatically sterile.

55.description: I don't recommend coming on a Sunday as the menu is much smaller and limited. We popped in after finding out our first choice was a 2 and a half hour wait. I had the Chinese Chicken Wrap which was decent but the dressing was very oily and overwhelmed the entire wrap. The portion was good but I couldn't finish it due to the dressing.My boyfriend ordered the taco salad which had barely any meat and iceberg lettuce. If you're going to try to get by with iceberg, at least mix a little romaine in there. Service was so-so and we sat outside and the line for Garrett's was encroaching upon our dining space, not very private.Overall it was fine, nothing to tout, so I probably won't be giving it a try unless someone I'm with another party who wishes to do so.

9.description: I hosted a company meeting for 2 days in October in the private dining room in Viand and I have to say that Erika and the entire team at Viand went completely above and beyond to accommodate us:- The valet and bell staff helped me unload my car and wheel all of my contents back into the room- Erika arrived promptly and helped me unpack and set up- I was running behind and she even helped me stuff gift bags and decorate the room- I brought my own A/V equipment and they helped accommodate my need for an additional table for my projector screenThe wait staff checked in regularly to take drink, food and starbucks orders on Day 1.  They even arranged a champaign toast promptly at 5:30 to cap off our day.  Day 2 had breakfast and lunch menu cards already printed and with my company logo.  Again the staff checked in throughout the day to take drink orders, deliver lunch, etc.  All members of management also checked in to introduce themselves and ensure all of our needs were being met.I have hosted meetings at many other locations in Chicago, many of them supposedly upscale, but none can compare to the level of service I received this week.  I will definitely be back to host my next event and recommend them for any other company!!THANK YOU!!!!

26.description: Just a basic hotel eatery. Come here if you don't have time to explore and/or need a quick place to eat. The food wasn't all too great, but it was good enough to not have any complaints.My water did not get filled up at all and the wine i received was a medley of a very old bottle and a new one (creating a strange funky taste).

25.description: I hosted a company meeting for 2 days in October in the private dining room in Viand and I have to say that Erika and the entire team at Viand went completely above and beyond to accommodate us:- The valet and bell staff helped me unload my car and wheel all of my contents back into the room- Erika arrived promptly and helped me unpack and set up- I was running behind and she even helped me stuff gift bags and decorate the room- I brought my own A/V equipment and they helped accommodate my need for an additional table for my projector screenThe wait staff checked in regularly to take drink, food and starbucks orders on Day 1.  They even arranged a champaign toast promptly at 5:30 to cap off our day.  Day 2 had breakfast and lunch menu cards already printed and with my company logo.  Again the staff checked in throughout the day to take drink orders, deliver lunch, etc.  All members of management also checked in to introduce themselves and ensure all of our needs were being met.I have hosted meetings at many other locations in Chicago, many of them supposedly upscale, but none can compare to the level of service I received this week.  I will definitely be back to host my next event and recommend them for any other company!!THANK YOU!!!!

12.description: By looking at the pictures on Yelp, my expectations were not to high for this place.  I thought I would be nice and casual dinner with my husband.  When we walked in I was very pleasantly surprised with the ambiance and attentiveness of the staff.   My husband had no clue where we were going and loved it the moment we walked in.  The hostess immediately said: "Happy Anniversary!" to us and the tone for the evening was set right away for us.  Then she gave us choices where we would prefer to sit - Thank you!  We has a super cute and small table in the corner of the booth, which made it up-close and personal intimate experience with my husband.  Our server Diamond greeted us right away and went over the featured items on the menu.  The drink list had variety and was not terribly priced - I was impressed.  I ended up ordering Moscow Mule (which I have never tried before) and my husband got his favorite: Mai Tai.  The drinks came out pretty quickly and the celebration began...  They had "Live Music" on Friday nights - Wooo Hoooo!!!Diamond gave us some time to look over the menu; it was not easy to choose - most of the items on the menu sounded wonderful!   We ordered: Guacamole and salsa for an appetizer - it was delicious.  My husband ordered sweet potato soup and I ordered Beet salad.  He loved his soup!  My salad was very delicious, the first 5 bites, but then got a little too overwhelming.  One thing I did not like was that Diamond brought out our appetizer, soup and salad all at the same time.  I asked her to take back the soup because we wanted to enjoy our appetizer first.  We told her that we weren't in a hurry...  She took the soup back and when she brought it back out, it was the same soup that has been sitting under a heat lamp and developed the film on top - that wasn't cool.  She should have had a fresh one brought out.  But it wasn't anything that would ruin our night.For dinner I ordered Halibut and my husband ordered Filet Mignon.  The food was absolutely delicious!!!!! The gentleman they had playing the guitar was absolutely INCREDIBLE.  He played all the modern songs and is VERY talented!  He made our night so much more romantic!!!  I hope he is there every Friday night!!! Very talented guy!We decided to go to a different place for desert simply for adventure, not because we didn't want to try theirs.  We loved everything about our dinner at Viand and we will definitely be back!

59.description: Eat here. Get the filet. Eat the fries that come with it, and soak up the delicious steak juices. Do it. Now.

21.description: I really like Viand.  I had breakfast and dinner at the restaurant.  The scrambled eggs with the cheese was outstanding.  I can't remember the name of the cheese but it wasn't the usual cheddar or jack.  It was fabulous.  The staff was top notch.  When the waiter made a mistake with our order, he apologized, quickly resolved the matter and moved on.  That meant a lot to me.  I would definitely return.

17.description: While the food was well made and presented, my party of 3 had to wait two hours to receive our main courses. Our waiter completely forgot about us and only apologized when we were paying the check, which was 30% discounted for our troubles. The most attentive person was the busboy who cleared our plates and refreshed our drinks. The hostess ended up taking our order and she and the host brought us our food. They cited a large party and several other tables backed up in the kitchen as the reason for our food taking so long, but the restaurant was by no means a full house and the waiter should have still been able to manage our table in addition to the large party, else they should reassign him or bring on extra staff. The food was excellent when we got it, but not worth the wait.

10.description: A friend and decided on Viand for dinner on a Friday night. It wasn't crowded so we were seated right away. We chose sidewalk dining however the restaurant is beautiful. The decor is stylish and upscale (cream, candlelight, and lots of chandeliers). They had live music that was entertaining at best. The menu is very small, not a lot to choose from. I choose the cheese flat bread with arugula and my friend had a club sandwich. I'm only giving it 3 stars because of the menu selections. The food tasted great. But if you are hungry and looking for a huge selection, Viand is not the place. But if you are mainly looking for drinks, socialization and small plates, stop in.

5.description: I was drawn in by the menu but was kind of disappointed. Not sure if I was there on a slow night but since it's attached to the Marriott I figured they would have at least a few peoe on staff. I ate dinner and then breakfast here.Dinner: went with a friend and we were seated immediately. There weren't many people there so I figured we would be in and out. Our order was taken and bread was brought to the table. About a half hour later we still had not received our appetizer. It took almost 45 minutes to get our food, which turned out to be good, but honestly was there just one person on the wait staff or in the kitchen? He didn't even check in on us until right before the appetizer came out so we didn't really have a chan e to say anything. The entree were just ok, not at all worth the wait or really the price. Breakfast: was seated immediately but at a table that had not been cleared which I thought was weird because there were plenty of other places to sit me. My food actually came out quickly this time and the quality was ok. Got decent service but it did take a while to get the bill.So I'll probably go back here if I go back to the Marriott, but I won't be thrilled about it.

3.description: Sunday nights during the Cubs and Mets game, we stumbled in looking for a quick desert and beverage.  Lucky for me, yelp offered me a free glass of their house wine for checking in.  My oh my, it went well with the vanilla gelato which the bartender recommended.  She was sweet and very catering to us.  Felt bad for taking up a spot at her bar to watch the game only to nurse my wine during the last 2 innings.  Great service and a calm atmosphere to relax.  Would stop in to try out their food if we're ever in town.

35.description: Eh, it's a hotel bar and restaurant. I didn't order food but I did see a number of the patrons tuck into things that did not look appealing to me. I was hungry and perused the menu but opted to walk down the street for something else to eat. The bartender was a pretty cool guy. I stayed in the hotel for a week so we got fairly well acquainted. He was attentive and made a good drink.

19.description: i have been coming here for like a year and a half mostly on my way back home from work like say about 6 or 7.I find the staff to be very attentive to my needs even though I am not the biggest drinker in the world but I do occasionally enjoy a glass of vino with their awesome hamburgher. Although the burgher cost $15 it is well worth it.Those of you who hang out in the mag mile area will note that it is way hard to find a glass of wine for under $12 at 5 or 5:30 pm besdies for flemings.at that hour.This place has 4-6 glases of wine for $7.50 that are of good quality.  Yes that includes a sparkling wine from France.They also make a mean mojito.Its not too croded on most weekdays after work if you are looking for a place to chill out.A good place to watch MNF-otherwise known as Monday Night football

28.description: Had an hour before my dinner reservation and wanted a drink and appetizer so I decided to stop in at Viand. Initially the service was a little slow, but after that all was fine. I had a local brewed stout, which was excellent. My colleague got the tomato soup and really enjoyed it. We also tried the hummus, which came with olives, cucumber, and warm pita. The hummus was very enjoyable. We sat outside on their small patio and delighted in the beautiful spring weather. Try Viand if you want a drink and appetizer before (or after) your meal.

45.description: I quite like this place! The ambiance is amazing (it's part of a hotel). The food is predictable (nothing like Girl and the Goat, or The Purple Pig), but still in decent quality. Very reasonable price- great restaurant for a Friday night dinner after watching a film in the near-by AMC cinema!

33.description: I was looking forward to a nice steak dinner paid for by work.  But there were just a few things that went wrong that left a really sour (and dry) taste in my mouth.  The first was the fact that I was served the most overcooked, dry steak I've had at a restaurant.  I ordered it medium-well and it was no where near well done, it was scorched.  I couldn't even finish eating it.  And the person next to me had such a raw steak that she politely cut off the really red parts and hid them under a side dish.  We couldn't send them back because it was a work dinner and we didn't want to look too picky.  The second thing was the wine.  The pours were very inconsistent and I only got at most 3/4 of a portion.  Again, I didn't bring it up because I was on a work dinner.  And I'm not saying they filled the glass up 3/4 of the way.  I used to work at a bar and I know what a full pour is and this was not a full serving.  Plus other people at the table obviously got more than me (a real glass).  Then when my wine was was empty (while eating my salad) they didn't ask if I wanted more for so long!  I would have gladly asked for a second glass if they hadn't waited to ask if I wanted it until I was halfway through my dry steak .  At that point, I just wanted water to choke it down.  Overall, I would not return here.  Too bad because the prices were decent for the area.

43.description: My hubby and I went here for a drink./bar food and also for breakfast the next morning.  We were staying at the Courtyard Marriott right next door..so super convienent of course!Bar- We went quite early (4.p.m.) because I was starving and needed some food before an evening of drinking!  Nice bar area for sure!  I ordered some delicious fries with ranch (which they gave me a HUGE bowl...love it!)...only $4! Not too shabby!  They had a Sangria drink special that looked good and a beer special for only $3 for the Goose Island IPA which was very good I must say!!!  Our bartened was great and attentive to all the patrons!Breakfast- I thought they were a bit pricey...with tip, our breakfast was $30.  I know its Chicago, but really?!?!?  I ordered ONE pancake, which they gave me two, and that was $3.75 and a cup of coffee $4.  Pancakes were delish, but really, how can you mess up pancakes!?  My hubby ordred the two eggs with potatoes, toast and bacon $8, coffee $4 and juice $3.  They do offer a buffet for $15 which included pancakes, eggs, bacon, pastries, fruit, etc.  I told my hubby he should have gotten that instead!!  With their prices, unless you are just having something small with no beverage, I say opt for the buffet!Service for the breakfast was okay....I would like to try their dinner or lunch here.  I would definately check out the bar area again if Im staying at the Courtyard again!!

2.description: Came in for a quick lunch at the bar on a Monday.  They offer complimentary house wine with a yelp check in.  Sadly I had to explain what that meant to two employees before they would honor it.  They believed me and all that they just didn't understand it.  Service took a while before I was served.  I ordered their soup of the day which was a potato and leeks soup.  The soup was excellent.  All in all the experience was kind of average at best and I didn't try enough food to really get a read on the place.  But the house cabernet was good and free so its worth checking out.

18.description: I was staying at Marriott and wanted a quick dinner. I went to Viand and got their beet salad with salmon. The meal itself was delicious. The salmon was cooked nicely. It was flakey and moist.

41.description: Made a reservation here to celebrate my parents' anniversary.  Loved the location, and after perusing the menu, it looked like a great place for Sunday brunch - both lunch and breakfast options available for our picky eaters.  Used Open Table to reserve a table for 10 about 2 weeks in advance.Fast forward to 10am the morning of our 11:30 reservation.  I received a call from the hostess "reminding" me that there is a limited menu on Sundays.  What?  That information is not published anywhere online and we had no idea that there would only be 6 items available.  I asked to speak to someone else.  When Brenda got on the phone, she said they are normally closed on Sundays, but have a limited menu during football season.  Double what?  She said the breakfast buffet would still be available.  Ok, that sounded promising...but then she said since it's not busy, she was going to take it down early.  Thanks for not luring us in for food that has been sitting around all morning!  Then she said the limited menu starts at noon, but our reservation is at 11:30 when the breakfast menu is still offered.  But, no, you can't order off both menus.  One ends at noon and the other begins at noon.  Period.  Really?!  After some coercing, she agreed to have both menus available to order from "just this once".  I thought we were getting somewhere until she mentioned that they would have to be doing some vacuuming while we were there and she hoped it wouldn't bother us too much.  WOW.  Needless to say, we did not eat here.  It was 10:30 before I got off the phone with her, but luckily another establishment was happy to accommodate us at the last minute...no vacuuming and a full menu.  Go figure.Viand needs to update their website to accurately depict their menus and hours of operation.  And, they need to have their staff trained in customer service.

52.description: I occasionally come in to Viand later in the evenings for drinks with a few girlfriends.  The bar is relaxed, dark, and quiet and the service is great.  There is usually the same bartender (Steve?) who is always friendly and conversational.  This place can get a little pricey, but on Wednesdays they have half price bottles of wine.  I have never eaten here, but it's a great place for drinks!

50.description: This is a pleasant space with above average food and great waitstaff.  Came for Thanksgiving dinner several years ago, and just recently for drinks on a Friday night, and the breakfast buffet on a Saturday morning, both of which were very pleasant experiences.  It's easy to overlook this place, but check it out.  Just off the Mag Mile and so much quieter.

4.description: This review is for the brunch. A friend and I came for brunch on a Saturday around 1pm in the afternoon. We were a little surprised to be the only people there, but eventually a couple of more tables settled in while we were there.  The ambiance of this place was very modern and classy, and I think it would be a good place to come back to experience at night for dinner. The brunch menu was pretty small, but we each found something we were comfortable with eating.  I had a breakfast burrito, which was loaded with avocado and other ingredients. Very tasty and reasonably priced brunch

6.description: I received a free coffee during the Cubs game as my girlfriend enjoyed her free glass of wine due to Yelp check in. Also, we had the Vanilla gelato - that was a good choice.

22.description: I was staying at Marriott and wanted a quick dinner. I went to Viand and got their beet salad with salmon. The meal itself was delicious. The salmon was cooked nicely. It was flakey and moist.

15.description: Their house wine is delicious! The service was incredible and the tomato bisque soup was to die for. I arrived just to get a bite and enjoyed the candle lit table and atmosphere. I would definitely come back for any occasion.

57.description: Like most of the reviewers I also work around the corner . We decided to come here for $5 salads with a group of 5 people. They were able to seat us right away and our server was very sweet and attentive. I had looked at the menu prior to lunch and decided I would get the avocado shrimp salad and with my luck that's the only salad that is not part of the $5 deal. I ended up getting the chinese chicken salad with cabbage, romaine, carrots, cucumbers, peanuts, scallions and cilantro. I'm glad I got it with the dressing on the side, because my friend's was drenched. The salad was huge and it wasn't missing any of the ingredients. I would order it again. Not for $11.50, but definitely for $5.00. It's a typical hotel restaurant - dark and a little dreary. Maybe next time we will sit outside on the patio.

20.description: Sitting in restaurant now. Horrible, slow service. Waiter inattentive and did not know the menu. Wait time too long for drink and food. Way to many great restaurants in Chicago to bother with this one. Skip Viand

36.description: I ordered a the grilled shrimp salad but asked that the shrimp be substitute for salmon. I thought the dish looked delicious but the fish was wayyyy overcooked and dry. I ate the salad (was a simple mediocre salad) and luckily my friend ate my fish so it didn't go to waste. The service was very nice and helpful but I simply didn't enjoy my meal...perhaps my fault for altering it. Whoops. Oh well. Next.

14.description: This is mostly a casual steak restaurant. I highly recommend the avocado appetizer.  For an entree, I had the skirt steak with asparagus instead of fries, and incurred a $2 surcharge as a result. The food and service were really good, but I'd have to say it was a tad overpriced given the ambiance and portion sizes. For two people, the total cost was $75 for two entrees and one appetizer. We did not order any drinks other than water. After reading a few more reviews, I realized that they have a bar menu that is more economical, but from the sounds of it, far less healthy.I would have given them four stars if the cost had been more reasonable because the food was quite tasty. :)

29.description: I'm in love with this Starbucks location and come here all the time. I usually stop in every morning before work, and it gets crowded but they do a great job of keeping the line moving quickly. All the employees are really friendly and enthusiastic, and I think it's awesome that they remember people's names. Two thumbs way up.

42.description: I typically don't review chains unless something really drastic happens.  I visit this Starbucks a few times a month, as it's close to my work.  Until today, it was pretty unremarkable.  However, when I was there last Friday, I had managed to leave my lunch bag there..  I realized it on my way home, thought about calling, decided it wasn't that big of a deal..  but then it kept gnawing at me, and so, whilst stopping for a coffee today, I asked if they'd happened to find it last week.  I described it to the guy, and he proudly ran into the back and retrieved it for me.  The 3 guys working were all far too happy to reunite a girl with her lunch bag, and frankly, I'm ashamed to admit how much getting the stupid thing back delighted me..  yet here we are.  Thanks guys, you're awesome!

23.description: This is not the Starbucks experience I have come to expect. For starters, the staff is extremely slow and appears inexperienced. As a result, it takes too long to get coffee in the morning. The seating area is dirty. On a positive note, there is significant outdoor seating, but with a new location 4 blocks away, I won't be visiting this store anymore.

47.description: I agree with Jody C. that this Sbucks is a little slow. And it's always crowded. But since it is on my way to class, this is my coffee stop.UPDATE: 9/25/2007You'd think that after 4 weeks of my daily tall-soy-green-tea-latte-no-water, they can get it right. Unfortunately, they're always effing it up: adding water (GROSS), giving me milk (HELLO, LACTOSE INTOLERANCE). Why? Just get it frickin' right and let me get to class on time.

8.description: About 15 years ago I frequented a Starbucks in the Mission District of San Francisco. It was the worst Starbucks I had ever encountered, but it was close to where I was staying. I complained (very politely) to the company about the filthy conditions of the store. Starbucks said it was because of the types of customers there, they tried to keep it clean, but my best option was to get my coffee somewhere else (at another Starbucks, of course). My reaction was to avoid Starbucks whenever possible. I have since found some great locations, a lot of OK locations, and a few mediocre ones. This one is the worst. It is a block from my home, so I go there occasionally. Until about 18 months ago, it was a great little shop, busy but comfortable and friendly. Then it changed management and it has been downhill ever since. I believe they use this one for training, because the baristas (and managers) seem to change monthly. About a year ago I complained to Starbucks that this location was usually dirty and that the staff did not seem to have any interest in keeping it clean. Starbucks Corporate's response this time was that they couldn't identify having a location at Ontario and McClurg. I guess I was dreaming.I have noticed a very clear deterioration the past few months. Today was my last visit. Apparently, there was a plumbing problem and everyone was told to leave. The guy at the table next to me was asking if he could finish his cup of coffee and the answer was "no, you will have to leave". The employee was extraordinarily rude to him. I was just amused thinking that Starbucks must have completely removed customer service training from their employee training. In any case, I left, along with the other half dozen customers who were told to leave in middle of drinking their coffees or eating the crap Starbucks calls "food"  (including people on the outside tables who were told they couldn't sit there any longer). I guess they didn't want to pay the employees to keep the place open for another 1/2 hour if they couldn't sell anything.Please, Starbucks, just shut this pathetic location down. There are now a number of options in the neighborhood and the comparison with this Starbucks should be embarrassing to the company. And get back to training your employees that companies stay in business only as long as they have satisfied customers.

31.description: The staff is friendly...almost TOO friendly.  The barista spent a little too much time talking to the customer in front of me and took longer to make my drink than it took for my sandwich to heat.  LOVE that they let their customers "borrow" the newspapers instead of buying them while in the store (apparently you can only do this if you are a regular customer as I was not allowed the same service).I actually prefer the next door coffee shop/sandwich place that serves intelligentsia, but I have gift certs that need to be used.

34.description: This is my neighborhood Sbux.  The poeple here are really friendly and make great drinks.  They have a patio which is nice too.

16.description: Above average Starbucks!The baristas are always friendly here. It's a pleasure to talk to them in the morning. It can get quite busy during morning rush hour, but the line always seems to move pretty quickly.

13.description: It's very difficult for me not to be a fan of Starbucks. This was my go-to spot at 6:30am during the days of my conference before boarding the shuttle which came at 6:45am or 7am. It was temperamental, but my service at this Starbucks was not! Great service, accurate drinks, and timely response. Happy to have found this during my short stay in Chicago.

11.description: This is unfortunately now my new starbucks being across the street. In the last month or so ive been here, at least 4 times theyve made my drink wrong as I watch others have the same issue. A lot of product being dumped down the drain. The employees are pissy and complain, ive never seen anyone smile here and thats me coming in every other day. Ive had a few times ive been waiting at the counter to order and they completely ignore me and ask the person behind me what they want, like hello im standing at the register for a reason. Ive frequented many starbucks in many cities over the years, this has to be my least favorite. In reading the reviews im not the only one with bad experiences. If I owned this starbucks I would fire everyone and start with a new fresh team

39.description: My drinks are always consistent here and the staff are so friendly and welcoming.  The barista practically remembers my usual order.  It's clean and they are pretty fast with the service.  The lines get pretty long in the mornings as with most Starbucks.

37.description: This is hands down my favorite Starbucks. It's mostly due to Jakob the best barista in the world!! He is friendly and willing to learn your name and drink. There are a few people with questionable customer service skills but Jakob definitely makes up for it. I can't forget to also mention Bill he's also very nice and friendly. I have issues when I go to other starbucks because they never seem to make my drinks the way the baristas do at this location.

0.description: Stopped in this afternoon for an iced coffee! Strong, hit the spot, just what the ole brain cells needed!Lots of seating here - with some outside on the sidewalk.

38.description: 5 mornings a week, I start my day here.  There's an early morning rush at this location and the staff does a pleasant & efficient job with it.  It's busy all day long but not crazy.  The outdoor seating is great for people watching.

27.description: I stopped in to this Starbucks to grab a cup and kick back for a while but came away disappointed.They did fine with making the coffee, but everything else about this location just does not work.  For starters the bathroom was disgusting, which is a big minus in my book.  If I am paying 4 bucks for a coffee drink, I expect them to keep the place up well.The second thing is that this place is so tiny that there was no place to sit.  Most of the people in there were camped out for the long run with laptops and papers spread all over the tables, so there was no way that any seats were going to open up any time soon.  When I walked in and saw the scene I should have turned around and gone anywhere else. Live and learn, I guess.

32.description: This is my 1 of 3 Bucks that are in my daily network. This one is at the very corner of McClurg & Ont St. They offer phone scan/pay and of course everyone knows this is fast and smooth. I usually get the Pike dark rost or Veranda blonde, they are some great regular coffees and I swear by them if I am drink from Bucks, cause I am not to much in the $6 cup of sugar and syrup; cause I can taste my coffee with a lot of sweets in my cup.I take my dark roast 4 sugar-in-the-raw and top it off with 1/2&1/2.....Montez G.

48.description: I love Starbucks and have nothing bad to say about their coffee. Sadly, i have no problem paying that much for coffee. But this is the slowest Starbucks in the world. They aren't even that busy, but it takes 3 or 4 minutes to get my Caramel Frap. I'm not asking them to be as quick as the ones in the Loop, but its like they aren't even trying. This site does have wi-fi, but there's usually a ton of Northwestern students crowding the tables so i usually dont bother. Go to the Dunkin Donuts next door

44.description: I live nearby and really like this location.  Super friendly staff that wants to please their customers!! Outdoor seating, friendly locals (like myself) and good service. Yes...it can be crowded, but I have never waited too long for drinks.  I have warm fuzzies when I think of this place and I prefer this location to any others in the area!

24.description: Slowest Starbucks EVER!  I try to go here every morning on my way to work but I'm always standing around for 10-15 mins.  They are understaffed and if you order a cold drink be prepared to wait even longer.  They are nice but they should be a little faster in the morning when many of us are running around. They had two people taking orders and one person making drinks and one person doing who knows what.... How about the majority of people making drinks???  I go back because of the location but the service there needs some help.

7.description: Today's Starbucks stinks. It's not just this store, but the complete switch to computerized machines and "calibration service contracts" that take away the human aspect... from labor right on through to taste. Go ahead, Starbucks, pinch your pennies and serve meager shots, but lose customers for good. I've been getting pretty crappy/weak coffee at Starbucks for the past year in one of their small-town shops. They always have the same excuse "it was just recallibrated" (as though that makes it okay that what used to be a good Americano at Starbucks now barely rivals the drip brew of an average diner?!).  Just had the same crappy coffee experience at a Streeterville Starbucks this morning. Seems obvious they've gone that route to up the profit by reducing the pack of the grind for shots (if we want it stronger, we have to BUY another shot. What they don't realize is that it's STILL weak/missing full flavor). The weak shots could be because the machine's grind isn't fine enough, or it's not packed tightly enough, and/or insufficient water temperature. Whatever it is, they've destroyed the product. And the fresh taste is GONE. Maybe the grind is done hours in advance.What is also obvious is a drop in patrons. The Streeterville location used to be twice as busy during the morning rush. Noticed 7-Eleven just across the street was crawling with business at the time -- now THEY serve better coffee (than Starbucks), and it's just the old BUN drip!Starbucks no longer means a great cup of coffee. They've broadened their focus to include so many menu items to attract a broad market segment/add-on purchases, there's no longer a focus on great coffee. And bring back the community newspaper rack. That was a great feature. It added to the atmosphere of the shops. Let's put it this way; we've never spent a dime on a NYT, but used to grab the crossword puzzle portion from a recycled issue to do the puzzle and buy additional cups of coffee and sometimes a couple biscotti. We spent more money for store products when there were free papers available.

40.description: Starbucks is Starbucks. In general, you know what you are going to get (a decently made latte, in a short amount of time). I want to like this place because it's convenient for me, but it's just not the best Starbucks outfit.  The bathroom is rather messy, and even when the line isn't long, getting coffee takes considerably longer than any caffeine-addicted American has come to expect. (The barista doesn't start your order before you pay for it, for example.)The coffee is what you have come to expect from Starbucks. Just don't think you can run in, grab coffee, and still make your morning meeting...

30.description: It's very difficult for me not to be a fan of Starbucks. This was my go-to spot at 6:30am during the days of my conference before boarding the shuttle which came at 6:45am or 7am. It was temperamental, but my service at this Starbucks was not! Great service, accurate drinks, and timely response. Happy to have found this during my short stay in Chicago.
