46.description: I miss you guys.I totally disagree with those reviews!

1.description: Don't like this place. Getting my drink was fairly quick, got it within 3 min after my ordering took 2 minutes because there was a trainee behind the register, but barista didn't read label properly and made my drink incorrectly but I was in a hurry so took it anyway. I have yet to find a consistent experience at a Starbucks in the area.

9.description: Unfortunately this is the Starbucks closest to my work. They are always running out of wooden sticks, splenda, half and half, bagels, cream cheese, you name it and they run out of it. Even more frustrating is the inconsistency of drinks. The number of pumps put into a pumpkin spice latte or into any coffee drink depends on the time of day and the barista. Starbucks became as big as it is today because of consistency. Really, that is why any big food chain is successful. I never know what I am going to get when I walk out of here, which is why I started to go to other coffee shops in the area, even if it's an extra 2-3 block walk. Luckily Julius Meinl and Cafe Decartes are in the area. Also, I don't appreciate cash register employees coughing all over their hands before handing back my credit card or picking up my coffee cup. It is really unsanitary and I think re-training is needed at this store. Sorry to be blunt, but this is Starbucks. If I am paying $4-5 for a cup of coffee, I expect it to be clean, sanitary and consistent.

26.description: Will not accept a note larger than $20.00!  Shit!

25.description: The time it takes them to pour plain coffee in a cup, fill it with ice, and put a lid on the cup is baffling. It's almost like they shuffle the easy drink to the side so they can get the more difficult mocha frappe lattes with soy milk and extra cinnamon out of the way before working on the drink that takes 3.7 seconds to pour. Frustrating if you've ever been to Peet's, Dollop's or Caribou (soon to be Peet's).

12.description: I'm in love with this Starbucks location and come here all the time. I usually stop in every morning before work, and it gets crowded but they do a great job of keeping the line moving quickly. All the employees are really friendly and enthusiastic, and I think it's awesome that they remember people's names. Two thumbs way up.

21.description: I'm not sure which one was this store because I visit it a lot but I remember that I tried a perfect hot chocolate in one of them ....thanks anyway

17.description: This place is TINY, with barely a good spot to study, but it holds decent hours and it's close to me...so i'll take what i can get.Because it's so tiny, it also feels louder than your average coffee shop.

10.description: Terrible. I ordered something was charged 2x what it should cost and then when I asked about it, the barista repeated back a different order. When I corrected her she denied that was my order and demanded that she had repeated back what she had charged me for and that I had agreed. First of all that's not true and second, she had quite the attitude about it. She refunded me but didn't change my drink back to what it was that I ordered in the first place. I decided to cut my losses and go with it. I can understand overworked baristas and that the customer isn't always right, but if I'm paying for a 4$ coffee drink, I'd like to get what I ordered

5.description: If you pay cash, watch your change! I have been short changed here twice by the cashier.  First time she acted like it was a mistake and asked the manager to open the register once I pointed out I gave her a $20 for a $6 order.  Second time she shorted me a $5 when she gave change back.  I know the second time was intentional (if not both) because as soon as I looked up at her she knew I was missing a $5. I can not imagine how many people don't check there change and get taken advantage of.  I called the manager to say that there a problem with the cashier and it appears there has been nothing done.  Big disappointment.

3.description: It's ok! Just an average Starbucks. There are plenty outdoor seats. The indoor space is super small though.

35.description: My local SBUX and it does the job. Most of the baristas are pretty friendly. There is a good amount of outdoor seating as well. It is a bit cramped on the inside. I wish they would take out some of their free-standing product display and move it to the walls, but oh well. I am one who hangs out, so its just annoying having to crawl over people with your hot drink in hand to get out the door.

19.description: This Starbucks is a mess.  I'm not sure why I'm writing a review for a Starbucks anyways - but it's been a disastrous experience here a few times now so I thought I'd share.  The service is slow, they mess up your drinks (wrong milk, or wrong size).  It's sort of a small dingy environment with too many people crammed into the space.  Dollop Coffee is nearby and much more spacious with better coffee.

28.description: When I'm in a rush or when I need internet or when I just am too lazy to make my own cup of tea, this is the Starbucks I rush to.The staff is pretty amazing. On weekdays nights, it's normal to see students and others gather to finish up work.

45.description: This is my neighborhood Starbucks and it gets the job done.  The difference between this Starbucks and the other billion in Chicago are the following:1.) More outdoor seating than other Starbucks'....yay!  The outdoor seating isn't always packed either, so it's a definite plus.2.) Always stocked with product.  I feel like other stores constantly are out of something...soy milk, reduced-fat chocolate chip pound cake, forks....basically whatever I need at the time.  With this Starbucks, they never run out of anything!3.) Cute doctors from Northwestern frequent this Starbucks.  Sometimes they set up their laptops and read about medical studies....not that I'm looking or anything....If you live in Streeterville this Starbucks won't disappoint.

33.description: I admit, I love Starbucks. I am addicted to their dark roast coffees, black, no room. Forget all the other drinks IMO, straight black coffee for me. Yes there are plenty of local coffee shops and I do go to those as well and even places like 7-11. But seriously, I love me some SBs. Admittedly, I drink more coffee made from my home than other places but if given a choice when I am out and about, SB venti bold no room please.

43.description: This place is a mess. Very crowded, no toilet paper in the bathroom, higher than normal amount of ice in drinks, staff who seem bothered by having to make your drink.. no thanks.  The only bonus is the outdoor seating.. With a Starbucks on just about every corner, I'll gladly walk a little farther to not end up here.

2.description: This Starbucks is close to my house but I try to avoid this one at all cost. Like many people, I have an addiction..... My addiction comes in the form of a Venti Soy, white mocha, stirred with whip. I get one everyday and I'm not afraid to admit it. I'm not a coffee snob... I don't like Pete's coffee or any of the other "real coffee" shops around Streeterville. I like Starbucks and that's it. I don't mind spending $6 a day on a drink because I used to work at Starbucks which helped pay for my college. So I truly appreciate everything the company does for its employees. Now for the review of this location. Thee employees..... Are the most unmotivated, non-customer centric, horrible coffee barista's I have ever experienced. Every time I come here it's a minimum of 10 minutes in line to order my drink then 15 minutes in line to collect my drink which is usually made wrong. No one has 25-30 minutes to wait for their coffee in the morning.Need better employees at this location.

18.description: Boy, is it ever time for an update.  This Starbucks used to be good, even very good.  But over the past several months it has deteriorated painfully.  Starbucks as a brand is still good, even better now that they're helping baristas get college degrees, but this particular Starbucks has gone way downhill.  I still go to Starbucks and I do so faithfully, but not this one.  The service is consistently poor with an offensive mix of persistent attempts at up-selling and complete disinterest in friendly service.  And the cleanliness I once found pleasing has gone by the wayside.  I'm done with this shop.

41.description: This is my Local. Not a Pub, of course. We're in America (as evidenced by the fact that I actually have a Starbucks less than a block from my front door). So it's my Local Chain Coffee Purveyor. I probably shouldn't complain... but that's never stopped me before.1) The staff is Great. Seriously great. They are friendly and fast and they get to know everyone just like good baristas should.2) Location is pretty good. Even though it's close to the Navy Pier Tourist Route it's still out of the way enough that it's not always mobbed by the Minnesota All-Star Girls Lacrosse team ordering 42 Caramel Macchiato Fraps.3) The interior sucks. Yes, considering the size of the place, they have quite a few little tables. But when the Northwestern students can't stand their roommates one more second, they go to Starbucks and camp out. It's not that I'm against camping out at Starbucks, I like to do that occasionally myself. But this Starbucks is SMALL. Really, really small. Should-be-in a-mall-somewhere small.So what happens is that people do everything they can to block out their "space", and any sort of good traffic flow becomes impossible. One is left inching around chairs, laptop bags, strollers, and students, all the while saying, "Excuse me, sorry. Oh, whoops. Sorry. Was that your foot?" Or, one goes back out the way one came in, playing elbow-hockey with the other people waiting for their coffee.So, it's always a get-in-get-out policy with me at this location. It's too bad because Streeterville is EXACTLY the sort of neighborhood where Starbucks thrives. I wish they would find a larger location! It's not like there aren't a ton of vacancies all over the area.

4.description: Very bad Starbucks, slow with no customer service. Went a week apart and they hadn't ordered something simple like a bagel. Not ever going again which is sad cause I liked Starbucks. I know think it's worth the customer service at a small coffee shop.

6.description: Worst location ever! Every time I order something they don't have all the ingredients.

22.description: This place is TINY, with barely a good spot to study, but it holds decent hours and it's close to me...so i'll take what i can get.Because it's so tiny, it also feels louder than your average coffee shop.

15.description: It's hard to fall short of expectations at Starbucks. There is a consistent quality and taste to their products. This establishment is no different. What is surprising is that the service is slow. There are often multiple people behind the counter with long lines of customers and one staff member at the register and one making drinks. Definitely skip if you're in a hurry

20.description: I usually avoid this Starbucks location unless I'm doing something directly around it.  Baristas seem very aloof and spend more time speaking/joking with each other rather than paying attention to the customers.  I always have some type of issue with my order here.

36.description: This Starbucks is tiny and has limited seating. I came to do some work on my laptop, but all the seats were taken. I finally managed to squeeze onto a bar stool right next to the door (which in Chicago, in the winter, can get unpleasant before it ever gets pleasant, haha) and thankfully there was an outlet underneath the table -- not that it's ideal for a clunky Mac charger to be plugged in upside down, but beggars can't be choosy.They had a bit of trouble with my order which is extremely basic and even tried charging me extra. Why? I have no idea, but in the end they didn't. This location is fine if you're just going in and out, but I'd say not to count on finding a seat if you're planning on it.

14.description: I'm new to the neighborhood and thought I would give this location a try to get an early start on my caffeine fix, rather than hit my usual location near work. Mostly this store looks and operates like any normal location -- same offerings, speed, etc.  However this location has missed the mark in three ways.1.  The a/c is not working properly and the store is a sweatbox, especially when busy and crowded. 2.  The staff does not have the same interest as other locations I frequent to learn your name or preferences. It's more of a get your $$$ and move you along process here. 3.  Staff has zero interest in customer satisfaction. After purchasing an iced cinnamon dolce latte, the cashier gave me a card and told me that when I completed five purchases I could redeem the card for a free drink. So, after 4 more iced cinnamon dolce lattes, I request my free drink and they tell me that it can only be redeemed for plain iced coffee or iced tea.  Even though the card was completed with iced lattes, it could only be redeemed for iced coffee. I tried again the next day with a different cashier and got the same denial. They agreed that it made no sense, but those are the rules. Rules before customer satisfaction at this location. Of course, when I turned in the card at the location at work, they told me it would be no problem. I'm very disappointed no one at this location was interested in resolving this minor issue. Obviously, I can afford my own lattes, but it would have been nice if someone would have made the minimal effort to do the right thing in this instance -- we must be talking about pennies here. Needless to say, I have been recommending Dollop or the SBUX by work to my neighbors and friends who want a/c and a more personalized experience.

0.description: I've been to many facialists over the years and Zina is great!.

1.description: I agree with Charles.  I filed case with the Better Business Bureau as well.  I brought a sterling silver set in for consignment in March 2013.  I found out that the set sold, but "M Ryan", the man who works there, said he did not know the sale amount and promised to call me the next day.  He did not.  I've called a number of times and he said that he would call and let me know the amount and would send a check.  He never did.  I went in there 2 times and he claimed that Shell had the paperwork and that she would be sending me a check.  He finally confirmed the sale amount, but at this point I don't believe him.  I have yet to receive the $480 due to me.  No one answers the phone so I will go in again.  If I don't have a check in the next day or two, my next call will be the police.  Shell Designs/Kai Koto Galleries seem to be criminals.

2.description: Do not conduct business with this person. I have a Better Business Bureau case that has remained open with her, she failed to address it. It's 3 years later, and while I'd rather drop the issue and let it be, (which I have implicitly), I think it's important that any person conducting business with her consider not having her appraise/sell your valuables. I am lucky to have gotten away with what was leftover heirlooms from family. two pieces retailing at above $2000/each were sold for $200as a set. Apparently I was never made aware of this, never again. I hope future people can see this, and also see that she operates under several other business names as well. Quite shady. She was nice and everything at first, but business is horrible. Nice store, nice jewelry, nice lady, but isn't that how a scam artists take advantage of those needing cash?  Stick to other reputable persons, there's a reason why that case with the better business bureau is still open. She also operates under Kai Koto Galleries and other aliases. at this point, I believe the business we conducted was under 'Kai Koto Galleries" which can be googled and looked up on the BBB website.

0.description: Great artwork and  custom jewelry!   I bought  some gifts and had them engraved. They did an excellent job and were  done in a timely matter. Shell is a very nice lady, I enjoyed shopping there.  I will be back!

1.description: The Cooking Club is an independent venture started by four Northwestern University employees. The venture seeks to create a "comfy work environment" (hat tip to fellow Yelper Kim L.) by uniting the passion for good food between an ardent Ohio State football fan (blech) and three very proud Michigan alums. The first pop-up was hosted by Mike Mbagwu and Eva Shiu, a fellow Yelp Elite with over 4 years of elite status under her belt. Congrats to Eva for bringing her passion for good food to IPHAM!The first day of the pop-up showcased wishing for warmer weather fizz, baked salmon with garlic, dill and onion, and roasted Brussel sprouts. There was an inherent bacon theme in the side dishes that reminded me of Zingerman's Camp Bacon, an event that I missed while at Michigan. The salmon was well-done, with dill and garlic. Still flaky after reheating. I ignored the side dishes, and only ate the salmon because it reminded me of the first dish I ever cooked with my best friend in Alaska: Orange-ginger salmon. The dish made me nostalgic of the orange-ginger salmon I had, because this dish was the result of a new partnership between Mike and Eva. Friendships and so much more can be built on the premise of cooking dishes rich in Omega-3 fatty acids. In addition to the food, the service was impeccable. Each plate was presented with a beautiful smile from the hostess, and the host made conversation. He was genuinely interested in how we thought the food was prepared and tasted. My guest and I had an excellent time and truly enjoyed the individualized attention from Mike and Eva. One could sense their pride in the food they served.We cannot wait to return for the next pop-up. Date and location to be determined.  Word has it it will be in Mid-March. Pending one of the chefs doesn't get too distracted by March Madness.

0.description: I am utterly blown away. Shout out to Chefs Jennifer and Maddie for preparing an amazing spread for the March 16th Cooking Club!The menu is summarized below, inspired by a proverb from Greece, chosen by Chef Jen from "As They Say in Zanzibar" to set the theme of our meal.     *     *     *"Let the guests at table be three or four - at the most five."BEVERAGE:"The River is Green and So Are Limes": ginger-lime waterENTREE:Imam Bayildi ("Imam Fainted"): Roasted Eggplant with red/green peppers, tomatoes and onions, served cold.SIDE #1:Coconut-Garlic Basmati RiceSIDE #2:Spinach salad with Chicken Kabob, Red & Yellow Pepper, Tomatoes, Hummus DressingDESSERT:Pistachio-Honey Red Pears and Jonagold Apples: Oven-roasted fruit from Washington State     *     *     *Since this cooking club involves a rotating partner system (we take turns to cook for our group) this one will be hard to top.  A little competition is fun (adding another course, throwing in dessert etc.) and definitely keeps us on our toes to be creative.  I haven't raised my white flag QUITE yet... but I Jen & Maddie, I shake your hands and pat my belly in acknowledgement of a job VERY well done.The portion size of the Imam Bayildi was huge, each diner getting a half slab of eggplant, the size of a big steak.  It was awesome to try a dish that I haven't had before that's equally healthy as it is tasty.  I also loved the coconut-garlic basmati rice, which was aromatic and light - a perfect combo with the roasted eggplant.The spinach salad was a nice touch even though at this point I was already getting full.  And to stick with the green theme, the chefs prepared a home-made ginger-lime syrup to mix with seltzer water.  Each glass was happily filled and decorated with a fresh wedge of lime.The dessert was very special since the fruits were specifically chosen from Chef Jen's home state of Washington.  Light, honey sweet and with mix of different textures, these roasted pears & apples were the perfect finale to our meal.  If I had to offer a quote in response to this meal, it would be this:"May our doors fling wideAnd our smiles spread wider.May we practice true hospitality."-Anna RendellOur chefs were truly hospitable and we ate like royalty.  Moreover, it was such a heart-warming experience with food and friends. They are so intertwined.  And it doesn't ever hurt to incorporate a love for literature to inspire the flavors you are about to share.

29.description: So I wouldn't normally review a place like the Gap, because, well, it's the Gap. I figure I'll only review if something incredibly great or terribly awful happens. Well I wouldn't call what just happened to me "awful" but freaking weird. I had a Groupon burning a hole in my pocket for the Gap and expiring in 2 weeks, so I have been meaning to go in. Everything's fine, stuff is fine, my personal opinion is that it's a little overpriced for what it is, but whatever, I got me a Groupon! I find my purchases and head up to the counter. Nothing strange yet. I get out my wallet and I look for my Groupon. I am searching for about 2 seconds when the woman checking me out says "What are you looking for?" What a strange question right? None of your business? I said I was looking for my Groupon and she says "Oh! I just saw it" and shoves her hands into my bag to retrieve it! She ended up NOT finding it, I did because I knew where it was, I just had to shuffle through several other Groupons first (love those things). I was mildly horrified by PAMELA. Get outta my bag! She hadn't even rung up my stuff yet, so it's not like I was holding up the line by searching, which would still not make it okay for her to stick her hands in my purse. Like often happens with me, I was so taken aback that I said nothing. I actually threw up my hands at one point in surrender, as if to say "sure, you dig through my purse, I'll step aside." I'll be back because the Gap is the Gap. But Pamela needs some lessons. Good lord.

42.description: While I use to find clothing at Gap, I seldom find anything now. The store seems to have gotten dull and little things aren't being addressed, like a greeter or tidy displays. Last time I bought something their computers screwed up and I had to wait over 15 minutes to process my credit card!Overall, it seems someones sucked the life out of this Gap. However, this store does have the largest selection of Men's clothing I've seen at any Gap, if thats a plus.

23.description: Girlfriend wanted a hoodie that had Gap on it with no zippers to bring back to Brazil for her. She even printed me up a picture from the Gap website of what she wanted. However, apparently Gap does not make hoodies without zippers now. So that was a shame. There are multiple levels in this store. 1st floor is women. Basement is for Gap Kids. 2nd floor is for Men. 3rd floor is for large people ... uh. I mean pregnant people.Well. The service on the 1st floor was atrocious. Had to literally grab a girl to help me because they were too busy trying to hide in the back and help people. I could tell that other people were starting to get little pissed off too. When I was finally able to get some service, I was told that they didn't have any hoodies and to go to the mens section on the 2nd floor even though I told them that it was for my girlfriend. They then told me to go to the bottom floor for kids because they may have something for her. So I go down there and the stuff down there is tiny. No way that is going to help me. Go up to the men's section. No hoodies either. No service either. Actually, I did not even see anyone up in that section. Went back downstairs to leave and I saw all the men who were supposed to be upstairs working sitting on the stairs chilling and telling stories. Don't plan on coming back.

47.description: FALL INTO THE GAP! You can never go wrong with shopping at the Gap...I always find something here...

8.description: Wow! A manager named Angie enthusiastically helped me pick out everything I needed for my niece and nephew's birthdays. One daunting task made easy thanks to the Michigan Ave Gap.

31.description: I normally don't review large chain stores, especially not retail stores, but my interaction with two different employees today really irritated me, so I thought I would share.I'd gotten the Groupon deal a few weeks ago ($50 gift certificate for $25). I also had gotten an email from the gap for one of those "Save 15%, 20%, 30% or 60%!" that told me to take in to the store to find out which it was. I printed it out, along with the Groupon and the $20 gift certificate I had received in my Gap Visa bill, and thought I'd get some pants with my wife.I went in, and asked if I could use the email I'd received. I was met with a sigh, rolled eyes, and a curt "no." I said okay, and we did our shopping. The gentleman who offense to my question also left my wife waiting in the dressing room when she asked if someone could get her a pair of pants in a different size. (The dressing rooms actually encourage you to ask them to get you a different size). He said he would, and then stood around for LITERALLY 10 minutes. When she asked him again if she should just go grab it, he replied "No, I already called someone." The store was NOT busy, so when another employee walked by and asked if she was waiting for assistance, my wife said she was waiting for a different pant size. The second employee kindly went and got the correct size herself. Came back and gave her the pants, and we ended up buying them.When we went to check out, a cashier (Sophia) immediately saw that I was holding the groupon printout along with another small card (which was the $20 gift card I'd gotten in my Gap Visa bill), and quickly said, before even seeing what the card was "The groupon is NOT able to be used with any other offers."Really? I can't use a gift card...with another gift card? Another disgruntled sigh."DId you even read the fine print?" I responded that I had, and handed it to her so she could read it. My wife suggested that if it was such a big deal, that we could just do two purchases (to speed things up.) She said fine, and we went on our way.Maybe it's just me, but when I was in retail customer service, I asked customers how they were doing, I didn't immediately assume that they wanted to do something that they couldn't, and even if they did want to do something that the fine print said they couldn't, I wouldn't be a jerk about it. I'd do everything I was able to make sure they had a good shopping experience.And thanks to Sophia, I will be glad to stick to other Gap locations.

34.description: My review for this shop is basically a reflection of the fact that I still do NOT know what to say to shop assistants when they come and chat to you about the clothes they are selling. Pause momentarily by a mildly interesting but overpriced black sundress: "oh we have lots of new dresses in and this is my favourite, it fits so well but it's really light and...". It's really nice that they come and chat but seriously, this is a 40 year old man so I don't want to know how he knows the dresses fit so well yet are supremely comfortable. And now I can't walk away, and instead have to make up some lie about having 50 black dresses identical to this already, to which he replies that they sell lots of cute coloured cardigans to liven them up and.... I dutifully pick up a nearby dress to keep the poor man happy, and lo and behold, it makes me look like I'm wearing a sack. I scoot into t shirt department - to find the only thing I was going to buy is out of stock (boo - by the way, if anyone sees that girl-sitting-on-a-dinosaur t-shirt ANYWHERE, I want it!) and a new assistant tells me how much she loves a nearby bag that is on sale. What are you supposed to say? I mumble incoherently. And buy the bag (it was cute. and on sale). It's Gap - the clothes fit me well (apart from sack-like dresses) and the jeans are great quality consistently, I've been buying them for years. My one complaint - their longer length really isn't that long. I can't wear heels with any of them.  And their shop staff are too chatty. Sorry, just the way I shop.

16.description: I called Gap stores around the country and was tipped off by the Gap in Lakeview that this Gap should have the much coveted item I'm looking for. I don't bother with my area Gaps because they are usually always sold out. I was quickly connected to the women's department and armed with the item number I gave them, they went to look for my item. They were nice enough to check in every few minute, albeit different people, that they were on my case. They eventually told me that they had some in the stockroom and it was marked much lower than most other stores. When it retailed for $300, every bit makes the difference! My item had debuted on their website and sold out within days at full price. Happy dance for getting it at 80% off. I know this Gap gets a great deal of foot traffic so I appreciate their awesome customer service even more. Experiences like this remind me why I love Gap (and yes, having designers who appeal to my taste helps too)!

13.description: According to all my Yelp Check-ins it looks like I'm a regular at the Gap these days.  While I"m not usually a fan of the clothes at this mega chain, I have to admit I like their maternity clothes (hence the reason I'm a regular). The maternity section is located way up on the top floor of this ginormous store, which is a bit cruel to do to us pregnos...but fortunately they've got a large and fast elevator. When my beloved Lululemon* workout clothes stopped fitting several months ago (sigh) I bought a bunch of workout pants and tanks here. Not nearly as cute as my lulus, but then again the rest of me isn't quite as cute as it used to be either.  I also bought a few tees, sweaters and other maternity clothes that I've been living in throughout my pregnancy. You'll find trendier clothes at Pea in the Pod**, Belly Dance*** and some other maternity boutiques, but the prices are much better here at the Gap.My pregnancy will be coming to an end in the near future and I'm looking forward to getting back into my Lulus and the rest of the clothes in my wardrobe, but I still may be a regular because it turns out they make some pretty cute (and affordable) baby clothes too!.  I stopped in the other day to find a tee to go with an adorable jumper my mom and bought for the baby elsewhere and found the perfect one..on sale for $5.99! Can't beat that- especially when the baby will probably grow out of it after wearing it twice!----------* Lululemon:http://www.yelp.com/biz/lululemon-athletica-chicago-8#hrid:rkcg3z-NEi5Amzqzx0FPkQ** Pea in the Pod: yelp.com/biz/a-pea-in-th…*** Belly Dance: yelp.com/biz/belly-dance…

11.description: Time and time again, I receive excellent customer service at this Gap. I'm not talking a friendly "hi" and "can I help you?" but above and far beyond standard customer service. Gap's clothing and inventory has been excellent all year and then to come to a location and have so many positive experiences, I am HAPPY to spend my money here.

39.description: I know The Gap has become kind of maligned in the last several years, but it's still one of my favorite stores. Everything is clean and simple and fits well, and they've upped the trend factor recently, especially with women's wear.This store in particular is great because not only is it huge, but it has an entire Gap Body store on its third level. Most of the mall Gaps are combined regular/Baby/Body Gap, so it's nice to find basically a full-sized Gap Body. They have wonderfully comfortable bras that aren't cheap, but are not as expensive as Victoria's Secret, and they always have cute underwear and sleepwear.As far as the women's wear goes.. it's Gap. They're not really reinventing the wheel here. I do buy a lot of basics and staples here, though, and spent a good deal on work wear a few months ago. They're women's trousers fit well and come in a variety of colors and cuts. My favorite Gap in the city, definitely.

37.description: Five stars for their jeans.  I have a booty...and thighs...and so many designers assume women with booty and things should wear...what??   Pants with an elastic waist?!   Yikes.   At any rate, the Gap understands how a Rubenesque woman is made.  You know...waistline, hips, things and booty.  Thus, they have jeans that fit the waist, have foom for the things and "hug" the booty!   Now, if they'd only create a nice line of SUITS!!?   Hmmm.

0.description: I went here today while out shopping with some girlfriends.  As I was checking out, the cashier realized that all my items hasn't rang up properly.  She fixed it herself without me saying a word.  I really appreciated the honesty, as I never would have even noticed!!  It would have been so easy to just ignore it, but she didn't.  Thank you!

38.description: It's a Gap on Michigan ave.3 floors of Gap.It's big. They have some decent sales. I was able to pick up some cheap selvage raw denim jeans for $12. Not bad.It's good for basics... then again, every Gap is.

27.description: I went in there at the beginning of January to exchange a pair of tights I purchased at the end of December for a size larger. Before I went to the register, I wanted to try on some pants that I saw online, and buy some tank tops. I looked around the store for over 20 minutes, obviously lost, trying to find the tanks. When a saleslady (the only one that was semi-helpful the whole time) pointed me upstairs, I was thankful. When I described the tank I was looking for to the lady up there, she waved her hand in a general direction and walked away. I did not find the tank.Then I went to try on the pants. The same more helpful lady gave me a couple of pairs and I headed to the fitting room. WHen I needed a different size, I asked the lady there and she made a "uhh" sound and rolled her eyes, said "fine" and went looking for the black pants. When she came back with complete different jeans (not pants) and said "this is all I could find" I said, "they are jeans, not black pants!" She just looked annoyed and I said never mind, took off the black, funny fitting pants, and left the fitting room.At this point, I was slightly annoyed, so I just wanted to exchange my tights and leave. I had bought 2 pairs of smalls by following the chart on the back. When I put on the first pair, the crotch came to about my knee. Sizes were WAY off. I wanted to exchange the pair I had not opened for a medium. I did not have my receipt, but thought since I was just exchanging for a different size it would be a problem. They did not have the exact pattern. but one that was pretty much exactly the same. They even had the same "2 for $20" sticker on them that mine had. I settled for those, but the lady at the counter wanted me to pay over $10 saying that she couldn't be sure I didn't get my pair for less. My pair were a much more intricate and nicer design, and they were both the same material, same price marked, some stickers. I told her I wasn't trying to get money, just exchange for the right size. She was rude and unhelpful. I ended up leaving with my original tights, no pants, and no tanks.I will not shop at this location ever again.SOOOOOO Rude, unhelpful, and acted too "good" to help a customer.It was not a busy night either. Get new sales people or train them on customer service. I went in looking to buy several items but bought NOTHING because of the lack of help I received.

32.description: I generally love this store, but I had the weirdest encounter with an employee the other day, that it prompted me to get on the internet and bitch about it.I am a lover of simple, solid colored items. I occasionally mix it up with some stripes, or a different colored cardigan.  All of these things can be found at the Gap, and I've been a shopper since I got that shiny card at 18.I've never had issues with employees there before- usually they are incredibly helpful and offer advice when I feel like being annoying and asking for it.But Charles, oh Charles...never have I felt so..wrong trying to buy items from a person before. Waiting in line, waiting for my turn to be acknowledged, and it never came- so I walked up. No eye contact. He rang up my one item, and I handed him my card- THE ONLY SENTENCE I HERD FROM HIM WAS: "It was declined." Seriously, the entire transaction- thats all he said. I handed him another card thinking it was strange that it came up declined- I figured that I would just call when I got home and see what was going on.So I did. There was still an available balance of $1100+! Obviously enough to pay for the single shirt I was trying to buy.Can you tell this whole exchange has annoyed me? For that kind of service I'll just shop online thanks.

48.description: HUGE Gap! This place is really big which helps with the usual limited selection. I normally am not a huge fan of Gap but this one always has a lot of cute clothing. The staff is pretty helpful as long as it isn't tooo busy!

44.description: As my nickname in high school was gappy, it will come as no surprise I love this store. This one is especially nice, its HUGE mongous. Did anyone check out the major sales last week on the 4th of July? They were amazing to say the least. GO GAP!

24.description: The Gap Give and Get Event starts on the 17th , don't forget to sign up in store or online.

7.description: This GAP was the best GAP I have ever been too.To start it was HUGE... 4 floors - a girls dream.  Secondly, I am the idiot who travels to Chicago, the windy city, without a coat.  I arrived in the city and my hotel at around 8 pm and it started to snow!  Snow in April?!  I definitely did not pack for this!  So when I checked in I asked if there was a store close by to purchase a jacket or sweatshirt.  The worker directed me to Michigan Ave but advised I hurry because everything closed at 9 pm.  So I ran to the closest store and could not find anything.  The store did not have any coats out because it was spring.  Finally I ran into GAP and had 10 minutes to spare, I explained my situation to the worker and she was BEYOND helpful to my needs.  She stopped everything what she was doing to help me find a sweatshirt and even accessories! They were amazing - great staff and superb customer service is what it is all about!

49.description: I usually do not like most Gap stores, but this HUGE one is an exception. All the stuff they carry seems a lot nicer and the store is really well kept. There's a lot of great deals to be found on each of the three floors. I can easily spend an hour here -- an enjoyable hour of shopping too!

40.description: I love Gap body.absolutely the BEST undies n comfy clothes ever.Everyone has to get their panties n their gap body t-shirts.They have awesome sales too! love gap body!

30.description: According to all my Yelp Check-ins it looks like I'm a regular at the Gap these days.  While I"m not usually a fan of the clothes at this mega chain, I have to admit I like their maternity clothes (hence the reason I'm a regular). The maternity section is located way up on the top floor of this ginormous store, which is a bit cruel to do to us pregnos...but fortunately they've got a large and fast elevator. When my beloved Lululemon* workout clothes stopped fitting several months ago (sigh) I bought a bunch of workout pants and tanks here. Not nearly as cute as my lulus, but then again the rest of me isn't quite as cute as it used to be either.  I also bought a few tees, sweaters and other maternity clothes that I've been living in throughout my pregnancy. You'll find trendier clothes at Pea in the Pod**, Belly Dance*** and some other maternity boutiques, but the prices are much better here at the Gap.My pregnancy will be coming to an end in the near future and I'm looking forward to getting back into my Lulus and the rest of the clothes in my wardrobe, but I still may be a regular because it turns out they make some pretty cute (and affordable) baby clothes too!.  I stopped in the other day to find a tee to go with an adorable jumper my mom and bought for the baby elsewhere and found the perfect one..on sale for $5.99! Can't beat that- especially when the baby will probably grow out of it after wearing it twice!----------* Lululemon:http://www.yelp.com/biz/lululemon-athletica-chicago-8#hrid:rkcg3z-NEi5Amzqzx0FPkQ** Pea in the Pod: yelp.com/biz/a-pea-in-th…*** Belly Dance: yelp.com/biz/belly-dance…

46.description: I used to love the Gap. I would buy my entire back to school waredrobe from this store, but now its getting kinda old. Now a days I get some pieces from the Gap to match with other brands.

1.description: Have to give it 1 star for the arrival experience. No one said hello no welcome to the store no one asked if I needed assistance. One guy made eye contact with me but went on with organizing a shelf. Was motivated to buy as I'm vacationing soon the lack of service was a turn off.

9.description: I expect better considering that this is a three-level flag ship store right on Michigan Avenue. I was annoyed that I saw cute outfits on the maniquins and then was told that those items were out of stock in the store. I was also annoyed that employees only spoke to me when I approached them for help. Besides those things, our return went quickly, the store was well organized and tidy, and check out was smooth.

26.description: After receiving very little customer service from the Gap on Broadway,  I had stopped at the store on Michigan Avenue just to browse.Justin, sales representative,  had greeted me and asked if I needed any assistance.    I had let him know that I was interested in purchasing a heavy cardigan.  I described the type and he knew exactly what I was looking for.  It took a bit for find the sweater, but he did.  Great job.On the way to check out, I mentioned how I can't find turtle neck this winter season.  They had them and on sale.  He assisted me to find the correct size and color.  I actually bought two of them.Either I receive no service customer or sales agents try to do the hard sell which is a turn off!!   Justin listened and got the sale.The cashier (I can't remember her name and I can't find her name on the receipt)  was also great.  She greeted me with a smile. Instead of just ringing up the items, she also was talking to me - granted small talk but it was great.  Gap should be lucky to have these two sales representatives.  In the future, I will browse at the Broadway store and purchase the item at the Michigan Avenue store.

25.description: It's a GAP, great location. What more can you say?

12.description: Girlfriend wanted a hoodie that had Gap on it with no zippers to bring back to Brazil for her. She even printed me up a picture from the Gap website of what she wanted. However, apparently Gap does not make hoodies without zippers now. So that was a shame. There are multiple levels in this store. 1st floor is women. Basement is for Gap Kids. 2nd floor is for Men. 3rd floor is for large people ... uh. I mean pregnant people.Well. The service on the 1st floor was atrocious. Had to literally grab a girl to help me because they were too busy trying to hide in the back and help people. I could tell that other people were starting to get little pissed off too. When I was finally able to get some service, I was told that they didn't have any hoodies and to go to the mens section on the 2nd floor even though I told them that it was for my girlfriend. They then told me to go to the bottom floor for kids because they may have something for her. So I go down there and the stuff down there is tiny. No way that is going to help me. Go up to the men's section. No hoodies either. No service either. Actually, I did not even see anyone up in that section. Went back downstairs to leave and I saw all the men who were supposed to be upstairs working sitting on the stairs chilling and telling stories. Don't plan on coming back.

21.description: love this store with super low price sales and flash sales! Great customer service too!

17.description: After receiving very little customer service from the Gap on Broadway,  I had stopped at the store on Michigan Avenue just to browse.Justin, sales representative,  had greeted me and asked if I needed any assistance.    I had let him know that I was interested in purchasing a heavy cardigan.  I described the type and he knew exactly what I was looking for.  It took a bit for find the sweater, but he did.  Great job.On the way to check out, I mentioned how I can't find turtle neck this winter season.  They had them and on sale.  He assisted me to find the correct size and color.  I actually bought two of them.Either I receive no service customer or sales agents try to do the hard sell which is a turn off!!   Justin listened and got the sale.The cashier (I can't remember her name and I can't find her name on the receipt)  was also great.  She greeted me with a smile. Instead of just ringing up the items, she also was talking to me - granted small talk but it was great.  Gap should be lucky to have these two sales representatives.  In the future, I will browse at the Broadway store and purchase the item at the Michigan Avenue store.

10.description: Spacious and great location. Worst Gap I've been to. Mostly because of staff with attitude, which may be attributable to a big store, which seems to be understaffed or incredibly disorganized. There were 3 sales associates on the floor. 2 in the fitting room. I had placed some items on reserve and came to this location to pick them up. There were 12 people in line and 3 cashiers working but after waiting about 10 minutes in line, and not much movement, I decided to go to the fitting room and ask the sales associate in the fitting room to grab the items so that I didn't have to stand in a long line for no reason. I say no reason b/c if I tried the items on and decided they were unsuitable, then I needn't have stood in line with all the people there to return/exchange/purchase. If I did find them suitable then I'd have to stand in line to get the items, which are hanging off to the side on a rack between the cash wrap and fitting room, stand in line again to try the items on, then stand in line a third time to purchase them. Possibly a fourth time queuing up to get another fitting room, if I had to go find a different size. Which I did. What annoys me most is that the staff in the fitting room and on the floor kept passing the buck to someone else so they wouldn't have to pull an item off the reserve rack.  They were so exasperated that I asked them to do a job that would take less than 2 seconds. Literally. And I actually mean literally b/c that's how long it took for the angry woman on the floor who sighed loudly when I sought out her help by saying excuse me. Then she pushed a cart with a few articles of clothing on it and barreled through the store knocking over an entire pile of shorts on the floor in the process. Lol and there was no one around her even. She was just in a bad mood or didn't want to be at work I guess. I first asked the girl in the fitting room if she could just grab the items for me. I could see the items on the reserve rack. Even though she was less than an arms length away from the reserved items, she told to go to the cashier. Then she walked a further distance than it would have taken her to just grab the reserved items to see that the line had wrapped around by now. She then told me to just ask anyone on the floor. Annoyed that she was so unwilling to help but understanding that she might be really busy or not allowed to do anything but "man" the fitting room, I browsed the floor for a sales associate. There were none. None! There was someone who seemed to be a manager who was running around to grab things from behind the sliding walls, but she was obviously occupied. I finally found the Queen of Attitude on the floor rolling the cart around. She wasn't folding anything or putting anything away, so I said, "Excuse me could I get some help?" She stopped pushing the cart. Without even turning around she sighed loudly and pushed forward with the cart. She didn't stop until she was in the fitting room and then she turns around and puts a hand on her hip and lifts her eyebrow. I thought this was rude even if she was having a rough day, but asked her if she could help me get the items, which were now less than a foot away from her. Then verbatim, she snapped, "Name."I told her. She yanked it off the reserve rack then said, "Here."Then stomped off. I waited in line for a fitting room to become available. While in line I saw her complain to the other fitting room attendant who first told me to go to the cash register then ask anyone else on the floor. Many of us have been in that position and had a long day or week. I still think it's poor form to complain about working or their job within earshot of customers. Complain with your coworkers or friends/fam after work. At the very least, be discrete about not wanting to be at work. When I get a fitting room,  I hear the fitting room attendant ask several people if they need other sizes. When the customers asked for a different size, she referred them to go look for it themselves. One woman had a stroller with a baby and looked frazzled but she was told that the item should be available on the floor. Why did the fitting room attendant even bother asking if she needed another size? Oh and it was laughable how messy and unclean the fitting rooms were. I'm laughing to myself even now. It looked like a hoarder had come to Gap. Clearly they were overwhelmed. They had thrown everything into a huge pile at least 3 if not 4 ft tall. In addition to the piles on the cart and clothes strewn across the rack. I wanted to take a picture of the mess but didn't think they'd allow it.Overall, I purchased some items, and despite the location, I will not return to this location. I'm certain they'll continue to get a lot of foot traffic however, and this review and my avoidance of this store will go unnoticed. Nbd though, there are other options :)

5.description: I work down the street from this Gap, so it's convenient to stroll into during lunch break or after work. But after visiting at least 6-7 times, always hopeful to find a new dress or top, I have constantly been let down. I am larger, and need a size 16 or an XL for everything, and this Gap has yet to offer either one. Just yesterday I was in there and they did not have one dress above a size 14, and most dresses the largest they had was a 10 or 12. As a larger girl, I have stopped getting discouraged by this from stores. It happens and I usually understand, but c'mon this is the GAP.

3.description: This Gap location has become one of my two go to shopping spots downtown because of it's proximity to my home.This location is large and in charge, with my main spot (mens) being on the second floor if you take the steps.While the Gap has ALWAYS been overpriced on 90% of their clothing, I have always managed to find the perfect shirt, shorts, jeans or pants at a reasonable price.The sales associates I've encountered have always been pleasant and ready to hunt down that Medium or Large shirt I need. They even stripped a mannequin once of a shirt and shoes for me.I'd recommend coming here if you are in need of a last minute clothing item because you are bound to find something.

35.description: I'm always gonna love the GAP, Tween, teen, college, etc. You just can't help but love their denim, accessories and tops. Not a place to go for my whole wardrobe but love the super casual basics. Lov their sales!

19.description: Best gap in all the land. I like my gap stores big and this one has a ton of stuff. Comparable to the size of the gap forum shops in Vegas.. That's about the only other ENORMOUS Gap that actually had tons of good stuff. Not like these little gaps you find in malls some of these days.. It gets busy but it's on MICHIGAN AVENUE... Don't complain about waiting in any line if you're shopping on MICHIGAN AVENUE... What do you expect???

28.description: I called Gap stores around the country and was tipped off by the Gap in Lakeview that this Gap should have the much coveted item I'm looking for. I don't bother with my area Gaps because they are usually always sold out. I was quickly connected to the women's department and armed with the item number I gave them, they went to look for my item. They were nice enough to check in every few minute, albeit different people, that they were on my case. They eventually told me that they had some in the stockroom and it was marked much lower than most other stores. When it retailed for $300, every bit makes the difference! My item had debuted on their website and sold out within days at full price. Happy dance for getting it at 80% off. I know this Gap gets a great deal of foot traffic so I appreciate their awesome customer service even more. Experiences like this remind me why I love Gap (and yes, having designers who appeal to my taste helps too)!

45.description: The Gap is great.  They've got all the classic looks.  Also, this location sells maternity clothes, which most of them don't.

33.description: I did some serious damage here. The sales people are really helpful and treated me better than in regular shopping experiences. The best thing about this location is there is SO MUCH to browse through, on three levels, blowing my usual Gap at a low end mall outta the water. I found at least one thing on sale, and the cashier gave me some helpful hints on other ways to save, like their jeans recycling program. I walked out with an armful of clothes I'll wear everyday, and that's worth it in itself.EDIT: FYI-- if you buy one of their brightly colored tshirts, your skin may get dyed the color of that tshirt. It's been two showers AND MY SKIN IS BLUE.

43.description: I do not own a credit card.I do, however, own a Gap Card.So ... when I find myself low on cash but needed, say, for example, socks.  Or relatively cheap shorts to wear on a float trip this weekend.  Or socks.  Or plain ole t-shirts.  Or socks.  I can come here at lunch, grab a handful of size Mediums, pop to the register, & off I go.& for that, I gotta give in to the Gap.

2.description: I was racially profiled at GAP by their cashier. When I walked up to the register, I was asked if I was "a U.S. citizen". I asked why did that matter? The cashier's response was that "U.S. citizens have social security numbers". I asked why do you need to know that? When did GAP start need to know my citizenship before I can pay for items? I asked did they ask everyone, like the guy over there? He said no because he's white. I told him that his question was both offensive and racist and he was racially profiling me. I'm Asian American. GAP needs to address this ASAP.

18.description: What a personable staff! They seem to work together quite well. I was searching for some pants that were in sale and was sent to the second floor for them. When I got up there, an employee had them waiting for me in my size! You'd think they work for commission here, but I guess these people just genuinely love what they do!

41.description: Very cool Gap, both in temperature (whoo, this summer is HOT!) and in design. They seem to be really pushing a lot of black outfits this season--looks more like Banana Republic than the Gap.Here's what you need to know:3th Floor--Body Gap2rd Floor--MenGround Floor--WomenBasement--Maternity and Baby GapInterestingly, the men's bathrooms are on the first floor with the women's clothes, and the women's bathrooms are on the second floor with the men's clothes. According to an employee, when the store was first opened, the clothing was on opposite floors.There were plenty of staff members cashiering and helping customers in the middle of a weekday afternoon, which was also a plus.

4.description: Went go The Gap on michigan ave while they were having a 40% off sale. The place was packed, which did not surprise me, it was a great sale. this is also a very large Gap. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The quality of their clothes are great. I bought some sweaters to get ready for the winter.

6.description: Shop updateAdditional 40% off sale going on right now even on sale items already. Clearance sections are limited, but sometimes you can get a good deal on already discounted items. I can't say I come here often, but the kids section has great clothes for low prices when it comes to these additional sales.

22.description: I'm not sure what the right forum for this is, but the athletic clothes at the Gap (Gap Body Fit) smell like pot roast.I have recently purchased some new clothing (two tops and three pairs of a pants) from two different locations, at a reasonable price. They fit well, and are so high quality--the same fabric as lululemon, but half the cost.However.The first time I wore one of my new items, i noticed an interesting smell, and wondered if someone just had some interesting BO. I identified the smell, which, clearly, was pot roast. Then identified the source, which, clearly, was me. Not knowing why exactly I smelled like a home-cooked meal, i migrated slowly to the back of my kickboxing class (as sweating tends to intensify smell) in shame.Then. Two weeks later.Having forgotten all about the pot roast incident, and dressed in a different Gap outfit (from a different store), I arrived at my Zumba class. I started to warm up, and I realized that I smelled, once again, like Sunday dinner.The following day, I had a friend/coworker/gym-mate smell an (unworn) article of Gap fitness clothing. She confirmed: chuck roast, carrots, Lipton Onion Soup mix.So, take it for what you will. High-quality fibers, flattering fits, perhaps not vegetarian-friendly.

15.description: Just got off the phone with Gabe! He was absolutely amazing! I work at Gap in Austin TX and from a customer perspective he was above and beyond! Thanks for finding that stupid hoodie I searched high and low across the states! You're awesome Chigaco keep warm! I don't miss that weather at all! :D

20.description: I work on Michigan Ave. and tried to go here recently during my lunch hour and there was a huge line to purchase my items :( I had to leave, I came back the next day only to find the same line and only two people working the register and they could not have been slower. I will continue to use the GAP on broadway - they are amazing there!

36.description: Just stopped by here on lunch. I had a 25% off all jeans coupon. Got a couple of new pairs for fall and it didn't break the bank. I finally got my hands on some trouser jeans and they are super cute! I love the size and clothing selection of this store. It gets super packed and there is a long ass line for the fitting rooms. There was a line for the registers too, I just wish the cashiers would step it up a notch. I used to work for Gap back in the day, I sure do miss the discount :(

14.description: A nice, big, spacious Gap store with some real bargains--I found lots of very nice kids' tops (in the basement children's section) on sale for a fraction of the original price. Staff were helpful, so a good place to go for basics and occasional bargains.

58.description: I walked in with a friend and requested a table outside around 8:30 at night. I saw several vacant tables and so I was a bit surprised when the hostess mentioned it would be a 15-20 minute wait. I mentioned the vacant tables and she said there were others waiting at the bar to be seated. Ok fine, gave our name and number and went to wait at the bar. No big deal. Not even 3 seconds after I walked away, I overheard her complaining about me to the other staff standing around the host desk. Seriously lady. Give me a minute to walk away (where I'm about to start spending money at your bar) before you start complaining about me to your coworkers. Not impressive.

56.description: Great options.... Sit down classy and cafe style. Staff is friendly. Patio seating is always good. Would recommend if you like Italian.

29.description: Nice little non-chain place to drop in for a quick lunch. You place your order at the counter before sitting and they bring it out to you, so it's pretty efficient. I've had a few different sandwiches and they've all been very good. The fresh chips they serve are outstanding as well. I've tried the 1/2 sandwich and soup combo a couple times and I'm not that crazy about their soup.  I ordered a creamy potato with bacon soup the other day which sounded perfect for a cold damp afternoon and it was the consistency of milk with no potato chunks to speak of and a few crumbles of bacon. Also had a layer of oil pooled at the surface. Sad to say but Potbelly's potato soup is way better. All in all though, I do recommend this place for its sandwiches and its quick service and relaxing atmosphere.

42.description: Stumbled upon this place on a walk. It's somewhat hidden: on the upper walkway above Grand just off Michigan.  It's worth seeking out. It has two sides, a casual cafe (where we ate) and a more formal dining side (which we haven't tried yet). We got the filet sliders which are excellent. We also got dessert: a piece of risotto cake and a turtle cheesecake. Both were excellent. Highly recommend the cafe side for a quick bite.

23.description: Labriola disappointed. Service was sub-par. One friend was served a spoiled glass of wine and when she sent it back, she received a bit of attitude from the server. My wine, though I didn't send it back, wasn't that great. We were given a free pasta sample, which was good, and we ordered the burrata, which was just okay. I doubt I'll come back here. There are many better options along Michigan Ave.

47.description: Recently walked by Labriola's while checking out the Miracle Mile in Chicago and decided to give it a try for dinner. Found the menu to be very good for what you would expect from an Italian restaurant. This restaurant doesn't try to be trendy or cutting edge, and I think that serves them well. The fiancé went with a chicken Caesar salad and was quite impressed. She said that the chicken was great, it was soft and almost melted in your mouth. I went with the chicken parm and thought it was very good. The portion sizes of the chicken parm itself were enormous. Definitely could have fed 2 with that. I was very impressed with the side of spaghetti that came with the chicken parm. You could tell that it was homemade pasta and it was very good. Our waiter was very attentive and thorough. Overall this was a good experience and I am glad we gave it a try. I would definitely give this a try again and recommend it to anyone who wants traditional American style Italian food.

8.description: This is one of the best places for outside dining in the Magnificent Mile area, because the sidewalk cafe is actually a balcony far above Grand Street, so there's no automobile traffic.The usual pasta dishes are on offer, but we concentrated on appetizers, and loved everything we tried, particularly the zucchini blossoms, which were very lightly fried and stuffed with a creamy smoked mozzarella that was delicious.The ricotta appetizer was also excellent, with fresh honey and crusty toasted bread.Clams and mussels are served in a garlic laced broth that's not too rich.We also shared a pizza. The offering changes weekly, so your mileage may vary. We loved the authentic Naples-style crust, but didn't care for the raspberry and onion based sauce on our particular offering.There are some nice selections on the wine list, and the service was friendly yet professional.

31.description: Wonderful staff, great atmosphere, perfect classic italian music, and amazing house - made pasta!

34.description: Went here for lunch.  Ok service Ok food.  Its a casual place that serve ok italian food.  I had the campanelle and my friend had the burger.  There's really nothing to rave about this place.  if like me, you have been to the different regions of Italy and really appreciate Italian food then this might not be the best place for you.   If all you have been exposed to is Italian american food then you'll probably like it.

16.description: Wonderfully location, with great outdoor seating! We had white wine (moscato), and pasta. Portions are kind of small, but the food is very good. Would definitely go back! Staff is friendly and attentive. I was here during the summer, and the flowers on the patio were absolutely beautiful!

13.description: Over, underLove the bread, of course, and the thought of warm bread, a glass of wine and pasta is what brought me in as I was walking along Michigan Ave. on a chilly evening. I was greeted by three people all standing at/near the hostess stand. Sure, this happens from time to time but it was awkward here as if I were interrupting a discussion. Service continued to be awkward, so much so that I thought they couldn't have been open more than a few days but I was incorrect on that assumption. Though I was seated in a booth, (on the bar side but a ways from the bar) the bartender was my server. She brought my wine and I didn't think to request bread, I waited on it, but it never arrived. it was only after my lukewarmish pasta dish was brought from the kitchen after some time by a line person did I realize that I should request the bread. And the fresh grated parm. And maybe go behind the bar and pour myself another glass of Chardonnay. I had to summon the only person passing by - a different host than the three by whom I'd already been greeted - and he brought out the fresh-grated parm. The bread arrived shortly after by the busboy. Although I was several tables back and there was a Bulls game on, I unfortunately was still privy to hearing one suited gentleman scold a hostess about having left the podium. Maybe she off was filling someone's water! Obviously, service issues prevailed. My calamari pasta dish was OK but not "rave-able."  I wouldn't order it again - there was an odd combination of textures between the dense noodle, firm calamari, limp arugula, and wrinkled roasted tomato. Also, overly-garlicky. I could see how one could have an enjoyable experience here however I really couldn't recommend it. I have no problem penning a review on a single visit. Why would I go back? Overstaffed, undertrained?

11.description: I love eating at Labriola on a warm/hot day! They have two separate seating sections - one for the cafe, and one for the restaurant. The restaurant side is "fancier" in that you get a menu when you are seated. On the cafe side, you can order at the counter and your food is brought to you. Note that the menus are not the same on the restaurant vs. cafe side so I would make sure to check out the menus first before deciding which side you want to go to. We decided on the cafe side due to its more relaxing vibe.  I loved the mushroom, arugula, and spinach pizza. Though I rarely order pizza when I eat out, this one was pretty delicious, healthy, and super refreshing. We also tried the Berkshire Porchetta sandwich which was enjoyable too. Two things I didn't like as much: the tough bread and the excessively fatty porchetta. I get that porchetta is supposed to be fatty, but I would've liked more of the lean parts.  Finish off your meal with a delicious Stan's donut. All in all, Labriola is a great place to come and enjoy the nice weather. The cafe food is very decently priced especially considering its close proximity to Michigan Ave. so that's always a plus. The outside seating is really gorgeous too. Don't miss out!

39.description: I was walking with my girlfriend around the mag mile on a Sunday night and the weather was gorgeous. "Let's get a drink on a patio" we said to each other. We knew Labriola had outdoor seating so we went up to the hostess and asked to sit outside. She was leading us to an open table and placing the food menus down when I said "thanks, we're just doing drinks." The hostess then says "oo I don't know if I can do that...yeah I'm not supposed to do that" and tells us we cannot sit down!I could have argued that we might change our minds and get food later, or the fact that drinks are actually the same price as some entrees and even more than most appetizers, never mind that we probably would have gotten two each for a bill of over $50. Aren't drinks higher margin sales for restaurants compared to food as well?We did not argue these points though and simply said "we will take our business elsewhere." There are too many places in the city to eat and drink to put up with rude service or to argue for a business to take your money. I was planning to come back another time to try the food as well, but now I have such I sour taste in my mouth that I think I will go to one of the other hundred Italian places in the city instead!

37.description: Stopped in for an early breakfast before a conference.  I loved the restaurant decor and general feel of the place.  I had an Italian breakfast sandwich which was fantastic.  All of the food on the menu looked good, and they had a fresh bakery + gelato bar.  Solid choice for visiting the area.

0.description: We were in Chicago for a quick getaway weekend and found this place while shopping on the mile. Tucked away on a side street and very unassuming, this gem is totally worth the stop.The cafe is warm and welcoming and the staff is very friendly. We ordered a deep dish pizza and grabbed a couple Peroni from the bar.The pizza itself is robust without being heavy. The dough is velvety and crisp and the tomatoes were vibrant and fresh.I highly recommend coming in and relaxing. Finish with a homemade desert if you are feeling decadent!!

38.description: I wish I could give this place a zero.  What a horrendous experience. We had a reservation for 8pm but arrived about 15min earlier and sat right away. The place was busy at first but it was not packed by any means (note it was a Saturday night). We ordered by 8pm and our server mentioned to us that it might be a while for our food because it was quite busy. We did not realize that this would mean over an hour before receiving our entrees.  We ordered three pasta dishes- no appetizers. The wait for our food was absolutely ridiculous and the best part- 2 of the 3 dishes were cold. When we spoke to the manager he was not apologetic at all- continued to say how busy it was and offered to get us fresh meals- no thanks. Did not want to wait another hour for a new pasta dish! Our server was doing the best he could as it wasn't his fault so thank you for that! Will definitely not be returning to this restaurant.

51.description: Really a 3.5...Labriola is a strong addition to list of Mag Mile dining options.  We've been here about 5-6 times, with different sized groups and sitting in different locations (outside, back dining room, high tops in the bar).   Here is my take...  Outside seating is nice for a weekday lunch.  There isn't much noise from street traffic as you're on a balcony and the seating/flowers are nice.  At night, though, the nearby streetlights cast a very harsh white glow that (for me) kills the ambience.  The seating out there is very tight as well, so if the restaurant is busy be prepared for a tight squeeze.Back dining room is elegant and relaxed, but doesn't get filled up that often (at least from what I've seen), so can seem a little lonely if you're one of only a few parties back there.  High tops at the bar is my go-to.  Lively, good and quick service, great atmosphere.  Perfect spot for a post-shopping casual dinner.  Unlike the back room or outside tables, the service is less formal, so you can pace out your own meal and just hang out if you want.And here is my experience on some of the menu itemsproscuitto and melon - great preparationcaprese salad - standard presentation, good but not specialfried calamari - crispy and crunchy - yumfig salad - outstanding, really uniquebaby kale caesar - good, solid saladpizza of the day - great option to split as a starterpasta vesuvius - delicious and uniquechicken dominic - my favorite, very very goodhalibut - just had this one time, but was dry...  pretty disappointing for the price point.Finally, beer/wine list is good, but too pricy IMO.

27.description: Wonderfully location, with great outdoor seating! We had white wine (moscato), and pasta. Portions are kind of small, but the food is very good. Would definitely go back! Staff is friendly and attentive. I was here during the summer, and the flowers on the patio were absolutely beautiful!

32.description: Love coming here! Great and cozy! Every staff member is warm and attentive. They really care about their customers. Pizza is amazing, spaghetti and meatballs, any salad, as well as the cafe sandwiches. Very fresh and I highly recommend coming here for casual dining, a little tv&drinks at the bar,  or even a little romantic date action. Love it! Cute little outdoor porch too. Love.

54.description: This is one of the best places for outside dining in the Magnificent Mile area, because the sidewalk cafe is actually a balcony far above Grand Street, so there's no automobile traffic.The usual pasta dishes are on offer, but we concentrated on appetizers, and loved everything we tried, particularly the zucchini blossoms, which were very lightly fried and stuffed with a creamy smoked mozzarella that was delicious.The ricotta appetizer was also excellent, with fresh honey and crusty toasted bread.Clams and mussels are served in a garlic laced broth that's not too rich.We also shared a pizza. The offering changes weekly, so your mileage may vary. We loved the authentic Naples-style crust, but didn't care for the raspberry and onion based sauce on our particular offering.There are some nice selections on the wine list, and the service was friendly yet professional.

48.description: 4 stars for the food itself. Service mediocre. My biggest disappointment with this place is no salad and bread with my meal. Plenty of other great Italian places in the city who offer that.

44.description: I really wish I could review one of the home made pasta dishes offered on their menu after stopping in earlier this evening, but unfortunately I am not able to do so due to the lack of customer service.  After waiting approximately 10 minutes to be seated (the hostess left the seating area multiple times; pretty much after every customer was seated she ran to the back of the restaurant and returned a few minutes later), my friend and I were finally seated in a booth near the bar area.  We waited 20 minutes for a waiter to acknowledge us before we decided to take our appetite and money elsewhere.

24.description: Loved. This. Place. We rolled in hard on a Friday after determining Bandera and Purple Pig were too crowded. Sat at the bar, as is our custom. Ordered up a martini from the vaguely Ryan Gosling lookin' bartender - seriously! He KNOWS how to make a martini, as the Gin was stirred, not shaken. My Vodka martini was shaken, that's okay. Bartender was chatty and friendly. Martinis ON POINT.So, food. Good idea at this point. We got the Seafood salad, and this, my friends, is the Easter Egg of this place. It's called a salad, but there are no greens. That's okay! A large place of juicy chunks of seafood - Calamari, shrimp, scallops, GIANT CHUNKS OF LOBSTER in a delightful vinegarette. I LOVED this, and it was a good size for two to share - so, we did!The other thing we got was a Caprese salad, and that was good as well. Tender, sliced  steak tartare with greens. Very good. But the Seafood salad was the stand out of this visit.Another couple popped in and sat at the bar. By this time we were working on glasses of Malbec, which were very good. The other couple ordered cocktails . . . MAPLE SOURS?!What are these heavenly concoctions? They were INVENTED HERE? Never mind that we've had a martini and a glass of wine each, WE NEED ONE OF THESE TOO! A maple flavored whisky drink, shaken to frothiness. Just great.This place is just around the corner from Bandera, to the south. It seems like it's just hidden enough that it doesn't get filled up with tourists, well, it was not on that night. The outdoor area looks nice as well. Motivated to come back for some food. The prices were typical Michigan Avenue, but not super-super outrageous.And that Seafood salad. YEAH. That.

7.description: I highly recommend this restaurant if you want to meet a group and get the touristy Italian Chicago experience off of Michigan avenue. I was impressed by how beautifully the restaurant was decorated and the live music that made the experience much more enjoyable as well. It's brightly lit so a perfect group setting, and the outdoor seating is also nicely decorated. Food tastes great, and the complimentary bread was tasty as well. I ordered the seafood salad;  I was slightly disappointed that there wasn't any vegetables in this "salad", but it tasted fine nonetheless. I also loved the wine selections- the Pinot noir was great. Service was friendly, but I wish it wasn't so slow. Other than that I really enjoyed this restaurant!

49.description: casual, non-chain dining in a chainy area that is mag mile...love this place for lunch when you want to meet up with a friend but can't spare too much of your lunch hour. it's not fast food and not table service so you can better manage your time. the kale burger was good...the bun for it was better, haha. it lacked something and i can't quite put my finger on it. perhaps it was a bit on the dry side and needed some accompaniments like avocado or extra tomato? no sides come with the sandwiches but they are filling on their own. pass on the iced tea - pretty watery. disappointed too that the outdoor seating is only for table service dining. still come early to snag al fresco window seat instead.

40.description: We went there looking for carbs before the Chicago marathon. The pasta plates were just plain and flavorless. Good service though even when then brought the wrong pasta and had to re do it so I got my plate when the others where already eating. Not going back.

53.description: My sister and I decided to try something new for lunch and Labriola's caught our eyes. We were greeted by very friendly staff who explained the menu with great detail. The staff made it feel very welcoming. We were first given some bread with butter imported from France. The butter itself had set our high expectations. We were both given a house salad that had a citrusy-like kick to it. Their house-made pasta was one of the best pastas both my sister and I had tasted. I highly recommend the Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo! It boasted a wide array of flavors! The French/Italian music in the background gave the essence of having lunch in an Italian Cafe. My sister and I have plans to return soon!

30.description: The meal was a 4.  The ambiance a 5. The service was rather inattentive and slow, bordering on rude. The busboy many times alerted my waiter that I was ready for whatever was next -- dessert order, water in my glass, the check, the check, the check. How do you serve someone dessert and not anticipate you need to have the check ready to go? Not busy at the time, so I think the waiter just didn't like me?? But I was friendly and didn't complain. So, if prompt service is more important to you than the meal itself, prob need to go somewhere else.  The meal was so good. I said "mmm" after many bites. (I don't usually feel inspired to do that.)  had eggplant parm with handmade spaghetti.  Happy I ate there, but wish I would have had a different waiter.
