I would eat there again because the food and ambiance trumps the one sleepy waiter.

46.description: I work down the street and have been coming here for months now. Today was the worst experience I've had here and I'm very disappointed. I ordered the meatball sub, something of a regular purchase for me, and Briam at the counter asked if I wanted chips or a side salad. It's listed as coming with fries, which is what I wanted and what I answered with as I pointed to the giant menu behind his head. I work in retail and I know that if there's something listed, you honor it. He rolled his eyes and asked again if I wanted chips or a side salad. Rude. At the very least he could have given some reason as to why he wouldn't honor the menu. I've seen the general manager go out of his way to give everyone a great experience, which made Briam's attitude both disappointing and surprising. I got stuck with a side I didn't want, and for the amount I'm paying, ($10.95 for a meatball sub, soggy bottom bread and chips), I should be able to have the side I want within reason. Our busboy Cesar was very nice and helpful, but I don't think anything could rectify the terrible service first thing. Labriola is no longer my go to, good job Briam.

1.description: First time and I am glad I entered into Labriola! My mom and I were running errands all over downtown today and we decided on some Italian fare, since she wanted seafood and I wanted pasta. Our wish granted once we decided to pop into this place. Warmly greeted by the hostess, a plus! And our server Ryan made our first time a breeze and treated us like queens. Staff here are great!Food was wonderful and my mom licked off her plate, this was a plus in my book, when it's finger licking good. I got the bucatini My mom got the shrimp and scallop scampi. Divine! Will return soon!

55.description: This review is only for one thing I ordered, I will come back again to give it a second chance-I ordered the fettuccine, and I guess in my mind it would taste different-To me it was egg noodles in a bland beef broth with roasted garlic-Not an al dente pasta with a unique flavor just so bland tasting-At first I was starving, so I ate a couple bites thinking it would get better, then I was thinking to ask for some pepper but I don't think that would have helped-It just was lacking something...I made myself eat a couple more bites but then I had to stop-I started thinking how I walked by my beloved Shake Shack, how that would have tasted so much better than what I was eating-I paid and when I did I realized I had been charged for the dinner portion, not lunch-The waiter was nice and corrected it-

9.description: Loved. This. Place. We rolled in hard on a Friday after determining Bandera and Purple Pig were too crowded. Sat at the bar, as is our custom. Ordered up a martini from the vaguely Ryan Gosling lookin' bartender - seriously! He KNOWS how to make a martini, as the Gin was stirred, not shaken. My Vodka martini was shaken, that's okay. Bartender was chatty and friendly. Martinis ON POINT.So, food. Good idea at this point. We got the Seafood salad, and this, my friends, is the Easter Egg of this place. It's called a salad, but there are no greens. That's okay! A large place of juicy chunks of seafood - Calamari, shrimp, scallops, GIANT CHUNKS OF LOBSTER in a delightful vinegarette. I LOVED this, and it was a good size for two to share - so, we did!The other thing we got was a Caprese salad, and that was good as well. Tender, sliced  steak tartare with greens. Very good. But the Seafood salad was the stand out of this visit.Another couple popped in and sat at the bar. By this time we were working on glasses of Malbec, which were very good. The other couple ordered cocktails . . . MAPLE SOURS?!What are these heavenly concoctions? They were INVENTED HERE? Never mind that we've had a martini and a glass of wine each, WE NEED ONE OF THESE TOO! A maple flavored whisky drink, shaken to frothiness. Just great.This place is just around the corner from Bandera, to the south. It seems like it's just hidden enough that it doesn't get filled up with tourists, well, it was not on that night. The outdoor area looks nice as well. Motivated to come back for some food. The prices were typical Michigan Avenue, but not super-super outrageous.And that Seafood salad. YEAH. That.

26.description: My boyfriend and I always have a late dinner here after watching a movie at AMC river east which is like not even a couple blocks away. From their cafe section we have tried three of their pizzas, the pepperoni, veggie one, and the BBQ mozzarella one. Also, we've had one of their burgers, an Italian beef sandwich and one of their salads, it's been a while and unfortunately I can't remember the names. We have found that the food is kind of hit or miss. My boyfriend really likes the pizza, I personally think it's too charred and way too light/thin. However the pepperoni one was quite good, but this last one he had the BBQ mozzarella was really thin, soggy he had to fold the pieces backwards for everything to not fall off and we didn't taste any bbq. The veggie one had this kind of strange overbearing vegetable-y taste lol I know it's a veggie pizza but still unexpected flavor. When we got the BBQ mozzarella I also ordered their Italian beef sandwich which was unfortunately underwhelming and full of issues. The beef was just lukewarm and in this wierd compressed shape, I thought they had given me a sausage at first but it was just all stuck together which made me think it was frozen and just heated up. Secondly, it was on a type of overly stiff, crusty fancy rustic looking sandwich roll which I felt was totally inappropriate for Italian beef, anywhere else gives it to you on a plain white French bread type sandwich roll which feels and tastes better with beef. I remember the burger and salad being good. We have found that the later it is the lower our food quality for some reason. To be honest this place is a little expensive for the food you're getting but what keeps us coming back is the great service and we also really just love the atmosphere, there's this real romantic black white and red theme going on with dark woods, the whole place is really low lit with fake candles at each booth it's all really romantic so we feel like we are at some fancy schmancy restaurant without paying the price Go with your significant other

25.description: Eh. I went for lunch and sat on the restaurant side not realizing that there was a cafe side (which is the menu I had looked at online) so it was a little more money than I usually spend for lunch time.First, our waiter was a bit...off. He tried a lot of upselling, which I get he probably has to do, but I just wanted a casual experience with a business colleague without having to say "no thank you" every few minutes. He also offered us a bellini and when we refused as it was a business lunch, he made a weird comment about how he thought it was Saturday. Off. Now about the food: the calamari to start was amazing - lightly breaded, little slices of hot peppers, and overall yummy. I really appreciated the two ramekins of sauce so I had my own for dipping. I asked for the eggplant parm as a sandwich instead of pasta and after checking, he gladly accommodated. I was excited for the parm after great calamari, but was sadly disappointed. The bread was good, but the overall sandwich was so salty and totally fell apart in my hands making a business lunch a little embarrassing to eat and eventually I resorted to my fork and knife. It was sad not to enjoy my eggplant parm, usually my favorite dish to order. The salt was that overwhelming. And to compound the issue, my water glass was frequently needing a refill to counteract all the salt. I finished half my sandwich with no water in my glass before a busboy finally came by to fill it up again.Now about the coffee on the cafe side - it didn't seem like they were set up and it took over 10 minutes to get a simple americano as the guy who I asked what line to get in said I could use the coffee stand (vs. longer cafe line) and then disappeared coming back a few minutes later. No one else came by to help until he returned and when I paid in cash, he disappeared again, another worker showed up with a $10 for change in the machine all while the guy was off somewhere getting my change. It was very confusing and a bad customer service experience after salty food. The calamari started with such promise! Not sure I'll return. If I do, I will try the cafe side and see if it's any better with lower prices and less expectations.

12.description: Located inches away from the Intercontinental hotel is this italian gem.  They have delicious cafe food, sit down and grab and go options.  They have great bakery items as well.  Their gelato will leave you wanting more.  Everything is authentic and made in house or noted where they got it from.  They do sell some local brands which makes this gem even more noteworthy!We did host a wedding day lunch here for a large group and the event planner was sharp, accessible, had great communication and was very willing to accommodate all of our special needs/requests.  We cannot say enough about how much we love this place!!!

59.description: Food: Awesome. Great soups, fantastic sandwiches with pillow-like bread, exceptional desserts. Service: Terrible for takeout. My purchase receipt was date stamped 12:17pm. I didn't receive my takeout order until 12:40pm. All I ordered was half a sandwich and a cup of soup. And in all that time they still managed to stiff me on the bread that usually comes with the soup. What the heck were they doing for over 20 minutes?!

21.description: Labriola cafe was really impressive. We initially planned on going to the sit-down restaurant side, but decided to go to the cafe instead of waiting for a table. I was pleasantly surprised with how large and flavorful the side house salad was for less than $3.  Bolognese pizza was really fresh tasting and a good size for the price.  The 4 cheese tortellini was just ok-- not super flavorful, but not too heavy either.

17.description: From South bend indiana, came to chicago just for the weekend and we didn't know what we wanted. Happened to glance over on the Michigan av. Bridge and saw it. Wait staff was extremely helpful and patient with us, as we didnt understand the Italian side of the menu. They didn't serve deep dish just yet but made it for us. And holy crap was it good. Up there with uno and Du's and Giordano's. Took a while to cook as a deep dish will, so no problems there. Came right in and sat down. 5 of 5 have already suggested it to friends and family and we haven't even left yet.

10.description: I have visited the Labriola Oak Brook location many times. During a peak period, I ate there 2-3 days per week for lunch or dinner for an entire year. I adored this restaurant and I can't say I've ever had a bad meal there. Due to a move back to the city, I haven't been to the Oak Brook location in a couple of years.So recently I learned that Labriola opened a restaurant in downtown Chicago. I was thrilled. Since I love this restaurant (especially the Richie burger, salads, and pizza) I decided to finally stop in. My only concern was whether or not the food would be consistent with my experience at the other location.I had an early lunch (around 11:15A) and I ordered the Richie burger.  I found my food to be the polar opposite of what I was used to. The burger was the driest burger I have ever eaten in my life. The pretzel bun was unheated and tasted bland. The bacon was very thin. The cheese was yellow instead of white and covered only half the burger. The lettuce has paltry and anemic looking. The burger was also not seasoned and quite tasteless. It was also just warm instead of piping hot. As I was eating the burger, I couldn't believe how flavorless and dry it was. I began to wonder if this was a leftover burger that someone threw in the microwave to heat up.As a big lover of the Richie burger, this meal was a huge disappointment. I was planning to treat a friend from work to a meal here and to also bring family members. Well, that's clearly not going to happen now, because I'm not wasting another cent in this restaurant.I don't understand why they would have a location right off the Mag Mile and not make sure the experience is equal to or better than the Oak Brook location. I was hoping to eat here a couple of times per month. Oh well.Additionally, I tried the buttermilk donut. It unfortunately had a bad greasy aftertaste and the water glass that I was given was dirty. My advice - if you love the Oak Brook location be cautious about eating here, because the food may not taste as good. Plus the decor isn't as nice either.

5.description: Came here solely for coffee & a sweet treat (dolci) in the early morning. Establishment is very lovely & clean and has sweet friendly staff. My coffee was exactly what I needed that morning strong & bold and my treat was heavenly. They have many options for dolci and have gelato as well!! I can only imagine what lunch/dinner is like as they have all the components for a perfect dining experience.

3.description: Kind of confusing recommendation for Pizza Barra (within Labriola)from Red Eye.. but call 312-955-3100 to have this places food delivered. They don't come up on any of the delivery services. But if it's Labriola bread, I'm totally interested!  Time will tell if these delivery services actually deliver.

35.description: Located inches away from the Intercontinental hotel is this italian gem.  They have delicious cafe food, sit down and grab and go options.  They have great bakery items as well.  Their gelato will leave you wanting more.  Everything is authentic and made in house or noted where they got it from.  They do sell some local brands which makes this gem even more noteworthy!We did host a wedding day lunch here for a large group and the event planner was sharp, accessible, had great communication and was very willing to accommodate all of our special needs/requests.  We cannot say enough about how much we love this place!!!

19.description: Dropped in based on Yelp reviews.The food was delicious. Ambiance was relaxing and warm. Service was ok.I recommend it for the food. Wow. Had the minestrone soup, pucatino and the garganelli. Yum!

28.description: This gem of a bakery was just what we wanted for a casual light breakfast. The Marriott recommended it and she was spot on. Gteat way to start your day!

45.description: Stopped in for breakfast and had a good visit. You order at the counter and then it is delivered to your table. Food was good and service was quick. I would definitely give them a try for lunch or dinner.

33.description: I was just at the restaurant and had to wait a long time for them to take my order. The restaurant was not full at all. There were people who came in the restaurant after me that got there order taken after me. I  am attending a conference, and now I have to attend without eating this morning.  Not happy. Not recommended.

43.description: Great service foremost. Gave us everything we wanted despite some tables being closed and offered a pizza that wasn't on the menu since I was a vegetarian. Jimmy was helpful with good recommendations. Slightly tucked away nice establishment for a fun lunch with friends or a date

2.description: I really love their paninos , their burgers there really good !!Came in for dinner a couple nights ago. Love the arugula salad , campanile it was ok , lacking. A little love. Calamari really good  , server very uninteresting in his 2 or 3 tables  , managers walking around with no purpose, never ask how our meal was , bartender very attentive , busboy  nice and attentive ,over all ok experience.

18.description: I'm somewhat torn on my rating...I really liked the service and I thought the atmosphere looked quite nice.  However, it wasn't very busy and for me, for dinner, I like a lively atmosphere in a place like this.  We, however, sat at the bar and shared an appetizer.The bar area is quite appealing with some high tables and a relatively long bar.  The service was pleasant and very helpful about drink choices, etc.The ricotta appetizer was delicious - I could have licked the container.There are plenty of drink options and we had fun watching them make some interesting cocktails.  All in all a good spot, I just would have liked a little more liveliness for dinner on a weekend.  The outdoor patio looks really cute (though it was pouring rain, so I skipped that....)

41.description: I'm somewhat torn on my rating...I really liked the service and I thought the atmosphere looked quite nice.  However, it wasn't very busy and for me, for dinner, I like a lively atmosphere in a place like this.  We, however, sat at the bar and shared an appetizer.The bar area is quite appealing with some high tables and a relatively long bar.  The service was pleasant and very helpful about drink choices, etc.The ricotta appetizer was delicious - I could have licked the container.There are plenty of drink options and we had fun watching them make some interesting cocktails.  All in all a good spot, I just would have liked a little more liveliness for dinner on a weekend.  The outdoor patio looks really cute (though it was pouring rain, so I skipped that....)

52.description: I wanted to like this neighborhood joint. Food was good but too pricey for a casual Thur.  The value equation is a bit off ... A few nicer Italian places for the value.

50.description: First time here and I'm very impressed from the way you were greeted to the way they treat you throughout. Very impressed.  The waitress Victoria was lovely and the manager David I think it's his name was very accommodating  I'm not usually a gang of Italian restaurants but this one is an exception.     Try the seafood salad with some white wine.    Definitely will make you come back for more . 5 stars for sure for this one of a kind Italian place.

4.description: Sunday mornings in the cafe are my favorite! It was so relaxing and cozy. Plus our server was so kind and had a great personality. The coconut cake is beyond delicious. Layers of dense cake loaded with thick coconut buttercream. Yum! Great coffee, refills are free and plenty. :) Plus they had in a nice variety of Stan's Donuts in the shop as well! It was truly a wonderful  (albeit calorie-filled) breakfast!

6.description: We stopped in here on a freezing cold day for lunch.  There is a sit-down restaurant and a small cafe.  We had lunch in the cafe and were treated like royalty!  They have free samples of their pastries too!  Great place for lunch.

22.description: This place is awesome. Very friendly staff. We stopped in for coffee and they treated us to samples of gelato and donuts.

15.description: Review for the Labriola Ristorante and Cafe on Michigan Ave at Grand AveThe wife and I dropped in on a recent Saturday afternoon before the lunch rush and ordered on the café side of the house. I had to place my order several times with the patient cashier who was obviously frustrated with the clanging going on behind her at the soda fountain. After ordering from the television monitors above the register, we walked over to the dining area to find a smattering of food and crumbs on the floor and tables - nothing too discouraging, just more of a post-rush hour dusting of debris than a time-to-start-a-new-day look for 11:30am.Our food arrived very quickly, delivered tableside by a waiter we never saw again - my soup and sandwich combo included a half tuna salad sammich, topped with fennel and olives, perched on a large bagel-like onion roll that was a bit too thick to tackle. The soup of the day was a rich and flavorful creamy tomato soup ($9.95) - one of the freshest I have ever sampled. The tuna was just how I hoped - lightly dressed, with just enough fennel to make it taste like it had a little pickle relish in the mix. The wife's plate overflowed with fresh-cut, super-crispy potato chips and her prosciutto-wrapped chicken panini ($9.95) was welded together by a thick layer of gooey provolone cheese, some fresh spinach, slices of dried tomato, dressed with a pesto mayo.Both sandwiches were certainly flavorful and came at a very decent price point, considering the proximity to Michigan Ave. We look forward to trying them again.

57.description: Arrived and were promptly seated with our reservation. Ordered an appetizer, a Mai-Tai, a Beer, our entrees and a dessert. The appetizer was prepared perfectly. It was a unique cream filled mozarella. It was great. Our entrees, I felt, were small portioned but they were both delicious and well prepared. Our dessert was a unique take on the Tiramisu. It was served in a cup with marscapone mousse, a hazelnut pudding, an espresso biscotti stick, and "iced" espresso. It was delicious. Staff was friendly and our waiter was attentive.

20.description: Instead of waiting for an hour at Volare, we walked around the corner to find this place, and we were so happy we did.  Absolutely delicious - handmade pasta, everything we had was fantastic.  I will be back next time we are in Chicago!

36.description: Went here for lunch 2 weeks ago and the food was awesome. The service was great. We had the ricotta cheese appetizer and the veggie burger. The ricotta cheese was very high quality and it was served perfectly. The veggie burger had a great combination of flavors. I was pleasantly surprised to have 2 amazing dishes in 1 place.

14.description: I never realized this restaurant existed until I was searching to make a reservation the day of NYE for an Italian restaurant and this place had openings. Very cozy place with dim lights and decorations for NYE. I was very impressed. Food overall was excellent and couldn't speak more highly. We ordered the antipasti misti and meatballs appetizers, both very delicious and unique. The chicken Parmesan was a huge portion! Others at our table also ordered the chicken Dominic and bucatini all of which were very tasty and impressive. Only minor complaint was service. Waiter seemed very overwhelmed and perhaps a bit judgmental from the start considering our party of 4 was young, all 22 and 23 years old. He was a bit short with us at times; however, as dinner progressed our service picked up. Also, we decided to purchase the Yelp deal above, $100 for a $25 entree and it turned into a bit of a fiasco... It worked out in the end, as the deal is worthwhile.

58.description: I went to Treasure Island because a friend said it was cheaper than Trader Joe's and Whole Foods.  He was half right.  Trader Joe's is still cheaper, but it doesn't have the amazing deli that TI has.  They carry Boar's Head, which is the only brand outside of anything at Whole Foods that I will buy.  The selection is fantastic, they carry Dean and Deluca spices and such, which completely blew my mind.  Granted, asking $10 for a package of Barefoot Contessa brownies is a bit much.  So instead of driving here, a bit out of my way, I will stick to Trader Joe's for dry goods, Devon Market for produce, and Whole Foods for deli meat.

56.description: Normally friendly staff and a decent selection of grub.  Prices are too high for what you get, though.The baked goods counter needs to be more regularly staffed and a buzzer/bell should be installed to summons help when no-one is there.The little bistro table area needs much more attention.  No-one ever seems to tidy up that corner of the store.  I find myself picking up trash left behind by other patrons every time I eat there.  Additionally, why isn't there a full selection of basic condiments like hot sauce, salt, pepper, etc. (essentially, anything in a packet that will not spoil) and cutlery for people who want to eat their hot deli items in this area?

29.description: Conveniently located for fresh groceries! Fresh muffins and croissants if you're in the mood; it's also the one place I can always find Hob-Nobs!

42.description: This is the supermarket where I buy meat in Hyde Park.I'am european and back home the supermarket aren't so careful with the products presentation and maintenance. And don't have samples!!! I love some samples like cheese or olive oil.The staff in nice!

23.description: I just got out of the hospital, live in the neighborhood, and really didn't want to use pea pod and my cabinets are bare.  With that I called TI and was connected to their personal shopper Benjamin.  My taste bud were on fire after being on IV fluids for days, that I made a list of all my necessities and cravings and gave them to him over the phone.  You asked and you will receive.  Within 3 hours I will say all for $6 bucks! This is the best $6 service/delivery fee I have ever spent! Thanks to Benjamin I will now be eating  a fresh rotisserie chicken for dinner, and have fresh items in the house to nurse me back to health.This experience was wonderful and I'm so grateful to have TI in the neighborhood!

47.description: My go-to place for a quick lunch or a few items  needed for dinner.  Sale items in produce are generally a good buy.  Do have your produce weighed and labeled in the produce department -- the guys there are quick and efficient.   The salad bar is a draw both for lunch and for a few chopped ingredients for a quick stirfry for dinner. In the meat case just beyond the end of the salad bar, you'll find chilled, cooked boneless chicken, salmon and othe fish -- add it to your salad and make a meal!There's always chicken noodle soup and chili at the soup bar plus a few others that rotate; I'm a fan of the Boston Clam Chowder, reminds me of Cape Cod.  Wednesday is Pizza Day and thin, slightly crisp, fresh baked  pizzas, many with fresh veggies, start coming out of the oven around 11:30.  The steam table always has chicken pieces roasted and fried as well as roast turkey, hot dogs and brats.  Other items rotate including roasted vegetables on Thursday and several kinds of broiled and fried fish on Friday.Breads and rolls, up in front in bins near the cashiers, are baked in the morning and include crisp white and whole grain rolls in several shapes and sizes as well as baguettes, croissants, and mufins.  The nearby cake and pastry counter is tempting but never tempts me perhaps because its staffing is spotty.

8.description: The location is what makes me a frequent shopper here as I live just  block away. TI is generally pricier but they do have regular offers. You need to be careful selecting packed fresh produce as I've often come across blackened baby spinach, over ripe strawberries etc when I open the case upon reaching home. Overall I'll say it doesn't impress but it is decent enough if you live nearby.

31.description: What a dump!TI used to be a nicer grocery store in Chicago. It was similar to Trader Joes...lots of unique items back then.   I visited this location today. I lived nearby about 10 years ago and it was my grocery store at the time.  They have not spent a dime on this place in the past 10 years! Such a run-down depressing grocery store. I wouldn't be surprised if TI packs it in pretty soon.  RIP Treasure Island.

34.description: I used to live in the neighborhood and now I just work across the street.  It is mighty convenient haven't a grocery store across the street instead of eating out everyday.  (I admit I don't do a great job of planning when trying to pack my lunches.)  For $5.99 per lb. I can get a fresh salad.  Treasure Island has a great selection of food and the prices can vary from being a good deal to being "specialty-priced" (read: a little more expensive than I prefer to pay).  I like that they offer grocery items (fresh fruits, veggies, and frozen items as well) and prepared items ready to pick up during a quick lunch.  The sushi is prepared daily so you don't have any that have been sitting for a week or crazy non-sense like that.  They also carry great things like pure honey, almond milk, a wide assortment of cheeses, and shrimp chips (which take me back to my Asian upbringing).  One thing that is more of an annoyance than a complete turn-off: rude/non-chalant cashiers.  The other staff like those at the deli or salad bar are very friendly and take the time to get to know your name.   This promotes a neighborhood-like feel.  But once I get to the cash registers, it feels like a completely different place.  Not that I want my cashier to know all of my business so much so it slows down the line behind me, but talking to me without having their back turned might be nice.  They ARE rather efficient when ringing customers up, so I guess I shouldn't complain. Again, more of an annoyance than a turn-off.  I still visit Treasure Island (a.k.a. "T.I." as it's called by co-workers) each day for my usual.  I can't deny how incredibly convenient this grocery store is!

16.description: I love Treasure Island. I have been to every one of them and I have to say that sadly this one is not representative of the brand.  The store is dirty and the staff is not helpful or friendly and in some instances unsanitary.  I noticed the butcher sampling product and cleaning with the same gloves he used to prepare my order. Also, tonight I walked in and was greeted with a kiosk of bread rolls, all of which were green with mold.  I write this review with the hopes that the management considers improving, moving or closing this location.  It's not like any of the others.  The TI in Lakeview and Lincoln Park are both exemplary.

13.description: This place is hilariously awful for all the reasons below:-The staff is just outright rude. -Over the course of one year, two of my friends were outright ripped off at the store. One of them had her credit card overcharged and had to file for fraud to get her money back. The other one didn't get her change back. When she went back to claim her money - they said 'too bad, it's been over 24 hours'. -It often takes unnecessarily long to check out even though there's only a couple of people in line. The cashiers take forever to process transactions, are often despondent and rude and slow to bag the stuff. Hell, I'd do it for them if I could. -They charge extra $5 to reheat the pizza you buy from them! And it takes 20 minutes for them to warm it up. -Most produce is spoiled. I had to bring back a packet of bagged arugula (and I don't return stuff very often) - the smell alone gave it away. -The prices are higher and the produce is not up to par. I will take my business elsewhere.

11.description: We started going here a lot more since Dominick's and fox and obel both closed. The place has pretty much everything that one would need but the prices are rather high relative to what Dominick's charged, but they are much cheaper than what fox and obel charged.

39.description: For its location, i understand its for residents of the building, and thus the prices are a bit ridiculous.  Example- the parmasan cheese is typically about 17-18 dollars/lb, whereas the food markets on N Clark it is about 7-9.  What I do like about TI is their salad bar.  It is fantastic but doesn't have any items that rotate.  It is 5.99 per pound, where as the Dominicks a few blocks away is 4.99 per pound.  Their Deli is pretty good and you can get a monsterous sandwich for under $5.  Their baked chicken is also delicious.

37.description: I really like this TI because of the friendly guy who works the morning to mid-afternoon shift at the deli.  He is always there to greet me with a smile and to ask about my day, and he genuinely remembers things about my life!I also really like their salad bar and deli offerings.  The sushi isn't bad, either.I have two suggestions for this TI:1. Offer more organic produce (maybe there's a reason they don't...but it seems like their primary clientele could afford it... possibly there's a lack of interest since many of their clients are in the age 65+ category and aren't up on the organic bandwagon)2. Improve your meat selection and offer more organic options there, too.

0.description: The produce is often far from fresh, and I think the hot soup they serve gave me food poisoning once. On the other hand, the alcohol manager, cake decorator, and deli person have all been super friendly and helpful to me. And I really like their deli chicken salad.

38.description: I second thought, this place is in need of some upgrades. The facilities are old and the stocking of food is seriously lacking. Every time I go here on Monday to get a loaf of bread, nearly all the bread is expiring in two days or already expired. Or, they are out of several kinds of bread that I usually get. I came here yesterday for some ground pork and ground beef for meatballs and they barely had anything in the cooler to choose from.  I needed a specific amount of meat and I couldn't get close to what  I needed with the choices available.Did I mention this place was overpriced?

51.description: Ever felt like a grocery store thinks it is too good for you? I felt like that here. They have a decent selection of some really cool imported stuff but their prices are abhorrent and most of the products can be found elsewhere (and cheaper) if you look hard enough, although I get the impression that they prefer a clientele that is not concerned about the prices they pay for stuff. I have been to this store a handful of times, and the staff are generally rude and condescending to customers. I needed help once so I walked up to the service desk. There were two people behind the counter; a man and a woman. The woman never acknowledged my existence. The man was sorting some papers. He looked up at me, made eye contact and went back to his papers. I waited until he finished what he was doing and then said "excuse me". He shot me a patronizing look and turned away. I was the only customer there but he would not wait on me. After five minutes I gave up and left. I haven't been back since and I do not intend to ever go there again. If a store can be called a snob, this one truly fits the bill. I don't care how great you think your store is, you don't treat the customers like you are doing them a favor by letting them in the door.

27.description: Ok so it is the closest grocery store around me. While the prices tend to be a bit higher and the selection a bit less, I still can make it to the place within minutes when I need a last minute item. I really like their salad bar too. Their fruits and produce tend to be fresh. They have a pretty good supply of beer and wine. They have foreign chocolates which I cannot stay away from. As long as I live in Streeterville, I'll probably frequent this place really often... and you should too!

32.description: A sort of convoluted and overpriced place but you will be able to find what you need here. A pretty decent selection of beers as well.

54.description: Wish I could give this place more than three stars, but there are some issues that need to be addressed with this store.  Categorically:Location: 4 out of 5.Since I worked in 680 N. Lake Shore Dr for four years, nothing was easier for lunch than just hopping downstairs on the elevator and getting something at TI to eat.  I guess it's easy to get to if you live around the area or if you're close to Lake Shore Drive.  Free 90 minute parking in the attached garage with 30$ purchase, I think.  Quality of food: 4 out of 5.Pretty decent stuff here.  As others have alluded to, the salad bar is consistently good and offers a healthy alternative to traditional lunch fare.  HOWEVER, there is consistently a large selection of expired dairy items on the shelves which I think any grocery store should address.  I mean, fine - you can leave eggs out past the sale date, but milk?  ummm...not so much.  More on this later.  All other items are no better or worse than a non-discount grocery store.Pricing: 3 out of 5.Prices aren't exorbitant for some items, but for others - I really wonder how they come up with such curious schemes.  The good: salad bar is 6 dollars a pound; sandwiches are 5 bucks; lox and cream cheese bagel is 7; and corn dogs are pretty cheap.  The bad: some items in the hot bar are ridiculously expensive for what they are; dairy items are a little pricey for the generic brand (and as I've mentioned, are sometimes expired).  On everything else, expect to pay 8 - 10% more than what you'd pay at Dominick's or Jewel.  However, sometimes they'll have really good sales on items like Gatorade (88 cents) and GM cereals (4 for 10), commensurate with a club card discount.  Also, beware of who you get at the hot deli to ring you up.  Some of them will just slap a price tag on your box without ringing up the correct item.  For example, there's a price difference between the lemon chicken and fried chicken, and the different types of pastas.Customer Service: 3 out of 5.I wish I could average out this number and have it be much higher.  Some of the people who work at this location are 10 stars.  Others, seriously, are like...2 star worthy.  Gus in the deli has never been anything but attentive, polite, and courteous to me, as has the lady that works back there with him who may be some type of manager.  The head dairy aisle restocker is really careful, but on more than one occasion I've seen him chew out an inept employee for, get this, putting an expired dairy item right back on the shelf, or just behind two other non-expired ones.  The girls behind the cake counter are always nice; not the fastest and sometimes it'll take awhile for them to appear, but they're pleasant to talk to and very polite.  The cashier that I adored when I was there worked in the middle: graying African American lady who would sing songly say, "have a nice day" or "enjoy your day" on the way out or say, "sorry for the delay, folks" if there was a long line.  And of course there are some surly ones that work closest to the little seating area.  I don't understand why they continue to work there if they're so annoyed by what they do.  Overall: 3 out of 5.  If you know the right people, it can be a great shopping experience.  If you get stuck with  Murphy's Law of inept and surly employees, good luck to you.

48.description: It's both a blessing & a curse to have a TI so close to work. A curse in that I end up spending a whole lot of money over there for lunch, but the rest is just bliss.This is not just your local grocery store; they've got everything from a full bakery, floral shop, and most importantly, a fabulous deli counter and great ready-made foods perfect for lunch or for one of those days you don't feel like making dinner.Do yourself a favor and try out two of my fave salads: the Spanish Corn & Beans salad as well as the Pasta Supreme Salad - delicious & so fresh! They have really handy to-go containers too that are microwaveable, and most importantly, reusable!They also have a large assortment of hot foods too, ranging from baked & fried chicken, to corn dogs, hot sides, and even some exquisite thin crust pizza. The menu rotates and I'm still not sure what day of the week certain foods are on tap, but you will always find something that is tasty. If someone knows when they make the pizza - LET ME KNOW!You'll also find a large assortment of ready-to-go subs, a large salad bar, and someone making fresh sushi if that's your kind of thing. You will honestly be hard-pressed not to find something of your liking here. While the food items are reasonably priced, I think they make up for it in the groceries big time. Expect to pay a lot more than your local Jewel, Dominicks, etc. but what you are paying for is the convenience and what seems to be the "Streeterville location tax".The staff is also extremely friendly; from the guys at the deli counter, to the hot meal servers, down to the cashiers. My only gripe with this place is that if you so happen to purchase any produce, be prepared to wait at the check-out line for a while. For some reason they do not have weighing scales at the registers, so usually your cashier has to take your produce, go over to another station and weigh & price it out.

44.description: Yet another unlikely business tucked into the ground floor of the Playboy/680 Building - a full-on supermarket.  Had I not seen it for myself from the inside I never would have believed it was there.Treasure Island curiously dubs itself "America's Most European Supermarket".  I don't know whether or not that's true, how it could be verified or what it even means exactly, but it does have a slightly different vibe than your standard supermarket.  I would have chalked it up to the place being stuffed into the ground floor of a hundred-year old residential/office building owned, in part, by Hugh Hefner, but hey - I've been wrong before.The service is generally very good.  The staff is always very friendly and knowledgable.  The selection and prices are what you might expect for the location - it falls somewhere in between the high-end Fox & Obel at Illinois and McClurg, and the more pedestrian Dominick's at Illinois and Columbus, both competitors only a few blocks away.  I don't recall having to actually weigh my produce in the produce department since sometime in the late 70s, but that is the M.O. at Treasure Island.  Perhaps that's one of those "European" things that they're referring to.  Their meat department is adjacent to produce and in my opinion is rather lacking.  It is small and the selection is pretty weak, which is odd considering every other part of the store is full-stock.  What they do have in meat is generally pretty good, anyway.So, the Treasure Island at 680 is a pretty good place to shop if one lives nearby, but the lack of anything resembling a parking lot, a three block hike to the CTA and a 6-7 block hike to the Red Line limits those who may be coming from more than a few blocks away (though there's always the cab option, I suppose).  Check it out if you're in the neighborhood.

24.description: I live across the street and am usually at the store a couple of times a week.  There's a Dominicks a few blocks away and I'll go there once in awhile.   Friends will remark that the prices are higher at Treasure Island.  That may be the case sometimes but I find the service to be OUTSTANDING!  I like the product selection more, the meat and fish selection may be not be large but the quality is great.  And the deli is wonderful.

7.description: maybe grocery store sushi is just a bad idea = GI issues

49.description: Yes, they have great imported ingredients you will not find anywhere else. Their 5$  gummy bears are to die for, and the produce and fruit usually is great. However, on numerous occasions I have had freshness issues with items I bought there. I like their Italian bread, but twice I have come home with a moldy loaf. Once I noticed mold on the loaves on the shelves and told a person from the bakery counter who then tossed out the moldiest loaves and left the rest molding away... The other day I bought big  shrimp for a shrimp cocktail that tasted and smelled like dumpster juice. When I returned them and asked for my money back I got attitude instead of apologies. This store has some upsides and I go there because it's close, but this place is poorly managed and has too few customers, resulting in items being out too long. I give it another year or two, max.

40.description: Great selection for a small store of everything from ethnic to gourmet to house wines. Very tucked away though:( I stumbled upon here because the drug store near by was closed and the bf was craving chips n guar & a heat pad for his back, what a great find. Miss you already Chicago!

53.description: I also dig the mini-shopping carts.I stop here every once in a while when I'm in the area for sandwich, cookie or even for their soft serve ice cream. Prices are usually cheaper here than at Whole Foods but Treasure Island does not compare to Whole Foods or even Trader Joe's as far as store ambience, variety, customer service or how well the store is organized and kept up.It's got everything larger grocery stores have but just less, less choices, less variety and less locations throughout the city. Of course, it owes its success at being the only grocery store in a particular area. As a result, prices can be high but for downtown locations, like this one, it's all relative and reasonable.But again, I come here mostly for the cheap soft-serve ice cream, cookies, muffins and fresh sandwiches.

30.description: Unfortunately this is the closest supermarket to me, though I rarely go. They proclaim that they're a European-type supermarket - if by that they mean overpriced then they're spot on. Everything here is far more expensive than items you'll find at Dominick's and Trader Joe's.

46.description: If you live in Streeterville this can be a little gem.  Located in the lower level of a Condo/Medical building, you'd miss it if you didn't ask the concierge.  While they specialize in hard to find ethnic items, they also carry things like detergent and household goods.  They're bakery is excellent and they sell Leonidas Chocolates from Belgium.  Very expensive, very worth it.  Buy a few and indulge.  You don't HAVE to have the whole pound and you can mix and match :)The produce is excellent and I'm usually amazed at how good the prices are.  While some items are very expensive others aren't.  You really need to just go and check it out for yourself.  They always double bag for your and the other bag is plastic so if the weather is bad you don't get a hole in your bag and end up with your eggs smashed on the sidewalk.

1.description: The convenience of this Treasure Island is what keeps me coming back. I live next door so during the winter months it is just easy to not travel a little further to whole foods or uber to trader joe's.The price point here at Treasure Island is not so great. The staff here are very standoffish. The two times I purchased baked goods from the bakery, they were very old and tasted very artificial compared to the baked goods I receive at the gold coast location near the clark/division stop. I also really do not like the layout of this store. The produce is alllllll the way in the back. The aisles are so tight, which makes navigating with carts nearly unbearable. For what it is, it gets the job done. But it holds no candle to other grocery stores in the area.

55.description: i always spend at least 30 min looking for just one thing...and yes i should ask for help at the 15 min mark but shouldn't  they just organize the store a little bit better? they still get 4 stars from me b/c the salad bar is running a close second to Whole Foods on options and quality but it's def cheaper which for me is the most imp thing as a broke ass student.....the deli hot food is pretty good too, i've tried the chicken and a few of the hot sides and no complaints...everyone is always super friendly even when they're busy and the wine selection ain't too shabby.....it's closer to school than dominicks so i'll be back for sure.

9.description: Stay out of this produce department! Vegetables sitting, rotting in pans of water, black gunk all along the top of the mirror behind the bins (wonder how they recycle their water?!). Employee spilled the water out of those containers when I pointed it out. Manager said the black gunk wasn't mold and that they would be remodeling in a few months. Meanwhile, needless to say, I didn't think buying anything in the meat or poultry or fish departments was such a good idea, either. Bye, Felicia.

26.description: I agree with the reviewer who stated that TI used to be a nice store. Thirty years ago. This Treasure Island in 680 Lake Shore is the worst. Sure it has the basics of what you need in the aisles, but if you are looking for good service, fresh produce at a reasonable price (not about-to-spoil-produce at a higher than market price) look elsewhere. Service is terrible.  Waiting my turn in a two-person line at the deli counter, the surly counterman completed the order for the man next to me, then when it was my turn turned away from the counter and started doing other things. I mean, really? Am I invisible?  Heads up, TI:  Dominicks and Trader Joes are within blocks and Whole Foods is nearby. You might want to pick up your game.

25.description: This grocery store has a great location but the layout of the store is really strange. I guess they are trying to make the best out of their space but a few more signs in the stores would really help. Also, finding it for the first time in the first floor of this building is not easy .The main reason i frequent this store is because of its location. The veggies could be a little more fresh in my opinion.

12.description: This location has gone to hell in the last couple of years. The store is filthy, many employees are rude. My friend told the manager that I almost slipped because of water on the floor and he replied, "Well, did she slip or almost slip?" I've seen moldy bagels, green bacon and lunch meats in the cold case, bread on the shelf that is 3 days past the sell by date, and grayish colored meats in the fresh meat section. The food they sell in the deli section is unappealing and just plain disgusting. I used to like their hot soups, but now they are watery or pasty and pretty much flavorless and lacking in variety. I actually got lunch from McDonald's today and I hate McDonald's.

59.description: I live in the area and prefer not to drive which is why I USED to shop here. When I first visited the store, the staff was so rude (with managers standing within earshot) that I believed it was part of their marketing strategy . . . similar to Ed Debevic's. Most of the cashiers (the ones that work afternoon, evening) are discourteous and utterly unaware of a concept called "customer service." The managers are not especially personable but they are tolerable, unlike the disrespectful cashiers (especially the short, rotund one). In addition, TI seems to be a lot more expensive than other stores. Consequently, I would rather drive and, if necessary, spend more money than shop at a place that clearly does not appreciate my business. The management is aware of their impolite staff but continue to tolerate it, at the expense of their customers. I for one will never shop there again and judging by the way that I have heard the cashiers talk to some of their other customers, I expect more to do the same.

21.description: Great produce selection - I juice and eat healthy so I need organic bananas, strawberries, blueberries, packaged green varieties, etc and this place has it all!  I like the boutique styling and friendly folks that work there.  I'm happy to pay a little extra for the service and I'll continue to go there.  They actually have some prepared lunch selections that will surprise you too.  They also have a very inexpensive delivery service -

17.description: Staff is rude, items are overpriced and the store is dirty. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place.

10.description: TI offers a pretty decent selection of most groceries you'll need.  The prices are slightly higher than Jewel without being better quality. They offer hot soups, pre-made lunches, and a bakery if you want to grab something to-go during lunch time.  They usually have a few free samples scattered throughout the store, which is always a nice surprise.  It's not a bad choice if you're in the area and have a limited selection of grocery stores to choose from.

5.description: Love the produce department, deli, and salad bar.  The salad bar is really fair priced at about $5/ LB and the deli always has HUGE deli meat sandwiches that last me two lunches at the office.  The veggie couscous (with red peppers, cilantro & asparagus) at the deli is healthy & delicious, and they almost always have it! Love it.  The dry foods can be a little pricey, but they do run great sales / promotions once in awhile.  It can be tough to find things, as the store is laid out in a very mazelike manor, but the staff is always helpful & point me in the right direction. So grateful this is here for healthy, affordable choices close to the office!

3.description: Make sure you validate your ticket at treasure island n spend 10.00 to get free parking...

35.description: We live in the neighborhood, and of the 4 nearby grocery stores, TI is definitely our favorite.-Great selection of interesting foods while still carrying the stand-bys.-Despite what you might think, it is NOT that expensive compared to Dominicks (and is way cheaper than Fox and Obel). We did some trial runs to compare prices on our staples and a few extra things, and unless you're using some coupons at Dominicks, TI is cheaper the majority of the time.-Good sales. The ad is posted online each week, and they pretty regularly have one type of each lunch meat on sale, as well as good deals on cuts of meat and produce.-I come here sometimes and get stuff from the prepared food section for lunch, and it's delicious.Minus one star because sometimes the meat selection is limited (though every time I've asked the gentleman at the meat counter for something, he's gone to the back and cut it for me) and some of the staff members are not very customer-service oriented.P.S. Weighing the produce is not that big of a deal.

19.description: I just got out of the hospital, live in the neighborhood, and really didn't want to use pea pod and my cabinets are bare.  With that I called TI and was connected to their personal shopper Benjamin.  My taste bud were on fire after being on IV fluids for days, that I made a list of all my necessities and cravings and gave them to him over the phone.  You asked and you will receive.  Within 3 hours I will say all for $6 bucks! This is the best $6 service/delivery fee I have ever spent! Thanks to Benjamin I will now be eating  a fresh rotisserie chicken for dinner, and have fresh items in the house to nurse me back to health.This experience was wonderful and I'm so grateful to have TI in the neighborhood!

28.description: I come here a few times for work when I purchase beverage and booze (tons to choose from by the way) for my department parties :) and for a quick lunch or snack during my lunch break.  They have a deli with a LOT of tasty dishes to choose from- you may be there for awhile.  The grocery food selection is great and very organized, but can be pretty pricey.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.

45.description: Came here because I was at Northwestern Hospital and this was the closest grocery store I could find. The prices are decent and the quality is pretty good. I bought watermelon, bing and rainier cherries, coconut water (a new brand imported from Thailand), and chocolates. The price for the rainier cherries were not listed, but when I got to the checkout, I find out that they are $8.99/ pound! I ended up paying $15 for the bag of cherries that I got. To make things worse, they weren't even as sweet as they usually are. Other than that, the remaining items were a good buy. This is a good place to stop and pick up some small items.

33.description: Can be kind of pricey, depending on what you are shopping for, but always offers a great selection of produce.

43.description: let me start by saying that i was so looking forward to shopping here since i love the t.i. in hyde park. well... this particular location offers more TRASH than treasure.1. the location of items is nothing less than retarded. refrigerated juice is found in 3 entirely different locations - enough said.2. you have to weigh your produce in the produce section because checkout cashiers don't have scales... LOL.3. produce section is absolutely sub-par: almost no organic products, much less variety of fruit and vegetables as compared to the nearby dominick's, and quite a few items were ROTTING.4. parking is a headache.overall, if you're in the area and want a few simple items, this will work. if you want to do real grocery shopping, go to dominick's.

2.description: I'm revising their review to a three.  I visited again recently, and the situation in the produce section seems to have improved.

18.description: What a dump!TI used to be a nicer grocery store in Chicago. It was similar to Trader Joes...lots of unique items back then.   I visited this location today. I lived nearby about 10 years ago and it was my grocery store at the time.  They have not spent a dime on this place in the past 10 years! Such a run-down depressing grocery store. I wouldn't be surprised if TI packs it in pretty soon.  RIP Treasure Island.

41.description: Weirdest ever location for a grocery store? Probably.  Super convenient for the residents of the nearby high-rises?  You bet.It's a pretty small store and the selection reflects that. But the quality of the produce is equivalent to other groceries in the area.

52.description: This place sells fun ingredients from faraway places. Take the fancy butter, which can be found near the imported cheese. Less fancy butter and cheese sit in a different dairy case. I thought that was dumb, but no matter. A cashier snapped at me because apparently I am dumber than their fancy butter and cheese placement to know that "produce must be weighed in bags." She went and weighed the lone pepper and tomato herself, brought them back without a bag. I'm sure I'm not the first or last customer to make this mistake, so put a hugely obvious sign in the produce area to tell dumb customers this Island policy. Pass.

50.description: I like TI because there's never a crowd, people are nice, and they tend to have what I need. On the other hand, they're very expensive and don't have a wide selection of vegetables. They do have pretty good meat and I hear that their bakery and deli are kicking, in an expensive Streetervillian kind of way. In other words, TI is a compromise between Fox & Obel and Dominick's.

4.description: I lived in this building for 17 years, from around my first birthday until I moved off to college. I used to go down to TI to get bagels in the morning, gum or candy in the afternoon, and to go grocery shopping with parents when they went. I grew up going here which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 3, and it's very convenient which is why I even considered 3 instead of 2. My review will be in the form of younger and now for comparison. Deli:Younger- samples galore, got great service, they put up with crazy little me. Now- the employee who's remained the same did not recognize me but still gave excellent service. The employees who are newer were rude and looked like it was a chore to give me a sample, I'm a picky eater I can't remember what of the foods I liked, it's not difficult to give me a tiny taste so don't roll your eyes.Produce:Younger- fruit was mostly fresh, salad bar was good and fresh. They even let me learn how to use the scale and press the buttons while supervised. Now- I hadn't been since they started weighing food at the registers, so I asked for help having the only decent looking/ripe Apple they had weighed, the employee lightly shook his head and carried on with what he was doing and did not tell me they weigh up front. Bakery:Younger- fast service, though they did lose one birthday cake once, but that's out of multiple a year for over a decade, one isn't THAT bad and it was easy to replace.Now- I bake a lot, but one thing I'll never give up is bakery frosting. The bakery no longer looks like somewhere I'll be buying from. Yes, the decorations look nice, but the icing looks warmer than it should be and the cakes all look like they've been sitting there for weeks and they're not even boxed, just in a container that's being opened constantly through the day and very easy for bugs or ants to make their way in. No thanksRegisters:Younger- they were friendly, they knew who I was and they asked about school/life/ whatever Now- I understand that I've changed over the years and that they've had a change in employees, but I worked as a cashier in a grocery store and you damn well better believe that I asked every customer how they were and provided extremely quick service. The line took WAY too long, I don't know if I just never noticed this because it was the grocery store I always went to or if the employees have slowed it down a lot but I always remember there being excessive lines. They didn't even look at or talk to me they were talking with the next cashier over. I understand talking to friends who work with you, but when you have a customer, talk to them, or at least say hello. Don't be rude. All in all, this place has gone down hill over the years. I got better service when they knew who I was but now I'm just another customer most of them have never seen before and I've been learning how they treat the customers that don't come in daily- not good. Step it up TI! Your store is dirty(that's nothing new) and your employees are increasingly rude by the day. And with your selection, I might as well go to 7-11 to do my grocery shopping.

6.description: Although Treasure Island is VERY convenient for those in the Streeterville area, its prices are exorbitant when compared with the quality of the produce, meat, etc. It's a great place to stop in for emergency food/wine runs, but not for your everyday grocery needs. On another note, the employees here are zombie-like. Managers, get those unfortunate people some fresh air!

22.description: I love Treasure Island. I have been to every one of them and I have to say that sadly this one is not representative of the brand.  The store is dirty and the staff is not helpful or friendly and in some instances unsanitary.  I noticed the butcher sampling product and cleaning with the same gloves he used to prepare my order. Also, tonight I walked in and was greeted with a kiosk of bread rolls, all of which were green with mold.  I write this review with the hopes that the management considers improving, moving or closing this location.  It's not like any of the others.  The TI in Lakeview and Lincoln Park are both exemplary.

15.description: Really great produce. Everything is fresh and the food is decently price. It's not the cheapest supermarket but you're not overpaying on anything. The selection is quite varied. The staff is also very friendly and available when you need their help.Only wish would be that the aisles and general layout of the store was more easily navigable. When you're using the shopping cart, it's especially difficult to navigate through some sections of the store. Also, their stock in ethnic foods leaves much to be desired.Other than those two issues, Treasure Island Foods is a great place to shop. I'll be coming here for my regular grocery needs.

57.description: My review is 98% based on the salad bar. Which I love.It is reasonably priced, has spring mix, romaine, spinach, etc. Lots of regular veggies like cherry tomatoes, cucumber, olives, artichoke hearts, tofu... but also lots of stuff that I, with weird tastes, really enjoy, like beets, hearts of palm, corn, alfalfa sprouts, and marinated mushrooms. They also have some premixed stuff, like fruit salad and mixed bean salad, lots of dressings, oil and vinegar, pepper, etc. Don't forget to pick up a fork and napkins.The rest of the store, however, is a just a conundrum to me.

20.description: I love this place. Friendly staff,  great variety and conveniently located in the building where I work. AND they validate parking!!!

36.description: I wanted to give this place 1 star but it earns the extra star because of convenience. Let me start with the staff, they are horrendous! The only two people that provide consistent genuine costumer service is Gus in the deli and the Latino guy in produce. Everyone else is quite rude and just plain miserable. I grabbed a bread that was 79 cents and the lady charged me 89. Granted I know it was only a dime but I asked for future references if that was the wrong price. The lady seriously stared at me with a dirty look like I just killed her first born. Then she rolled her eyes at me and walked away. A response would've been suffice but she had to pull out the theatrics. The deli manager is just as bad if not worse. She is blatantly rude to costumers and frequently makes inappropriate remarks. I have witnessed this first hand several times so I know to stay away from her. The place touts itself as the most "European Market." Well if that's how markets are in Europe I think I'll pass. I am not complaining about the prices because I get it, they have to be higher due to the location. But I have picked up several items that look like they have been there since the dawn of time. I picked up a container of ovaltine and the dust on top was like an inch thick. At this point you are probably wondering, "Why does this chick keep going if she hates it?" Well I'm glad you asked, they sell soda by the can for 60 cents. Also they do have a nice hot food section complete with soup and sometimes chili. The sushi is not bad either but wait for the sales because some of those prices are so not worth it.

14.description: Moved a little too far from Whole Foods, TI is a good replacement. They have a salad and soup bar, nut butter grinders, balsamic and olive oil dispensers, and all the deli and bakery goodies like WF on a smaller scale. Like other reviewers have mentioned the prices are a bit higher than WF, but TI's salad bar/lb was a couple $$ cheaper, which I like! Employees have been friendly every time and they have some cool specialty items.

12.description: The remodel is awesome!! Convenient, clean and the staff is always friendly. What more could you ask for from a 7-Eleven? Also, if you download their app, you can get some pretty good deals, including free Redbox rentals, regularly!

7.description: This is literally the nicest 7-Eleven that I've ever been to. It's so fancy! The workers are also very friendly and this location is extremely clean and organized. I honestly almost forgot this was a 7-Eleven because it was so nice! If I lived closer, I'd definitely come here more often, but if I'm in the area, I'll for sure stop here if I need something.

20.description: Everything is overpriced. Old promotional slurpee cups are 1.39 instead of 1.99. So that's one thing that isn't overpriced. But it serves its purpose for late night needs, glaring flaws aside. Oh and unlike the other 7's a few blocks away there isn't really any panhandlers at all hours.

19.description: Everything is overpriced. Old promotional slurpee cups are 1.39 instead of 1.99. So that's one thing that isn't overpriced. But it serves its purpose for late night needs, glaring flaws aside. Oh and unlike the other 7's a few blocks away there isn't really any panhandlers at all hours.

1.description: This is the best 7-Eleven in Chicago. VERY clean, organized, theres groceries here, bar seating, all of the food on the menu are made to order which ensures its freshness. They have great wine selection here. I really enjoy having this right around the corner from my apartment.

2.description: I really like having this nice 7 Eleven in the neighborhood.  They will make you breakfast, there is a great salad vending machine with fresh salads, and even a small section with fresh fruit.  This is by far the fanciest 7 Eleven I have ever seen. Clean, nicely designed and the staff is friendly.Stop in to gallon of milk or breakfast made to order - you'll be happy you did.

9.description: The 7-11 staff is exceptionally friendly and accommodating - I've lowered my Starbucks consumption because the 7-11 coffee is cheaper and taste as good and besides they have discounted refills and beautiful area in the store to sit in and the self- serve approach is a real joy (no line ups and attitude) - A 10 on 10 for this 7-11 :)

6.description: Swankiest 7-11 I've been to. Has the basic slurpees and everything but there's a wine selection too (that's Streeterville for you). Straightforward, friendly service overall

18.description: came back here 2 weeks ago.brought a big gulp and 2 hot dogs.okay for a snack.

10.description: It's 7-Eleven what more is there to say?! I do like the fact that they have a decent vodka section which came in handy when my friend ran out of vodka at his BBQ. Good thing this 7-Eleven is at the bottom of his bldg. Also, the workers here are a lot nice and than the ones over at 201 E. Ohio.

13.description: 7-Eleven gets a bad rap.Sadly, most of the time, the bad rap is completely justified.  I've been in 7-Elevens that I wouldn't have taken my dear old mother into for fear of offending her delicate sensibilities.  Some of these places, Slurpee or no Slurpee, are just &#$%ing nasty.The 7-Eleven at McClurg and Ontario, however, isn't too bad at all.  In fact, it's generally clean, well stocked, well lit, well staffed and not altogether unpleasant to visit when one hankers for a hunk of cheese (or whatever).You can get a Slurpee the size of your head or a 55-gallon drum of Diet Coke (ok, not really), smokes if you are into that sorta thing, candy, chips, dip, a slightly over/undercooked wiener (with bun!)... you name it.  It's a convenience store, it's got a boatload of convenient stuff (forget your prophylactic while visiting your girl/fella in Streeterville?  This is your place, brother).Some have commented on the prices - they are a bit high, but it's a convenience store in downtown Chicago.  The sales tax alone is, like, 115%.  You ever check out the property taxes down here?  Get used to it.So all in all this is a high-grade 7-Eleven.  Easy if not particularly cheap to the unaccustomed.  Five Stars.

16.description: They're open again after their fancy remodel and I've got to say, job well done. They have a beer section absent Steel Reserve and Four Loco and instead let you build your own six pack of micro brews. They have much healthier selection of foods...real food. They still have their share of processed junk crap, but the choice is there now. They even have three different brands of kombucha drinks...that's more than Whole Foods on Dearborn folks... Redbox is there too but not quite working yet.

17.description: The coolest spot in Streeterville at 3am since it is the only thing open for late night.

15.description: The remodeling made a huge difference.  Very clean, the food is amazingly good,  and the sweet tea is fresh and tasty.   All of the employees are friendly and ready to help.   Luis is always giving me advice on trying new menu items,  and I love it.

0.description: First up. "711" is a community pillar since I was a kid and they have taken over NYC and I see they are gunning for the Chi. I love you 711, you are in my building and open 24/7 when I need you most you are three. Expensive, but you are there. 1 apple, cost = direct deposit to 711.Seriously, 7-Eleven has been very convient for me and I am sure this winter, my first in Chicago, 711 will serve me well. Montez G supports his 711 and vote Montez G for King! I run on the platform of beer, whiskey, fast cars, bars, Chicago Bears/Bulls/Soxs/Drawers/Belts and tell me what else!Montez G. LeGo.....

5.description: As 7-11's new concept store- this location does a great job in showcasing "fresh to go" items and merchandises things in a consumer friendly way.In store- they have the "Farmers Fridge" concept which is a modern vending machine that dispenses freshly prepared salads and other "healthier options".I liked the display of "Fast Fruit" which is fruit that is ready to go for the consumer.  And the display of the peppers and limes and avacados to make guacamole was also quite interesting.Oh sure- there are the standard things that 7-11 offers like the coffee bar, alcohol and sundries for you to purchase.  But the interesting thing about this concept is all the "grab and go" healthier snack items that seem to abound.The other thing to note is that the staff at this 7-11 were some of the nicest people I've ever seen at a 7-11.  Personable, helpful and they actually seemed like they wanted to be working there!Not usually a big fan of 7-11, but this one impressed me!

11.description: It's been awhile since I've been to a 7-11 but after a night out and coming across this place it brought back so many memories.  The thing is, most 7-11s I've been to are much larger than this one.  This one is more of an express version of the 7-11s I've been to.I have to say though that I'm happy they didn't have some of the new food I tried when I was younger because I'd be majorly out of shape!  I came across some Frankenstein of a food when they had buffalo chicken things that looked like a mix of a hot dog and taquito and decided to get 2 since there was a special.  DAMN THEY'RE DELICIOUS!!!  I doubt they're real chicken but they're really delicious!I think my favourite thing at this location was some of the riff raff that come in and the fact that the staff were super cool to them vs trying to be rude and kick them out!  If the staff are going to be awesome to drugged out people they're going to be pretty awesome to everyone else.

8.description: I hadn't been to this 7/11 location in a long time and boy has it changed! Stopped in today for a few drug store essentials because Walgreens wasn't open yet, and found that they've completely redesigned the layout and concept. The store is clean and well organized. I liked the open feeling of the layout, rather than congested aisles. They have a convenient small selection of produce essentials like onions, tomatoes, avocados, bananas, etc., loads of healthy to-go food options, and a super cute wine selection area. Definitely not your average 7/11 store and much needed in the area since Dominick's closed a while back. Check it out!

3.description: I know I am reviewing a 7-Eleven right now. This isn't just to pad my review count. This is literally the nicest 7-Eleven I have ever been too. Large space, HUGE selection of items. They even have a whole area dedicated to health food items.Usually convenience stores can have tight aisles and dirty floors. This is the opposite. So if you are in need of items, this place is a well-lit, clean place that you can rely on. If you even want to eat your treats in the store, there is a  standing counter by a window that lets you look out onto the street.

14.description: Dear 7 Eleven,Thank you for being so close to me at 4AM when I want an overpriced banana, silly bands, and scratch off lotto tickets.  You truly have my heart.  I love you.Steph

4.description: This 7-eleven is kinda fancy. They have a menu where u can order food. I love the chicken Caesar panini. However I don't like the over counter ordered pizza and pastries. I feel it's more convenient to buy pizza and donut from those old 7-eleven settings.

28.description: Danyel is extremely thorough and knowledgeable when it comes to hair! She did a fantastic job with turning me back into a blonde from a much different color, when I literally thought my hair would fall out from the process. I also appreciated that I did not feel rushed as I have at other salons- she was very particular and careful with my hair. She's also fun to chat with when you're having a long process like I had done! I would absolutely recommend Danyel for any hair services.

1.description: I went here to get a balayage and I left happy until I disected my hair at home and saw the mess that it had become.  I admit, I went there with my hair grown out and was in desperate need to fix it but never did I think that I would leave hating it even more. I specifically asked for a dark blonde and I came out looking like a spotted leaopard!!!  I asked to stay away from golds so she gave me copper hair.  She put all of these awful chunky highlights down the middle of my hair, so now I am forced to part my hair to the side or wear it in a high bun to hide these hideous highlights. I seriously don't know how much clearer I needed to be! I even showed her a picture of what I wanted.  When I asked my stylist from San Francisco he said the bottom should not have been highlighted because I did not ask for a lighter color. She double processed it when it was not necessary!  Once I sent her a text to tell her what was wrong she said she would fix the problem for free, but I do not think she really knows how to color blonde hair or any hair at all!!I will now have to pay $300 to get this mess corrected! Being upset is an understatement!If you love your hair stay away from this stylist!

9.description: This review is long overdue but Danyel did a really nice job on a last minute up-do for me last summer. I found her through her yelp reviews, and she came on very little notice and drove from her home on her day off to do my hair for a wedding. I loved the up do. It was lovely and I got lots of compliments on it (pics to follow soon). She also did my make-up but didn't have much time to spend on it because I was running late, but she did a good job considering. I would just recommend that she increase her make-up selection if she wants to also do make-up.Overall, I thought she was fabulous and was especially great at up-do's which is really the only service I used her for. Her customer service was also wonderful-- from driving last minute from her home to accommodate me, to driving all the way to my hotel afterwards to drop off my phone charger that I had left behind. Talented and a sweetheart! I would definitely go back to her to try her other services next time I am in Chicago

29.description: Danyel was the first stylist that I tried when I moved to Chicago and she became the last stylist that I tried. She has a lot of talent and is extremely professional. These two qualities are hard to find in the same person. I had recently went natural and other stylists did not want to 'deal' with it. Danyel embraced the challenge and made my hair look beautiful and healthy. She is always following up on trends and new hair innovations and fully embraces hair as her craft. I would definitely recommend her to anyone that is looking for a versitile and knowledgeable stylist.

23.description: Based on yelp, I went with a groupon deal for what was advertised as a Brazilian treatment over a month ago. I have had this treatment before in NYC so i knew what to expect and i know what needs to be done to extend the effects of the treatment. One thing i noticed was that Danyal nor I wore a face mask which is because this wasn't really a Brazilian treatment with formaldehyde that i paid for. this wasnt advertised as blowout either. I basically ended up paying over a $100 for this "treatment" that did nothing to my hair when i washed it 3 days later. she tried to sell me on smoothing shampoo or serum to really activate or keep it straight but i have never heard off it. Glad I didnt buy a 2 pack deal. So I am still looking for a place to get a brazilian keratin treatment which would include formaldehyde.

5.description: Based on yelp, I went with a groupon deal for what was advertised as a Brazilian treatment over a month ago. I have had this treatment before in NYC so i knew what to expect and i know what needs to be done to extend the effects of the treatment. One thing i noticed was that Danyal nor I wore a face mask which is because this wasn't really a Brazilian treatment with formaldehyde that i paid for. this wasnt advertised as blowout either. I basically ended up paying over a $100 for this "treatment" that did nothing to my hair when i washed it 3 days later. she tried to sell me on smoothing shampoo or serum to really activate or keep it straight but i have never heard off it. Glad I didnt buy a 2 pack deal. So I am still looking for a place to get a brazilian keratin treatment which would include formaldehyde.
