The employees here are NOT Einstein's best and brightest.  The customers behind us had to repeat their order (seriously) over 6 times!  What was super weird was that they had four employees...two taking orders, one wandering around, and ONE making the food.  Huh? On a busy Chicago morning, this is not a good plan.If you have another option, use it.

19.description: Ordered two Turkey BAT, one on a Plain bagel, one on Sourdough. Took way too long and still did not get the order right. Observations the same as others. Only one person assembling the sandwiches. Should be shut down and some other franchise should come in and hire new staff

28.description: A very inefficient system and not a super clean facility. It was abnormally small for the amount of foot traffic they must get. Most of their staff was occupied by taking orders on the computer. Have witnessed more efficient systems of order taking at other einsteins. They also did not have cranberry bagels and their trash was full, as well as they were out of napkins.

45.description: Now for the record I am not exactly a fan of "chain" establishments for getting food, but I enjoy this particular chain. You can get lattes and asiago bagels, which is like getting a blowjob while slaying a dragon. But boy oh boy, the employees at this location are downright STUMPED when you approach them. They are not entirely sure they have left the house, and are expected to serve you. Oh, they're nice enough. Downright gregarious. But beyond this character they put up, it is clear they believe to have fallen into their cap and apron by mistake, as if the uniform could be strewn across a doorway like some kind of cobweb.I asked for a veggie sandwich on the aforementioned fellatio-quality asiago bagel (don't worry, I just said asiago)."We are out of tomatoes! You know, with that salmonella outbreak and all." the cashier replied."Great, because I don't care for tomatoes anyway." I said, mistaking this as a conversation."What? What am I supposed to do?" said the cashier."Oh, nothing. I was just saying it's just as well about the tomatoes. I don't like tomatoes." I replied."We... We don't have tomatoes, sir!" I took a deep breath and nodded, adding a dirty chai to my order. I was careful to spell it out and not just use the lingo- I ordered a chai latte with a shot of espresso.I was the sole customer and she the sole staff on hand at this point. The cashier- finished with taking my order- then turned to the foodstuffs and stared like a toy robot run out of batteries.This was so awkward to witness that I took a seat and pretended to have other things to think about. After a while a manager appeared and began to help the cashier with my order. Things seemed to be picking up in pace. The manager then came to me and asked me to confirm my latte order."A chai latte... you want a shot of espresso seperate?""No, in it.""Oh, well, different strokes for different folks I suppose! Have a great day, okay? And come back, we're a new location!"She then poured the shot in with a broad, sincere smile. I picked up the cup and immediately noticed it was really light. I sipped, and there was barely a drop of milk or chai in it, just 90% foam and a shot of espresso in a small puddle of latte. I looked up at the manager- she was still smiling at me. She'd done it on purpose due to some twisted money saving logic! If I had any sense of aggression in my personality whatsoever, I would have protested. But no, let's be clear- when you complain about a coffee beverage a piece of your soul withers forever. You did, after all, ask an underpaid retch to fetch you a drug. Talking down to them makes you an addict so vile you may as well be on heroin. So unless the mistake is fatal (or you are a sociopath) it is very difficult to take a barista to task. So I let my glance linger on the manager... Her smile faltered as my lower eyelids raised themselves in a squint. That's right... I am writing a motherfucking Yelp review about this. I know you're trying to be nice, and maybe it was even a mistake, but you held this cup and you know it's practically empty. You can't pretend you don't know what happened here! History is written by winners, and I will not be defeated by this misuse of latte foam proportions.My retinas are very articulate.

33.description: Holy heck this was the worst Einstein Bros Bagels I have EVER been to.  The service was horrible -- a weekend morning in an empty downtown and it took almost ten minutes to get our order.  Tables were dirty and sticky and there was trash on the floor.  We left as quickly as we could.

43.description: This place sucks.  Seriously, 20 minutes for 3 toasted bagels.  I didn't even get cream cheese!  What a joke.On the plus side, I convinced 3 people behind me in line to walk down the street to Panera for their morning bagel.

2.description: Very surprised with the low ratings with this branch of Einstein Bros Bagels. Service has been nothing but prompt and friendly. I always order the same thing- asiago bagel, toasted with plain cream cheese. It's the same every time- delicious. This is my go-to bagel store.

18.description: Round bread with holes.  These are not real bagels.  The service is fast and exceptionally friendly.

41.description: Here is a fun gameBecause you are super busy, and don't have time to get a real lunch go to Einstein and get a pizza bagelPay $5 for itgo back to the office, open it, and have their packaging(They wrap it in paper, which I thought to be wax paper but considering how easily the sauce permeated it, I would say not) pull off every single bit of cheese except for one small spot. where the paper sticks to the cheese insteadIt's fun.  Consider going back even though the reason you went in the first place is lack of time. Only $5 for all that anger and vexation!Ok, this place has VASTLY improved.  Not only are they faster, but after a couple months of ordering plain bagels I ventured another pizza bagel: it was ina  box! No wax paper! No loss of cheese.  The staff has also gotten extremely competent while being friendly and nice.  It's just a bagel place, but I can actually recommend it now.

4.description: Nothing fancy here, but we were looking for a quick breakfast bite before heading out for some serious shopping and tourist attraction stopping. Found a decent selection of bagels, but not as many as I expected. We ordered and pulled a few small tables together for us. There are not a lot tables here...or chairs. I think most people must grab n go. Most of our bagels were given to us, but they missed one, so I caught the eye of the guy behind the counter and he whipped up another one ASAP. No biggie. We'd stop here again. Glad to have found it.

6.description: Although the location is small and packed in the mornings, I'm usually able to get in and out with my coffee in a few minutes.  Most of the workers are super friendly and sweet.  Make sure to show your Northwestern ID, which gives you a 20% discount!

22.description: This place is hit or miss.  I almost always get the same thing, an asiago bagel toasted with light cream cheese.  There is no consistency at all, and yeah I know people put cream cheese on bagels in different ways but sometimes I'm pleased and get a lot of cream cheese and sometimes I barely get any.I waited 18 minutes today for a bagel with cream cheese.  On top of it, they ran out of asiago bagels so despite having already waited 15 minutes I didn't really feel like waiting at least 10 more minutes so I just changed my order to a different type of bagel.  Really frustrating.It's annoying that when you come here, you have no idea who is still waiting for their food and who already got it, so on a day like today when you think there are 4-5 people in front of you - guess what you might be in for a surprise when they call the next number and it's like 20 away from your number.  wtf.

15.description: A prime example of how so many of Einsteins in this city are being forced to close.  Website lists wrong hours of operation, no direct line to the store (only to the hotel operations who I tried at least 10 times - every time to  be "transferred" aka disconnected.  Hotel employee stated the location no longer has its own phone line because the "store phone got taken away due to the number of personal calls made by the employees"...what??).  Don't try calling this location, it is a waste of time and energy - move along to another.

20.description: This place has so many cockroaches on the sidewalk and up against the building (both dead and alive), I wouldn't dare eat here. Clearly, there is a problem. I can only imagine what the inside of the establishment is like.

36.description: Stopped in for a quick bite one Saturday afternoon and was so happy that I did.  This place is a bit small, there was plenty of seating available and no line.  I had a the turkey sandwich on a bagel thin and it was very tasty.  Next time, I'll ask them to toast it a bit more but other than that, I was very pleased.  My favorite part was the vanilla hazelnut coffee.  OMG was that amazing!  I like that the sandwich comes with the option of fruit or chips..the orange that I had was very juicy and fresh.I am happy to stop back in for a quick and affordable lunch.

14.description: The first time it was alright This time the egg tasted like cardboard. I couldn't make through half of my bagel

58.description: Looks good!!! Smells good!!! Definitely sit outside place or take to go. Simple easy. Only downside I see is no bathroom. But military friendly.

56.description: Burgers are decent, although small and overpriced. They do taste good though!  At around $5 for a double cheeseburger, it's not too bad for downtown Chicago. The service is quick and friendly, and you can also get milkshakes/fries to go with your food.

29.description: Good burger for the price. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The fries are a bit over salted.  I would suggest going with a bit less salt. Like to get hypertension on my own terms.

42.description: M Burger should be known as Meh Burger. First and last visit for me - so few choices about how to make your burger - really?  Being forced to have sauce and pickles because they only make it one way?  No real restaurant in my book does this to customers. Sorry - but being able to even slightly customize is a necessity.

23.description: Saw the signs everywhere around the Miracle Mile in Chicago advertising this restaurant, and my ten year old son though the burger looked tasty, so stop in we did one evening. First impression upon walking in, is "this is it"?  It's smaller than my walk in closet at home.  But we placed an order for two burgers, and fries, and a drink, and got ready to wait.  There really is no place to sit, so we sort of leaned against the wall. No sooner than I had started to lean, our order was ready.  That fast?  Unbelievable.  How is this, absent the use of a time travel machine, possible?  I mean it was "I can't believe it" fast.  My burger was hot, fresh, and great.  The fries were even better - piping hot and very tasty.  Looking at this burger, it is very obviously a copy of the In and Out burgers we have back home, but that was fine with me.  Don't mess with what works.  The only difference is that the burger is about three times the price of In-N-Out.While the atmosphere is not much to speak of, and there are very limited choices, this was a solid choice for a quick bite to eat and a nice dinner.

47.description: Good cheeseburger and great fries fast service and cooked freshhowever the location inside is so small it reminds me of a roach motelThere is basically no where to eat. Tis the season to get sick as well.And your fellow patrons are so close they are breathing on you, reminiscent of a train that you see in x rated films.

8.description: I stopped in yesterday as I was in the area. The staff was all incredibly friendly and nice, which is always a plus. I ordered a cheese burger, the boyfriend said it was good - but it was pretty small for the price of nearly $4. I got the Chicken Betty, again good; the guac on the sandwich made the bread super soggy, and I ate it right after ordering it. I can't imagine what would have happened to the bread had I had to wait a while to eat. I think if if had been placed on the sandwich with lettuce on top it'd be better off. Now, the fries were excellent! Only one size, which is a bit size, and they were $2.50. Seems a bit pricy, but as I said, they were delicious. My boyfriend got a vanilla shake as well; and it was really good (I snuck a few sips). I liked the food and would get it again if I were done here, but $20 seemed pretty pricey for the amount of food we got...that's just me, though! Also, I didn't like that they didn't have any meal deals to offset the cost, slightly.

31.description: Get the dr Betty it's really good. The avocado is really a spread vs fresh slices like I thought but still good combo of flavors

34.description: Don't expect to sit down! Thank goodness our hotel was right across the street. There is MAYBE room for 6 people to sit around the walls. We didn't have room to even stand and wait for our food. Normally the cramped quarters would have made me give an even lower rating but the burgers were very good. I had the Doctor Betty (a Nurse Betty with a beef patty). The addition of the avocado was the perfect creamy condiment. And the M sauce was slightly spicy and quite tasty. My son had the double M burger and like the addition of bacon and sauce. My daughter has a cheeseburger saying it was one of the best. We all agreed that the fries were some of the best we have ever had - thin, crisp and not too greasy. Just wish we could have sat down and enjoyed everything while it was hot.

16.description: Definitely doable!I stopped here for a quick burger, fries, and shake.  I ordered the M Burger, but I think that might've been a mistake - I'm a simple girl, could have done without the bacon on my burger, and I wasn't too much of a fan of the secret sauce.  Doesn't matter, the burger was still good enough to make me come back.  Lesson learned, and now I get the plain old cheeseburger.  Their fries are super thin and crispy, just like I like'em.  The chocolate shake was good - not Tastee Hastee good (ahh memories), but I'll definitely get one each time I come here.Just note that while the staff is super friendly, they're not the smartest.  One time I had a $15 LEYE bday certficate and decided to treat my two friends.  After we all ordered my friend had a taste for a milkshake so I asked if we'd hit $15 yet.  We were told we had, but after looking at the receipt we only totaled $12.  Of course, the girl said it was too late to adjust the order.  Boo.  Milkshake denial will def lose you a star.  Oh, and this place is small with limited seating so don't bank on finding seats during the height of the lunch rush (although there's extra outdoor seating in the summer).  Three stars it is.

13.description: I am starving. And I was really wanting a good burger. Maybe it was the snow, but was disappointed in the burger. Bum absolutely fell apart in my hands. The patty was at least 1.5 inch circumference smaller than the bun and tasteless. Not enough sauce and it just seemed a waste of my appetite. Fries were typical frozen thin fries. Didn't finish it. Heading to Windsor.

11.description: Another average burger place.  Don't care for the bun, and the burger is simply too salty.  Fries are decent.

39.description: I stopped in yesterday as I was in the area. The staff was all incredibly friendly and nice, which is always a plus. I ordered a cheese burger, the boyfriend said it was good - but it was pretty small for the price of nearly $4. I got the Chicken Betty, again good; the guac on the sandwich made the bread super soggy, and I ate it right after ordering it. I can't imagine what would have happened to the bread had I had to wait a while to eat. I think if if had been placed on the sandwich with lettuce on top it'd be better off. Now, the fries were excellent! Only one size, which is a bit size, and they were $2.50. Seems a bit pricy, but as I said, they were delicious. My boyfriend got a vanilla shake as well; and it was really good (I snuck a few sips). I liked the food and would get it again if I were done here, but $20 seemed pretty pricey for the amount of food we got...that's just me, though! Also, I didn't like that they didn't have any meal deals to offset the cost, slightly.

37.description: I came here to get a few shakes for a couple of coworkers. They always have good burgers and the shakes were good as well. I would recommend this place if you're in the streeterville area, or after an appointment at Northwestern Hospital.

0.description: Amazing place!  Quick and spot on service!  A must stop when in the area.  I Recommend the root beer float!

38.description: The food was okay but there is NO RANCH DRESSING. Also they don't offer a combo so it's more expensive than it should be.

51.description: The employees were super nice and funny the service was fine but the food actually tasted so terrible???? Somehow managed to make a burger and fries really really gross and bad...loved chillin with my squad on the outdoor seating, and by squad I mean every pigeon in Chicago with one leg.

27.description: As I'm eating my burger, the entire time I'm thinking "Is this real beef"? It just taste funny. The "beef" patty reminds me of the burgers I had in elementary school, just horrible. There are a lot of other places with way better burgers., Shake Shack, Epic Burger, 5 Guys, Portillo's etc.... Please don't waist your money on this place. I'm still mad I spent my money here and I visited this place a few weeks ago! Never again!

32.description: Portillo's burgers is better and it's cheaper. The M Burger was dry and the sauce was very pedestrian. Sea salt fries at M Burger were skinny and crispy and appropriately salted, which I appreciate, but $3 for some small amount of fries is not worth it.

54.description: Came by for a lunch and because I hadn't tried them yet. I got the M burger, it was tasty and well made but a little bit smaller than what people may be used to. I got the single but I probably should have gone with a double to stave off hunger longer. Also got their chocolate shake, which was great! Didn't taste cheap, tasted like real chocolate, thick, and creamy. I would come again if I were in the mood for a burger. :)

48.description: Service was friendly and the food makes me wish it was closer.  I would highly recommend the M Burger.  You could tell it was not a typical fast food burger.  The M sauce which is just a basic mayo and ketchup mixture made it seem better being already mixed together.  I would prefer to have another choice for sides.  I'm not a big fan of fries, but they were nice and crispy.  The vanilla shake was a little pricey for the size.  Overall it was a good experience, but do not plan on trying to eat there due to lack of seating.

44.description: I love love LOVE M Burger. Their burgers taste so fresh and their fries are to DIE for. Not to mention the lemonade, which tastes super fresh. It's super cheap and super worth it. Probably my favorite burger place in Chicago.

24.description: M-burger is an awesome new burger chain in Chicago. They have classic burgers, spicy hurt burgers, and chicken sandwiches. Each sandwich can be served 'salad style' with a lettuce wrap instead of a bun.The Chicken Betty is a delicious choice, it has avocado on it, and the spice they put on the hurt-sauce can be as spicy as you like it (1st, 2nd or 3rd degree burn) This place also has bomb milkshakes. Standard flavors are available, but each month they has a special flavor (this month was Key Lime Pie). The space is small but has enough room to seat a few groups, there is also Outdoor seating!

7.description: M burger is a solid choice for a "new" fast food burger. By new I mean it is part of the new wave of fast food / burger chains that have flooded us the last 5 or 6 years. Five Guys, Shake Shake etc. They all crush the traditional old school mega chains such as McDonalds; you simply have no reason to go to those places ever again. M Burger is not the best of the new wave but not the worst either. The patties are thin so get a double if you want the beef. I add bacon, cheese and grilled onions for a very satisfying quick serve burger. Shakes are also good. This is a category with tons of competition but give them a shot. You don't have to wait in long lines and they are a good value. One word of caution: these places are small. Most are carved out of space from existing Lettuce Entertain You restaurants (M Burgers parent company) so they tend to be tiny.

49.description: I stumbled on this little place by accident and I'm glad I did! The M burger itself is fantastic. The "sauce" mentioned on their menu which they put on the M burger seems to be similar, but different from, thousand island dressing. That, plus cheese, pickles, and bacon make a great flavor combo. Altogether, the food is relatively inexpensive for Chicago prices and it's definitely worth the extra few bucks to get a shake or malt. The chocolate malts are very good.

40.description: At first I adored this place, but recently the food is extra salty and the fries are terrible. The shakes are good. Honestly, I would give it 2.5 stars and keep it moving to Shake Shack.

53.description: Simple, honest burgers without a plethora of customizing options (read: the wall of indecision) that so often plagues other fast casual places. I ordered the single hamburger - no onions- with a side of sea salt fries. For a Friday afternoon during lunch rush my order came out quickly and was right on the money. The bun was fresh and the lettuce extra crispy for the win. The fries were fresh and worthy of a splurge. I was lucky in that I didn't have any problems finding a seat and appreciated that the layout featured tables and counter seating within the space, without leaving customers to wander the surrounding food-court seating in search of a place to park it. For quite a while, Epic Burger has been my spot to satisfy my inner carnivore unless of course I am deciding to upscale-it and go for III Forks sliders. It looks like there is a new contender in town, as I am now a convert to M Burger when the craving strikes.

30.description: Fries are good when fresh, thin and crisp.  But burger was cold and not good.  Trying to be an n and out burger, but not close.

46.description: Definitely doable!I stopped here for a quick burger, fries, and shake.  I ordered the M Burger, but I think that might've been a mistake - I'm a simple girl, could have done without the bacon on my burger, and I wasn't too much of a fan of the secret sauce.  Doesn't matter, the burger was still good enough to make me come back.  Lesson learned, and now I get the plain old cheeseburger.  Their fries are super thin and crispy, just like I like'em.  The chocolate shake was good - not Tastee Hastee good (ahh memories), but I'll definitely get one each time I come here.Just note that while the staff is super friendly, they're not the smartest.  One time I had a $15 LEYE bday certficate and decided to treat my two friends.  After we all ordered my friend had a taste for a milkshake so I asked if we'd hit $15 yet.  We were told we had, but after looking at the receipt we only totaled $12.  Of course, the girl said it was too late to adjust the order.  Boo.  Milkshake denial will def lose you a star.  Oh, and this place is small with limited seating so don't bank on finding seats during the height of the lunch rush (although there's extra outdoor seating in the summer).  Three stars it is.

1.description: Tiny, tiny burger place. Maybe 8 people can seat here if they share tables. However, the cooker hoods are so effective that you don't smell like fast food after you dine here which I actually didn't expect.Burgers were good but nothing exceptional. I also had a Vanilla milkshake which tasted very average and was mostly icecream and therefore I had to use a spoon.Overall, this place has nothing on Shake Shack unfortunately which remains my favorite for fast food in Chicago. I suggest to go elsewhere unless you are literally standing in front of this place and the burger cravings are too strong.

55.description: This place serves a better than average fast food burger, along with good fries and shakes.The bun is "eh" -- nothing you wouldn't see in any fast food place.  The meat is cooked properly (definitely not over cooked as in other places) and the sauce and other things tend to be fresh and crisp.  Fries are thin and tasty.Chicken sandwiches are also good.The issue people have here tends to be on expectations. The burger is a fast food burger. It is not David Burke's.  Same for other things on the menu. For context, think about a McDonald's, but with pleasant staff and a better quality product. Prices are also a bit higher, but not dramatically.Living in the area, this tends to be my go-to place for a quick  burger. It is fast, relatively good, and a decent value.One last note -- a reviewer below was outraged that the person from M  Burger told her the outside dining area is small. I agree with M Burger on that one. There are a few tables, but at lunch hour, don't count on getting one. If you want to enjoy the meal outside, you probably need to walk a few blocks to the park around the Water Tower.

9.description: Very small burger place, no more than 10 people can fit inside, there are only seats for a few people. However they are good at processing orders and food comes fast.The food is good, even though not exceptional. But for a burger chain, I liked it :)One great thing about the place is the terrace outside: they have lots of tables and benches you can sit on, and when the weather is good, it just feels great to be able to have lunch here.Also, the location is nice, right by Michigan Avenue: if ever you are hungry and want to have quick affordable and decent food between two stores, or simply because you are passing by, M-Burger is a fine place!Conclusion: 3* only because I am a gourmet, otherwise it would totally deserve 4*.

26.description: MBurger is great when you want to grab a quick bite to eat and you're in the neighborhood. It's better than McDonald's and reasonably priced. Although I prefer In-N-Out on the west coast, this is the closest you can get in the Midwest when it comes to fast food burger joints. However, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here if I didn't live nearby. My personal favorite is the Old Fashioned burger. Indoor seating is extremely limited at this location, so I usually get my food to go. There is ample outdoor seating when the weather is nice.

25.description: heir menu looks extensive so it might be worth trying other things and they do deliver so I'm giving two benefit of the doubt stars. Their burgers are good, but no better than McDonalds and waaaaaaay overpriced. I agree with the other poster that stated their fries soggy. If I would have just gone to Neptune diner I would have had a burger and fries twice as good with money left over for a beer. Burger ur way, please take your gentrified overcharging selves elsewhere.

12.description: Usually good and fast service! Today the customer service not great! Staff look like they rolled out of bed and came to work. Customer service is definitely lacking & they got orders mixed up. Handed my food with out and apology after waiting nearly ten minutes.

59.description: This place is pretty good, well priced. My only complaint is that they don't have enough room to accommodate everyone trying to order and wait for there food simultaneously. I usually get the nurse Betty or the grown up grilled cheese. Their sea salt French fries are awesome!!

21.description: Very small hamburger place. The store is just big enough for taking orders. Customers have to line up all the way outside the place. But the sidewalk seating areas is very nice and comfortable. You need some luck to find a table thought.The hamburgers are really good - fresh and tasty. The chicken burgers are good also. The avocado makes it taste much more delicious. We all enjoyed the quick lunch and the sidewalk dinning experience, which we don't do much under the scorching sun in Dallas, Texas.

17.description: MBurger is great when you want to grab a quick bite to eat and you're in the neighborhood. It's better than McDonald's and reasonably priced. Although I prefer In-N-Out on the west coast, this is the closest you can get in the Midwest when it comes to fast food burger joints. However, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here if I didn't live nearby. My personal favorite is the Old Fashioned burger. Indoor seating is extremely limited at this location, so I usually get my food to go. There is ample outdoor seating when the weather is nice.

10.description: M-burger is an awesome new burger chain in Chicago. They have classic burgers, spicy hurt burgers, and chicken sandwiches. Each sandwich can be served 'salad style' with a lettuce wrap instead of a bun.The Chicken Betty is a delicious choice, it has avocado on it, and the spice they put on the hurt-sauce can be as spicy as you like it (1st, 2nd or 3rd degree burn) This place also has bomb milkshakes. Standard flavors are available, but each month they has a special flavor (this month was Key Lime Pie). The space is small but has enough room to seat a few groups, there is also Outdoor seating!

5.description: When you can't decide between a hamburger and a grilled cheese sandwich, M Burger's secret menu comes to your rescue. Ask for a bacon cheeseburger "Roman style" and you'll get both. Yep, a bacon cheeseburger with two grilled cheese sandwiches as the buns.If that sounds insane, it is pretty extreme. However I must say that both the burger and the grilled cheese are top notch, and the combination weirdly satisfying.Fries and shakes here are just run of the mill. Pricing is quite reasonable. I like this location's ample outside seating, which is nicely shaded. That's a good thing, since the dining area inside is about two feet wide!

3.description: In line with most of the other reviews, this place is above average and worth a stop if you find yourself in need of a quick bovine fix around meal time.Located on the second level of a the complex that contains Macy's, it's adjacent to a number of other eateries, giving you plenty of options. The place is a bit on the cramped side, but it works, given the seating for around 30 people. The line queues up on the left and you wait on the right. Menu is simple with 4 or 5 burger options (the M burger was solid - Burger + Bacon = Bliss), a non-meat option (The nurse burger - though this can be obtained con carne) and chicken or turkey options. The fries were excellent, crispy, lightly salted and with a little skin left on them.We finished off with a couple Malt's for us and the kiddos. They were boss! Thick ice cream, legit dark chocolate and just enough that we felt like we got our money's worth, but without it being so big that we couldn't get through it. The ice cream fixins looked great and are certainly something we'll be back for in the future!Very friendly and helpful staff who move things along, but don't get snippy with you - a good mix.The whole experience was similar to Dick's in Seattle, but inside a food court. Relatively quick and actually tastes like it was cooked, not just reheated. Worth checking out if you're in the area, but not a go out of your way to try type spot.

35.description: My wife and I dropped by for a quick bite to eat. The staff was friendly and our order was done quickly. I had a double cheeseburger, fries, and a shake. My wife had a cheeseburgers, fries, and a shake and it was approx. $22.  If you're familiar with Five Guys Burgers and Fries I would call this restaurant their baby brother. Food was good, and I would come back. However, a bit on the pricey side.

19.description: Small place. Burgers, chicken sandwiches and fries are good and fresh. Fries are a bit salty for my taste. Burgers are nothing special. During the summer they have special shakes and lemonades. Not too bad a price either, about 8 dollars will get you a burger and fries.  They also have a patio area in the summer.

28.description: Since I was walking around downtown and got hungry I found this place very close by Michigan avenue where I  just found the perfect place.  In fact I was pretty hungry, this place had just the right food that I needed.  I had the M-burger double and a hot fudge. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. What is interesting about this place is the outdoor seating.  They have a couple tables which is perfect place to enjoy your meal. I love places like this.  After enjoying this meal I got my energy back so I could walk around the places I needed to go.

45.description: Imagine In-N-Out but with bacon - seriously was great. Get a double or two of them if your actually hungry.

33.description: There are already something like 4,356 reviews of M Burger already, so what can I really add to the discussion that hasn't already been said?Wait, why has that stopped me before?The M Burger (double) with fries and a chocolate shake is my go to here.  And indeed, it is A-OK.  Nothing fancy, nothing special.  A-OK.  When I unwrapped my M Burger, the cheesy goodness spreads off the bun and rewards you with a bit of cheese paper to lick.  The fries are french and fried.  The shake is chocolate.  Everything as advertised with minimal waiting, no fuss, and no drama.  You order the food off the sparse menu and within a couple of minutes, someone hands you a brown paper bag with your treasures.All of this cost just a bit north of $12.  More expensive than a typical fast food place for sure, and it is better than a typical fast food place...but if you are the type that calculates your ROI on a quick lunch, you are probably going to be disappointed.Is it worth the visit?  Yes, especially when you are staying at the Hampton-Homewood hybrid across the street.  And that is probably where you will be eating your treasure because there are a total of 8 seats in the 'dining room.'  Yep, I counted them.  Two tables, each have two chairs and not room enough to slide another one over.  The remaining 4 chairs have cramped homes under a counter adjacent.  The kitchen is twice the size of the dining room.  In short, you aren't coming to M Burger for the vibe or the ambience, you are coming here to feed the hunger in your tummy. In in that measure, it succeeds.  I'll probably be back because between the walk across the street, the time to order and receive, and the time to get back to my humble abode for the week is a grand total of 8 minutes.  Unless those damn kids are playing on the elevators again.

43.description: Good option if you're craving a simple classic beefy burger. Love the fries too.

2.description: It's quick, decent food. I had maybe 20 minutes for lunch and this served the purpose. I ordered a Hurt Burger Lettuce Wrap (no bun) & fries. It was good. The jalapeño and lettuce was fresh. The pattie reminded me of a frozen style Jimmy Dean. The fries were in between shoe string and normal cut. They were really enjoyable. You gotta accept it for what it is before going in.

18.description: I didn't think it would be all that because it's a small tiny place but their burgers were amazing.. GET THEIR PEANUT BUTTER ICE CREAM. It's like ice cream coated with crunch bar type stuff and it's sooo delicious

41.description: My M Burger experience was ok. The burger was cold but the fries where hot, and the shake was a little watery for my liking. I've been to better places then M Burger.

52.description: Been here twice.Does the "M" stand for Mediocre?  That's about what it is.  Not great, not bad, just...mediocre.Pretty good if you need a burger fix, but Portillo's is way better!

50.description: Overpriced for what it is.  Small portions.

4.description: I chose this burger place because it is close to the hospital.  It was average.  Nothing really stood out to me.  The burger patty was the size of a mcdonalds burger the bun was no different then one I could grab at the grocery and the fries had nothing to make them stand out either.  The chocolate shake was too rich for me but some may like that.  The price was a good value for being downtown.

6.description: Very small hamburger place. The store is just big enough for taking orders. Customers have to line up all the way outside the place. But the sidewalk seating areas is very nice and comfortable. You need some luck to find a table thought.The hamburgers are really good - fresh and tasty. The chicken burgers are good also. The avocado makes it taste much more delicious. We all enjoyed the quick lunch and the sidewalk dinning experience, which we don't do much under the scorching sun in Dallas, Texas.

22.description: When you can't decide between a hamburger and a grilled cheese sandwich, M Burger's secret menu comes to your rescue. Ask for a bacon cheeseburger "Roman style" and you'll get both. Yep, a bacon cheeseburger with two grilled cheese sandwiches as the buns.If that sounds insane, it is pretty extreme. However I must say that both the burger and the grilled cheese are top notch, and the combination weirdly satisfying.Fries and shakes here are just run of the mill. Pricing is quite reasonable. I like this location's ample outside seating, which is nicely shaded. That's a good thing, since the dining area inside is about two feet wide!

15.description: They make an amazing burger! I had chicken as well which I ordered Roman style; meaning instead of buns they put it between 2 grilled cheeses! I LOVED it. The only reason I was split on my review was because of the seating. There is almost no seating at all in the restaurant; maybe enough for 3-4 people but that's it! Food is undeniable good though!

57.description: Grabbed a quick lunch here last week while in town for a few days.  Burger was simple but tasty.  I ordered a single patty cheeseburger, with their traditional toppings (lettuce, pickle, onion, some sort of sauce).  It was pretty good for a quick burger, although in hindsight, I should have ordered double patties for a better meat-to-bun ratio.  Fries were hot and fresh.Best bonus:  Fresca on the fountain soda machine!  I've never seen this before (do I live under a rock?!) and I was a little too excited.  If you need a quick, easy, no frills meal near Water Tower Place, check out M Burger.

20.description: Loved this  burger no hormones beef. The small burger was just right size. Tasty sauce and great fries.

36.description: Grabbed the Hurt Burger, fries, and chocolate shake for a quick lunch. Other than the surprise of mayo (bleh) on the burger, it was delicious. Staff was busy but still friendly.

14.description: This was my first time at this particular location and it is based on this location alone that I gave 2-stars. I don't believe I have spoken to a more incompetent associate in a long time. From not telling us that they have a patio RIGHT OUTSIDE to obliterating our order, I thought: this can't be real, people like this aren't real. But back to the patio thing for a second: over the phone, he told us that their location was very small and didn't have much seating: "it's more of a carry-out" location. What he failed to tell us was that they have a BIG A$$ PATIO RIGHT OUTSIDE. SMH. Anyway, the food was as expected and definitely satisfied my craving.

58.description: Great location, except for the flies and bugs. Chicken was undercooked and worst service ever! And not clean. Just stick to a beer and skip the food.

56.description: I really want to give this place more stars! The location is amazing and the view is spectacular. Was with a group and 5 ladies and we had a great time here but we all wished the service had been better. I hate when I visit an establishment and feel as though I am bothering the server. I mean,  at least pretend like you really care about your guests. The place was not even halfway full.  The busboy was way more accommodating than  the waitress. Actually the busboy totally rocked and I wish we  could have tipped him instead of the waitress! He would have gotten a much bigger tip. The bugs can get annoying but the place is also small dog friendly. The food was actually decent. No one really had any complaints in that area. Drinks are a little pricey but were decent as well. Also,  the bathroom was borderline filthy!

29.description: Service was below average, especially considering the place was not busy at all.  From our order, the iced coffee was warm, the gelato tasted like everything else stored in the freezer.  But worst of all is their ability to do math.  There is a 1% charge for being on the lakeshore, however is not really 1%, (our bill was $23 and the charge was 0.26), this amount is also taxable and they include an 18% tip automatically whether the service is deserving if it or not. Furthermore, when I calculated the % charged for taxes, they round UP your bill (if the total is $1.201 for taxes, they charge you $1.21).  When I started asking questions about the bill, they treated me poorly and gave me attitude, 'because it was just 26 cents!', but they are MY 26 cents and you need to prove I owe them to you for me to pay them!  Horrible overall.

42.description: Memorial Day weekend was packed but  they still have us a great table to hang out and do some quality daydrinking!  Food hit the spot nicely.  The menu had a nice balance of your standard favorites and some newer stuff that I'll try my next go around.  Waitress and staff were prett attentive so none of us had to wait long to get refils/food/etc.   Definetly one of the cooler beach spots in Chicago.  Highly recommended

23.description: No idea why anyone wouldn't like this place, it was great and on the beach.  Food was surprisingly good and if the weather cooperates it's one of the better spots in the city to enjoy a bite or a drink.

47.description: The only thing this place has going is location and good drinks- as long as you don't mind waiting 30 min to see your server.  On my way to the restroom we got challenged and told that restrooms are for "paying customers only"... After we ordered 6 cocktails and dinner...Our food took 45 min when the restaurant was at 1/3 capacity and came out undercooked and inedible...Boo Oliva, boo...

8.description: Should've act my rule which is "do not go if yelp has less than 3 stars"Waitress service: where is my waitress?? I had to ask another waiter for my service. Seriously, where is she????Food: my souvlaki was under cooked and rough rough!! I had to returned to the shelf. Lamb burger is so so. Seriously where is my waitress??? Had to wait so lobg to cancel my food. Yeah it took so long I was full with my beer!! Too many flies also not pleasant......I will not go back...too bad it is by the beach sand...

31.description: The place is located right on the beach so it's perfect for people watching and taking in the great view!  We sat in the lounge chairs in the sand.  No charge for these FYI!  Great bar selection and a full menu filled with beach bite to sit down entrees.  I had the chop chop salad and thoroughly enjoyed every last bit!  Because we were no at a table there was no service staff and at first they would not allow us to order food because we were sitting on the patio.  With a little coaching I talk the girl into just waving me down when the food was ready!

34.description: Caffe Oliva Atmosphere: 4.8 Service: 4.1 Food: 3.5 Value: 3.8 Favorite thing about the night: The view, the people. the wings and calamari View Love the outdoor venue-great view-great friends Friends + view Was like I was on vacation in my own city Loved the wings The beach, the city,vacation I love this place Nicole was very sweet and helpful Great view and great company The food is better than expected Least favorite thing about the night: Eric won't watch the world cup with us No Terri or Aimee Serving utensils kind of scarce Terri and Aimee bagging on us Limited venue No Aimee and Terri No live music Need a little more variety on the menu-white meat chicken, please Overall Assessment: Awesome place to chill-we'll always go back Fun place Food and drink were really good! Great value-not for naturalists Something different Not fancy, but fun Felt like I was in Florida! A great casual spot to enjoy the city in the summer Would go back for sure!

16.description: Wow, I really wanted to like this place due to the location and being right on the water. Unfortunately the wait staff seemed clueless and I had to ask the hostess and then another staff member if they could send someone to take my order. I had several waiters walk right past me multiple times as if I was invisible.  Great way to make your potential regular guest feel! These kids need some basic customer service training and its apparent the management team doesn't watch over the floor and has dropped the ball on so many levels here.  Food was average at best. What a waste of a great property.

13.description: This is a great little place to stop and relax on your walk/bike/rollerblade ride. Their iced tea is actual tea that is chilled and served with ice and not the sugary snapple kind of concoction. Very refreshing. Will definitely be back here.

11.description: I went to this place on Monday, July 27th at 4pm. At 4:28pm, I was still sitting there. All wait staff ignored me while they helped 4 people that walked in after I did.  The guy sitting next to me at the bar has even gotten irritated by this. I then yelled "can I order"? The waitress came over and said she didn't see me and I looked so comfortable, I didn't seem to need any help. I told her I had been there a half hour and she said, naw, you weren't here that long. After debating about how long I was there she said well, what do you need. I told her I didn't like her response and I did not NEED anything from her and left. The racism in this country is beyond tolerance.

39.description: By far one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago! The food is incredible.. I had the fish tacos, buffalo wings, truffle fries, and guacamole! All fantastic! Not to mention the great views of the city and Lake Michigan! Great cocktails as well! Try the white mojito! Don't understand the poor reviews, maybe those people need to give it another shot! If you don't come here you will be missing out!

37.description: Should've act my rule which is "do not go if yelp has less than 3 stars"Waitress service: where is my waitress?? I had to ask another waiter for my service. Seriously, where is she????Food: my souvlaki was under cooked and rough rough!! I had to returned to the shelf. Lamb burger is so so. Seriously where is my waitress??? Had to wait so lobg to cancel my food. Yeah it took so long I was full with my beer!! Too many flies also not pleasant......I will not go back...too bad it is by the beach sand...

0.description: This is a cool lakeside bar. The atmosphere is relaxed and the drinks offered are the typical favorites you'll find at most places. It's basically a fixed-up wood framed bar with cabanas situated beside the Lake Michigan shore. Definitely looks like a summer hangout.The menu consists of a few mixed drinks and there's a decent beer list. You'll also find some Mediterranean inspired food on the menu, just in case you need to munch on something while you have some drinks.If ever you're looking to get a little buzz in the open air while you jam out to some classic rock songs then check out Caffé Olivia.

38.description: What a great spot! Awesome location and the food is really good - definitely best on the beach! Everything is fresh and the menu is really creative. Definitely recommend Caffe Oliva!

51.description: What a waste of my time! Not only was there no one at the host stand, but the host cursed when she approached me. Said there was a wait for a table, but I could order food at the bar. Went to the bar where I sat without being noticed for 13 min until I asked the bartender ( brunette female) if I need to get in line near the beer garden just to get a menu. Keep in mind there was only 3 people sitting at the bar including myself and two bartenders. After several more minutes, I had enough and left. If you are looking for horrible service with a side of attitude - this is your place! I'm going to head to Navy Pier instead.

27.description: After long day biking at the lake I decided to stop in this beautiful restaurant/bar by the lake. I really have to say it was so nice to stopped here. This place is so relaxing and eat/drink near water Is a A+.  Staff are  also great very  friendly and prices is reasonable. This is truly a hidden pearl in the city that everyone should try it.

32.description: This notoriously mismanaged place has lived up to its reputation. I decided to give it a try - will never be back again.Here's my experience at ol' Caffe Oliva - I went to the bartender to be seated. She said because I was one person I had to sit at the bar because it wasn't worth the waitress to serve a party of one. It's my day off, I wanted to enjoy the beautiful sunshine and the city view, so I asked to sit at a table anyways. She rolled her eyes and said sure. Trying to not let her ruin my good mood I just said thanks and sat down. While waiting, waitresses sat other tables, took other orders, and completely ignored me. 15 mins later I left, and went to oak street beach where I had a lovely meal with great service. Don't wast your time with this tourist trap!

54.description: Not to be confused with Caffe Olivia which does not exist this place is great. Having a real restaurant on the beach with private chairs and a full bar is awesome. Great food not bar foodGreat service (ask for Allie)Management and owners are very nice.Reggae on SaturdaysGreat for lunch or dinner or just drinksA true hidden gem, check it out

48.description: We headed back here yesterday on the lingering-polar-vortex-weather delayed opening day for this season. The "new" 2014 Olivia features a slightly expanded menu and a significantly expanded bar with a better layout. The atmosphere is definitely beachy and casual, if you are expecting fine dining service at a beach shack like most of the negative reviewers here seem to then try going up to Oak Street Beach or Castaways and see how that works out for you. We still love this place, our friendly bartender Jerrica politely introduced herself, both the chef and the owner checked on us, our food was great, the "Chicago Mule" was huge, strong, and the ginger beer had a nice bite to it, and of course the location seals the deal. This is still a big step above every single other option on the lakefront in Chicago and we are happy it's finally open for the summer!

44.description: OMG.  Cool location but they RAN OUT OF FOOD Memorial Day 1:30pm.  Kitchen staff didn't show up.  Servers tried but ultimately couldn't make up for this disaster.   Customers everywhere complaining.

24.description: I got suckered into the location, but I should've listened to the reviews.. They are all spot on. It took 15 mins for me to get my beer and I only ordered hummus, which was nasty. The best part of the meal was the carrots. Burn me once...  Never again. Also, way too many bugs.

7.description: STAY AWAY! This place is HORRIBLE! Not only is the food bad but it comes out of buckets that have been sitting there all day. My wife and I felt very sick after eating there. And it's not sanitary... Found a mosquito baked into the bread and waitress kept picking up and hugging a customer's dog then turns around to serve food without washing her hands. I wish there was a way to give negative stars :/

49.description: We stumbled upon this place while walking through the park and were so glad we did. We bought a few beers and enjoyed the view of the beach. Our phones were about to die and when we asked if there was a place we could plug in to charge, the owner was nice enough to let us use his personal laptop. How kind! We sat with the bartender, Kris (sp?) for a long time and chatted with her about everything under the sun. She took good care of us and told us a lot about the city (we were visiting). My sister ordered a lamb-burger at the bar which was quite good but took forever to come out (we didn't mind, though, since we were enjoying ourselves). The fries were also fantastic. It wasn't crowded, but we were there on a weekday afternoon.  I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a nice casual hang out with good company.

40.description: My sister and I happened upon this amazing little place last week, and we are so happy we did! The food was delicious especially the truffle fries, guacamole, and burgers! The chef really knows what he is doing! We had a few mojitos that were also great. Even the hospitality was great, our server, the manager, and the chef all came over to ask how everything was and were super friendly. You don't find that kind of friendly attitude in Chicago especially downtown. This place is an amazing little gem in Chicago, you have to try it out. If not for the extremely delicious food, the view is worth the trip!

53.description: In seven years of living in this great city, Caffe Olivia recently became the source of my worst dining experience thus far. They force an 18% gratuity on you - this is in very small writing and after the elderly ladies next to us got the wrong order 3 times, I pointed that out to them, they hadn't realized. The staff is auto-tipped - could this be why they don't care at all about service? At all. Terrible. We waited 25 minutes to place an order for melted margaritas that arrived 20 minutes after that. Then she says, "I'll be right back to take your order" - we were trying to politely say "we can tell you now it's just a burger and a salad!" But she ignored us, not for one minute, but for 20. When we finally ordered, I told the waitress I had a wheat allergy and double-checked the calamari is sans croutons. No extra requests, she confirmed it doesn't come with croutons and I ordered off the menu as-is.  It showed up with no lettuce and extra croutons. It was just calamari, tomatoes and croutons on an appetizer plate - are you kidding me?? This is now 90 minutes in. We just tell her to take it off the bill and well cash out because it's inedible. She says, "that might take a minute, our managers are really backed up." SHOCKING. Horribly managed, horribly serviced, bland bad cold food. And we weren't the only ones to be given dishes not even made to menu description. They get their 18%, why should they care? It's on the beach and people will come no matter what must be the mantra. DON'T DO IT. Don't waste your day at the beach being forced to tip people who won't service you anyway. If I could give zero stars, I would. Don't do it.

30.description: Over priced.  $8 for a kids meal with no drink.  Chips are stale.  Caprese salad was poor quality.  You have to BUY water.  Not worth it.

46.description: Great location, great decor, but that's where it stops. Menu consist of food that should be cooked in 15-20 minutes (i.e. Burgers, salads, tacos, flat bread) .Took over an hour to get our main food and more than that for our hummus plate appetizer. Server comes by rarely to check in us. This place just opened and probably under staffed because of the Memorial Day weekend. Management did come by to apologize at end, gave discount and gift cards. Said they only have one POS as one of the reasons why they are slow. On a plus, food was pretty good for what it was when we got it. Maybe with time they can improve, but they are a sister restaurant to the Dock at Montrose Beach and you would expect them to be better prepared.

1.description: Last weekend I reserved a cabana at Caffe Oliva for their Air & Water party for a friend's bachelorette weekend and we had a blast. Sarper was a pleasure to work with when booking the cabana and was very accommodating throughout the whole thing. The event was unlimited drinks and a food buffet. The food and drinks were very good. Also, our server Armando was fantastic. He was very attentive and made sure all 11 of us were having a good time. He didn't mind us hanging up decorations in our cabana and even filled up this giant margarita cup we had brought for the bride (since drinks were already unlimited). There were also two other bachelorette parties at the event on Saturday, but Sarper and the rest of Caffe Oliva made sure each group received individual attention. Sarper checked on us often to see if there was anything else we needed. I am so glad I found Caffe Oliva for last weekend because we would not have had nearly as great of a time at any other beach during Air & Water with how crowded it gets during the show.

55.description: We had a great time at Cafe Oliva.  The service has improved since our last visit and Colin was an excellent server.  We enjoyed the lamb meat balls and the lollipop chicken wings, yum!  The bar tenders poured strong drinks and the manager stopped by to see how our meal was.  Overall a great experience, will be back again soon!

9.description: Excellent location, poorly run business. No filtered water served with your food so you have to buy their $3 water. Appetizer never showed. Several items on the menu not available because the kitchen was lacking the ingredients. Lastly, got placed at a table in the sun. After asking whether we can sit in a cabana we were told that its only for larger parties. 10 minutes later a group of three were seated in the Cabana despite us being a group of 4. This place has a lot potential if they can get their act together.

26.description: The location is beautiful. Our drinks were good. If only they came in less than 30 minutes. We had to ask for menus when no one came by to give them. Then we had to ask someone to take our order since no one ever stopped by. Rachel, who finally we stopped and asked to take our order, was nice enough. The food was "quite tasty" per Steve and Erin, but it took another 30 minutes to come. So come for the location, not the service.

25.description: Loved the location and the fact that I could bring my dog and the staff made him very comfortable by bringing him water. Ordered the bruschetta and the ingredients were not fresh and it took an extremely long time. Only had one domestic beer period, as the server explained that they had a run on them? Go buy more? Overall I would say it was overpriced, very small selection on the menu and it wasn't very good,

12.description: Had lunch here on Saturday and it was awesome! The food was great and they have really good drinks. There aren't really any other places with a view like this, good food, service and dog friendly (they even brought the dog a fresh water bowl). I will definitely come back as a weekend regular!

59.description: An awesome concept, right on Ohio street beach but it needs a little work. Knowing it's brand new, service was still very poor. Food was alright. Flatbread overcooked, burnt corners.

21.description: Great place on the beach, but the food is awful. Don't step out of the box. Keep it simple with a burger or just a simple drink. Definitely not coming back.

17.description: good location on ohio street beach. but two cons: smells like trash because there are no dumpsters and also, the food took over an hour that we had to ask for the check before it even came. 2 stars cause the manager felt bad.

10.description: After long day biking at the lake I decided to stop in this beautiful restaurant/bar by the lake. I really have to say it was so nice to stopped here. This place is so relaxing and eat/drink near water Is a A+.  Staff are  also great very  friendly and prices is reasonable. This is truly a hidden pearl in the city that everyone should try it.

5.description: From you the moment you walk in you feel like you're a tropical environment. First the drinks are really good neither being too strong or too weak but the perfect mix, they are very fresh tasting. As a app we had the Greek bruschetta which was great, everything on there was extremely fresh, and the bread held up perfectly. One of the best Greek style apps I've had. For entrees I had the lamb burger which is simply put amazing, the toppings of spinach and feta which melts as the burger sits is just the right amount. My wife had the blackened chicken which you swear you ordered at a Cajun place. Also the vibe of the place was perfect, we went for Reggae On The Beach which just makes the experience even better. With the music, great drinks, and amazing food there is not a better beachfront restaurant in the city.

3.description: I only go here after my triathlon training sessions at ohio street beach, their stuff is kinda pricey and while the food is fine, nothing that special, it also can get pretty crowded and it gets hard to order at the bar or get served from a waiter, some decent beers on tap, it does have a great view of the beach though, i suppose oak and north ave beachs get just as crowded so this might be a little less packed, just dont go during peak hours

35.description: I went here on the 4th of July. Although they were busy the service did not suffer and it didn't take long to get our food. I liked the festive pop rock jello shots, but the other alcoholic beverage I had had me wondering where the liquor was. You can't beat the location of this restaurant being right on the beach. I think it may be a little overrated, but they can get away with that because of their location. Parking can definitely be a challenge too.I had the lamb meatballs as an appetizer and I LOVED them. They were nice size meatballs and they came with goat cheese and bruschetta. I also had a decent sized salad. I don't feel like our server checked on us often enough to warrant the 18% gratuity that was automatically added to our bill. I have no complaints about the service but it would have been nice to have had the server be more attentive to us. I don't know if I overlooked the fine print on the menu about the gratuity being automatically included (there were only 2 people dining), but that was an unpleasant surprise--That definitely rubbed me the wrong way.The bathroom was small and outhouse-ish...I think they should definitely invest in a better bathroom especially when the lowest price for renting a cabana is $500, they should definitely be able to afford the construction, IJS.Nevertheless, Caffe Oliva is worth checking out at least once....

19.description: This notoriously mismanaged place has lived up to its reputation. I decided to give it a try - will never be back again.Here's my experience at ol' Caffe Oliva - I went to the bartender to be seated. She said because I was one person I had to sit at the bar because it wasn't worth the waitress to serve a party of one. It's my day off, I wanted to enjoy the beautiful sunshine and the city view, so I asked to sit at a table anyways. She rolled her eyes and said sure. Trying to not let her ruin my good mood I just said thanks and sat down. While waiting, waitresses sat other tables, took other orders, and completely ignored me. 15 mins later I left, and went to oak street beach where I had a lovely meal with great service. Don't wast your time with this tourist trap!

28.description: This is lengthy, I apologize, but I have to get it all out.I was really excited to come to this place knowing it was at the beach and looking at the menu and pictures.  I probably should have left it at that.1. When I got there the hosts were nice which is pretty normal.  I asked the host if she knew where the nearest ATM was, and she said "Oh I don't know... we're at the beach, so can't plug one up here, we don't have much electricity here either, so......" I let that comment fly away without response.2. When I asked for a glass/cup of water, our waitress said they only had bottled water.  Which is extremely odd.  You serve carbonated drinks, coffee, and tea, which means you should have water.  How are you washing dishes??3. When we ordered alcoholic drinks, I tasted no alcohol.  Another customer at our table told our waitress he tasted no alcohol and she shrugged it off, as to say "so".  He asked for the drink to be made again, and she didn't do it.  I think if I'm paying $9 for a drink, and am not satisfied, the drink should be made again.  The customer ended up going to the bartender who even still didn't want to make the drink again.  Therefore 11 people at the table with $9-$12 cups of lemonade.  Do the math.4. When it came to ordering food, we got the brunch menu.  Someone ordered an item, and asked for no pecans.  Our waitress told her, she couldn't grant that request, when our friend asked why, the waitress stated "All of our food comes off a food truck, so everything is pre-made, so you can't take anything away".  Someone else at our table asked for "no bacon" on a sandwich, so they asked about the bacon, and the waitress barked "YOU'RE FINE WITH GETTING NO BACON, WE CAN DO THAT! BUT WE CAN'T TAKE THE PECANS OFF".  At this point everyone was frustrated with our waitress.  Not to mention, our food didn't come out for close to 40 minutes.5. At some point, our waitress decided she no longer wanted to serve us and our new waiter was the general manager.  He came out the door extremely nice, got us new drinks.  The cook also came out and explained why it took so long for our food to be served.  He also explained that their food DOES NOT come off a food truck and where he got his ingredients from.  I would love to eat here just based off where their inventory comes from.  He seemed a bit upset about that statement. So these 2 stars are for the manager, his actions and the cook.  If I could only deal with these two gentleman I would come back.6. Another issue I had was, since our waitress decided to give up on our table, where was our 18% gratuity going?? I'm positive she had NO PROBLEM picking up that tip with the amount of money spent!All in all, I probably wouldn't come back here, and wouldn't recommend to my friends, or others I come across who may be looking for a place to eat at the beach.

45.description: Don't do it! Waited over an hour for a mediocre flatbread with a waitress who didn't seem to care.Then she have us the wrong bill w someone else's credit card in it!!

33.description: It's hard to quibble with the location, obviously. I was immediately turned off by this: when I asked for water, I was told, "We don't have water, since we're here by the beach. We have bottled water." Well, they do have a full bar, Coke products, and the ability to make ice and food. An obvious lie, we don't have water. Too many flies to enjoy it. I'm sure the location is a challenge, and the prices are decent. The 2-star rating is deserved.

43.description: Location is the only good thing about this place.  Service is probably the worst in the area. Everything takes forever to come. Servers seem non-experienced. Food is nothing special. Too bad it's the only option on that beach.

2.description: Super slow service.  Not handicapped accessible so my sister went from park above to placed a take out order.  She was gone a very long time so I got concerned & went to make sure everything was ok, I had a beer from our cooler as I walked in to the outdoor seating area & found my sister sitting at one of the many open seats with a cocktail from the bar waiting for our $70 take out order. I was told I couldn't bring in alcohol  (I was just there is see what was taking so long) so I threw it out got a drink from their bar and sat with my sister to wait for the food.  Soon we were told we couldn't sit there with our expensive cocktails purchased from their bar waiting for our expensive take out order bc we weren't eating food.  Bar area is crazy with always being in the servers way as they get drinks.  Food was ok but not worth the disrespect as a paying patron. I will not return

18.description: The idea of the place is good unfortunately  the way they do business  there sucks,  service unprofessional,  food was even worse.   i wont comeback ever and i would never recommend  this place to anyone not even my worse enemy.  Seriously  people  avoid wasting your money and go and take your business  somewhere else.

41.description: I went here last weekend for the first time and I dont understand all the bad reviews below from last year because this place was awesome.  Beautiful view, friendly people, great vibe.  I will definitely be going back and I think I found my new favorite spot.  Sorry cast aways but you are just too ghetto now and this place is first class all the way!!

52.description: Caffe No-Frik'in-WayLiving just a stones throw away, we really wanted this to be a great little, beach side  haven for weekend brunches and sunset cocktails. We went twice hoping our first experience was an anomaly. Even one visit was... one too many!Location... 5 Stars.  On the beach 50 yards from swimming and 150 yards from the "playpen."Ambiance... 3-4 Stars.  On warm days you can fry in the overhead sun shining down between widely   separated overhead trellis beams. They offer "cabanas" which are just walled in larger tables sitting 3 feet back from beach side tables... they have no breeze unless it is blowing in from the water, so with the overhead sun they can feel like hot boxes.Service... 0-ass Stars.  The hostess was warm and friendly but after being seated, we watched waitresses walk by for over 15 minutes... no smiles, no hellos, no menus, no water... you get the picture. It took a trip back to the hostess station to get a server to our table. When we watched a table next to us go thru the same for 10 minutes, we directed them to the hostess, as well. And... what a joke... "Hey, self-absorbed server, you're not doing us a favor by   gracing our table. If you want to hang with people at the bar and other employees;   take off the apron and grab a bar stool. The busboy was kind enough to bring the missing silverware and lemon you were going "bring right back" 5+ minutes earlier." Worse yet... only about 40% of the tables had guests/intruders - depending on whether or not you were a server.Food... 2 Stars - Our Calamari was seasoned wonderfully but the bottom half of the basket was     soggy, dripping with fryer grease. - The Chicken and Lamb Kabobs, again seasoned well but some meat was tender     while other so tough, inedible. - We'd opted for Mojitos; rum, fresh mint... refreshing on a warm day. Mine had no   rum flavor, while my wives was overbearing. As for the restrooms... you may want to consider wading out into the lake for a better experience.A PB & J on a towels, in the sand would have been just as good and a lot less than the $140 tab. The Purple Pig,even absent the view and openness of Caffe Oliva, is a greater lunchtime experience and value.

50.description: If I could leave ZERO STARS, I would!  Enough said!  Food - disgusting, service - disgusting, management - mentally challenged with severe hearing impairment! When a local speaks, listen.  They are your repeat customers, however in this case ONCE WAS ENOUGH!!!In a nut shell, Streeterville residents need to step up and demand higher class, better quality and superior service for such an upscale area!  Our beaches are awfully served by less than desirable food service companies posing as restaurants.   If you have an issue serving seating of 75 in "a kitchen the size of a trailer" then don't bid on a city contract!!!  Anyone up for putting together a private beach/floating barge with gourmet food/cocktails and charging a membership fee?  Seriously considering a proposal!

4.description: Anyone who knows me well knows that I'm obsessed with outdoor dining and drinking. Caffe Oliva seems so perfect in every way but every time I come here (trust me. I've tried so many times), I leave disappointed. The music is almost always weird or just too loud. The bartender told me that they don't have filtered water so I had to buy a bottle for $3. One time, I left after standing at the bar for 20 minutes trying to get a bartender to stop actively trying to avoid eye contact with me. It makes me so sad. I have so many fantasies of sitting in one of their booths on a quiet, sunny day, just enjoying the beach and laughing with my friends while receiving decent service, but I think I'm about ready to give up.

6.description: Worst service ever today. Less than half the tables are filled and they still can't our order in. Waited forever on our food and eventually left. Worst temp staff ever.

22.description: The staff is so super friendly, welcoming, and hard working.  Also when I arrived the music was awful and they were kind to change it to make it more customer friendly.  Food is good too. My only recommendation is to ask the people who are in charge of chair rentals on the beach to move their pods for a better view.  What a pleasure it was to be here.

15.description: My friends and I randomly found this restaurant while out for a walk on Monday, popped in for a drink and bite and loved it!  Between the relaxing atmosphere, beautiful views of the city and lake, good music, delicious food and tasty cocktails we will for sure be coming back to enjoy the summer days and those cabanas!

57.description: Underwhelming food and drinks. I saw them turn away a woman with her young child needing to use their restroom. I will never be back and ill make sure to tell everyone I know that takes their families to Ohio St Beach not to give them their business.

20.description: They're lucky they have a cool location on the beach! Went on a Saturday and they weren't very busy. Asked to switch to the table next to the one we first got due to a larger size and a wobbly table, but were literally told by the waitress that she couldn't do that because they wouldn't be able to switch our table assignment in the computer. Everyone just looked at each other and laughed out of ridiculousness. We hadn't even ordered food yet. We were a table of 5, stayed for awhile and had several rounds of drinks. Food was cold and not very good. Drinks average at best. Every single thing we asked for - a new drink or a side of ketchup - took 15+ minutes to get. Drink was spilled on my wife without even apology. Our group just had to laugh at how bad the place was (other than location). At least they took off the auto 18% gratuity after we complained.

36.description: Ok -if you just want a drink-- this is a cute spot. It's not often you have a cafe on a beach with a major city in view. However- beware of the overly ambitious mosquitos which the cafe has done nothing to deter. The food is simply gross. The fish and chips looked like they suffered a nuclear explosion and tasted even worse.  Pretty sure they took a couple of years off my life. The fish tacos were pretty gross, but the potato chips were the most interesting part of the experience. How you can screw up chips is beyond me- but not only were they fried to oblivion- they were saltier than the Dead Sea. The fries were even worse. Have a drink or two but unless they get a new kitchen avoid the food.  I forgot to say that we waited forever for the food. And it was not a busy day or time.

14.description: This is my new favorite place. Beach, sun, drinks, can't beat it. Sat at the bar and Brandon took care of me. Really nice pour too. Food was tasty and reasonably priced. They've got a full bar, tables and cabanas. Honestly if you're looking for a place to chill this summer solo or with a group of people this is the place.

3.description: Took a tour of the new Bockwinkel's today on Ohio Street here in Streeterville - much like its proximity to our apartment, the prices fall about halfway between Whole Foods and Jewel-Osco. Some of the fresh vegetables and packaged hamburgers/chicken parts are certainly prettier and less expensive than Whole Foods, but I stumbled into a few items - boxed pastas, frozen pizzas, some favorite condiments and ethnic fare - that were inexplicably more expensive. (My favorite Tuesday night, go-to frozen pizza, Gino's East, was a full $3 more than I can find it on most places. And a one pound box of DeCecco Fusilli pasta was a full 30 cent more than "The Jewel").Unlike Whole Foods, their $6.39 salad bar is all veggies, with just a smattering of proteins, including large chunk tuna, boiled eggs, "krab" and sliced (dry!) chicken breasts. There's also a soup bar of about a half dozen different simmering offerings, but you have to flag someone down from the deli to portion out your cups, bowls or quarts. The deli has a HUGE offering of sliced meats and cheeses, including most Boar's Head products, as well as pre-made salads and pastas. The much talked about Juicy Italian Beef sandwich ($4.39) will only be available on Mondays - and Friday's famous "Domesticated Tacos" are also a hit at only $1.99. Unfortunately, the deli worker couldn't tell me what makes the tacos "domesticated"...I assume they're simply well trained. Overall, the place is crazy clean, the staffers were very friendly and the layout was comfortable and very bright. The selection was certainly better than Treasure Island, mostly cheaper than Whole Foods and logistically closer than Jewel-Osco...here's to a long future in Streeterville.

1.description: Disappointed. Most of the grab and go food here is of cheap quality. Tried the beer cheese soup-tasted like drinking liquid spray cheese. The wings from the deli are inedible, salty and off-tasting. You have to shift around the salad bar greens to avoid wilted leaves. The store has an eerie atmosphere due to the quiet radio and lack of business. The prices are higher on many frozen and fresh items than whole foods-whole foods! For the quality and price i'm better off popping into 7/11.

2.description: I give it a year. Maybe 1.5 years.To little fanfare or marketing this chain I've never heard of opens in Streeterville just downstairs from home. A newish Whole Foods is nearby and is almost constantly mobbed with people and action. The prices at WF may not be for everyone, but they're for enough people to fill the damn place.Contrast Bockwinkel's which is almost always forlorn and near empty. I've only stopped in a handful of times for "dis-n-dat" but what I've noticed is not too great produce, not too great prices, some bordering on ridiculous ($10 for a 4 pack of Red Bull, which is $6-$7 everywhere else, even gas stations!), and a kind of larger 7-11 feel. It's just plain strange. I don't get it, really I don't.Some other reviews have mentioned the cheapish and goodish prepared foods and daily specials, which I'm sure are fine but I haven't tried.For not bad prices and much nicer stores visit Jewel on DesPlaines (NOT State) or Mariano's in Lakeshore East.My crystal ball on 1/8/16 says Bockwinkel's will be gone by 6/30/17. Mark my words...

9.description: Agreed, some of their prices are high however yet heir prepared food bar is cheap and delicious!  $6.39 for a salad bar is amazing.  It's clean, beautiful and inviting.  Unfortunately it's fairly small however it will do if I don't want to make a trip to jewel or marianos

10.description: I've stopped by this place a few times to get a freshly made sandwich at the deli counter and I love how they make it every time. It's fairly affordable, matching the price of some far less quality products at 7/11 and other stores in the area. For that I give them five stars.
