They get five stars for friendly and always there to help you find stuff employees as well. Today I walked out without buying anything and an employee asked what I didn't find and mentioned that they have a form where customers can request certain items in store- great feature! Now, the reason that I'm giving only three stars- their prices. In fact, the three stars are an average I got by giving their prices zero stars. Today I decided to go grocery shopping in the area and avoided whole foods because there's no doubt they'd be the priciest option. I chose bockwinkels for the above mentioned reasons yet I ended up walking out without purchasing anything. I reached for grapefruit bits that cost 1.29 in target (1.99 here). I then reached for a jacks pizza which costs 3.99 (and today 4 for 10) at target, and 5.99 here. That's twice as much for the same product that I can (and did) get down the street at target. Hopefully they adjust their prices, I know they just opened in the area and are probably still figuring out how they want to run their business. If not, target will continue to get the revenue from people who will very quickly catch on that they're paying twice as much for the exact same product.

4.description: Welcome to the neighborhood Bockwinkel's!!!! Your arrival was long overdue. This place is cheaper than Whole Foods yet seems to have a similar level quality of items to Whole Foods. The meat looked great. The salad bar was fresh and varied. Produce was impressive. There seemed to be more aisles of stocked items than the ones's at Whole Foods. A dozen eggs were $2.19, which I have not seen in Chicago for quite some time. And by comparing this to Whole Foods, I am by no means trying to disparage Whole Foods because it is great - it is just a little bit pricey, which I think everyone can agree on. I see myself going to Bockwinkel's on a regular basis. And to think that a year ago there was pretty much no grocery stores and now three have opened up. Treasure Island sure is in trouble.

6.description: Disappointing. Have tried it numerous times out of convenience, but the prices are terrible. Do yourself a favor and head to the Target Express, Whole Foods, or Trader Joes instead. All of Bockwinkel's products seem to be marked up above normal retail prices. Like literally all of them. Not sure how they'll survive at this rate, in an era of fewer SKU, high value discount grocers. Needless to say, their alcohol prices are also pretty ridiculous.On the positive side, some of their sales mark down items to "normal" prices.  Additionally, their meat is sometimes priced OK - I'll pick up their salmon, tilipia, cod, and pork chops occasionally.

12.description: This is my first negative YELP review. I am inclined to praise great service and outstanding organizations. It takes a lot for me to write something negative - especially because everyone has a bad day one in awhile. However, I had a very unsettling interaction with the OWNER of this new grocery store in Streeterville a couple of weeks ago. His attitude and actions were  abominable. I confess that I ordered some pasta from the deli and began eating it while roaming the store to see what they carried and how it was laid out. It was my first visit. I was wrong in not paying for it first, but certainly had every intention of doing so. I simply had not eaten all day and the weight/price had been affixed to the container. It must be frustrating to observe this, knowing that some customers don't follow through with payment. However, his approach to me was unnecessarily rude and alienating. I cannot imagine that anyone working for this man would ever consider that a friendly, service-oriented approach was valued. Such a shame because I live across the street and had been looking forward to a more convenient stop for food and wine. Not that Whole Foods is inconvenient. I predict the store won't be there for long, but I will never again step foot in it while it is.

5.description: I recently visited Bockwinkel's to pick up something I knew Whole Foods would not have.While I was there I also bought three items that I was going to get at Whole Foods assuming they would be cheaper. All three were cheaper at Whole Foods. Parchment paper was $5.99. It was 4.49 at WF. Three Brothers Sidekick beer was $10.99. It was $8.99 at WF. Frontera Salsa was $4.49. It was $3.99 at WF. Needless to say I was annoyed when I got to Whole Foods and compared the prices to find I had spent more. I haven't been back. If Bockwinkel's isn't in the neighborhood to provide a less expensive alternative to Whole Foods then why are they here?

13.description: They just opened down the street. 3 failed trips already there. i purchased yoghurt on Dec 3rd. When i arrived home, i noticed all of them expired Dec 2nd or the 5th. Really, Bockwinkel's ? that's how you start your business in an upscale neighborhood with Wholefoods a few feet away ? and why is your Chobani Flip 50% more expensive than Target's when it is EXPIRED ? Avocados: so creamy and old. Fuji apples: old. Another type of red apples (2nd attempt): old. $3.5 slice of Chocolate fudge cake from the deli: just awful. i can't believe that Express Target's fruits and veggies (on illinois st) are much fresher. Plus their yoghurt expires in Jan 2016... and their orange juice (same brand) is $2 cheaper than Bockwinkel's. And finally, to top it all, the display at Bockwinkel's is old and cheap looking. i was shocked. These people won't last a long time here if they don't pick themselves up. Won't go there again even if they're just 20 feet away.

11.description: This place is horrible. The produce isn't fresh and the food is horrible. The cook doesn't wash his hands or even where gloves!!!! DO NOT SHOP HERE

8.description: I gave this place a fair shot and unfortunately it was terrible. Almost everything is overpriced by a few dollars and the produce rotten/ moldy within 1 to 2 days. Extremely disappointed and the customer service wasn't very good either. I'll continue to go to Mariano's and whole foods even though they are further from my home.

0.description: Was going to make a trip to Jewel but decided to stop in this place since it's right across the street from me. I was pleasantly surprised to find everything I needed to make it through the week! Also, it wasn't busy at all which was actually really enjoyable compared to having to deal with a ton of people at Whole Foods. I wasn't completely stressed out for the first time while trying to get my grocery shopping done. I hope this place can make a name for itself and stick around the neighborhood considering there is a ton of competition.

7.description: Have officially given up on this store. Went to use my $10 off coupon and threw it away at the store. Went for carrots - all molded. The yogurt "special" of 3 for $5 was a joke. You can get this same yogurt for $1 per container at other nearby stores. Seems as if the coupon was only to bring prices down to normal levels.

3.description: Something has changed in this store and not for the better.  The place used to be better stocked, with inviting floor displays tempting you to buy goods just inside the door.  Those displays are now gone.  Whether this is for reasons of safety, corporate policy or thrift, it makes the store look bare and it is not a good development.Also, I saw a bunch of FLIES in the donut cabinet today.  When I alerted one of the cashiers to this fact, he apologized and then said that they knew about it and they were going to do something to fix it.  The only question I have is why were they continuing to sell donuts out of this fly-infested cabinet?  Even if far worse things go on in the food business about which consumers know nothing, this is beyond gross.  I should also imagine that it is a violation of food sanitation/health code.

1.description: Out of stock on alot of items. Then the cashier tried to tell me she put an item in the bag and she didnt

2.description: Why is this the only late night place open in Streeterville?

0.description: Let me start off by saying that the 4 stars is a reflection of the Latina ladies that work in the morning. They are helpful friendly and they always make my day when I go in there to buy coffee or cheap lunch.Ok so I know that the food there is so not good for you but when you are in a pinch (like the day before payday) and you need lunch their $1 slices of pizza and 2 for $2 hotdogs are awesome. I love that they have chili and cheese so that you can make chili cheese dogs. Their store brand chips are also very yummy and less than a buck. They periodically have coupons on the fridges as well as by the chips that you can save a dollar with the purchase of both which is always a win. Their milk is also way cheaper than the nearby stores which is awesome when I need to buy some for home.Next time you go say hello to Maria and give her a nice big smile and I bet she will return the favor! ;)

4.description: Next door and stocks cheap beer.  Nuff said.

3.description: Crispy French bread, juicy chicken, fresh herbs and spices.  What's not to like on The Henhouse?  Splash a little Siracha and it's perfect.  Big fan of this place. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

1.description: Nothing better than a $9 bowl of "vegetable and tofu ph" consisting of 10¢ of instant noodles, 10¢ of sliced carrots, and 5¢ of scallion 50¢ of tofu bathed in poorly seasoned broth accompanied by a rolled up sandwich bag of 8 sprouts, 2 slices of jalapeño, 1/8 lime, and four sprigs of basil to make you feel like a sucker.Technically edible.

2.description: I work nearby, and my colleagues and I have been patiently awaiting the opening of the latest Siagon Sister location. We couldn't have been more disappointed though now that it's opened!  "Half the size but twice the price" of typical Pho. I paid nearly $10 dollars for a half full bowl of broth and 2 small slices of Roast Beef. You have to ask for the bean sprouts, cilantro and basil--they're not included--and they give it to you in tiny little plastic baggies. I'm hoping that this new location is just still working out the kinks, but I'm not overly optimistic.

0.description: Ordered the Porky $9 and some change. Bread is fresh and good. Ingredients are firing on all cylinders. But the portion size of meat (Steve said that they put on 4oz. Of meat for every sandwich) is sparse. I can say honestly it's a good sandwich, but a little more meat would make it great.

1.description: My first session was with Erin and was amazing.  If I had only purchased one session, I would have given 5 stars.  But, I purchased a groupon 3-pack and I don't even want to use my 3rd one.  My 2nd session was with Holly and was less than 45 min (supposed to be an hr).  I'm trying to now schedule my 3rd one, Erin isn't there anymore, and they can't even tell me what availability they have for a different Esthetician.  Has me very annoyed!!!

0.description: Excellent facial, relaxing spa room and I LOVE that use all natural/organic products! Will be back again and again.

58.description: What can I say about this place? Well for starters it opens at 8:30am which is super helpful. I happened to have a shoot on Friday and had to work all day Thursday and didn't have a chance to get a manicure. I decided to get up early Friday and head downtown to find a manicurist before the 10am shoot. I first started on Oak street and found some places but when I got there of course they were booked. I frantically searched through Yelp and happened to come across Polish and Pour. I called and spoke with the front desk... She asked how long it would take me to get there? I told her five minutes and sure enough when I got there they got me seated right away. Now at this point it was 9:30 I told the manicurist I needed to be out the door by 9:50 (luckily the shoot was a few blocks away). Even after having a horribly botched manicure from Pinkys the week before the (Polish and Pour) manicurist managed to do an amazingly thorough job and had me done by 9:48!I can also attest to the patience of the employees... As I was sitting a bitchy bridal party walked in... The bride was a huge bitch! She was complaining that all of the bridesmaids weren't sitting together. When the front desk lady apologized the bride was still being bitchy. The front desk was not at fault! The only reason that the bridesmaids weren't sitting together is because one little princess showed up 13 minutes after everyone else was already seated and other customers had come in. Yet the front desk lady handled it with ease and was still very polite after all the bitchiness from the bride. The customer sitting next to the bride even got up and moved in the middle of her pedicure to accommodate the late princess. I would've told them to go screw themselves but that's just me.I can't say enough good things about this place... I highly recommend Polish and Pour! I was so happy with the outcome I tipped the manicurist $10 (on the $17 manicure) and gave the front desk lady $10 for having to deal with the bridal party.

56.description: If you can get an appointment at the Streeterville location, the manicures and pedicures are good.  However, it is really difficult to get an appointment.  I think that a nail salon that does not accept walk in appointments is unacceptable.  I called at 11AM on a Thursday and the first opening they had was for 1:00.

29.description: I've came to the conclusion that I will never trust anyone else to do my nails except for Lana and her sister Galina. These two sisters are the Rock Stars of nail technicians.  I went over there last week to get a quick manicure except both ladies were off.  Against my better judgement, I decided to go with one of the other tech. What a huge mistake...she destroyed my cuticles (I forgot to take a photo of my cuticles). Well, I went back today (2/4/2015) and Lana performed a miracle on my cuticles (I have attached a photo).  She is a miracle worker. I don't know how she does it but she and her sister, Galina will definitely my go to girls for my nails. Kudos ladies!!!

42.description: I live close to the Streeterville location which is what brought me to Polish & Pour.  I have, however, found an excellent nail technician, Lana.  The entire manicure is very well done, from the shaping of my nails to the cuticles and the polishing.  Lana is kind, extremely professional and does a great job.  I'm happy I found her and look forward to each and every visit!

23.description: Horrible customer service! I went in yesterday after work to get a no-chip taken off and just a polish change. First, the receptionist didn't acknowledge me standing there for over 10 minutes. Second, after saying they had availability, she immediately changed her mind because I just wanted a polish change. It's unfortunate that one of the only nail salon in the neighborhood has such bad service. I went in there to try the place to see if I could switch to a salon closer to me but I will definitely not be going back.

47.description: This was the best, longest lasting manicure and pedicure I have ever gotten. I'm not even kidding when I say my finger nails did not chip until maybe well into the third week!! Sex and the City episodes were playing the whole time I was there which was amazing. I am making another appointment as we speak for tomorrow.

8.description: Made an appt on Wed for a Thurs gel Mani w/ reg pedi.  I don't live here, but thought I'd give this place a try. Note to self: don't get a gel while out of town. This service was great and there is excellent ventilation.  They do your Mani/pedi seperately, which allows sufficient time for your toes to dry. Unfortunately, my gel Mani chipped on one nail and cracked on another.  I had them do a silk wrap that cracked...this was by Sunday.  The downside is I could not go back to have them fix it since I left to return home already. I think the price is a little too steep as well. I paid $75.

31.description: Thank you Galina at Polish & Pour, you continue to be my favorite nail technician.  At the end of my work day when I get my nails done it's so relaxing to just let you do what you do best.  I don't need to know what color works for me, you just know. For New Year's Eve I wanted a little sparkle and you wow'd me again.  Thank you for truly being the gifted artist that you are as you take such good care of your customers, time after time!

34.description: Galina is the best manicurist I have ever had. I've been getting my nails done for over 22 years and she is amazing!!! Lana and Bema are both second to her, but if she ever leaves, I will go to whatever salon Galina is at.

16.description: When I sat down for my pedicure I said I wanted the callus removal. Suddenly the technician was huffy and had to get a different tech. Perhaps they need to peg down what service you require before you sit down. Either way, they should never make the customer feel unwanted or uncomfortable.

13.description: If I could give no star I will. The WORST Pedicure service ever for the amount I paid. First thing, the receptionist didn't greet which didn't bother me as I understand people have bad day. I have seen other lady was given a nice foot message which I didn't. I asked for french pedicure and halfway of my treatment just to accommodate other group they moved me to different station even though all pedicure stations were empty. And once nail paint is done I didn't feel like I went to nail spa AT ALL. I will be going to another place today for pedicure cause I can't stand my feet like these. The whole experience was if they were doing free Pedicure. BIG NO for this place.

11.description: I LOVE this salon! It's conveniently located 3 minutes away from my work and they have a good amount of staff there so there is never really a wait. If you work at RIC or Northwestern, you get a decent discount (20% off), and they have a frequent club card as well. All the people I have had here are amazing at what they do and they really take their time with it. 1.5-hour no-chip manicures, 1-hour regular manicures, but at the end you have PERFECT nails and polish that lasts for days. I will definitely be coming here from now on!

39.description: I LOVE this salon! It's conveniently located 3 minutes away from my work and they have a good amount of staff there so there is never really a wait. If you work at RIC or Northwestern, you get a decent discount (20% off), and they have a frequent club card as well. All the people I have had here are amazing at what they do and they really take their time with it. 1.5-hour no-chip manicures, 1-hour regular manicures, but at the end you have PERFECT nails and polish that lasts for days. I will definitely be coming here from now on!

37.description: First time in and wasn't disappointed. Called for a same-day appt last Friday expecting them to be booked up, but they had space for my friend and me to get posh for the weekend. I got a no-chip mani and a reflexology miracle 30 minutes on my feet. My friend got a mani-pedi. Kind staff and a nice chat with the owner. I'll definitely come back

0.description: It was my first time visiting the salon. The place was very clean and nicely decorated! Also the technicians were very gentle when dealing with the my padi. Some other places would scrub my feet so hard that it hurts, but it was very pleasant here! I would definitely come back again!!

38.description: Lana was not only the biggest sweetheart, but she gave me the best shellac manicure and pedicure that I have ever gotten. She was extremely thorough and got my calloused skin buttery soft. She also was so considerate to make sure the whole process was extremely relaxing and perfect. I would highly recommend her to anyone!

51.description: Came here to get a manicure while in town for a business trip. It's pretty pricey for a basic mani ($17 not including tax and tip), and I feel conflicted about this place; my manicure was horrible while my mom's was amazing, so I think it really depends on who is doing your nails.When my technician was cutting my nails, she cut them so they were pointy across the top, and I had to ask repeatedly for them to be filed down more so they would be square. She also tried to argue with me about how short she could cut my nails - I know my hands and I know how short I like my nails! Also missed a lot of my old nail polish when she was removing it and prepping me for new polish - I had to point out a lot of old polish to get it off my nails. Didn't adequately soak my nails prior to fixing my cuticles, which led to messy and dry looking cuticles (the worst!!) that she failed to push back enough. The massage was done with her wearing latex gloves, so it was extremely uncomfortable for me and really did more harm than good in relaxing me, and the latex pulled on my skin. And the polish was messy - got all over my cuticles since they weren't pushed back properly. Three days later and my nails are chipped all over - I could have done a better manicure myself.My mom, on the other hand, got some genius nail technician and her manicure looked like it was done with lasered perfection - even, beautiful red coats, cuticles that were all but naturally missing and smooth. I could not stop staring in jealousy for hours after we had both finished. Her manicure looked like it had been done by someone who invented manicures... I wish I had gotten her technician's name so I could mention it here.They are pretty efficient with booking and calling you to make sure you show up for your appointment. They take walk-ins when there is room to accommodate. In short, come but cross your fingers that you get a good technician!

27.description: I know I shouldn't Yelp upset, so I gave a second star because I'm happy with my toes.  But the hands.... oh the hands!I know square nails are popular, but it's just not a look I like on myself.  So if a client tells you that, and you only know how to do square nails, do you know what you should NOT do?  You shouldn't pretend you know what an almond-shaped nail is and proceed to file my nails into the uneven, jagged mess I walked away with.  And then complain that my nails are "kind of short."  Well, you "kind of" took more than 1/4" off when you massacred them with the course file a few minutes ago.  And now they are really short because I have to cut them off and try to fix what Polish & Pour did.And they nicked my cuticle pretty badly during the manicure.  I don't appreciate going around looking like a meth addict that picks at my nail beds.

32.description: I love Bema! She's very personable, conscientious and meticulous.  Her manicures and pedicures are fabulous! I have been going to her for almost two years.

54.description: This review is long over due, because Ive been seeing Lana for a while now and she never fails to do a beautiful job. She is such a perfectionist and it really shows. I am very particular about my nails and she is always so patient, It is obvious she likes to make her clients happy!  I would never go to anybody else for my manis/no-chips or pedi's!

48.description: I know this is a major change after my previous review, as my last experience with this place left with my mom and I leaving very upset and unhappy with the service we received. However Im back to give a new review. I'm thoroughly  impressed with the fact that the owner himself contacted me to apologize for my bad experience for one, for two offered to make up for it by having me come back for the same services in hopes of offering a better experience.  I didn't expect anything to come of my review as I rarely write reviews unless I'm crazy in love with a place, or very displeased. I was very happy with my service this time around! Migi was my nail tech and she was great!! Loved her, my no chip and pedi turned out wonderfully she took her time and was very thorough. So thrilled to write a new and improved review.  I believe it says a lot about a persons buisness ethics when they are willing to reach out to a customer and go the extra step to give them a more positive experience.   Thanks for making my experience so much better and taking the time to contact me. I will definitely go back, and would recommend anyone to go see Migi!

44.description: I was in town on business and was not liking my nail color. I had no chip polish/ shellac so I was unable to remove or change the polish myself. Polish and Pour was right by my hotel and I stopped in on a Friday evening around 6 pm and I only waited about 5 minutes to be helped. I do my nails often and usually I think they look nice, BUT Lana put so much attention to detail behind a color change I really wish they were located in my city. Even though it was just a no chip color change I feel like I had the royal treatment, and I love the color selection. Next time I am in Chicago I will be stopping by for a manicure and pedicure. Great Place! Thank you Lana!

24.description: I know this is the same managements as Arbre but my experience here was nothing like the one I had with Arbre. I came back upset from Arbre so many times. This place is nothing left me that. If you get your nails done here with one of the two sisters, you would not wanna go anywhere else. This two beautiful sisters are meticulous, expert and awesome. They do magic with your short and long nails. My nails were so damaged by another place. I came here, asking for another no chip. Galina told me I need to give my nails a break. She kindly removed all the polish, cut my nails and filed them nicely. It was the most beautiful short short nails that I ever had. I really appreciate that she was honest and didn't put another no chip polish on my nails just to charge me. I have been going to this place for 2 months now and will never go anywhere else. Love them!

7.description: A long overdue review-I almost don't want to write this review because I don't want flocks of people asking  for my favorite person ever, Lana!I first started going here after i moved to Chicago. I've had such a great experience with Lana from the very beginning that I never ask for anyone else. She is super sweet, easy to talk to, has great attention to detail (like when I request for my nails to be cut shorter or to remove the dirt under my nails). She is patient when i take a little longer to pick my nail color and has great suggestions when I want to try a new color. Without fail, my nails are perfection when I leave Lana's hands. I always get a classic manicure. Lana is amazing and has magical powers because my regular manicure lasts for 8-10 days WITHOUT a single chip.

49.description: I booked a group appointment for 10 people for my wedding that was just over 2 weeks away. When I first called, the girl on the phone told me "no problem, we have plenty of appointments, etc...".  I called back the day after with some more details about who was getting what and the person who answered the phone was very rude and short with me. She said that booking my group was a mistake and that she doubted they could accommodate that many people on a Saturday, but that she would call me back in a few minutes. I should have looked elsewhere, but this place was right next to our hotel and allows mimosas and plays sex and the city!  And I have had great pedis there by myself in the past. So I waited... and waited.  I did not here back for about 2 hours so I called them again and was told that in fact they could accommodate us.Fast forward to Saturday morning... we all walk in together 5 minutes early and check in to a frankly very rude and sullen girl at the front desk. We were not given any instructions and she just took our champagne and orange juice and set it on the counter. She did not offer us cups while we waited, did not ask us to choose our colors...  We waited for about 10-15 mins before anyone came over to us. And then still without explanation they took 4 of the 10 people back for pedis. We then had to ask 3 times for our mimosas and they weren't sure which champagne was ours as their were other groups there. The rest of the group was left standing at the front wondering what to do. It was awkward. Then while I was getting my nails done, the girl at the front kept coming up to me and asking who was getting what services. She literally asked me at least 5 times. Each time I answered her. I don't understand why she had to keep asking me the same question while I was trying to relax rather than just asking the girls standing at the front waiting. And I wanted to pay for myself and another girl, but that was too confusing for the girl to understand and resulted in a lot of painful questions. It was so ridiculous the nail technician was rolling her eyes and laughing. I should say the nail technician did a wonderful job which is the only reason there are 2 stars instead of 1. They need to hire better people for the front desk and improve their customer service for me to go there again. I have no complaints about my actual nails, it's just not worth the hassle of dealing with them.

40.description: This is my local nail salon and a good one at that.  It's clean and the staff is friendly. I love how they always show Sex and the City Episodes. Never get sick of it!  Some things to note:* Tip cannot be added to your credit card charge, so have cash ready* Classic mani/pedis are cheaper on Mon/Tues than the rest of the week, so book then and save $5* It gets especially busy after work hours and weekends, so definitely call in advance to make a reservation

53.description: I was in town visiting my best friend -- what a better way to kick off the weekend with a little pampering.My friend made an appointment ahead of time and we were quickly seated upon our arrival. The salon has a sizable selection of OPI and Essie polishes, each brand nicely categorized by color scheme. Have you been to a salon where the polishes were all over the place? Blues mixed in with the reds and nudes mixed in with the purples?!? I can't handle that kind of chaos and appreciate the orderliness at P&P.  Lana and Tania worked on our nails, and those ladies are meticulous with their craft.  They spent time making sure we were happy with the colors we picked for our mani-pedis and were very pleasant. This salon may be a little pricier than others in the area, but at least you don't walk out feeling like you were in a scene of Anjelah Johnson's "Beautiful Nail" sketch.The whole weekend my friend and I were admiring our nails. The polish is so good that I'm still admiring my nails. When I'm feeling meh, all I have to do is look at my nails and I feel much better. Thank you Lana and Tania!

30.description: A long overdue review-I almost don't want to write this review because I don't want flocks of people asking  for my favorite person ever, Lana!I first started going here after i moved to Chicago. I've had such a great experience with Lana from the very beginning that I never ask for anyone else. She is super sweet, easy to talk to, has great attention to detail (like when I request for my nails to be cut shorter or to remove the dirt under my nails). She is patient when i take a little longer to pick my nail color and has great suggestions when I want to try a new color. Without fail, my nails are perfection when I leave Lana's hands. I always get a classic manicure. Lana is amazing and has magical powers because my regular manicure lasts for 8-10 days WITHOUT a single chip.

46.description: Loved this place! such a fun environment with lots of polish options to choose from. I got a Shellac no chip mani and it has lasted over 2 weeks! Definitely will be going here regularly from now on!

1.description: I used to come here on an every other week basis. The nail technicians have always been great. The last time I went here it was in October and the receptionist was incredibly rude and impatient with me. If you live in some of the high rises in the area they will grant you a discount. I had never had any problems before but the receptionist was incredibly rude when explaining the policy had changed and the discounts were different. She made me feel incredibly uncomfortable and as though I was an inconvenience to her. It wasn't busy and she rolled her eyes at me and rudely blamed my building's management and said that she would have to call and yell at them. It was incredibly unprofessional. When she listed out the discounted prices she also listed them incorrectly. I had been coming here for two years and haven't returned now for several months ever since that situation. I'm pretty disappointed in the customer service I was given. I guess that's the way they treat their loyal customers. Sadly.... I'll be going elsewhere from now on.

55.description: I come here all the time as it's just down the street from my house.  I always like it, however today I worked with Lana and she was awesome!  She was really detail-oriented, really nice, and really great at communicating.  I will be sure to request her in the future.

9.description: This is my local nail salon and a good one at that.  It's clean and the staff is friendly. I love how they always show Sex and the City Episodes. Never get sick of it!  Some things to note:* Tip cannot be added to your credit card charge, so have cash ready* Classic mani/pedis are cheaper on Mon/Tues than the rest of the week, so book then and save $5* It gets especially busy after work hours and weekends, so definitely call in advance to make a reservation

26.description: When I sat down for my pedicure I said I wanted the callus removal. Suddenly the technician was huffy and had to get a different tech. Perhaps they need to peg down what service you require before you sit down. Either way, they should never make the customer feel unwanted or uncomfortable.

25.description: I like Polish and Pour and go here regularly because the location is convenient for me.  I usually get a no chip manicure and wish they had more options of colors and sparkle.  They have great massage chairs for pedicures and generally have Sex and the City on the TVs. They do not get 5 stars because it is expensive. You pay for the location, cleanliness, and the girl who schedules appointments and greets you at the door is very good.

12.description: This is pretty much heaven to me. I could spend every day here. I wish I had that kind of money. This is a pretty standard nail salon. They have a ton of chairs (some have seen better days). They can easily accommodate large parties. It appeared to me appointments are necessary. Weekdays may be different though. Things that set this apart from other salons...*Friendly staff!*BYOB*Great polish selection*Sex and the City episodes playing on tv** If you forget your wine there's a 7-11 right across the street. **

59.description: Best nail salon! It doesn't matter who does your nails they are all highly trained and my nails always come out perfect. They last a long time too! I usually just get a regular manicure and they last at least 5 days unchipped and can go longer. They are a little more pricey but worth it.

21.description: I always have a positive experience when I go here. It's clean, cool, and accommodating. Not to mention its a fun place to go with friends, with or without BYOB! The best person here is Narina - she makes sure your manicure is perfect! I have never gotten as many compliments on my nails as when I go to her, and I just use simple Ballet Slippers!

17.description: I like Polish and Pour and go here regularly because the location is convenient for me.  I usually get a no chip manicure and wish they had more options of colors and sparkle.  They have great massage chairs for pedicures and generally have Sex and the City on the TVs. They do not get 5 stars because it is expensive. You pay for the location, cleanliness, and the girl who schedules appointments and greets you at the door is very good.

10.description: Ok so after my first visit the manager immediately reached out and offered to redo my experience. Now that's what I call good business. I was so happy I went back and took 3 additional people with me. The lady who worked on me this time was great, took her time and fixed anything I needed. They gained back a client but also anyone else who comes with me. Here's a new pic of our toes!

5.description: I had a great mani here. It's clean and looks well maintained. Polish selection is great. Folks from the coasts will find it more expensive but that's how manicures are in the Midwest. It's an added bonus that it's right next to a Starbucks :)

3.description: This place is BYOB and hella expensive, but they do an amazing job and have some of the most comfortable chairs for pedicures I've ever sat in. They feel like thrones! I had a really awesome, talented person who was also talkative and fun. I can see that others are not that talkative, but it can be a great experience when you have good friends and good wine and Sex & the City playing on the TVs. Absolutely had a blast and it was PERFECT for a bachelorette party event! PS - My pedicure is still amazing three weeks later.

35.description: My favorite nail salon.  The people are super nice & they do excellent work while making you comfortable. My macurist is Miji & she totally rocks!  She deserves 10 stars. :-)p.s. I could do without the constant Sex & the City reruns

19.description: I know I shouldn't Yelp upset, so I gave a second star because I'm happy with my toes.  But the hands.... oh the hands!I know square nails are popular, but it's just not a look I like on myself.  So if a client tells you that, and you only know how to do square nails, do you know what you should NOT do?  You shouldn't pretend you know what an almond-shaped nail is and proceed to file my nails into the uneven, jagged mess I walked away with.  And then complain that my nails are "kind of short."  Well, you "kind of" took more than 1/4" off when you massacred them with the course file a few minutes ago.  And now they are really short because I have to cut them off and try to fix what Polish & Pour did.And they nicked my cuticle pretty badly during the manicure.  I don't appreciate going around looking like a meth addict that picks at my nail beds.

28.description: A friend of mine and I got our nails done here recently. The salon is clean and there are ample stations to get a mani and/or pedi. We went on a Monday night, but I would imagine that on weekends and around holidays this place is packed. Their prices are very expensive, but if you follow them on Facebook they post deals and discounts occasionally. Make sure to mention the deal when you're booking your appointment. And also make sure to mention the deal again when you arrive. The person you spoke to on the phone probably won't indicate said deal on your appt note. We had to mention to the receptionist a couple times about our complimentary parrifin wax soak-thingy. She was a little skeptical also when we mentioned it. (Even though if you pulled up there Facebook it was on the wall) but she honored our deal even though she was unaware of it. The manicurist are good. But they seem a little grumpy. But if you're coming to a place like this you probably aren't coming alone, you probably have at least on friend with you that you would want to chat with. This place is BYOB. They have bottle openers and glasses for you. And sidenote: there's a 7eleven just across the street that seal beer, wine and liquor. ;)Overall a good experience. Pricey, but sometimes you just want to treat yourself.

45.description: Honestly, not bad, but definitely NOT coming back! Here's why I gave them only 3 stars:Star 1) They were able to accommodate my sisters and me at such short notice. That was very kind of them to squeeze us in even when they're really busy. Star 2) The lady who helped me with my No-Chip manicure was very nice and did a good job in terms of cuticles, filing and etc.Star 3) beautiful interior design. It's also BYOB!Why am I not returning? Apparently, they weren't knowledgeable about the chemicals they're using to remove my old no chip! I've been doing no chip for over a year now and never had an issue with weak nails and painful experiences. My friend who usually does my nails explained to me that they're using acetone to soak. That's fine for regular manicures, but to remove no-chip, it's a big no no. Ouch...my entire hand hurts. Ladies, make sure you ask how they remove your no chip wherever you go...

33.description: Call and make an appointment with Lana. You won't be disappointed.I've been living in Chicago for about six months now and lucked out with finding this place right from the start. As a regular on Sundays, it is the perfect ending to every weekend. Lana is the best manicurist I've ever had, so consider yourself lucky if you can schedule an appointment with her. She makes my nails look fabulous with any constraint, from combining red gel polish with sparkles to "I have an interview in 30 minutes." From a technical standpoint, she is just phenomenal - a perfectionist, detail oriented and attentive. Treat yourself and go see Lana. She's the best there is, hands down.

43.description: We had a spectacular time with a group event for 8 people on 10/18/14. The salon was responsive by phone and email prior to the event and was very flexible in accommodating our needs. All attendees praised the excellent work by the nail technicians, and we were especially pleased with the gentleman working at the front desk who happily catered to our every need. I noticed that he was able to easily help multiple parties, transition the space from our party to the next, and adjust to changing circumstances. We were very very pleased with Polish & Pour, and I would recommend it especially for groups. The facility provided a refrigerator, a table, a tablecloth, and opened our bottles for us. Thank you!

2.description: Worst nail salon ever. I got a no chip there for a special occasion and it looked terrible to begin with and it chipped THE NEXT DAY! Also- they charge $10 to get the no chip taken off, such a rip off! This place is way over-priced and I have never been happy with my services there. I go here purely for convenience but I will no longer be going there.

18.description: I was in town visiting my best friend -- what a better way to kick off the weekend with a little pampering.My friend made an appointment ahead of time and we were quickly seated upon our arrival. The salon has a sizable selection of OPI and Essie polishes, each brand nicely categorized by color scheme. Have you been to a salon where the polishes were all over the place? Blues mixed in with the reds and nudes mixed in with the purples?!? I can't handle that kind of chaos and appreciate the orderliness at P&P.  Lana and Tania worked on our nails, and those ladies are meticulous with their craft.  They spent time making sure we were happy with the colors we picked for our mani-pedis and were very pleasant. This salon may be a little pricier than others in the area, but at least you don't walk out feeling like you were in a scene of Anjelah Johnson's "Beautiful Nail" sketch.The whole weekend my friend and I were admiring our nails. The polish is so good that I'm still admiring my nails. When I'm feeling meh, all I have to do is look at my nails and I feel much better. Thank you Lana and Tania!

41.description: This is pretty much heaven to me. I could spend every day here. I wish I had that kind of money. This is a pretty standard nail salon. They have a ton of chairs (some have seen better days). They can easily accommodate large parties. It appeared to me appointments are necessary. Weekdays may be different though. Things that set this apart from other salons...*Friendly staff!*BYOB*Great polish selection*Sex and the City episodes playing on tv** If you forget your wine there's a 7-11 right across the street. **

52.description: I've been here a few times now.  It's pretty spread out so you get your own space.  Sex and the City reruns on every TV is amazing.  I love that you can BYOB, although drinking by myself seems silly, so I have yet to do so.The quality of the mani/pedi is sometimes not spectacular, but the people are very nice.

50.description: I am visiting Chicago from out of state and needed my nails done before going to a nice dinner. I walked in and although they seemed busy, they squeezed me in for a gel manicure. The girl who did my nails did a great job and she was very sweet.  I'm thinking about going back before I leave because their pedicures looked pretty fancy!

4.description: After having my polish chip from a manicure just a few days ago, I had to find a nail salon quickly and easily accessible. They offer my employer a really nice discount, especially for a salon downtown Chicago, so I decided to stop by after work yesterday. I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door and it only took about 6-7 minutes to be seen. The receptionist, Lisa, was professional and informative. Bema did an EXCELLENT job on my 'express manicure!' She took her time, even cleaned up my cuticles; I was THOROUGHLY impressed with the results.It is a very clean establishment and they have a very broad selection of polish. From what I saw, every manicurist is also a pedicurist. AMAZING!! Needless to say, I booked another appointment on my way out for a follow-up mani/pedi!!Excellent job, ladies and GREAT customer service!!

6.description: This used to be my go-to place for pedicures...no longer. Made an appointment for myself and two friends. Sat soaking for ~15 minutes before technicians showed up for two of us. Ok, I get it, just running a bit late. And sure it was kind of odd when my technician just up and left for about 5 minutes mid-pedi but...stuff happens I guess.Thirty minutes later, one friend, feet still soaking, still did not have a technician and by that point the other pedis were far along. Kind of defeats the purpose of getting our nails done together. Not feeling the wait was worth it, she went to the front desk and cancelled the pedi. The girl at the front just gave her a blank stare and said, "Well, don't you want to wait?" No...not really, that's why we made an appointment! If technicians weren't available a heads up would be nice and we would have rescheduled.  I get the increased prices and the $2.00 corkage fee (which Arbre didn't charge) but these scheduling issues have happened consistently enough to make me a former client.

22.description: This place is awesome! I came in for a pedicure yesterday and I'm basing my review on the atmosphere and quality. First of all, everyone seems so sweet and nice here! Was given a warm welcome from the front desk while I waited for my friend to come. SEX AND THE CITY AND BRAVO PLAYING ON THE TV SCREENS ABOVE. YASSS. The two girls that did our pedicures were so cute and helpful. It's BYOB so you know we took advantage of that. There's a $2 corking fee. I'm pretty basic so I just did "Blanc" by Essie, but my friend did a mixture of two colors to get a paler/nude pink. The nail technician did a great job! It was such a pretty color! I know she used "Marshmellow" as the first layer, but I'm not sure which pink she used on top of it. (Speaking of pinks, they have a LOT of different pale pink polishes and that's my go-to for my nails, so I will definitely be coming back for a mani soon). I got a nice leg massage (my calves are always killing me) and she did a good job with my feet. My friend accidentally messed up her nail but got great service upon getting it fixed. I really like this place a lot! Will be coming back very soon!

15.description: This place is awesome! I came in for a pedicure yesterday and I'm basing my review on the atmosphere and quality. First of all, everyone seems so sweet and nice here! Was given a warm welcome from the front desk while I waited for my friend to come. SEX AND THE CITY AND BRAVO PLAYING ON THE TV SCREENS ABOVE. YASSS. The two girls that did our pedicures were so cute and helpful. It's BYOB so you know we took advantage of that. There's a $2 corking fee. I'm pretty basic so I just did "Blanc" by Essie, but my friend did a mixture of two colors to get a paler/nude pink. The nail technician did a great job! It was such a pretty color! I know she used "Marshmellow" as the first layer, but I'm not sure which pink she used on top of it. (Speaking of pinks, they have a LOT of different pale pink polishes and that's my go-to for my nails, so I will definitely be coming back for a mani soon). I got a nice leg massage (my calves are always killing me) and she did a good job with my feet. My friend accidentally messed up her nail but got great service upon getting it fixed. I really like this place a lot! Will be coming back very soon!

57.description: I booked a party here for my friend's bachelorette party and it was a huge SUCCESS! From the beginning staff was very professional, friendly, and helpful. They easily accommodated our group of 13 girls and had a nice setup for our byob and outside catered food. The technicians did an awesome job on the mani/pedis and were really fun to chat with!! Really fun, cute place in a nice area!! Will definitely be going back.

20.description: Good pedicure but the old town location is by far better,friendlier and you have a full bar. You will have a drink in your hand before you get to your chair. I went with my mom and I went a few minutes before her yet she finished before me...which means her's was rushed and I don't appreciate that.we make an appointment for a reason.

36.description: I am never coming here again. I came here on a weekend to get a pedicure, and they were able to easily accommodate me because the place was empty. The pedicure was quite expensive and average at best. At other salons, they usually massage the foot and/or leg as a part of the pedicure, but this was not included despite how pricey it was. The worst part, however, was how I felt they treated me. They made me feel like I was not welcome and that they didn't want me there. It was like they were rushing through my pedicure to get me out. I felt so bad and I have never been made to feel like that before at any place I have gone to for a pedicure. Unfriendly and overpriced.

14.description: Good pedicure but the old town location is by far better,friendlier and you have a full bar. You will have a drink in your hand before you get to your chair. I went with my mom and I went a few minutes before her yet she finished before me...which means her's was rushed and I don't appreciate that.we make an appointment for a reason.

12.description: Well here we have a McDonald's restaurant.Although it is technically a "local" business (based in Oak Brook), there are over 32,000 of these worldwide, making it sorta, well... not local.  The goal of McDonald's is "consistency" - in other words, a Big Mac should taste the same in Bangor as it does in Sausalito.  A Filet-O-Fish the same in San Diego as in Rochester, and so on.  McDonald's, then, should be judged on that basis along with service quality and cleanliness.With that in mind, this "Mac Shack" fares reasonably well.  It's a little hole in the wall on McClurg Ct. between Ontario and Erie and, as is the case with most urban "Mickey D's", has no drive through.  It is located strategically between Northwestern University's Chicago campus and the bulk of residential high-rises in the Streeterville and River East neighborhoods so it gets a lot of carry-out business during your standard dining periods.  The dining room itself is rarely all that crowded.The food is pretty consistent with the bulk of the other McDonald's that I've visited throughout the course of my life.  I've never had a "bad" meal there, which is all one can really ask.  Occasionally the food is actually really good, which is a bonus but should never be the expectation at any McDonald's.As for service quality, the staff is generally amicable and the food is prepared at around average speed.  The dining room is generally clean and the condiment station stocked.In the end, this is a pretty good McDonald's by comparison to other McDonald's.  Of course if one is to compare it to, say, a local one-off hamburger joint, it's gonna fare pretty poorly, but in this reviewers opinion, that's comparing apples to oranges.

3.description: Restaurant update:I came by for breakfast with coupons for free egg white delight mcmuffin. Ordering was not bad but the food took a while to make. I tried to use my belly card. First of all if you want people to use the belly card why do you keep the ipad behind the counter. The lady scanned my card and clearly it was not working. The lady just ignored it and went back to what she was doing. Ugh.... Breakfast also is no longer a deal with prices upward of 4-5 dollar you might as well pay a few dollars more and go to a breakfast/brunch place around the corner.

1.description: I am very confused as to why this McDonald's has such a low rating! I think that for what it is, a fast food chain, it excels! I have frequented this McDonald's often (being that I live literally next door). I have gone for breakfast, I have gone for lunch, I have gone for dinner. Every time I visit, my fries are piping hot, the burgers are juicy, and the chicken are juicy as well. The cookies are always fresh and warm. and the sodas are never flat. I mean, for a fast food restaurant, it gets the job done. Period!

2.description: Typical McDonald's except for the portable air conditioning blowing like crazy 2 feet from the counter. No wonder they mess up so many orders, they can't hear you!.

9.description: This is a McDonald's.  It has McDonald's food.  Compared to others, this one has a friendly staff and is usually pretty quick.I think my favorite thing about this particular McDonald's is the steady stream of cab drivers that come in to buy a coffee and use the bathrooms.  It's like a parade--stay out of their way.  Or don't, especially if you happen to need a taxi.The one thing that is totally not cool about this McDonald's is that they don't post their hours.  Thus, I have no idea when it's open.  Usually I assume they are open if the sun is out, but it's tougher in the winter when the sun sets at 6pm.  It's a total bummer when you're all amped up about a Big Mac and you get there at 9:05pm on a Sunday to find they are closed.  And it's not like you can get a Big Mac anywhere else, so you just go home, feeling forlorn, lost, and abandoned by the one establishment that is supposed to care.

10.description: SLOWEST MCDONALDS ON EARTH. Seriously. Its. That. Slow. The food is fine in the sense that it tastes just like every other McDonalds,  but don't go here thinking you will be out in any less than 5 minutes. Also, there can be some questionable patrons inside and outside.

4.description: As others have commented, this is simply the worst way to represent a brand.Located in one of the nicest and cleanest areas in the city it is1 dirty 2 Horrible service. 3. Long delays for who knows why4 can never get an order correct5. Did I mention the people they hire are either horrible at their jobs or simply don't understand English well: example - arguing with my that "this is hot chocolate". Insaid "again , it is. I ordered the 'new' WHITE hot chocolate. Seriously??? Am I the first to do this on 12/13/14?It is sad: McDonald's is using quality ingredients and things likeThe small yogurt and others are decent quick choices for $1. The white hot chocolate was actually really good !!!! But not worth arguing over "brown vs white"How is this in business? Can't corporate fix it? Hope they do

6.description: Fresh Hot Fast Yummy! Polite team even when it was busy! Everything that makes a great McDonalds!

15.description: The staff members here do their best to run a reasonably good operation.  I'm a regular customer, so they must be doing something right.

0.description: I come to this McDonalds every Wednesday at 5:15 before my class at the Northwestern Memorial Hospital. In total I have visited this McDonalds almost ten times now. I'm looking at the rest of the reviews on this page and am puzzled by many of the complaints. Of course I might just come at an ideal time.To start with, I get the same meal everytime: the 10pc McNugget meal. The time it takes from the moment I step into this McDonalds until the first bite of food has never exceeded five minutes. Normally I expect variation in the taste of each visit, but the food has always been of consistent quality. They have been reminiscent of my most romanticized memories of elementary school lunch chicken nuggets. Really, I have been searching for the past 15 years for something similar and this McDonalds has done it right.As for cleanliness I have never had a problem with that either. Each time I visit, around the time I am finishing up my meal (~5:30) there has been a McDonalds employee mopping the floor, cleaning the beverage area, and/or emptying the trash.Like I mentioned earlier, I may have a biased view of this McDonalds simply because of the timing of my visits. That being said, I have conservatively been to at least 50 McDonalds from around the world and this one sits near the top of that list.

5.description: This restaurant is emblematic of the issues the whole chain is having. The service is awful and can barely communicate. The orders are wrong bc they cannot understand  the customer. The restaurant is also difficult to access by wheelchairs. Odd bc it's right by RIC.

13.description: McDonalds is McDonalds and this one kind of sucks. When I am in dire need of a soda this is an easy spot to pop into though.

11.description: Just had a shamrock shake and a mac wrap from here.. meh.Not a bad place, seems to be consistently popular here.  Generally I avoid fast food and have had McDonald's maybe three times in the past few years.  However, when I do have it I'm pretty disappointed.  I don't know if my taste buds have grown up, but it just isn't as delicious as they used to be as a kid.  Plus the prices are jacked.  I hear people go to Mickey D's because it's cheap, but I feel you get a whole lot more (and tastier) food at the nearby grocery store.

8.description: Went here on a weekend when school started and there were flies flying everywhere.. The staff was very slow and took forever just to make a MCCHICKEN. AND GUESS WHAT, THE MCCHICKEN GAVE ME FOOD POISONING FOR TWO DAYS . This was the only thing I ate all day and all of a sudden I felt lightheaded and nauseous and I stayed up all night barfing and I was unable to go to school the next day. NEVER coming back here again and I recommend you to not come here as well unless you want food poisoning.

14.description: I normally won't go out of my way to get their food.... But on a hot summer day walking around the city forced me to check for a nearby McDonalds to grab a sweet tea. Definitely hits the spot! For the calorie conscious, don't look at their nutritional information, but everyone knows this. The decor is nice, staff seemed friendly. When I first walked in we were greeted by a giant air conditioner... Definitely a relief from the heat!

7.description: This has got to be one of the worst locations. Aesthetically, yes, I am into aesthetics. The building looks run down, the windows looked scratched or maybe even plastic and the inside way too small for the common two-seat comfort distance. I'm scared to imagine this place at night. At McDonald's, I thought you could at least expect a clean, comfortable, well lit environment to scarf down one's meal.The food, you know the food. If you're hungry, you will eat it.

1.description: After trying 3 different rooftop bars in the area, this was the only one that was open to the public. Although the rooftop area is small, it was never really crowded at 10-11PM. There was no DJ, which is neither a plus nor a minus. The wine list isn't very good. I ordered a glass of prosecco and it came in a stemless wine glass with black spots! I thought the glass was dirty, but it's actually a part of the design. Who wants to drink from a glass that purposely looks dirty? They're like tiny black fingerprints all over the bottom of the glass.

9.description: I stopped by on Wednesday night to check out this new spot. I'm always up for discovering a new rooftop, especially when the nice cool summer nights are numbered. Initially when walking into the hotel I really loved the modern vibe. It's very "South Beach". They didn't really seem to have it together yet but I will cut them some slack as they are new and getting the hang of things. The location is very nice and just a couple blocks away from the lake. Located on the 16th floor, the views are pretty, but certainly do not match Trump or The Wit. I like the secluded feeling as it's a bit off the beaten path. The purple lights glowing from under the bar provided a sexy vibe in the summer breeze. The speakers were bumping upbeat club music which I enjoyed, but maybe not everyone would feel the same. Most of the pretty white, plush couches were reserved for "people arriving later" and we were told we could sit there for a little while until the people arrived. We enjoyed some yummy cocktails and pork sliders. Then we were told the people were arriving and we would need to close out. 45 minutes later, the people who had reserved that table never arrived. We had 4 people with us now but they kept beating around the bush with getting us a table, so we decided to continue our night of fun elsewhere. The place is cool but make sure to accommodate the people who will spend money and who are polite. Too bad they lost some of our business for the rest of the evening. I bet that table never ended up getting sat. The views were cool, but I was not happy with the execution of their customer service. There are far too many places in this city that take care of my friends and I for me to waste time waiting for a table on a rooftop full of empty tables.

23.description: The Sky Terrace at the Ivy is an exercise in overpriced mediocrity, and an example of how shiny and new mean relatively little. Its got a beautiful outdoor space, brand-new everything, comfortable chairs, and its all bathed in a a soft purple light, but the Ivy Sky Terrace relies too much on its appeal as a brand-spanking-new space, and fails to serve up the kind of outdoor entertainment you might expect from a rooftop lounge. Competing with others like the rooftops at the Wit or Dana hotels, the Ivy's Sky Terrace has positioned itself as an ultra-premium lounge with cocktail prices ranging from $12-$16 and a large portion of the drink menu dedicated to bottle service options upwards of $350.Even if words like "new", "ultra", and "premium" tickle your fancy, the Sky Terrace will disappoint with its lack of substance. The rooftop is only on the 16th floor, and offers a view of nothing in particular:  you can see parts of Northwestern's Chicago campus, an empty lot where the VA used to be, and if you're lucky, you might get to see some dude in his condo watch a movie in his underwear across the street, or maybe even a nice couple getting it on at one of the hotels in the area. As far as drinks go, you might be disappointed to find that the $14 strawberry mojito we ordered was simultaneously cloyingly sweet and watered down, with very little mint and a lot of strawberry-flavored syrup. Most of the drinks we ordered off the cocktail menu were similarly sweet and lacking in alcoholic punch. The Ivy's rooftop is not without its perks though: the seating is comfortable and readily available sans cover charge (at least as of now, shortly after their opening), and the sound system sounded great without being loud enough to drown out a conversation. On a nice night, I would definitely take a group of friends to hang out and enjoy the weather and a few beers, or it might be a great venue to reserve for a party, but I will certainly be staying away from the overpriced cocktails and perplexing bottle service menu.

12.description: I stopped at the ivy late on  (around 1130) July 4th because they had a sandwich board out saying they were open. Having 2 sets of out of town guest who were looking to keep the night going we decided to go up. We were automatically greeted well, greeted is too warm, stopped by a door gaurd who informed us the lounge would be closing soon,  but that we could order, quickly. Once In, Melissa rudely informed us the lounge was closed now, last call for drinks had been called. There were of course still people lounging around on couches and at the bar. When we asked the door man for the managers name he stated he didn't know. How does an employee not know a mangers name. Well I'd like to come back and actually try drinks. The ambience and view is quite nice. Maybe I'll have better luck if I have the pleasure not to encounter Melissa

21.description: I'm still surprised how new restaurants/bars are not set up properly for launch and continued operations. 1) There were only 2 bartenders for a busy Friday night.2) Only one POS terminal and it was on one end of the bar not in the center so a bartender had to walk to other end to make any transactions.3) The liquor bottles were all on one level and mixed (as at a house party) up so bartenders had difficulty finding the correct bottles/brands.4) One bartender submerged both of his hands in a large container of olives to get them for the martinis. GROSS. Heard of a spoon?I do like the approachable, comfy and loungey furniture though. I'd return since it is one of the few outdoor bars that is open until 1am.

16.description: Decent view and very comfy chairs.  It's not the greatest rooftop in the city, but the bar is pretty cool-looking and I wouldn't mind coming here again.

17.description: I'm still surprised how new restaurants/bars are not set up properly for launch and continued operations. 1) There were only 2 bartenders for a busy Friday night.2) Only one POS terminal and it was on one end of the bar not in the center so a bartender had to walk to other end to make any transactions.3) The liquor bottles were all on one level and mixed (as at a house party) up so bartenders had difficulty finding the correct bottles/brands.4) One bartender submerged both of his hands in a large container of olives to get them for the martinis. GROSS. Heard of a spoon?I do like the approachable, comfy and loungey furniture though. I'd return since it is one of the few outdoor bars that is open until 1am.

10.description: It was suggested that my friends and I check this place out and I am glad we did!  I was alone before my girlfriends met up with me and I enjoyed the view and the drinks.  The bartenders, Doug and Joe, were the main attraction...they were attentive and kept us laughing.  The truffle fries were yummy and every drink was excellent.  For a place that we were just going to meet at and move for the night, we found ourselves so enchanted with the Sky Terrace and the bartenders that we stayed until close.  There was an unpleasant smell in the women's bathroom, but once it was brought to management's attention, they did their best to rectify it.  Thanks to Doug and Joe for a fun night.

5.description: My friend and I were walking around looking for a bar. There was a sign that included the words "sky" and/or "rooftop" along with a martini glass so we decided to go up. It was around 7pm on a Sunday and pretty empty. However it was nice, relaxing, the waitress was kind and the drinks were tasty. I had the jalapeño cocktail and my friend had the watermelon one. We both thoroughly enjoyed our $13 drinks. Waitress and bartender let us charge our phones so that made it even better. Summary: cute, relaxing place with good music, tasty drinks and friendly staff.

11.description: YEAH my fiancé and I love roof tops (as does most of Chicago I bet) and this one was just ok. I was confused, though, because there were signs that stated "Grand Opening" and the hostess told us that "this is our first day" but yet there are yelp reviews from last year. Maybe she meant this is the first opening of the year. Or maybe just reopened under new managements. Or maybe this was everyone's who worked there first day (which may be the case). Our server, who was VERY nice and friendly, seemed like she had never held a tray before. I hope she can get better. Of course she told my fiancé that all the drinks were great, so she ordered one and didn't like it. Plus this place is a bit pricy. Maybe to make up the fact that they are only open during the roof top season but wow $9 Half Acres and $14 mixed drinks. The high prices may be intended to keep the riff raff out because there are limited seats available. The views are pretty neat but over powered by the surrounding, and higher, apartment buildings. It is pretty neat because you can actually peer into people's apartments and see what they are watching on television, which is what I bet management was hoping for because they don't have a television.In all, if you are looking for a more unique roof top then this place is pretty cool. They do serve food but we had eaten prior so didn't experience any of this part. Pop up for a quick drink and check out the apartment views and the cool looking bar. Oh and don't expect to get up there "quickly", we noted that the elevator seems to run slow for some reason.

22.description: I stopped by on Wednesday night to check out this new spot. I'm always up for discovering a new rooftop, especially when the nice cool summer nights are numbered. Initially when walking into the hotel I really loved the modern vibe. It's very "South Beach". They didn't really seem to have it together yet but I will cut them some slack as they are new and getting the hang of things. The location is very nice and just a couple blocks away from the lake. Located on the 16th floor, the views are pretty, but certainly do not match Trump or The Wit. I like the secluded feeling as it's a bit off the beaten path. The purple lights glowing from under the bar provided a sexy vibe in the summer breeze. The speakers were bumping upbeat club music which I enjoyed, but maybe not everyone would feel the same. Most of the pretty white, plush couches were reserved for "people arriving later" and we were told we could sit there for a little while until the people arrived. We enjoyed some yummy cocktails and pork sliders. Then we were told the people were arriving and we would need to close out. 45 minutes later, the people who had reserved that table never arrived. We had 4 people with us now but they kept beating around the bush with getting us a table, so we decided to continue our night of fun elsewhere. The place is cool but make sure to accommodate the people who will spend money and who are polite. Too bad they lost some of our business for the rest of the evening. I bet that table never ended up getting sat. The views were cool, but I was not happy with the execution of their customer service. There are far too many places in this city that take care of my friends and I for me to waste time waiting for a table on a rooftop full of empty tables.

0.description: Went up to the Sky Terrace bar in summertime and the weather and view here was great. Our hotel room at the Hyatt was not yet ready, so this was a great open air bar in the sun to grab a cocktail and lounge under one of their big umbrellas and see all the high buildings and sites from up high! Definitely worth a stop to at some point in your busy trip!

20.description: This place just opened so a group of us who looove rooftops decided to have a Friday evening happy hour here. The hotel is gorgeous and the rooftop just as gorgeous. Wonderful comfy seating and well placed plants (separated seating spots/ groups). The view is not so great...but the breeze sure is. :-) It was as if you weren't in the city anymore but your own little comfortable world...haha.When I saw the drink menu it was exactly as I expected...my friends were a bit shocked at the prices but hey...we are at a hotel rooftop in Streeterville...what do you expect?I ordered a regular Mojito and mango Mojito and they were both delicious....but where was the alcohol? You see I am a lightweight...after two mixed drinks I should have felt at least a little buzzed...I felt nothing...so I decided not to bother with a 3rd drink (I should have ordered beer or wine!)I think this place is a great place to get a drink with friends and talk...because the music wasn't loud and the setup really is for groups and conversation. Everyone was also very friendly...(.except our waitress who seemed to want us to get out of there)....from the receptionist downstairs...to the workers we met at the elevator...even the manager chatted with us. :-)Glad I got to check out this place before it gets cold!

19.description: Overpriced drinks, servers walking around like a chicken with their heads cut off, clueless managers, not a great view and a superficially atmosphere is not exactly my definition of a good time!

2.description: It's a nice cosy rooftop bar. Came here for drinks and highly impressed with the courteous service. Music is decent. Not a whole lot of seating but a relatively quiet and nice place to hang out with friends. Drinks could have been stronger. The view is pretty nice as well.

18.description: This place was just awful! Horrid customer service. 25 minutes to get a drink when the place wasn't even busy. Gas lights were out so it was totally dark on the rooftop and no one attempted to fix the issue. It rained when we went and  throughout the entire downfall, no one offered to put up our umbrella. Even more irritating, the manager is clueless. I asked for the check three times and he was running around like a chicken with his head cut off and totally forgot about it...each time!

13.description: Went here on a Thursday night over the summer and it was crowded..but still managed to snag a table. Nice ambiance - very classy. Bathrooms are NOT on the same level though, you have to go down the elevator which was sort of a nuisance.They had a great cocktail list, with some very classy interesting combinations. It took quite a long time to get our drinks, and didn't get replenished as much as I had hoped.

4.description: This is a 3.5 star establishment, but I rounded down.  This is a good place to start your night, but there's better options if you're looking to mingle. PROS: the food was surprisingly good. Off of the bartender's recommendation I ordered the truffle fries and chicken flatbread. The flatbread was more like pizza, but it was still really tasty for bar food.  The price tag was $23; but the portions were such that you could split it...so the value was decent.The view was nice, and the staff was fairly attentive.  The place isn't huge like the Wit, but I didn't feel cramped.The drinks weren't bad. A cocktail goes for $14; I had something that was bourbon infused which did the trick.CONS: I went there on a Saturday night at 8 pm and my group stayed until 1030...and the place was empty.  I've been to a number of rooftops in Chicago and this was easily the most dense in terms of crowd. In addition, they have a lot of seats upstairs, but 90% had a sign saying 'reserved.' Again I was there for over two hours and most of those spots were empty when I left.  And of the people who did take those couches, none of them had bottles...so that was confusing and irritating.  Minor knock - there are no bathrooms on the rooftop, so you have to take the elevator down a floor to relieve yourself.One more thing - I've been spoiled by the ambiance of the Wit, Drumbar and other rooftops. Compared to those Ivy doesn't have the gravitas if that makes sense.  Not to say basic is bad, it's just not what I'm used to regarding rooftops in Chicago.I'd go back here with friends if I wanted a quiet place to start my night.  But I can't see finishing my evening here.

6.description: We came by on a Sunday and it was mostly empty. I know it was an off hour, but we just wanted a decent drink to round out the weekend. The place seemed messy- tables were dirty, nothing cleaned down. The server had to ask us to repeat our order twice because she wasn't familiar with the menu. Then our drinks were served in dirty glasses (I mean really dirty- not just a smudge). The wine was 15 a glass and the cocktail was 14. Way overpriced for what it is and absolutely not worth it. We told the waitress we didn't want the drinks since they were in dirty glasses and we left. She said she'd talk to the manager about us being upset and she seemed sweet, but we were over it by that point. HUGE disappointment.

15.description: This place just opened so a group of us who looove rooftops decided to have a Friday evening happy hour here. The hotel is gorgeous and the rooftop just as gorgeous. Wonderful comfy seating and well placed plants (separated seating spots/ groups). The view is not so great...but the breeze sure is. :-) It was as if you weren't in the city anymore but your own little comfortable world...haha.When I saw the drink menu it was exactly as I expected...my friends were a bit shocked at the prices but hey...we are at a hotel rooftop in Streeterville...what do you expect?I ordered a regular Mojito and mango Mojito and they were both delicious....but where was the alcohol? You see I am a lightweight...after two mixed drinks I should have felt at least a little buzzed...I felt nothing...so I decided not to bother with a 3rd drink (I should have ordered beer or wine!)I think this place is a great place to get a drink with friends and talk...because the music wasn't loud and the setup really is for groups and conversation. Everyone was also very friendly...(.except our waitress who seemed to want us to get out of there)....from the receptionist downstairs...to the workers we met at the elevator...even the manager chatted with us. :-)Glad I got to check out this place before it gets cold!

7.description: Had a group here and it was Ok. The view and décor is really nice. Comfortable seats & cute tables that double up as seating. The menus light up (kinda like a tablet-so unexpected and cute)The waitress didn't know we have RSVP seating and looked completely clueless when we told her about it yet I had given my Cc info to the events planner a week before and made a deposit- not a big issue coz we made sure to get there early to avoid such confusion. The drinks are about $13- decent cocktails, nothing special.Only gripe is how extremely slow the servers were. A couple of people in my party had to go get their drinks from the crowded bar. They did explain that they only had 2 people on the floor & though the place wasn't jammed packed, it was still relatively crowded hence the slow service. In summary, I would go back.

8.description: I was just here last night just to have drinks randomly with some people I know.It mixes style and ambiance along with good stiff drinks.They have got a nice professional crowd of people that live in the city, live in streeterville and the surrounding area.yes they have 2 bartenders and some wait staff who are quick and efficient.I am sure they would hire a third bartender if they felt the place got packed all the time when the weather is over 70 degrees. It is well on its way for that. You should be prepared to mingle with a top notch crowd of professionals if you go on a summer night that it is not raining.I heard they have a DJ on friday and saturday nights after 9:30.
