You can be sure that I am not the only one that will be checking that out.This is a great diversion to those people who dont go to the cview because the service is not that good. Far be it from me to reinforce a positive with a negative :)A friend of mine last night pointed out to me "hey this is like the outdoor pump room I like it here"For some reason people dont know about the place. They should.I could not have said it better

3.description: 3.5 StarsWhen you enter the Ivy hotel it is absolutely beautiful. I love the elegance of the art work on the wall and the huge hanging chandelier by the elevators. This pass Sunday I had the pleasure of returning to their rooftop Sky Terrace on the 16th floor. I hadn't been for a while, but my friend took us here using her groupon (4 drinks, plus 2 appetizers). Yesterday was a scorcher and the staff was wonderful in accomodating our request for a shady part of the rooftop. Moving chairs and umbrella's around they made sure we were well taken care off. Our waitress was extremely bubbly and made our expereicne relaxing and enjoyable. We all order the Purple Ivy drink (chambord, citron, pineapple & lime juice)  and didn't really care for it. We were expecting it to be a bit sweeter than it was.For the apps we ordered the fries (abosolutely decicious), Guacomole Tower (Disappointing and only came with 4 chips), and the buffalo flat bread (pretty decent). Now granted coming here we know it's a tapas place, but I still feel the food is way over price. I know for rooftops your paying more the ambience and view, but rated against the other rooftops charging the same price is why I feel this one is overrated. The view isn't as great as say Wit or IO, and the atmosphre on both times I have came is also pretty dead. Don't get me wrong it's a lovely rooftop, but compared to my usuals this isn't one I would frequent that often.

14.description: This place is a nice place if you want a calm environment. Ive come on two different occasions after work and both times the place hasn't been too crowded and it was easy to get a seat.

3.description: Food is awful and tremendously over priced. Eight pieces of bacon and about 1/2 cup of breakfast potatoes will cost 9.51. And the bacon was inedible.

1.description: Nothing here is going to blow your mind, but it's a cafeteria so you probably already know that. But it's open 24 hours, which is much appreciated in the area. When I'm burning the midnight oil in the library across the street, I can always come here for any late night snack cravings - pudding, yoghurt, granola bars, sandwiches, salads, and a huge soda selection. And of course they have coffee, which is a must in a hospital.

2.description: Great food and amazing staff.  They are very friendly and helpful.  We came for a routine workup and planned a two day trip and have been here 7.  We found out about the cafeteria on day two and have eaten there a lot since.  Reasonable prices and very good food.

9.description: Fresh Market is the cafeteria on the second floor of the new Prentice Women's Hospital. It's open 24 hours. The made-to-order salads, burgers,  and omelets are ridiculously great! The mini-Starbucks helps with late-night studying sessions. -1 star for the sketchy grab-n-go items, which, according to my digestive system, have been out too long.

10.description: When did hospital cafeterias get so overpriced?  Bland sandwich, chips and drink hit the $8 mark.  The cafeteria was lifeless - slow service, unexciting food that's been sitting out for who knows how long, no lunch rush.  Overall 'bleh' that I most certainly am not willing to pay $8 for again.

4.description: Prentice's hospital cafeteria which does not have as wide a selection as Cafe 251 across the way in Northwestern Memorial. It really isn't bad at all though. Plus, there is a Starbucks so you don't have to go to the Feinberg Pavillion for your caffeine fix.

6.description: Utterly great cafeteria in the Prentice Women's Hospital. Went here for lunch today - had a Mexican salad that was really tasty - though the tortilla bowl (I always seem to hate bowls made of bread products) was like cardboard, tasteless. A good option in a sea of pricey lunch places - they had some nice options at the "station" type serving area.However the menus on the video screens? Rife with misspellings!!! People! Proof your work!LADIES: great place to scope out oh-my-gawd-HAWT young doctor types. But they're all busy, busy, busy and don't hang out at the tables for long.  At any rate, great scenery.

11.description: i actually eat here a lot. i'm a student at the medical school and i spend a lot of time in the area. the food is good for a hosp cafeteria and it's open 24/7. the downside is that the place is expensive and it doesn't have many options but overall it's decent.

5.description: You gave me the only piece and quiet I could search for at 2:30am, and you were decent enough to serve me a very cooked burger.  But hey, it was a burger.

7.description: Yes, that's right - a hospital cafeteria. I know what you are thinking - jello and burnt coffee are not the makings of a pleasant dining experience. But there is a new sheriff in town and her name is Joyce Goldstein. When she's not keeping the law in these parts, she is a cookbook author, food columnist, San Francisco restaurateur, and former chef at Chez Panisse. Joyce and her team are whipping up stuffed pork chops and crisp Waldorf salads, flatbread pizzas and gourmet sandwiches to go. We're talking baked tilapia filets, people. The menu changes often, as does the selection of yummy side dishes. And you can watch your meal being made right in front of your very eyes. This is one smart sheriff. Nutritional information is posted for each delectable delight, prices are affordable, and the tranquil dining area overlooks Seneca Park and the MCA. The scenery is also conducive to watching young doctors in their natural habitats. Yeow!

8.description: Wide selection of nicer cafeteria food. This place is definitely a little nicer compared to NMH's other cafeteria in Feinberg. But, it's also a little more expensive. A typical lunch can easily hit the $10 mark.As a side note, their burritos stink. It costs like $7 and it is pretty terrible. Go to Chipotle if you want a burrito.

0.description: With the birth of my first child four years ago at Prentiss, I had some fond memories of regaining my composure at the cafeteria. 2014, the cafeteria is the same but seems to be more expensive. You might as well do room service since you'll get more for the same price.

So a serious fur connoisseur sent me here to find a first rate piece at a fair price. Now I am all about paying for quality and not out for a steal, yes perhaps a deal, provided its the right pick. WELL let me say this, the hubby and wife team that runs this show is seriously a cast of characters from a Seinfeld episode if not from another planet. We walked in to find a closet-size "showroom" where a lady asked me what I want. I explained to see different lengths of mink in black and brown and as I am trying on a coat her husband walks in and says hello and then heads to the back some place (seriously he is swallowed by the closet). A few minutes later he appeared and asked me not to touch the coats and then offered  to put a scarf on my neck. I think for the look, he says no its so I do not soil his fur with oils from my lotion or perfume and then he asked me to refrain from touching the coats so I do not soil them.So at this point I am thinking ...if you prefer I can leave, and he asked me to (mind you I never uttered a word I only smiled). Perhaps when asked for how much I was willing to spend he felt it was not enough as I replied around $3000. He says we can not help you here, please go, and repeats we can not help you here.  The show was even better (more bizarre stuff happened), but please go and see for yourself, its comic relief for a Sat. afternoon.  It's the soup nazi gone fur crazy ...literally. PS this place is not worth the one star, it is just so you go and enjoy the show.

58.description: Absolutely love this place! Quick, healthy, fresh,delicious, and the friendliest staff imaginable. As a vegan, it's very difficult to find high-quality, fulfilling, and tasty food options, but Lyfe Kitchen has tons of dishes! I live just across the street and find myself coming back several times a week. I still haven't tired of the options! Sometimes I'll order an item and a starter - and I'll order one thing that's clearly vegan and one that has a vegan option and I'll completely forget to specify. The staff is so attentive that they always catch the vegan preference and ask me if I want it to be vegan. That takes a level of attentiveness and care. I appreciate that.Because we are there so often, the manager, Brinker Wolf, always says hello and makes us feel right at home. I cannot say enough about how glad I am that this restaurant has opened up in Sterville. It's a life saver!

56.description: Delicious, healthy food...quick and great  service.   Had the quinoa bowl to and added  chicken. It also came with avocado,  hummus, spinach etc...filling and delicious!!

29.description: Excellent!  Great food fast and healthy!My chicken spicy soup was amazing and the margarita flatbread fresh and wonderful!

42.description: Good food isn't cheap (and food in Chicago isn't cheap period). It should also leave you feeling better than before you ate it. That's why I like Lyfe Kitchen. There's a shortage of healthy, quick options in Streeterville and it's nice to have Lyfe as a go to. Lunch is $10, but I like to add salmon or mahi mahi as my protein, which is an additional $5. My fav is the Quinoa Crunch Bowl. I also like the fish tacos but those are a little messy for desk eating. Service speed can be touch and go, but is always polite and attentive. Lunch time is a madhouse (for reasons listed above) so allow time.

23.description: Excellent, tasty food. Lots of options. Low/ no salt added. Great kids menu.Friendly staff.I have nothing else to say YELP - change your minimum review length policy.

47.description: Been here a number of times and the food and service have been excellent.  The fish options (salmon) are very good as well as the quinoa soup which I always get.  The various teas are good too, but they have tap, mineral, or chilled water in the back which is nice.  Will be back.

8.description: I love their relatively small but wide variety menu. They have it organized by gluten /vegan/ ore turning . The Art's unfried chicken & the Mahi tacos are great - but I think I liked the chicken more! The butternut squash / Brussels sprout side is delicious ! But the soups are outstanding ! For someone who is dairy free, having corn chowder is such a special treat! They make it with cashew cream and it's delicious ! The seasonal squash soup was outstanding as well. Great service, free wifi, wonderful prices - I will be back ! Plus...they had the UK game on which is a big plus for us Kentucky fans ;) #GoCats

31.description: I love this place! They have something for everyone and it's so nice to eat out and get good, clean food.

34.description: it's like fast food that's good for you. quick ordering, fresh food, great service. employees are very very helpful.

16.description: My first reaction upon seeing this place open was "Yay healthy food!" But after the meal I was like "Boo healthy food... also I'm still hungry." There's always a battle between my brain's desire to eat healthy and my taste-buds' demand for flavor, and they rarely end up being mutually satisfied. That trend continues with Lyfe Kitchen. While I think the restaurant itself has a cool, airy setup and lots of menu options for the pickiest of eaters - the food itself falls flat. You end up leaving feeling less-guilty about your meal, but you also never end-up craving anything you just ate either. The flavor-free chips and guac was the first bad sign: it was more like "old, stale crackers with squashed avocado." The rest of the meal followed a similar formula of being bland, but edible. If I had some Sriracha sauce handy I would have drowned my food in it. I also could have eaten a whole other meal afterwards too.Will I be back? Probably. But only at the insistence of a vegetarian, gluten-free friend who demands organic & free-range, guilt-free food.

13.description: Was wavering between 3 and 4 because while I enjoyed the food, I can't say that for the price it blew me away. However it's a good affordable spot in the area(at least for streeterville), and being healthy is never a bad thing. Also I was eating with a vegetarian friend of mine, so being able to cater towards those dietary restrictions(they also do gluten-free), is worth something. Ordered the fish tacos, which came with two tacos that were loaded with a nicely seared piece of white fish, avocado, cilantro, chipotle aioli, and slaw. On the side was a small cup of fresh salsa, which was actually portioned pretty perfectly for the tacos. As with all their entrees there was an accompanying kale and carrot salad, which while fresh, was pretty unremarkable otherwise. As for the tacos itself, actually I quite enjoyed it. As promised, everything tasted light and fresh, and unlike many of my other meals I didn't feel like a greasy potato afterwards. The avocado and fish worked quite well together, though I do wish that the slaw was perhaps a bit more flavorful. I was also worried about the portion size at first, but after finishing the meal I felt full, but not bloated. Verdict: Yeah you pay a bit of a premium for the health aspects and for the location in Streeterville, but even then Lyfe Kitchen is a decent choice for lunch and actually serves decent food to boot. At times I wish the flavors could have been a bit more pronounced, but they do make things quite fresh and you can walk away feeling satiated but not disgusting. I can't say that about eating at mcdonalds every day....

11.description: Pretty good! I really like the mahi mahi fish tacos and bbq chicken flatbread. I also tried the "unfried" buffalo strips and baked sweet potato fries - I found the buffalo strips to have a really strong flavor which was a little overwhelming at times especially because it was literally just chicken strips in sauce. The baked sweet potato fries were good but the batch I had was really burnt - I'm assuming this isn't how they normally are though.

39.description: So happy to find a gluten-free cafe close to our hotel (Courtyard Marriott on E Ontario). My mother and I happened to run across LYFE Kitchen on a walk to find brunch. We both had the Classic Breakfast (mine gluten-free, my mother had the original). I don't eat eggs so I subbed them out for a GF English Muffin. We also added the Fresh Squeezed Orange Juice. The food was delivered to our table in no time. The food had very good flavor. My favorite was probably the potatoes with a spicy sauce atop. We both throughly enjoyed our meals. We left satisfied and comfortably full. Would definitely return! I even looked up other locations in the U.S. before leaving the restaurant.

37.description: 11.50 for a bland chicken wrap and a few pinches of oil-soaked kale on the side. There are better places around Streeterville to spend upwards of 10 bucks on a healthy and fulfilling meal.

0.description: Spent an hour writing about my hate for RCN in condos so wanted to spend ten minutes writing about my favorite places. This is one of them. Healthy food. Friendly staff. And sparkling water on tap for free!

38.description: Love this place! we had never been here but were looking for something healthy and fresh. This was perfect. It has a very calming atmosphere, you feel healthier just by walking in, and the people were so nice. I had the Farmer's Market Salad and my husband had the Buffalo Chicken Salad. Both were amazing!! Not that he let me have anything more but a small bite of his, it was very good! We will definitely be back and so happy that they have take out!

51.description: I'm definitely a fan of Lyfe Kitchen. This venue is also great and easily spotted by the outdoor seating surrounded by bamboo (?) branches coming out of wooden rectangle flower pots.This place has a pretty nice upper level for any group that wants a little exclusivity. Bathrooms are upstairs.I tried their fish tacos (9.99) and chocolate Budino. I would get both again! Though the Budino is pricier (3.99) so I won't get that every time. But their fish tacos were good and filling. Plus their service is pretty good (you order at the counter, they bring everything to you and also assist in clearing the table). A great, filling and healthy option for the area. Be prepared to spend anywhere from $10-$20 per visit.

27.description: Excellent vegan/gluten free food.  It's done in a pay up front first style then they bring you your food.  Excellent selection of food as they have 3 menus to choose from: 1) Vegan 2) Gluten Free 3) everyday.   If you need a combo of let's say vegan and gluten free they will substitute foods to make it so.  I had the Thai plate, sweet baked fries, and roasted Brussels sprouts.  All for $20 and very filling.  Highly recommend this one if you are downtown Chicago!

32.description: Was wavering between 3 and 4 because while I enjoyed the food, I can't say that for the price it blew me away. However it's a good affordable spot in the area(at least for streeterville), and being healthy is never a bad thing. Also I was eating with a vegetarian friend of mine, so being able to cater towards those dietary restrictions(they also do gluten-free), is worth something. Ordered the fish tacos, which came with two tacos that were loaded with a nicely seared piece of white fish, avocado, cilantro, chipotle aioli, and slaw. On the side was a small cup of fresh salsa, which was actually portioned pretty perfectly for the tacos. As with all their entrees there was an accompanying kale and carrot salad, which while fresh, was pretty unremarkable otherwise. As for the tacos itself, actually I quite enjoyed it. As promised, everything tasted light and fresh, and unlike many of my other meals I didn't feel like a greasy potato afterwards. The avocado and fish worked quite well together, though I do wish that the slaw was perhaps a bit more flavorful. I was also worried about the portion size at first, but after finishing the meal I felt full, but not bloated. Verdict: Yeah you pay a bit of a premium for the health aspects and for the location in Streeterville, but even then Lyfe Kitchen is a decent choice for lunch and actually serves decent food to boot. At times I wish the flavors could have been a bit more pronounced, but they do make things quite fresh and you can walk away feeling satiated but not disgusting. I can't say that about eating at mcdonalds every day....

54.description: Great concept and good menu options, but after seeing how much sodium is used really puts things into perspective and shows how you gain your weight even if eating "healthy" so just be aware and informed...

48.description: Tasty and healthy food if you're willing to pay a bit extra for it.  Good service and great interior design.

44.description: Nice and clean restaurant with a nice variety on the menu.    You order at the counter and then they bring your food to your table.   I tried their vegan meat substitute and while it looked just like meat, it just wasn't that satisfying for me.    Reasonable prices and very friendly and helpful staff.   If you are a vegetarian, then I think you will love this place.

24.description: Busy Friday night in Chicago before the marathon   I was hoping for light fresh vegetarian food without having to go to far in this crazy traffic. This place was perfect!  Had the spinach mushroom pasta. Whole grain hot and nicely seasoned. If the calorie content is true it was a filling 350.

7.description: Giving this location 4 starts just as I did the location on Clark & Hubbard. Healthy food that's actually tasty. I recommend you trySTARTERS*Unfried buffalo chicken strips*Chunky guac n'chips SANDWICHES & BURGERS*Grilled Chicken & Avocado*Pizzanini

49.description: Excellent! Had the buffalo chicken salad and the ginger pomegranate lemonade and it was so quick and delicious!

40.description: Best place ever! I ate here almost every day of my week-long stay in Chicago. The food is great, they offer food for vegan no vegan and gluten free diets which is really practical if you're in a group. A special mention to Sam who went out of his way for our meals to be memorable every time we went there.

53.description: I got Thai curry. The food was not that impressive. Kinda plain. Guess that's the trade-off of healthy food... My friend got a burger dish, she seems like it. There is help-yourself style sparkling water which is kinda neat. I like the dining environment. It's bright and spacious inside. Northwestern wildcard can get 10% off discount. I might come back if I wanna eat healthy.

30.description: Burger on GF bun is amazing, hence the 5 stars. Sweet potato fries were just ok. Ordering online was easy and thorough. Staff very pleasant and courteous.

46.description: Lyfe kitchen continues to be underwhelming and overpriced. As an employee at nmh I was excited for a new healthy restaurant and I've tried it several times. The portions are extremely small. The flavors are good and it tastes pretty good, but not worth another visit. Go next door to cosi, much better!

1.description: The quinoa crunch wrap is my favorite of all the things I've tried. It's crunchy, refreshing, full of veggies, with a delicious hot sauce to dip it in. I've tried so many different things on this menu. They have great choices for healthy eating and awesome breakfast choices too.

55.description: I was excited to visit Lyfe Kitchen to try out their foods but there were things that underwhelmed me once I got my food.  The quinoa crunch wrap was good and I was pleasantly surprised when they mentioned I could add a protein to it.  I added salmon but, sadly, that didn't really help much.  There were parts of the wrap that was tasty and parts of the wrap that was bland due to the uneven spread of the hummus.  I had the wrap along with the ginger mint chia tea which was just okay. The reason why I took 2 stars off was because the argula salad that came with my wrap tasted awful.  It wasn't due to the seasoning but the arugula which tasted like mildew.  They most likely stored the arugula damp in a plastic bag for a long period because I couldn't bear to take another bite because of the mildew taste.  It sort of leaves me to wonder what their other salads might taste like so I'm staying away.  I think they have great potential.  The ambiance is really nice and bright and their customer service is great.  I might want to try another location maybe but not this one.

9.description: My sister and I stopped here for lunch while on vacation. Love the fresh herb garden when you walk in! Adds a nice, bright touch of color. I like that they have 3 menus immediately available for those with food allergies (i.e. Everything, Gluten Free, and Vegetarian/Vegan). They were very accommodating to special requests, as well. We sampled a few different things:Crispy Gardein Tenders with sweet potato fries - 3 stars: Crispy, tasty tenders but soggy disappointing sweet potato fries.Farmhouse Burger with roasted Brussels and squash - 4 stars: Burger was dry and bland, but the Brussels and squash were a real winner! Perfectly roasted veggies topped with cranberries, chives and fantastic Dijon dressing. Ancient Grain Stir Fry (modified with tofu instead of the beefless tips) - 5 stars: this dish was fantastic. Just the right amount of spice balanced out this dish of quinoa, rice and veggies. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they have water glasses near the silverware with both still and sparkling water available on tap. Nice touch!

26.description: Another great find while in Chicago!  Unfortunately did not have a chance to eat there but did stop in for a much needed banana kale smoothie.  The decor was nice and had a cool vibe to it.  Will definitely come here next time I'm in town.

25.description: First time trying this place and I loved it, they serve breakfast til 11:00 daily and 3:00 pm on Sunday's.  Try the spinach and avocado egg frittata which is served with chipotle hash and salsa.  Nice clean sleek atmosphere, order at counter and they bring dishes to table.  Will be back for lunch!

12.description: Delicious vegan food. We had the tofu tacos and the quinoa crunch salad bowl. So good. A bit pricey, but perfect for a quick healthy bite!

59.description: Super excited to have such a healthy and tasty "fast food" option in my neighborhood!  Everything on the menu is 600 calories or less.  I tried the Unfried Chicken and it was delicious - I'll be getting it for many a meal.  Service is friendly and quick.  Check it out!

21.description: I absolutely LOVE all the healthy  food options at Lyfe Kitchen and I don't have to feel guilty about eating out. It's my " GO TO " place when I'm hungry .

17.description: My experience at LYFE Kitchen was excellent! One of the best brunch time meals I have ever had. Customer service was superb and the food was so delectable! I had the arugula & avocado omelet - try it, you will not regret it.

10.description: The BBQ chicken flatbread is SO DARN GOOD!!! The sign on the door about pickpockets freaked me out a bit but I'm glad they make patrons aware of what's happening. I was just passing by, thinking about where I'd go to dinner and then saw this place, saw the people inside, saw that I haven't been here before, and decided to walk in. I also tried the spicy vietnamese lettuce wraps but they weren't spicy at all (I wonder if they forgot to add the spicy sauce) and the Garden burger, which were both okay compared to THE BBQ CHICKEN FLATBREAD.I really, really like how they have 3 different types of water ... On draft(?) available: sparkling, regular, and another one I forgot... Maybe really soft water?The herbs they have growing inside with the light is pretty cool, too. I wonder if they use those herbs for food or if it's just for decor. I'd like to come back here again and I'll be sure to bring few things and protect my belongings.They have 2 floors and the place seems very well ventilated. Staff bring food to your table even though you get a buzzer (maybe only when it's not so busy), which is nice. The restroom sink is wide and really cool. It's clean but the first women's stall has a huge gap between it and the wall so it might be awkward if people walk into the restroom and the first thing they see is that gap.Staff is nice but line formation for placing orders is rather confusing as patrons don't seem to stand in any line in front of the open register. I wish menu had descriptions of the foods, since I didn't see any pictures or I wasn't familiar with their options. I like how the menu is short and simple, though.I like how they have some big couches, some large 6-chair tables, and many smaller tables with 2-4 chairs. The tables have salt and pepper shaker but the salt part is very small (maybe 1x1x1 in) so it's a way to encourage a lower sodium meal, which is pretty cool.

5.description: I was super excited to try out Lyfe Kitchen, but it fell just a bit short of my expectations. The chips and guacamole came with the strangest, stale chips. There is no reason to reinvent the tortilla chip- stick to the classic, it's never failed. The unfried chicken came with delicious vegetables, but the chicken itself wasn't anything that great and a rather small portion of chicken. I need more protein! Overall, I found it a bit overpriced but wouldn't mind returning to try something else on their menu.

3.description: I've stayed away from this place for as long as I could because I'm not a fan of healthy eating...the only thing I care about is delicious eating, health be damned! Anyhoo, came here for lunch with friends, one of which has gluten allergy, so I thought this might have more options. I got the chicken & avocado sandwich, which tasted pretty good but was rather tiny for the price. The salad it came with was fresh but nothing special. Service was really slow...I appreciate they make things to order, but a smoothie/sandwich shouldn't take more than 20 minutes, especially when we beat the lunch rush and ordered before the rest of the crowd entered. It's ok if you're on the healthy food bandwagon and have cash to burn. I won't be a regular here.

35.description: Ooookkkk! Why mess with something that works? This review if for the NEW Veggie Burger only. This burger did not meet (meat) my expectations at all. Lyfe Kitchen has removed the old Gardien (Vegan) Burger with a vegetable and grain burger because some customers were complaining about the gluten in the Gardein Burger. Weeellll, I say that Lyfe should bring back the Gardien Burger and X the new veggie burger and direct their GF customers to other options on the GF menu. The burger itself is very grainy and crumbles easily so the patty itself will not stay on the bun. The taste is not as flavorful as the Gardien and 1/2 as filling. I will not be buying this burger again. I was a disappointment in this product.

19.description: Wonderful gem. I found this spot walking back to my hotel. Great food and healthy options for everyone: children, vegetarian/vegan, and gluten-free. I had the tofu veggie wrap that was so filling I couldn't even finish it. Delicious organic coffee and a self help water station with sparkling water. The staff was incredibly friendly. I would highly recommend this place over the surrounding standard fare (Panera and Einstein bagels).

28.description: This is a great healthy lunch option in the streeterville area. I especially liked the mushroom goat cheese flatbread. Everything is a little on the pricier side but the items are healthy and have the calories and sodium listed on the menu. Their freshly squeezed drinks sound delicious which I will be trying soon!

45.description: The vegetarian curried tofu is superb. The price is right and the outdoor seating is an extra bonus. Will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

33.description: Pricey, but so fresh and so clean! Love how they have chilled sparkling/chilled tap/ambient tap water so you can help yourself.  Workers are super nice and courteous and the manager is great too! I frequent Lyfe often, and everytime I go, I get a nice hello by name.  They have stevia and raw sugar at every table with bright lighting and good wifi.  Awesome place to study  and eat healthy.

43.description: I ordered the daily special: avocado and arugula omelet with the hibiscus beet water.  I could taste every veggie in the omelet, the cheese was not overpowering or heavy, the relish was a great extra taste with the omelet. I could not have ordered a better breakfast to start my day

2.description: Happily I'm changing my review of LYFE Kitchen! After their great customer service from their corporate office I was happy to give LYFE another try and absolutely loved it! I decide to stop in for some Friday night takeout and it was delicious. Ordered two dishes to try and both were excellent and super healthy and great on calories if that's something you watch or keep track of. Went with the Mahi Fish Tacos and Ancient Grain Stir-Fry. I will definitely be back to LYFE along with some friends! Great food and even better customer service from corporate. I'm looking forward to try Art's Unfried Chicken that everyone is talking about! (Original Review) Sadly  I have to give the new LYFE Kitchen location only one star! Looking forward to finally checking this place out I decide to download the LYFE app and stop in for lunch. When you download the app you get a $5 credit which is a great bonus. After ordering than I was told that this location doesn't have "the box" to scan and they were unable to give me the credit. Better customer service, info or signage would be nice when ordering that they don't offer any of the rewards that come with the LYFE app at this location. Sadly I decide not to dine there for lunch and don't know if I'll be back. I do hear that the food and water infused drinks are good. Hopefully they will get " the box" soon and I'll give them another try!!

18.description: Three separate menus:1. Gluten-Free2. Vegetarian/vegan3. OmnivoreI liked the vegan breakfast burrito ($7) that I came back the next day with friends and ate it a SECOND time! What a great price! My vegan soy cappucino was also great. Comfortable seating and interior, with table service if you choose. There are even three types of water that you can serve yourself from a tap!Spoke with the manager, who said that there are currently 16 Lyfe Kitchens in the US and it would take 5-10 years to get to Canada. Well jeez .... HURRY UP!

41.description: I've been several times since this location opened across from my office, and have had mixed experiences.  The Unfried Buffalo Chicken Strips are a favorite, but this time around they were mushy and cold.  Mushy chicken...no thanks.  I love roasted Brussels & Squash, but again, this side is hit or miss.  Sometimes nicely roasted, other times overcooked and mushy and once way under-cooked and hard!  The Kale Caesar is tasty but not much to it (2 small broccoli florets!) and gets a little pricey when you add chicken or Gardein.  While I appreciate the healthy aspect, if they are going to charge these prices the food quality has got to be more consistent.  If it wasn't across the street I would not go out of my way to eat there.

52.description: What a fantastic healthful/locavore cafe - wish they had one near my home but they seem to have a few in Chicago. All sorts of fresh juices, natural and tasteful food, and in a bright modern space with very helpful and friendly staff (thank you Aramenta!). Prices are reasonable given the quality. I hope this restaurant succeeds and I will definitely seek it out in the future.

50.description: Took my Divvy bike here on a whim.. Received my food in just a few minutes, very fast friendly service, two stories so great for friendly gatherings. I ordered a glass of OJ with some blueberry strewn buttermilk quinoa pancakes, very light and flavorful. I'll definitely be returning here.

4.description: Meh.I went here on the opening day and ordered a kale caesar salad ($7 or $8), which ended up not having any kale in it. After tweeting my disappointment, they gave me a giftcard to try it again, which I appreciated. I've been back a few times to use the giftcard balance, but I haven't been that impressed. The food is relatively fresh, but it's nothing special. They have a huge variety of food for all dietary options, which I appreciate as a vegetarian, but nothing is really that outstanding. I think they try to do too much.I had a side salad that was okay but not worth the price at all (It was maybe a small handful of greens and some lemon juice), sweet potato fries that were a bit on the soggy side, and roasted brussel sprouts with butternut squash and craisins. The sprouts dish I've had twice and both times it was pretty good (the sprouts were amazing), but the squash hasn't been cooked quite right so it was a funky texture.Once I'm done with my giftcard, I don't think I'll choose to go there on my own.

6.description: I organized a lunch with my mom and mom-to-be friends to check out the new Lyfe Kitchen and everything turned out great. We were able to secure a long table for the 7 of us (3 with babies in strollers). Lyfe has a lot of great healthy choices, although a tad pricey. I ordered the squash and lemon grass soup, focaccia margherita style as well as a hibiscus iced tea.  That set me back $16. After placing your order at the counter, if you're dining in, you get this black device that has GPS tracking on it! That's right, wherever you sit down, they will find you and serve your meal. I should hide in the bathroom next time.Overall, a good meal at the shiny new Lyfe kitchen that I hear is bigger than the Clarke Street location. Plus the manager came around and gave our group baby onesies for those of use who have babies. Nice touch!

22.description: My sister and I stopped here for lunch while on vacation. Love the fresh herb garden when you walk in! Adds a nice, bright touch of color. I like that they have 3 menus immediately available for those with food allergies (i.e. Everything, Gluten Free, and Vegetarian/Vegan). They were very accommodating to special requests, as well. We sampled a few different things:Crispy Gardein Tenders with sweet potato fries - 3 stars: Crispy, tasty tenders but soggy disappointing sweet potato fries.Farmhouse Burger with roasted Brussels and squash - 4 stars: Burger was dry and bland, but the Brussels and squash were a real winner! Perfectly roasted veggies topped with cranberries, chives and fantastic Dijon dressing. Ancient Grain Stir Fry (modified with tofu instead of the beefless tips) - 5 stars: this dish was fantastic. Just the right amount of spice balanced out this dish of quinoa, rice and veggies. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they have water glasses near the silverware with both still and sparkling water available on tap. Nice touch!

15.description: Excellent!  Great food fast and healthy!My chicken spicy soup was amazing and the margarita flatbread fresh and wonderful!

57.description: Tons of gluten free breakfast, lunch and dinner options - separate gluten free menu and everything is clearly labelled. Staff also very familiar/knowledgeable about allergens so eat with peace of mind!Everything made fresh and under 600 calories!My favorites are the: BBQ chicken flatbread, mahi fish tacos and the kale salad - all SO good! The corn chowder GF soup is also excellent. The staff are also always super pleasant and friendly at this location & the space itself is open and bright making for an enjoyable dining experience every time.

20.description: Yummy and super friendly helpful staff. Gave good ideas on visiting places in Chicago!

36.description: Meh.I went here on the opening day and ordered a kale caesar salad ($7 or $8), which ended up not having any kale in it. After tweeting my disappointment, they gave me a giftcard to try it again, which I appreciated. I've been back a few times to use the giftcard balance, but I haven't been that impressed. The food is relatively fresh, but it's nothing special. They have a huge variety of food for all dietary options, which I appreciate as a vegetarian, but nothing is really that outstanding. I think they try to do too much.I had a side salad that was okay but not worth the price at all (It was maybe a small handful of greens and some lemon juice), sweet potato fries that were a bit on the soggy side, and roasted brussel sprouts with butternut squash and craisins. The sprouts dish I've had twice and both times it was pretty good (the sprouts were amazing), but the squash hasn't been cooked quite right so it was a funky texture.Once I'm done with my giftcard, I don't think I'll choose to go there on my own.

14.description: Tons of gluten free breakfast, lunch and dinner options - separate gluten free menu and everything is clearly labelled. Staff also very familiar/knowledgeable about allergens so eat with peace of mind!Everything made fresh and under 600 calories!My favorites are the: BBQ chicken flatbread, mahi fish tacos and the kale salad - all SO good! The corn chowder GF soup is also excellent. The staff are also always super pleasant and friendly at this location & the space itself is open and bright making for an enjoyable dining experience every time.

56.description: I live right near this place, and always assumed it was too expensive. Plus I love Pinky nails on Southport. I decided to try this place on a whim and i was really impressed. The express mani/pedi is $40, but there's nothing express about it. They have great massage chairs and whirlpools for your feet. You get the full leg and hand massage. The people are friendly and really know what they are doing. They also do a great eyebrow thread for $15

29.description: Peaceful, Affordable, and clean! Brain was my nail tech today and I truly enjoyed my visit. Brain is down to earth and funny....ill be back!

42.description: Having gone to other nail salons in this area, this place tops them all. Easy walk in or scheduled appts, fair prices, and quality jobs. I love their no chip manicures. They last me any where from 2-3 weeks. And they still look amazing. It's just that my nails get out grown. Northwestern peeps get an extra 10% off all services. but you have to ask. I always forget. Now this place can get a little crowded, so sometimes you have to be patient, go grab a bite across the street, or come back another day. being so close to where I work, the convenience of this place is superb.And cash tips only!!

23.description: STAY AWAY! DO NOT GET WAXED HERE!I wish that I could give this place negative stars, but Yelp made me give them at least one.I went here last week for an overdue eyebrow wax. I have been here at least 30 times in the past for the same service and loved the younger girl. She wasn' there, so an older asian woman ended up doing my eyebrow wax. It hurt a little more, but I didn't think anything about it. When I finally was told to check them out, I had a nickel size burn in between my eyebrows. Of course, this happened the day before professional family pictures were scheduled. When I brought the burn to her attention, she brushed it off and asked me what I thought about the shape and if I was interested in a manicure. I was floored. No apology. No discount. She was only interested in upselling me. I paid my money, still tipping her- why?!, and left. Here it is Wednesday, five days later. My burn has since scabbed over and peeled. I have put neosporin on it, but it looks like I will still have a permanent scar. Honestly, mistakes happen and I get that. Had she apologized, I might not be as upset as I am. The woman had no remorse, even though she knew she messed up, and no customer service skills.

47.description: not the best ever, but goo dprice, reliable & good availability

8.description: Love these people -- great and very friendly service. They really are not on the first (ground floor) so look up to see their new sign.  Don't miss it!

31.description: I'm embarrassed to admit I've been here a few times for "emergencies". It's probably the only nail spa in Streeterville of its kind. It's not upscale and trendy where bachelorettes go with their parties in tow. But it doesn't charge exorbitant prices either - a mani pedi is $40 and less on weekdays. They almost always have time for walk-ins, a unique feature in a neighborhood of predominantly well-groomed and well-coiffed yuppies. So it works for me when nothing else does.The technicians are always pretty nice and friendly. Most importantly, they are extremely efficient. If your nails are in desperate need of some quick work and you can't wait to make an appointment somewhere else, this spot is a good fall back. Just make sure they don't cut corners on standard hygiene. Last visit, they tried to use an electric cuticle/dead skin remover on my toes right after I saw them use it on the man next to me - without even a pretense of washing or cleaning it. Horrific. But like I said...I only come here when I'm desperate.

34.description: Hmm. Ten-Not-So-Perfect Nails and Spa might be a more accurate name. I hate giving this establishment two stars because the people did seem very nice, the price was reasonable, and there was no wait. But seriously, my nails looked shabby the same day. Chips, snags. Tsk. And the same happened to my friend so I know it probably wasn't just a fluke. I won't be back.

16.description: I have been going here for about a year and LOVE my nails. Moved here from Orange County CA and tried several places before coming here. Sydney is a perfectionist. Always can get me in. Hard to find good nail salons and this is a great one in Chicago.Lisa N

13.description: Visited as a walk in. I was taken right away, however went in for eyebrow threading and was left with minimal looking eyebrows. The woman whom did the threading couldn't speak well English and I was left guessing what she said. For $15 eyebrows I expected better service. Her hygiene was an issue as well, she did not wash her hands prior to starting and smelled like she had been cooking onions. Terrible service.

11.description: Unpleasant service.  I got a no chip and it hasn't been a day yet and it's already chipping.  What a waste of money.  I will not be retuning here.

39.description: Great place if you have acrylic nails.  Ask for either Van or Phoebe - they both do a wonderful job on my nails and I always walk out feeling like a million bucks.   Everyone who works there is really nice, the salon is clean, and their prices are reasonable.  Their price for a fill is the same as what I used to pay when I lived in the suburbs - for this part of the city, that's amazing.

37.description: Great place! I went here after purchasing a Groupon special and I really did not know what to expect. My appt. was made for 12pm and when I arrived exactly on time the technician was ready for me. This is important to me as my time along is valueable. I was recommended to see Sessie who did a great manicure for me. She was easy to hold to conversation with, gentle and she did a very detailed manicure (and I know I can be picky about my nails). I would go back and recommend either Sessie (last station) or Lee (first station) The place is clean and bright and they waiting area is not bad either.

0.description: Very accommodating & friendly.   Got a great pedi just off the Mile & would definitely return here during my next Chicago trip.

38.description: Exact description I would give this place....Meh. I've experienced better....WAY BETTER.  I was in a pinch and needed my nails done.  Walked into one place...didnt have the color I wanted, went to a second place...closed for a private event....alas, I ended up here...third choice...for good reason.It was a no frills mani that in the end just looked ok.  After one day...chipped...ugh, good thing I only needed it for one day.  I wont be heading back unless I run into this exact situation, which I am guessing has a very small possibility...I am not a statistician...

51.description: This spa is located right around the corner from one of my doctor's offices which makes it super convenient for me if I'm in a crunch. It's a bit pricey but it's probably the fastest mani and pedi I've ever had and probably the best I've ever had. I walked in around noonish on a Friday and the place was pretty busy but I managed to get a spot and they went to work. It was a whirlwind but before I knew it was I was by the nail drying table with all my fingers and toes done and looking impeccable. This is probably not the most high end looking spa I've ever been to but they definitely do good work. If you're in the area check them out...you won't be disappointed.

27.description: Pretty standard salon.  Clean, variety of services. They always seem to fit me in as a walk-in.Often very impersonal service.  Although I have to say Sam is great.  He is friendly, takes his time, and it quite a perfectionist.Manis and pedis are pretty standard.  I can't say they do an exceptional job for the price they charge. Also, I have noticed several times that they try to offer you little extra services for $5 more. Don't nickle and dime me for things that should be included in a mani/pedi (cutting down cuticles!!!).Eyebrow wax- My experience was less than pleasant. I was walked to the back to the waxing room only to find an employee hanging out there chatting on her cellphone.  By the end, a chunk of my eyelids also waxed off. OUCH! Never again.

32.description: I really can't say anything bad about Ten Perfect Nails. I've been several times now for mani/pedi's, pink & white's and eyebrow waxing and have had a positive experience each time. Their prices are pretty good for Streeterville, and while they're not "warm & fuzzy" they do a great job and don't talk amongst themselves the whole time (like other nail salons in the neighborhood). Even though I continue to try new nail places in the city I keep finding my way back here. In a nut shell they're clean, reasonably priced and consistently do great nails.

54.description: Ten Perfect is by far my favorite nail salon.  Everyone there is so nice, and all know what they're doing and are extremely meticulous.  Great eyebrow work as well.  I like that you can tip on credit too, many places won't let you do that.  Always really quick wait times, if I even have to wait.  Recommend it big time!

48.description: I like to think that this place is actually called Perfect Ten...but anyway...I wandered in one sunny Saturday afternoon, desperate for a mani/pedi in less than 90 minutes including commute time. I called every nail salon within a 5 block radius of my condo and only Perfect Ten said they could fit me in. Kind of a red flag considering the fact that they are a block off of Michigan Avenue and surrounded by hotels, but I went for it anyway.I walked in and was greeted by an extremely friendly gentleman, who I presumed to be the owner. I was taken care of immediately (there were maybe only four other people in the place) and my technician got to work.Long story short, they were quick and did a good job. Unfortunately, the place was a little shoddy and unkempt, which is what would keep me from going back.

44.description: Jennie can wax the hell out of some eyebrows.I don't often get my nails done, and when I do, it's a good experience here, but I come for Jennie the aesthetician.  Her rates are reasonable and she's clean, timely, and does an awesome job.  Never have my eyebrows been waxed too thinly and never have I had a reaction after waxing,

24.description: Apparently Melinda is no longer there. Boo. Hiss.

7.description: Best in the city, hands down :-)! New location and services are amazing, and the customer service always was and still is, unparalleled. Besides the new very elegant space, the only other change you may notice is their volume of business. While Sydney and the whole team at 10 Perfect will always accept any and all walk-ins, I personally would encourage you to call ahead and make an appointment. Especially if you are looking for any service beyond a mani or pedi, like brows, lashes, waxing, etc.. Then I'd say an appointment is a must. But either way, it's worth the wait. They get Perfect 10s from me. Across the board and every time. It's THE place to go if you're in the area.

49.description: I went here on the Friday before Labor Day weekend.  The place was mostly empty--bad sign #1.  Friday afternoons are always packed at nail salons because girls are getting ready to go out.  I was seated immediately, and noticed that the entire row of foot spas looked really grimy--bad sign #2.  I went ahead with the mani/pedi anyway, telling myself that it wasn't so bad.  And it wasn't THAT bad, until we headed over to the manicure table.  At that point, the lady asks me how I want my nails shaped and I said, "Mostly squarish with slightly rounded edges."  I'm not sure what I said to confuse her (she spoke limited English), but she shaped my nails like sharp, pointy witch nails!  I kept thinking in my head that she would file them down, but that never happened because she didn't leave much nail to file.  When she was applying polish, she kept using her jagged fingernail to clean up the mess when she went outside the lines.  OUCH!  Not only painful, but CLEARLY not sanitary.  Besides that, she left a big gap between where the polish ended and where my cuticle-area started.    This became more apparent over the next 1-2 days as my nails grew out.  Lastly, whatever "lotion" she applied to my hands at the end of the manicure smelled spoiled--like nasty B.O.  I'm not sure how you get lotion that smells like that, but I had to wash my hands immediately after the manicure.  Never again!  Spend a few extra dollars and save yourself from the stress  and a possible infection!

40.description: I love this place and especially after they remodeled it. They "do" great acrylic nails and I'm a super big fan of their pedicures. I don't know what else to rave about other than telling you it's my go to place for nails. Prices are good for the area as well!One thing to keep in mind is that you can only give cash tips. I feel like a jerk when I forget this, so I end up having to go back.

53.description: I've been going here for two years, and at this point, it is the only place I trust to give me a good pedicure.  I haven't been here since the summer, because it's far and I've held 2 jobs, classes for college at the U of C (Hyde Park!), and 3 extra curriculars, so I haven't had time.  However, I was just looking for the number to book an appointment now, and figured it's a good time to write a review....Pedicures-  I've been to a few places in Chicago, but pedicures in Chicago are WAY expensive compared to the $20 I pay in FL and $18 in NYC.  There just isn't enough competition among salons here.  In any case, this is one of the cheaper pedicures I've found in Chicago at $28, and it's the best one I've had.  My first experience two years ago was strange, because the accents were so thick and I think they were new then, so they seemed ecxtatic just to have customers.  I came with a friend.  When I thought it was over and I was ready to go, it was obvious that there was more to go.  The woman had me sit down and I wasn't sure what she was doing.  She put some kind of moisturizing oil treatment on my feet and then wrapped them in saran wrap and said I could go.  It was snowing out, so I had to walk around down town with this gooey feeling in my boots.  The bright side is that they've never done that again since I've been going there.  The down side is that i wish they did, because my feet have never been so soft again.  The softness lasted two weeks!  Otherwise, their pedicures are excellent in general.  They know what they're doing and their work is meticulous.fingers- My friend who I went with the first time got her nails done, but she didn't want it to look like she got them done.  She wanted them to have a natural shade and look like she had spent weeks growing them out. with no polish.  They did this for her with gel nails and they looked REALLY beautiful and natural.  I spent the next three weeks forgetting she had them done and exclaiming that she doesn't bite her nails and has really pretty hands and fingernails.  I'm always pretty dead set on trying to let my nails naturally grow long, so I have never tried this out myself, but it looked nice and was quicker than my pedi.eyebrow wax-  I used to sometimes let Milio's hair salon wax my brows, but eventually I realized that I can't go anywhere else to wax my eyebrows.  They do them perfect every time.  They stick to my natural brow shape and make it look amazing.  The woman tells me every time that I have a beautiful shape and she never tries to manipulate it by giving me some generic shape or added shape.  Some places wax a little too much off and they look too thin, but Ten Perfect Nails knows what they're doing, and they're gentle on my eyebrows.  This is a good place to pamper yourself for everything short of hairstyling.  I'm not sure and you should call, but I believe an eyebrow wax is $12.

30.description: I like my nails certain way as I serve food all the time & I don't like having crappy fingernails or toenails. I came here because I was nearby and needed a quickie, plus I had a now-groupon.[I think groupon is great for certain occasions. A business should only offer them to attract new customers that will come back] The crappy service I received was probably the fact I presented the groupon beforehand... even though I tip according to the original amount no matter what. I had a no-chip mani and a regular pedicure. My nail technician was as a fast as a storm but my fingernails did not satisfy me. It wasn't even painted even, rather it was slanted closer to my cuticle. Pedicure could have been better and I'm sure I've been spoiled by regular place a lot by now that I expect a lot for it.Overall, i know places that are great and this was barely worth the parking, walking and the groupon.

46.description: I've given 10-Perfect Nails a handful of visits a year for lunch break manis, and until now have found them acceptable.  My last visit didn't jive with my mani standard at all...After my cuticles were trimmed, I had to request the technician (the business card on her table said "Sydney") a number of times to clip the hang nails/skin tags that were missed.  The polish, while it was Essie's Mademoiselle (a light every day pink) it was all over my cuticles and in the nail bed.  While other places go over this area with a paintbrush and acetone to clean this up, I didn't think it would matter based on the light polish color.  (Very wrong and will elaborate later.)  While I was drying, I noticed that the polish started to bubble.  Tiny, tiny bubbles popped up and I brought it to Sydney's attention.  She promptly told me they would disappear once dry.  Fast forward 24 hours- The light polish in the cuticle/nail bed has hardened and whitened, making my cuticles stand out and look crusty.  The bubbles have not disappeared and look ridiculous.  The polish is now chipped at the tips on three nails because of the not-so-smoooth surface.  Basically I wasted $14 + tip and an hour.  Save you money and walk some where else.

1.description: I stumbled upon this place while In town for a wedding and was not disappointed. At first I was surprised by the prices but then I realized that nyc manicures are dirt cheap compared to Chicago. The place is very neat & clean, well lit. They have a ton of color options which is fantastic. In fact I liked their nail polish so much I could t pick one color and ended up getting a design! The girl did a really good job. She cut my cuticles very carefully and took her time. It was obvious that she took pride in her work. If I'm ever in th neighborhood again and need a manicure I'll for sure head over here

55.description: I absolutely love this place. Thanx for the review Jody! I agree, these ppl DO know what they're doing. Ask for Eric for the nails coz he's the best.he's so careful and meticulous. He makes sure my nail's are smashin! As for the massage there, I absolutely loved it. Ask for Paul and he would give you the most phenomenal massage...it was sooo relaxing and my body felt refreshed.

9.description: Every trip to Chicago, I try to make it into this nail salon. The younger girl that works here (never caught her name) always does such a great job on my nails with the "dip-it" system and we always have great convos! I've never experienced anything other than 5 star service here!

26.description: I think they did a decent job with my nails! I went and got a manicure, and I would say that they didn't do a good job with the manicure itself, but a good job withe the final nailpainting and finishing touches. I have a lot of dead skin on my nails and they didnt take it off at all, and the massage was non existant. At $10 for a nail polish change and $14 for a manicure, it's inexpensive for the area, but I'll keep looking for a better place, coming here for emergencies/ when I'm in the area. Writing this from a week post the manicure, its still in place with no chipping. Enough reason to go there for me!

25.description: Worst wax in Chicago! Since this place was right next door to me, I decided to try it out. I will never be going back. The (older) lady that did my wax did everything wrong. It hurt 10x worse than any other wax I've gotten, she went in all different directions, and missed so many chunks. I had to tell her about 3 different spots she missed while I was there and asked if she could redo those spots. Then I got home and noticed even more spots. I also had more swelling and red bumps than any other wax I've received. I suggest not going here for a wax! I do have to say, however, Vanessa, is very good at nails! I would go back to Vanessa only for my nails.

12.description: I used to be a regular and Lynne would give me great service and do a fantastic job on my nails. The last few times I have gone there were some people that seemed really new and I haven't been happy with my nails. I left the last 2 times for sure with smudges and frustrated that the service has gone down hill. The owner says hi and bye to some people walking in and out. I walked out clearly unhappy with my smudgy polish and the shady drying stations and instead of taking that as chance to recover some potential business with great customer service I got not a peep walking out the door. How rude.  I'm not going back even though it's convenient for me I'll find some place else.And why am I getting a manicure with my fingertips in a half full saucer of dishwater? Shouldn't a manicure include washing of hands? Not here!

21.description: I'm not sure what happened to the review I posted for this business. All the reviews have been cleared out. It's not under new management as the same people are still there. My co-worker just came back from doing a manicure there and the work was really sloppy. I asked her if she read the reviews first and she said there are none to read. Sure enough she was right.I feel bad that she spent her money to have a rushed manicure that consists of painted cuticles on two fingers. She's bummed about it and will probably go home and redo it herself.As for eyebrow waxing, I like the young latina girl who has done them for me in the past. She listens to what I want and makes sure to fix and shape them as I requested.I still stand by my previous "removed" reviews. This is not the go to place for quality mani and pedi.

17.description: Will not go back. Right as I walked in I got a bad vibe from this place. I had been here before many months ago for the same service I got today (eyebrow wax) and promised myself I would never go back. Apparently I didn't listen to myself. I get a discount there, which they never remember when I'm paying. I was lead to the back where the waxing room was already taken by someone else and so I was told to go into this other room where it looked like the table linens hadn't been changed in months. It was so dirty. I put my coat into a ball and laid my head on that as there was no pillow or towel. The girl doing the service kept walking in and out of the room, no clue as to what she was doing. Finally she got going on my eyebrows. It wasn't too bad. Although she used a brush that clearly came out of an antibacterial (I hope) cleanser because every time she brushed my brows I got splattered in the face. She also used her finger nails to get off the remaining wax left behind. Then whatever "soothing" cream she used actually burned. It's really too bad this place is so horrible, could be really great.

10.description: I'm not sure what happened to the review I posted for this business. All the reviews have been cleared out. It's not under new management as the same people are still there. My co-worker just came back from doing a manicure there and the work was really sloppy. I asked her if she read the reviews first and she said there are none to read. Sure enough she was right.I feel bad that she spent her money to have a rushed manicure that consists of painted cuticles on two fingers. She's bummed about it and will probably go home and redo it herself.As for eyebrow waxing, I like the young latina girl who has done them for me in the past. She listens to what I want and makes sure to fix and shape them as I requested.I still stand by my previous "removed" reviews. This is not the go to place for quality mani and pedi.

5.description: I have had Sydney care for my nails now for almost a year, every two weeks.  She uses Shellac brand no chip products and my nails have NEVER been Stronger!  I had so many people say the no chip is not good long term.  That is not true, it is the person doing them that matters the most and and I have the best, Sydney and Ten Perfect!

3.description: A friend recommended this salon to me and I am still thanking her for it.  Allie has given me three perfect manicures (read:  beautiful and long-lasting) and a fantastic eyebrow arch, which made my eyes look twice as big!  My manicures have lasted almost two weeks, with no touch-up or extra top coat, and they were shiny and smooth as glass.  The place is neat and clean;  the services reasonably priced;  and the techs are friendly.  Why not five stars?  Well, I've only been there three times, and I still have pedicures, French, and other services to experience--but I have every confidence that they will all be excellent.  I'll give them an update soon, so look for the five stars!

35.description: I was not impressed with this place. The only good thing is that they take walk- ins and I never think far enough in advance for a nail appointment. Mani- Pedi was $40 without tip which is pretty average. The lady that did my nails was realllllly slow, and kept making me put my hands in front of the little fans they have on the desks. I hate that because then you are freezing. Pedicure was nothing special.

19.description: I just got back from this place and came straight to my computer to write this review.  This place is dirty and for the most part had rude employees. If you don't want to read this entire review just read this part: While I went to wash my hands before getting the polish put on, my manicurist started giving herself a pedicure and DID NOT WASH her hands before trying to polish my nails.Other terrible highlights - I went to pay for the $15 mani by handing a $20 and the lady gave me $1 back assuming I was giving her a $4 tip... I think NOT.Definitely think this place should think about cleaning and de-cluttering, along with training their staff on how to treat customers - making them feel comfortable, pampered, thus enticing them to return.Until that happens, I DO NOT RECOMMEND!

28.description: Based on some of these reviews, I was about to not go to this salon to get a Mani/Pedi. I'm glad I ended up going because I got excellent service. My technician was fast, efficient and my nail polish is lasting more than usual! I did go there with a Groupon and I did not feel like I was getting a worse service because of that. Will definitely come back.

45.description: Yikes. Came here last Friday afternoon as a walk-in and had a good first impression as they had a good number of customers there and the place seemed clean. I do my own nails at least once a week as I am very meticulous when it comes to manicures. I arrived at 6:30, put my name on the list, and wasn't called to a station until 7:00. I waited at least 15 more minutes at the station with my hands soaking in soapy water - so long that the water was cold and my fingers wrinkled by the time they even started.My technician finally arrived - of course, the only man (and older) technician in the place. Don't get me wrong - I'm not sexist, but when it comes to my nails, I'd rather have a younger woman with perfect nails as my manicurist vs. an old man with jagged, long nails and dry hands. Relaxing Friday night manicure? Not so much.He was very nice and attempted conversation, but I was anxious about the manicure the ENTIRE time. He picked too much at my cuticles (I actually said "ouch!" at one point) and did not file as thoroughly as he should have. I also asked for a paraffin wax, but the owner explained they no longer used it, and suggested I do a sea salt scrub instead. For only $5 extra I went for it. Bad idea. The man rubbed it way too hard on my hands - it wasn't relaxing at all! Totally not worth it.Once the nails were prepped, he began the polishing...ACK!!!!! He got through one coat of one hand and it was awful. Crooked, streaky.....just bad. I decided to let him keep going as I figured he would fix it...but he stopped midway, and asked the next technician over if she could finish my nails. He was "too nervous" about messing up and wanted "a pro" to finish it for me. I thought he WAS a pro????So the new technician finished my nails - she did a good job, but was super rushed and the second coat was sloppy. She also used her nail to wipe up excess and dug in pretty hard into the cuticles. There was no room at the dryer so I had to sit at the station with a mini fan.I may be too picky, but this was not my idea of a relaxing manicure. I'm giving it two stars because my nails actually came out looking decent, the prices are cheap, and it's in a convenient location. But after this experience, I won't be coming back.

33.description: Came in on Saturday afternoon. Got me in right away. Saw Cindy who was super nice and spent lots of time making the bottoms of my feet soft as a baby's butt. Very meticulous. Very happy with result. Would go back if i was in area.

43.description: I love this place. After going to really expensive to really cheap nail salons, this place is the best. It is a really nice facility with great people working there. Jennie does the best eyebrows and my mani/pedis always keep for at least 2 weeks! It is a little on the pricey side but I say they are worth it. :)

2.description: Screw this place right in the ear.  Everything about my manicure here was unpleasant. The place was cramped and didn't seem clean, the color selection was a little limited, relative to the competition, and my manicurist was quite lazy.  Limited attention to filing/cuticle efforts, no arm massage, and not a single pleasantry exchanged.  I honestly felt like I was inconveniencing them with my presence.  Oh, and somehow, the manicure started to chip the next day.  The location is convenient, but there are so many other shops in the area, I doubt this can keep up if others experience similar (lack of service).  In case it is unclear, I will not be back.

18.description: I have only been to this salon twice and have nothing but good things to say about it. The staff is very helpful, nice and friendly. The salon is nice and clean. The younger girl (oops! forgot her name!) introduced me to the "dip it" application and I absolutely LOVE IT! They will be my go-to nail salon every time I travel to Chicago :) Thank you for making my nails look lovely!

41.description: First time visiting Chicago, happened to be staying at a hotel close to ths Ten Perfect Nail salon. I stopped by and it was great! I had never had the new No Chip nail polished and I just loved it! Ask for Lee, very patient and detail. Make sure you have enough time to allow Lee to do a great job.

52.description: I have been going to this nail salon for several months and the service it typically very good.  So far I have only found 2 places in the loop that do a good thorough job on a mani & pedi.  Great job!

50.description: Stopped by this place in my quest for beauty on a budget. Im very picky about the nail salons I visit and typically overpay at Mario Tricoci or Nordstrom to feel that Im getting a professional, sanitary, experience.Anyhoo, my budget needed a break and my feet needed some attention. Ten Perfect was ok - clean but not to the standard I prefer. I went in for a mani/pedi 45 mins before they closed and it was no problem. The nail tech was ok - a little pre-occupied but she did a good job on my feet (most places just ignore some of the hardened skin that accumulates on my pinky toe) but she took care of it and overall my feet are soft.I might be back - $40 for a mani/pedi is pretty good - but if I can find somewhere cleaner/friendlier/convienient, I'll go there instead.

4.description: Everyone was extremely nice and accommodating. W rescheduled a couple of times during the day and they were so nice about it. Charming location in an older building and they did a very good job 25th the manicures, pedicures and eye brow waxes.

6.description: My husband Jayce scheduled a manicure and pedicure for me and to be honest I really didn't want to bother.  I'm really glad I did, the work is far and away the best I have ever experienced!  Every time I go back I have someone different but they all rock!

22.description: Um. Well, it's clean. And they seem to have a vague idea of what they're doing. But the lady who did my nails had very pointy sharp nails that she kept using to try to use to scrape wayward polish off of my skin until it hurt so much I asked her to stop.Then, she cut my cuticles so much that they bled (attempting to stave off the bleeding by putting on some fun stinging ointment). The manicure itself was decent, so it gets two stars, but, only two stars because I'm not into masochism.

15.description: Everytime I'm in Chicago I head to Ten Perfect Nails. Sydney is the greatest. Any shape you want she can do- Perfect 10! If your looking for a nail salon in downtown Chicago look no further; stop in and ask for Sydney.

20.description: My mom and I literally pulled up to our hotel talking about how in the world we were going to get our feet done, when BAM! Next door we see this nail salon! They closed at 8 and we got there at 7:49. We didn't even have to beg or plead that we had to go to a graduation early in the morning; they just had us sign in and pick our color! I've never seen blue antibacterial pills in California, and I've never had a salon give me the foot scrub they used on me afterwards. I didn't feel rushed at all!

36.description: The salon does not have any glitz or glamor, but I LOVE VAN.  Van does the best manicure/pedicure and always spends a long time making sure my cuticles are cut/clean.  I have been going to Van for 3 years and highly rec' her.  I have tried a few others when she was off and was disappointed.

14.description: I go to this salon every two weeks to get the "dip-it" manicure. It's the only place in Chicago that has this style of polish and it's seriously a godsend. I personally love it more than no chip. It stays on longer and makes my nails stronger. The paraffin dip made my hands baby soft also. The new remodeling looks awesome and everyone is so sweet. I'll never go anywhere else in the city...I love this salon!

58.description: Nice atmosphere, delicious food, prompt and knowledgable service from Humberto. The Caesar salad was surprisingly good, much better than a typical salad appetizer. I had a fabulous vegetable risotto special. I would definitely recommend the seasonal fruit crostata for dessert. The portion sizes were filling but not too big. I had no complaints with my experience at Tre Soldi and would return for sure!

56.description: We ate here yesterday night, 30 minutes before they closed their doors. It's truly a beautifully set restaurant, with many large windows to view the outside restaurants, and passerby street people. Chicago is still awake, which is notably pointed out, with the busy bustling young adults who are outside deciding in large noisy groups, with loud voices saying things like... 'The night is young, lets go to this so and so bar!' ... 'I'm buzzed, and I want to check out this so and so lounge, and dance!'... Ji-Seung and I are like... 'dude keep it down, we are tired and just want some good food, because we're exhausted!'Anywho... our server, was a bit zippy from the get go. It was apparently very obvious he wanted us to eat super quick and get out super pronto, so that he could do his nightly errands, and just get to his next destination... after all, it's party harty day, and his job is the last place he wants to be.We start off with our choices: Ji-Seung chooses the app, which is a cheese wrapped rice ball, with a great dip sauce of tomatoes and herbs. It was so good. Crunchy on the outside, and as you bite into the ball, it sort of crumbles and falls into the rice inside. Not salty at all. I did mention: 'NO ADDED SALT TO ANY OF OUR DISHES PLEASE... thank you so much', with a small smile... hopefully he'll cheer up.I ask him: 'Is the margarhetta pizza less cheesy than the mushroom pizza?'... I ask because it's pretty late, and I don't want to go to sleep having to digest so much fatty cheese... already the cheese ball is enough.He ensures me that the first choice has less cheese, it just has mozzarella balls here and there. Okay, so I say that I want the less cheese Margarhetta pizza, with no salt. It's made to order, so a simple very easy request. Just don't look at that salt shaker and move her booty up and down, dosing the gluten free pizza crust, because after all the tomato sauce is salty as is.So what comes to the table? THE MUSHROOM PIZZA WITH SALT.I'm super hungry, so i just let it pass... and say to myself: 'just be grateful that it's food, and it's closing time, and everyone is bustling around cleaning tables, making loud noises as they rush here and there, mopping and wiping, and I can smell the cleaning products within the air, as it circulates as we eat. So I'm eating slowly, because I won;t rush myself, and endure a night of rumblings in my tummy for any server and employees, because like them, if you don't care about my needs, why should I care about your selfish needs? After all, i didn't complain about the MANY mistakes you selfishly made because YOU WEREN'T LISTENING.The table next to us are a loud group of drunkards, who are taking their time enjoying their food. Our server knows that this group will leave a hefty tip, while us two tired girls will just leave mouse leftovers, from our small pockets.So onto the food... DELICIOUS, OMG. Also we were hungry and tired... so maybe that just increased the taste buds to be less picky, and just love whatever is savored within our mouths. The crust is thin... but salty. The egg on top was the a very smart add on. It decreased the SALT VOLUME. The mushrooms are healthy, delicious, and I'm a lover of most shrooms. Mushrooms that were SALTED.However, no complaints when he he quickly and rudely asked with a fake smirk... 'how's everything,' with a subtle wave of 'uh, hurry up.' We both say, 'Oh it's very good.' In my mind: 'BUT SALTY, however, I'm too tired to care, and back at home I've got yogurt and water to take away the salt factor.'I will be back, because that time, I'll clearly state my last visit was salty, and a bit snappy.PS. You're food is delicious, and there are many gluten free options. If you just LISTEN to EVERY SINGLE diner, you'll get 5 starts instead of 4. Also, I left more than 20%, because I understand that being a server at a busy joint, that opens early and closes at 11PM, a saint factor is not always possible. So, next time I know the relationship will get closer, for I've said my piece, and the rest lets give PEACE.

29.description: Best pizza in Chicago. Hands down! We live in the neighborhood and get an incredible meal every time, best quality ingredients, service and wine list! Deserts can't be beat. We love this restaurant because it is not a mass produced chain restaurant. The food is unbeatable- along with the price.

42.description: I absolutely love this place! The food is amazing and the service is unbeatable. I feel confident bringing clients here for meals and Marco the owner always takes care of us! I have never once had a negative experience.

23.description: My boyfriend and I love Chicago, one of the reasons being the food. We've never had a bad meal any of the times we've visited.
