We discovered this restaurant last week when we were in town and fell in love. The food is so delicious, the service is wonderful, and the ambiance is just right if you want a nice, but casual, meal. We loved it so much that we went three times in the span of four days!The highlight of the meal by far was the octopus and potatoes. It would be criminal not to order that dish when dining there. The next time we're in town we are going to make a point to come back.

47.description: This place was surprisingly good. I have been reading the reviews and I am glad I gave it a try!

8.description: Pasta made in house so really fresh and scrumptious. Wine n an entree came out to about 35$, includes tip.The restaurant is slightly above street level on Ohio so it's pretttty nice people lurking from a slightly different angle. Plus, the street has some light-decorated trees that are pretty :) it's also next to gyu-gaku so if it happens to be too crowded there and u have to wait you can always head next door n chill out w some wine rather than sit in their waiting area.

31.description: Great food, great atmosphere!!! Very authentic. The salads where delicious!  Drinks were incredibly strong!!!

34.description: A great place to eat on a summer evening. Just off the Magnificent Mile, they have seating outside and a warm, friendly vibe. We got kale salad with apple and hazelnuts, which was delicious, and followed that up with *amazing* lasagna and ravioli. Good food, modern music, outdoor seating. A perfect mix!

16.description: First time I every tried tre soldi and it was just out of no where. Me and my fiancé were hungry and just browsing places around our hotel and this restaurant came up because we were craving italian food. Let me tell you...you will not be disappointed! loved loved this place! We loved it so much that we went back the last day we were in chicago! Recommend the calamari!! THE BEST i have every tried!! and their pizza was great!! I am not a fan of the chicago style pizza so this place made their pizzas thin crust. Their pasta was phenomenal amazing palomino sauce!

13.description: We loved this place. Ordered two of the salads which were amazing (kale/apple and the beet salad) and a fresh pasta special. The setting is lovely and the wait staff are professional and attentive.

11.description: When you're looking for authentic food, an authentic dining experience, for a reasonable price, look no further than Tre Soldi. A wide selection of wines both house wines and select bottles. Impress your customers or your date by dining here. Very comfortable and enjoyable experience.  Come visit Marco, he will make sure you experience is pleasant. Service is outstanding.

39.description: Couldn't decide between the gnocchi and tagliatelle, bar tender recommended the gnocchi and it did not disappoint! As a solo traveler you get wait staff who either hover or are absent; I sat at the bar and received my food quickly, bar keep checked in without being annoying, and once he made sure my meal was ok, let me eat in peace. Olive oil that came with the complimentary bread was good as well.

37.description: Had dinner on the outdoor sidewalk patio on a Friday night. The place was busy but we did not have to wait for a table which is hard to find downtown on the weekend. We started with wine and a cocktail which were solid (the Italian Manhattan is tasty). For dinner, we shared the Rigatoni and Spinach Ravioli. Both were good, although I was not blown away; I have definitely had better tasting pasta in the city. That being said, I recommend this place as a decent Italian option given the nice decor/outdoor seating, short wait time, friendly service, and good, but not great food.

0.description: My boyfriend and I love Chicago, one of the reasons being the food. We've never had a bad meal any of the times we've visited. We discovered this restaurant last week when we were in town and fell in love. The food is so delicious, the service is wonderful, and the ambiance is just right if you want a nice, but casual, meal. We loved it so much that we went three times in the span of four days!The highlight of the meal by far was the octopus and potatoes. It would be criminal not to order that dish when dining there. The next time we're in town we are going to make a point to come back.

38.description: Get your nose up and pinky out for this fancy yet moderately priced experience.  If the food here had its own website it would have to be dabomb.com! Your taste buds will be yelling raise the roof and force you to continue eating while completely ignoring your stomach's "all full" message. Belly is officially ready to burst!  Bon a'petite

51.description: The best smoked salmon panini ever!  Such amazing flavored with the thinly sliced cucumbers, arugula and citrus aioli!

27.description: My family came into town and we were able to snag a list minute reservation here. I live down the street and had been wanting to try it for awhile. I'm so happy I finally did!I ordered the carbonara & it was really good. I would recommend ordering it. We also ordered lasagna, ravioli and the spaghetti. We all cleaned our plates. The food was really good and affordable l. After how good the para dishes were, we decided to order dessert. I had the pistachio gelato which was to die for! I will for sure be coming back. I've found my new go to Italian spot in my neighborhood!

32.description: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING ALL AROUND. Great setting, amazing service, and fantastic food. I highly suggest this Italian restaurant!

54.description: Made reservations for 630pm on Saturday. Very good food, excellent service, great ambiance. Would definitely come again and recommend this place

48.description: Wonderful food and excellent service are the hallmark of this restaurant.  Fried calamari is very good (wish it did grilled calamari instead) as was my wife's gnocchi and my penne pasta with arrabiatta sauce (nice and spicy).  Service was efficient and timely.  Both of the owner's checked on us during our meal to see how everything was going, which was a nice touch of class.  Prices were spot on for the portions offered, which, by the way, were perfectly sized.  We had our fill without feeling stuffed and did not have to lug doggie bags around town after dinner.  Wonderful location with outdoor seating, which would be advised if you have difficulty hearing in a crowded and relatively small Italian restaurant.  Overall a very nice place for a good Italian food at a reasonable price for a Mag Mile restaurant.

44.description: Excellent quality and flavor! We ordered Kale salad but changed it to romaine., delicious! Order risotto, pasta specials appetizer portions and preen cotta! Yummy

24.description: This place was terrific! We sat outside on the patio which was lovely. The service was perfect, attentive but not intrusive, and we didn't wait for a thin. The waiter was knowledgeable and made great suggestions. We loved the food (tasty, authentic and abundant) and the wine!

7.description: Visited for lunch, not sure what to expect. Service was super friendly, and the pasta was perfect. I had the butternut squash filled ravioli with a butter cream sauce, toasted pine nuts, and crispy sage. The Bud had the gazillion-layer lasagna. Both were fantastic (pasta had the right amount of give, and their sauce:pasta ratio was spot-on). I love getting off the main drag for my meals. This place is so close to Michigan Avenue that you can pop over for lunch during a marathon shopping/people watching/coffee drinking adventure.

49.description: Excellent food, excellent staff, excellent drinks!  This was our last meal in Chicago and it was amazing!  We started out with the grilled octopus - citrus/olive oil dressing accompanied by roasted potatoes, olives, chopped parsley, and red onions.  Light but hearty.  Excellent dish.  We also ordered an app size of the squid ink pasta- by far my favorite dish of the night!  This is easily a full size meal for an adult.  The shellfish was cooked to perfection, the pasta was al dente and the sauce was buttery and lemony! Nom!  We also shared the kale pizza.  It was slightly underwhelming hot, but the leftovers were sooo much tastier the next day.  Perhaps the flavors had more time to meld?  Finished off with the fruit tart- fresh and not overly sweet. A++ definitely worth a visit!

40.description: Came here because the Japanese place next had a 30 minute wait.  This place was empty.  Have gotten take out and dined on the patio in the past.  This time dined inside with my pops and spouse.Food: Carpaccio, Kale Salad, Ravioli, Lasagna, Carbonara - all AMAZING.  Please order anything that says HOMEMADE pasta. :)  Have had the pizza before also, and that rocks.  Portions are more on the European sizes (i.e. small).  Service: More often than not it is pretty slow and non-responsive.  I did mention we were in a hurry yesterday though, and so service yesterday was pretty good.

53.description: Went here this Wed evening after a convention. We were a party of 8 without any dinner reservations. The host kindly made room for us and had us sitting within 15 minutes. We were warmly greeted by one of the owners named Marco that made sure we were attended to right away. We ordered the Braised Artichokes, Grilled Octopus, Roasted Beet Salad, and Beef Carpaccio for the table which were all amazing. The main courses followed which all in our group unanimously praised over. Perfectly cooked, seasoned right, and using the freshest ingredients. Marco then finished off the meal with some desserts for the table which were devoured, leaving nothing behind. Tre Soldi was a true gem of a restaurant to find in a city where there are so many options to choose from. We've already made our reservations for next year!

30.description: Had an okay lunch here today. I had the Mussels Linguine with a tomato based sauce. Good, not great. She had the trout special which was also good not great.

46.description: Service was mediocre. Carbonara was terrible, don't get it. Appetizers were decent. Overall pretty disappointing.

1.description: This was my second visit to Tre Soldi, with my first visit being about 2 1/2 years ago. While the service was very good, the food was basic. I had the calamari as an appetizer and it was just OK. Nothing special, besides the fact that they were stingy with the amount of calamari they gave me. For my entree I had lasagna which was good, but not memorable.Lastly, I highly recommend that they restaurant takes down those tacky holidays lights that are hanging outside the restaurant.

55.description: Great Italian family restaurant. A bit loud because everyone seemed happy and having a great time. Appears to be a favorite for locals; lot of people knew each other.

9.description: I was in town on a work trip and was wandering aimlessly looking for food.  I ran across this restaurant and decided to give it a try.  When you step in the restaurant was extremely nice and well decorated.  Wandering in with a t-shirt and tennis shoes I felt underdressed.  I arrived early for dinner and more people started showing up when I left.  The food was excellent!  My appetizer of Bruschetta Salame was simple yet amazing.  I went with Rigatoni for my main course.  The pasta was good but it did need a bit more sauce and meatiness.  I will ask for double sauce next time.  The reason I did not score this place higher was because of the staff.   There were two other tables seated and just myself.  I stood there for a few minutes waiting for the host to seat me, who was on his cell phone and I rudely interrupted him wanting to be seated.  Service started out good but progressively got worse throughout the meal.  Two other tables were seated next to me and they started gaining more attention, especially the one with pretty ladies.  My waiter was waiting on them hand and foot as I sat there staring at empty wine and water glasses and waiting for my food.  After I had finished eating it was the same routine of staring at empty plates and glasses.  After I had finished eating it took almost 15 minutes for my check or just some attention.  Good food, nice place, poor service.

26.description: Love this place! The food is great, the vibe is perfect, and the service is A+++. I live close by and come here frequently when we want a little break to relax and enjoy good food and wine. It's a very comfortable place and the people there make us feel right at home. We've tried many things on the menu (all good) but we now always order the same thing because we have a favorite: the same bottle of wine, we share the same pizza, and then we both get the same pasta - a dish that was on an old menu but isn't on it anymore. The cook always makes us the dish! Leo is incredible and welcomes us warmly and he *always remembers* our order. He just smiles and says, "The usual?" It's perfect! Everyone there is this thoughtful. One of the differentiating factors of this restaurant are the amazing people who work here. I am grateful that this restaurant is so close and feels so special - and yet so welcoming - both at the same time.

25.description: I found this place on Yelp as we were trying to find a place close to our hotel and my parents love Italian food! I was very pleasantly surprised. We made a reservation on OpenTable and were seated immediately. We ordered the fried calamari to share and it was realllllllly good! My mom ordered the Arrabbiata (penne, spicy tomato sauce, garlic) and that was super yummy. My dad ordered the Tagliatelle and the lamb ragu was SO delicious, it was more like super tender brisket. I got the Carbonara, which was the most underwhelming. Overall, everything was really tasty and reasonably priced.

12.description: My friend I decided to try out Tre Soldi last night and overall it was an okay restaurant. We were seated right away, the staff provided friendly service from the time we arrived to the time we left. I have don't have any complaints with the staff at all. I loved the ambience of the restaurant , it was very intimate and trendy, but still maintaining an authentic vibe.I ordered a glass of chardonnay along with salmon. The salmon was served on top of a mixture of potatoes , green beans, and tomatoes. My friend ordered the Carbonara, he was underwhelmed with his dish. We both agreed that our dishes weren't bad just not great either.  After looking at other reviews I feel like we ordered the wrong items on the menu. I'm not sure if i would ever go back but if i did i would try one of the popular items i see people talking about mostly.

59.description: I came in at around 6:30 to 7:00 and they sat us down right away. They took our order and I ordered the Caesar salad and the marguerite pizza.The salad was good and quick but the pizza took forever but was Excellent!  The pizza had very flavorful sauce, a hint of basil and a decent amount of mozzarella cheese. We got the check around 8:35 and we had a great time.

21.description: Some of the best authentic Italian I've ever had in the U.S.   Will definitely come back here when in Chicago.

17.description: This is one of the few restaurants in Chicago that supports the new Dash iPhone app. It's honestly the reason why I came here for lunch after shopping on Michigan Ave. The food is very good and the space has a rustic feel. As others recommend, the kale salad is fantastic and filling. The kale pizza is unique. The calamari comes with fried lemon slices that make you wonder why restaurants do not do that more often.The prices here are very reasonable for the amount and quality of food. You can read more here: getda.shSign up and use my code B9273 and get $5.00 off your bill. I get $5.00 and we will both be happy! This is the future everyone.

10.description: We ate here yesterday night, 30 minutes before they closed their doors. It's truly a beautifully set restaurant, with many large windows to view the outside restaurants, and passerby street people. Chicago is still awake, which is notably pointed out, with the busy bustling young adults who are outside deciding in large noisy groups, with loud voices saying things like... 'The night is young, lets go to this so and so bar!' ... 'I'm buzzed, and I want to check out this so and so lounge, and dance!'... Ji-Seung and I are like... 'dude keep it down, we are tired and just want some good food, because we're exhausted!'Anywho... our server, was a bit zippy from the get go. It was apparently very obvious he wanted us to eat super quick and get out super pronto, so that he could do his nightly errands, and just get to his next destination... after all, it's party harty day, and his job is the last place he wants to be.We start off with our choices: Ji-Seung chooses the app, which is a cheese wrapped rice ball, with a great dip sauce of tomatoes and herbs. It was so good. Crunchy on the outside, and as you bite into the ball, it sort of crumbles and falls into the rice inside. Not salty at all. I ask because it's pretty late, and I don't want to go to sleep having to digest so much fatty cheese... already the cheese ball is enough.He ensures me that the first choice has less cheese, it just has mozzarella balls here and there. Okay, so I say that I want the less cheese Margarhetta pizza, with no salt. It's made to order, so a simple very easy request. Just don't look at that salt shaker and move her booty up and down, dosing the gluten free pizza crust, because after all the tomato sauce is salty as is.So what comes to the table? THE MUSHROOM PIZZA WITH SALT.I'm super hungry, so i just let it pass... and say to myself: 'just be grateful that it's food, and it's closing time, and everyone is bustling around cleaning tables, making loud noises as they rush here and there, mopping and wiping, and I can smell the cleaning products within the air, as it circulates as we eat. So I'm eating slowly, because I won;t rush myself, and endure a night of rumblings in my tummy for any server and employees, because like them, if you don't care about my needs, why should I care about your selfish needs? After all, i didn't complain about the MANY mistakes you selfishly made because YOU WEREN'T LISTENING.The table next to us are a loud group of drunkards, who are taking their time enjoying their food. Our server knows that this group will leave a hefty tip, while us two tired girls will just leave mouse leftovers, from our small pockets.So onto the food... DELICIOUS, OMG. Also we were hungry and tired... so maybe that just increased the taste buds to be less picky, and just love whatever is savored within our mouths. The crust is thin... but salty. The egg on top was the a very smart add on. It decreased the SALT VOLUME. The mushrooms are healthy, delicious, and I'm a lover of most shrooms. Mushrooms that were SALTED.However, no complaints when he he quickly and rudely asked with a fake smirk... 'how's everything,' with a subtle wave of 'uh, hurry up.' We both say, 'Oh it's very good.' In my mind: 'BUT SALTY, however, I'm too tired to care, and back at home I've got yogurt and water to take away the salt factor.'I will be back, because that time, I'll clearly state my last visit was salty, and a bit snappy.PS. You're food is delicious, and there are many gluten free options. If you just LISTEN to EVERY SINGLE diner, you'll get 5 starts instead of 4. Also, I left more than 20%, because I understand that being a server at a busy joint, that opens early and closes at 11PM, a saint factor is not always possible. So, next time I know the relationship will get closer, for I've said my piece, and the rest lets give PEACE.

5.description: The best Italian food in Chicago!!!!

3.description: We have been here more than a couple of times since we moved to Streeterville. The food is delicious and the owner of the place is very friendly giving it a very authentic vibe. They do serve gluten free fettuccine and gluten free pizzas which is definitely a plus. Their pastas are darn good. I do recommend the ricotta gnocchi and fettuccine with mushroom ragu. Only gripe are the servers and waiting staff. Almost every single time, they were ready to clean the table as soon as you are done. Almost trying to push you out, even though the place was empty. I also got food delivered a couple of times and quality was same as restaurant. Overall decent experience so close to home.

35.description: Although the Calamari was good the main meals were a disappointment. One of our group ordered Lasagna and said it tasted more like beef stroganoff. The atmosphere was fine but the food itself no so good. Service was average. Seemed like a struggle to get the typical oil and bread that you get in most Italian places.

19.description: We stopped in here on a recommendation and were pleasantly surprised. It's got a great atmosphere, looks nicer but still has a casual feel. The service was a little slow and our waiter was constantly distracted, looking all over the room while we ordered. Basically anywhere but our table and/or faces. My only guess was maybe he was waiting for some friends to come in. I ordered the ricotta gnocchi and everything tasted incredibly fresh and homemade. It was the softest gnocchi I've ever had, topped with a dollop of rich, creamy ricotta and a drizzle of olive oil. Incredible. I was so stuffed but had to splurge for dessert when I saw my favorite classic, panna cotta. It had vanilla beans throughout and was divine. They paired it with a caramel sauce and strawberries, I probably would've preferred something lighter than caramel, but it didn't stop me from eating it. :) I'd definitely stop back in here when we're in the area!

28.description: We came here for my sisters bachelorette party on a Saturday night with a group of 14 people. They were really accommodating with our group and had our table ready for us when we got there so we didnt have to wait! The food was FANTASTIC!!!! Everyone raved over what they ordered and everything was fairly affordable! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because our waiter seemed to almost be annoyed by us... And then at the very end it took us 20 minutes for us to get our checks and credit cards back, even when our limo was outside waiting for us. Other than that, highly recommended!!!

45.description: Surprised this is not on many lists for a really good meal in the Magnificent Mile area. Lamb tagliatelle was excellent as were the spinach ravioli. I also really liked the Caesar salad which I try in every restaurant that says its dressing is homemade.This was one of the best. Outstanding service, reasonable prices and very tasty food.

33.description: Delicious home made pasta, great portion size. We had the gnocchi and lasagna. Will definitely be back!

43.description: This is the finest Italian food I've eaten outside Italy.  It is delicious - it was my second time there, and I ordered the kale salad and gnocchi both times (plus a garbanzo bean soup this time).  Everything was exceptional -- it tasted fresh and homemade.  My boyfriend and I were also very pleased with the service.  It is definitely my favorite Italian restaurant in the U.S., and I hope to be back soon.  Wish a branch would open in Monterey, California and I'd be there all the time!

2.description: I took a group of people here on a weekday evening. They sat us immediately at a large table for 10. We had all of the formaggi starters (verde capra, taleggio, cacio di roma, pecorino toscano, parmigiano) for $7 each. They were all excellent and came with slices of apple, little crostinis, and honey. The parmigiano was my favorite.For an entree, I had penne arrabbiata. It was pleasantly spicy though the penne was a little on the crunchy side. We had prompt service from an actual Italian speaker so I got to order in Italian ("io sono vegetariano...").I would definitely go back and would happily take a group.

18.description: Solid effort by all. Appetizers, dinner and service were all really good. Came here with the kids... I thought that we ordered too much, and the kids wolfed it down.  I recommend the artichoke hearts as an appetizer. You can't go wrong at this place.

41.description: Went there Sunday afternoon to check it out. Family coming into town. I would like to take them to a nice place. Reviews have been good here. Walked in about 1:30 pm. Few patrons. I wanted to find out the restaurants weekend hours. There were three servers helping the 12-15 patrons.  No one came to the desk.  I smiled at the servers. No one came to help. I checked the business cards on the desk. No hours listed. I checked the windows in the entry. No hours that I could find. Still no one came to talk to me. No one...

52.description: Our last night in Chicago and we could not have picked a better place to have a delicious meal.  The pulpo was excellent as was the squid ink pasta and the kale pizza with caramelized onions! The service was top notch. If we ever have the chance to come back, we will!

50.description: We just ate a delicious dinner. All of the courses were excellent and a reasonable amount of food in each course. The waiter was very attentive even though it was quite busy and the wait time was minimal for each course. I'd come again when I'm in Chicago

4.description: Excellent service. The food is so fresh, and delicious! We loved our salads, soups, the calamari and our pastas. The pasta is so fresh and cooked perfectly. Even the Parmesan cheese, the olive oil for dipping on the bread were phenomenal!

6.description: This is a great spot. They have half portions of pasta here, which is amazing. So delicious.

22.description: The food was OK, nothing more, but what was atrocious was the service. The food took forever, the waiter was sloppy and disoriented and the food came out in huge gaps so we were not even really eating together. Never coming back, and you should either.

15.description: I found this place on Yelp as we were trying to find a place close to our hotel and my parents love Italian food! I was very pleasantly surprised. We made a reservation on OpenTable and were seated immediately. We ordered the fried calamari to share and it was realllllllly good! My mom ordered the Arrabbiata (penne, spicy tomato sauce, garlic) and that was super yummy. My dad ordered the Tagliatelle and the lamb ragu was SO delicious, it was more like super tender brisket. I got the Carbonara, which was the most underwhelming. Overall, everything was really tasty and reasonably priced.

57.description: We stumbled into this place, and were so pleased. I'm originally from Boston and my friend who joined me lived in Italy years ago, so our standards for Italian food are pretty high. This is real Italian food, and the prices were so reasonable. Go and enjoy :).

20.description: We ordered the rigatoni and the carbonara.  Both dishes were very good.  Service was also excellent.  The bruschetta was also a hit.

36.description: The food is really good and the service was fast and accurate. However, the bill had an automatic 20% service fee and as we asked the reason for it the waiter argued it was "part of the law of the area". We knew this was not the case as we had had dinner in a few places already so we asked to see the manager who clarified it was policy of the restaurant and not part of any law. Finally the manager decided to remove the automatic 20% surcharge after admitting it was not in the menu. In summary, we found the situation dishonest although the manager acted accordingly.

14.description: Very solid and reasonably priced for the area.  The service was very good--out water was constantly refilled.The green bean salad was very good. Beans cooked but not mushy. Great seasoning. tasted very fresh.We enjoyed both the fettuccine and spaghetti. The spaghetti had a bit of bite--we liked that. Both freshly made pastas.The Italian Manhattan was a nice cocktail.

1.description: After the guy I'd been going to for over a year elsewhere cancelled my appointment at the last minute because he'd decided to go on vacation, I decided to give Floyd's a shot since I work in the area and needed a quick touch-up before going out of town for a wedding. I'm typically not one who likes change when it comes to hair stylists. When I start going to someone, I hate cheating on them. I like being able to sit down and say "have at it" and knowing it'll come out great every time....so to switch stylists at the last minute and right before a wedding: yikes.I had Tyler for my cut and couldn't have left happier. He took his time, asked all the right questions (many of which I didn't know the answers to since I usually just let my regular guy go at it and do what he wants), and gave me a perfect cut and fade. With more comments than usual on how great the cut looked, I'll definitely be back.Bonus: They're open late which is awesome if you're trying to get in after work.

9.description: This place just opened up around the corner from me. It has reasonable pricing for being in Chicago. I call ahead too and get my name on the list and then walk over, which is a plus as I am not one that likes waiting around. I was out on my bike getting it fixed and did not have a lock and they had no problem with me bringing it in the store, so that too was a plus. This place is my new local barbershop. Sorry Bertha's.

23.description: It's a brand new location which is nice! It's right by my work and so I figured I'd give it a try for a quick clean up. I walked in and was greeted right away! The woman at the front desk set me up with Eddy. I would definitely recommend sitting down in his chair! He was great! Easy to talk to, detailed and professional! I will be going back to see him!

12.description: I've been searching for a good barber shop around Chicago since I've moved here, this one is by far the best cut and customer service that I've come across.  Natasha was the one who cut my hair, I showed her a picture of what I wanted and she took the time to look at every detail.  She took her time during the cut and when she was finished, it was just as I wanted.  I'd recommend Floyd's to anyone.

21.description: Great experience! Definitely recommend Megan. She knows what she's doing and has a great personality! Now I'm set looking good for my time here in Chicago!

16.description: I love it when my barber pays attention to the haircut, and I am not seemingly on a conveyer belt. Katie W gave me a great haircut! She was cute and very helpful and paid a lot of attention to my hair. I had a great fade and she helped transition my haircut into the beard!! LOVED the shoulder rub after -- it was totally relaxing!!

17.description: I needed and new place to get my hair cut and this just opened across the street from my office, which is perfect! The staff was friendly and got me in same-day when I called ahead.Sarah was my stylist and wow! She knew what she was doing! My hair isn't easy to cut do to different growth patterns throughout it, but she gave me exactly the faded disconnected undercut I was looking for. My night job is at a Boystown bar, so it's nice to have a trendy haircut...EVERYone took notice of my new do and loved it. Thanks, Sarah! I will be returning to this Floyd's again soon!

10.description: I needed to have my hair colour corrected and fixed after a bad salon experience and when my husband went here and told me they have dedicated colourists at this store I thought l'd make an appointment. My consultation was with Sarah (could be spelt Sara) was great, she was so patient as I didn't really know what I wanted but needed to cover up patchy bits of red left from the last disaster. She made excellent suggestions and we got started.What a perfectionist and also a lovely personality.If I lived in Chicago, she would be my go to every time!Salon was inviting and laid back, I would 200% recommend this place.

5.description: Everyone here is super friendly and courteous, great atmosphere and a comfortable place! I've been back about 4 times to see Cat, who rocks. Cat is always fun and super cute, most importantly, though, she does a great job with my hair!

11.description: Brilliant place!I walked in and asked for a haircut...waited 5 mins and was in.My barber listened to my requests for style, then she also made suggestions.Great comfortable old school with new school haircut and grooming experience.The best!!

22.description: First time at a lloyds, love the call 30 min ahead situation. Chill place. Friendly staff. Cat was awesome. She went out of her way to make sure everything was tight and right. Best haircut I've had in a while. Happy guy

0.description: First time I have gotten my haircut at a new place in a couple years, and I'm really glad to have found this place close to my office.  Called ahead to put my name on the list and was taken immediately (which was great because it started to pick up around noon when I left).Everyone was super friendly and accommodating; Osborn did an awesome job cutting my hair and I will definitely be coming back.

20.description: I was extremely nervous to come here. I wanted a new hairstyle to go along with my new job but had waited until the Sunday before to do something. I checked yelp to see what salon was open today and Floyd's 99 came up. The reviews were great but I'm African-American and I was worried how it may turn out. I called to ask if they felt comfortable doing my hair type and the receptionist said it wouldn't be a issue. Megan did my hair. She was extremely knowledgeable about all types of hair and even gave me tips on how to grow thicker eyelashes. She took extra time to straighten my hair in small sections. I actually forgot I was at a chain. I highly recommend checking them out. I'll definitely be back to Megan at Floyd's for future trims and cuts.

19.description: It's a brand new location which is nice! It's right by my work and so I figured I'd give it a try for a quick clean up. I walked in and was greeted right away! The woman at the front desk set me up with Eddy. I would definitely recommend sitting down in his chair! He was great! Easy to talk to, detailed and professional! I will be going back to see him!

2.description: I really don't like having to give bad reviews but there's no way I can avoid this as it was the literally the worst job I've ever had done. All I needed was a 1 back and sides, short on top. So messy and uneven, no fade at all, I tried my best to guide them to fix it but instead I got told it was the lights or the shape of my head! I've had the same haircut since I can remember and this is the first time I've ever had to come home and shave my hair all off straight after a cut. Stick to your normal barbers or you'll be disappointed, believe me.

18.description: Always a pleasure to go to Floyds and get my haircut. Friendly and very good at what they do. Sarah M is a pro and gets my hair right every time and will do whatever it takes to make sure I love it.

13.description: My new favorite barbershop! In my opinion Floyd's Barbershop is as good or better than many of the expensive salons that I have been and their prices are much less.  Megan was my stylist and did a great job!

4.description: Love this place. Cat B. always does a great job! Meticulous and precisely cut, faded, and shaved every time.

6.description: Sarah Meyer is the best!!! I'm very particular about my hair color.  I want my hair to be low maintenance but still chic even when I don't see her for a few months.  She never lets me down! I always walk out of the salon looking and feeling amazing! Since I get balayage, my highlights grow out looking natural and NEVER streaky! She is the very best at balayage and should be working for the stars! Not even joking. Go see her!!

15.description: So I'll preface this review by saying I have never had a bad experience with Floyd's. I usually go to the location on Milwaukee Ave in Wicker park. I stopped into the Ohio St location for the first time this past week. The woman cutting my hair didn't listen to anything I said I wanted. For the past few months I have been growing my hair out and just getting trims to keep it from looking uneven. I told her I wanted a 5 guard clipper on the sides and back with it tapered to a 3.5 guard on the bottom. She started using a 2.5 guard clipper and even though I wasn't facing the mirror, I could see how much hair was coming off. I immediately voiced my concerns but she told me it would look good. Nothing she did ever made it look good. She wanted to use a 6 guard on the top but I told her boldly that I wanted a scissor cut on top with only a little bit (maybe a quarter of an inch) taken off. She ended up taking a full inch off the top because she couldn't get it even and kept cutting. At this point I was disgusted. I should've voiced my opinion when I checked out but I just wanted to leave because I was so mad. I've never had someone cut my hair and not listen to what I wanted. I even told her I had a cut just 3 weeks ago so not much needed to be taken off. After using a barber shop in Lincoln Park for 2 years, I might be going back after this. Now that it's been a few days since my cut, I can look in the mirror and tell how uneven my hair is.

7.description: Great cut, staff and prices...

8.description: It was such a disappointment because we live on this street- my boyfriend gets his hair cut every other week and we were so excited to have a barbershop basically right next door instead of hiking to Irving park where he normally goes. He focused on going to a barber, David. It was just a sloppy mess, fade was funky, and his beard was chopped with a lot of different levels and this is after he asked him to fix it. Don't want to throw him under the bus because he just seemed new and I'm sure he will get it together but it was so bad we had to go to his regular barber a few days later. We may give this place another chance because we are desperate for the convenience but if it doesn't improve with another barber then that's a wrap. Otherwise- dope space.

3.description: Great music and staff. Ely P is AMAZING. She did a great job cutting my hair(she took off many inches of dead weight) about a week ago and I came back for some  color work. Very happy with the service provided and the environment. I'm referring all of my friends to her!

14.description: First time at a lloyds, love the call 30 min ahead situation. Chill place. Friendly staff. Cat was awesome. She went out of her way to make sure everything was tight and right. Best haircut I've had in a while. Happy guy

29.description: If you love some space and quiet surrounding. Great food, simple ambience and fast service.

42.description: A must visit when on Michigan Ave.  Great food, loved the "snack-atizers" try a few, especially the Buffalo Cucumbers.  Had the smoked trout app, ceasar salad, rotiserre prime rib, rib eye, roasted brussel sprouts, and nutella brownie.Everything was fantastic, service and atmosphere could not be better!

23.description: I had lunch recently with some colleagues from work and we loved The Windsor. We sat outside surrounded by flowers. I had the chicken rotisserie sandwich, which was delicious. And I tried the spaetzle mac and cheese -- very yummy. Everything was top notch. The restaurant wasn't far from our River North office, so I know we'll be visiting often.

47.description: Lets give this brand new restaurant  a fantastic thumbs UP.....perfectly located in the city. Love the interior design---staff is very courteous and knowledgeable.  I had the Crab Cake appetizer which was generous and delicious and finished off the meal with tender Scallops entree.      Congrats Dunley and group--you have a winner on your hands

8.description: A must visit when on Michigan Ave.  Great food, loved the "snack-atizers" try a few, especially the Buffalo Cucumbers.  Had the smoked trout app, ceasar salad, rotiserre prime rib, rib eye, roasted brussel sprouts, and nutella brownie.Everything was fantastic, service and atmosphere could not be better!

31.description: And the award goes to...Most pleasant surprise: scallops entree comes with not 2, not 3, but 4 scallops!  Whoopee! And they're done perfectly and pair scrumptiously with that corn and mushroom combo.  Here's one night I didn't miss red meat!Top small plate: though we debated for 10 minutes about whether to get 2, 3, or whattheheckoneofeach of the appetizers, we landed on 3 (the spaetzle mac 'n cheese, guac, and Korean short rib).  The clear tastiest of the bunch was the mac 'n cheese with bacon; the other 2 were a little underwhelming, with the tortilla chips bordering on stale, the guac lacking in creaminess, and the short ribs with the heaping pile of coleslaw served next to it forgettable.  Best aroma: the. mouthwatering. smell. of. that. skillet. cookie!  (My nose had mistook the aroma of that for the nutella brownie, which we ordered for dessert, and which was 100% ooey-gooey-chewy-chocolately goodness with vanilla ice cream.)Biggest opportunity: refill our water cups!  By the end of our 1 hour and 40 minute meal, over half the table had completely empty glasses of water.  They'd never been refilled.  Seems like a rookie miss.Business savvy moment: show the hotel valet next door the business card here, and you'll get a discount (thank you!).  Instead of paying a whopping $27 for less than 2 hours of parking, you'll pay a debatably preposterous amount of $20.

34.description: The food is amazing! I ordered the pork chops and I devoured them. Great price point for the amount of food received. Can't wait to go back! Nice atmosphere. Laid back!

16.description: The food was very good.  The service was also attentive.  I am visiting from out of town for Northwestern and I will stop back again for the prime rib!Mark

13.description: So excited about this place opening. The location is amazing & the décor is even better. The mussels were perfectly cooked & seasoned, & you can never go wrong with a skillet cookie. The wine list is extensive & well thought out. Our server Emily was attentive & friendly & made the visit very memorable. Will definitely keep coming back!

11.description: Came in for breakfast. Great. Spätzle mac and cheese, and some ridiculous hash browns are standouts. Really the hash browns should be on the controlled substance list, they were that good. Will be coming back.

39.description: I went to The Windsor recently with a friend on a Saturday night. The weather was lovely and we were able to sit on the spacious patio. (It's hard to tell you're in the heart of Streeterville with such a nice outdoor space.) The food and service was fabulous. Emily, our server, was attentive without being overbearing and gave us great drink & food suggestions. This was my friend's second visit and even though she was getting an entrée, she absolutely raved about the Wrightwood Salad. We got that, and the Spaetzle Mac & Cheese, to start. Both were excellent. I'm a Southern gal (born & raised in Memphis & moved to Chicago from Atlanta in April), and I like to think of myself as a Mac & Cheese connoisseur. The Windsor's did not disappoint. Creamy without being gooey and flavorful without being too rich. I decided to splurge and got the prime rib as my entrée. It was served with mashed potatoes and I got an additional side of asparagus - I needed something green to balance my dinner! The prime rib was flavorful, tender, and cooked perfectly, and the potatoes and asparagus were both delicious. My friend got the bucatini, which she said was fantastic. At this point, we were very happily stuffed, but how could we have this amazing meal without enjoying a dessert as the finale? We decided on the nutella brownie, served warm with a scoop of ice cream on top. YUM. YUM. YUM. It was the perfect ending to a pretty perfect meal.Beyond the food, the actual restaurant is gorgeous, with detailed wood ceilings and a couple of rooms that look like they can be closed off for private events. It's beautiful without being stuffy, and when the weather is nice, the restaurant flows onto the patio thanks to what look like big pocket doors. We happened to chat a bit with the couple sitting at a highboy next to us (in what I think would have been inside the restaurant if the pocket doors were closed), and they raved about their food as well - she said the mussels were the best she'd ever had.Since going to The Windsor, I haven't stopped talking about it. Chicago has some of the most amazing food, and I feel fortunate that I was able to experience the exceptional food, service and ambiance of The Windsor. Chef Todd Stein & his team have done a fabulous job, and I'm looking forward to dining at The Windsor as often as possible!

37.description: Just returned from a delightful evening @ this recently opened property.  All aspects  from the hostess to the martini to the service was top-notch.  My waitress, Tristen, was quite impressive.  She was thorough and knowledgeable in regards to the menu details.  After her recommendations chose the incredible beet salad.  YUM! YUM!  Ordered a bowl of their Smoke Daddy chili (a 'sister' property) available as their soup of the day on Saturday.The value for the quality and portion size is incredible !  The Windsor will be one of my 'go to spots'.  FYI this restaurant group (4 SG)  also owns The Remington on S Michigan across from Millennium Park... a must try.  The lobster deviled eggs and the filet sliders are 'over the top'.I am a gin martini man so am hoping they add a few more gins such as Chicago produced CH and Leatherbee.Cheers, clinks and 'tasty sips of HUM',GLW

0.description: Wow. Just absolute wow. This place is probably one of the most underrated eating sports in Chicago. This is a must try to anyone visiting! Especially if you're staying in the Hampton next door. We would come over to the Windsor around 8:30 at night after a long day of walking to just wind down. The first night we got to Chicago, we came to grab a quick bite to eat. My sister got a burger with fries. We fell in LOVE with with the fries. We then proceeded to order 2 separate plates of fries. My father tried the chicken tortilla soup and said it was the best he had ever had. Since we fell in love with the fries and cool, classy ambience, we came back. We ordered 4 more plates of french fries. We just could not get enough!!

38.description: We just happened to walk by the Windsor. Wonderful food and wonderful service. I live the decor! And is in my neighborhood! I hope they do some outreach and promotions for local residents. Much success to this restaurant!

27.description: I came here for lunch and It is a nice casual place with great service. My food came out very quickly. I ordered the chicken sandwich and it had no seasoning. The tomatillo salsa was sweet and no spice. I like spicy food, but they should offer some alternatives such as a light chile mayo on the side. I asked for some crushed red peppers to add some spice. I had the coleslaw as a side and it was one of the best I had. I would come back for a beer and try something else from the menu.

32.description: Came in for breakfast. Great. Spätzle mac and cheese, and some ridiculous hash browns are standouts. Really the hash browns should be on the controlled substance list, they were that good. Will be coming back.

44.description: So excited about this place opening. The location is amazing & the décor is even better. The mussels were perfectly cooked & seasoned, & you can never go wrong with a skillet cookie. The wine list is extensive & well thought out. Our server Emily was attentive & friendly & made the visit very memorable. Will definitely keep coming back!

24.description: Excellent food and drinks. Good service and good prices. Loved the nutella brownie.

7.description: We came here later in the evening and sat at the bar for dinner. The bartenders were super busy but very friendly and took the time to make us some fun cocktails! We ordered a bunch of small plates to share including the macaroni and cheese, short ribs,  fried clams and the crab toast. Everything was pretty good but the crab toast was the bomb!

40.description: Wow. I had the pleasure of going here before the restaurant opened on one of their preview nights. We got to try a wide array of the foods and I can say it was all amazing. I can't wait to go back.  I love turkey burgers and have eaten them at more restaurants that I can count. This was by far, the best one I have had. Don't pass up the mac and cheese. I can also recommend the short ribs, and this is coming from a person who doesn't love meat.

30.description: Pretty dead on a Saturday night and slow service. Food and drink look good but we left to grab dinner elsewhere

46.description: I love the clams!!!!! The chop salad is to die for! What can I say besides it is awesome!

1.description: I grabbed a bite to eat early afternoon. I was pleasantly surprised that it was not too busy on a weekend afternoon, after the two previous places I tried were packed. Sat at the bar and had an appetizer and entree. Both were good. The Monkey bread is essentially a cinnamon bun. It has a sweet sticky glaze as you would expect but also some components that are baked/toasted to add a little crunch. It's generous size and probably more fitting for 4 people to share. For the entree I had the Crab Benedict. It was decent. Some for the side, I got the potatoes. The potatoes were the surprising part of the dish. It was hash browns with both a savory fluffy part and a crispy outer crust. Overall good dining experience. Excellent bet for the weekend if you're looking to avoid crowds.

9.description: Outstanding spot. Crab toast and Berkshire pork chop are amazing!!  Great selection of bourbon and mixed drinks. Barkeep was very friendly and we had a great chat. All and all a awesome place with a great vibe.

26.description: Last time I visited was just before it closed down as elephant&castle.  Out of curiosity I walked past to see what had taken its place as was rumoured to be a coffee bar.  Saw the Windsor and it looked very different.  Went in for a light meal.  Felt very relaxed and informal atmosphere.  The menu was varied.  Chose the fried egg sandwich which was cooked to perfection.  Our waitress I think was called Lauren.  She was really friendly and helpful from beginning to end.    I am visiting again next month so will try to visit again and have a full meal with hopefully the same waitress.

25.description: The food here is outstanding! We came here with 8 girls on a Saturday night. The ambience is very relaxed and chill. We tried almost everything on the menu. We loved everything! Highly recommend!

12.description: The food is amazing! I ordered the pork chops and I devoured them. Great price point for the amount of food received. Can't wait to go back! Nice atmosphere. Laid back!

21.description: Outstanding spot. Crab toast and Berkshire pork chop are amazing!!  Great selection of bourbon and mixed drinks. Barkeep was very friendly and we had a great chat. All and all a awesome place with a great vibe.

17.description: Pretty dead on a Saturday night and slow service. Food and drink look good but we left to grab dinner elsewhere

10.description: Breakfast menu was pretty limited, food was average. No people in restaurant but somehow they forgot pet of our meal and it took a while for it to show up still. Found out once we got the bill that they charge you every time they fill your coffee. Not worth your time.

5.description: Friendly service?  You betcha!  Good food?  Yep.  Nice ambiance?  Yes sir.  So much nicer than the old Elephant and Castle that once graced these walls.Stopped in for lunch the other day to check out the latest creation from the Four Star Restaurant Group (they also recently opened Remingtons which is also high on my list!)  We were seated in the dining area next to the fireplace (a nice touch on this cold day) which is warm with earth tones, leather and small seating areas.Our server, Braxton, was great!  Full of suggestions as to what we might like and quick with drink refills.  He was just the kind of server you would like to have sit down and have a drink with you (it was slow so he probably could have!, ha!) as we talked about not only the food but shared some personal stories.As for the food, I had the Wrightwood salad based on his recommendation and it was very tasty with rotisserie chicken, avocado and goat cheese and my friend had the beet salad.  Know before you go that the beet salad is sized more like a side salad than an entree salad.The menu also has burgers, entrees like pork, mussels and steak, as well as they serve brunch which probably appeals to the hotel patrons of the adjacent Hampton Inn.And while I was trying to watch what I ate on this day, there is a Nutella brownie with salted caramel sauce that was calling to me on the menu.(still is and it's been a couple of weeks!)There are a couple of large rooms in the back as well so this could also be a great place for your holiday party as it was all decorated when I was there and felt very festive!If you drive- parking is always a bit of a challenge in this area.  If you park across the street at the hospital it is going to set you back a pretty penny ($40 for a couple of hours) so my suggestion is to park a couple of blocks away or ask if they validate (I forgot to and got hit with a parking tab bigger than my lunch bill!)All in all, a nice addition to the neighborhood as there is little like it in the area.

3.description: It's Lent and the fish fry is amazing here. So light and crispy, not greasy and really generous portion. I had it on Saturday and I'm still thinking about it. My daughter always gets the spaetzel mac and cheese and my son loves the chips and guac and cheese burgers here. Food always comes out super quick. Also, I think their bar snacks are the best deal in town, especially the chips and french onion dip.

35.description: Fantastic. I try not to eat pork but their Pork Chop w/mashed potatoes was phenomenal! Our party of 4 was treated very nicely with quick service. The waitress was very knowledgable. They have water filtered by Pepsi. Absolutely would come again. No wonder it's hot & new. Not the best view, but has great food and atmosphere with a full bar.

19.description: We had Julie as a bar tender. She was great, very friendly and some of the quickest service I've had. We will definitely be back again.

28.description: Been to the Windsor a couple times and have really enjoyed it. The cheeseburger is one of the best I've had, perfectly cooked and accompanied w/a ripe tomato, lettuce, and pickle. Can't be beat! The smoked trout dip and guacamole are also standouts.  A cozy interior and excellent service makes for an inviting and enjoyable experience.

45.description: What a great place to find right across from the Hyatt on magnificent mile! Beautiful Beet salad... Tasty jewels of cooked and carpaccio beets and arugula, steamed mussels with yummy crouton soaked in jus... And house made guacamole with hand cut chips! The best part of this sweet place was our fabulous server Jasmine! If we could ever steal her away to the west coast we would!!!

33.description: This place is a perfect example of what it is.  Food is better than good.  Prices appropriate.  Cocktails correct.  Waitstaff was doing it right.  Go here, don't worry.

43.description: It was only day four of this restaurant when we went for brunch last Sunday. But the early signs are excellent. My chicken hash was outstanding - chicken moist and plentiful, the fried eggs just the right amount of runny. My wife's pancakes were light and tasty. The room is comfortable and the staff attentive and well trained. Looking forward to trying a dinner service.

2.description: Wandered into the Windsor because it was down the block from our hotel. It's about a block off the Mag Mile, on a nice corner. Enjoyed a few snacks and cocktails in the bar area (early evening hours) before meeting family for dinner plans elsewhere. Our server was not the most skilled, but she was very attentive and personable. Ordered up a round of Manhattans: bourbon cherries on point. Deviled egg: to die for. Very creative twist on a pot luck classic. It totally works. Order one per person and enjoy every savory bite. Spatzle Mac - I might have fought my hubby for the last bite. And then there was the french onion dip. I'm a chip-and-dip connoisseur; queso, guac, salsa, spinach, I do not discriminate. But this... Caramelized onions in a delicious dip... with the homemade chips... It was really unforgettable. My only complaint is that we didn't have time to stay for dinner. I would most definitely return, for breakfast, lunch, or dinner!

18.description: We have visited twice for brunch and love it! Menu is limited but food is well seasoned. Their outside seating is nice and they do allow dogs! Monkey bread is delicious!! Huge buns come on a cast iron skillet drizzled with sweet glaze! They also taste amazing the next day re-toasted with some walnuts! Chicken hash is good.. Like chicken pot pie but with turned into a hash.. Caesar salad was crisp and refreshing! Service is attentive and coffee remained filled! Good new Streeterville spot!

41.description: The Windsor restaurant is a must do! Atmosphere is open, cleansing and welcoming. Whether you choose to sit at an inside booth, the vibrant bar, or the outdoor oasis of seating, you won't be disappointed. I stopped in for lunch simply because the outdoor seating on a beautiful breezy day couldn't be passed up. The menu has a good variety/options with items ranging from snack sized apps, small plates, well portioned colorful salads, amazing sandwiches, entrees and decadent desserts. I had the Mahi Mahi sandwich which was out of this world with roasted Brussels sprouts as a side. I tend to look at other dishes ordered as I passed through and I must say everything looked delicious. Overall you just can't go wrong. Great little place in the heart of downtown Chicago.

4.description: And the award goes to...Most pleasant surprise: scallops entree comes with not 2, not 3, but 4 scallops!  Whoopee! And they're done perfectly and pair scrumptiously with that corn and mushroom combo.  Here's one night I didn't miss red meat!Top small plate: though we debated for 10 minutes about whether to get 2, 3, or whattheheckoneofeach of the appetizers, we landed on 3 (the spaetzle mac 'n cheese, guac, and Korean short rib).  The clear tastiest of the bunch was the mac 'n cheese with bacon; the other 2 were a little underwhelming, with the tortilla chips bordering on stale, the guac lacking in creaminess, and the short ribs with the heaping pile of coleslaw served next to it forgettable.  Best aroma: the. mouthwatering. smell. of. that. skillet. cookie!  (My nose had mistook the aroma of that for the nutella brownie, which we ordered for dessert, and which was 100% ooey-gooey-chewy-chocolately goodness with vanilla ice cream.)Biggest opportunity: refill our water cups!  By the end of our 1 hour and 40 minute meal, over half the table had completely empty glasses of water.  They'd never been refilled.  Seems like a rookie miss.Business savvy moment: show the hotel valet next door the business card here, and you'll get a discount (thank you!).  Instead of paying a whopping $27 for less than 2 hours of parking, you'll pay a debatably preposterous amount of $20.

6.description: Overall: We came here for brunch and received some of the slowest service I've had with food that's too rich and buttery. Food: My table shared the monkey bread and mac and cheese. I ordered the chicken hash. The Monkey Bread was coated with caramelized sugar and cream. I ate two and felt nauseous. The mac and cheese was runny and watery without much flavor. The chicken hash was dominated by celery flavor. ---Long story short, we sat at this restaurant for about 3 hours with no service. The waiter was friendly but kept us seated there for such a long time that we started getting sleepy. Oh, and the food that we ordered was not good. As in bad.

22.description: Salty!  Hubby ordered Ranch oyster crackers and Sriracha corn nuts from the bar menu. Fine if you are drinking but we barely touched them because of the sodium overload.  I thought their shoestring fries were like kettle corn- sweet and salty.  Off putting if you don't expect that.   Know that the Brussels sprouts aren't plain but doused with a sweet and spicy soy sauce.  My favourite was their Key Lime Pie. Excellent deep crust with line shavings.  Slow to refill water but quick to clear your plates.

15.description: This food was ok but I was disappointed by the service. The waiter struggled to break out a smile the whole night and looked annoyed when I asked him to repeat the sides available with one dish. Sounds petty but everytime he came around with plates he just left them on a stack on the table instead of passing them around, which was annoying as my girlfriend's mother had to pass them around each time (he left them by her). I would have told him only didn't want to cause an awkward atmosphere there. It also took a good 15 minutes before I finally was able to flag someone down for the bill as the waiter seemed to be happy to abandon our table (the place wasn't busy either).

20.description: I had the chopped salad....really tasty, big portion, reasonably priced ($14)....good vibe, busy but not too crowded....very enjoyable!

36.description: Breakfast menu was pretty limited, food was average. No people in restaurant but somehow they forgot pet of our meal and it took a while for it to show up still. Found out once we got the bill that they charge you every time they fill your coffee. Not worth your time.

14.description: When we first sat down I wasn't sure about this place and I said good morning even though it was afternoon and the waitress decided she needed to correct me on that.  Hello, it's always cloudy here I don't know what time it is!  Almost just got up and left lol BUT glad we stayed!  The food was absolutely amazing!  We also had a few cocktails as well, which were great.  By the end of our meal the waitress and I were literally best friends, I now know her son and daughter's names, etc.  If we were to return to Chicago we'd eat here often!  Also, they play all oldies, it really made me nostalgic thinking about my Dad. Loved it!

12.description: Bertha did a wonderful job and I couldn't be happier. Kind and listened and did exactly as I asked. Made my haircut in Chicago a winner. Thanks!

3.description: Found this on yelp as I was looking for a haircut place near me that was NOT a chain.  First cut is 15 from her website offer and I think normal price is 20 after that. Convenient location if you work or live off Michigan Ave.  Bertha was very friendly and gave a great cut.

1.description: Bertha is a 5 star!I've been in Chicago for almost a year, trying out different salons, but couldn't find any that were worth the money.Bertha is definitely the best I've met, and has a fair price. My search has ended.She's located in the Tribune tower, 9th floor. Give her a visit - you won't regret it!

2.description: Bertha is fantastic. Great, basic haircut at a reasonable price. She can usually schedule you last minute as well.

9.description: Bertha's is one of the best barbershop in town! Not only is everyone so friendly there (just for that alone I would go back), but Bertha's also has the most professional barber and hair stylists. I highly recommend this place especially for those out-of-towners, who are sick of expensive haircuts or expensive AND bad haircuts. Bertha's will solve both problems with a smile!

10.description: Based in the Chicago Tribune building, 9th floor. Go in to lobby and check in at reception. Lovely lady. Great haircut. Highly recommended.

13.description: Everything you've read is true: Bertha is hands down THE BEST. Not only did she give my boyfriend the best haircut of his life, but she and her husband are the warmest, most gracious people you ever did meet.  We came in last weekend for a haircut, as we were staying at the Intercontinental for a wedding.  She's a master of her trade, and it's amazing that she only charges $20 for haircuts.  I promise you that her cuts are better than $200 men's haircuts I've seen.  She's the newscasters' best kept secret - his hair and the lines all around his head look great from every angle.  She even made sure to do his eyebrows!  His hair looks amazing in all of the pictures from the wedding, and we have her to thank.  She has a sharp eye, great attention to detail, and is the sweetest, sassiest, most beautiful lady ever.  He adored her and left her shop feeling like a million bucks.  Thank you so much, Bertha!!

16.description: What a great find!  I called to ask the price and was surprised it was only $20 for a basic haircut.  I made an appointment for 30 minutes later, and when I walked into Bertha's small area (with a nice waiting room) I was impressed with the simplicity of it all - right on the Mag Mile.  When she saw my relative lack of hair she gave me $5 off - unsolicited.  I'll go back regularly and tell others about it.  Bertha has a nice manner and personality, she makes it easy and convenient.  It's on the 9th floor of the Tribune Tower and you have to sign in with security, but it's all smooth and easy.  Plus, it's a nice building to walk through.

6.description: Bertha is hands down the best! I just landed with my girlfriend from LA and needed a great haircut in view of my cousin's wedding for which I am one of the groomsmen. Upon learning this Bertha became ecstatic. She almost immediately recognized what cut I was looking for and delivered in an astounding way. For all the attention and skill she put in my haircut $25 is a bargain (I could have asked for the first-timer $10 discount, but I felt it would have been a robbery). In fact, I threw in an extra $5 out of pure gratitude. I've gone to $100 haircuts that looked worst than this. Bertha is a skilled and tasteful hairstylist and a pleasure to be around. Five full stars!

15.description: I havea very simple haircut so maybe I am not the best judge, but $15 on Michigan Ave.   You can't beat it plus it is a nice place with nice people.

0.description: Bertha is fantastic! She gives great hair cuts and is extremely careful in the process. She even opened after hours for a hair emergency. I will definitely keep going back.

5.description: Bertha is very reliable and the only place that I go to to get a haircut in Chicago. I generally only need to give her a half hour to an hour notice to get a hair cut.

11.description: Amazing haircut!!! And amazing lady! She took her time and got it right! My hair is hard to cut and she did an amazing job!

8.description: I came in here off of a recommendation from a co-worker and have been coming back ever since. Bertha's is on the 9th floor of the building I work at, so not only is the service warm and amazing, the commute is easy :)

4.description: I've been getting my haircuts at Bertha's for a few years now, and they always do a great job. I tip big because they always know what I want, even when my visits are several months apart. Although my sessions are shorter now, both Bertha and Alma are as friendly and patient as ever, if I want something done differently.The location is very convenient if you live downtown, but keep in mind that you do need to sign in at the front desk to get to the elevators. The shop itself is small and cozy so you know you'll receive personal attention.

14.description: Great place!!!! Mens haircuts are $20, and you get to walk through a nice historic building. Bertha was great and I will definitely be back. Walking in is like being transported back into the time when you aren't just a name and a number, at least after you get past the doorman for the building.

7.description: Bertha is awesome!  Pure and simple.

58.description: From Texas and I come to Chicago 4 times a year.  This is my "go to" spot for Irish/Sports Bar.  I'm sure there are better spots, but this one is near the hotel where I always stay.  Good beer selection. Decent bar food.  Consistent.  Bar tenders are cool.

56.description: This spot was within walking distance of my hotel so we ended up there a couple of nights before passing out.  Really good beer selection.  Decent prices.  Lots of TVs.  Acceptable but not great service.  Pretty much everything you would want from a sports bar.  I could do without the large staircase but its a good drunk test.

29.description: They have a make your own Bloody Mary bar on Sunday's! Made it a little easier being like 1 of 3 Packer fans in the place during a Bears game haha. Still had great service, our waiter was new and I told him he was a natural! So personable and efficient! Food was good and we were seated right away too. I like it here!

42.description: I have passed by this place many time and never really took it to heart, until I gave it a try. Wow am I Impressed! The service here is just over the top, and everyone acts like your a family friend. The food is amazing. I feel I am a hard one to impress, but Timmy's you guys rock!  keep up the good work and continue to impress.

23.description: Second time visiting and second time successful. Great place to watch a game. Variety of drinks and food. Would recommend the peppermint martinis and Irish nachos! We'll be back.

47.description: A lively sports bar that I will definitely go back and enjoy when the snow is falling!!  Scotch, ManCave!

8.description: This was the first sports bar we stopped by when arriving in Chicago. I just wanted good bar food and of course great beer.We ordered the spinach artichoke which was creamy and good and we ordered the pretzels with beer cheese dipping sauce. The pretzels were huge and very soft. It's turning into my favorite bar snack.This place had a great beer list too. A lot of beers I can't get here on the east coast were on tap so I had a few which were great. The bar itself was awesome. A lot of tv's and definitely a great spot to watch Chicago sports.

31.description: This place used to be really great, but they recently made a bunch of changes (clearly looking to save $$) and I won't be back.  My "chicken wrap" tonight was really skimpy on the chicken and my Moscow mules were soo weak.  They changed their French dip to a pastrami French dip (what the...!?), their NY strip steak to skirt steak, and have taken their delicious monte cristo off the brunch menu.  So disappointing!

34.description: This place is perfect for grabbing a bite or drink on your lunch break. They have a pretty good menu and extensive drink list. Your options for watching games and going to a standard pub in the area are not that great so they perfectly fill the void. While it does get kind of loud at times it's a pretty chill environment. I'll definitely be back if I'm in the area and craving a burger (and some truffle fries, yum).

16.description: They have a make your own Bloody Mary bar on Sunday's! Made it a little easier being like 1 of 3 Packer fans in the place during a Bears game haha. Still had great service, our waiter was new and I told him he was a natural! So personable and efficient! Food was good and we were seated right away too. I like it here!

13.description: I only come to Chicago every few years and I tend to say at the Hilton right around the corner. This is always a good late night stop for my friends and I as there are not too many bars on this side of town.  First off I love their beer selection, always glad to see what they have one tap. Second I love their wings... their buffalo sauce may be my favorite yet. I love how this place is underground and just reminds me of something out of a TV show.... always a pleasure to stop in when I am in town.

11.description: Very cool place TV's everywhere with all the footballs games! Great atmosphere!!!A must go if your in Chicago!!!

39.description: Very cool place TV's everywhere with all the footballs games! Great atmosphere!!!A must go if your in Chicago!!!

37.description: In town on business and had to fly in Sunday. Checked out O'Tooles because it was near my hotel. I will echo what others have said this is a great place to go and watch the games.  I was there on an NFL Sunday and the place was not overly packed. Got a table by the bar where I could easily see 12 TVs - no exaggeration I counted, and there was another bank of 4 behind me.  Service was fast and extremely friendly.  Lot of beers on tap and I heard the waiter describing a few to the table next to me who seemed to beer experts - they seemed impressed when he walked away. Nice warm little place, I didn't get much of the Irish pub feel but was there for sports.Overall great place, in town on Sunday would highly recommend.  Only ruined because the NY Giants lost again...

0.description: You'll always find fun and people at Tim O'Toole's, regardless of the day of the week. I like Wednesdays when Comedians You Should Know takes up shop at 9pm in a back room/bar that seats about 45. It's a series of 4 or 5 aspiring stand-up comedians plying their trade and coupled with drinks specials like $5 Absolut mixed drinks. Other nights have karaoke or god knows what.The main bar/dining area of TOTs is a pretty big subterranean space with a large central bar with a TON of beer taps. You won't go wanting for a good beer option here. They are a little pricey though, like $7 for a pint of Sam Adams. Their typical bar food options like mozzarella sticks, buffalo wings and the like are really good.Service is typically attentive, friendly and female. All good!

38.description: Love this place for the food and beverages. Unfortunately, they took my favorite items off the menu - volcanic chicken wings and onion rings. Disappointed!!

51.description: This was the first sports bar we stopped by when arriving in Chicago. I just wanted good bar food and of course great beer.We ordered the spinach artichoke which was creamy and good and we ordered the pretzels with beer cheese dipping sauce. The pretzels were huge and very soft. It's turning into my favorite bar snack.This place had a great beer list too. A lot of beers I can't get here on the east coast were on tap so I had a few which were great. The bar itself was awesome. A lot of tv's and definitely a great spot to watch Chicago sports.

27.description: Checked this out while on vacation.  Fun place to relax.  Large selection of beer on tap.  Rick and all the bartenders were attentive and personable.  Didn't eat but others were raving about the food.  Reasonable prices.  Going back tonight for a nightcap.

32.description: A small group and I (4 people) went today to watch the Bears game and grab mimosas. The atmosphere to watch the game was great. There were a ton of games on. Great for all fans. Unfortunately our server had other things to do than serve us food & drink. She forgot to place our food order then didn't bring us a round of mimosas. We patiently waited all of 3rd quarter to get our drinks. When nothing came and the mimosa bar was being cleaned up she told us that the system went down so our order must not have gone through. This would have been nice to know as soon as she knew the system went down. We then asked for our check and it took the majority of 4th quarter to get. Needless to say, we were less than satisfied.

54.description: This is a perfect example of managing expectations. This place is unapologetic about what it serves and what it's trying to be. Beer list is one of the best kept secrets in town, regularly grabbing high end, hard to come by items and keeping the prices fair. Not headed here for fancy dinner. Expect good bar food and great beer selections and you will be happy.

48.description: The service was fine and the food was as advertised except the onion rings that I paid $2 extra for came out cold. I sent them back and the same ones came out scorching hot but soggy as hell...glad I was full.

44.description: We are in town on vacation but my bf is a huge Dolphins fan. One of our tour guys recommended this place and we are glad they did. Even though the Bears were playing they had at least one TV to each of the other games going on. This is a sports  bar so expect that type of food. The wings were really good and so were the Irish Nachos. As sports bars go we really liked this place

24.description: This is my absolute favorite bar to eat at in Chicago! Lots of variety on the menu and the beer selection is huge. Any time I've eaten there, my food has always been delicious and the wait wasn't long unless I was there on a Friday or Saturday but even then it didn't take too long. Sometimes they have live music as well but anytime I've been, it was in a separate room away from the bar so if you were to watch any sporting event, the music wouldn't interfere.

7.description: All in all I wasn't that impressed. We stopped by after dinner for a quick drink. I like my drink to actually taste like it has a drink inside it. The drinks are very very expensive and not poured evenly. I ordered a captain and diet and it tasted like lime.It was strange that there was so much security. There was a security guard checking IDs which is pretty normal but then there was also security standing around which made me wonder if they have problems on other nights.

49.description: The best bartender in town! Great drink and amazing service! Thank you Derontae! Definitely coming back! All the way from the LBC!!!

40.description: We were in Chicago for several days and found T O'Tooles on Yelp. We were not let down as it was a very nice place to visit. Outstanding customer service from server. Food served hot and fresh. We really enjoyed ourselves and will definately return when we visit again.

53.description: Loved this piace.  Big bar.  Met people from all over the world there.  Fun times.

30.description: This has been a staple place I frequent for over a decade. The Irish Nachos, hot wings, martinis, salmon & asparagus, pretty much anything on the menu. I haven't been disappointed yet. The cool thing is, it's in the heart of downtown Chicago, steps away from Michigan Ave,  2 blocks away from the water tower, but it doesn't give you the grungy pub feel, the ambiance is more living room like, with pool tables, and a round bar, with personal televisions per each booth to catch the games, but more intimately. I will continue to be a fan of O'Tooles.

46.description: Not sure why they only have 3.5 stars? We ate here last night and the food & service were excellent. Our food came out quickly & tasted great! Love that they have late night kitchen as we checked into our hotel at 10pm and found most places were closed or stopped serving dinner. This place was right around the corner from our hotel (Marriott Fairfield Inn). I recommend the Michigan salad wrap!

1.description: Timothy O'Tooles was our dinner stop while we were bar hopping on a Saturday. It was 6 of us and the hostess said she had a table for us but we would have to leave in an hour for another party. We agreed. They had 3Floyds Gumballhead on tap which is my favorite beer and it was reasonably priced at $6.50. I ordered the grilled fish tacos for dinner and they some of the best I've had. Two tacos each with a whole large piece of fish on it. When the waitress brought the check, she said she was unable to split the bill more than 3 ways but we were able to work it out anyway. Overall a good experience for a quick beer and dinner.
