55.description: The signs on the windows boast of 48 beers on tap and 70+ HD TV's.  They weren't kidding about the TV's because there was pretty much one at each table along the walls.  There were tons of great choices on the menu, some taking a more creative take on bar food like the Rueben egg roll and pulled pork nachos.1 pt of All Day IPA $5.50 - One of my go to IPA's.Goat Cheese Quesadilla $10 - Yum!Side of Truffle Fries $4 - Good truffle oil flavor on these delicious fries.Reuben egg roll $9 - These were filled with corn beef, sauerkraut, swiss cheese and a side of thousand island sauce.  It was good, but not as tasty as I had hoped it to be.Bayou Mac and Cheese $13 - This pasta dish comes with shredded chicken, peas, andouille sausages, mushrooms and awesome buttery garlic bread.  My favorite dish of the night.Nachos $10 - Very large serving of tortilla chips topped with chili, tomato, scallions, jalapenos, and real cheese.  I'm prefer the fake melty cheese on my nachos.  Chips were ok, but got super soggy fast.I tried a bite of my friend's fish and chips, and it was pretty good.  Overall good food, service and atmosphere.

9.description: Came here for dinner while on a business trip to Chicago. I found this to be an excellent pub, with just the right ambience and good drinks and food to go along. When you enter you go down a flight of stairs, so the bar is slightly subterranean. It's a large area and slightly dark, just like a good pub should be. There's a large oval shaped bar, with seats going all around. I was able to find a seat at the bar when I visited. There are ample screens behind the bar playing a variety of sports events, so it's easy to watch games from anywhere you sit. There are lots of tables around eye bar for groups to sit at. When I went, the bar was extremely lively, with an animated crowd that made it feel like a fun place to be. They have a large number of craft beers on tap and advertise 48 beers on a sign outside. I ordered a Bell's Two Hearted Ale, one of my favorites The menu looked like pretty standard pub dare, and I got a Californian burger, which came with avocado, sprouts, and jack cheese, and was quite good. The die of cole slaw I had with it tasted pretty generic. All in all, I found this bar to be real fun to hang out at and would come here again if I visit Chicago again.

26.description: First of all they have an excellent selection of draught and bottled beers. That atmosphere is that of a very casual sports bar. The menu was all over the place. Some of the choices were Shepherd's pie, Cuban Sandwich, Banh Mi, and lots of burgers and wraps. Everything I tried was satisfactory. The service was friendly and attentive.

25.description: Food was ok. Bloody Mary bar was a little disappointing. They say they have over 50  condiments but 45 of them were different spices or hot sauces. Lots of tv and great staff and atmosphere.

12.description: Came in here late on evening on a Wednesday evening for something to eat during a work trip to Chicago. It was after midnight and the brainiacs in management up the street at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel & Towers think it's good business to close all food service down at a particular time - even when the hotel bar is packed to overflowing with business. So one must go elsewhere for food and drink.The lady manning the front desk at the Sheraton recommended I try Timothy O'Toole's. So I walked down from my hotel - about five blocks.The place was hopping late - actually it was past midnight so technically it was Thursday morning. I grabbed a spot at the bar and ordered a plate of Nachos and a pint of the Goose Island IPA.While I was waiting, I scanned the bar, noting the goings on. It's an interesting mix of things - it feels like it is trying to be multiple things: An Irish Pub, A Sports Bar, a Dive Bar... It also felt like a bit of a meat market - which made for some entertaining people watching. There are flat panel HD TV's all over the place, and some pool tables.Nachos were huge - way to much food for me to eat the whole plate! The Goose Island IPA is a rather ordinary IPA on my scale of IPA ratings, but it is a local Chicago area craft beer, so felt like I should order one!I'd come here again! Would have been more fun with friends!

59.description: The room temperature was extremely warm and uncomfortable.  It was also very loud, so do not come here for conversation unless you plan on shouting.  I had their "special" Reuben and it was over done, too crispy, along "premium" garlic parmesan french fries, which were drowning in what looked like the fake garlic butter that comes with a national brand pizza.The service was very slow. I had to wait a while to order my first drink, wait a while to get it, and it was long gone before she asked if I wanted any thing else.  In fact she asked if I wanted to box up my dinner instead of asking if I wanted another beer.  I also had to borrow silverware and napkin from the next table.The only redeeming quality about this place was, they had 48 beers on tap and about half of them were decent quality micro/craft brews.  They also have a zillion TV's, all tuned in to sports, if that suits you.

21.description: Decent pub in the River North area. There were a few bowl games on when we were eating which was fun. The food was mediocre, but it was close to the hotel and had something that everyone in my party was content with.

17.description: Ask for Tracy! Completely took care of us. So helpful with drink selections. Love her she's the best. Will be coming back. Great environment, fun spot. Lots of tvs and nice bathrooms.

10.description: If you're looking for a relaxed place with good food downtown, you've found it! Irish pub atmosphere and open til 4 am on the weekends. I had the Michigan Avenue wrap which was one of the lighter options on the menu but just what I was looking for. They also have burgers, sandwiches, entrees, salads and a few platters. It's nothing super fancy, but it's a reliable spot for a good reasonably priced meal!

5.description: I used to go here back in my law school days in the 90s. It looks less divey now but is otherwise much the same - the reason to go here is mainly to drink. Service is good.  There is a large/varied beer selection. I had a tilapia sandwich that was good. The goat cheese and marinara sauce appetizer was so massive that I wasn't able to eat the sandwich until the next day.  The appetizer size was excessive for 2 people but is probably intended for a group to order while drinking. The app itself was good but obviously consisted of ingredients taken directly from the back of a Sysco truck, thrown together and defrosted in a microwave.My wife ordered a chicken pita and said it was the worst sandwich she ever had. It was dry and flavorless.  But the bread pudding was excellent.

3.description: I can tell this pub gets poppin on the weekends and during big events. Its pretty massive as far as pubs go - so I am sure accommodating large crowds is just fine. I came here on a weekday afternoon to try the food because I was tired of all of the fastfood in this area. I ordered the chicken tenders with garlic parmesan fries. The chicken tenders were standard. The fries however were fantastic! I will come back for these alone. Service was spotty, but not bad. Id like to attend a karaoke night here.

35.description: We visited this place this weekend for drinks at the bar...it had been a year since our last visit.  This place has lost a star or two.  Everything we tried to order from the drink menu was not available due to a missing ingredient.  Even their "specials" which most bars plan for were not available.  It took a half hour to get a single drink, as everything we ordered was unavailable, but the waitress didn't know.  We wound up finally getting a single drink and leaving.

19.description: Finally getting around to write a short but good review! Recently had some drinks and appetizers with a group of friends from Northwestern. It was a friendly atmosphere, fun staff and good food. The egg rolls were one of my favorites. Definitely looking forward to stopping in again and this time really getting to explore the menu!

28.description: Great place for a beer. Tons of beers on tap. Stop in for a football game and enjoy the Bloody Mary bar and friendly staff.

45.description: I used to go here back in my law school days in the 90s. It looks less divey now but is otherwise much the same - the reason to go here is mainly to drink. Service is good.  There is a large/varied beer selection. I had a tilapia sandwich that was good. The goat cheese and marinara sauce appetizer was so massive that I wasn't able to eat the sandwich until the next day.  The appetizer size was excessive for 2 people but is probably intended for a group to order while drinking. The app itself was good but obviously consisted of ingredients taken directly from the back of a Sysco truck, thrown together and defrosted in a microwave.My wife ordered a chicken pita and said it was the worst sandwich she ever had. It was dry and flavorless.  But the bread pudding was excellent.

33.description: Finally getting around to write a short but good review! Recently had some drinks and appetizers with a group of friends from Northwestern. It was a friendly atmosphere, fun staff and good food. The egg rolls were one of my favorites. Definitely looking forward to stopping in again and this time really getting to explore the menu!

43.description: Fun times with fun friends! Just a short walk from our hotel. Great service. TV on at any way you turn your head. We had french onion soup, nachos, and a burger. No complaints here.

2.description: What a fun place!I also liked the fact they have a big bad bouncer door guy so people don't get stupid.  Yes it's that kind of place but sometimes u need a neighborhood bar that serves a strong jameson and a decent pour of Guinness to break up the 5 star restaurant scene.Nice varied menu and decent food as well.Reasonably priced and if ur staying at the hotel's nearby the concierge have discounts as well.

18.description: In town on business and had to fly in Sunday. Checked out O'Tooles because it was near my hotel. I will echo what others have said this is a great place to go and watch the games.  I was there on an NFL Sunday and the place was not overly packed. Got a table by the bar where I could easily see 12 TVs - no exaggeration I counted, and there was another bank of 4 behind me.  Service was fast and extremely friendly.  Lot of beers on tap and I heard the waiter describing a few to the table next to me who seemed to beer experts - they seemed impressed when he walked away. Nice warm little place, I didn't get much of the Irish pub feel but was there for sports.Overall great place, in town on Sunday would highly recommend.  Only ruined because the NY Giants lost again...

41.description: If you want to spend a day watching football cannot think of a better place.....

52.description: Short review.. I came here with a colleague for lunch. We were seated right away, but it took quite some time to receive our food due to the lunch rush. No biggie because the wings and fries were delicious! We knew what we signed up for when we walked in.

50.description: I usually frequent this place when I'm in town on business and came back the other night to a terrible experience.Our waitress was terrible, she had a crappy attitude, and didn't put any effort into taking care of my party.  She took her time initially greeting us, took even more time bringing our drinks, and tried to tell us that checks couldn't be split more than three ways.  I've been to this place in large groups several times and never had an issue before, when we called her on it she said, "Well I have to get a manager and it'll be a while, like a long while" as her section sat half empty.  I've worked in restaurants for nearly 8 years in fine and casual dining and would have been absolutely debilitated if I that were the case, especially with the 5+ table section she had.  When she came back, she shorted my friend $4 so I didn't leave a tip, first time in my life.  When I checked my credit card, I found I was charged for two different transactions, I'm sure one was canceled but I was not informed of this.The food was good, the service was never a problem before, and the beer selection is good.

4.description: Great Irish bar! Decent prices for being in the city, nice bartenders, great selection of draught beers. The interior has lots of fun decorations. The crowd was mixed with a little bit of everyone. It wasn't super packed on the Saturday night that I went, so I'm happy about that!

6.description: The signs on the windows boast of 48 beers on tap and 70+ HD TV's.  They weren't kidding about the TV's because there was pretty much one at each table along the walls.  There were tons of great choices on the menu, some taking a more creative take on bar food like the Rueben egg roll and pulled pork nachos.1 pt of All Day IPA $5.50 - One of my go to IPA's.Goat Cheese Quesadilla $10 - Yum!Side of Truffle Fries $4 - Good truffle oil flavor on these delicious fries.Reuben egg roll $9 - These were filled with corn beef, sauerkraut, swiss cheese and a side of thousand island sauce.  It was good, but not as tasty as I had hoped it to be.Bayou Mac and Cheese $13 - This pasta dish comes with shredded chicken, peas, andouille sausages, mushrooms and awesome buttery garlic bread.  My favorite dish of the night.Nachos $10 - Very large serving of tortilla chips topped with chili, tomato, scallions, jalapenos, and real cheese.  I'm prefer the fake melty cheese on my nachos.  Chips were ok, but got super soggy fast.I tried a bite of my friend's fish and chips, and it was pretty good.  Overall good food, service and atmosphere.

22.description: Stopped here on a Saturday night. Wait if you requested a booth.  A great selection of beer! And food was great too, would recommend... Good prices!

15.description: Food was great. Service was excellent. Definitely coming back here next time we are in town.

57.description: The fish and chips are the worst I've ever had its not even battered it has some burnt bread-comes covering it. $9 for a glass of white wine. Overrated pig swill for food. Try getting a German Kolsch beer on tap

20.description: Waitstaff is great, and their junior chicken club with homemade honey mustard was the best thing I ate in Chicago. (:

36.description: Been here several times to watch football and have never been disappointed. They are super accommodating with putting your game on tv. Are very welcoming to guys wanting to kick it at a bar where they can watch several games at once, and have a good (not amazing) beer selection. Plus, Molly is a base and the best!

14.description: The food was great however I will think twice about coming back... new servers needed, ours was a bit flaky and it took us flagging her down to be served.

3.description: Walking into this 7/11 is like walking to a seedy underground bar. Genuinely rude cashiers.

1.description: I'm basically giving this 7-Eleven location two stars instead of one because it is convenient in it's location, hours and everything it has in it as a store. However, going to this one on a Sunday night just to pick up band aids and a couple drinks was pretty bad. We waited for twenty minutes in line just to get these few things. There was only one guy working, and he was moving at a snails pace. Which is half his fault, and half 7-11 fault for not staffing more people per shift. Also, I'm traumatized from a girl buying a bunch of lottery tickets and bending over to get them in her leggings that she was wearing like pants and seeing ALL of her bits and pieces. So did everyone else in the packed store. Go here if need be, but just know what you're in for.

2.description: This 7-Eleven store is very busy.  Dropped by here twice during our stay in downtown Chicago.  Both times there was about a dozen people in line.  Maybe, that is why the store and staff were not very impressive.  The store was dirty and unorganized.  Staff was not friendly, but they were fairly quick.After the second trip here, I decided we would not return here.  Found another 7-11 store close by that was clean and crew was nice.

5.description: I hate this place.  The staff are extremely slow and don't care at all about the long lines that build up.  I've seen employees lazily walking around behind the counter doing random stuff while only 1 register is open and 5-10 people are waiting in line.  When they ring me up they never articulate clearly what the final amount is and I never know because the tax seems to get added on at the very end - I've had exact change ready based on the number shown on the register then the number changed - wtf.  annoying.The only reason I go in this place is because it's the only convenient store within a 1 minute walk of my office plus they have a Citibank ATM.

6.description: I just got back from here almost 40 minutes ago.Im only writing this review right now because i have Internet access at Northwestern Hospital where I'm here with my mother receiving her treatments. I wont say that this is a top of the line store, but the store is neat and the prices are about the same considering where it's located at.The cashier Maria was super clean.She rang me up for my order of 2 Jalapenos and Cheese Taquitos($1.29 each), and immediately washed her hands!That almost never happens anymore. I think that lady deserves a raise..like instantly.Other than that, its a pretty basic store just like the rest.Remember its the location that makes any store what it is or what it will be.Its in the Chicago loop with a million stores to choose from ranging from low end McDonald's around the corner to Gucci and Prada(also around the corner).Its like a miniature New York for those that have never been to Chicago. Parking would be hell , so no i don't recommend coming here for anything unless you happen to either be shopping,some type of tourist, have a loved one in the hospital or on your way to the beach for a fun day out...Did i mention it was only a few blocks away from Lake Shore Drive with a perfect view of the Chicago skyline.

7.description: I hate this seven eleven. It's not the seven elevens fault. There's just always someone panhandling outside regardless of any imaginable variable. The positives would be they have a nice slurpee selection. And I was able to find the ever elusive Megatron slurpee cup here. So it's not all terrible.

8.description: Mangomania Slurpee served up here! Good place to go when the 24/7 grocery store is more like 18/7.

0.description: It's a 7-Eleven so not much to say...except:1) It's 24 hours which is nice when you're in need of a slurpee at 3am2) Being that it's 24 hours and located near a couple hotels, get ready to see some drunk tourist from all over the world after midnight looking to feed the alcohol beast inside them4) Prices here are definitely inflated compared to other 7-Eleven's I've been to (welcome to downtown)5) The employees tend to run hot and cold so be prepared for a warm smile or a look of disdain as you checkout

4.description: Store review:7-11 quick shop along the Mag Mile. I have been here before to buy random small items and checkout was fast. It is well lite and clean. There use to be a issue with panhandlers outside, but there appears to be less now with a sign installedPros: well stock, well lite, quick serviceCons: premium price for convenienceHidden deals: Sign up on website to get emails about discount. There is always food items being promoted and discounted

3.description: I've been there few times and my skin was always so soft next day. She is doing great european facial which combines multiple treatments together specially choosed for your type of skin. I've been in few spas and people were always changing, so every time they try to learn what is the best for your skin over and over again... if you are looking for long term skin improvement you can count on this place. Marisa seems very knowledgeable...

1.description: Marisa is a true professional taking her time to make sure your face is as it should be,   healthy. Carries exclusive European skin brands like GUINOT . Her facials treatments are worth the trip and so relaxingfor both men and women.  She's just steps away from Michigan Ave, right by Northwestern Memorial Hospital location. This is a private by appointment destination so book in advance.

2.description: I've been going to Marisa for almost 2 years now and she's done wonders to my skin. I previously lived in sunny CA for 6 years and had developed a lot of sun spots which I was very self consious about. After seeing Marisa for facials and some additional european treatments that she uses, they've dramatically faded. I'm so impressed. She's asseses your skin at every visit and depending on the state of your skin, varies the treatment. I love how customized she is and her product line is incredible. I'm a huge fan and will continue to go see her over and over again. I highly reccommend to anyone who is looking to keep their skin healthy and young!

0.description: Marisa"s customized facials are excellent.  I see her regularly and the long-term results are noticeable. Some think I'm in my 40's but,  I'm 50 :)She is an excellent esthetician specializing in customized facials based on the condition of your skin.  Marisa works with you on a regimen to meet your goals and maintain a healthy complexion.

I've been a client of Sole's for over 5 years. I first met her at Maxine's and was hooked from the first brow waxing. My sister & I used to go to Maxine's on our lunch break. I was booked with Sole and my sister was booked with another esthetician. Once my sister saw my brows, she booked with Sole for the following week. Sole has since moved on from Maxine's and started her own business, needless to say I followed. She is the BEST esthetician in all of Chicago.

58.description: Love this place. I could eat breakfast, lunch and dinner there! A wide variety of options at reasonable prices, and the location was very close to my hotel so that helped.

56.description: Pretty disappointing!  Food was OK - Swiss oatmeal and garden gate scrambler. Place was filthy!  No one was busing tables, and outside had pigeons. Really disgusting!!  And, after waiting in long line, they totally botched the order. A shame, this place used to be pretty good.

29.description: Bustling business. Usually a line. Waitress was extremely helpful and obtained water for my friend. He enjoyed his coffee. Few vegetarian options -- almost all the omelettes are served with bacon. Please expand your menu.

42.description: Ate here twice on most recent trip to Chicago. Service was fast and pleasant, and food was excellent. Had the chicken tortilla soup for lunch. Just enough spice and very hearty. Had steel cut oats for breakfast. Delicious with dried fruit and almonds and a touch of brown sugar. The cinnamon raisin "toast", which was very thinly sliced and toasted crisp, was almost like a cracker. Sprinkled with sugar it perfectly complemented the oats. Breakfast was on a busy Saturday morning and the orders were still taken quickly and the servers were fast and friendly. I'd eat there again - often!

23.description: After I sent an order back, because it was not what I ordered,  my new breakfast sandwich came back with a curly black hair embedded right in the middle.  So gross.  I took it up to the manager but I'm sure it will happen again to someone else.

47.description: The only thing that keeps it from 5 stars is that it was noisy and crowded...maybe that should be a plus:  lots of people eating and enjoying it.  Food was surprisingly good,  very reasonable.  Quick service.  Chicagoans are the best...my friends and I thought we were standing out of the way while we read the menu board...only to look back and realize there was a line behind us almost out the door,  waiting patiently.  God bless them!

8.description: Lots of seating, great pastries, decent pricing- nothing to complain about, but it's missing anything that would put it over the top.

31.description: I finally got a phone call back from corporate. Since my money was never refunded and they can't figure out how to do that the man I spoke with actually wrote me a check from his own account. Which was very nice. I feel bad. But there also has to be a better way for this company to do business. I was also given 3 $5 dollar coupons to go back. I won't be using them. But the thought was there. The nice man finally tried. Two weeks later. So I do finally feel the 1 star is earned. I won't be going back. And it is a shame. I used to love Corner Bakery.

34.description: Worst corner bakery ever. Waited forever for the wrong order and cashier, barista and server were all very rude. People here hate their jobs and it shows. do yourself a favor and go to the hospital across the street to visit one of their similar inexpensive-ish restaurants on the 2nd Fl of the Galter pavilion. Seriously. Never ever go here. Thanks.

16.description: Food is good when they get the order correct. They say 15 minutes and take 30. Ive had good experiences mixed in too.

13.description: Review is strictly for take-out ordering.My husband and I had a class to attend tonight and so I ordered us dinner online to pick up on the way. The ordering part was easy enough and seamless. I opted to pay upon receipt. Also seamless.But...once we got to our destination and sat down to eat, I noticed that the $1 avocado I paid for was not on my husband's sandwich and they did not include the $1.49 caesar side salad I also paid for.I checked the receipt to make sure it was correct and it was. Apparently those kinds of directions are difficult to follow. We will not be patronizing this location again.

11.description: Our go to breakfast place whenever we're in Chicago for a convention. Fast, yummy, nice selection for everyone.

39.description: Our visits to the Corner Bakery near our hotel were exactly as we expected them to be--pretty much the same every time we came in.  Decent service, prices aren't ridiculous (higher than I'd like, but we are right off the Magnificent MIle), and the food is fresh yet completely consistent from visit to visit.We stuck to breakfast foods (although my wife did get a salad one evening, and said it was good), so I can't speak to some of the comments about some of the other types of food.  But breakfast was always good.Nobody's going to walk out of a Corner Bakery raving about it being a wonderfully unique experience.  If that's what you're looking for, go somewhere else.  But when you want a consistent breakfast experience with good service, it's a great place to stop.

37.description: I'm a fan of lemon pound cake , and the offering here was quite large, very rich and delicious. The staff was friendly and efficient. Since they also order other breakfast selections which are cooked to order I'd like to try healthier option on my next visit.

0.description: The Corner Bakery provided us with a convenient, affordable breakfast two mornings in a row, blessedly close enough to our hotel that we didn't freeze our a**es off in the process. Service was quick, both ordering at the counter and delivery of food to our table within probably five minutes each time.There's breakfast for whatever mood you're in, for sure, from healthy to I-need-a-sugar-rush, with plenty of options in between. Steel cut oats on day one were pretty good but I had trouble getting them sweet enough. The thin, sugar-dusted toast that came with it was shockingly crisp at first bite, but quickly grew on me. The breakfast potatoes with red onion were delicious, soft and creamy in the middle. On day two I ordered an avocado/spinach flatbread that came with a really good pepper sauce. The only thing that could've made it better was if the sauce had been hot, not cold. My friend ordered a scramble of eggs, sausage and veggies that she said she really liked. I ate her multi-grain toast and it was delicious. The rest of the spectrum ranges from yogurt parfaits to every kind of baked goodie you could possibly want, and whole bundt cakes if you want to share. All of this (except the cakes of course) can be had for less than $10, some substantially less.Moving around can be a bit challenging, people tend to get in each others' way filling drink cups and getting condiments. But there's plenty of seating once you're done, and Corner Bakery is certainly a convenient and affordable place to start your day.

38.description: Filthy. Rude. Expensive. Forgot our order and clearly couldn't care less. Don't be deceived by the cute exterior. Order the "Histoplasmosis Special," made by all the pidgeons eating off the tables covered with trash .

51.description: The Chicken Apple Sausage Panini was great!It includes maple and apple chicken sausage (obviously), scrambled eggs & cheese  on sourdough.The morning lines here can be a little crazy, but the staff gets you in and out of there.Good to stop by if you work in the area or visiting someone @ Northwestern Hospital across the street

27.description: Busy cafe on weekdays.  It's one of many cafes in the area but closest to the  hospital, so it can be packed.  Service is pretty good despite the rush.  If busier places seem overwhelming for you, head East to find a few more cafes to enjoy inside of administration buildings and "stand alones."In case you need (catering) a party case of cafe goods, CBC has a few options prepacked and ready for purchase, ranging in many items and prices.      I dig it here. The proximity to the hospital across the street and parking out front which always seems readily available (most times) for me.  (Also, street parking is less expensive than hospital parking.)

32.description: The wait staff here jacked my wallet out of my purse. We were seated by some doctors and an older woman and the only people that walked by my purse was the waiter (who bumped into my chair and said excuse me-little did I know he was stealing from me). I'm sure he does this all the time as after eating lunch here my wallet was gone and at target on a shopping spree within the hour. The staff is miserable and they obviously don't mind making cash on the side. NEVER going back there. If you do eat there, watch your wallet.

54.description: I've heard a lot about Corner Bakery being so much better than Panera,so I thought I'd check it out.I went before class and the line was long, but not too many people were sitting to eat in.  I also chose the route of take out.I got the power panini and thought it was just ok.  The bread seemed really cheap and not authentic to something they would bake. I did however like the fact that they used "scrambled eggs" that are higher quality than most fast food places.Service went quick and coffee is good. What else could you ask for. Def worth it more so than other chain bakery/delis.

48.description: The second....and I mean the VERY SECOND Sopraffina opens it's doors across the street, Corner Bakery will lose half its business/captive audience.  If not more.  Your front staff is great, they are pleasant, they know who you are and what you want (usually).  BUT, something is going on behind the scenes....and by something I mean nothing.  Anyone who has been here more than once knows what I'm talking about.  The food takes forever to come out and it is wrong fifty percent of the time (generous approximation).  Corner Bakery, c'mon!  Maybe you also can't wait for Sopraffina to open, because you are not just in the weeds on a daily basis, you are buried.

44.description: Went for breakfast on a Sunday morning.  I had been to the one on Michigan a few years ago and enjoyed it.I ordered the bacon thin panini and the fiancee ordered the chicken apple one.  I also got a side of oatmeal with currants.  There was an upcharge from the normal brown sugar to the currants which seemed confusing since the full size oatmeal came with choice of either with no upcharge.Both paninis had good flavor and featured crisp bread, but they were cold!  The cheese was not melted at all.  I love their oatmeal.  Simple steel cut oats with no added sugars or other flavoring which is hard to find at restaurants.Had the sandwiches been warm, it would easily merit another star.

24.description: Always on the corner waiting to serve up a fresh cup of coffee and good food. Kind staff and clean, it's not high brow, but who wants it to be. Breakfast today was a bagel and cream cheese and a side of bacon. Good stuff!

7.description: Ur service is subparMy cashier Shadae was rude and seemed bothered by my businessIt was early on a Saturday morning, no lines or anyone else waitingI always come for the foodLet's get a better attitude from staff

49.description: Location, location, location.  The mantra of retailing.For this place, that seems to be enough to run a horrible store and stay in business.  Because location is all they have going for them.First the pigeons.  I've never seen anything so disgusting at a restaurant.  The patrons had left one of the small outside tables and the dirty dishes had not been cleared.  There were 15-20 pigeons on the table flapping their wings and fighting for food.  Much dropped on the ground, where another 30 or so pigeons picked at the scraps.  When someone finally came to clear the dishes, she spent 3-4 minutes just trying to chase the pigeons away.  Then she removed the dishes, gave the table a minimal wipe, and left it for the next patron.  That next patron will never be me.   Meanwhile, back inside, I had placed a take out order.  I repeated the order as it was handed to me, the man nodded yes, and I left.  When I got home it wasn't what I ordered.  I went back, to discover the guy who screwed up my order and said it was right was the manager.  He apologized, gave me another order, right this time, for no charge.  But in refunding my money, he short changed me.  When I pointed it out, he said, "Oh, I forgot the taxes."  How he can miss that on the receipt I gave him I don't understand, nor the fact the refund did not match the taxes.  So he gave me an additional refund - short changing me a second time.  I just left.  If this is the manager...

40.description: This is a convenient stop for me going to and from work, I always get sucked in and always hate that I choose this place.   I've been to different locations around the city, but this is my primary one.Whenever ordering the pasta (this includes all the pasta dishes and Mac and cheese) the pasta is always HUGE in portion and terrible in taste.  The sauces are always watered down and literally dripping off the pasta..... So basically you are eating plain pasta (and lots of it).  It's not cheap and with panera bread literally a block away...I'll make that extra trip.

53.description: This little gem just off the Magnificent Mile was terrific for a quick and hot breakfast. It was just around the corner from the Allerton where I was staying for a bachelor party.  For two days in a row, I enjoyed the Anaheim scrambled eggs (bacon, tomatoes, green onions, avocado, and cheddar cheese) - not the sandwich. As bachelor parties often go, at least one of those breakfasts was well after typical breakfast hours, so it was really great to still be able to get a hot breakfast that tasted really great.

30.description: I had lunch here last week, and got a "trio" - a cup of lemon chicken orzo soup, and two of their specialty salads.  You can also get three of the salads and forgo the soup.  These salads are probably the best thing Corner Bakery has to offer.  I got Asian edamame salad and toasted sesame kale salad.  Both were surprisingly fresh, and the kale especially had really good flavor.  I felt so healthy eating it!  Next time I come back, I'll definitely be getting those again.  The lemon chicken orzo soup tasted sour to me - too much lemon for my palate, perhaps.  I haven't had great luck with soups here, but those speciality salads are where it's at.

46.description: The Corner Bakery Cafe is in a very convenient location, just off Michigan Avenue. It has a decent kids' menu and OK sandwiches. But it can get pretty crowded at lunchtime and sometimes it takes staff a while to clean up tables. So fine for a quick bite, but not worth a special trip!

1.description: I choose:crunch honey banana pancakes ( four buttermilk pancakes topped with sliced bananas,honey , granola ,& dried cranberries , served with applewood smoked bacon ! Super delicious

55.description: Great atmosphere and a decent selection of food. Very homestyle and comforting.

9.description: Look at the posted photo of the Parmesan Crusted Chicken Breast with salad for $10 bucks with tax!!! Totally a waste of money! They also need to train their staff as no one there tonight knew what was going on! Very disappointed. I would avoid it at all costs and go elsewhere :-(

26.description: The corner bakery was located right next to my hotel so I figured I'd give it a whirl. They had a pretty good menu with many options and different portion sizes. This is a nice spot for a quick breakfast/lunch. I don't think it's anything to write home about but if you are in the area and need a quick food fix, it's a good spot.

25.description: Review is strictly for take-out ordering.My husband and I had a class to attend tonight and so I ordered us dinner online to pick up on the way. The ordering part was easy enough and seamless. I opted to pay upon receipt. Also seamless.But...once we got to our destination and sat down to eat, I noticed that the $1 avocado I paid for was not on my husband's sandwich and they did not include the $1.49 caesar side salad I also paid for.I checked the receipt to make sure it was correct and it was. Apparently those kinds of directions are difficult to follow. We will not be patronizing this location again.

12.description: Have been coming here for awhile now and this is the first time I've had an issue. Ordered the chicken Caesar flat and was served the southwest flat. Server insisted that's what I ordered but it wasn't. Had to tell him I was allergic to half the items in the southwest flat, but he still tried to tell me that's what I ordered. Had to tell him that I should know what I can and cannot eat. He took it back into the kitchen and then returned with the same plate telling me once again that this is what I ordered and this time, told me it was the chicken Caesar, which it wasn't. Tried telling me that the jalapeño peppers were part of the Caesar dressing. Um, no! He disappeared into the kitchen again and within a few minutes came out with the right food. BUT, with no silverware. Went up to the counter to ask but was instructed that "the line starts over there" and I tried to explain I needed silverware & the woman walked away. So, I went and tried to find someone else, but no one was available but the cashier. Finally found Cher, who helped me out. She was apologetic for the poor service and nice about it. I say, if your working in a restaurant and serving food, it should be a requirement to know what the dishes are. I will be back again.

59.description: **This review is only on their catering**I have never had a problem catering from Corner Bakery.  Their online ordering system is user-friendly and even when I order over the phone, customer service is always excellent.  Love the Corner Classic package!  Sandwiches always arrive fresh and delivery is always on time.  Their desserts are delish!  I highly recommend Corner Bakery for your catering needs.

21.description: Don't waste your time here. While the staff were very friendly and provided prompt service, the food and coffee were awful. I pretty much consider my experience here a $9 donation because the steel cut oats were so bleh and my drip coffee tasted like it had been brewed weeks ago. Maybe the baked goods to go and the drinks made to order are better...Convenience, location, and staff are the only reason this place gets two stars instead of one. Do yourself a favor and just head to Panera instead.

17.description: Always on the corner waiting to serve up a fresh cup of coffee and good food. Kind staff and clean, it's not high brow, but who wants it to be. Breakfast today was a bagel and cream cheese and a side of bacon. Good stuff!

10.description: I work next to this location so it would be convenient for lunch. This location is always filthy dirty, the silverware doesn't even look clean. They never clean up the coffee area and there is spilled coffee all over. The tables don't get wiped down and the floor is always dirty! And the staff is not the friendliest. I do not eat there anymore, and I have warned everyone I know!

5.description: I have been going to corner bakery for many years...but this location is horrible. Slow service, rude staff, very disorganized and long wait times even for simple orders. Never going back to this location.

3.description: Ordered two breakfast meal. The Anaheim scrambler and  bacon and cheddar panini. They were pretty good and I was happy with my purchase. I'm writing this review as I become fed up with Corner Bakery coffee. Somehow they've managed to find the perfect balance between watered-down and bitter. It never fails that the coffee disappoint and I finally made a decision to stop purchasing it. I don't know if this location is more atrocious than others but the coffee was pretty bad.

35.description: Great place for breakfast or a snack. They have healthy and tasty options. The cashiers get through the line quick. The staff brings your food to the table fast. The staff cleaning the tables is very courteous.

19.description: I've been increasingly disappointed with this location. The last several to-go hot sandwiches I've purchased have been small in size and luke warm. Today's breakfast sandwich was smaller than the size of my cell phone and the cheese was not melted at all. Not my best use of a $5 bill.

28.description: Spacious with plenty of seating, quick service and adequate coffee. Lots of windows too. Fee WiFi. A solid place to start your busy morning.

45.description: Pretty yummy food but it took a while to order and get our food.  We had: rugelach, lemon bar, brownie, chicken noodle soup, and the roast beef & goat cheese sandwich.  The sandwich was incredible, and the soup and rugelach were also good.  The brownie and lemon bar weren't quite as good as I've had at other places but it was ok.

33.description: Free Wi-Fi (but I think it belongs to NMH).  It's close enough that you can use it without issues.  :) The Divvy bike stand is right across the street.  So convenient!

43.description: Such a disappointment! I stood waiting for assistance but evidently, I was not standing in the right place and had people cutting me in line by walking right up to the cash register rather than standing in front of the display of muffins etc.  The muffin was warm which seemed quite delightful but by the time I got across the street to my office, the bag was soaked in grease and I discovered that the muffin was actually a ball of grease!  Never again!

2.description: Good service considering how busy it is during the weekdays. It's right by the hospital so it is jet packed with customers during the day.My brother and I ordered the chicken pomodori with a cup of cheddar broccoli and a cafe size pesto cavatappi with a mixed green salad. It all tasted good and came actually really fast.Outdoor seating area is nice!

18.description: Bustling business. Usually a line. Waitress was extremely helpful and obtained water for my friend. He enjoyed his coffee. Few vegetarian options -- almost all the omelettes are served with bacon. Please expand your menu.

41.description: Always get the $5 kids meal. Comes with half sandwich, half cup soup, pickle, chips,fountain soda and your choice of cookie or side of fruit!!!!

52.description: Never seen such crap organization. Waiting 20mn to learn that yogurt parfait was not on stock. Very noisy and messy place. Never go again even for a simple coffee.

50.description: Corner bakery employees are so inept - When I placed the order the woman looked totally disinterested and didn't even suggest salad or greens as an alternative to chips so I thought maybe chips don't come with a standard order. Anyway I got that wrong - I was stuck with chips on my to go order.  I clearly said Chicken Pomodori no cheese on my order and I have the receipt that clearly says that so she got the order right. But the sandwich I got once I started to eat at home had cheese on it and no chicken - how stupid and incompetent is their kitchen. Apparently its not the first time; a friend of mine in another city had the same thing where he got no meat in his order. Either they are doing it on purpose to save on meat or their way of pulling the order together needs to be re-worked as they seem to keep "missing" the meat. I get that its lunch hour but it's not my problem. I usually avoid them because their food is over greasy compared to potbelly and others and now with these order fuckups, I am done with Corner Bakery. Avoid!!

4.description: Busy cafe on weekdays.  It's one of many cafes in the area but closest to the  hospital, so it can be packed.  Service is pretty good despite the rush.  If busier places seem overwhelming for you, head East to find a few more cafes to enjoy inside of administration buildings and "stand alones."In case you need (catering) a party case of cafe goods, CBC has a few options prepacked and ready for purchase, ranging in many items and prices.      I dig it here. The proximity to the hospital across the street and parking out front which always seems readily available (most times) for me.  (Also, street parking is less expensive than hospital parking.)

6.description: For the first time, I had breakfast at a Corner Bakery.  I was impressed with their 4 stack pancakes!  Simply delicious!!  Their breakfast sandwiches are ok.  The bread was a little hard and too toasted for my liking.  Their lunch and dinner items are excellent.  I've had their soups and salads.  Excellent food preparation.  Their lunch sandwiches are great tasting as well.  Great service as well.

22.description: Fast casual dinning. Good for a sandwich or salad.  The Asian Wonton was fresh but could use a bit more dressing.  The Chicken Pesto sandwich was good but not wonderful.  And the Mac and Cheese was creaming but not the best I've had.

15.description: I had lunch here last week, and got a "trio" - a cup of lemon chicken orzo soup, and two of their specialty salads.  You can also get three of the salads and forgo the soup.  These salads are probably the best thing Corner Bakery has to offer.  I got Asian edamame salad and toasted sesame kale salad.  Both were surprisingly fresh, and the kale especially had really good flavor.  I felt so healthy eating it!  Next time I come back, I'll definitely be getting those again.  The lemon chicken orzo soup tasted sour to me - too much lemon for my palate, perhaps.  I haven't had great luck with soups here, but those speciality salads are where it's at.

57.description: Great service and really good breakfast!We went here and got two bowls of oatmeal, one cold and one hot bowl. We also got coffee, and we had around 4-5 different types of coffee that we could choose from. The lady behind the counter was friendly and we got our food really quick.We were lucky to come so early in the morning, by the time we finished with our breakfast, there were people lining up in front of the counter, but the line seemed to move quickly too.Cozy place to eat breakfast and the volume of the music was just right.

20.description: This location is horrible. It's very disorganized and it is also extremely hard for them to get an order correct. I think that is the staff were less occupied with their own conversations, they may just be able to help....Don't even bother with management because management is poor at this location. It's in the building I work in but after giving them several chances to clean up their act, I'd rather go somewhere else to spend my money.

36.description: This location constantly messes up my VERY SIMPLE order and I'm over it. They've given my order away to other people and did not offer any resolve. When I ask for no cheese and chips on the side, the associate who was mumbling at me told me it would come as I ordered. The staff is rude as all hell. A toasted bagel shouldn't take 20 minutes. This place is awful.

14.description: Don't waste your time here. While the staff were very friendly and provided prompt service, the food and coffee were awful. I pretty much consider my experience here a $9 donation because the steel cut oats were so bleh and my drip coffee tasted like it had been brewed weeks ago. Maybe the baked goods to go and the drinks made to order are better...Convenience, location, and staff are the only reason this place gets two stars instead of one. Do yourself a favor and just head to Panera instead.

28.description: Here is the problem I had with Geldner. I went to him back in 2001, or so, when I was researching plastic surgeons to help augment my chin. I had an implant put in in 1996, which was causing bone degradation. Thus, I wanted it removed. Geldner is not a bone specialist--so i went to mckay mckinnon--who solved that issue for me. However, to work with the new chin (elongated very symmetrically), I wanted to add a more square jaw line. Speaking with me over the different options, Geldner proposed a new, "cool," method -- buccal fat transfer from the abdominal area to the jaw line. Anyways I was convinced--it was less expensive than having implants put in, and he assured me it would look great. Well, needless to say, I had it done, and my face looked like an exact box. A square box. OR a chipmunk. After 1 year or so, I went back to him, and asked him to remove it. He charged me only $1000 for the removal, warning me, "next time, be careful what you wish for...you might just get it." so he removed it -- but he couldnt remove it all, due to tissue scarring, etc. So my "lumps" are a little lopsided--and of couse, my skin is massively stretched. It was horrible judgment on his part to propose building a robert redford type of jaw line by using this technique. I sent his office a "before and after" and of course, got no reply. How can this guy be so revered? If you read his website, and his fans, you would think he was the holy grail. I went to several other surgeons to fix his mess, after he removed the buccal fat, and they mocked him. Professional jealousy? I cannot say.I am not a litigious person, but this was a horrible lapse of judgment. They had no digital imaging, so I couldnt see what it would have looked like before. My disappointment, and anger, more than anything else lies in the realm of bad judgment and of course--I cannot revert to where I was prior to the procedure.Be careful with teh surgeons, people. I think Geldner is famous for breast implants but apparently not for facial enhancements and modifications.

1.description: There are two sides to this review. Lynn would get 5 full stars. I adore her personality and the way she handles the needle for botox. She is beyond friendly, offers wonderful suggestions as to what would look most natural and attractive with your facial structure. She is gentle and you hardly feel anything. Scheduling to get in should be handled with care. She is good at her job, so be sure to be smart and schedule in advance. Price-wise, the first visit was steep but I base that as a new patient/first-time appointment. Whereas the second appointment in which I added a botox treatment to my upper lip was far lower. I would say if you scout out the area of trusted offices their prices are no different. Apart from Lynn, I made an appointment with Dr. Geldner for a rhinoplasty consultation. This is where I am not a fan. I made the appointment weeks in advance and when I showed up, I waited in the room for nearly a half an hour. It's a doctors office so this is expected, but 30 minutes is time wasted. When Dr. Geldner came in, he barely said anything other than shooing off all of my two seconds of saying why I was there and referred me to an Otolaryngologist to whom he partners with when or if you mention anything involving medical concerns. This is called selective hearing when you don't say--I just want a nose job. He was in the room for 5 minutes if that.I walked out frustrated and downright disgusted by the 'bedside' manner. Part of me wonders if the doctor couldn't be bothered with consults. It's truly a shame because they lost a patient who was ready and prepared to move forward with a procedure.

9.description: Every subsequent appointment has been amazing. I think I caught them on a bad day. Really enjoy my quick appointments, and LOVE my aesthetician. She has fit me in on days when things pop up and I need an earlier appointment. Highly recommend them!

29.description: Dr. Geldner is the best in the city, hands down. I met with numerous plastic surgeons over the summer when researching my options. Dr. Geldner is honest, upfront, thorough, compassionate and friendly -- more than any other doctor I met. Once I decided on my surgery, I was completely at ease in his care and confident in my decision.  He did a great job on my surgery and was available for me when I needed him. My results have been nothing short of fantastic. Also, his staff is very friendly and informative and his office is very comfortable. I would recommend him to anyone considering plactic surgery.

23.description: I went to Dr. Iteld for injectables several times. He is a wonderful doctor - very skilled and reassuring. Because of my good experiences with him, I decided to go with the Geldner Center for a recent surgery. The results are wonderful, but I was overcharged by the surgical center by a significant amount. I was strongarmed into paying more than I had been quoted by the surgical center on the day of surgery - it was either pay or don't get the surgery. I had already taken time off work for the procedure, so walking out wasn't an option. I figured the Geldner Center would help me resolve the issue after the fact to bring the charges in line with their quote. I was completely wrong. After getting the runaround from the Geldner Center for 2 months (I can't even count the number of times someone there told me "Oh, it's all going to be fixed and your account will be credited tomorrow!"), I have come to the conclusion that they are not going to do anything. It's up to me to dispute this with the surgical center, even though the Geldner Center was the one who gave me the written quote for surgery charges. The fact that they can't honor the quotes they give patents, or else have a terrible relationship with the surgery center they use, and don't seem to care, is truly disappointing. Regardless of the doctors' great work, I will never give my business to the Geldner Center again. Conclusion: If you don't mind being swindled out of tons of money, the doctors here are great.

5.description: I had laser hair removal from Beata and have had no problems, the front desk staff and Beata are great. I will definitely be coming back to get more laser hair removal and recommend the center and Beata to everyone.

25.description: It can be difficult to imagine that you could improve yourself with the use of scalpel. It can be even more difficult to walk into a plastic surgeons office that can help you explore areas that you could improve about yourself. ::Drum Roll:: But at Dr. Geldner's office, you will find a very different plastic surgeon. I met with Dr. Geldner for an initial consultation. I can only think of 3 words to best describe him: Ethical.Honest.Kind. After speaking with Dr. Geldner, he told me that there was nothing esthetically displeasing about my face. Nothing that needed correction, significant improvement, etc. This isn't what I expected to hear. I thought that I would hear "sure we can do that...and make it look like this, and sure, I will do that too." Dr. Geldner takes his approach to plastic surgery with humility and honesty. So, in truth, what I thought I wanted to change, needed to change, hoped to change....was clearly just my vanity. Not seeing what I already had was exactly what I already needed. Maybe for some women, this is a "duh" or "obvious" afterthought. For me, I was caught up in ways to improve myself to something "ideal." A huge thanks to Dr. Geldner in helping point out that all I need was a little more self-esteem. Of course Dr. Geldner could have performed the procedures, decided not to have a heart-to-heart...but when I looked in the mirror, there wasn't anything that was wrong with me in the slightest. I just wanted better...and really...I'm not sure if better...is always, better. I highly recommend Dr, Geldner if you want an honest and thorough opinion about plastic surgery. If you want a Dr. that isn't simply interested in taking your money or preying on your vanity. Dr. Geldner asks the important questions. The only side note is be prepared to wait. I was a little temperamental that I had to wait almost an hour! Not what I had expected, but it was definitely well worth it.

12.description: I just went here for Botox with Dr. Geldner.  I love the results.  I like my forehead nice and frozen but still natural.  Dr. Geldner was able to make it happen.  I'm 30 so people don't imagine I've had Botox done which is exactly what I want - freeze the wrinkles, but make it look natural.  Competitively priced for a top notch doctor.  I will keep coming back as soon as it wears off!!!I also recently had my eyebrows  and eyeliner permanently tattooed with Deanna Stellato who is the aesthetician at the Geldner Center. Excellent results!  people cannot believe it is a tattoo as it looks natural.  They were even able to numb my forehead for the eyebrow tattoo.

21.description: I just went here for Botox with Dr. Geldner.  I love the results.  I like my forehead nice and frozen but still natural.  Dr. Geldner was able to make it happen.  I'm 30 so people don't imagine I've had Botox done which is exactly what I want - freeze the wrinkles, but make it look natural.  Competitively priced for a top notch doctor.  I will keep coming back as soon as it wears off!!!I also recently had my eyebrows  and eyeliner permanently tattooed with Deanna Stellato who is the aesthetician at the Geldner Center. Excellent results!  people cannot believe it is a tattoo as it looks natural.  They were even able to numb my forehead for the eyebrow tattoo.

16.description: I would give this place 5 stars - easily. The only reason I docked 4 stars is because I arrive 5 minutes before my appointment but I end up waiting 15-20 to be seen. They really need to see clients at their scheduled time.

17.description: I was very apprehensive about having plastic surgery, but I had been talking about having breast reduction surgery for years.  I was looking for a plastic surgeon who cared about his patients more than his paycheck.I found everything that I was looking for in Dr. Geldner.  He has a great sense of humor and was so comforting during the process.  My results are great and I am so happy i went through the process and I chose him as my surgeon.

10.description: I would give these butchers a -1,000,000 if I could.  My wife went in to get a basic hair removal for an area above her waist on her back and received several treatments, by the third the non-certified technician (we later found out) told her she would increase the intensity of the laser. She did, and subsequently BURNED HER.  The Geldner Center refuses to take ANY RESPONSIBILITY for this and defaulted to their "you may get a burn" from treatment line.  My wife had had hair removal from other places, even outside the state and NEVER, EVER received a burn.  This was an extremely painful laser burn (the wrong laser was used and the wrong intensity for her skin type).  Her skin turned pink and had a horrible scab over 6" long and 5" tall. She could not workout, dress herself, or even bend over for weeks.This is the most horrible, lousy, two-bit operation I have ever seen and I will take these people to court if it takes me the rest of my life. She has a permanent SCAR she will have the rest of her life.  Ladies, BEWARE! Stay home, stay away!

11.description: This dr did my breast surgery(lift and mild augmentation 32dd to a 32 ddd) the results are natural . My neighbor was so impressed she had hers done. he also does my botox every 4 months and keeps things looking natural. He has a great bedside manner. I wouldnt go anywhere else.

26.description: Dr. Iteld at the Geldner Center Rocks. He helped my mother calm her nerves while going through a cancer scare. And my mother was paranoid , scared, ready to go pick out caskets at Costco scared. He was her reconstructive surgeon but was with us throughout the whole ordeal . He is a godsend to anyone that has to have plastic surgery.   Everyone at the Geldner Center was wonderful. And Dr. Iteld did a marvelous job.

27.description: kind, caring, honest.  After exhaustive research, and multiple visits to other docs in chicago, I settled for Dr. Geldner.   I was not disappointed.

0.description: I began going to Beata for LHR after a family member's recommendation and a Groupon deal (Soooo worth it!) that I just could not pass up.  I could not be more thrilled with my results. Beata is ridiculously skilled and highly knowledgeable. She manages to be incredibly friendly and down to earth without compromising any professionalism. I recommend her to absolutely everyone! Thank you Dr. Geldner, for employing such a talented esthetician. I can't wait to come back. :)

20.description: NIce facility, but it's really hard to make an appointment. You have to book it with the aesthetician, who is always in session, so you have to wait for a call back, and then call back, and then leave a message. Really annoying. I'm not going to go back to this place for that reason.

19.description: It can be difficult to imagine that you could improve yourself with the use of scalpel. It can be even more difficult to walk into a plastic surgeons office that can help you explore areas that you could improve about yourself. ::Drum Roll:: But at Dr. Geldner's office, you will find a very different plastic surgeon. I met with Dr. Geldner for an initial consultation. I can only think of 3 words to best describe him: Ethical.Honest.Kind. After speaking with Dr. Geldner, he told me that there was nothing esthetically displeasing about my face. So, in truth, what I thought I wanted to change, needed to change, hoped to change....was clearly just my vanity. Not seeing what I already had was exactly what I already needed. Maybe for some women, this is a "duh" or "obvious" afterthought. For me, I was caught up in ways to improve myself to something "ideal." A huge thanks to Dr. Geldner in helping point out that all I need was a little more self-esteem. Of course Dr. Geldner could have performed the procedures, decided not to have a heart-to-heart...but when I looked in the mirror, there wasn't anything that was wrong with me in the slightest. I just wanted better...and really...I'm not sure if better...is always, better. I highly recommend Dr, Geldner if you want an honest and thorough opinion about plastic surgery. If you want a Dr. that isn't simply interested in taking your money or preying on your vanity. Dr. Geldner asks the important questions. The only side note is be prepared to wait. I was a little temperamental that I had to wait almost an hour! Not what I had expected, but it was definitely well worth it.

2.description: Deanna is a a gem! Super sweet and made me feel so comfy doing my LHR. One of the best Groupons I've ever purchased!

18.description: I got my eyebrows done by Deanna and I looooove them. I would highly recommend seeing her if you are in need of eyebrows.

13.description: Ah, laser hair removal. With the sting of your zap and the tedious repeated visits, who can really truly say anything good about the experience?Which is exactly why it is essential to go to a place like the Geldner Center to have LHR done - where the staff are professional and the office is well run. Deanna has been great in booking my appointments. There is hardly ever any of that waiting around/long delay business. I am in and out of the office in less than 25 minutes which is the way it should be. I have not had any negative issues with LHR at the Geldner Center and have been seeing great results!

4.description: I am reviewing the aesthetics side of this business.  I would give the service 5-stars - Lindsay was professional and very friendly.   But the pricing is ridiculous, I feel ripped off and will not return.  I received a SkinMedica Rejuvenize peel and was told it was on special for $350 (discounted from $400).  I've had SkinMedica peels in the past but of a lower strength so I assumed that's why this higher strength was more (for comparison - at my previous derm I could buy 3 for $400 or $150/each).  After my peel, the more I thought about it, the more incredible this price seemed.  I started calling other derms/spas in Chicago offering the same SkinMedica peel and found them to be about $225 (including the consult etc).  So (at full price) a difference of $175.  I feel so incredibly ripped off, I will never return here.  And while the service was fine, there was nothing above and beyond that would justify this.   Also, an interview with Deanna of the Geldner Center on radio md from May 2013 noted that peels run $100-300, which means they greatly increased their prices (33%?!) from the prior year or Geldner is outside a normal range.

24.description: I highly recommend that any looking to get Botox injections from Dr. Geldner, to RUN NOT WALK AS FAR AWAY FROM HIM AS YOU CAN!  I've had Botox from another doctor for the past 5 years with stellar results and I never had one complaint or issue about his work. Unfortunately, I cannot say the same about the results of injections Dr. Geldner did to my face.  The photo of me listed here was taken PRIOR to seeing Dr. Geldner.  Unfortunately, as a result of his handiwork with giving me Botox, I'm no longer able to smile.   In fact, when I try to smile I look like a monster as my mouth is turned downward, my lips are no longer symmetrical and I'm unable to show my pearly whites.  I am new to the area so I went on the web to find doctor's that provided Botox injections. I found The Geldner Center website. I wish to God that I never stumbled upon their website. If I hadn't scheduled an appointment with him I'd still be able to physically smile. I'm in sales and a smile goes a long way when talking to potential customers and giving presentations to groups of decision makers. Not to mention, I'm an outgoing person that use to have a smile beaming from my face until I received Botox from Dr, Geldner. I immediately contacted Dr. Geldner to ask him what could be done to reverse this nightmare he caused. He said that there was nothing he could do and that only time would be able to make this better when the Botox wears off. Only then will I be able to smile again. I was in tears when he told me this and his response was "tell people you had dental work done specifically a root canal". I was even more furious at his comment of what I should say the cause was for my face looking the way it was". To make things worse, if you can imagine, I left the Office Manager (think it's Geldner's wife) that I want a full refund for this botched up mess that only Dr. Geldner causes and was told that I will NOT be getting one penny back and that they didn't take too lightly to threats and they would take action against me! What nerve!!! What threat??? Imagine that...he damaged my face, my smile, confidence and she had the nerve to tell me I wouldn't get one penny back? I told her that I will make every effort I can to make certain that no other individual has to be disfigured the way I have as a result from the works of Dr. Geldner. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND DR. GELDNER!

6.description: I bought Groupons for six laser hair removal (LHR) treatments at three different locations, including the Geldner Center. I was looking for cheap treatments and was not committed to any of the three businesses. Now there's nowhere else I will go and that is because of Deanna Stellato.I started seeing Deanna and was so impressed by her professionalism, knowledge, and honesty that I chose to have the other LHR treatments I wanted done here. She not only knows her stuff but is warm and always puts you at ease, which is nice if you're having, um, delicate areas worked on. But don't let her sweet smile and pleasant demeanor fool you - when she puts on the wraparound sunglasses and grabs her laser gun, she's like the Dirty Harry of LHR, if you'll forgive the pun. And in a few, short minutes, you're this much closer to a less fuzzier you.

22.description: Ah, laser hair removal. With the sting of your zap and the tedious repeated visits, who can really truly say anything good about the experience?Which is exactly why it is essential to go to a place like the Geldner Center to have LHR done - where the staff are professional and the office is well run. Deanna has been great in booking my appointments. There is hardly ever any of that waiting around/long delay business. I am in and out of the office in less than 25 minutes which is the way it should be. I have not had any negative issues with LHR at the Geldner Center and have been seeing great results!

I told her that I will make every effort I can to make certain that no other individual has to be disfigured the way I have as a result from the works of Dr. Geldner. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND DR. GELDNER!

7.description: I love this place! I just had my first session for laser hair removal that I purchased from Groupon. They were really nice and didn't treat me any differently because of the Groupon. I felt like a valued customer there. Lindsey is the one who took care of me and made me feel very comfortable while zapping my hair follicles away.  The whole procedure took about 10 minutes. The only reason for a 4/5 is because I tried to book for a consult online but that didn't work out. I called them after a week and got an appointment booked right away. They also sent me emails on what to do before and after the LHR. I look forward to my next appointment and will update when all my sessions are completed.

8.description: Lynn Hollins is exceptional with Botox. I had Botox done 4 days ago, I couldn't be more pleased with my results. She kept me looking younger in a natural way without going overboard. Big thanks to her!

30.description: I was surprised that there were no reviews yet for Dr. G.  After this latest yelp discussion, I think it's time for one.  He is awesome, as is his staff (Marilyn is great!).  Do you research obviously, but consider Dr. Peter Geldner.  He is considered one of, if not the, best in Chicago.His credentials:Dr. Peter D. Geldner is Chief of Plastic Surgery at Michael Reese Hospital. He is also Clinical Assistant Professor at the University of Illinois and a clinical instructor at The University of Chicago. He is certified by the American Board of Plastic Surgery and has been nominated as "Best Plastic Surgeon" and "America's Top Surgeon."

3.description: Love this place! Bought a groupon years ago for laser hair removal (LHR) and recently bought another. They have upgraded their lasers so the pain is much more tolerable. My aesthetician is Biata and she is great. Friendly and super fast so our sessions go by in breeze. If you are in the market for LHR call and ask for their groupon rates!

14.description: Wow! Jill Jensen is amazing! After meeting her at Tiffany Kim and getting the most amazing, natural results from her, I am loyal to her for life. Not only did she give me fantastic results, but she is an incredible woman who truly desires to give you the best service possible. When she accepted a position in Hinsdale, I knew I would follow her to the ends of the earth. Go see Jill and you will not be disappointed.

29.description: I went to lunch heaven. Pretty sure I'm eating here everyday for the next month . They have gluten free and low carb if u need no noddles they will add more meat or veggies and the owner hangs out so u feel like everything is really at best level !

42.description: Overpriced. Tiny portions. Major disappointment.

23.description: My husband and I go every few months to NMH and were pleasantly surprised to find Saigon Sisters. So much gluten free, it's crazy. I ordered the chicken curry bowl and it was very good and I thought the portion was just fine. I even took home some of the brown rice, an option that was great. My husband thought the carmelized chicken was just ok. We always bring a water bottle so I don't really know about the expensive drinks that people write about. The manager was outside greeting everyone and keeping everything clean. There is not much seating, but maybe most people are picking up and taking to their offices. We did find a seat no problem and it was around noon. We'll definitely go again when at the hospital.

47.description: OK, my 3rd visit was a letdown. This time I got the lemongrass chicken salad because I wasn't very hungry, and found the portion to be too skimpy for the price. The rice noodles were lukewarm, which made the veggies not as fresh. The chicken was stale and sad-tasting. Could've used more mint and citrus to perk it up. This was so far away from the bright fresh flavors I got from the pork belly bahn-mi and chicken curry rice bowl I wondered if their competitor stole into the kitchen to mess up their food on purpose. I'll stay away from the salads from now on.

8.description: I have always wanted to come to this restaurant but not in a hospital building. I had food poisoning ordering a green tea with blueberry pearls. I believe it was the cross contamination of them making a green tea from scratch. Never will i go to this one or another of their restaurant.

31.description: There are 2 veggie options on their menu. The one I got was the lemongrass broth with tofu. It was super bland with minimal tofu. It was pretty much a broth soup and scant pieces of tofu. Not veggie friendly at all!

34.description: I tried giving this place another chance, but it's crap and it's expensive. The chicken has rarely been fresh looking. Most times, I pull 90% of the grey gross chicken out of it in order to consume what's left. It's not worth it, I give up on this place.

16.description: Awesome food and packing !!!

13.description: The store manager at this NWH location is a delight, always pretty courteous and cheery...however, the food isn't worth the price. At all. The portions are pretty small, but good for a light meal or snack (depending what you get). I've had food from Saigon Sisters on numerous occasions (more convenience than actual preference), and I've never been a fan. The owner is quite overbearing and annoying, and have had him approach me and try to sell me their image constantly. It's always like hearing a sales pitch from someone who has to try harder to make people believe the product is better than it is.  I've had a few banh mi, noodle dishes, and baos...everything is pretty Americanized or has a fusion taste, which is fine...but the taste of it all never stands out. It's a small storefront and not an excessive amount of seating, but it's usually pretty clean.

11.description: Ordered delivery from this restaurant and was definitely satisfied. The pho was individually packed so that ingredients stayed fresh, and the meat dish with rice was perfectly seasoned and delicious. They estimated about 45 minutes or so for delivery, but they arrived even sooner than expected. I haven't eaten in the restaurant, but judging from just the quality of the food, I would definitely check it out.

39.description: Probably best lunch at the hospital, but if you've got expectations from experience on Argyle st., you will be let down. For slightly less than Tank Noodle, you'll get 1/2 sized bowl, noodles that are starting to develop pasty texture like they were refrigerated and reheated, and most notably, only a token portion of the pile of basil you are really craving. The portion of meat is 1/4 what you might get at a real Pho place. Bottom line: relax your expectations.

37.description: I'm a banh-mi fiend thanks to this place!  The porky, the VBQ, the sun-tanned cow, yum.  I honestly can't vouch for any other menu items, although a co-worker said the pho isn't very memorable.  The sandwiches are made right before your eyes and topped with a sweet/tangy slaw, cucumber, spicy jalapeno,  and cilantro. This is a welcome addition to the hospital restaurant row.

0.description: I ordered through Fooda, which went seamlessly and was delivered on time at an acceptable temperature. I ordered the caramelized chicken with noodles and added peanut sauce.I thought the food was okay - the noodles were good and the portion felt right. There weren't many vegetables, and they weren't particularly good either. The chicken was pretty poor quality and was definitely not carmelized as advertised. The savior of the dish was the peanut sauce (+$.50). I thought it was excellent and it went really well with everything else in the dish. Giving this place a generous 4 stars.

38.description: I once said yes to the banh-mi twice in one week. Preferring pork belly, I went for it and found that the sandwich was the perfect balance of sweet, hot, and savory.I've also had the chicken curry and it does not disappoint! This is restaurant week quality food at decent prices. It's perfect for anyone on the go.

27.description: I wanted to love it as meetings take me to NMH regularly. Its expensive, not authentic (I'm Vietnamese) and the day I stopped in took forever to get my banh mi made. Bread is decent - not quite right - but a pile of sliced deli ham? Um, no. The pickled veggies were also slimy, pate watery and way too much mayo. I suppose better than Banh Mi & Co (horrible) and Ba Le (less horrible), but not worth it. Go to Argyle.

32.description: I have just had the Bahn Mi sandwich.  Simply put, better tasting and surprisingly cheaper Bahn Mi at Ba Le.

48.description: Feelin' cold, get some pho.Grab a banh mi, bao, a bowl.Salads and spring rolls,Saigon Sista, food for da soul!I cannot tell you how long I've been waiting for its frosted glass doors to open, and after this morning, I am a fan! FINALLY- a place that serves congee in the mornings. What is congee? It is a soupy, rice porridge. Call it the asian oatmeal. SS tops it with pork, chinese sausage, egg, ginger and scallions. For $6, you're paying double for half the portion. But it's a decent start to the mornings.  If you're not feeling too adventurous, they've got vietnamese coffee and macarons. Yes, macarons. Lovely.Saigon will be my go-to-dinner-for-breakfast spot. Find me unabashedly working my way through their menu in the mornings. Just today, I scarfed down their classic banh mi. Pate, where have you been all my life? Fabulous.LOCATED ON THE 2ND FLOOR ACROSS FROM THE PROTEIN BAR!

44.description: Great location and healthy food, even though a bit pricey. I have gone twice in a week already and loved the Pho and the combo Bao plate. The nice service and friendly staff, together with the tasty food, make for a great lunch experience. Yay, I'm a fan!
