24.description: Sadly, I ordered for pick-up and they had me waiting for my order. The food was cold, super small portion and I was left having to find other food to eat. I was very disappointed. I ordered the caramelized chicken. Sorry, won't be returning.

7.description: Only tried their shrimp spring roll. It comes with 3 rolls about 4 inches each. Not alot of ingredients. A bit small for the price. It comes with the peanut butter sauce.Update: Tried the Wagyu beef banh bao. It was quite delicious with the Viet BBQ sauce. Stayed to eat, environment is pretty good.

40.description: Very decent pho, especially if you realize you are in a hospital. I'm a big fan of Northwestern's push for more varied fare within the hospital. Prices are a bit insultingly high, compared to what you would get on Argyle, but then again, you are eating at a hospital in Streeterville.

30.description: What a friendly group of people! I got a huge bowl of Vegetarian Pho. It was spicy and filled with noodles! It's not the best pho I've ever had, but it was still great! The lovely woman that took my order offered me a free cup of coffee. I declined, but that simple gesture will bring me back my next time at NMH.

46.description: LOVE having Saigon Sisters close to my workplace as a viable lunch option now that they have a location inside NMH. Great option for those with dietary restrictions as they offer several vegan and gluten-free options and the best part is... they are clearly labeled on the menu - thank you!My go-to is the gluten free chicken curry rice bowl which is made with organic brown rice, pickled daikon and carrots, cilantro, raw jalapenos, red peppers and cucumbers. I love the curry - not spicy, not sweet, perfect. Also, the chicken is always cooked really well and the portion is very generous.Recently they also started carrying gluten free macarons from Vanille, one of my favorite macaron bakeries! The menu has other great options such as gluten free Pho, salads, several other rice bowl flavors and for those with no dietary restrictions, indulge in banh bao or their famous banh mi sandwiches!Don't get discouraged if you see a long line, especially over lunch; it moves fairly quickly. Love the fast and friendly service!

1.description: Ordered some beef pho at the Northwestern location.  After what seemed like an eternity for the pho to cool down, I was able to dive in.  Very little broth to noodle ratio.  Beef was ample enough, but had lost almost all of its flavor.  It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't as good as it could have been.  The place has the potential to be much more.  After a while, the scent of the leftover, covered pho permeated the room and made me a little bit nauseated so I had to pitch it down the hall.  I may stop by for a Bah Mi at some point, but probably not soon.

9.description: Tasty food even tho not authentic. Staff is extremely nice and caring. However even being a small Asian I feel like they could have served more portion. I need to fill myself one bowl of pho plus 2 buns to feel full. Overall good dining experience.

26.description: This was hands down some of the best Pho that I have had in Chicago to date, however I likely will not be back.  I had a beef Pho with extra beef instead of the standard meatballs.  The broth was delicious, which is the most important part.  However, it was $9.50 + tax for the tiniest bowl of soup ever!  There were hardly 5 slices of beef in the soup.  I went to the one inside Northwestern medical center and the food was fast, the service was friendly and nice, the location is small and cute, and convenient if you happen to be in the hospital for something.  However, I will not be back because although the Pho was good, it is also supposed to be cheap and overflowing with noodles and meat.  Too expensive a bowl of soup for me, but delicious.

25.description: Very expensive. Charging $3.50 for an ice coffee that is the size of a free water cup is ridiculous. Banh mi bread was warm but meat was cold. $8.50 for pho was crazy.

12.description: I had the classic Bahn mi today and will tell you it far from being classic.  It was very salty or briney tasting.  The pate was liquidy.  The only good thing about it was the bread.On another trip I decided to give their pork belly rice bowl a try again and yet still disappointed.  The whole dish was fairly cold and the rice mushy.  They sold me on a carmelized egg that was really disguised as a normal boiled egg.I think I'll just stick to my trips to Argyle to get my fix.

21.description: Saigon has great chicken pho soup. The Vietnamese spring rolls and bao are also very good. The delivery option makes frequent take out easy

17.description: I don't have much to say about this place, except for the fact that I ate their classic sandwich everyday for 5 days straight, and then I brought my boyfriend over (for a sixth time) and we had the tuna one... They're so good and fresh tasty! yummy! ^__^I see the bad reviews about the overpriced and cold arguments... And I don't know anything about Vietnamese food... But it's not a hot subs place... And it's downtown, I didn't think my sandwich was bad for $7... :/ oh well... I still like it :3

10.description: We needed a quick lunch so we decided to grab sandwiches from this little shop inside Northwestern. It took at least 15 min to get two sandwiches. No others in front of us in line. I ordered the Hen House, the cashier confirmed and the wrapper denoted HH. They gave me the classic (pork pate and ham). I can't eat pork. I went hungry that day as that was my only window to grab a meal. Thanks so much, guys.

5.description: I got the roast beef pho and a side of "just noodles" here after a doctor's appointment. I knew there would be a high price tag since it is located in the hospital. What I wasn't expecting was the skimpy portions. As some of the other reviewers on here mentioned, the pho soup only fills up about half of the bowl. It is mostly noodles and lacking in the meat department. For the $9 price tag, I would have been happy if they just put a little more broth in. The extra ingredients (bean sprouts, jalapeños, and one basil leaf) are very sparse. The "just noodles" were utterly tasteless. I asked for fish sauce and soy sauce to give them flavor. I definitely wouldn't order the noodles again for $5.I will probably return since the options at the hospital are limited with no cafeteria, but I would not order the noodle dishes!

3.description: In the last couple month's I'd been spending a lot of time here on the Northwestern hospital campus and getting to know their eateries was becoming a daily routine.  I hadn't heard much from word of mouth and their varied reviews weren't as enticing. Then one day while trekking between buildings a few of the Galter center eateries were showcasing their fare in an adjacent dining area.  Atop a display table I saw multiple cans of Cafe Du Monde coffee and was intrigued.  (A New Orleans fan favorite) Came to find out that Saigon Sisters uses this coffee type to create their Vietnamese Iced coffee.  Upon this discovery I decided to check them out.Their menu pricing is a tad high compared to Vietnamese food found anywhere else in Chicago.  But look at where they're located.  I decided to try a trio of banh bao's (open faced steamed buns filled with seasoned ingredients.)  If they served a trio with a small salad, it'd be a decent meal that fills the belly.  I got the Wagyu beef, Hoisin glazed pork belly and Teriyaki tofu (don't ask why).  The first two were savory, flavorful and my tongue had desired more.  The last one, tofu, was tofu.  Another eatery located some yardage away also offers baos but filled with sushi and is only offered in a pair with a tiny seaweed side salad (and at times they run out, so at $8.95 for two, this is the better deal. Sometimes they might sub if the salad is out, but still, the trio is the better deal.)Since I was "20 questions" about using Cafe Du Monde, I was offered a free sample of the iced coffee.  I've only ever had it piping hot and on location in Nola, so this was a tasty different method.  If you like a sweeter iced coffee, it might be worth a try.

35.description: Curry Chicken, bland and made my office smell like fart due to the closed up container with the pickled radishes.  I had a healthy appetite, and after seeing the reviews about the portions being small, figured I might get a spring roll from the refrigerator or order a salad on the side.  When I asked the girl at the register and taking orders how big the Curry Chicken bowl is, she responded, "its like a meal".  Seriously? what the fuck size is a meal.  Obviously this is not the first time she gave this response as the guy next to her grabbed a container and showed me its size.  WTF?  I'd skip this joint and try something else for $9.Edit: Ok, seriously, I just started eating this thing and it's curry mayonnaise?  If I wanted a warm curry chicken salad that's what I would have ordered.  You guys need to get your food straight.  Definitely not authentic or asian at all.

19.description: This was hands down some of the best Pho that I have had in Chicago to date, however I likely will not be back.  I had a beef Pho with extra beef instead of the standard meatballs.  The broth was delicious, which is the most important part.  However, it was $9.50 + tax for the tiniest bowl of soup ever!  There were hardly 5 slices of beef in the soup.  I went to the one inside Northwestern medical center and the food was fast, the service was friendly and nice, the location is small and cute, and convenient if you happen to be in the hospital for something.  However, I will not be back because although the Pho was good, it is also supposed to be cheap and overflowing with noodles and meat.  Too expensive a bowl of soup for me, but delicious.

28.description: SO disappointed!  All I wanted after a long day was some Chicken Pho.  I have never ordered from here and will never again after how they handled the situation.  My food was delivered through Grub Hub and I actually got it pretty quickly which is always nice.  I poured the chicken soup into the bowl with the noodles and such, I let it sit for a second because it was hot.  When I went to take my first bite the stench coming from my soup was something less than desired - it smells SPOILED!  I contacted Grub Hub back and they reached out to the restaurant.  They are NOT willing to give me a refund - they offered me a 25% discount on my next order....REALLY...do they think I am going to order from here again - I just spent $24 on spring rolls and spoiled soup...THINK NOT! My advice dont order PHO from here, not unless you want to eat spoiled food.

45.description: But the Beef Pho could have been better, The chopped meatballs tasted too rubbery. Although the noodles & beef slices were pretty good.  However, The spicy shrimp chips, Dusted with some cayenne or other similar spice was a nice treat. As are the regular Vietnamese shrimp chips.

33.description: I've glanced over this place and watched friends purchase their food, but I've never bought anything due to the price.I'm very disappointed in the banh mi. I had the classic. The baguette is quite small, with the majority of the contents being meat. This leaves it flavorless because most of the taste, in my opinion, comes from the vegetables like cilantro and the pickled carrot-daikon. If I wanted a toasted sandwich with meat I could've saved 7 dollars and made it at home. The pho is ok. The bao is super tasty but over priced. And the shrimp spring roll is ok and over priced.Its good if you want something different and are short on time. But if you want decent vietnamese food, I suggest you go somewhere else.

43.description: This place caught my attention at the NMH as I don't see many sandwich places with waygu beef as an option.  It is a little pricey but  service is quick for lunch. I like the baos a little more than the sandwiches as the bao are nice and fluffy.

2.description: I stopped by for lunch and tried the caramelized shrimp.  After dishing out ~$12, I had fairly decent expectations that unfortunately just were not met.  I don't eat rice, so I had requested extra veggies and received 5 shrimp with a few slices of cucumbers.  Although tasty, I could not believe the portion size to price ratio.  With the other options at NMH, I don't see myself stopping by again.

18.description: I am a fan of the Banh Mi!  This place also has good pho ga.

41.description: 15 minutes between classes to walk over, order, get food, and walk back.Getting exciting gourmet food in this timeframe - extra awesome.So far I've had the veggie and beef pho: the beef pho's noodles were dried out, but otherwise very good and the variety of ingredients and large amount of broth makes it last a long time (which is great when you're in class!). Ideally, the broth would have more depth, but for a quick dinner during class time, it's good enough.Love the wagyu coconut rice bowl (woohoo brown rice!). Also a good portion size. Get the egg for an extra buck.

4.description: Went here for a quick lunch during work. Very overpriced for Vietnamese food. The bahn mi sandwich was small and forgettable - very little flavor. Try Lotus Cafe next time - huge difference in quality, price, and portion size.

6.description: Don't expect good service. Don't expect any explanations on menu items. Maybe It's efficient as long as you know what the hell you are ordering and you can hear over the bongo music playing over the speakers. Not a fan.

22.description: Who would expect great Vietnamese food in a hospital food  court. The curried chicken  rice bowl was terrific. Get the glazed egg for an extra treat.

15.description: Feelin' cold, get some pho.Grab a banh mi, bao, a bowl.Salads and spring rolls,Saigon Sista, food for da soul!I cannot tell you how long I've been waiting for its frosted glass doors to open, and after this morning, I am a fan! FINALLY- a place that serves congee in the mornings. What is congee? It is a soupy, rice porridge. Call it the asian oatmeal. SS tops it with pork, chinese sausage, egg, ginger and scallions. For $6, you're paying double for half the portion. But it's a decent start to the mornings.  If you're not feeling too adventurous, they've got vietnamese coffee and macarons. Yes, macarons. Lovely.Saigon will be my go-to-dinner-for-breakfast spot. Find me unabashedly working my way through their menu in the mornings. Just today, I scarfed down their classic banh mi. Pate, where have you been all my life? Fabulous.LOCATED ON THE 2ND FLOOR ACROSS FROM THE PROTEIN BAR!

20.description: Paid 12 bucks for pho chicken soup that was highly watered  down broth with 2 small shreds of chicken and too many noodles.  Live around the hospital and use the docs and health services. I have been wanting to try the fare.  Won't be back.

36.description: The fact that this Saigon Sisters (located on the 2nd fl of Northwestern Memorial Hospital) is so close to my workplace is a huge plus. Now I can have pho any day during my work week. Hellz ya! Although the portions are smaller than what you get at Argyle the Pho here is pretty good- at least satisfying enough to hold me over until 5pm.  The bahn mi sandwiches sound delicious and will be giving them a try the next time I pop in here, which will be very soon.  They also sell macarons (glutten free!) from vanille patisserie and cafe du monde coffee -good stuff!

14.description: I  have gotten lunch here dozens of times and really have enjoyed the food. Really am appalled by the unfriendly service by the staff. Making eye contact while taking money is the least one could do. It appears that doing one's job is disdainful to this staff. Where is the management in all this?

3.description: During my last trip to Chicago I found myself struggling with some ankle pain. Since we were walking A LOT I wanted to stop and get an ankle brace and some ibuprofen. I did a quick search on Yelp of drug stores by our hotel and this Walgreens showed up. First off, it was very difficult to find. I wandered around looking for a good 10 minutes (it would have been faster to just go to the next closest location at that point, but I was stubborn). Finally, after some help from a very nice security guard, I found it. It's on the second floor of one of the Northwestern hospital buildings. Upon walking in I knew I wouldn't find what I was looking for. This is a pharmacy ONLY. with a few OTC medicines and such on a small wall on the left. The lady behind the counter was nice but told me they didn't have joint support like I was looking for. I could have bought the meds but I decided just to do both at one place so I left empty handed.I suppose if you're at the hospital and need a prescription or just need some Tums this would work out but if you need anything further you might want to mosey on to someplace else.

1.description: My dear god, i never want to come back. Spent 1.5 hours waiting for 3 prescriptions, in the end, they only pulled 2. I gave up b/c i was already running late to meet up with friends. Why bother having a screen when the info displayed doesn't even get updated?! A lady came around and took down the names of everyone (including myself) in the waiting area, but half of our names never showed up on the screen. So, after waiting for 45 min and not seeing my name, i got in line to find out what was going on. They told me they received my prescription in the system but needed to process the order to get it pulled. I sat down, and waited another 20 minutes. Still no name on the screen. By now, i've probably seen 50 people walk in and out of the store. I got up again to check in. By the way, everytime i have to get back in line. They told me they would check up on the order. I sat back down again. After 1.5 hours, i finally got called and they provided me with 2 prescription. I told them i had 3, and showed them the doctor's request. By now, steam was emitting from my head. This was going to be my 4th time sitting down. I told them i had to run and i'd pick up the 3rd one another time. If i had to stay a minute longer, my head would've exploded. Warning:  my name never showed up on the screen during the 1.5hr wait, so it's pointless. Just check in with them if you get antsy like me. P.S. i ended up transferring the 3rd prescription to another pick-up location. Couldn't afford to face the madness again.

2.description: This review is for the PHARMACY only.How on earth is it possible that the world's rudest pharmacy staff works IN A HOSPITAL? Do they not receive special sensitivity training about the fact that most people are going through something and perhaps maybe they shouldn't treat customers like idiotic nuisances when THEY are the ones who have screwed up?I've been dealing with a wound complication following a surgery and my doctor has sent prescriptions there a couple times because 1) It's right there and 2) They tend to have some of the weird wound creams and ointments in stock already when other pharmacies don't. The first time I visited this pharmacy, I was told it'd be about a 25 minute wait. An hour later, in pain, I finally had my prescription.Yesterday, my doctor prescribed a wound solution that again is not often in stock, but the nurse said she'd call it there because they might have it. Upon arrival, I checked in and explained that I'm sure it wasn't ready yet, but it had been called in and I wanted to make sure they have it in stock. I was assured they had it in stock and it'd be ready in about 25 minutes.15 minutes later, my name still wasn't showing up on the screen. I went up to check to make sure I'd been processed, and with no explanation, was just told "we're working on it." 20 minutes after that, they called me. Shocker: They actually didn't have my prescription in stock. So I said "So I just waited 35 minutes for you to tell me it's not in stock?" "Yeah, sorry. We'll order it."I left and left a message for the nurse to see if she could call around and find it at a pharmacy near me. She called me back and said they didn't have it anywhere near me, but she talked to the Walgreens at Northwestern and they had a different solution that was fine for me to use, and they'd have it for me in the morning.So this morning I trekked to this Walgreens and received an attitude when I smiled, said good morning and said I was there to pick up a prescription. "WE DON'T HAVE EITHER." I calmly explained what the nurse had told me. "Yeah, no, we don't have either solution and it might be in the shipment we received this morning and it might not be, but no one can check until at least 2 p.m." All with a nasty tone.Talked to my nurse, who talked to them and confirmed 4 times that it will be available for me later this afternoon and I'll be alerted when it's ready. I'd say it's 50/50 whether this actually ends up being true.But what disturbs me more than the lack of competence is the rude, nasty staff. I have never gone in with a bad attitude or anything. And I hear them talking to others. What I'm going through is emotionally draining for me, but forget that, what about the people who are there who have terminal illnesses? Or who are picking up prescriptions for their sick children? YOU WORK IN A HOSPITAL, PEOPLE. BE A LITTLE FREAKING NICE!

5.description: Waited over two hours for a prescription to be filled after being discharged. Very poor service.  They need to staff up or get out of the game.

6.description: This place blows. Why do they have a screen showing names and the time your prescription will be ready for pick-up when the prescription isn't ready at that time. Plus, there are a lot of ghetto people in here.

7.description: This is my pharmacy of choice. They're quick and efficient, with a large gang of pharmacists working behind the counter. They even have a waiting area where your name pops up on a screen when your order is ready. They don't have many products, they're more just a pharmacy than a store, but they have a few of the essentials.

8.description: The ready by time means absolutely nothing!   The nice lady at the counter let them know I was waiting 5 min after my "ready" time.

0.description: I don't understand the low reviews. This place is awesome. I'll start off by saying that I don't use the pharmacy. Luckily, I am currently not taking any prescription pills.So I'll leave that part out of my review.The rest of the place is great! Yes I do work in one of the networked buildings so I can come here without stepping foot outside. It is always clean and the people are always friendly. I always get a "Welcome to WalGreens" when walking in. At check out, they are quick to call an "I see 3" which is their code when there are 3 or more people standing in line. I often get a "Stay healthy" or "Stay Well" when checking out.Plus, they have everything you would need here. One day, my shoe lace broke, Walgreens had it. I needed a lint brush, Walgreens. Birthday card? Of course. Plus a slew of over the counter meds. Feel a sniffle or a tickle in the back of your throat? I just head here to grab something. I don't have to wait until I get off work because I am at work!They even have socks here! I found this out when I got stuck outside in a monsoon and had wet socks, who wants to wear wet socks for the rest of the day? No worries! $9 for a 3 pack to the rescue! I was also able to upgrade my umbrella too.Oh did I mention this place as a fro-yo bar? I haven't tried it yet but really a fro-yo bar with toppings at a Walgreens?

4.description: hey Sunday crew if you don't like to deal with people, like to be rude to customers when they ask questions about prescriptions and hide in the back room to avoid customers I would suggest working somewhere else. might I suggest Comcast customer service center?  never seen someone take my question on getting a flu shot only to go hide in the back room to avoid customers and hope I left (I did). even worse was to see how rude you guys were to the other customers who had legit questions about their prescriptions. sad.

3.description: Great priced drinks! This is the perfect place to grab a drink before your night out if you are staying at the hotel.

1.description: Dan is the best bartender. I heard the drinks were inexpensive, but we haven't paid yet so who know if that is true.

2.description: Nothing to write home about.A small reasonably priced bar in the lobby of the Inn of Chicago.  I had some sort of Orange Martini.  I thought it looked nicer and bigger in the pictures.  The bar oinly has about 4 seats and a couple tables.  This is not a place you go out of your way to drink at.

5.description: InnBar is located in the Inn of Chicago Magnificent Mile lobby. The entrance is just off St. Clair between Ohio and Ontario.If you are looking for a realitively quiet place to have drink after work, this is your place. The bartenders are super friendly, especially Jimmy "the Stud". They pour a nice hearty cocktail and have some yummy specialty martinis as well!

0.description: The name says it all.Is it an Inn?Is it a Bar?Bird? Plane?....................Did not utilize the "Inn" portion.... but did make use of the "Bar" side.Next door to the Courtyard (where we were staying).... so we had a quick drink.Not a big bar. A few tables/seats.Cool lighting.Not much as far as beer choices.The Bar I suppose it more for the "Inn" stayers.Has a "strange" conversation with some of my fellow bar patrons. They were in town for the night as they had just worked the Amtrack train from Los Angeles. I asked what is one thing that most people would not know/understand about the cross country Amtrack service..................per the guy it is "How often they hit people on the tracks (suicides!!).Happy New Year. Yuck.

4.description: The Inn Bar is actually inside the Inn of Chicago - Magnificent Mile. The lobby slowly transitions in to a bar. Thought is looks loungey in photos, it is a bar so don't be fooled.When we went, it wasn't crowded at all which is fine but the music was absent.  But since my friend and I were there to catch up, it wasn't a big deal. I was saddened that they didn't have Mojitos due to food license issues.Our bartender was mad cool. I was buzzed when I got there and told him that he looks like Billy Corgan when Billy had his head shaved. We then went into discussion on the ways he could con the city.

3.description: I've got to give 5 stars for this place based just off the service alone!We arrived and were greeted warmly by the maitre'd, and then taken to our table by a lovely server. After checking our coats, we sat down and ordered some cocktails to get started. I ordered the Hendricks gin and chartreuse cocktail (the Jealous Green, it might be called?) and my friend ordered the pumpkin and bourbon cocktail. We both agreed they were probably the best we'd ever had. On to the food: I ordered the turkey chilli starter for my main, to which they obliged very willingly, and my dining partner ordered the burger, cooked medium. Both our meals came out in good time and were absolutely delicious. The chilli was spiced perfectly and the red kidney beans were still firm enough to be speared with a fork, which I appreciated- mushy beans make me sad! My friend devoured his hamburger, so I'm assuming he enjoyed it too. ;)I didn't order dessert (though believe me, I was tempted to!) but my friend had the creme brulee with pumpkin cream and just about fainted after his first bite- he raved about how delicious it was for hours afterwards.All in all: definitely recommended.

1.description: Loved my experience here at Mariposa as it was my first time. I've only ever been to Zodiac room but not downtown so it was nice to experience this for a Sunday brunch with my mom. We did some shopping downstairs and decided to go have some tasty lunch since we were too tired to walk anywhere far. We got a nice table by the window and ordered away. The place is a more modern twist to the traditional Zodiac Room but it went well with the Michigan Avenue store. Okay, so let's talk about those popovers, I swear those things alone deserve five stars, they are to die for, and seriously the best part of eating at Neimans. Oh and that strawberry butter that goes along so wonderfully with them, I mean wow! How can I fail to mention the little chicken broth soup that I have with the popover, it is so very tasty and now that fall is on our way, it's the perfect thing to have on a chill, crisp day. I take that back, it's good anytime of year. We ordered the salmon platter as an appetizer which had a fabulous presentation but we could have passed since our entrees were enough. My mom ordered the thai scallops which she seemed to really enjoy. I wanted to get the turkey panini but then when I saw a cheeseburger brought out for someone else with gorgeous skinny frites, I quickly changed my order and got the burger. I asked for well done and it was over done so that's the reason I didn't give them 5 stars. I wasn't in a hoity toity mood to send it back but for a $17 burger which can easily be shared by the way, I want it done right. The service I must say overall was very good, our server was sweet and attentive and everything was brought out as it should be brought out. For drinks my mom got the strawberry margarita and I got the fruity sangria and both were also delicious. As if we weren't full enough, because I seriously should have been done with my broth and popover but nope, we had to try one of their desserts. We shared the creme brulee and it was beautifully presented but I didn't love it, it was a little warm like it was sitting out for a while and the flavor just wasn't like it is at RL or some other places. Overall, a great little lunch spot, not a foodie place, but a girly place for after too much shopping or window shopping. If breakfast is at Tiffanys, than lunch is at Neimans.

2.description: Lovely as it can be but I miss the Zodiac room and those strawberry popovers.  Addictive as crack I say but I digress.  The servers here are wonderful.  And, unlike the Zodiac my husband will join me for lunch here and not feel like the only male in the room!  Surprisingly impressive offerings of wine by the glass but I'm a cocktail girl and they have made me happy with my martinins on the rocks and vodka gimlets.   I love getting a nice buzz going in the afternoon.  Their menu is seasonal and they list the calories for each and every entree, even the kiddie entrees!  My favorite sammie is the grilled cheese with tomato jam.  I also like their grill chicken sammie with arugula and the scallops with an Asian twist.  My husband is a meat and potato guy and has enjoyed their version of steak frites and their cheeseburger with some special sauce that we always joke about (we've been married a long time).Lots of designer bags and clothes here.  It's a nice place to take your wife or mom to for a fancy schmancy lunch.

5.description: I loved it here for lunch.  We were met by a very nice maiter'd who made us feel very comfortable and welcomed. The restaurant looks beautiful inside, much more contemporary and stylish, but not an overly trendy feeling.  Just a very nice visual setting to enjoy a wonderful lunch, and extremely well set up with beautiful table settings. Just perfect. It is not a stuffy feeling at all here.As far as the menu, I think there is much more of a variety than Zodiac.  Plenty of sandwiches to chose from, chicken, turkey, and tuna, innovative, creative salads with so many different kinds of vegetables, fruits and different greens, main courses of salmon and chicken, appetizers like hummus, vegetarian lentil soup.I ordered the crab salad which was full of crab, tomatoes, greens,avocado, mango seasoned just right with not too much dressing.  It was fantastic, served beautifully and visually appealing. It was so appetizing.  That's what makes this restaurant special. the way the food is prepared, the variety on the menu, and there are healthy food services with so many  different vegetables and of course the atmosphere.  If you are a vegetarian, or want to eat healthy, there are many options on the menu for you.  In fact, I think all their selections lean towards healthy eating. I also like the way they list the calories and cholestrol for each item.  Also, the service was great.  I think this restaurant took a fantastic turn for the better, with expanding their menu, the creativity of the food, the renovation, and terrific service.  Don't be put off because it is in Neiman Marcus. You do not get a stuffy feeling here at all, and will not feel uncomfortable if you even come here by yourself. We are still talking about how nice our lunch was. My partner had the grilled salmon and loved it.  There are many factors that contribute to a success of a restaurant and I feel Mariposa succeeded.

0.description: The mister and I are always down for a Socialite Babe lunch, and this is the perfect spot.Service--from beginning to end--is top notch. The interior is bright and stylish with Calder tapestries flanking the walls.  Yummy, strong cocktails. Beautifully prepared and flavorful food.If breakfast is at Tiffany's...lunch is at Neiman Marcus!

4.description: While our food was good, the service left much to be desired. We were immediately seated upon arrival, but it took 15-20 minutes for a server to come to our table. We had to ask several different workers for a waiter. The restaurant was almost empty, so it's not like our waiter was busy. Once we got our food the popovers and soup were delicious as always. So was the salmon salad.

28.description: I went for a quick manicure at lunch, and was a little skeptical. I'll admit I'm biased against the "chop shops", but except for one thing they were amazing. Took me right away, wide selection of polishes (including the Designer Series from OPI), clean, and modern looking. I saw people getting pedicures with the cuticle razor thing (what are they called?), which I thought was illegal in IL. (But I do love them, but it made me uneasy since I know they're a no-no.) I guess I also didn't love that the file and buffer were re-used, but the tools looked shiny and clean (no fingerprints or other people's cuticle grime that I saw). Clean towels, too. I walked out an hour ago, so I can't speak to the longevity of the polish job. But it looks amazing, and even better than my "regular" place, which charges me double. No one asked if I wanted my brows done, no one chatted with me (which is quite fine, thank you very much), and it was pleasant. In and out for $19 incl tip. TIPS ARE CASH ONLY

1.description: Two Mani Pedi's, Two Great experiences.Stop in and give them a shot.

9.description: I was in town for work and had zero time to spare but desperately needed a mani pedi before a big event. Nail perfection was recommended by my concierge and they got me in on a Sunday at the last minute. They did such a great job and even had two nail techs work on me simultaneously so I could get my nails done on time. They did a beautiful job. If you are in Chicago definitely get your nails done here!

29.description: Well first of all, I could never give a nail salon 5 stars I don't think.... they all hover between 2 and 4. how good can someone buffing your nails be? That said, there are a few basic things I do expect and I was actually let down here. The paint job isn't great, and some other boring nail-related things weren't done as I'd expect. The people were friendly-ish but not terribly welcoming. And yes, being asked if you want your eyebrows waxed is disconcerting - I'm not sporting a monobrow for goodness' sake. And the final nail in the coffin - thanks for giving me one of my three nail repairs free, but frankly, charging $3 per nail for a repair is borderline daylight robbery and I'd have been coughing and spluttering if you hadn't given me a freebie. I really hope there are better value and nicer places in Chicago. There must be.

23.description: I have been here once, and never will I ever go back.  I don't expect much when it comes to a cheapie manicure.  But I can't tolerate dirtiness and poor hygiene.  I watched in horror as one of the nail technicians picked her nose for a full 3 minutes.  In full view of all the customers.  Beyond foul.

5.description: No frills but great service and great price. The massage with my pedicure was great. Was able to walk in without a reservation. Lots of colors to choose from and super friendly staff.

31.description: A little on the dirty and chaotic side for my tastes.... they have been renovating so it may be better now but....I tried this place 4 times or so and was always disappointed.  I have only gotten a manicure here because it looked to dirty to try a pedi. All of the manicures I got were really sloppy and there was always topcoat all over my cuticles. By the next day it always looked-a-wreck.

25.description: This place is like a quickie....can sometimes be dirty and sloppy, but you know what?! It gets the job done when needed.We walked in spur of the moment on Sunday and they were able to fit us in with no wait, when another *nicer* salon around the corner had no availability without an appointment (even though there was only 3 people in the entire place).As others have mentioned, cleanliness can be questioned.  Prices are right though!  $33 for a spa pedi isn't too bad.  And yes, tips are cash (unless you gripe that you have no cash--then they'll put it on the card) only!Probably wouldn't frequent this place as my usual joint; but, like I said, it works in a pinch.

12.description: 1.5 hours for a pedicure. Tried to charge me for no chip take off which I did myself while I was waiting for the lady to finally put on the last coat on my toes. The only thing good about this place is Kim. Sadly she was not here. Try Ten Perfect around the block.

21.description: I tried them out to get my eyebrows waxed. I told her I only wanted them cleaned up and wanted to keep them thick. She went slowly on the first one, letting me check each time she waxed a section. That brow (the right one) looked fine so I thought she would naturally wax the left one to match it. That was my mistake. She waxed the second brow SUPER thin with a crazy shape. When I told her that they did not match, she blamed my eyebrow, saying the left one was thinner. I am so upset because now I have to walk around with crazy looking, not matching brows until they grow back. :-/

16.description: I am starting this review by letting the readers know that my left foot is in so much pain from my 'Nail Perfection' pedicure last night that I wont be surprised if i end up having to go to the hospital while I am here in Chicago. My work associate and I are in town from boston and we came two days early to meet up with our other galpal who was here on business so we could have some relaxation since we will be working for most of our time here. I suggested we get a manipedi at Logan Airport before we left - that is another review in the making, it was awful - so to make up for that awful mani pedi, i suggested we get a "redo" while in Chi.it was 8 pm and Perfection nails looked full of people even thought it said their hours were 10-8 - so i thought i would just ask, as I know back home some salons make exceptions etc... The man who was clearly the manager of the place said we should definitely come in and pick our colors.I was impressed with the selection of colors that NP offered - which basically is what the one star I am giving them is for.the three of us sat in the pedicure chairs and began what we hoped would be a great experience. Throughout the entire pedi, the same man who was the "manager" or whoever, kept talking to / yelling at the ladies and they would stop the pedicures and get up and do other things, which was insanely annoying. We were there to relax, not to have front row seats to a yelling match in another language.but the real horror began as the technicians came out with ACTUAL CHEESE GRATERS to work on the bottoms of our feet (note - i had a pedicure the day before so not sure why this was necessary). My one friend was laughing while getting her feet "grated" so i thought it couldnt be that bad.... well, lucky me, the woman doing my feet thought using the  ILLEGAL RAZOR would be best.... well, she BUTCHERED my foot - then sprayed alcohol on it - which was the most insanely painful thing i have ever experienced. I should have stopped right then and there and left.the same woman did my manicure and cut two of my fingers to the point that they were bleeding - she then sprayed more alcohol on it, even though i told her not to, that i wanted to just wash my hands instead....i was in so much pain that i could have and should have cried. i asked her to only do one coat of polish (so i could get the hell out of there) but she said "sorry" and started painting the second coat...when i was walking toward the dryer area she suggested i put "vaseline on my foot"... All of this and I was charged a ridiculous price of $44 for both services. I would never in a million years ever go here again, even if it was the LAST place on earth. FOR YOUR NAIL SERVICES - GO ANYWHERE BUT HERE. I will be reporting this place to the board of health.

17.description: Not the biggest fan of this place. It is kind of dirty and I thought the manicurists were extremely pushy (trying to push no chip and eyebrow wax on me multiple times). I probably won't be going there again - although it is extremely convenient to my school. If you're having a nail emergency then this place will suffice.

10.description: I usually go to Arbre Nail Spa down the street from this place, but they didn't have any appointments available the day i wanted to get my nails done. I was desperate, so I thought I would give this place a go.I called in advance to make my appointment, and lucky me - they had the time I wanted available. When I walked in, I was surprised by how many no-chip polishes they had. I felt like a kid in a candy store, and I couldn't wait to get my no-chip done. After waiting for only a couple minutes, I sat down with a lady whose name I didn't have a chance to get. Everything was going well until she started cutting my cuticles. She spent an abnormal amount of time on my cuticles, which I thought was weird because I don't have bad cuticles in the first place. She was cutting them so much that I had three cuts on my left hand that were bleeding. It hurt so bad!!! And it started to hurt even worse because she kept using nail polish remover on my nails that made my cuts sting. I felt like she was seriously trying to punish me for something. The actual no-chip turned out okay, but I wouldn't go back because my fingers are still in pain from the cuts she gave me. UGH.

11.description: Been to this salon twice for a pedicure (currently $32) and they do a great job!  I cannot stand places that don't clean your cuticles and under your nails enough.  after she massaged my feet, she went back and triple checked to ensure that everything was cleaned up!

26.description: This is the third time coming here. I love walking out of my building in sandals to get my feet looking perfect. They do a great spa pedicure but the manicures look amateur- paint on the nail beds? Really?!!I definitely will go back for future pedicures because they are the best, in my opinion, but will try out other places to get my finger nails glam!

27.description: I will not go back to this place.  I told the lady who did my nails that on my big toes I wanted the OPI taupe color I chose with white polka dots of varying sizes.  I thought it would be pretty easy, however, when she had me look down at my toes there were no polka dots and some swirly design instead.  I guess to try and appease me she put a few polka dots between the swirls, but I was still like WTF.  As a previous poster mentioned, I too noticed the person next to me having the illegal razoring done to their feet (yuck).Onto the manicure, I didn't like how stuff was reused and not brand new but the paint job was fine.  There was a special going on for a mani-pedi for $39.99 and the lady said the nail art on my 2 big toes would be $5.  When she gave me the total she said $40 (I assumed she comped the nail art since she didn't do what I had wanted) and I gave her $46 (I didn't want to give her a good tip because I was still pissed she didn't do my polka dots, but I was happy that she comped the nail art so that's what I went with).  About 2 minutes later she says she forgot the nail art and that would be $5.  At that point I was really mad because I think she knew she was going to get a bad tip if I had known initially that she would have charged me for the nail art.  Anyways, I gave her $3 and told her to take the rest out of her tip because she hadn't done what I wanted.  Also, when the lady took the toe spacers out of my toes she put them back in her smock (obviously they are reused on people-- yuck!)I would not recommend this place at all.

35.description: i've gotten a manicure and pedicure here. the lady was friendly and did a good job, but overall the experience wasn't anymore special than getting it done at other places. i found the prices to be comparable to most, $40 for both.

8.description: So, since my last Yelp review was so negative, I felt like I needed to restore my karmic balance and give kudos where they're due. This place gets pretty blasted on Yelp, and having been in business for at least 8 years only has 20 something reviews -- weird. I stopped in for a pedicure today because I couldn't get in to my usual place across the street, and I'd just come back from a conference and this was not a situation that could be put off. Someone, anyone, rub my feet. The place is not super trendy in terms of the decor, but I thought all of the Yelp claims that it's "dirty" are totally unfounded. I've definitely been to neighborhood nail places that care a lot less! They had brand new pedicure chairs and I checked out the tools too -- there was not a thing I was concerned with. (I should add that I'm a bit of a germophobe and wash my hands at least 15 times a day!)They were really friendly and had a nice big selection of colors to choose from. I grabbed some magazines and got settled in for my pedicure with Sue. She gave me a great pedicure, taking her time and double-checking that nothing hurt and that the water temperature was okay. The best part (that I had NO idea I was in for!) was a full foot and leg massage, first with a scrub and then a SECOND time with a lotion. Sue told me that she also gives full body massages there, so I think I basically lucked out by landing a masseuse who happens to do pedicures too. My poor post-conference feet were in heaven and I will probably take her up on the full-body massage some day soon!So, I can't vouch for anyone else or any other services, but I can confidently recommend a $32 BOMB foot and leg massage that happens to end with nicely polished toes... also known as... a pedicure with Sue.

0.description: I love this place.  We found it close to the IC hotel for my son and daughter-in-law's wedding. Ask for Anne and get a no-chip.  It lasted for four weeks. Decemt prices and a really nice staff.

20.description: I didn't have time to get a pedicure before I left town and the concierge at the Marriott recommended this place. It was on a Thursday afternoon and they took me right away. I have to say this was one of the nicest and most relaxing pedicures I have ever had. My technician was nice too. If I ever come back to Chicago, I will come back.

19.description: This is the third time coming here. I love walking out of my building in sandals to get my feet looking perfect. They do a great spa pedicure but the manicures look amateur- paint on the nail beds? Really?!!I definitely will go back for future pedicures because they are the best, in my opinion, but will try out other places to get my finger nails glam!

33.description: Ok, I have concerns about Nail Perfection because the overall cleanliness is questionable.  In addition, I was a little bit annoyed that they kept asking me if I wanted an eyebrow wax (behind a shower curtain, no less) in addition to my manicure.  The stunning irony is that I had only gotten my eyebrows waxed somewhere else the day before - and they looked perfect, if I do say so myself.  But I'm giving Nail Perfection 4 stars because said manicure took place exactly one week ago today and my nails are still looking mighty fine.  That almost never happens.

2.description: This place is awesome!!! Ladies are so sweet and always do such a beautiful job especially a French mani.

34.description: I love this place for manicures and pedicures!  Though I was hesitant initially, I found that they do a great job on eyebrow waxing, too!  There is rarely a wait for service, and my manis and pedis last a really long time (probably due to the ultraviolet drying station, which I am sure is horrible and carcinogenic to some degree).

32.description: The manis & pedis here really last--they have ample staff on call, so you can walk in at the last minute and be set in a half hour. As mentioned in other reviews of this place, cleanliness is suspect, but I think it's more a question of shabiness. I've been a regular here for a while, and have never had a problem.

18.description: This place is like a quickie....can sometimes be dirty and sloppy, but you know what?! It gets the job done when needed.We walked in spur of the moment on Sunday and they were able to fit us in with no wait, when another *nicer* salon around the corner had no availability without an appointment (even though there was only 3 people in the entire place).As others have mentioned, cleanliness can be questioned.  Prices are right though!  $33 for a spa pedi isn't too bad.  And yes, tips are cash (unless you gripe that you have no cash--then they'll put it on the card) only!Probably wouldn't frequent this place as my usual joint; but, like I said, it works in a pinch.

13.description: Gave this place a try when my usual salon was booked up. The place was small and very full-- when I asked about the wait, they told me it would be 5 minutes for a non-chip mani. A lady stepped away from her current customer, asked me to sit at the bar, and proceeded to give me a bowl full of acetone for me to remove my current polish. (Usually they would wrap your fingers in pieces of foil to make this process go faster and avoid drying out your skin.) I was expected to hold my finger tips in the bowl and wait. Someone checked on me after about 10 min and told me to continue waiting. Needless to say, after 10 more minutes my finger tips were starting to burn, and the old polish was completely soft and starting to come off on its own. I told them I wasn't going to sit for a half hour with my fingers in acetone-- if they didn't have time, they should have told me the wait would be longer. The lady told me she would use foil-- she knew I was mad that they had been lazy about the process. I washed my hands and left. Additionally, the people I talked to were also very difficult to understand. I will not be back.

4.description: The first time I went to this place I got a no chip manicure and bugs kept flying at me and once even on my nail while it was in the UV light machine ( don't know what it's called). I also never had a no chip before and the guy was very rude. I tried to give the place another chance and I had a very rude woman who didn't even cover my entire nail with top coat so my nails looked like they had a matte border.

24.description: I was in Chicago this month from the West Coast for business meetings, and hadn't had time to get a manicure because I was moving the week before (which had also destroyed my nails). I had an hour and a half between the time l checked into my hotel and a business dinner where I planned to wear open-toe shoes (of course my toenails weren't done either). I came running into this place and asked how fast I could get a manicure and basic polish change on my feet. They were amazing!! I was done in 50 minutes, the manicure lasted a week with no chips, and my toes are still in good shape. And besides that, I walked in wearing the boots I'd worn on the plane and without flip-flops (come on, it's Chicago in January, why would I have flip flops?). The lovely woman who did my nails - in all the craziness I forgot her name, but she's the first table on the right when you walk in - gave me a pair of flip flops to wear back to the hotel so the boots wouldn't smear my pedicure. She was so helpful and considerate, and the prices were very reasonable, especially for that location. This is a great resource for women staying in the many hotels in the area and needing a quick polish fix!

6.description: Not sure why this salon doesn't receive more feedback. I was instantly greeted, only waited a total of 30 seconds, and everyone was very polite. I was in town visiting and it was in close proximity to my hotel. The prices were average, and they were efficient and clean. My toes and nails look great.

22.description: I've been here at least half a dozen times for mani-pedi's and polish changes and all times I've been quite pleased with the friendly service, cleanliness of the space and the service I've received.  I'm not sure what they do but, my manicures last without chips for at least 5 days, I don't even have to put another clear coat on top myself a few days later.  After about a week, it starts to wear off, not chip.  I haven't seen a special in awhile and a mani-pedi is $35, mani $15 and polish change $10.  It is very quick and if they are busy, they'll quote you on your wait time and it is usually accurate.  They also have a terrific selection of Essie and OPI colors to choose from.  For me, the lasting polish job and their friendliness stand out above other salons in Chicago and keep bringing me back.

15.description: I walked in and needed a gel manicure and a pedicure pretty fast! They immediately served me, and two women worked on me at the same time. They were very attentive to detail and asked me whether I liked my nails. Their prices were very reasonable too! They wrapped my feet in baggies to be sure my toenails did not smudge and offered for me to come back if they smudged on my way out. Great find!

7.description: DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE! The owners husband and wife Christine and some of the nail technicians will talk crap about you in Vietnamese and insult you while you're getting your nails done. I don't understand why these people open a nail service business and do not appreciate the customers that walk in the door and who pay and tip for the service. They talk crap about every customer the minute they walk in. Don't support this business. I am Vietnamese, live in Streeterville and have come here for many visits. They insult every customer who walks in. I stopped going on my last visit when the owner took it too far to insult my husband in front of me. I will spend my money elsewhere.

36.description: This place is great.  I go every other week to get my nails done.  All of the girls are great for manicures or pedicures.  If you're getting gels or acrylics done, I recommend Jimmy or Flower.  They're the best!  I love this place and am really sad to move out of the neighborhood because I'll have to try to find someone just as good and friendly, and I'm not sure that I can!UPDATE 7/25/07: So I moved out of the neighborhood, but I couldn't stay away!  That should attest to my loyalty to this place.  Great, friendly service, which is o nice after a long day at the office!

30.description: This is my "desperate" place.. When I just can't look at my dang chipped nail any longer... And I am at work and everything by my house is closed.... I mean really to actually go to this place a lot of conditions have to be met. for what you pay your better off going to a nicer place.. With nice technicians. It doesn't feel clean, and I always feel rushed here.

3.description: I've never had a no chip that's lasted this long before. Very friendly staff and plenty of color options. I will definitely be back.

14.description: In town for a wedding and needed a pedi badly. Walked in and was served immediately. Clean place, nice people, and a quality job.

58.description: Forget all other eyeglass places if you are looking for a place within the Gold Coast, River North, Mag Mile, or Loop area.  I've been to all of them since I'm picky and a comparison shopper for high-end items, and no place compares to the doctors, service, or eyeglass selection as this Pearle Vision location.  You can make an appointment over the phone or online and select whichever doctor you wish.  I have gone to several different eye doctors here, and consistently I have found them all to be friendly, helpful, and quick to put you at ease if you have any angst with doctors.  Afterwards, you are free to roam and try on glasses as much as you want.  High end, middle of the road, inexpensive, and glasses of all shapes and color are there, and the pricing (with insurance) is extremely competitive.  Should you like a frame but prefer a different color, you can have them check the catalogues and do a special order without any sort of payment or commitment to purchase them.  Within a week, the sample frames wil come and you can choose then if you like them or not: you are under no obligation to purchase them, in such cases.  If you don't need an eye appointment, just tell the people at the desk when you first walk in that you're needing to browse for new glasses, and they'll let you browse at your leisure.  This is a welcomed difference compared to every other place, including the large Lenscrafters at Michigan Avenue that shadows you like a hawk and locks most of their designer glasses.  Sorry, if I'm going to pay $400 out of pocket for my high-end glasses (excluding the cost of the lens and insurance allowance for frames), i should not be treated like a criminal.  Pearle VIsion is not like that  - they welcome all of their customers and treat them well.  When you do get your finished glasses, the technicians will take their time to properly fit them to your face.  As they adjusted mine to my bridge and temples, I felt like they were giving me a free head massage considering the amount of time they went to painstakingly ensure the glasses fit and looked perfect on me.  Talk about excellent service.  Don't waste your time visiting other stores with sub-par quality glasses and small selection of frames.  Just book an appointment and get here.  You'll be done and have your glasses quicker than Clark Kent can change in a telephone booth.

56.description: I have been a client of Pearle Vision for 4+ years.I really liked my Doctor at the Ashland location, however I work across from this location (400 Division), so I decided to call there when I was in need.I had a piece of fiber from my sweater stuck in my eye for about 4 hours at work. It got so bad, that I couldn't work anymore and I had to do something about it.Now going to the ER would have been a little extreme, so I decided to call the place of business that I have had my eyes poked and proded from for the last 4 years; I trust them and how big of a procedure could it be?I told whomever that answered that I was an existing client, and that I needed someone to help me fish this fiber out of my eye which would just take a rubber glove, some eye drops and 5 seconds.The voice on the other end wanted to charge me $70.Are you kidding me?I spend $40 a month here on contacts, which is high to begin with but because I believe in customer loyalty, I look past it.I felt so slided and treated like a number at this location.I really think I will be ordering from 1-800 contacts, and boycotting this place for good.

44.description: First time going to this location. I was in and out with prescription and full exam in 30 minutes! Seemed pretty efficient to me.

29.description: I had a great and easy / professional experience!!! No need to go the high fashion eye care boutiques any more (which I did) in order to get really good eye care service. Thank you Debbie and Pearl Vision

42.description: This place has a fantastic salesman that takes care of your needs no matter what's going on at the store.  Will gets it done and is courteous and professional.  Can't say too many good things about him and his dedication for quality service.

23.description: I have been going to this location since 2010. Based off my last visit in 2013, I was planning on making this years annual check up my last at Pearle Vision. However, Debbie was so attentive and amazing during the entire process that I can't imagine going anywhere else! Debbie is the best!

47.description: I used to go to the fancy stores, but my prescription was never as good as the one I get here.  There is a decent selection of frames and while they don't pick frames for you, they are very helpful if you see something you like.  I just got new lenses for my frames and a new contact lens prescription - contacts are cheaper online.  It was a great experience as usual.

31.description: i just got my first pair of glasses here! Debbie was great, she really helped me find the best pair of glasses for my face! Dr. Mila is fantastic as well, very nice and thorough. Everyone is very friendly! I will definitely be going back.

34.description: So far I've had excellent service from Joan. She ordered new lenses for my existing frames and made sure the order went through quickly so that I would have them in time for my trip. Picking them up today!

16.description: In all the years of getting glasses, no one has been as helpful as Erwin. And he speaks  amazing Spanish!

8.description: I've been coming to this location for over 5 years and despite numerous billing issues and overlooking the hassle that ensues to sort it out for them each year, I do love the physicians that work here and provide the actual care.  Unfortunately, this past Monday they double booked my appointment time.  This is a normal experience here - I often find that they are running late by over 45 minutes or more.  The front desk told me that it was the dr's discretion to manage their appointment times.  I totally get it - but, if you avoid double booking to begin with, you'd probably have happier clients. In this instance, I arrived at the same time as another patient so it wasn't as if the dr. was just running late.If you have 45 minutes - 1 hour to spare to potentially wait to be seen in addition to your appointment time, then, this place is pretty good.

11.description: I took my visionally impaired boyfriend to the Pearl Vision Old Town Square location on a Sunday afternoon very skeptical after a horrible experience we had at an optometrist's office in Joliet. The employees were very kind and accommodating. They listened to what he wanted and worked patiently with him on applying and removing contact lenses for the first time. The head optician talked to him about football to calm him down after he kept getting frustrated with his failing attempts of application and removal of his new contact lenses. I recommend this business to anyone who needs eye care.

26.description: I was assisted the second I walked in. Very quick and efficient. Saleswoman Debbie went out of her way to make sure I had a trial pair of my contacts (a difficult, astigmatic prescription) and that I was happy with my experience. Beyond that, she took the time to explain the benefits of my particular insurance plan, as well as helped my father with estimating the prices of his future appointment and glasses. I definitely recommend this location.

39.description: Another great experience at Pearl!  Needed my new glasses for the holidays since I accidently sat on my old ones. Fortunately, I was able to get right in and get my exam and glasses quickly. As always my new glasses were perfect and the staff was very friendly. Thank you Dr. Blase for such a great experience!

37.description: Don't waste your time. They lie about the price of lenses to get you in the store. I called and shopped around and these were most reasonable. I get in. And magically the price is $65 more.

0.description: So my insurance company is triflin'. They are a major pain and my people over at Pearle vision cut through their BS and took care of me.  The appt process was super easy online. I came in and got seen within minutes, exam finished and left with a years supply of contacts in hand within half an hour. They even fixed my busted glasses for free!  Woopwoop!

38.description: $59 for an annual eye exam. I was in and out within 15 minutes. There's nothing I hate more than waiting for the doctor for 45 minutes. Very friendly, very efficient, very price worthy.

51.description: I've never had a good experience here.

22.description: I went to the Pearle Vision on Division in the Gold Coast. (Old Town Square)  Everyone was super attentive.  Debbie was especially helpful in picking out the perfect pair of new glasses for me.  I absolutely love them!  And I was told they wouldn't be ready for a week but received a call in less than 24 hours.  I was quite impressed!  Dr. Mila Petkovic is probably the sweetest doctor I have ever met.  She was very knowledgeable and I will definitely go back for my future eye care needs.

32.description: This is my first time posting anything on yelp :) I wanted to write a review about how AWESOME Erika is. She spent a lot of time helping me find the perfect pair of glasses that looked good on me and that was within my price range. She helped me find the best price with my insurance and with any discount they were offering at the time. Erika was really friendly and very helpful! The doctors there are really great too- very thorough, knowledgable, and efficient. Great place to get your eyes checked! I moved from the neighborhood 3 years ago, and I still make it a point to go to this eye doctor. Thanks!

54.description: Came in today to buy a pair of glasses.  I already had a prescription, so I just needed to pick out some frames.  When I walked in a guy at the entrance asked what he could help me with, I told him and he asked for my prescription & insurance card which he took, handed off to another girl, and promptly wandered off without telling me what was going on or who'd be helping me.  Fine... I'll just make myself at home and started trying on some glasses. After a few minutes, the girl asked me for my birthdate.  I told her, then glanced at her computer screen to see what she was up to. She was logging into Facebook.  Hmmm.... Ok... gotta get her fix I guess, I'll try on some more frames.  A few minutes pass, I hear some typing... Oh good! She's entering some information for some reason. Not sure why, I just wanna try on some glasses... but whatever, maybe she's checking my insurance to see how much they'll cover.  Nope. She's not entering my information, she's updating her Facebook.A couple more minutes pass... my prescription & insurance sitting on her desk in front of her as she Facebooked away.  I try on a few more pairs... still Facebook... and I decide to leave.  Told her "Thanks, but I don't see anything that I like. Can I have my prescription and insurance back?""Huh? Oh.. ok.. Don't worry, I'll remove the lock on your account"....Lock on my account? For what? What account, Facebook? I didn't even wanna ask I was so outta there...

48.description: I had the best eye exam experience at Pearl Vision so far.The doctors are very professional and friendly. The staff there are all very nice and  helpful. Also, the price are very reasonable too.

13.description: I'm so excited to pick up my new glasses and I give my thanks to Debbie! She patiently brought me frame after frame until I fell in love with just the right one. It's obvious that she's not just selling eyeglasses but rather making sure that her clients walk away with the absolute most positive experience AND a great pair of frames. She takes the time to listen, she asks the right questions, she's never in a rush and has a great sense of humor to boot! I'd recommend her to anyone needing a new pair of glasses. ALSO a big shout out to Ben, the technician who went above and beyond to make sure my order was ready before Thanksgiving...girl's gotta show off her new frames to her holiday peeps!  And they are ready for pickup today! I can't wait to see them.Thanks Debbie and Ben!

24.description: The location is completely incompetent. After waiting for two weeks for frames I talked to anothwr person who said it wont work for my prescription. The choice of frames is limited and the staff is lacking core training.

7.description: I scheduled an appointment online for the same morning and it went very well. Erwin went above and beyond to confirm my insurance and I really liked Dr. Yaffe! The doctor gave me a thorough eye exam and made sure I had no questions. Erwin worked very hard to find the right frames at the right price for me.  I'm anxious to get my new glasses next week. I will definitely return to this store!

27.description: This Pearle Vision is tucked away in Old Town Square, and was very efficient during my appointment. I haven't been to the eye doctor in years, but at the end of it, I thought to myself, 'that was much faster then I remember the appointments'.Great staff, and great service. A+++

49.description: BEWARE!!!!!!   I went in for an eye exam and got prescriptions for glasses and contacts.  I ordered new lenses for my eyeglasses through them, opting to use my existing frame.  This is because although they have a rack full of frames at "50% off" (based on their advertisement), you can only get the 50% discount if you are not using your vision insurance.  If you want to use your vision insurance towards the frames, you have to pay full price??!!  Then I asked for a price quote for a one-year supply of one-day disposable contacts.  The prices quoted was approx. $480 plus tax.  I told them that I found an online store that offers $259 for the same supply and asked if Pearle Vision would either match or come close to that price.  They said they couldn't do it.  I paid for my doctor's visit and the RX and went home to order the contacts online.  The online RX tried to verify my presciption with Pearle Vision but was told I am not a patient!!!!  Fortunately, I did ask Pearle Vision for a written prescription so I was able to fax it to the online store.This is very a very bad business practice by Pearle Vision.  I feel they basically tried to force me to order the contacts through them.  It's very disappointing for a national chain to do this.

53.description: Pearle Vision on Division for the win. Really enjoyed the service here and they have a huge selection of frames. The prices are higher than I'd like to pay but for the location they are competitive. The staff that worked on the Sunday we were in were terrific on all fronts. Knowledgable and helpful and kind.

30.description: I just went to Pearle Vision on Division for the first time--I had no expectations that it would be different from any other big chain, I chose it because it is super convenient to my new place. Previously I had gone to another large chain store that was corporate owned--staff turnover was very high there and I never saw the same doctor twice. Before that I went to a doctor in a private practice. The Pearle Vision on Division is hands down the best optometrist I've been to since moving to Chicago 10 years ago. I go to the eye doctor annually and have been to at least three others in that time--a mix of high-end private practices and big chains. I started going to big chains because they seem to have the best diagnostic equipment but the trade-off was always the experience level of the doctor and the professionalism of the staff. I was very pleasantly surprised by how personable all of the staff at this Pearle Vision location are--especially Debbie, who clearly explained my lens options and the pricing, and the doctor I saw, Dr. Mila Petkovic.  Dr. Petkovic is easy to talk to and I have a lot of confidence in the advice she gave me regarding my prescription (It is a doozy--7.75!!) As a team, they were thorough and professional, I am a happy customer and I will definitely be back!!!

46.description: Pros: Weekend hours (Saturday and Sunday), convenient location for public transportation and full parking lot, and they take most insurance.  I could get an appointment fairly quickly.Cons: Least thorough eye-exam I have ever had (felt rushed).  They also never gave me my new RX even when I asked for it and just kept saying they'd order my contacts for me so not to worry what it was.I'm trying to keep in mind I went around the holidays and I know no one is exactly thrilled to be working the week of Christmas.  I might try them again in the future to see if I caught them on a bad day.

1.description: I made an appointment online. Got to the confirmation page and everything. So I go to my appointment on a Saturday. I'm running late so I take an Uber. When I arrive I'm told they have no record of any appointment for me. They ask if I'l made online and I said yes. They said they have problems with online appointments. She then brings over another employee and I repeat everything and the two employees keep looking at each other saying someone should talk to the doctor and asking if I got to the confirmation page online. After a few minutes of watching the two receptionists keep saying to each other someone should contact the doctor, I walked out. Waste of an uber, waste of a trip, waste of an afternoon. Thanks for nothing, Pearle Vision.

9.description: I went in for an eye exam this weekend and I had an incrediable experience. I was greeted at the front desk by Debbie and she is the definition of great customer service. You can tell she really cares about every customers that walk through that door. Her and the rest of the team at Pearle Vision are personable and light hearted and I could have stuck around all afternoon chatting with Debbie.

40.description: I have been coming to the Old Town Pearle location for years.  Matt and Will are incredibly professional, knowledgeable, and helpful. They are both a total asset to this location.

25.description: I have had many poor experiences with other companies and locations, but I was quite impressed with the staff at this Pearle Vision in Oldtown. First, everyone I interacted with listened attentively and did not try to up-sell me on anything I did not want, but catered the visit to me based on my expressed needs. Sean G. was friendly, professional, helpful, and went the extra mile to serve me, cleaning my existing glasses when I arrived, and even replacing one of the broken pieces on my old pair, free of charge. Dr. Petkovic was very warm, thorough, and efficient. I felt very confident in her care.Although all the employee interactions I observed were professional, you could tell they enjoyed their jobs and had fun working with each other-- which makes for a warm, inviting atmosphere that is pleasant for any client spending time there.

12.description: I had a fantastic experience at this location.  This was the first eye doctor I've been to since I moved to Chicago.  I was helped by Will, and he was amazingly patient even though they seemed very busy.  He helped me figure out great deals with my insurance and lensing combinations.  Overall a great experience!

59.description: Hip hip horay for eye care!My office recently added VSP as our vision insurance provider and since my previous eye care specialists (For Eyes, thankyouverymuch) actually isn't in the VSP network I did a little hunt for a provider super close to my Noble Square apartment that was cheap and not fancy schmancy.  I don't have any eye "issues."  I just need contacts.So I made an appointment with Dr. Mila Petkovic, who was very professional and thorough.  She even gave me a few new contact lens samples (yay for Acuvue Oaysis for people with astigmatisms) and told me to wear them for a week before ordering a year's supply.Payment was easy.  The staff is friendly.  What more can you need for basic eye care services?  Not much, I'd say.

21.description: I walked in just looking for a certain frame. I have been all over the city. Debbie asked if she could help me. I was pleased she was not pushy and was there to help me search for a good frame that complimented my face. If you want someone who cares, I'd suggest stopping by and ask for Debbie.

17.description: Bought my glasses here about a week ago. Paid for anti-reflective and scratch resistant coatings. It's very obvious that the coatings were not put on my glasses. I have scratches, although the glasses were never dropped or handled without care. They also reflect light.  This is not my first pair of glasses and I know, that if done properly, the lenses should not scratch unless they are mishandled. My last pair lasted 1.5 years without any issues. This one didn't even make it a full week. I will go back to see if they address this problem. Will update!They fixed my glasses within 24 hours after I brought them in.

10.description: I literally ran into Pearl Vision on my way to work with an issue regarding my contacts. DIANA could not have been nicer. She helped me and had me out the door in 5 minutes. Great customer service !!!!

5.description: I went in to Pearle Vision a couple weeks ago for an eye exam and to purchase a new set of frames.Dr. Yaffee and Debbie were great! I was in and out in no time. Thanks for the great customer service!

35.description: I want to start this off by saying this is my first post on YELP. I use YELP all the time and find reviews very helpful. That being said i had to make an account to write a review about this specific pearle vision because i couldn't have asked for a better experience there. Keep reading to find out why i had the most amazing, comforting and helpful experience. This couldn't have been a better place to go and receive help, specifically from Dr. Norman Blase. I was driving home from college and was having trouble closing my eye and my vision was getting blurry in one eye. I freaked out because i was having trouble seeing and going out of town the following day. I called over to Dr. Norman Blase's office and he instructed that i come by immediately to get checked. When i got to his office i was helped immediately. He was extremely professional and comforting at the same time which made me feel relaxed about the whole eye examination. He ended up finding out that my cornea was scratched and gave me 2 eye drops. The following morning i woke up feeling like a new person with ZERO pain in my eye. I would HIGHLY recommend people to Dr. Norman Blase for various reasons. First he was extremely thorough in his examination as well as making sure his hands were clean before touching my eye. Second, he was comforting and made sure during the whole examination that i was okay and also would stop when my eye began to tear up. Third, he genuinely cares for his patients and that's why he instructed that i come in to see him immediately. You would be silly not to go and see him, he is the BEST!!!!

19.description: I went to the Pearle Vision on Division in the Gold Coast.
