(Old Town Square)  Everyone was super attentive.  Debbie was especially helpful in picking out the perfect pair of new glasses for me.  I absolutely love them!  And I was told they wouldn't be ready for a week but received a call in less than 24 hours.  I was quite impressed!  Dr. Mila Petkovic is probably the sweetest doctor I have ever met.  She was very knowledgeable and I will definitely go back for my future eye care needs.

28.description: I purchased an expensive set of glasses in January 2014.  In August, I noticed a small scratch that was enough to cause a blur.  I had not purchased the protection plan but Debbie and staff were able to call the vision provider and get me new set of lens coming next week.  Very happy with the outcome and glad a resolution could be made with minimal hassle.

3.description: I am not one to write reviews often, but I feel that this location deserves one. I arrived with no appointment for an eye exam, and Erwin was able to make it work. He also assisted me in shopping responsibly for glasses and contacts, pulling out all the tricks. He is quite a knowledgeable asset, and if you are headed to this location, make sure to put in a request for him - he is a down to earth person with the interests of the customer in mind. Thanks again Erwin!!

33.description: Great friendly service from all the doctor was warm and she was a pleasure to see. Erwin also gave me great service searching for all money saving possibilities.

43.description: This is my first yelp review which has been prompted by a pretty snotty phone conversation at this location.       8 months ago I went to this location for a contact and eye glasses exam.  It was my first time wearing contacts so I had to make another appointment for them to "teach" me how to put in and remove contacts.  Keep in mind that when I was told I had to make this appointment it had to be at a different date.  Inconvenient, whatever, moving on.  I made my follow up appointment.  Not really sure why I needed an appointment for this it consisted of me pulling my eyelids with one of their techs saying "you were close keep trying". Honestly, I could've just sat in front of a mirror at home and turned on the biggest loser and my experience would've been the exact same.  Anyway I put my contacts in and out and went home.       Today I broke my glasses, and I'mon my last pair of contacts.  I called today and spoke to a male employee who I will not name.  I asked for extra daily contacts he snapped at me and said I need to make an appointment.  I said I was a patient and he said I still needed to make an appointment, since my last appointment was so long ago.  I was just there 8 months ago!  I tend to judge my doctors offices by how they treat me in a crises.  After a pretty stressful work day, I called hoping for a little bit of empathy.  Instead I was constantly interrupted.  How can you help a patient if you won't even let them talk?  Well Pearle vision you can take advantage of someone else.  I won't be doing business with you anymore.

2.description: I love this place! Great customer service and professionalism! You don't feel any kind of pressure, they are not trying to sell you designer frames that you don't need. Dr Yaffe is amazing! This is my go to spot from now on.

45.description: Watch your charges!Even though their on hold recording insures you won't receive un expected charges that is not the case.I returned to this location 12mo after getting my first pair of contacts from them because their customer service was so great, the doctor so nice, and they let you try contacts to make sure you like them, which was great since I was new to contacts.During my second visit I mentioned many times that I was in to use my insurance to buy contacts and get an exam and that I'd pay out of pocket for my new glasses and buy them on the internet. During my check out, I went over this again with they guy, making sure I was using every last dollar my insurance allotted me for this year, double checking that I wasn't missing out on an option for them to buy my glasses. He confirmed that it was a fixed amount and that with my exam and contacts I'd be paying about an additional $25. I sign my credit card receipt and left.Checking my transactions this morning  I see a charge for $177 from Pearl Vision and so I call assuming there has been an error and knowing they'll happily correct it because they are so nice.But after being on hold a lot, I am informed that my insurance only covers contacts or glasses ever 24months and they just went a head and charged my for the contacts without my authorization. Yikes. I'm returning the contacts today. Luckily I didn't open them!

18.description: I walked in just looking for a certain frame. I have been all over the city. Debbie asked if she could help me. I was pleased she was not pushy and was there to help me search for a good frame that complimented my face. If you want someone who cares, I'd suggest stopping by and ask for Debbie.

41.description: Bought my glasses here about a week ago. Paid for anti-reflective and scratch resistant coatings. It's very obvious that the coatings were not put on my glasses. I have scratches, although the glasses were never dropped or handled without care. They also reflect light.  This is not my first pair of glasses and I know, that if done properly, the lenses should not scratch unless they are mishandled. My last pair lasted 1.5 years without any issues. This one didn't even make it a full week. I will go back to see if they address this problem. Will update!They fixed my glasses within 24 hours after I brought them in.

52.description: After going to Pearle Vision in the suburbs for years, I thought the service couldn't get any better.  Now that I live in the city, I go to the Pearle Vision in Old Town and the service is excellent.  Everyone from the people at the front desk, managers, etc are very nice.  Dr. Mila Petkovic is very friendly and very nice and I never show up with an appointment (although I dont think that is a good idea and I may be pushing my luck).  Regardless, they always try to find a way to squeeze me in and give me advice on my insurance plan to maximize my benefits between contacts and glasses.

50.description: I have bought new glasses and had a complete vision work up, including that bizarre glaucoma test where they blow a fast burst of air in your eye, twice here.  Although the location is obvious for those that drive down Division regularly, many people just drive by, although the service has been very good.  The optometrist that I had last was exceptionally personable and made the appointment as painless as possible.  I was surprised by the options for glasses selection as well.  I got a pair of Hackett frames (a British company that is higher-end) and, although my insurance required the order to be sent out, they came back quickly and were exactly as ordered.Don't drive by this Pearle; it could be your new "eye" place.

4.description: I've purchased glasses from Pearle in Old Town for years because of the great service and selection.  This last time though was an amazing experience.  I wanted to special order frames as well as lenses that were not the type normally in stock.  As I was struggling on crutches, Sean, my optician, ordered the frames and lenses in advance so that I could get everything done in one visit.  Sean was even kind enough to order the frames in all available colors so that I would have a selection.  Ben, one of Pearle's lab techs, expedited my order, grinding and fitting my lenses in about 15 minutes.  I was so happy with the service I even bought 2 pairs!  On top of that, Sean applied a great promotional discount to both pairs.  I couldn't be happier with the service.  Sean and Ben went the 'extra mile' for me.  Thank you Pearle!!

6.description: Went to this location for the first time yesterday and had a great experience. Erwin was outstanding! He was very patient and helpful, as I sorted through the different frame and coating options, as well as money saving options. He also replaced the broken nose pads on my current glasses and adjusted them, which is a great help as I ride out my final days with this pair! Dr Vidulich did a thorough medical and optical history, and exam (probably the most thorough one I've ever had). Being able to take care of all of this on a Sunday makes this full time mom/full time IT professional a happy gal. I look forward to getting my new glasses soon!

55.description: I came in today for a routine eye exam and met with Dr. Mila Petkovic. She was very friendly, professional, and honest about my eye situation. She did not try to over sell anything and told me that I would be fine without eye glasses. Dr. Petkovic also gave me tips on a vitamin to take that would strengthen my eye sight and also an eye drop to use due to my long hours in front of a laptop at work. Very helpful.

15.description: August 22 Needed contacts for vacation, woman on phone said contacts in stock.  In the middle of eye exam Dr tells me contacts not in stock.  He noticed I was upset asked if I wish to continue I said no, we stopped. Jan 26 receive call from guy saying I owe $50 for fitting, if I didn't pay it will go to collections. Told him u guys haven't called me 5 months but the first call I receive is u threatening to send me to collections. Guy on phone said he personally called me.  Fine! I go in guy at desk says I owe for fitting. Told him I didn't have a fitting. Manager shows up and says he personally called me. Second person that personally called me? Manager says am i going to order contacts thru them. I said no. We go back and forth, he says we will just wipe everything clean and part ways. Next they are billing my insurance for eye exam. I have no contacts no glasses no prescription for anything. They lied to my insurance and said they gave me a prescription but if I want it I can drive all the way back over there and pick it up.So now I have to dispute thru my insurance the eye exam charges...and cannot use insurance for glasses or contacts till it's resolved.

57.description: I am VERY particular about who tends to my eyecare needs and went here mainly because they took my insurance (Humana Comp Benefits). I am SO glad I did! Dr. Mila Petkovic first saw me. She was very kind and listened to my whole eye 'situation.' She gave me two new trial pairs of contacts that came within a week. They also got me the best deal by having the eye exam through my BCBS HMO and the contacts through my vision insurance. Fastforward to present time--I called today and was able to make an appointment for later this afternoon. I had some weird eye pain/tearing/light sensitivity for a bit and really needed to be seen quickly. The doctor who was there was extremely helpful too! Here's why:-He had the 'insurance guy' run both my vision and medical insurance (figured it would be covered because I had an ulcer-yeah ew). My stupid HMO wouldn't cover it but he still charged me $25 which was LESS than my copay. -He called around to CVS to price the antibiotics for me and had them run my insurance to give me a price ($12 vs the $85 he originally wanted to prescribe, not bad)I have never had any doctor whether it be PCP or whomever be so attentive and jump through all the insurance hoops so I wouldn't have to.  Highly Recommended! Wonderful service!

20.description: I took my visionally impaired boyfriend to the Pearl Vision Old Town Square location on a Sunday afternoon very skeptical after a horrible experience we had at an optometrist's office in Joliet. The employees were very kind and accommodating. They listened to what he wanted and worked patiently with him on applying and removing contact lenses for the first time. The head optician talked to him about football to calm him down after he kept getting frustrated with his failing attempts of application and removal of his new contact lenses. I recommend this business to anyone who needs eye care.

36.description: My husband and I have gotten our glasses here for years and I have always found just what I was looking for at a very fair price.  Dr. Norman Blase gives us very thorough eye exams and his staff was so helpful in pulling glasses for us to try.  We never felt rushed in making our selections and the options seemed endless.  BUT,  what made me write this yelp review was because of a recent eye problem.  I woke up one Saturday morning and my eye was really red and painful.  It felt like there was gravel in my eye.  Of course, I automatically thought it was going to be pink eye and that I would just have the Dr.  call in some drops.  He said it could be so many different things and that he needed to see me.  By the time I arrived at his office, I realized that he could be right.  It didn't itch like Pink Eye, but it still hurt. He dilated my eye and immediately discovered the cause of my problem.  There was an eyelash that was stuck in my tear duct and every time I blinked it would rub on my eye causing the irritation.  He put in some numbing drops and in a flash removed the culprit eyelash!!  It immediately felt better!  Just to be sure, he gave me some drops for pain.  I felt like the lion that had a thorn in its paw!  I am so thankful that he suggested that I come in so that he could have a look at  my eye.  Dr. Blase, you are my hero!!

14.description: $59 for an annual eye exam. I was in and out within 15 minutes. There's nothing I hate more than waiting for the doctor for 45 minutes. Very friendly, very efficient, very price worthy.

3.description: I've heard of this place before but didn't considered them for my "redesign on a serious budget" home project. Internet researching brought me to Cort Furniture where I found EXACTLY what I needed. In fact, I discovered options! YES, options! Whoever heard of options with a serious budget? I am thrilled with my purchase, and even better - I don't have to hear my husbands mouth! SCREAMING "THANK YOU MARK!!!"

1.description: The furniture we picked was certainly nice, but it better be for the price.The delivery and pick up teams were efficient and respectful.But there was no room to negotiate price for people that wanted a flexible schedule (one month was the same price as 3 months - what??!!!).And the pick up time was all messed up: the window was 1-4, but they didn't show up until 5. It made it difficult for me on my last day in Chicago with my kids - we even missed my oldest boy's karate class. There was no compensation for this issue.

2.description: This place is awesome! Wide selection of great looking furniture. Prices are fair - especially comparing against other furniture stores nearby. Mark was very knowledgeable and even helped us get our purchase into our apartment a few blocks away. Highly recommend.

5.description: This is the best place to go!!!!! I had a nightmare of an experience and Cort really went above and beyond to help fix everything for me. WAY TO GO MARK! I had ordered a table upwards of $2000 from a different furniture company and then was told it was lost in the mail (how that happens I have no idea) I was in tears. I had a big party planned and caterers ready to arrive in a matter of days and no table for my dining room. I drove to Cort to see if there was anything they could do. Mark not only found me a table, but worked it out where I was able to buy a table that would normally only be for rent. They had it in my home and ready just hours before caterers and decorators arrived for my husbands birthday. I AM SO GRATEFUL TO CORT FOR THIS EXPERIENCE!!!!!

6.description: Awesome place to shop for furniture with great prices.  I found some great pieces to complete  my condo.

0.description: My fiance and I were looking for furniture at very specific price points. Mark and his colleague took amazing care of us. He really hooked it up. We left with more than we came for and spent less $$ than expected. I kept suggesting cheaper looking couches if he couldnt hit my price point with my first choice and he wouldnt allow it. We left with my 1st choice coffee table, couch, nesting tables and 2 floor lamps all for the prices I wanted to pay!! He even threw in a couple night stands for my previous roommate so she wouldn't have to go hunt around the city on Craigslist for nightstands that she'd struggle to find transportation that they'd fit in...etc. There were many cheaper night stands that he could've offered her to throw in yet he STILL offered us the nicer night stands. She feels so special and we were treated like royalty. From greeting the 3 of us with waters and cokes to the amazing deal... I couldn't be happier and I wish I would've gotten more! Mark and everyone at cort was amazing. They are delivering and accommodating all of our furniture needs straight to our place. Go to cort clearance center for the best prices and service around everyone! ! Go go go!!

4.description: I rented from Cort for many years. I found that their furniture was very poorQuality and actually quite outdated and disappointing. They are notWilling to,negotiate  and will not even agree to,take their furniture back unlessYou spend thousands of dollars. do,yourself a favor and do,not rent from them. Lousy customer service. You are better  off buying used furniture fromSalvation Army!

29.description: Go talk to Bridgit. She's the absolute best! I came into SEE last Friday afternoon by myself to look at the frames since I had purchased the Groupon. Keep in mind that I was wearing my glasses when I stopped in. I asked the girl that was working if she had any recommendations for me. She asked if I wanted a frame like the one I already had and I said no. Then she proceeded to tell me that it was basically up to me to find one that I liked and that I should try a bunch on to see what I liked. She didn't pull any frames or even stick around to see what the frames would look like on me. I have pretty bad eyesight and it didn't make much sense for me to try on frames on my own since I can't really see what I look like with them on. I found a frame that looked good sitting on the shelf and then told the girl to write down the info off of it so that I could come back to try it on with my contacts on. She didn't seem to understand how that made sense and didn't even bother to give her own opinion. I definitely regretted purchasing the Groupon. The next day, I convinced one of my friends to go with me to SEE so that I would have a second opinion. I also made sure to wear my contacts. Fortunately, the girl from the day before wasn't there. Instead, Bridgit asked if she could help us. She immediately began pulling frames for me to try on and gave her opinion on what she thought looked good. Once the three of us had narrowed it down to two pairs, she even asked some other customers to give their opinion. It was soooo helpful! She was really friendly and made me feel comfortable in giving my real opinion. I purchased the frames and am now just waiting to pick them up. I will update my review when I do pick them up. After I purchased my glasses, my friend wanted to look at some sunglasses, so we started to do that. Bridgit opened the case to the more expensive sunglasses and left us to look at them. At that point, that was way more helpful than her only taking out one frame at a time since my friend didn't have any intention to buy but was just looking. Turns out that we found the perfect pair of sunglasses and Bridgit agreed without being pushy. My friend purchased her sunglasses and is super happy with them. Overall, absolutely do not go to SEE unless Bridgit is the one that is helping you! She makes the experience fun and she is appropriately helpful.

42.description: I am so happy that I came across See! I love the two tone purple frames that I got here. They have a great selection of frames. I am more so into the plastic frames and they have a large selection of them here. They also have metal and rimless. Even though I have vision insurance (which seemed to only be accepted at expensive boutique places), I feel like it ended up being a little bit cheaper to get my frames here. I like how the prices on the frames include your basic lenses. The sales staff was very helpful. The only problem I had was when I picked up my frames, the case they gave me was too small for my glasses (which I figured out after I left, of course). I was able to go back the next day though and get a larger case, no problem. Thanks, See! I'll be back.

23.description: I made an appointment at SEE Eyewear for an eye exam for contact lenses.  At the beginning of the exam the Dr. mentioned that I had eye infections in both eyes and would not be able to wear contacts.  She then said that she wouldn't allow me walk out of the exam with the pair of contacts that I wore into the exam.  After some prodding she did let me leave with my contacts however she refused to give me an eye exam because of the infections.  I showed no visible signs of eye infection and no irritation at all.  I went for a second opinion at a proper doctor's office where I was given an eye exam and prescriptions for contact lenses without an issue.  I mentioned the initial Dr's findings to the second Dr and he said there is nothing that leads him to believe that I had any type of eye infection.  He mentioned however that allergies can sometimes be confused for an eye infection, I do have allergies.At SEE I feel like I was given an inexperienced doctor that misdiagnosed me and I was charged $40 for this misdiagnosis.  I'm not sure what the issue was, as I said there were no signs at all of eye infection.  I am writing this one month after my initial exam and still no signs at all of any issues or irritation with my eyes.  SEE might have a great selection of eyewear however if you are going to have an eye exam I recommend you go to a more professional establishment with more experienced doctors.

47.description: The staff here is super friendly and totally nice. A++I've come in here several times and have gotten top notch treatment from the staff. I've gotten two pairs of glasses from this location and each time they were super. They really go above and beyond. Sure they are a bit pricey (don't have insurance) but I wanted something different. I went to tons of speciality stores and regular ol' Lens Crafters and nothing compares to the selection of frames I found at SEE. I get compliments on my glasses at least once a week from total strangers.

8.description: I just picked up my glasses today and I LOVE them!  My old glasses were in a word, busted.  So busted that someone bought me a groupon to See as a gift.  I was a little  worried because the website highlights very trendy  fancy pants glasses, and I'm typically pretty boring, especially when it comes to things that I will have to wear on my face every day.  When I visited the store, I was pleasantly surprised.  They had a great selection of glasses and I found the perfect pair.  I did not have my eyes examined there, but the other staff members that I met were very knowledgeable.  I always thought that I couldn't wear plastic frames because of the shape of my face, but they worked some sort of magic and made them fit.  Best groupon ever.

31.description: SEE is hands down the best place to get glasses. The service is great, I was lucky enough to have Leo help me find a pair I really liked--he worked with me for a while, as it takes me forever to finally choose a pair, and he was never impatient with me and always wanted to help. He was so fabulous, and went above and beyond to make sure I got the frame I really liked. This is my fourth pair of SEE glasses and I couldn't be happier with them!

34.description: I was out of my contact lenses and happened to walk in to the Watertower location. Scheduled my exam for a Saturday, got in, got out, even had my prescription in hand without even asking for it. I love the eclectic choice of frames available and will probably add one of their sunglass frames to my wardrobe. Service was great and when one of the sales people realized I lived closer to the Lincoln Park location he asked if I'd like my frames sent there for pick up. Great forethought!

16.description: I had an  awesome experience at See late night with Bridgit ,there was one customer she was waiting on and it was at the end of the day and the store was closing .when the customer left Bridgit told me set down were going to straight this out ,I had ordered a pair of glasses and I was coming in to see if they were ready. , but when I tried them on again I didn't like them ,I had looked around and found another pair that I like better and look better on me and Bridgit agreed .she was just awesome I stay about an hour after closing trying on glasses and in doing so I found another pair  her customer service was the best and thank you again for staying late with me .Paula  See's eyewear at the Water tower 2nd floor please look for Bridgit tell them I told you so ,!!!!!!

13.description: I forgot to update this review awhile back... anyway, after my original yelp review, I received a call from the store manager.  He apologized a great deal and gave me a free box of contacts for each eye - can't complain there!  So I'm bumping them up to three stars for making amends.I will likely be back for glasses in the future, as their prices and frame selection are great and I never had any problems getting glasses from them.

11.description: I've been going to see eyewear now for a year and the customer service is fabulous. I am always in and out when I need to and the employees are so friendly and helpful.

39.description: The only reason I gave SEE four stars is because of the optometrist, I felt that the price of the exam was way too much, even with the "insurance discount." So I'd recommend going to a clinic to get your eyes checked. But, the optometrist DOES NOT get commission from the store, so I'm not going to go into detail about that.The store is wonderful though, I love going in here and trying glasses on. However it can be expensive depending on what you go with, if you find the right pair, you will be very happy. I've received nothing but compliments on my glasses and I'm very happy with my choice and service. The store is clean, organized, and the staff is friendly and patient.

37.description: I have been hunting down a particular pair of Ray Bans for awhile now.  And... was ecstatic to find them today at See.  This location is a bit larger than the other two in Chicago and doesn't solely carry the proprietary frames.  (Enter Water Tower on Michicgan, take the escalator up, look at cool water fountain as you pass, walk back and hang a right at the top)The sales guy was nice and efficient.  He cleaned my frames, put them in a case, and had me outta there in no time... where I proceeded to stroll Michigan Ave on a bright, sunny, winter day.

0.description: Awesome selection of frames from classics to bolder statement frames. I've been going here and bringing in friends for years. Everyone always finds something they love, and with SEE's evolving selection, there's always something new and fresh to check out.And the customer service here is excellent. Mike, Heidi, Brian, Sarah... everyone I've met here has been super friendly and helpful from advising on styles to adjusting my glasses for a better fit.

38.description: I've needed to buy glasses for the past 5 years and I just couldn't do it. I don't know what's wrong with me but it felt too permanent for me. Like wallpaper or a tattooed wedding ring. I just can't do it. I know I sound dramatic but it's the way I am; I've never had to buy glasses growing up so i have this idea in my head that once you buy a pair boom that's it. Doesn't match your outfit? Too bad you are going to have to look like an idiot. Well, finally after straining my eyes for half a decade I started to get headaches and my one eye was starting to look lazy. I freaked out, went to the doc and again, he said "buy glasses". I marched myself to SEE EYEWEAR went right up to the first employee I saw and said "I need glasses asap" and "I don't want them to cover my favorite feature... my eyes" HA! Before you claim me as vain let me give you a back story: every girl has her favorite feature.  End of story.Okay, so with those two statements in mind John (See employee) wondered around the store grabbing the best glasses he could find. I tried on about 12 and found a pair that I love. They are chic, clean, inexpensive and they don't hide my money makers (my eyes, duh!) Since I am in a long distance relationship with almost everyone in my life: my family, my boyfriend, my bosses -- I needed some quick opinions from those who matter most. I took some Twitter photos of a few pairs and had my friends vote on the pair. & within 5 mins they choose the glasses I originally choose for myself as well. Yippie for technology! All in all, great experience, price and look. Now all I need to do is grow some balls and wear them while I walk across the street from the elementary school in my hood. Yes, I'm terrified of being called a four-eye. Ha! xoxoh here is the twitter experiment: sporkproject.com/2010/01…

27.description: Here is my See Eyewear experience. One week ago, I was so frustrated that I didn't get the sunglasses I expect. 1) Eye reflection on the glasses; 2) too dark; 3) there are spots that made me very dizzy.  After I talked with the customer service, he asked me to pay $75 more to fix the lenses.  I was so upset and wrote a very negative review at yelp. This weekend, I got the chance to talk with the store manager, his attitude was totally different from the customer service that I talked earlier. He was very nice and also promised that he will try his best to take care of my problem. Hopefully I will get my sunglasses asap. Thanks a lot.

32.description: see has a nice selection of modern and modern vintage frames. this location seemed to have more than the others. not sure if that's true or if it's just laid out better, but this one is the one to visit. bridgit deserves accaulades as a salesperson-- she is seriously good at selecting flattering frames and is patient beyond belief.

48.description: I'd say I get at least one compliment from complete strangers each week on the frames I got at SEE.  Random bus passengers, people in line at the dry cleaners... I have gotten more compliments on these frames in a year than all my previous glasses in my lifetime!

44.description: I am forever hooked! I read great reviews on how friendly the folks were at the Lincoln Park store, and the folks at Water Tower are just as so! Though all of the employees are very accomdating,I mostly dealt with manager Mike, Jeff,and Matt. They were great  and very kind toward me, esp when I couldn't pay for my lenses all at once on account of a layoff. I finally got my cool, new frames and I'm getting alot of compliments!I had my eye exam somewhere else but the fun,attractive layout of the store and the wonderful selection of modern, trendy, one-of-a-kind frames lead me into their establishment. customer service is top notch and no wonder; manager Mike is so nice!I'm definitely coming back for prescription sun glasses this summer!

24.description: I forgot to update this review awhile back... anyway, after my original yelp review, I received a call from the store manager.  He apologized a great deal and gave me a free box of contacts for each eye - can't complain there!  So I'm bumping them up to three stars for making amends.I will likely be back for glasses in the future, as their prices and frame selection are great and I never had any problems getting glasses from them.

7.description: I first went to sunglass hut where I bought my sunglasses to fix the pin keeping the lens to the temples - pretty generic but sunglass guy said I would have to find and call the Gucci manufacturer to fix and when I get the piece, then maybe they can fix it. Wow. Without looking I stumbled upon See asking without expectation if they could help. NOT ONLY did they fix my sunglasses on the spot, they did it for free with a polish and a notice that they will always provide free repair even when the glasses aren't theirs. I'm never going back to sunglass guy again- See, you've got me coming back for more!

49.description: Awesome eyewear store!  I just purchased contacts and a pair of glasses (wasn't planning on the glasses - but they were so cute and SO affordable, I couldn't resist!!) from See.  Great service and a lot of really fun and trendy frames.  And it was great that the sales people gave real opinions on how the frames looked and spent time finding just the perfect pair - Jeff and Mike were wonderful, as was the Doctor who also helped and was super friendly!  They used my insurance to the fullest benefit and I'm so happy!  So easy, nice location and great staff.  Highly recommended! I have a strong prescription and have tried numerous times to get contacts fitted correctly at other eyewear stores and it was so easy at See!

40.description: I initially went to SEE last year for new glasses and had an OUTSTANDING experience! Everyone was so friendly and accommodating and they know their collection really well so they are able to make the most of your time. They also were very good at suggesting different options and were incredibly patient. I felt like the only person there yet they managed to attend to everyone around me as well.I had a problem with a lens and it was handled courteously, promptly and with no hassle. I also had some damage to a frame and went back today and that too was handled without a problem!I HIGHLY recommend them for any of your eyewear needs. They've made vision frames into great sunglasses for me, suggested stylish frames and always treated me like a valued customer. I will always remain loyal to them. They GET customer service and professionalism without being uptight or stuffy. They're highly knowledgeable about and believe in their products (the SEE frames, unique to SEE, are also really affordable and durable).Thanks for being my GO-TO place for eyewear and eye-care!

30.description: When looking for new frames, I had popped into SEE a number of times.  They always seem to have a good selection of reasonably priced, stylish frames as well as friendly and helpful employees.  And even better, they have an awesome wall of clearance-priced frames. Knowing I wanted new frames, my husband happened into the store, found some awesome frames, called me, and within thirty minutes, I was there being measured for the frames.  They contacted my eye doctor's office to have a release of information authorization faxed over, had me sign it, and had my prescription faxed over.  Easy as pie.. Two days later, they called me to let me know my new glasses were ready to be picked up.  Good selection, good prices and good customer service.. kinda makes me want to have more than two pairs of glasses.

46.description: I value precision (hello, Virgo!), and especially in eyewear. Picked up my new eyeglasses here yesterday - hello, progressive lenses, gah! - and wow. Sharp. Perfect. Crisp vision again - the revelation I had back in 4th grade with my first glasses and could see the blackboard again. And *sigh* I can read again with out contorting my eye over my frame and holding the book two inches from my face. Getting older is inevitable, but there is no reason to give up on style, baby. This is the place to get those frames, 'cos everyone needs glasses eventually.AND the prescription in my sunglasses is not *quite* precise enough for me, so they told me to give it a couple days, and if it's not right, they'll fix it for me - good answer, guys! Excellent customer service.

1.description: Good selection of frames. Both, in-house, hand made as well as some designer frames like Chanel or Oliver Peoples. The design of their house brand is state of the art. Overall the prices are moderate, however if you pick the high end glasses the package gets expensive. The staff is very nice, not too pushy and not too "I don't care". They leave you the space you need to decide. I like that a lot.Their optometrist is young and/but he does an awesome good job. I love my glasses, the frames are from their "main" collection (around $170 without glasses). They came with a loose temple hence we did send them back. That can happen and absolutely not issue getting a new pair.My experience was very positive and I would shop there again.Thanks.

9.description: I value precision (hello, Virgo!), and especially in eyewear. Picked up my new eyeglasses here yesterday - hello, progressive lenses, gah! - and wow. Sharp. Perfect. Crisp vision again - the revelation I had back in 4th grade with my first glasses and could see the blackboard again. And *sigh* I can read again with out contorting my eye over my frame and holding the book two inches from my face. Getting older is inevitable, but there is no reason to give up on style, baby. This is the place to get those frames, 'cos everyone needs glasses eventually.AND the prescription in my sunglasses is not *quite* precise enough for me, so they told me to give it a couple days, and if it's not right, they'll fix it for me - good answer, guys! Excellent customer service.

26.description: I can't say enough good things about this SEE Eyewear location.  The customer service has been excellent and the staff (Mike in particular) has been very patient and helpful as I have been indecisive about my eyeglass purchases.  They have been flexible with me to make sure I am happy with my final pairs of glasses.In addition, they have a fabulous selection to choose from.  Their own brand (SEE) is great.  Very cool and trendy, but with classic frames as well.  The prices are great.  They also feature some of the higher end brand names as well, so it's a great selection.I highly reccomend this location!

25.description: I have been wearing glasses all my life, so I would like to think I know a few things about them. I like SEE for two main reasons: 1) a good selection of modern frames and 2) cost. They do a good job of seeming like a cute boutique you might find in Wicker Park, but with all the competitive pricing that comes with being a chain. That also means they have good arrangements with insurance companies, making their glasses both hip AND affordable.

12.description: See does it right. The staff at see is top notch. From the sales people to the optomitrist See can't be beat. I went to the Michigan Ave location for the first time and couldn't be happier with my experiance. The frame selection here is great. They have lots of interesting styles you will not find at other stores.The staff here is also extremly helpful. I must have spent at least a hour in the store checking out frames and they were very helpful when I needed a second opnion. When I finally picked out my frames they were nice enough to ship them to my house so i didn't have to make another trip into the city to pick them up. Unfortantally mine were shipped with a broken screw. This is were the customer service at See really stand out. They shipped me a empty box and I returned the defective pair and they shipped me a new pair. I couldn't be happier with the service I recieved at SEE.

21.description: See does it right. The staff at see is top notch. From the sales people to the optomitrist See can't be beat. I went to the Michigan Ave location for the first time and couldn't be happier with my experiance. The frame selection here is great. They have lots of interesting styles you will not find at other stores.The staff here is also extremly helpful. I must have spent at least a hour in the store checking out frames and they were very helpful when I needed a second opnion. When I finally picked out my frames they were nice enough to ship them to my house so i didn't have to make another trip into the city to pick them up. Unfortantally mine were shipped with a broken screw. This is were the customer service at See really stand out. They shipped me a empty box and I returned the defective pair and they shipped me a new pair. I couldn't be happier with the service I recieved at SEE.

17.description: I love this place. If I had more money, I would have 10 pairs of their glasses!I went in with my groupon, and even though that can sometimes come with medicore service...not here!! From the first phone call to the visit to pick up my glasses, everything and everyone was great.I worked with Leo, whose honest (but NOT mean) opinion helped me find frames that didn't make me look weird...and that is invaluable. He was also helpful and patient with me throughout the whole process, as I had a lot of questions, and wanted to try on a lot of frames. The staff in general seem to be helpful people that are able to maintain their sense of humor and personality throughout the process. Don't undervalue this!!SEE is a little expensive, however. But I think it's worth it. They're also transparant about their pricing, so it shouldn't come as a surprise. Also...this location is in the Water Tower. What do you expect??

10.description: I was in the store and looking for a particular type of glasses.  They promised me they could order them and ship them to me.  I knew that these frames were next to impossible to find so I called three times to make sure they were what I was looking for.  After several promises, I agreed to purchase and have them shipped to me.  Of course, they were the wrong frames when delivered.  While Mike did agree to accept my return, which is against their policy, I was the one who ended up apologizing when he lied to me over the phone about the frames.  Additionally, I had to pay shipping both ways for their mistake. I would not recommend purchasing from this store.

5.description: Posted a negitave review & received a call from corporate.  I then got a new pair of lenses immediately & they did not have to send my glasses in for analysis, they just sent my new lenses for my former frames and they even made them with my new prescription free of charge.  Thanks!

3.description: This place was recommended to me by a friend and I am thrilled that she did! Not only was I able to make an appt the same day, I picked out my new frames from an extensive amount of great options. Heidi walked me through it every step of the way! I am wearing my new glasses and love them tremendously! The service alone was worth five stars. Way to get it right See.

35.description: I am updating this review, and replacing my previous rating with 5 stars, all thanks to the store manager, Mike. After reading my first review, Mike got in touch with me and apologized for my initial experience. He also had me come into the store again and he personally helped me with everything that I needed. He was quick in responding to me and helped me with my problem quickly. Mike is a truly kind and helpful individual, and the company is very lucky to have someone who really cares about their store and products. My faith in SEE has been restored and I will most certainly be returning to them for all me eyewear needs! :)

19.description: I have been hunting down a particular pair of Ray Bans for awhile now.  And... was ecstatic to find them today at See.  This location is a bit larger than the other two in Chicago and doesn't solely carry the proprietary frames.  (Enter Water Tower on Michicgan, take the escalator up, look at cool water fountain as you pass, walk back and hang a right at the top)The sales guy was nice and efficient.  He cleaned my frames, put them in a case, and had me outta there in no time... where I proceeded to stroll Michigan Ave on a bright, sunny, winter day.

28.description: I love this place. If I had more money, I would have 10 pairs of their glasses!I went in with my groupon, and even though that can sometimes come with medicore service...not here!! From the first phone call to the visit to pick up my glasses, everything and everyone was great.I worked with Leo, whose honest (but NOT mean) opinion helped me find frames that didn't make me look weird...and that is invaluable. He was also helpful and patient with me throughout the whole process, as I had a lot of questions, and wanted to try on a lot of frames. The staff in general seem to be helpful people that are able to maintain their sense of humor and personality throughout the process. Don't undervalue this!!SEE is a little expensive, however. But I think it's worth it. They're also transparant about their pricing, so it shouldn't come as a surprise. Also...this location is in the Water Tower. What do you expect??

45.description: Got my uber cute frames from here. Had great customer service. The employees are all so fun and very nice. I'm actually going back this month to get new frames. I've had my current pair from See for a little more than a year now and I still get tons of compliments. :)I, too, received a loely handwritten note and also two pairs of trial contacts so I could see which type I loved more. Plus, a follow-up visit to see how I was doing. That's excellent customer service.If you're looking for some really unique glasses, this is the place to go. And don't just check the website, go into the store, the selection is waay better!

33.description: Wandered in while killing time before a meeting. I happen to not mind wearing glasses as the thought of wearing contacts puts me off. I do want cool specs, however, tho I am sorta nerdy and attracted to tortoiseshell. I was addicted to the instant gratification of lens crafters but bored with the frames. Holy cow! See has hip, cool, nerdy and limited edition styles so you won't see yourself coming and going. Yeah, had to wait a week but so happy that I went back for sunglasses a month later. I personally had great, attentive service, get offers on my email and a gift for my birthday. What's not to like?

43.description: Update: I got my glasses earlier than expected and they look great!  No problems with pickup and everyone was ever so helpful.  I'll definitely be checking them out for sunglasses.

2.description: I have been coming here for at least 5 years and I love them. They always help me find a cool pair of glasses that fits my style. They have some of the coolest glasses I have ever seen. They are not pushy and always glad and enthusiastic about helping you find the perfect pair. I will always get my glasses and contacts from them. I love this place and plan on getting sunglass from them soon.

18.description: When looking for new frames, I had popped into SEE a number of times.  They always seem to have a good selection of reasonably priced, stylish frames as well as friendly and helpful employees.  And even better, they have an awesome wall of clearance-priced frames. Knowing I wanted new frames, my husband happened into the store, found some awesome frames, called me, and within thirty minutes, I was there being measured for the frames.  They contacted my eye doctor's office to have a release of information authorization faxed over, had me sign it, and had my prescription faxed over.  Easy as pie.. Two days later, they called me to let me know my new glasses were ready to be picked up.  Good selection, good prices and good customer service.. kinda makes me want to have more than two pairs of glasses.

41.description: I had the best experience at this SEE location recently.  While I've always been a Lens Crafters girl, I decided to try something new when I lost my glasses on Halloween (whoops - I do not recommend doing that!).  I was with my mother because as everyone knows, nobody should go glasses shopping alone and I knew she'd give it to me straight.  The staff was awesome, offering us mimosas, chocolates AND popcorn when we came in (I know, right?!).  Also, always a good idea to get the mom a little liquored up when shopping.  I really liked that they had a selection of both designer frames and their own styles, which were perfectly on-trend.  The styles spanned from conservative to funky to those hipster Buddy Holly-esque glasses I keep trying to make work for me but really never will.  In other words, there's definitely something for everyone.  The customer service was perfect for me - helpful and informative, but not over bearing and breath-down-your-neckish.  Phew!  There's nothing like feeling pressured when you're buying something that will be on your face everyday.  Prices are about in-line with what you'd pay at independent shops around Chicago - a bit higher than a national chain but it reflects the selection and quality.I ended up purchasing TWO pairs of snazzy glasses since they had an amazing deal going on and they were both ready within a few biz days.  I don't intend on losing either pair *knock on wood* but if I do, I'll be heading back to SEE!

50.description: Zero stars!This is the bitchiest optical place I've ever walked in.  I was shopping at Water Tower Thursday night in search of a weekend bag and thought, hey!  Why don't I stop in the optical spot to see if they carry my both beloved and coveted Bellinger frames?  I walk in and I don't get so much as a hello from the attendant.  Sure she was chatting with another person but I looked around for a good 7 minutes and not once did I get a "I'll be with you in a moment" or "Hi, was there something you had in mind?"  I promptly walked out.  I could have potentially spent $500 there, and now they have guaranteed that I will not, nor will other people who read this review (rally behind me, troops)Motherb****es!

4.description: My prescription changed (hooray), so on my way home I decided to pop into SEE, since I got an email earlier about their new Core Collection, and see what's what. My previous trip wasn't so fruitful as their previous collection all ran small for some reason (no, I don't have a big head). I'm glad I decided to give them another try. I was immediately greeted and checked out their new frames. So many to chose from and my salesperson was beyond patient with me. I finally found a pair that I liked and looked good. The frames run at around $150 and my lenses were a bit more because I need progressives (I paid approximately $330 with insurance). I got them in the two week time frame promised. Best of all, they got my prescription right without a crappy computerized program, which can be difficult for progressives. The experience was a total win. Next time I need new glasses, SEE will be my first stop.

6.description: The customer service is nice and had it not been for that I would have given this place 1 star.  See got my prescription WRONG! How is this possible, is this not what they do?? Extremely annoyed that I had to come back to have them fix the presecription for free. Its great that they have prescription fix for free but UNACCEPTABLE that they got it wrong in the first place.Never again will I come here.

22.description: I just picked up my glasses today and I LOVE them!  My old glasses were in a word, busted.  So busted that someone bought me a groupon to See as a gift.  I was a little  worried because the website highlights very trendy  fancy pants glasses, and I'm typically pretty boring, especially when it comes to things that I will have to wear on my face every day.  When I visited the store, I was pleasantly surprised.  They had a great selection of glasses and I found the perfect pair.  I did not have my eyes examined there, but the other staff members that I met were very knowledgeable.  I always thought that I couldn't wear plastic frames because of the shape of my face, but they worked some sort of magic and made them fit.  Best groupon ever.

15.description: Excellent service, great atmosphere, nice selection, clean store. Adam was awesome!!

20.description: Went to this location after a hiatus of several years from SEE to get my annual checkup for contacts and glasses. The Dr. I saw was super fast and seemed very knowledgable. She continuously made sure to use alcohol wipes and disinfect all surfaces which made me feel at ease since I figure this is more of a high traffic store being in the Water Tower. After my exam, Leo my friendly optician gave me several choices to examine for glasses. Since I had several pairs at home I knew exactly what style I wanted but also sought his opinion on what new styles I might want to incorporate for this new pair. After searching through the entire line/store, I was able to decide on a pair with help and encouragement from Leo. When it came time to review the pricing, he was extremely efficient and explained each section thoroughly. I felt I had a good understanding of what I was paying for and also had a wonderful experience selecting my frames and even reviewing insurance coverage (if you can believe it). I highly recommend anyone who wants honest and friendly service to go see Leo!! I give him 5 stars (manager: *bonus*) haha But in all seriousness,  this was perhaps the most pleasant experience I've had selecting glasses and not feeling as if I've just paid an arm and a leg for them. THANK YOU!! I will be back! :)

36.description: I walked in and right back out.Happened to hear a girl asking for her contact RX back so she could buy somewhere else after they had canceled her appointment 3 times.  They refused.  They also would not give her the contacts which were in the store, because "their optometrist had to check her eyes with the contacts in, store policy."as I was walking around looking at frames and admittedly eavesdropping, i spotted the optometrist in the back of the store eating.i realize this may have been her lunch hour, but it was 5pm- soooo probably not.i will never waste my time here.

14.description: I had been squinting for years and I decided to finally get some glasses. The folks at See were incredibly helpful and attentive, and their selection is well curated and well priced. There are zero ugly frames here -- they have great taste! Everyone weighed in -- including the manager -- to help me pick the very best pair, and they really helped me stay within my budget. Note: they are not in the VSP network but they have a standard discount for VSP members.

3.description: I recently got a coupon and the deal was too good to pass up. I have never whitened my teeth in any capacity, as they are naturally pretty white, so I was hoping for some great results. The place itself is very clean and nicely set up and both the front desk girl and the woman who did my whitening were extremely friendly. The best part, my teeth did come out MUCH whiter (she said 2 shades) so I was happy! The only reason I am leaving off a star is because the first 5-10 of the procedure hurt very badly. Felt like needles going into my gums. She asked if I was comfortable and said tingling was good, burning was not. It felt like a little of both so I said I was fine (I didn't want to be a giant baby!). When she removed the mouth piece my lower and some of my back gums had turned white. She said this happens sometimes and they would go back to normal in a couple of days. The whiteness is gone but my gums are a little scabbed up and open sore looking. I've been using lots of mouthwash to make sure they don't get infected and they seem to be healing quickly. I looked online and this happens sometimes when the peroxide gets on your gums. Apparently its not supposed to happen but it's not that big of a deal when it does. I think it's partly my fault for not telling her I could feel some burning/tingling on my gums. I'm just glad it is my lower gums and back teeth so you can't see it when i smile! Overall I will be back in a few months for another treatment as it works great. Just hope no gum burning happens next time!PS...one tip....you can't read or look at your phone really so bring head phones to help the time pass!

1.description: This review applies to their body wraps (yes, i got two body wraps) - I got some YouSwoop coupon and decided to give it a try. The woman was really nice and welcoming. The wrap, on the other hand, is not anything special. You just lay under some heated blanket in some "suit" and you sweat your ass off. I couldn't do the full 60 minutes the first time. And honestly I am not sure whether it really works. I mean yes I lost 0.5lbs, but that's all water weight, and that doesn't mean I burned 3000 calories due to the wrap. I've done some other body wraps in Seattle before my wedding, and they actually apply some cream on you, wrap you first, then put you under heated blanket. I think that's a better and more convincing way to say I've lost calories. The good thing is, if you purchased coupons, you automatically lock in some price. So for the Youswoop, it's $29, and going forward for the next year, even without the coupon, I am still locked in on that $29 per wrap. Not too bad.

2.description: I purchased a Groupon for the body wrap however they did NOT wrap me.  All she did was put me in a sauna suit and under a heated blanket!  That by definition is NOT a body wrap!  I've gotten body wraps before where they measure you, exfoliate the skin, apply a cream WRAP YOU in bandages THEN in a heat capsule and once you're out they measure again and see the amount of inches that were lost!  This place is a rip off - don't waste your money!

5.description: Went in for teeth cleaning and noticed them being a good 5 shades lighter.  Definitely worth the price.  It was quick, I only did a 30min session however It still gave me great results. Would recommend to anyone in need of a quick service with great results.

6.description: I purchased a Youswoop for a 30 minute whitening session. I was very nervous before hand because I've never had this done before and Lasers pointing at my teeth sounds scary. But the technician was very nice so I felt comfortable after meeting and talking with her. I was worried also because Crest strips hurt my gums but she assured me it would be nothing like that (She was right). She got me set up and gave me some magazines and the session began. Just about the time I was getting bored and uncomfortable from being in the same position the session was over. My teeth were noticeably whiter and I was happy with the results. I got a card locking me in for my youswoop price so they will be seeing me again.

7.description: I decided to go here since there was a gilt city sale for only $99.  The Girl at the receptionist desk was extremely friendly and told me to have a seat while I the she got the lady who would be whitening my teeth. The woman came a cross a bit cold. While getting my teeth whitened she wasn't too friendly but got the job done. Throughout she she would stop in and ask how I was with her purse on her arm ( which was a bit odd for me). But all in all a good service. All in all a good service for a good price. I just wish she was a bit more nice.

0.description: They have moved!  New deals on lifebooker.com/referral/…Ritzy Blue Spa and Salon By Whitening Bright Studio2422 W. Roosevelt Rd.Chicago, Il 60608

4.description: I purchased a Youswoop deal for a 30 min whitening session.  I booked my appointment online via their website, good luck getting someone to answer.  I went in for my appointment 2 days ago.  I was 10 mins early, my session started 20 minutes late.  Therefore I spent an extra 30 mins waiting.  3 magazines later, I was led in to the room, I didn't even have time to ask questions, or grab my iPod to play music as many suggested, I had to sit and listen to a the radio playing 80% static, she came to check on me twice so that was good but since you have the tray in your mouth you can't speak.  I was SO glad when the session was over, unfortunately to my dismay there was NO difference with the before and after.  I was at a level 10 (they show you different shades of yellow to determine where you stand) and ideally I should've been at a level 6 (4 shades lighter), nothing changed.  Funny enough that the person said it could be my eyes distorted from wearing the red glasses, so I ought to give it a few days.  Nope, still no change!  So glad I didn't pay $200+ for the session.The first 10 minutes was painful, I wanted to stop.  I felt a sharp pain on both sides of my mouth, and when I went home that night I couldn't brush my teeth, and felt sporadic pain throughout the night.  I'm giving this place 2 stars because it is clean and you get what you pay for.  But think twice before you decide to really go through it.

58.description: Split mussels and strawberry rhubarb brown butter tart. Beet salad was OK. Too much frisse for my taste. The cheese ball in the salad was the best part of the plate.I should have listened to the server and ordered the chocolate cake. The filling in the tart was not as clean as I thought it would be. The tart rhubarb did not come through.They did enough to make me want to come back.

56.description: I went to Marketplace after an invite from a friend.  I had no idea about this place, so I was excited to try something new.  Food: I had the lobster mushrooms and risotto.  For $23 a plate, they should provide more mushrooms than the small serving in the bowl.  Despite this, the flavor was rich and creamy.  The risotto was cooked perfectly.  Drinks: Small drink menu.  I was happy to get the Green Line beer and Prosecco with my meal.  Reasonable prices.Service: This was the most problematic.  Our server was obviously in the weeds.  He was hard to find when we needed something.  He also didn't bring our biscuits that were included with the meal.  We watched as other tables sat down and got their food before us.  For the price of this restaurant, the servers need to be on top of every detail.  I will say he was quite friendly.  Atmosphere: The restaurant has a warm ambience.Overall:  I will probably not come back.

29.description: I've stayed at the Doubletree twice and got room service once and dined in once. The pot pie was surprisingly amazing fresh and hot even when delivered to the room. The dine in experience with juicy scallops and asparagus was pretty good as well

42.description: I would never have come here, but on Valentine's Day all the other restaurants were full. And the Yelp reviews were promising. Other reviews are accurate; great homemade pickles, very attentive service, and Amazing Bread Pudding. We got a half-price bottle of wine which was excellent. We were surprised by the final bill: it came in much lower than we would have expected :)The restaurant seems to have more space than it knows what to do with. Maybe it gets busy on weekends? Also: the music was like a "greatest hits of the nineties and today" radio station from 2005. Daniel Powter's "Had a Bad Day" was representative. I'm not sure who this mix was meant to appeal to; I assume it was meant to be inoffensive, but I wouldn't say it was entirely inoffensive.

23.description: The service was excellent and the presentation was splendid. We were able to get a reservation on short notice on a Friday night at 7:30 pm but had to wait for a table when we arrived.  The small lounge area is cozy and intimate.  My friend's hamburger was delicious. My flat bread was  not memorable. I should have had the mac and cheese which looked scrumptious. I'd give this place a second chance as it had a lot of potential but would not advocate for it on my first experience.

47.description: Excellent food. Pricey but worth it. Had lobster pumpkin papperdelle ($32). BF had meatloaf ($23) which he loved. Very tasty overall. No wait at 7 pm weekday. Restaurant was actually on the empty side.

8.description: Yum, had dinner here on a Saturday night. The restaurant caught my eye on our walk over and they didn't have a ridiculous wait (unlike every other restaurant in Chicago).They started us off with sweet potato and pecan bread, which was amazingly delicious. Seriously, I gotta look up a recipe for that stuff. We shared an order of mussels for appetizers, which was pretty good but a tad too sweet.For the main entrees, I ordered the warm lobster salad which was one of their specials. The lobster was so fresh and well poached, and it was so tender that it was literally quivering on my plate. The flavors went together well, and I was warned that it would be small, but since I wasn't too hungry it turned out to be the perfect size. I also stole quite a bit of my bf's fried crab (also one of their specials) which was also really great and not too heavy even though it was fried.They use locally sourced ingredients, le creuset bakeware, plus the service was excellent, as was the decor, AND they accept restaurant.com. You really can't ask for anything more.

31.description: I'm hoping the dinner service makes up for the lost reservation...even with a confirmation call this afternoon. ****UPDATE*** Service and food were amazing! While there was no real apology for the lost reservation, they had it under my first name and apparently when I said my whole name, it didn't register, the mac and cheese and bread pudding are calling me back for round 2...reservation or not! Excellent call when in Streeterville. Oh, and don't let the reservation thing fool you...make this as fancy or as casual as you'd like.

34.description: Just finished a really enjoyable dinner. We started with the scallops which were tender, juicy, and super flavorful. For entrees we had the grilled trout and the pot pie. Both were delicious, but the trout and wild rice was really the standout. Finally, our waiter was charming, friendly and very helpful. His suggestions all night were spot on.

16.description: Not bad.  The food was good but wasn't anything stellar.  I like that they use quality ingredients for their dishes and that is what brought me here.  I had the pot pie and it was very good.  Wasn't very tasty, but good.  My dinner companion had meat and he said it was good but nothing spectacular either.  For the prices, I expected more.  The wait for the food seemed quite long as the restaurant was probably half-full.  Perhaps it was the preparation required for our dishes...  It was a decent experience and I'd maybe return but maybe not.

13.description: At present they have switched to breakfast only which is interesting since they prior had been a dinner spot that focused on local produce. This restaurant always has struggled with business with promotions on restaurant.com. I have not been for breakfast, but this is a FYI for anyone wondering

11.description: Was a little skeptical when I walked in. Restaurant was a bit empty for Friday dinner and the clientele that was there was, elderly, to say the least.Wasn't a huge fan of their famous pickles, just tasted like your average sweet pickle to me.The fish and chips, though, was very tasty.  It had a delicate, thin breading to it and the fish tasted fresh and flaky.  Fries were pretty thick-cut and resembled more of a home-style fries texture than a french fry, but were pretty good nonetheless. I'd be back to grab this again.

39.description: We went to Markethouse for dinner last night. and ordered their signature Trout, pulled pork and lintil burgers. Also ordered their grilled flatbread with arugula for appetizer. The wine choice was good, and the grilled flat bread excellent. After that, it was downhill - the trout was not at all fresh, the pork was standard, at best. The lentil burgers were good but a little on the dry side. The complimentary dessert for a celebration - raspberry ice cream on molten fudge, was a nice touch.The ambiance and decor were tasteful and pleasant. Our waiter seemed a little bored but we saw other friendly wait staff. Overall, it was a bit disappointing.

37.description: Ordered the market burger at medium, my wife ordered medium-well. They both came out medium rare. We sent it back, and both came out crispy as a hockey puck. Not the most competent chefs here. Two stars (instead of one) since they were nice enough to give us complimentary dessert - which was tasty.

0.description: Was wanting to go for a while after seeing it on a trip to Galena before. Definitely  a hidden gem! Excellent! Was everything I hoped for and more! The dressing on the creamy cucumbers was great and the crab salad yum! Had the Duck. So good! I highly recommend it! Dinners come with a cracker basket with Pate and Garlic butter!!!

38.description: Great experience. Had the Markethouse burger and substituted the cheddar cheese for goat cheese. It was to die for! Best burger I've ever had. It was cooked to perfection. Also, the flatbread appetizer was fresh and delicious! Even though the service was a little lackluster, it was an amazing experience, I will definitely be back.

51.description: Markethouse brunch is on the top of my Chicago brunch list.I'll admit it...I moved here from NYC and I'm a little pretentious when it comes to brunch. I'm all for the classic faves...Yolk...Meli's..etc. but once in a while, it's nice to be refreshed by something different. And Markethouse is definitely something a step above the norm.Their menu is interesting and expansive; there will definitely be something to suit everyone's tastes. The prices are definitely reasonable, considering the service and atmosphere. They also have drink specials for only $5 with weekend brunch!I liked both of the dishes we ordered (Benedict and pancakes) but I can't wait to go back and try others on the menu. Definitely stop by here when you're in the area...it's not too crowded, everyone there is super accommodating (we had a lot of stuff with us so they let us sit in a private area!), and the food is some of the best I've had. You won't be sorry!

27.description: I consider myself a pretty good cook, but I'm kinda slow. If I want a good meal slowly, I'll stay home and cook it myself. That said, Markethouse has good food. My friend seemed to enjoy the half chicken and a side of macaroni and cheese. I liked my mushroom soup a lot and the pot pie sans chicken. Brian, the waiter, was the issue. When he greeted us with "hey" like one might accept from an old college friend, we should have known things would be off. He did not tend to our table, or any of his tables, really. He came when the food came which meant empty water glasses, no bread and imprecise serving. He didn't seem to realize anything was wrong either. Had we not been in a super rush to get to a movie, we may have shared this with the manager. Oh well, this is what Yelp is for, right?

32.description: The night started off poorly. After receiving a voicemail and calling back and confirming the reservation, it was sad to see the hostess lost in her screen only to emerge stating, "I don't see your name."  Fine not a problem, a quick glance around we spotted 6 empty tables and an entire section open (on a Saturday night no less! I had high hopes on a quick seat. Not so! We were told there was a 15 min wait (hey at least comp us a drink for losing our reservation and making us wait!). Then the bar tender seemed to be more interested in taking pictures of the girls at his bar than making our (non-comped) drinks.HOWEVER, everything turned when we were sat. The server was quick and courteous, the busser brought us some amazing bread quickly and made sure our waters were filled. The food was AMAZING. They make the mac and cheese the way I LOVE it.... creamy WITH BACON! The fish and chips were way better than the Irish bar across the street and the one down the block, and this place isn't even an Irish place. Spying our neighbor's food (cause that is what I do):1. The loaded fries look fantastic. The guy who ordered them ordered them as a "side" and they are really entree size, I mean they could easily feed three. He didn't finish them and I was really tempted to ask if I could try his "leftovers".2. The full rack of ribs was outstandingly huge. They must of come from a mutated cow that they grew into double the size (or is it that I've been getting smaller ribs at other places?). He also did not finish them and again I really wanted to ask for just one rib. "How much for one rib?"We also had the bread pudding. We had a tasting portion at the taste of streeterville (which was a total flop of an event) and it was pretty darn good there. Here, it was twenty times better. The hot bread pudding with the cold ice cream on top hit the spot.I can't believe this place has been just down the street from me for over a year and I didn't know about it. Go here. Love it. Oh and it won't break your bank. I mean we got all this food and a couple of beers for about $50.

54.description: Great food and atmosphere, got the cobb salad and it was awesome.

48.description: Market house serves phenomenal food. I have been there on three different occasions and both times my guest(s) and I each enjoyed it. Their bread pudding is the ABSOLUTE BEST THAT I HAVE EVER TASTED IN MY LIFE! I've had the ribs, hamburger, and one other dish that I cant recall. Great food for a pretty reasonable price.

44.description: Go here and thank me later.  Without Yelp, I never would have found this.  It's inside a Doubletree hotel and the decor is a bit dated, but the food is amazing.I got their version of a Long Island ice tea and it was tasty, but overpriced at $13.  Our very attentive waiter brought out homemade pickles, which were really tasty. The right amount of sweet and sour and super crunchy. The complementary bread that evening was sweet potato pecan and it was so fluffy and light.  Nom.I got a salad, which was quite tasty and fresh. The dressing was weird, so I'm glad that I got it on the side. And just in case you're about to think I'm super healthy, I got a side of mac and cheese. The best mac and cheese. The sauce was gooey and cheesy, the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente and the topping was crunchy. So tasty.My husband got the banner burger that this place is famous for and I can see why. It was massive and deliciously seasoned. The fries were awesome, too.  They were thick-cut fries and had some fresh herbs on it.This is why it's lacking a five-start rating: the dessert was kind of mediocre. We should have followed the advice of every other review here and got the bread pudding, but I wanted chocolate.  So we got the melting chocolate cake, which was served with blueberry ice cream.  It just wasn't that stellar.  It wasn't actually molten, and the berry ice cream was a strange choice.It was quite reasonably priced, too, for what we got. I must go again and get a different dessert ....

24.description: Markethouse has nice décor reminiscent of a small pond with tall grasses and lily pads. There are large windows that look out onto the street level urban landscape which somehow ties in the flat screen TV playing football. Our server was relaxed - verging on the familiar and (in that manner) nearly unprofessional. Luckily for him we found his banter amusing but I don't think it would have meshed so well with the high fashion couple seated nearby.I got two martinis and found both to be mundane and predictable. The bar at Markethouse has not caught up to the innovative locovore movement of the kitchen. I even glanced over the beer list and saw no craft beers - just macrobrews that you would expect to find in any gas station, apartment fridge, or concert across the United States.The food was good. Between the two of us we had the chicken pot pie and ribs. The pot pie was delicious and perfectly sufficient as a meal of its own. The crust was philo dough and overlapped the edge of the bowl. Tucked inside were large chunks of vegetables and chicken - well portioned if not a tad salty. The glory of the ribs was in the sauce and fries. The large slab was cleverly placed on top of the bed of fries so that some of the barbecue sauce dripped down upon them. We didn't even touch the coleslaw.Our concluding opinion of Markethouse was that it was a good restaurant for two dollar sign comfort food. Other menu items included hamburgers and fish and chips. We were satisfied with the price of our meal: about $95 for two entrees and four drinks. Although Markethouse satisfied our need for that meal, I am doubtful that we would choose to return. There are so many other restaurants in the area that are crying out for exploration.

7.description: Honestly, I felt a little under dressed...the hubby and I both in jeans, T-shirts and a hooded zip ups.  Despite our attire, our server was great and very hospitable even if we looked like starving students.  The atmosphere was nice but for me personally it wasn't aesthetically engaging; tons of brown/tan, burnt orange and yellow hues.We started with the hummus appetizer, it was served with an herb flatbread.  Total fan of the hummus, nice portion with a lot of flavor.  Not so much a fan of the flatbread.  We also received complimentary bread and a small jar of house made pickles.  O.M.G. the pickles were the best I've ever had; I want the recipe, they are amazing.For my entree I had the Chop salad; romaine, radicchio, hearts of palm, black olive, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, celery, goat cheese, corn, red onion, sweet & sour tarragon-mustard dressing.  There was a lot going on there.  The hubby had the 10oz Grilled Black Angus Burger, our server referred to it as the burger "adventure".  I didn't understand that reference until the burger came out.  It stands almost 6" off the plate; a half pound of beef stuffed with BBQ braised short ribs, roasted peppers, tomato, lettuce, melted white cheddar and topped off with fried onion rings.  It looked like an adventure.

49.description: I have been here three times with various people. We all agree the food is fresh and tastes fantastic. We highly recommend their burger, the salmon, and the wild boar. The burger is one of the best I have had here in Chicago. If you are a big fan of pickles, like myself, you will love their home made pickles that are complimentary with each meal. Their bread pudding is to die for. Best bread pudding I have ever had. Oh, I almost forgot to mention that they are an almost all organic restaurant (except for a few excepts). You will forget, too, once you taste their food. The service is great. The staff is very friendly. Also, their prices are reasonable.

40.description: Both of the soups were outstanding with the sweet potato bread. The salads were just ok. I would not recommend the flatbread appetizer. Just ok...would not go back.

53.description: Had a terrible dining experience here with my parents. The rotisserie chicken made me gag and the French fries were not cooked. Our waiter was not attentive and we had to ask for the check 4x. Will never dine here again.

30.description: Came in for dinner alone and sat at the empty bar. The dining room was also almost completely empty. Odd for 5 oclock in a hotel restaurant downtown.Good beer selection with craft locals. I ordered the steak which was pretty expensive at 35 dollars. IT had great flavor though and the vegetables and potato puree and red onions worked well together. Large 12 oz NY Strips are so tasty!Since I was staying in the double tree I was able to get free dessert. The bread pudding with ice cream was also excellent.Overall this place was a good choice. Are there better places around? Yes, but if you want to avoid a 2 hour wait on a Friday night check this place out.

46.description: I've been here twice, both times were superb. This place offers comfort food prepared well for a reasonable price and considering the location, that's hard to find. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to anyone! And seriously, the bread pudding is AMAZING!! But my favorite part of this spot is that they support local farmers and promote sustainability :)
