1.description: Markethouse has nice décor reminiscent of a small pond with tall grasses and lily pads. There are large windows that look out onto the street level urban landscape which somehow ties in the flat screen TV playing football. Our server was relaxed - verging on the familiar and (in that manner) nearly unprofessional. Luckily for him we found his banter amusing but I don't think it would have meshed so well with the high fashion couple seated nearby.I got two martinis and found both to be mundane and predictable. The bar at Markethouse has not caught up to the innovative locovore movement of the kitchen. I even glanced over the beer list and saw no craft beers - just macrobrews that you would expect to find in any gas station, apartment fridge, or concert across the United States.The food was good. Between the two of us we had the chicken pot pie and ribs. The pot pie was delicious and perfectly sufficient as a meal of its own. The crust was philo dough and overlapped the edge of the bowl. Tucked inside were large chunks of vegetables and chicken - well portioned if not a tad salty. The glory of the ribs was in the sauce and fries. The large slab was cleverly placed on top of the bed of fries so that some of the barbecue sauce dripped down upon them. We didn't even touch the coleslaw.Our concluding opinion of Markethouse was that it was a good restaurant for two dollar sign comfort food. Other menu items included hamburgers and fish and chips. We were satisfied with the price of our meal: about $95 for two entrees and four drinks. Although Markethouse satisfied our need for that meal, I am doubtful that we would choose to return. There are so many other restaurants in the area that are crying out for exploration.

55.description: Markethouse was a wonderful surprise of a restaurant that I had been to before.  Since my first visit (which I thought was awful), they have revamped their menu and the atmosphere.  I enjoyed eating classic meals that I remember as a child but with a modern spin.  The portions were huge but they didn't sacrifice on quality or flavors.  This restaurant isn't in the best location of downtown Chicago, but it may be worth walking to after you see the pictures below.  I did notice some problems with the waiting staff and also the lack of seasoning on some of the entrees.  However, I still gave it a high rating because of the enjoyable experience my family and I had while dining here.

9.description: Markethouse is about average for a hotel restaurant. We went for dinner and it was a smattering of American offerings, but everything seemed a bit on the heavy side. The butterscotch bread pudding is really the only thing to write home about though. The prices are expensive and catered towards tourists. The service is about average for chitown. Will not make a point to return.

26.description: Good food, the worst service ever.  Let me explain...the restaurant was only 1/2 full on a Friday night.  There was at least one other server working so no one was  in the weeds.  First, our server looked exasperated when he took our order, he also looked pissed when I asked him to explain some local selections on the beer menu (we're from out of town).  He took the order without so much as a smile.  Then, he never once checked on our drinks (our wine and water glasses were empty the entire night).  He never once checked on our food after the runner dropped them.  He ignored me when I tried to flag him for the check.  He never asked us if we wanted dessert.  He never said, "thank you" when he dropped the check.  But, as he served the table behind us (a white couple, mind you) he was friendly, joked around, asked how their food was, checked up on them multiple times, sounded like good service from where I was sitting. All in all, we spent a couple hundred dollars here.  Our money is as good as anyone elses.  We still tipped 15% despite the horrible service; we usually tip at least $20% since I have a background in the service industry. This was such an embarrassing experience for my family and I.  No one should be treated like this. The manager was understanding though, and handled my complaint with professionalism. Someone from the hotel dropped off complimentary buffet tickets to our room, though we won't be able to use them before we check out tomorrow.Service aside, the food here was excellent.  Specifically, the full rack of ribs were great, and the busser & runner were polite, so that was nice.On principle, the food here isn't worth patronizing a business that condones this kind of conduct.  The comments from the management on others' negative yelp reviews claim that bad service is an anomaly here, but I question the veracity of that statement since I had the same bad service from the same exact server that they complained of.  I understand that the food service industry is difficult, but this particular server, Brian, needs to understand how horrible he made us feel.  We are here on a trip to celebrate my sister's graduation and her big move to the city and he really made our family feel discriminated against.

25.description: My wife and I have now been here 4-5 times, as we live in the neighborhood.  We really like Markethouse:1)  It's never that crowded, and it's quiet yet casual.  We like the quiet, casual ambiance.  There's very little turnover in the staff as far as we can tell, and we've gotten to know the waiters who are wonderful.2)  The food is solid, dependable and delicious.  Nothing too fancy or exotic.  Some of our favorite dishes include the wild truffle mushroom soup (slightly salty but savory), the Maine Diver scallops, the Mac & Cheese Gratin, the Pot Pie, the Ale Battered Shrimp, Risotto and the Ribs.Markethouse is the place we go when we don't want hassle, don't want to have make reservations in advance and have a solid experience with good American fare.The only con is one of the maître d, a red-haired woman with freckles, always seems to have a humorless scowl on her face.  She's always there and though she doesn't say much is more than a bit intimidating.

12.description: CLOSED. So I can't slam them after my last trip there on Dec 20th. Drinks were watered down so bad that the manager agreed they were watered and comp'd us. Question is why they were even served.I hope they re open with a better management.

59.description: "Fresh and local" should not mean "bland".  Had a very average dinner here last night, but I really wanted more.  When the best part of the meal is the pickles they bring for the table, well...The pate appetizer was bland..no flavor unless you bathed it in the sauce (pretty good sauce).  Should have gotten the full rack of ribs so there would have been some meat there.  The asparagus did have a nice lemon/salt dash, but the charred brussel sprouts were barely cooked,So it wash;t bad, but in a city where the options seem endless, I am going to keep searching.

21.description: Not bad.  The food was good but wasn't anything stellar.  I like that they use quality ingredients for their dishes and that is what brought me here.  I had the pot pie and it was very good.  Wasn't very tasty, but good.  My dinner companion had meat and he said it was good but nothing spectacular either.  For the prices, I expected more.  The wait for the food seemed quite long as the restaurant was probably half-full.  Perhaps it was the preparation required for our dishes...  It was a decent experience and I'd maybe return but maybe not.

17.description: Markethouse is our go to restaurant when we can't decide where else to eat. We started eating here a couple years ago. Before, they offered complimentary pecan sweet potato bread and pickles, but no longer. Sad! they now charge $2 for it. We still like to eat here though. My favorite is the rainbow trout (21). You can't get trout this fresh anywhere else, and the wild rice is great. Their lamb is also consistently good. We also enjoy the Mac and cheese, which is very rich. What's best though, is the bread pudding (7). It comes with pecan ice cream, and it's so amazing. If I lived closer, I would definitely be frequenting Markethouse much more often just for dessert! Also, the service is great. Juan is a great server- he is friendly, personable, attentive, and provides fast service. He even stuck a candle in the ice cream for the birthday boy! The restaurant is always clean, and has plenty of booths and tables.

10.description: Group dining has its own frustrating challenges, so I took a leap and entrusted Markethouse to provide the atmosphere, while appeasing the varied palates of my 10-ish coworkers for a professional dinner.I say 10-ish because we ended up with a couple more than planned. No worries, as they graciously accommodated with more chairs.   We started our meal with pickles and warm sweet potato pecan bread. Between our salty used-car-salesman waiter service and lackluster drinks, the saving grace was our entrees.A majority of the table ordered the trout and raved about it. A couple had the ribs which was by far, the heartiest between an entire corn on the cob and base of thick-cut fries. One of my coworkers is notoriously known to be particular with her food. Unfortunately, her mac 'n cheese came with bacon (even despite her requesting it sans meat), but loved her side of asparagus which harbored a nice smoky yet fresh crisp taste. Another one of my coworkers ordered the pork shank and marveled wide-eyed at the foam on top of his dish. My meatloaf was decent. I wished the seasonal veggies presented in larger rustic cuts, instead of like it was from a bag in the frozen section. I thoroughly enjoyed my the twice baked potato. For almost last minute planning and on a Friday during prime dinner hours, MH was a decent choice. Kudos to the staff for putting up with our crazy group, since half did not show up until thirty minutes after established reso time. The maitre'd up front was very accommodating about our seating time, though I could read the slight annoyance. I liked that they had a small lounge area where our group could wait and sip in style. If you're paying with plastic, they only accept up to 6 cards for groups. NMH employees get 20% off the bill-- just flash your ID!

5.description: Wandering around looking for a place to enjoy an adult beverage, we stumbled into the cavernous space that was fairly empty. Good for us right? Mehhhhhh. The drink were expensive and good if you were able to flag someone down to order one... So that pretty much sucked. We ordered a few drinks and found our way to another spot which was more interested in our service!

3.description: I've stayed at the Doubletree twice and got room service once and dined in once. The pot pie was surprisingly amazing fresh and hot even when delivered to the room. The dine in experience with juicy scallops and asparagus was pretty good as well

35.description: Jose is fantastic, if you like sitting at the bar with some great conversation. I recommend this place the food was as great as the great drinks.  The price value is very good as well.

19.description: Incredibly delicious.  Even the bread they serve in the beginning is fantastic and I couldn't get enough of their homemade pickles.  I ordered the scallops as my appetizer and the pot pie for my entree.  The scallops were cooked and seasoned to perfection!  The appetizer comes with 3 scallops, but I probably could have eaten a 2nd round because they were so good!  A small frisee salad comes with the scallops which complement the dish perfectly.The pot pie is really what loses the star.  The flaky crust was absolutely delicious, but I felt some of the vegetables inside were a bit underdone.  And I wish I had a little more creamy soup inside the pot pie to eat w/ the vegetables.My friend also ordered the garden tomato salad, and it was very good as well.  It's very simple, but executed perfectly with high quality ingredients.  The heirloom tomatoes were to die for!  I didn't try the crostini that she ordered, but it was a plentiful portion that looked beautiful.We really wanted to try their signature bread pudding, which I hear is absolutely amazing, but we had to run.  I definitely want to come back for dessert, the scallops, the bread, and the pickles!

28.description: Good food with bad service does not a good review make...At some point restaurants will learn that an excellent meal can be ruined by a mediocre waitstaff. I had the roasted chicken. It was good. I also had a side of the macaroni and cheese. It was really good.Now that that's out of the way...Brian, the waiter, was not good. Brian initially approached our table and said, "hey". Once I realized he didn't actually know my friend, I was left confused, but I got over it. Brian quickly took our orders and filled our glasses. Then, Brian disappeared....For 30 mins. My water glass sat empty for upwards of 10 - 15 minutes as Brian, other waiters, and a busboy, walked by numerous times. Sometimes these people looked at my empty glass while holding pitchers of water.  What? I had to stop one of them and ask for water. We waited for about 30 minutes before our food arrived. Two other tables were provided with bread during their wait. Not Brian's tables, though. No, Brian's customers got to sit starving and dying of thirst while watching the customers of other waitstaff eat merrily and drink, but I digress. Eh, I can't say I'll be back. Bad waiters make me feel that way. If you decide to eat here, I'd pay special note to the people with bread and water at their tables. Chances are they don't have Brian as a waiter. *A special note for Brian, if you're reading this: I left you a small tip, not because I'm cheap, but because you were terrible. I would have told your manager at the time, but I was running late thanks to your slowness.

45.description: Marketplace has been on my list of places to check out for over a year as I always pass it when visiting my mother who lives nearby.  Plus, I read in the Trib that it was an under-appreciated gem and worth the trip.  When I saw their $50/pp special 4-course Valentine's Day menu, it sounded delicious and I made a reservation.  From the moment we entered the restaurant, all of my hopes for a romantic Valentines Day dinner evaporated.  We stood at the hostess stand for nearly 5 minutes before being acknowledged (two servers frantically approached the stand, grabbed credit card receipts and scurried away).  When the hostess arrived, she explained that they were running about 15 minutes late on reservations & encouraged us to grab a seat at the bar.  We did.  In fact, I stood at the bar for nearly 10 minutes before the bartender even acknowledged me.  She seemed overwhelmed--in fact, every employee seemed that way (the hostess was also busing tables & pouring wine).  It's Valentines Day--one of the busiest restaurant nights--I get it.  Clearly the restaurant was under-staffed that night.  Crap happens...I get it.  I'm one who rolls with the punches & always attempt  to make the best of situations.  When I finally got her attention, the bartender couldn't have been more curt & disinterested.  I paid for our wine and returned to waiting for our table.  We were finally seated around 9:15 (with 9pm reservations).  On the way to our table, the hostess informed us that they were substituting NY Strip on the pre-fixe menu since the kitchen ran out of the filet Mignon.  When our waiter finally arrived, he informed us that not only were they out of the filet, but they were also out of the lobster--meaning two of the four items on the menu were no longer available.  He returned to inform us that scallops would replace the lobster from the menu (scallops are not equal to lobster).  Having chosen this restaurant solely based on their menu, I asked to see the manager.  The manager (who was also the hostess) informed us that Markethouse sold more than they expected from their pre-fixed menu and invited us to return the following night saying that "there is nothing she can do."  She did not attempt to make any of the wrongs right...instead, she just rattled off excuses.  Strike three, Markethouse.After some deliberating with my girlfriend, I decided that Markethouse didn't deserve any more of my money.  I expressed my frustration to our waiter; he apologized (the first person to apologize in the nearly 60 minutes we were there),  and we decided to leave.  Before exiting, I wanted to have a few words with the manager/hostess and let her know why we were leaving.  I waited another 3-5 minutes, but she did not reappear, so we left.  Valentines Day 2013 was going to be memorable for all the wrong reasons.Markethouse is the type of restaurant that I want to support--supporting local farmers and serving organic, natural food that is good for you.  In return, Markethouse provided the most pathetic Valentine's Day experience and I would NEVER return.  In my thirty-some years of living in Chicago, this was the first time I have ever walked out of a restaurant.  In fact, this is the first time I've ever been compelled to post a review on Yelp.

33.description: I sat at the bar on a weeknight and was waited on very attentively by the barkeep. I ordered a delicious squash or pumpkin soup. I can't remember what was in it but it was really good. I also got a small order of the macaroni and cheese gratin. It was super rich and delicious. I did not eat all of it. There was no way I could. They had some decent wine as well. The wait staff was chatty and friendly. They offered up other food and sightseeing suggestions for me since I was in town for the week.I don't recall that my meal was super expensive which had been a challenge staying close to Michigan Avenue and not wanting to spend $60-100 per night for dinner and drinks.

43.description: I went here for Valentine's Day and it was really nice. I shared the squash soup (very delicately flavored and great) for an appetizer. The pot pie I had for my entree was wonderful. The dough was flakey and puffy and the creamy sauce within was really nicely seasoned. We shared butterscotch bread pudding for dessert which was sweet and delicious. Basically, every part of the meal was really pleasing. The only complaint is the awful early-2000s music that was playing the whole time. Please change that.

2.description: Great breakfast buffet at the Doubletree! Eggs made to order with all the usual breakfast items available: bacon, sausage, oatmeal, french toast, breads and spreads for toasting, cereal options. All was good!

18.description: Good food with bad service does not a good review make...At some point restaurants will learn that an excellent meal can be ruined by a mediocre waitstaff. I had the roasted chicken. It was good. I also had a side of the macaroni and cheese. It was really good.Now that that's out of the way...Brian, the waiter, was not good. Brian initially approached our table and said, "hey". Once I realized he didn't actually know my friend, I was left confused, but I got over it. Brian quickly took our orders and filled our glasses. Then, Brian disappeared....For 30 mins. My water glass sat empty for upwards of 10 - 15 minutes as Brian, other waiters, and a busboy, walked by numerous times. Sometimes these people looked at my empty glass while holding pitchers of water.  What? I had to stop one of them and ask for water. We waited for about 30 minutes before our food arrived. Two other tables were provided with bread during their wait. Not Brian's tables, though. No, Brian's customers got to sit starving and dying of thirst while watching the customers of other waitstaff eat merrily and drink, but I digress. Eh, I can't say I'll be back. Bad waiters make me feel that way. If you decide to eat here, I'd pay special note to the people with bread and water at their tables. Chances are they don't have Brian as a waiter. *A special note for Brian, if you're reading this: I left you a small tip, not because I'm cheap, but because you were terrible. I would have told your manager at the time, but I was running late thanks to your slowness.

41.description: I went to Markethouse with a group of 6 people for dinner on a Friday night at 8:00pm. While the restaurant was still half empty, the surly hostess sill made a very big deal about not seating us before our entire party was there. After waiting for about 10 minutes and knowing our last guest was on their way, we convinced her to let us sit, but she insisted on taking the chair and dining setting away before the last guest arrived, in case we only ended up being 5 people. Very odd, and uncomfortable when the guest did arrive and the chair and setting needed to be brought back.Overall, our party was satisfied by the food. I had a chopped salad that was great, although my salmon was undercooked in the middle. Other guests really enjoyed the fried fish (all you can eat), and the desserts we had were hit or miss (bread pudding was good, but molten lava cake was very dry and pretty tasteless). While the food was decent, the attitude of a lot of the staff was pretty rude. While our waiter was friendly, it took a very long time to receive desserts and entrees. With so many other great restaurants in the city that have great food and wonderful service, I would recommend picking another option other than Markethouse for a night out in the city.

52.description: Maybe 3.5 stars.Pickles were good.  Chopped salad was way overdressed.  Boar Belly Crostini was the best food of the night.  Lobster Pappardelle was bland...needed seasoning and not worth the price.  Restaurant is dated and could use a makeover.  My opinion is it's just an above average hotel restaurant.  With a few changes, it could be a 4-5 star restaurant.

50.description: I stayed at the Double Tree and found this little gem on the property. Thankfully it is not the typical hotel restaurant that serves stale old food. this is a fresh, cool, delicious place and I cannot wait to come back. the decor is modern, not stuffy and for the Monday evening I dined, the bar was a little busy and the poor bartender was there alone.  Not his fault as he did his best to accmomodate everyone.  I started with the chopped salad which was a good portion for only 9 bucks.  I thought it could use a bit more dressing but overall it was good.  The half roasted chicken was the best i have ever had and I eat a lot of chicken.  It was juicy, crispy skinned, and had a slight sweetness from the candied lemon.  there were hints of rosemary and and some other seasonings (I think maybe some 5 spice but I'm not sure).  It came with fingerling potatoes, arugula, and asparagus.  It was divine.  A bonus was the fact that it was almost deboned but you can tell that it was cooked on the bone.  Nice touch. For 22 bucks, it was a steal.

4.description: The food were pretty good. Huge in size. My mom and I both had to take leftover back up to our hotel room. Free dessert if you stay in Double Tree (check your bathroom, they leave a sticky note on the mirror!).My mom got a burger and I got mac and cheese. Our dessert was bread pudding, with salted caramel icecream. Love it!

6.description: The night started off poorly. After receiving a voicemail and calling back and confirming the reservation, it was sad to see the hostess lost in her screen only to emerge stating, "I don't see your name."  Fine not a problem, a quick glance around we spotted 6 empty tables and an entire section open (on a Saturday night no less! I had high hopes on a quick seat. Not so! We were told there was a 15 min wait (hey at least comp us a drink for losing our reservation and making us wait!). Then the bar tender seemed to be more interested in taking pictures of the girls at his bar than making our (non-comped) drinks.HOWEVER, everything turned when we were sat. The server was quick and courteous, the busser brought us some amazing bread quickly and made sure our waters were filled. The food was AMAZING. They make the mac and cheese the way I LOVE it.... creamy WITH BACON! The fish and chips were way better than the Irish bar across the street and the one down the block, and this place isn't even an Irish place. Spying our neighbor's food (cause that is what I do):1. The loaded fries look fantastic. The guy who ordered them ordered them as a "side" and they are really entree size, I mean they could easily feed three. He didn't finish them and I was really tempted to ask if I could try his "leftovers".2. The full rack of ribs was outstandingly huge. They must of come from a mutated cow that they grew into double the size (or is it that I've been getting smaller ribs at other places?). He also did not finish them and again I really wanted to ask for just one rib. "How much for one rib?"We also had the bread pudding. We had a tasting portion at the taste of streeterville (which was a total flop of an event) and it was pretty darn good there. Here, it was twenty times better. The hot bread pudding with the cold ice cream on top hit the spot.I can't believe this place has been just down the street from me for over a year and I didn't know about it. Go here. Love it. Oh and it won't break your bank. I mean we got all this food and a couple of beers for about $50.

22.description: Markethouse is our go to restaurant when we can't decide where else to eat. We started eating here a couple years ago. Before, they offered complimentary pecan sweet potato bread and pickles, but no longer. Sad! they now charge $2 for it. We still like to eat here though. My favorite is the rainbow trout (21). You can't get trout this fresh anywhere else, and the wild rice is great. Their lamb is also consistently good. We also enjoy the Mac and cheese, which is very rich. What's best though, is the bread pudding (7). It comes with pecan ice cream, and it's so amazing. If I lived closer, I would definitely be frequenting Markethouse much more often just for dessert! Also, the service is great. Juan is a great server- he is friendly, personable, attentive, and provides fast service. He even stuck a candle in the ice cream for the birthday boy! The restaurant is always clean, and has plenty of booths and tables.

15.description: As of this writing, Markethouse serves breakfast only. I chose to skip the ordinary looking $21 hotel breakfast buffet and chose the $21 Blue Crab eggs Benedict instead. For this price, I at least expected a properly poached egg, but I got two golf balls instead. I walked across the street to West Egg and got a great Benedict for half the price. My advice is to walk across the street quickly.

57.description: We enjoyed our Thanksgiving dinner at Market house.  The meal was spectacular...we had the grouper, risotto and the ribeye.  All the dishes looked beautiful and tasted perfect...not a single complaint at the table.  The wait staff were all great and the dessert was awesome.  I can't wait to dine here again!

20.description: Was waiting to be seated for an hour even though there are empty seats. The front desk lady (the black one) is racism, not friendly to Asians. When we came to her and said we didn't have reservation, she asked us to wait 25min but she never put us in the list. We came to her 3 times in the next one hour, she was like I don't know how long should you wait, you didn't talk to me blablabla. I understand that it is hard time working during thanksgiving but please we are with empty stomachs walking in windy Chicago. She is just not good to be a front desk.

36.description: I came here for brunch with my friend who was staying at the DoubleTree. I was very unimpressed. The brunch menu was super boring and uninspired. I got a veggie omelet, which was bland and overpriced. Service was also quite lacking (we had to flag down our waiter to get a glass of water). I'd take Yolk or even Clarke's over this anyday.

14.description: We have 1-2 date nights per month, two kids and full time jobs keep us busy the rest of the time.We make it a point to try a variety of Chicago's most amazing restaurants, both old, new, $ to $$$$.We've been to Markethouse  3 times and are planning our 4th trip soon.We have not been disappointed. Food and service has been excellent and consistent.We have tried the various menu items and agree with other Yelpers, good stuff. Trout, bread pudding, burger, and the famous pickles and bread.Note to Markethouse...keep the pickles and bread.....it makes you uniqueSee you soon

29.description: I finally severed all ties with these idiots today. DO NOT go here. There are other options. The people manning the phones are not helpful, rude,... and from what I can tell, have limited intelligence. The last straw for me today was this - I was down to my last pair of disposable lenses this morning, and tore one of them. I happened to have an extra one for the opposite eye. So I basically I walked around all morning wearing the wrong lens in one eye, resulting in a terrible headache. I called Rosin to make an appt and see if they would give me a pair to hold me over until my visit. I was denied this request, and told it was unlawful to be given a pair of lenses with an out-of-date prescription. B.S. give me a break. I called a new doctor down the street, was treated kindly, and they gave me a fresh pair until my appt this coming Tuesday. And guess what, the police didn't show up to grab them out of my hand because I am a month overdue for a check up!!! Crazy I know! Just for good measure, I am going to go home and cut off the mattress tag and see if the authorities show up. I'm feeling lucky.Another time, I called to have my eye prescription emailed to me so I could order some contacts from 1-800-Contacts. I was told I would need to either fax or email an authorization form to "receive that information." I really don't understand the point of filling out a long document to authorize myself to see my prescription, myself.In addition, I have gotten a different doctor every time, and each one has been rude. They act like they are doing you a favor by seeing you. Spare yourself.These are the type of people that make you angry every time you speak with them. I have never once gotten off the phone and not been infuriated. And I never get angry!

42.description: When I came in, there was a woman being very upset at the front desk about how long she had to wait, demanding her glasses back and chastising the service. I thought she was just a high-maintenance lady; forty minutes after my scheduled appointment and not even sitting in the optometrist's chair yet, I wish I had the gall to do the same.Don't get me wrong, my doctor was very good as was her assistant who helped me fit my contact lens -- thus the two stars rather than one. But the front desk was absolutely clueless. They didn't know how to apply my student insurance and didn't care to find out - ultimately, the lady who fitted my contacts took matters into her hands and really did everything to solve the problem. I observed the front desk ladies during my epic wait -- they couldn't even do simple things like calculating discount percentages, which worries me. However, both contact lens lady and my doctor kept me waiting periodically throughout the process - between tests, fittings, etc etc. I brought a friend to walk me home after the exam, when my eyes would be very sensitive -- the wait between everything was SO long that my eyes re-adjusted to normal before i could even leave the office (speaking of which, what about putting out magazines rather than "eye health" or whatever it is if you are keeping us waiting this long).And the worst thing -- pricey as HECK. I wouldn't mind so much if the service was good all around, I mean if you spend on anything you might as well spend it on your eyes, right? But I couldn't help but feel like I could walk into a glasses shop in a mall and get equal service for a much lower price.

23.description: I came in for a routine eye exam and new glass's i bought the frame that the Rosin person suggested.After more then three, return visits and three different attempts, it was determined that the frame was wrong for my vision. That took over two month's and three different taking my glass's back to the lab.Finally, after meeting with the Mgr, before the store opened, the mgr got the right frame for my vision, Even then, they had to order new lens to put in the automatic light darkening lens i had originally ordered two months and over five visits later, i got glass's that workThe mgr (Samantha) really cared, but it was pretty obvious the staff was sick of seeing me and NO ONE, really said, so sorry for your trouble, except for the Mgr.

47.description: Possibly one of the worst shopping experience ever. The shop has a very limited selection of frames and most of the frames they have are truly old and out of fashion. I had a pair of lenses replaced on a frame I bought here one year ago and once completed the glasses had a different shape than when I brought them in. Manager had the gut of telling me that this is was because everyone face is not symmetrical. Anyway the managers are incompetent unwilling to help. They will get you on your nerves...so do not bother to go there

8.description: I went in to purchase new glasses and was helped by Cat. She was most helpful and provided great customer service! She was knowledgeable and helped me pick the glasses best for me. I would recommend this location if someone asked.

31.description: An office of mega-proportion miscommunication!I came through the recommendation of Benefits Dept at work (for pricing), and as the sole member of BCBS IL.LASIK CONSULTATION ONLY:The gadget to measure the eye is old and the light is ON [a psychedelic effect].  I was told the light is NOT supposed to be ON.  At OFF, the gadget is still functional.Staff recommends 14 days without contacts before taking final measurements whereas the printed brochure indicated 10 days.I showed up with contacts.  She asked whether I have glasses.  I was never asked about contacts/glasses at the time of appointment.It sounds like Dr. Rosin is a competent surgeon.  I find it weird that I would not meet Dr. Rosin until the day of surgery.I was told that all surgeries are performed in Westchester!  Westchester does NOT show up as one of the Rosin Eye care location.  My guess, a surgical center rented by procedure.At least 2 staff ends their sentences with "ok" as a form of period.  Insane in the Membrane!

34.description: I had a bad experience with a different eye doctor a year ago that messed up my contacts orders a couple times (I think there was a problem with the prescription, and then they were supposed to mail it but kept calling me to pick it up, etc.) and I was pretty sure he over-corrected my vision.I was looking for a new place to go, and found that Rosin Eyecare is covered by my VSP insurance.  They're close to my office and I called at noon to make an appointment the very same day and they were able to fit me in at 2pm.  There was pretty much no wait as they took me in right after I finished filling out the paperwork and putting away my insurance cards.  They did a bunch of tests...and the best part was they didn't do that annoying "puff of air" in my eyes that I hate so much!  They actually used a different machine to measure the pressure which gave me such a relief.The doctor I saw was Dr. Mark Graves and he listened to me rant about the previous eye doctor over-correcting and gave me a thorough eye exam to determine that yes, I was indeed at a prescription -1.50 more than I needed to be!  He gave me a new pair of contacts to try on and it already feels much better.  After the exam, they even helped me look up if the brand I tried on is covered by my insurance, and also that there's a $50 rebate for that brand.The only reason I gave a 4 instead of a 5 is because I'm the kind of person that likes options...I always wonder which brand would be the best kind of contacts for me, and want to compare it with others that are covered by my insurance.  It's the OCD part of me, I can't help it.  I have no doubt that Mark fit me with an excellent pair of contacts...but I would love to have known all my choices and the differences between them.  With that said, I'm still going to be going back to them from now on.

16.description: I was having MAJOR issues with one of my eyes. I wasn't sure if I had scratched it or I had pink eye. I could barely open it and was very light sensitive, so an appointment was necessary. I first went to immediate care and I guess they ended up prescribing me some sort of allergy drops.. that were $90?! CRAZY. I saw that Rosin was close to my work office so I called to schedule an emergency appointment. I was able to get right in the day of and the woman that I saw was so gentle and helpful. I have been to a few eye doctors that haven't been so gentle and didn't take their time with me, but she did. She gave me two different kind of drops and gave me her 24/7 on call number in case something went wrong. She also scheduled a two day follow-up appointment and called to check on me the following week.

13.description: I've always had a great experience at Rosin Eye Care.  Specifically, the doctors have always been extremely friendly and thorough, and I always appreciate that they take their time and don't rush through appointments/eye exams.  They take the time to answer any questions I have, and discuss options.  The staff who then assists with the ordering of glasses, lenses have always been extremely helpful and friendly as well.  They have always worked with me to find the best possible option that meets my needs, in terms of any rebates, insurance, etc.  I have no complaints, I've always had exceptional service!

11.description: I was quite skeptical about going in for an eye appointment due to the fact that it had been years since I had had my eyes checked. Everyone at Rosin from the ladies at the front desk to the doctor himself was so friendly and helpful that I immediately felt at ease. The office was clean and sleek looking. Really no complaints at all!My eyes are perfect so I won't be going back often, but it's nice to know I have a convenient reliable place nearby for the future! Would recommend to anyone in the streeterville/river north area looking for an eye doctor.

39.description: I feel compelled to write a review after reading so many negative comments. I decided to go here despite what I read since it is very close to my office. I cannot comment on their selection of glasses or the prices since I was only in need of a contact lens prescription/reorder.I found the staff to be professional and courteous all the way though from my first call to make the appointment though ordering my contacts. The woman handling my order gave me all my options to find the least expensive way to get my contacts and the price per box was comparable to any other place I've purchased contacts before. Dr. Lagina was also great. Very friendly and didn't scold me for wearing my 2 week disposable for 3 weeks! I will definitely go back to Rosin and would recommend to my friends.

37.description: I read the reviews and was a little apprehensive after doing so, but I kept my appointment and am glad I had. I typically only write reviews when I've had a troubling experience, but my trip to the eye doctor was so completely different than the reviews I had read, I felt the need to share my perspective.I was greeted as I walked in the door. The front desk staff was friendly and quickly located my name on the appointment calendar. I was handed a couple of forms to fill out as a new patient and was brought back as soon as I had completed them. The doctor (Dr. Lagina) administered several tests. When she had finished, she discussed my results and explained my options. Far more options than I had anticipated. I had some questions which she patiently walked me through. She made sure I understood everything before leaving. My experience couldn't have been more professional, friendly, or patient. I'm hopeful the previous reviews were either employees that are no longer there or I just had a different experience. Either way, they are my eye doctors of choice now!

0.description: I loved this place, from the minute I walked in I was greeted with respect, professionalism, and integrity. The Dr's were amazing, very nice and I was impressed with their ethic and manner.  Kevin was super nice, helpful, and helped me choose the right eye gear for me, I'd def. would go back when needed.

38.description: Awful. I came here because I was new to the city and it was one of the few places that accepted my vision insurance. I wouldn't waste my time or money here. I've been wearing glasses for about twenty years and this is the worst optometrist office I've been to by far. Similar to what others said, the staff was rude and completely incompetent, and the actual ophthalmic care was below mediocre . They couldn't confirm my insurance information even though what I gave them was correct, and couldn't have been more unprofessional about it. The receptionist was on the phone with my insurance company, couldn't figure it out after about thirty seconds, and actually literally handed the phone over the desk to me and said "Here, you talk to them." I was shocked at the level of unproffesionalism of this place. The exam with the doctor was alright, but then afterward, another office staffer gave me an additional "eye test" that I initially thought was a joke, having me look out of a junky tattered twenty year old hardcover book and point to things. In an office that arrogant and hoitty-toitty, that's the technology you're using? Really? I haven't seen that since elementary school vision screening. The did another additional test, which they had to administer, count it, FIVE times before they got it right. It would've been funny, except that told me AFTER that this "test" was actually not covered by my insurance and I had to pay out of pocket! They said they didn't realize what my insurance covered, OBVIOUSLY since instead of talking to my insurance company like you were supposed to you handed to phone for me to do it myself! Disclaimer, this was a while ago, but I would never EVER go back and highly recommend against this place.

27.description: I went here today for new glasses and I'm so glad I did!  Michelle was so great.  She immediately came up to me and assisted me in finding the perfect pair of glasses.   She was very honest (but in a very nice way) with what did and didn't look good.  She took her time and made sure I was happy and found what I was looking for. She did a great job of staying within my budget.  Her and the other girl working at the time (I'm sorry I forgot your name) had the best personalities and made the whole visit fun.  They are a great team.  Not to mention Dr. Lee was so friendly and helpful and ensured I got the correct eye glass prescription...really went above and beyond.  Thank you all!!!

32.description: I asked a co-worker where he had had his LASIK surgery done when I was looking into having mine done back in 2006.  My co-worked recommended Dr. Jonathan Rosin of Rosin EyeCare (rosineyecare.com), and after having been treated by Dr. Rosin myself, I now recommend him to others as well.  He was very friendly and knowledgeable.When I went in for my consultation, he first examined my eyes to determine if I was even eligible for the procedure, and then he explained how the procedure worked and made certain I was comfortable with everything.  I asked tons of questions because I was a bit nervous about the whole thing, and Dr. Rosin managed to answer all of my questions and put me at ease with going forward.When I went in for the procedure, they dilated my eyes, which seemed to take a long time.  After that, though, the whole procedure probably took about 15-20 minutes.  I just remember it being very quick.  Then, my fiancée drove me home, and I'm pretty sure I was back in the office the next day.I had my consultation in their office on Michigan Avenue and my surgery in Niles.

48.description: I've gotten several pairs of lenses for my Air Titanium frames from Rosin downtown and from their Morton Grove office.  I bring my son to Rosin because of their extensive selection of frames.   All very hip and cool with the few traditionals tossed in there.I really love their displays at this office. The only complaint I've had with Rosin are their Managers.   There's a gal here that totally gets on my nerves so I try to get around dealing with her.    Matter of fact there's a lenscrafters manager that totally pisses me off too(ill get on that review - lincolnwood)

44.description: It was okay.  Three stars for everyone being really nice and for fitting me in at pretty convenient times.  Dr. Amy Lagina was REALLY REALLY nice. Like maybe too nice for 9 am on a Saturday...  Didn't like their glasses selection that much.  And I really didn't like how I spent 30 mins on the phone when I scheduled my appt going over insurance info, and then had to review that again before my appt, and then again after my appointment. So I wouldn't go out of my way to recommend it, but I will probably go back just because now I kind of have a Dr there.

24.description: I went here to pick out a new pair of glasses. Not only did they have a wide selection of frames, including frames in petite sizes that I was searching for, but the staff was also very nice and helpful. The person who I worked with selected a number of different frames for me to try on that she thought might look good on me. I appreciated what a good job she did at selecting frames for me and also appreciated her honesty about whether or not each pair looked good on me. She took the time to help me try on a variety of different pairs of glasses until I finally settled on the perfect pair. I will be returning to Rosin Eyecare next time I need new glasses.

7.description: I can't imagine a more ideal vision care experience. Dr. Parker at Rosin Eyecare was tremendously knowledgeable, professional, and punctual throughout my routine vision test this week. I suppose Rosin could improve in its on-site selection of glasses. But for a world filled with Warby Parker-wearers, I'm not sure it would matter too much anyway. Thanks for an awesome experience, Rosin Eyecare!

40.description: I used Rosin for Lasik eye surgery in February 2009 and had various routine follow up appointments afterwards.  Dr Lagina and Dr Rosin themselves are very attentive, responsive and have a good demeanor. Also, the folks that help through the process were very good as well.  Much like what others have written, the front desk is absolutely horrible.  When I first visited, I was asked to sign a notice stating that I had received their privacy practice documentation (standard practice of course) -but they never provided it, I asked the front desk to provide me a copy.  The lady looked at me like I asked for her first born. She rummaged through a file cabinet, complained that it was many pages long, they only had one copy, etc.  I ended up telling her that we can do this two ways - either they give me the HIPAA privacy documentation and I will sign and confirm that I have received it, or I won't sign the form.  When I arrive for office visits, they seem preoccupied in themselves.  I originally selected this location because of proximity to work.  Lastly, in terms of office wait, I usually have been in the chair within 10-15 minutes of my arrival, but most of my appointments have been in the mid to late afternoon.   I would rate them much higher if the pretentious wanna be gold coast front desk staff were much nicer and helpful.

30.description: I chose this eye doctor because it was covered under my insurance and close to home. I have had an eye exam, purchased glasses, then went back for a contact fitting a few months later. The first doctor I saw was great - very nice and friendly and made me feel at ease. I purchased glasses a few days later and the staff was very friendly, and didn't push the more expensive glasses. I went back a few months later after I decided that I wanted to give contacts a try. I was examined by another doctor, who wasn't as great as the first one. He seemed a little bit nervous about everything he was saying. But it was fine. Then one of their staff brought me into a room to teach me how to put them in/take them out. I found something that I am not good at - wearing contacts! But she was soooo patient, and helpful. I was there for over two hours, but still didn't get the hang of it. She had me come back a week later for round 2 of lessons. She wasn't there, but another member of their staff helped and I finally go the hang of it. The first girl even called to see how I was doing. Overall, I have had nothing but good experiences and friendly staff. I would recommend this office to anyone.

46.description: After having had ludicrously bad service from Lenscrafters and Pearle Vision (really snarky, haughty attitude from the opticians when you don't buy the $500 pair of glasses), I was really pleased to find Rosin Eye Care via my Vision Service Plan.From start to finish, they were professional, polite, fun, and very friendly.  My eye doctor, Dr. Amy Lagina, was very sweet and friendly, too.  Usually, I have a little trepidation of the eye tests (especially the ones where they use the machines to blow a puff in your eye or to get really close), but she set my mind at ease.  They have a great selection of glasses.  I didn't buy a pair this time, but maybe next time.  Mark took care of me, and he showed me several very cool pairs.  I'm definitely a return customer.

1.description: Please go elsewhere. If I could give this place less than 1 star I would.Extremely terrible customer service involving multiple parties, as well as negligent eye care involving optometrists - all leading to a horrible eye infection.I am lucky here because my boss is the one with the terrible infection because of their negligence. I, though, had to be the one to coordinate everything which was an ordeal in itself.Here is what all went wrong:The wrong contacts were ordered after the first visit.Went back to get correct contacts, could not provide these so they "ordered" a new box, gave a trial pair (only good for a few days) & told me to come by tomorrow to pick up the ordered contacts.Went back, only provided me with an additional trial pair that would last 30 days even though they made it seem I would pick up the full rx the next day - said that they had ordered the correct contacts (full box) and would be there in 3-4 business days.The trial pair(s) / the original wrongly ordered contacts caused a horrible eye infection.I called to make him an appointment - phones were not turned on until 9:30, hours say they opened at 9 am.He went back in to see a doctor, they called in the rx. He went to go get said rx immediately because he was in pain.Once at the pharmacy, he learned that they never called in the rx, called the office multiple times but the phone was turned off in the middle of the day (not during a lunch break), had to walk back to the office.Medical information was still out on desk, blatant HIPAA violation, waited 15 min and no one came to the front, finally was able to grab a written rx after finding staff in the break room.After using the rx, his eye became worse. Went back in, saw a new optometrist who let him know that it wasn't bacterial but viral and that the doctor before should have told me that if it didn't improve this would be the case...never was told any of this beforehand.To top it off, found out they had never ordered the correct contacts to begin with & they had to overnight them...It was pretty much a big mess from start to finish. The office manager blamed it entirely on the receptionist staff, saying one person was out. Seems hard to believe that one person being out caused this many issues - if that's true, there needs to be a change in their business practices.

9.description: Make sure that if you order anything through this office that you do not go through Kevin, he is incompetent and rude. Terrible customer service yet again from this office.

26.description: REVIEW FOR LASIK ONLY:I came here after I had been to LasikPlus and Kraff Eye Institute upon a recommendation from another friend. I was told to be out of my glasses for 9 days, and got to my appointment where the eye doctor performed tests to see if I would be a candidate. So, the doctor tells me that the maximum prescription that they do for patients, and I am like -2 above that. He tells me that they are a conservative practice and like to be like 96% confidence in their success rate, and basically with my obscenely high prescription that I'd be treading waters with them. The thickness of my cornea was actually fine like 550 and they want you to be around 500. So, I asked why they just didn't ask me what my prescription was in the first place as to not waste my time. The doctor says that sometimes patients can actually have the wrong prescription off by -2 even, and I'm thinking like that would have not made a difference in my case. So, no I am not a candidate here. Honestly, I have been wearing my current eye glass prescription for probably about a good 10 years with the fluctuation of -.5 or something so I'm going to be pretty close. Another wasted effort...

25.description: Do not go here! They pressure you into LASIK and have horrible service and doctors.

12.description: They broke my $500.00 Tom Ford frames and they don't want to pay for them.  Initially, they simply told me there's nothing they can do.  I was extremely insulted.  Now, I'm fighting with them to pay for my frames.  I've been a loyal customer for many years and this is the treatment I get.  Game on...

21.description: I had a great first eye doctor appointment (first time ever!). Stephanie Parker was my doctor and she was very kind and talked me through each step and found me the perfect prescription. She also allowed me to schedule the dilation for another day (no charge) as I wasn't aware of how long the effects would continue (2-3 hours) and had a few other errands to run that day. I then worked with Jaron Taylor on picking frames. He sure knows his stuff and helped me select a great frame that fit my face well along with selecting one that would fit into my lifestyle.

17.description: I am very satisfied with my glasses/prescription. The doctors were friendly and knowledgeable. The staff was courteous My only complaint is that I had to go back twice, because my first prescription appeared to be only for near - range seeing. One eye was very blurry at distance.

10.description: Overall, Rosin provides great eye care. The doctors are professional, on time, and efficient while taking the time to discuss options available.

5.description: Professional and clinically on target. My wife finally has received excellent care after being examined at Rosin. Highly recommend. Thank you.

3.description: I LOVED my visit here. The young ladies at the desk were attentive and nice and answered all of my questions (only asked 1). My doctor was Carly Szafranski and I highly recommend her. She made the visit easy and smooth but was very detailed in her work. She was very open to my suggestions and gave me lots of options as far as lenses and gave me advice on how to improve my eyesight. The best visit with an Optometrist that I have ever had! They had a nice variety of designer frames, I went with the hipster Ray Ban, but they have others that fit whatever style you have. I was in and out in about 30 or 40 minutes.

35.description: So a few things -- I'll be honest and say last year I came in without a problem.  This year -- not so much.At the beginning of the appointment, they ask you for an extra $15 for a glaucoma screening.  This is a ploy.  Any regular eye exam (after they put the drops in and look around internally) will show glaucoma.  I've worn glasses since I was three -- so don't try to pull a fast one on me and charge me extra for something the annual exam includes anyway. Don't go.

19.description: TL: DR, this place made my vision worse by not giving me the right instructions, and the optometrist laughed at me after he realized I'd sustained permanent eye damage.I came here on a relative's recommendation. I had one appointment that was uneventful, got some glasses for computer eye strain, and then as my vision worsened I had two more appointments with a doctor who was terrible. The front desk staff was very nice and the opticians who helped me select/prepared my glasses were very sweet and helpful, so that's why they get two stars instead of a lowly one...The problem is with the optometrist I saw for my second two appointments. I cannot recall his name, but he was younger with dark hair. Everything with the first exam went fine, but he gave me no instructions on how to wear my glasses, nor did he mention they should be for distance only, nor did he bother updating my prescription for computer glasses to treat my eye strain from my job even though he asked about my work and how often I went on computers. I left under the impression that I had one pair of glasses to wear all the time, which was wrong.The second appointment I had, about 9-12 months later, I had the same doctor, and he laughed at me once he found out I had been wearing my glasses wrong. He couldn't keep a straight face the whole appointment, including when he informed me that 'you've actually, hah, made your vision worse by wearing those glasses when you work on the computer, heh.' I asked him about contact lenses and he laughed at me again and told me 'actually, hah, I want you in bifocals.' He couldn't say bifocals without chuckling, as though they were the ugliest glasses in the world. Then he informed me not to be upset and that people get Lasik just to see as well as I see so I shouldn't be upset. Well, it's not about what you want for me, Doctor, and it's your responsibility to tell your patients how to use the glasses you prescribe, without laughing at them.  I work as a graphic designer and now my eyesight is permanently worse: my eyes are my profession and I clearly trusted the wrong person with their care.I have since taken my business to Chicago Vision Club, and they're amazing (I'll be reviewing them next to make up for this nasty review). They told me that had I been prescribed proper glasses for computer use and given detailed instructions by my optometrist at Rosin, I could have prevented a lot of damage. So now I have distance and computer glasses, and I'll never be back to Rosin. Rosin is without a doubt the worst recommendation I've ever gotten. Don't bother coming here.

28.description: The office staff here is awful. My eye exam appointment took over two hours. The eye exam portion with the doctor was fine. I asked the staff to assist me in finding a frame, and I was told "go ahead and pick some out" without any sort of help at all. When I finally picked out a pair, waiting for them to ring up my glasses purchase took over an hour because there was one guy who appeared to kinda know what he was doing. I sat and waited for SO LONG that a manager finally took notice and came up to me and asked me why I was still waiting. I said "I don't know" and she had one of the (several) front desk people assist me. Thing is - that lady didn't know what she was doing and told me she'd have to wait for the guy to help. So basically, I sat across the desk from her in total silence for an additional 15 minutes while I waited for him to finish up someone else's order.They then went on to use the excuse that my insurance was "unknown" and therefore takes significantly longer to complete the transaction. Really? EyeMed is an unknown insurance? Because I'm pretty sure that nothing should ever take that long to ring up EVER no matter what the excuse. And guess what? I don't care. If you don't know my insurance, or if it's too difficult to help people who have my insurance, then don't accept appointments from people with that insurance. So two weeks later, I went over to pick up my glasses and apparently they don't do any sort of adjustment or checking of the frames other than to look at them on your face and say "yep, look straight!" They don't check fit behind your ears, the width of your face, nothing. When I asked them about whether there's an adjustment to make sure they fit my head properly I was told "we do an adjustment when they come in to make sure they're level on the table and the arms touch the table equally top and bottom."..........seriously?!?!That would be FANTASTIC if every head was completely symetrical and level like a table. .... which they NEVER ARE.I just took my glasses and left rather than have them sit there and look at me with the look of pure attitude and confusion. Once I was back in my office I followed up with a call to the store manager. She was very apologetic and offered the alternative of going to a different store to have them checked, which I'll do next time I have a spare hour laying around that I don't need. Ridiculous.

45.description: what a bunch of idiots that work in this place! and talk about unfriendly doctors...thanks, but no thanks.rosin, you may be close to work and convenient for me, but for all of the sh*t you've put me through, i'm never coming back!you screwed up my contact prescription twice! causing me to walk around like someone tripping out on acid. when i came back in to have another doctor evaluate my prescription, she said that i had to be charged for another exam and that the prescription for my contacts that i re-ordered was invalid because it had been over a year ago and it had expired. well maybe the idiots behind the desk should have told me that before they ordered my contacts that were the WRONG prescription than what i gave them. it turns out...my prescription DIDN'T change and they had made 2 mistakes and cost me money that could have been spent in more useful ways. in the meantime, here i am, the CUSTOMER, walking around with contacts that i cannot see correctly out of it (and i have really bad eyes too, -12.50), and they did not treat me well. so finally i get the yearly exam (and i don't trust their doc's expertise there, i'm going to an ophthalmologist from now on, no more half-ass eye docs) and i order my contacts. they tell me that they would send them directly to my apartment so that i didn't have to come back in again (thank god!), so i get a call a week later that my contacts are in at their office, without asking why they didn't arrive at my address (i just expected this from them, they're idiots), i came in to pick them up. a week goes by and i get another package...another yearly set of contacts. HAHAHAHAH, i got the last laugh on this one...because they ordered me 2 years of contacts and only charged me for 1!!oh..wait, it gets better!! they call me a few weeks later and say, " your contacts have come in, please come and pick them up at our store." they left me another message like this and said they would dispose of them if i didn't come to get them - at this point, i felt guilty, so i never came to pick up a 3rd set of contacts that they ordered by mistake! i wonder how many other people they do this to?? stay FAR AWAY from rosin eye care on mich ave!!

33.description: I went to Rosin to be evaluated for lasik eye surgery.  The front desk staff was very welcoming and informative. Megan who gave me my preliminary exam was very knowledgeable and friendly. I then met with Dr Rosin who gave me my final exam and explained my eyes were not bad enough to receive this procedure. I would recommend Rosin eye care  to anyone who wants a trusted eye care provider..

43.description: Nice doctors, but some of the people at the front desk are obtuse and uncooperative. Also, anyone who pays for glasses at one of these places is a chump. I got my glasses from the internet and am more than satisfied. Check out glassyeyes.blogspot.com  or goggles4u.com.  Then buy yourself a nice dinner with the savings.

2.description: Terrible customer service. They were trying to make sure I buy my contacts through their service. So they gave me an estimate - AND filed a claim that led to a hold on my insurance benefits. When I started shopping around online I could not use my benefits because they were on hold. So i had to spend an hour in the morning trying to resolve this issue.The price they quoted was not the best too. I am very disappointed about this way of tricking people into buying. I am definitely not coming back.

18.description: I came in for a routine eye exam and new glass's i bought the frame that the Rosin person suggested.After more then three, return visits and three different attempts, it was determined that the frame was wrong for my vision. That took over two month's and three different taking my glass's back to the lab.Finally, after meeting with the Mgr, before the store opened, the mgr got the right frame for my vision, Even then, they had to order new lens to put in the automatic light darkening lens i had originally ordered two months and over five visits later, i got glass's that workThe mgr (Samantha) really cared, but it was pretty obvious the staff was sick of seeing me and NO ONE, really said, so sorry for your trouble, except for the Mgr.

41.description: Every time I go in, I'm there for at least 2 hrs. Half of that is just sitting there. I tried buying glasses and they tried to sell me a $600 pair of frames - not including the lenses and the cost of the visit. The doctor perscribed me eyedrops in a bottle that had maybe 10drops for $60, my eyes are just fine thank you. The front staff is RUDE and very unhelpful. They get all pissy when you ask questions. I tried ordering a year supply of contacts, and since i ordered earlier this year they won't let me. WTF. It's my insurance, and it's my money that i'll now take else where.

4.description: The only reason why I'm giving this place 4 stars is because they cancelled my appointment the day of. Unfortunately, I didn't get the voicemail in time and showed up anyway. I was told the eye doctor was sick and I'd have to reschedule.  My calendar is constant insanity and I informed them I really didn't have another date I could do. They were nice enough to get me in with another doctor. He was very nice and did my contact eye exam with ease. I was in and out in under an hour. My appointment was the end of last week and my contacts are already available for pickup.  They also wished me an early birthday when they called to tell me - a special touch that not all places would do. It's conveniently located to my office and it was also incredibly easy to book an appointment online. I seriously avoid calling people like the plague, so this was a huge bonus for me. I imagine in a year when I need a new prescription, I will come back.

6.description: Great visit. In and out relatively quickly. Front office staff helped located my vision insurance even though I didn't have appropriate documentation with me. Doctor was friendly and thorough, made sure all questions were answered, and delivered everything I needed on my visit (new Rx, new contacts, etc.).

22.description: I enjoy the people in the office and they are very thorough in the appointments. I really recommend talking with Brad (office manager) if you think there is an issue. I had very good experiences here and (as most people do) got very upset when I had one frustrating moment of mis-information. I have a very weak prescription and I ended up getting the priciest (biotrue) contacts. I expected quality and they were horrible. They sent me home with a few pairs and they were ripping in my eyes and unbearable to wear for 8 hours. I am not qualified to say this but I think since my prescription is so weak that the contact material is too thin. When I went to pick my order up they mentioned that they were very highly rated and the trials were probably bad. This seemed reasonable to me because I have had something like this happen with a bad batch of contacts before and I also couldn't expect the front desk person to know what was wrong with them and I had to go.I kept having the problems and I decided to go through my 6-month supply, which took me close to a year because I don't wear them often. I mostly wore my glasses or would only wear them to the gym for a couple of hours. I figured I had to pay out of pocket on top of insurance so I'd try to use them as much as possible. Most of them ripped or chunks came off the edges before I even put them in.I called in because I was finally out of them. My insurance doesn't renew until 8/30 and I just wanted to order some contacts to get me through next month and a half and I obviously didn't want these contacts. When I called in to get just any other dailies that they have... I was told that they couldn't switch brands so close to the end of my insurance. I wasn't given an alternative on the phone and I didn't ask more, I just got mad.Long story short(er)... Brad reached out to me and cleared everything up. I am going to get a brand that I had prior to these until I come in for my yearly appointment and look into Lasik. I'm glad that everything has been worked out. It is hard to remember but a lot of general office staff will try to answer questions to help you out as a customer. They are not being malicious but they might not always give accurate information. I suppose this applies anywhere but I recommend not getting upset when something seems wrong and try to dig in and get answers.

15.description: This company has been a nightmare. It's not necessarily this doctor specifically. But I have been mislead and experience quite a run around in diagnosis. When I thought I was going in to have an issue taken care of, I was instead given temporary treatments twice that required more and more visits and bills. Very disappointed.

20.description: I was having MAJOR issues with one of my eyes. I wasn't sure if I had scratched it or I had pink eye. I could barely open it and was very light sensitive, so an appointment was necessary. I first went to immediate care and I guess they ended up prescribing me some sort of allergy drops.. that were $90?! CRAZY. I saw that Rosin was close to my work office so I called to schedule an emergency appointment. I was able to get right in the day of and the woman that I saw was so gentle and helpful. I have been to a few eye doctors that haven't been so gentle and didn't take their time with me, but she did. She gave me two different kind of drops and gave me her 24/7 on call number in case something went wrong. She also scheduled a two day follow-up appointment and called to check on me the following week.

36.description: YES! A great provider. If you need your eyes checked out or need glasses or contacts, this is the place.I was the last appointment of the day to have my eyes checked and like any doctor at the end of the day, she was a bit behind. No problem though. My fault for booking that late. Good to know that they stay late on Tuesdays though. If you need an appointment after work, that's the day to do it.The Doc was friendly, knowledgeable, and had a cool, quirky personality. Dare I say...I had a bit of fun in my eye exam. She explained everything to me in detail and even over explained a bit. Fine by me.As for the office staff...GREAT! Everyone was so nice and helpful. The girl who was helping me to order my contacts even offered me cookies that they had there for the employees. I love me some cookies!I didn't get glasses on this trip but they seem to have a large selection and based on the service that I got, I'm sure they are terrific at helping to pick out great frames.This will definitely be my eye doctor moving forward. I can't wait until I need new glasses. Maybe they'll have cake.

14.description: I had an eye exam and purchased glasses using my Eyemed benefits.  When the tech totaled my cost I asked for an itemized bill for which he wrote out the frame cost, lens cost, etc. I asked were any of those features optional. He said no.  I later called Eyemed to ask about the charges and was told one of those charges was free and that I had been charged a $25 service fee for which I had no knowledge about.  I questioned the store as to why the charges and the itemization did not match.  They then offered to refund my (optional) $25 service fee but needed my card to do so.  I also asked was it their custom to sell the display frames because clearly I did not receive a new pair (visible scratches on my pair)  and they were ready in less than a week.  I have been wearing glasses for over 20 years but never experienced such shadiness until now.

58.description: Great place to have some vegetarian options. They have a huge variety of Mimosas and good collection of coffee beans. Don't forget to try Latte with almond milk. I love the veggie skillet and the place is right around Downtown.

56.description: The Farm to table is a very cool concept one I am familiar with living in Austin, TX so I was pleasantly surprised to find this place.  Bobby's bike tour recommended it and it was great.  I had the omelet and some coffee it was cool to see on the menu where every part of my omelet came from (local farms there in IL). If I lived in Chicago I would be back.

29.description: The breakfast was absolutely delicious! The ingredients they use are all one's looking for in a healthy meal.  The kids shared pancakes. We had poached veggie ciabatta something which was a hearty meal and very delicious.  The service could've been better as they didn't remember little details like whip cream on those pancakes.  Yet the servers were very nice, apologized profusely and blamed it on not been used to so many customers on a Monday.  Overall good breakfast!

42.description: We were in town for a long weekend.  Our condo was right around the corner.  The reviews looked great.  The prices seemed a little high but we're from San Diego so we weren't that surprised.  We headed down for breakfast.  Then we waited, and waited and waited...20 mins to get seated.  Not so bad.  Then 30 more minutes to get a cup of coffee and champagne. 1 hour to receive food that was mediocre at best. Usually, I would never wait 30 minutes for a cup of coffee, but at 15 minutes, I felt invested.  The waitress kept telling us it was coming.  But where was it coming from?  They have no pots of coffee.  It looks like each cup is prepared individually.  As for the champagne.  I love the bottomless idea.  But I don't like that they pour it from a bottle into a carafe, then they pour it into your glass.  Bubbles, where are the bubbles?  None left after a double pour.  The pulled pork I heard so much about was way too sweet for my taste.  The omelet our friend had looked like a sorry overcooked mess.   My husband's eggs weren't cooked correctly but there was no way we were sending it back.  Maybe the reviewers are so taken by the locally sourced food that they overlook the quality and the service.  I don't.

23.description: Went for dinner - it's an interesting atmosphere.  Feels very casual but the menu seems like it's trying to be a bit more fancy.Cheese board was pretty standard, nothing special.My friend and I split the pulled pork and the burger.  I didn't care for the pulled pork and the burger was fine but I've had better bar burgers other places.  The fries were good but again, you can get decent fries anywhere.We also got the mac and cheese - I'm a sucker for trying mac and cheese at different places and am rarely disappointed.  But this completely lacked flavor.  I would not recommend getting it - even if you are as tempted as I am by mac and cheese.I wouldn't go back if it were my own decision but if I ever did find myself there again, I'd try the truffle flat bread - that smelled really good.

47.description: Update for brunch- I came here for brunch the other day. I love the side walk seating if the weather is nice. It was much less crowded than Yolk down the street that had a crowd of people hovering outside.I had the pulled pork benedict and a latte and both were great.  The pulled pork was nicely cooked and flavorful and the potatoes were crispy and well seasoned.  At $14 for the benedict the prices are a little steep, but brunch in general in the city is expensive, and yolk's regular benedict is $12.49 (cheapest around here is West egg at 10.50)  so it's comparable for better food, delicious pulled pork instead of canadian bacon and a better atmosphere. As noted numerous times on yelp- this place is not fast, but why come here if you need a quick meal?  This is a place to relax, if you are in a rush just come and get a pastry to go instead.

8.description: I wanted to love this place, as it's in my neighborhood, but it's just not my jam. I respect what they're trying to do with local, organic food - but for me, the taste just wasn't there. I ordered apple cinnamon french toast for brunch, and it just wasn't good - the apple compote was good, but there wasn't much of it, and the french toast itself was very dry and flavorless. I added a lot of whipped cream (which was fantastic) to make it work. My side of bacon was quite tasty, but my friend was also underwhelmed with her breakfast burrito - it needed something to liven it up. She asked for sour cream (they didn't have any) and settled for salsa, which helped but didn't redeem the dish. I understand why the prices are higher, and I know that, in theory, the quality of ingredients is probably higher. But it didn't translate into a more enjoyable dish, and I don't feel passionately enough about eating local to return.

31.description: I really wanted to love this place. For the concept. For the what I assumed would be unique dishes. For someone who works there who I thought was pretty cute.But, sadly, I don't love it. The place: Our server was nice, courteous. We sat outside, so I didn't get a great read on the interior, but nothing stood out really as terrible or amazing. I think it's probably nice enough inside, but my friends and I appreciated sitting outside, on one of the 12 Chicago days that we're able to.The taste: We got some breakfast skillets....and they weren't bad, but they were overpriced for what they were, and they weren't amazing. This place obviously prides itself on highlighting local products. My New Yorker friend hated the ketchup. It lacks high fructose corn syrup, and to him, any flavor that he could tolerate. We suggested that he walk around with his own bottle of heinz going forward, but in this moment, he had to, in his opinion suffer through the less than palatable midwestern ketchup. I didn't think it was as terrible, but it was a flavor I wasn't used to and didn't particularly enjoy. The mushrooms in the veggie skillet - those stood out as juicy, flavorful, delicious. But the main "vegetable?" in the skillet was potatoes. I guess when I'm going to a place to experience local cuisine, I don't get that excited about local potatoes. Maybe that's just me, but there were so many potatoes, and I would have rather had a skillet highlighting other veggies.My face: A little let down. I think we each paid around $25 for our respective dishes, with coffee, which was almost worth the $4. I get it, intelligensia, that's what it costs, and it's good, so okay. Still $25 seemed steep for this brunch. I think you pay a little for the locavore aspect, and a lot for the location. Not sure I'd go back again.....if someone was in a bind, I might recommend it.
