34.description: I went to local root with a large crazy group. My group wanted bottomless mimosas ($19/person). I was a little bit disappointed with the service. I ordered coffee when I got there, and I did not get it until everyone had already gotten their food. I had to ask two people about it. They also forgot the juice I ordered. Everyone else's food came out. They brought out an omelet for me, but it wasn't what I ordered. I had to tell two people the my food was missing. The server eventually stopped by and stated that it was forgotten and needed to be finished (not her fault). They brought out the omelet I ordered, but I had subbed out for fruit which they forgot. It was dropped off very quickly and I couldn't get the servers attention before she walked away. No one came back very quickly so I was unable to ask them to fix it. I also had toast and was not brought any jam or butter. It was just a dry piece of bread (can I not have jelly with my $15 omelet?)Food was okay. It wasn't the best I had. Not sure it was worth all of the hassle. They need more servers. The one we had was friendly but so busy that it was hard to get what I ordered. Tracking down a server was hard. They need to hire more people. I've had better in Chicago.

16.description: I really wanted to love this place. For the concept. For the what I assumed would be unique dishes. For someone who works there who I thought was pretty cute.But, sadly, I don't love it. The place: Our server was nice, courteous. We sat outside, so I didn't get a great read on the interior, but nothing stood out really as terrible or amazing. I think it's probably nice enough inside, but my friends and I appreciated sitting outside, on one of the 12 Chicago days that we're able to.The taste: We got some breakfast skillets....and they weren't bad, but they were overpriced for what they were, and they weren't amazing. This place obviously prides itself on highlighting local products. My New Yorker friend hated the ketchup. It lacks high fructose corn syrup, and to him, any flavor that he could tolerate. We suggested that he walk around with his own bottle of heinz going forward, but in this moment, he had to, in his opinion suffer through the less than palatable midwestern ketchup. I didn't think it was as terrible, but it was a flavor I wasn't used to and didn't particularly enjoy. The mushrooms in the veggie skillet - those stood out as juicy, flavorful, delicious. But the main "vegetable?" in the skillet was potatoes. I guess when I'm going to a place to experience local cuisine, I don't get that excited about local potatoes. Maybe that's just me, but there were so many potatoes, and I would have rather had a skillet highlighting other veggies.My face: A little let down. I think we each paid around $25 for our respective dishes, with coffee, which was almost worth the $4. I get it, intelligensia, that's what it costs, and it's good, so okay. Still $25 seemed steep for this brunch. I think you pay a little for the locavore aspect, and a lot for the location. Not sure I'd go back again.....if someone was in a bind, I might recommend it.

13.description: I will start this review by saying that my food was pretty good. However, most of my table had issues with their food (there were 8 of us). Many people complained of under or overcooked food and/or missing food (items that were ordered and never came).The concept of the restaurant is nice. We went there for a friend's birthday who is very into farm-to-table restaurants. When we got there, we ordered cocktails. The service from the start was extremely slow (and the restaurant wasn't even half full). We had to ask for things multiple times because the waiter would forget to bring someone's drink or appetizer. The food came out and my sandwich was great (I had the pulled pork). I was a little bummed because the mac and cheese never mentioned that it had mustard on top - that kind of ruined it for me. There were a few things on the menu like that where not all the dominant flavors were listed and in my example with the mac and cheese, it made it so I didn't want to eat it. All in all, we had pretty bad service and the food was just average. Probably not a place that I would frequent again.

11.description: The food itself was good, so no complaints there. The service on the other hand was a bit lacking. Had a very unenthusiastic waiter and looked as if he was hungover. Look, I get it, we've all somewhat been there, but I couldn't overcome the slow, awkward service.

39.description: Went in for brunch.  A few diners inside and a few more outside - I came in around Noon.  Waiter added feta to my skillet.  The eggs over easy sat long enough under the lamps to harden the yolks.  My extra crispy potatoes request was ignored.  Ordered an iced tea.  It was flavored and tasted like crap.  Add on waffle came first and it was cold.  No butter in sight.  I am all for local, sustainable and organic restaurants, but they just blew it.  The place wasn't busy.  There was no reason to not be served as soon as it was ready.  For farm to table, seasonal, sustainable and organic food I will gladly pay a premium, which I did here.  I left disappointed.  It's really a shame.

37.description: Horrible!My brother had the closest thing to a burger and he had to go to mcdonalds after it was so bad. My sandwich was aweful, and our parents didn't have anything good either. It was all overpriced crap. The soda, which they claim to be home made, was even terrible. I'm not even picky. Never again.

0.description: Wow!I'm really glad that I didn't check the reviews before going to Local Root!I was driving my son to the airport and we were trying to find a lunch place that served clean, tasty organic options (besides the cafe in Whole Foods).My son ordered a mocha coffee drink which was rich & delicious and I started with some Jasmine Tea which you get at least 2 full cups of in the pot.I'm self admittedly a tea snob and a stickler for organic tea. The selection was fun and my choice was soooo good - like a warm hug - very satisfying!He ordered a burger - after the first bite he was interrupted from inhaling it only to say how amazing it was. Edzo's (Burgers) in Evanston is an excellent option for grass fed and organic beef burgers, truffle fries etc , and finding this place was a real treat.He said the burger tasted like it had truffle in it. It was served with home made chips as well.I ordered the beet/arugula/goat cheese salad with candied walnuts and a piece of salmon on the side.The salad was fresh, the dressing was perfect and the salmon was moist and extremely tasty (I'm craving it right now).This place will definitely be a "go to" place when in the area.I'm not sure about these other mixed reviews, I just know we had excellent meals as well as friendly attentive service.BTW - I rarely write reviews on YELP but this restaurant deserved my recognition.

38.description: We came by on a weekday for brunch. Service was decent although you could tell that our waitress was really trying (sometimes a little too hard) to connect with us. It was too slow though but I think it was because she was pretty much the only one covering the other tables, but sometimes she was simply nowhere in sight. You can tell that food here is supposed to be healthy and locally sourced - it actually reminds me of certain places out in the West where this is a pretty big deal. I got the Champagne chicken sandwich - chicken was pretty dry but I enjoyed the tomato jam and the brioche bread. My sister got the pulled pork benedict which we both expected to taste better given that it's supposed to be one of their most frequently ordered items. I didn't get the smoky, pulled pork flavor I wanted. Overall the flavors of their dishes are pretty toned down compared to the average American food which is fine if that's what you're expecting. Then again, I was not expecting the ketchup to taste like pasta sauce. There was no thickness to it at all! I do think that prices are on the higher end and it would be better to drop it down by about two dollars. My chicken sandwich was simply not worth the $12, even if you throw in the quality of the ingredients (and well, the chicken was dry).

51.description: They make really -really good coffee.  thanks for making me feel good every time I get one.

27.description: Went for brunch on a Saturday morning. Wait was about 30 mins but we just sat at the bar. Mimosas were ok. Not great. Service was great. Got the tofu scramble and the waffles. Both were average. Great ambience and love the picket fences outside. Really think they could make better mimosas. Wish the tofu scramble came with toast or something. All in all- a nice place for brunch

32.description: Went here for brunch on a Saturday morning. We ended up having to wait quite a while to be seated although we did request to eat outside on the 6 or so table patio. I had the grass fed burger while my companion had the eggs benedict. My burger was definitely good, although I thought it was too expensive ($16). There is an Irish place, Dublin's, in the Gold Coast which has in my opinion better burgers for $9. The eggs benedict received a decent rating although I do not think it was noteworthy. Overall, I think this is a decent option if you are in the area, but the higher than average prices for good, but not great, food, means I probably will not be a repeat customer.

54.description: 5 stars for the quality and taste of the food but very expensive for the amount you get. $12 for sausage and biscuits with two tiny pieces of sausage! $12 for a salad with no protein! Croissants are soft and fluffy wonderful in fact but also $12 for an egg and cheese sandwich. This place should be a $$$ place since you get so little for what you pay for!

48.description: Jesse was our server, very personalable. The drink make this a 4 star. Gimlet...Soo good. Crab cakes spicy and very go9d. Skip the stuffed mushroom, too muchstuffing not enough mushroom.

44.description: I'll start off by saying the food and drinks were awesome. We started off with cheese and charcuterie  the assortment was great. Really loved the brie. For entrees we had a burger, watermelon salad, and portobello mushroom, all excellent. Great melding of ingredients to make amazing flavors. The drinks were also very good with the unique assortment of spirits. In all the food is five stars.The service is a whole other story. Started by putting my name on a list and had another group seated before us who arrived after us. Once seated it took 20min before our waitress showed up. She was very nice and knew the menu well. It took another 20min to get our drinks, 10 min after that the app showed up missing one of the meats. Took 10min to get the missing meat. Then took another 20min to get a second round of drinks. About 10min later the food showed up. Didn't bother to ask about dessert since it had taken so long for everything else. In total dinner with an app took almost 2hr. If you have time to kill and are very proactive on ordering drinks can be very enjoyable experience. The manager was apologetic through the entire process and comped our drinks. Assuming they were short staffed because they weren't terribly busy. Would try it again because of the quality of food, but service will need to improve.Happy Dinning!

24.description: Though they clearly try very hard to promote the "local", "organic" and "homemade" brand, this is nothing more than a pricey, average brunch place with very standard at best food. The waiters are not really accommodating of special requests and customizations and try to charge extra for any changes to the menu, which is fair, however they also don't seem to put that much thought into what I ordered, bringing me regular coffee when I asked for iced. It wasn't a big deal, but that was just an added annoyance on top of the others. I would probably opt for something different next time, but it was overall just a fairly average dining experience.

7.description: Confusion and side talk encompassed the host process.  Sure we walked in without a reservation but the hostess appeared confused as what to do and then carried on a 5 minute conversation with what appeared to be the bus boy without speaking one word to us.The food was boring and bordering on bad.The service was good.

49.description: I live close to this place, so it does become a choice of convenience. I SO want to love this place, but every time I try it, it always falls just short of something memorable. Food is becoming more consistent, which is important. They have a great concept of farm-to-table, though sometimes it seems the ingredients don't shine through. A lot of the food is salty. Other times, the food is very bland. They have a hard time striking exactly the right balance all of the time. I'm also not sure what I'm getting that is so unique to justify the cost - a $12 salad of iceberg lettuce and Caesar dressing?The service is friendly, but SO SLOW. That's nice when you're in no hurry, but for it to take over an hour to get a cup of soup and salad is ridiculous. Another table adjacent to mine had to get their food to go because it was taking so long to come out, and they had to return to work. Finally, I still think the prices are outrageous, even considering the organic sourced ingredients and neighborhood. My lunch of a cup of soup and salad cost $25. No alcohol, no frills, $25. It's simply not worth that cost for what you get at LocalRoot.

40.description: So. I love a good brunch and came across this place when searching for a good brunch spot (with mimosa's) near Navy Pier. Upon arrival there were people sitting outside and a few inside. We were greeted and immediately seated. I ordered the bottomless mimosa ($19) not realizing you could order by the glass ($8). Sounds good right? Yeah. Well when my glass was filled to the top with champagne and only a teaspoon of pineapple juice, I knew my liver was in trouble. Lol joking. FYI: The mimosa's come with freshly squeezed with OJ but I'm not a big fan of OJ so I asked for pineapple juice. But along with the glass was a carafe of champagne and pineapple juice mixed together. I couldn't finish the entire carafe and was unable to be charged for only a glass so be sure your order is correct when it's placed. For food I ordered the breakfast skillet which came with 2 eggs cooked your style, potatoes, caramelized onions, spinach (yum!) and mushrooms. You can add meat for an extra $4. I added bacon. It was good but  lacked a little flavor. I guess being from the south I'm used to bold flavors and this was kind of bland. Overall, I added some hot sauce and finished my meal. Our server (Samantha) was awesome and very attentive. The place had a very relaxed feel - I'd return. Oh yeah, the bathroom was super clean (major plus lol).

53.description: If you're looking for great food and friendly knowledgable staff with a relaxed atmosphere, this place has you covered. The chicken and waffles are phenomenal. The coffee mugs are large and they're quickly refilled. Bloody Mary - superb. The biggest problem is the price. Definitely not cheap.

30.description: We were quickly seated on a patio by one friendly staff member and promptly brought a bottle of water for the table. We had a bottle of Pinot Grigio for their half price bottle night (Tuesday) and also decided to order a cheese plate. The food is lovely - fresh and well curated. I wish we'd had a more competent server. He was remarkably absent and uninformed, although other employees we encountered were very helpful. I was dining as part of a couple, and had no introduction to the menu or the mission of the restaurant (which is why we chose it in the first place), although two girls at the next table seemed to get excellent service. For a place that advertises its craft beer, you expect the servers to have some knowledge of the selection. We also opted for a truffle flatbread (excellent) and beer flights (great selection of local beers). If our waiter would have remembered our order or been informed about which beers made up the beer flight, it would have made for an excellent date night.

46.description: Local Root is one of the few brunch places in my neighborhood, and while the food is decent, the service is amongst the worst I've experienced.  My friend and I were there this morning and were quoted a reasonable half an hour wait during peak brunch hours.  We went to the bar where it took the bartender 20 minutes to serve our Blood Mary's (which were very tasty).  Meanwhile about a quarter the tables in the restaurant were open with no one being seated - perhaps the kitchen needed to catch up.  Fifteen minutes after being seated, we still hadn't seen our server.  The neighboring table told us to plan on waiting forever or to talk to the host/manager.  Finally I went and asked the manager to send a server to our table and got zero apology.  It took 20 more minutes to get our coffee and soda (both were sitting on the counter waiting 10 minutes before we asked the bus boy to bring them over).  Our food came out separate - my friend was nearly done eating before my skimpy omelette arrived.   Meanwhile the table on our other side received superb service - apologies for the wait and were served 10 minutes before us despite being seated 10 minutes after us.Not sure how Local Root gets four stars with the service we experienced this morning.

1.description: A co-worker of mine recommended this restaurant to me. Funny enough, I heard about it and was one of the places I bookmarked to visit.  This was a great recommendation.The food was locally sourced so everything tasted fresh.  I ordered crab cakes and this by far surpassed all the other places in Chicago where I've had this dish.  They have the crunchiest exterior and when biting into the cakes, they had a nice chewiness - it was fresh!  And the waiter wasn't joking when he mentioned this dish was spicy, it had a kick.I washed the food down with an iced tea.  I think it was a peach iced tea which was the tastiest even though it wasn't sweetened.  The aroma of the fruits in the drink made me happy.Now, minus some points for the panna cotta.  Hello!?!?!  This needs works.  I'm thinking about the panna cotta dish I had back in New York and the panna cotta at Local Root was lacking.  I was cheating a little by having sugar but I honestly didn't feel bad about it because I didn't finish it.  It wasn't bad but it wasn't great either.  It could have used more fruit preserve topping.  Improve the desserts please!

55.description: Great place for breakfast or lunch.  Natural ingredients and a very friendly staff.  They had great mimosas and blood marys.

9.description: I went to local root with a large crazy group. My group wanted bottomless mimosas ($19/person). I was a little bit disappointed with the service. I ordered coffee when I got there, and I did not get it until everyone had already gotten their food. I had to ask two people about it. They also forgot the juice I ordered. Everyone else's food came out. They brought out an omelet for me, but it wasn't what I ordered. I had to tell two people the my food was missing. The server eventually stopped by and stated that it was forgotten and needed to be finished (not her fault). They brought out the omelet I ordered, but I had subbed out for fruit which they forgot. It was dropped off very quickly and I couldn't get the servers attention before she walked away. No one came back very quickly so I was unable to ask them to fix it. I also had toast and was not brought any jam or butter. It was just a dry piece of bread (can I not have jelly with my $15 omelet?)Food was okay. It wasn't the best I had. Not sure it was worth all of the hassle. They need more servers. The one we had was friendly but so busy that it was hard to get what I ordered. Tracking down a server was hard. They need to hire more people. I've had better in Chicago.

26.description: I would take a star off for Very slow service. But the food was SO GOOD!Every detail down to the coffee creamer was beyond delicious. Iced coffe, regular coffee both amazingChicken and waffles was memorable. Prices are reasonable. We got a little table outside. Can't wait to go back!

25.description: The food was terrible.... Like the worst breakfast food I have ever had. I'm not a big person on organic food vs. non-organic food BUT either way, the food sucked. I ordered the breakfast burrito with sausage, bacon, cheese and eggs only. I am pretty sure what ever was in my burrito WAS NOT SAUSAGE and if it was, it was the worst tasting sausage ever. The eggs tasted like they had been scorched in the microwave for 45 minutes. Even thinking about the food makes me feel sick to my stomach. The only decent part of the meal was the bacon. Do yourself, stomach and day a favor; skip this restaurant. Go to yolk, Wildberry, subway... Anywhere but this restaurant. We heard consistently bad things about the local root but wanted to give it a try ourselves..... Big mistake. I gave two stars because the restaurant was clean and the staff was decent.

12.description: My friends and I needed a place to have some good breakfast food that didn't require a 45 minute wait and this was something that I stumbled upon. I was pleasantly surprised because I enjoyed this place much more than I thought I would. The atmosphere was much more inviting and relaxing as compared to your regular Sunday brunch crowd.The staff was very friendly, from the hostess to our server. We also ordered bottomless mimosas ($19) and they were truly bottomless because I wait or made sure we had a pitcher ready for us to refill our drink at all times.I ordered the eggs Benedict with pulled pork and it was very tasty. The potatoes on the side were also very delicious. Another review described the ketchup being underwhelming, but it was very fresh and made in house, literally, all the ingredients were natural and non processed (tomato paste, tomato purée,  apple cider vinegar, salt, pepper, etc.) which may be why someone comparing to ordinary ketchup was not pleased.

59.description: I had brunch here on Monday.  The restaurant is very pleasant and as most reviews say, it's a great concept.  Whenever a place has polarizing reviews, it's a sign of inconsistency and I always keep an eye out for this hoping that I'd win the coin toss and lean on the side of good.  Unfortunately, my group lost  the coin toss and will likely not return:1. Service was extremely slow from the kitchen.  We ordered at 11:45 and our food took about 45 minutes.  I asked the waitress on status and she told me "good food takes time".  I'd agree except that two three tops that seated and ordered after us got their food before us.  Clearly, something is amiss with their queuing.  The physical amount of time to cook the food should have been 15 min tops, this was definitely a order of operation issue.  2. Overall, the food experience was underwhelming.  I ordered the chicken and waffles special based on reviews here.  The waffle was burnt.  The chicken was a skin on-bone-in chicken breast that looked like it it was just deep fried.  No breading, no seasoning, and no brining so it was dry.3. Our waitress was non-existent between the time we ordered until the food came.  Once the food came, she checked on us every five minutes to see if everything was ok.  Nice gesture but more frequent communication while we were waiting for our food would have been nice. This place definitely has promise but it needs to step it up.  For the price they are charging for food in Streeterville it needs to be much better.

21.description: My husband and I have a great deal of food allergies, and were very skeptical about finding a caterer for our belated wedding reception who could compassionately and patiently work with us to provide a menu that would allow us to enjoy everything, without compromising taste and quality. After timidly sending email inquiries to a handful of local vendors, I was overwhelmed with gratitude when I received a response from Local Root, enthusiastically advising me that they would easily be able to work with us. From day one, the Catering Manager, Bruce, was a joy to work with. He responded promptly to emails and phone calls, reiterated everything in writing that we spoke about by phone, and did everything he could to accommodate our hyper-specific requests calmly, like they weren't strange or high maintenance. He was also extremely organized, and quick to make suggestions when we brainstormed about the menu and presentation. Shortly after exchanging a few emails, Bruce invited us to have lunch with he and the chef, Isaac, to discuss the event. Not only did we come up with a menu that met our needs, but they agreed to accommodate our request of sourcing bread and pasta from two additional, out-of-state vendors, and serving the home brew my husband makes, worked with us to identify and order the specific, deli-style packaging we wanted, and allowed us to provide labels we designed to apply to the containers.The day before the event, I went to the restaurant to drop off the sourced bread, pasta, and food labels (which a handful of kind staff people offered to carry in for me), and Isaac invited me to the kitchen to taste some of the ingredients that would be used in the food for our party. It was really rewarding to see how many items were from local sources, and the quality was evident in the flavors I was able to sample. It was also a wonderful opportunity to see how much care was going into our event, and how passionate Isaac is about what he does.On the day of the party, the catering team did a fantastic job of setting up the buffet (of sandwiches, salads and chips), walking our guests through making their selections, and clearing everything out before the end of the evening. Both Bruce and Isaac took the time to stop by the venue to make sure everything was to our liking. We were also able to tip the staff by phone a few days after the party, instead of having to deal with doling out cash after our reception, when we were frazzled with getting everything out of the venue in time.The food was exceptional. From the bottled sodas created in-house, to the three flavors of handmade potato chips, to the roast beef made on the premises specifically for our sandwiches, everything was delicious, and very much enjoyed by our guests.We're so very grateful for the time, effort and attention to detail that Isaac, Bruce, and their team were able to provide. They were understanding, gracious, and showed that they really cared about the quality of our experience, even though we were probably especially difficult to work with due to all our restrictions (which they treated very seriously). Thank you Local Root for alleviating so much anxiety, and delivering excellent food and service. Without you, we would have been reduced to cooking all of the food ourselves for 100+ people in our one-bedroom apartment!

17.description: I like that there's finally an organic focused restaurant downtown. There could be some improvements and some things made me hesitant trust the place. For example, I called and asked what oil they cook with and they said an olive oil canola blend. Then I asked if the canola was certified organic. They looked for a certification and said "yes, it says non-GMO" not realizing that non-GMO and certified organic are not the same. I was concerned about why an organic focused restaurant wouldn't know the difference. When I went into eat, the waitress told me the meats were all organic. But, I brought up that some of the farms I recognized and those weren't certified organic. She clarified they weren't all certified organic but that the farms do followed organic practices. I wish she was more upfront about how they were defining organic, it just seemed a little sneaky. I was left wondering if the farms really did follow ALL organic practices. I understand that verification costs money and like the idea of supporting non-certified but organic practicing farms, but the way the waitress said it made it seem like she didn't know what certified organic meant which made me wonder if she knew what organic practices were. The restaurant seemed to focus more on the local aspect than the organic aspect. I enjoyed my steak. The bread pudding was great. I'd like to support more organic focused places. I wish this one was more upfront about how they were  defining organic.

10.description: Local Root is one of the few brunch places in my neighborhood, and while the food is decent, the service is amongst the worst I've experienced.  My friend and I were there this morning and were quoted a reasonable half an hour wait during peak brunch hours.  We went to the bar where it took the bartender 20 minutes to serve our Blood Mary's (which were very tasty).  Meanwhile about a quarter the tables in the restaurant were open with no one being seated - perhaps the kitchen needed to catch up.  Fifteen minutes after being seated, we still hadn't seen our server.  The neighboring table told us to plan on waiting forever or to talk to the host/manager.  Finally I went and asked the manager to send a server to our table and got zero apology.  It took 20 more minutes to get our coffee and soda (both were sitting on the counter waiting 10 minutes before we asked the bus boy to bring them over).  Our food came out separate - my friend was nearly done eating before my skimpy omelette arrived.   Meanwhile the table on our other side received superb service - apologies for the wait and were served 10 minutes before us despite being seated 10 minutes after us.Not sure how Local Root gets four stars with the service we experienced this morning.

5.description: We came by on a weekday for brunch. Service was decent although you could tell that our waitress was really trying (sometimes a little too hard) to connect with us. It was too slow though but I think it was because she was pretty much the only one covering the other tables, but sometimes she was simply nowhere in sight. You can tell that food here is supposed to be healthy and locally sourced - it actually reminds me of certain places out in the West where this is a pretty big deal. I got the Champagne chicken sandwich - chicken was pretty dry but I enjoyed the tomato jam and the brioche bread. My sister got the pulled pork benedict which we both expected to taste better given that it's supposed to be one of their most frequently ordered items. I didn't get the smoky, pulled pork flavor I wanted. Overall the flavors of their dishes are pretty toned down compared to the average American food which is fine if that's what you're expecting. Then again, I was not expecting the ketchup to taste like pasta sauce. There was no thickness to it at all! I do think that prices are on the higher end and it would be better to drop it down by about two dollars. My chicken sandwich was simply not worth the $12, even if you throw in the quality of the ingredients (and well, the chicken was dry).

3.description: I just popped in for a light bite in the late afternoon. I had their Acorn Squash Sope which is vegetarian normally but they left the Feta Cheese off to make it Vegan for me. It was really delicious and Carlean paired it with a really nice, not too bold, red wine. The prices are very reasonable and I absolutely love the concept of this restaurant. Even though there is not much vegan food on the menu for me, I am looking forward to trying more.  I think that their menu probably changes a lot since they do local, sustainable, organics. The space is small and quaint and the service is excellent. What a jewel in the city.

35.description: The food was ok, we waited 25 minutes for our three omelette's and one blueberry muffin.  Could have understood the wait if they were slammed, we were one of three tables seated inside.  Food was ok, nothing to write home about and service sub par.

19.description: We went for brunch- it was not busy.... I have figured why!  Our server was great, the iced tea and orange juice was delicious, the rest of the meal, however- was not. The Mac and cheese was bland and flavorless- we added salt and hot sauce to eat it. The crab cake Benedict was burnt and inedible.  The chicken and waffles was terrible. The waffle was flat and the flavor was sub par- had an odd taste. I had the pork Benedict.  It was awful. The pork was not good- all I could eat was the eggs.  Also need to mention that it took forever to be served our meals. Not sure what was going on in the kitchen.   The pain of it? 3 people was $90.00 including tip. No alcohol.  We left and took an uber to go eat- we were hungry!

28.description: A big anti climax. Tofu scramble was heaped with the sharp taste of tumeric?? Accompanying breakfast potatoes were under cooked and contained black bits. It's really unacceptable cooking in this day and age, particularly in a city with so many great culinary options. Caesar salad was plan average. No touches, nothing special, totally unremarkable. Not cheap either. A beer each and the bill was over $60 for lunch. A wasted lunch on our short trip of 2 days in this amazing city.

45.description: R U kidding me- we waited half an hour for COFFEE and the place wasn't even full. My friend ordered bottomless mimosas and got the same wait. Screwed up one of our orders too, which we waited an hour for. The waitron threw cookies and a muffin at us for our trouble. We wanted coffee and breakfast.  The food was very mediocre and overpriced. Need I say more?

33.description: Love the Idea and concept as I live a Paleo lifestyle! I was there for brunch and it wasn't crowded. The service was very friendly but crazy slow. Also...my server didn't know anything about the local farms in the menu. To be successful as a farm to table restaurant ...the servers must be educated on what they serve. I'll give it another try but they have some work to do.

43.description: My wife and I were recently in Chicago with friends and after doing some research on local eateries and breakfast spots my wife was quite excited to try Local Root. The reviews posted on Yelp were quite favorable.We had a 20 minute wait for a table upon arrival.Once we were seated our server greeted us and took drink and food orders.Then we waited. And waited.We were talking and enjoying our friends company and then we realized we'd been waiting 20 minutes and we still had no drinks!So we tracked down our server and asked when we could expect 2 cups of coffee and one mimosa. The server gave us free cookies and a muffin to make up for the slow service.After another 10 minutes we finally got our drinks.Another 15 minutes passes (for those doing the math - that is 45 minutes!) our food arrives and my eggs are scrambled instead of over-easy as I requested.Granted, the food  tasted fine. But is it really worth the wait - or the high prices? My answer would be "No".We left Local Root unimpressed and rather annoyed by the entire experience.

2.description: Alright, so I appreciate the whole "farm to table" concept. I'm all for it. In my experience these types of places are quick, have a robust food menu, and stellar customer service. Things I liked: the ambiance, and their in-house sodas. Spunky. Now let's get into my grievances with this spot:We opted for this place today after learning they had a Restaurant Week Lunch Menu. For $22, the selection was pretty bleak. My butternut squash soup was good and portabella mushroom sandwich was tasty (goat cheese made it flavorful, otherwise it would've just been "meh"). Service was so ridiculously slow-- we were sitting around idly for 40 minutes during our lunch hour, waiting for the third course. I had selected an Apple Fritter but asked for it to be packed. When I opened it up to eat just now, it looked half eaten. Regardless of whether or not it was, the portion size was meager, at best. Really lame deal for $22.Especially upset by our experience here today because one of my friends is gluten-free, and she had specified her restriction to the waiter upon ordering. Lo and behold, her plate came out with potatoes touching her omelette (potatoes shouldn't have even been on the plate, it's all gluten!). Sure, they corrected their mistake... but it took over 15 minutes. In principle, it should have been deducted from the bill, but I won't get into that.All in all, was hoping for a better experience... but won't bother going back.

18.description: Was staying at the W around the corner and had literally just checked in before I found this place.  Figured it was just going to be a simple, nothing special meal.  Quite the opposite.  Food was great, had live music going on and seated at the nice quiet table tucked in the corner.  Had the cheese plate, truffle mac/chz, kale salad and pork sandwich.Per the recommendation of our waitress Ruby, I tried Koval Rye which is a local whiskey made with honey.  I'm from SF and we don't have the stuff here.  I'll probably begin scouring online to order some.  Kudos for my being my first meal in Chicago since I was 7 and not disappointing me.

41.description: Local roots- it's definitely a great concept with farm to table experience.. But very well executed with seasonal menu and good service. Our server was very nice, she gave us great suggestions. We stopped by during our evening walk, so weren't too hungry and ended up sharing plates. So I am definitely excited to go back for a complete meal. Highly recommend- truffle flatbread and bean tacos. Keep an eye on their specials ;)

52.description: Great food. Great service. Everyone from hostess to server was really nice.  Did not know that place exist. They have brunch 7 days a week with bottomless mimosas....where can you find such thing in Chicago. Great lunch and dinner options as well.Will be back.

50.description: Delicious!  Just had a late breakfast here on a Monday. Bacon is thick and tasty. They customized the French toast for my son, no cream cheese or almonds. Highly recommend.

4.description: The food was good- creative combination of flavors. I'm a fan of locally sourced food, so that alone was a plus. The place itself is tiny, but service was good.

6.description: What a great concept! Local Root serves up locally sourced food and tells you exactly where it comes from. I have done the farm to table experience before, but I have not seen full disclosure of the farm and location of where the food is coming from before. They are also eco friendly and sustainable and in my book that is awesome!I stopped in for breakfast yesterday before a spa appointment. I was literally blown away by the freshness of my breakfast. The eggs were so light and fluffy, it was like eating a cloud, or at least that is what I imagine the consistency of a cloud would be. The fruit was super fresh and delicious; berries were ripe and pineapple was sweet. It was a great combination of summer fruit. The bread was warm and chewy, and the outer crust was perfect. The inside was light and airy. This meal, for being so simple, was literally the best thing I have eaten since arriving in Chicagoland!The interior of the restaurant is rustic. There are wooden tables and chairs and hardwood floor. It is keenly decorated to look like the inside of a modern farm house and the art is very outdoorsy. The staff is super friendly and inviting, and I had no problem dining alone. Such is life on an extended business trip. I would definitely return and highly recommend. Great experience from beginning to end.

22.description: Went for brunch on Saturday. There was no wait which was awesome. The food was very good (burger and French toast), the interior cute, and the service very good.

15.description: Though they clearly try very hard to promote the "local", "organic" and "homemade" brand, this is nothing more than a pricey, average brunch place with very standard at best food. The waiters are not really accommodating of special requests and customizations and try to charge extra for any changes to the menu, which is fair, however they also don't seem to put that much thought into what I ordered, bringing me regular coffee when I asked for iced. It wasn't a big deal, but that was just an added annoyance on top of the others. I would probably opt for something different next time, but it was overall just a fairly average dining experience.

57.description: So wanted to like this place. Love the idea of local farm to table, but sadly I have to give the boot to Local Root. For starters, my cream of mushroom soup was very watery. The kids flat bread was soggy and went largely uneaten. My chicken breast sandwich was composed of a lot of rib meat. The falafel was amiss as well-bland hummus dominating the dish. Best thing was the fresh hot bread and olive oil.

20.description: We went for brunch- it was not busy.... I have figured why!  Our server was great, the iced tea and orange juice was delicious, the rest of the meal, however- was not. The Mac and cheese was bland and flavorless- we added salt and hot sauce to eat it. The crab cake Benedict was burnt and inedible.  The chicken and waffles was terrible. The waffle was flat and the flavor was sub par- had an odd taste. I had the pork Benedict.  It was awful. The pork was not good- all I could eat was the eggs.  Also need to mention that it took forever to be served our meals. Not sure what was going on in the kitchen.   The pain of it? 3 people was $90.00 including tip. No alcohol.  We left and took an uber to go eat- we were hungry!

36.description: All local produce and you can tell...it's fresh, healthy, delicious and with friendly helpful staff and a relaxing atmosphere.

14.description: I was expecting a lot more, and being the one of 3-4 people having lunch outside on a Wednesday afternoon...I expected some service.  I specifically asked that my crabcakes be served with salad, they said "of course" and I got no salad.  In that time, my waiter disappeared forrrrrrrrrrever so I just dropped it.  Pretty spendy for what you actually get.

28.description: Cute fun shoes - I usually just shop it when there's a sale because the deals are really good - I also like their handbags and earrings, too - really cute but quality, too.  This is my boyfriend's favorite shoe store - pricey but worth it for him.

1.description: First time here. Had a good selection of shoes but they seemed overpriced for some sandals. I ended up getting some earrings and rings that were buy one get one free. The store is neat and cleaned; well lit.

9.description: best aldo store yet! super helpful staff with lots of selections and sales!

29.description: This is a great store with trendy shoes!  THey've got good sales at the end of the seasons and sometimes you can find some real deals!  I love their handbags and accessories as well, its always fun to shop here when you don't feel like trying on clothes

23.description: Surprisingly good sale prices and surprisingly fashionable shoes. I wish all guys got their shoes here. I also got a nice handbag and accessaries here. Worth a look-around!

5.description: Shopping on weekends in this store is horrendous.  During the week it is much less crowded and you're actually able to get a sales associate to assist you.  Last fall I liked a pair of shoes but they didn't have my size (damn big feet....) :(    So they offered to ship them to me.  For FREE.I love the variety and styles of Aldo.  Low heels, flats, sky high heels, boots, you name it, they probably have it.  And the best part is that the prices aren't too bad--so you can have cute looking shoes on your feet and still have money left over to, you know, eat and pay rent.

25.description: I really like Aldo but feel that their quality does not match their prices lately.  Having said that,  they have a fantastic selection of trendy and some classic shoe styles for men and women.  If I don't feel like spending an arm and a leg for shoes then I come here.  I have one of their leather handbags and it was a steal!

12.description: I'm not the biggest fan of Aldo shoes but I like some of their accessories like the costume jewelry and tights from time to time. This one is the better location compared to the one in water tower. They're a lot nicer and eager to help here despite being busier unlike the ones in water tower where it'll be dead in the store but they're still acting like a bunch of raggedy bitches as if you bothered them from their daydreaming. Moral of this: Go to this location, avoid the one in water tower. It's not THAT bad on sundays.

21.description: Not much sales here compared to the stores in the burbs but the gals working here are EwW Wee sexy!  lol The selection is great here, I saw many different styles that I do not see at the woodfield or fox valley store.  I've had good and bad experience with Aldo shoes where the sole and the leather seperate where they are joined. I once had to return a pair of shoes 5 times.  I've had better experience with the casual shoes than the dress shoes.  Anyways decent selection and the gals are gorgeous!Would I come here again? sure but I won't pay the 10.25% chicago tax.

16.description: Usually I am a Kenneth Cole loyalist, however, once setting foot in this store I fell in love with there variety and different style of shoes. Dress shoes to Boots and more. Its not to pricey, found it to be quite reasonable. What I also liked about ALDO is there accessories... watches, rings, necklace, hats, glovesDefinite recommendation and its location is centered with other intriguing stores!

17.description: I love Aldo's shoes at every store I go to. Their selection is kept up-to-date with trendy styles which are usually priced under $100. Even if they are more expensive, Aldo runs great sale and clearance events pretty regularly. I have a hard time leaving with less than a couple pair.Onto my Mich Ave experience... I work at Harlem and Irving Plaza on the northwest side of the city, so I most frequently purchase from that location. On my latest trip I bought 3 pair with the purpose of trying them out at home, and returning 1. When I went to the Mich Ave location, I was greeted quickly by the greeter/security-guy. Three other associates offered assistance (on a busy Friday afternoon) while I looked at the styles. When I was ready to complete my refund, I stepped into line. Another associate come over to open another register. I presented my receipt and shoes. They asked (of course) if I had any problems with them, but otherwise it was a no-questions-asked experience. They quickly took care of my transaction, gave me back my receipt (even though I told them I didn't need it), and told me to have a nice day. I've never had such a hassle-free $80 return in my life. I'll be frequenting this location more in the future b/c of the eager service, bigger selection, and easy return policy.

10.description: Sales staff is fantastic. Shout-out to LaurenUsually Aldo is on the upper limits of my student budget, but when they have sales and clearance items, it is such a bonus! And their sales staff has never been snooty to me when I've picked out some seriously marked down shoes. That's class!

11.description: Super-stylish shoes at great prices. I'm a shoe king and Aldo knows how to feed my addiction. They are always having 40-50% sales on a large majority of their inventory. Check them out if you are in the market for designer shoes at reasonable cost!

26.description: Just bought a pair of boots here! They have cute shoes but sometimes don't have my size (10). There is also a lot of cute purses, jewelry and other accessories. Everything is very trendy-so it most likely won't be in style for long.

27.description: They've got a good selection of mens shoes and boots here as well, a little pricey but good quality

0.description: Aldo is the probably the only store where I can get the type of shoes which i like. I normally the leather pointy shoes which are hard to find at other stores. Aldo has some really good stuff. Staff is uber friendly and they always welcome you when you enter the store.I liked a pair of shoes but they were not carrying it. So they shipped it for Free, yes free shipping. Shoes arrived within 3 business days. Over a period of last 6 months I bought almost 6 pairs of shoes and all of them are of great quality.

20.description: What they have that I love: teetery, sky high hooker shoes that can't really be meant for walking.What they have that I buy: cute, trendy, inexpensive completely flat sandals that are sale priced. Oh, all right, I have a few teetery wedges from this place that I adore also.Popped in here today, and bought a pair of sandals. When the cute guy was ringing up my purchase ($47! Cheep!), we were both singing along to a Madonna song. Excellent service!

19.description: The reason this Aldo gets four stars is not for the quality of their shoes.  No.  Nor is it for affordability sake.  They, I believe, would receive a 2-3 in quality and cost.But what Aldo lacks in its prices and quality, it more than makes up for it in its customer service.  Read on my friends.Last Wednesday I was to attend a fashion show with a couple of friends.  I picked up the most adorable pair of nude patent leather three inche pumps.  Well, I got into an enormous fight with my best friend before the fashion show.  She stomped home.  I was left with my fancy Aldo pumps, no more fashion show, and mad as hell.  You think I was going to let those sky high things go to waste?  Hell, no!I decided to go out with my boyfriend, stick the heel through a grate, get them stuck in the grate, and forget to know how to walk in these bad boys.  I fell down and scuffed them to the point of no return.It looked like I sent these shoes through a trash compacter- it was bad.I woke up the next morning regretting what I did to the shoes almost as much as regretting the things I said to the friend.My boyf looked and them, looked at me and said, "Dude, your screwed. Way to waste 80 bucks."But Friday, I went back.  Now I used leverage of purchasing another pair of boots, but the girls TOOK THEM BACK and gave me a NEW PAIR?!?!?!  Who does that?!I have been buying shoes from Aldo for a while.  I have always liked their styles but felt like the heels wear out quickly, they are uncomfortable and overpriced.  But who takes back a pair of shoes, replaces them, all because the owner got upset at a friend and took her anger out on her new shoes?Thanks Aldo!

2.description: Went to Aldo looking for boot for the winter, and I was surprising disappointed on the shoe selection. For a Aldo located on Michigan Ave. I expected a large selection to pick from, but the store was kind of empty. I hope is not always that low on shoe selections. The prices were reasonable on the shoes they did have, I hope they get a better inventory soon.

18.description: I love Aldo Shoes for its price, quality and the long lasting-ness of it. I try to come to this Aldo more often because it's more bigger so I just feel like I get more choices but every time I come to this one, none of the sales associates would bother to ask how I'm doing or if I need a size or what kind of shoes im looking for. The only time they helped me was when I came in the last minute to look for dress shoes and this lady was helping me. They need to step up their game with their customer service.

13.description: Fun little store on Michigan Ave, cute shoes with reasonable prices (especially considering the location), plus purses, jewelry, sun glasses and other accessory stuff. Some stuff for guys, but mostly for the X chromosome crowd.

4.description: I just love stopping in this store, everything is nice and neat and displayed very well. I'm totally loving the electric blue shoes that they have as well as the blue statement necklace and earrings. I love the jewelry collection that they have and their purses are pretty nice and affordable.

Way to waste 80 bucks."But Friday, I went back.  Now I used leverage of purchasing another pair of boots, but the girls TOOK THEM BACK and gave me a NEW PAIR?!?!?!  Who does that?!I have been buying shoes from Aldo for a while.  I have always liked their styles but felt like the heels wear out quickly, they are uncomfortable and overpriced.  But who takes back a pair of shoes, replaces them, all because the owner got upset at a friend and took her anger out on her new shoes?Thanks Aldo!

Oh, all right, I have a few teetery wedges from this place that I adore also.Popped in here today, and bought a pair of sandals. When the cute guy was ringing up my purchase ($47! Cheep!), we were both singing along to a Madonna song. Excellent service!

They quickly took care of my transaction, gave me back my receipt (even though I told them I didn't need it), and told me to have a nice day. I've never had such a hassle-free $80 return in my life. I'll be frequenting this location more in the future b/c of the eager service, bigger selection, and easy return policy.

15.description: Meh. I always find shoes here that I love, but then one of two things happen: Either they don't have my size (they never, EVER have my size. And it's a pretty normal size) or they do and I buy the shoe, only to find out it falls apart after a few months. I know you get what you pay for, but these shoes aren't *that* cheap. I've had 12-dollar flats from Old Navy that last about the same amount of time.Bottom line is, this place is great for fun shoes you'll only wear a few times, or trendy shoes that you'll only want to wear for a season anyway, but for everyday stuff it's definitely not worth it. And they need to stock more sizes! hrumph.

7.description: Every time I visit Chicago I make it my business to stop at this particular Aldo. I can always find a good sale on something here. Staff is nice and they are very helpful.

8.description: I love aldo!The shoes are always in-trend and after I've shopped here I don't feel like I'm bankrupt, which is a good thing. To top it, they have great sales. But my recent experience in this location has prompted me to write this review. I liked a pair of electric blue shoes and I usually wear between 39 and 40. The 40 was loose and 39 seemed to fit me well and so I bought it. I wore them and realized that they need to be stretched out a little and asked them if they could do it. They obliged and I was so happy. The next day I collected the shoes and when I wore them.. surprise surprise, nothing was done to it!! Soo disappointed...

3.description: I was walking on the avenue on Christmas morning and was horrified to discover that Aldo was open. On Christmas Day! How money hungry is this company , to not even allow its employees a day off??  I am disturbed and disgusted. Will never shop Aldo again , and neither will my friends and family.

14.description: ALDO.  Fantastic always.  Saturday afternoon and I had a salesperson in NO time getting me my size 8 strappy stilettos.Muah!!!

3.description: Very skilled practitioner. Intuitive and knowledgeable, with excellent manual therapy skills. I have received work from Matthew in Rolfing classes (yes, I'm also a Rolfer) and have found his work to have lasting benefit. In particular after some detailed lung and rib work, I found that I had a lovely increase in torso mobility and a smoothness in my breathing that I have wanted for years. That was almost a year ago, and rather than feeling that the benefit has faded over time, I actually feel that the ease of breathing has continued to improve. Matthew applies his mindfulness-based personal meditation practice to his bodywork sessions, allowing him to read information from the body about what to treat and how to treat it. He is deeply insightful and is an excellent guide for whatever transformation you may be seeking.

1.description: Matthew is a true professional.  He uses multiple methods to find the source of my body aches, then treats them accordingly.  His knowledge of the bodily systems and their connections and their with each other adds up to an effective treatment.  I would definitely recommend Matthew to anyone, especially those with chronic symptoms that can't seem to be fixed.  His treatments unlocked a couple elements that other practitioners had been missing, and for that I am grateful.

2.description: I have seen several Rolfers, massage therapists. acupuncturists, and also chiropractic care during my lifetime for various bodily woes.  Matthew is skilled and personable, effective, and efficient.  He has fervently pursued extensive advanced knowledge regarding visceral, neural and vascular involvement and how it effects alignment. This is evident in the results achieved during our session and they have stayed put.  Unlike other body work that feels delightful but is without long standing effects, Rolfing, especially with Matthew, will keep.  As a physical therapist, running coach, and ACSM personal trainer, I feel like I have insight into how to change my alignment and body.  After a car accident, I really needed the assistance of Karen and Matthew to address the trauma caused by the forceful impact of the accident. I had the pleasure of working with Matthew and Karen Edwards Wagner, in a two rolfer session (whaaaatttt!!!! Yes, it was amazing.) Having two skilled practitioners unlock my sternum, ribs and neck after addressing lung and artery issues has significantly improved my ability to move, run, and play after a car accident.  The work done on my legs has helped me transition back to running.  I am very thankful to know these talented people.

0.description: I have gone to massage therapists and received chiropractic care for many years for a variety of physical ailments. A few years ago I started working with a naturopath (after being inspired by reboot-with-joe dietary lessons), and she recommended seeking out a rolfer. I connected with Matthew Berean and have been extremely impressed with his approach, professionalism, skills, and most important the results. Initially his practice was more traditional with physical manipulation but it was uncanny how he seemed to know exactly which areas had pain. Pain that he relieved thru Rolfing techniques. Over time it became clear he had an intuitive ability to identify where I had physical stress. As we progress with treatments his approach has included far more energy field work which has had great effect. Pain is a physical manifestation but has many reasons for being. Poor posture, injuries, stress, and emotional trauma all contribute. My sessions with Matthew have produced great results and continue to do so. For anyone considering this method of healing, you will not be disappointed. For me it works.

58.description: Buying sunglasses in Winter is crazy, I know. But there I was, on the snowy streets of Chicago wanting a new pair of Raybans. I've been to EyeSociety a few times and I'm always so impressed with the staff there. Polite, friendly, and honest. I found some glasses I liked (everything but the Price tag). And try helped me find a frame that I like even better - for cheaper! Really, this place is known for it's service. Stop by and check them out - maybe you'll see me trying on more sunglasses.

56.description: Dr. Mago was very nice and was the only reason that I stuck with this place for a year.  I'm a demanding optical patient and customer and was able to get quick appointments when I needed them.  The office appears warm and inviting when you walk in.  Eye Society turned me on to Scotchgard lenses, which are so much easier to clean than my old lenses.  Thanks to them for that.  They are definitely worth the investment.Unfortunately, I'm not sure that Dr. Mago is there anymore and I have switched optometrists.  I was strongly considering doing that anyway because of the rest of the staff.  Every time I came in for a frame adjustment or for anything else, the staff treated me like I was an annoyance.  They also hassled me because I did not purchase my frames from them (despite being a patient).  I couldn't get them to understand that the reason that I did not purchase frames from them was because I lived in Indianapolis at the time of my last frame purchase.Dr. Mago was great.  The staff was not.  My eyes did not suffer because of it, but the attitude of the staff and possible change of doctors was more than enough to convince me to change optometrists.

29.description: I have been wearing glasses since I was 4 and have been to eyeglass stores and optometrists in several different cities.  Eye Society stands out among these for several reasons.  Scheduling was painless and the optometrist, Dr. Mago, saw me on time.  She was professional, courteous, and friendly.  I work in the medical field and was impressed with both the breadth and detail of her new patient exam.  Dan, the optician I saw, helped me for almost 2 full hours as I agonized over frames.  He hand selected frames that he thought would work well with my face, that matched my style, and that were suitable for my professional obligations.  He helped me navigate some of the finer details of designing lenses for the visually challenged (I have pretty jacked up eyesight).  He even snapped some pictures of me so that I could get a second opinion from a friend.  It was by far and away the easiest and most pleasant glasses buying session I have experienced.The shop itself is fairly small, but they have an excellent selection of designer frames.I highly recommend checking this place out.  Do yourself a favor and ask for Dan.

42.description: Was super happy with the staff and selection of glasses.

23.description: I had a wonderful experience at Eye Society. The staff is so friendly and immediately greet you when you walk in. I did not have to wait long to see the doctor either. I ended up getting a pair of glasses that I love. It did not take me long to find the right pair because the girls working there knew exactly what frames would fit my face.  They have so many different types of frames to chose from so it would be hard for someone to not find the right pair! I would recommend going here if you want an eye exam or to get glasses/sunglasses!

47.description: I found Eye Society on Yelp after struggling to find a good eye doctor in Chicago.  This place does not disappoint.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, the doctor is amazing, and the service is excellent.  They provide quality care without up-selling or pressuring the client into unwanted services or purchases.  Outstanding!

8.description: My first time getting my eyes checked here. The staff was super friendly and the doctor was super knowledgeable. I love their eye wear selection!!!

31.description: I've been going to Eye Society for three years for my eye exams and have thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The doctor was the first to have ever pointed out my dry eye problem and explained to me how to improve it. Also, I recently purchased a new pair of eye glasses and it was a great experience! Dan is the absolute BEST!! I was the most difficult customer trying to find the perfect pair and he was patient with me the whole time, always told me his honest opinion about the pairs I tried on, and was more than willing to help every time I went in to try on new pairs. I finalllyyy found a pair that I fell in love with and I couldn't have done it without the help of Dan. I highly recommend Eye Society - great doctor, great staff, happy customer.

34.description: I walk by Eye Society on a daily basis, so I thought I'd come here when I needed an eye exam.  Scheduling an exam was easy, they took my insurance, and the appointment was fast and on time.  I thought everything except their selection of frames was great.  And from all of the things I had heard about Eye Society, I honestly expected more in terms of their selection.  I'd go back for an eye exam, but next time I need frames, I'll probably continue to go back to See Eyewear.

16.description: Walked in without an appointment.  Becca was very nice, attentive, and prompt.  She was very knowledgeable. She helped me see again!   The shop was very clean with a good selection. Service was excellent.  I come from a family of Ophthalmologists and I was very impressed.

13.description: Very professional staff. They are usually quick and the doctor is knowledgable. I am confident in coming here. I do not have vision insurance, so they are accommodating in helping me with payment.

11.description: They were able to replace a broken screw in my beloved pair of Ray-Bans (not purchased there) and saved me six weeks of waiting for factory repair. Recommended!

39.description: This is my first year going to Eye Society for my annual exam and glasses. The staff are all amazing. Always friendly and always ready to help. The Doctor was great too, she explained everything in detail and in a way I could understand. I felt very comfortable asking questions and they laid out all the costs for me. I HIGHLY recommend them!

37.description: I agree with April's comment - the front desk isn't warm at all... I visited two of the doctors - One of the doctor (Tanvi) is good but I don't feel the other one (Braun) is really too professional... I would love to visit Dr Tanvi again but not Braun... sorry... They were both nice indeed....Overall... I won't go there again... there are better places out there...

0.description: This is actually for the New Wacker Dr. Location but that location isn't set up in Yelp yet, because now Eye Society has 2 Chicago locations! All I can say, is outstanding! The facilities were amazing, and the staff was even better! Very friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating! Hands down the best in Chicago. Thanks for all your help and an extremely comfortable eye exam. Kudos to you!

38.description: Awesome spot , great service and lovely staff ASK FOR JESSICA she's the bomb but everyone is super nice and the frames are so cool !

51.description: I've been going to the Eye Society for the past 3 years. In 2009 I discovered this little place in passing since I lived a block away. In 2010, I moved to the Loop but kept going to Eye Society because of their great service and doctors. Dr. Mago is sweet, friendly, answered all my questions and gave great advice. I wanted to try the month-long contacts that I could sleep in and she ordered those right away. AND this office is open on Saturdays! What a bonus.This year I moved to South Loop but I'll continue to make the trek up to River North because honestly they're worth it. Thanks for a great experience.

27.description: They were extremely kind and helpful, and Becca exceeded my expectations by going above and beyond!  Can't recommend enough!

32.description: A simple phone call or reminder to let patients know their prescription is about to expire would be helpful. I now have to walk around with dirty lenses in my eyes until I get back from a work trip because I called to order more and was told I had to come in for an appt. Oh and it's illegal to give out trial pairs apparently. My eyes haven't changed in years, dumb policy. Getting a new doctor.

54.description: I've never felt more like "just a number" -- in a doctor's office, no less. I know eye doctor appointments are not as intensive and sensitive as medical appointments can be, but I still think they have some sort of duty to make patients feel comfortable. After briefly explaining my eye history, I was quickly hustled back and forth between two rooms for various tests. After getting back into the exam room, she started to test my prescribtion. Obviously the clarity didn't vary that much from slide-to-slide -- but I felt rushed and that she started to get frustrated with me because I wasn't making my decisions fast enough.Overall, I did end up buying a pair of glass from this place. But I certainly will never return for another appointment here. I felt so "used" and uncared for. I probably will go to get a second opinion from another doctor -- I really don't know if she even cared if I was given the right script.

48.description: I was looking for a local eye doctor recently and came across Eye Society. My experience, from the initial exam with Dr. Braun through their helpful staff assisting me in a frame selection and reviewing my insurance coverage, was exceptional. I highly recommend Eye Society!

44.description: Friendly staff. Clean place. Nice frame selection but pricey (downtown so it was expected) .Dr  Braun explained everything clearly. They emailed me my prescription which is great because I won't ever lose it and can refer to it.

24.description: I've been going to Eye Society for 3 years...always loved them until my last visit.  I'm sad, but will not be going back.  They sat me down for 15 minutes to tell me how busy they've gotten & don't have the extra 15 minutes to do the eye dilation in your visit.  So, you either have to pay $40 for a *new* form of the dilation part or come back for another appointment (in which I assume they charge you another $20 copay).  Um... in the 15 minutes it took for you to explain to me how busy you now are, you could have done the dilation.  Bummed out.

7.description: Been coming here for years, awesome place.Fast, professional, they have tons of styles, always very accommodating.All around great experience every time!

49.description: Very competent and friendly optometrist.  Made insurance and pricing easy to understand and had good selection of glasses.  Was intimidated by the brands, but I ended up picking up some Burberry frames that only cost me $136 after insurance.

40.description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!! Hands down some of the best customer service. Rebecca and Nancy did everything they could to get my glasses and at a great price thanks to insurance. Had a small (HUGE) problem with my insurance company and the former place I went to and they handled everything for me. I will be return here to get all my optical needs sunglasses included. So glad I found them and what a great selection of glasses. They had some of my favorite brand and even educated me on some others I had no clue on.

53.description: I went with my wife to Eye Society today where she had a check-up by the young, beautiful optometrist, Carol Braun.  The doctor ran her through the normal battery of tests, updated her prescription, and soon we were on our way.  The missus says that despite her age, Dr. Braun inspires confidence and she plans on seeing her again.P.S. Eye Society offers a Yelp check-in special.

30.description: I had a great experience with eye society. They have a great selection of frames, are very knowledgable, and great to work with. I will go back for all of my eyewear needs.

46.description: All the staff at Eye Society is excellent. We worked with Anna Marie and Becca for my husband's glasses. The original glasses we purchased did not work out. They ordered a second pair of glasses we liked.  During this time, they were the most helpful. They do everything in their power to satisfy their customer needs. We highly recommend them.

1.description: This is a very solid eye doctor and eyewear retailer.  I've been 3-4 times and always enjoyed timely and friendly service.  The staff is very informative, answers all your questions and explains every step of the exam process.They also have a pretty good selection of frames.Make sure you take advantage of any credits your insurance company offers - the staff will look that up for you.

55.description: After my second visit to Eye Society, not only do I feel like I have super human sight, I also get compliments on my glasses!  Also, Dr. Mago suggested newer, more comfortable contact lenses.  As good as it gets.  No complaints.

9.description: Becca was absolutely amazing! She patiently waited while I tried on 100 different pairs of glasses 100 different times. Great help all around. I'd definitely recommend the Eye Society to anyone!

26.description: Selection for glasses was great. Zaira helped me and she was wonderful

25.description: Dr Mago is the best, extremely smart, thorough, patient and intelligent. Unfortunately she does not see patients much, but has been kind enough to come to the practice when specifically requested. Dr. Braun - not a very good bedside manner. Kind of stiff, abrupt and jumpy. And the other lady - Dr. Shah(?) seemed very confused and distracted, was bouncing 3 patients around simultaneously. Kept one waiting while she'd bring the other into her office, etc. I spent close to 2 very confused hours there - had one test, would have to wait...she could find a chart for one of my eyes...not the other...she kept asking me what tests where done and when. I am not an opthalmologist to know the exact jargon and scientific terms. I would love to keep going there - but if Dr Mago is unable to see patients I'd have to consider other options.

12.description: Why does an optometrist appointment have to feel like a trip to a used car lot? I went in to get my contact lens prescription updated, nothing more. When my appointment started I was immediately swept into a sales pitch for an elective retinal imaging procedure, which I didn't need and my insurance wouldn't cover fully, so I refused it after some persistent salesmanship.When my appointment ended, the staff balked at giving me my prescription so I could order contacts online. They were fine with this in 2013 - it was a big part of why I decided to come back - so I was surprised and disappointed at the change in attitude. Again they laid on the sales pressure and convinced me to buy lenses from them and take a chance at what has turned out to be a fairly onerous mail-in rebate. The rebate comes only in the form of a prepaid Visa card, you have to submit original copies of two different receipts (which you do not receive on the day of your Eye Society appointment), and you have to submit your name, address, and email to CooperVision and surely their marketing department.The exam with the doctor was pleasant, but I don't appreciate being nickel-and-dimed for medical services and will not return.

59.description: I'm so happy Eye Society is near my apartment. Dr. Mago is fantastic - she does a very thorough exam and discusses my concerns in a professional but very friendly manner. She has definitely made me feel better about some of my vision-related anxieties :)The staff is also great. Every time I call or go in, Rebecca is super nice and attentive (and I'm not just saying that bc we share the same name...). She always goes over my insurance and bill with me line by line and will call my insurance and double check on things for me without hesitation. I order my contacts and glasses through Eye Society. I had Naftali (sp?) help me pick out the most recent pair of glasses I ordered. He was also very attentive and picked out a great selection of frames that were my style and looked good for my face shape. As others have said, it's not cheap, but you get what you pay for and at Eye Society, you're getting a lot. Absolutely worth it. Go there.

21.description: They were able to replace a broken screw in my beloved pair of Ray-Bans (not purchased there) and saved me six weeks of waiting for factory repair. Recommended!

17.description: Excellent service today for my wife and myself. Extremely accommodating from the whole staff. Becky took great care of us and very knowledgeable. Will definitely be back!

10.description: Convenient appointment times, short wait times, very helpful staff. I was able to obtain copies of my prescription quickly and easily.

5.description: this is not your run of the mill lens crafters type of eye place. THIS place is awesome!! very trendy and an amazing staff to go along with it!! HIGHLY recommend if you are in the market for an eye exam.

3.description: I came to Chicago on vacation from LA and I forgot to bring my contacts! My eyesight isn't the worse, but it's definitely uncomfortable without my contacts. I was staying at the Hyatt nearby so I decided to yelp for the nearest eye center after checking in to my hotel. I came across several places, but decided to come here because of their positive yelp reviews. And I'm so glad I did! I explained my situation to Becca (front desk), and she told me that I can contact my optometrist back in LA and have them fax over my prescription. After doing so, she gave me sample contacts that matched my prescription, free of charge, along with a travel size solution and contact case! She was very accommodating and nice even though I'm not their regular client and would probably see them never again. Thanks for all your help, Becca! I created this yelp account just so I can write them a review :).

35.description: My experiences at Eye Society have been consistently excellent. I was lucky enough to attend one of their Trunk Shows and what a treat! I felt like I had several personal stylists to help me pick out the right style for me. I appreciated the level of honesty from the staff about what suited me and what did not. I did not feel like they were just trying to make a sale for the sake of making a sale. I felt that Dr. Mago and the staff really had a vested interest in establishing a longitudinal relationship with me. That is hands down what is going to make me continue to go back there for my eye care needs.  They have a great staff who have always been friendly and a wonderful selection of products. Definitely check out Eye Society!

19.description: I was looking for an eye doctor in the neighborhood and I found this place. They took extra effort to contact my vision insurance and made sure I had maximum benefits. Dr. Mago was nice and very professional. I also asked about the possibility of getting LASIK surgery next year, she was very candid and told me it's better to wait it out for a few more years. In the end, they also walked me through my bill to make sure I understand fully what's been charged and what options I have. (A side note, they did make an extra effort to show me the policy that the sales are final.)Highly recommended!

28.description: Great experience. I got my first prescribed sunglasses. Becca was really helpful and patient. They have a lot of cool styles!

45.description: Great doctors, excellent customer service, and a great selection of frames. I also love that they do not rush you, I was able to take as long as I wanted to find the frames I loved and the staff was happy to make suggestions as well. So thrilled I found this place after my disasterous experience at See in Water Tower.Whew, now I have a place to go!

33.description: I recently started going to Eye Society due to an insurance change.  I chose them mainly due to location convenience and what my new insurance covered (which is not much!).  I found the front desk staff to be helpful and the few times I have had to call for billing questions or asked them to email me receipts from past visits, they have been very helpful and responded promptly for my FSA claims and helped to answer my questions.  Although it is unfortunate I can not receive the receipts at the time of service, a quick call a few days later is all it took to suffice.  Shifting through the nitty gritty of insurance can be confusing and I have appreciated their patience.A day ago I also went to pick out new glasses and I received amazing help from their very knowledgeable optician, Dan.  I had only originally asked him for his opinion about a few lenses I liked, and wasn't even sure if I was going to purchase lenses at the time, but he then proceeded to pull about ten other ones that were better suited for my face!
