 He even gave me a pair of disposable contacts to wear while testing out the frames, since I had come into the office wearing my own glasses, stating he wanted me to be able to take in the whole experience.How personalized (albeit time consuming) and appreciative the experience really was.  He clearly knew the glasses companies very well, as well as current fashion trends, and informed me a little about the company history about the frames I ended up picking (handmade, apparently).  It was nice to work with someone who was so passionate about their job and didn't mind taking the time to help me navigate the world of lenses and explain the differences to me.  It is important to note that compared to other glasses selections I've seen, I thought the selection was a little smaller than others I've seen.  However, I thought it was a good selection in terms of brands and quality among the ones that were there.  I did end up finding an amazing pair of glasses than I'm very excited about wearing in 2 weeks when they come in.Overall, I would highly recommend Eye Society for picking out frames, especially if you would like a personalized experience.  Ask for Dan, but plan for a little extra time, some tidbits of information, and fashion advice.

43.description: This place is great. Super friendly staff. Great selection of eyewear and you get an honest opinion of how they look on.  They are also very prompt so the wait is minimal which is great if you are on your lunch hour.  Can't think of a single complaint.

2.description: Needed contacts on short notice, and Eye Society was my savior! I was in and out in just a few minutes and on with my day. Great location, great office, great staff. I highly recommend Eye Society to anyone living in or passing through the downtown Chicago area.

18.description: I walk by Eye Society on a daily basis, so I thought I'd come here when I needed an eye exam.  Scheduling an exam was easy, they took my insurance, and the appointment was fast and on time.  I thought everything except their selection of frames was great.  And from all of the things I had heard about Eye Society, I honestly expected more in terms of their selection.  I'd go back for an eye exam, but next time I need frames, I'll probably continue to go back to See Eyewear.

41.description: I find it interesting that all these reviews raved about the staff... Which is the soul reason I came to this office...yet the front desk (3 ladies) was not very warm when I got there. They seemed miserable, as if they wish they were elsewhere so I'm not quite sure what these reviews about a "friendly staff" were about. No they were not rude to me. They weren't genuine nor did they show any concern to really help me. Maybe I didn't look like I had enough money? I don't have insurance but I make enough to pay out of pocket.Doctor was great though and the price was right. The place was nice.I just don't care to feel like I'm inconveniencing them.No smiles.I work with a company that is known for outstanding customer service so it's nice to be serviced well yourself. It doesn't give people a good impression when you don't even look like you want to be there. Completely uncomfortable when I'm the one smiling at them and they are stone-like.I'll be having my exam elsewhere next year. And I don't mind paying more to go somewhere else that is more pleasant.

52.description: I included my previous review as well-- at the bottom for reference. I seriously have not had better service than with Eye Society. An avid eyewear devotee, everything from vintage to modern frames pieces I will invest some serious cash in.This last Saturday, visited with my friend who I had referred to Eye Society, and as per usual, they were warm, welcoming, fun; the atmosphere was totally laid back.  Eye Society has been the only optometrist office since I started seriously collecting frames that hasn't been off-putting when I enter the establishment. Frames are not something easy: first impressions and presentation are absolutely pivotal, and as an individual, you often need time to try on many different sets to find "the one." Eye Society never rushes your time with them, and they let you be so you can concentrate on what your are fitting to your face. I had sent an email earlier saying that I was popping in, and without much of a queue, Becca, one of the opticians with ES, said, "Hi Kayla!" right when I walked in and gave me a quick hug. When was the last time you were hugged or addressed by name without a patient sheet on a clipboard at the Optometrists office?The ambiance of ES is quite nice- laid back, comfortable, and with a definably stylish interior, it feels more like a boutique where you are a regular than an optometrists office. Also, the lighting is not harsh-- so you can really see what a frame will look like without the glare of standard in-store lighting.You will shell out money here- ES does an excellent job finding discounts where they can with insurance, promotions, etc., but with premium frames and lenses comes a premium price. A great piece of advice given to me a few years ago: "Sometimes the best isn't for everyone." Eye Society is very much in this category. If you are looking for run of the mill, standard frames, with as small of a price tag as possible- ES isn't for you. IMO, if you are going to an Optometrist office in Gold Coast, common sense should tell you a premium pair of designer lenses isn't going to be "free" with insurance. If you are looking for "free," visit a location with lower-end options and a more traditional feel.The pair I picked up on Saturday (without an appointment) are perfect. Very chic; very me. Also paid out-of-pocket for the frames, without an insurance benefit.Hopefully to you, the reader, this speaks volumes for itself: a pair of frames without insurance, inclusive of premium lenses and coatings, went into the higher three figures.Just remember to have fun, and that eyewear isn't something you can put a price on: you wear it most days, and is an outer expression of yourself. The investment is worth it.(Previous review:)Just loved this place- the selection of frames is great, the service was exceptional; I am an eye wear aficionado, and the fact that they said I could bring in my other vintage frames to be filled speaks volumes.Will be a patient and customer for however long my future is in Chicago- they've got me for life.

50.description: I am new to Chicago and was very nervous to find a new eye doctor. I live very close to this location and walk by on a daily basis.I have worn glasses for the past year and absolutely despised them! I wanted contacts but was unable to get them in! I know, i know... I would stand in front of my bathroom vanity and jab my eye over and over before giving up. Seeing 'greater than' Appearance, I admitted defeat and glasses it was.I scheduled my appointment online (love) was contacted immediately (love) and the receptionist are INCREDIBLE! LOVE!I went in for my appointment and was instantly impressed with the space . It's modern, fun, and had a great energy. The receptionist were so professional yet personable. They made me feel completely comfortable and I could 'see' I made the right choice. Dr. Braun was my optometrist and you couldn't ask for better! She was knowledgeable, kind, professional, and much much more. I was confident with my prescription and got brave and asked about contacts. I explained my past struggles and she ensured me that I would be a perfect candidate for them. She set me up for contact training the next day.I had my contact training with one of the receptionist and in 2 tries with her tips and techniques... I now am FRAME-FREE! THANK YOU!When my contacts were in a week later, I showed up a week after that. When I went into eye society everyone greeted me by name (without an appointment) and recognition is fantastic. I chatted with the staff for a bit and forgot that I was at the eye doctors. The customer service on every level was impeccable and I will be loyal to them forever!

4.description: What an amazing experience. By far the most professional, helpful and nicest staff. From the reception desk to the actual eye exam I was extremely impressed and pleased. There was no pressure to buy frames on the spot. I went back to the store 3 days after my exam to purchase my frames and had help when I needed it. I highly recommend Eye Society!

6.description: Friendly staff. Latest eye exam technology. Selection isn't huge, but well-curated, representing most of the latest styles and brands (like 141 Eyewear which I was interested in). I haven't walked into any light poles lately, so the glasses seem to be working great.

22.description: Walked in without an appointment.  Becca was very nice, attentive, and prompt.  She was very knowledgeable. She helped me see again!   The shop was very clean with a good selection. Service was excellent.  I come from a family of Ophthalmologists and I was very impressed.

15.description: My daughter and I get our eye exams& glasses from here. Recently daughter's glasses broke and I was really impressed on how quickly they were able to get her a replacement pair. Becca & the staff went above and beyond my expectations. Since my insurance wasn't eligible they were able to give me a discount. She got a affordable and more durable pair within a week!

57.description: Lovely office & staff.In my quest for an updated prescription, I stumbled upon Eye Society on Yelp.  Conveniently located in River North, the staff was friendly, the office was beautiful and the doctor was thorough and knowledgeable.  Very happy with the level of service, will definitely be back.

20.description: Why does an optometrist appointment have to feel like a trip to a used car lot? I went in to get my contact lens prescription updated, nothing more. When my appointment started I was immediately swept into a sales pitch for an elective retinal imaging procedure, which I didn't need and my insurance wouldn't cover fully, so I refused it after some persistent salesmanship.When my appointment ended, the staff balked at giving me my prescription so I could order contacts online. They were fine with this in 2013 - it was a big part of why I decided to come back - so I was surprised and disappointed at the change in attitude. Again they laid on the sales pressure and convinced me to buy lenses from them and take a chance at what has turned out to be a fairly onerous mail-in rebate. The rebate comes only in the form of a prepaid Visa card, you have to submit original copies of two different receipts (which you do not receive on the day of your Eye Society appointment), and you have to submit your name, address, and email to CooperVision and surely their marketing department.The exam with the doctor was pleasant, but I don't appreciate being nickel-and-dimed for medical services and will not return.

36.description: Great customer service - willing to help answer questions and very professional.

14.description: I have never been a fan of wearing glasses, but with the right pair of frames I feel like I look as good as I can see!  Thanks Dan!!!  The Dr. and the staff are really friendly and very helpful.  I'd recommend them to friends!

58.description: Market Review: I eat there 5 out of 5 daysI think that speaks for itself. However I will continue anyways because... because! there is a HUGE range of food. Hot bar, is always great, changes daily and it's fresh, looking. Not 2 hour old mashpotatoes. It's really great, I love the salad bar. Even the premade salad are great. great vegetarian options, and even vegan! I always go with their quinoa salad (idk which one there is like 3) and I like to make up my own salad often. The root veggies on the hot bar TASTE AMAZING and the mac and cheese is pretty delish also. CANT STOP EATING THERE

56.description: Amazing brunch! Visiting Chicago for the weekend and found this new gem. Had the pot roast sandwich and my boyfriend had the chimichurri steak. All amazing! The hash browns were a little dry for our taste so we probably wouldn't order that again but aside from that delish and great atmosphere! New, hip, and tasty :)Side note: We mentioned the hash browns were a little over cooked and they promptly took them off the bill without us asking. Great customer service!

29.description: The only way to improve on an already great establishment is to open up another location closer to the heart of downtown. Plenty of open seating and a separate coffee bar with all the pastries you can hope to eat, it's a great place to swing by for a quick snack or for a full brunch with several friends.Ordered the mushroom quinoa burger, which was my perfect idea of a veggie burger; it didn't try to taste like meat, was just right in taste and texture and had an extra kick if you add in the sriracha aioli sauce (so good!).All in all a perfect Sunday brunch experience - will definitely be coming back to try all the other items on the menu.

42.description: Came here for bunch with six of my close friends. Front host staff was very friendly, and I ordered a Butter Chai tea to wait by the bar while waiting for the rest of my party to arrive. It was the most delicious Chai I have ever had-- made with great spices, almond milk, coconut, and grass fed butter. Once seated, I ordered the Chicken Tinga with a side of Ricotta Cheese Raspberry toast. The toast looks like pasta sauce which was initially scary, but the taste was very sweet light and fresh. The Tinga was all right, could have had more flavor in the spices though the chicken was very tender and eggs well made. Would definitely come here again for the the chai!!!

23.description: The coffee bar is great with unique drinks like the espresso Hot Chocolate,  and the must try, Nitro.Nitrogen charged cold brew on tap.It's so creamy it doesn't need,  cream.Great place.

47.description: I have been to the river north store for a couple times but today is my first visit to streeterville Beatrix. Convenient location with nice ambiance for brunch. I had the waffle with mixed berries. Waffle is not too sweet and the mint gives a nice touch for your last bite! Parking is a bit challenging as expected...

8.description: Nitro coffee with vanilla for me and the blueberry cocktail for the fiancé. We also ordered a carrot juice which was yum. This was the first time i had a nitro coffee and I was pretty darn happy with it. The price was 4.95$ which is pretty decent I think. The blueberry cocktail was their housemade juice, gin and a few other things. I'm not a gin drinker but the cocktail was pretty good, this was 11$. We sat at the bar and was served by the bartender.. Service was just okay. But we minded our own business and enjoyed our drinks. If I ever come back it would prob be for a Togo drink or be seated in the dining area. Bar had no ambiance or appeal.

31.description: I couldn't be happier to have a second location of my favorite restaurant open. If you haven't been to the original Beatrix, you're missing out.This continues the atmosphere and reputation as the original. This is a goto place for me whether it's just grabbing coffee, doing brunch, or grabbing dinner.If you're in the neighborhood, this is definitely worth a stop in to check out.The staff is really friendly, the atmosphere is spot on, and the food is delicious. Do it. I dare you.

34.description: I loved the original Beatrix already and now there's another!!? Fantastic. Now I always stop by and grab something from the Fresh market when I am at the doctor's office since it's right on the Northwestern campus. This place does get very packed on the weekends for brunch so I would recommend planning ahead for reservations. Service 5/5Of the 3 times we've dined here dinner/brunch the service has been good and the waitstaff are very pleasant. Food 5/5 By far my favorite brunch dish is the cauliflower grits and they do an amazing job at this location. I really like it much better in Streeterville than in RN. I will go out of my way to this location to order this dish because they execute it so much better. My husband is a big fan of the braised pot roast and egg sandwich. I ask for some of the extra relish that comes with that dish because it's also delicious with the cauliflower. Overall, I'm really happy with this new location and will continue to be a customer at Beatrix. The Market addition is wonderful, I wish the River North location had one too!

16.description: While at another restaurant with another friend, I had mentioned the Beatrix -Streeterville was listed on Beatrix's website.  We are both fans of Beatrix on State Street.  I had called and found out they just opened - TODAY.  After a drink and an appetizer, we had left the first restaurant and went to Beatrix & Market - Streeterville.Upon entering the restaurant, we were greeted by the hostess staff and were seated promptly.  We were seated at a table next to the kitchen.  I will say this table is not for everyone since it faces directly into the kitchen.  I had enjoyed this table - got to see how the kitchen staff works together and we were able to see the food come up from the line.  The dining area is very much like the original Beatrix - very modern - very cool.Danny, server, had greeted us and took our drink order.  By the time, he brought us the wine, we were ready to order.   I had ordered the Bebe Chicken and my friend had ordered the Neatloaf. While we waiting for the entrees, we had walked around.  The dining room has dining three areas. Two of the areas are more casual area then the third area has a bar and an eating area for the "market".  The Market is just like Foodease with the available hot and cold foods.By the time we had returned back to the table, our food was brought to us.  The presentation was fantastic.   The chicken was incredible.  I had tried the neatloaf and was also very good.    Danny would check in with us.Of course, we had saved room for dessert.  We had decided to split the Apple Stredel.  One word - YUM.For the first day of operation - everything was fantastic.  When I'm in the area, I defiantely will be back.  I would highly recommend this restaurant - market.

13.description: Dined here for the first time for restaurant week. I did their lunch tasting menu and it was very satisfying. I started with their tomato soup which I highly recommend. It had a very unique blend of flavors but was absolutely delicious! Their warm pot roast sandwich was awesome! Very filling! My only criticism is I found their desserts to be a little too sweet and rich for my taste. We tried the caramel pie and chocolate cake along with the chia pudding. I liked the uniqueness of the chia pudding but I'm not sure I'd order it again. The atmosphere of the restaurant is really laid back and comfortable. I recommend this place for lunch or a casual but nice dinner.

11.description: In a city with a plethora of brunch options, Beatrix is truly a class act.  After a wonderful first experience at this location, I came back today with my family.  The food was excellent again, but they accidentally brought us the order for a different table at first, meaning that my dad received the wrong toast and meat, and half of our party got their food about three minutes later than everyone else.  I found it a bit weird that they asked for the original, wrong food that they had given to my dad back, but whatever--not a big deal.  However, the way they made up for it was by going extremely above-and-beyond and bringing us an entire platter of baked desserts.  Absolutely delicious, and although it really wasn't necessary, what great customer service!  I plan to return many times!

39.description: Half an hour wait for brunch on Sunday - service was horrible. Our server kept disappearing and I had to ask for the check twice before I went up to the hostess stand. I ordered the spicy chicken tinga and it wasn't very spicy and had too much tomato sauce in it. I've had chicken tinga a few times in NY and it was very different. My boyfriend had the egg-white omelet and he says it was good but how difficult is an omelet?I wouldn't return.

37.description: Ordered a bunch of items. Everything was ok. Service could have been better. Music horrible. All was nearly saved by my arugula straight A salad though!

0.description: I was in Chicago  for a conference all day and I had both lunch and dinner in this restaurant.I sat at the bar for each meal and the bar tender was  super friendly and attentive.For lunch I had crispy kale salad , absolutely delicious and for dinner I had a burger very juicy.Great place to hang out!

38.description: Sitting at the restaurant writing this review...the waiter has left us unattended again!  My husband picked the restaurant out of a pack of restaurants through the Lettuce Entertain You group.  When we arrived for our reservation our table was not ready.  This is understandable.  My husband heard the host call my name, but another group took our table.  They said they were a group of two.  When walking to our table they said, but we are not Samantha.  They sat us after the two that took our table...but at the worst table in the place.  So, not worth the Open Table reservation.  Our table was basically in the server alley.  We each ordered a beer.  I would have liked to order more than one beer...never got the chance...but not after I was done with my entrée.  The one star goes to my husband's burger.  He enjoyed that.  I got the Chicken Bebe.  I should have not have gotten that.  It was also on the side menu for Restaurant Week, so I think it was rushed.  The menu called for roasted asparagus, I'm guessing it was steamed.  The chicken was heavily oiled and in a pool of sauce.  My stomach aches from what I ate.  We were going to get dessert too.  But the wait to clear the entrée plates was long.  The waiter did drop a menu for dessert but we were long past wanting to get the hell out of there.  We waited about 15 mins to just hand the gift cards over when he came with the bill.  I will never come to this place again.  I will tell people with the LYE gift cards to not go here.  I had over 200 in gift cards to spend here...didn't even break 50.  I would have if the food and experience was better.  My suggestion is to AVOID!

51.description: This review is only for the coffee shop since that's what we did on out first visit.  What a tremendous selection of unique as well as typical baked goodies!  I opted for an apricot tarte and hot cocoa.The tarte pastry was tender and the buttery taste melted in my mouth.  The apricot filling was loaded with finely chopped, apricots not just apricot flavored jelly like others I've had.  Some filling stuck to the paper wrapper and I absolutely licked it off of there like it was my job!

27.description: Dined here for the first time for restaurant week. I did their lunch tasting menu and it was very satisfying. I started with their tomato soup which I highly recommend. It had a very unique blend of flavors but was absolutely delicious! Their warm pot roast sandwich was awesome! Very filling! My only criticism is I found their desserts to be a little too sweet and rich for my taste. We tried the caramel pie and chocolate cake along with the chia pudding. I liked the uniqueness of the chia pudding but I'm not sure I'd order it again. The atmosphere of the restaurant is really laid back and comfortable. I recommend this place for lunch or a casual but nice dinner.

32.description: Food tasted phenomenal! Loved the steak chimichurri - will go back soon. Nice portions, really worth trying. AWESOME FOOD

54.description: Great waiter and awesome service. Everyone at our table got a different dish so I got to sample a lot and enjoy the short ribs, pork shank and burger (all so tender and flavorful). The Caesar salad was fun too, with the dressing underneath it on the plate. Try the caramel pie for dessert!

48.description: Nice ambience. Got seated pretty fast on a Friday night. Wasn't served or acknowledged more than 10 minutes after we were seated. Wasn't even that busy of a night. Left after waiting.

44.description: I've been twice- friendly staff, great food, fun bakery side. I like that the menu has lots of options from healthy (lots of hearty salads) to indulgent. Something for everyone. I also like that there are several fresh juice and mocktail options so for non-drinkers, you're not stuck with water or soda. Side note- first time I went with a friend, our server accidentally mis-described a menu item. It turned out to be no big deal, but he felt so bad that he sent over free cookies- really nice and really unexpected (and totally unnecessary because the snafu was not the slightest bit of a problem). Ambiance is lovely and I would highly recommend, especially if you're on the mag mile and want something less touristy.

24.description: The place is connected to a hospital which is a good thing because of the food that is undercooked. I had chicken breast on my salad and it was more red than the tomatoes. Lettuce Entertain You is not what it used to be I recommend better training for your servers and management staff until then you should be called Beatrix A Lettuce Try Not To Poison You restaurant

7.description: I came here on a Friday evening at around 6:30pm.  Make sure you make reservations prior to dining here especially on a Friday!  It may look like there are seats available, but usually they aren't.  There is always an option to order & eat at the bar if you are by yourself.Prime Burger ($13.95) - I enjoyed everything about this burger from the ingredients (I choose aged white cheddar for the cheese option) to the perfectly cooked medium rare beef.  I literally demolished the juicy burger (& you don't see me do this that often).  The burger was flavored perfectly so I did not have a need to add any additional condiments (ie. Ketchup etc).The burger came with kennebac fries which were tasty and seasoned just right (nothing too special about the fries though).Portions - The entrees alone are pretty filling itself.  I was literally stuffed after eating the prime burger.DessertWarm apple strudel ($7.95) - It tasted ok, but I would not rave about it.  If you like apple strudel, give it a try.  The portion is good for sharing amongst 2-3 ppl or more depending on your hunger level.*I heard the oh my caramel pie was tasty so it is my next to try list.Cost - expect to spend at least ~$20+ for dinner unless you are going to eat a salad (~$15, including tax etc).  The dessert options aren't too bad and it is around $7-$8.Atmosphere - Good for any size, diverse age range and communal /individual tables.Dress attire - casual, business casual, or you can dress up..Customer service - hostess was ok... server was knowlegeable & good.Washrooms - clean..no complaintsParking - street parking available (pay meters).Public transportation -just east of the grand red line (on the north side of the street)..a block or so east of Michigan ave.I would come here again to try their other menu options.

49.description: Great atmosphere, but most of all......the chocolate cake. Yeah, its amazing. I've had several dishes and cocktails here and all were fantastic. And if you're not feeling their cocktail list, you can order a juice from their specialty list and add your choice of alcohol. Highly recommended!

40.description: I came here on a Friday evening at around 6:30pm.  Make sure you make reservations prior to dining here especially on a Friday!  It may look like there are seats available, but usually they aren't.  There is always an option to order & eat at the bar if you are by yourself.Prime Burger ($13.95) - I enjoyed everything about this burger from the ingredients (I choose aged white cheddar for the cheese option) to the perfectly cooked medium rare beef.  I literally demolished the juicy burger (& you don't see me do this that often).  The burger was flavored perfectly so I did not have a need to add any additional condiments (ie. Ketchup etc).The burger came with kennebac fries which were tasty and seasoned just right (nothing too special about the fries though).Portions - The entrees alone are pretty filling itself.  I was literally stuffed after eating the prime burger.DessertWarm apple strudel ($7.95) - It tasted ok, but I would not rave about it.  If you like apple strudel, give it a try.  The portion is good for sharing amongst 2-3 ppl or more depending on your hunger level.*I heard the oh my caramel pie was tasty so it is my next to try list.Cost - expect to spend at least ~$20+ for dinner unless you are going to eat a salad (~$15, including tax etc).  The dessert options aren't too bad and it is around $7-$8.Atmosphere - Good for any size, diverse age range and communal /individual tables.Dress attire - casual, business casual, or you can dress up..Customer service - hostess was ok... server was knowlegeable & good.Washrooms - clean..no complaintsParking - street parking available (pay meters).Public transportation -just east of the grand red line (on the north side of the street)..a block or so east of Michigan ave.I would come here again to try their other menu options.

53.description: The lemon ricotta pancakes were mushy because they poured syrup on them before bringing them to the table.  The flavor was pleasant but it was really hard to get over the soggy, mushy texture.Service was painfully slow.

30.description: The waffles were amazing!! They were honestly the best I've ever had. The Bloody Mary was unbelievable as well. Friendly staff too!

46.description: Got off the plane, checked into the hotel, and found this warm, welcomed place for our first meal in town.Very cool vibe. Warm feel. Good service. Service was friendly and attentive.The food and wine selection was great. I ordered the branzino. It was just what I needed after a long travel day. Buttery deliciousness atop a bed of mushrooms. I cleaned my plate.Seems like a great place for dinner. There were various groups: first date, family night, girlfriend night out...and the occasional weary traveler just trying to blend in.

1.description: Alright I gave this place one more chance after two lackluster dinner meals and I finally remember what made me love the River North location... BRUNCH! Weekend brunch is what Beatrix is all about! Do it for the self serve chilaquiles! Shredded chicken, egg, tortilla chips, and cheese and then you build up with your own toppings that they have for you to choose... spicy coleslaw, shredded jack cheese, assortments of salsa (go verde!), guacamole, and more crispy chips to top if you please. Did I mention the self serve chilaquiles is all you can eat? For just under $12, you can eat as much chilaquiles as your heart desires. Make sure to grab a michelada to wash that all down.Some other notable favorites if you're not down to join the all you can eat club... their pot roast and egg sandwich or their chimichurri steak n eggs! I drool thinking about those. Anyways, til next time, cheers!

55.description: Came with my family on New Years and it was great! Nice and chill environment. Perfect to talk and have quality time in. The food and service are also great! Didn't have to wait long and the waiters were all so nice and friendly! Very clean and homey restaurant. Definitely will come again. Ordered the chicken bebe, tomato soup, straight A salad and prime burger. All tasted great. The black cherry sangria was also one the best I've had ever.

9.description: Beatrix is now one of my top 5 fave restaurants.  Our party of 5 enjoyed a comforting meal here with attentive service and fresh, flavorful food for Restaurant Week 2016!6 things I especially enjoyed:1.  The nymph-like service of our waiter, who reminded me of Mr. Bean from the Love Actually movie.  He was always there in the flashiest of flashes!  So polite and helpful too.2.  Saving $10 by opting for the $33 RW deal of an enlightened Caesar salad (with Greek yogurt, though less anchovy flavor and croutons than expected), salmon entrée (with warm tortillas to make fish tacos!), and a hunk of the tall-dark-and-handsome chocolate cake, which was SO MOIST, DECADENT, and INDULGENT!  3.  How clean those bathrooms are!4.  Seeing how much my friends equally enjoyed their meal (including the chicken bebe, tomato soup, and caramel pie!)5.  That chocolate cake though!  I have to go back to it.  It's hands down, one of the best chocolate cakes I've ever had! #heaven #whatwaistline #yolo6.  One block's proximity from Stan's Donuts AND Do-Rite.  You know, for second dessert.Can't wait to come back.  Beatrix is also a Lettuce Entertain You restaurant and on OpenTable!

26.description: I was very happy and satisfied with my dinner here recently.  The interior is bright and open.  The service was excellent, my water was refilled constantly and my waiter made everything he talked about sound so delicious I ordered everything he recommended.To start we had the chicken meatballs and the burrata.  Of these I highly recommend the burrata, it was perfectly paired with the figs.My main entree was pasta with beef that was a special, it was rich and delicious.I had the caramel pie and a nitro iced coffee for dessert.  The caramel pie was so decadent.  The nitro coffee was bitter and I would not get again (did not have that smooth iced coffee flavor I love).  Not to mention the salad /hot food bar is amazing for lunch if you are in the area.  Overall I love the atmosphere, the food is great and the service is fantastic.

25.description: I was traveling through Chicago alone and sat at the bar. In my experience, bartenders in trendy/posh restaurants are not very friendly. These bartenders were great. You have to try the juice there. They also have a great gluten free menu and yummy cocktails.

12.description: An delightful (and "healthy") experience!My wife and I had heard often about Beatrix but we're never really tempted to visit the place. Last Saturday we were starving and happened to walk by Beatrix Streeterville, so we decided to go for brunch. The restaurant's decoration is nothing special, yet there's something about it that makes it feel warm and cozy. The staff is very friendly and quick to greet you with a huge smile. Not too loud, not too quiet, the perfect music volume to make it a pleasant experience. Food was ASTONISHING! I ordered the chicken tinga (with two sunny side-up eggs and avocado) and my wife ordered a healthier version of eggs Benedict (over a quinoa patty instead of an English muffin). We were both extremely happy with our meal. Everything in the menu looked mouth-watering and we absolutely loved what we tried. This will become one of our favorite spots in the city for a casual lunch:1) Inexpensive2) Great food3) Healthy twist4) Good ambience5) Friendly staff

59.description: LOVE the bulletproof coffee here!  Pastries are really good, except I thought the angel food cake was a bit dry.  But overall, solid breakfast bar.Also, they have a salad bar off to the side to grab and go fresh, local, organic ingredients!

21.description: My husband and I decided on Tuesday to get a reservation for Saturday night which was risky and were surprised that there were many options available at Beatrix.  That should have been a clue as to what we were going to experience.  We arrived on schedule and were seated quickly but ended up at the very back of the restaurant almost near the exit.  The back portion was not fully filled so the good news was we could at least hear each other talk which is not the case in many places these days.  The decor was also very pleasing.  We ordered drinks but it took a while to arrive which was surprising since it was not packed.  We placed our orders and although I have had the salad before on another visit it was almost lukewarm and there was a mess of dressing at the bottom of the plate which was very unappealing.  When the entrees arrived the server left so quickly I couldn't even ask him a question so I want with the flow since our waiter was not to be found.  My short rib entree was awful.  It was not very hot because it must have been sitting under the lamp because some of the veggies were dried out.  However the worst part was the rib itself.  It was the most bland boring dish and presentation I have have ever had.  It must have been leftover or sitting on a heating table and totally lacked ANY flavor or seasoning.   It was more like a bad pot roast.  Fortunately, my husband's entree was better.  The service while very courteous was lackluster.  The only time we saw our waiter after we placed our order was just before we flagged him to get our bill.  It is not often that we only have one drink with our dinner but considering how the food was it was not worth it.  If the restaurant is going to be wildly successful in this area it has to improve.  Service could certainly be more attentive and the  menu needs more interesting and creative entrees. We have heard this from several of our neighbors and we tend to agree with them now.

17.description: The only way to improve on an already great establishment is to open up another location closer to the heart of downtown. Plenty of open seating and a separate coffee bar with all the pastries you can hope to eat, it's a great place to swing by for a quick snack or for a full brunch with several friends.Ordered the mushroom quinoa burger, which was my perfect idea of a veggie burger; it didn't try to taste like meat, was just right in taste and texture and had an extra kick if you add in the sriracha aioli sauce (so good!).All in all a perfect Sunday brunch experience - will definitely be coming back to try all the other items on the menu.

10.description: The burger was really delicious. Great atmosphere and one of the best services we received. Not great for a huge group and parking is tough but definitely a great spot for dinner and drinks.

5.description: I LOVE BEATRIX- in RIVER NORTH! I have been dozens of times to that location with different people, different hours, and for different occasions. But this location isn't bad either! I made reservations for 7:15 on a Tuesday night for Restaurant Week. There is a very small waiting area just right in the front with two chairs, a bar that is bigger than it needs to be, and a cozy dining room to the left after you walk in. You can see the chef's station- and this location is smaller than the one in River North. This is a perfect location if you work nearby and want to escape the expensive prices of MI ave restaurants. The host was friendly and seated me right away at 7 pm but didn't ask if I would like to wait for my friend. The waiter approached me immediately, and he was very accommodating working with me with the restaurant week menu. The wine list is great and I got a glass of Sauvignon Blanc from Napa for 11 dollars which is a great deal! I love Branzino. And the brioche crusted one was a sweet deal.The tomato soup had a food drawing of a 'smiley face' and the chocolate cake and caramel pie are to die for. The Chicken Bebe was perfectly tender. All the flavors are healthy and simple, with a dash of creativity and flavor. Perfect restaurant for vegetarians. Hope to return back for Brunch!

3.description: Absolutely love this restaurant.   It offers everything from coffee to ready-made meals for those on the go (think Foodease) to a spectacular dine-in menu.  I've had their coffee which is pretty good-not to mention cheaper than Starbucks!  I've dined in for lunch and tried the Prime burger which was awesome.  Service is friendly, too.  A great dining option located on the first floor of Northwestern Memorial Hospital.  Another LEYE hit!

35.description: I'm a loyal Lettuce Gold member and I stopped by this Beatrix for dinner about a week ago. I was extremely excited to try this location because i LOVE the river north one, but was unfortunately disappointed here.The only word I can use to describe the service was "stumble." The hostess was nice and sat us down right away for a 8:15 reservation. But the waiter just seemed uncertain about everything. He lacked a certain "suave," which was apparent when I asked questions. For example, I asked if I could sub-out my fries for some kind of vegetable. After a series of "ums," I got a "well you could get a side salad." I had gone to the river north location a week prior and had gotten asparagus on the side then. I asked the waiter if i could do the same here. After a series of more "ums," I got a half-shrug and "yeah, I guess we could do that here."The whole experience was kind of similarly disjointed...

19.description: What a surprise. We found this place as a last minute dinner choice with some friends before beginning the evening in the city. It turned out to exceed all of our expectations. The decor is casual modern and it wasn't overly packed. It has a full bar as well as a cocktail menu. The food also exceeded our expectations. We had the turkey sweet potato and greens neatloaf and chicken bebe, which both turned out to be excellent choices. Rich in flavor and a good portion to fill you up without leaving with a doggie bag.The place is more known for their brunch, but don't pass it up for dinner - it's worth a shot.

28.description: I LOVE BEATRIX- in RIVER NORTH! I have been dozens of times to that location with different people, different hours, and for different occasions. But this location isn't bad either! I made reservations for 7:15 on a Tuesday night for Restaurant Week. There is a very small waiting area just right in the front with two chairs, a bar that is bigger than it needs to be, and a cozy dining room to the left after you walk in. You can see the chef's station- and this location is smaller than the one in River North. This is a perfect location if you work nearby and want to escape the expensive prices of MI ave restaurants. The host was friendly and seated me right away at 7 pm but didn't ask if I would like to wait for my friend. The waiter approached me immediately, and he was very accommodating working with me with the restaurant week menu. The wine list is great and I got a glass of Sauvignon Blanc from Napa for 11 dollars which is a great deal! I love Branzino. And the brioche crusted one was a sweet deal.The tomato soup had a food drawing of a 'smiley face' and the chocolate cake and caramel pie are to die for. The Chicken Bebe was perfectly tender. All the flavors are healthy and simple, with a dash of creativity and flavor. Perfect restaurant for vegetarians. Hope to return back for Brunch!

45.description: I love their brunch menu and a various selection of breads!

33.description: Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.OK, I've been here four or five times for breakfast and lunch and told myself today, I need to leave these guys a good review because... they deserve it!  First off, this is a MUCH better use than the previous restaurant that was here which seemed to have an identity crisis.  Beatrix has Very solid food and the place runs like a well oiled machine.  It's border line "health food" but they do have some less healthy items and a complete bar.  The space is huge so it's always been easy for me to get a seat.  A lot of the food I order here is simply, healthy stuff that reminds me of something I might quickly throw together at home.  David the bartender is very good too.  I was impressed when I came back for my second time that he remembered my name and he makes an absolutely correct Negroni.  Almost forgot to mention they do a brisk take out business which is a nice option if you work nearby or you're stuck at the hospital for a while.  Nice job team BeatrixPlease don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

43.description: This location is just as good as their River North location. I believe the menu is also very similar if not identical.At this location specifically, I've only had brunch here on New Years. The place wad definitely busy possibly since people were trying to nurse their hangover from the night before!Food: Good to great.Green chile enchiladas: My husband thought this was just ok. This would be the reason this is a 4 star and not a 5 star.Egg sandwich: I really enjoyed my sandwich! I would definitely recommend.French toast: This was a great dessert to end our meal!Juices: They make all their juices in house. We tried and green juice and a red one. Both were yummy if just a little pricy.Price: Very reasonable with many different price points to choose from.Service: No complaints. Our waiter was very nice and checked up on us a few times.

2.description: We came to Beatrix to kick-off my friend's bachelorette party. Beatrix as a whole is lovely. The food is delicious and the ambiance is perfect. If you go, you have to try the fresh squeezed juice and stay for Brunch. I had the breakfast enchiladas and my oh my they were lovely. All of my girlfriend's had delicious meals as well. Only complaint is that our service was lackluster. We let them know that we were celebrating a Bachelorette party and they took down the name of the Bachelorette when we arrived, but then... nothing happened. When we were seated our waiter said "your server [name] will be with you shortly, can I get you started with some drinks?". We led with some drink orders, two of us ordered the spicy bloody mary on the front of the menu for $7.95 and another two of us got the mimosas. Now here's what's a bit odd, we never got a new server. The original person who had taken our drink orders stayed with us. He never came back to check on us after our food came out, which was unfortunate because the Bachelorette's mimosa was basically just a glass of prosecco and she couldn't drink it. Once we were done eating and our plates were cleared, it took 15 minutes to get our check from him. Once we did get our check, it was wrong. He had charged $11.95/each for the Bloody Marys. To be fair, there are two "spicy bloody marys" on the menu and they have different pricing. Perhaps there should be a way to distinguish this? Anyways, the food was great but service was less than desireable.

18.description: This review is only for the coffee shop since that's what we did on out first visit.  What a tremendous selection of unique as well as typical baked goodies!  I opted for an apricot tarte and hot cocoa.The tarte pastry was tender and the buttery taste melted in my mouth.  The apricot filling was loaded with finely chopped, apricots not just apricot flavored jelly like others I've had.  Some filling stuck to the paper wrapper and I absolutely licked it off of there like it was my job!

41.description: Great salad and after dinner treats.  Very good wait staff. I highly recommend.  You can eat at the bar or find a table that is more intimate.  Consider reservations.

52.description: What a spot, great CS, friendly staff, good drinks, amazing food. It was my 1st time and I had the quinoa and eggs, it was like a veggie patty and eggs on top. Would def like to come back and try another item on the menu.

50.description: This is a great lunch destination featuring a healthy take on comfort food. At least that's what the waitress said. In reality it was high on salad options for comfort food but still a great menu with fresh seasonal ingredients you can feel good about eating. And the flavor were excellent too. I enjoyed the deviled eggs, although the portion was small (1.5 eggs peeler order), and the mushroom quinoa burger. It was really well cooked with lots of flavor and a nice side of fries. I'll be back soon.

4.description: Beatrix is so trendy and family friendly, located right off the Magnificent Mile! I was in heaven drinking my latte topped Mexican spices, eating  delicious "snacks" (appetizers) and listening to Sublime playing in the background. So relaxing and warm on this frigid Chicago morning. My kids were enjoying fresh juices and a kids menu that was not dumbed down.  The hummus was wonderful and served with a tomato salad and warm Naan bread. We also went with the fries which included fried potatoes,  peppers and lemons and were served with a spicy dipping sauce.  I LOVE  fried lemons, as do my kids and the addition of the peppers made for a unique and colorful spin on a traditional french fry. Perfectly crispy.Our service was outstanding! Some of the best I have had in awhile.  I will most definitely be back next time I am in Chicago.

6.description: I'm a loyal Lettuce Gold member and I stopped by this Beatrix for dinner about a week ago. I was extremely excited to try this location because i LOVE the river north one, but was unfortunately disappointed here.The only word I can use to describe the service was "stumble." The hostess was nice and sat us down right away for a 8:15 reservation. But the waiter just seemed uncertain about everything. He lacked a certain "suave," which was apparent when I asked questions. For example, I asked if I could sub-out my fries for some kind of vegetable. After a series of "ums," I got a "well you could get a side salad." I had gone to the river north location a week prior and had gotten asparagus on the side then. I asked the waiter if i could do the same here. After a series of more "ums," I got a half-shrug and "yeah, I guess we could do that here."The whole experience was kind of similarly disjointed...

22.description: Beatrix is so trendy and family friendly, located right off the Magnificent Mile! I was in heaven drinking my latte topped Mexican spices, eating  delicious "snacks" (appetizers) and listening to Sublime playing in the background. So relaxing and warm on this frigid Chicago morning. My kids were enjoying fresh juices and a kids menu that was not dumbed down.  The hummus was wonderful and served with a tomato salad and warm Naan bread. We also went with the fries which included fried potatoes,  peppers and lemons and were served with a spicy dipping sauce.  I LOVE  fried lemons, as do my kids and the addition of the peppers made for a unique and colorful spin on a traditional french fry. Perfectly crispy.Our service was outstanding! Some of the best I have had in awhile.  I will most definitely be back next time I am in Chicago.

15.description: Happy to have this addition to the NWM site. Great food, ambiance, and space. Everything I've had was satisfyingly good.Chicken Salad; Meatloaf; Prime Burger; Mushroom/quinoa burger; Fries; Straight A Salad; Apple Strudel; Lemon pancakes; Le Colombe coffee... really, you can't go wrong here!

57.description: Fresh and inventive food. Casual dishes like salads and sandwiches complimented by a range of snacks and side. They have a great bar and coffee bar so this is a great place to get a drink and a snack or a full meal. The service was welcoming and attentive. The staff totally makes me want to come back.

20.description: In a city with a plethora of brunch options, Beatrix is truly a class act.  After a wonderful first experience at this location, I came back today with my family.  The food was excellent again, but they accidentally brought us the order for a different table at first, meaning that my dad received the wrong toast and meat, and half of our party got their food about three minutes later than everyone else.  I found it a bit weird that they asked for the original, wrong food that they had given to my dad back, but whatever--not a big deal.  However, the way they made up for it was by going extremely above-and-beyond and bringing us an entire platter of baked desserts.  Absolutely delicious, and although it really wasn't necessary, what great customer service!  I plan to return many times!

36.description: the kennebunk fries and oh my carmel pie are worth their weight in gold

14.description: I've been twice- friendly staff, great food, fun bakery side. I like that the menu has lots of options from healthy (lots of hearty salads) to indulgent. Something for everyone. I also like that there are several fresh juice and mocktail options so for non-drinkers, you're not stuck with water or soda. Side note- first time I went with a friend, our server accidentally mis-described a menu item. It turned out to be no big deal, but he felt so bad that he sent over free cookies- really nice and really unexpected (and totally unnecessary because the snafu was not the slightest bit of a problem). Ambiance is lovely and I would highly recommend, especially if you're on the mag mile and want something less touristy.

58.description: I like the Dollop coffee shop on S Dearborn St very much. I went there many times, so I want to try this one. But very bad and rude service, the waiter (a guy with beard and glasses) wouldn't wanna explain to me just one more time when clearly there was no one behind. He told me that they wouldn't accept international credit card in a very rude manner (and since when stores don't accept Visa cards?). I purchase coffees fine in the other Dollop coffee shop and everywhere else in the world. Wouldn't come back again!

56.description: this place is great.the outer walls are large windows, providing awesome lighting & great city views. the coffee is delightful & the staff is great.I came here to wind down & plug in. the wifi is great for that and there are also plugs everywhere which is an amazing plus. no wandering around like a weirdo staring at people's feet in an attempt to find adequate outlet space- you're covered here! lots of tables for seating, a couch, and a couple comfy chairs. they also offer creative sandwiches and coffee options such as the Brie sandwich with fig jam, pear, and Brie as well as a Rosemary latte = coooool. I just got some drip black coffee but I'd definitely be down to try one of those [or both] next time I'm in town.they have loud-ish rock music that's not typically my style, but I was planning to use headphones anyway so this was not an issue in the least. great space and tasty coffee!

29.description: Cute place great options I had the Mexican latte it was perfect, not too hot to totally kill my taste buds, perfect to drink right away, plenty of seating, decent music, they played the yeah yeah yeahs when I was in there  I'll be back

42.description: On a bike ride downtown happened by this place and thought I'd try it. Look and feel: cool place. A cross between industrial and old time soda bar, with lots of tables, outlets and free fast wifi. Drinks: I had the iced Red Eye, good standard coffee fare. Some of the menu items are raved about in these reviews and I would have tried one had I read them ahead of time.Staff: Huge shortcoming. Hipsters, but not the fun, worldly kind. The bad kind. The over-compensating snotty kind. I like living in the Midwest because it lacks the caustic edge and icy demeanor of much of my native East Coast. The coffee houses in this city are known for their friendliness and I have learned to like and appreciate that.Not here. I did not see one person behind the counter smile the entire time I was here working, about 1.5 hours. The poofy haired guy in horn rims/tank top who took my order acted as if I was going to ask him to borrow money. The tall hair-piled-on-top young woman who took my 2nd order was the same way only she barely even looked me in the eye. In fact, the only person I saw approach warmth was the cute African-American woman making a sandwich.I wanted to ask if someone had died. I'll give it one more chance on the possibility that something negative had happened and I was there on an off day.It's a coffee shop guys, not the Philosophy Dept. at Harvard. Lighten up. You actually have pretty cool jobs for the service industry. Try working at McDonald's.

23.description: Great café for getting work done. Big, airy and spacious with both communal and private tables. Fast wifi and perfect ambiance music for working (Daft Punk, Zero 7, instrumentals, etc). I had the veggie sandwich on a baguette and it was really good and fresh. I'm from out of town but if I lived here I'd come back.

47.description: This place is great for an early morning breakfast stop. There's outside seating, great coffee and their bagel sandwiches are awesome. My old complaint would be that the outside seating often has spills that go un mopped. In any event, the decor is a cool, funky modern style, and the staff tend to be friendly and uncharacteristically hip for the area. If you work in the area and get into the city a little early, go pick up a latte from them. It's less busy than intelligencia and just as good (if not better). They also have the coolest milk steamer I've ever seen.

8.description: After dinner at Bombay Wraps across the road, I suggested post-meal coffee fix to my hubby.  I knew Dollop Coffee & Tea was in a close proximity, and they open until 2100 hour, unlike many downtown coffee shops that would close at 1800 hour or open no later than 2000 hour.  I walked in, quickly browsed through the menu, and found my target of interest!  "Awesome, they have Mexican mocha with cayenne."  I always love the "Ipsento" at Ipsento in Bucktown by the CTA Western Blue Line station (O'Hare branch).  Cayenne pepper is the key ingredient in a cup of "Ipsento."  Thus, I was excited to see it on the menu here at Dollop.  Dollop Coffee & Tea uses Metropolis Coffee, one of my favorite local coffee brands (other than Dark Matter).  They have a high-ceiling dining room, with a plenty of chairs, high stools, and power outlets.  My plan was to take it to-go, yet I changed my mind since the ambiance appeared to be relaxing to stick around and watch some sophisticated downtown-dwellers passing back and forth.  My Mexican mocha was delicious, but the cayenne pepper was a bit too strong to my liking.  Perhaps my taste bud was somewhat skewed since I had some Indian food with distinct spices used in the food I just consumed.  Nevertheless, I was very glad I could end my work day with a cup of quality coffee.I remember my last visit to a Dollop Coffee & Tea (Lakeview location) wasn't as spectacular, but I think I've had a better experience with this Streeterville location this evening.  As always, I'm a die-hard supporter of local businesses, and I will certainly advocate Dollop Coffee & Tea to anyone who wants "coffee," not diluted, mysterious brown H2O like you see at a place with an initial "DD."

31.description: I love Dollop! Their drinks are great. I had the Nutella mocha which was perfectly balanced and not too sweet. Definitely worth a try. Dollop is one of my favorite places in river north to do work! The ambiance is a perfect combination of hipster and modern. They have ample outlets and lots of table space.

34.description: I love Dollop.  The workers are awesome and the ambience is perfect for getting some work done.  Specialty coffees are delicious *favorites: lavender vanilla and cinnamon honey* and as an added bonus, they offer Hoosier Mamma pies and boar's head sandwiches so you can literally stake out there all day.  Vibe: there's a trophy by the cashier that says "best kissers" and a tip jar that says "to keep Max off the pole" - basically, awesome.If you can, you should get to know Max, he's pretty ridiculous.

16.description: I have a love and hate relationship with this location. I love the food and drinks and service but I absolutely hate the clientele and how dirty the bathroom gets. I'm absolutely in love with their ham and cheese croissants and jam biscuits. I don't even care that I turn into the queen of crumbs while eating it. The berry iced tea is my go to drink here but I hear that the Nutella mocha is amazing. There's a couple of outlets for the working bunch that frequents this place but they're kind of oddly placed. The four or so couch seats can't reach (only two to three seats in that area can reach the outlet that has room for seven devices to be plugged in.The people who are under the mistaken notion that they're in their own living room so they take their shoes off and place their feet on the couches and proceed to speak loudly- disgust me. This is still a place of business, one that serves food and drinks no less. Nobody wants to see your gross feet on the couch near their food. I have no idea why people are complaining about the servers here. They aren't little rays of sunshine all the time but no one is after being hassled to make ridiculous drink concoctions for people who are equally no rays of sunshine. They've always been polite and delivered what I ordered. As long as they serve the berry iced tea I'll be back. It's delicious!

13.description: Dollop is a cool coffee joint near the magnificent mile. They have the usual coffee selections and plus some unique special ones written on a small list located next to the register. The shop is very spacious with lots of seats, tables, and even a couch and sofas. This shop would make an excellent study center. I had the mexican mocha with cayenne, mexican cocoa, and lavender vanilla latte. Both mexican drinks had spicy cayenne pepper that is pretty noticeable but not too spicy to be offensive. The spiciness lingers on for minutes even if you stopped after a small sip. The lavender vanilla latte was pretty good but nothing outstanding. I especially love the creamy taste of it. All the drinks had a fair amount of sweetness which is just right for me. Price for the drinks was about 5 bux after tax for a large size, which appears to be 20 ounces, which is fair.The environment is minimalistic and trendy. It reminds me of the apple store with the wooden chairs, wooden tables, and clean design. Overall coffee 4 stars and environment 5 stars.

11.description: Cute place great options I had the Mexican latte it was perfect, not too hot to totally kill my taste buds, perfect to drink right away, plenty of seating, decent music, they played the yeah yeah yeahs when I was in there  I'll be back

39.description: Really solid coffee. Love the atmosphere and space (open and light) . Great place to bring your computer and get work done!

37.description: Service was awesome & they customized my drink exactly how I wanted it! Great coffee shop, you will not be disappointed!! Highly recommended!!!!

0.description: Ordered the Raspberry Mocha, Mexican Mocha, and the Turkey Sandwich.The Raspberry Mocha was rich, creamy, flavorful, and had that nice raspberry flavor that made you want to drink it more and more. It wasn't too heavy and served as a great morning starter. Great choice if you want a change from your regular mocha.The Mexican Mocha was definitely more flavorful due to the dash of cayenne that warms your soul as you drink it. The consistency was thicker and creamier. This is the perfect drink for a cold Chicago day! The Turkey Sandwich was also very delicious! The avocado and chipotle mayo paired perfectly with the toasty whole grain bread. Everything was very fresh and made my morning fantastic!Will definitely be back to try the other items on the menu! There is also also of table space to get work done as well as outlets and wifi!

38.description: Nothing spectacular. They serve metropolis coffee which I enjoy, but tasted a little burnt when I had it here. The inside is gorgeously decorated but compact. I do enjoy that they serve Hoosier Mama's quiches and some pies. One thing I found off putting was when I paid. There are 2 iPads laid on the counter so I  can see hers and she can see mine. I gave the woman my card. She swiped it and a screen that said tip pops up. I immediately hit no tip because all she did was pour 1 cup of coffee. I felt very awkward that she was staring the entire time.  Also, no lids for small coffee. Woof, spilled coffee on myself twice while walking.

51.description: I love this place.  The space is great, the chai is good, they have almond milk, and their biscuits are delicious.  I love coming here, which is what makes their new strategy of having their bathroom "out of order" on a daily basis so annoying.It has been going on for probably two months now.  The bathroom (there is only one unisex stall) works in the early morning, but mysteriously breaks down by 11am.  Either they have a terrible plumber, the city's worst pipes (strange for a new business), or they just don't want people to stay too long since they fill up so quickly.  I just don't get it.  Change your policy, your prices, whatever, but don't shut off access to bathroom, especially when you serve coffee...

27.description: We had a quick weekend away & were staying close by, we ended up at Dollop two evenings in a row and both times we were the only customers. Which, I enjoyed! Although it seems to be much busier in the morning and close to lunch time.The space was trendy & a bit industrial and the staff was very friendly, which was a huge plus. Nothing worse than coffee snobs! :)My husband ordered hot chocolate and absolutely loved it. I had a mexican mocha- it definitely had quite the kick to it going down the throat, not really my style. I also tried a vanilla lavender latte, I believe is what it was called, and it didn't have too much flavor. I was hoping to really taste those notes of vanilla & lavender. All in all, I would go back and try something new. Good vibes.

32.description: This is my go to spot in the Loop for a cafe study session. People are generally reasonably quiet and the large space supports this. ( if you're new and reading this, please keep it this way!) Large windows, white walls, wooden decor make it very enjoyable and trendy. The baristas are friendly and make a mean cayenne mocha!

54.description: Excuse me? Lavender vanilla latte? How did I get to heaven without even realizing it??Stopped in with my husband during our recent Chi-town trip for our favorite activity of late...exploring coffee shops. This place was bragging all sorts of crazy awesome espresso drinks...there was also a lavender white mocha that I almost ordered,  and a rosemary latte, and the classic but always-a-winner Mexican mocha. And those were among lots of others that looked creative and delish. I've noticed that sometimes coffee shops that offer crazy options can't really pull them off...and the appeal is more of the excitement over something different than of how tasty it actually is. However, I have to say that the lavender vanilla late was excellent. Excellent!! I was so happy as I sat there sipping it and eating my almond croissant while people watching over at the bar across from the counter. Loving it!! I will be sure to stop back by one of these the next time I'm in Chicago, and I will try something new!

48.description: Stopped by here to get a drink after eating at M Burger. Very spacious coffee place. Exceptionally high ceiling with lots of sunlight from the glass windows.The lavender vanilla latte is amazing! Not too sweet with the vanilla. The lavender is subtle but noticeable enough - awesome drink. House coffee is great, fresh, bold, and full bodied. One thing I find interesting is that there is only one restroom for the entire store, which is quite large in size, compared to the coffee shops I've visited. I mean one for both genders. And the condition is not pleasing at all. Anyway, the drinks we've ordered are good and atmosphere is nice. We'll come again if we happen to be in this area next time.

44.description: Love these biatches. Great coffee and some food options. Dope place to go to work or study or meet with friends. Super cool decor. Only one thing that drives me crazy- NO Recycling. You go to throw something away and its full of paper and plastic. Otherwise I'd give them 5*s.

24.description: I'm not sure how to offer this feedback, as I have offered it several times to many staff members who don't seem to care, and I'm not sure if the business owner reads this, but this location is consistently disappointing for several reasons:1) they have a menu with delicious sandwiches, my favorite in the city actually, but are consistently out of supplies by noon, which seems like a simple enough fix (but what do I know? I only own my own business and therefor understand the necessity to offer my customers the goods I advertise), but none of the staff seems to care.2) the staff hates making food. Whenever I or my boyfriend go this location (which is frequently as we live down the street), the staff visibly rolls their eyes and then proceeds to treat us as if we ruining their day, which seems weird because IT'S THEIR FUCKING MENU THAT IM ORDERING FROM.3) good luck getting a bagel (that's right--at a coffee shop) after 11a. Poor staff and poor management. If that doesn't bother you, go for it--good food and coffee (the drip coffee is a little bitter for my taste). It's times like these where I'm so happy to be part of the American commerce, which used to stand for excellence in customer service, but now means paying inflated prices and being treated like shit. Thank you, Dollop, for consistency in your awfulness. And because I live in downtown Chicago, I'll be back tomorrow. Ah--the American Dream.

7.description: Stopped by here to get a drink after eating at M Burger. Very spacious coffee place. Exceptionally high ceiling with lots of sunlight from the glass windows.The lavender vanilla latte is amazing! Not too sweet with the vanilla. The lavender is subtle but noticeable enough - awesome drink. House coffee is great, fresh, bold, and full bodied. One thing I find interesting is that there is only one restroom for the entire store, which is quite large in size, compared to the coffee shops I've visited. I mean one for both genders. And the condition is not pleasing at all. Anyway, the drinks we've ordered are good and atmosphere is nice. We'll come again if we happen to be in this area next time.

49.description: Definitley my favorite coffee shop in Chicago. Both my drinks (cortado and cappuccino) were delcious, and the baristas were very friendly and talented.

40.description: My FAVORITE coffee and tea shop in the neighborhood.  Staff is so nice and the atmosphere is great.  The quality of the coffee is wonderful.  If your looking for a great cappuchino I highly recommend.  If your a tea person get the blueberry rooibos tea.

53.description: Good food and drinks except they don't replenish bread when they run out... So if you want to get a sandwich around 2pm you probably can't, which is annoying because they're pretty delicious.

30.description: I was treated extremely rudely by an employee with a British accent who hollered in front of other customers, "Bullshit entitlement!" I have a service animal that is trained to remind me to take my medicine. Said employee told me they don't have a license for service animals to which I replied, the business doesn't need one. It is a right protected by Federal Law. Service animals do not only need to provide physical guidance, such as a seeing eye dog; they are also allowed to assist with psychological/emotional needs such as depression or anxiety, provided they are trained a specific duty.Under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), businesses and organizations that serve the public must allow people with disabilities to bring their service animals into all areas of the facility where customers are normally allowed to go. This federal law applies to all businesses open to the public, including restaurants, hotels, taxis and shuttles, grocery and department stores, hospitals and medical offices, theaters, health clubs, parks, and zoos.Illinois State Law provides The Service Animal Access Act and White Cane Law are state criminal laws that guarantee the right of a person with a disability to be accompanied by a service animal in public.I don't know if he is unaware of the American Department of Justice or Illinois State Law, but as a manager or employee of a business, I would suggest educating yourself before you ignorantly and rudely address a paying customer. I will continue to exercise my protected right regardless of benighted individuals.

46.description: Oooh this place is a blessing! Of course I am biased with the location, as it's a block from me... But love the place for the variety of coffee it offered, beautiful location well lit so perfect for some quiet work! I am definitely going back to try some more soon!! P.s. The owner was kind enough to share his coffee experience with us!!! Made our day :)

1.description: Infinitely prefer the Dollop on Dearborn over this one on Ohio St. As Stephanie P mentioned earlier, the staff here are not friendly and generally are very indifferent towards customers. They also frequently and consistently run out of bread, so don't count on having bagels or sandwiches available, especially later in the day. There is plenty of seating, however, and the wifi is reliable! The coffee is great. The space is clean and spacious and there are decent pastries and other baked sweets.

55.description: Great place with excellent lattes and very nice baristas. Feels like a real coffee shop even though it's located close to the magnificent mile. Good place to work and socialize.

9.description: A great place to grab coffee or tea in the River East area. The place is usually bustling with students, and the place plays good music. Dollop uses Metropolis coffee, which is one of my favorite brands of coffee. There is both long table seating and comfy chairs, and the place provides free wifi. There are many other locations in Chicago, but this place is my favorite.

26.description: How Dollop makes a latte:1. Burn espresso.2. Burn milk.3. Pour burnt milk unto burnt espresso, be sure to make a heart or leaf design, because THIS is what makes it a latte.4. Pray that the customer uses a lot of sugar. Unfortunately for me, I like the taste of coffee and chose not to sweeten the sulfuric dirt I paid $3.75 for.  Your coffee is overpriced garbage. Notice every loves your flavored, sugary stuff. That's the sugar, not the quality of your product. Enjoy fleecing people.

25.description: I love this place but there is a weird cashier dude who seems foreign that charges me differently every time i go there even though i order same damn thing. He's definitely not nice and he never smiles. He seems likes hes little off and hits on every young girls. Btw whys he wearing shades when hes inside of the building?does he think hes robert downey jr of dollop or something? If hes not going to be friendly, then at least be professional and be consistent on how much to charge...all u have to do is to push a correct button.

12.description: I spent an afternoon at Dollop Coffee working on my thesis (luckily, I was eventually able to do this, but more on that later). I didn't choose Dollop--my girlfriend did. She arrived before me, and let me know that there was an open seat next to her. I usually avoid working at coffee shops in the city like the plague because they're so busy and it generally difficult to find seating. However, upon hearing that there was an open seat, I took the chance to try something new and took the train over.The location is prime, and the aesthetic is clean and the most "hipster" you can get for the North Side of the city. There are letters that say "DOLLOP" which I noticed several people took pictures of during the the hours I was there (presumably to upload onto social media). They also utilize their space pretty well. There were really as many seats as there possibly could comfortably be. Also, the outlet situation was perfect with power strips spread out throughout the cafe.My main issue with Dollop was the wifi situation. They advertise free wifi and they provide the password displayed prominently. My girlfriend had no issues whatsoever getting onto the wifi, so I figured I would be fine. Wrong. It took over half an hour for me to connect. It wouldn't connect on either of our phones either. There must not have been enough bandwidth to support all the people and their laptops. It wasn't until someone packed his laptop up and left that I was miraculously able to access the internet. It seems silly to me that a place that clearly has a lot of seating and people come to primarily to work on their laptops (and hook their phones up, too) wouldn't have enough bandwidth to support that. I've never run into that issue at Starbucks. The bathroom was also kind of dirty/falling apart, which wasn't at all consistent with the rest of the aesthetic, which surprised me a bit. Not a biggie, but worth mentioning. I would not seek out coming back to Dollop to get work done, but would consider dropping by for one of the bagels as an affordable quick food option in this area.

59.description: If I lived nearby I would be a regular. The front door is sort of hard to find, but after you get in, Dollop is nothing short of excellent. The barista who welcomed us knew a lot about the product and was willing to strategically help us decide what to get. They have lots of creative drink selections on top of the usual staples. If you don't mind sugar, definitely get one of these. I opted for a cafe miel (still has honey, oh well) and liked it very much. The interior is worth a few minutes relaxing. Next time I'm totally getting a piece of pie.

21.description: Nice perfect temperatured Cappuccino!Roastbeef sandwich on whole grain is delicious. Come back

17.description: This is a really cute place for a morning or afternoon of working. They have plenty of seats and usually you can find a place next to the outlets. I feel like the food selection isn't great, but they have the basics. I've had their sandwich, pie, and tea. The food is good enough, but I mainly go for the space. There's plenty of other people working and some are there chatting with friends as well.

10.description: Really cool environment and awesome atmosphere at Dollop. Although they have other locations around the city, I'm partial to this location. Great place to chill and catch up on some emails or study. Every time I come in it has been crowded. That's because the coffee is sooo good!  Lots of flavor packed into these drinks with some really great pastries and cookies to pair with a great mocha.

5.description: Beautiful coffee shop at a great location with decent coffee, lots of seating, plenty of outlets and wifi, and cafe food. They have a Mexican mocha/ chocolate that is delicious if you want to indulge!

3.description: I love love love studying here. The music is on point, it's never too crowded, & even if it is there are enough seats. Not to mention the free wifi. I've also gone to dollop on van buren in the loop but this location has so far been my favorite. I've gotten the smores mocha, Nutella mocha, & veggie breakfast sandwich and have yet to be disappointed!

35.description: Ok, so I've come to Dollop a lot now, it's quickly turning into one of my fav coffee spots in the city. The baristas are always chatty and kind. I'm also starting to see some new faces behind the counter and although their latte art is a work in progress, it's kind of fun to see the evolution of their hearts and tulips. Love the metropolis coffee and add in the daily selection of Hoosier Mama's treats and you have a great place.

19.description: Solid 3. I think this location is better than their Lakeview location given the larger overall space, tall ceilings, and brightly lit room but I'm still not a fan of the rectangular communal seating tables in the middle. It just seems more practical to have tables of 2 or 4 so that people who want to talk don't have to cram themselves in between other people studying/doing work. Others: I enjoyed their tables outside when the weather is nice. Service was a 2 at best, I thought the ladies at the counter were quite stand-offish and looked bored as hell.
