Music level changes - one time it was soft, another time it was pretty loud. Internet was an alright speed though to be honest, I haven't used it extensively. Also kind of sucks that they can't make their hot teas into iced teas....which I have no idea why.....

28.description: I was skeptical for some time - the name always made me think of the amount of sour cream I might put on a baked potato or in black bean soup - not coffee. I don't think they roast their own and I generally prefer to get my coffee at a place that starts with the bean, however they do a very excellent job here and they get extra credit for knowing how to make a cortado. Excellent espresso. And they are all friendly and pleasant. Cool but not frosty.

45.description: I really like this Dollop location! It's spacious, has great coffee and awesome baristas. Its most frequent visitors are Northwestern graduate students and Streeterville residents, which might not make it the most hipster coffee shop in town. However, if you want to grab a cup of well-made coffee or work in a place with reliable wi-fi/outlets, or read, this is a fantastic place.

33.description: THE GOOD* The sell Metropolis coffee (Chicago home-grown company)* Good sandwiches* Chicago companyTHE BAD* Not owner-operated and not professional/well-trained staff* Staff often more interested in chatting amongst themselves and getting you moving through the line as quickly as possible so they can go back to their chat timeTHE UGLY* Sandwich orders when ready are placed on the counter with staff calling-out what the sandwich is, creating unnecessary confusion in the order/pickup process* Dollop would be well served by taking a name or providing a number so that, when the order is ready, the food is referenced by this* I actually like the idea of not taking names/providing numbers, but this relies on staff to remember who you are and what you ordered to confirm that one has picked-up the correct order - and Dollop staff pay more attention to talking amongst themselves than making the customer feel like number 1THE NOTEThis review is for Dollop in Streeterville on Ohio St.

43.description: Love this place! The coffee is amazing, and it's a great place to study or do emails. I usually get the iced mocha or the Nutella latte. There's a window section that's good for people watching. There's also an outdoor patio for when the weather's nice.

2.description: I find the staff here are unfriendly and disinterested. So what keeps me coming back again and again is the space (a ton of tables to sit at and work with lots of plugs), the atmosphere (lots of students working, really bright space, good music), the tea (delicious!) and the cookies (try the Mexican chocolate cookie, it has a subtle spiciness).

18.description: Excuse me? Lavender vanilla latte? How did I get to heaven without even realizing it??Stopped in with my husband during our recent Chi-town trip for our favorite activity of late...exploring coffee shops. This place was bragging all sorts of crazy awesome espresso drinks...there was also a lavender white mocha that I almost ordered,  and a rosemary latte, and the classic but always-a-winner Mexican mocha. And those were among lots of others that looked creative and delish. I've noticed that sometimes coffee shops that offer crazy options can't really pull them off...and the appeal is more of the excitement over something different than of how tasty it actually is. However, I have to say that the lavender vanilla late was excellent. Excellent!! I was so happy as I sat there sipping it and eating my almond croissant while people watching over at the bar across from the counter. Loving it!! I will be sure to stop back by one of these the next time I'm in Chicago, and I will try something new!

41.description: such a good place to find the best tea and coffee. their services are really good. the only reason i took off one star is their prices are quite high

52.description: Nice café just outside the touristy area in Chicago. Lots of seating, interesting menu, industrial cool ambiance. Would have liked the staff to guide us a bit in the menu. Didn't notice the specialty coffees until after I ordered. Had a regular coffee and Honey Lavender scone. Both very good. They offer pour over options and some sandwiches that look delicious.

50.description: I Like the place and coffee is good , but staff is kind of snobby and if you don't tip them they make your coffee whatever .. I thought that so rude. Also they only have one bathroom and it's always out of order. It makes me think that they just lazy to clean it and it's much easier to put a sign on the door "out of order".

4.description: Great writing/working space, atmosphere and drinks. Baristas are friendly too!While in town on vacation I was looking for a space to write. This place appealed to me for the variety of seating arrangements, natural light and free wifi. They have a nice long bar with stools to either stand or sit at. I like having both options to keep the writing going! They have extension cords around the place so plenty of outlets to plug into if you have a long enough leash... I mean cord ;)I also love their range of music. I have heard both alt-J and the Beach Boys while here. The volume is just enough to enjoy but not overpowering your focus.I ordered an iced vanilla latte. They have a range of sweeteners for self-service, which I usually will do to avoid over sugary drinks. However they put in just the right amount for me. The espresso is very good. Deep and smooth, and not too acidic. Next time, I'll bring a snack (or try a scone here) and try their Mexican Mocha.

6.description: Love Dollop! Great neighborhood spot to grab coffee or a light bite. Prepare for a line most weekend mornings, but always worth it. I would suggest the chai or a cappuccino- they make the prettiest coffee art here as well. Get one of their pour overs if you need some serious caffeine- you will be awake for days!

22.description: Overly expensive for a coffee shop.  Medium coffee which is smaller than a Starbucks tall and a 2.5 inch square scone cost $7.50.

15.description: One of my favorite places for getting work done. The space is clean and well-lit with large windows for natural lighting during the day. There's lots of seating, outlets everywhere and pretty good WiFi. The food/drink is better than your average Starbucks and pretty good for a coffee shop, though it does get annoying that they always run out of bread/bagels later on in the day. The mexican mocha is one of my favorites--the mocha had a nice level of spiciness from the cayenne, and the food in general tastes pretty fresh. The one annoying thing is that they frequently run out of bread/bagels as the day goes on.

57.description: Solid 3. I think this location is better than their Lakeview location given the larger overall space, tall ceilings, and brightly lit room but I'm still not a fan of the rectangular communal seating tables in the middle. It just seems more practical to have tables of 2 or 4 so that people who want to talk don't have to cram themselves in between other people studying/doing work. Others: I enjoyed their tables outside when the weather is nice. Service was a 2 at best, I thought the ladies at the counter were quite stand-offish and looked bored as hell. Music level changes - one time it was soft, another time it was pretty loud. Internet was an alright speed though to be honest, I haven't used it extensively. Also kind of sucks that they can't make their hot teas into iced teas....which I have no idea why.....

20.description: Staff was okay. Cafe was nice. Coffee was super acidic and burnt tasting. No way José. I like my coffee light and yummy like a Himalayan flower.

36.description: Dollop is a cool coffee joint near the magnificent mile. They have the usual coffee selections and plus some unique special ones written on a small list located next to the register. The shop is very spacious with lots of seats, tables, and even a couch and sofas. This shop would make an excellent study center. I had the mexican mocha with cayenne, mexican cocoa, and lavender vanilla latte. Both mexican drinks had spicy cayenne pepper that is pretty noticeable but not too spicy to be offensive. The spiciness lingers on for minutes even if you stopped after a small sip. The lavender vanilla latte was pretty good but nothing outstanding. I especially love the creamy taste of it. All the drinks had a fair amount of sweetness which is just right for me. Price for the drinks was about 5 bux after tax for a large size, which appears to be 20 ounces, which is fair.The environment is minimalistic and trendy. It reminds me of the apple store with the wooden chairs, wooden tables, and clean design. Overall coffee 4 stars and environment 5 stars.

14.description: Dollop definitely understands that design is just as important as taste. I've wanted to stop by this location for a while now as I love a good cafe and am all about large, open, white, industrial-y spaces. Lucky for me, I had an appointment at Northwestern during Chicago's spring snowstorm and, thus, had the perfect excuse to pop in to Dollop. I came in just after 9 and there were 2-3 people in line ahead of me. Plenty of open seats at this time, but it did fill up a bit over the next hour. It looked like they have free wifi but you need a code from the register. I ordered an almond milk hot chocolate and croissant and happily caught up on emails at one of the window seats. I don't remember how much I paid, but since it wasn't memorable, that probably means it was the same price range as most other coffee shops in the city. Two not so great things: 1. The bathroom. It's unisex, which is fine, but it's kind of gross. My biggest pet peeve about restaurants/shops/etc. is when they put so much effort into designing their main space and then the bathrooms are no better than what you'd find at a sports arena. 2. The staff wasn't particularly friendly. The girls weren't rude or anything, but a simple hello would be better than making me feel like my being a customer is ruining your morning.

58.description: My husband and I stopped in here to get out of the cold and get a hot breakfast; we were not disappointed! A large restaurant with many booths and tables but even at 10:30 in the morning on a Thursday, this place had a steady stream of customers who wanted delicious fare. We both ordered a savory egg dish (I got the traditional Eggs Benedict, which was great) and then split an order of the Cinnamon Roll French Toast. My breakfast came with red diced potatoes and fruit--all were excellent. But the REAL standout winner was that Cinnamon Roll French Toast. HOLY MOLY. That is some of the best French toast I've ever had, and I've tried it almost everywhere. I'll be going back to Chicago just to get some more! Service was exceedingly prompt and friendly, the coffee was refilled multiple times, and we left warm, full, and happy. Yolk fan!

56.description: Awesome breakfast, came in on Tuesday and we were seated quickly, great service!  We had the breakfast burrito (needed flour instead of whole wheat tortilla),Nutella crepes (my son said amazing), a Belgian waffle, the big boy breakfast and the best breakfast poutine ever.  Will be back!

29.description: A wonderful choice for breakfast when you are downtown. I had the most amazing sweet potato hash with a scrumptious side of french toast.  It was a large portion so I wasn't hungry until dinner time. Their coffee is great and the waiter always came by to make sure my cup was never more than half empty.

42.description: Delicious omelettes and wonderful French toast. Loved this place! Long wait time... But totally worth it.

23.description: This is a great place for breakfast, brunch or lunch. Always great food and the staff are friendly. It's such a popular place you can end up waiting for a while for a table , but put your name down as well worth it. My only issue with the set up is the line to pay as they don't take payments at the table. Salmon scrambler with fruit is a must try !

47.description: Wow they had very good food. Very fast service. Everyone was very friendly. Nice view of the city. A must stop.

8.description: Our first stop on arriving in Chicago based on the recommendations of our fellow Yelpers, and Yolk certainly didn't disappoint.  I started the day with one of the five-egg omelets (yes, you read that right, five) - the Hey Ricky!, with avocado, chorizo, onions, jack and cheddar cheeses, and a healthy amount of jalapeños for those of you who like a little heat with your eggs. The omelet had this amazing texture, lightly done on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and even though I've never polished off five eggs in one sitting before, I didn't feel weighted-down after that last bite - just amazingly satisfied, ready to start a day of sightseeing. One of my buddies had the Santa Fe frittata, which I'll be getting next time I visit:  bacon, avocado, more jalapeños, onions, potatos, and cheeses, all baked together into a fluffy skillet of yumminess.  My other buddy had the West Coast crêpes, which he said tasted amazing but thought that the crêpes were a bit on the thick side; I countered that you'd need a thicker crêpe to stand up to a rather healthy-sized filling.  The side order of pancakes is the way to go with any combo - better than most, and enough to share.We had to knock down one star since the coffee just isn't that good, which is surprising for a restaurant that specializes in breakfast, and my buddy's iced tea was met with a thumbs-down as well.Beverages aside, I wish we had breakfast places like this in DC!  (That was a hint, Yolk!)

31.description: Zero complaints!  Yolk has amazing breakfast.  I had the California crepes with potatoes and an English muffin.  It was an enormous amount of food.  The crepes were decadent and the potatoes were probably some of my favorite breakfast potatoes.  We also tried the bacon waffle and chicken.  The chicken had great flavor and you could taste the bacon pieces in the waffle. Lastly, we tried the peppermint mocha and YUM.  On a cold morning this is exactly what the doctor ordered.  I will have to go back and try the s'mores hot chocolate.  I will definitely be going back.

34.description: Always a must stop place when visiting Chicago. The menu has a lot of excellent choices. I usually get one of the skillets which is delicious and plenty of food coming from someone with a healthy appetite.Skipped my all inclusive hotel breakfast to go to this gem. Do yourself a favor and check out a Yolk near you.

16.description: Yet another misleading address in this area of Chicago.  I tell ya this area is full of them.  355 East Ohio huh?  Again that's the building but the actual entrance to this place is at the corner of Grand and McClurg around the corner.  This place is good but not great.  Breakfast for me is one of those meals that you can't mess up considering the ingredients are so basic.  Some places do things better than other for instance Pamela's in Pittsburgh makes those pancakes really special.  Granted my wife and I only had one dish each from here and only visited once I can still safely go with just a 3* from just about everything in our one time experience.To start things off this place is WAY too crowded inside to the point that you pray for an outside table.  We were lucky and we ended up sitting outside where you'd think it'd be noisier with cars, traffic, sirens being so close to Northwestern and all but still outside is a paradise of serenity compared to inside.  When I had asked for an outside table the greeter said they don't take those requests, they simply have what they have available at the time a table becomes available take it or leave it (not exactly in those words but I knew what she meant).The counter where you pay is also the same counter where you put your name in for a seat.  They don't have buzzers like the Cheesecake factory to let you know your table is ready, just a person yelling "your name" party of "X".  Chaos.  People standing near the entrance waiting for their name to be called can't really go outside to wait because you might miss your name, again no buzzers so you can't stray too far in an already overly noisy place.  The cash register is beside the long bar where people are also seated to eat.  There's a LONG line formed to the register just so people can pay and leave!  A huge line to pay and leave, why?  This place is so chaotic not that I would condone it but it would be VERY easy to slip out without paying because of all the masses of people and how crowded the front of the place is with people paying and people waiting for seating.Once we got outside it was a whole other experience.  It was so quiet and nice.  There's an element of the country outside considering there's planters filled with some sort of long grass or weeds growing out of them in uniform height.  So peaceful and quiet... then you have to go inside to that crazy hole and pay!I ended up ordering the Irish Benedict which was corned beef hash instead of ham in the Benny.  My wife went with stuffed French toast.  The food was ok for the cost but it was certainly nothing that should cause such a buzz and commotion and be so overly crowded and noisy.  I didn't get why this place was so popular after experiencing the craziness that is the inside of the restaurant and the mass of people trying to get in.  We were lucky we didn't wait that long to get a table.  There were many people with parties of 6 or more waiting for tables.  Bottom line... the way I see it if you're inside you lose and outside, you win.  Go when it's not busy to have a normal breakfast inside if outside is not available IMO.  Inside = hell, outside = heaven.

13.description: Exceptional breakfast in a fast friendly environment, definitely a superb spot for breakfast! So glad I chose Yolk based on Yelp reviews as it didn't disappoint! A great selection of breakfast choices with bold coffee and stellar service is all you get at YOLK!

11.description: Just your average breakfast spot. Not AMAZING but also not bad. Service is OK and the atmosphere is pretty loud.

39.description: Wow wow wow what an amazing place food to die for very friendly staff If you in Chicago must try this Place

37.description: I had read about it and seen long lines.  Didn't meet our expectations .  The food seemed unloved and nothing to write home about

0.description: First day getting to Chicago this was the first place I try ! Service was good and the eggs Benedict were very delicious but I recommend the steak and eggs, great seasoning and simple

38.description: DELICIOUS AND WORTH THE WAIT! I was visiting Chicago with my boyfriend for the new years weekend and wanted to try popular Chicago restaurants. Looked up Yolk from TripAdvisor and yelp and decided to go find it. Upon arrival on a Saturday morning at 11am, the wait was estimated at 30-35 min and it was very crowded. They took our phone number and texted us when the table was ready. We sat at the counter and the menu looked amazing. We had a hard time deciding but we ended up ordering breakfast poutine, fried chicken and waffle (it is a bacon waffle), and a patty melt (we were hungry). The food arrived quickly in about 10-15 minutes. It looked mouthwatering, so we snapped a couple photos and dove in.  It was all amazing! I cleaned my plate of the chicken and bacon waffle with sausage gravy. The breakfast poutine had bacon, sausage gravy, eggs, scallion, and cheese curds. The patty melt was large with fresh thousand island dressing. All the dishes had generous amounts of bacon, definitely not bacon stingy like some places. One of the best meals I've had! Worth the wait, price is reasonable, and a must try in Chicago!

51.description: My favorite breakfast spot in Chicago and plenty of people agree! You can tell by the long lines in the morning on weekends. I recommend calling ahead of time and placing a to-go order if you can. They have large portions that can definitely be split amongst 2 people.I recommend:- any of omelets- pineapple yogurt parfait- any of the hashes- red velvet French toast (**MUST TRY)

27.description: No frills, great service with great food. Everything on the menu is customizable and it's great place to go if you want a quick but not rushed breakfast. We went back twice in our one visit to Chicago, would happily return again.My only gripe is that their green tea had jasmine essence in it.

32.description: A bit expensive for food I could cook at home by myself, but if I was greatly concerned about that, I wouldn't be at a breakfast/brunch place in a trendy part of Chicago.Something that greatly impresses me is that their All-Star Breakfast never fails to fill me up. I tend to be both cheap and gluttonous, which is to say I have a big appetite. The All-Star is one of the cheapest combos on the the menu and yet it comes with a lot, both savory and sweet.My girlfriend and I also greatly enjoyed their Strawberry-Orange Juice. It's pretty much exactly what the name says, and tastes very fresh.When I want to take people out to breakfast or brunch in the area, I always take them to Yolk!

54.description: Wow they have a crazy wait weekend mornings.  They should implement the nowait system like Wildberry so we don't have to crowd the tiny front entrance.As far as the food goes, I thought it was okay diner breakfast food.  I had the fried chicken on bacon waffles.  The chicken was strips of chicken breast.  It was okay but I would have preferred bone in dark meat on the chicken for better flavor.  Overall they do a pretty good job of keeping people moving.  Just come early if you need to get breakfast!

48.description: Yolk just rocks. Great food, big portions and decent prices.

44.description: This is a very enjoyable trip. It was great to take a spin around the bay and see the area from the water. We really enjoyed looking at beautiful homes and boats. The little two seater boats have pep and it is reassuring to have a guide would knows the waters and boat safety. The guys in our group liked driving the boats while the girls enjoyed the ride. The owner/staff were knowledgable, polite, and provided outstanding customer service.  Great little trip!

24.description: The California omelet is a must here ! Specially If you love avocado !! It comes with an English muffin , potato, cheese and sour cream. It's the best omelet I've ever had ! Award goes to it

7.description: Chicago does NOT mess around with breakfast. Very possibly the best breakfast I have ever had in my entire life. Only caveat: coffee is just ok.Went with the build your own skillet that was so good, a group of us went back the next day and all ordered it again. Bacon, chorizo, red and green peppers, green onions, jalepenos, smashed avocado, red potatoes, jack cheese, and two eggs over easy. Hella good.

49.description: Exceptional breakfast in a fast friendly environment, definitely a superb spot for breakfast! So glad I chose Yolk based on Yelp reviews as it didn't disappoint! A great selection of breakfast choices with bold coffee and stellar service is all you get at YOLK!

40.description: Great food.  Kids loved it too.  Long wait on a Sunday am.

53.description: HAVE THE FIRST TIME: The Irish benny with corned beef hash was very good, but I actually would not have it again - once was enough. The poached eggs were just perfect!

30.description: Who doesn't  enjoy a clean breakfast?  The food here is tasty without the guilt of being nad for you.  Foot traffic is hectic but the table turnovers are quick, so the wait isn't unbearable. Close enough to Navy Pier to walk off the extra calories.  Acoustics are loud, very kid friendly.  Open spaced, not ideal for any multi tasking (meetings with food).

46.description: What a cool place. Really relaxing and chill atmosphere, very friendly staff, and great food. Portions are fairly large and the menu is very robust. The menu has many options, so many that it was hard for me to decide what to eat. I decided to go with Chicken n Waffles, and that was an excellent decision. I would recommend this place to anyone, wether you want your traditional breakfast or if you want to mix it up and try something different. Definitely need to check it out!

1.description: This place seems like a great place to grab brunch! It's a chain with various locations around Chicago. I wasn't very pleased with what I ordered. My eyes kept darting back to the red velvet french toast and I went for it, considering I've never had it before. I was super disappointed when I got the food though because it basically tasted like a cupcake, as it was really stuffed with cream cheese frosting and there was no way I was going to finish it. I give them props for the nicely made french toast, but it definitely tasted way more like a cupcake than anything else. My friend also ordered a skillet and kept talking about how it was way too salty. It seemed like neither of us were really satisfied, but I trust that there are better items on the menu that we didn't order.

55.description: Heard abt this place from many, must say it's amazing place. Had chicken waffle it was great.... Will definitely visit again...

9.description: Yolk was our first stop after we arrived in Chicago in mid-October. I didn't know a lot about this location except for the fact that the Yelp reviews were very promising. I can imagine that this spot might get hectic between 7-9am as people emerge from their apartments and the subway and head to nearby offices, but we arrived in the mid-morning and were immediately seated.The restaurant is clean and modern with large windows and views of a park nearby. Service wasn't overly friendly but was prompt, and we received our food quickly. I ordered the Tour De France, which is a flight of french toast with accompanying sides. It was a tasty and pretty plate with lots of interesting flavors. I didn't really get "french toast" from the more cake-like bread but did thing it was a nice dish.

26.description: There ought to be a better way to figure out tables...everyone just blocks traffic waiting for their name to be called.  We waited about 20 min (not bad) on a Saturday morning. We got the south of the border benny, chicken and waffles and s'mores hot chocolate.  Both entrees were big yet bland, and the s'mores hot cocoa was just loads of sugar, haha.

25.description: Went today Saturday morning and it was packed of course, but told wait would be about 15 minutes for two so we waited. It seemed like it was less than that. We got seated and ordered immediately since we looked at the menu while waiting. We both got the same which was French toast, 2 bacon, 2 sauges, and two eggs. I opted for the egg whites. Our food arrived fairly quick I would say within 5 minutes. Food was very tasty and enjoyed every bite of it. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

12.description: I came here on a Friday morning at 9am with one friend just as we landed in Chicago. There was absolutely no wait and we were seated outside, which was absolutely perfect. If it's a nice day out, definitely choose outside seating as it's surrounded by trees, bushes and a breath of fresh air.I ordered the Pot Roast Benedict ($12.99), which was even better than I anticipated. There was so much pot roast on my English muffin. Not only that, but the meat was tender and juicy. The flavors worked so well with my poached egg. It also comes with a side of diced red potatoes and fruits. Potatoes were crisp and fruits were fresh. It was the perfect start to my day.This spot is the perfect breakfast spot. Food was great and service was wonderful. My only fault was that when you pay, you can only split the bill evenly. My friend and I were a bit careless, but I realized that they overcharged us afterwards somehow.

59.description: This is an amazing place. I have been trying to go to this restaurant from quite a while and finally I got the opportunity to go and try the food out. Yolk is a brunch/ breakfast place. I dropped in here at around 2:00 PM on a fine Saturday. The place was packed with people. We were welcomed by the waiter and immediately got a table to dine on. I ordered the all star yolk breakfast which included eggs (I took fried eggs), bacon, sausages, 2 buttermilk pancakes. The whole meal was so damn delicious. The pancakes were soft, fluffy and scrumptious. I love to pour maple syrup on the crispy bacon. It was a delight.My friend took a very healthy option - the ironman omelette with chicken. The whole omelette was made with egg whites and vegetables. I did the taste the omelette and my goodness, it was fantastic.We also took the Pot roast Benedict which was fabulous too. I enjoyed every minute at this restaurant. I would love to go here again. I recommend this place.

21.description: My "go-to" place whenever I want American Breakfast. Plates have nice quantity, super delicious! Won't let you down!!

17.description: My favorite breakfast spot in Chicago and plenty of people agree! You can tell by the long lines in the morning on weekends. I recommend calling ahead of time and placing a to-go order if you can. They have large portions that can definitely be split amongst 2 people.I recommend:- any of omelets- pineapple yogurt parfait- any of the hashes- red velvet French toast (**MUST TRY)

10.description: This place is really good, but you should definitely plan on a wait.  We went on a Monday, which happened to be President's Day, and had a 20 minute wait.  From what I've been told, this is not out of the ordinary, and had nothing to do with the holiday.  You should also make sure to dress in layers, as it was very hot in the restaurant (almost stifling).     I got the farmers plate; eggs, potatoes, an orange slice, and biscuits and gravy.  The potatoes were very good, and the biscuit weren't bad either.  I usually get biscuits and gravy when I go out for breakfast, and I can honestly say I've had better (that's not a knock on Yolk, I've just had some good B&G).  My date had a gigantic omelette with a side of fruit, which she reported was very good.  Even upon hearing up her omelette later, she said it was really good.  As long as you've got the time to kill, I'd say give Yolk a try!

5.description: There ought to be a better way to figure out tables...everyone just blocks traffic waiting for their name to be called.  We waited about 20 min (not bad) on a Saturday morning. We got the south of the border benny, chicken and waffles and s'mores hot chocolate.  Both entrees were big yet bland, and the s'mores hot cocoa was just loads of sugar, haha.

3.description: Not bad, not bad... I always see crowds huddled around the entrance in the mornings on the weekends so I figured I'd give a try to see what all the hype was about. If you're looking for breakfast food, Yolk has got you covered. They do everything from omelettes to pancakes to benedicts to skillets so I'm sure you'll find something you're in the mood for no matter what the appetite. Service is prompt once you're seated and they definitely try to keep the tables turning over to accommodate for the crowds but without feeling like you're being rushed (def appreciated). I tried the south of the border benny which is a chorizo benedict served with sides of fruit and homestyle potatoes. Very filling and quite tasty but nothing special. If you're looking for a breakfast spot with no gimmicks, roll on thru but be prepared to wait to grab a table especially during peak hours on the weekends. 'Til next time, cheers!

35.description: This was my second time coming here and my husband's first time. The portion size is extremely generous. Everything is homemade and fresh (salsa, pancakes). I had the kale scrambler with egg whites, fruit, avocado and an English muffin. It was amazing; I couldn't stop eating it. My husband got the Hey Ricky! With potatoes and pancakes. He ate the whole thing and wouldn't stop raving about how good it is. Definitely coming back my next time to Chicago!!!

19.description: There were a lot of people waiting to be seated, but they got us to a table pretty quick! The services was great and everyone loved the food. I got the west coast crepes, which were a savory sweet dish. It was really good. The crepe was amazing

28.description: The benny's were delicious, but be ready for very large portions. Strait forward breakfast food with no-frills lighter options if desired. Cilantro is their herb of choice.

45.description: Stumbled upon Yolk as we were making our way to the Navy Pier. Great breakfast spot!We ordered the pineapple yogurt parfait and the west coast crepe. The yogurt parfait is served on top of half a pineapple... talk about a huge portion of yogurt! The west coast crepe was more on the savory side with mushrooms and onions. Both were delicious. I wish we had more room because their red velvet french toast sounds soooooo good. Until next time Yolk!

33.description: I love this placeThe food is really good and freshThe personal nice and friendly But the wait is a little long . Specially during the weekend

43.description: This was hands down the best breakfast/brunch I have ever had in my life. I ordered the "hey Ricky" 5 omelette and have never eaten a better omelette in my life. My mother ordered the farm house and it was nothing less than delicious. Our wait time was "30 minutes" however we were seating in 15. Service was speedy and our waiter was delightful. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND eating here!

2.description: We had a silly, ridiculous experience with the hotel we stayed at downtown. We were in desperate need of some good food and a happy send off before we left town! I was randomly searching Yelp for a highly rated place nearby, when Yolk appeared in my Monocle!!I ordered the Chicken 'n' Waffles... It was bacon waffle topped with crispy fried boneless chicken breast & sausage gravy with maple syrup... Does this not sound like the breakfast of champions?!?! The waffle was sweet and savory and the sausage gravy made a great compliment to this dish!The boy ordered the Breakfast Poutine special! Sweet potato french fries with sausage gravy and bacon topped with cheese curds... I seriously tried not to pick off his plate as I had my own goodness happening, but, but! Holy delicious! The leftovers that we took home made us just as happy the next morning!!

18.description: Wonderful breakfast!  George is a highly recommended waiter too.  I had the seasonal pumpkin swirl French toast...amazing.  The freshly squeezed orange and strawberry juice is a must on your first visit!The ambiance is refreshing too, especially on a beautiful Chicago morning.  The yellow decor is enough to cheer up even the most grumpy grumpus in the early hours.Go here, highly recommend.  I suggest going early though... You could be waiting awhile for a table.

41.description: Most places have a 3 egg omelet.  Eggsperience has a 5 egg omelet and it is fantastic.  I went in very hungry and loaded up my omelet with tons of meat and it did not disappoint.The service was quick and we got sat almost immediately on a busy Saturday morning.I'll definitely go back the next time I am in Chicago.

52.description: I had the Kale Scrambler with pancakes and fruit. So good. I also had their freshly squeezed strawberry orange juice and it was amazing. Service was fast, restaurant clean with big windows everywhere. Would definitely eat here again.

50.description: Awesome in house made Greek yogurt with fresh fruit. I had an apple cinnamon muffin since they ran out of blueberry, but it was so good! I'm glad I was able to try it. I'm still amazed with the in house made Greek yogurt.

4.description: Yolk was a perfect place for a late morning breakfast after a day of traveling. Our server was very friendly and suggested the red velvet French toast when I asked him what his favorite was. He was absolutely right, it was delicious! The serving size was huuuuge and I ended up with enough leftovers for a second meal. My husband ordered the Croque Madame and enjoyed his plate too. I stole a few of his hash browns and they were crispy and well seasoned. Coffee was also tasty, though I hate that they only have Truvia and sugar. My husband called me old because I wondered allowed if I should start carrying Splenda packets with me. If we weren't visiting and wanting to try every breakfast spot within walking distance, I could easily see returning to Yolk on a weekly basis for some breakfast time indulgence.

6.description: This is an amazing place. I have been trying to go to this restaurant from quite a while and finally I got the opportunity to go and try the food out. Yolk is a brunch/ breakfast place. I dropped in here at around 2:00 PM on a fine Saturday. The place was packed with people. We were welcomed by the waiter and immediately got a table to dine on. I ordered the all star yolk breakfast which included eggs (I took fried eggs), bacon, sausages, 2 buttermilk pancakes. The whole meal was so damn delicious. The pancakes were soft, fluffy and scrumptious. I love to pour maple syrup on the crispy bacon. It was a delight.My friend took a very healthy option - the ironman omelette with chicken. The whole omelette was made with egg whites and vegetables. I did the taste the omelette and my goodness, it was fantastic.We also took the Pot roast Benedict which was fabulous too. I enjoyed every minute at this restaurant. I would love to go here again. I recommend this place.

22.description: Yolk was a perfect place for a late morning breakfast after a day of traveling. Our server was very friendly and suggested the red velvet French toast when I asked him what his favorite was. He was absolutely right, it was delicious! The serving size was huuuuge and I ended up with enough leftovers for a second meal. My husband ordered the Croque Madame and enjoyed his plate too. I stole a few of his hash browns and they were crispy and well seasoned. Coffee was also tasty, though I hate that they only have Truvia and sugar. My husband called me old because I wondered allowed if I should start carrying Splenda packets with me. If we weren't visiting and wanting to try every breakfast spot within walking distance, I could easily see returning to Yolk on a weekly basis for some breakfast time indulgence.

15.description: Would I recommend this place? Yes, but If you have to wait more than 30 minutes here, then no. if you have to wait any longer, I suggest you walk over to Wildberry Cafe.I ordered the Challah French Toast -- carbs on carbs on carbs. $7.99 but I added strawberries and bananas for $2.99. kinda pricey if you think about it.. literally $8 for sugar and bread and $3 for a couple pieces of fruit... It was good nonetheless. I've also ordered their yogurt in the pineapple. It looks cute for the instagram but would I order it again? no. Their omelettes are pretty heavy but the salsa that it comes with is kind of watery. Everything about this cafe is A-OK. Its not crazy delicious and it's not terribly bad either. I will say that I've by far experienced better service here than I have at Wildberry so that is a huge PRO.

57.description: Our first stop on arriving in Chicago based on the recommendations of our fellow Yelpers, and Yolk certainly didn't disappoint.  I started the day with one of the five-egg omelets (yes, you read that right, five) - the Hey Ricky!, with avocado, chorizo, onions, jack and cheddar cheeses, and a healthy amount of jalapeños for those of you who like a little heat with your eggs. The omelet had this amazing texture, lightly done on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and even though I've never polished off five eggs in one sitting before, I didn't feel weighted-down after that last bite - just amazingly satisfied, ready to start a day of sightseeing. One of my buddies had the Santa Fe frittata, which I'll be getting next time I visit:  bacon, avocado, more jalapeños, onions, potatos, and cheeses, all baked together into a fluffy skillet of yumminess.  My other buddy had the West Coast crêpes, which he said tasted amazing but thought that the crêpes were a bit on the thick side; I countered that you'd need a thicker crêpe to stand up to a rather healthy-sized filling.  The side order of pancakes is the way to go with any combo - better than most, and enough to share.We had to knock down one star since the coffee just isn't that good, which is surprising for a restaurant that specializes in breakfast, and my buddy's iced tea was met with a thumbs-down as well.Beverages aside, I wish we had breakfast places like this in DC!  (That was a hint, Yolk!)

20.description: Not bad, not bad... I always see crowds huddled around the entrance in the mornings on the weekends so I figured I'd give a try to see what all the hype was about. If you're looking for breakfast food, Yolk has got you covered. They do everything from omelettes to pancakes to benedicts to skillets so I'm sure you'll find something you're in the mood for no matter what the appetite. Service is prompt once you're seated and they definitely try to keep the tables turning over to accommodate for the crowds but without feeling like you're being rushed (def appreciated). I tried the south of the border benny which is a chorizo benedict served with sides of fruit and homestyle potatoes. Very filling and quite tasty but nothing special. If you're looking for a breakfast spot with no gimmicks, roll on thru but be prepared to wait to grab a table especially during peak hours on the weekends. 'Til next time, cheers!

36.description: There was a wide selection of some cool stuff and I got this awesome sandwich! It was cheap and the environment was fun like our waitress. I recommend anyone looking for a brunch place to stop here at least once.

14.description: Most places have a 3 egg omelet.  Eggsperience has a 5 egg omelet and it is fantastic.  I went in very hungry and loaded up my omelet with tons of meat and it did not disappoint.The service was quick and we got sat almost immediately on a busy Saturday morning.I'll definitely go back the next time I am in Chicago.

58.description: Service was baaaaarely okay, drinks were okay.  I liked the hot chocolate, but that's bc I like my drinks warm (and not hot).  One of my friends is into coffee said his drink wasn't hot enough.  Espresso comes out looking like a cute little dessert, so that was pretty cool too.

56.description: Perfect place to warm up with a quick lunch & coffee to go.

29.description: This place is hands-down disgusting. I was in Chicago and meeting a friend for coffee, and she just picked this place randomly. I wish she wouldn't have.When you walk in, there's a ceiling art installation or something like that with bottles all over the coffee area. It looked like it hadn't been dusted in years. I really could not care less about how good or bad the coffee was when you have to worry about age-old dust falling into your cappuccino. Very unappetizing.Ultimately, we just sat outside in one of the two tables left. Definitely wouldn't go back here.

42.description: This place seriously has the best latte I've tasted in Chicago. Totally trumps Starbucks and I may actually prefer Lavazza to Intelligentsia. :X

23.description: The croissants are the best and of you get the nutella croissant with the cafe latte then you have a perfect combination for snack time

47.description: I heard a lot from my friends about this place, so I was excited to try but a little skeptical.  The coffee really was excellent, but the barista was not as amazing as reported...didn't really seem to know a lot about coffee.  Overall, very satisfied with the coffee and gelatto.

8.description: Finally good espresso in town! They really know how to make it right! No more Starbucks and donnkin Donuts.THE Place Is very convenient and worth going!Real Italian coffee.

31.description: So glad I work right down the street from this place!  Their regular coffee is outstanding. I haven't tried many of their specialty drinks, but they do have almond milk which is a nice change. I have to take a star off for the service as the employees seem miserable for the most part.

34.description: Coffee was good, but OMG this place was filthy. All tables dirty and not cleared and counters all had crumbs and such. I am not a picky guy, but was so bothered by the lack of cleanliness that I decided to post.

16.description: I worked here for Lavazza for a few months and it was hands down one of the most fun jobs I've ever had. I couldn't have had better coworkers and I regard the owners Sam and Seniha Karatas highly. They really care about the cafe and are always looking for ways to improve it whether it be seasonal menu items or improving the menu board. I absolutely loved working here and the food and coffee are so worth trying! The only thing I would say could be improved is maybe the seating? It is a very small space and when it becomes crowded, it is hard to navigate. Other than that 5 stars.

13.description: Like some froth in your espresso?  This place offers the classics as well some combinations you probably haven't heard about.  Much more original than Starbucks.

11.description: Love this place! Although the cafe can be cuter and more of an open space, the coffee is great and there aren't too many people there. It's quiet and good for people watching. I always get the regular black coffee because when the coffee is good, you don't need cream or sugar.

39.description: Great coffee shop using authentic Lavazza coffee... Italy's favorite! Lots of Italian inspired espresso drinks and desserts. Great prices too!I got a kick out of this place when a couple of girls from Italy ordered two espressos and were shocked at the size. They thought the were getting a different drink until someone had to explain to them that everything in America is bigger!

37.description: I've been there twice.  The experience from the first visit was not worthy of a second visit.  The servers couldn't even explain the drinks or show us the size of the cups.  However, my friend was surveyed and received a store voucher for future visit.  Not wanting to waste 'money', we went back a second time.  On the second visit, the drinks came out ok but they were vacuuming the store and ceiling fixture while we were drinking our coffee. So weird.

0.description: Any place that serves coffee in a mug vs a paper cup for those dining in, is a winner!! This is a cute coffee shop near mag mile! Lavazza is one of my favorites so I just get the coffee black but it appears they have some fun interesting froofy drinks as well. They also sell sandwiches, soup, and gelato. Barista was not the most friendly but they provide fast service. Great choice over Starbucks! Best seat in the house = next to the large window.

38.description: Absolutely wonderful Italian coffee. Helped to keep me going during all the sales!  Tasted what I imagined Italy would serve in their coffee shops.

51.description: This place is a great refresher if you are looking to break the Starbucks/Dunkin Donuts routine in your life. It also has a very European style to it (being a European/Italian coffee shop originally) and this adds some variety to the already lively Streeterville neighborhood of Chicago. Try their "Orange Mocha Mio" - its totally worth the money if you are looking to break away from the usual Caramel/Mocha/Vanilla/Cinnamon/Hazelnut flavors you can get along with your coffee at other pervasive major coffee chains around the city.

27.description: This was the first snow of the year, and it made me want to find a cozy coffee shop to split a gelato with a friend. This was the perfect spot! Rich chocolate gelato and Italy's best coffee... Perfect for a snowy day! Great service, super cute!

32.description: I usually just get a coffee, but today someone introduced me to the idea of a fun dessert: Affogato.   Wikipedia:  "An affogato (Italian, "drowned") is a coffee-based beverage. It usually takes the form of a scoop of vanilla gelato or ice cream topped with a shot of hot espresso. Some variations also include a shot of Amaretto or other liqueur."  I think I have a new favorite: I got it with pistachio: a fun way to combine all your dessert services into one dish.Friendly and fast service, not too crowded on Sunday afternoon.

54.description: Probably best coffee in Chicago. Not enough places to sit but that is what makes this place special. So not count on a true 2% milk as the mix skim and whole. That was disappointing. Some staff are more knowledgable then others. Overall it's a good coffee and that's what matters.

48.description: I actually discovered Lavazza coffee while in the French Polynesia and HAD to find it once I was back in Chicago.  I was pleasantly surprised to see many locations in chicago.  Hubby and I went there for a late afternoon lunch.  The panini and baguette were delicious.  Totally made me feel like I was in Italy.Iced coffee was the BEST ice coffee I have EVER had.  But the piece de resistance was undoubtedly the pistachio gelato!  I look for pistachio gelato on the menu everywhere I go.  Even random, hole in the wall, non italian bars.  This was by far the best gelato I have ever had!  Do not miss out on this place!

44.description: I live across the street from this place and frequent it about 2 times a week.The drip coffee is delicious, and is significantly better tasting than Starbucks.The pastries are very good, particularly the scones and croissants. They also have chocolate cake by the slice- so if you are in the mood for a cake snack, its very very good and not too filling.The staff here is nice, but like other said, not much room for seating.

24.description: I love Lavazza coffee... But I ordered a latte here with almond milk and it seems that this is just another place where people don't realize you can't heat almond milk at the same temperature as dairy milk or it burns and tastes like cardboard. I ordered the smallest size and can't even taste the espresso. Maybe I'd give them another chance but I know many other places in Chicago that do an almond milk latte well. The people working there were friendly though. I took it to go otherwise I would have asked for something else.

7.description: This place has NO OUTLETS. It's miserable to try to come here to have a coffee and catch up on emails or work for an hour bits lovely and great coffee and people but I've never known a cafe to have no outlets. Which sucks because this is my neighborhood cafe and I would come everyday if they did. If there is a change I would be there daily. I hope they do. *fingers crossed*

49.description: I stopped here on a whim for something to drink on a hot day in Chicago.Freakin' delicious specialty drinks. I had a iced espresso bianco, and dayum, was it refreshing. Prefect little place for something different than your regular chain coffee stops. Plus, the people there are super nice! Coffee always tastes a little bit better when it's served with a smile.  I'll definetly be going here whenever I'm in need of a coffee fix in Chicago.

40.description: Good product. Staff needs to go to a finesse class. A very tall African American barista mocked the Italian accent several times very loudly while calling out a drink as if the customer were on the other side of Lake Michigan. The place is small, no need to yell like that. She may have tried to sound funny to the people around her, but she assumed that no Italians were around. Not very professional. I didn't appreciate it (I'm from the same place the brand is from). For the management: This was on November 24th in the early afternoon, in case you feel like addressing it.

53.description: Just finished the best hot chocolate I've ever had, "italian hot chocolate". Don't want to know what goes in, how much or why...all I know is that it was the best $2.90 I ever spent and tasted like liquid fudge in a cup. Needless to say, I will be back.

30.description: Usually I love Lavazza because it's so European and the coffee can't be beat. However, this location is just awful. The coffee was ok but the food was terrible. I ordered the quiche of the day (by the way you're charged more than the actual menu price) and the next thing I see is someone put my quiche in the microwave to nuke for 3 minutes! The cashier also didn't know what any of the coffee drinks are. I sat down with my coffee until my quiche was ready. They brought everyone else in the cafe their food but I had to get up and get mine. Not a big deal but it was an added annoyance. Since the quiche was microwaved beyond oblivion, it obviously didn't taste very good. The crust was way too chewy and I have a suspicion that the "quiche of the day" is more like the "quiche of the week". Definitely won't be coming back to this Lavazza.

46.description: Stopped in here randomly for some coffee ( could not find Starbucks).  Had an iced mocha and it was amazing. Very coffee-ye yet with a chocolate twist. Friendly staff and euro atmosphere.  Tiny tables and a few people reading newspapers.  They also had some appetizing bakery items and quiches in the window.

1.description: This is a perfect addition to the Eataly complex as it is an iconic Italian coffeehouse.   The baristas work tirelessly supplying not only grocery shoppers, but commuters coming in off the street.My drink was made perfectly and was in my hand less than 2 minutes after ordering.   What more can I ask for?

55.description: For some reason, both the workers here were totally off.  I'm not sure how many times we had to ask for and repeat our orders of hazelnut gelato and vanilla gelato before they got it right.  I'd suggest hitting up another location.  I wanted to get an americano, but they did not look like they had the ability...

9.description: Sunrise muffin was delish. Yesterday I had the lowfat blueberry. It had a chewy texture to it, probably woulda been better toasted, next time I'll try that. Also the barista was very pleasant and friendly.

26.description: it's a small hole in the wall, but it's great to grab some coffee to go.  they also have sandwiches, but I feel like you can get more bang for your buck at marianos.

25.description: A great little taste of a European cafe!  I felt like I was sitting back in Madrid - decor, menu, taste, everything. Their sizes are very much American! I got a grande cappuccino about the size of my head! The Nutella croissant  was awesome! The croissant itself was so good!! I was basically licking the plate!  Definitely worth dropping in for a cafe!

12.description: I usually just get a coffee, but today someone introduced me to the idea of a fun dessert: Affogato.   Wikipedia:  "An affogato (Italian, "drowned") is a coffee-based beverage. It usually takes the form of a scoop of vanilla gelato or ice cream topped with a shot of hot espresso. Some variations also include a shot of Amaretto or other liqueur."  I think I have a new favorite: I got it with pistachio: a fun way to combine all your dessert services into one dish.Friendly and fast service, not too crowded on Sunday afternoon.

59.description: In a world of Starbucks dominated coffee it's a breath of fresh air to stop in this jaunt and grab a bold and flavorful espresso. I used to live in Italy and this is simply incredible quality that reminds me of being back there. You can not get a more authentic Italian coffee than here.

21.description: Coffee twas quite watery. The milk in the macciato was all bubbles, but the espresso was pretty good

17.description: Great coffee, nice staff. Highly recommend the ham and cheese croissant. Definitely a new favorite for breakfast!

10.description: This place is hands-down disgusting. I was in Chicago and meeting a friend for coffee, and she just picked this place randomly. I wish she wouldn't have.When you walk in, there's a ceiling art installation or something like that with bottles all over the coffee area. It looked like it hadn't been dusted in years. I really could not care less about how good or bad the coffee was when you have to worry about age-old dust falling into your cappuccino. Very unappetizing.Ultimately, we just sat outside in one of the two tables left. Definitely wouldn't go back here.

5.description: After a light bite in the area, I was craving gelato. Trusty Yelp showed that Lavazza wasn't too far away so I decided to quell my craving. The gelato was ok for me, just average. I went for the cappuccino and pistachio. Was definitely anticipating a richer deeper flavor for the pistachio, but it was largely missing. There were little chards of ice in the cappuccino that made me feel it wasn't super fresh.

3.description: We loved our iced caffè mochas! I thought it was going to be way too sweet, but it turned out to be rich and chocolatey with a great, deep coffee flavor. I was very happy with it! Price was around $4.95 for a large. Nothing you won't pay any less for at Starbucks lol. We didn't try any pastries or treats, but it all looked tasty! Give it a try. I think they serve drinking chocolate. Mmm...next time!

35.description: If you want to enjoy a great cup of coffee, LavAzza is the place! The dark roast is great! My wife loves the Café Mocha! Enjoy!

19.description: Lavazza does such a great job! I don't really understand why people go to Dunkin Donuts or Starbucks when this place is right down the street. They have some of the best coffee in the world.

28.description: I'm so happy to find this place for my morning coffee!Was so tired of the burnt coffee from the giant chain.The staff is very nice.Love it!

45.description: I went with someone who said it was amazing gelato. This was my first time. I ordered hazelnut and he ordered chocolate chip. His tasted awfully artificial and overly sweet. Neither of us finished our gelato because his had a hair embedded into his and mine was filled with ice chunks. We also noticed there was this spoon "art" above the food (the food is is thankfully contained in glass) and it was covered in dust. Can you guys clean that at least?

33.description: The cappuccino was good, and this is a great place to relax and sit by the window or at the tables outside to watch the downtown traffic and people bustle by. The croissants, however, were disappointing. I read some reviews that said how great they were, but the cream croissant was hard, and the entire middle looked like a cave! There was some yellow custardy creamy something on the bottom of the cavern, and then there was this enormous emptiness, and then the top of the croissant that was super hard. I guess maybe this is how the croissant is supposed to be? But I was definitely not expecting that.  So I asked the guy if this is how it's supposed to be, and he shrugged and said he doesn't know, but was nice enough to switch it out for a Nutella croissant instead.  Unfortunately, that one wasn't great either.... But at least they were nice about it. So come here for the espresso, but if you are craving croissants, you might have better luck elsewhere.

43.description: After a chilly morning walking around Gold Coast in Chicago, I stopped by here on my way home to get some caramel apple cider. The decor is not up-scale, and the cafe is located within a hotel, but the caramel apple cider was really great!The service was "fine" at best, but I loved sitting there and just enjoying my drink. They offer "to-stay" cups, which are not disposable, and allow you to really enjoy your drink while sitting in the space. I recommend stopping by after some shopping on Michigan Avenue, to visit and grab a warm drink for the commute/walk home.

2.description: Great service and awesome coffee. The medium mocha was so large! Very cool hangout spot and I loved the coffee themed art.

18.description: I love Lavazza coffee... But I ordered a latte here with almond milk and it seems that this is just another place where people don't realize you can't heat almond milk at the same temperature as dairy milk or it burns and tastes like cardboard. I ordered the smallest size and can't even taste the espresso. Maybe I'd give them another chance but I know many other places in Chicago that do an almond milk latte well. The people working there were friendly though. I took it to go otherwise I would have asked for something else.

41.description: Lavazza has long been Italy's most populist coffee, and for good reason.I enjoy coming into this outpost of Italian flavors and European-styled traditions. The coffee and food is far better than Starbucks, though the staff seems to be the weakest link here. I understand that most people stumble in here while sightseeing or shopping the mag mile, but if you live here I'd suggest you make this a daily coffee shop.

52.description: Coffee was good, but everyone behind the counter was yelling at each other. Very unprofessional and quite frankly embarrassing. Don't think I will stop by there again for a while.....

50.description: Lavazza is a gem in a sea of Dunkin's and Starbucks.    I have had ups and downs with the customer service, but James and Merci are so polite and helpful I can't help but give five stars.  Plus, the coffee speaks for itself.  Recommended for people who aren't looking for a milkshake but real, Italian sizes (meaning quantities meant for human consumption.)

4.description: Quick and friendly service. Coffee is delicious and genuinely strong. The local art and decor displayed is wonderful to look at while you have your drink. The blt is ok. Good not great.

6.description: This place is right next to the inn of Chicago. Me and my gf had breakfast here the day we checked out. By this time we were broke and didn't want to spend a lot of money so Lavazza came through. We spent $20 on two croissants and two coffees. Not bad for Chicago. Not to mention it was pretty good and fast. Passing by it might not call your attention but it's definitely worth it! Good coffee.

22.description: Lavazza does such a great job! I don't really understand why people go to Dunkin Donuts or Starbucks when this place is right down the street. They have some of the best coffee in the world.

15.description: Love the coffee. Staff was friendly. I just found that I can get Lavazza in the store but this was way better.

57.description: Popped in here so a friend could grab a cappucino.  I've decided to go back when I'm in Chicago to get some gelato!!  Cute little shop with wonderful looking food.  :)

20.description: I worked here for Lavazza for a few months and it was hands down one of the most fun jobs I've ever had. I couldn't have had better coworkers and I regard the owners Sam and Seniha Karatas highly. They really care about the cafe and are always looking for ways to improve it whether it be seasonal menu items or improving the menu board. I absolutely loved working here and the food and coffee are so worth trying! The only thing I would say could be improved is maybe the seating? It is a very small space and when it becomes crowded, it is hard to navigate. Other than that 5 stars.

36.description: We had a great experience my first time visiting. It was the perfect study atmosphere with great coffee and good music to compliment it. Our baristas were awesome too. William Boyd was always near to see if we needed anything and was consistently happy and refreshing. Dorell Tonson was was also a great server and showed the same characteristics and showed he generally cared that we had a good experience. Nothing bad can be said about their customer service. We were very pleased.The coffee was fresh and tasted great. I would definitely recommend Lavazza to anyone.

14.description: Excellent drinks for entire family including three kids. Ham and cheese quiche was excellent, almond latte was excellent, kids loved Nutella croissant. Something good for entire family. Just wish they had more space, but definitely worth stopping. We will return next time in Chicago

58.description: This review is about the food only, as I ordered delivered and I'm not aware of the type of service they have or if it is really romantic as the other reviews says. I'm a big fan of mediterranean cuisine, but the cold dishes are my favorite between all they have. I usually order hummus, baba ghannouj, labneh and raw kibbee. All of them are really good, but the labneh is my favorite.

56.description: Place has potential but failed on delivering anything noteworthy.  The service was good but the food was close to average.I had a platter of the hummus, tabouleh and baba ganoush.  All of which I can make better at home.  Probably pass at this spot on my stroll down the street next time.

29.description: Not sure what everyone sees in the place.   Ambiance was fine, but on a Friday evening at 7:00 pm......the restaurant was empty.   Friday night on Magnificent Mile should have been packed.   Locals know more than U.S. tourists.   We should have changed our minds at the sight of an empty restaurant, but decided to give it a shot.A Mediterranean restaurant WITH OUT Fried Kibe.......only for lunch.    A Mediterranean restaurant with out Kafta, only lunch on Wednesdays.........I have never heard of such a thing.    Chicken Kabobs were fine, chin was juicy but rice was bland.Look for other Mediterranean places, there must be better near the magnificent mile !!!!!!!

42.description: great place and delicious  food I went here with my friend , we ordered spinach boreg  very tasty and lahmajoun was flavorful .. 100 out of 5 kufteh (meatballs with yogurt & mint , as I think yogurt gave a really wonderful flavor   .. I'd definitely come back here for "lahmajoun " :D

23.description: Not as exciting of a place as it could have been. They work hard but my smart. Need to focus on quality of service a bit more. I have been there twice and fell into the place by accident. The food is good, service needs focus, not ride or anything, just can be more friendly and more share and more helpful. Cute place though.

47.description: Reasonably priced Armenian/Middle Eastern food in a cosy, intimate setting. We shared the baba ghannouj and labneh, served with warm pita, which were good but unspectacular. The lulla kebab was delicious, served with rice pilaf and a very tasty red lentil soup (it's a thin, but not watery soup). Then we had the Armenian combo, with stuffed grape leaves, cheese boereg, kufta, grilled eggplant, and the soup. The grape leaves and eggplant didn't have a lot of flavor, but the cheese boereg (phyllo stuffed with cheese) and kufta (Armenian style meatballs) were quite good. Overall, we shared four dishes with four people. The waiter divided the soups into four cups because we were sharing, which was appreciated. The food was good, but none of us thought it was particularly outstanding.

8.description: We came here on a whim while visiting Chicago. We actually found this restaurant on OpenTable as it was one of the only places with an open reservation for 9 (always a tough one).Couple quick things about expectations of the place: We were a little hesitant going here as it had received so-so reviews on both Yelp and Open Table. In addition, the place was pretty empty when we got there. The emptiness probably had to do with the location (a little hard to find - especially being out of towners) and the weather (it was raining that night so most people probably chose not to go out).The food - really good actually! I was super impressed by the appetizers. I love a good hummus and tzatki. We ordered a couple samplers and the server made sure to bring us extra pita which was great. The extra pita is definitely a must when trying out these dips! I ordered the mixed kebabs which were actually pretty good. I was a little disappointed by the rice - not as much flavor as I would have liked but that may have been the goal so it didn't overpower the meat.The atmosphere - super small and cozy place. They keep the lights pretty low which adds to the cozy and intimate atmosphere. There are some neat booths along the side that give you some privacy. We were at a large table in the middle so it wasn't quite as intimate but it could be fun for a date night.The service - this is where they lost me. Our server wasn't that great. If the place had been super busy I would have understood her forgetting things or taking awhile to bring something but the place was almost empty. She forgot one of my co-workers drinks and so he was sitting without for a bit. In addition, she just seem kind of irritated with us the whole time and I'm not sure why. I know that big groups can be a pain but I thought we were relatively laid back and not demanding. As I was only visiting Chicago, this will not become a regular spot for me. However, if you're looking for some good Middle Eastern food, you should definitely check this place out.

31.description: I had dinner here in a Tuesday night recently while in Chicago on business. I was walking down Michigan Ave. looking for a place to eat and saw this place. I noticed immediately they had to things I enjoy, Mediterranean food and live jazz! I had a great experience here, the ambience was nice, the food was fresh and had great flavors and the Jazz trio plus singer were very good. Dinner service was a little on the slow side but I really didn't mind since I was enjoying the music. I would definitely recommend this restaurant and will go again when I'm back in town.

34.description: They provide you with excellent customer service, and the food is pretty good too, but I wouldn't say it is totally worth the price.  Prices here are high. I would be ok paying around 7-9 bucks for the meal, but they are around 17-23 and you don't get much for your money.  And that makes me sad. Because it is not that kind of spectacular food you can ONLY get at Sayat Nova, it's more like the type of food you can get wherever.  Ambiance is great and cozy, drinks were pretty good too.  The French martini is definitely my preferred.  I had ordered a Paloma first but didn't like it. Without any objections the server changed it for a drink of my choice.  I really appreciated this gesture. I really believe if prices were a little lower this would be a great place to be a regular.

16.description: Good food. Very trendy atmosphere. Been here a few times, zero complaints. Good location, too. Service was pretty quick.

13.description: Sad to say watching an episode of Keeping Up With The Kardashians made me curious about Armenian food as they were eating some awesome dishes on a particular episode...sigh LOLI came by recently and walked into very nice, cozy and dim lit place. I knew from the look and feel of the place we were going to have a nice meal. It was around 6PM on a Friday when we showed up and the place wasn't very populated. This was good because so many booths were available and we got the one near the back in the corner...quite romantic! We started out with the Armenian Spinach which was crazy delicious. We shared it but I wanted to hog it all by myself because it was so good. The spinach is sautéed in onions and olive oil and comes along with a lemon wedge.My entree was even better as I got the Sautéed Lamb which is pieces of lamb sautéed with onions, tomatoes and green peppers along with rice pilaf. I enjoyed every bite! My dining companion got the sautéed shrimp and it was equally as good. Same dish except there was shrimp instead of lamb. Service was really good and music went well with scenery. I think its awesome that actual Armenians work here which assures you authenticity...awesome!

11.description: Reasonably priced Armenian/Middle Eastern food in a cosy, intimate setting. We shared the baba ghannouj and labneh, served with warm pita, which were good but unspectacular. The lulla kebab was delicious, served with rice pilaf and a very tasty red lentil soup (it's a thin, but not watery soup). Then we had the Armenian combo, with stuffed grape leaves, cheese boereg, kufta, grilled eggplant, and the soup. The grape leaves and eggplant didn't have a lot of flavor, but the cheese boereg (phyllo stuffed with cheese) and kufta (Armenian style meatballs) were quite good. Overall, we shared four dishes with four people. The waiter divided the soups into four cups because we were sharing, which was appreciated. The food was good, but none of us thought it was particularly outstanding.

39.description: Always good! Cozy and food is authentic, tasty and reasonably priced. Good date night spot!

37.description: The food is mediocre. The portions are small. I'm used to middle eastern restaurants like Reza or Noon O Kabob where the plate is huge and they pack on the meat and rice. The plates here are small and a little overpriced. The service is also not good. Granted the night we went was Valentine's Day but I had to ask random waitresses walking by to get our waiter for us because he was nowhere to be found. I wouldn't go back. They should up the portions and concentrate on their service. I'd recommend Reza or Noon O Kabob to anyone looking for a middle eastern cuisine.

0.description: I ducked in here for lunch with The Bud while seeking shelter from the Chicago wind. What a serendipitous find. The menu consists of kebabs in all manner of meat and mezze plates. The kebabs are served with a flavorful rice pilaf. Their cocktail menu spans the alcohol spectrum, and their beer list includes an Armenian beer/lager. I had the Paloma, a tequila/grapefruit/lime/soda concoction that I recommend with tequila-infused enthusiasm. If I were looking to dessert, I would have tried the Armenian coffee martini that is a combination of vanilla vodka, Baileys and Armenian coffee. Because. Coffee. We were seated at a booth in a row of half-moon booths along one wall where the wall behind each booth is decoratively cut away and back lit. It makes for an intimate and cozy conversation and eating area. This is a perfectly respectable place to stop for a quick lunch before getting back to the vital business of supporting the economy of the Magnificent Mile. I'm willing to bet it's downright romantic in the evening when the Moroccan-style lighting fixtures can really throw their geometric light shapes around the place.

38.description: Food is OK ! Nothing great about this place.  The service needs improvement. You have to keep waiting for the waiter as no one comes to clear up the plates or ask you for order another drink or desserts or food.

51.description: Armenian cuisine is familiar in many ways to other middle eastern cuisine but I like it since it is milder and lets the flavors of the ingredients come through.  The place is quiet, on a side street but also conveniently located.

27.description: Not the best. Food is about 2 and a half  stars. My buddy asked for a corona, and they brought him a mixed drink. Looked at the waitress and said "is this a corona?!" She goes "yep! That's a corona!" Lol. It was not even beer! I had the Armenian Combo. It was good enough to finish but kind of meh. The lentil soup tasted like it was made of chicken broth and it was watery.Nothing here that would make me want to return. Well except we were seated in 5 minutes at 10 PM on a Friday night. Much better than a 1-2 hour wait every where else.

32.description: The beef shawarma was very chewy and you will have to spit it out .. So Plz don't order it

54.description: GoVeg's review was spot on.  This is a great location with a really intimate interior.  The service is great, more of a family owned and run place where everyone serves you and takes care of any needs you might have.  Quite attentive and very helpful.The food varies, there are some dishes that are spot on and other that are just average.  Last time I was there we had the grape leaves which had good flavor but were a little on the tough and chewy side.  The kebabs were well cooked, but lacked a Mediterranean flair.  A few of the vegetarian options were a little bland, but also well cooked.  Our visiting guest had the lamb and it was well received.  The pitas are a bit dry and could be better.Overall this is a decent middle-eastern restaurant with nice staff and reasonable food.  The prices are a bit on the high end for what you get, so for that reason it drops it more to a 3 star than a 4, but it's a solid choice if you're in the mood for middle-eastern / Armenian and are in the area.

48.description: Great location and well-priced.They took a reservation without hassle, and even added someone to our party with no questions asked.Delicious food and beautiful decor.

44.description: I really love the ambiance here. Cozy booths backlit with red lights and a cave-like feeling. The highlights for me were the side salad (that came with the entree) with mint dressing and the spinach boureg (which was hugely awesome).

24.description: I absolutely love this place and come in every time I'm in the area. The things I love are all vegetarian (as am I, most of the time). I'm shocked no one has mentioned the amazing plaki-- a gigante white bean appetizer that is amazing. I've had a lot of hummus in my day and I think this is really delicious, similar to what I've had and loved in Israel. The tabouleh is fantastic and I usually avoid tabouleh. Fresh, flavorful, full of finely diced tomatoes that give it a slightly acidic kick that I find tabouleh which is primarily chopped parsley lacks. The red cabbage is lemony and delicious-- this coming from someone who usually doesn't order cold dishes. And the spinach boureg are mouthwatering, just the right balance between the spinach and cheese. I don't like the cheese boureg as much-- too cheesy for me-- but with the items I've listed above, I don't think you can go wrong.

7.description: The restaurant is definitely right place to go.Live jazz ones a week and food is delicious! Ohh, I almost forgot, Armenian coffee is great, should try!

49.description: Came to Chicago for a conference and went here for dinner.  Hostess was very friendly and there was no wait, unlike most places in Chicago on a Thursday night.  They have these great booths with back lit stonework.  The service was super friendly but sometimes on the slower side.  We tried the lamb cous cous, jajic, and vegetable kebab.  All fairly tasty.  Vegetables were a little on the chunky side.  Lamb cous cous was flavorful and the meat was nicely cooked but not as hot as it could have been.  The best thing about the restaurant is the atmosphere.  Would go here again!

40.description: Great experience at Sayat Nova this weekend. We had two lamb dishes that were very good. The inside of the restaurant is cool with a Middle Eastern feel to it. Service was fair, had to wave down our waiter a few times. Great raspberry cheesecake for dessert, and the Armenian coffee was very good if you enjoy strong brews.

53.description: Sad to say watching an episode of Keeping Up With The Kardashians made me curious about Armenian food as they were eating some awesome dishes on a particular episode...sigh LOLI came by recently and walked into very nice, cozy and dim lit place. I knew from the look and feel of the place we were going to have a nice meal. It was around 6PM on a Friday when we showed up and the place wasn't very populated. This was good because so many booths were available and we got the one near the back in the corner...quite romantic! We started out with the Armenian Spinach which was crazy delicious. We shared it but I wanted to hog it all by myself because it was so good.
