35.description: We ate here as a recommendation from a coworker, and it was wonderful!  Some of the best Lasagna I've ever had, and the lamb was so tender.  It's a must on the date night list!  Not to mention, the service was phenomenal.

19.description: YUM! We loved it here! Make a reservation, they fill up fast! The Spaghetti AOP was very good. Not spicy as mentioned.  We also had several bruschettas and could've had 10 more - they were delicious.

28.description: I really liked the ambience here as well as the staff. Seems like a small Italian restaurant in a small street in another country with intimate seating. Wasn't too busy on a Friday night either. The noise was a bit loud though. Food-wise it was good but nothing too special. The frites, lasagna, and salads were good. Not too huge of portions on some of the pasta dishes but the fried chicken was quite big. Prices for this area were actually very decent but it definitely wasn't cheap. I would normally give them 4 stars but I hold Chicago restaurants to a higher standard and they weren't anything to write home about but a good option. Especially if visiting someone at the NW hospital next door like we were.

45.description: 5 stars for food. 1 deducted for poorly maintained atmosphere. Will probably come back for that calamari!  Service was also prompt, organized and attentive!

33.description: I love the cozy atmosphere here and they serve all day.  In the summer, the patio is charming.  The homemade pasta is always a good choice.  Can get crowded, best to have a reservation.

43.description: Was here last week for a vendor lunch. It is rather small and the atmosphere a little close. The pseudo-Modigliani frescoed walls were well executed. Service was friendly and fast. The tacchino panini (smoked turkey and pancetta) is highly recommended. Just be aware that due to its small size, the place can get loud - or maybe it was just the boisterous office group there that made it so. Overall, an above average dining experience.

2.description: I really liked the ambience here as well as the staff. Seems like a small Italian restaurant in a small street in another country with intimate seating. Wasn't too busy on a Friday night either. The noise was a bit loud though. Food-wise it was good but nothing too special. The frites, lasagna, and salads were good. Not too huge of portions on some of the pasta dishes but the fried chicken was quite big. Prices for this area were actually very decent but it definitely wasn't cheap. I would normally give them 4 stars but I hold Chicago restaurants to a higher standard and they weren't anything to write home about but a good option. Especially if visiting someone at the NW hospital next door like we were.

18.description: I moved to this neighborhood recently and have been wanting to try this quaint Italian cafe.  We had a lovely dinner last night sitting outside on a great evening.   Our appetizers and pasta dishes were excellent!!Many restaurants with sidewalk sitting areas have the problem of loud traffic noise, but that isn't the case here.  The ambiance and service was great and we look forward to going back to try other dishes at this quaint neighborhood cafe!!

41.description: I had the black squid ink with shrimp. FANTASTIC! My mouth is literally salivating as I write this review. We had the Prosciutto with chees and honey as well as the grilled octopus. The octopus was sooo tender it practically melted in my mouth. My friend ordered "regular" spaghetti which I felt was a waste of a night out...until the dish came. The portion was superb (she def had enough for leftover/lunch the next day). And the flavor had a nice kick to it so not just your typical, boring spaghetti. My meal was great, the pasta was mild but the squid ink flavor was noticeable. The shrimp were succulent and the sauce perfectly complimented the seafood in the dish. Their olive oil is something special as well. very rustic tasting and fruity. The service was impeccable, my glass never fell below the half-way mark. Can't wait to come back!

52.description: Great food and service.

50.description: Lovely atmosphere for a nice Italian dinner. Lasagna & spaghetti, yes, but also octopus ink pasta with shrimp and bruschetta with white beans and truffles.

4.description: The nhoque its PERFECT! great service!! I came with my puppy and we stayed at the patio and it was really nice!!! The service its amazing  and also the pinot grigio! HeheGreat italian place to have greeeeat food!!!! Ask for the nhoque you wont regret!

6.description: ready for the quickest review ever? great food, exceptional service, incredible atmosphere!! done! :-)

22.description: The pasta looks really good but tastes very plain. It was tasteless to a point that we complained to the server but he was rude and just insisted that it was good. Don't come here for the Lasagna. The Spaghetti AOP doesn't taste good too. I know I'm picky but it's just too plain. Don't come here. It's not worth it. Service is not on point too.

15.description: This location is right near where I work, so I frequently come here for lunch.I love their food, I have never had a bad dish here, the food is consistent. The spaghetti AOP is my favorite...everything I've tried has been great.I would say that typically the service is a bit off; sometimes slow, sometimes too fast, the waiters can be awkward/not helpful. Essentially the service is inconsistent.That being said, the food is always great and their patio is fabulous;)

57.description: 14 of us had a really good time and the service was great!  The food however was below average at best. The highlight was the calamari and it went down hill from there.

20.description: The nhoque its PERFECT! great service!! I came with my puppy and we stayed at the patio and it was really nice!!! The service its amazing  and also the pinot grigio! HeheGreat italian place to have greeeeat food!!!! Ask for the nhoque you wont regret!

36.description: We chose this on the high recommendation from the concierge at the Sheraton on a bitterly cold, snowy night. Upon arriving, we were immediately welcomed  by the Maître d'. The ambience was warm and inviting and very much like a comfortable neighborhood cafe. Our server Miguel was terrific as were the other staff who ensured our water glasses were never less than half empty and seamlessly served & cleared plates. From the recitation of the specials to the recommendations of the house specialties, we were enthused at the offerings and only wished we could have tried more dishes. The veal medallions were perfect, and my colleagues raved about their selections as well. It was a delightful and relaxing and delicious experience and I hope to get back there again.I encourage others to try this little gem!

14.description: Went for Restaurant week.  Despite having a later reservation we were able to be seated 45 min early, and the rest of the service was on that level.  We started with the Sette Vegetali (nothing special) and the Polpo (tasty octopus), had the mushroom Risotto (great if you like mushrooms) and Rigatoni alla Buttera (great, flavorful and good portion), and both finished with the Panna Cotta (the real reason we went here).  At only $33 for dinner it was a solid meal, and the atmosphere and service would great.  I'd come here more often if only the prices were lower, because it's not really a place you can afford on a student budget.

12.description: I have breakfast here often enough, and I do love me my scrambled eggs, hash browns, and bacon.Mmmm bacon.Occasionally, I'll come for the salad bar too, but I've definitely had better salads.

3.description: Had lunch here yesterday.  Nice salad bar with healthy selections ( spinach, garbanzos, black beans, eggs, beets, peas, chicken, tuna).  Topped off with Tazo Iced tea and the bill totaled $8.00 even! However, I was surprised at how much unhealthy and fried food they were serving, all being scarfed down by overweight hospital workers....hmmmmm.

1.description: Restaurant ReviewIs there good hospital food.... maybe. I have been here numerous times for the past three years and seen the variety of foods available. You can get a custom tossed salad, Mediterranean food, soups, grill items (turkey burger is healthy and the best), sushi, italian pasta station, and gourmet burgers. The new addition is soft serve yogurt and smoothie station. You can round out your meal with starbucks coffee. Well stocked, but at a price. The food is very expensive even for the streeterville area. If your hungry I would recommend the turkey burger with a nice helping of fries. If you are looking to be healthy I would give the sushi and yogurt w/ granola a try. Only 3 stars because of the price.Pro- wide variety, quick serviceCon- very expensive, you can get a cheaper meal outside of the hospitalHidden deal- NMH employees get 10% off and there is a 1 dollar special on the fried food bar everyday

2.description: The Allspice Cafe is the official name of the cafeteria for Northwestern Memorial Hospital. Employees call it "the cafeteria" and it looks exactly like a cafeteria. This cafeteria, The Allspice Cafe, is extraordinarily good, and offers a wide variety of food, all at prices that are reasonable, although they are not cheap.The cafeteria is broken down into multiple sections. There is a section which displays and serves dinners. Patrons line up there for salmon, chicken, mac and cheese, eggplant, and the like. Usually there are two or three entrees, vegetables and starches available. Another section makes hamburgers and the like, to order. There is a nice section that does nothing but offer two entrees, plus various vegetable and starch dishes, all of which are nutritious and calorie counted for the customer. Here is an example of a meal from this station: baked fish, choice of couscous or bulgar salad, choice of two vegetables from: spinach, asparagus, mediterranean salad (like a horiatiki), squash. Calories = 600, according to the chalkboard, and price = $6.95.Another section makes sushi, to order if you like, but mostly to stock a chiller with boxes of sushi. The sushi is not particularly cheap, nor is it great, but it is made fresh.There is a frozen yogurt bar, almost like a frozen yogurt store, where a worker will put together your yogurt to order.Some items in the Allspice Cafe/cafeteria are quite a good deal. The meal that I described above is one such deal. Most hot dinners, for example salmon, mac and cheese and one vegetable, would also run about $7.00. The hot dinners are quite good.There is also a salad bar that charges by weight.I recommend the Allspice Cafe, particularly at lunchtime when all of the stations are open. The food is very good, freshly made, and fairly priced, or, in some cases, a bargain.To get to the Allspice, enter the East side of the Feinberg Pavilion on the Erie Street side, then go up the escalators to the second floor.

9.description: I've had breakfasts, lunches and dinners here and the selection is always great.  The prices are a bit high, but that's to be expected at a hospital cafeteria of this caliber.  It's clean and the staff are mostly friendly.I especially love the area after you pay where you can find all the condiments, silverware and microwaves because it's so extremely organized which is very refreshing in a large cafeteria like this.The special are usually awesome with an equally good price so check them out.

10.description: The lack of decent non-corporate lunches on Michigan Avenue led me to resort to wandering through a hospital and dining among a mix of scrubs and senior citizens.  I seemed to recall that Northwestern University was noted for best vegetarian dining by PETA, which somehow led me to assume that perhaps the Medical Center's cafeteria might be something decent.  I was wrong.The salad bar selection was oddly limiting.  I tried to make something decent out of it, but wound up with an odd melange of spinach, firm tofu cubes (plain), beets, crunchy noodles and french dressing.  It tasted as strange as it sounds, not to mention the greens were wilted.Then I got some soggy pasta in some sort of sauce...marinara?  No, more like salty watery red stuff.The case of cake and pie slices looked lovely, though, and I was depending on this to make my meal more satisfying.  I picked out a flavorless Oreo creme pie with a soggy cookie crumbles and crust.  In other words, a chunk of mush.    BOO Allspice!!!  Maybe I just picked the wrong things though?  I mean the overall selection was definitely wide and varied...maybe my expectations were just too high...but I don't think I'll be back.

13.description: If you're in Streeterville, can't decide what to eat, and want something fast and cheap, you can't beat Allspice Cafe - Northwestern Memorial Hospital's cafeteria.They've got a great selection of all kinds of cafeteria foods, plus they have signs with everything's nutritional value.  My faves are the extremely cheap soups, or a mix of sides with a small salad.Btw, this place is hidden on the 2nd floor of the hospital, next to a large Au Bon Pain.  There are escalators near the central entrance that will lead you there.

16.description: All Spice Cafe has a variety of food "stations", one of which is a salad station. They used to make a decent size salad for the price. But then they went to a smaller container, same price though. Today I bought a salad and the container has shrunk again. The salad seems fresh enough, but the amount is definitely NOT worth the price. I won't be back. I tried to find an address where I could write a complaint, but can't seem to locate one. I guess when you have thousands of employees and hospital visitors going through, they aren't too worried about losing customers.

6.description: Aw, dang! I totally thought I had the lock on being the first reviewer!Mike W. ain't lying, this hospital cafeteria beats all ideas one has of such places to death (Code Blue!! HaHa! eeehh...) with a wide selection and reasonable prices.  It's a place that reminds me of the University type cafeterias with seven or eight different stations featuring different types of "cuisine".  Remember though: you're not going for selective quality, you're going for food: quick and not too overly priced.  Their salad bar fits the bill nicely.

15.description: Not for me.  Expensive for what you get.

0.description: If you got to be sick and need to catch a bite to eat before or after seeing your doctor, the second floor at Northwestern Memorial Hospital is the place to be. "They" remodeled the second floor into a shopping/foodcourt destination head and shoulders above any hospital I've been at.Restaurants include a remodeled Au Bon Pain, Asian/Thai cuisine, Greek and the ever present smell of gyros, a protein bar for all those yuppies and hipsters as well as the usual stock of serving stations in the main cafeteria.Give them kudos for presenting a more relaxed informal atmosphere for those patients wanting to escape the bland, impersonal cafeteria aesthetics for a few minutes for lunch.I do have to say I was surprised at some of the prices, even from the serving stations in the main cafeteria. 10 bucks for a torta seems pretty steep. That's how they get you. Who wants to walk blocks to find something to eat when not feeling well.Anyway... It's worth a look

5.description: Decent hospital cafeteria fare with a HUGE assortment of fried food.  You'd think that at a hospital, they'd serve healthier things, however, allspice loves to deep fry.   Follows is a listing of fried fare I remember seeing:  French fries, sweet potato fries, waffle fries, corn dogs, mini corn dogs, zucchini fries, battered mushrooms, taquitos, mozzarella sticks,  mozzarella scoops, chicken strips, chicken nuggets, chicken wings, battered fish filet, fish nuggets, hush puppies, and cheese cream stuffed jalapenos.  I'm sure that there's a ton more that I'm forgetting too.  You won't see all of those options at any one particular time, as they rotate.  The non-fried food is decent, but I haven't had enough of it to make a truly informed judgement.  I just can't say no to the fried food because it's delicious, always available regardless of the time of day, and the best value.Oh, and unlike Prentice's cafeteria, they don't charge you here if you grab a plastic cup for water.

11.description: Very reminiscent of good old Owen Hall...The salad bar is a little on the expensive side ($10 for a pound of salad??  err...Northwestern, I pay you enough in medical care that you could certainly subsidize my  healthy lunch so I don't end up in your offices so often....wait.........i think it's a ploy...eat the unhealthy cheap shit so you DO end up in their offices more often...)Conspiracy theories aside, it's a quick decent lunch and you can eat it by a sunny window with invalids and other interesting hospital types.

8.description: You would think that since this cafeteria is in a hospital that they would have a greater selection of healthy food but you would be wrong . But they do have a variety of foods to choose from and some of it is even healthy.  The decor is nice and it is much nicer than the cafeteria at Rush. That cafeteria is just depressing

4.description: Not a lot of healthy options.  Standard salad bar, but most of the options are greasy, cream-based or fried options. It's awesome to see all the medical professionals get fried chicken on top of their giant slices of pizza.Overpriced, too.  A medium salad + small chili = $11.11? Redic.Friendly workers, though. And open till 3AM for the munchies whilst studying.

14.description: For a hospital cafeteria, Not bad. With some exceptions of course, But will be said later. The salad bar is fantastic. LOTS to choose from. The entrees ain't bad either. However, AVOID the Dolmadas. Bland & tasteless. There was another entree which I didn't particularly care for either, I believe it was the Mustard Greens. The desserts are OK, Some may be not as fresh.

7.description: Meh , hospital food, during lunch great selection, but after hours things get a bit sketchy

58.description: Hubby had been wanting to go there so we did last weekend.The sake is pricey, but we split a bottle of Wandering Poet (which may have contributed to our positive view of the place. There were some loud partiers by the bar but we were promptly seated in the back quieter area. A Japanese film (I think it was Zaitochi) was playing.We decided to make the bar snacks a light supper.Hubby had edamame, which he said was typical. We had the pork gyoza, which were some of the best we've had. Then we shared a bowl of soba, which was also good.The waitress, a student from Osaka, was delightful. She came by and chatted when she could. We've been to Japan so it was fun to reminisce and share notes with her.We had an enjoyable evening there and plan to return. Hubby (who loves Pokari Sweat-ugh!) needs to try the Pokari-tini

56.description: I hope Yumi is there when you go. She served us and was so sweet and very knowledgeable about the sakes.The space is small and intimate and great for conversation. I was really excited to check out the karaoke room for another get-together but it was disappointing. The room is tiny and a wall splits it is half so views are obstructed and your group will be separated.Advice to the owners: the karaoke should be in the main room and be the draw of your lounge. That is what differentiates your business from your competitors.

29.description: I was a guest to a birthday party that was hosted here by a DJ.  It took place in the front room/lounge area.  Although small, this spot had a cool vibe.  I liked how the bar was setup where you are seated above the bartenders...it was kind of a cool change up...although I'm a 6'3 blonde so this only made my 6'4" black date and I look more like salt and pepper Godzillas in comparison to the petite and beautiful Asian bartenders.  We didn't eat but we had good, quick and friendly service at the bar.

42.description: Plum sake is delicious. Waiter knew his stuff. Loved the environment. Perfect late night date night location. *wink wink*

23.description: I'm rating the karaoke only. Do not karaoke here. It is a rip off. The equipment and song list is outdated. The room is also hot and doesn't have good ventilation. I went here with 6 coworkers on a weeknight for two hours. I studied the bill after I got home and noticed that the 20% gratuity they charged on a party of 6 or more was tacked on to the room bill ($150) and tacked on to the taxes ($30). I thought the tip was only going to get tacked on to the food and drinks, but they based gratuity on the room charge and taxes as well! The only break we got was a $50 discount on the room rental for spending more than $100 on food and drinks.What a rip.

47.description: try the cabin in the snow sake...best i've ever had!  i went in a group of 4 and we got there early, around 8 or 9 on a saturday night.  there weren't many other people there and we felt like it was our own private lounge. got a cozy corner booth/table and the hot towels were a pleasant surprise.  if we had only been there for an hour or so i probably would have given this a 5, for the amazing sake and friendly service.  but when it got busy later on, we found that our corner spot was really awkward since the tables immediately surrounding us were over-full with a bigger group, and brought extra chairs around their tables.  it made it so hard to get out to go to the bathroom or whatever, and also hard for the waitress to get our orders.  only complicated even more by the people who were sitting there blocking the way...i'm trying to be nice and polite as i go by, and they would hardly move an inch and then act like they were doing me a huge favor.  note to girls wearing butt-skimming skirts in late november, you can still look cute and not be a total bitch.  i have nothing against scanty clothing (except for being cold), until the people in them start acting like they are the only ones that matter.  i realize this is not the fault of the lounge, but i would have to agree with someone else about the awkward furniture arrangement.   would be an awesome place if you had a big group and could reserve the whole space, or if you just went as a couple and sat somewhere else.  not great for a small group though.

8.description: Great lounge, great drinks, great food, great service. There's karaoke at Murasaki Lounge as well, but I can't vouch for that. There's a decent variety of Japanese drinks offered here, but sake is the main staple. The atmosphere and lighting make it a pretty good sit back and chill kind of a place.

31.description: Best place downtown to try out sake. Yes, other restaurants have sake, but none of them are as intimate as this one.

34.description: This place is fun for a little sake cocktail and an intimate setting.  There are many, many options and the staff are very educated in the making of sake and the regions it comes from and what makes the tastes different.  Go in; sip and ask; it's interesting.

16.description: Food was ok. Had a kind of awkward experience-  came in for dinner with a girlfriend at 6:45 on a Wednesday. We were literally the only 2 customers there for over 2 hours. The service was a little slow which was weird considering there was no one else there.... Maybe this place gets hopping for karaoke but I wouldn't recommend stopping in just to eat.

13.description: When I think of a lounge this is place is the exact image in my head. Excellent selection of shochu, small quaint karaoke rooms (but more than 4/5 people is too many) and patient servers (patient bc the group I was with were loud crazy drunk people) I would recommend.Karaoke: 3/5 - Machine is a little buggy to use and the music selection is a little dated. Service: 4/5Location : 4/5

11.description: Cool sake bar! We tried the mixed drinks with Saki and they were great.  The food was great as well, the best miso soup I have ever had.

39.description: Been here several times with friends, one of which DJs there occasionally, so I thought it would be a nice place to get drinks with high school friends that it's too loud.  I even called a few weeks in advance to see if it was ok to have a large group (10-15) from 8pm-10pm on a Friday night.  They told me it's fine but they only split the check max of 4 ways.  I decided to go ahead and reserve it anyways.  When asked, they said they would be able to give me two $10 cocktail specials. I will never hold an event there again.  Dealing with management was a nightmare.  When my friends go there, they were told there was no reservation.  No big deal as there were few people there at 8pm.  They also did not provide any specials they had promised me.  More people than 30 people ended up coming over the course of 3 hours.  They put the first 20 people on one huge tab which was a pain to deal with.  Eventually, they were smart enough to open tabs for individuals who came later.  My DJ friend also dropped by and said that the boss pulled him over and was unhappy that my party was so big and thought that we were underage even though we were having our 5 yr high school reunion.  I was pretty annoyed that they were unhappy.  Shouldn't they be happy that they're getting business.  Whenever I went there in the past the place was usually pretty dead.  Anyways the only non-negative thing of the night were the cocktails my friends and I had.  I ordered the Far East ($12).  It was very colorful and fruity.  I also tried my friend's mint kiss, murasaki, and pear ?

37.description: Went here last night after a bad experience looking at wedding bands and my fiance and I were in poor spirits to say the least.Walk in not knowing what to expect and it was just about empty on a Saturday night at 8:30 or so.  Boy were we pleasantly surprised.=== Sake ===The sake list is awesome.  As someone starting to get into sake who knows enough about it to be somewhat comfortable reading a sake list, I was pleasantly surprised with the diversity.  However they had a list of sake flight specials that were a steal.  The two I had ($12 and $15 for three each) were very generous pours and the value was great.  The quality of the sake was very high and the bartender was very knowledgeable about them and taught us quite a bit.=== Food ===Having not eaten dinner yet, we proceeded to order (almost) everything off of their short, but fairly diverse small plate menu.  Think of it as Japanese tapas and you'll get a feel for the size and selection.  This is Japanese bar food done right.Some highlights:Takoyaki - One of my favorite Japanese streetfood dishes.  Theirs were fluffy, and the katsuobushi on top was finely shredded which added a nice texture.Cruncy Yakitori - These had some sort of crust on them (panko?) and with the seasoning and texture this was one of our favorites.Yaki Zushi/Yaki Rice - The spicy tuna on the zushi was good, but the real star here of both was the yaki rice (which you can order on its own in nigiri form).  Delicately grilled, crunchy texture, and just the right amount of soy flavoring.  Unbelievable.=== Atmosphere ===Soothing neon and a great DJ that came in later.  I mentioned it was empty when we arrived, but it filled up not to long after that and was quite full when we left.  However we never felt crowded, it was never too loud, and we had a great feeling of being at ease the entire time there (of which we spent over 2hrs probably).  This is how I like my Saturday nights to be.=== Service ===Service was fantastic.  The entire staff was super friendly and most (if not all) were from Japan.  They brought the food out in a slow measured pace that allowed us to enjoy each dish without being rushed.  They happily answered all our questions about Japan and sake and we learned quite a bit.=== Value ===For two people we had three sake flights, and most of the dishes from their menu.  Total came out to just over $100.  For what we got in terms of amount of drink/food and overall quality that is a great deal IMHO.  I will definitely be coming back here when I get the chance and recommending it to friends who enjoy a nice chill evening.

0.description: Wonderful atmosphere for a relaxing after dinner drink. The staff and friends are welcoming, with good recommendation for the taste I described I'd need. The Japanese movie in the background adds a good vibe to it! I was surprised by the lack of buzzing on a Friday night - but apparently it is Sat and Sun when the DJ stirs up the systems ;)

38.description: A few of us decided we are going to do our own little sake tasting and so with the help of yelp, we decided to try Murasaki Loungewhat a great find!the staff was helpful with the choices of our sakes (note the menu online is not up to date and sometimes they do run out of the ones listed on the drink menu)interesting vibe, they play animation on the tv and some cool music after the crowd picks up around 10pmi liked the raw octopus with wasabi and the octopus balls, the bites seem to be quite goodall in all a great place to have some sake and enjoy a little bit of japan in chicago :)

51.description: Stopped by this lounge with for my friend's birthday. We were a fairly big group (6 ppl) and didn't have a reservation... However, the host was very accommodating, and asked two ladies sitting on the couch if they'd be willing to move.The sake is pricey, but they seem very high quality (the reason why I say "seem" is because I'm unfortunately a n00b when it comes to sake..). The waitress was very helpful in answering all of our questions and her recommendations were great. Very friendly service (they even gave my friend a mochi ice cream on the house)All in all a very positive experience, though definitely one of my pricier outings. Don't expect to get very much in quantity (unless you're willing to pay for it :P), but this lounge is definitely more focused on the atmosphere and experience, which I appreciate more.(didn't get to try the Karaoke, and probably won't be trying it soon... it's $100/hr @_@)

27.description: Very cool sake bar. They have all the sake you can think of + more! Super chill place. We stopped in and sat at the bar while we were waiting for another restaurant. Had a few drinks here. Told the bartender to surprise me with something girly and tasty and he did just that. I also snacked on some pork Shumai and it was delicious!

32.description: A wide range of saki selection. Some of them are quite interesting. The price is not cheap but reasonableThe ambiance is not fancy but talk friendly.They aired EVA on the TV, which is definitely a plus for my taste.

54.description: If I could give this place negative 100 stars I would.... this is the WORST Karaoke lounge (if not the worst place period) I have ever been to!!!!!  Their service was beyond bad to your imagination!!  We reserved a room and when we got there, we realize they provided the wrong information.  Most importantly, they KICKED US OUT because they made a mistake in their booking.  How can you make a mistake when there is only ONE karaoke room at the lounge??  More than that, they demanded we pay for half of our rate although they kicked us out only after 40min there!!!  How can any place provide such services???  Beyond what happened, the owner of the place did not show any sympathy for kicking us out.  She basically told us to leave and that we we had to pay a portion of the bill.  We were furious by the attitude we received from the owner!!  She also lied to us about the time we had to leave.  Originally she said the next party is arriving at 11pm, but then at 10:40, she came in and demanded we had to leave!!In addition, the lounge was small and shabby.  The karaoke room was extremly small and seating is awkward.  We were not able to see the screen from some angles and the Song list is ridiculously outdated.  PLEASE STAY AWAY~~~~  WORST PLACE EVER!!!!This was my first time in Chicago  and sadly, it gave me a bad impression about Chicago...

48.description: Don't listen to any other negative reviews.  Try this place once and you will get to know Kerry and the rest of the crew at Murasaki.  The Takoyaki is great along with the Temaki!! They helped me with a trip to Japan this year and was able to get me a pass to a Sake distillery in Osaka. How many restaurants can say that...NONE!!!Mamma-san is sweet, Kerry is great, it is nice to have a family business that actually cares about customers.  If someone has a bad experience it is likely because they are not open to a new experience (myopic suburbanites), or they have a preconceived notion of what a sake bar is (without actually being to japan or korea).Try this place for high end sake/soju/sochu/temaki!  They have tastings each month that are outstanding and inexpensive.  They will teach you the difference between junmai's and daiginjo's!!    Let me know if you have questions I will be happy to answer, but this place is top notch!  The best sake bar potentially in the entire country....I have tried MANY!!  Try it and find out what true premium sake really is.... or stick to crappy gekkeikan and never know what is out there!!!

44.description: This is a small Japanese sake bar/karaoke lounge.  It features a variety of sakes, one private karaoke room, and an attentive staff.  It is a good place for an intimate drink, the house lights are usually rather low and the music Is quiet enough that you can pitch your woo without having to shout in your date's ear.  The karaoke is in a separate private room so that the other patrons need not be assaulted by the off-key caterwauling of drunk, amateur crooners.  There is a small menu of tsumami (Japanese tapas sized dishes) but it is not a place to go for a meal.  The staff is very friendly and the ambience is low key but not low class.  The two wide screen televisions are usually (possibly always) playing Japanese anime without sound: more decorative visual stimulant than cinematic presentation. I recommend it as a good place for a quiet drink with a date to begin or end a romantic evening out on the town or for those who like sake and/or want to practice their Japanese.  Those on a date wanting privacy should sit at a table, not at the bar.  The owner and/or het son are there on most evenings and they are very nice people who are clearly goodhearted and always happy to chat with their customers.

24.description: We went to a sake tasting and for $30 it is totally worth it.  I haven't tried it but the bf says it's delicious! We def can't wait to hit up the karoke there!

7.description: We came here for a night of private karaoke!  It was my first time doing this style of karaoke (I'm well acquainted and very comfortable with singing badly in a bar full of strangers), and maybe I'm just not being appreciative of cultural differences, but I'm definitely not convinced that the Murasaki way is better.The best part about Murasaki karaoke is the instant gratification.  When there is just a handful of people, the wait to sing your song is nonexistent.  The second best part about being at Murasaki were the random videos of Rome and jazz musicians in 1960's that loop in the background as your lyrics are playing on the screen. The worst part about Murasaki karaoke is the VERY limited musical selection.  None of my standbys were in the book, half of which is comprised of Japanese artists.  The second worst part is the lack of feedback -- I NEED that room full of drunken strangers to applaud and whistle and generally make me feel like a star.Maybe you like private karaoke! If so, this place is great.  The waitress was very attentive and the room is nice.  Go try it out.  If you need a bigger audience, go somewhere else.

49.description: My friends and I recently reserved the karaoke room for a bachelorette party and had an amazing, fun time! It took us a little while to figure out the karaoke system and the books (1/2 in Japanese) were a bit confusing...that also very well may have had a lot to do with the massive amount of wine consumed with dinner.  The song selection was good.  The room was big enough that those who weren't interested in karaoking could lounge in the back.  Bottle service is pretty reasonable and our very awesome servers kept bringing complimentary shots of Japense Vodka.  All in all, we had an awesome time at Murasaki!

40.description: Their selection is pretty large with more than 20 different sake bottles available. They are very knowledgeable about their product and are happy to help you choose. My favorite is the Gome Gome. Ambiance is pretty nice, very chill place good for meeting friends or relaxing after work. Food is tasty especially while drinking, but a bit pricy. They play anime on the big screens throughout the lounge most of which are pretty nice to watch while just hanging out. I have tried their Takoyaki (octopus ball) which is very tasty, however each ball is much larger than most other restaurantsalso tried their yaki tori(chicken skewers) they are a bit dry, but the interesting thing about them is they are crusted with a pocky or pretz coating. This is something I have not seen elsewhere before.Rice balls are pretty standard. If you are craving them they are a good fix.

53.description: Quiet and unexpected sake lounge in the middle of Streeterville in what seems to be a decorated hotel lobby and bar circa 1980s.  Came with a small group on a Friday night around 9pm, to a relatively empty lounge, but the place promptly began to fill.  There's a small karaoke room in the back, which was well in use.  Had the Murasaki martini, which was very light/almost watery with a hint of grapefruit.  Others ordered sake bottles from the lengthy menu.  Service is really attentive as others have noted, as they definitely kept our shot glasses full.  Nice place to catch up with friends, actually have a conversation, while enjoying a drink.

30.description: Did I die and go to heaven? We accidentally stopped by this place, not knowing such a gem existed. I was the only one in the group who ever tried (and loves) saki, so I convinced my hesitant friends to come with and thank me later. I'm so glad this place ended up being as awesome as it was, otherwise I would turn off a whole bunch of people from delicious saki. We tried four different saki's all of which were sweet. One was jasmine, the other peach, blueberry, and something else. I think we liked Hoshi usagi blueberry the best. The good part about the night was since everyone besides myself had no idea what to order the nice Latvian waitress was really good at explaining and suggesting which bottles to try. The seating was comfortable, and the dj was pretty good. Overall I really liked the atmosphere of the place. I'm surprised it wasn't more packed. I would have given it five stars if they didn't mark up the price of the bottles so much. Our tab was ridiculously expensive, and I know how much those tiny bottles cost at the local Asian supermarket. I guess they have to make their money somehow, but goddamn. But if you feel like a baller stop by, because everything besides the beating to your wallet will be awesome.

46.description: Unabashedly Japanese and wonderful. Not a sushi bar.

1.description: Classy little bar. Staff was friendly and the drinks were bomb. I recommend the ocean sake flight. There is one kareoke room in the back, but I think you need to make reservations beforehand. They were also play Nujabes throughout the bar so BIG BIG plus! You don't hear that kind of music around these days.

55.description: Top notch service and the staff is exemplary.  Not only will you walk out of here feeling like you just made good friends with the staff, you will also receive an education in sake drinks.  Great selection of sakes here and they have surprisingly good dj's on friday and saturday nights.  I also hear there's a new gay night they are trying out on sundays with a dj as well if thats your kinda party...This place is truly for mature cats with culture.  If you wanna slam shots of patron and attempt to whisper sweet nothings into a drunken DePaul chick's ear, this is not the place for such douchebaggery.  (no offense to all of you beautiful and talented young DePaul ladies)  If you're into a great staff with oodles of personality and a laid back lounge vibe with the possibility of drunken karaoke to finish off the night, check this place out.Tell the manager, Kerry that "the Dukes" sent you over for some culture and sake.

9.description: This is an incredible spot for few reasons:1) hospitality2) level of service3) quality If you are looking for a spot that is actually ran by Japanese people that is legit, this is the spot. As a fellow Japanese, I highly recommend!

26.description: It's got that coveted lounge feel (mmm, because it is a lounge). But it's done the right way with good modern looks and comfy intimate ambiance. It's got great music at just the right volume so you can socialize without yelling. It's got a huge selection of sake. It's got other drinks. It's got good sushi. And it's got ramen. What else can you ask for? :)

25.description: I work a block away from this place and one thing I have to say is I love this place! The bartenders or hosts are very attentive and they would always come up to me and my co-workers if we wanted more drinks and they are very kind. For a college student, I would say it may be a little bit pricey but it's definitely worth coming because it's a really nice environment. They have live music at times and usually I don't like live music but the one's here are really chilled out so I actually liked it! The couches are very comfortable to sit on and chill so I'm definitely considering this place one of my favorite hang out places after work! :)

12.description: An exellent example of a lounge when they weren't the crowded spectales they are now.  The atmosphere is mellow, usually with indie scene R&B or hip hop in the background.  Its also one of the only places in Chicago that feels like a true expat bar - Japanese is sometimes more common than English.  Finally, their drink selection is quite extensive when it comes to all things japanese from whiskey to sake.  I would recommend it for anyone who is a fan of good drinks and good company in a quiet atmosphere.

59.description: This was a very classy place I've found in Chicago.Great drinks, friendly service and good atmosphere.Owner was a very nice lady who took the time to chat with me and my wife for a bit as we were visiting the city.5 stars if not more.

21.description: Murasaki is the rare hidden gem that I actually *do* wish more people would find out about; we were there for an hour in the evening and were literally the only customers in the place. The sake and shochu selection here is unparalleled in Chicago (not that that's saying a lot, to be honest, since shochu seems hard to come by period). They also offer flights and have a cool menu that explains the different kinds for newbies and gives nice tasting notes. Haven't tried the bar snacks yet, which do look good, but our server kindly brought us some Edamame on the house and it was decent. The ambiance and service seems pretty authentic. Some of the servers don't speak great English, but they are attentive and sweet. There are Japanese movies playing on the screens, cozy couches, and a trendy low-seated bar. Just wish there were, you know, customers here!

17.description: Very cool sake bar. They have all the sake you can think of + more! Super chill place. We stopped in and sat at the bar while we were waiting for another restaurant. Had a few drinks here. Told the bartender to surprise me with something girly and tasty and he did just that. I also snacked on some pork Shumai and it was delicious!

10.description: Murasaki lounge, in my opinion, is a very chilled place. Went there on a Tuesday night.. was quiet. Can tell a lot of the clients were Japanese.They have television but they only played Japanese cartoon.I feel that I'm tall for an Asian and the seats were a little too short and uncomfortable for my height.But overall a good experience as there aren't many Sake lounges in Chicago.Will go back.

5.description: This place has the best selection of sake, Japanese whiskey, and Japanese vodka. Owner and staffs were amazingly friendly. Been coming to this spot for awhile, will keep going back for sure :)

3.description: This place is amazing on many levels. Let me disclose that I only had water and miso soup. I just finished some CorePower Yoga and was headed out for a run. So my tummy needed salt but wasn't ready for a meal. I peeked in and was warmly welcomed. I sat down and looked over the menu. I am still tempted by all the delicious things on the menu, but really need to stick to the run plan (I have a half marathon coming up in a few weeks). So miso soup is on order. The bartender didn't bat an eye. She poured me a water and promptly served me some of the best miso soup I've ever had. My tab was under $5, but they treated me like I'd made it rain. Amazing. I'll be back after my run. Literally. See you in a few hours, folks. You're amazing.

35.description: I liked it. It was cool. We came in from the freezing cold for a friends birthday and were feverishly seeking sake. Hey, that makes for a great T-shirt slogan. We were seated immediately and the ordering started before the last coat was off. The girl worked for the her money that night. We ordered just about everything of the food menu throughout the night and a boat load of sake. They have a great selection and it is well presented at your table. The Dj. was playing some nice beat but the music could have been louder. I will def. make it back to this place.

19.description: We came here for a bachelorette party this weekend. One of the bridesmaids had done something similar before, and it seemed like a perfect idea for our group. The first thing we noticed was that the whole place was really warm-over 80 degrees for sure. No AC or fans were on, until we made a comment to the waitress, and she eventually turned it on. The biggest down side is the drinks/pricing. We had a group of 9 and reserved the room for 2 hours. Because there is a 1 drink minimum per person per hour, we had discussed buying a bottle of liquor, and splitting it, vs each buying our own drinks. First the girl told us it would be sufficient for 4 people's drink for 1 hour (i.e. to go this route, we would have to buy at least 4 bottles in 2 hours....these bottles are $260 each). Then after we pressed her on it, she said it would be ok for 8 people for 1 hour. Still too much as that would be over $32 per person for "1 drink". so we each went with individual drinks, that averaged about $11 each. Pretty average for Chicago. We had some in our group who got a glass of saki, and some who got a bottle (Maybe had 3 glasses or so worth of saki in the bottle?). The waitress/woman came back at the beginning of the second hour and asked what people wanted for their second drink. We asked on this, and she said it didn't matter if they bought one glass or a bottle; that still only counted as 1 drink. These girls had made it about a half way through their bottle and still had to buy something else. She eventually let us know that soda could count as the 2nd drink, so the girls with the bottles of saki got a glass of soda.....for $5 each. The music selection was pretty good, and we had a good time overall, but the heat and the drink pricing just made the experience more stressful and complicated than it should have needed to be.

28.description: Shochu in Chicago is a tough find. A handful of Japanese restaurants carry a handful of varieties, but it's not something that many places carry. A notable exception is the eclectic Murasaki Lounge, which had a dozen shochus and a knowledgeable proprietress. The space is unusual in that it's got a karaoke room, a DJ booth, and low lounge-like seating where you can order from a full menu. But sit at the front bar in the low traditional Japanese chairs and enjoy a pleasant conversation with the Japanese bartenders. You're as likely to find yourself sitting next to an American who studied abroad in Tokyo as next to a Japanese executive seeking out a bit of home in the Windy City. Kampai!

45.description: Great atmosphere for drinks and conversation. Its not too loud and easy laid back atmosphere. Hostess was nice and attentive.Food was ok, though one does not really come here for the food.Overall, fun and enjoyable experience

33.description: This review is about private room karaoke, service and management only.First, the website says that private room karaoke is $100 per hour. My group was there less than one hour but the manager insisted that the $150 total on my bill for the room was correct. Bait and switch number 1.Second, the 12 of us each ordered a drink. Pinot noir came out as pinot grigio. Random martinis appeared from nowhere. Everyone was easy going about it and told the waitstaff not to worry about it, even though we got extra drinks (that we didn't drink) and didn't get some of the drinks we ordered. When the bill came, guess what? Everything they brought us was on the bill. No matter that some of the drinks were more expensive than the one we actually ordered and that there were extra drinks given to us. To add injury to insult, the waitresses came up with the "check" and told me that they wrote down our order exactly as we ordered it and everything was correct. But 30 minutes earlier she had been apologizing for all her mistakes. Bait and switch number 2.All told, this place over-charged me at least $150 bucks and honestly should have comped the whole thing, for the above reasons and also because:1) they responded to my reservation request a mere two hours before the reservation time 2) the bathroom overflowed black water into our private room and we had to walk through it to leave and3) there were virtually no instructions on how to operate the machine - which switches automatically to Japanese

43.description: I went here on a date late one night and I loved it. The food was alright, but I was moreso in love with the sake and the environment. There was a live DJ spinning, the environment was very mellow and chill. I'm not a huge sake person but my bf is all about it. The waiter was very helpful and helped me to pick out a very good plum sake (for the beginners like myself). We're planning to come back soon enough. Check it out.

2.description: Went out looking for sushi and found this place.   While I did get some good food this "is a whiskey lounge not a restaurant" according to the waitress.  She's right.  If you're looking for drinks this a good bar.  Amazing selection of expensive whiskey, sake, etc.  The food was average though so go for drinks and an appetizer but not for dinner.

18.description: Every first Friday Come out to see @bvax spin the lounge, soul, Hip Hop, Soulful House and downtempo at #soulandsake Very cool place to get away from the usual "club" scene. It has a sake bar as well as Karaoke in the back. in the front by the bar the DJ spins a mixture of everything from Soul to Dance. The food and saki are great and the place has plenty of seating.  It's never a cover charge and  It's worth checking out!

41.description: I don't usually go out downtown too much, I tend to stick to Bucktown, Wicker Park, Logan Square, and Lakeview for the most part. However, when I was out with my family and my sister mentioned that she wanted to karaoke, I checked Yelp on my phone and this place came up due to proximity.We took a chance and came in on a Friday night. It wasn't very packed, but the bar itself looked nice. There was a massive, neon-colored dj booth that played some techno music, and it felt very authentic to a Japanese karaoke bar.But....We were bummed to find out that it was private rooms only. For me, the whole point of karaoke is to watch strangers embarrass themselves, and perhaps help you drive up the courage to embarrass yourself.Regardless, we had a round of drinks there and my pear sake martini was good, but I was pretty amazed to find that when my sister ordered a Makers and Diet Coke, the waitress literally brought them separately. She also forgot my boyfriends single shot of Jameson on the rocks. Having worked as a waitress before, I thought this was pretty ridiculous.In the end, the bar was cool, but for karaoke I don't think I'd come back unless it was a big group that really required a private room. Just not my style!

52.description: Wow!!! What can I say about this place?!?!  My favorite hang out in the city with everything I need sake, otsumami, and karaoke.  The master (Kerry san) has a truly amazing knowledge of sake and actually just everything in general.  Personal favorite sake HOYO, while at it always try the 'imo shochu' and Japanese whiskey that is exclusively sold at Murasaki!!!AND the otsumami (drinking food) menu takes me right back to the streets of Tokyo.  Must haves for me are tako wasabi and tori karage.  Few others to mentions are buta wiener, tako yaki, and the hand rolls, and of course the Murasaki original yakitori (must have).  Lastly, the menu that takes me back to my childhood Ochazuke (rice soaked in tea broth) topped seaweed and salmon.  Do me a favor don't order too often so there will always be some left for me in case I do stop by.The karaoke room is always fun however do make reservations, and on weekend there is live DJ in the lounge area playing great music, nevertheless good music throughout the week.  Finally, if you are a fan of anime or Japanese films the TV screen will not be playing sports but works from Miyazaki, Kurosawa, and etc. Try to sit in the lounge area and save some room at the bar for me ;)

50.description: I don't know who comes here for karaoke and I haven't been there when a live DJ is spinning, but I come here to relax, have a cool glass of Asahi or sake, and relax and this always hits the spot when I'm smack dab in the middle of Michigan Ave.It is a little pricey (hence the missing 5 stars), but I haven't had horrible sake yet.  They rotate their sake selection out every couple months so it's always a nice change to try something new.  There's a great wide variety as well of sake that you can't have elsewhere, and thankfully they don't have the crappy "sake bomb" quality garbage that most places like to serve.Beer I think is a bit steep but then again, Japanese beers is always ridiculously expensive anywhere I go in Chicago, even the grocery store.Cocktails are also a little costly but they're unique and anyone I've been with has yet to have anything less than mediocre.  They don't use cheap mixers either and have usually been consistent and great in presentation.Their otherwise liquor selection is usually upper-to-top shelf stuff so no skimping there.  Their whiskey selection is pretty good, I've learned to really enjoy their Hibiki and Yamazaki scotch as well, definitely something you can't find in most American spots.Atmosphere is laid back, relaxed, and chilled for the most part.  Their bartenders are always great and interactive as well as very attentive to make sure your drink is filled.  Although I find it great they always seem to have some kind of Japanese anime playing while playing lounge music, it makes up for an overall great place to sit back and enjoy a drink.  Did I mention it's very clean too?Could use more (or better priced) food though.  I'm usually sticking with edamame if I need something to munch on, but at least you're getting actual Japanese food, not the crap you find at any Japanese or sushi joint in 95% of Chicago.Addendum: I forgot to mention that the staff there is INCREDIBLE.  Kerry is a great host and makes you feel at home, mama-san is tons of fun to talk and joke around with, Jun, Nan, and the rest of the crew are always very helpful and friendly!

4.description: If you love places with rude and horrible service, this is the place to be!My friends and I wanted to find a nice karaoke lounge after dinner and stumped upon this place. It had 4 stars so it should be good! We asked for a karaoke room and the fee for the room was $35 for 1 hour. Because there were 5 of us, the minimum of 5 cocktails had to be purchased to meet their minimum requirements for the karaoke room. We didn't want individual cocktails so we decided on purchasing sake bottles. Each bottle were considered as two cocktails. The problem begun when we wanted to purchase the sake's. 4-5 sake's we asked for were out.. So we asked her to give us less than 5 minutes so we can figure out what to purchase instead of holding up her time. This rude little Asian lady told us well if I leave this room I will be starting your time! (With her angry face) are you serious lady?!!! Maybe if you gave us a heads up of which sake's were out, it wouldn't have taken so long! We ended up purchasing two of the same bottle of sake and a cocktail. Aggravated by our server, we had a hard time understanding how to read the karaoke machine. Everything on the machine as well as the remote were in KOREAN. When the rude server came back with our cocktails, we asked her how to use it. Our server said she doesn't know to use the machine. We asked if anyone else here knows to use it. She said no. WAIT, WHAT?! We finally figured it out and enjoyed our 45 minutes of singing. Our rude server barged in and screams TIMES UP!!!! Waving her hand like she's demanding us to leave like we were the problem!!Overall, this place was horrible! Service was ridiculously rude and I totally understand why the place was dead! If it was possible, this place would have ZERO stars! If I ever come back to Chicago or have anyone in my knowledge visiting Chicago, I would definitely tell them never to come to this place! Never!

6.description: This place is a hole in the wall if you're not familiar with the location. I absolutely loved it! Cozy atmosphere to lounge with your friends. Great selection of sake. Friendly staff as well so I'll definitely return! Thanks for the great service.

22.description: I booked a large group for my birthday, and it was great! The waitress was super attentive, and the sake selection is amazing. They even have takoyaki! It's a hidden gem downtown. I didn't realize they also offer karaoke so I missed out on that, but I will definitely be back.

15.description: Murasaki is the best place to grab a drink with a small group of people in Chicago, particularly if you enjoy good saki.The vibe this place gives off is such that the best comparison is really the feeling of getting off a plane in another country. Remember the bar in "Lost in Translation"? It's something like that.The environment overall is Murasaki's greatest strength. The bartenders, particularly Jun, are genuinely respectful, something you rarely find ANYWHERE nowadays. They'll engage you if you want, but will happily let you be for hours with only the subtlest move to refill your drink or water.In terms of the drinks and food, the saki menu and recommendations are fantastic. The decanter size is perfect for 2, and the food is overall very tasty in a Japanese crossed with tapas style. I recommend the cho-shu barbecue, Ramen, and the soba noodles.This place is best for small groups and it's a SUPER gem in downtown, definitely worth whipping out on a date to impress. I recommend it for coworkers, dates, or just a drink to tie up the week by yourself.To sum it up, Murasaki is a bar for people that don't typically like bars. It's quiet, peaceful, and cozy. Can't figure out whether I want more people to come here or not as it might despoil my fun!

57.description: if  you want an authentic japanese experiencie, check this place out. Karaoke is awesome, but respect the tradition. Don't be trashy in this classy place. If you love sake, talk to the bar, they'll direct you. From Nine.

20.description: Murasaki is one of a kind... Beautiful food and great crew... Can't go wrong with an awesome dj!

36.description: The only reason I can give this more than one star is because of the quality selection of sake - which, allow me to preface, I know nothing about.  However, the sake was delicious - as was the Yamazaki (whiskey).  But, on to the bad... Came in on a Saturday night, around 10:30,  to check out some dj's and have a couple drinks.  The place was empty, save for dj's and a table of people doing karaoke 'downstairs'.  Ordered a couple drinks at the bar, then when some seating opened up sat down to listen to the music.  We had 3 different servers during our (no more than 2 hour) stay.  They all seemed to be incredibly confused, completely botched orders, apparently had no idea what flavors of mochi were available, and it took repeated badgering of them to finally bring out checks.  They included gratuity on the bill, even though there were only 4 of us that were sitting together, and didn't bring my friend's order of tea until AFTER we had already paid and were getting up to leave.  So, sorry Murisake, but I don't think I'll be heading back any time soon.

14.description: Nice spot to chill on the weekend. Very laid back atmosphere with a good vibe. Saketini was slow to hit and a pleasant taste.

1.description: I LOVE this place! There isn't anything that these amazing women don't do well! This is my favorite kind of place - comfortable, with NO pretension!I am always greeted so warmly, from making appointments until I walk out the door, post-treatment. Rosalyn is just a dream! If you're nervous about injectables, see Rosalyn. She is VERY patient and will answer all of your questions thoroughly.  She price checks everything (without prompting) before proceeding with any services. She will tell you everything she is doing as she is doing it. She has given me Botox, Juvederm, & Voluma and NO ONE ever believes me when I tell them - she makes it look SO natural. No wrinkles, but my face still moves! :-)Linda is a just a sweetheart - she makes sure to speak to everyone, whether you are seeing her or not! Jill is FANTASTIC! I highly recommend her dermaplaning & chemical peels! They offer GREAT packages if you prefer these treatments regularly. All in all, everyone who works at Goldcoast is just lovely (and they are GREAT advertisements for their treatments - they are all so beautiful). I highly recommend them, especially for nervous first-timers!

9.description: I got Botox done in January and again in May. Julie is so wonderful, and listened to all of my questions and concerns. She did not overdue it and the lines on my forehead have gone away completely. So happy with my results and Julie's professionalism. I would recommend Julie for Botox for anyone who is interested or a little freaked out like I was.

12.description: Had a series of laser treatments and peels on my décolletage and was quite pleased. The prices were reasonable and it was refreshing how laid back the techs are about retailing products. They tell you what's available -- and that's it. No pressure, which I really appreciated. Julie, the RN I saw for the consult and first treatment, was very honest about what to expect, which I also appreciated. My only complaint is that I was never given anything in writing about what to expect at each appointment and I admit I lost my way. Is today a peel and laser or just a laser day? While I believed them to be competitive, it was still quite an investment in money and knowing *exactly* what I was paying for when would have helped.

21.description: Two visits and two botox treatments didn't do much to erase the really deep scowl lines between my brows. The folks at Gold Coast are very nice and seem to have their act together, so I think I'd rate them higher....my 3 stars is due to overall results. I probably should have addressed those lines a few years ago before they became so pronounced!  Phooey. Aging sux. But it beats the alternative!

16.description: I went there for a laser hair removal. I am very happy with the service.  The lady taking care of me is Julie Hoff. She's very friendly and you can feel her sincerity to her customers.    The laser hair removal treatment is wonderful.  I bought a package of 6 treatments for underarm and upperlip. After 1 treatment I barely see any hair in my underarm anymore (and it used to be super hairy). The price is reasonable too. I highly recommend this place and I am very pleased with their service.

17.description: Two visits and two botox treatments didn't do much to erase the really deep scowl lines between my brows. The folks at Gold Coast are very nice and seem to have their act together, so I think I'd rate them higher....my 3 stars is due to overall results. I probably should have addressed those lines a few years ago before they became so pronounced!  Phooey. Aging sux. But it beats the alternative!

10.description: So... in my previous review, I was not in a good place regarding Goldcoast MedSpa.  Just yesterday, I went in for another treatment, and , Linda, the other technician admistered it --- Awesome Awesome Awesome, Linda is awesome!  I didn't even know that the customer service was supposed to be that great.  The numbing cream used to always drip on my clothes while I waited for it to take affect, and it was just plain annoying to have that stuff greasing my blouses- but wouldn't you know it, they have a tubetop type thing you can change into to avoid this kind of mess! (Thanks for the heads-up, Linda)She was so sweet, attentive, and a great listener!  I only had to tell her to take a break ONCE cause all the other times, she noticed me gripping the stress ball super tight, and she *knew* to take a break.Here's the deal, if you are a beast, and you can handle pain no problem, go to Julie, but if you need some understanding go to Linda.  She is fantastic!

5.description: Timely, professional, and friendly. Everything you could ask for. A real treat. Will definitely make this my "go to" place.

11.description: After the closing of my beloved Center for Modern Vein and Skin I was delighted to hear that Dr Erika Ugianskis was now the Medical Director at GoldCoast Med Spa. Look, I'm not getting any younger and unfortunately when I was younger I spent days,weeks hell YEARS basking in the sun slathered in baby oil. Now, I'm paying the price. Consider this a PSA if you are in your 20's NEVER I repeat NEVER walk out of your house without SPF on your face. If you turn your nose up at this advice please save money for treatments in your 30's. Trust me! Back to Goldcoast. Med Spa, on my first visit there I met Julie Hoff she is the Clinical Director. She is so sweet, very professionaland never puts pressure on me to do any more then I want to do and I never feel like I'm being hard sold on anything. I've been there 3 times now I have gotten Chemical peels and Botox and I have nothing but love for her and the rest of the staff. I have a crazy schedule, sometimes I'm calling 24 hours before I want an appointment and she has accommodated me. Her Botox prices are competitive ($12 range per unit) and so are her other treatment prices. I'm adding the price to my Yelp review because years ago I thought Botox was probably too expensive for my budget and I was buying $60 eye creams and cosmetic lotions and potions to combat the aging process. I can tell you all that stuff is a waste of money. Botox is the fountain of youth. I don't own eye cream now and there are pharmaceutical grade lotions and potions that are better than anything you can buy at your big department store beauty counter for roughly the same price.All sold at GoldCoast Medspa. Explore your options ladies and gents. GoldCoast Med Spa is a place you can trust and have amazing results. A couple of little tips and tricks- Email- register your email on their website and every month you will get the specials emailed to you. Parking- street parking for about $5 an hour. Appointments- They are busy, sometimes you have to leave a message and they will call you back. If you know your schedule or desired times leave that info on the message.

22.description: I went there for a laser hair removal. I am very happy with the service.  The lady taking care of me is Julie Hoff. She's very friendly and you can feel her sincerity to her customers.    The laser hair removal treatment is wonderful.  I bought a package of 6 treatments for underarm and upperlip. After 1 treatment I barely see any hair in my underarm anymore (and it used to be super hairy). The price is reasonable too. I highly recommend this place and I am very pleased with their service.

0.description: I've been going to GoldCoast MedSpa for 6 months now and could not be happier time and time again. My first visit was simply a consultation where I asked Rosalyn about a million questions about procedures, risks, side effects and more so I could make a well-informed decision about what would help ease the aging process. She was extremely patient and informative, and built the trust needed to let someone near your face with chemicals. After the first time, I've been back to also see Jill and Linda - both of these women are able to offer guidance and information to make the aging process as easy as possible. Jill took the time to review my entire skin care regimen and products and advised some tweaks that have been helpful. And Linda is always a delight to see! She always knows who I am and doesn't treat me like just another patient, which I assume is the case for anyone who comes to see her. She has listened to my concerns and is always offering advice and different ideas in a helpful way - not a pushy way. While I can't remember the receptionists name right now, she is always very nice and helpful, accommodating last-minute appointments and sharing information with ease.I can continue to count on these women to be advisers in keeping me beautiful and healthy through aging process!

20.description: This is a fabulous place.  Unlike all the other 'med spas' in Chicago, it is non-commercial, non-pressure and excellent.  The owner, who does the services, is an RN and highly trained and experienced.  Not one of those 'medical aestheticians' that other med spas use.  She works with Michael Byun, a plastic surgeon, who she shares the office with.She is honest and I trust her totally.  Her fillers are fabulous.  She has lasers which she has used for years and is honest about results.

19.description: This is a fabulous place.  Unlike all the other 'med spas' in Chicago, it is non-commercial, non-pressure and excellent.  The owner, who does the services, is an RN and highly trained and experienced.  Not one of those 'medical aestheticians' that other med spas use.  She works with Michael Byun, a plastic surgeon, who she shares the office with.She is honest and I trust her totally.  Her fillers are fabulous.  She has lasers which she has used for years and is honest about results.

2.description: I've been going to Goldcoast MedSpa for a year. There's a lot of "good" there, but I can say I've just found other places that I prefer and would not recommend this anymore. My two cents:1. They are great at Laser hair removal, not at injectables. I would not recommend for anything needle related.2. Linda is awesome and the only reason I went back a second time. She's great with a laser and totally personable3. There are other individuals that work there that I always left feeling manipulated or somehow paying hundreds of dollars more while getting something less done. My suggestion would be to make sure you have FULL understanding of what your buying so you don't leave feeling like I did.Linda is awesome, but overall I need to go somewhere where I feel I can get more than LHR done and not getting manipulated into paying more.

18.description: Julie from Gold Coast MedSpa is the best. She's an actual Registered Nurse so she truly knows what she is doing unlike many other "med-spas" out there. Their prices are competitive and they always honor your coupons posted online, every little bit helps!  She's also very kind and trustworthy so I never feel like I'm getting ripped off. I've been going to Julie for years and I have no intentions of looking elsewhere :)

13.description: Very, very happy with GoldCoast MedSpa!  Took advantage of their participation in the Pretty City promotion and scheduled a microderm session.  Wasn't sure if the atmosphere would be stuffy or "less than" as we were using a discount.  Could not have been more pleasantly surprised!Linda was amazing.  Very nice!  My daughter had a chemical peel and her results were also great.  Will definitely go back!  Thanks, Linda!

4.description: They are all such wonderful people and their services are fantastic. Definitely worth the drive into the city.

6.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE GoldCoast Medspa! LINDA IS THE BEST!! She is so nice, listens to your needs/wants and is NOT pushy at all. Yet she suggests products or treatments if you say want more info. She really wants to help you attain whatever you wish to accomplish. Professional and genuinely super sweet. Have had botox, microderm and happy with both. From my experience, their prices are very reasonable vs. competitors. The office staff is nice and helpful as well. And their new office space is gorg. Overall have had a wonderful experience and will def be back for more. :)

15.description: I'm sorry to say that I had a truly unsatisfying experience here with sclerotherapy. I'd had sclero done before, for some superficial veins, somewhere else, and it was very successful. But this one was an absolute mess-- it hurt, it burned and my results were really, really bad. As in, worse than when I first came in. I went back in and spoke with Dr. Erika about it and she seemed surprised, then kind of annoyed. I found out that the gold standard drug was not even used on me. So, I blew $450 and 3+ weeks of my life on a highly ineffective procedure and could not wear shorts all summer. She offered to do it again but did not offer me a discount or a valid explanation as to what might have happened. She's probably a good doctor but she's only in town once a month, so I'm going elsewhere to get this fixed and monitored. All of the staff is very nice, but after this experience, I really don't trust this place.

7.description: Everyone there is amazing! The first two times I lasered I didn't need to numb up. The third time it hurt so bad I could only get through one underarm! They were really nice and let me reschedule to come back and numb up then get the other underarm and Brazilian done. Plus they have an extremely potent laser. It is pricey but they have a payment plan and it's worth it! It's an actual medical spa and not some joint with an old laser selling group ons. I love this place and highly recommend it!

8.description: I completed my laser treatments that were included in the package and still continue to go in for touch-ups. However, I'd rather go in for touch-ups than be faced with more waxing/shaving. I'm highly considering starting on my legs since that is pretty much the only area I have left. Ask for Linda! She is so nice and tries so hard to keep me preoccupied with conversation, but I am not able to forget about the pain. One thing is for sure...she is quick and efficient and I am thankful for that!

3.description: Everyone i've met here is wonderful.  I've been for botox, microdermabrasian and IPL facials and was incredibly happy with all of my results, and the experience at the spa.  They are always great about alerting me to special deals that are going on, and pointing out opportunities for me to save money on things I was going to pay full price for anyway.  They are different than other places i've been, where i don't feel like they are constantly trying to sell me stuff, but rather, truly consulting with me on what, within my limited budget, will get me the results I want.  I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to start exploring medspa treatments.

14.description: I have just started to go to Goldcoast Medspa over the last year when Dr Ugianskis left her practice and  partnered up with Julie Hoff, RN.  You always worry about going to a new place or trying someone for the 1st time, especially when you are dealing with things to add to your beauty....no worries here!  Julie is a complete professional, you do not feel as if you are being "sold" on unnecessary services and both Julie and Dr Ugianskis are consultative and fun.  The atmosphere is so not stuffy, it is relaxed and you feel as if you can ask questions, be honest with what you want and they listen!Last year around Christmas time I was trying to make an appt-Julie actually called me, after hours, from her cell, and worked to squeeze me in before vacation! That is amazing! Plus, for those of you familiar with the high price of city parking, I can always find metered parking on the street-within a block.I would highly recommend giving Julie and Dr Ugianskis a call-you will love the results from either of these ladies!

3.description: Over several years I have met with Amanda for treatment/massage. Consistently she over delivers and manages to help me manage the pain I experience from biking and exercise.  Amanda does a great job of listening to her client, treating the area in the most appropriate way with the perfect amount of pressure then following up with expert advice, and goals to help manage while away from treatment. Sadly, having moved from Chicago I have not been able to work with Amanda however I know I can rely on her for care/treatment should I be back, and I know the experience will be as good, if not better than the last time. Great work Amanda!

1.description: Best tan a German Irish Polish boy like me ever had. By the next day I had women swooning all over my perfectly tan, rippling pectoral muscles. Amanda shaded just the right spots to give me that extra "optical inch". All for a great price too! And if you need a massage...she somehow turns her hands into fire.

2.description: Amanda gave me a massage at my house in New York.  Still to this day it's the best massage I've ever had.  She brings such a lightness to the room, I felt relaxed from the very beginning.  She was very in tune with my body, self, and what I needed.  I felt truly taken care of- Amanda was very aware and concerned about my needs throughout.  Through pressure, pace, and what areas to concentrate on, getting a massage from her was such an amazing experience, every time she comes to town I must have one.After the massage I was completely rejuvenated in both body and spirit.  It's something that I recommend everyone to experience.

5.description: All I can say is Amanda will exceed all of your needs! As far as massage this is not just a job for her she TRUELY cares about her clients and helps them through any issues they may be having. I have had a few massages and she has always figured out why I am having pain in the 1st place and sets out to fix it, she is a true healer.And as spray tan goes...WOW! I mean I'm pretty fair and don't tan well but crap, I look amazing after seeing Amanda. She does a flawless job and I swear I look thiner afterwards! No streaks or patches, just perfectly even color. Thank you Amanda for always making me feel AND look better!

6.description: amanda is a goddess, master of her craft.. I always feel safe and well guided when in her company.. And in all honestly, the best massage I've had..
