7.description: I had a 2 hour massage with Amanda this morning and I can hardly believe it flew by that quickly.  Amanda's technique and sense of touch reminds me of watching the Ballet.  The massage feels entirely as though her movements are choreographed to your body, your breathe and the music.  The heat that her hands produce is almost unnatural, she is moving some serious energy around in the muscles and tissue.   She brought total relief to the knots i build up around the base of my neck.  I felt safe enough in her presence to drift in and out of consciousness and that's saying something.  I have an incredibly hard time quieting my mind enough to drift into day dreams and sleep.  My body feels incredible right now and all i want to do is stay in my robe, eventually take a hot bath and curl up in front of the fire place and do nothing at all.   Thank You Amanda,  your talented and gifted with the body beyond description.  Thank You for fixing me.

8.description: Amanda is an amazing talent. A massage from her transports you to another place, a place where you rejuvenate and revitalize. It is the ultimate in self-love, letting her work out your stresses. There is nothing you need to do except walk to the table. THAT is a mini-vacation. Professional and intuitive, you can't go wrong with Amanda.

0.description: I highly recommend Amanda especially for injuries, muscle aches and pains.  I hurt my neck somehow and was getting pretty concerned about it.  With the first massage, 80 percent of the pain was gone.  By the second one, there were no problems at all and that was two months ago.You will be impressed with her work and professionalism.Robert Kravitz

4.description: Add another voice to the many fans of Amanda! I've never had a better experience with a massage therapist. She listens to how you say you're feeling and listens to what your body tells her, too. She's incredibly intuitive and you will feel GREAT afterwards. I really enjoy having her come to my home, because when she's done, I can get straight in the bath, or take a nap and not lose my bliss taking the CTA home from a salon.

58.description: This place rocked my whole office this week.  We have been working long hours, so for lunch I placed a large order (burgers, fries, and shakes for over 20 people) at 10:45am, everything was hot and ready for us at 11:40, (except the shakes, nice and cold!)  they even provided us 2 full bottles of ketchup and mustard!  Not only that, but I brought 3 people from my office with me to pick this food up, and we didn't have enough hands to get it all, so the manager had one of his employees walk with us back to our office (2 blocks) so we wouldn't have to make two trips. The employees were all very helpful on the phone and in person, and I can't praise the food quality enough!  (Plus Manager Kevin McCoskey was super helpful!)Bravo Epic Burger, Bravo!

56.description: This is an aptly-named place..in the same way that, after being kicked in the nuts for five minutes, getting kicked in the ribs feels comparatively EPIC!Bland burgers. Routine fries. Toss in a healthy dose of attitude at the register.Saddle up and walk 3 blocks to Portillo's. It'll be worth every lard-lusting step.

29.description: We there today while in town for a concert. Awesome service and Great food. Nice outdoor seating area. Must try when in downtown Chicago. Fast and great prices as well.

42.description: Decent burger.  Fresh whole wheat bun, thick cut grilled onions, really good dill pickles and great cheddar cheese.  No BBQ sauce or sweet potato fries which was sad for me.  And a "skinny shake"...really??

23.description: People were very friendly. Felt like it was a good value for the money. I like they're trying to make it as organic as possible. If I'm comparing I'd say it's like an organic Smashburger.

47.description: Very average burger with a hefty price tag. I wouldn't go back--

8.description: This is my second trip to an Epic Burger, first at this location. My first visit was in the South Loop and it didn't go well, everything was tasty but super greasy and the staff didn't give a $&@". This trip was better but I'm still not overly impressed. I'll break it down as I experienced it. Appearance: Nice decor, a little dark but nice, well laid out and clean. Staff: Very friendly and helpful, A+Seating: Plenty of options, booths, tables and a window bar. Food: Greasy, kinda bland but fresh, good fries. I had the Epic Burger with cheese, fries and a soda. I thought it was alright but it didn't really taste like anything. It was strange all those great sounding fresh ingredients tasted like nothing and again like last time, lots of grease. When you pick up your burger and juice and grease run out it's not appetizing. I will say the fries were good, hot, fresh and surprisingly not greasy. Overall: If I went back I'd try their chicken or veggie options before I had another burger. I still like Five Guys better.

31.description: Imposter!I've been to enough Epic Burgers to know what to expect.  I totally had a taste for my usual burger deliciousness, so I dragged the man to the nearest Epic Burger I could find.  Huge mistake.  Unfortunately for us, both our burgers were half the size they usually are.  Really, can I have some meat with my bun?  What a waste of $20.  And that was for two burgers, a fry, and a drink.  Fml.

34.description: Epic Burger is similar to Five Guys. I give Epic a slight edge. Great casual dining concept and like the way they cater to the non burger customer. I had the burger and fries and thought they were excellent.Cool looking space and good service. $11.49 for the combo regular burger.

16.description: Friendly staff who explained how it worked at epic. The burger was good, great bun but honestly it was too well done for me. The staff told me they only do well done, why I don't know.It would have been so much better not so well cooked and charred.I didnt have the fries but they looked good.

13.description: Been here for over 20 mins still no food. Just told us they lost our order. So many people have come after us ordered ate and have left. This was terrible service. We asked server al times about it and they told us it was coming.  Not until we showed our recept did they tell is it was lost...Follow up: Epic burger made up for this sour experience. Continue offering antibiotic free meats and I'll continue to patronize Epic. Let management know about poor service. They'll make it right.

11.description: Ordered a chicken sandwich w/avocado, the husband got an epic burger. I seriously hardly tasted the chicken, the lettuce is a different story and where's that epic sauce? Oh there it is! Slightly smothered on the bottom bun. Overpriced and tasteless!

39.description: Delicious and greasy, and serves humanely raised  meats that you can feel ok about eating.

37.description: Pretty good except that it was dripping in grease. Think my patty will need a good ole Amurcan pat down next time I'm there.

0.description: Excellent choice if you appreciate quality ingredients. Nothing overly fancy, but everything was overly delicious.

38.description: Three stars for the food, would have 1-2 stars for the service. Almost every time I go here, something goes wrong, and I have only been here like 3 times. One time, we ordered food and it came wrong, they corrected it, but one of our meal-mates food didn't come out for like a half hour! We were done with our food, like 15 minutes ago when his food came! They did apologize but it was a result of poor operations - he got a burger just like we did! Last time I was there I ordered avocado and they forgot the avocado so I went up to tell them, thinking they would just give me some avocado on the side. But instead she followed me back to my table to take my tray that I already put ketchup all over to take back to the kitchen and put avocado on my burger. I didn't think that was professional, and it opens me up to all sorts of sanitation coupons. Not to mention, the whole reason I went back there was because we had a $5 karma card from the last bad experience, and I found it right as we paid and they refused to give us $5 back. So now I have to go back two more times if I want to use my two karma cards, argh.The food itself though is tasty and fine, but overpriced for the small portions...

51.description: Definitely was a good choice for fast food. There are choices for every aspect of a simple burger order (white or wheat, grilled or raw, what kind of cheese), and even choices for a shake (skim, whole, or soy). We also did junior burgers which were plenty filling. Didn't have to wait too long and reasonable price. Friendly service.

27.description: Fresh burgers and fries with great staff! If you're looking for a quick bite that's better than a McDonald's burger come here!

32.description: Fresh and delicious. I always get the turkey burger with caramelized grilled onions, pickles, lettuce and tomatoes. The chicken sandwich is also pretty good. It's a little pricey if you get a burger, fries and drink. But you have to pay for quality food nowadays.

54.description: You know, I'm just sick of the use of the word "epic," as a superlative, because mostly everything that is described as such, rarely is.Enter Epic Burger, another in the family of "upscale" burger joints.  Like everywhere else, they offer a sparse menu, the ability to choose from a multitude of toppings, and fries with a description that's meant to make them seem more than just deep-fried cut potatoes.Sorry, but this doesn't do it for me.  The burgers are too flat, dry, and bland.  For the same $10 for a combo meal, I can get an superb Italian Beef at Portillo's or Al's, or an always good chicken sandwich at Chik-Fil-a.  In fact, I'll just go to Chipotle next door, and not be disappointed by my "epic" expectations.

48.description: Pretty damn good for a fast food joint. I appreciate the ability to order different kinds of burgers (I like the turkey), cheese (havarti), and the option to add an egg or bacon on top. Portion sizes are enormous - turkey burger often hangs off the edge of the bun by quite a bit. I didn't realize there was a Jr option so I might have to go with that in the future. The food is a bit overly oily - things will drip from the burger and the fries are super greasy - but I mean hey it's fast food, what do you expect?

44.description: I had a double cheeseburger with a fried egg. It was an epic fail. Both pucks were blackened and dry. The egg was not over easy as ordered but over cooked!!! My girlfriend ordered a chicken sandwich and that was also over cooked. It was seriously like a piece of wood. The staff was nice enough to give us a refund though.

24.description: So after a rather good night, we had a bit of a rough morning and this place just sounded amazing when we looked up "Burgers" on Yelp. (gotta love yelp).  The woman behind the counter was very nice and walked us through how it worked since we have not been before. The food was DELICIOUS!! It is all organic so the burger was very light but still filling. You know when you have a burger and it feels like a brick in your stomach all day which just makes you uncomfortable, well that didn't happen! How awesome is that?? The place is a little pricy but for all organic you do have to pay extra.

7.description: Great burger restaurant! I especially enjoyed the atmosphere and the friendliness of the waiting staff. The burgers are gorgeous, delicious and extremely gourmand. Besides, they are really fulfilling! I also had a peanut butter shaker to top the dining experience! Suggested to everybody and it's not expensive!

49.description: I was in town visiting for the weekend and we stopped in for lunch. The service here is excellent. Sergio and Dora let us in before they were even open when they saw us hanging around outside. The fries here are hand cut and delicious and the burgers are really good, too. Definitely recommend this place.

40.description: Not sure who is working the fryer here, but they're inept. They actually took longer to cook than my burger. If you don't mind waiting 15 minutes for fast food this is your place.

53.description: I'm not sure why Epic Burger has bad reviews AT ALL!! I ate here yesterday and had the turkey burger and absolutely loved it!! I love that they give you a choice between buns and cheeses and also that you can add toppings on. The customer service was awesome and can't believe how many friendly people work there. I work just down the street and will be definitely be coming here a lot more now.

30.description: I went to this epic burger location earlier this week and received the best costumer service. The girl at the register (Emma?) was really nice and helpful. I am a picky eater and she answered all my questions efficiently and with grace. Definitely will return very soon. The food was amazing, the fries crisped to perfection. I recommend this epic burger for sure. 5 stars!

46.description: I grabbed a quick bite at Epic Burger! It was pretty good, although a bit pricey. The patty is really moist and I love their Epic Sauce. I should have gotten caramelized onions, but it was still a decent meal. We went at a non-peak hour and the service was really nice. I can see that this place would be great for a work lunch and it does pretty well for being a fast food chain.

1.description: Was a late lunch stop, the decor ambience was really something amazing. We were looking for a place that served halal, we were a bit reluctant as we didn't see any halal signs, but found out about the place on muslimeater.comWhen we went inside we inquired and the lady at the till was really helpful and did inform us that the meat is halal and even told us that some of the sauces had wine it as well.  The burger itself was really juicy and succulent, the family and I really enjoyed it.  I have had better, but the decor and ambience make up for the overall experience.

55.description: Burger is extremely greasy, dry, and under seasoned. The whole grain bun is tasty and I like that they give you the option to add a fried egg, but if you're going to spend $10 on a burger, there are better options in the neighborhood.

9.description: Good concept, but recipe needs rework. I've come here twice. The first time, I wasn't blown away and I had really wanted to be. So I came here a second time a few months later, but it still wasn't an epic experience. I would give 4 stars for the beef patties. They are juicy, fragrant and grilled to perfection. However, the rest of the burger is bland. The epic sauce just tastes like a sibling of mayo; there's nothing special about it and I end up adding ketchup to boost the flavor. When I was done eating, I just felt... meh.Maybe 3rd time's the charm, but it'll be some time before I try again...

26.description: I go here a bunch and the food and customer service never disappoints.  I love the grilled cheese with onions and pickles and the fries are delicious.  They also have fruit smoothies and natural sodas in addition to the typical soda machine.  This location is always clean and inviting with really friendly staff.

25.description: Amazing!! Friendly service. Mouthwatering food. I got the burger with bacon, cheddar and avocado. Hubs got the chicken with cheddar, bacon and avocado. Shared some fries and a strawberry shake. I loved every bite of it. The fries are well done (crispy) and the shake was thick and very flavorful. Super convenient location around the corner from the Hyatt where we were staying. Will stop back in next time we are in town!

12.description: Epic burger is one of my favorite downtown burger restaurants, Christian customer service was and is always outstanding any time I see or talk with him. Recently found out that  you guys deliver in our area, I was working at and recognized him from the restaurant I thought he was renting a room where I am a front desk supervisor and he said no ma'am I'm making a food delivery. GREAT STUFF EPIC BURGER.Keep up the great work and the burgers are fye

59.description: Salt. Ever heard of it?The burger patty, the grilled onions, and the fries were all severely lacking some Sodium Chloride. It's one thing for any of those to be too salty, but to not salt anything at all is disrespectful to the taste-buds. I'm not even asking for a lot of salt. I just need something to draw the flavors out so I can tell the difference between a grilled onion and a french fry by more than just the texture.The only thing epic about this place was my disappointment.

21.description: Fresh and juicy burger, thicker cut fries that are well seasoned.  They only have two burgers (classic or turkey) but you can build your own and add cheese, bacon, avocado, grilled onions, etc.  decent prices make this a regular lunch spot.

17.description: Ate here today for the first time and had a great experience! Staff is super friendly and my classic burger and fries were delicious.What gave me the feels was when I forgot to order my fountain drink and had to walk back into the line once I remembered...the guy at the register just handed me a small cup and said "don't worry about it, enjoy your meal!" Now management, before you get upset about the freebie understand that I appreciated it, it's rare and I doubt they give away free drinks all the time. This gentleman was the ultimate customer service champion. I will be back for sure!

10.description: Ok, one word.... HALAL !!! Woohoo! Just found out that they serve halal beef burgers, and being a Muslim, I can only eat Halal. And guess what, I had not had a meat burger (beef, chicken, goat lamb or anything) for a while... and man when I put that burger in my mouth, it was an amazing feeling... on top of that the burger actually was very nice, not too expensive. I had a double beef burger along with a drink and it came squarely at 10 bucks. It filled my appetite and as I said, satisfied my taste buds too. Good thing for shoppers is that the joint is conveniently located just off Michigan Ave, so if you are shopping and hungry, which of course you will be, this is a good place for nice food that is very well priced, unlike all the other expensive stuff on Michigan Ave. The staff were very polite, good crowd, nice and clean place, I could almost become a regular here

5.description: Good burgers! My daughter had the grilled cheese and loved it! Strawberry milkshake was good too! Wait staff very friendly.

3.description: Update - I had occasion to give this location another go and my portobello burger was fantastic.  Looking forward to more.

35.description: Friendly staff who explained how it worked at epic. The burger was good, great bun but honestly it was too well done for me. The staff told me they only do well done, why I don't know.It would have been so much better not so well cooked and charred.I didnt have the fries but they looked good.

19.description: Hands down the best tasting burger I've ever had!  I'm not sure why the front desk guy across the street at the hotel told me to avoid this place, but I'm glad I didn't listen!!!

28.description: Ethical, great tasting food. It's a little pricey, but I'm willing to pay more for better food.

45.description: Had a burger there - the patty was so dry and hard to bite. Some of the fries were overcooked but others were undercooked. :S

33.description: My friend took me out here for early lunch. Being a huge burger lover there was some pressure surrounding the experience. The menu was clear and simple which eased the ordering process for a first-timer like myself. Burgers were pretty big, very juicy and full of flavor. The only thing I didn't like and found strange was the fact that everything (ketchup, tomato, cheese, fries) had to be ordered separately. Also as I discovered later on they make their own, famous "epic sauce" which wasn't even suggested while we were ordering. My friend decided to have a very small, overpriced milkshake which wasn't ready till after we were done eating. It also wasn't brought to him, he had to go and remind them because they clearly forgotto make it. If you like burgers and don't care about service or "little" things I would recommend this joint.

43.description: Tried Epic Burger for the first time today & had the best portabello mushroom burger ever. I think I'm officially obsessed. Also, I am still not hungry & it's like 7hrs later. But that's because I also had the peanut butter shake and (still) feel like I probably ate & drank my daily maximum calorie intake in 3 minutes. This place is great for vegetarians who also want a quality burger experience. I added egg & havarti in a wheat bun with everything on the portobello burger mine by the suggestion of the very friendly staff there and it was amazing. AH.MAZ.ZING! I never like 'these kinds of places' but this one is goooood. One thing: it looks very affordable but the add-ons like cheese, egg, bacon, etc along with the $2 will add up to around $10 on average. It spent almost $16 in lunch with my shake. Food for thought.

2.description: We came here during lunch hour on Friday. It was pretty quick in and out and it was busy but not jam packed. The atmosphere was relaxing and laid-back.   I had the classic burger with french fries and the price was very reasonable.  Them meat was very fresh and tasty.  I liked wheat buns and the fries were pretty good too.  It is definitely a fast food place with quality food and I felt happy and full after my meal.

18.description: So after a rather good night, we had a bit of a rough morning and this place just sounded amazing when we looked up "Burgers" on Yelp. (gotta love yelp).  The woman behind the counter was very nice and walked us through how it worked since we have not been before. The food was DELICIOUS!! It is all organic so the burger was very light but still filling. You know when you have a burger and it feels like a brick in your stomach all day which just makes you uncomfortable, well that didn't happen! How awesome is that?? The place is a little pricy but for all organic you do have to pay extra.

41.description: I had a blue cheese burger with grilled onions and bacon.  While I appreciate that they use all natural products, the only thing missing was the beef. Yes I opted for some strong tasting ingredients, but I could not taste the beef. "Where's' the beef"? The beef patty in my hamburger at Epic was more like a deli slice than a patty. Honestly, the beef patty on a quarter pounder at McDonald's is thicker. Hands down, the trimmings at Epic are very good, but the star of the show, the beef, is missing. In addition my beef was overcooked and the fries were average. Not how I like my burger.

52.description: What can i say. i have been here twice. i love their turkey burgers. the shakes are pretty decent as well. the staff and service is friendly. its a bit on the pricey side, and its easy to rack up a bill at this place. i will be returning, but it wont be a regular spot for me, the prices are just a bit up there for a burger. my son and fiance loved it though.

50.description: Portabello Sandwich is delicious!  Well seasoned portabello with crunchy fresh lettuce, tomato and pickle.  Perfectly grilled portabello with a size that covers the entire bun.  No epic sauce and cheese to minimize calories.  It was already flavorful as ordered.  You can also taste the butter in the bun.

4.description: People were very friendly. Felt like it was a good value for the money. I like they're trying to make it as organic as possible. If I'm comparing I'd say it's like an organic Smashburger.

6.description: Imposter!I've been to enough Epic Burgers to know what to expect.  I totally had a taste for my usual burger deliciousness, so I dragged the man to the nearest Epic Burger I could find.  Huge mistake.  Unfortunately for us, both our burgers were half the size they usually are.  Really, can I have some meat with my bun?  What a waste of $20.  And that was for two burgers, a fry, and a drink.  Fml.

22.description: This was my first time at Epic Burger today. Food was priced decently for quality and portion. My burger was great, but the fries were too mushy for my liking. Next time I'm in the area I'll be sure to stop in.

15.description: Epic Burger is a quality fast food burger joint, almost like a Chipotle except for instead of burritios, EB serves  you a fat, nasty, juicy, grass fed, beef patty of deliciousness. A burger and fries + a drink will end up costing about $14-$16, kind of pricey for a quick dose of obesity, diabetes, and yet another broken promise to start eating better. I work in the Streeterville area, and despite the price of this disgustingly delicious, fat infused, flabby patty--I still have to deliberately try and NOT go there, because it such a gosh- diddley-darn tasty way to add a few more centimeters to your lusciously large love handles....baby

57.description: Really good burgers. I order a Jr. because a normal sized burger here would send me into a food coma. The portion sizes are kind of a lot, but it's un-American for me to complain about too much food, so I'll just leave it up to you to decide if it's too much or not.I've had the turkey burger, regular burger, and the chicken sandwich here (I work on Michigan Ave, so we eat here for work-lunch a lot). All were good, but again - I'd go with the Jr. size.The meat tastes a lot better than most other burger places in the area and the wheat buns are a nice option for anyone trying to be good. Overall, delicious food.

20.description: Wow, the burger tasted almost like a backyard BBQ burger! Super fresh and simple; what more could you ask for?!

36.description: I can't help but stop by Epic Burger every few months for their hurt burger and fries.  They're relatively quick and reasonably priced given its location.

14.description: Epic Burger is similar to Five Guys. I give Epic a slight edge. Great casual dining concept and like the way they cater to the non burger customer. I had the burger and fries and thought they were excellent.Cool looking space and good service. $11.49 for the combo regular burger.

58.description: Was a member for almost three years and thanks to the TERRIBLE customer service I received two Friday's ago I finally opened my eyes and canceled my membership.  Word to the wise you shouldn't hang up on people because you have the manners of 5 year old.  Therapists are always hit or miss here.  If you get lucky and get one of the rare therapists with experience you might walk out feeling your money was well spent but that is few and far between.  You truly get what you pay for and thanks to this location I will NEVER refer a friend or family member here again.

56.description: Mediocre in every way possible.  Came here over the summer because I was lured in by the $49 deal.  This is a no frills massage.  You walk in, fill out the basic paperwork, wait.  Go to the room, undress, get oiled up and massage, get dressed and leave.  Notice, there is no where to rinse off because they don't have showers, just a bathroom.  The massage was lighter than I would have liked, easily one I could have gotten from a friend.  When all is said and done, only the first massage is a deal (and that's if you luck out and get somebody good), after that, it's $$$ and I would rather pay elsewhere so that I could get the full spa experience.

29.description: Like any spa, your massage therapist needs to be ideal for your pressure level/massage style. My wife and I come regularly for Magda and Roberto. I would recommend this ME to anyone but like anything worth enjoying, you need to try out the options and go with the therapist for you.

42.description: Lupe is great, New but great for a deep tissue massage , I am looking to have a massage with her very soon.

23.description: This was an amazing experience! I had a couple massage with my boyfriend and I felt very cozy, comfortable, and at home. Customer service and employees where very friendly. I will be back next time I visit Chicago!

47.description: I really like Massage Envy on Ohio. I have been going for around two years, always to the same therapist, and I love her.  Tattenai has awesome healing hands.  She is lovely to talk to as well, if you feel like talking. She makes sure all of your requests are taken care of.  Massage is a very good therapy for me.  I feel so much better.Overall, I find the staff very friendly and helpful.  Would recommend it to friends.

8.description: I have been going to this Massage Envy for a few months now and have always had a pleasant experience. The front desk people are very nice and welcoming and always helpful when booking appointments. I have had a variety of therapists and all have been great. The location is nice and central and very clean and comforting. All around a nice place to get a massage or facial.

31.description: This place is so disorganized.  I upgraded to the sugar foot scrub and aromatherapy, neither of which I got once inside the room.Booked a facial and a massage back to back.  It was such a cluster for the facialist to get her stuff out of the room and had to make several trips with the lights full on.  Once the massage therapist was in the room, he of course, had to completely rearrange the room.Talk about major relaxation buzz kill....

34.description: I wouldn't visit this place unless you have a massage scheduled somewhere else afterwards... When you visit Massage Envy for the first time, you are promptly greeted and engaged into friendly conversation by the seemingly pleasant reception staff. Like me, you may just  be checking the place out as they have an attractive first-time client special, so what the heck right? No. The massage itself was very nice, which is why this review has 2 stars. The therapist was very friendly and professional, gave a great relaxing massage and discussed areas that he focused on with me afterward. So why is this terrible? Because then you have to leave. When you go to settle out at the front desk the friendly receptionist transforms into a pushy used car salesman, trying to convince you to sign up for a monthly membership. And no is not the correct answer. I treat myself to massages very rarely, perhaps once every 3-6 months. Would I like one every month? Sure. Do I want to pay for another monthly membership? No.  And that's it, and should have been the end of it. But the sales pitch continues, and every bit of the hour I am trying to pay for is being erased. Not only was the sales technique ineffective, but the demeanor of the agent changed and she became rude after she realized I wasn't going to bite. Don't waste your time here.

16.description: My first time ever my session was amazing with Tangie. Before hand she asked me everything like how I like my pressure if I have sensitive areas and throughout asked me if it was hard enough. She gave me everything I wanted! I enjoyed every moment. She took my lower back pain away completely. The sad thing is she no longer works at this location. I have since gone twice and both time a felt like it was a waste of money. I feel bad to say it because the staff is very nice and friendly. The second time I went for my birthday, the lady seemed confused she was trying to go slow and hard how I liked it but it seems she didnt no the spots she was massaging and kept hurting me she also forgot if she massage my one side and stopped to ask. I never had any training but I know where the nerves mussels and sensitive areas are and you would think a trained therapists would be well awared of those things. She began hurting me so bad It was almost unbearable. I seriously was biting my lips trying my best to not cause an akward scene and just fight the pain. It was torture. At one point  she was slowly and very hard going over a muscle then slipped, it hurt so bad she apologise but sheesh wth I cam to feel good not that. I can't believe I paid so much money to go through that! The third and last time time around I went for Mothers Day the lady was nice but to sum it up is seemed like she was playing with oil on my back I couldnt believe it. No pressure at all I barely felt anything. She was going very fast and and I enjoyed very few parts of it. Both lady's barely asked me anything before hand. I'm debating on going back for a regular service with my membership it 59$ ( I believe) dollars a month plus like 20$ tip for 20% that's a lot of money to pay to not enjoy a service at all. I could of had my boyfriend do it for free. I might just use my last 2 services for a hot stone massage Instead. And over all I'm a pretty understanding person but two bad times in a row... I don't know. Ps. I also had a facial once it's was ok the lady was super nice nothing special though.

13.description: Just had one of the best massages of my life. Ask for Dorie at the Streeterville location. She worked on my shoulders and neck in a way that gave me actual relief. She even thought to turn down the music when a particularly intense classical song got going. Dorie was in tune with me, the massage and just seems like a lovely person in general.

11.description: Great program, usually great massages. Times when they have not been so great include cold hands at the start! BUT, the customer service has been great and rectify any issues I have had including comping an entire massage for small complaints. Overall, well worth the membership and I will definitely keep coming back ! They also recently started doing facials. These are ok. Wish they had people trained to do microdermabrasion ( the exfoliation they have is not great)

39.description: Everyone knows about the sales pitch for memberships immediately after the massage.  That's lousy, but not a deal breaker.  I scheduled a couples massage with my gf and booked two female masseuses.  However, we got one male/one female masseuse.  The male said "Somebody should have called you"...of course, this never happened.  The explanation from the guy at the front desk was "Sorry, I'm new here and I thought Michael was Michelle."  Evidently, more seasoning at the front desk is needed to effectively determine gender.  Still, that didn't completely ruin the experience.  I took the massage from the male masseuse & it was easily the wrost massage I've ever had.  This had nothing to do with his gender or even the pressure he used.  His movements/techniques were just bizarre - lots of poking, pulling, and strange shaking motions.Anyway, moral of the story is that this place features bad sales pitches, a front desk that isn't capable of booking the correct gender of masseuses, and poor massages.  The only way it's worth checking out is if you find a good masseuse that works there (not easy) and want to purchase a membership (prices without memberships aren't close to worth it).

37.description: I love massage envy for monthly massages

0.description: Not a great start, but John saved the day!My fiancé and I booked a couples massage which we confirmed before arriving. When we got there they were not able to provide this for us. My fiancé had a wonderful experience, however, mine was awful. I contacted the location a couple of days later and was beyond impressed with John at the front desk! He was courteous and respectful and was determined to make the situation better! He refunded my massage and set my fiancé and I up with a new appointment with a different masseuse. Everything was done very quickly and without stress to us! John is the main reason we will be returning to this location! If you are fortunate enough to work with him directly, he will make sure your experience is wonderful!!

38.description: The customer service was amazing--let me start off by saying that. The ladies were nice and welcoming.  Maybe I was a bit irritated the day I went in for my massage but the environment was not at all relaxing. They put you in a cold room pre-massage that has the greatest of intentions of being soothing but all I heard was the laughter of the people in the reception area. Ok--that's fine. I'll take that. The therapist was nice, but did not listen to my groans of pain as she elbowed her way down my back and kept saying how tense I was. Yes. I was tense because I was in pain due to that terrible massage. I was on defense about 75% of the time and was relieved when she was done. That has never happened before. This is the reasoning behind the 3stars. I have another hour to use so I'll just make sure she's not available next time I go.Next hour: The massage therapist was great this time, and I'll be back. "Member's area" is still very cold. The session actually lasted an hour this time and I was satisfied--not four stars yet, but at least I didn't walk out in pain like last time. I have another session this week which will determine whether or not I'll continue with them or not.

51.description: So I have been a member of Massage Envy for over a year and gone to many different therapists.  The last massage I had was by SHIRLEY and it was AWESOME!!  I work in the service industry and have alot of shoulder and neck issues.  She did some sort of trigger point therapy or something like that and really new what she was doing.  She was very comfortable to communicate with and I left there with noticeable relief in my back and neck.  Thanks Shirley!  I will definitely be back and hopefully this time get on a regular schedule since I have found someone great.

27.description: Thank goodness for a downtown location and easy to schedule last min. appt.  Between long plane trip. too much walking, and sitting in conference rooms--I was in misery with leg and back pain.  Luis, my massage therapist was wonderful.  He was able to really assess my problem areas and take care of things.  Wonderful deep pressure massage and stretching and he got me pain free.  I recommend this location.

32.description: I got a facial and I really enjoyed it.  Timely, clean, comfortable and a very relaxing experience.

54.description: The saying "you get what you pay for" is rightly applicable here.  The price points are good....$50 for a one time introductory session.  Sign up for a monthly membership at $60 and that includes 1 massage session and subsequent hours are only $50.  Non member prices are $100 for an hour massage which I don't think is necessarily worth it given the quality (see below).  It's no frills in terms of quality.  The facilities are just a lobby and a hallway with a bunch of massage rooms.  No biggie, it's clean and all, just feels like an assembly line. The therapists newer and less experienced , which can often yield just an average massage session. But when scheduling an appointment I make a point of asking for a therapist who meets my specific needs (skilled in deep tissue, very firm pressure, etc) and seen to have better results this way vs. just taking who they give you and hoping he/she is good .Not a bad place if its close by and you are in a bind, but I'd rather spend a little more and get a high quality massage at a better spa than continue going here.

48.description: I received a free 30 minute massage voucher in the mail yesterday.  I am new to Chicago and thought it would be a great place to check out.  I have never had a massage before but I've had other relaxation spa treatments.  When calling, I talked to Jillian who asked if I wanted to upgrade to a 60 or 90 minute massage.  I declined, as it is my first massage I wanted to see what it was like before doing a longer one.  I was then given another excuse, "the 30 minute massage actually translates to a 20 minute massage."  Ok, misleading, but that's fine.  I was put on hold several times throughout this conversation and then Laura picks up the phone like I had never talked to Jillian and starts over again.  Ok, so I gave her all of the same information and she also proceeded to put me on hold.  I was now on the phone (mostly holding) for over 10 minutes when she finally picked back up and suggested a time next Monday.  Sure, great.  When she found out I only wanted a 30min one, she said that wouldn't work and put me on hold again.  This is getting a little ridiculous, this is my fourth time holding.  She clearly didn't want me scheduling a 30 minute massage with this voucher.  Finally she suggested another date next week and I agreed.  She then proceeded to ask for my credit card number.  I have a voucher therefore the only payment I will be providing is gratuity, so why exactly is a credit card required?  She had no explanation but simply "that's our policy"  I had been on the phone for 18 minutes and clearly got the hint they didn't want me to schedule if I wasn't going to pay.  Their professionalism was clearly lacking.  If you don't want me to schedule, don't send me the voucher.  At least let me come in and have the massage and then hound me to buy something.  There was absolutely no way I was giving these people my credit card number.  At this point, I didn't even want a massage at a place like this.  There are many other options here in Chicago and I refuse to waste my time being treated like this.

44.description: I'm surprised by many of the reviews here.  If you have experience with massage therapy in Chicago, you know that the going rate really is in the $100 range and only places labeled as "spas" have additional facilities such as showers, steam rooms, etc.I've enjoyed several massages here from different therapists.  One was so good I'm not going to mention her name, because it's hard enough to find a spot in her schedule as it is!  But even the fine-but-not-fabulous therapist gave a worthwhile massage.  I've had enough experience with therapists elsewhere who were well trained and experienced and yet were no better than the therapists here, and every single one of them cost more than the Massage Envy price PLUS 20% tip.I suspected what another reviewer has reported, that the Massage Envy therapists are receiving less from the company than most therapists do.  That just makes me want to give them a few more dollars; after all, even 25% gratuity plus the introductory or member rate is still less than the going rate in Chicago.The massage tables are top of the line: they have a hydraulic lift so the therapist can adjust the height quickly and quietly, heating pads, well-constructed face cradles, fitted covers for everything (excellent for hygiene purposes), and they're the full (wide) size rather than the cheaper and narrower version that many places have.  They could make it easier to deal with clothing: it seems that only some of the rooms have a hook and hanger available.  It's very quiet and dim, so once you're in your particular room you don't have any sense that you're next to other occupied rooms.This place is for people who know they want to have regular monthly massages but also like to have the flexibility to be able to call up on a particular day and say "I need this worked on now: who do you have available?"

24.description: I went in an agreed to the 1 year package.  My therapist was Bridget and she was GREAT.  A++  She was the only reason I committed to a membership and the only reason I continued to go back.  After 11 months of going to every appointment and being on time, I ran into a work issue.  I called at 8:30 to reschedule my 2:30 appointment and was told I couldn't reschedule on the day of and that I would still be charged anyways.  Needless to say this made me irate.  I asked then to cancel my annual membership and they made me jump through hoops to get it cancelled.  Not too customer friendly.

7.description: I have been a member of ME for several years and been to spas all over the country. Your massage is always only as good as your masseuse/therapist and finding one that is right for you is a pretty subjective and individual process in my experience. What does set one spa/clinic apart from another is the front desk staff. Most MEs are poorly run and have a revolving door of employees. This one is the exception - they are great! Always friendly and knowledgable and they get my billing correct and are helpful when booking appointments.

49.description: I try to give my business to locally owned establishments whenever possible.  That said, it is hard for me to pass up a $49 hour long massage which is precisely what they offer here for first time members.The reception area feels a bit corporate compared to the salons I'm used to but that was to be expected.  When the slightly socially awkward receptionist informed me that I will be seeing 'Amber' I was a little weary.  Amber sounds like a nice gal but I was hoping for a name that was a bit more meaty sounding..like 'Sven'.Turns out, Amber was a dream come true.  She did a fantastic job and applied just the right amount of pressure.  She was very thorough and did not speak once (a huge plus in my book) except to ask me to roll over.  She did a full body massage and left me in a state of utter bliss.I was so relaxed when I left the place that I could barely think straight.  One word of advice, if you are teetering between the 60 and 90 minute massage..go for the 90.  You won't regret it1

40.description: I really like the fact that Massage Envys will usually take me if I make a day-of appointment. I'm a member, so I don't know if that makes a difference, but if I have a rough day, I need a massage THAT NIGHT and massage envy usually delivers. It was walking distance from my hotel, and I managed to snag an 8PM appointment. Perfect. I go, and they usher me right in, no filling anything out or anything. [I find out later that they thought I was someone else, and even gave a wrong chart to my massage therapist, which resulted in a funny little mix up.] My therapist was Cynthia, and she was pretty awesome. I've gotten a TON of massages, and she did a few things that I've never had done before and they felt pretty good. It was exactly what I needed. I always wonder what good therapists are doing at Massage Envy, since I have a vague inkling that they are seriously underpaid compared to other spas. My only issues were that she was pretty talkative, and at first I responded out of habit and politeness, but eventually just zoned out. I really don't like it when therapists talk but I find the awkwardness of being blunt and telling them not to talk more uncomfortable than just dealing with it. The thing that really surprised me was that she asked me how I got my scars, which i found to be shockingly rude and made me feel pretty uncomfortable. Even when I go to those ghetto Asian places and they don't know I speak chinese and talk about me behind my back, no one brings it up. Maybe people are just more open here. Also, I think they read the reviews here because when she walked in, she announced the start time and end time out loud, which is pretty cool because I've gotten robbed of several minutes at other locations a few times. The room was also super warm and the bed was REALLY warm so I think they fixed the cold room problem.I tipped her $21. I literally cannot believe people writing that they feel it's okay to tip $10 - I hope it's because they don't know any better and not because they're ignorant. [uh oh, I feel the rant starting...] If you just used your brain for one second and think about what's going on here - you're getting a dirt cheap massage. The company keeps a lot of the money, and the therapist is making barely anything. Then you are adding further insult to injury by leaving them coffee money instead of a real tip. For someone to say "if you want me to tip $20, charge me $100" is idiotic. Really, is that what they have to do, charge you more money, for you to give a fair tip to your masseuse? Every time I go, I always overhear someone leaving like an $11 tip or a $10 tip and acting like they're all generous and I always want to just smack them. A lot of the people here do just as good a job, if not better, than the masseuses at other spas and tip should service. Tipping based on price is just a starting point. If you can't afford to properly tip [or you don't want to], don't get a massage. [/end rant]

53.description: I have'nt been to this location,just the one on Diversey & Halsted.I called to make an appt.after I received a gift card for Xmas.I get there the day of the appt and they have no record of me.The young lady I made the appt with never asked me for my name,(which I didnt realize till I got off the phone).Needless to say they had no one available to take me at that time so I had to comeback 2 days later for my 2pm swedish massage.When I go back for my massage the receptionist tells me they have me down for 3pm,I said "are you sure,theres no way i would've scheduled it for 3". She proceeds to tell me thats the only time we have u down for.She apologizes profusely even though it isnt her fault.I leave to do some grocery shopping then come back @ 3.The massage was lovely and I may even go back for another.

30.description: Well my partner was suppose to get a surprise massage but left irritated.  The room was not as cleaned as expected. The atmosphere lacked. The therapist didn't have good energy in or out of the room. I guess you get what u pay for. One plus was the front staff, they were great!

46.description: The massage was good --- but nothing better than anything else I have had and I have had dozens.  The real experience killer was the woman who I believe is the manager who tried to give my wife and I the hard sell before and after the massage about their membership plans.  I kindly said no thanks 3x before she backed off.  The real deal breaker why I wouldn't go back is how pushy she was in us leaving a tip.  In my two minute conversation while settling the bill she must have said the word gratuity 6 times.  I had to tell her that a tip was an optional payment based off experience and she was surely taking away from the positive experience.  I don't get her motivation, but I wouldn't go back just due to the shakedown.

1.description: Horrible!! Horrible! Horrible!! I've tried it more than 5 times (i was a member). All they care about is money & not the customer service they provide.My friend gifted me a 1 hour massage ( gift card saying 1 hour massage) & when I went to get it they said I need to pay extra 40$ which is the difference between the member rate & the non member rate since I wasn't a member !!! I told yhrm its a gift card saying 1 hour massage which is already paid for, what difference does it make if im a member or not?????!!!! The most ridiculous thing I've ever heard.  And today I went to get another 1 hour massage since my neck & shoulder were really tight. I added the foot scrub & the lady at the front desk said it's 15$ extra & I had no problem with that. Once in the room my therapist asked what I was looking for today & I told her "back,shoulders & neck mainly" and she added " otherwise it's a total body" & I said yes. Of course she also said I'm getting a foot scrub at the end. I thought it would be at the end of my massage. Which made sense. She worked on my body, foot scrub & decided to SKIP the NECK. And when I asked her why she said there is no time!!!!!!!!! She took the liberty to decide for me what is the least important part in my body that is best to skip without even asking me. None of the employees there said that  you getting a foot scrub, which you're paying extra 15$ for, is going make your massage session shorter or that the therapist will not be able to do total body. They keep their customers in the dark on purpose. Bad bad bad customer service. Hopefully will convince my member friend to go find another place to spend her money at rather than wasting it there.

55.description: 3.5....I REALLY want to give them a half of a star but they really arent a 4...Location-perfect for meHours-TONS!  So easy to get in for an apptmt.  They are open early and late, weekends, weekdays...etc.Massage-Martin was pretty good.  He definitely did deep tissue, which is what I asked for.  He always asked about temperature, pressure, etc.Price-$49 introductory price....I think its fair.  Its a no frills massage place.  However, if you are like me, I find deals to massages all of the time so I never pay more than $50 for a massage...well, almost never so its really not that great of a deal.Overall, not bad if your looking for just a massage...if you like bells and whistles...this is not the place for you.Also, its really a 50 min massage, as stated in their deal.  Its 5 mins for dressing and undressing....so a 10 minute cut into your time....

9.description: Everything about my January 2015 visit to this massage envy location was pleasant. I received a gift card for Christmas and it was enough for a 90 minute massage. This was my first massage anywhere, and the staff seemed to be very friendly and knowledgeable. I really wished I remembered the name of the massage therapist I had, because she was amazing. She applied the perfect amount of pressure and made me feel very comfortable. This location is very clean and I loved the heated table. I went on a day in which it was very cold outside and snowing all day, so the whole massage experience here was a great escape. I will be coming back in the future.

26.description: We visited Chicago for a girls/sisters weekend and needed something to do other than shopping before we flew out. We decided to each get a massage.  They were very accommodating and got two of us in at 9 and two of us in at 10 which was great considering we decided at 8:30 the night before. My massage was probably one of the better ones I have gotten before. There were only a couple reasons I gave it four stars. One was the lobby area was not very large. First impressions are crucial. 2nd thing I really would have loved a heated table. It was chilly in the room. But overall experience was great! Thanks!

25.description: Wow. I haven't posted a review in a while (mostly because I'm a teensy bitter Yelp! appears to have revoked my Elite 13 status since, after I received it, I didn't write enough reviews to keep it), but it would be a crime to not write something about the massage I got last night. Luis is AMAZING. Like, AMAZING!!! I have had a lot of massages in my time (a lot, but not enough) and I cannot recall one where I felt I had better communication. Before we started, Luis walked me over to a big diagram of women muscles, I pointed to where I was most sore, we talked through it all, and then when he went to work he honed in on those areas and boy goodness gracious was it awesome. He found all the worst areas and spent a luxurious amount of time on them. When my 90 minutes were over I wanted to grab onto the table/bed and yell "Nooo!! Don't leave me Luis! Don't leave me!!!!" I'm going back in two weeks. Awesome prices and awesome service! The woman at the front was super friendly, too. Totally exceeded my expectations!

12.description: It was my first time at Massage Envy Spa. My massage therapist was Rachel, she was excellent--very knowledgable and accommodating. I would recommend her to anybody going in for a massage. I had a great experience thanks to her and the staff. I will definitely be returning and booking with Rachel.

59.description: I have been going to Robin and love her. I would suggest to make sure you do not get assigned to the connected room...it can open up into another room and you can hear what the other client says. I think finding the right massage therapist is key.

21.description: I'm not a member here. I am a member in a different state and these folks were incredible. Front desk was accommodating and very friendly. We got a free upgrade, foot scrub, and it was excellent. Our therapists weren't the best we've ever had but they were excellent and treated us like five star clients. Mine was tiffany and I'd recommend her because she was great.

17.description: I have no complaints about the massage therapists but the front desk and the rules that ME has are absolutely ridiculous.  They do every thing they can to get more money out of you.  They require a $10 "transfer" fee to give someone one of your credits....that you've already paid for.  You can only let the same person use a credit every six months and yes, they do require that $10 transfer fee.  I actually think their massage therapists are good but they should run out of ME and to a place that knows how to treat their customers.  I canceled my membership (and believe me they put you through the ringer to cancel)because of the transfer fee and the one time every six month deal.  They lost me as a customer but you know, they don't care.DO NOT JOIN THEM AS A MEMBER GO SOMEPLACE ELSE

10.description: This review is for CC only: perfect strong pressure, tips on how to avoid soreness on certain areas, and very personable. Will be going back to see her. The other person I'd gotten a massage from at this location was forgettable at best.

5.description: I've been going to this branch of Massage Envy for over a year. It's clean and the staff is friendly.  The key to having a successful experience is to find a great masseuse. It took me a few tries before I found a great one- her name is Evetta.  Then when I got pregnant, I had to start my search again as I needed a therapist who is certified in pregnancy message. Again it took a few tries until I found Venisha. A couple things to note:* Of the dozen or so massage rooms, there are two massage rooms that share a door (instead of a wall). I don't remember which room numbers they are, but I've had this room twice and both times, the person who was getting a massage next door loved to talk during his entire session (yes, it was a man both times!)* There are signs for "suggested gratuities" all around the location, this only applies to you if your massage costs $99. If you're a member, your massage will cost much less so your tip will be less.

3.description: Very excellent customer service, they booked me the day of for both a massage and a facial.My facial was without a doubt five stars considering the price and relaxation. The esthetician was friendly and super experienced while the facial massage and shoulder area massages were heavenly. I would return for facials without a doubt. I was not too thrilled with the massage though, masseuse did not really focus on any areas despite my telling her I got the massage for sore feet and shoulders. She seemed to be going through the motions and not very engaged in her task. I was not impressed and did not think she did any better a job than I could have done with my two hands. I didn't feel any more relaxed by the end of it, which was highly unfortunate.

35.description: Worst massage I have EVER had.  Booked a first-time client 60 minute massage to just relax and have a few sore spots worked on. After repeatedly asking the therapist to use MUCH LESS pressue I resigned myself to just suffering through it, but I really should've just walked out. Eventually I did...in tears, with scratches from the therapists fingernails (disgusting!!) down my neck and back and feeling like I'd just been in a UFC cage fight.  The staff didn't ask how my massage was, didn't notice I was visibly upset and were only concerned with pushing a membership package on me.After several phone calls over the next few days to complain about the experience and report that scratches from fingernails are a definite healthy and hygiene issue, I managed to get a refund. But that certainly doesn't make up for how terrible I felt after this "massage".

19.description: I am a member of this particular location and am very pleased with it.  Two therapists in particular, Dorrie and Tamieka are both EXCELLENT. They are very professional and well spoken, and do a terrific job. I would highly recommend either of these ladies.  The office staff has always been very friendly and courteous as well.

28.description: I had been a member of Massage Envy for over 2 years when this happened to me.  And until then would have given it 4 stars but now it will be a very long time before I get a massage again.  And while I appreciate the efforts that are taken by the owners when hiring massage therapists, the fact of the matter is this massage therapist had a criminal record and they took a gamble on him and they lost.  He not only assaulted me on their property during a massage which is supposed to be a safe place, but when he finished, he offered me personal massages in my home and gave me his personal phone number on a Massage Envy card.  So something in their efforts failed, they missed a red flag somewhere and I am the one paying the price for it now.

45.description: Marie is MAGIC !!!!     She is  very knowledgeable and listens to one's needs. I highly suggest you treat yourself to her skills.

33.description: I love Massage Envy.   Awesome massages and customer service.

43.description: Go here.  Ask for Paula.  Pay attention to nothing else.  Just ask for Paula.  Nuff said.

2.description: This place is hit or miss, mainly due to getting a time slot . Hardest thing is signing up and then trying to get a session when you want it. All the spots seem to get booked up well in advance so make sure you book upfront. The therapists are friendly and the setting nice, however I think some therapists are much better than others. Good location makes this an easily accessible place when you need to relax and be pampered

18.description: I went in an agreed to the 1 year package.  My therapist was Bridget and she was GREAT.  A++  She was the only reason I committed to a membership and the only reason I continued to go back.  After 11 months of going to every appointment and being on time, I ran into a work issue.  I called at 8:30 to reschedule my 2:30 appointment and was told I couldn't reschedule on the day of and that I would still be charged anyways.  Needless to say this made me irate.  I asked then to cancel my annual membership and they made me jump through hoops to get it cancelled.  Not too customer friendly.

41.description: I'll start with the good: Roberto.  One of the best massages I've had (and I love massages) and it was a deep tissue massage that got all my kinks out.  I had him focus on my back and neck the whole 50 minutes and it was worth it.the awkward: I understand it's a membership but I wasn't prepared for the sales part.  I wasn't interested - I can get a massage near my house for $65, so why pay $59/month (and be expected to tip $20)?  Basic rooms.  Good location (saying it's close to the Grand-Red is a stretch, it would be quite a walk).

52.description: I've been going to this Massage Envy for a little over a year and overall I've been pretty pleased with the services I've received.  Everyone here is professional and pleasant.Massage Envy is like the Walmart of massage places and hires therapists out of massage school, so you shouldn't expect the best massage you've ever had right off the bat.  This particular Massage Envy has been around a while now and has therapists that have been there for a few years, and those therapists are very good.  In particular, I've gotten fantastic massages from Robin and Roberto, along with some other therapists who have now left.  My advice is to ask the front desk who is good at the particular therapy you need, try a few people, and stick with the ones you like best.  Also make sure to try and communicate exactly what you want.  I know I've had some therapists who I'm sure do great massage, but I was not clear as to what I needed, and so didn't get the best results from my massage.With Massage Envy, you usually sign a contract to pay $59/month for a membership, and with that membership you get a one hour massage, with the option to have more massages at the rate of $49/hour, so it's a good deal.  Having such low prices means that therapists here are not making as much as therapists at regular day spas - they start at $15 per hour massage, as opposed to starting at $25 per hour massage.  And they only get paid for the massages they do.  Massage therapists cannot work eight solid hours like the rest of us; massage is difficult and grueling work.  So many do about four to five massages per day, if they are lucky.  Many people here are complaining about the signs suggesting proper gratuity levels.  I think that's BS.  Those signs are essential to these people getting paid properly.  They are doing massages for half the price of a regular massage.  Why should they get paid half the tip?  You are saving money by getting a massage here.  I don't have any clue as to why you would skimp on the tip.  This should be the same type of guideline as tipping at a restaurant when you have a coupon - you should always tip on the full bill before any discounts.  And you should always tip at least the suggested amount here.  Making excuses as to why you tip less...well, sorry, it's not cool.Knowing what I know now about the way Massage Envy operates and pays its employees, I would not have signed a contract to get massages here.  But having done so and coming to the end of my contract, I have to say I have been satisfied with the services I've received here.

50.description: A friend bought me a gift card to this place. I wasn't sure what to expect because when looking at their website, the atmosphere just didn't scream, "hey, come here to relax." I would prefer a more spa like atmosphere where lights are dim and most importantly - I don't want to feel like somebody is trying to sell me something. However, right after my massage, I was continuously pressured to get the monthly deal. I'm sorry but my experience wasn't good enough to justify buying a massage every month. Mainly because of the reasons I have stated above. And because Groupon offers so many great deals lately for spas, I really can't justify committing to your massages every month. However, my massage was good and my massage therapist was decent. Not the best, but good enough considering it was a free massage. She hit the pressure points, she knew where I had tension/pain and she got rid of it. Also - I found it odd that the rooms were cold. As a place of relaxation, shouldn't the temperature be on the warmer side? Perhaps that's just a personal preference.I'd go back here but def would not pay $100 for a massage here.

4.description: I've been a customer off and on for a period of 4 years. I was lucky enough to have the best massage therapist in Chicago over that time period. I was never thrilled with the front desk due to their overall snootiness but my therapist was so good it didn't matter. Unfortunately, my therapist left the company and I was referred to a different therapist. Let me just say my back still hurts from that massage from 6 weeks ago! She literally dug her elbows into the small of my back to the point of me screaming out with pain. I then cancelled my membership a couple of weeks later. This is where I need to warn you all. I still had 2 1/2 hours of credit on my account and tried to call to make a booking to make use of them. However, I was abruptly told my account had been deactivated. The front desk then said that someone must have tried to call me. They didn't. She then said someone would call me the next day. Nothing. I tried calling back and was put on hold for 15 minutes before I hung up. Bottom line, they're scammers. By skimming customers this way they are able to remain profitable. If you plan on "exiting the building", use all your credits first. Then again, when I did that a couple of years ago and cancelled they found a way to charge me for an additional month. Buyer beware. They lure you in but then they spit you out. I will not be back for more! I'm hoping this behavior will eventually catch up with them.

6.description: By far the best massage envy I've ever been to. The staff was incredibly helpful and nice, and the interior was beautiful. They even had a quiet room that actually felt like a spa. Not just a cubby with three people crammed into it. If this were closer to my home I would go here all the time.

22.description: First off, the therapists there are good and friendship and that's the 1-star is for. The front desk staff, on the other hand, are horrible!I had extra credits from my annual membership, so I wanted to transfer one credit to my husband. That was the second time I wanted to do that. I made the appointment successfully on the phone and they told me that the credit has been transferred. I also scheduled my own session on the same day as my husband, just 2 hours ahead of him. When I showed up for my appointment, the staff member told me that I could not transfer the credit for my husband's session because I could only transfer credit to the same person every 6 months. I already transferred one previously to my husband within the 6 months period. I said: I didn't know this rule and when I booked the appointment, the person I booked with did not let me know. And the appointment was made successfully. The staff member said: Yes, whoever booked that should have let you know. I said: well, can you make an exception for just this time then since I was not notified? He said: No, we really can't! I thought it was so rude of him and unreasonable to make me pay for their mistake. My husband ended up have to pay full price for his session which is $99. Just to clarify that it wasn't the money that made me upset, but the way they handled my case and made me, the customer, paid for mistake that made by them was poor customer service. With a place that I supposed to go in and relaxed, this really defeated the purpose and I really had a hard time letting it go. So I've decided to cancel my annual membership when the term is up and be vocal about this experience whenever possible for a very long time! I will never be a customer of Massage Envy again after August which is when my membership ends.

15.description: I've been to a couple Massage Envy locations, but this one is by far the best customer service. John especially at the front desk went above and beyond. It was pouring rain and he refused to let me walk out in the rain. He accompanied me with an umbrella. Unbelievably sweet and caring customer service.

57.description: I went for a promotional event with my girlfriend.  They had single rooms next to each other and opened a door in between so we could get a proper couple's massage.  In hindsight, we could have been at opposite ends of the building and enjoyed it just as much.  We were so comfortable we had to watch ourselves to keep from drooling and falling asleep.  I was unaware that ones face could be massaged, but now I know it's possible, and amazing. I'd definitely go back and ask for Emily again, but I hate getting tied into yearly memberships, especially knowing how lazy I am and that I'd probably not take advantage of it.  I also wished they would lay out their pricing plan in detail on their web site so I know ahead of time exactly what I'd be getting into in regards to monthly membership fees and individual massage fees from there on out.  Still an awesome experience all around.  Friendly and helpful staff.

20.description: Well since their staff can't book an appointment on the appropriate day, I'm not able to review the massage therapist. M I will say I woke up at 715 for an 8am appointment that was actually not for Wednesday it was actually for Thursday. Appointment booked on Tuesday. I will say that the staff at the desk this morning was very trying to be helpful, they earned that second star. This affected not only my appointment but the person who was to come after me who is traveling with me. Both were canceled. We leave Thursday at 8am. Guess I'll try again during market days...

36.description: Fine if you need something basic and relaxing massage. Vast differences between therapists! Dori & Roberto of the 5-6 therapists I have gone too have been by far the best.

14.description: Decent experience. Not much of a wait.  Massage therapist was OK, but nothing I'd write home about.

3.description: I like going to Chaku for my eyebrow threading. She does a great job. She gives me a great brow  shape and she's quick too!!! Will definitely recommend her to everyone.

1.description: She's awesome! Super fast, does a great job and you can text her for an appt and she gets right back to you even if it's last minute. It's also super super cheap!! My fav place to get my brows done in Chicago. FYI - it's no frills. If that's what you're looking for, this isn't the place. If you're looking for good brows, make the trip. Easy street parking too!

0.description: I was very pleased with my eyebrows!

2.description: She did a good job on my eyebrows. She is very friendly and attentive. I will be returning as a regular just after my first visit . The salon is beautiful as well.

5.description: Chaku is great.  My eyebrows too!  She's experienced and very quick.

6.description: I bought a Lifebooker brow and lash tint and was excited because the reviews were so good. However, the phone number for the business is disconnected, so I am very disappointed!

7.description: NO ONE makes my eyebrows look better!!  Great prices, great service and best of all...great results!  Highly recommend the threading service here.  Don't be deceived by the lack of reviews as she recently moved from her Indiana location.

8.description: I am OBSESSED!!!!! I love, love, love Chaku... no one makes my brows look better, no one.  The downside of that is that if she ever leaves Chicago, I will be forced to follow her wherever she goes because I honestly can't go to anyone else besides her.  She is quick and affordable, but mostly importantly makes my brows look amazing... and my eyebrows are difficult to maintain (too long in some parts, too sparse in others) and she does such a remarkable job that I walk out of there looking fabulous!

9.description: New location. Same lady (Chaku is her name). She does a great job, doesn't rush you. Has a lot of experience and prices are good!

10.description: She made my eyebrows look great!

4.description: This is my 2nd time coming and I'm highly pleased and satisfied. My first time was when she ( Chuka) was located on 21st & Indiana. Now she's in a new location inside of Marimarshe Salon. The new location is a little more busy because its full service with hair, nails, etc. But Chuka gets me in and out every time. If you're unsure about her work, check the reviews from the other location. I hope that her old clientele follows her and doesn't shy away from the new location, she dies GREAT work!!! Highly recommended. She also does waxing. I get my upper lip waxed as well.

1.description: Located inside the Warwick Allerton, the M Avenue Restaurant is the hotel's restaurant. Really, in the middle of Chicago with it's wondrous food options, I can't imagine many people would go out of their way to come here. The prices were what you would expect for a hotel food establishment, that is to say, on the expensive side for what you're getting. Still, on my last day leaving the hotel, might as well give it a try right? I ordered the salmon and bagel breakfast and it wasn't bad. Heaping pile of salmon, onions, capers, tomatoes, cream cheese. Pretty basic, near impossible to mess up. It hit the spot. There was only one other group there for breakfast that day so service was attentive of course, but make no mistake, they were very polite.  I was pretty happy and considered myself well fed as I said goodbye to Chicago!

9.description: Went here last night with a travel zoo voucher...as did every other person in the restaurant since it was expiring today. we were told it would be a 30-45min wait, which we were fine with. After an hour of waiting and noticing that people were having to get up from their tables to get a drink and wait for an hour for a drink, food and in some cases even order, I realized we may never get to eat dinner. I spoke with a manager and told him I understood they were in over their heads, people who were sitting weren't even being served and maybe they should honor the travelzoo voucher past tomorrow to clear some people waiting out (there was a line wrapped around and there wasn't even a hostess or anyone to take names). His response was "no. After tomorrow your voucher is worth the value you paid". No apologies or cares in the world, even with other people overhearing me and chiming in to agree. This was just the beginning of my 3 hour drink and appetizer experience at M but you get the idea. Terrible management and I won't be back ever again.

12.description: The Atherton is a secret little romantic boutique hotel. Its where (literally) flght attendants stay and this sultry little lounge is where they hang. Its charming but cramped and the furniture, many backless chasise lounges for instance , makes little sense.But the service was good, and there is a fair amonut of old world charm. The location, just off the Magnificent Mile, is lux and fun.

21.description: we came here for a restaurant week lunch because we were thinking about the allerton for our wedding reception. i love the decor of the newly decorated lobby/bar/restaurant. really great feel. the food and service were also good, which i found surprising since it was so empty when we were there. they did try to serve me a completely flat glass of proseco, which was a little disappointing, and i was not a fan of the bread pudding dessert. but if you're looking for a new place to try for lunch on michigan ave, i would say go!

16.description: Loungey and Art Deco. I didn't find it very inviting, though. Maybe because I was staying at the hotel. It is a very open area. The Oyster Creek Sauv Blanc was spectacular. Service was also very attentive.The restaurant I thought was trying too hard to be European with its food.  Again, service was attentive.

17.description: Got the Travelzoo deal so overall, it was a great deal.  My friend and I both had the onion soup (ok), steak salad (good) and shared a bread pudding for dessert (awesome)!!!  Service was good and waitstaff catered to our 2 little girls (they also have kids menu).  They even gave chocolate milk to them instead of us using our deal for 2 non-alcoholic beverages as the mommies preferred to pay extra for wine!!  :-)

10.description: Cool little lounge area in the Allerton Hotel.  Didnt try the food, but drinks were good.Didnt have too many beers on tap, but did have a wide selection of high end alcohol.

5.description: The perfect venue for Ladies Who Lunch (Urban Dictionary meanings #1 and #2 applies).  Quiet relax venue.  Pleasant and knowledgeable service.  Selections are ordinary with a lunch menu of soup, salad and sandwich that is served the best way it can be enjoyed.Onion Soup -- good serving size with too much bread that slurps all the available liquid.Cobb Salad -- generous portion with mega chunks of perfectly grilled chicken.Hot Tea -- nothing special about the brands.  It looks fancy served from a wooden box and presented to you.Steak Sandwich -- The sandwich relied heavily on the mayonnaise.  Without the bread and mayo, steak was dry and tough.  Well seasoned fries needs to conform to the size and shape worthy of a "$$" restaurant.Mango Mousse Cake -- a true delight.  Light flavorful mango mouse with a firm moist cake.
