11.description: Trendy and chic atmosphere.  If only the drinks, food and service were of the same qualities as the hotel it's located inside of.  I realize this bar / restaurant  if you could call it that, was merely created to capture what "little" or few business they might come across in a day.  The space has potential but management needs to cross train the bartender and some of the wait staff.  I'm specifically speaking about experiences here during the TravelZoo offer which expires today 8/11/2012.  It's been pretty busy for the last week or so.  More so than I imagine it regularly is.  One day I stopped in solo to see what the environment was like and possibly have a drink.  Per their photos, there is a lush bar which is always open with a small seating area nearby.  Behind curtains is their dining areas which is larger and better accommodations when having a light meal with drinks.  However regardless of the day of the week or how busy, they close down the dining area by around 6:30 pm nightly.  The night I stopped in almost every seat was filled.  I met a sexy single at the bar and we decided to grab a table which we could not find.  A few people were already sitting in the back dining area, so we too headed over.  I waited about twenty minutes before getting a chance to speak with anyone for a first drink! When the waitress or hostess stopped by it was to ask us to remove ourselves from dining and move over to the bar.  The other tables were told the same but they like us were stranded because there weren't other seats or tables available.  So we decided to leave and found better accommodations down the street.My next visit was a few days later.  A weekday afternoon joined by another Yelper, just in time for happy hour.  Drinks are poured with a heavy hand which is usually a good thing but when the taste is so harsh you breathe fire, that's a whole other part to drinking.  It's called alcoholism.  LoL.  We started with the specialty drinks menu "Silky margaritas.  Wow they were strong and poured into large wine glasses.  Followed by the Garden gin martini which was all gin.  For decoration a long sliver of cucumber is added.  With each sip we took, a grimace, ghastly lip curl was made.  That face one makes when they experience harsh flavor.  My buddy drank a quarter of it and told me he would not drink any more.  Specialty drinks are $12 each and the average drinker would have a decent buzz starting with the first.  I would recommend a basic cocktail and avoid specialty drinks of any nature.  We put in an order for a few appetizers which somehow got jacked up in the ordering process.  Although we pointed out the error to different parts of the wait staff the problem was never corrected until the very end when paying.  Service was negligent and people often waited over twenty plus minutes before someone was available for refills or etc's.  I feel that with the gross amount of business recently with the current offer they weren't prepared.  Instead of trying to capture new business via deal sites, management should approach nearby companies or websites which host for networking or happy hour gatherings.  Per their online menu with daily booze specials listed, I know that some of the happy hour groups I participate in would be interested.The food wasn't awesome, it was average stuff.  My buddy has worked a kitchen and felt the meat in their sliders were probably microwaved just before serving.  Of the appetizers ordered, none memorable.  The couple seated next to us enjoyed the buffalo wings and the Cajun shrimp. Would I come back.  Maybe if I happened to be on the Northwestern hospital campus and wanting a stiff drink.  If your aim is to get a date drunk, there ya go and its in a hotel so that's a plus.  Another reviewer commented that flight attendants stay here.  I can confirm that.  If management can score a decent bartender with specialty drink skills, that would be a draw.  Skip the deal site business.  A hotel bar with the look but the feel of a motel bar.

3.description: $25 for the M Avenue breakfast buffet.  $25.  For breakfast meats, eggs, and fruit.  If you ask, they will bring you toast. $25!  For that amount of money, in this city of infinite possibilities, you can do much better.

0.description: I wish I could give them an extra star.This review is about over a year late but better late than never.I worked with the manager to have some friends there for my 29th birthday. I liked the decor and I thought it would be a nice place to celebrate. Boy was it.I requested a cake and I had no idea it was going to be that fresh and delicious. I still think about that cake. The staff was great and paid a lot of attention to my guests. The kitchen was closed and they opened it just for us (we weren't even a large party, 10 people tops). It was a great time. I absolutely loved it.I'm going to have to do a stay-cation at actually hotel soon.

20.description: Went there after a stop at the Apple store right across the street to find this cool contemporary lounge with a cool gas burning fireplace in the middle of the lobby.  After waiting awhile to pickup my damaged iphone, this vibe is what I needed to relax.  I scanned their cocktail list and was suddenly offered a complimentary glass of wine.  The server mentioned that they were pouring free wine from 4:30pm-5:30pm for all guests -hotel and non-hotel.  I accepted a glass a of Cabernet and started to take in my surroundings.  On the cocktail list, they offer daily specials- Monday's beers, Tuesday's off tequila based drinks, including Jose Cuervo margaritas for $4, Wednesday's off wines, Thursday 1/2 off Cocktails, and on my fortunate night on Friday- I treated my self to $5 Baker Manhattan and my girlfriend a $5 mojito with Bacardi during their $5 Fridays.  With these specials and gorgeous space and cool music along with a magnificent location-especially after shopping or a night in the city, M Avenue Lounge is definitely a must for all the Streeterville/Goldcoast hipsters and shoppers.

19.description: we came here for a restaurant week lunch because we were thinking about the allerton for our wedding reception. i love the decor of the newly decorated lobby/bar/restaurant. really great feel. the food and service were also good, which i found surprising since it was so empty when we were there. they did try to serve me a completely flat glass of proseco, which was a little disappointing, and i was not a fan of the bread pudding dessert. but if you're looking for a new place to try for lunch on michigan ave, i would say go!

2.description: Inside the Allerton: I completely agree with Debbie E's review:  a decidedly loungey, Art Deco look, a spacious lounge but because of odd furniture and virtually no walls to break things up for a bit of semi-privacy, it doesn't feel totally comfortable, can't get your sea legs due to the mishmash. However, the bar itself is a nice throwback, as it feels like you walked back into the 1940's, with lots of top shelf liquors and a few excellent draft choices. I ate breakfast here once or twice and its fine: 18 bucks for cold buffet, 22 bucks for both hot and cold, it is more than passable. My service from the waitstaff last Wednesday was exceptional.

18.description: had a travelzoo voucher and came in for lunch,service was a little slow, i asked for coffee after 2 minutes the waiter brought a soda...ordered the m signature onion soup.tasted it and felt it lacked flavor,and watered down.entree was just ok i had the penne with chicken.

13.description: After getting the Travelzoo deal for 3 appetizers and two cocktails each, my bf and I went one day after work. It was pretty decent. Kind of your typical hotel lobby bar but decked out pretty swank. I can't say I'd come here often but if in the hood I'd come back for the very potent martinis.

4.description: Gf got the travelzoo deal. Food wasn't bad. It wasn't great though. Service was the same. Pretty forgettable experience. I don't think I'd go back with other places to eat around the area. Without the travelzoo deal, I'd be more on the 2 star side.

6.description: This is one of those places where you're glad to know it exists to have in your back pocket in case you're on Michigan shopping and want a drink.  I wouldn't plan on coming back.I came in with a travelzoo voucher.  The main guy was friendly.  The guy who brought the food and took away the plates was abrupt.  The food was ok.  I probably wouldn't have food here again.  The drinks were good!  We tried a fruity mojjito, the gin martini and a sazerac.  All well executed and refreshing.

15.description: Sexy! The decor of this place is really open and loungey and dark-- somewhere you could catch up with your girls over a few cocktails or have a secret rendezvous with a lover. I came here to meet up with one of my girls for dinner, and the service was very attentive. Then I looked around and realized there was almost no one there. Strange, considering the food was really good. The braised lamb fell off the bone, but was complemented by some tangy fruit flavor that didn't really appeal to me. The portion was BIG though-- like twice the size of my fist. The bread pudding dessert was nothing to sneeze at either. Probably one of the only times I wasn't able to finish the meal. I didn't have any foodgasms that night, but with the large portions and fair prices, I'd probably come back here for a lunch affair.

7.description: We were staying at the Allerton hotel which houses M Avenue bar.  Since our dinner reservations were not until 9 pm that evening, we decided to check out our hotel bar.  It was very comfortable with couches and pillows to lounge on as you enjoy your drink.  I tried the Pama Kiss Martini, which was awesome.  It was super sweet, yet strong at the same time.  This bar is nice if you are staying at the Allerton or meeting up with someon who us, but I would not seek it out otherwise.

8.description: This cozy bar is on the second floor of the Allerton Hotel.  The lounge area is cute, but very small.  We went early on a Saturday night and there were just a few people there.  The bartender with the long hair makes THE BEST MARTINI ever with St. Germain Liqueur.We asked for food recommendations for a snack and he suggested the quesadillas.  Now, to be fair, I'm from TX and we did tell him that.  They were pretty run of the mill flour tortilla, cheese, chicken and pico, but that's OK.

14.description: Great location, historic building and attentive service make it a 4 star review.  Came for lunch and food was okay.   Fries were not crispy, onion soup a little bland, steak sandwich came med. rare as ordered, but needed seasoning.  Side of fruit was a nice option and was tasty.  Reuben sandwich was good.  If you're in the area, I would check it out.

28.description: Great value laser hair removal. VERY nice people. Brought my younger daughter here - new to laser and very self-conscious. They were great to her. Made her feel very comfortable.Highly recommend.

1.description: WON"T HONOR GROUPONS PURCHASED!  Total Scammers. Tried to get me to purchase Botox at full price after I paid for groupon units....wouldn't let me redeem.  Extremely rude.

9.description: Do not ever go there!!! I only gave 1 star because the nurse was nice and she was trying to make me "happy", what a joke, but unfortunately she doesn't make any decisions. I came with a Groupon, but it was not accepted because I already was there once before sometime last year, normally all businesses accept it if it was more than at least 6 months ago. Office manager tried to push me into using it towards membership which gives discounted rate, but when calculating all the cost - it would have been 20% higher than their regular rate. So why would I wanna do it??? Reported to Groupon, got my refund, but what a terrible business marketing!!! Will never go again and I will tell everyone I know - not to!!!

29.description: This place only gets one star because I have to fill it out. I bought their groupon for laser hair removal. It took me a whole month to actually get my consultation because they kept rescheduling me. They explain I can have my underarms done and when I go for my first appointment they tell me I have to pay an extra $50 to have that area worked on. My appointment was for 1015, I get a confirmation email for 11, then when i got there they tell me they are running late and I have to wait another half hour!  I asked if there was parking and she told me there was plenty of parking. There was no street parking available and called to see if there were any garages or alternative parking areas. She told me to park in front of the yellow blocked off area, put my hazards on and run in and risk it. I am not joking, that was her solution. Horrible customer service! I've never been so frustrated with a company! I would never recommend this establishment. There are much nicer places that will actually treat you like a decent human being. I got my money back and will never go back to this place!

23.description: I am a body builder and have been for some time. I brought my son there with me as we are not from Chicago and the Peninsula wanted $160 for an hour. What a fantastic massage. I have had a few hundred and Susan (make sure to ask for her) did a fabulous job. She found knots even I didn't know I had. I will go there every time I come to Chicago. Terrific.

5.description: I wish I could have given this place 0 star. I bought the hair laser groupon deal. I've been to many places to get the hair laser removal treatment. Believe me, this place is the worst place. I don't see any difference. I always leave tip to Susan, however, there were several times I was called by the receptionist asking for the tip for Susan. I had to tell the receptionist that I already left the tip with Susan. She even made sure I left about $15-20 each time. One day I had an appointment with Susan on Saturday. I was there and believe it or not they were already closed. I was so angry that I came all the way there to find out that they were closed. I left the voice mail complaining about they closed early on Saturday.  No one ever called me back! I would not recommend this place to anyone. Please do not go to this place and run away as soon as you know that your laser hair removal is Susan.

25.description: Unfortunately, I have to agree with the previous one star comments. I have been robbed: I've finished my last laser session (I've had a set of six), and there's ZERO result. I have had laser hair removal on my bikini area in a different salon before (it was a bit of a drive for me though), and after four sessions there wasn't much hair to work on any more. At beauty cell I did armpits. Each session in this salon was painless (which could've been a plus), but completely useless. I mean, really, useless, as if she used a flash light on my armpits. The hair stayed where it was with no shedding. The technician isn't the most caring and nicest person either; she just didn't give a damn (she would work about three to two minutes on each area). The receptionist however, does make sure you tip at least $10-$15...Do yourself a favor and find another place.

12.description: I made a Lifebooker appt for a wax; I really wanted to like this place because it's near downtown and convenient to work. First the receptionist called to reschedule the appt because the waxer doesn't work on Fridays. Okay, weird, but no problem. She rebooked me for a late evening slot, for which I was surprised and grateful. On the day of, she left me two voicemails asking if I could come in any earlier? What? I called back and said, no I can't come earlier. Fine. When I got to the appt, the aesthetician could not have had more of an attitude. I guess she was mad it was so late? I actually offered to leave, it was that uncomfortable. I did stay and get the wax, which was fine. Nothing special, nothing terrible. She did leave wax residue which is not comfortable but not the end of the world either.The experience overall is not worth your time or money, I promise!

21.description: I fell into the Groupon trap.  I knew it when I bought it, but I couldnt help myself.I bought the aromatherapy with Thai bodywork massage.  I called and made an appointment.This is an area where I used to live so I am familiar with the building and the craziness of Streeterville.  The "spa" is basically an office.  The receptionist was super nice.  Susan did my massage in a make shift room with lots of oddities to it, including a step ladder and a crockpot (I think it was warming towles, HA!).  I felt that it was very basic massaging.  I didnt sense anything special with the "supposed" Thai bodywork.  I have had Thai massage and they really get in there.  This massage reminded me more of my husband rubbing my back when I ask him to.  Really mediocre at best.Also, the room I was in was super close to the front desk.  Several times, I thought that someone had walked into the room I was in.  It was difficult to relax.For the groupon price is was A-OK.  I would never pay full price and to be honest, I wouldnt go back on the deal.  There is so many other places that I would rather go to that are cheaper or the same price.

16.description: Unfortunately, I have to agree with the previous one star comments. I have been robbed: I've finished my last laser session (I've had a set of six), and there's ZERO result. I have had laser hair removal on my bikini area in a different salon before (it was a bit of a drive for me though), and after four sessions there wasn't much hair to work on any more. At beauty cell I did armpits. Each session in this salon was painless (which could've been a plus), but completely useless. I mean, really, useless, as if she used a flash light on my armpits. The hair stayed where it was with no shedding. The technician isn't the most caring and nicest person either; she just didn't give a damn (she would work about three to two minutes on each area). The receptionist however, does make sure you tip at least $10-$15...Do yourself a favor and find another place.

17.description: I booked an appointment using a groupon for a 60 minute swedish and thai massage. It was a great deal and my body has been aching for some time now. Even though it was only an hour, I felt like my body was mostly being picked and touched at a surface level and my tensions and knots never really worked on and released. Most of the massages that I get are usually Thai so I was looking forward to when that would kick in, but alas it never really did aside from 2 assisted stretches. I've been trained in some thai yoga bodywork and know what it feels like, and I was left wanting more. If you're going to advertise it a certain way, you should be prepared to deliver...

10.description: I have to give them 3/5 because their pre appointment customer service and their service at the salon are on opposite poles. Bought a Lifebooker and left a message to make an appointment. They did return my call based on who they saw on their caller id- not a good idea! I didn't want my work to receive the call- very high school of them.Called at 8 am to confirm my appt for same day, didn't receive a call back for 5.5 hours which would have been 15 minutes before my appt-it shouldn't take that long to call someone back.At the salon: fantastic receptionist and technician, explained the process and made suggestions which I followed. Excellent customer service once you get in the door!!!

11.description: Be careful..Inquired about price for Botox.Was given a price of 10 per unit and then was told when I was there that the price is $ 14.00 per unit.Classic bait and switch ...not good.

26.description: I would give this place zero stars of it was possible. I scheduled a massage here a month in advance. The day of my massage they call me to confirm and when I get there, there is no massage therapist to be found because he double booked. I had prepaid for my massage (it was cheaper if you did that) and then I asked for a refund the receptionist instead charged me another $60. So they I have to deal with getting $120 back on my credit card. This place is horribly run.

27.description: I'm pretty sure this place is a scam. I had 7 sessions of laser treatments and the area doesn't look any different. I thought the owner was doing my treatments and usually you don't tip the owner if they are doing your service. When I was leaving, the receptionist made a snide remark. If that doesn't turn you off, then I should mention that they asked me if I could come early for my last appointment. When I come early, I find out the receptionist forgot about me and let the technician go home early. I had to wait 20 minutes for the next technician to come. Unbelievable.

0.description: This month marks one year of going here and getting fabulous massages! I was so stressed with work I was coming every week and now it's once a month. Always feel like a million bucks when I walk out. Susan somehow manages to get those super tight knots out of my back every time. Wish I could go more! Def recommend!

20.description: Loved this place! Massin is amazing and does such a great job! Love the staff here too! Will definitely return! Thanks!!

19.description: I went there for a Brazilian from an offer I got from lifebooker. I personally really liked this place. She was quick and clean and kept good conversation which makes the process easier. If you're used to getting waxed you would really like this place. The only complaint I have is that it was really difficult to schedule an appointment because the woman who waxes isn't there everyday, only three times a week I believe. It is also normally on the pricey side too. $55 for a Brazilian. Otherwise if it's convenient then go for it.

2.description: Second appointment, second time I was stood up. No response from the phone messages I've left.

18.description: Again, I echo the 0 star sentiment. I threw money away at this place buying a laser Groupon deal. Not only was it ineffective but the receptionist was rude when she called to ask if I could come to my appointment early and hustles you for tips.   Completely uncomfortable. I strongly recommend never going here.

13.description: BEWARE - The customer service here is despicable. I first went in for a botox treatment with nurse practitioner Roslyn, who repeatedly asked me for a tip both before, during, and after the treatment. This made me extremely uncomfortable and she was not gentle whatsoever in her administration of the units. I had to remind her to use alcohol swabs on each area before the injections, and I left my first appointment with bruises at each injection site. I have never bruised from botox injections.I took before and after photos, and there was not one bit of difference after two full weeks (which is how long it takes for the botox effectiveness to peak). I called and complained, as this was not the first time with botox and I am familiar enough with it to know what to expect. I specifically stated that I was not going to pay for any additional units, and they asked me to come in and let Roslyn see my forehead. I arrived to my appointment 15 minutes early, and the office was closed. I called the main line and was put on hold for 10 minutes. When I called back they told me that she was running late but would be there soon. I regurgitated my story to her and she offered me an additional 20 units, which I had again stated that I would not be paying for. After administering the injections, she charged me $15 a unit and had the audacity yet again to ask me if I was going to be leaving her a tip. Because their computers were not running, she made me write on a blank piece of paper that I authorized the charge to my credit card.I have called repeatedly to speak to someone to complain, and my calls are not getting returned. Never in my life have I been so uncomfortable or disappointed in not only the quality of work done, but also by the customer service. Do not get drawn in by the discounted Groupon rates. This place is unprofessional and there are so many better locations in Chicago that offer specials with Groupon that will treat you with respect.

4.description: Horrible place!  I think they use noxema instead of lotion.  I have had my share of massages and every time I was massaged on the front and back side.  This place only massaged one side and the table wasn't the cleanest. One good thing...it was in inexpensive groupon!!!

24.description: I booked an appointment using a groupon for a 60 minute swedish and thai massage. It was a great deal and my body has been aching for some time now. Even though it was only an hour, I felt like my body was mostly being picked and touched at a surface level and my tensions and knots never really worked on and released. Most of the massages that I get are usually Thai so I was looking forward to when that would kick in, but alas it never really did aside from 2 assisted stretches. I've been trained in some thai yoga bodywork and know what it feels like, and I was left wanting more. If you're going to advertise it a certain way, you should be prepared to deliver...

6.description: Botox Scam.  I purchased a Groupon and paid for extra units separately.  I don't know what they injected me with but I don't think it was botox.  I have been using botox for years and know exactly what the results look like.  There is no visible difference from when I walked in.  Not to mention they use the biggest most painful needle I have ever felt.  You could actually hear the skin pop as they inserted the needle.  That's a first ever for me in 8 years.  I would never recommend this facility.

22.description: Again, I echo the 0 star sentiment. I threw money away at this place buying a laser Groupon deal. Not only was it ineffective but the receptionist was rude when she called to ask if I could come to my appointment early and hustles you for tips.   Completely uncomfortable. I strongly recommend never going here.

15.description: VERY difficult to get someone on the phone.  My initial visit with the male physician assistant was great.  My second with the nurse was pleasant too.  Prices aren't competitive unless you become a member, but why would you if booking is such a chore?

7.description: This place is a JOKE! Where can I start off.. Well, I made an appointment a week ago for the 20 unit Botox that I purchased through Groupon. My appointment was scheduled today, 7-24-15 at 6:30 pm. I made sure I asked the receptionist Darin that my appt was on the 24th at 6:30 pm and he said yes. I arrived to the building not knowing what floor the suite was on. So I called the number that was provided on the Groupon and a women picks up, I can't remember if her name was Shannon or Stephanie and asked her that I had a appt at 6:30 and wasn't sure what floor The Beauty Cell was on. Well she was a bit confused and said that everyone has left for the day and there was no apportionment for Botox at 6:30. Oh boy was I furious... I went up to floor 4 and saw suite 412 was closed. Great!! So I called her back and was complaining about how unprofessional this was to do to their customers. I had driven 45 mins out of my way in Friday traffic to find out they left. She told me I was not even in the system! I mean the women did not even let me finish a sentence. Every time I tried to speak she got upset and HUNG UP ON ME! So I called back so upset thinking to myself how can a "professional business" do this to their customers. Yes I get it, it wasn't her fault. But honey you don't hang up on your customers, especially not me.. So damn rude. This is the best part! Hahaa, she actually gave me 5 extra units if I didn't complain on yelp. Wow... I will never be coming to this place again.

8.description: I fell into the Groupon trap.  I knew it when I bought it, but I couldnt help myself.I bought the aromatherapy with Thai bodywork massage.  I called and made an appointment.This is an area where I used to live so I am familiar with the building and the craziness of Streeterville.  The "spa" is basically an office.  The receptionist was super nice.  Susan did my massage in a make shift room with lots of oddities to it, including a step ladder and a crockpot (I think it was warming towles, HA!).  I felt that it was very basic massaging.  I didnt sense anything special with the "supposed" Thai bodywork.  I have had Thai massage and they really get in there.  This massage reminded me more of my husband rubbing my back when I ask him to.  Really mediocre at best.Also, the room I was in was super close to the front desk.  Several times, I thought that someone had walked into the room I was in.  It was difficult to relax.For the groupon price is was A-OK.  I would never pay full price and to be honest, I wouldnt go back on the deal.  There is so many other places that I would rather go to that are cheaper or the same price.

3.description: Yes, this place is extremely dishonest. I have received many Botox injections at OTHER clinics through the years, always successful and effective.  I received injections at the Beauty Cell and they were completely ineffective.  I suspect that they used saline or god-knows-what!  I have before and after pictures and I have opened investigations with the FDA and the professional licensing board of Illinois.  Through this investigation I have learned that I should have been screened by a doctor and I was never seen by one.  And how to spot vials that have tampered with or are not Botox.The receptionist is an extremely aggressive con artist.  I was swindled into buying the membership. And I was asked to pay a tip to the "nurse" (who's license I never was able to find on record).  I have never been asked to pay a tip to a nurse.  And yes the managing doctor was Brian Murray, the one who is on probation for taking money for pre-certifying patients for marijuana prescriptions. There is reportedly new management.  Beware ElleHomme spa is part of the same group and I suspect that New Body and Face Spa is as well.

14.description: I bought a Groupon and was suckered into a second one by the receptionist -beware! The first massage was good. But for the second one my first masseuse has quit supposedly. Instead I  was scheduled with a girl who massaged with the tips of her two fingers one hand at a time!  Definitely a bait and switch.  Yes, the spa is on the third or fourth floor of an office building right in front the NMH hospital (so you do hear ambulances going by every 20minutes during the massage). But I was willing to overlook this ambiance problem if the massage was worth it.

58.description: Busy place during lunch on weekdays.  Burrito bowls are decent - the rice is a bit too sticky/moist for my liking, but the steak was tasty (although, a bit dry).  They have your standard burritos, burrito bowls, and tacos.  I haven't tried everything on the menu (really, just the steak on most occasions), but they do have shrimp and various marinades for their chicken, so a bit more variety than their neighbors (Chipotle, Qdoba).Chipotle is very close to here, and I think Chipotle is much better.  The prices with regards to getting grilled veggies and extra meat is better at Chipotle, if that's what you always load your burrito with (I always do.)EDIT:  Edited my review a bit to distinguish my claim on the slightly higher prices after the owner reached out to me for some clarification.  Happy to do so, and glad that he said he'll try to get the rice less moist and get the steak more moist!  Like it a lot when owners contact me, so definitely a plus there.  Will probably give it a shot again one of these days when I get sick of Chipotle...

56.description: Restaurant update:I continue to frequent burrito beach for the steak burritos. The beef has a good flavor and the protein portions are definitely better than when I first visited back in 2010. Service is overall problem friend and friendly for the most part. They haven't been running facebook promotions for free burritos anymore though...Hidden deals:Same as before. Four square checkin first time for 1 dollar burrito and subsequent check-in you get free guac/chip small.

29.description: Better than the other fast food burrito joints. Loved the Chicken Chorizo burrito.

42.description: I live around the corner from here, and let me tell you- Walk another block northeast, where Qdoba and Chipotle are comfortably located. Both of those chains have significantly better food than Burrito Beach.The Burritos, the tacos, the chips, the quesadillas: All of those items taste better and are a few bucks cheaper at Qdoba.Burrito Beach is a locally established mini chain with a few restaurants in the area, but the food just isn't good at all. I gave it about 4,5 chances because of its convenience, and each time I left disappointed.In area that really lacks in quality Mexican food (be it fast food or sit down),  Burrito Beach epitomizes the area's deficiencies as far as Mexican delectables.

23.description: Me at a Burrito Beach?  Even when I checked in on Yelp someone thought I had taken a wrong turn given my usual Mexican fare tends to be a little more upscale.  And I had some trepidation as I pushed through the door as this didn't look like a place that I was going to like.But I have to say that I was impressed on this visit at the freshness of the food, the wide array of choices and the friendliness of the staff and manager (owner?)I was in the mood for a salad bowl and I saw that they had Mexican quinoa which is also a good source of protein.  While the serving size of quinoa was quite small- the other condiments that filled my bowl were quite robust from the mixed greens, to the mixed veggies, to the guacamole with big chunks of avocado, and the spicy salsa this was one tasty bowl of food.  And as I went to the condiment bar to get a fork and knife, the manager asked if I had found everything okay and was very friendly and personable.The seats were clean, the price was right and if there had been just a smidge more quinoa, this would have gotten a perfect score. Surprising as I really didn't think I was going to like this place when I walked in the door.  Guess you can't really judge a book by it's cover!

47.description: I ordered the shrimp burrito and watched the guy behind the counter sprinkle a few measly shrimp onto a bed of rice and beans and then carelessly toss the partially finished burrito onto the counter where it sat for what seemed like an eternity before someone else picked it up and asked me what sort of salsa i want.Other than that, the service was okay but my burrito was pretty bleh. The shrimp tasted old and was oversalted, the "jack cheese + sour cream" in the menu description was missing and the rest of the filling was relatively bland. It was also disappointingly small for $6.50. But I guess that's what I get for going to a "Mexican" place in Streeterville. Next time I'm there around lunchtime, I think I'll just take the bus home and eat there.

8.description: A chipotle style place, it was good with different style of cookin the meats of course, asked for hot sauce and it was hot liked I hoped

31.description: Chicken and chorizo with green sauce. Ultra good. Wife had steak and thought the same. Been here on previous visits and the quality has been high on each visit. Highly recomended.

34.description: I was so happy to find a location open on Sundays! I used to frequent the Michigan Avenue location. I used to go everyday for lunch and get nachos-sometimes chicken, sometimes beef. I cannot get enough of those damn nachos! I also like the tacos. I was surprised but pleased to see that they serve Intelligentsia coffee. The ingredients always taste fresh and of a pretty decent quality. The strawberry lemonade was tasty too.

16.description: Cabo shrimp burrito so tasty.  I love when a fast food type Mexican place has a shrimp option because I'm not a chicken fan.  The guac and salsa are delicious too - wayyyy better than Chipotle.  I will never understand why all of Chicagoland is obsessed with that place.  Go to Qdoba or burrito beach for superior fake Mexican food!

13.description: Husband says he does not regret this decision and wanted another one immediately after finishing. Close contender to Chipotle. Huge burritos and very tasty! If you're at Union station try it out! Don't go to mcdonalds over this!

11.description: Delicious and tasty breakfast burritos!  Great deal too. My entire family ate for $12!!!At breakfast it is nice and empty because nobody thinks to go to a Mexican restaurant for breakfast!  Highly recommended!

39.description: While most people believe that Chipotle is #1, Qdoba is #2, and Burrito Beach is the lowly #3 in the hierarchy of mass chain "Mexican" burrito fast food joints, this Burrito Beach is about 20 feet from my work, which makes it a solid #2 in my book. I love the option of Spanish rice instead of boring white or healthy brown, their burrito bowls are big enough for you to actually mix your ingredients without accidentally tossing half of them out on the table, and they have shrimp and brisket as a meat options. SHRIMP! My favorite thing to get is the steak tacos but I think the steak burrito is a better value for the same price. They also service breakfast and while it's not the awesome variety provided by some (I'm looking at you, Chick-fil-a) it does include large slices of bacon and the Ketchipotle option which a lot of people really like. The service is usually pretty fast and they don't give you dirty looks when you ask for extra lettuce or cheese.

37.description: Great breakfast burrito. You show up at 10 am on a Sunday and they not longer have any breakfast. On top of that they are rude to customers

0.description: This place was walking distance from my hotel, so I figured I'd try it. Really fast service, friendly staff, different menu items than chipotle/Qdoba & they have breakfast burritos! Cheap & pretty good overall.

38.description: This is a solid 4 star fast-casual restaurant.  I think its a great addition to your dinner or lunch rotation.  I guess it can be compared to Chipolte but the food and the vibe are quite different, in my opinion.  I've been here several times and have always enjoyed my chicken burritos.  The service has been good and there is always a lot of room to sit (although I have gone at odd times).

51.description: Chipotle is better.The burrito I had was just bland! Even with copious amounts of hot sauce I just couldn't get it to taste like anything other than reheated chicken.I don't think I will eat here again as there are non in Minneapolis anyways, but if in Chicago, I certainly wouldn't eat here. I did however like the customer service. They are fast and friendly which is a plus, and he even attempted to help me make my favorite burrito that I get at Chipotle!

27.description: loved this place when I was in Chicago!  So much better than Chipotle or Qdoba!  The Cabo Shrimp burrito was my favorite and their hot sauces...! If you need something quick and good - definitely the place for you!

32.description: I almost never eat out anywhere, 'cos I'm too poor.  But today I went out for an errand at lunchtime, passed by this Burrito Beach (which I've bypassed many times before) -- with money in my pocket and craving a change from my Ramen noodles.Didn't expect to like it.  All the items seemed to have some ingredient I wasn't crazy about (goat cheese, blue cheese, cilantro).  Finally chose the veggie burrito, to go.It was fast and very reasonable, with my NU discount.  And much better than I expected.  The veggies weren't overdone and had a nice firm texture.  The other reviewers were right that they go heavy on the onions, but I liked it that way (and you can probably ask them to tone it down, if you're quick enough).  Did have cilantro in it, but I didn't seem to mind it.Too much food for a little person like me; made me extra sleepy in the afternoon.  Didn't want any dinner, either.Sure, it's not like a burrito from a *real* Mexican joint, but it is what it is, and I thought it was pretty good.

54.description: This place is lacking. I tried this place for brekkie. I got a chorizo burrito that was smaller and not filled up as much as the way i am used to at most burrito places. The tortilla fell apart ez too. Wont be back. Tooo many options in the area.

48.description: I'm stuck between Meh & A-OK, I'd like to go 3 stars but I just can't. Burrito Beach is down the street from my office, and there's a reason I've only been here 3 times in almost 3 years for lunch. The guacamole is good, chips are decent but not as good as Chipotle's. I just have a problem with the main entrees, I'm not a huge fan of any of their options. I think the chicken is kinda dry and wayyyyyy too spicy. I've finally learned my lesson, after eating lunch here I normally have to go get something somewhere else to satisfy whatever it was I was wanting to eat. I'm curious about the breakfast burritos, maybe one of these days I'll have to give those a shot & update. Otherwise, I'm gonna continue to skip this beach unless I have a mid-afternoon craving for chips & guacamole or something simple like a cheese quesadilla.

44.description: Being that I'm not from around here, I have no idea of what Burrito Beach is "famous" for.  I ordered a grilled chicken bowl and it was good, but not great. Definitely not in Chipotle's league, but good enough to satisfy a craving for mexican food and seemed to have a lot of healthy options.  Extra credit for having nutritional information on their website.

24.description: Line moves quickly and a lot loss crowded than chipotle.

7.description: First time I've ever had Burrito Beach before.  I was skeptical because I'm a fan of authentic Mexican food so I kinda figured it was going to be a knockoff Chipotle but I was pleasantly surprised.  It was pretty good.  I ordered the Chicken and Chorizo Burrito.  Its roughly the same size as a Chipotle burrito but the glaring difference was the taste.  The add chorizo added another level of spice to it which was perfect.   The one thing I liked about it is they had different options of meat you could put in your burrito besides just chicken, beef and steak.  The one negative to my experience is I had a $5 off coupon that the workers there did not know how to honor.  So I had to spend 10 minutes waiting on a worker to call his manager on the phone and talk him into how to discount my meal.   But after that was resolved, everything else was good.

49.description: I had the cheddar chicken quesadilla with onions and pablano peppers - it was just what I wanted. A little oily but that probably just made it more delicious.

40.description: I don't understand why there are so many mediocre reviews--maybe it's because it's a small/local/relatively unknown chain. But I was recently convinced by a friend to stop by and finally try a burrito, and now all I can think about is the mouth-watering cabo shrimp! Seriously, it has a really distinct taste--tangy/robust with fresh vegetables and salsa and sour cream to balance out all the flavors. Lots of shrimp, too. No other local burrito place has that kind of flavor and quality for that low of a price (~$6)! Competitive Analysis: Qdoba: similar in terms of "unusual" flavors, but the closest location to Burrito Beach closed down recently. Burrito Beach burritos tend to be a little larger and more robust than sweet/zesty like the Qdoba burritos I've tried. Disclaimer: I don't eat really meat/chicken at these places so I can't compare those types of options.Chipotle: always  delicious but no shrimp/flavor like this! But Chipotle burritos do tend to be bigger bang for your buck, because the burritos are often stuffed to the max. Bottom-line: Add a Northwestern or University of Chicago 10% discount (show your student ID) and you can get a really great deal for lunch. Plus, it's owned by a UChicago grad (sign posted by register about the restaurant's history), and I like supporting entrepreneurial initiatives! Try your burrito with a mango juice or horchata drink on the side to get the whole Burrito Beach experience. Confession: I've had the cabo shrimp burrito 3x the past week... #noshame

53.description: Burrito beach makes a fresh, tasty breakfast burrito.  My standard order is chorizo, egg, guacamole and hot salsa.  It may not be the best breakfast burrito in the world but is pretty darn good.The burrito is made fresh while you watch.  Eggs scrambled on a hot griddle with your choice of meat.  Fresh, chunky guacamole added immediately before the burrito is rolled.  Very fresh and very tasty!

30.description: The chicken and chorizo burrito was amazing; unfortunately, the next time I visited here I found out that was a limited time menu item. The buffalo chicken burrito was good, nothing great. The service was friendly and efficient, and manager was walking around ensuring the soda and condiment bar was clean.

46.description: I have to bump this rating up a notch, seeing that I eat here all the time.  I still love their shrimp bowl, guac, and veggie quesadillas.  For the days I'm looking for healthier options, they have a great quinoa with beans and corn that are great served in a salad, with a taco, or on it's own. And their seasonal soups are hearty. So some of the fixes include better care of their fountain for drinks and a super friendly staff, who I look forward to chatting with on my visits.

1.description: I suppose this is Chicago's chain alternative to Chipotle, but honestly it's not even close.We came in early in the morning, that meant they had a breakfast menu in effect. Can't argue against having breakfast burritos and bowls. So breakfast seemed promising given the options on the menu. I Ordered the chorizo breakfast burrito and my girlfriend chose the veggie breakfast burrito. Immediately after I ordered the breakfast burrito a man had came in and asked about that, and the lady that first took my order tells him that the veggies aren't that fresh. Where's the heads up for me? Also noticed the guacamole and the chorizo were sort of discolored. So as you could imagine, my girlfriend wasn't that satisfied with her burrito and my chorizo burrito was just ok. The spicy salsas they have made it taste better, but I've had better.I'd recommend looking for something else and if your search produces nothing, then give Burrito Beach a go.

55.description: Nice standard big non-authentic burritos. The great thing about this place is their website, which lets you build your burrito and see how many calories you are about to consume. Its nice because then you think if you really need that extra guac or full fat sour cream. I mean the BBQ chicken bowl with white (as opposed to the more calorie red rice), FF black beans, all the salsas and veggies is a grand and tasty meal for under 500 calories.Ok wait, why I am talking about calories and not the food, because really the food quality and taste is about what you'd expect in a burrito place. Nothing mind blasting but better at non-Mexican restaurants. I guess it helps that I get a 10% discount for being a NMH employee so I continue to frequent this place when I need a good meal at a good price.

9.description: Not bad tacos for the price. Quick and convenient. Asada chicken, if you are going with a chicken option, is the way to go. A nice grilled taste with the right amount of flavor. Their other options, especially the buffalo chicken were over spiced. The buffalo was to much vinegar for me and was not cooked, but rather just chicken drenched in sauce. It's really one of the only options for tacos around Northwestern Hospital.

26.description: As soon as we dropped our bags at our hotel we needed to eat ASAP.  Hotel sent us to Ohio Street and we chose Burrito Beach.  Place was clean and had seats lining the window to watch the city go by.  Fast service, interesting ingredients.  I got the Shrimp Quinoa Burrito and added Goat Cheese.  I loved the burrito and it was so huge.  Plus with the Quinoa it kept me full for quite some time.  They had several options so I could really customize, which I appreciated.  Quick service, nice servers.  Came in with a large party of 8 and they had us fed very quickly.  Would definitely return.

25.description: Chipotle= 3 star; Burrito Beach 4 star. Loved their Baja chicken burrito and would love to try cabo shrimp burrito next time. Some people say their food is too spicy, it's definitely not an issue for me. Their spicy level is like 3 out of 10 points scale from my perspective. Staffs were friendly and nice. Asked for adding a bit more guacamole, a whole spoon of extra guacamole was put in my  burrito. So generous! Price is cheaper than chipotle. What else can I say when the food is cheap and delicious at the same time?

12.description: The menu looks to be desired but the Burritos are nothing special ... Lack of chicken amount and flavor.

59.description: Definitely sub-par compared to Qdoba or Chipotle. Meat is drierSalsas are just ok....It's fine if you don't have an alternate nearby but for this location with Qdoba right around the corner there's little reason to come here....

21.description: First time in here we had a communication problem, manager contacted us and made it worth our while to come back. Very tasty. Glad we gave it another shot! Thank you, we will be back!

17.description: If you're looking for chipotle but not chipotle, this place is a good option. The nachos are a nice variation.

10.description: First time here, visiting town.  Had the steak tacos with a side of guacamole.  The tacos were delicious.  The steak was tender and flavorful. Bathe guac was really good and tasted homemade.

5.description: Think really good Mexican food with a Chipotle-like set up. You walk in to a line, you choose your meal base, meat,toppings etc. I had the Chicken burrito with a spinach wrap. They offer tacos (3per order) and comboa. They also had the option of guacomole and chips for $2.99, lots of the people that work in the area kept purchasing it-but I was already extra stuffed with my burrito I opted against the additions. With the burrito and a fountain drink,my total was $9.15- about 85¢ cheaper than ordering just a burrito in NYC but much more filling. There are multiple areas for seating-a countertop with stools along the window and multiple chairs tables I did not need to use the bathroom,so I have no review for it. But, I appreciated that they had a revolving door for patrons to use, so less cold air came in from opening and closing the regular door. But, its still there as an option. I went on a Month day around 2pm, The staff didn't rush you to finish your meal or give up the seat thank goodness.The downside to the place is the way the cashier rush you, while you're trying to ask them about other items in addition to your food. Also, the soda and iced tea dispensers looked like they've never been cleaned since last month, you could see dust and dried splash spots all over. I plan on returning to Chicago to try the other locations, and will update accordingly.

3.description: Easy on the wallet and hearty, especially after a day shopping the Magnificent Mile. This location was solid with traffic the whole time I was there and the many times we passed it going back and forth to our hotel down the street. It seemed to get a good crowd of locals eating in or picking up dinner on their way home and tourists or shoppers in from out of town. It's a Subway style Mexican place with a simple menu. Pick your frame: tacos, burrito, bowl, nachos. Then add a protein, and end with some toppings: salsa, sour cream, guacamole, cheese, lettuce, onions, tomato, etc. They have standard sodas and homemade cookies, too. I had shrimp tacos with corn tortillas. They were well-seasoned, but not too exciting. The hot salsa was hotter, better than I expected, though. It was rich and not bitter. The ingredients and toppings seemed fresh and tasted good, and the tortillas were handled well. There are better options for more authentic, interesting Mexican food in Chicago -- even in this area, but this is a solid, quick choice.

35.description: I love this place.  Great food, efficient, nice room, clean.  I look forward to going here.  Really prefer it to Chipotle (which isn't bad.).

19.description: It was okay. Kind of run of the mill. If there was a Chipotle around,I would have definitely gone there instead. Service could have been nicer and a bit more engaging.

28.description: Better than chipotle or moes! We wanted something quick and filling so we decided to stop here and im glad we did. The workers were very friendly, the rice and chicken is perfect. It tastes very authentic. The guacamole was also very good. Not too pricey either. The burritos are also huge, so that's a plus. I recommend!

45.description: I was staying nearby and decided to give this place a try. I was thinking it was more along the lines of Qdoba or Panchero's and for the most part I was right. I ordered the Mexican chicken soup (not chowder), and it was pretty tasty although a bit on the spicy side. I did sample some beef nachos and they were decent--i just wasn't thrilled at the fact that the ground beef and nacho cheese looked as if it had been sitting out for awhile. The guy also had to scrape the bottom of the barrel to fill up my cup of soup...so obviously the menu items aren't the freshest. On the up-side though: it is inexpensive and gives you the opportunity to build your meal!

33.description: First time I've ever had Burrito Beach before.  I was skeptical because I'm a fan of authentic Mexican food so I kinda figured it was going to be a knockoff Chipotle but I was pleasantly surprised.  It was pretty good.  I ordered the Chicken and Chorizo Burrito.  Its roughly the same size as a Chipotle burrito but the glaring difference was the taste.  The add chorizo added another level of spice to it which was perfect.   The one thing I liked about it is they had different options of meat you could put in your burrito besides just chicken, beef and steak.  The one negative to my experience is I had a $5 off coupon that the workers there did not know how to honor.  So I had to spend 10 minutes waiting on a worker to call his manager on the phone and talk him into how to discount my meal.   But after that was resolved, everything else was good.

43.description: I am writing an update to my previous review. although my initial feelings have not really changed, i have however been contacted by the owner Greg and i was very impressed with his response. He was calm, cool and collected and has in every way tried to rectify my experience. i appreciate when an owner operator takes these situations seriously and works with their patrons to improve their operation. one thing we sometimes forget, is that these places are their livelihood and our reactions to our experiences directly dictates future patrons.

2.description: Me at a Burrito Beach?  Even when I checked in on Yelp someone thought I had taken a wrong turn given my usual Mexican fare tends to be a little more upscale.  And I had some trepidation as I pushed through the door as this didn't look like a place that I was going to like.But I have to say that I was impressed on this visit at the freshness of the food, the wide array of choices and the friendliness of the staff and manager (owner?)I was in the mood for a salad bowl and I saw that they had Mexican quinoa which is also a good source of protein.  While the serving size of quinoa was quite small- the other condiments that filled my bowl were quite robust from the mixed greens, to the mixed veggies, to the guacamole with big chunks of avocado, and the spicy salsa this was one tasty bowl of food.  And as I went to the condiment bar to get a fork and knife, the manager asked if I had found everything okay and was very friendly and personable.The seats were clean, the price was right and if there had been just a smidge more quinoa, this would have gotten a perfect score. Surprising as I really didn't think I was going to like this place when I walked in the door.  Guess you can't really judge a book by it's cover!

18.description: I've eaten here a couple of times but I have to agree with other reviewers thar this place is expensive. I purchased a rice and beans bowl. It seemed that as you go down the line the spoonful shrinks. Everything I asked for was only half a spoonful. If you are going to give small portions then usw a smaller spoon. I left feeling robbed of my meal. Also I ended up paying 8 dollars for a bowl that didn't have meat in it.

41.description: ok food, a bit expensive compared to chipotle

52.description: Over the past five or so years, this areas become kind of gritty.  The Seven-Eleven across the street is on the Homeless Alcoholic's map of Chicago.  The Inn of Chicago glammed up their lobby, but pimps still miss the hotel's hourly rates back when they were a Best Western.ANYWAY, this Burrito Beach is pretty good.  They're not open super late but later than most places in the area.  Love the feta & bean burrito.  The Cabo shrimp burrito is great.

50.description: they had average tacos. their corn tortillas didnt radiate the corny flava flave that i usually love in really good corn tortillas, but it was still decent.not the greatest mexican wannabe food, so 3/5 for yummy food but not really outstanding.

4.description: This was ....ok. It's a Chipotle-style fast casual restaurant, but with confusing menu options. The chorizo chicken meat was extremely oily and I felt like I was going to get heartburn later. It's food, but it's no fun. I don't think the quality of the food is even worth the price.

6.description: Review for breakfast only.  Another Qdoba/Chipolte model. Paid $10 for breakfast for 2 with a coffee & a cookie. Filling. Quick. Friendly service.

22.description: I went here for lunch before the lunch rush. At 1130, there was no one in line. I ordered great tasting veggie tacos that come with chips and salsa, got extra guac, and a rather bad mango agua fresca. The kicker was the price-it seemed a bit high, so I requested the receipt. Cashier charged me for salsa and chips included in meal, and left off charge for guac. Instead of apologizing and refunding me, Cashier explained 3 times that it's only a 70 cent difference.I get it. Please refund me for your mistake.Cashier fished in their tip jar, handing me pennies and making me look like an ass for asking for a refund.Uhh, thanks?Bottom line: better than chipotle. Horrible sassy service.

15.description: TL;DR: The burrito was really good, but I draw the line at being overcharged.I passed this place every day on a temporary assignment downtown and finally stopped in to give it a try. The people who worked there were nice enough, the place looked clean and well-taken care of and the food looked fresh and definitely made me want to eat. I ordered an asada chicken burrito and guac with chips. Both were very good, no complaints about taste, quality or quantity, but the price? I was too distracted at the time, so I didn't realize that my $6 odd dollar burrito magically came to out $8.50. I didn't order any extras, so what gives?! Tax is high, but it ain't *that* high. So needless to say, I'm not a happy camper and probably won't be going back.

57.description: Nice alternative to Chipotle (but not necessarily better than, just different) if you are looking for a quick bite. (also a good dollar or so cheaper than chipotle for the burrito and their guac is only an extra 90 cents instead of chipotle's crazy $2).  I got the goat cheese black bean burrito and I thought it was delicious, especially with added veggies and some hot sauce (passed on the rice).  Boyfriend got the baja chicken burrito, he didn't really like it and thought it was bland.  He felt that compared to chipotle there was less filling and more tortilla. So summary:  go and eat the black bean and goat cheese burrito, maybe pass on the baja chicken one.

20.description: Cabo shrimp burrito so tasty.  I love when a fast food type Mexican place has a shrimp option because I'm not a chicken fan.  The guac and salsa are delicious too - wayyyy better than Chipotle.  I will never understand why all of Chicagoland is obsessed with that place.  Go to Qdoba or burrito beach for superior fake Mexican food!

36.description: Just had the healthiest and best tasting lunch. The organic quinoa salad was amazing!Their Guac is best in town and also love their breakfast burritos.

14.description: I ate it just coz I was hungry.  Not a good value for the money.  Not enough amount and not a good taste too.

58.description: I was visiting Chicago from out of town. After a 5 hour dive we arrived at our hotel and were hungry! We had never been to Chicago before so we started walking around and stumbled across this gem. Out of our whole trip, this was our favorite place to eat! We ended up coming here twice! Severs were very nice. ORANGE JUICE IS FRESH SQUEEZED AND AMAZING!! I recommend the blueberry wonut and the banana pancakes! Delicious!!! If I ever go back to Chicago, this will be my first stop!

56.description: Arrived and saw there were about three groups waiting for a table. We were told the wait would be about 25-30 minutes. We opted to get food to go... It's been 25 minutes and we still have yet to get our to go order. If we hadn't already paid, we would have left long ago. This is ridiculous.

29.description: They have gluten free waffles! Need I say more? But really, the food is excellent and the service is really above and beyond. I will definitely be coming back!

42.description: I know you all are hard working men and women here. I felt that when I walk in, but with all respect your customer service sucks.  Waited about 6 minutes to get a menu (the place wasn't even half full), and then a guy with a bad attitude came up and asked for what I want. Except the one African American gentleman there, I would say, the rest of the waiters don't know what they are doing.  (One of the stars are just for him, otherwise I would rate the lowest)Anyway, after a few minutes they borough my pancake and orange juice. Pancake was half burned and the juice was hot! Plus when you charge $10.95 for a one topic pancake, you really shouldn't charge $1 extra for the maple syrup. Again, I know you work hard, but people pay to get good food and good service.

23.description: Very good waffle place! I got the waffle sandwiches and really enjoyed it! Great atmosphere and in an awesome part of town. Very different than the norm too, small waffles, makes it unique.

47.description: Came for the wonuts and should have left after getting them. Unfortunately, also tried the Eggs Benedict Waffle dish and I immediately had a stomach ache after. This was the first dish I ate that morning so it can't be from anything else. Even the orange juice that is supposedly fresh squeezed using this cute gimmicky whirling machine was meh. Weirdly way too sweet. I only recommend this place for wonuts. I had raspberry and green tea. Green tea was amazingly yummy and raspberry was good but not as tasty. Service here is okay, not great. Plenty of time I have been ignored because server walking around was not serving my section. My server was no where to be found, had to ask people to call for them. Note* they do provide free wifi. Only 1 washroom for girls and 1 for boys. Must get a key for it too.

8.description: I deducted a star for the bathroom... Seriously smelled so bad I almost threw up my waffles.... The waffles however were divine!  Really liked the red velvet.

31.description: Came here because of a Groupon discount and had the steak and eggs. The steak was a little spicy and the eggs were over cooked. The service was just ok. Had to ask for silverware, sugar and cream and then noticed that the napkins holder on the table was empty.

34.description: This place was very good I had the steak & egg torta along with a side of waffles. The waffles were amazing I would recommend the Mexican waffle. The customer service was great as well.

16.description: Ate breakfast here on a visit to the city. Service was rough, we were ignored half the time and even had to get up and pour ourselves more coffee. Food was okay - however the plain side of waffles were great! We left with a to go red velvet wonut which was delicious!Advice: come in and grab a wonut to-go, skip the rest of the food and avoid poor service.

13.description: We came here while on conference in Chicago.  We wanted a brunch spot that had good breakfast items and this placetotally delivered. From the egg plates and waffle shaped hash browns their foods were off the hook.  We had several types of waffles from the liege, to the chicken and waffle and a couple wonuts.  Every item was delicious and we left full and loving the items we tried.  We will be back!

11.description: Came for the wonuts and should have left after getting them. Unfortunately, also tried the Eggs Benedict Waffle dish and I immediately had a stomach ache after. This was the first dish I ate that morning so it can't be from anything else. Even the orange juice that is supposedly fresh squeezed using this cute gimmicky whirling machine was meh. Weirdly way too sweet. I only recommend this place for wonuts. I had raspberry and green tea. Green tea was amazingly yummy and raspberry was good but not as tasty. Service here is okay, not great. Plenty of time I have been ignored because server walking around was not serving my section. My server was no where to be found, had to ask people to call for them. Note* they do provide free wifi. Only 1 washroom for girls and 1 for boys. Must get a key for it too.

39.description: Met a friend here the other day and absolutely loved it. I try to eat gluten-free and oftentimes have to avoid waffles but not here! The Cinnamon Sugar wonut was tasty. Reminded me of a churro a but a little lighter. My friend had no clue it was gluten free!  My GF waffles (4 small round) with whipped cream and strawberries were perfect! The service was attentive and friendly. I will definitely be back!

37.description: Did someone say wonuts!?!?! One of the most delicious things human has ever created. We ordered breakfast (room service) wafflescafechicago.com/r… too... don't remember how we felt about the breakfast... doesn't matter. This place should be all about wonuts anyways. I can't imagine waffles or donuts the same way anymore. There should (yet shouldn't) be more wonuts in the world.

0.description: This is a great little hole-in-the-wall place.  We come here about once every 1-2 months for a ladies brunch before going to see a movie.  It's BYOB, so we always bring in a couple bottles of champagne and get their orange juice to make mimosas, and it's never been an issue.We've had varying experiences here, but I think as we've become more 'regulars' we've gotten better service.  One time I made a reservation and we got there and were told there was no record of it.  Trying to fit in our group of 7 wasn't easy.  Every other time it's been fine.Sometimes the service was spotty, but that seems to depend on the server.  We had Fabrizio on Saturday, and he was great.  Very accommodating, checked on us frequently, and even split our checks out for a group of 9 (which we didn't specifically ask for, but was nice).For the food, I always stick with the waffles.  I've gotten other things, like the omelet and the waffle sandwiches, and just not been impressed.  I usually get the flavored waffles like Red Velvet or Mexican Chocolate, and those are good.Overall, good place, and we'll continue to go back.

38.description: To start, the place is very close to Magnificent Mile and it offers a clean and welcoming environment, coupled with prompt service. The waffles are just right, a welll balance of softness, crispness and flavors. The portions are generous and could be shared; price is not an issue since everything is priced reasonably. We tried the egg waffle sandwiches which were amazing! And now, for the piece of resistance, the flagship waffles - to go.Free Wi-Fi and Intelligentsia coffee is served to order!

51.description: This place is awesome! I am a donut fanatic so I'm always interested in sweet doughy creations. When I heard of a "Wonut" I was interested to see what the Waffle Cafe had to offer and they absolutely delivered!! The Wonut is the perfect mix of a donut waffle baby. The Cafe could stop there but they keep the belly satisfied with their delicious breakfast options. From their 3 egg omelette with waffle shaped hash browns to their waffle breakfast sandwiches. I was in heaven . The owner and staff were extremely welcoming and friendly. Their only down side .... they don't have a location on the east coast.

27.description: Had a Groupon, bad experience. From the moment we sat down and told our server we had a Groupon his attitude immediately changed towards us. He hardly came by our table, and his attitude was cold. We ordered extra items on the menu not just what the Groupon called for, thinking he would cheer up. It did not. We also ordered espresso drinks that were awful. When we asked the server to exchange it for basic coffee, he charged us for the one sip drink that he threw out. The "Wonuts" they are known for were just OK. Nothing special. We would definitely not go back.

32.description: Stopped in for breakfast on Sunday and the place was packed so we sat outside. The waitress came and took our order and we waited. And waited. The server came by and we asked for more water and what was up with our food "it's coming".  It got cold outside so we asked to move inside. Still no food. I asked again, "it's almost done". Then, 35 minutes later I see the server and Manager talking. I went and asked what was going on "your server forgot to put your order in". Ok, I get that, it can happen but I asked two other times and was told "it was coming". Ridiculous.

54.description: This was a disappointment. The service was slow and unfriendly. The wonuts were okay, but not as good as I imagined. We tried the birthday cake one, but there's a big assortment of flavors. I ordered a make your own scrambler which was actually pretty good with kale, onion and Swiss cheese. It came with cute waffle hash browns but unfortunately those looked better than they tasted, they don't have much flavor. The toast was awful, burnt beyond eating. I don't know how you can serve that. Overall not satisfied and will not be returning when there are so many better options around here.

48.description: I LOVE WAFFLES. It is important to know that beforehand. I was drawn to this restaurant because a friend told me about their wonuts. We did end up trying a few wonuts, which were a lot of fun (unfortunately, they usually only stock a few kinds at a time, and it varies throughout the day, so the wonut menu is useful just in the descriptions of the wonuts). There were no holes in the center of the wonuts either. Basically, the taste/texture was denser than a donut, kind of cake-like, but with the shape of a waffle.In addition to the wonuts, we also ate brunch here and enjoyed some sweet and savory waffles dishes. We had the flight of donuts, which was fun, plus a pork/shoulder + cheddar waffle dish and an eggs benedict dish. I loved the novelty of all the waffle dishes, because most other restaurants I've been to don't offer so many savory waffle dishes. Service was average. They seem to be pretty busy. They did take a photo of our group for us when we asked. The restaurant itself is also very simple in decor, although there is one wall that features various waffle irons of the past. Prices average.Overall, a solid restaurant for the waffle-lover, but nothing spectacular.

44.description: This place is awesome for kids (and adults that act like kids...). The wonuts were awesome. We tried several and all were great. The Brussels waffles were great too. I had the eggs and chorizo were fantastic, as were the huevos rancheros.  My kids already want to know when we'll be back!

24.description: First off, the bathrooms are absolutely the nastiest thing I have ever seen. When I told our server she shrugged and said its a shared bathroom and the building manages it. So clearly they aren't concerned that their customers use it. Disgusting.Secondly, the staff are rude. You walk in and have no idea if you need to wait to be seated. And they walk around you and ignore you. We ended up seating ourselves. We ordered a wonut and it was okay. We both ordered the plain and simple and the eggs were overcooked. Overall, food was just meh. Someone came by and grabbed our napkins before we were even done eating. Not sure why...We won't be back.

7.description: Cute little cafe that serves wonuts! Which is essentially a waffle donut. It was my first time getting it and I chose the Mexican chocolate wonut. It has a hint of orange in it and the whole thing is covered in chocolate.  I'm not a huge sweets or desserts person but I enjoyed it. Worth trying if you're in the area and want to try something new

49.description: They don't have fresh Grapefruit juice what??? Only bottled  Their Spicy Mexican waffle was too sour. I don't understandNot coming here again. Yolk is still the best. Don't come here

40.description: I deducted a star for the bathroom... Seriously smelled so bad I almost threw up my waffles.... The waffles however were divine!  Really liked the red velvet.

53.description: Tried Waffles Cafe for brunch today & we weren't disappointed.  It's a simple little cafe with no-frills decor, which was cool with us.  They had something called "Wonuts" on the menu so we had to try one.  Had the Birthday Cake Wonut & it was delish...imagine putting donut batter into a waffle iron cooking until partially done then finished in a deep fryer & dipped in glaze & cake icing.  I had the 3-egg omelet, my son had the waffle egg sandwiches, & my daughter had a Brussels waffle with Nutella & eggs.  Everyone was satisfied & the service was prompt & friendly.  Would definitely go back.

30.description: Visiting Chicago for the very first time! I love a sweet so I researched and discovered the Wonut! Oh I was gonna definitely try this. First of all this place is very cute. We were seated right away and the staff was extremely friendly. We ordered breakfast first. The waffle sandwich was delicious. Bacon and eggs sandwiched in between two mini fluffy waffles. Yum. Now on to the Wonut! I wanted to try the green tea one but unfortunately they didn't make any today. So I tried the Mexican Chocolate and the Turtle. I love a Wonut! Waffle and cake donut with yummy chocolate drizzle. I am so sad that after I leave on Monday I will not have another. Boo!

46.description: I came to Waffles Cafe for a quick brunch around 11AM on a Thursday. All tables were taken, which I took as a good sign. It took about 10 minutes for my party of one to be seated. However, I was seated at a wet table. I didn't realize this until I sat down and opened my wet menu.  However, the woman working there for the day realized my table situation and got on it right away. I'd say right now, she was the highlight of the visit. Once she filled my mug with coffee, I ordered the Mexican Chocolate Waffles - it sounded pretty appetizng. After a 10-15 minute wait I received my waffles! The portion was quite large, two full size waffles drizzled with chocolate and orange vanilla cream. The waffles lacked any chocolate taste. I think the orange vanilla cream had too much of an overpowering citrus taste to the dish, I could have done without it. I really expected more.Being that this cafe is off the magnificent mile, I can understand why I was charged what I was charged. But looking for those looking for value, I'd say look elsewhere. I should have tried the wonut while I was there, since it seems like that was what they boasted.

1.description: They are a little understaffed and unorganized, they need to pay more people to run this place as it is in a busy section of town.The food is off on its execution. The waffles have a nice flavor and texture. I would say they are better than some places that have just plain waffles. I got the waffle ham and cheese sandwich that could have been great, but it was done wrong. They used ham chunks rather than a slice of ham, cheese sauce covered all of the items l. So it comes like you ordered them separately with drizzled sauce vs a sandwich or a Benedict. A nice concept but not done right.The hot sauce here is the real star. That stuff is amazing. Didn't get to try any of the sweet stuff. If I went back I would just grab and go.

55.description: Home of the infamous wonut, which I first saw on buzzfeed, and almost jumped a flight from the Jerz to Chi-town for, I made a special trip to the city to try this delicacy last weekend. It was just okay. It made me glad I didn't spend $200 on a flight to Chi-town to try a wonut. Perhaps I tried the wrong wonut? I had the white ganache wonut and it was just off. It is hard to describe; it was very sticky, like a cinnabon. But the wonut itself was good; the ganache ruined it for me though. I had two bites and it met the trash can. I would go back to try the Mexican Chocolate or the Cinnamon Sugar. the food was not up to par. I was hungry after wandering around the city. I am new - i need to get acclimated to the hood. Sure, I live in the burbs but I play in the city. AND I NEEEEEEEDED A WONUT. I didn't eat waffles because that would have defeated the purpose of a wonut later. I had an omelet. It was kind of rubbery and dripping in oil. I can definitely say I have had better -- heck--I have even cooked better and I can barely use a stove. What intrigued me was the has brown shaped like a waffle. It tasted like a potato latke and was the star of my breakfast. I was in love. Eat the hash-waffle. Skip the eggs. This is a meh and a half resto. I am rounding up because the wonut has potential for success.

9.description: The worst service I've ever had...but I keep coming back because the food is great. Last time I was there, I had to physically stand up and grab my own menu after being seated. They let me sit without any service for about 15 minutes before I gave up and just left. I think it'll be my last time going.

26.description: I come to Waffles every time I visit Chicago. The first time it was to try the wonuts, and it was so amazing that it quickly became one of my favorite brunch spots. The wonuts alone are worth the trip, but the other breakfast options are wonderful as well (their omelettes are great and the chicken & waffles is to die for). It's a small place so I'd get there early to get a spot and to get the best options for wonut flavors. Waffles is definitely a Chicago favorite!

25.description: I couldn't figure out a quick and close breakfast location nearby since I was short on time.  Waffle Cafe came up and even though there wasn't many starts on Yelp, I suggested we go too.  Upon arrival and after we sat down, my sis was a bit skeptical after seeing just a 3.5 start rating.Alex took care of us and was just the sweetest and most patient person ever!  We decided on something savory and something sweet.For savory we decided on:EGGS & CHORIZO - $10.95Potatoes, Onions, Red Bell Peppers, served with Corn Tortillas,  Guacamole an Sour Cream.When this dish came out, the meal was split in two! How wonderful!!
