This plate was very good!So for sweet here's what happened:At first we decided on the Waffle Flight, but realized there were wonuts (waffle donuts) which sounded cheaper as yimmier.  So we asked Alex to cancel our Waffle Flight and wanted wonuts instead.  Alex had to run into the kitchen to make sure the cooks didn't start yet and he has to see what wonuts are available since not everything on the menu may be there.We took some time to decide and chose 2. When Alex brought out our beautiful plate of 3 donuts, he had mistakenly given us Cinnamon & Sugar also. We told him we didn't order it, but perhaps we can trade for something else.  Alex: "Alrighty, what would you like" :)Us: "Ummm...hmmmm..."Yeah we were jerks. Alex immediately decided to let us have it for free.  We then made our decision and here were the WONUTS:LEMON BLUEBERRY WONUT - $2.50The batter had blueberries and was topped with fresh blueberries and lemon zest! The blueberry frosting was plentiful and was served warm! My favorite! Yummy!WHITE GANACHE WONUT - $2.50This warm donut was topped with white chocolate and bash pearls.  So lovely and quite tasty!PINK RASPBERRY WONUT - $2.50Another warm donut that had a bright pink frosting and reap every on top! Sweet!CINNAMON & SUGAR WONUT - $2.50This was actually a gluten-free one which no wonder tasted a bit different (not as good as the rest).  It was fine but I would have never known it to be gluten-free.  Oh and with all these sweets I had to order a glass of MILK - $2.50.Alex came and chatted with us and he was just so friendly and nice! Turns out Alex is the owner!  We really appreciated everything and his service! He took really great care of us! Gosh I wish I can come back!!! :)THANKS ALEX!!!!!!!

12.description: Home of the infamous wonut, which I first saw on buzzfeed, and almost jumped a flight from the Jerz to Chi-town for, I made a special trip to the city to try this delicacy last weekend. It was just okay. It made me glad I didn't spend $200 on a flight to Chi-town to try a wonut. Perhaps I tried the wrong wonut? I had the white ganache wonut and it was just off. It is hard to describe; it was very sticky, like a cinnabon. But the wonut itself was good; the ganache ruined it for me though. I had two bites and it met the trash can. I would go back to try the Mexican Chocolate or the Cinnamon Sugar. the food was not up to par. I was hungry after wandering around the city. I am new - i need to get acclimated to the hood. Sure, I live in the burbs but I play in the city. AND I NEEEEEEEDED A WONUT. I didn't eat waffles because that would have defeated the purpose of a wonut later. I had an omelet. It was kind of rubbery and dripping in oil. I can definitely say I have had better -- heck--I have even cooked better and I can barely use a stove. What intrigued me was the has brown shaped like a waffle. It tasted like a potato latke and was the star of my breakfast. I was in love. Eat the hash-waffle. Skip the eggs. This is a meh and a half resto. I am rounding up because the wonut has potential for success.

59.description: I was wondering why a new cool concept in a fancy neighborhood has no business, after a visit I know why. I ordered takeout, only coming home to find that they missed my order! They didn't give me everything I ordered but charged for everything. I didn't check the package before I left, that's my bad, but they weren't even busy! It was 6:30pm, no one was there and they cannot get my order right! I'm not going back ever.

21.description: I don't write much reviews but I sure read them. All I can say is the chicken and bacon waffle is excellent! My mouth is warm with the spicy goodness! And there was plenty enough food, I am stuffed. Our waiter Fabricio was a class act! And his supporting staff was helpful and friendly too! Loved it! Good job guys!

17.description: Visiting Chicago for the very first time! I love a sweet so I researched and discovered the Wonut! Oh I was gonna definitely try this. First of all this place is very cute. We were seated right away and the staff was extremely friendly. We ordered breakfast first. The waffle sandwich was delicious. Bacon and eggs sandwiched in between two mini fluffy waffles. Yum. Now on to the Wonut! I wanted to try the green tea one but unfortunately they didn't make any today. So I tried the Mexican Chocolate and the Turtle. I love a Wonut! Waffle and cake donut with yummy chocolate drizzle. I am so sad that after I leave on Monday I will not have another. Boo!

10.description: I LOVE WAFFLES. It is important to know that beforehand. I was drawn to this restaurant because a friend told me about their wonuts. We did end up trying a few wonuts, which were a lot of fun (unfortunately, they usually only stock a few kinds at a time, and it varies throughout the day, so the wonut menu is useful just in the descriptions of the wonuts). There were no holes in the center of the wonuts either. Basically, the taste/texture was denser than a donut, kind of cake-like, but with the shape of a waffle.In addition to the wonuts, we also ate brunch here and enjoyed some sweet and savory waffles dishes. We had the flight of donuts, which was fun, plus a pork/shoulder + cheddar waffle dish and an eggs benedict dish. I loved the novelty of all the waffle dishes, because most other restaurants I've been to don't offer so many savory waffle dishes. Service was average. They seem to be pretty busy. They did take a photo of our group for us when we asked. The restaurant itself is also very simple in decor, although there is one wall that features various waffle irons of the past. Prices average.Overall, a solid restaurant for the waffle-lover, but nothing spectacular.

5.description: This place needs more servers. It's slow service and they don't always have the flavors of wonuts you wanted. Plus they need a double door since whenever someone enters or exits, a huge gush of wind blows in and makes it cold; try not to sit near the doors. Not even a warm experience. Nevertheless,  the delicious wonuts make up for the bad experience. My fav so far is the cinnamon sugar which reminds me of the taste of a churro.

3.description: I always walked by this place and I have been meaning to try it for a while. I ordered the Nutella Brussels waffles with coffee. The waffles were light and crispy and definitely satisfied my waffle craving. They also refilled my coffee right before I finished eating so I took it in a to go cup for the road. I'll be coming back to try the other flavors!

35.description: I had the chocolate turtle, blueberry, and cinnamon apple cider wonuts(a cross between a waffle and a donut). The chocolate turtle wasn't great, it was a bit hard in the middle of the wonut. The blueberry was great but pretty sweet. The cinnamon apple cider was really light and sweet and airy, so soft. I had hash browns that looked packaged and eggs over easy. The eggs were straight.

19.description: I order the veggie chili and chicken and bacon waffles. The chili was some of the best chili I have had. It had a nice kick of heat about it. The chicken and bacon waffles were superb. The chicken was cooked to perfection leaving it tender and juicy. The waffles had large chunks of bacon in them. Pairing with the spicy maple syrup put them over the top!

28.description: I would not return to this place. The service was not good to start off with. The waffles are very small, not your average size waffles. I ordered the waffle sampler plate with 4 different flavors which was $15. When they came out with the small plate of 4 tiny waffles, I was surprised. Waffles should not be that much. They also were not that good. Out of the 4 flavors the red velvet was the best. The green tea flavor I thought was disgusting, & the other 2 flavors were just ok. But other then the overpriced food, we waited almost an hour for our waffles which was very frustrating. I don't expect waffles to take that long to cook in a griddle. So all in all from every aspect it was overall bad experience from service, food, & the price! For good breakfast in downtown I recommend wildberry pancake cafe!

45.description: In town for work. Was looking for traditional breakfast food and stumbled across this quaint cafe......opted for the plain and simple - two eggs, toast, hash browns and turkey sausage. I thought they forgot my hash browns, but didn't realize it was actually a little hash brown waffle.  Omg....everything was great, especially that hash brown.  Then my server decided to give me a "wonut".  Never heard of that before, but it's a mix of a waffle and donut.  It was delicious!!!  This will definitely be my breakfast from now on when here in Chicago.  Looking forward to trying other menu items.

33.description: The Wonuts are delicious. I loved my hash brown waffles wish they were not as thick. Overall this place is great. Love the concept.

43.description: The restaraunt appeared very dead for the first few hours it was open. A very "home like" space. Some areas of the table were sticky and the syrup bottle had not been cleaned. The music was blasting and my mom kindly asked for it to be turned down a bit because we couldnt hear our own conversation.  Nice manager and waiter though. The food was okay. I had fries (very good) but the "red velvet" waffles took away a few points. It just tasted like waffles that were dyed red, with strawberries thrown ontop and powdered sugar. Eh.:/ and the whipped cream stuff would have been a loveley compliment if it didnt have a bitter tart aftertaste. My mother wasnt too fond of the waffles ontop of her egg and cheese as a little creative sandwich because the flavors were conflicting, but she did enjoy them separately. I recommend this to those who enjoy smaller, quiet atmospheres with less people in the early mornings. And good for kids too :)!

2.description: We walked in here because it was close to our hotel. We were also starving since we had just spent 6 hours at the airport/on the plane, an hour in traffic, and walked around looking for a place for 15 minutes. We were promptly greeted by a friendly hostess when we walked in and we had high hopes. The table even had a chalkboard with chalk for us to draw on.However, our enthusiasm for this place began to dwindle as soon as we tried to order. My friend tried to tell a waiter that we were ready to order, but he just ignored her. He was 3 feet away with a nearly empty restaurant, so there was no way he could not hear her. When we finally did order, it took 40 whole freaking minutes for us to get our food. At the 33 minute mark, the chef gave us a wonut as an apology for the wait (I wanted to give an extra star for that, but decided against it because the service was so poor). The wonut itself was not that good. Because we waited 40 minutes for our food, which we ordered a Mexican chocolate waffle and a plain&simple (eggs, wheat toast, bacon, and hash browns), we expected it to be the best meal we've ever had. Nope. My order wasn't even right. I ordered the eggs sunny side up and they gave me scrambled eggs. I also ordered wheat toast, but got white instead. The waffles were just ~meh~. I didn't bother trying to get them to change the food for the right order because I was just ready to get out of there. If I ever came back to Chicago, I definitely would never come back here. The hostess/waitress was occasionally friendly. Occasionally. When she decided to acknowledge us, she was nice. However, a majority of the time, she just walked passed us.

18.description: Wish u could give this place a no star. Walked in and sit down and only one waitress. She did come over and and hand us menus. Five minutes later took our order which was drinks and food. Waited about 20 minutes for  hot tea and a cappuccino. Finally another waitress came in and dropped the hot tea off but still no cappuccino. Proceeded to watch three tables that arrived after us receive there food. We wanted 45mins and still no food or cappuccino. Needs to say we got up and walked out since we could not get no ones attention. Very sad as this looked like it was some good stuff. Also sad for a out of town guest.

41.description: Mediocre.  Was excited about a "Waffle" restaurant.  Left disappointed.

52.description: To my surprise this Waffle breakfast egg & bacon sandwich was great.  I have been walking pass this café for about a year finally this morning I went in to grab a bite to eat.  The café was fresh and clean and the food did not take that long to prepare.  I will consider some of the other options on their menu in the near future.

50.description: Meh sums it up. I had wanted to try the wonuts from the time we moved in and so took the family in for breakfast when they came to visit. Breakfast was a waste of money. Ordered the sampler flight $14 and coffee $3+. We were literally sitipting next to the tiny beverage station and after 7 mins finally had to ask for the coffee, which was terrible. I stopped next door at 7-11 when we left for a better cup of coffee.  Got 4 small waffles AND NOT ONE WAS DONE. NOT ONE. Family ordered the waffle sandwiches. Again, waffles were gummy and sticky on the inside. They offered to remake one and they walked up,to the table with it after about 15 mins and said, oh, this isn't yours. We waited so long for the refired sandwiches we paid the check and left and they didn't notice. Maybe the small expensive wonuts are better? I know they are made offsite, we watched them bring them in.

4.description: I couldn't figure out a quick and close breakfast location nearby since I was short on time.  Waffle Cafe came up and even though there wasn't many starts on Yelp, I suggested we go too.  Upon arrival and after we sat down, my sis was a bit skeptical after seeing just a 3.5 start rating.Alex took care of us and was just the sweetest and most patient person ever!  We decided on something savory and something sweet.For savory we decided on:EGGS & CHORIZO - $10.95Potatoes, Onions, Red Bell Peppers, served with Corn Tortillas,  Guacamole an Sour Cream.When this dish came out, the meal was split in two! How wonderful!! This plate was very good!So for sweet here's what happened:At first we decided on the Waffle Flight, but realized there were wonuts (waffle donuts) which sounded cheaper as yimmier.  So we asked Alex to cancel our Waffle Flight and wanted wonuts instead.  Alex had to run into the kitchen to make sure the cooks didn't start yet and he has to see what wonuts are available since not everything on the menu may be there.We took some time to decide and chose 2. When Alex brought out our beautiful plate of 3 donuts, he had mistakenly given us Cinnamon & Sugar also. We told him we didn't order it, but perhaps we can trade for something else.  Alex: "Alrighty, what would you like" :)Us: "Ummm...hmmmm..."Yeah we were jerks. Alex immediately decided to let us have it for free.  We then made our decision and here were the WONUTS:LEMON BLUEBERRY WONUT - $2.50The batter had blueberries and was topped with fresh blueberries and lemon zest! The blueberry frosting was plentiful and was served warm! My favorite! Yummy!WHITE GANACHE WONUT - $2.50This warm donut was topped with white chocolate and bash pearls.  So lovely and quite tasty!PINK RASPBERRY WONUT - $2.50Another warm donut that had a bright pink frosting and reap every on top! Sweet!CINNAMON & SUGAR WONUT - $2.50This was actually a gluten-free one which no wonder tasted a bit different (not as good as the rest).  It was fine but I would have never known it to be gluten-free.  Oh and with all these sweets I had to order a glass of MILK - $2.50.Alex came and chatted with us and he was just so friendly and nice! Turns out Alex is the owner!  We really appreciated everything and his service! He took really great care of us! Gosh I wish I can come back!!! :)THANKS ALEX!!!!!!!

6.description: randomly picked a breakfast place because it was so close to the hotel we were staying at (Red Roof Inn).- eggs & chorizo - this came with like scrambled eggs with chorizo, bell peppers, potatoes, and some other stuff.  it was pretty good.  it came with some tortillas and a small side of guac and sour cream.  I wish they gave more of both.  this entree was good.- plain & simple - basically just 2 eggs, waffle shaped hash browns, and sausages.  everything was good besides the waffled shaped hash browns.  they tasted weird.  add another $2 for 2 mini waffles.  these were good- lemon raspberry wonut - this was very good.  didn't taste the lemon though

22.description: We came here while on conference in Chicago.  We wanted a brunch spot that had good breakfast items and this placetotally delivered. From the egg plates and waffle shaped hash browns their foods were off the hook.  We had several types of waffles from the liege, to the chicken and waffle and a couple wonuts.  Every item was delicious and we left full and loving the items we tried.  We will be back!

15.description: Food was good. Service was extremely slow! I came in for breakfast on a Friday morning, the restaurant was NOT full. Ordered the chicken and waffles and a coffee. It took 15 to 20 minutes for them to bring the coffee and another hour (at least) for the food to arrive. Once the food got to our table it was great, but the wait was a little crazy!

57.description: Wow!  The burgers were amazing! Wonuts were even better!  But the service was the BEST!!!

20.description: Maybe my expectations were greater than they should have been but I was disappointed with this place. The service wasn't great, the waffles came quick but were cold when I got them. Not to mention they didn't have that unique of a flavor. The apple one and red velvet one tasted like a normal waffle. Bacon was so-so. All in all I wouldn't recommend it, but I guess I'm glad I tried it...

36.description: Great for breakfast ! Opens early and tastes awesome ! The wonuts are great ! I wish I had these in Miami  so far I have had the plain and simple followed by some wonuts  also I noticed the kids menu is just under $4 !! Seems like a good deal to me!

14.description: The Mexican Chocolate orange waffle is excellent. The bacon or pork sausage is just ok. Service is a little slow even when the restaurant is mostly empty. The menu is interesting because they have all these sweet or savory waffles BUT on the other half of the menu are all these Mexican breakfasts you can choose from such as Chorizo and eggs. It's a decent place to eat.

58.description: Located on the second floor of a small building on Ontario Street, you could walk right by the Indian Garden and miss this culinary treat. We have been here a few times and have never been disappointed. We like spicy and this place has got the fix."Food of the God" and that is what this food is - pure, freshly cooked, vegetarian and vegan in most cases. The vegetables are grown fresh and pulled for cooking on the day.Truly delicious food made with love, served in a peaceful atmosphere by friendly smiling people, in a clean quiet venue.You must try the lunch buffet, which is served 7 days per week.  The lunch buffet has a great variety for starters, main course and desserts. The quality of food is top-notch and you'll definitely be making lots of visits to the buffet line. There is so much to choose from that one is likely to get overwhelmed. However be calm, take your time and enjoy the delicacies.Cheers,Jordan & Marks

56.description: It's my favorite Indian restaurant so far. Love their Lunch buffet, vegetarian variety and interior is as good. The only downside - it is inconvenient to get in with the stroller, long walk and you need an assistance, they need to improve this aspect for people in a wheelchairs

29.description: I came there twice for dinner (vegetarian).Food is descent as well as the price. The first time I was a bit impressed but the second time, the charm was not there due to the behavior of some "butlers". Before you leave, take the seeds for the digestion, which is very good. Not too much noisy (thanks God!) and good for a romantic dinner but ask for a good spot.

42.description: Phyllis W.   5/16/2015The food and service was excellent, we had the samosa as well as the shrimp appetizers, and for then the house special combination of chicken, lamb, and fish....everything was so delicious - it was the best i've had. Other Indian restaurants downtown don't compare to The Indian Garden's quality of food. Also,  The service was impecciable....water was replenished, dirty dishes were removed without having to ask!  I highly recommend this restaurant!!

23.description: This is a good restaurant, but it has its quirks.  However, if you are in the area and looking for Indian food, you will probably be happy with this choice.As a local, I am surprised there are not more Indian restaurants in the loop area.  In fact, my normal "go to" place closed about six months ago.  So I was interested to sample this again since I hadn't been here since many years ago.  So here is my view.  I ordered the Eggplant dish, Baigan Bharta, and it was just delicious.  I found it mildly spicy, but very tasty.  I would definitely order it again.  My dining companion ordered Shrimp Bhuna, and I found it very tasty as well.  The rice is a separate al a carte item here, so we ordered one rice between us and that was sufficient for us.  However, you are missing something if you don't order the naan (bread).  I had the garlic naan and I loved it.  The other bread we ordered was Kandhari Naan which included pistachios and almonds - it was just as good.Truly, the food is good here and I think you will be pleased with it.The service is adequate and functional, but I would not call it warm.  As one other reviewer commented, "They do the job."  I agree with this assessment.  The water person kept my glass full which is essential in a restaurant serving spicy food.  You will do well with the water.  I ordered Iced Tea and my dining companion ordered Mango Lassi.  I was not offered a refil on my iced tea and I suspect they don't do refills - not sure on that.  Therefore my recommendation would be that you forego the drinks and stick with water which will be in abundance.Now let's talk about the atmosphere.  The restaurant is on the second floor and there are quite a few steps to climb to get up to The Indian Garden.  I have bad knees and I really had to take my time but I made it and I would do it again.  However, if you are handicapped or otherwise need assistance for stairs, you may want to make another choice.  Also, it was 82 degrees outside and I was rather surprised they were dependent on open windows for ventilation.  I suspect their air conditioning may not have been functional, but it was a humid evening and noticeable.  One might observe that it added to the Asian subcontinent atmosphere through environment - but I am being nice.  It was hot and I wish the air conditioning had been on.All in all, the most important thing, the food, was so good, any other shortcomings were worth being overlooked.  If the restaurant would make some improvements in their experience through things they can control, e.g. more attentive service and air temperature, I think that I would have given them a higher rating.  But it is a winner with respect for the food.  So my line for this restaurant is "Go for the food, not the experience."  ;-)

47.description: Many vegetarian options, but very little for vegans - which I find strange. We ordered a selection of items that came with rice. Our waiter told us that our food didn't come with rice, so we ordered more. It also came with bread, but he allowed us to order more bread also.The food wasn't that nice. I really like Indian food, but I won't be going back.

8.description: Worst Indian restaurant. Service is terrible. Food doesn't taste authentic. I would never go back.

31.description: Best Indian food Ive ever had.  Also some of the best priced food in the Loop. Walk up the stairs and eat the good food.

34.description: Not so flavourful. Went here for lunch buffet. Appetizers seemed chewy and cold. Vegetables lacked authentic flavours. Daal was just boiled - No flavour at all..The worst food ever had among all indian restaurants so far. Giving 1 star for food and 1 star for interiors as interiors are really good.

16.description: Best indian food i tried so far Lamb biryani is amazing A little bit pricey but it worth it

13.description: My recommendation would be to visit the lunch buffet. Great price, great options and great food. You can get all the classics and try new dishes.With both vegetarian and meat dishes, it's perfect for all kinds of crowds and they're able to accommodate large groups.Service is always friendly - one of my favorite spots.

11.description: Tasty food, great atmosphere, location on River North but feels like you aren't, all at a reasonable price.  What's not to love?  The restaurant's on the 2nd floor, and that combined with the festive decor inside it doesn't feel like you are in downtown Chicago.  At the end of the meal you do pay River North prices, but since the food and atmosphere are both better than average it's definitely worth it in my opinion.Chicken tikka masala was the star of the meal.  Delicious on it's own and also excellent when paired with the garlic naan (I can't get enough of this stuff).  The mango lassi was great, and seemed simple enough I've tried it at home (although not as good as made at the Garden).  The gulab jamun and papdi chaat were both average.  Since I was there at the same time as brunch I checked out the buffet, but wasn't feeling their offering at the time.  I am interested to try the lunch buffet, as I've heard some good things about it.

39.description: The food here is decent. I came here for lunch and they have lunch buffet. There were a variety of selections: lamb, chicken, spinach paneer, potato, beans, lentils, and salad. They taste pretty good for me as a Chinese however I can't tell if they are authentic or not. Most curries/dishes are spicy, which led me to eat lots of desserts to compensate. They have donut in syrup (hot) and fruit cream (cold) for desserts. I'm kinda disappointed for not finding kheer and mango ice cream for desserts which are offered at Gaylord on oak street. The lunch buffet is around $15-ish/person. Northwestern student can get a 10% off discount:))The place is large and bright, which is better than Gaylord. However I do gave Gaylord a higher rating for the food.

37.description: Walked in at 2 pm with a friend and was recommended the Buffet, and we said Okay. Bad choice ! Most items were cold, especially the tandoori chicken...by the time we were ready for desert they had already wound up their spread. Not bothered to even come and ask us if we wanted desert or if they can keep it aside for us. Zero customer service ! Cold food !! Pricey for the quality we got served !!!

0.description: I definitely enjoyed the food! We tried chicken tikka masala and Bhuna Lamb, which were both flavorful and good!Service on the other hand is not great. Servers never smiled and spoke minimum. It's almost like having customers is inconvinient for them. But hey I'd rather have no smile from the waiters and just enjoy food, than have bad food with lots of smiles. Definitely coming back.

38.description: This restaurant made me sign up for Yelp just to give a review. Unfortunately it's not a good one. Ordinarily I was a spectator on Yelp just surfing places to go. But I feel I needed to write this to forewarn people before they go to this place. Many Chicagoans and foreigners might like the food but what they are liking is the idea of Indian food which in it's essence is spectacular. However the execution of the idea by this restaurant has been appalling. If this food was an ambassador of India then people out here have been fed lies since it's inception. We tried 3 appetizers and one dessert. Let me begin with the Paneer Tikka (Cottage cheese). We paid $18 for something that tasted like an eraser, we could have got a cheaper one at staples. Paneer is supposed to be soft and melt in your mouth. The Chandni Chowk Aloo Tikki sounds and looks great in theory however in practice it was a mash of bullshit. The pattie was terrible and lazily prepared. The samosas were mediocre at best, however no where close to how it is supposed to be. I forgot about the poppadum, it was not fully cooked and had corners which were raw not roasted. However the cook was more generous with the Gulab Jamun (dessert.) Probably too generous because he burnt the dish. And the server had the audacity to bring the burnt dish to our table and   place it there in a nonchalant manner.The service was alright. The only reason I gave this place one star is because the Bollywood music is good, but the melodious tunes only mask the disservice that the people in this place are doing to Indian food.

51.description: Chicago, Illinois- When you're cozy, in your pajamas, and in cold Chicago at the end of the winter season, when you feel hunger setting in you call a delivery service. The objective is to remain comfortable. I was surprised when I received the call that I needed to come down to get my food and even more surprised when the delivery person and I could not find each other for 10 minutes. When I finally got to my room to reveal my vegetable korma that I had been craving I found what looked like veggies from my grocer's freezer in a bright yellow sauce. Having had korma in many cities and on many occasions, I would venture to say this wasn't korma. I went to try it and realized I had no utensils or napkins which was enough for me to call back. Come on. I'm in a hotel, not a home and the rooms don't come with kitchen utensils. The order I made for almost $40 was not found in their system for some time and then the manager got on the line. He really did try to fix things, bless his heart. He sent the delivery woman back to my hotel and I met her downstairs after getting out of my pj's for the second time (I guess I could have gone Walmart style and worn them downstairs). This time she brought a napkin, a plate, and a fork. She was very kind and apologetic. I thanked her and asked to forward my thanks to the manager as well. I still didn't get korma but rather a tomato-like dish. By the time I had utensils (they did beat room service!) my basmati rice and naan were cold and the experience was pretty much unrepairable. I'm giving two stars because the staff were very kind and appeared sincere. I think that is important. Also, the basmati rice is quite flavorful and gets 5 stars on its own.

27.description: Delicious indian food with good portions. The crab curry was my favorite but the eggplant and paneer, along with all the different breaks and briyani rice were all very well done. No complaints except the slightly slow waiter service.

32.description: After weeks on the road, we were looking for some comfort food (Indian family if 4) and we landed at this place based on reviews. We found a restaurant with tasteful and clean ambience and the service prompt. Ordered pakoras and shami kebabs for starters. Pakoras were awesome, but the shami kebabs were a bit dry. Be careful with the spice levels as medium can be a bit on the high side. For main course we ordered navratan korma, shrimp curry and daal along  with a bread basket and veg biryani. Everything tastes great and was cooked to our satisfaction. Highly recommend to anyone looking for some tasty Indian food at downtown Chicago

54.description: I put in an order for carry out and arrived 20 minutes later, as instructed.  I paid for my order and was told to sit and wait.  Another 20 minutes go by with others around me grumbling about how long it's taking for their carry out orders.  I decide to ask about my order and it was sitting on the counter the entire time.  Um, perhaps you should tell customers to check in periodically to see if their order is ready instead of being told to sit and having them assume you will notify us that it's ready to be taken home!  That aside, I got the lamb vindaloo.  While heavy on the lamb, I can tell it was very old and overcooked.  I assume they were trying to get rid of the old meat and no better way to do that than in a spicy vindaloo sauce.  Everything else was blah and likely would have been better had they not been sitting on the counter for 30 minutes.  Nobody was friendly, nobody communicated with me other than when I paid.  I stood at the counter to inquire about my order while 3 separate people looked everywhere but in my direction.  Due to customer service, I will not go back.

48.description: The place is beautiful. The staff vary in their attitudes. The vegetarian options were the best. The chicken was dry. The curries were very thin.

44.description: My first time to this restaurant.The Interiors:Loved it.  Can feel a high class feel to it as compared to Indian restaurants on Devon.Service:Terrific service.  The best? No, far from best.  Could use a lot of improvement but as compared to many other restaurants of this caliber (Indian or otherwise), I'm going to say it was pretty darn good.Food:GREAT selection of naans.  Terrific naans.We ordered 3 veggies and 1 chicken dish.The chicken dish was OUT OF THIS WORLD. (Chicken Badaami.)Never seen this dish in another Indian restaurant (I've been to many around the country, overseas INCLUDING India.)This was a dish made up of an almond base.  You could taste the almond flavor.  This is a unique dish in my opinion (till I find other restaurants if and when they serve this dish.)Unlike most Indian restaurants where the chicken pieces are just too big and dried out, pieces were relatively large but the chicken was SOFT AND MOIST.The vegetarian dishes were not bad. Pretty good actually but the tandoori veggies need A LOT OF WORK.  They were way below subpar.  They weren't marinated long enough nor did they have a look like, "wow, I want to dig into that."I know for sure I'm doing a take out of the chicken badaami next week for sure.

24.description: I had been to this restaurant 3-4 years ago and had terrible food and service, twice! It wasn't even worth wasting my time writing a review. But the tables have turned. I finally decided to give it another try, since I believe in giving restaurants a chance to improve. Mind you, I've been to almost every Indian restaurant in Chicago and I was blown away by the food here. The food totally reminded me of my time in Delhi. The price point doesn't affect me as long as the food is on point. Brilliantly cooked paneer, samosas, okra, lentils and kofta make me your number one fan. Absolutely no doubt in my mind that I'm going to be ordering from you guys whenever the cravings start. Hoping to have more and more great times at the Indian garden. Keep up the great work!!

7.description: My date spilled some of her food and sighed, "at least that's one less bite I'll have to eat."  She wasn't impressed with our meal. Neither was I. The Paneer Makhani she ordered didn't taste like Paneer Makhani. Both it and the Rogan Josh I chose were quite flavorless. The portions were also small for the price. The service was attentive and our water glasses were promptly refilled. The restaurant was tastefully decorated with artwork from India. Though the service and decor may have been A-OK, I can't, in all good conscience, give this place three stars. The food left too much to be desired.

49.description: Tasty food, great atmosphere, location on River North but feels like you aren't, all at a reasonable price.  What's not to love?  The restaurant's on the 2nd floor, and that combined with the festive decor inside it doesn't feel like you are in downtown Chicago.  At the end of the meal you do pay River North prices, but since the food and atmosphere are both better than average it's definitely worth it in my opinion.Chicken tikka masala was the star of the meal.  Delicious on it's own and also excellent when paired with the garlic naan (I can't get enough of this stuff).  The mango lassi was great, and seemed simple enough I've tried it at home (although not as good as made at the Garden).  The gulab jamun and papdi chaat were both average.  Since I was there at the same time as brunch I checked out the buffet, but wasn't feeling their offering at the time.  I am interested to try the lunch buffet, as I've heard some good things about it.

40.description: I have been here many times, and I really like the food. The service is not that good though.

53.description: Great decor, loved the old school Indian vibe. however the food was mixed: good vegetarian selection (reco the Paneer) but the meat / non vegetarian selection lacked the quality and breadth. + Service was average. The mango Kulfi was great too.

30.description: I ordered a take away recently. I specifically mentioned in the order to remove one of the ingredients but 2 out of 3 items had the same. Food is good but service is poor and waiters expect to tipped on a take away. Management need to change the restaurant manager otherwise they would have very few repeat customers. Very poor service. 2 stars because at least one of the item in the order was well made.

46.description: Stopped here with a craving for some Indian food.  I was greeted and seated immediately (was medium busy on a Monday night).  Was brought water and chutneys and a basket of Papadum immediately. I ordered a large king Fisher (Indian Beer $9.00), and order of plain naan (a must, need to sop up all of that amazing sauce, $3.00, he asked if I wanted butter on it, YEAH!), and Murg Chilli Masala - Medium ($15.00) The server was very concerned about getting the heat right (I love HOT foods but he recommended medium, which was perfect, with sliced / chunks of hot peppers in the sauce).The chicken was fantastic--very tender, awesome flavor.   The Naan was outrageous.  Crispy and soft at the same time.Would recommend for sure.

1.description: Came by here for Sunday brunch / lunch buffet. I really enjoyed the paneer, chicken tandoori, and the chicken curry (maybe it was masala?). Those were my top three, but overall I thought the buffet dishes in general we're very good. Even the veggie dishes were good, but definitely on the spicy side of the spectrum. SO BEWARE!Anyways, Sunday brunch cost us $16 per person which isn't bad in my opinion for all you can eat. The one thing that really bothered me during my visit though was the fact there was a water leak from the ceiling, and they didn't bother to put out a bucket to catch it or rope off the affected area. Someone could've easily walked right under it after grabbing a full plate of food and gotten water onto their plate. =( I only mention this because it almost happened to me.Aside from that, a very good place to grab traditional Indian food IMO. 'Til next time, cheers!

55.description: So great! Reasonable priced for the quality. I will definitely be back!

9.description: This place was so cool! I loved the decor and ambiance. It's hidden in a second floor location on Ontario. I would totally go here again just based on the atmosphere. I saw in a booth against the window with all of these cozy and beautiful pillows. I was so comfortable and relaxed. I felt like I was in an Indian palace with all the colors and low lighting.  I love the hard naan wafers they put out right away with the different dipping sauces. I had a glass of wine and this vegetarian eggplant dish with basmati rice and naan bread. Loved the food and loved the ambiance, it would be perfect for a date night.

26.description: It has been said by others, average food and very expensive. 15$ for a dish and I had to order rice separate. Another thing that irked me is that I ordered the Chicken Korma and the chicken came with the bones in. This lead to me having to dig around bones and accidentally chomp down on one. This is seriously the only time that I have seen Korma made by this and it just feels lazy.

25.description: I love this place. It was my 3rd time dining at this restaurant and each time it's better than the previous. The atmosphere is "magical," decor is really nice. Food....amazing! I loved the dipping sauces (especially the mango one!). I ordered a lamb basmati rice and my boyfriend had the lamb in a spinach puree. We both had a bite of our food and looked at each other in an AWE moment. lol! We LOVED it!! Our waiter was superb!! recommended the garlic naan...which I HIGHLY would recommend as well! Amazing...amazing...will certainly be back very soon! =)

12.description: I got take out so can't comment on the service. All I have to say about this place is average Indian food, inflated prices. Entrée didn't even come with a side of rice. Will not order their food again.

59.description: The fish curry was really, REALLY tasty - but I did not expect it to have bones in it.  Maybe that's normal (I'm not exactly an Indian food connoisseur.

21.description: Indian Garden provides a great dining experience for dates, families, and groups of friends. My group of three and I made a reservation online prior to coming on a Saturday night. We were seated Immediately, and due to how crowded this place gets on a Saturday night, I would strongly suggest making a reservation. Due to the restaurant being on the second floor of the building, it actually has a nice little view of Ontario street, which is cool. The menu is very large and there is a good amount of meat and vegetarian options.  We started with their appetizer sampler platter, and that was both tasty and a good value. I had a tough time deciding on a main dish. The waiter ended up recommending one of the lamb dishes. The dish was pretty good, but it wasn't quite spicy enough for me unfortunately. It was too toned down, but now I know to ask for more heat next time.  Please note that rice is a extra cost, but the order of rice is enough for two people. Food, service, and atmosphere make this place a good option in the Streeterville neighborhood

17.description: This place has the best indian in chicago. I rate its all vegetarian dishes superb as i dont eat non veg stuff, i would recommend its cold coffee in drinks and for main course malai kofta, punjabi chilli paneer, chana masala, IG dhaniya paneer is their specialty and there are more to taste from, ans lastly i forgot to name their veg biryani which is appropriately made and served in the haandi

10.description: Having lived in India, I am a snob when it comes to good indian food. Indian food is usually a bottom pick for me when going out to eat primarily because I don't like Indian restaurants in downtown Chicago. That changed with my visit to Indian Garden when I visited with 5 friends. We tried a number of different dishes - tandoori chicken, Bombay tikki chaat, Bhindi masala, dhania paneer, Chana masala, chicken biryani, bread basket, ras malai, warm gulab jamun and kulfi. Items I wouldn't repeat - tikki chaat, biryani (too wet for my liking), ras malaiItems I would definitely repeat - tandoori chicken (amazing!!) , Bhindi masala,gulab jamun and kulfi This place is really a 3.5 since I waited 30 minutes with a reservation however that tandoori chicken helped bump it up to a 4/5! Also it is quite reasonably priced at $20 pp.

5.description: The food here is decent. I came here for lunch and they have lunch buffet. There were a variety of selections: lamb, chicken, spinach paneer, potato, beans, lentils, and salad. They taste pretty good for me as a Chinese however I can't tell if they are authentic or not. Most curries/dishes are spicy, which led me to eat lots of desserts to compensate. They have donut in syrup (hot) and fruit cream (cold) for desserts. I'm kinda disappointed for not finding kheer and mango ice cream for desserts which are offered at Gaylord on oak street. The lunch buffet is around $15-ish/person. Northwestern student can get a 10% off discount:))The place is large and bright, which is better than Gaylord. However I do gave Gaylord a higher rating for the food.

3.description: Indian Garden provides a great dining experience for dates, families, and groups of friends. My group of three and I made a reservation online prior to coming on a Saturday night. We were seated Immediately, and due to how crowded this place gets on a Saturday night, I would strongly suggest making a reservation. Due to the restaurant being on the second floor of the building, it actually has a nice little view of Ontario street, which is cool. The menu is very large and there is a good amount of meat and vegetarian options.  We started with their appetizer sampler platter, and that was both tasty and a good value. I had a tough time deciding on a main dish. The waiter ended up recommending one of the lamb dishes. The dish was pretty good, but it wasn't quite spicy enough for me unfortunately. It was too toned down, but now I know to ask for more heat next time.  Please note that rice is a extra cost, but the order of rice is enough for two people. Food, service, and atmosphere make this place a good option in the Streeterville neighborhood

35.description: By far the best Indian food in chicago. I've tried a lot of places, but the vegetarian options always disappoints me.. BUT this place.. is ama-wait for it -zing.

19.description: Delicious indian food with good portions. The crab curry was my favorite but the eggplant and paneer, along with all the different breaks and briyani rice were all very well done. No complaints except the slightly slow waiter service.

28.description: I got take out so can't comment on the service. All I have to say about this place is average Indian food, inflated prices. Entrée didn't even come with a side of rice. Will not order their food again.

45.description: Don't EVER get takeout. What a ripoff. The food is not bad but the containers are so tiny. I ordered 5 entrees and even with only 4 girls we still went hungry.

33.description: Loved the ambience.  The service was also very good. Food was good too.  We enjoyed the vegeterian spread there. Will visit again to try the non vegeterian spread.

43.description: Good ambience but average food!!I an disappointed with the food here. The service is okay but could be quicker. Food was very average. For example, paneer kadai had no flavor- I could fix a better version by throwing some paneer and tomato purée with some bell pepper. Shami kebab were decent though.Overall, not impressed.

2.description: I came to eat here because it was a central location for a number of friends coming from different points in the city. In that respect the place is great.As far as the food?Run-of-the-mill Indian. Nothin' Special.Expensive, too.didn't outright suck, but....

18.description: Last two weeks I have been focusing on Indian food.Large, generic Indian restaurant.Food: OK. A bit Americanized. Too mild.Naan: good.Service. Nice. But i had to push them to get a larger table for six in a better part of the restaurant for us (4 people). They worried they would be full. Sure enough the restaurant remained more than half empty (or should i say "half full")Valet: good and $12 cheap for the location. $8 extra tip made it fair.

41.description: This restaurant is a little odd.  We spent the weekend in Chicago and were looking for places to eat near our hotel.  We had trouble finding the restaurant because it is upstairs in an industrial building.  Both my friend and I thought maybe it was a cooking school and not a restaurant, until we walked up the stairs and saw that it was an actual business.  As far as the review, I'm basing it entirely on the food.Phenomenal.  Enough said.  We enjoyed every bite of our baigan barta (eggplant) and dal makhni (black lentil).  The eggplant dish is something that is absolutely mouthwatering, and it makes me angry that I left our leftovers in the hotel refrigerator.  Service is not particularly warm, but they do their job, and I had a nice visit with the person I was with.  After all, I didn't come to eat with the servers.  I would recommend the food here.  They had some kind of Michelin recommendation, so that says something too.  Very well priced and a nice atmosphere.  Delicious food.

52.description: FOOD: 2 starsI've been to many Indian lunch buffets. The food at this place wasn't very good. Even the dessert was subpar and that's typically good at every Indian buffet. The tandoori chicken and chicken salad were the highlights. SERVICE: 3 starsGood but not great. Plates were cleared and drinks refilled but was never asked if everything was ok. One server dropped food on the floor and just left it. Mon - Thurs prices $13.95 Fri - Sun $15.95ATMOSPHERE: 4 starsGreat decor and ambience. Beautiful place

50.description: Had the buffet here. Everything was very good. Just the right amount of spice to let you know it is there but not so much that your mouth is burning with every bite. Service was good. The atmosphere is very nice. Makes you think you escaped to a different place in time.

4.description: Overall: Great lunch buffet that tastes great and is easy and quickThe good: Great tasting food that was hot on the buffet line. Plenty of options for both veggies and non-veggies. Everything tasted authentic and delicious. The service was quick with the plates for seconds and fast on the water and naan.The bad: Pricey, 20 bucks is a little steep for lunch. It's a buffet, but I've had cheaper Indian buffet nearby. Atmosphere: 8/10Service: 8/10Food: 8/10

6.description: 2.5 stars. The lunch buffet is good, but if you're spoiled by Diwan street, you will feel that the meal leaves something to be desired. I was disappointed in their buffet lunch dessert options.

22.description: Love this place!! ordered food multiple times and also for baby shower. Cordial staff, great ambience and spice level tailored according to request. Love kashmiri aloo.. Spicy !!! Not for the faint hearted

15.description: It has been said by others, average food and very expensive. 15$ for a dish and I had to order rice separate. Another thing that irked me is that I ordered the Chicken Korma and the chicken came with the bones in. This lead to me having to dig around bones and accidentally chomp down on one. This is seriously the only time that I have seen Korma made by this and it just feels lazy.

57.description: Great food with great ambience. Service is fast. Must try matter methi malai and bhindi masala. The laccha parantha is delicious with lots of layers and cooked to perfection.

20.description: The ambience was good but the food was just Ok. They should put emphasis on improving the quality of the food.

36.description: My date spilled some of her food and sighed, "at least that's one less bite I'll have to eat."  She wasn't impressed with our meal. Neither was I. The Paneer Makhani she ordered didn't taste like Paneer Makhani. Both it and the Rogan Josh I chose were quite flavorless. The portions were also small for the price. The service was attentive and our water glasses were promptly refilled. The restaurant was tastefully decorated with artwork from India. Though the service and decor may have been A-OK, I can't, in all good conscience, give this place three stars. The food left too much to be desired.

14.description: We loved the food - Biriyani was absolutely amazing. One of the best I have had in quite a while. Yum!Tandoori chicken was very dry and not tasty but this was the only negative in the entire lunch buffet menu.Our waiter was very sweet and very attentive. I am giving a rating of 3 only because of the surly fellow that greeted us. The management seriously needs to change the person welcoming customers in. What is the use of the amazing food and good service staff if customers get put off walking in and meeting the unfriendliest person behind the desk!!!!That said, if you are in Chicago, you must visit this restaurant for a truly scrumptious Indian meal!

1.description: I've gone here about 10 times for numerous household projects.  The staff is pretty helpful if you ask for help and they have a lot of product for a small location.  Highly recommend.

9.description: A surprisingly convenient and useful spot in Streeterville. They actually have quite a bit to offer and it is fairly well priced. Whether you need nails, a level, or lightbulbs the staff can quickly direct you to the proper aisle. Don't hesitate to ask because it is a but mixed up inside.

23.description: Ace Hardware is still around? I didn't even know that...This one is a little tricky to find since you don't see it from the street. But, once you're inside the streeterville building just keep walking and you can't miss it. Once you're in there just ask someone for what you are looking for -the place is small and cramped, you might as well just get out as quick as you can.

12.description: I'm really not sure why this place has earned such a bad reputation. I've lived in Streeterville for years and would have been over a barrel many, many times if it weren't for this place!They have everything at this location, including, get this: self-tapping metal screws. For putting up the shelves that you bought at IKEA. And IKEA thoughtfully provided you with the type of screws that your husband refers to as "Pieces of Sh*t". And your building, a super cool highrise, has metal wall studs. But you didn't know that when you bought the shelves, now did you? But anyway...I've even had keys made here; and when the first one didn't work I brought it back and they ground me a new one for free. So I even have experience with the key-making guy.They have EVERYTHING and I've never expienced anything but pleasant and helpful customer service.

21.description: You need it now.  Walk and get it.  Done.  Or save a couple bucks and 45 minutes and drive to HD and wander the aisles.  Sometimes you need to, but if you dont, come on!!    Ace is the place.

16.description: Not sure if its franchised but it seems like it! I totally agree about the HORRIBLE customer service. They have signs posted everywhere in the store about what they DO NOT do... or what you can NOT return. "If its not what you want or doesnt work out you cant return it, buy a different one... we have (insert the different item) too" *Real friendly huh! Got a key cut there... had to take it back twice because it would jam every time.  Third time it didnt work I told them about it, but its not like I could get my money back or anything!Thought I would give them one more chance... I bought light bulbs.  I found a coupon on line for my light bulbs I bought there earlier that morning. I asked if they would still honor the coupon less than three hours later. Nope. Uhhh....Jewel and Dominicks do, so what gives? -Was my $1.00 coupon worth losing a customer? Also their prices are not competitive... but that's okay everyone who lives in the building is upper class! Yep so fair for us peons who have to work around there. I'm sorry but if the big chain stores are so much more flexible with their prices and more importantly their policies, thats why I shop there instead of this ACE of a place.  John Madden would be scowling.

17.description: This place is a little small, but it has just about anything you'd need.  I bought paint here recently and was helped by knowledgeable and friendly staff.  Also, the cashier had a coupon for me, which was nice.  The manager also dropped by to make sure my needs were being met, and greet me.  Overall I've only shopped here once or twice a year, but I've always been treated right and gotten what I wanted.

10.description: Gordons has since proven itself as customer oriented and is again our go to place in Streeterville.

5.description: I love this place.Why doesn't this place get more love?  It's more or less a full-on Ace Hardware stuffed into the main floor of the Playboy/680 Lake Shore Drive Building in Streeterville where we're lucky to have anything of the kind within a 10-minute cab ride.  The service I've received during my many visits there has been very good, and they virtually always have exactly what I need.  Who can ask for more?The security at Hef's Chicago Ranch is awfully tight, and lemme tell you, getting the photograph of this freaking hardware store onto Yelp darn near lost me my cell phone to a very angry security guard (apparently one DOES NOT take photos within the Playboy Building under ANY circumstances), but I digress.This is a great little place.  If you're in the neighborhood and you need anything hardware related, the Ace is located in the west wing of the building and the folks there will be happy to find you what you need... so don't be shy... check it out!Tell 'em Hef sent ya.

11.description: Best hardware store I have been to since in Chicago. The cashier was very friendly and knew the exact location of the door stop I was looking for. I definetly recommend this location to all my friends and family and would mostly likely return.

22.description: This is a small hardware store with nice and helpful service. I came here in need of "supplies" that I was too afraid (read: price leery to seek out at a craft store. It's also very conveniently located to my work.Some of the prices here are great--they have a decent selection of cheap paintbrushes--and others fall into the yikes! category (lightbulbs seemed pricey) but such are the times...It's definitely a cramped space but not too crowded so you may be able to escape some of the hassles of a Home Depot. IMHO.

0.description: Have been in half a dozen times, from everything from buying paint, to caulking, to weatherstripping. It's a tiny store, so don't expect even a medium-sized downtown store, but they have adequate basics with a good selection of paint. The Ace Hardware closer to East Bank Club is the bigger one with carpet cleaning rentals, etc. Neither one of them is a bigass Home Depot, but they are perfect if you need something to fix up the house and aren't trying to buy appliances or build anything.

20.description: If you want excellent customer service, Ace is NOT the place! Several times I've come to this store just to get copies of keys made (I move quite often). The "gentleman" who makes the copies is always sitting down, will stare you right in your face while he is in front of the key copying machine, yet will refuse to ask you "can I help you?" You literally have to walk to the cashier and ask her 'Can someone help me get some copies of my keys made?" To which she will yell at the guy who watched you during this whole episode. And please, by all means, don't have the audacity to ask the guy to keep your originals in a certain order-because he will DELIBERATELY mess up the order of the keys. There are several other elderly "gentlemen" (and I use that term loosely) who work there who will also see customers walking aimlessly along the aisles, knowing that these customers need assistance, but would rather not take the time to ask if someone needs help. That would be too much like right! Strangely enough, the female staff is always polite, and the younger male staff is quite helpful. If you live in this area and simply HAVE to pick up a few hardware items, yes this is the place to buy them-but don't count on asking anyone to help you find them. You're better off either looking on your own, purchasing them online or better yet- go to Home Depot!!!

19.description: Ace Hardware is still around? I didn't even know that...This one is a little tricky to find since you don't see it from the street. But, once you're inside the streeterville building just keep walking and you can't miss it. Once you're in there just ask someone for what you are looking for -the place is small and cramped, you might as well just get out as quick as you can.

2.description: Really great place. I mean living in Streeterville is tough since it is mostly touristy filled. Become a member of this place and get super great discounts, access to sales, and bonus if you work for NMH, you get an additional anytime discount.Come here for a lot of stuff, not just tools and home improvement stuff.

18.description: Convenient location and gets the job done.  Seems like most bad reviews involve getting keys made.  I had a key made and it didn't work the first time (they used the wrong type of key, but I went back and they fixed it for free).  If you need anything other than keys, I would recommend it.

13.description: This hardware store is a hidden, helpful gem in Streeterville. I always find the random household things I need at a reasonable price. Each time I go in here I am personally lead to exactly the product I need by an employee. Great service!

4.description: As a Facility Technician, time is important to me and there is not much of it to run around town to purchase needed hardware items. I have always preferred real hardware stores over the big box home improvement centers, so you can imagine my surprise when I found out there was an Ace Hardware within walking distance in Streeterville.The good is that for being such a small store, they have quite a bit of product and a great selection of miscellaneous fasteners, light bulbs, painting supplies, hardware and such. The people working there are friendly and helpful. Also, they can place special orders if you need something they don't carry in stock. I've started to use them for my HVAC filter needs and typically order in bulk.The only (understandable) gripe I have is that they don't and can't carry everything, because of the obvious lack of space. Still, it would be great if they carried some networking accessories (CAT-5 jacks, wall plates, connectors, etc). All I saw was phone accessories and that was a bummer. Still, that isn't enough to prevent me from rating this store five stars. This has become my "Go To" place now (Along with their location on Illinois & Orleans) for everything hardware and I will continue to shop there for the foreseeable future.

24.description: This Ace is inside the Playboy building on the first floor. It's on the smaller side for a hardware store, but has most of what you probably need living in this area. If you're looking for basic tools, lightbulbs, or nails then you should be ok going here. Otherwise, you'll probably need to try a larger store. Good selection of paint. They lose a couple of stars from me because their service is always less than helpful or friendly.

6.description: Service is terrible!!!! Everybody that works there seems to be in hell, like they all hate their jobs! Every time I go they won't even say hi even worse help me.

15.description: If you want excellent customer service, Ace is NOT the place! Several times I've come to this store just to get copies of keys made (I move quite often). The "gentleman" who makes the copies is always sitting down, will stare you right in your face while he is in front of the key copying machine, yet will refuse to ask you "can I help you?" You literally have to walk to the cashier and ask her 'Can someone help me get some copies of my keys made?" To which she will yell at the guy who watched you during this whole episode. And please, by all means, don't have the audacity to ask the guy to keep your originals in a certain order-because he will DELIBERATELY mess up the order of the keys. There are several other elderly "gentlemen" (and I use that term loosely) who work there who will also see customers walking aimlessly along the aisles, knowing that these customers need assistance, but would rather not take the time to ask if someone needs help. That would be too much like right! Strangely enough, the female staff is always polite, and the younger male staff is quite helpful. If you live in this area and simply HAVE to pick up a few hardware items, yes this is the place to buy them-but don't count on asking anyone to help you find them. You're better off either looking on your own, purchasing them online or better yet- go to Home Depot!!!

7.description: Hidden gem! Thought I had to go all the way to Target for some specific bulbs, but then I remembered this place. They actually made us find this place during a scavenger hunt our first week of grad school, because it's so useful. It's not as big as the Home Depot, but I'm not going to be needing aisles of light fixtures/bathroom sinks for a looong time. Until then, this place is good for all the basics.

8.description: I have lived in the neighborhood for about 5 years and have been in this hardware store about a dozen times. I am often frustrated by how much more expensive their items are verses the Walgreens next door which is high priced, as it is.  But sometimes I am in need of a very long extension cord for my hospitalized mother so her IV pole with her chemo can be pulled all around the room without needing to be unplugged.  another time I went in to get a hook to stick on to my wall next to my front door for my keys and found a medium size  metal hook that was brushed metal, like my door know.....it was $9.99....but I had to have it right then. A two p ck of the identical 3M medium hook was $5.99....so I way overspent, but I've always had good service and shop at Ace when I need something now and cannot wait for Amazon.The store is bigger3r then you think once you get inside.  Just be prepared for high prices.  Sometimes.....it's worth it and necessary.

3.description: For a small store, they've got everything you can ask for. Keys made, crazy glue and patio tables. Super convenient.

14.description: This is a small hardware store with nice and helpful service. I came here in need of "supplies" that I was too afraid (read: price leery to seek out at a craft store. It's also very conveniently located to my work.Some of the prices here are great--they have a decent selection of cheap paintbrushes--and others fall into the yikes! category (lightbulbs seemed pricey) but such are the times...It's definitely a cramped space but not too crowded so you may be able to escape some of the hassles of a Home Depot. IMHO.

12.description: Would not return because the staff's ignorance:Tried to get some tan before an event. They would not allow me to use their tanning beds because my lotion for indoor tanning wasn't bought at their salon and because it contained.... OIL. Yes, oil. The guy who works there (and the girl who is the manager!) told me they take classes and are taught what's allowed on the beds and what's not. Well, both of them must have failed the courses. I asked them to show me their bottles of tanning lotion, which they did, and each one of them contained OIL. So I emailed their corporate headquarters, and they confirmed that my Indoor Tanning Lotion IS allowed on their beds. Of course, I wouldn't give any business to ignorance, so I didn't return. My tanning lotion was accepted at other indoor tanning places.

7.description: Staff is very rude and unfriendly...especially daytime girl...if it wasn't close to my work, would never go here! This is consistent every time i go...suggest hiring more friendly staff!

3.description: So I walk in and no one is there....no sign, no note, no one...anywhere.There is an iphone behind the counter.  Needless to say, I thought about swiping it and leaving...but I am a good person.  Along with a laptop and some other things.  I just made myself at home after about 5 minutes.  I even called the phone and it just rang and rang.  I waited about 10 minutes.  At this point, I was kind of curious where in the heck was the staff?  I guess if I loved tanning lotions, I could have taken one of those as well.  Alas, I hate smelling like coconut and feeling like a greased monkey.Ah, finally, walks in a shorter, Asian girl with her Chipotle!  The mystery is solved.  Sorry I interrupted your lunch.  She was crude and rude...I should have swiped her iPhone while I had the chance.The beds here are OLD, gross and whatever...I mean, do people really go tanning anymore???  Yes, yes I am here to tan...but I bought a groupon for super cheap.  I am slightly embarrassed that I went tanning.  Somehow I justify the act in my head and get my vitamin D dose a few times after this time.  Each time feeling dirty and shady after leaving Ultimate Exposure...kind of like leaving a strip club...hmmm, maybe I will just stick to tan towels.

1.description: $30 a month for unlimited tanning in a standard bed is whatever. This place is usually pretty empty when I go (after 5:30 pm on weekdays), so no complaints there. The beds are just fine, the low level beds have facial tanners which is nicer than most salons, but I don't think the bulbs are replaced as often as they should be. The aesthetics of this place is hilarious - I almost think it's a temporary location, because the walls are all thin and cheap. No money went into any design. The walls are bare. It's so weird.2/3 of the employees I have encountered thus far are so blatantly rude and awfully unwelcoming and oddly narcissistic it's amusing. It's gotten to the point where I just walk out without saying goodbye or thank you. And surprise! No one says anything to me either. Now THAT is some customer service!On the bright side, this place has convenient locations across the city and suburbs, and I hear these are much better. If you're cool with just walking in, getting what you need (some faux rays and vitamin D), and leaving, this is your place. Just don't expect good customer service.

2.description: Beds are fine and at least it's quick (though I'd add a higher level stand up), but my big complaint here is the staff. The reviews below that talk about this are spot on. There is one nice guy there, but at least a few of the girls have just been flat out rude. I don't need to be treated like a queen, but I'd appreciate not being talked down to in such a condescending manner when some tanning salon girl explains to me that I have to wait 24 hours--not 23 hours--between tans. If this place weren't on my block I would have stopped going a long time ago. You should only go here if it is truly convenient for you.

9.description: Decent price and easy location but the service there is horrible! I explained my skin sensitivity and that I knew nothing about tanning and haven't gone in years but just wanted "a little color" before my trip to a warm climate. The girl took that info and decided to fry me in the stand up machine. I was severely burnt for 3 days and had the most uncomfortable long plane flight of my life. You need to recommend the correct things for the customer not burn them to make 2 extra bucks.

18.description: This location is within walking distance for my boyfriend and I, which is good.  The bad part?  Perhaps bad is too strong of a word but between the raggedy old "Ultrabed" (a leftover from when this place was Tan Bodies?) and the unpleasant Janine Garafalo-lookalike (who can't hide her bitterness in her inability to up sell us "Monster" beds and overpriced lotions you can buy cheaper online)  manning the front counter, this location gets two stars from me.

10.description: Don't even think about setting up a membership here! Or a least, make sure you keep a copy of all or your receipts! I had a spray tan membership deal that was to end May 1, 2012-which meant stop charging my account. I had signed up for an automatic cancellation which NEVER happened. They have been charging me $65.99/mo. since May. Customer service was a joke. They didn't re-pay me because they "couldn't find" a copy of my automatic cancellation. They didn't even offer me any sort of consolation. Just said they would stop payment from here on out. What kind of customer service doesn't want to keep your business? I will never step foot into an Ultimate Exposure again. Jergens ladies!

13.description: I'll quote Dave Matthews: "So much to Say..." but I'll keep it to a user-friendly, bullet-point list:CONS:This location is far from the nicest Ultimate Exposure in town. It has a stark, industrial feel to it, and lately the door alarm has been broken, which means it goes off every 5 seconds continuously. Beyond annoying!In prime time you will wait up to 20 minutes for an ultra bed, (the only bed available for the cheap promotions) Unlike the other poster, I am not impressed with the quality of the ultra beds, but I just remind myself that you get what you pay for.The promotions are only available for first time customers. The next package you buy will be considerably more expensive.Finally, my BIGGEST pet peeve of this place: I am continuously asked: "What lotion are you using today?" You know how I want to answer this question? "None of your  $&^%@# business!!" I have lotion now, and I use it. But, A) I had a long day at work, and frankly I don't feel like hearing the sales pitch about bronzing agents and silicone bases, and B) There is no law that states you have to have lotion on your body to lie in a tanning bed! I bought lotion on the internet specifically because I didn't want to buy it at UE and reward this pushy sales pitch. No way. PROS:Cheap- You really can't beat the initial deal. Clean and fairly efficient, albeit stark and sparse.Locations- lots of em, which is nice.So, in the end, you get what you pay for. Executive Tans on Sheffield is better- too bad they're so far away from me. Now, go buy some lotion on ebay!

16.description: Just wanted to write an update saying that the staff has gotten alot more friendly. Give credit where credit is due, right? No change in the parking situation, but it's close to my work, so I just walk over there at lunch.

17.description: Pale skin like mine often needs a little fake baking just to allow for that 'non-albino glow'. While the company has multiple locations all over the city (and this is far from the best) it is only 2 blocks from my office. The rooms are tight but serve their purpose, typically there isn't a long wait & the prices are reasonable (tan all you want for $19.99 a month). Most importantly, their beds are clean & the bulbs are fresh & hot. If you prefer to bask in your artificial sunlight while jamming to tunes...pack your ipod, as the radios aren't very great.

15.description: Very close to home, so I am happy to trot over there, very convenient. I always use an upgraded bed, as through experience at almost any place you tan, they are better maintained, and of course faster. I think they do a great job of keeping it clean, which is huge considering they only have one person working per shift and I have seen it absurdly busy, so the demeanor of the staff and the fact that they have that much to do and still are nice makes me rock the thumbs up sign. The manager, Freddie, is absolutely adorable and the nicest person on earth, and knows a ton about lotions, and will very quickly give you an honest opinion. Love him!

0.description: Right... This place has had so many bad reviews... I think it's a bit unfair - I've given a 3 star rating but I think the sunbeds deserve a 5 - I come out looking very brown each time I use them and it makes me feel very radiant.. Also the location for me is fantastic as it's a 5 min walk from my condo.. :) the reason I give a 3 is because of the staff.. One girl is abso amazing and deserves a 5 but there are other members of staff that are a liability or just very rude and thts why I lowered my rating.. When I walk in any kind of shop or salon I like to be treated well - not like the queen, but well - not like I'm a burden.. I worked as a cashier in a bank for 7 years and trust me, I had my bad days but never would I dream of taking it out on customers.. So there you have it - great place but some downfalls.. :)

5.description: Rating on the services and choices for patrons: I am by no means a frugal person, as much as my husband wishes I were. The options for tanning here were overpriced, hands down. The lowest end beds were $30/month with the next step (of five) priced at $50. That is a pretty extensive jump in price for a still mediocre bed. Being that I travel to Chicago from NYC each week, I would have paid the $50 without complaint IF they wouldn't require a minimum of THREE months. No other options except $25/visit.... that's it! Out of principal I won't allow myself to be forced into an overpriced contract. If you gave better options, you would probably have more business.

11.description: Their employees lied to get me to upgrade my package. Then once I did, they charged me a month early and refused to refund the money unless I signed another contract.  Horrible service experience.

8.description: I've only been here once and it was also my first time at an Ultimate Exposure but so far I have nothing but good things to say. The girl behind the counter was quite friendly and showed me around the salon and to each of the beds, explaining exactly how they all worked. I didn't feel pressured at any point to purchase a package or upgrade but then again I went in with the mindset that I was going to purchase a package regardless. I also didn't feel any pressure to buy new lotion and she was cool with me using my lotion that I had leftover from my last salon. I am paying a little more than I did on my last package but it's worth it in my opinion because I'm getting access to every bed in the salon and that's perfect for me because I need a stronger bed to get a good tan going. The salon itself is under construction as they are adding new beds and whatnot but I still felt it was clean and orderly, I didn't even realize construction was going on until she pointed it out to me. The beds and rooms were also very clean and neat and I LOVED the bed I ended up using. Aromatherapy while tanning? Sold!

4.description: First impression...I liked it. Friendly and pleasant service. Good location. Adequate equipment.

14.description: Let's be honest - the Ultra beds are useless.But with that said, the staff was always really helpful and friendly to me.  And although they did ask me about which lotion I was using about half the time, I dont really mind.  It's their job.  I'm sure they hate asking just as much as we hate hearing it.When I lived in Texas, I guess I was spoiled with the tanning salon I used there because it was way more simple than Ultimate Exposure.  There was the regular beds and the super beds, unlimited tans with each (in a 24 hour period, of course) and the super beds were slightly more expensive.  Simple and easy.The first day at Ultimate Exposure I was overwhelmed with the thousands of points and dozens of different beds; unlimited plans or points plans; upgrade to this plan and receive a discount on this thing or that.  I mean, damn.  It was like a pop quiz.I went to three different locations, which were all conveniently close to either my work or apartment or movie theater, and was pleased with the service I received.  There's one guy who works this Streeterville location, mostly weekday afternoons, who I adore.  I dont know his name but he looks like a Brad or a Justin.  I want to give him a hug and put him in my pocket - so cute.My experience is, again, that the Ultrabeds are useless.  Try at least the Monster Bronzer.  I upgraded to it a few times when the wait for the ultrabeds was excessive.  And I actually really liked the bed.  Much better results.I put in my 30 day notice to cancel my membership and will probably see how cheap I can tan my pale ass next summer.  But it'll at least be on the Monster Bronzer bed.

6.description: Ultimate exposure is by far the worst company to work for or patronize. The equipment is hardly ever maintained and it is HIGHLY overpriced. I'm pretty sure the regional manager doesn't exist because I worked there for a year and had never seen them once.
