They're also professionals at sweeping anything that would need immediate attention under the rug. Roaches? Not dealt with for more than a three weeks. Bed bulbs being out? Not changed for at least three months after the bulbs had burned out. Any sort of real maintenance on equipment is hardly fixed in a reasonable time. All they're worried about is getting their money no matter how horrible their services are. They're constantly getting new management, each one more incompetent than the last. Their way of handling customer service complaints are an actual joke. They don't have any type of main headquarters so all complaints are handled within the store and with the district managers. This wouldn't be a problem if the managers were actually professional and could follow through on calling disgruntled customers in a timely fashion. As I stated earlier there is no main office which means there is no number for you to get in contact with and since employees are under strict rules not to give out managers' phone numbers or any number which can reach someone with one functional brain cell, your best bet is to just hope to walk in one day when the manager is working. The rules and restrictions put in place for membership holders are ridiculous for the amount of incompetency that happens in this establishment. The reason why the employees look so miserable working here is because they're so embarrassed to actually try and sell you on this establishment knowing that you're getting screwed out of a quality service. Do yourself a favor and never tan here. Even if it's convenient for you. Take the extra time to get to LA Tan. From a previous employee; Ultimate Exposure not worth the money or the time spent.

28.description: Came here on a Friday night. It was Very loud since it the area isn't separate from the lobby of the hotel. They were also setting up some sort of band and kept hitting the drums. I couldn't hear across the table to my boyfriend who was with me. Very obnoxious... Food was just okay nothing spectacular.

1.description: This hip hotel restaurant at the W offers a way too loud trance-techno soundtrack, so be prepared for that. Still, the room is nice looking, the seating comfortable, service is fine, and there are no complaints about the food. The martini, served in one of those stubby glasses (ridiculous! stemware please! always for martinis), came with terrific cheesy olives. Salmon was moist and tasty and is served with a nice radish salad. Polenta with mushrooms was the perfect side. There is an outdoor terrace if you want it, and watching heavy traffic on Lake Shore Drive can be entertaining when you're not in it. Actually, the views of the lake from the restaurant are pretty nice. So if you happen to be skirting the shore of Lake Michigan and pass by the W in search of refreshment, you can do a lot worse than heading here for dinner.

9.description: Food was execellent. We stayed at the  W Lakeshore Hotel in Chicago, so it was convenient coming downstairs for dinner. I ordered Margarita pizza, mushrooms, asparagus, and Caesars salad. It was delicious. I don't mind ordering the same thing the next time around. The service was also excellent. Very accommodating

29.description: Was here a few nights ago and was blown away by the changes to this place...What a fantastic upgrade of the space.I have had some of the food that was nice. The bar/lounge area is pretty spacious which leaves room for socializing which is a good thing because this seems to be a streeterville socializing haunt.If you lke drinking wine with your friends, you are in luck. There is a huge list of wine choices available to us for between $8 and $11. I probably will be back to sample the martinis many times over.Cheers to the weekend

23.description: Came in for Thanksgiving dinner and had a really wonderful time with my family! They had a Thanksgiving food menu AND allowed guests to order off their regular menu as well... I thought that was nice.  We made a reservation (which I would recommend if you are planning to eat here for dinner) and the receptionist was very friendly. When we arrived, we had to walk through the lobby of the hotel before we reached the restaurant. It was super cute and super trendy. I was totally loving the vibe. We were seated quickly. I will say the tables are quiet close to each other, which made the dining experience slightly uncomfortable (i.e., overhearing our neighbors conversations, getting up to use the restrooms were awkward, etc.) We ended up not ordering any of the items off the Thanksgiving menu (besides the dessert items). Here is the food summary: APPS- The calamari and zucchini frittis were delicious. MAINS- The sausage pizza was good. The truffled mac and cheese was the BEST. The salmon was good, but nothing special...and the lamb pasta dish was not my favorite. DESSERT- Apple pie was too sweet for me but the cookie cheesecake was perfection. DRINKS- They had the vandermill ginger peach which is one of my favorites! A glass Riesling was definitely overly pricey (huge surprise when I got the bill)- not sure if I'd order that again. Overall, the food was good. The ambiance was great. My company was awesome. The only thing that was somewhat subpar was the waiter's attitude. He just seemed a little snappy and a little too quick. We let it slide considering it was Thanksgiving. I'm sure I'd have a 'tude if I had to work on Thanksgiving too.

5.description: Decent food but the service is PAINFULLY SLOW. We ate here for breakfast two days in a row and both times it took over an hour and a half for a simple breakfast. Restaurant was never even close to full capacity.Waited 5-10 minutes before a waiter asked us if we wanted  coffee. Waited 10+ minutes for milk for the coffee. Took 10+ minutes to pick up the check.

31.description: This restaurant just opened but based on the food and service received, you wouldn't know it. I had burrata on a wedge of butter lettuce, lamb spidini (sp?), a salsiccia pizza and the conchiglie pasta. My guest for the evening had the paccheri with lamb ragu. Our meal was paired with a nebbiolo wine. What I liked about this restaurant:It's straight forward, honest food. Lots of locally sourced, good ingredients. Pasta that is made in house, served al dente and which holds up to the sauce. I bought the small plate of pasta and it was still a big portion. The fonduta sauce was smooth and creamy and had just a hint of smokiness to it. The peas were firm to the bite. The flavors are well balanced. Plus,the staff is very attentive. Their wine list is long and thoughtful with wines to suit any taste. I also very much appreciated that, despite the marble floors and glass walls, the restaurant isn't overly loud. You can have a conversation in your normal speaking voice. I also liked the lighting, which is not quite mood lighting but is dimmed enough that the atmosphere is relaxing. I don't live in Chicago but when I come back I will gladly come back to Current. I was able to watch and epic thunder and lightening display over the lake from the dry comfort of my seat inside. Wonderful! This evening was a great end to a long, hard week. This place is already running smoothly and I can only imagine that a little more practice will increase their ability to delight.YAY! COOTZ OUT!({})

25.description: Solid restaurant. Waiter was extremely nice and friendly. Pizza was decent. Call me a tourist but would have preferred a deep dish. If you are staying at the hotel it's a good choice. If not, would not go out of your way.

12.description: Was here a few nights ago and was blown away by the changes to this place...What a fantastic upgrade of the space.I have had some of the food that was nice. The bar/lounge area is pretty spacious which leaves room for socializing which is a good thing because this seems to be a streeterville socializing haunt.If you lke drinking wine with your friends, you are in luck. There is a huge list of wine choices available to us for between $8 and $11. I probably will be back to sample the martinis many times over.Cheers to the weekend

21.description: Dined at Current on New Year's Eve with our family of seven adults and two small children.  We were guests of the W and are Starwood Preferred Gold.  We had made a dinner reservation several weeks in advance.  Staff was friendly and welcoming.  The only glitch was a refusal to seat our party by the windows on Lake Shore Dr.  We had called the restaurant a couple of hours before our ressie, and were told it would be no problem.  When we arrived at the restaurant, the hostess told us they would be unable, and that whoever we talked to on the phone was in error.  While we were disappointed, we were seated at a lovely table in the middle of the room.  FYI:  This restaurant is great for small kids, as it is quite energetic, and any noise the kids make will not be noticed by other guests.  The wait staff was excellent.  Drink, appetizer, and dinner orders were delivered at the appropriate interval.  Everyone enjoyed the food.  There was an extensive chef's special menu for NYE, and most everyone in our group ordered from that menu.  In comparison, last NYE we stayed at the Sheraton Chicago, and had dinner at Shula's restaurant in that hotel.  Our meal at Current was far superior in all ways, and cost hundreds of $$ less than Shula's for the same group.All members of our group also went down to Current the next morning for breakfast, and everyone raved about their breakfast food.  Again, service was solid, and prices were reasonable.  We've hosted our family at different hotels in the city of Chicago on NYE for several years.  We can unequivocally state that the W hotel and Current was our best experience so far.

16.description: Brings I stayed at the W hotel I did end up eating here a few times. I never expect the food in hotels to be any good (unless you are in Vegas). However, this place is not bad. I had breakfast here a couple times, and dinner a couple times (depending on weather). I would not recommend the biscuits and gravy as the biscuits are very hard and gravy does not have much flavor. Everything else seemed to be pretty good.

17.description: This restaurant has a very interesting menu. It is not the one that is posted here tho   After a bad start with an unfriendly waiter things began to improve with the new waiter   Food was pretty tasty. Service a little slow. We ate here because we were staying at the W hotel.  Background music loud and too much like a dance club

10.description: My crab cake was okay but the salmon entree was raw and unedible. I did not order ceviche, did I?

11.description: The Current Chicago is a very stylish Restaurant with Great Food. The NEW Menus are great!!   Its in the W Hotel LSD on the ground level. I love their Mushroom Pizza, The Crab Benedict has so much crab and Their Prime Ribeye is Superb! Great range of prices for any budget. Certainly my favorite place to be when I'am in Chicago!

26.description: This place is the best. I've been in for lunch and dinner 5 times. For lunch the caprese salad and the porchetta sandwich are unbelievable. For dinner I've had the margherita pizza, the pork chop (best I've ever had), and the brick chicken, which were all delicious.The staff were very friendly and helpful. Definitely recommend. Will be back!

27.description: We ate there because it was in our hotel, and, for the most part, the food was excellent.  The problem is that they are new and still working out the glitches related to service, but it will get there.

0.description: We stayed at The W Lake Shore this past weekend when we were in Chicago and our first night there.  Everything we ordered was amazing.We started with the meatball appetizer which was super delicious although you may want to get two orders just because they were so good, they will go quickly.My dinning companion had the Lobster spaghetti which was very filling and quite a large portion.  I ordered the prime ribeye which also worth the price on the menu.  The atmosphere was great, the service likewise.Later in the weekend we grabbed drinks at the bar.  The cocktails were also amazing and the bartenders very cool.  We will come back for sure!

20.description: So no I didnt try the food here so cant comment on that this is just on the customer service aspect. Had a reservation for vday at nine pm came in at 850 and was told we are running behind for our reservations. Waited about fifteen minutes and saw five tables open and visibly clean. We asked instead of a window seat we had requested we would sit at one of the open tables instead. We were hungry. We were told the tables are "dirty" and that they are doing the best they could. Waited ten more minutes and decided to just have drinks at the bar instead of eating at current. And if your thinking this restaurant has a view it doesn't, your on the first floor and your view is basically traffic.

19.description: If I could give this place zero stars then I would. Prepare your self for the worst service and condescending staff. Never again.

2.description: Patrick and George were the best bartenders we had all weekend. They made us feel so welcome! Patrick gave us free drinks for our anniversary which was so sweet. We were going to go out drinking at bars down the street but came back here for these two. Definitely give this place a try! Thank you guys for a great time!

32.description: I had lunch there yesterday. Apparently they're brunch menu wasn't ready since they just opened, which was disappointing but somewhat understandable. What I found odd was how unprepared they were. The waiter didn't know anything about the menu, and offered to give us suggestions of other places to go eat brunch? I was shocked. Also, they didn't have the SPG dining card for me to fill out and get points. Food was average.

18.description: Dined at Current on New Year's Eve with our family of seven adults and two small children.  We were guests of the W and are Starwood Preferred Gold.  We had made a dinner reservation several weeks in advance.  Staff was friendly and welcoming.  The only glitch was a refusal to seat our party by the windows on Lake Shore Dr.  We had called the restaurant a couple of hours before our ressie, and were told it would be no problem.  When we arrived at the restaurant, the hostess told us they would be unable, and that whoever we talked to on the phone was in error.  While we were disappointed, we were seated at a lovely table in the middle of the room.  FYI:  This restaurant is great for small kids, as it is quite energetic, and any noise the kids make will not be noticed by other guests.  The wait staff was excellent.  Drink, appetizer, and dinner orders were delivered at the appropriate interval.  Everyone enjoyed the food.  There was an extensive chef's special menu for NYE, and most everyone in our group ordered from that menu.  In comparison, last NYE we stayed at the Sheraton Chicago, and had dinner at Shula's restaurant in that hotel.  Our meal at Current was far superior in all ways, and cost hundreds of $$ less than Shula's for the same group.All members of our group also went down to Current the next morning for breakfast, and everyone raved about their breakfast food.  Again, service was solid, and prices were reasonable.  We've hosted our family at different hotels in the city of Chicago on NYE for several years.  We can unequivocally state that the W hotel and Current was our best experience so far.

13.description: This restaurant just opened but based on the food and service received, you wouldn't know it. I had burrata on a wedge of butter lettuce, lamb spidini (sp?), a salsiccia pizza and the conchiglie pasta. My guest for the evening had the paccheri with lamb ragu. Our meal was paired with a nebbiolo wine. What I liked about this restaurant:It's straight forward, honest food. Lots of locally sourced, good ingredients. Pasta that is made in house, served al dente and which holds up to the sauce. I bought the small plate of pasta and it was still a big portion. The fonduta sauce was smooth and creamy and had just a hint of smokiness to it. The peas were firm to the bite. The flavors are well balanced. Plus,the staff is very attentive. Their wine list is long and thoughtful with wines to suit any taste. I also very much appreciated that, despite the marble floors and glass walls, the restaurant isn't overly loud. You can have a conversation in your normal speaking voice. I also liked the lighting, which is not quite mood lighting but is dimmed enough that the atmosphere is relaxing. I don't live in Chicago but when I come back I will gladly come back to Current. I was able to watch and epic thunder and lightening display over the lake from the dry comfort of my seat inside. Wonderful! This evening was a great end to a long, hard week. This place is already running smoothly and I can only imagine that a little more practice will increase their ability to delight.YAY! COOTZ OUT!({})

4.description: I was very pleased with my breakfast. Vegetarian eggs Benedict was delicious. Nice decor and excellent costumer service

24.description: Food is fair...service is horrible.  There are so many better places in the area...don't settle for here!

6.description: Had the overcooked lobster spaghetti. Not good, chewy and as interesting as a bathroom slipper. Returned it. Nobody cared. Life must move on, I guess. Had their $25 grilled chicken.....not good. That chicken's been dead a while. I wanted to stand up and salute it out of respect. Bartenders are distracted and stressed...which is weird because there's not more than 10 people hovering around the bar at any given time. 1 + is that they have amazing beer nuts that have bits of bacon in it. They don't offer it...you have to ask for it. As an SPG member this is the saddest W hotel and restaurant that I've been to.

22.description: only reason I'm giving two stars is because the Brussels sprouts side was so good. Otherwise, what a disappointment! my husband and I stay at W hotels around the world and always love the food. This is the first time we've stayed at Lakeshore since the renovation and we're excited to try new restaurant. And my husband loves all food trust me it kills him not to like something. but the food was bad!!! maybe the chef was on vacation for Xmas because it's shocking that poorly made pasta would be allowed to leave the kitchen. The noodles were inedible - hard, mushy and clumpy at the same time. Meatball had zero flavor. the fried rice balls had no flavor either. Ravioli was fair at best. We also had breakfast here and it was okay...the eggs Benedict were "meh"... not much Hollandaise or Canadian bacon.... the restaurant was so empty which can't be a good sign either. Looking forward to hopefully an improved fare for our next visit in the spring.

15.description: Great ambiance.. But the steak was horrible!! More fat than meat! I don't understand how a 5 star hotel restaurant can serve such a poor cut of ribeye... The rest f the food was decent. But being in downtown Chicago I don't know how this place survives.. The food is fair at best....

7.description: I live practically next door to this place and was hoping that it would be a regular addition to our breakfast/brunch rotation.  Uh, noes.I will not be returning to this restaurant--even if I have no food in my apartment and everything else is closed (I'll wait for lunch, thanks).  I ordered the waffles, which were supposed to come with mascarpone whipped cream and raspberry proseco compote.  I got your standard microwavable waffles with a spoonful of not-table-thawed butter and something that looked like really old (translate: gross) cherry preserves. Unfortunately, it wasn't just the jam that failed to live up to the establishment's namesake.The decor was stuck in the 90s, the service was lackluster, and I don't believe the menu has been updated in a decade (not even when it's no longer accurate...).Steer clear, folks.  Hit up Local Root, Yolk, or even Dollop if you want breakfast in Streeterville.  The only reason I haven't given this a one-star is because I didn't come home with food poisoning.

8.description: Came in for Thanksgiving dinner and had a really wonderful time with my family! They had a Thanksgiving food menu AND allowed guests to order off their regular menu as well... I thought that was nice.  We made a reservation (which I would recommend if you are planning to eat here for dinner) and the receptionist was very friendly. When we arrived, we had to walk through the lobby of the hotel before we reached the restaurant. It was super cute and super trendy. I was totally loving the vibe. We were seated quickly. I will say the tables are quiet close to each other, which made the dining experience slightly uncomfortable (i.e., overhearing our neighbors conversations, getting up to use the restrooms were awkward, etc.) We ended up not ordering any of the items off the Thanksgiving menu (besides the dessert items). Here is the food summary: APPS- The calamari and zucchini frittis were delicious. MAINS- The sausage pizza was good. The truffled mac and cheese was the BEST. The salmon was good, but nothing special...and the lamb pasta dish was not my favorite. DESSERT- Apple pie was too sweet for me but the cookie cheesecake was perfection. DRINKS- They had the vandermill ginger peach which is one of my favorites! A glass Riesling was definitely overly pricey (huge surprise when I got the bill)- not sure if I'd order that again. Overall, the food was good. The ambiance was great. My company was awesome. The only thing that was somewhat subpar was the waiter's attitude. He just seemed a little snappy and a little too quick. We let it slide considering it was Thanksgiving. I'm sure I'd have a 'tude if I had to work on Thanksgiving too.

30.description: My girlfriends and I celebrated my birthday here and we had an amazing time!  The staff was very attentive, very patient and very informative on the menu.  Since there were 10 of us, we decided to share everything.  A few of my favorites were The Polenta Fries, the Roasted Beet and Burrata (cold anitpasti), and the Conchigle!  The oysters were super fresh and desserts were amazing!  The cocktail list was fun and we all tried something different.  The wine list is very Italian, which I am not familiar with, but our server did an excellent job at helping pick a bottle out.    Overall, the experience was great because I had amazing company, but the staff and the food made everything exceptional!

3.description: Great lunch options at Current! The tomato basil soup was recommended to me (I usually don't like tomato soup) and it was great! The Greek salad was light and had great flavor! The club was ok, not awesome but not bad. My colleague and I also shared the polenta fries which had great flavor as well. Prices are a little steep but it's in River North! Can't wait to try more!

14.description: Walked in twice to try and find a menu, lots of staff standing around and no one acknowledged me

1.description: Southwest chicken wraps light up my week. I hit this place up 2-3 times a week for lunch. It may not be gourmet but it is close and cheaper than many other options around the Mag Mile...You can't go wrong with their grilled cheese, turkey chili and the yummy chicken salad. The salad bar has good and bad days, but the update makes me happy. I love sunflower seeds on my salads, which they have. Depending on who works the grill, it can be really great. They just did a new salad bar layout, so that is yet to be determined if it is a hit. Pass up the pizza, which always sort of sucks.

0.description: Okay, I seriously have hit this place up for lunch, and sometimes breakfast, every day while I'm working in this building. Wow, I'm doing an "I'M BORING" broadcast, but at least I don't have to brave the cold.The pre-made Cobb salads are delicious, and a bargain at $6.10.The salad bar upgrade continues unabated.The pizza still sucks.Now that the morning grill worker has stopped sticking her fingers in my food, yum - breakfast is good again. She's very nice, I was just taken aback for a few days, but it seems that have that particular kink worked out now.

1.description: I swung by this Men's Wearhouse location on 11/11/2015 hoping to purchase a few suits for job interviewing and social events.  Jimmy L. (store manager) and Linda D. (wardrobe consultant) were extremely kind and helpful!  I ended up with three quality suits at ridiculously low prices, and I also picked up some great shoes, shirts, and ties.  All-in-all, this was perhaps the best shopping experience I have had in a very long time.  I will definitely be back to this location for future purchases, and I cannot recommend Jimmy and Linda enough!

9.description: Came in on a Friday morning needing something for a wedding the next day. Erika took great care of me, picked out a jacket, pants, shirt and tie, everything pressed and ready to go. I walked out 45 minutes later, good to go. Thanks, Erika!

12.description: Terrible customer service. This location always seems understaffed even when there are only 3 customers in the store.

21.description: After a decade of working in Alaska and the Southwest (both of which, while nifty places in their own right, don't put much stock in formal businesswear), my husband recently got a job in the Loop.  His new company has a relaxed enough dress code where his standard jeans-and-polo-shirt-and-work-boots combo isn't out of place, but he quickly realized there were going to be a non-zero number of future situations where his attire would need to be a touch classier.  Not to mention, after four years in Arizona, he needed a good warm coat.Having noticed that N Michigan appeared to be the go-to spot for higher-end shopping, we wandered down the row of shops, stopping at several different places ranging from the Gap to Burberry.  Most places didn't even have anything that would fit him - he's very broad in the chest but not tall, so most coats that were big enough around had sleeves that were far too long.  At Burberry we found one that he loved and looked amazing on him, but even if his new job pays quite a bit more than his old one, we aren't quite ready to drop $1000 on a coat just yet.  So we kept walking until we hit this place.We showed up perhaps half an hour before closing time, which I generally try to avoid (as I well remember my own days in retail when I just wanted to go home but was stuck helping somebody who showed up at the last minute).  However, you'd never guess it from the service we received.  Our wardrobe consultant was named Linda, and she was amazing - listening to his preferences, while making recommendations that would work well with his slightly-oddly-shaped physique.  Even though we were there more than an hour, well past closing, she never once seemed hesitant or like she was trying to rush us out the door.  Between her service and their buy-one-get-one-free sale, we walked out of there with two shirts, two pairs of slacks, a pair of dress boots, and two coats, all of which looked excellent on him (the coats especially - within five minutes someone had already complimented him on the long wool coat with a high collar we found him).The next day, we realized that the second, more casual coat had a few broken teeth in the zipper.  I took it back for an exchange, and while they were out of that size in the store, they ordered us a new one and had it shipped directly to our address free of charge, saving us the trouble of heading out there again.Needless to say, they've earned themselves a repeat customer!

16.description: Total fail. I was a groomsman and had to rent a tux from men's wearhouse. I came in to get measured a month before the event. The day I came to pick up, they had a shirt and jacket that were both much too large. I was asked to come back the next day (only a few hours before the wedding), and they said they would order a new shirt and jacket. The next day I show up and they gave me try on the exact same shirt and a jacket which is even larger, with sleeves that ended past my fingers. They scrounged around and found a jacket and shirt that fit, handed me a bag of accessories and sent me on my way. As I'm getting dressed just prior to a photo session, I realize they gave me the wrong style jacket. You might think all tuxes are the same, what's the difference, but the accessories the bride and groom had picked included a white pocket square, and the jacket I was given had no breast pocket at all, so it ended up being totally evident in photos that I was the odd groomsman out.When I retuned the tux I told the staff person that they had given me a different style than the rest of the bridal party, he totally did not agree this was a problem. He said "that's all right. It's cool". No, dude, it's not.

17.description: This Men's Warehouse location has the best customer service I have ever experienced! As my wedding approaches, I have had to deal with many vendors, and this store had gone above and beyond for me time after time. The main reason for this glowing review is because of Angel, the amazing associate that has been helping me along the way. I had a few random requests that were a little out of the ordinary, and her response has always been "no problem!" Thank you Angel for your great service!

10.description: I bought my tuxedo from Men's Wearhouse and received great service in choosing the tuxedo, as well as making the alterations to fit just right.  This store is incredibly busy, but once you are able to work with an employee they give you their full attention.  Saint took his time to help me, even as I asked 100 questions.  When he wasn't there the following trip when I went to purchase a vest, Jeremy gave me just as great a service.  I would certainly recommend this store for your next suit or tux purchase.

5.description: Some good and some bad with my experiences, but overall I have a good impression of the store.Needed to get a new suit as it had been some time and nothing fit anymore. While perusing, Linda came over and ended up being the employee who led me through the entire process. I have to give her credit as she is great at what she does. When she brought over some shirt and tie combo suggestions and I said I had a similar tie, she didn't harass me to buy it anyway. Same thing when I declined to look at the shoes. Not pushy at all and that goes a long way with me. I needed the suit tailored within 5 days for an interview and she said she'd get it done.When I returned later in the week, MW was a ghost town. I'm guessing they load up on employees over the weekend and run a bare bones staff during the week. I needed to exchange my shirts as they were too small and the gentleman at the counter was a bit shady about it, claiming they usually don't accept them back and it'd probably have to be damaged goods. Nowhere in the return policy does it say anything about a shirt that's been unpinned, just if it has been washed or not. They had not. The exchange was thankfully accepted. When I tried on my suit again, none of the tailoring work had been done. The gentleman was highly apologetic and promised it in one hour, which was fulfilled. Not a huge deal since it all worked out, but inconvenient nonetheless.Tl;dr - Good location, not immune to problems but they were quick to resolve them.

11.description: My fiance and I just went here to get tuxes for our wedding party. We had a discount for signing up at a Bridal Expo and wanted to take advantage of it because.. well, why not? RJ helped us, and he was absolutely amazing! He offered his professional opinion, which was great because we've never done this before. He was very helpful and answered any question we threw at him. He knew exactly what he was doing and you could tell that he loves what he does. He made the process seamless and easy for us, and we are very confident that everything will be perfect. Thanks RJ!

3.description: I really do not understand how this place has a 4* average. In fact it is shocking to me. I had to deal with this store for a wedding last weekend. I came in during May to get measured, which I thought went well. I came in five days before the actual wedding to pick up the suit. Everything was like 3 sizes too big and the length also that way. The lady I was dealing with asked if I had lost a lot of weight in the past six weeks. I lost like 3 lbs but was planning on gaining that back at the wedding anyways. So it turns out the gentleman I dealt with for my measurings was just completely incompetent. So then I go in two days later to pick up my suit, the sizings are correct but there are no shirts in the bag. They had to get them in the back for me. It is like the people here do not care. There were something like 7 guys in the wedding party and well more than half had similar experiences with Men's Wearhouse's different locations so this was not just a location specific issue. In the future, I would probably just want to do a suit supply suit, pay a little extra and be able to keep the suit.

0.description: Had a great experience shopping with my coworkers at this store.  Saint (I believe thats his name) and the manager Jim were great hosts and made our experience memorable.

20.description: We rented the tuxedos for our wedding party from Men's Warehouse on Michigan Avenue. Our sales associate was Jeremy, and he was great. He was very patient while we picked out what colors we wanted, etc. My husband decided 3 days prior to the wedding that he wanted to add a vest, so I called Jeremy, and his response, no problem. I was a great experience overall!

19.description: I needed a shirt and tie for a wedding the next day and a fantastic gentleman named Thomas completely took care of me. Helped me find everything I needed and more, gave me a great deal, and pressed my shirts while I waited. Couldn't have been happier. I am very indecisive about clothing and he was extremely helpful in finding what was right for me and my narrow criteria.Thanks a million Thomas!

2.description: Erika, Assistant Manager, was amazingly customer-focused - best service I have ever received, period.in May of 2014, while on a business trip to Chicago, I purchased two Perry-Ellis Portfolio suits and never got around to getting them altered.  While preparing for a business trip in May of 2015, I noted the suits, with the tags still on, and decided to bring them with me.  By this time, however, I was half the man I was in 2014, so I need some MAJOR alterations.  I found my receipt from 2014, and was disappointed that the return policy was within a month, however, I thought, nothing ventured, nothing gained, so I took my suits, and my receipt with me to the store.My premise was to keep the suits, but see what they could do to alter them for my now smaller frame.  I would have paid any amount to ensure a good fit, but when I tried them on, it was very clear that no amount of altering would make the suits look good.  In fact, Erika recognized the need to exchange the suits, and without hesitation, found two identical suits in the right size.  At the end of the day, the only alteration needed was hemming of the pants, which took ~20 minutes and was completed before I even had a chance to get the staff, and myself, a cappucino from Starbucks.  I used the suits immediately afterwards for my business meetings, and I dare-say, I looked great!Easily, the store could have stuck to their store policy which would have left me with two useless suits, but in providing the exchange, and ensuring I left happy, I would highly recommend this particular store to any friends, or colleagues that want 5 star service for the low-cost / high quality) products.

18.description: My fiance and I visited Men's Warehouse to look for his wedding tuxedo.  We didn't have an appointment and came at a very busy time, but we lucked out and worked with the Manager, Reagan. Reagan was AWESOME.  He knew more about wedding styles and etiquette than myself (I thought I was a total fashion/style guru!) and he was unbelievably insightful.  He was so patient with us as we asked to try on numerous suits, vests, shirts, etc., and made the experience a lot of fun.  His initial recommendation for suit and color scheme was what we ended up going with- it definitely was the best choice and his advice was spot on.  He was a true professional and so helpful- even with planning the entire wedding party colors.  He noted things I didn't even think of regarding coordinating.  It was so nice to work with such a great manager- definitely a class act and great representative for Men's Wearhouse.

13.description: My boyfriend loaded up during the last buy BOGO free sale and now most of professional wardrobe is from MW at this location and their State St location.  Somehow, the customer service at this Michigan Ave location makes State St look sharp.  That said, the clothes, themselves, aren't the problem, it's the customer service.  Unfortunately, there are only a few chains that have professional clothes for big & tall guys.  Pros: - Prices during the BOGO free sale were fair.  - Shopping online was relatively easy.- Staff tried to be helpful.Cons: - Sales staff didn't seem to understand that the clothes were bought online and shipped to the store and that my boyfriend wanted to try them on.  They kept trying to put things away, including the receipt that showed he'd already paid for the items!- On repeated visits, we were made to work with a woman who either didn't understand us or she simply didn't understand English.  Whenever I tried to talk to another sales clerk, they pointed me back to her.  I guess we were assigned to her?- Likewise, we were made to work with a tailor who didn't seem to speak English at all.  Rather than find a different tailor, the first woman wouldn't let us talk to this tailor directly, and kept trying to translate instead.  There were plenty of other staff members that spoke English and weren't busy with other customers.- The staff didn't write down or follow directions.  While the alterations were made properly, the items we asked to be pressed weren't pressed when we went back to pick them up.  Also, they had an incorrect count of the number of items they should've had pressed.

4.description: Erika, the Assistant Manager, is amazing! She was extremely helpful in finding the right size for the suit I wanted. Thank you Erika!

6.description: If there's one thing I can't stand, it's having someone try to constantly up sell me. Went here to buy 4 shirts and 4 pairs of pants - PERIOD - and was prepared to tip the guy $30 for nailing the sizes, BUT...he (his name was Saint) persisted to try and add things to my order that I didn't want or need (ie, ties, sweaters, shoes, extra shirts for 50% off, and on and on and on). Oh, and he was my "buddy", like a used car salesman, Mr. Slicko. I told him I was in a hurry and only wanted to buy the pants and shirts and he kept leaving to do God knows what and also tried to sneak in all these extras with my alterations for the pants, he seemed put out when I told him I didn't want those things, so screw you Mr. Slicko, NO TIP FOR YOU!!! Then, when I went to checkout, the cashier tried to screw me out of my discount, had I not paid attention, he would have got me on that one. It was an annoying experience at best, An unfortunate trend that seems to plague the last two Men's Wearhouses I've been to. BOTTOM LINE: I WON'T SHOP HERE AGAIN!!! WILL GO TO BROOKS BROS.

15.description: Bought a tuxedo at this MW today, as they had good brand names heavily discounted.  Mark helped me for at least an hour straight to get a great combination of tux, shirt, vest, shoes, and links .  They didn't have a shirt that fit me perfectly, so ordering it and sending it to my home.   Got everything at good sale prices, so not too painful financially.  I'll breakeven versus renting on my fourth use and no more hassle to go in for fitting, pickup, and return.  Noticed some nice jean jackets at 40% off or two for one, so may be back tomorrow for more.  Service was all around excellent!

7.description: These guys saved my life.  I bought a suit at the State Street location (you can read about my horrifying experience on their page) and after 7 alterations, I took it to the Michigan Avenue store for fixing.  The Manager, Jeremy Golden, was amazing.  He spent at least an hour with me making sure we got the fit just right.  After all, this was for my wedding.They couldn't get it ready until the day before my wedding, but it came out perfectly.  The tailor and staff at this location are top notch and miles above the State Street location.

8.description: I had Jeremy N. help me find a Tux to rent for a wedding. He did a great job but he also made the process as simple and quick as I could possibly imagine. I never post these reviews but felt he deserved it.

14.description: My fiancee and I came here to shop for a suit for our wedding.  The atmosphere is dark and dank and you feel as though you stepped into some sort of bomb shelter for the Zombiepocalyse.  And yet they have display windows facing Michigan Ave.  One suggestion: windows and natural sunlight. Anyway, my gripe really isn't with the decor. It's with the customer service we received.  Our customer service agent was named Saint. It all started out nice and good and we talked about our honeymoon.  And then he started making comments to my fiancee like "You can wear these pants, but you'll need to start doing crunches."  or "I have a hair guy down the street who can fix your hair."  I was appalled that a complete stranger who is trying to get our money is telling my fiancee that he is fat and disheveled.  And he said this multiple times!!!!!  Don't most people who work on commission compliment their customers, and not cut them down, in order to make a sale. We ended up leaving the store and returning to buy the suits (God knows why we decided to do that).  And when we came back, Saint wasted so much of our time trying to sell us cedar hangers, shoes, ties, etc.  We were so exhausted and he just kept going. It's as if this guy doesn't have an off-switch.  And then he started asking us about our honeymoon, which we began talking about at the beginning of this endeavor.  It became obvious that he just has a tape in his head that repeats over and over.  Obviously, I understand that is how salespeople work.  But jeez.  We ended up having the suits tailored and when we received them, we were not pleased with how baggy and big they are.  All of our delusions about how nice these suits were, they were just crushed when we got them home.  We will be returning the suits to a different Men's Wearhouse because I think we will both be happy if we can never see Saint again, unless he's paying for counseling for the both of us.

1.description: I was there when Spice of Life made Chicago history: the first Chicago hospital with great food at extremely low prices.  It was somewhere in late 1998 or early 1999.  A bunch of us ate there EVERYDAY.  So did a lot of other business people from neighboring companies.  Back then, other area hospitals were still stuck in the coffee shop/vending machine mode.  Spice of Life was a beacon for people who wanted great, fast and cheap food 24/7.  It's set up like little food islands--stations, really--where you can get Chinese, Sandwiches, Pizza, Sushi, Grill, Breakfast food, Salad Bar, Soup Bar, Desserts, etc.  By the end of 1999, the Chicago Tribune caught on and wrote a big article on what was soon to be a phenomena: well-appointed cafeterias with good food at blue plate special prices for everything.  By early 2000, my office mates and I had to fight for tables and wait in lines for whatever we wanted--this place was THAT popular.Well...that was then, and this is 2009--era of reduced service hours, apathetic food service employees and prices that are just as expensive as traditional fast food.  In 1999, a soda cost 65 cents.  Now it's $1.95-and no free refills.  A slice of pie was $1.29 in 1999; in 2009 it's $3.25.  During the daytime, Spice of Life is still OK and offers basically the same food stations as they did when the place opened, but service and food availability is terrible after about 3pm when most food stations close for the day/evening.After Spice of Life closes in the late evening, you'll be stuck with the overpriced (yet yummy) Au Bon Pain which I always thought was an ironic name for a cafe in a hospital.

2.description: Hospital food doesn't have to be horrible!  And if you're looking for decent food at a decent price you might want to check out the wide selection of healthy eats offered at the NMH cafeteria.There's a grill, sandwiches, soups and salads, and pizza - to name just a few of the offerings.Hours:Daily  6AM - 3AM

0.description: Variety of cheap good food. Friendliness could be a little better though.

3.description: The selection of gift is amazing but unfortunately the attitudes of those who work there ruin the whole experience. I was in there purchasing some health-minded snacks and gifts for a friend in need (cute veggie steamer, sugar free candies, etc.) and received such a sour attitude from the sales associate when I asked for gift bag. Eye rolling, head shaking, interrupting... the whole nine yards. Definitely had plans to shop there again since I work so close, but not after that!

1.description: We have been in the hospital for 3 weeks and they are never open on the weekend or after 5:00.  It's not an amenity because it is never open.  You can walk to Treasure Island a block away for flowers at any time you might actually visit someone.

2.description: This gift shop is located on the 2nd floor at Northwestern Memorial Hospital.  They have some very cute stuff - perfect gifts for your loved ones and of course for yourself.  :)  They sell a variety of items to browse through: candles, soaps & lotions, children's books and toys, jewelry and cards.  Great gift shop- something from here will certainly brighten up a patient's day.  Friendly staff, too.

0.description: The Pulse gift shop is a great hidden gem when looking to buy out of the ordinary houseware items, jewelry and other kinds of knickknacks for women. There is nothing here for men but that's okay. It's merchandise looks like quality stuff and I assume by their price point that it's not found in many chain stores like Target, Wal-Mart and the like.If you're visiting a relative in the hospital, this place will provide you with something for their room to improve upon and humanize the sterile atmosphere of hospital rooms.I would even recommend this shop for people looking to accessorize their homes and apartments. I was there during the holidays and the assortment they had was tremendous, unique and the staff was very friendly.Being located in the hospital, yes, it was wheelchair accessible.

4.description: It is hard to keep a good thing going and this store is the perfect example of that: inconsistent attitude (and not pleasant), from the sale associates, slow service, dissing remarks - just the opposite of my first shopping experience here. Thanks, but, no thanks - I will not be returning here anytime soon. It looks like they depend on one-time customers who come for a doctor's appointment or to visit a relative at the hospital, versus returning customers. Too bad!

58.description: Had a carry out. Food was done in 10 minutes and the portion size was huuuge.  Real good noodles. When walked in got great service and good food. 45 for dinner for 2 isnt a bad deal. Incl. Apppitizer, 2 entrees and desser. I drink. Good deal, ha?!

56.description: Horrible pad Thai and green curry. Pad see ehw noodle was tasty, but beef is too tough to bite

29.description: Ordered delivery on a Sunday evening. They quoted me 45-60 minutes, but they showed up within 20!! I had gyoza and crazy spicy noodles with chicken. The gyoza were really juicy and flavorful. I'm sure they are even better at the restaurant  because they were slightly soggy by the time they got here. The noodles were ok, but again, with the travel time they were sort of mushy and stuck together. There also could have been a tad more chicken, but overall the flavors were good.

42.description: Food is below average. They refused to take back a dish which smelled and tasted very bad!!

23.description: Came here to have a quick bite with my daughter, since today is her first day home from college and she had a craving for Thai food. The dishes were pretty good, but the service was TERRIBLE!!! By far the worse I've ever experienced, especially in downtown Chicago needless to say next time I'll drive to Oak Park.

47.description: We were visiting from out of state.  It was a party of 4 of us.  We originally requested to sit in a booth but while being escorted to our seats we our mind about our seating location.   The hostess was very rude and demanded that we sit where we originally asked to be seated.  Food was great.  After our meal they didn't ask if we were all going to be on the same ticket but assumed we were and brought one ticket with all of us on one ticket.  I told our waiter we wanted the ticket split because we were not going to be on the same ticket.   He became very rude and upset and told me I should have told him in advance!

8.description: PLEASE DO NOT EAT HERE! I was dining out with a group of friends last night around 7:30pm CT and there was a ROACH found in my RED HOT CHICKEN CURRY! Luckily no one at my table dug comfortably into their dinner yet. Also, I've had better service elsewhere. As I stormed out, a different server had the nerve to tell us to come back again?! I'm so disappointed and reporting Dao Thai to the IL Dept of public health to hopefully shut this restaurant down.

31.description: The fresh spring rolls were terrible.  They are made with some kind of weird flour wrap, not typical of fresh spring rolls I've had at other Thai places with the clear rice paper.  Tom yum soup had nice broth, but was full of a bunch of inedible roots and leaves probably used for broth seasoning that I had to keep picking out.  They made my order really fast, though and staff were nice.  Wouldn't recommend, based on the food I had.

34.description: The food is OK - the chicken is always dry and over-cooked, but some of the curries are tasty. The menu is hit and miss, about six good dishes, the rest pretty are bland. But the service is bad -- they know their website does not work, and they don't tell you this, they waste half an hour of your time and then don't even apologize. Not professional. This place only survives because it is the only Thai in the area - as soon as something good comes along, no one will come here.

16.description: Best thai I have had since moving to IL. I am not sure why they don't have 5 stars! We ordered the salmon in a curry sauce with vegetables, amazing and cooked perfectly. Also ordered the shrimp fried curry rice, equally fabulous.

13.description: We ordered a take out on Saturday evening. It was quick! I liked the ambience probably looked to me like more traditional Thai. We had Pad Thai noodles and cashew chicken. Pad Thai was really yum with crunchy peanuts, didn't find cashew chicken too appealing.

11.description: We order Dao Thai about once a week. Shrimp in blankets, Tom Yum and Tom Kha Kai, Green and red curries are really delicious. I usually order extra veggies in my curry and sometimes sub meats for tofu.Fried tofu is relatively bland, but sauce makes it better. Crazy spicy noodles are terrible - overcooked, stuck together, overly sweet, not spicy mush. We forgave it bc everything else we've had is pretty much great.Delivery is always within one hour and everything is very hot. My bf is typically not a fan of delivery food, but loves Dao.

39.description: The only good thing this place has is decor. The decor seems to be nice and gives an authentic feeling. I don't know if others will even agree that the decor is good but the rest is very mediocre. The food I feel can be cooked at home without much effort. If I eat something and feel like it can be cooked at home then the restaurant has failed to produce top of the line food. But the food isn't bad so if you're lazy and don't want to cook then it's acceptable. The staff was okay as well. Overall, mediocre is all I can say, so keep trying as there is still room for improvement.

37.description: I would give a zero if there is one. Very unauthentic. The Tom yum soup is even worse then some of the frozen food I tried. Super slow as well. Forty minutes already and not one entree yet. Good location that is all I can say. Don't waste your time here

0.description: I had my concerns trying Thai cuisine, as I've had some "very bad" experiences in Phuket and places in India too. But, Dao Thai just blew my mind away. Every dish we ordered (we are vegetarian) was just awesome. Appetizer - Fried Tofu (yummy)Main course - Chicken pad Thai (w/o the Chicken) was absolutely my favorite and the flavors were brilliant.Spicy Crazy Noodles was a bit on the sweeter side, but it's very much enjoyable!Their waitress was sweet and she suggested all the best things for us to eat. Double thumbs up!

38.description: Decent Thai restaurant, and probably one of the cheaper meals in streeterville. Went here with a bunch of friends and got to sample a variety of different dishes, including the classics(Pad Thai, Drunken Noodles, Panang Curry, etc.). They also have some fusion dishes(I saw something that looked like Pho), which I would probably try to stay away from. The Pad Thai was adequate, though nothing I would really return for, and the Curry was strange in that there was a small ratio of liquid to everything else(in fact there was no curry item on the menu but this was just a curry style meat dish). That alone is a sign that it's a little suspect as an authentic Thai restaurant. Nonetheless, my drunken noodles came with mixed vegetables and proteins(chicken, beef, shrimp), and was actually fairly decent. And at $9.25, you could do far worse for dinner in streeterville. If someone is feeling Thai and doesn't want to go very far, I wouldn't complain.

51.description: SOLID. I had one goal since moving to my new place in Chicago. Find the best beef pad see eiw. Well lucky I didn't have to go too far or check out too many places! Stir-fried large rice noodle with beef, egg, Chinese broccoli and caramelized garlic soy sauce sauce cooked to perfection. Comes out fast and the price is really reasonable. Will definitely be back here many many times to come in the future.Til next time, cheers!

27.description: Got more than expected. Great value. Like the atmosphere. The staff is friendly. Food was good especially the chicken satay.

32.description: I took my cousins from Lithuania for good hot soup after cold day in Chicago . Good was great , and I will comeback for soup again. I will recommend this place to my friend , of course if they like Thai food

54.description: Really wanted this place to work :-( I called for pick up and asked if they could make the pad Thai spicy. They said yes. When I got the food I was disappointed to see that the noodles were not spicy at all; they just gave me a small container of "spicy sauce" on the side. And my search for spicy pad Thai continues....

48.description: Worst excuse for thai I have ever had. First of all I had to wait 30 minutes for a take out order. Got home and it was wrong- I should have checked. The spring rolls fell apart and we're tasteless. They did not include the sauce. The lab gai was overcooked and again tastless. The pad thai was the palest I have ever seen - the whole dish was a pale yellow. Not sure the tofu was cooked and again tasteless. Please do not ever go there!

44.description: One of my favorite Thai food places in Chicago. The place is decorated very nicely and they even have seatings where it looks like your seating on the floor and your legs are under the table. The food was very good and flavorful. I been here a couple of times and I plan to go back.  I have tried different dishes on the menu and have not  been disappointed yet. If you love Thai food give this place a try, they have many options for you to try!!

24.description: This is an awesome place. Got ginger chicken. The first bite itself surprised me with all of the spices. The dish was also very hot. But I love hot. So it was perfect. Would come again when I come to Chicago

7.description: We,a group of seven friends, went to this restaurant on Saturday night. We got bad experience from this restaurant. We got pretty spicy food even we told the waiter for less spicy food as some of our friends can't eat spicy. We found chili in squid garlic and pepper stir fried which is unusual for this No Spicy dish!! Besides, when we asked for check and later we informed the waiter that we wanna split check. He said "you should tell me first (or why don't you tell me first), but I will do it anyway then". This was very unprofessional and not ok for us. I've never heard any waiters said to customers like this. He should have never said this if he had a service-mind. We were very upset with the service especially myself. This turned out that we didn't enjoy the dinner as we expected. PS. If you come as a group and order a lot, please carefully recheck the final price on the check as this restaurant let the waiter calculate the price and write down on the paper, not from the system.

49.description: This was without a doubt the single worst Thai restaurant I've ever been to anywhere in the world. Went with my wife for lunch and I got spicy basil chicken (Thai spicy) and she got the tom yum soup. It took 30 minutes to arrive despite the place being nearly empty during the lunch hour. The only thing you could taste at all was sodium from soy sauce, they used absolutely no nam pla (fish sauce) that is distinctive in what I had ordered. Instead it was not spicy at all, had no taste apart from sodium, and the best part? They put TOMATOES in my dish. What planet is this?

40.description: Not a good experience "Fresh spring rolls" are raw flour egg rolls They were rude and not helpful to switch to something edible Gross duck sauce poured all over it

53.description: Usually good, my last visit was terrible. I ordered the Tom Yum Noodle soup. I don't know what they served me but it was one of the worst things I've had at a restaurant. Read my other reviews and I try to be pretty even keel about things; rational and support reviews. This was unacceptably bad. It was NOT tom yum anything. It was overly salty chicken broth (it also tasted of old salt; salt that has been sitting in a cabinet too long and absorbing the funk of a cabinet). There was nothing sour about it and the chicken was simply bland. I'm pretty sure they just used speghetti rather than rice noodles. It was riddled with celery (which I've never run across in a tom yum noodle soup).I asked the server about it and she condescendingly suggested I didn't know what I was talking about. I love thai food and have had thai all over the world. I know the difference between "chicken noodle soup" (that's terrible) and tom yum with noodles.That said, I've been to Dao many times and this is the first of such a terrible experience. I'll go back to see what the story is and change my rating should it be better but this was a serious strike.

30.description: Ordered for delivery on a Thursday night (I live 4 blocks away) and the food showed up an hour and a half later ICD COLD. not even slightly warm... I am not one to complain but for a $35 dinner that looked like it had been sitting for an hour I called to let them know. I didn't even get a sorry or a credit. I was told they could remake my order and deliver it again. No thanks! There excuse for the cold food was that they only have two delivery guys who take out 8 orders at a time. Save yourself the frustration and order elsewhere.

46.description: Food was hot and fresh but the service was awful!! They were rude from the time we entered the restaurant to the time we paid our check! Such a shame considering how good the meal was.

1.description: "Almond Beef" means just that - beef with "almonds". Not beef with jarred, roasted peanuts. No, my dear waitress, THOSE are peanuts - those are not almonds. Which is why I said if there were no almonds available, I did not want the kitchen to substitute the almonds with peanuts. Remember, that's what happened the last time we dined in your fine establishment, and that is why I asked for almonds -very, very politely- not peanuts, on my Almond Beef. No, I do not believe that the kitchen cuts almonds in such a way as to perfectly mimic the shape of peanuts. That's just silly. Those are peanuts - plain and simple. You know it. I know it. The boys in the kitchen know it. But, if you actually employ a sous chef who spends his mornings whittling perfectly good almonds down into the shape of peanuts, kindly bring the almond container to me and we'll end this little debate right now. Oh, it's not available? Tragic. Why, yes, I would like to order something else - how's the "Cashew Chicken" this evening?

55.description: Their pad thai was horrible as well as their cashew chicken. It was loaded with tons of soya sauce so all you could really taste was sodium. Ambiance was okay.

9.description: Dao Thai is on Ohio street and not far from Michigan Avenue. When you enter the restaurant, the middle section looks like the seating is for those that wish to sit cross-legged on a mat. It is an optical illusion because  you can actually sit at each table and let your feet dangle below. We opted for a regular table and chairs and were promptly greeted. I had the red curry with chicken and the others at my table had the cashew chicken and another curry dish. You have to order the rice separately and it is not included with the entrees. My curry dish was decent yet it was not very hot. The portions are good for the price ($10-14). I have just had better Thai food in other restaurants and can therefore not rate this among the best. It is close to Michigan Avenue and they offer quick service.

26.description: We had veggie egg rolls, a curry dish, and crystal noodles with veggies and tofu. The food was decent Thai food, not amazing. Good service. Cute table set up.

25.description: I love to cook and eat Thai food so I am picky about the flavors and preparation. The food here is ok - a 3 probably if that was the only factor. The outstanding service, spice tray, brown rice and country music (at a Thai place?) pushes the review to a 4. Now this was my first visit and I only tried an app and entree - spicy beef salad and Pad Kra Prow so there could be some hidden gems to be had but I am very familiar with those dishes and they were average. Will I go back next time I'm in town --- maybe but not likely. If I was a local probably give it another shot.

12.description: SOLID. I had one goal since moving to my new place in Chicago. Find the best beef pad see eiw. Well lucky I didn't have to go too far or check out too many places! Stir-fried large rice noodle with beef, egg, Chinese broccoli and caramelized garlic soy sauce sauce cooked to perfection. Comes out fast and the price is really reasonable. Will definitely be back here many many times to come in the future.Til next time, cheers!

59.description: I have been here several times, and the staff has always been very fast and friendly (they always keep the glass full, give a big "thank you and have a nice day" on the way out), and the food is consistently good. Appetizers and entrees are very well priced and the decor is memorable.

21.description: Please stay away from here - the food is not safe. My friend and I recently went to Dao for dinner. We ordered right away and the food came out quickly. Shortly after, my friend bites into something very hard and spits it out....it is a huge jagged STAPLE!!! She was 1 second away from swallowing it! She didn't want to make a fuss, but obviously didn't want to continue eating her dish. We informed our waiter - who did apologize but had no idea how to handle this. He looked confused and asked her what she wanted to do. She stated that she would like her dish removed from the bill and he agreed and offered to remake her dish to-go. We obviously had a bad experience, but at least they were trying to make it right. This is where it gets weird. Our waiter brings out my friends remade dish packed up in a take-out bag. Then a different waitress brings out the check (which I think was done on purpose)  and we notice that my friend's dish was not removed from the bill. We inform her politely, to please remove the item since she was not able to eat most of it. She agrees and then goes to talk to the other waiter about it. Two minutes later she comes to the table, says nothing and snatches the carry-out bag off the table and leaves!! We were shocked! We never asked to have her dish remade, the first waiter offered! We were going to say something, but figured what is the point....if their kitchen sends out food with staples and crap in it, why trust that they won't do it again?! I can only imagine what other health codes they break. We just paid the bill and left. I am just thankful she didn't actually eat it!Please do not go here...I would hate for someone to really get hurt/sick from eating here.

17.description: Good service, average food, cool seating, reasonably priced, vegetarian friendly. I guess that sums it up for our experience at Dao. The papaya salad, Thai iced tea, and pad Thai were good. Not really impressed by the curry or spring rolls.

10.description: One of my favorite Thai food places in Chicago. The place is decorated very nicely and they even have seatings where it looks like your seating on the floor and your legs are under the table. The food was very good and flavorful. I been here a couple of times and I plan to go back.  I have tried different dishes on the menu and have not  been disappointed yet. If you love Thai food give this place a try, they have many options for you to try!!

5.description: We have ordered out and dined in here, it is just down the street from us.  The food is delicious! The delivery service was also a great experience! It is now a regular for us!

3.description: DO NOT ORDER FOOD FROM HERE!!! We ordered for a delivery and found cockroach in the tofu fried rice. In addition there were egg shells mixed in as well! This was 2 mins after opening the box, don't even want to know what would have come out if we dug in. The owner apologized and reasoned that the kitchen got "sprayed" and so the cockroaches "came out" otherwise it isn't a problem. Seriously?? A kitchen infested with roaches, where food is stored and cooked....how can this place be even open!!

35.description: The potstickers were outstanding and shrimp wanton  and wonton/pork noodle bowls were excellent. Get the bowl with the broth soup.

19.description: The staff is very friendly and understanding as they try their best to communicate with you about your order and your needs. Yay!The rama chicken tasted like it has a lot of peanut butter in it. and had too much sauce. The broccoli, however, was cooked nicely and had a nice crunch to it.The pad thai had lemon in it. Wah :(. The pad thai sauce was too sweet for me. I want lime because it tastes ... sharper? Lemon tastes sweeter and doesn't cut through the sweet and sourness of the pad thai as much as lime can. I like how they can bring a tray of different spices on for you. I wish they had labels, though, because I added a spoonful of BBQ spice to my pad thai, thinking it was red chili pepper spice.The seating at the carpeted area is fun and it's located close to nearby residential areas.

28.description: Stay away from this place! I used to order from this place quite frequently, most of the time to go. Just tonight I was waiting for my to-go order when my girlfriend spotted a cockroach running around us, just outside the kitchen. She was very concerned but I told her those bugs are hard to eradicate and she should have no concerns. That was not the problem... keep reading please!We stood up and waited for our food right in front of the desk where you order and pay for to-go food. From here you can see inside the kitchen through a glass behind the counter. To my dismay, one of the cooks -a woman- who was preparing my food simply put her hand into  a large pot where they had cucumber salad and picked up a portion to put into the to-go container. No glove, no nothing, she simply put her hand into the container and picked up the food with her bare fingers... I am sorry but I do not believe that is sanitary!I told the guy at the to-go counter and one of the waiters went inside to talk to her. She was even upset when she was told not to do that! I can only imagine the cooking practices of that woman in that kitchen!!This is actually sad, I truly like their Satay Chicken but I do not believe I can trust them ever again.I would recommend to stay away from this place!

45.description: I enjoy going for a quick work lunch especially on their half off Sushi wednesdays. Food is pretty quick & tasty.Quiet enough to have a conversation.

33.description: Love this place! I don't know why there are negative reviews. The place was packed when we ate there. The service was good.  We ordered crab rangoon, a chicken curry, a beef curry, and pad Thai! Great price range! If you go it's family style,  so share experience and you won't regret it! Oh and the atmosphere was really nice & chill. They turn down the lights at night! The prices & food are so good that we even took our friends back a few days later!

43.description: before I delve in further, I would just like to say: STAY AWAY from this place!I was visiting my brother and SIL, who live in the area, during the middle of a work week. My SIL and I finally decided to try out the nearby restaurants and get to know the area. Unfortunately, we were craving thai food and therefore stumbled upon this place. We were optimistic for a good experience given the lunch rush [although, I doubt there was a rush here] was over and it was a weekday. While the interior decor transported us to Thailand, the food did not.We started off with an appetizer. Initially, we were going to order either a vegetarian item [vietnamese spring roll] or a shrimp item. I just decided to ask if there was any meat byproduct in the items [due to my dietary restriction]. The waitress did not know and did not feel it important to ask the cooking staff. I had to therefore ask her to check. Shockingly, these items was misleading as there was meat byproduct in it [in one or both items, I cannot recall]. Therefore, we opted for the Tod Mun Pla [walleye fish cakes]. What a horrendous option. The cakes tasted stale and old, not a good combination, particularly for seafood. They also appeared/taste re-fried [that is, fried once, then frozen, then defrosted, and fried again]. We would have left at this point but we had already ordered our entrees. I ordered a fish entree [the pla-duk pad fed; I clearly ordered this before trying the appetizer] and my SIL ordered the panang chicken. The food quality was poor beyond belief. The fish was again stale and chewy. The panang chicken was essentially chicken with a peanut butter paste. We had specifically asked if there were any vegetables mixed in with the dish. It just came with steamed broccoli [likely frozen broccoli that was defrosted]. When we asked for more sauce, we had to pay extra and got a  marginal amount [for how much we paid]. After this experience, I've sadly had an aversion to thai food. This restaurant has a prime location in prime real estate. Unfortunately, I don't believe there is much business here and thus the resultant poor food quality.

2.description: Thai'd and TrueI am very excited to have found a quaint Thai restaurant seemingly steps away from my back door. On a cold, winter's night (2/9/16), Dao Thai was definitely the move. Location - I am mentally backhanding myself for never truly walking around my new neighborhood to see exactly what is around me. If I hadn't jumped on a bus on Ohio last week I would have never known that Dao was this close to me. There are other fast food chains and wine bars along this street as well. Just steps away from Michigan Avenue too. On a Tuesday night, Dao was not even busy. I was immediately seated.Decor - subtle yet immaculate. I love the statues and figurines and the bamboo. The interior is dimly lit, which sets a more intimate atmosphere. I love the middle section. The cushions are super plush, which makes for great, comfortable seating. Bathrooms were a bit wahwah but Its not like I was expecting it to be glammed out.Service - Quality service! Truly. The staff here are very welcoming and very warm spirited. All smiles and great talk. one of the elderly workers (probably the owner) even offered to teach me how to use chopsticks. Even though I already know how (I was just too hungry to play around with them), I thought that was cute. Drinks - There is a full bar here. Unless someone buys me drinks however, I choose not to imbibe. I pretty much always stick with water. If you read my other reviews, you will see that this is a recurring trend.Food - Let it be known that within 10 minutes of placing my order, I received my food. This scared me at first to be frank. I questioned the freshness of the food at that point.*Pad Khee Mao - I LOVE the squishy/chewy rice noodles. I told them to make sure it was spicy because I have been to many places that claim this dish is supposed to be spicy but it never is. Again, they said they would turn up the heat but I guess that meant for them, to add more thai chilis. It wasn't spicy at all, but it was tasty. I thought it was funny that this dish was supposed to come with chicken and shrimp. More like chicken and a shrimp. I swear on everything that of the entire dish, I had one piece of shrimp. I definitely would have preferred beef and if I try this dish again, I will make sure to get it with. Other than this minor let down, I thoroughly enjoyed the dish. I have had better and I have definitely had worse. Price - THIS is what will keep me coming back. The meal was just over 10 dollars. For a generous portion.

18.description: Had dinner with my friend after a long walk on Christmas night. I wasn't disappointed. Our first choice was Indian garden and the closest alternative we could find was dao Thai. I had green curry and my friend had red curry. It tastes like authentic Thai. Spices were good enough for me but not for my friend who is visiting US. Atmosphere was decorated with native Thai collections. Staff and chef looks authentic.

41.description: This restaurant is considerably cushy. I can exclaim that the interior is sumptuous! It reminds me of my last visit to Thailand. The staff is also friendly and kind as well. But the thing is when I tried their iced Thai tea is not quite authentic while claiming it as a deluxe one. Thai tea is one of my favourite beverages and unfortunately theirs is unable to meet my expectation. I ordered shrimp spring rolls as my starters and they were ridiculously yummy! And lastly, their pad Thai is sooooooo fine! I would definitely date it!  I'm so glad to find this gem.

52.description: Ordered pad thai and steamed dumplings for take-out - food was decent.  We ordered mild, but still filled with spicy peppers - either our palettes are sensitive or they don't really pay attention to how hot you want your food.  Convenient to Prentice which was why we ordered.

50.description: Went to this place craving drunken noodles(mixture of thin rice noodles, veggies, and full of flavor and spice). Walked in to an empty restaurant aside from one couple on the patio and several employees. Decor was strange, abundant, and confusing. Menu pricing seemed reasonable but the beverages weren't priced... Ordered the tom yum soup and Pad Woon Sen. Soup was enough for 3-4 which our server pointed out, but I still ordered and he was thrown off that I ordered more. My friend and I both got the Pad Woon Sen and requested it to be made spicy. My soup had amazing flavor but was a bit different than some tom yum soup I've had and the noodles were flavorless and had one shrimp strategically placed on top. Had to add a ton of chili sauce, soy, and fish sauce just to be at all worthy of eating. The chicken was pretty dry and flavorless. Our servers(not sure which one was our actual server but had 3 people at our table throughout the meal) were not attentive and when our bill arrived we requested it be split respectively between 3. My friends discovered why they don't list pricing on their mediocre cocktails... $10-12 and they were watered down and not mixed properly. Probably won't be back... Good luck!

4.description: I stumbled upon this place on NYE and had dinner there since we missed our reservation and this was one of the only places with a table available. We ordered the Miso Soup, Gyoza, Pad Kra-Prao, and Mussaman Curry. The Miso Soup was standard. The Gyoza were yummy and quite addicting! The Pad Kra-Prao is similar to a basil chicken type plate and it also had very good flavor and spice. The only thing we did not enjoy there was the Mussaman Curry which happened to be a little too sweet for our liking. The food there is delicious and the prices are awesome for the city. The service is even better! The waitress removed the Mussaman Curry from our bill without us even asking since she noticed we didn't like the plate. We would definitely return and would recommend this place to anyone in the city looking for good taste and good service!

6.description: I am addicted to Tom Kha soup, so I had to try it here as well.  The server warned me that it came in a large bowl--only one size--and I said sure, that's fine.  When the Fred Flintstone-sized bowl arrived (obviously meant for sharing), I was a bit embarrassed, but that soon faded away as soon as I tried it.  Blissful!  The best I've ever had.  The embarrassment then came when I nearly finished the whole thing!  In addition to pad thai noodles, which were also very tasty.  My addiction has been fixed.

22.description: DO NOT GO HERE PLEASE! I had an awful experience tonight. I found a metal STAPLE inside my PAD KEE MAO. When I told the waiter about this he became very nervous and said "um what should I do? what can I do?". As a physician myself, I have seen esophageal partial tears secondary to swallowing such things.  I had to tell him to take away my plate and he said they would make another one for carryout as my friend was almost done with her dish. THEN, the waitress comes to our table and charges me for a dish instead of apologizing and admitting a mistake had occurred.  I told her I would NOT pay for this food and then she took away my carryout food without asking me. AWFUL restaurant because of its subpar food and awful customer service. Chicago is a great city so please save your money and go to one of the much better THAI places down the street. They do NOT know how to treat customers and will charge you for a dish rather than say sorry.

15.description: before I delve in further, I would just like to say: STAY AWAY from this place!I was visiting my brother and SIL, who live in the area, during the middle of a work week. My SIL and I finally decided to try out the nearby restaurants and get to know the area. Unfortunately, we were craving thai food and therefore stumbled upon this place.
