We were optimistic for a good experience given the lunch rush [although, I doubt there was a rush here] was over and it was a weekday. While the interior decor transported us to Thailand, the food did not.We started off with an appetizer. Initially, we were going to order either a vegetarian item [vietnamese spring roll] or a shrimp item. I just decided to ask if there was any meat byproduct in the items [due to my dietary restriction]. The waitress did not know and did not feel it important to ask the cooking staff. I had to therefore ask her to check. Shockingly, these items was misleading as there was meat byproduct in it [in one or both items, I cannot recall]. Therefore, we opted for the Tod Mun Pla [walleye fish cakes]. What a horrendous option. The cakes tasted stale and old, not a good combination, particularly for seafood. They also appeared/taste re-fried [that is, fried once, then frozen, then defrosted, and fried again]. We would have left at this point but we had already ordered our entrees. I ordered a fish entree [the pla-duk pad fed; I clearly ordered this before trying the appetizer] and my SIL ordered the panang chicken. The food quality was poor beyond belief. The fish was again stale and chewy. The panang chicken was essentially chicken with a peanut butter paste. We had specifically asked if there were any vegetables mixed in with the dish. It just came with steamed broccoli [likely frozen broccoli that was defrosted]. When we asked for more sauce, we had to pay extra and got a  marginal amount [for how much we paid]. After this experience, I've sadly had an aversion to thai food. This restaurant has a prime location in prime real estate. Unfortunately, I don't believe there is much business here and thus the resultant poor food quality.

57.description: First time to Chicago and stopped here for lunch. Good was exceptional. Huge portions and great flavour. Would highly recommend

20.description: Dao Thai is on Ohio street and not far from Michigan Avenue. When you enter the restaurant, the middle section looks like the seating is for those that wish to sit cross-legged on a mat. It is an optical illusion because  you can actually sit at each table and let your feet dangle below. We opted for a regular table and chairs and were promptly greeted. I had the red curry with chicken and the others at my table had the cashew chicken and another curry dish. You have to order the rice separately and it is not included with the entrees. My curry dish was decent yet it was not very hot. The portions are good for the price ($10-14). I have just had better Thai food in other restaurants and can therefore not rate this among the best. It is close to Michigan Avenue and they offer quick service.

36.description: I have always been a huge fan of Thai food and I have to say, based on the reviews for this place I was disappointed. The dishes were mediocre. The service was okay. The restaurant itself seems a little confused about what it wants to be. It's hidden off the street, so not super easy to find.We ordered pad kee mao and Thai curry, and like I said mediocre. We also ordered lychee for dessert, which was served out of a can on top of giant ice cubes in a bowl. Not exactly what I would call "worth it". Will not be returning.

14.description: Food is okay. Portions are excellent - cheap and affordable! Flavors from our food were better when we used the tray of hot chilis. i ordered the Tom Kha Noodles, PERFECT FOR COLD WEATHER IN CHI.

58.description: all kinds of good food, good prices

56.description: Excellent every time I've been. Any of the wraps are excellent. Samosas are also a great treat :) Couple of things they could do to improve the experience would be to include more samosas for the side and make the wraps just a bit bigger. Otherwise its a great Indian fast food experience.

29.description: Delicious Indian Wraps with tasty filings! Cheese Paneer is the clear winner. In love with the new introduced Rice Bowl. Great concept and reasonable prices :)

42.description: I've been here 3 times now and I have been met with a smile every time. If you're craving some kind of Indian food and are on the go this is the place for you. Although Indian Garden is down the street you can't beat wrap in hand and walking down the street.  Also as a bonus they let you sample their chai tea which had just enough spice! They also give you a discount if you work at the hospitalWrap+ side and fountain drink for less than $8.50= happy customer

23.description: Had two wraps and a salad delivered to our hotel room. The convenience was great, but the wraps were cold and they forgot to give us a fork for the salad. Husband had the chicken tikka- was spicy-ish and had good flavorsI had the chicken reshima wrap- good flavors and not spicy. The paranthas they were wrapped in were good (a bit thicker than authentic ones, but held the roll together)- just wish they were warm!

47.description: Stayed in Chicago for 3 days and ate here every single day! It was 30 seconds walk from Hilton's double tree hotel and we found ourselves having our brunch here everyday.I am vegetarian so can only speak for the vegetarian wraps. Chickpea chana and potato tava both are pretty nice - but the 5 stars that I gave them are mainly for the Cheese Paneer wrap.mixed it up with chutney and pickled onions - and it tasted heavenly.They also have a collection of lassis - Mango lassi is where you simply cannot go wrong.The other one - coconut + pineapple lassi was something I tried for the first time - very unique! It was something you should try at least once. I personally found it too sweet - but then I am not much of a fan of sweets anyway!They also give you a choice between roti and parantha based wraps. I tried both and I will go for the parantha based wraps any day but if you are big on avoiding too many calories- then the roti wrap is for you.If i go back to Chicago - I am definitely going back here !

8.description: Pros: Tasty bites, quick service, friendly staff, clean restaurantCons: Price, small portions, inconsistent sizingCame here to grab dinner the other night. Clean set up and super friendly staff even with the store coming close to closing time. The ordering and prep works pretty similar to a Chipotle line, where you can choose between a wrap or salad bowl and then pick from a variety of traditional Indian fillings. Being a bit on the hungrier side, I opted for 2 wraps and tried the chicken tikka and lamb curry wraps. I have so say both were pretty tasty, however I noticed the chicken tikka wrap had considerably less meat than my curry lamb wrap. At just under $12, I have to say I expected a good amount of food, but my togo bag definitely felt a bit on the lighter side. And after inhaling both, I definitely was still hungry. Maybe portion control is a good thing, but I must say I expected more for what I paid. Also, I forgot to add that both came with options for spicy or mild. Mild is really mild, I'll give the spicy a chance the next time I'm in. I really hope they adjust their portions and pricing accordingly, because other than that the food is really good!'Til next time!

31.description: Oh my yum...Indian fast food?! LOVE IT! I got the Beef Kebab, sweet potato fries, dessert AND a drink for $10. Everything is spiced perfectly-I can't believe this is fast food! I need this place close to home!

34.description: Very delicious but quite small wraps. For the price (for instance, you can get a vegetarian wrap for $4!), it makes sense, though. A nice location for a quick bite in Streeterville. The staff is consistently very kind.

16.description: Oh my yum...Indian fast food?! LOVE IT! I got the Beef Kebab, sweet potato fries, dessert AND a drink for $10. Everything is spiced perfectly-I can't believe this is fast food! I need this place close to home!

13.description: Over-rated. Super salty chicken over rice, beef wrap, and sweet potato fries. Loved the concept but food didn't meet expectations. Chicken was juicy. Won't come again unless the salt issue is solved.

11.description: FYI - I had the unwrapped portion and it's ridiculously small if you compare it to other establishments for the price. There are just way better choices out there. Not for me.To the owner: I was clear enough in my review. Instead of sticking your head in the sand, how about developing your listening/ reading skills, unless you want to be out of Business in a year. Your response was canned and really speaks volumes about your idea of customer service.

39.description: Wraps were good. A little tinier than expected. Worst thing on the menu is the mango lassi. They're salty instead of sweet, and I regret ordering two because now I'll just be tossing both away.Edit: After writing this review I got the money back for the lassi's which were made incorrectly and the managing partner offered to deliver 2 new lassi's to me. Their willingness to correct their mistake is more than appreciated, and definitely makes up for the error. I would recommend eating in rather than getting delivery in case something like this happens again!

37.description: The tikka wrap is so tasty and delicious. I like the spicy chutney and onions. I wish this place was in Phoenix. The service is quick.

0.description: Great place for a quick meal or snack. I've tried their Chana and their paneer wraps. Both are really good especially with the spicy sauce. The pickled onions are key- so load up on those! Surprisingly, you can also pick up spices from Swad from here

38.description: The chicken Tikka wrap is where it's at, the chicken reshimi wrap is good and a bight lighter  on the flavor, also the lamb wrap was on point. Great for the price and they have a few typical Indian spices and condiments  that you  can buy to take home.

51.description: The food was okay but my biggest issue was the proportions. They're just too small! I can get more for the same price at Whole Foods and other places in the area.

27.description: Was pretty excited to try this place. I have been to the infamous "Kati Roll" in NYC, and loved it, so I had high expectations for this place. Came here for lunch on a quiet Monday afternoon. The rolls seemed kind of small so I got 2, the chicken tikka and the panner. I would not consider this chicken tikka at all. There was very little flavor to the chicken. It tasted like the oven baked chicken breast from subway with added psuedo tikka masala. The "Paneer" doesn't have the cheese like flavor real paneer does, its more of a tofu blocks with the same "psuedo masala'. I added onions and spicy sauce which wasn't spicy at all. Although its called "Bombay Wraps' it doesnt really have the exotic spice/flavor profile indian food has, its very Bland/Americanized. Its about as indian, as Taco bell is Mexican. The food isn't bad, just expected more from this good concept.

32.description: I was visiting my sister in Chicago and we stopped in at Bombay Wraps for a quick dinner.  Being a resident of NYC and a frequent visitor of kati rolls, I was curious how this place would compare.I got the cheese paneer wrap and the chickpea channa.  The wrap fell apart the minute I tried to eat it!  Either the wraps themselves were not big enough to roll or the folks preparing the food need more training. Overall, I was very disappointed with the experience of eating here.

54.description: I'm an avid middle eastern food lover but this place is not one I love. Honestly I'm disappointed in two things: portions and food.Portions based on price are small and food is not impressive.  The person in front of me got a lamb wrap and this did not have more than a few sauces.  As I saw it prepared, I thought of Taco Bell. A Taco Bell bean burrito is bigger than the wrap. Seriously just try for yourself.  You will see what I meAn.

48.description: This is a fine lunch place. Nothing special - but solid solid for wraps and salads.

44.description: So excited to find Indian food that is both delicious and really convenient. They would have gotten 5 stars but it's 7:45pm and they were out out of chicken tikka. So, I got a different chicken with the tikka sauce and it was still amazing. The sweet potato fries are also very good. I really love Indian food and we have to drive over 30min for it at home. It's always nice to be able to get it when I travel. This place couldn't be more convenient when staying at the double tree.  I hope this place is a new franchise- I'd love to find it in other cities too!

24.description: Paneer wrap, spicy with onions, rocks.  Great little takeout place.  Inexpensive and tasty.  Was only turned off by seeing a giant Costco type bag of frozen samosas being dumped into the fryer.  Guess it would be much to expect store made for the price but they could hide the big box packaging a little.  Coming back to try the tikka masala and lamb.

7.description: Rosa J. loves the Chicago "neighborhoods."  Customers at work often ask her for recommendations on local "quick bite" places in downtown/loop/Streeterville areas, but she freezes and feels a bit embarrassed since she's a self-proclaimed "Chicago foodie."  Well, that's about to change.  She has started broadening her horizon in the downtown Chicago area.  Back to the usage of first-person pronoun, I purchased a groupon on Bombay Wraps since it's a place that hubby can partake since many items on the menu are vegetarian-friendly.  Apparently, it's a fairly new joint, with chic-looking furniture, bright lights, and clean facilities.  The groupon basically provided $10-worth of credit to spend on food and beverages.  I chose the unwrapped version of lamb curry, while hubby picked the two (2) wraps meal combo special.If you have chosen the "unwrapped" option, it would be presented on a plate with a cup of spiced lime vinaigrette dressing (similar to a salad bowl...in an Indian style).  I personally thought the meal combo deal was right on the money.  The "wrapped" style would cost less than the "unwrapped" version.  If you were to choose two (2) wraps, you could get a fountain pop for $0.99 extra.  For instance, hubby's potato tava wrap ($3.99), samosa wrap ($3.99), and a fountain drink ($0.99) would make the entire meal under $10.  We paid approximately $10-difference since the lamb curry was one of the most expensive items on the menu ($8.99).  I wouldn't consider the portions as generous, yet they were enough for individuals with healthy appetites.  My lamb curry "salad" was average.  Although I requested "spicy," it wasn't anything strong that would cause a burning sensation.  Hubby enjoyed his wraps, but he did agree with me that the entire meal was on a "pricer" side.  Nevertheless, I would prefer Bombay Wraps over other "fast-foodie" commercial chains nearby in a heartbeat!  The dining room was very comfortable, with Indian music videos constantly playing.  Who wouldn't like synchronized dance moves and syncopated music beats?This location is pretty close to the Navy Pier and Lake Shore Drive.  If you ever end up staying or visiting in the downtown/Magnificent Mile part of town, Bombay Wraps would be a good alternative if you are trying to steer away from the Mc*ona*d's.

49.description: I had a samosa wrap & a chana wrap. Both were good. I specially liked samosa wrap. Quick service. Small place, limited menu. Good food.

40.description: Not bad if you need something quick, but not exactly the most flavorful Indian street style food. The wraps are made from really thick bread which makes this meal a little more filling but everything was a bit too greasy. The concept is good but it needs some refining. They should also add some more flavors or veggie combinations. It feels like the menu is limited to just a couple options.One convenient thing is the mini grocery store they have, which is great if you need some random Indian grocery products and don't want to go far. The place is clean and the staff is very friendly.

53.description: Tastes like chipotle. But the size is so small. Ordered beef kebab on rice. Hard to say it is good.

30.description: Wraps were tasted alright, but for the price you're paying for them, you'd expect a little more food.  I ordered the Samosa Wrap and the Chicken Tikka Wrap, and actually did enjoy both of them. The Samosa Wrap had incredibly crunchy pieces of Samosa in it with a nicely spiced mix of potatoes and peas. As for the Chicken Tikka, the pieces of chicken were cubed and weren't dry, but could have used a bit more in depth in terms of spices. The sauce that they drizzled on was good, but nothing phenomenal.  Perhaps I'm being critical because I've made these at home before and know that it really doesn't take that much effort to heat up a Paratha Roll(they can sell these at the grocery store and are just as flaky and delicious), and then throw in some meat + onions + sauce in the mix.  At $4 for a vegetable roll, and around $5 for a meat one, you should expect to get something a little more substantial.

46.description: My husband and I went here today. We ordered Chicken tikka bowl with salad and paneer wrap. I was trying to be healthy. The salad was good and spicy but the wrap is sooooo much better. Get the wraps!!! I love this place.

1.description: Eh. It's a salty dumbed down version of Indian food. I was looking for a cheaper alternative to the great Indian buffets in the area. Sadly I should have paid the extra money and eaten the real deal.Chana wrap on roti - loaded with salt and just okay, a little smaller than I hoped (but for $4, it was a fair size); glad I ordered the comboSamosa - room temperature but flavorfulSpicy mint chutney - star of the show and saved this from being a 1 star experienceAnd for a serious pet peeve unrelated to the food: SUPER LOUD VENTING SYSTEM. I came in to relax and listen to a podcast during my lunch break. The vent would shake and rattle so loudly every 10 seconds I finally got fed up and left with 30 minutes left on my break.Don't think I will be back.

55.description: My go to place for cheap tasty and fast food when I don't feel like eating McDs Beef kabob wrap is slightly spicy and very tastyMango lassi is another favorite

9.description: Lentil soup, spicy chicken tikka wraps, Samoas... Good texture, nice dosa wraps, but bland as Cheerios, all of it. Soup was mostly oily broth. Still, one of the few choices for fast food near AMC. Extra star for fast friendly fun staff.

26.description: Chipotle style Indian food joint with really small portions. The Chicken tikka tastes bland and the roti/wrap was just horrible. Do yourself a favor , go somewhere else.

25.description: I love Indian food but don't eat it often for some reason. Making it into a convenient wrap was a great idea! They have some tasty options here and my favorite is probably the potato tava (and I'm not even vegetarian). If you're sick of the usual sandwiches and burgers for lunch, it's a great change of pace. The sweet potato fries are really good, too. Bombay Wraps was one of the pioneers in "fast food indian" and have a loyal following in Chicago with their two downtown locations. I hope they open more shops.

12.description: I was visiting my sister in Chicago and we stopped in at Bombay Wraps for a quick dinner.  Being a resident of NYC and a frequent visitor of kati rolls, I was curious how this place would compare.I got the cheese paneer wrap and the chickpea channa.  The wrap fell apart the minute I tried to eat it!  Either the wraps themselves were not big enough to roll or the folks preparing the food need more training. Overall, I was very disappointed with the experience of eating here.

59.description: What a pleasant surprise! Came here for lunch because I wanted something different from the usual sandwiches. Opted for chicken tikka salad bowl and got a huge bowl of fresh salad with generous topping of flavorful chicken. So flavorful, in fact, I didn't need any of the salad dressing that came with it (though I did taste it and found the flavor interesting). I think I'd get the sauce on the side next time because it got a bit too salty near the end but overall a decent meal!

21.description: Was looking for something that would not feel too heavy and not the usual quick lunch faire in the area.   Thought the name and menu seemed interesting so gave it a try.   Had the Chicken Tilkka wrap combo with samosas.   It was hot, quick and hit the crave a bit of Indian flare.    There was enough flavor to the chicken Tikka and the chicken was tender and fresh.  The samosas came in a serving of three, smaller than what most other place would serve, but was served hot and crispy on the outside.   Not a large portion but reasonable for the price and I was not left hungry.   Will need to go back and try some of the other menu items which looked tasty as well.   Reasonable and adequate for a quick meal if you didn't want to sit down in one of the Indian restaurants in the area.

17.description: Service was great. The food was alright. I had the chicken tikka wrap with a side of samosas and sweet potato fries.The wrap was so much better than what I was expecting. It was flaky and the chicken was cooked just right and went well with the sauces. I don't recommend ordering the sides. The samosas were very small but generously stuffed. They were overcooked and pretty hard. The fries were near burnt. Don't get me wrong, the fries were good but they just had a burnt taste to them. They offered me a cup for water without me asking and threw away my trash once I was done. It's a fast food place, something I don't expect the workers to do. Overall, I'd return to try their other wraps!

10.description: I was very excited trying this place. Flavors are great. Food portions are so tiny . The wrap was only 5.50 . I ordered a mango lassi smoothie and received a watered down yogurt mess. So let down. Ill probably stick to columbus curry or rajun cajun.

5.description: Was not expecting this place to be so great. Having moved from the UK where Indian food has become a country favorite , Chicago had a lot to live up to. Bombay Wraps is a quick place to get a taste of well flavored chicken , lamb or paneer. My favorites are chicken reshmi or lamb curry. The wraps are actually really tasty Indian parathas which makes these a more substantial snack/ meal than similar I have had at other places ( where a chapati is used). Too it off with a cool mango lassi which is a nice compliment to the spiced (med or high options) wraps. Defo worth a try when you fancy a quick bite.

3.description: Wrap is fine, no surprise, but lamp curry unwrapped is not worthy of the price, and the beef kebabs unwrapped as well, not good value for mon

35.description: Taking into account as others have stated that the wraps are quite small for what you get, i'm basing my review on flavor alone. I recently bought a lamb wrap and some samosas-the lamb was alright, the samosas very dry. I tried bombay wraps again today and ordered the chicken tikka and paneer cheese wraps, and a mango lassi. The wraps were both overwhelmingly salty- inedible. I ordered medium spicy as I was recovering from stomach upset already, and there was a nice spice but no flavor to my food. The lassi was good, but I chugged it with all that salt in my body. I'll stick to my known Indian fast food spots on the west side.

19.description: I live and work in Streeterville and rarely leave my downtown bubble. My sense of adventure involves trying the new restaurants that pop up around my hood.So I was power walking home for lunch one day with my blinders on when I decided to take an early left turn directly into this newly opened establishment. I walked straight up to the menu, decided on the Beef Kabob Wrap and only the Beef Kabob Wrap, paid, received my food, and beelined for my living room couch. There could have been a mutant monkey sitting at a table and I wouldn't have noticed it. If you'd ask me about the color of the floors, walls, tables or chairs, I would have no idea.Anyway, my first impression when I opened the foil was, damn, this is sort of small. But it was tasty! And - surprisingly filling. Oh - and they gave me a $5 coupon! Okay, I like you guys. Today I ordered the "make-me-whatever-you-desire" off of GrubHub for takeout. Pick up was quick and easy, the staff was friendly. I took a moment to take a look at the aesthetics of the place. It's a pretty typical fast-casual venue: simple, clean, crisp and modern. My meal, which I, again, ate on my living room couch, was more elaborate than the first, and just as delicious. The staff at Bombay had bestowed upon me a Chicken Tikka Wrap, three Samosas, a side of cilantro chutney, and some super odd, bright orange fudge-looking thing. To be honest I really had no idea what I was eating, as my experience with Indian food is minimal and I didn't even think I liked it - but I am now a fan. I took an itty bitty nibble of the dessert and had to pass. I've received plenty of rejection when I try to share my Polish sweets with people, so deep down I knew the people of Bombay would understand. If you're in the area, check this place out for some unique, quick dishes at a bargain. You won't regret it.

28.description: HOLD THE PHONE... This place is fire. Wraps are on the small side so if you're hungry get two. Tika Chicken Wrap is on point. Fantastic alternative to a Chipotle or Jersey Mikes typa meal plus you feel a bit more cultured getting Indian... Know you feel me on that one. Shouts Bombay Wraps. Free Gucci.

45.description: Pros: Tasty bites, quick service, friendly staff, clean restaurantCons: Price, small portions, inconsistent sizingCame here to grab dinner the other night. Clean set up and super friendly staff even with the store coming close to closing time. The ordering and prep works pretty similar to a Chipotle line, where you can choose between a wrap or salad bowl and then pick from a variety of traditional Indian fillings. Being a bit on the hungrier side, I opted for 2 wraps and tried the chicken tikka and lamb curry wraps. I have so say both were pretty tasty, however I noticed the chicken tikka wrap had considerably less meat than my curry lamb wrap. At just under $12, I have to say I expected a good amount of food, but my togo bag definitely felt a bit on the lighter side. And after inhaling both, I definitely was still hungry. Maybe portion control is a good thing, but I must say I expected more for what I paid. Also, I forgot to add that both came with options for spicy or mild. Mild is really mild, I'll give the spicy a chance the next time I'm in. I really hope they adjust their portions and pricing accordingly, because other than that the food is really good!'Til next time!

33.description: Over-rated. Super salty chicken over rice, beef wrap, and sweet potato fries. Loved the concept but food didn't meet expectations. Chicken was juicy. Won't come again unless the salt issue is solved.

43.description: The food was excellent. Simply delicious, very tasty with authentic flavor combinations. I was fortunate to meet the owner who was very nice and hospitable. Was immaculate with a great sunshine vibe. Should be one of these in every mall in America.

2.description: Got takeaway about 20 minutes before close - their rice supply had been exhausted for the day, so I opted to order just the chicken tikka and sauce sans the wrap or salad.   I didn't know how well Indian could be prepared in this fast casual model, but I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised.  The chicken breast was super fresh and cooked to near perfection - the sauce is not necessary, but have some anyway because it's way too good to waste.  I'll be going back

18.description: NYC has Kati Roll, and Chicago has... Bombay Wraps? OK, honestly, I wouldn't necessary say it's on the same caliber as Kati Roll in NYC, but oh my, is Bombay wraps tasty!! It's fast food, so very convenient for those needing a quick bite while shopping on Mich Ave, doing touristy things and needing something to hold them over until dinner, or just looking for something quick and tasty! My favorite at Kati Roll is the Paneer wrap, so naturally that's what I gravitated to at Bombay wraps - and it was tasty! The guy asked if I wanted it mild or spicy and I asked how spicy spicy was - he said about a 7, so I said mild and that was still kind of spicy for me! So, if you're not a huge fan of too much spice, opt for the mild knowing that you'll still need a water chaser! But, it's delicious enough that you won't care! Yelp's check in offer is 10% off wraps! And, as I was ordering, my phone died! As I was checking out, the cashier told me that she put in the happy hour deal for me which is 20% off wraps! So, definitely try this place around the late afternoon to get this deal! Worth it!They even have a little section with indian spices, snacks, condiments, etc - so if you're living downtown and don't want to hike to the nearest indian store, this is a quick place to grab a few things (likely overpriced, I didn't look too closely).Overall, very good - and if I'm staying at the Intercontinental again like I was this time (and do on every trip to the city), I'll be back :)PS they have free wifi!

41.description: Had both lamb curry and chicken Tikka wrap. Lamb curry wrap was the best tasty and juicy. Samosa was ok.overall good food.

52.description: Rosa J. loves the Chicago "neighborhoods."  Customers at work often ask her for recommendations on local "quick bite" places in downtown/loop/Streeterville areas, but she freezes and feels a bit embarrassed since she's a self-proclaimed "Chicago foodie."  Well, that's about to change.  She has started broadening her horizon in the downtown Chicago area.  Back to the usage of first-person pronoun, I purchased a groupon on Bombay Wraps since it's a place that hubby can partake since many items on the menu are vegetarian-friendly.  Apparently, it's a fairly new joint, with chic-looking furniture, bright lights, and clean facilities.  The groupon basically provided $10-worth of credit to spend on food and beverages.  I chose the unwrapped version of lamb curry, while hubby picked the two (2) wraps meal combo special.If you have chosen the "unwrapped" option, it would be presented on a plate with a cup of spiced lime vinaigrette dressing (similar to a salad bowl...in an Indian style).  I personally thought the meal combo deal was right on the money.  The "wrapped" style would cost less than the "unwrapped" version.  If you were to choose two (2) wraps, you could get a fountain pop for $0.99 extra.  For instance, hubby's potato tava wrap ($3.99), samosa wrap ($3.99), and a fountain drink ($0.99) would make the entire meal under $10.  We paid approximately $10-difference since the lamb curry was one of the most expensive items on the menu ($8.99).  I wouldn't consider the portions as generous, yet they were enough for individuals with healthy appetites.  My lamb curry "salad" was average.  Although I requested "spicy," it wasn't anything strong that would cause a burning sensation.  Hubby enjoyed his wraps, but he did agree with me that the entire meal was on a "pricer" side.  Nevertheless, I would prefer Bombay Wraps over other "fast-foodie" commercial chains nearby in a heartbeat!  The dining room was very comfortable, with Indian music videos constantly playing.  Who wouldn't like synchronized dance moves and syncopated music beats?This location is pretty close to the Navy Pier and Lake Shore Drive.  If you ever end up staying or visiting in the downtown/Magnificent Mile part of town, Bombay Wraps would be a good alternative if you are trying to steer away from the Mc*ona*d's.

50.description: Service was great. The food was alright. I had the chicken tikka wrap with a side of samosas and sweet potato fries.The wrap was so much better than what I was expecting. It was flaky and the chicken was cooked just right and went well with the sauces. I don't recommend ordering the sides. The samosas were very small but generously stuffed. They were overcooked and pretty hard. The fries were near burnt. Don't get me wrong, the fries were good but they just had a burnt taste to them. They offered me a cup for water without me asking and threw away my trash once I was done. It's a fast food place, something I don't expect the workers to do. Overall, I'd return to try their other wraps!

4.description: Been here a few more times and the food is growing on me.  My usual is the Chickpea Chana unwrapped on a salad, vegetarian and healthy, while also tasting really good.  It's not quite enough all on its own to fill me up, but nothing some sweet potato fries can't fix.  Those are good, and well seasoned so they don't even need the spicy ketchup sauce they come with.  The Chicken Tikka wrap is also very tasty, the chicken still moist and the sauce just delicious.  The menu now includes some breakfast items, various wraps involving eggs, so we tried one of them.  Can't remember the name (and their website doesn't have them up yet), but it was eggs, peppers, and tomatoes cooked with Indian seasoning.  Substantial size for a cheaper wrap, but it was a bit oily (see pic).  Enjoyed the flavor, but the amount of oil was a bit of a turn off (nothing that can't be corrected though).

6.description: Was pretty excited to try this place. I have been to the infamous "Kati Roll" in NYC, and loved it, so I had high expectations for this place. Came here for lunch on a quiet Monday afternoon. The rolls seemed kind of small so I got 2, the chicken tikka and the panner. I would not consider this chicken tikka at all. There was very little flavor to the chicken. It tasted like the oven baked chicken breast from subway with added psuedo tikka masala. The "Paneer" doesn't have the cheese like flavor real paneer does, its more of a tofu blocks with the same "psuedo masala'. I added onions and spicy sauce which wasn't spicy at all. Although its called "Bombay Wraps' it doesnt really have the exotic spice/flavor profile indian food has, its very Bland/Americanized. Its about as indian, as Taco bell is Mexican. The food isn't bad, just expected more from this good concept.

22.description: Okay, so it's not the healthiest food on the planet. And the wraps are definitely not made from scratch (though the fillings might be). Neither are the samosas. HOWEVER it is tasty stuff. Addictive even. The sweet potato fries are ah-may-zing. Especially with the sauce (which also is probably not made inhouse, but I don't mind that). Portions are perfect for price. 1 wrap is a filling snack or meal if combined with fries and lassi. 2 are more than enough for me. Friendly service. Go here for the taste!

15.description: It's a pretty decent short but sweet menu. This place has pretty decent wrapped or rice foods as we've come to know in the past decade. The foods pretty tasty pretty good for lunch out having quick Indian food. It's even got a little mini mart inside for browsing. Good on the go Indian food

57.description: After trying their another outlet on N wells St, we went to mother outlet on E Ohio St. It's bigger in size and has some Indian tea etc products for sale. The cheese wraps were good like before. Tried samosa wrap as well this time. It's a good one.Rewards program which I subscribed to last time has some glitches which the owner said she will look into. Let's see when it gets solved. Rest all good.

20.description: Really quick and delicious! The sweet potato fries and the dipping sauce are to die for! One of my go to places!

36.description: Chipotle for Indian food.  If you haven't tried Indian food before,  this is a great place to get a crash course.  The wraps are delicious and are reasonably priced.  Two wraps and I was full and satisfied.

14.description: I love me some Bombay Wraps. A newer fast food entrant to the Streeterville area, Bombay Wraps provides wraps and plates of popular Indian street food at reasonable prices in a well lit, modern and funky dining space.Get your wrap ($3-$7) in flaky buttery paratha bread or whole wheat roti. I prefer paratha. Wrap fillings run from spicy potatoes or paneer cheese for vegetarian options, to savory lamb curry or probably the most popular, tender chicken tikka for meat options. Samosas (Indian veggie rangoons, essentially) are excellent. Haven't tried desserts. You can build your own fountain drink, buy familiar bottled favorites, or be adventurous like me and try the goofy foreign drinks. The mango juice box was sweet but had spices in it. Not good. The aloe/honey drink from Thailand, however, was a hit.An ultra-suave British/Indian looking bloke must be the proprietor of this spot. He's there a lot. Other than that, employees are cheery and helpful.A TV plays Bollywood stuff over the dining room, which is funny to watch. Look up "Bollywood Boss video" for a laugh.I love loyalty/rewards programs but BW may just have too many. From Spring Rewards to a loyalty punch card to AAdvantage Dining miles, methinks they're giving away too much for marketing.

12.description: The most succulent $4.50 you'll ever spend on pasta, a roll, and a can of soda.  It's a heavy lunch, to be sure, but sometimes you just need mad carbs to keep rolling through the day.I dig their tortellini.  It usually fills my man-sized appetite.  I don't dig their macaroni and cheese because they added onions to it.  Yuck.  I do dig their meatball subs.They usually get there a little before noon (I've seen them at 11:30), so roll up early if you want a larger selection.Overall, a solid lunch option that really satisfies a midday pasta craving.

3.description: Honestly the pasta is amazing !! I had this she'll type pasta with marinara and mozzarella cheese and my friend has a pesto pasta and both were simply delicious. You can't go wrong with with pasta, bread, and a drink for $5!!! And it fills you up! I recommend.

1.description: The meals are now $6!  No longer a good deal in my opinion...still a good option, but might turn off loyal customers.

2.description: $5 for a pan of past, drink, and some bread. There are a lot of varieties, but all the ones I've tried so far have been great!  The truck is usually there a bit after 11 and runs out of good sometime between 12 and 1.

9.description: Streeterville workers, I have the inside scoop on a great CHEAP meal!We all know and love The Pasta Bowl.  Did you know they have a truck (aka roach coach) downtown parked at 340 E. Superior?I know what you're thinking - "ew, roach coach!  I don't eat food off of a truck!"  I know, I know. I thought the same thing.  But everyone in my office wouldn't shut up about it and today when a coworker came back with some delicious smelling food I couldn't resist checking it out.For the insanely low price of $4.50, you get an entree (choice of a pasta dish or salad), bread, and a drink.  All for $4.50!  And the portions are huge!Did I mention it's only $4.50?!  (and that includes tax)For coming off of a truck, it was surprisingly really good and fresh.  I was shocked!Tip - go there early if you can, like before noon.  Not only will you not have to stand in line (it's very popular), but you'll get a better selection.

10.description: Mushy pasta?  Check.22 year old driver texting her friends while ignoring customers?  Check.Crummy lunch that is caked with mozzarella.....check.

4.description: A staple for anyone on Northwestern's Chicago campus. How can you beat pasta (enough for two meals), a roll, and a can of soda for only $4.50. I went with the top seller of chicken pasta and was not disappointed. Good flavor, a decent a mount of meet, and delicious sun dried tomatoes. If you are ever in a rush or don't have time to make lunch, this is an easy and cheap option available on weekdays.

6.description: I stopped by the Pasta Bowl Truck to pick up a quick bite. All I've had so far was pasta and I thought I would check out their sandwiches.Definitely not better or on par with the pasta offerings. The portions were large but just not enough flavor.I might try another sandwich next time.

0.description: After moving away from Chicago almost two years ago, we returned for a mini vaca and made a special trip to the Northwestern area just to get Pasta Bowl again. After the "controversial" price hike (which I still don't understand, because the value is incredible), it's worth noting that the price is now back down to $5 each for pasta dishes (no idea about salads). That pesto tortellini was just as delicious as ever.Pasta Bowl was my first ever food truck. Since then, I've sampled several across multiple cities, and I have to say that this is one of the best values out there. The food is delicious, and it's practically two meals worth. I'm so glad that they were parked in their regular spot when we went looking today!

5.description: I work in the area and get pasta from The Pasta Bowl Truck about once a week. I have only gotten the pasta. The pesto pasta and chicken pasta are both great options. It costs $5 and you get the pasta, a slice of bread, and a drink. Overall it is a great deal and is a great option for lunch. The truck usually arrives at 10:45am and their selection is mostly gone by 12 so be sure to get there early.

13.description: i have to say that the salad is pretty good.. chicken caesar. i am a little upset that they raised the price from 4 to 4.50 over the course of one academic school year though....and the pasta can get super greasy also. i have to use a napkin to soak up all the nastiness and it becomes hard to eat the leftovers after having to do that sometimes

11.description: Great location for those working in the Streeterville area. Quick and inexpensive lunch. I had a portobello mushroom sandwich which was quite filling. Service was friendly and I explained I was not familiar with the truck and the young lady working the truck today was super helpful. It is a good deal for $4.50 to grab a sandwich and drink on the way to the office.

8.description: Pasta = meh.Selection = never changes.The pasta shells with gorgonzola = the best one, I think. Not saying a lot though. Anything baked with gooey cheese wins.The salad = for the suckers who get there at 12.30 rather than 12.The service = leaves something to be desired. For someone selling comfort food for 30 minutes on the street max, why is the dude here so cranky? Print out a menu if you don't like people constantly asking what you have today.The packaging = they give you a plastic bag but it's going to leak if you use it, so hold it like a plate.My wallet = stolen after a pasta truck visit right out of my bag while I wasn't looking.The service, again = couldn't care less about that. I'm SOL, he has $4.50 pasta bowls to sell, so don't bother him is the vibe I'm getting.Pasta bowl truck = meh.

14.description: Oh, my heavens, this little business serves up some very good grub, but pick your pasta carefully.  Some of the sauces are rather creamy and when combined with hearty pasta and cheese, a postprandial food-induced stupor is a very real possibility.Do not bother with the caesar salad.  I tried it once, and it was a disaster compared with the pastas.  Brown-tinged romaine lettuce leaves?  Not for me, man.

7.description: VERY cheap!  4.50 for a filling meal + a drink is really a steal.I've tried almost everything, some stuff is delicious, others... not so much.The good:  -any of the salads.  I love these.  They are huge, and the dressing comes on the side so you can control the amount.-The gorgonzola shells.   Marinara sauce with spinach, pasta shells, and lots of melted cheese.  Amazing.  (beware of food coma)Bad:-everything else.  The sandwiches are really greasy, the marinara sauce is just bad, the tortellini is flavorless, and all the other sauces are cream based (and super oily) which doesn't sit well with my stomach (even the pesto, and I love pesto).Still gave this place 4 stars for the salads and gorgonzola!  Definitely worth checking out if you are in Streeterville and looking for a quick bite on the go.

28.description: First wax here is half off!  I got a bikini wax (too much information) for $21 and it was fantastic. What makes a fantastic bikini wax? A clean salon, a quick procedure, and practically pain-free. They use the type of wax that dries solid and doesn't use paper strips to adhere to the wax. This location is perfectly situated in Streeterville and the studio is clean, friendly, and offers great packaged deals. This may be my new spot!

1.description: I was burned before by buying an unlimited was pass from a lady who then never had the time to honor it. It took months to get my money back (thanks for coming through citi bank) and equally as long to find a good wax service that doesn't cost an arm and a leg. European wax centers delivered! I have their unlimited wax pass for 12 months (13 since I got it as a new client of the center- don't worry after your first service you can back out if you don't think it's for you). I've been coming here for four months now and I couldn't be happier! They're on time, quick, the place is clean and I highly recommend it!I love how easy it is to make an appointment and to reschedule! You can call their number from the app and reschedule or cancel and schedule across their locations.

9.description: I'm an esthetician myself, so I have performed hundreds of brazilians and am super picky but every now and then I like to go somewhere new to see if I can pick up something new to add to my Brazilian technique. DeVanne did a great job on my Brazilian, she was very knowledgable and very quick, the entire service was nearly painless. I would definitely recommend going to her if you ever schedule an appointment here. The only reason I didn't give the place 5 stars is because they use only hard wax which makes the service a little longer than I'm used to -- but I was still done in about 20 minutes.

29.description: When European Wax opened up in my neighborhood, and my mailbox was full of promotions offering a free wax or upgrade to a brazilian, I decided to check it out. - Immediately upon entering the salon the front desk clerk began with some major sales pressure to purchase a variety of packages.  I expressed that I travel extensively, prefer to call and make appointments when I have the time, do not mind paying the small difference for that convenience, and ~ most importantly ~ do not want to commit to a series of waxes at a salon I have never been to before. - As other reviews mentioned the room I was taken into was cramped and very basic, however the waxing technician was pleasant and I was quite pleased with the results.  For this the two stars.- As I leave to pay and tip, the front desk clerk again tries to sell me a variety of packages and says the promotional card I am holding is no longer valid. Interesting.  Not only is there no expiration date on the card but the same promotional material has been arriving weekly in my mailbox for months.  She reluctantly (and quite rudely) took the card. - Finally, she began to launch into a really pushy list of reasons why I should re-book for my next appointment right then ~ no thanks!If you want a decent wax you might receive it here.  But, in my opinion, the sales pressure, up selling of useless products, and the general attitude of the front desk staff are simply not worth it.

23.description: Wax is okay. No frills - nothing luxurious or calming about this place. They are very clean - no double-dipping. My brows were basically unchanged - even after several rounds. If you want shape, this is not the place. I had some tweezing to do when I got home. I will be going to someplace else for brows from now on. My Brazilian took much longer than necessary and there are still a few broken hairs, even though I went through several clean up rounds. The esthetician was generally knowledgeable, but nothing to rave about. It is cheap! So I guess you get what you pay for.They don't, however, know how to answer their phone. I have called on several occasions to ask about an appointment, reschedule or make a request and I am always put on hold for an extended period of time. I called when I was about 3 minutes away one afternoon and stood in the shop while on hold and watched the receptionist chat frivolously with another staff member for at least an additional 5 minutes. Unacceptable.And yes, they also try to upsell you on your way out, but it's not a big deal. Neither staffer was rude, just trying to do her job.

5.description: Why bother making an appointment if it's not honored?  I scheduled an eyebrow wax, which takes 15 minutes max, and left without getting waxed. My technician was 25+ minutes late for a 15 minute service, and the receptionist couldn't provide an ETA of when she'd take me.Pretty annoying when I wanted my brows done for a vacation and now had to pluck them.  I'm new to the neighborhood and won't be heading back ever.

31.description: I have been going to European wax centers for almost a year now. I'm quite happy there is the streeterville location close to where I live. Before I had to frequent the Elston and north ave locations prior to Streeterville. I hope they open one up in river north or loop!!I have only gotten the Brazilian service so can't comment in the other services such as an eyebrow wax. Anyway my technician was Jennifer and she is just lovely and makes you feel very comfortable. I've been to some techs that will just burn off your skin and never ask. Not so with Jennifer she is friendly and careful and makes sure you have a good experience. I would give this place a try and hope your tech doesn't quit!!Good thing is you can purchase a package and it's less expensive than purchasing individually. You can schedule when you need and they are really flexible and accommodating with any changes. So far this place has been great. I've been here 3 times.

25.description: I have been going to LaRIssa at this location for several months.  Not that anyone actually "enjoys" getting waxed, but if your technician is LaRissa the process will be a lot smoother...pun intended. She is the most detailed oriented aesthetician I have ever worked with.  I only make my appointments with her and am thrilled after the session.  Highly high recommend.

12.description: Went to the European wax centre for the first time today as the place where I usually go was fully booked.. It's only a 2 min walk from where I live so I thought I'd give it a go.. And I am so glad I did! :) I had a Brazilian and I was literally on the bed for about 10-15min.. Erica is amazing, so quick and so gentle.. She likes to have a laugh too which keeps me relaxed.. The treatment was that quick & painless that I didn't even realise she had finished.. *thumbs up* :) really pleased.. :) Thanks Erica! :D

21.description: I've visited Billy (female) at this location three or four times now, and every time I get a great wax and great company.  They use a special gentle wax, the whole place is very clean, and Billy's recommendations have helped my brows grow back fuller and more attractive than they were when I first came to her.  They have lots of specials, deals, packages, etc. that are good at any location. I'm a convert!

16.description: I dropped in here for a wax and was very surprised by my waxer. Larissa was fantastic!! The front desk staff could use a little more personality and training in customer service but she was fantastic!!! I will definitely be back for Larissa!

17.description: I am literally just walking out of this place and I am seriously enraged at what just happened. They advertise a free wax if you're a first timer. I thought, great! Why not? I checked in, met my lady, aka eyebrow butcher, Didi and she began doing her thing. She used not one, not two, but THREE layers of wax on me! Burnt my skin!! Then she showed me the mirror at the end. Omg! She thinned out my eyebrow to the point that it looks like liner. I feel like crying and/or punching someone! Seriously?!Then I check out with the receptionist, I tell her what happens, she said sorry and tried to sell me a $20 product to magically regrow my hair faster. Are you kidding me? AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE! awful experience; never again.

10.description: I have gone to this location a few times. Great staff and never a wait!When I moved from LA I thought is either have to find a new waxing place.. Or is have to travel super far to find a EWC. And then they opened this location a block away about a month after I moved. Lucky me! The prices are a little much.. But I nigit a package and they throw in free brow waxed every so often  via email. I sometimes will buy groupons for other aces.. But this one is so close to me. I'm sure to return.

11.description: Wax is okay. No frills - nothing luxurious or calming about this place. They are very clean - no double-dipping. My brows were basically unchanged - even after several rounds. If you want shape, this is not the place. I had some tweezing to do when I got home. I will be going to someplace else for brows from now on. My Brazilian took much longer than necessary and there are still a few broken hairs, even though I went through several clean up rounds. The esthetician was generally knowledgeable, but nothing to rave about. It is cheap! So I guess you get what you pay for.They don't, however, know how to answer their phone. I have called on several occasions to ask about an appointment, reschedule or make a request and I am always put on hold for an extended period of time. I called when I was about 3 minutes away one afternoon and stood in the shop while on hold and watched the receptionist chat frivolously with another staff member for at least an additional 5 minutes. Unacceptable.And yes, they also try to upsell you on your way out, but it's not a big deal. Neither staffer was rude, just trying to do her job.

26.description: This review is specifically for Larissa and the rest of the waxers - not the management (of this or the other the sister South Loop location). I recently has Larissa and she was fantastic. Meticulous, good to talk to and easy to relax around.  I highly recommend her.

27.description: I dropped in here for a wax and was very surprised by my waxer. Larissa was fantastic!! The front desk staff could use a little more personality and training in customer service but she was fantastic!!! I will definitely be back for Larissa!

35.description: I am literally just walking out of this place and I am seriously enraged at what just happened. They advertise a free wax if you're a first timer. I thought, great! Why not? I checked in, met my lady, aka eyebrow butcher, Didi and she began doing her thing. She used not one, not two, but THREE layers of wax on me! Burnt my skin!! Then she showed me the mirror at the end. Omg! She thinned out my eyebrow to the point that it looks like liner. I feel like crying and/or punching someone! Seriously?!Then I check out with the receptionist, I tell her what happens, she said sorry and tried to sell me a $20 product to magically regrow my hair faster. Are you kidding me? AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE! awful experience; never again.

8.description: I started going here when Billy started working here. This place is great if you have an appointment with Billy! The place is clean, and the prices are TOTALLY reasonable, especially compared to other salons in the area. They also offer package discounts if you're a regular. Like many women, I've had more fair share of terrible waxing experiences. I can't recommend Billy highly enough!

0.description: This review is long overdue but it's much needed. I came into this place not ever having hard wax applied to my skin. As I was a bit nervous I decided to just go for it and by some miracle (or the grace of God perhaps was looking down on me ) I got put with Jennifer. She is PHENOMENAL!  Getting a Brazilian, full leg, underarms, nose, lip, and eyebrows is a lot of work for a first timer and I was crazy nervous to say the least. Jennifer made me feel like I have known her for years and made me feel the most comfortable you can possibly feel when someone you just met is all up in your lady parts while you are butterflied out on the table. I just moved out of Chicago recently and probably the saddest part was leaving my most favorite waxer that I've ever had! I went to jennifer every 4 weeks for a year and loved every minute of it, yes I just said I loved going through the pain of getting most of my body waxed because I had Jennifer to talk me through it. Go to Jennifer, she will love you like her own child and take very good care of your flower. I promise :)

20.description: I started going here when Billy started working here. This place is great if you have an appointment with Billy! The place is clean, and the prices are TOTALLY reasonable, especially compared to other salons in the area. They also offer package discounts if you're a regular. Like many women, I've had more fair share of terrible waxing experiences. I can't recommend Billy highly enough!

19.description: Convenient, professional and courteous staff, and make it quick and easy. The products also work great. They are not just trying to make a sell. I have had great experience with the exfoliator, lotion, and serum. I hope you have the same satisfied results as I did.

33.description: I went there (as a first timer--so I got a great deal on the wax) and saw Kesha. She explained everything she was doing/about to do and was very precise. The place has good prices for waxing ( especially Brazilian--it's less than $50), it's clean, and Kesha did a great job. I will be going back to her!

2.description: Pleasantly surprised by my experience here! Situated in a very accessible area of Streeterville (Ohio and Fairbanks), just a hop and a skip from the Whole Foods.Highly highly recommend JoAnn for any and all waxing. She made the experience quick, painless, and was lovely to speak to. She guided me through the process by telling me the benefits of all products she was using, as well as the advantages of the unique wax use at EWC (no strips are used here, which makes for a significantly more comfortable experience). If JoAnn's not around (I believe she's at the West Loop location more regularly), I had a great experience with Lupe as well!The reason I give it 4/5 stars despite the raving review above, was because on both occasions I've come here, the receptionists have been inattentive. Didn't bother telling me about the bulk package deals EWC offers, didn't make eye contact, nor were they personable. Regardless, I'll be back.

34.description: I wish I could give this place 0 stars. I live right across the street from this location so when it opened, I thought why not? I got my eyebrows done and they are horrendous. I told Maria that I like my eyebrows at thick as possible, just needed a clean up and she literally removed all shape I have and I will literally have to pencil in my eyebrows because they are so uneven and shapeless.I agree with Katy S. -- AVOID THIS PLACE.

32.description: It goes without saying, "you get what you pay for." The service was great, Kathleen was experienced, friendly and made me feel as best as she could, comfortable. What lacked was the awkward and very uncomfortable feeling one gets. You follow your technician into a very bright light room, your asked to undress and put your clothes in a corner of the room, literally a small corner and while she's there. No towels, no gown, no warm blanket you only see a strip (no pun intended) of paper on the bed. $40, is certainly a good price, but it was just so very uncomfortable to say the least. It didn't help that the owner/manager was in the hallway during my session talking to the other staff. Goodness...

18.description: This is a good place to go if you need to schedule something last minute and don't want to spend a lot. But the waxing is only so-so and the customer service is horrendous. As others have mentioned, they are very pushy. I have been maybe five or six times and every time they try to sell me a package; when I say I am not interested, they become hostile. I won't be going back here again.

13.description: You really can't go wrong with ANY European Wax location! Worth every penny and their products are great!

4.description: Worst waxing I have ever get. It took one entire hour to wax full legs, underarms and bikini, which is really the first time it happened to me in 10 years of monthly waxing when I lived in Paris (I just moved to Chicago)! The wax is very poor quality and I get rashes during 24 hours after my appointment, which is also the first time! They do not use wax roll-on and strips for the legs (which is the best and only way to do the legs), but the same blue wax that they use for bikini and underarms which is not the right wax to do the legs. I have never had such unclean legs after an appointment. Even the lady who waxed me told me that she does not understand why this center does not use roll-on and strips which is clearly the best way to wax quickly. She had to do it several time on the same areas as it was totally inefficient. So my best advice would be to avoid this chain of wax center, which are by the way incredibly expansive for such a bad service. I paid 109 $ without the tip, while in Paris I would have paid 40$ for a better work. Will NEVER go back there.

24.description: What a great experience.  Today was my first visit to European Wax Center on E. Ohio.  My wax specialist was Tatiana.  She did a great job.  She greeted me with a smile and was very personable.  She asked if I had experience with waxing and I told her yes. She proceeded and made sure I was okay throughout the process.  We chit chatted about our neighborhoods and family and found out we had some things in common.  I felt really comfortable throughout the whole procedure.  The facility was clean, the price was right, they use hard wax(which works best for me) and I ended up purchasing a package deal.  I'm looking forward to going back and having Tatiana as my wax specialist.

6.description: Went there this week after a friend told me and after Ive seen great reviews here. Little they know i am an aesthetician myself. So for 15 years had my fair share of shopping around! Alma did my wax and she is ULTRA FAST!! Absolutely I will be back!! The faster they pull the least is the disconfort!I reccomend and I booked online the night before it was mega easy the booking form was not super lenghty so u can do whilst sipping a coffee w a friend and no one will notice!

22.description: Just visited with Billy at European Wax Center in Streeterville. I've visited European wax for the last 3 years (Naperville, West Loop, Lincoln Park and South Loop), but Billy and new manager, Chayanne, of Streeterville location are making this brand shine! A couple of months back the service and talent were questionable at best. Now I can't wait until my next appointment. So professional and the results were awesome! Thank you so much! (Larissa awesome too!!  Great team!)

15.description: This place is analagous to a Great Clips only for waxing. Feeling particularly ungroomed last week, I decided to venture here. The (comparatively) lower price points, consistency, and efficiency are the main draws here. If you are expecting a pampering experience, it is probably best to look elsewhere. Before coming here my only waxing alternatives were 1) storefront nail joints where the possibility of double dipping (horror) is top of mind or 2) higher end spas/salons where prima donna estheticians needlessly drag out what should be a wax-wax off process with their delusions of being Michelangelos, working in hot wax instead of paint. I point to one salon in particular on Rush Street, where the woman flat out refused to wax my brows, noting that I should let the hair grow more in the middle (aka unibrow style) before she would even touch them. Digressions aside, EWC gets the job done, with an easy to use online scheduler to make appointments. Yes, the upselling might be considered aggressive by some, but these days I consider it a common practice. Thank you, European Wax Center for helping me not be mistaken for a Yeti or Duck Dynasty cast member.

7.description: I highly recommend seeing either Larissa or Lupe. I've gotten waxed by Larissa multiple times and she is very gentle for Brazilians, underarm and lower legs. Larissa wasn't available today so I booked an appointment with Lupe and wow, she did an AMAZING job on my Brazilian and lower legs! She was gentle, meticulous and very friendly! There's nothing better than coming home and NOT having to tweeze stray hairs.  Thanks ladies for keeping me smooth! :)

36.description: I am so so happy this opened in my neighborhood!  I am always really nervous before I get a Brazilian Wax at a new place (because well it can be a bit uncomfortable) I had been going to a place in my neighborhood which was twice the price because I figure if I am putting myself through this I will pamper myself but European Wax is not only affordable but also feels like a pampering experience at 1/2 the cost!  It was better than the place I was going to before using a different type of pre and post lotion and the wax was comfortable (well as comfortable as a wax can be).  I will be a regular customer and the price will enable me to keep up on my waxes!  It may even be time to retire my razors and go for all waxing all the time!

30.description: I give this place a B-.  It's a new place and right across the street from my apartment building.  I've got to hand it to them that the prices are right. But the waxing and customer experience leave much to be desired.I've had my lip and eyebrows waxed twice there as well as a Brazilian.  For smaller areas, this is a fine place and for $25 for a lip and brow, you can't beat it.  I had no issues.  For the Brazilian, DEFINITELY NOT.  They use a hard wax that has to dry...which is fine for a smaller area but for a Brazilian wax, it just prolongs the experience and makes it longer.  Additionally, because they don't use the strips, it was hard for the techician to grip the wax and pull it off.  I've had laser hair removal on my bikini line and it still took almost 45 minutes for the Brazilian.  When I got home, I noticed that there lots of smaller and broken hairs leftover.  So not only was the area NOT smooth from the beginning, because the hair wasn't pulled out from the root, it grew back really quickly.  Super waste of money, even though it wasn't that expensive. I was very disappointed.Two other things happened that rubbed me the wrong way...during both the Brazilian and one of my lip waxes, I was told that I would be upcharged for eliminating certain hair around the areas.  Not only had I never heard of this before, but then I wasn't upcharged.  So it created an uncomfortable exchange between myslef and the technician and then left me confused.  Obviously I was happy not to be upcharged, but whoever even heard of suggesting an upcharge to have the lower side of your lip waxed for a lip wax? There wasn't a difference in their price list for "upper lip" and "lower lip."  It made no sense.Also, they really push thier packages and scheduling your next appointment while you are checking out.  I don't really do waxing that way and when I didn't want to schedule another appointment, the person at the desk was rude and gave me a dirty look. She told me that it's better for the technicians because they get booked up.  Waxing is an "as needed" service for me. It's not something I schedule regularly.  I didn't appreciate the attempt at bullying me into making a future appointment.  The other person at the desk was quick to let me know that it was fine...but only after I had to spend a couple of moments explaining why I wasn't interested in making another appointment.I'll probably continue to go here as long as I live across the street, but it's definitely not a place I'd cross town to patronize.

3.description: This is my go to wax place. They are almost always late. They have messed up my appointments a couple of times now. They changed my appointment time once without informing me. However, their wax is good on my skin and Lupe is pretty efficient. There are not many waxing options in Streeterville so I run to European wax center.

14.description: I have been going to LaRIssa at this location for several months.  Not that anyone actually "enjoys" getting waxed, but if your technician is LaRissa the process will be a lot smoother...pun intended. She is the most detailed oriented aesthetician I have ever worked with.  I only make my appointments with her and am thrilled after the session.  Highly high recommend.

3.description: I Had long dark hair before coming to this salon and left with dull ,over cut  hair after 7 hrs of being there. No excuses! I went in for a consult since I was nervous about having anything done and was quoted a price of $110 so when my money was saved I Would treat myself after leaving there 7 hrs later when I was told it might take 3-4 they cut all my hair and charged me $210,, WHAT!! so upsetting after telling stylist about this she answered ok sorry will give you back $60 I am still waiting for this refund this was truly a hair nightmare!

1.description: My 7 year old daughter had a photo shoot so we called to get some curls in her hair. They set us us up with Alberto who is SO nice and did exactly what we needed!!

2.description: Let me start by saying Jayce is the BEST! If I could give ten stars, I would!Before I moved to Chicago, I had used the same stylist for years and was nervous about having to switch to someone new. I have really curly hair and have had issues with people cutting it in the past, so once I find someone I like, I have to stick with them. Based on other positive yelp reviews, I decided to give Salon 161 and Jayce a try. What a great decision! The salon is in a great area, just off of Michigan Avenue. It is a very clean place and is a fun, bright atmosphere. I was able to get an appointment quickly that fit into my busy schedule. The staff is all very friendly and courteous. The prices are not what you would expect to see on the Mag Mile and were more than reasonable, this coming from a graduate student on a budget.Now to the best part, JAYCE! I must say, he is the best stylist I have ever had and I would recommend him to everyone I know. He is totally open to listening to the ideas you have for your hair, but will also provide awesome advice with his professional expertise. He is able to change my color for the seasons while giving it a natural look. He cuts my hair to a perfect length with the curls. And he does the best blowout ever! I have never been less than absolutely thrilled with my cut and color when I leave. If you're looking for a new salon with a fabulous, reliable, talented stylist, don't look further than Jayce at Salon 161!

9.description: I've been getting my hair colored for 12 years and have never had it look as good and natural as when I had Jayce at Salon 161 do it for me.  He's got a lot of new ideas for it and usually I like to stick to what I know, but I trusted his suggestions and he's doing a fabulous job!The pricing varies each time I go, which gets a little confusing, but the results are well worth it.

10.description: If you're looking for a hair stylist I highly recommend Jayce at Salon 161. With Jayce you're sure to get the very best of the 3 Cs: Cut, Color and Conversation. While being very welcoming and concerned with providing the best quality hair cut imaginable, Jayce causes time to fly with his ability to maintain conversation while concentrating on all of the details necessary to get you out the door looking magnificent. Even this summer after an extended time between hair cuts, I still had hair stylists complimenting how well my cut was done while out of town having my hair done for a wedding. Look no further - Jayce is your man for the job.

4.description: I went there as I am sick and it was very close to my doctor's and my regular place is kind of far.  I went because there were grand reviews of Jayce.  I made an appt with this person and was called right before my 11am appt that Jayce was out sick.  They asked me if I wanted to reschedule or go with a different stylist.  My roots were bad, so I went with a different stylist.  The older gentleman stylist was quite nice, but 1) I am left with BAD dye stains on my face.  Really???  and 2) I asked for a Bang Trim.  I got my bangs to almost a perfect place.  They just needed a bit of a trim.  Again, I asked for a trim, just a trim. Not a complete redo of my bangs.  I had heavy straight bangs when i want in, after he was done with my bangs, they were thin with a jagged edge...what?????  I said I want them cut straight.  He did that, and then I noticed they went down on the sides some.  I then again asked if he could cut them straight across.  They are NOW so far from perfect.  Why of freaking why would he do that if I just asked for a trim???  On top of this, I paid 110.00.  Although I tipped him 15.00, that is not my usual high tip.  Also, the place is way on the worn side of thing.  The stylist asked me if I wanted a cap and I said, "Sure" and he pointed over to a closet where they were stacked on a high shelf.  I am sick and have been for awhile and just wanted to feel good, although the time I spent there was relaxing...I do not feel like I look good.  Thank goodness, I am of the thought it is only hair and will grow back.  Oh, and if you go there, be sure to like old people.  I am not a youngin' and these people made me feel young!

6.description: Last week I got my hair highlighted by Jayce. He was very thorough and it turned out fabulous!!! He even did an extra service for me to brighten my hair. I didn't feel rushed  or like just another client. I love the feel of this place too. Mostly men stylists with female customers. Cute tool boxes for hair stations. Jayce def keeps the salon young and modern too! I will def go back for my next highlight. Hard to find parking though. The place next door has cheaper valet than usual. Make sure you get your parking ticket validated.

12.description: I love love love this place. I lived in Chicago until November 2008, and continued driving all the way downtown, fighting the meters for parking, and walking in rain sun or snow to get my haircut here. It's not all that dramatic, but every time I come here, I go to Jayce. He listens to what I want, understands that I want to look "different" without hacking off all my hair or dying it purple. He understands that I am a librarian, not a rock star. BUT he also understands that librarian is not all I am, and gives me a cut that can be demure during the day, and HOT at night =) I love this place, and look forward to going back! His cuts are great, but it's his color that keeps me coming back! I really didn't want to get highlights until I was 30 (this was at 26), he gave me the confidence that he would make it rocking by the time I was 27 (without forcing it or talking me into it, lol). Jayce is great, and I actually followed him from a different salon, since I loved his haircuts so much.

5.description: Jayce is by far the most amazing stylist I've ever had and truly an awesome person. I used to go to Jayce regularly and, since moving to LA, I miss him terribly! I'm even scheduling my other hair appointments and delaying re-highlighting in anticipation of visiting in December and going to Jayce then. I've also sent my aunt and cousin to Jayce and now they send me braggy photos whenever they go to the salon just to make me jealous (which I am). Not only is he a genius but he is so fun to talk to.

11.description: I've gotten my hair cut/highligted a few times now by Sarah. She really takes her time and makes sure I like the color, cut, etc.. before I leave.This is a pretty affordable place for being located in Downtown Chicago. I'd recommend this salon to others

8.description: I Just had my first cut at Salon 161, and I'm very pleased with the result.  Charles, my stylist, listened to my concerns and updated my style without hacking off too much length. The cost for the cut was $58, as opposed to the $45 I pay in Oak Park. But hey, you get what you pay for.  And I'm worth it.

0.description: Dennis is hands-down the best stylist I've ever visited. When I lived out of state, I would often schedule my trips home to coincide with my hair appointments so that I could come here. I've been getting my hair highlighted and cut by Dennis for about 3-4 years now. Since I started, people have expressed surprise that my hair is highlighted at all, as it looks like the natural color. He is very thorough and does a great job. I wouldn't trust anyone else to do my hair!

7.description: The stylist was very nice but cannot blow out curly hair. I wouldnt recommend this spa for people with thick curly hair.

1.description: This place is like a hidden mall! It's got a pharmacy, hardware store, supermarket, dry-cleaners, cafes and even a bar. Students will definitely find Ace Hardware and Walgreens useful. Treasure Island supermarket is a bit too pricey though.

0.description: Beautiful building! I love that it is right next door to my apartment because it has a Walgreens, Ace Hardware, Treasure Island, plus a salon/spa, a coffee shop, a restaurant, and a new cafe coming soon. Fantastic. I wonder what the residences look like.

1.description: This Baskin Robbins location fails in the uniformity department.Part of a chain restaurant's appeal for customers is knowing what to expect when you walk through the front door.  Uniformity is supposed to mean that you can get the same thing from one location to another.I love BR and I've loved it since before I could even spell ice cream.  I usually order the same thing in every state and while I was in Chicago I walked there from my hotel to get my favorite treat.  After waiting in a long line in an unairconditioned room, it was finally my turn to place an order with Tattoo Guy.Me:  Two kids scoops in a cup please.Him:  Uh, we can't do that.Me:  They're both for me so I need them in one cup.  It's what I always get.Him:  We don't do that though.Me:  (Blank stare)  He said it like I'd never been to a Baskin Robbins before.  Since I wasn't in the mood for a continued exchange with him I ordered one regular scoop instead.  What I really wanted was to pay for two small scoops...two different flavors in the same cup.  It seemed simple enough.  Because I can get it at every other Baskin Robbins they should have been able to do it too.  I still love BR.  I was really annoyed that I walked there and waited in line to receive that lack of customer service.  So glad this isn't my go-to location.

9.description: Good donuts, rude staff at 11pm.

23.description: Store reviewWhether it is a cold winter day in chicago or the blistering heat in June, the BR/DD chain is always there to fill your stomach. The location off the mag mile is the perfect location for locals and visitors to stop and catch a break. There is one section for all your DD goodies (donuts, coffee, and more) and right across is the ice cream section. There is numerous deals to be found here include the DD dollar menu, 9.99 brownie a la mode ice cream cake, using amex for 5 dollars back, .99 cent coffee in the afternoon on the weekdays, and local newspaper coupons. Service is relatively fast and friendly. Stop by for a sweet treat and cool eats.
