(**that might be a borrowed slogan from DQ...**)Pros- cheap, many different deals as detailed below, quick serviceCons- noneHidden deals1. If you use american express, sign up for the free promo. Use your AMEX 4 times and get rewarded with a 5 dollar DD gift card2. 9.99 brownie a la mode ice cream cake. This is the cheapest and best ice cream cake I have ever had period3. Use your coupons from mailers4. .99 cent coffee in the afternoon any size hot or cold, you can't beat that5. .99 cent food menu with donuts and other treatsThere appears to be also deals later in the day for donuts and munckins as well.

5.description: OK so the good: - this place is 24 hours (score)- always have a good selection of donuts (at least the kind i like)-  staff is friendlyOK so the bad:- can be sketchy in here at night with the cast of characters that come in here- at times it takes WAY TOO LONG for your food or drink order to be prepared. - my friends and i have counted before and there's no 31 flavors (on the baskin-robbins) side) in this store.

25.description: Follow these simple steps for a successful business that I'll give 4 stars to.Are you open 24 hours a day? Yes!Do you serve a full menu even in the middle of the night? Yes!Donuts? Yes!Ice cream? Yes!This place was relatively clean, even at 2:30am when I stumbled in. The staff was awake and friendly, and by friendly I mean they seemed to get a huge kick out of me trying to figure out what to eat. I finally settled on a Turkey, Bacon, and Cheddar Flatbread Sandwich and for $3 and some change I was satisfied.

12.description: When I was in town for a conference I was delighted there was a DD by my hotel since we don't have them where I live. The people working here were nice, quick and got everything right. This DD is money, although there were some interesting people inside...

21.description: Dunkin Donuts is a faint mystery here in southern California, as we don't have any chains here, at least, not called Dunkin Donuts.  Instead we have Krispy Kremes.  But people have long been saying how amazing Dunkin Donuts is, and upon walking by it in my visit to Chicago I decided on a whim to try it out.This one was merged with a Baskin Robbins which I can't rate because I didn't have ice cream, however; the donut and coffee was to say the least somewhat disappointing.  Disappointing to the hype mind you, not for the quality = price ratio.  The price is no doubt pretty good, and the quality is good for the price.  In my opinion though, Krispy Kremes beats this is donuts pretty well.  The donuts were somewhat cold and the coffee wasn't fantastic.Service wasn't splendid either but I can't blame a 24 hr. service for always having good customer service, especially at 11:30 at night.  But what can you do.Nothing too terrible to report about cleanliness, the place seemed well organized and there were nice places to sit.No offense to anyone, but towards the witching hours, you'll get some interesting folks...like Dennys at these joints.  Just so you know.

16.description: Not much can be said for this place but the breakfast is pretty good. very happy with the sausage croissant i had and will give BK a run for their money.

17.description: Good donuts, bad chaotic environment.After being in line for about 10 minutes, I wanted to run out of this establishment screaming.Of course, the donuts make it the worth the wait, but can't this DD get its act together like the 50,000 Dunkin' Donuts I've been to? One thing that might help is more donut visibility. The line snakes through the place and you can't see the donuts until you get to the front. Then you either bow to the pressure and order so fast that you don't get what you want or you meticulously analyze each donut and piss off everyone behind you. It's a lose lose proposition.More donut visibility and more seating are both needed. Get it together Dunkin' Donuts.... but I still love you.

10.description: I expect a business with posted hours to honor those times. This particular location continually closes early when Starbucks, AuBon Pain and others in the building remain open. They are losing business.

11.description: Ok I used to throw shade at this place. There's plenty of places nearby to grab fancy, gourmet donuts or baked goods. But they'll cost you a pretty penny. If you're a broke grad student like me and need to bring something quick and dirt cheap to a small meeting - go here! When you bring Donuts: you are KING in your groups' eyes.

26.description: I visit this location every Friday morning. For the most part it is well-staffed, busy, and they have yet to get my order wrong. This location, by all definitions, deserves five stars. So 5-star review, right? Hell no.My favorite drink was discontinued for a while- the Vanilla Chai. In most ways this drink is an affront to nature and an abomination. It's gravelly-textured from the amount of sugar in it, and tastes nothing like "tea". But I loved the damn thing- it was piping hot loveliness for those of us who don't particularly like the taste of coffee. But eventually it gave too many people diabetes, and they took it out of all locations.So I go there this morning, and along with some new latte options the chai is back on the menu!! Can you even begin to understand the pheromones that coursed through my body in anticipation of this radioactively sugary treat? I don't think you can, Yelp reader. So this morning I was elated. Next thing I do- I order some up in an XL cup, thank you very much! I said,"Excuse me, but did you bring back the Vanilla Chai? Can I order it now?!""Yes sir!""Awesome! Extra large, please!""I'm sorry sir, we only offer Vanilla Chais in medium."Perplexed, I blinked at the menu. Sure enough, they had removed the prices for all sizes other than medium."But... but why? The medium costs the same as a medium latte, and the cups are right there, why can't you just charge me for an extra large latte and pour it into a cup from that giant stack right there? Are you low on chai mix?"The manager, a nice man who I have seen running around helping at peak hours, overheard me as he walked by and stopped to intervene."Sorry sir, it's a marketing technique we're trying. Only medium chais.""Just... marketing?""Yes sir, we want to push the medium size only.""Well, then give me a medium latte.""You don't want a medium chai?""No, your marketing technique is stupid, and I won't play along on principle."Shocked, the manager made me the latte personally, shaking his head and offering me whipped cream on top. "Do you normally put whipped cream on top?""No sir, but I thought I would offer given your dissatisfaction.""Well thanks for improvising on the fly like that!" I said, but my ironic tone was lost on them. Perhaps you can understand this, Dunkin' Donuts:FOUR STARS.The carmel latte is pretty good.

27.description: Well, there's not much for these guys to Ef up here.  Donuts? check. Ice cream, toppings, cones, tiny pink spoons? check.  Occasional free iced coffee on Tuesdays? Bonus!  Patio? Double bonus!!  Extra points- advance to the next round!!!I haven't tried Dunkin Deli because I find that entirely unnecessary.  Most often, I go for the iced coffee.  When I'm feelin' saucy I eat ice cream for lunch.  Baskin Robbins ice cream will always be my favorite.  That's for 3 primary reasons.  1. Hard scoop ice cream: the hard ice cream will always be my one and only.  Soft serve is pussy, and lacks the combination of flavor combined with chunky treats.  2. Not outrageously priced: paying $4+ for an ice cream cone is for decadence and suckers.  3. I was raised on it: free ice cream cones after the soccer game with your uniform and shin guards still on! Memories anyone?!

0.description: After strolling along Michigan Ave. after dinner, we had a craving for some donuts. Our friend brought us to this Dunkin Donuts to satisfy our sweet tooth.  Intending to only get two donuts, the cashier suggested that we should get more because all the donuts were half off after 8pm.  Cool! It's 8:10pm and we said "why not?" and we ended up getting half a dozen.  My only concern was the donuts were not fresh.  But our half dozen consisting of two apple filled, two powdered custard filled, one chocolate custard filled and one crumb donut were not stale at all. Wished that Dunkin' Donuts were in the Bay Area as they make a lot better donut than Krispy Kreme.  This location near Michigan Ave. satisfied my donut craving.

20.description: Pretty much the same as every other dunkin donuts in the city, if you like DD, you'll like it here.

19.description: 4 stars for the workers, not the donuts.  For someone used to the awesomeness of Manderfield's in Appleton, mass produced donut holes & mediocre glazed garbage doesn't resonate.  That being said, the people who worked there were top notch, service was outstanding and fast, and they tolerated the indecision of my kids in deciding what color sprinkle was most appropriate for their Thursday tastes.  Bless your heart, everyone- you guys all deserve a raise!

2.description: I like how this place is open 24 hours. The staff I've seen here so far is nice and drink/food preparation takes less than 5 minutes each time I've been here. I usually get iced coffee here (if you ask for added sugar, remember to stir up the sugar with your straw) most of the time. Their donuts are okay (if you get munchkins too late at night like around 11pm, they can be super dry). The glazed chocolate cake donut and cruler were fresh at 11pm, which I appreciated. I like their sausage/cheese/egg croissant sandwich. Their chicken biscuit is okay because I'm not a big fan of too much dough in the biscuit. The chicken part is pretty tasty, though.I asked about the DDPerks card one time and they told me how it works but didn't try to sell it to me or ask if I was interested in getting one and walked they away from the counter. I wanted one that day, though. I ended up getting it the next time I went there. The ice cream is fine, but there were bits of ice in my strawberry ice cream. The gold medal ribbon ice cream is pretty good. I like the taste of vanilla and the caramel in it.

18.description: This dunkin donuts is close to my job. its very small. i love all dunkin donuts. im not sure how they could mess anything up. staff is ok, no big issues.

13.description: Overall: The floors were messy and in desperate need of a thorough sweep and mop. This is NOT appealing when you go somewhere to get food. I went to the 31 Flavors side to get a shake. I am the only one at the counter, and 3 employees were standing literally in front of me gabbing for 2 minutes before I was greeted. Not even a nod to indicate I existed. Finally, I had to ask to place my order - really? - and get an eye roll. Perfect. So, I finally get to order the medium Mint Chocolate Chip shake that I had been craving. Guy (who have me the eye roll) sets out to make it. Watch him put 2 scoops of ice cream that is NOT mint chocolate chip (maybe regular choc chip? I dunno), then goes "Wait, chocolate chip, right?" "Nope, mint choc chip".  Adds 2 scoops of mint choc chip to the blender. Hands me a greyish looking mess. I told him I wanted just mint choc chip, and he kept arguing with me that that is what he made (when clearly that was not the case). Frustrated with his rudeness and incompetence, I just accepted it and went to pay. I requested a receipt do I could include his name in this review, and then he gave me the wrong receipt!  What a joke.

4.description: They are open 24/7Got here late for the donuts but they still tasted good to me. Nice staff.

24.description: there are no Dunkin Donuts in L.A., at least not that I know of.  On a chilly Chicago day, we popped into this location before shopping on Michigan Avenue.  I got the White Hot Chocolate, which was so delish!  Their donuts did not look appetizing though, am I missing something??

6.description: This place can get ridiculously packed especially on the weekends. I have left several times and just went to my usual Starbucks after the line was all the way to the front entrance.

22.description: Coffee: burnt, stale, and lukewarmDonut: cold, hard, and not delicious

15.description: This is a great location and the staff are very nice and efficient. I always visit the store when I'm going to see a movie at 600 N. Michigan because it is so convenient. However -- when asked if I could get a tea instead of a coffee with the order I'm told, "yes." Really, D&D? You can't afford to let someone have a tea instead of a coffee? You have to charge more? Hard to believe. Disappointed. Also - the literal way that this order was taken is just ignorant. It's a meal deal. If you ask "Can I have a tea instead?" It means, can i get it without paying more. Instead, she just says "Yes" and then promptly charges more for it. For that reason, I must give 2 stars.

7.description: Store reviewWhether it is a cold winter day in chicago or the blistering heat in June, the BR/DD chain is always there to fill your stomach. The location off the mag mile is the perfect location for locals and visitors to stop and catch a break. There is one section for all your DD goodies (donuts, coffee, and more) and right across is the ice cream section. There is numerous deals to be found here include the DD dollar menu, 9.99 brownie a la mode ice cream cake, using amex for 5 dollars back, .99 cent coffee in the afternoon on the weekdays, and local newspaper coupons. Service is relatively fast and friendly. Stop by for a sweet treat and cool eats. (**that might be a borrowed slogan from DQ...**)Pros- cheap, many different deals as detailed below, quick serviceCons- noneHidden deals1. If you use american express, sign up for the free promo. Use your AMEX 4 times and get rewarded with a 5 dollar DD gift card2. 9.99 brownie a la mode ice cream cake. This is the cheapest and best ice cream cake I have ever had period3. Use your coupons from mailers4. .99 cent coffee in the afternoon any size hot or cold, you can't beat that5. .99 cent food menu with donuts and other treatsThere appears to be also deals later in the day for donuts and munckins as well.

8.description: America Runs on Dunkin!  Ok, its winter time and this is pumpkin season so everyone is selling all things pumpkin/flavored. DD/Bucks and others are selling pumpkin spiced coffee/tea. I tried them all. DD got them all beat by a Chicago Magnificent Mile! Tip: go and get a "Hot DD Pumpkin Spice Coffee, Medium" and I promise you will like and keep going back.

3.description: This is a composite review for the Deli and BR.  I'm a fan of the breakfast sandwich, OK I know it was slapped together and heated in the microwave but it was late and I was hungry.  On the desert side I'm kinda Meh....  How does BR only get away with putting up 10 flavors.  I struggled to pick one that I wanted....  If it was a normal day I would have passed.  So overall A-OK...

14.description: First time actually having Dunkin Donuts. We don't have these on the Westside. I've always been partial to krispy kreme. I didn't find anything special about their donuts. I did like how they had breakfast sandwiches and other things on top of just donuts. The coffee tasted fresh. It's a nice place to grab quick breakfast. I would however find another donut place.

3.description: Not fantastic grub by any stretch of the imagination.

1.description: Pro: It exists?Con: The coffee here is consistently, legitimately awful.  Try Harry's Cafe inside the Northwestern Law buildings one block north, on Chicago Ave.

2.description: I just have one word for this place....bootleg! Super over priced with stale pastries. The only good thing about that place used to be a fruit parfait they would make with yogurt, fruit and two layers of granola. Then, they got smart and started using only one layer of granola  and they switched to runny fat-free yogurt. It also sucks because they are essentialy the only 'cafe' on campus so they pretty much have a hold on that market. I rather go to the vending machine, at least I know I'll leave it not feeling robbed.

0.description: Convenient place for coffee. I also like their made-to-order salads and pastas.You can also get pastries, grab-n-go items like sandwiches, yogurt, candy, etc. And beverages from Coke and Pepsi to Odwalla and Sobe.

3.description: This has to be one of the poorest excuses for a bookstore in Oak Park.The selection of books is very limited, they had no New Age or Alternative Religion books and when I asked, the Gentleman behind the counter gave me a scowl and began to preach at me about finding Jesus. After I told him what he could do with his sermon and beliefs, I walked out the door!Ironically, I read in the newspaper that next day that they are being shut down and booted out for not paying almost a years worth of rent.Goes to show you that Kharma really does exist!

1.description: Given that I would like to support independent bookstores, I really wish I could give this place a higher rating. Unfortunately, there is no real difference between this location and any chain bookseller.Great independent bookstores provide great advice and slightly unusual selections. Going into one makes the trip worth the effort.Unfortunately, the selection at Barbara's is similar to what you would find in any airport book store. The staff doesn't seem particularly interested in books or motivated generally.The only real reason to go is if you are a hospital patient. Everybody else can save the trip and go to Amazon, or go find a real independent bookseller.

2.description: I have been meaning to write this review for over a year.  Chris at Barbara's was so helpful when I visited, and I thought, "I must write a review for them."  Here I am over a year later, but this was the experience that brought me to this point.  I was browsing for some items in the store and did end up making a few purchases.  However, Chris agreed to gift wrap a book that I didn't even purchase there, saving me a lot of time and effort in delivering my gift.  Thanks!

5.description: As an employee of the hospital, I'm always looking for stuff to read on my breaks.  Now, the selection isn't mighty, by any means because it's more of a satellite store, but I've always found something to read.  If not, the staff has really good recommendations, and are always really personable.

6.description: This little bookstore is a welcome find.  Managed by one of Chicago's finest independent bookstores, they have a good selection of bestsellers, classics, magazines, and newspapers.Just the place to pick up a 'get well' gift or something to fill the hours if you're spending a lot of time at NMH.Hours:Monday - Friday  7AM - 8PMSaturday               8AM - 7PMSunday               10AM - 7PM

7.description: You may or may not know that there is a Barbara's bookstore at Northwestern Memorial hospital.  Even though this location is smaller than their standard stores, they still carry a well thought out selection, and what they may lack in quantity they make up for in quality. It's worth a trip a couple of blocks east of michigan if you're in the area. Here's a special treat. It is a rare thing these days to find bookstore employees who actually read and care about books. This location is lucky to have one of Chicago's most knowledgable and experienced booksellers, Guilietta, who has worked at Barbara's for many years in various locations.  If you are stuck on what to read, or what to buy as a gift, she will steer you in the right direction.

8.description: They have a great selection of books. They open early on the weekdays, thank goodness because there are the pod people who wake up at four to go to work and by the time they get to the city Barbara's is like their savior to get a good book for the ride home.

0.description: Barbara's Bestsellers is like a convenience store for books.  You can't sit and stay, browsing books over a cup of coffee, but you can pop in and pop out for a new title.  If you're looking for a specific book, you may not find it here unless it's a new release or bestseller.  I was there the day Harper Lee's highly anticipated Go Set a Watchman was released and they had lots of copies available.There wasn't a large selection of titles but if all you want is a GOOD book then you might get lucky.  It helps to be flexible.  Recommendations from the staff are posted all along the shelves to highlight their favorite reads.  I really appreciated their personal touch.This is a teeny bookstore but they offer a well-organized selection of good reads.

4.description: For a bookstore in a hospital, this place is really good. Part of the independently owned chain, the only difference between this branch and its non-hospital based counterparts is its slightly smaller size.Staff is still extremely helpful and recommendations are always spot on.I do kinda wish they carried a larger selection of magazines, but I suppose that's what the Borders at Michigan/Pearson is for.

58.description: I'm a fan of this Chipotle when I go downtown. I love the rice with cilantro and the marinated antibiotic free chicken. If I want a large portion, I go for a burrito, then save the other half for a meal. Otherwise, a burrito bowl will do. The burrito itself is over 1000 calories, but you can cut it down to half that sans rice and cheese.

56.description: Thanks a lot Chipotle. When I walked into your store today, my expectations were simple. All I wanted was to acquire a delicious burrito that I would be able to carry home and enjoy. Little did I know that this would prove so difficult. It started well. Worker #1 put rice beans and steak onto my burrito shell. Worker #2 put some salsa, sour cream and guacamole onto there. Things didn't really go sour until I hit worker #3, a slobby looking young woman with a dazed look in her eye. Worker #3 began her attempt to roll the burrito but it was plainly obvious that her oversized fingers were not nearly dexterous enough to complete the task at hand. As she folded the edges of the burrito shell in, I could see that things might get a little sloppy but I was distracted by the cashier and unable to see just how bad things had become (or to get an idea about which end to begin eating my burrito from to minimize the degree to which it would fall apart). I paid and returned to my apartment expecting some difficulty, but what I was greeted with when I opened my brown paper Chipotle bag back at home was a horrifying sight. Guacamole filled the southwest corner of the bag entirely, seeping out from the rigid tinfoil shell in a disgusting looking secretion. Sour cream was smeared over diverse regions of the inside of the bag, and merely removing the burrito without sullying my hand was a daunting task in and of itself. I tore off one end of tinfoil to begin what was to be an arduous consumption process and I could plainly see directly into the cavity of the burrito, rice and beans spilling out like entrails. Needless to say, my hands were a mess by the time i finished, and at least 20% of my burrito was spilled over the plate I was using, despite expert burrito management operation. What is this world coming to when a burrito that costs EIGHT DOLLARS AND THIRTY ONE CENTS is not even consumable? Screw you, Chipotle employees. And screw you Chipotle, for employing them and paying them a trivial sum that fails to even motivate them to complete the preposterously menial task set before them. I understand that it can be tough to keep yourself sane when the cost of a single burrito is more than you are being paid per hour but COME ON. You must roll like seven hundred of these things in a day, I find it impossible to believe that even the slightest amount of effort on your part could fail to produce an acceptable burrito. I hate you Chipotle. Maybe that's why I don't feel bad stealing bottles of Tabasco brand hot sauce from you every time i go...

29.description: It is amazing... Take a chicken burrito with white rice, black beans, fajita vegetables, salsa, cheese, sour cream, lettuce and most important Quacamole to finish it off. You will not be disapointed

42.description: Walked by the place twice looking for it - dinner hour on a Wednesday is QUIET in this neighborhood. Staff were great, served me a burrito bowl sans rice in a jiffy. Tasty, hot, priced right.If you don't see it - it's right next door to the Potbelly sandwich place.

23.description: Your standard Chipotle. This location is especially busy during the lunch hours--you will have to wait in a line that might very well go out the door. Generally service is fast, and asking for an extra amount of a topping is usually no problem. Be prepared, however, for the proportion of toppings to vary with traffic--e.g. the amount of lettuce or salsa you get may depend on how many people are in line with you and how much of that ingredient they have left. Go at a less crowded time if you can!

47.description: I'm not reviewing the entire Chipotle chain per se, just the Ontario store.I always get a veggie salad and ask for a TON of ingredients - i.e. extra lettuce, extra pico de gallo, extra black beans - and the staff there have been nothing less than generous with the portions. Even the serving of guac that they dollop on top is more ginormous than that of the other 5+ chipotle stores I've dined at in the Chicago-land area. Service here is A+, the guys behind the counter work hard, are super nice, and the place even has a nice clean bathroom customers can use. Yay!

8.description: Chipotle is always a favorite of mine. When I don't know what to eat, I can always get something quality and tasty at Chipotle. This particular location used to be spot on with service. As of late, the service has been slow, unfriendly, and not goo at getting orders rights. Too bad, I come here a lot.

31.description: Consistently good like any Chipotle, but for some reason they are always out of some ingredient when I get there. It's hard to beat the cost for the quality of food you are getting.

34.description: We have been to this location twice, both times had terrible service. We were here on 8/31/2012 at 7 pm, it was a Friday. Staff was very rude, portions were small compared to other Chipotles. There was no ice, no sugar, no salt, no lemons, we asked numerous times for salt and sugar for our iced tea and never got it. We left there extremely pissed off for the second time. We have been to numerous Chipotles throughout IL, IN, and FL, and never had such bad service. This location is close to our apt. but I am going to look for another location to go to.

16.description: When I'm super hungry, a burrito from Chipotle always gets the job done!  Chipotle never disappoints.  My favorite is the chicken burrito with extra guacamole.  Sometimes the chips can be a little stale, but I still eat it.  :)

13.description: The worst chipotle I've been to. Horrible service, not clean, didn't have veggies, chips or fajitas. Not handicap friendly.

11.description: My friends and I dined at Chipotle on Wednesday July 1st. After we finished our food, we walked to the garbage can near the door to throw our trash away. The trash can  was very full and overflowing with trash. We ended up leaving our trash on a nearby table and left. I couldn't believe how unsanitary the dining environment was!

39.description: It's Chipotle - nothing different or new about this restaurant. I like Chipotle. It gets REALLY crowded here during lunch and dinner because of the Northwestern Univ hospital (nearby) and the various hotels (nearby). The only real big complaint I ever heard about this place is that my friend found a huge leaf inside his rice. When he approached the store manager about it, the store manager denied that the leaf is dangerous. But when my friend contacted corporate, they were upset and sent him free burrito gift cards. I've seen Chipotle with better service, in general.

37.description: I write this review to compare it to New York. The Chicago branch is definitely BETTER than New York. My food was seasoned so perfectly... and it's cheaper but then again what isn't cheaper than NY? We all know what to expect from Chipotle so no need for a long review... just putting it out there that they get props from what used to be a NY Chipotle lover (still secretly am)! Now I'm a fan of Chicago too and it saddens me that the NY branches don't reflect the taste of the windy city...

0.description: Best fast food chain EVER! Seriously! The best fast food experience I have ever had. Granted, i came to this location at 3:00 on a weekday. So i was able to escape the lunch rush of Northwestern students and doctors etc. The restaurant was completely empty except for the workers and 1 other diner. It was quick, easy, and within 2 minutes I was sitting down ready to indulge into my bowl!The ingredients were fresh, very well seasoned, and the portions were spectacular as well! This is the first Chipotle in Chicago that is not stingy with the meat! Woooohoo! Seriously, this one is not a mistake! Visit soon, and visit often!

38.description: I've always enjoyed Chipotle.  My first experience with Chipotle was a couple of years ago in the suburbs.  The flavor is just right.  I've gone to other places before that are the same type of restaurant that Chipotle is, but there flavorings can't compare.  The service is always quick no matter during what time of the day it is, even when there's a long line during lunch time.  The tables, chairs and floor is always clean.  Also, as more people become conscious of what they eat, they now serve brown rice as well.  I've recently gone to Chipotle with my husband at this location.  We both ordered a burrito with guacamole.  The staff had to re-wrap my burrito because the tortilla broke.  When he re-wrapped the food that was in the original tortilla with the new tortilla, I barely got any of the guacamole left inside my burrito.  Even though the flavoring was good, I was a little bit upset that most of my guacamole was gone with the old tortilla.

51.description: Others say this is the best in the city. I say this place is best at making me sick... in the city. I've eaten here on two occasions and got sick both times D: I've never had trouble at any other location. Perhaps, I ventured out too close to closing time? I think I'll stick to burrito beach.

27.description: Whenever I don't feel like cooking rice and beans, homemade pico de gallo, guacamole, and fajita veggies, there's Chipotle! Yes, I can make all of that. With that said, this Chipotle is just like all of the other ones I've been to: consistent, fast, fresh, friendly and accurate. I frequent this location whenever I'm downtown shopping.

32.description: Ok I used to not be a fan of Chipotle... but I've quickly become a regular and am now addicted. I try to limit myself to once a week, but that guacamole calls to me. They're also great for catering: I ordered 50 burritos from here once and they were a big hit.

54.description: This place reminded me of why I don't like chain restaurants.  Oversized burritos stuffed with too many fillers - if I wanted a bean and rice burrito I would have ordered it.  So much for the hype.

48.description: What can I say? I love Chipotle. I think it is the best tasting and probably healthiest fast food place out there. I always go for the burrito bol with rice, black beans, carnitas and tomato salsa, hot red salsa and medium salsa. I just looked on the Chipotle nutrition calculator and this has 13 grams of fat and 515 calories. And, it tastes awesome. Hard to beat for a $6-$7 lunch.

44.description: It's a Chipotle! If you love it, go here. If you need Chipotle-away for your underwear the day after you eat here, don't go here.This store is in a busy high density area with a huge hospital right next door. If you go here at lunch you will be waiting in line. They do take phone in orders for pickup, try that instead. Seating can be rough at lunch too, but hey, you're not in the suburbs anymore Dorthy. Never had a service or food problem in the numerous times I went here. And I use to work right down the street so I was here a lot.

24.description: Love their burritos and soft-shell tacos. Guacamole and chips are awesome too!

7.description: I love Chipotle, I really do... But this one location is super stingy with their food! They focus more on serving you so fast that they don't notice they're not putting enough food on the plate and do not want to take the time to add a decent spoonful... I'll take my Chipotle cravings elsewhere :/

49.description: Way tooo busy at lunch plus I caught an old dirty homeless guy trying to sneak my wallet out of my purse while I juggled my chips, dips, and drink... Shameless... He even told me he was sorry after I twisted his wrist... Then he really pisssed me off... He called me ma'am! I alerted the managers after I completely lost my appitite.  They couldn't care less.Did you know the burritos are an average of 1400 calories? not worth it in my book!Beware of pickpocketers in this chipotle!

40.description: Everyone knows what Chipotle is and how they do it. No need to have long review. The fact is, I like the food and it tastes good. In the past two years at this location I've had one mediocre burrito bowl.  I usually go that route to save calories and I've perfected the low calorie bowl with chicken, black beans, rice, peppers/onions, medium salsa and lettuce. Skip the sour cream, cheese and extra salsas, or do whatever the hell you want.I've been to many locations over the years and I'm always satisfied. I started eating Qdoba in college and hated on Chipotle as they ripped off the way the prepare and offer food. I even preferred the taste but since there have been no Qdobas close to me since very recently I've been on Chipotle ever since and now prefer it.  I appreciate the fresh ingredients and the efforts to serve all natural meats and local/organic produce when possible. Not many chain establishments make that commitment and clearly care - unlike places as Whole Foods who do these things purely as money makers and not as an ethos (just look up the CEO of Whole Foods - not a great guy).Just thinking about Chipotle has me thinking of another trip. I usually go once per week and bring my lunch the other 4 days. I went yesterday but now I'm craving it once again!Damn you, Chipotle!

53.description: i LOVE chipotle.  i finally had chipotle for the first time in over a year and i was never more happier with food!  my friends didn't understand why i love this place so much but it's a feeling i can't even describe haha.  i love their tacos and everything is fresh.  i would get their burritos but they're humangous and have enough calories to last me a week.  on my last night in chicago, i was so sad as i ate my last taco since i won't be seeing a chipotle for awhile.  T_T

30.description: Beware.  This location does not honor gift cards.I received a gift card for $25 and checked the balance online.  All is good.I attempted to purchase two burritos but they were unable to figure out how to use the gift card as credit.  It seemed like it was the first time that they had ever seen a gift card.  I was simply told that the card was invalid.  I left and took the card of the proprietor, Pedro A. Aguilar, so that I could complain to Chipotle.  I checked the balance again online when I got home and it still says it's worth $25.  Now I just have to figure out where the gift card is valid.Don't go to this location if you intend to use your brand new gift card.

46.description: This is the only location I go to. They're fast and the staff is always nice. I always leave happy and full.

1.description: I ate at this chipotle location and the one in river north on back-to-back days. The second night I got severely sick with a stomach bug. On top of that, when I complained both managers were extremely rude and made it a pain for me to formally complain - it would have taken hours of my time. I wouldn't go back to either place even if they offered me free food - my experience vomiting and in pain isn't worth it. I would give chipotle negative stars if I could.

55.description: i really don't understand people's love affair with chipotle. the food isn't as life shattering as some of my friends will lead you to believe. i guess you can say you get your money's worth because they do give you  a decent amount of food. i give them an extra star though because they donated food to NW when we had a fundraiser to support a local free clinic and I appreciate any place that gives back. i only come here at the suggestion of other people but when i do come i get the carnitas burrito and it's consistently good. so, if you're seeking a burrito the size of a newborn baby that will make you look as if you're carrying a soon to be newborn baby then by all means come on down.

9.description: Come for lunch, absolutely. YUM. For that, I give two stars. But do NOT place a big order. We ordered lunch for 12 people. Came in in person, the day before, to place the order. Dictated our order to someone, who marked it down on a form. Next day, we come in to pick it up (because they don't deliver) 20 minutes before our lunch meeting was scheduled to start. We learn they hadn't started our order yet, because "another big order just came in unexpectedly." Oh. OK. So, we finally get the food and get back to our meeting 10 minutes late. Pass out the lunches to find that all but 3 are completely wrong. One vegetarian had a lunch full of meat. Three of us that WANTED meat had salads with just lettuce and tomatoes and cheese. In sum: disaster. Don't do it.

26.description: Updated visit:Please read my prior review for all the pros/cons. I came back for lunch yesterday and was not disappointed. The steak burrito is as good as ever! Quick service and lunch for about 14 dollars. You can't go wrong with that.

25.description: good food - good price - fast service

12.description: It's a standard Chipotle.  I always get a chicken burrito and have to tell them multiple times to scale back on the filling.  The chicken to me seems burnt so sometimes I have to pick out chicken as I'm eating (interactive meal?!?).  It is a good quick fix to a hungry day.

59.description: Listen, when I go to Chipotle I expect standard mexican fare with good service.  The food was good enough, but the service was rude and condecending.  Who would have known that a run of the mill place such as this would have such arrogant service.  HELLO, YOU MAKE BURRITOS for a living.  They need some serious customer service help here.

21.description: When I'm super hungry, a burrito from Chipotle always gets the job done!  Chipotle never disappoints.  My favorite is the chicken burrito with extra guacamole.  Sometimes the chips can be a little stale, but I still eat it.  :)

17.description: This was my first visit to this Chipotle. What I've learned is that while all Chipotles should be made the same they aren't. The people at this location were super friendly and can make a mean margarita! They don't snarf when you ask for extra salsa or this or that, which I appreciate. Yaay Chipotle.

10.description: Updated visit:Please read my prior review for all the pros/cons. I came back for lunch yesterday and was not disappointed. The steak burrito is as good as ever! Quick service and lunch for about 14 dollars. You can't go wrong with that.

5.description: Chipotle is one of my favorite fast food places; behind Wendy's and Checkers. My stomach comes alive every time I walk through the doors of this place. Also, I like the fact that they have a nutritional calculator online, which I use on the days I want to try and eat somewhat healthy.I am a huge fan of the burrito (with brown rice, black beans, carnitas, sour cream, cheese & fresh tomato salsa). I sometimes like to think that I'm a member of the Trump family (with better hair of course) and get guacamole as well.Just know that with this location it gets SUPER PACKED during lunch time. So if you want to stand in line around with a bunch of med students, nurses, doctors and hospital employees hit this place up between 11:30a.m - 1:00p.m CST. Maybe you'll meet a rich surgeon who will spot you the $1.98 for guacamole.

3.description: should have thought about the e.coli virus going on at Chipotle. Was to hungry and just went here today 1/21/16. Had the chicken bowl and then had diarrhea afterwards.

35.description: Horrible service! Barely any chicken in my bowl...asked for more and was given 3 cubes. Decided to pay "extra" for full spoon. Will not be back.

19.description: Clean, fast, efficient, and, oh yes, good food! I like the Chipotle at this location a lot, because the staff is really nice and efficient.

28.description: First of all... who doesn't love Chipotle?  I won't dwell on the food because the food at every Chipotle tastes the same and this one doesn't have any sort of weird food issues.I really like this location - the staff cranks out burritos quickly and they are really friendly.  There almost always seems to be an open table when I'm there, they have plenty of the chipotle tabasco sauces out at all times and the drink/plasticware section is always well stocked.In short, they run a tight ship.  Me likey.

45.description: It's the closest thing I have to Mexican at work.  Chipotle isn't great, but it can really hit the spot.  I usually only go about once every six months, and having went recently, I found the burrito production pretty slow ... which kinda stinks when you're on a time limit.  The burrito was good though.

33.description: Chipotle is chipotle and you can never go wrong. Like any other Chipotle, just try to avoid it during the lunch rush.

43.description: I eat here to much!Bottom line, they are the best solution to any issue..like:HangoverDietLunch Per Diem Limit of 10 bucksGuac in a rushMargaritas that are awesomeDone.

2.description: A Chipotle is like most chain restaurants. It is hard to write a review that will be substantially different based on food. So when I write these reviews it is mainly about service or the experience because of service. The service here is great. Workers are genuinely friendly and happy to be there. It doesn't take much but people often find it difficult to simply be kind. The people here are courteous and provide service with a smile.

18.description: Chipotle is Chipotle, and this one is not much different than any other Chipotle. The burritos are all delicious, just don't use the online nutrition calculator if you want to remain guilt-free.The only thing I have to say about this location is particular is that the line can get incredibly long during the lunch hour (like to the door long). Try to come before noon or after one for lunch!

41.description: Living so close was both a blessing and a curse.Sometimes, you just need a Chipotle to hit the spot and having frequented many all over the Chicagoland area, I chose to post my review here because.....It's Chipotle, most people know the food on offer here. This location never seemed to get overly busy but had enough turnover to keep the food fresh. High speed yummy "Mexican" food. What's not to like?!!

52.description: I have a friend that says that I should own shares in Chipotle. I love that place. It's the most food for the least money, and in this economy who wouldn't like that? The burrito's weigh a pound and that couldn't be happier. They've also lowered their prices by about 50 cents which also sweetens the deal. Love it!

50.description: Chipotle is pretty good but not outstanding by any means. The ingredients seem fresh and the portions are large. The guacamole dip is terrific but the tortilla chips are horrific - seriously man.One thing I've learned from eating here is to eat the food immediately and not wait until you get home. The time it takes to drive home is more than enough time to disintegrate the tortillas like the skin on cadavers that have been weighted down in a lake for years, unfortunate victims of Mafia wars.The restaurant decor is industrial in nature and quite attractive, in my opinion. Clean, bright with large windows facing the street. I would not mind subletting one of these places.I would not "run to the border" to eat here and it is not my favorite Mexican restaurant. But when I'm downtown in the area, it is probably the only option available for Mexican food that is not at a sit-down restaurant.PS Don't eat the tortilla chips.

4.description: The line to order is usually pretty long but it moves fast. They seem to be really concerned with "portion control" because I have seen them actually take a piece of chicken from the taco I ordered and put it back in the meat tray. Order double meat. It's not that much more expensive and they really pile it on if you are willing to pay for it.

6.description: Typical Chipotle, which is good for me. Having just arrived in town, late with a hungry family, we needed something quick, tasty, and reasonably healthy. Service was fast, portions were generous, especially the large slab of guacamole for my burrito bowl. Restaurant was clean. Great meal after a long day! Everyone left satisfied.

22.description: This was my first visit to this Chipotle. What I've learned is that while all Chipotles should be made the same they aren't. The people at this location were super friendly and can make a mean margarita! They don't snarf when you ask for extra salsa or this or that, which I appreciate. Yaay Chipotle.

15.description: Nice ppl , they give you good portions depending on the server. Overall they r pretty cool , large interior as well so u feel like you are in a nice restaurant but nope you are just in chipotle. The music is always strange foreign like the hustle n bustle of the street but that's their urban look /feel.

57.description: It's Chipotle, plus the people here are really nice. :)

20.description: Chipotle is one of my favorite fast food places; behind Wendy's and Checkers. My stomach comes alive every time I walk through the doors of this place. Also, I like the fact that they have a nutritional calculator online, which I use on the days I want to try and eat somewhat healthy.I am a huge fan of the burrito (with brown rice, black beans, carnitas, sour cream, cheese & fresh tomato salsa). I sometimes like to think that I'm a member of the Trump family (with better hair of course) and get guacamole as well.Just know that with this location it gets SUPER PACKED during lunch time. So if you want to stand in line around with a bunch of med students, nurses, doctors and hospital employees hit this place up between 11:30a.m - 1:00p.m CST. Maybe you'll meet a rich surgeon who will spot you the $1.98 for guacamole.

36.description: Normally I am very happy with Chipotle, but my most recent experience at the 291E Ontario St. location was below-average. The burrito bowl was pretty much the exact same that it always is at every Chipotle location, but at this place they were completely out of forks. Of course I didn't find this out until after I already had my bowl. I asked the cashier if they had any forks anywhere and she just said "no." Not "sorry, we ran out," or "sorry about that, unfortunately we don't have any right now." Just "no."Gee, thanks. I guess I can eat my bowl with a spoon, but you should at least be apologetic about it!

14.description: very rude employees and they don't give much meat on your order.  I called one time to place order and when asked a question they simply hanged up.

58.description: Great late-night option for upscale pub grub. Friendly and warm ambience, tasty options for veg alternatives. Loved the "curry chips" and our waiter, Gerlich. Cheers, D4!

56.description: I live in the neighborhood and tend to forget about this place.  I went as an afterthought with a friend on Friday evening and it was very nice.  We sat outside, did not have to wait, and the service was nice. We had the pulled pork nachos and burrata salad to share along with a couple of the raspberry martinis.  Everything was good, not AMAZING, but it will stay on my list of neighborhood options.

29.description: Pulled pork sliders are amazing. Other sliders are OK as well. Chicken fingers are delicious.

42.description: Happened to pass D4 while walking from my hotel and decided to give it a try.  The atmosphere is very cozy and the noise level is relatively low for a pub, so you can easily carry on a conversation.  This is a big plus for me as I don't like to shout and eat. The wait staff were very friendly and attentive. The selection of beers was impressive as well.  I was particularly pleased to find one of my favorites on draft, Kentucky Bourbon Barrel Ale. For dinner I ordered the Fish & Chips (small size) which was plenty of food.  I also asked the waitress to bring me some of the Curry Coconut sauce that they have for their Curry Fries appetizer.  This curry sauce is amazing and probably the best thing that I have ever put on fries.  The fish was lightly battered and delicious.I would strongly recommend D4 for dinner if you are visiting downtown Chicago.

23.description: We were looking for a late night dinner and D4 was the perfect restaurant close to Michigan Avenue. The restaurant is very cozy with the black and white checkered cafe floor, brassy light fixtures and a fireplace in the back room. We ordered from the "late night menu" and had the grilled cheese triangles and chopped chicken salad. The menu has many comfort food items and I would also recommend coming back weekdays from 4-6pm for their happy hour menu. When my friend said we were going to an Irish place, I was thinking it would be more pub fare. I was surprised to find that D4 is more of a cafe with a cozy setting and very tasty food. I also learned that D4 is a district in Dublin and that is where the names comes from. If you are shopping or staying near Michigan Avenue, D4 is a great place to stop on Ohio street and refuel with drinks, a cozy fire and comfort food.

47.description: I walked in 35 minutes before having to catch a movie. Asked if they could get us in and out in less time. The host, the elderly manager said absolutely. Proceeded to seat us on the patio as requested, it was a beautiful night in Chicago.Server showed up immediately, he was friendly and said I'm ready to take your order, when your ready. We ordered the lobster roll, corned beef sandwich, coke and a beer. The food arrived quickly, so quick we actually had time to enjoy the weather, scenery and the view. Now here is where it gets amazing. This had to be the best corned beef sandwich I have ever had in Chicago, EVER! they make their own corned beef with a secret recipe. They shave it very thin and stack it mile high (1lb of meat, Yaasss 1lb) with fresh rye bread, it had the right amount of fat content, very juicy and incredible flavor. The mustard and horseradish also was a perfect mixture. You must go here and tell if you feel the same?

8.description: While attempting to find Yolk, we stumbled upon D4. Since the line at Yolk ended in Indiana we turned around and braved the sun in their patio. It was brunch time, aka my favorite time of the day. Should one have breakfast or should they have lunch? Oh my, while I figure out that dilemma I must drink to loosen up my anxiety. We sat outside and our server came right away. We had some delicious St Germain grapefruit drink, corned beef hash and eggs and veggie scrambler. It was so hard to pick those two meals because everything in the menu sounded great. My scrambler was so fluffy, angels made it. I wanted two. And their potatoes? Oh wow. I have no bad words. None! I am so going there again. Mark my words.

31.description: I am literally sitting in this restaurant at 2pm on a Sunday in the middle of brunch and some employee has been vacuuming for the last 7 minutes around the whole restaurant. No one can hear anyone else talking. Very obnoxious  please stop.

34.description: I'm just going to say that the sweet coconut curry dip for the Curry Chips is incredible. I never would have thought it would be this good. Holy Moley! I had a chicken salad and the Curry Chips. Big portions. I'm full and I didn't finish. All was really good, but that curry!!! Unreal.

16.description: Love the atmosphere here. I went there on Wed night, and ordered chicken pie. Delicious! It will be crowded on weekend night.

13.description: I haven't been here since moving out of Streeterville about 5 years ago, but remembered how awesome their chicken tenders were...and still are.  My friend and I went for happy hour last week.  I was pleasantly surprised to see an extensive happy hour menu, aka many of their regular small plate items for $6 between 4-6pm.  Of course I had the chicken tenders and was magically transported to my happy place.  Something about the crispy, yet airy tempura batter and moist meat.  Each order comes with 5 decent-sized tenders and the habenero ranch dipping sauce, although you can ask for the other sauces (curry yogurt is equally delicious or the sweet & sour, which are options on the regular menu).  The sweet & sour sauce had the consistency and look of apple sauce and was too sweet for me.I also tried a strawberry mocktail which was on the sweet side.  The cranberry lime soda was definitely better.  Man I miss drinking Guinness!  The tenders were so good that my friend and I came back this week for another happy hour.  We each had our own order of chicken tenders (oink) as well as the Grilled Cheese Triangles (basically a grilled cheese sandwich cut into quarters - yummy bacon and cheese) and an order of Buffalo Wings, which my friend had to take home since we were stuffed.  Service was great, we had the same server as last week who actually remembered us.  She actually gave us all three dipping sauces for the tenders for both orders!  Hopefully I've satisfied my chicken tender fix, for now.

11.description: Managed to eat D4 twice in one day while helping a friend move apartments. For lunch, the Caesar Salad with steak was very satisfying although the novelty of the parmesan cheese chip/crouton/circle was lost on me. The other croutons were crunchy and well-seasoned. The steak was cooked medium-rare as ordered. The romaine was decent and the dressing was too delicious. I also liked the hearty soda bread that came with our meal. For dinner, I got the "small" fish and chips - a big plate of excellent fries and beer-battered tilapia (I think). Very pleased with everything but the coleslaw could have used more vinegar to brighten it up. D4 staff was very friendly on both occasions and they had good drink options although I was too tired from hauling stuff around to drink.

39.description: Excellent service, friendly and responsive staff, and a great diverse menu with quality ingredients and tasty items. The fish tacos, burger, and all of the house fries are fantastic! 99% of the time I order takeout and it is always on time, hot, correct, and reliable. Thanks to the management and staff.

37.description: YUM. Seriously. After seeing the huge wait outside Yolk down the street, I made a last minute reservation for brunch at D4 and was happy that I did. Strolling around hungover on a Sunday morning called for a lot of coffee and water, which D4 quickly provided while we perused the menu. The smoked salmon caught my eye as it is difficult for my to turn down. It was served as three large swirls atop cream cheese and (here's the weird part) toast. I supposed this was an Irish twist but it was good nonetheless. Plenty of capers, tomatoes, onions and a hard boiled egg made this the perfect breakfast. The rest of our group got French toast, Benedicts, or veggie omelets, which they all devoured as well. Some diners had what looked like good bloody marys but it had been a long night the night before and we weren't quite ready for the hair of the dog. Quick and attentive service though, and the inside of the restaurant is beautiful... We sat near the cozy fire. Would definitely return!

0.description: Not sure why people will wait for a table at yolk for 1.5hrs+ when this restaurant is just as delicious and right next door. With usually no wait. D4 also takes reservations! They have a very tasty brunch. My husband and I have gone here a few times. They have a good selection of savory and sweet brunch items. As well a a good brunch cocktail menu. Their mimosas are only $7! The ambiance is really fun too. One side has a bar feel and the other a restaurant. They have tvs on one side too. We haven't gone here during a game, but I'm sure it gets packed.

38.description: Nice space, more restaurant than bar.  Good selection of beers. I sat at the bar and had the short rib nachos.  Tasty and enough for sharing. It's a calmer alternative to Timothy O'tooles.   Will be back for dinner.

51.description: The lobster mac and cheese was great! I never heard of or tried this before, but it was really good!

27.description: Ordered the corned beef sandwich, pretty dry and bland although a lot of beef. My wife ordered the lobster roll. Should have been called a lobster salad roll since it was a cold sandwich with celery and onions mixed in. Not what we expected. Had a caramel mule which was pretty smooth.

32.description: My husband and I live nearby and are always looking for a new spot to grab a bite.  Before going to AMC East we found D4 nearby and decided to give it a try.  It was so cozy warm without being too hot.   The food was what you would expect from an Irish pub, and delicious.  All the comfort foods, with a nice variety of salads too. Portions are generous.  Love this place, will definitely go back.  Would also be a great place for a drink and dessert  by the fireplace in the winter.

54.description: Great brunch choices and definitely value for money. Friendly hostess are very attentive and make sure you get all you need for a lovely brunch. We didn't have to wait in a line even in a Sunday since the venue is very spacious.

48.description: went there for breakfast because yolk had line out door . service was fine but there is nothing special here no authentic Irish food that's for sure

44.description: We had a busy and strenuous day exploring, experiencing and learning in Chicago and dropped in here because it was close and looked inviting away from the windy streets.    We were seated promptly and were given a glass of water each with the menus.   Our server then seated two other tables directly adjacent to us and in both cases gave the other tables bottles of water?   We noticed this and thought nothing of it until of course we asked for a refill later in the meal which took 3 separate requests of the waiter to have it fulfilled.The meal choices were standard Irish comfort foods and were delivered with no great expectations.   Our assumptions were met and the meals were heavy on plain tasting fare.The negative in this situation was that the Main meals we ordered were delivered 1 minute after we received our starters!    I asked the server to return them as we were not even close to ready for them.      We then completed our starters all the while thinking that our Fish and Chips and Steak frites were sitting under a hot light deteriorating by the second.     The server during this upset was no where to be seen and no apology or excuse was offered.      All the while we were awaiting a duly requested glass of water again.The main meals were brought out again even though we still had our starter plates on the table and all hands were to the pumps to clear enough space to pack them onto the table.    Eventually someone did come and remove our completed dishes.Again, our mains were plain and simple comfort type foods that neither of us were able to complete.Our server was seen infrequently and the manager was seen once from a distance.   I don't know whether delivering all food as close as possible together is normal in Chicago pubs, but it was not our last experience of it to the point where we asked if we needed to do something differently.I am firmly of the opinion after this experience that these waitress/waiter staff are not formally trained and have no compulsion to secure customer loyalty.   The managers are oblivious to the needs of customers and disinterested in securing any level of satisfaction where a failure has occurred.Probably will not revisit the experience.

24.description: This place is a MUST in Chicago. Our family went with another family and we had the most pleasant experience. Our waiter was absolutely accommodating. He did such a fantastic job of making sure our kids were happy. And when kids are happy, the parents are too ;). Food is fantastic. The kids had chicken fingers, Mac and cheese bites And Tator tots with bacon and cheese. All came out hot and fresh. The fingers have to be the best in the city.My husband and a friend had the burgers and both loved them. I had a chicken chipped salad and it was also delicious. If you're the type who likes a lot of dressing, I recommend asking for more on the side. I found my salad a little lacking of the dressing but it's about personal preference. And I do recommend their ranch. It's delicious! My other friend had the pork sandwich and it was different and delicious. Different in a good way. The bbq was rich and flavorful.My husband got a beer with Left hand milk stout with chambord. That drink was so good. It was like a party in your mouth! I recommend ordering it! And our waiter then brought out ice cream for the kids so the adults could have another beverage.This place gets it. It's kids friendly but there is also a bar and a part of the restaurant where we could come back without kids and still have fun! Great atmosphere, fantastic service and the food was some of the best in the city.

7.description: Awesome service.. great food... Good Times...Surprisingly it's a good place for vegans too.. they have a couple very good vegan options.. lucky for me, my friend got me to this place.. wish it showed up for my vegan sort in yelp by itself.. so I am not sure who should put in a little extra effort - yelp or restaurant guys? So that it shows up in the vegan sort.. Kale salad was phenomenalNachos - exceptionalFlat bread - pretty goodBurger - ok, nothing to brag about...All in all .. good place.. Will certainly see you guys again..

49.description: Visited here Wednesday Sept 16th, (evening time). As an Irish person who visits Chicago on a regular basis, (at least twice a month), I decided to visit D4 for an evening meal and a few social drinks. (I even went to the bother of handing in a few of the Irish newspapers I had on my person as recommended by a colleague, as it's apparently greatly appreciated by the owner of this bar who himself is Irish). The food was nicely prepared, and along with it, I ordered a beer. There was little sign of the female waitress while I ate, which itself is unusual for bars/restaurants in the U.S.  She did on one occasion ask how was everything but only as she walked by my table at speed, which in itself showed that she had little interest in my answer. Prior to finishing my beer, she asked if I wanted coffee, or dessert. I asked for a second beer, to which she replied, that she'd get it and bring the check also. Is there a limit on 2 beers or is it just this particular waitress that  decides on what quantity of beer a customer  can purchase before being made feel they are unwelcome. Only for this bar has been highly recommended by colleagues, I wouldn't bother returning in the future. As an aside, I noticed the owner walking the length and breath of the premises throughout my visit expressing his thanks to customers for their visit which was a very nice touch. Now that's the Irish welcome I'm more used too.

40.description: We were looking for a local place that we can run into and grab lunch before our boat tour. This was the place to go! The food was amazing! We got the grilled cheese and the a spread sandwich. Both were so flavorful. A must go to!

53.description: Good comfort food and great prices, considering the location. The fish & chips, steak frites and chicken fingers are my favorites. They have some great specialty drinks, too. I've noticed a big turnover of staff in the last year which is unfortunate, but everyone is always nice.

30.description: Visited D4 for a few Saturday afternoon cocktails with a group of 6. Nice selection of beers and craft cocktails. The strawberry basil martinis were to die for! I didn't give 5 stars because it seemed a tad short staffed and we were told we couldn't split the checks. Regardless I would definitely come back!

46.description: Their French toast, authentic corn beef hash, and fast service makes this a great brunch place. They have a good drink menu which keeps me coming back! The outdoor area is small but nice when warm out.

1.description: We were in Chicago for a long weekend recently and honestly stumbled upon this place. Like many, we were heading for Yolk, but the line was out the door so we moved on.We were there for a Sunday brunch, and surprisingly it wasn't packed at all. There was a steady crowd, but I think the slightly higher price probably leaves some looking elsewhere for Brunch. The decor in the restaurant is very sophisticated for an Irish Pub kind of place. Very high ceilings, large bookcases on the wall, overall a very relaxing, yet refined environment. The homemade jam at the table is some of the best I have had. This is a must with your side of toast. As far as the meal goes, I had the corn beef hash eggs Benedict, and it was very tasty. My other half wasn't very impressed by the omelette, but I tried it and it was decent. Service was above average, and we would come back here in a heartbeat. Definitely worth checking out, especially if you find the line out the door at Yolk.

55.description: Stopped by here for a quick brunch before going out into the city.  I asked the waitress to bring the food out as quickly as possible because we wanted to walk around the city and not waste any time. We both ordered omelets and they were pretty good. I actually liked my side of potatoes the most. I asked for cheese on my omelet and they put it on top instead of inside which was weird but overall was ok. We didnt try any drinks and just had coffee which was good.   Not a bad quick omelet spot.

9.description: I was expecting a lot out of this place but honestly it was a let down. The Chicken fingers which they're know for were okay at best. The service we got was sub-par at best and it took almost 20 minutes to receive our bill. I would understand if they were really busy but they weren't. It was almost like our waitress didn't want to deal with us because we were clearly the youngest couple in the bar. That's too bad because I typically tip in the 25% range. The only reason I gave three stars is because they had Three Floyds on tap.

26.description: Excellent food. Great service. Good seating availability. Very nice food and bar menu. Prices were very reasonable for the generous portion size. Definitely would go back.

25.description: Home away from home. Friendly wait staff and bartenders. Varied rooms, and a styling bar. I love the tea room with a fireplace. Fish n chips, yummy! Interesting lentil soup, an innovative version. Good wines. I always enjoy the company, and my tummy leaves smiling. Great desserts, too.

12.description: This place is a MUST in Chicago. Our family went with another family and we had the most pleasant experience. Our waiter was absolutely accommodating. He did such a fantastic job of making sure our kids were happy. And when kids are happy, the parents are too ;). Food is fantastic. The kids had chicken fingers, Mac and cheese bites And Tator tots with bacon and cheese. All came out hot and fresh. The fingers have to be the best in the city.My husband and a friend had the burgers and both loved them. I had a chicken chipped salad and it was also delicious. If you're the type who likes a lot of dressing, I recommend asking for more on the side. I found my salad a little lacking of the dressing but it's about personal preference. And I do recommend their ranch. It's delicious! My other friend had the pork sandwich and it was different and delicious. Different in a good way. The bbq was rich and flavorful.My husband got a beer with Left hand milk stout with chambord. That drink was so good. It was like a party in your mouth! I recommend ordering it! And our waiter then brought out ice cream for the kids so the adults could have another beverage.This place gets it. It's kids friendly but there is also a bar and a part of the restaurant where we could come back without kids and still have fun! Great atmosphere, fantastic service and the food was some of the best in the city.

59.description: The greeting waitress was super rude. That ruined my experience here. The food was ok. If I wanna brunch, I'd rather go to yolk or westegg nearby.

21.description: I'm only giving this place one star and that's because it's a beautiful bar.  My husband and I just walked in to enquire about breakfast and were very rudely greeted by all staff. Saying that they weren't open yet for 12 minutes by one staff member, 17 minutes from another who then changed to 20 min. The doors were open and we weren't the only people walking in looking for breakfast. The whole staff was snobbish and rude, which I would expect from a nightclub in LA, but not a pub in Chicago. Really disappointed as I would've liked to come back for dinner/drinks while we are in town. I'll be spending my money somewhere else now.

17.description: Stopped by for brunch with some friends around 12:30pm on a Sunday. The place wasn't particularly busy as there were plenty of open tables inside. Service started off great - coffee/drinks brought out and personal recommendations for brunch/lunch options. Once we placed our orders we barely saw our server. Again there were definitely more open tables than occupied tables. I don't know where he was. The service left much to be desired. We had to constantly track our server down and request the basics (i.e., creamer, coffee, syrup, new glass). I ordered the salmon benedict. The eggs were overcooked. The only highlight was the decent cup of coffee. I've read some of the reviews and service has not been an issue in the past. Perhaps this experience is an outlier.

10.description: We were looking for a late night dinner and D4 was the perfect restaurant close to Michigan Avenue. The restaurant is very cozy with the black and white checkered cafe floor, brassy light fixtures and a fireplace in the back room. We ordered from the "late night menu" and had the grilled cheese triangles and chopped chicken salad. The menu has many comfort food items and I would also recommend coming back weekdays from 4-6pm for their happy hour menu. When my friend said we were going to an Irish place, I was thinking it would be more pub fare. I was surprised to find that D4 is more of a cafe with a cozy setting and very tasty food. I also learned that D4 is a district in Dublin and that is where the names comes from. If you are shopping or staying near Michigan Avenue, D4 is a great place to stop on Ohio street and refuel with drinks, a cozy fire and comfort food.

5.description: Veal meatballs are extremely savory and full of flavor. Slight spice on the end but sweet in the middle. The tomato sauce is very good. It has a hint of cinnamon!  Love it.The Heirloom on the other hand was ok. The tomatoes for being February were good but the olives were still seeded. Although a decent salad in terms of flavor picking out the seeds were a pain in the rear.  Bartenders are great, atmosphere is awesome. More of an upscale Irish Pub. Definitely would recommend and come back!

3.description: Came here with a friend for brunch this morning.  There was plenty of seating available and no wait for a Sunday brunch during prime time.  The staff was friendly, and the atmosphere was warm and cozy, especially next to the fireplace.  We both ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict, which came with thick cut potato chips and generally was a tasty option.  I opted for the Bellini, and my friend ordered the Bloody Mary, both of which were great.  For one drink and a meal, the price was $27 - a little overpriced in my opinion for the overall experience.

35.description: My husband and I love D4!   We live nearby in the Streeterville neighborhood and D4 is always a go-to place for us... very comfortable and cozy atmosphere, with a nice mix of friendly people.   The service is consistently excellent and attentive, and the food and the beer/cocktail selections are great.   We always recommend D4 to friends who are looking for a more upscale but yet still casual place to go to in the Near North area.

19.description: Ordered delivery through Doordash after seeing great reviews and picts. I ordered the burger sliders, sloppy Joe sliders and crab cake sliders. The sloppy Joe and crab cake sliders were good, not anything to rave about. The sliders shocked me b/C they aren't your normal slider size, they are more like a mini version of a regular slider. I could practically combine two of them just to make the regular size of most sliders you see at other restaurants. I also ordered the chicken tenders. Fried to perfection, but lacking seasoning. Thank God for the dipping sauce they provide, especially the curry sauce which was extremely good. I also had their side of roasted corn. This dish was extremely good. Overall I would say the food in general was pretty alright, but wouldn't say it was beyond the norm.

28.description: I'm a frequent client to this bar. I think it is one of the best local Irish bars in the neighborhood & in Chicago in general. The atmosphere is great. It's refreshing in summer, cosy during winter with a fire place that gives warmth to the surroundings.The food is great, especially the sweet potato fries. The chicken sandwich is one of my favorites. The prices are really reasonable. It is a highly recommended place to go to. Also, breakfast is delicious and sweet.

45.description: Great little restaurant close by to the Sheraton Tower.  Quickly assembled a table for our large group and the wait staff was very accommodating.  The food was great with lots of options from salads to sandwiches to fish and chips.  The fish and chips plate was huge!

33.description: Pretty cool place in river north. The food was decent. We got fish and chips and the fish tacos which were both solid choices... Nothing spectacular but definitely a good dependable option.

43.description: I first learned about this place while looking for an Irish pub after a trip to Ireland for nostalgia's sake. However, since then I have eaten here a couple of times before a show or event nearby. I love their tempura chicken fingers!!! Their staff is pretty attentive and the space looks like a pub. I would prefer seating near the entrance in front of the bar...the back seems dead and uninspired. They also have outside seating. If I have something nearby and I want some Guinness or some tenders I will come back here...but not a place I would plan for a date or special dinner.

2.description: Great neighborhood spot. The food is wonderful and drink menu has something for everyone (Alpha King on tap!!!!) Only complaint is the manager seems to hover over the bar staff - who are already doing their jobs well. So we get asked the same questions twice.

18.description: Nice place! I love Irish pubs though so maybe biased. I was here at opening on a Friday (11 am) just got a few beers before a movie (1 block away). They have 16 beers on tap. Bartender is very friendly. Huge menu that looks very good (I'm also told it's good). Brunch is only on wkds and reportedly better than the Yolk restaurant next door that often has a wait. Will definitely come again.

41.description: I've been here a number of times over the years but honestly tend to forget about it. Not because I haven't enjoyed each experience D4 is just a bit off the beaten path unless you are headed to Navy Pier. My mom was visiting town last weekend and since it was nice out, and would probably be one of the last nice weekends, we headed over to Streeterville Social just to be reminded they are not open during lunch time. Since we were in the area I recommended we go to D4. Food:-I ordered, as I always do, the chicken tenders which are one the best I've ever had...granted I don't order them very often. The batter is a light beer batter, the chicken pieces large and juicy and they come with three dipping sauces which are delicious. For a side I ordered the roasted corn which was amazing. There is parmesan, paprika, green onion and other spices. Definitely something I plan to make at home now. -My mom ordered the corned beef sandwich since the one at the table next to us looked great. You receive a TON of meat, I believe he said it is a pound. This was great but the real star was the side of brussel sprouts. The sprouts were tender and had brie and bacon mixed in. Beer:-Good selection but nothing special. Did have a few Irish beers I haven't seen elsewhere. Service:-Pretty good. The waiter was a very nice guy and knew a ton about the beers but did not come around too often. Granted we were sitting outside and there were only two other tables occupied outdoors. It seemed he was also covering tables inside at the same time.

52.description: D4 has a nice outdoor patio in a great area that beckoned us to give it a try for brunch on a Sunday morning. The first impression was a very rude hostess.  She acted like we were bothering her by wanting to eat here. We asked to eat on the patio and she at first said that was not possible because it was too busy. We asked how long the wait would be and she said she had no idea. When we insisted that we would wait for a table to become available, she said fine, follow me, and took us outside to an open table. Two more tables around us opened up within 5 minutes of us sitting down as well so I have no idea why she was lying about there being no availability outside (with a rude attitude too!)That being said, our waitress was very nice. I had the steel cut oatmeal and my companion had the eggs benedict. Both of us thought our dishes were solid but nothing to write home about. It is also worth noting that we had a couple cocktails indoors (which actually has a nice decor imo) on a previous visit and we did not care for them (one tasted like cough syrup - the other tasted like straight whiskey).Overall, I would give D4 a shot if you want a casual meal in the area especially if other restaurants in the area have a long wait. I may return eventually to give one of their burgers or sandwiches a try as those looked good at some of our neighbors' tables.

50.description: I've been here a couple of different times during business trips to Chicago. Cool place that seems to be connected to some condos. Decent food and the kitchen is open after 10 pm. Very, very cool beer list and some nice signature cocktails. When you're staying at one of the hotels in the area, take a stroll over. Solid place to chill and collect your thoughts.

4.description: Enjoyed this place with a nice cider and hot chocolate. It was close to DoubleTree I stayed, nice Christmas decorations at that time, whole bar area looked interesting.Hard to find a table in the evening, so we just sat at the bar. Overall it was refreshing to stop by and get a drink.
