6.description: Just came in here for a quick beer. Got my tab $9 of a half full Delirium Tremens. Really?  Wow. Over over priced. Go to Timothy O' Toole's. At least the prices are in line

22.description: I've probably tried 8-10 different items off their menu and all were delicious! But what really keeps me coming back with the bread pudding.

15.description: This place is one of my new favorites! The drinks were nice and I had the short rib nachos and they were the bomb!!!! So good! The service was really good, Juan did great! He made me a chocolate martini that was to die for! I definitely had a good time with the girls for a nice lunch! It wasn't too pricey either so it really did not disappoint!

57.description: Great place for late-night snacking. Food took some time so be prepared to wait but when it came it was superb. Would definitely go back for nice meal.

20.description: Great food & great service! We thoroughly enjoyed our server Juan and the fantastic breakfast. Will be back!

36.description: This place had great service and perfect outdoor seating. The drinks and food were all delicious and perfect atmosphere brunch.

14.description: This place is solid! And might I add much needed for this area. So many times after a movie at the AMC, or at Navy Pier, I had wished there was someplace close for a bite, or a drink. D4 fills that void nicely.Its not a destination place. You wouldn't go here for date night, or if you weren't in the area shopping, or seeing a movie. That being said the service is really great, its clean, huge, and has many options for food and drink. I've been here twice now and tried the chip and dip which was a table favorite, the veggie flat bread which is very nice, and the mac 'n cheese which was super yummy and smoky. My friend had some veal meatballs which she must have liked b/c they were all gone in 10 mins.

28.description: Had brunch here today before the bridal expo and based on previous reviews I thought it would be great.  If I could rate on food alone it would have been 4 stars without a doubt but unfortunately the service killed it for me.  We arrived for reservations at 11:30, the restaurant was pretty empty maybe around 3 tables.  The server tool a bit to come by and when he did he mentioned that he would only be helping us until our actual server arrived.  He took our drink order and then we waited. ..and waited...and waited some more... we were on a bit of a time crunch ad we were there for a bridal show at 1pm.  Around 11:50, we got our drinks, the busses stopped by a few times and tried his best to hurry the process along but the bartender was MIA for quite some time.  Once we had our drinks they gave us the incorrect order but corrected it.   We ordered our food after I finally flagged down the manager who took our order.  I mentioned that we were pressed for time so anything they could do was appreciated.  At 12:30pm our food arrived, I was given the wrong item so they sent it back and came back with the correct one shortly after.  The food was great. My grandma and mom went for egg sandwiches with fries on the side, they enjoyed them and it was a lot of food.   I opted for the eggs Benedict with crab cake instead of ham with hash browns, also great.   My cousin had the Nutella stuffed french toast and we all had bites and it was tasty as well.  The staff realized that I was not happy with the service so I will give them credit for trying to turn things around in the end by being extra attentive once we had our food and giving us a couple of extra mimosas as well as a dessert plate to share, unfortunately the desserts (pictured) were pretty they tasted flavorless and not worth the calories.   I know this review seems harsh but I truly believe that constructive criticism helps people learn from mistakes so I truly hope Level Two does that since the food is worth the visit.

1.description: Loud place had to use a crowded bar voice to be heard Service was terrible, one waitress covering 20 tablesFood was lousy Not impressed

9.description: Very lovely place! Our server was so polite and attentive! How can you go wrong when you get donuts for brunch instead of rolls!!! They come out warm and are SO yummy!I got the chicken and waffles... Waffle crisp on outside and warm and soft and fluffy inside! Perfect! The chicken was crunchy on the exterior and nice and moist and so juicy inside. Seasoning in the batter was great! Don't be fooled... There is a lot of food even though it looks small!My friend got the grass-fed burger with truffle and Parmesan fries....and its MASSIVE! This is an awesome place!

29.description: Went for breakfast before a day of sightseeing.  Wife went for the continental breakfast buffet, while I had the eggs benedict.  The buffet had a good selection of quality items, and the benedict was one of the better ones I've had.  Came with a side of delicious potatoes and a small cup of berries and granola.  Service was also quick and friendly.  At first I thought it was overpriced, but then again, it's a hotel restaurant in downtown Chicago.

23.description: Amazing service.. Amazing food. We stayed at the Hyatt this weekend for our anniversary and stayed at the hotel for dinner both nights! Joshua was our server

5.description: Came here for brunch with a friend and a Groupon and I was quite pleased with the result. The Groupon offer was for two cocktails, two entrees, and apparently, a dessert to share, which we did not realize was part of the deal. Thankfully, we each ordered savory entrees, otherwise it would have been too sweet of a meal.For our cocktails, we both tried Tee Time, which was citrusy and refreshing. I don't normally go for cocktails, as I'm a beer girl, but I very much enjoyed this one. Because I love Chilaquiles, I had to try Level Two's version and I wasn't disappointed. The smoked chicken flavor came through and the refried black beans were a spicy and tasty addition. The tortilla chips also stayed crisp in the dish making for a hearty flavor and texture combination. I wish I hadn't talked as much as I did, so I could have eaten more of the dish before it got cold.The dessert then came around, and it was a tasting of three different treats: white chocolate bread pudding, key lime pie, and chocolate chip cheesecake. I liked the cheesecake best, as it was smooth and creamy. The key lime pie was tart, but too crumbly, and the white chocolate bread pudding was just okay, as it was a bit on the dry side.All in all, with pleasant service and an elegant atmosphere, Level Two offers a menu to satisfy any taste, and I was certainly not disappointed.

31.description: Their weekend brunch is fantastic! It starts at 11:30 and goes until 3pm. It's located in the beautiful second story of the Hyatt hotel (the St.Clair location). It's $25 (not including tax or tip) per person. Not too shabby for all you can eat/drink!The food is served buffet style. I thought there was a very decent selection, and a vast array of options. There was a lot of food! Eggs benedict, bacon/sausage, thinly sliced steak and potatoes, seafood patella, little cast-iron pots filled with sausage and peppers, granola, a meat/cheese section, and fruit/salad selections. There was also a omelet bar, a bread/bagel station, and a nice table of desserts. On top of all of this, there is a table where you can make your own bloody mary or mimosa. Lots of fresh juices, fruit purees, and all kind of bloody mary-ish options (olives, pickles, etc). Once you make your base, the server brings you your choice of booze (champagne or vodka). Service was excellent. Our server was Courtney, and she was friendly and attentive. Overall, the food was all fresh and tasty. I think the eggs benedict (served on top of an english muffin with ham) was my favorite (aside from the mimosas of course!). Their checkbooks are cool as well, they are little journals, which you can sign kind of like a guest book. Level two itself is beautiful, and I think we will be back soon to enjoy the bar area, which had lots of comfy couches and chairs to relax in.

25.description: Brunch was EXCELLENT!   The food was amazing, our server recommended the Chicken Chorizo Burrito, great recommendation.  It was excellent!  I am huge on great customer service and Level Two, exceeds that.  The waitstaff was very attentive and friendly.  the manager stopped by to see how we were enjoying our food and we couldn't stop praising the staff.  We will be back!

12.description: Came in for happy hour on a Monday night. I was told I could sit anywhere and then was told I had to sit at the bar to receive the special(s). The waitress and hostess both didn't know what the happy hour specials were - and had to ask several times. The menu is okay, there is not much variety over the standard American fare. When asked if I could order small plates/sides along with an appetizer the waitress stared at me as though I was speaking another language. Unfortunately, I didn't leave and decided to place my order anyway. The food was delivered timely and it presented nicely but it was flavorless and bland. I had the chicken pops and they were really fatty and ended up not eating most of them. The salad was unoriginal and bland. Overall, I wouldn't eat here again even if staying at the hotel.

21.description: The service and the meal were excellent.  My party had the Grass fed Angus Burger, The Chicken & Waffles,  The Farmers Omelet, & The Kids  Pancakes.

16.description: Had brunch here today before the bridal expo and based on previous reviews I thought it would be great.  If I could rate on food alone it would have been 4 stars without a doubt but unfortunately the service killed it for me.  We arrived for reservations at 11:30, the restaurant was pretty empty maybe around 3 tables.  The server tool a bit to come by and when he did he mentioned that he would only be helping us until our actual server arrived.  He took our drink order and then we waited. ..and waited...and waited some more... we were on a bit of a time crunch ad we were there for a bridal show at 1pm.  Around 11:50, we got our drinks, the busses stopped by a few times and tried his best to hurry the process along but the bartender was MIA for quite some time.  Once we had our drinks they gave us the incorrect order but corrected it.   We ordered our food after I finally flagged down the manager who took our order.  I mentioned that we were pressed for time so anything they could do was appreciated.  At 12:30pm our food arrived, I was given the wrong item so they sent it back and came back with the correct one shortly after.  The food was great. My grandma and mom went for egg sandwiches with fries on the side, they enjoyed them and it was a lot of food.   I opted for the eggs Benedict with crab cake instead of ham with hash browns, also great.   My cousin had the Nutella stuffed french toast and we all had bites and it was tasty as well.  The staff realized that I was not happy with the service so I will give them credit for trying to turn things around in the end by being extra attentive once we had our food and giving us a couple of extra mimosas as well as a dessert plate to share, unfortunately the desserts (pictured) were pretty they tasted flavorless and not worth the calories.   I know this review seems harsh but I truly believe that constructive criticism helps people learn from mistakes so I truly hope Level Two does that since the food is worth the visit.

17.description: The service and the meal were excellent.  My party had the Grass fed Angus Burger, The Chicken & Waffles,  The Farmers Omelet, & The Kids  Pancakes.

10.description: Over a weekend trip I had their salmon which was really good, their breakfast was really delicious and the service was outstanding. the Parmesan truffle fries were nothing exciting but the mushroom empanadas were really good. My favorite item was the Nutella French toast but luckily the waitress warned me this dish is super sweet so instead I asked for plain French toast with a side of Nutella and that was perfect. Sooo yummy. I could only eat two of the four pieces but super good!My only complaint was that the rotisserie chicken tastes like it had freezer burn. Overall the food was very good but the service was really really good.

11.description: I ordered the trout and a side order of asparagus. They both had way too much black pepper. Also the radicchio that came with the trout was extremely bitter and unpleasant. The sliced apple that was provided was not enough to balance it. Both the asparagus and trout were cooked perfectly. The restaurant is kind of pricey though.

26.description: First of all, anyone here for the vaunted brunch buffet (with the mimosa/Bloody Mary bar) should know that they've "minimized" (i.e., eliminated) it "for fall" (whatever that means).  That was a disappointment, particularly since the service was so agonizingly slow and indifferent that our party would have been much better off if we'd been in charge of our own fetching and carrying.  After waiting an excruciatingly long time for our waiter to take our drink order in an otherwise-empty restaurant (to be fair, helping that busboy roll napkins was definitely a life-or-death matter), I tracked down a manager to complain.  I learned a lot about union regulations for hotel staff as a result of that conversation, but I don't know where this guy got the idea that I was interested in hearing about his daily headaches as opposed to, you know, actually getting some food and beverages.  I didn't even get an apology.The food was decent, but I don't think I'll be back.

27.description: Words cannot describe how incredibly awful the brunch service was, and not in a so-bad-it's-funny-Raj-Darbar way. It would have been forgivable if the restaurant had been full, but I'd say it was at about 10% capacity at 11:30 on a Sunday. Our server took our coffee/drink order, and disappeared. When the second half of our party arrived, and sat, and sat, and sat, one of my friends literally got up from the table and tracked down another employee just so the rest of our party could get water. Seriously, we could not get attention to save our lives, then there were mixed up drink orders, an entire lack of silverware, and an insane amount of apologies, but no correction in the crappy service. Amazingly, the food came out right, but it was average at best. We were NOT happy to see an auto-gratuity added when our server showed up at the end of the meal (for the first time since the original coffee order) to drop the check. I absolutely, positively will NOT return.

35.description: Delicious buffet brunch with unlimited bloodies and mimosas for $25! As a hotel guest this seems excessive but from a normal diner perspective (compared to other brunches in the area) it's a great deal.Gourmet and healthy saladsLAMB CHOPSBloody Mary barMimosas with multiple fruit purées...and many more Also!Sushi happy hour from 5-7 (50% off). Not too many creative maki, but the fish is fresh- chefs sashimi platter is the best deal.

8.description: We did a groupon and this was truly a treat!! Joshua was our server and made all the best recommendations! We did Chilaqualies and it was spectacular. I did the whiskey bloody mary and my bf did the coffee cocktail, both were fantastic. Match all of that with a bowl of donuts in lieu of a bread basket and this was one great brunch!!! *the dessert tray was also outstanding* big thanks to Claire and Joshua

0.description: Boyfriend got a living social deal for this place so we decided to try it out, and we're pleasantly surprised! I could see why people would never know this place existed, unless you were staying at the Hyatt it's located in. But with that being said, I'm so happy we found it!Our LS deal was good for brunch and cocktails for two. My guy only drinks beer, so I tried two of their cocktails and they were both delicious. For eats, I indulged in the crab Benedict, of which I ate the entire thing, while my boyfriend opted for the chicken and waffles, also absolutely delicious judging by the one bite I was allowed. Finally, one last touch I really loved about Level Two is their support and promotion of Chicago. All the beer they carry is local to Chicago, and we were treated to a sample of mini donuts from Stan's Donuts while we waited for our food. I found this to be a really cool and creative way to get tourists interested in just a tiny sample of what Chicago has to offer, and being a local, I really appreciated that!

20.description: This restaurant is lovely! Great staff and amazing food! No wait, warm environment,  and live music! #thebombdotcom

19.description: The service was fast and friendly. The Nutella French toast was a large portion. I had trouble finishing it and I can eat a lot. I weigh over 250 lbs. the Sunday brunch came with a drink and desert. The desert was 4 different choices all brought to the table! Located on the second floor at our hotel was great too.

33.description: This is a review for Travel zoo deal - Magnificent Mile Brunch w/Cocktails for 2Don't hesitate to jump on the deal if it ever comes up again.  This is an excellent steal of a deal. I came on a Saturday around 11:30am.  Reservations are recommended for brunch, but I didn't have one and was seated within 5 minutes. The cocktail refills are unlimited.  They have a self-serve bloody mary station or juice station (orange, pineapple, apple) and the servers adds the alcohol at your table.   The server came back multiple times asking for refills.  The food at the breakfast stations felt fresher and higher end than normal breakfast food.  They also had greens and salads.I was also impressed with their dessert stations and pastries (I love bear claws).The desserts were equivalent to what I would find at 5-star Vegas Buffet.

2.description: The weekend brunch buffet was such a good deal when they had it - I was impressed. We went back last month to try out the brunch menu and it was just mediocre. My husband had the chicken and waffles. I found the waffles to be dry, and the chicken was not as flavorful as I expected. I had the shrimp /grits with sausage gravy. Don't be misled, there's really no sausage in the gravy, they chop it up into small pieces and add it to the gravy for flavor. The shrimp was very good and the grits were done fine but I was really underwhelmed by the gravy which should have brought the entire dish together.We really liked the buffet before if anything for the food because we don't drink but too bad we found out that they will not be bringing back the buffet anytime soon. I would pass on this restaurant and look for plenty of other good places around streeterville.

34.description: this is only for weekend brunch. I used a voucher from travel zoo deal.they have own mimosa and bloody marry station that you can make your own drinks. very fun!their number of food are limited for buffet but good quality. you can find most menu for brunch like egg Benedict, own omelet,,etcservice was nice.I will def. go back

32.description: Four of us went here for dinner last weekend. Modern atmosphere, spacious layout, OK menu, and OK service.

18.description: Delicious buffet brunch with unlimited bloodies and mimosas for $25! As a hotel guest this seems excessive but from a normal diner perspective (compared to other brunches in the area) it's a great deal.Gourmet and healthy saladsLAMB CHOPSBloody Mary barMimosas with multiple fruit purées...and many more Also!Sushi happy hour from 5-7 (50% off). Not too many creative maki, but the fish is fresh- chefs sashimi platter is the best deal.

13.description: All I can sY is that this place made my night.  I was on a flight running late from Houston on a Saturday night.  Get into the hotel around 6 pm and it is a out 38F outside.  I came down from my room thinking I would grab a drink and then go eat.  Of course the well written menu sucked me in.  Everything sounded great.  I finally committed to the crab cakes as I wasn't going for a whole meal.  I also asked about the local on draught, it was an IPA.  Both were superb.  As was the service, management and other craft beer selections.  This place is a gem.  The service was superb. Each wait staff, not just mine, including the manager, asked how I was doing and engaged as they made their way by.  The food tasted as great as it sounded (a rarity these days). Lastly, a peeve of mine, the wait staff was not only familiar with the menu, but with the craft beer selections.En toto, when all was said and done, these guys had made my night.  A little good food, beverage and company for the wayward traveler on a cold, rainy night in CHI town.  This is not your typical hotel restaurant.  This is a good place to come for great food, great service, and some excellent, carefully chosen, craft brew selections.Added values to the hotel and worth your time if you are in the area and looking for a nice meal, alone, or with friends.  Great place.

4.description: There is nothing I don't like about this place.During my 5 day stay at the hyatt we visited here everyday. Whether it was for half off wine Wednesday. .or lunch before we ventured out...or nightcaps on the way in.Service is spectacular! The best bartenders in chicago. Once he learned my style of drink I didn't even have to order. He'd mix up something special and delicious every time.The food...awesome. super fresh and delicious. One time we split a sandwich and soup and they graciously brought it out on 2 plates and 2 small bowls. That's the kind of service you get here.Nice sleek atmosphere. ..comfortable. .upscale yet cozy.I seriously recommend this place.

24.description: Over a weekend trip I had their salmon which was really good, their breakfast was really delicious and the service was outstanding. the Parmesan truffle fries were nothing exciting but the mushroom empanadas were really good. My favorite item was the Nutella French toast but luckily the waitress warned me this dish is super sweet so instead I asked for plain French toast with a side of Nutella and that was perfect. Sooo yummy. I could only eat two of the four pieces but super good!My only complaint was that the rotisserie chicken tastes like it had freezer burn. Overall the food was very good but the service was really really good.

6.description: We stayed in the Hyatt, so it made sense on the day of check-out to drop down to this place for breakfast. It was so good! I love, love, love Eggs Benedict and they make it perfectly. The poached eggs had runny middles, the Canadian Bacon was smoky, the English muffins we buttery and toasted with a slight crisp, and the Hollandaise sauce was creamy and delicious! My husband got the breakfast buffet, which included coffee. It had regular things like scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon, but also had fancy cheeses, like Havarti with dill, and fancy meats too, like mortadella. He said the food was higher quality than most buffets.The service was great, and the atmosphere was very nice. I would eat here again if we weren't going back to Florida today.

22.description: I wouldn't order their Margherita Pizza, it was terrible. I actually can't believe they sent that out, it still amazes me, it was a thin crust with a tomato dropped on top and a small piece of Mozzarella in the middle of the tomato and piece of green cilantro.. It was more like a cracker with a tomato topping, I still don't get it. HmmThe other stuff we ordered was good though. Try their Papardelle Carbonera.. Wow!! it was Amazeballs.

15.description: Came here for dinner because friends came to visit from out of town and other restaurants all needed reservation to get in. After reading that it has decent rating, we decided to try this place. Service was way too slow, my friend ordered shrimp salad and she didn't receive her food although most of us were almost done with our food.  She finally got her food after like 10 mins and was very unhappy. I ordered spinach chicken risotto and it was like the worst risotto I've ever tasted, it looked like someone spilled bunch of dried rosemary in the risotto, all i could taste was rosemary. Some of the rice was undercooked, it was also under seasoned. Our waitress was way too busy and didn't ask us how the food was. I barely ate risotto and threw most of it out. It was terrible, NEVER again.

7.description: I purchased a Groupon from here just wanting to try something new. My expectations were pretty low because it's a hotel restaurant. I was totally blown away. Service was excellent, seated right away, food was 5 stars, location was nice. Literally everything was perfect. I'm def going back and recommend for all.Only con- and this isn't a deal breaker was that there is no barrier from the elevators to the restaurant. Basically the hotel guests come out of the elevator and watch you eat and they're your focal point. One of the guests even came over to me to ask what I was having, in his swim shorts. I'd suggest those room divider curtains for a little bit of privacy. To me there is a difference between restaurant in a hotel and hotel restaurant.

36.description: I need to divide my review into 2 part - service and food.  I understand that this is a newly opened restaurant and lounge area in the hotel.  However, after 3 weeks, it would seem that they would start to get familiar with how things worked or, better yet,  that the restaurant had actually hired staff with some prior experience inside a restaurant.  Some of the staff are very nice, however after staying several nights and eating there multiple times, this area needs some work.Friday morning - despite the fact that the hostess had seated me for most mornings of the week - she came up to me in front of other people, and told me that I would need to pay for the breakfast buffet - that it wasn't free.  First of all, isn't this a conversation you would have with the waitress?  She had sat us at the table with menus that clearly stated the price.  I hadn't sneaked out any other morning without paying in full.  Even if this is an issue with other guests, it was poorly handled.The food, I must say, is better than the service.  They seem to use fresh ingredients that are locally sourced.  For a downtown hotel lobby restaurant the prices are reasonable.  They have a nive variety of food - including a sushi menu.I hope that the growing pains are short lived.  This is a great hotel with a nice staff, new, comfortable rooms and a fantastic gym.

30.description: Brunch was great.  Did not have to wait and the food was top notch.  Had the chilaquiles and the chicken n waffles.  Both were fantastic!What sets this place apart from others was the service.  The server was awesome.  They did not have the ingredients to make the drink my girlfriend wanted.  Normally not a good sign.  But the manner in which he took care of us would make me go out of my way to eat there again.  Kudos to the management team for hiring top notch servers!

3.description: Food was delicious!!! Through Groupon this place was worth it. Full price though - no way. The donut appetizer was very nice. No dessert plate afterwards though like others have mentioned. I think they were short-staffed because things took awhile and tables all around us were at various points of brunch waiting for things. Our waitress seemed stressed but was still very kind to all of her customers. So, get the groupon or living social deal and go get your brunch on!

14.description: LOVED this place. Great breakfast, great mimosas, amazing staff. Very classy but casual feel. The dishes are big so be prepared to share or come hungry! Very reasonably priced for such a classy brunch. ($15 a person for food).

56.description: I did not like this place one bit. Yes, they've only been open 3 days but their chicken was dry, their tzatziki was flavorless and their prices were too high.

29.description: Good spot to grab breakfast if you are visiting someone in Northwestern Hospital...or just if you work nearby.I stopped in after a physical last week and did not want Au Bon Pon so I saw this place and was like hmmm. Only a few people in line which worked out good for me.I got the Olympus omelet which was delicious. I includes ham, green pepper, onion and cheddar cheese (I substituted with feta to keep the greek vibe going). You can also get their omelet options as a handheld (served on a pita or wrap).

42.description: Food: 5 StarsCustomer Service: 2 starsFood is EXCELLENT, but service is way to frantic and rushed! I need a xanax before even getting in line! NOTE TO MANAGEMENT: Fast does not = efficient.Fast and inefficient does = poor customer service.Juan was VERY rude. He did not listen to what I wanted on my plate. He was way too consumed with trying to hurry than listen! He actually rolled his eyes at me and was very curt. UNACCEPTABLE!!!Robin, the cashier, apologized for my experience and made sure I got my order the way I wanted WITHOUT an attitude!Thank you Robin!

23.description: I work nearby but have not been back in months.  I actually liked the food, which makes this review all the more unfortunate.One of their employees was reaching into fries fresh out of the fryolator with his bare hands, and was popping some into his mouth before disappearing into the back kitchen area - he did this a few times!  Considering everyone else was wearing gloves if they handled food directly, that was definitely out of place in a hospital cafeteria...and gross enough for me to be very reluctant to stop by again.

47.description: Worst Falafel in the city!

8.description: Northwestern has it down when it comes to providing delicious hospital food! It's really great that they consciously (or maybe it was unconsciously) put a healthy fast food restaurant that has a ton of variety. During lunch hours, the wait can be pretty atrocious which is why if you're visiting the hospital, it would be in your best interest to eat an odd hour (think 2PM). When I came by for dinner tonight, the food was as fresh as ever. I had myself greek salad with a chicken kebab added on. The feta was flavorful and my salad had a ton of color in it. The chicken kebab was moist and with the greek dressing, it was all quite tasty. Only downside is that my salad was pretty pricey at like $9.50, but it was a decently large portion size and it's downtown.Go get yourself some GRK!

31.description: Northwestern has it down when it comes to providing delicious hospital food! It's really great that they consciously (or maybe it was unconsciously) put a healthy fast food restaurant that has a ton of variety. During lunch hours, the wait can be pretty atrocious which is why if you're visiting the hospital, it would be in your best interest to eat an odd hour (think 2PM). When I came by for dinner tonight, the food was as fresh as ever. I had myself greek salad with a chicken kebab added on. The feta was flavorful and my salad had a ton of color in it. The chicken kebab was moist and with the greek dressing, it was all quite tasty. Only downside is that my salad was pretty pricey at like $9.50, but it was a decently large portion size and it's downtown.Go get yourself some GRK!

34.description: I love a good Greek salad...and to find one in a hospital???  Amazing!  Easily customizable, as they make it in front of you, and on my second visit I decided to combine romaine and spinach lettuces, skip the onions, add extra olives and make it a salad I was proud to call my own!  Plus:  They don't skimp on the feta!  Nice job!

16.description: Meh. The food was good and filling but not as authentic as I would've hoped! Regardless, decent pricing. This is clearly the fast food of American mediterranean dining. Warning- it's located INSIDE the hospital building! As tourists, we had no idea what to do until we called and the staff told us to come up to Level 2 of the hospital. We didn't prefer eating in a hospital for our first meal in Chicago, but no worries - it was filling and interesting!

13.description: I love this place! The food is quick and delicious. The employees are friendly and always give me a ton of meat in my pita. The food is easy on the pockets as well for those on a budget.I recommend you try the lamb & beef on pita (white or wheat doesn't matter) with tzatziki, tomatoes & cucumbers, vinegar pickles, onions, and feta.

11.description: I work nearby but have not been back in months.  I actually liked the food, which makes this review all the more unfortunate.One of their employees was reaching into fries fresh out of the fryolator with his bare hands, and was popping some into his mouth before disappearing into the back kitchen area - he did this a few times!  Considering everyone else was wearing gloves if they handled food directly, that was definitely out of place in a hospital cafeteria...and gross enough for me to be very reluctant to stop by again.

39.description: I love this place! The food is quick and delicious. The employees are friendly and always give me a ton of meat in my pita. The food is easy on the pockets as well for those on a budget.I recommend you try the lamb & beef on pita (white or wheat doesn't matter) with tzatziki, tomatoes & cucumbers, vinegar pickles, onions, and feta.

37.description: Most bang for your buck with the platter. This is a great addition to the hospital and you really get a lot of food with any option. I am a huge fan of the rotisserie chicken and their hot sauce. I also choose rice as my carb each time and love it.

0.description: I had the make your own omelette. It was fresh, well made and the cashier was friendly and helpful. For a quick delicious breakfast this place works for me.

38.description: Come on it is a hospital!  Treat people with kindness or fake it til you make it.  I've never been treated with such poor service!Edit****** I was contacted by management quickly, which I am satisfied that the issue was addressed, so I am taking down my original post.  I do not wish this business any ill will.  Hope that customer service training can be handed down from management down to the people who are on the front line by treating customers with respect.

51.description: Greek Kitchen is so-far-so-good and I'm so happy a few more quality but resonably priced dining options have popped up in the Northwesern Hospital neighborhood. I'm really exciting about the freshness of the chicken kababs at GK and the frequent-dining card.  The kababs are marinated and taste like home-made. It's a super fast in-and-out ordering experience - not even 5 minutes with 15 people in front of me. And the frequent dining card is buy 10 entrees, get the 11th free. Not too shabby. I'll defo be back.

27.description: I go to this place whenever I have to take my grandmother to the doctor. We always end up here for lunch because the food is so good. I've tried the salads, plates, and pitas and enjoyed them all. My grandmother who is a very picky eater even enjoys it, plus being a first generation Greek we both agree the food is very authentic Greek cuisine! The staff is always smiling and welcoming you in.  The store is always clean and well stocked even when it is busy,which I appreciate!

32.description: Stopped in for lunch here and they committed my number one pet peeve of assembly line service places- asking you for your order when you're still about 10 feet away and then randomly asking people what toppings they want on their food, pulling people out of order in line. It is the rudest, most awful way to handle customer service and it's not efficient at all. Take a chill pill. I bet you that a bit slower service will result in better customer service, correctly executed dishes every time, and a lot better reviews here on yelp. I also bet that the service won't even be any slower!Food was great, but the stressful ordering experience will keep me from returning. What a shame.

54.description: Oh man, I love this spot the moment I walked in and smelled the good food happening! I thank my coworker/good friend for showing me this place :).  It's basically a Greek Chipotle :D). Now that's smashing.

48.description: Great food! I work at the hospital and this is a great and affordable alternative to the cafeteria. The food is wonderful and they have a great variety of different greek foods customized exactly how you like it. The greek fries are to die for!! Not a big fan of the falafel though...fried a little too long...

44.description: Perfect option for a light dinner during class: avgolemono soup and a side Village salad. Except the salad seems to have been packaged in the morning and left to get soggy by the evening. I've had their meat before so I know the fresh items are better, will be back for a plate.

24.description: I am a nurse at Northwestern and often eat at Greek Kitchen on my breaks. Let me tell you about my last three experiences:1. I asked for a greek salad, along with greek salad dressing. I get upstairs and no salad dressing was in the bag. Had to eat it dry.2. Second time that week, I asked for a greek salad, made sure it had dressing with it, and told them to hold the onions due to an allergy. Sure enough, I get upstairs and have to pick through a salad covered in onions.3. Thought I would give them a third chance. Big mistake. I ask for the same greek salad, no onions, with a wheat pita. As I am getting ready to pay, i notice a whopping pile of onions on the salad. They made a new salad, but then forget the pita. Needless to say, Greek Kitchen does not have their act together, continually messing up simple orders even for hospital employees. I DO NOT RECOMMEND this restaurant.

7.description: I love their food, but hate that they run out of everything. Today they were out of spanikopota and rushing to close. I didn't notice until I got to my department that my chicken and rice were cold (totally not cool!).

49.description: Ok Food Not All That Great Not Worth The Money I Paid...Ive Had Better.

40.description: I love this place.  If I go here for lunch, I go "later" in the day (after 1pm) and have never had a problem with long lines or waiting or feeling rushed.  The food is very fresh.  The portions are generous.  The meat is cooked to perfection.  The staff is very friendly.  This is one of my go-to lunch spots in the loop.

53.description: Yes! We needed more quick food options in the River East area, and this place delivers. I've already been here too much since it opened and haven't been disappointed yet. I usually go for a wrap with rotisserie chicken - and I love that they don't skip on the meat, they load it on. Helps meet my protein quota! And I'm always sure to add spicy feta - so good. Those who rated this place low probably came when this place first opened. They did have some growing pains but they've definitely got the hang of things now.

30.description: I love Greek food and come here all the time for their salads, but today I tried the whole wheat handheld instead. I have been missing out!! For $7.50 I got a huge portion size, a much better value than the salads. It's a great, healthier fast food option in the hospital. I would suggest the chicken kabob that includes bigger chunks when compared to the rotisserie, which translates to juicier chicken. Also, the $.50 upgrade to spicy feta is a must-absolutely delicious & really makes the meal.

46.description: I was really disappointed with their chicken and rice. Also, there were fruit flies all over the dining area. Kinda hard to enjoy lunch while shooing away insects..

1.description: I'm basing this review off of their catering services.  I work on Northwestern's downtown campus and we placed a large-ish order for an event we were hosting.  The process of ordering the food was fine-- although the first person I called gave me a bit of attitude for calling during the lunch rush and advised to call back later, the second person I talked to was very friendly and helpful.  The process of getting the food, however, was where things went wrong.Our order was scheduled to arrive at 11:15 am, and when it wasn't there fifteen minutes later, I gave the restaurant a call just to get an ETA.  They use an outside service to deliver their orders, and I was told that the girl had left the restaurant ten minutes earlier (which was still after she was already supposed to be there, but whatever).  When she still wan't there ten minutes later, I called again, and they apologized and said to call back if she wasn't there in ten minutes.  When she finally did arrive, she discovered that one of the workers of the restaurant had packed the hummus we ordered at the bottom of one of the bags, and the weight of the food on top of it had made it burst all over the place-- making the hummus and some of the other food we ordered totally unable to be served.In addition to being worried that we wouldn't have enough food to feed our guests, who were now arriving, there was now a mess everywhere.  To her credit, the delivery girl apologized and stayed and got in touch with the restaurant and tried her best to salvage what food she could.  She was able to arrange for the restaurant to send us a new hummus free of charge, but it arrived after the event had already started, so nobody really ate any of it.  The new delivery girl was sure to tell me that they had thrown in some pita chips, and while I appreciated the gesture, I would have appreciated an apology from the restaurant afterward more, which we didn't get.  So long story short, I'd advise against ordering catering from here, and if you do, avoid hummus at all costs!

55.description: What a great addition to the Streeterville area.  I work in the area and the options have gotten very boring.  The place opened 3 days ago and even though the line seemed very long, they pump out the as they say on the back of their shirts " yee-ros " very fast!  A must try!  I might break my leg on purpose so I have an excuse to get their food in Northwestern Hospital on a Saturday.

9.description: GRK is great for a quick Greek fix. The food is tasty and they give you great portions for how much you're paying.

26.description: Can't get enough spicy feta!!! I love GRK! The service, atmosphere and food is all superb. Been frequenting this location for a year and in the last 6months it's really become friendlier and the service has improved tremendously. When coming in you really get the feel and the employees really help you along with your order. This is my quick lunch fix in a hurry! Quick, healthy and delicious!

25.description: Okay I'm updating this because I freaking love that the staff knows my order and has it ready for me before I hit the counter. Fast, efficient, delish. Love the staff and the food.

12.description: It's conveniently located at Northwestern Hospital since I see a doctor here.  But the first time I went; though the food was tasty; it was thrown all together on a plated item and I had a hard time distinguishing the various items.  And it took weeks for the debit-card purchase to show up in my checking account. I would have overlooked that if it wasn't for the fact that my second visit was pretty bad.  My falafel was inedible - burned beyond belief - I can't believe they actually sold it to me and I had to wait extra time for it.

21.description: I go to GRK whenever I visit the doctor. Friendly service and the food is great! I usually look forward to my doctor visit so I can have GRK.

17.description: Good spot to grab breakfast if you are visiting someone in Northwestern Hospital...or just if you work nearby.I stopped in after a physical last week and did not want Au Bon Pon so I saw this place and was like hmmm. Only a few people in line which worked out good for me.I got the Olympus omelet which was delicious. I includes ham, green pepper, onion and cheddar cheese (I substituted with feta to keep the greek vibe going). You can also get their omelet options as a handheld (served on a pita or wrap).

10.description: Glad the weather is improving so I can walk to a nearby restaurant next time.  I went in for the lemon egg soup--sorry so soup.  Greek fries--were soggy and barely any feta for $3.99.  The Greek Salad left a lot to be desired, some of the lettuce was already turning and the salad was tasteless.

5.description: The chicken kabob plate is sooo good and so is the bowl of chili.  This is definitely my favorite place to get a bite to eat at NMH.

3.description: Good food bad customer service! The customer service today wasn't the best. The cashier was rushing and ringing up orders so fast that she wasn't paying any attention. Understandable that it's a busy location within the hospital but at 11am and no line,  service should be better. The cashier only charged for half my order even after telling her twice. With only having 45 mins for lunch having to spend an extra 10 mins waiting for the rest of my lunch and having to get back into line to pay is a pain.

35.description: Annoyingly rude service, mediocre food! I hope these staff just happened to have a bad day on a SLOW SUNDAY coz no patients and anyone visiting patients there deserve that kinda rudeness. Well, no one should be deserving that kinda rudeness at all.We came in on a Sunday 2ish pm, so there was no rush hour lunch crowd from offices and the hospitals at all. No one was in line, except us ordering food, but the service we got was so rude that i wish i could have cancelled my order and gone next door which when i ordered a silly side item that's not even on the menu, protein bar happily went above and beyond to accommodate.

19.description: I am a nurse at Northwestern and often eat at Greek Kitchen on my breaks. Let me tell you about my last three experiences:1. I asked for a greek salad, along with greek salad dressing. I get upstairs and no salad dressing was in the bag. Had to eat it dry.2. Second time that week, I asked for a greek salad, made sure it had dressing with it, and told them to hold the onions due to an allergy. Sure enough, I get upstairs and have to pick through a salad covered in onions.3. Thought I would give them a third chance. Big mistake. I ask for the same greek salad, no onions, with a wheat pita. As I am getting ready to pay, i notice a whopping pile of onions on the salad. They made a new salad, but then forget the pita. Needless to say, Greek Kitchen does not have their act together, continually messing up simple orders even for hospital employees. I DO NOT RECOMMEND this restaurant.

28.description: Whoah! I'm glad i waited until after I ate here before I read the poor reviews.  I'm surprised at all the comments regarding the staff.  I ate at 1:30 and the line was short, the staff was friendly and the food was delicious.  The only drawback to eating later was that they were out of spanakopita.  My over loaded plate of rice, rotisserie chicken with humus and mixed vegetables was  well worth the price.

45.description: The food is actually very tasty, I do not however care for the rushed and rude personnel who takes the orders. It is food guys, people have to make choices about what they put into their bodies so chill out, it is not like you are going anywhere until the shift is over!

33.description: Though a few of the entrees I've tried were rather good.I somehow think their fries weren't the best.

43.description: Wow!  Delicious....and very generous with their Chicken portions.  I can't wait to go again!!!

2.description: First time eating at GRK Greek Kitchen.  All of the veggies were fresh and the pita was really good.  Sadly their falafels have a very weird taste.  Pretty much the weirdest tasting falafel I have ever eaten and I eat a lot of falafels.  Also for being a Greek place the Tzatsiki has zero flavor.I do appreciate though that this place is very health concious-but that said it would be great to have the calories on the meny board.

18.description: This place is so disappointing. I have ordered from here twice. The first time I ordered they did not include salad dressing, obviously a crucial component that I let slide as I could use an alternative dressing I had on hand. Tonight - although I ordered 2 chicken kabob plates with extra tzatziki sauce for both plates they somehow managed to fail to include even one. I called twice asking them to bring some over. I have now waited over an hour and a half for sauce that has still not arrived. My food is ice cold - and the kicker? They are currently closed. This place is a prime example of gross negligence and complete lack of customer service - do yourself a favor and order from another location. I could not be more dissatisfied.

41.description: Set up pretty much like Chipotle, it's a fast efficient serving line. Even a long line moves lightning fast. The food is fresh and delicious. I had the avgolemeno, which was pleasantly tart and lemony. The Greek salad with steak had generous portions and included a warm pita. I love that the kalamata olives are already pitted. A welcome and tasty addition to NMH's food offerings.

52.description: Their ordering set-up is like Chipotle, except there are many more options to throw in your pita, bowl, or wrap. I'm being very literal with the word "throw". Mr. Reved Up Speedy is on mach 10. He's the first guy you come to. I guess you shouldn't be offended if he gets upset with you for not ordering fast enough. He will skip over you if you take a few seconds to start your order. I get it. He has to keep the line moving. The entire experience is quite something I can't find a word for. It's very loud due to the large crowd waiting in line and sitting inside. It makes it hard to hear the food line people...sometimes difficult to understand them as well. By the time I had to pay at the register, I had to deal with the most cold and robotical people throwing a dollar amount at me, snatching my card from my hand, and slamming my card and reciept on my order. It was like they told me "thank you for your money sucker now get the hell out the line!". The only saving grace for this visit would have been the food, but it wasn't. It's labeled as Rotisserie Chicken, but it's more like tough salty chicken. The texture and taste of the pasta was disgusting. The pita was the only thing I enjoyed.This was the second time I visited. I overlooked the first since it was opening day. I ordered the pita then, and this time a plate. I didn't realize that this atmosphere, food quality, and customer service is the norm.Even if the food was great their quality of service is sorely lacking. That's enough of a reason to not revisit. Oh! I just thought of a word to describe my experience: frantic.PS- I would probably suggest you visit after the lunch rush. Maybe the service and quality is better. I'm still not sure about their food.

50.description: This place is a really nice choice for quick and hearty takeout. The portions aren't huge, but still priced appropriately. The oven roasted chicken was a little dry, but the chicken kabobs were moist and juicy. The baba ganoush and hummus were delicious. They are also available through seamless. Will definitely order again.

4.description: Poor customer service. Management lady always seems to be in a bad mood and I have never had a pleasant experience with her. I have both ordered catering (which has been a mess) and ordered in person in line and that has always been frantic. Food has always been good, but I try not to order from this place if I can help it because I don't want to deal with the customer service. One morning I ran to get a yogurt that they have for breakfast and it was 959am, not sure when they stop serving breakfast but it was still out and the cook was still making hashbrowns so I asked if I could order the yogurt, girl told me no and continued to switch everything to the lunch menu. Don't know why you'd deny a sale but policy is policy I guess?

6.description: The Greek Chipotle!I've been here multiple times and still like it. My most favorite thing to get is the chicken kabob plate. The meat is cooked perfectly and is always fresh. The other ingredients are fresh as well.I grew up always going to Hubs on Lincoln Ave (which is owned by the same family as GRK is) & the chicken and rice remind me of Hubs.. Same taste!Overall, great lunch option!

22.description: I keep hoping that my experience here will be better.  I expect the prices to be higher because of the downtown location.  However, it seems that every new set of employees is taught to be cheap with the meat.  If this is not intentional, then they need to be trained correctly and perhaps supervised in the beginning.  I can see paying $6.85 for a handheld sandwich, but I don't want to pay that if I'm only getting a teeny amount of meat.  I know what a gyro sandwich is supposed to look like, and the meat I get is usually half the amount of a regular gyro, and sometimes even less.  Perhaps the carved meats need to be premeasured by a supervisor, so that it's consistent every time.  I too, have experienced being rung up by robotic employees that could be nicer when they're taking my payment.  I find myself choosing a different option for lunch whenever I think of my negative experiences here.

15.description: Slow slow process and some employees don't want to be here. Training?  Manager on duty? Great concept.

20.description: I've eaten here twice - about a month ago and yesterday. The food was decent the first time I came in which might be because I got a wrap, and I think it's easier to cover up shortcomings in the food. Yesterday I got a plate and was totally disappointed. The falafel was very dry, the rice was undercooked, the consistency of the hummus was off. All in all, the food was unsatisfying.Pros: The line was out the door, but they were so quick that I was out of there in under 10 minutes. Everyone that worked there seemed nice, and the location is great. I appreciate having healthy, appealing options in a hospital food court. Next time, I'll probably skip over GRK in favor of Protein Bar, whose food tends to be consistently good.

36.description: Wow. How bad can it get. $16,00 and it went on the garbage. Dry, tasteless chicken. Peppers on the salad were so salty I could not eat it. A weird guy who yells out white or wheat until you realize he is talking to you.  I will stick with Au Bon Pain.

14.description: Bland. Assembly line, fast Greek, chain restaurant. That alone should tip you off. I had the chicken kabob plate with rice and salad. I would have been better off eating gruel. There was no flavor to anything.

36.description: Good selection of toys and clothes, and they often have good sales on toys. I have been wanting a stuffed Stitch for several years now, but for some reason, I keep hoping someone else will buy me one instead, haha. However, I find it odd that they don't have a big movie selection and their movies are all so overpriced. Getting a Disney movie from the Disney Store versus a Target or off Amazon doesn't make it any more spectacular.

29.description: The only problem with this store starts with a capital T: Tourists! But that's to be expected of a store that's located on Michigan Avenue. The finds in this store are worth the trouble of snaking around aisles full of tourists and their strollers full of screaming toddlers.  If you have a child who is into Disney (and what child isn't into Disney? That's simply un-American! LOL), then find your way to this location and make your child the happiest child around. The first time I went into this store I was a skeptic. I just knew that this store would be full of chaos, confusion, and stroke worthy high prices. Boy was I wrong. Well- I wasn't wrong about the chaos and confusion- but hey, it's a children's store for crying out loud. Show me a children's store without chaos and confusion, and I'll show you a world without children. But I digress....The prices in this store are so reasonable, I was checking to see if I was on an episode of "Punked!". I was able to actually buy my daughter a Halloween costume (of her latest favorite Disney Princess at the time- don't ask me which one, it changes with the latest Disney Princess movie!) for $20! Unreal! This store even has a clearance section (oh my stars......), and trust me, it's not a version of "let's just throw a bunch of crap that no one wants or has heard of in this section." I've found great bargains of toys that my daughter's friends are totally jealous for, and all under $10-$20. Even the clothes are affordable. If you're in the downtown Chicago area, and don't mind the touristy feel of Michigan Avenue, make your way to the Disney Store. The kid in you might even find something to purchase for yourself!

42.description: This store has something to make everyone happy. Everybody has their favorite Disney character and wether its Simba or Nemo, you'll find a cute litte doll, t-shirt, towel, or many other cool items relating to that character. Its lots of fun to browse around this shop.

23.description: love this store great customer service

31.description: It's the Disney Store.  Their job is to pimp all things Disney.This is what they do.This, however, is the Michigan Avenue Disney Store, not the Disney Store at Boongoggle Mall in Boongoggle, Illinois.  Retailers utilize real estate on Michigan Avenue to show their stuff - put their best foot forward.  They do the same thing on Fifth Ave. in New York and Rodeo Drive in Los Angeles.  Many a retailer has a flagship store on "Mich Ave".This is not a flagship store.With the exception of some Chicago-specific products, this is the same Disney Store you'll find in Boongoggle, Ill., or Yazoo, Neb., or Dimplefuque, N.M.  Same stuff - Mickey, Minnie, Goofy, crap from the latest blockbuster to come out of Disney Studios, a few items from popular Disney Channel programs - you get the idea.So if you're looking for the King of Disney Stores, don't make a special trip downtown.  The parking is atrocious and you'll not be amused.

34.description: made a little stop here during our christmas shopping. amazingly, things aren't as GROSSLY overpriced as i expected. there was a HUGE line, which was to be expected around the holidays. but, all in all, everything was well organized, the kids had a BLAST looking at and playing with anything they could get their hands on, and they had a lot of fun/cute stuff. i'm a huge disney fan, so it was a very enjoyable experience. nothing breathtaking, but definitely worth a stop!

16.description: Fun place to be! The employees are super nice! Just wish they had a bigger selection of the classical princess items. Frozen stuff has taken over (naturally).

11.description: Chicago style! Windy City Mickey Mouse hanging onto a lamppost T-shirt, and the never go out of style Little Mermaid beach towel! And did you know they carry full-size "Star Wars" action figures? All the employees are super-helpful and nice, by the way, they love working here. I didn't feel that at Michigan Ave's "Macy's." Last... So many stuffed animals to delight me. #tickled

39.description: I love the Disney Store!!  Walk in here and you will instantly go back to your childhood...Everytime I go in here I always feel like a kid in a candy store and I want to buy everything!

37.description: How can the Disney Store not have mouse ears?! I went there and they said that they ran out. Don't you think that they would have a ton of extra? It is the Disney Store after all. There is no Disney without Mickey....ears. I was very upset and no one knew when they were getting their next shipment in.

0.description: I love and very excite to come here and see a lot of cuit stuff !!!. I want to came back to be little again. I bought the mickey mouse. I love him and hug every night.

38.description: Talk about forcing parents to walk in with their lil's ones begging... " Mommy please can we go in just to see??" and 30 minutes later u walk out with 2 bags of useless toys that don't last because their cheaply made. Then again to see their cute lil smiles with those puppy cheeks and the puppy eyes my boys make( just melts me) is kinda worth it....SOMETIMES!! Thankfully I don't stroll down this store on Michigan ave to often (on purpose of course)!!

27.description: This place is simply magical. It makes me feel like a kid again when I walk in the door. My favorite part is the music playing. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. It is a bit crowded since it is right downtown but all in all I had a great time.

32.description: On vacation in Chicago, I dropped in here with my family because my sister wanted to see what they had to offer. Lets just say that I was not amused.First off, the selection was misleadingly limited. The store seems huge, but most of the space is taken up by racks containing the same product. Not to mention that, despite labeling itself as a toy store, there are very few toys and many more clothing products. Next, the employees were rude and unnecessarily curt. They hardly paid attention to me and I even slipped into the "Cast Members Only!" zone without them noticing. That's what I call an unattentive bunch!Finally, the men's bathroom was occupied by a couple of people playing a fantasy game of Beauty and the Beast, uncensored. I walked over, in desperate need of the facilities, only to hear a quiet but consistent banging coming from within the men's bathroom door, festively decorated with a picture of Mickey Mouse. I guess some people are into that...

13.description: Ah Yes.. Gone are the days of Lorelei hanging out in bars exceptfor when I am attending a Yelp Event..Now, I frequent places/stores like the Disney Store for entertainment..Yes.. I know.. kind of sad..Okay, so today I actually visited the Michigan Avenue Store withmy 4 year old Granddaughter Carissa in mind, and they had somuch that I know she would have loved!But then they had this really great sale going on where some itemswere up to 50% off and they had items that grown-ups would lovejust as well.They had some great t-shirts and sleep shirts with Winnie the Poohand Eeyore on them and god knows I love Eeyore for I identify withhis somewhat crabby/sarcastic nature!And I was looking for another stuffed Eeyore to add to my collectionI have about 10 right now in various sizes and colors.Hey.. a girl can never have enough Eeyores!But.. it was not meant to be for I could not find one!So.. I looked around at all the princess stuff.. geez.. there sure area lot of princesses over at the Disney Store.. but.. I have met a few whothink they are princesse'sin real life too.. Geez.. there's no escaping these damn princesse's!And the staff at this Disney Store is really a great bunch of people becausethey had to put up with me taking pictures and all those darn touriststaking pictures too!I actually did take some really great pictures!So.. I left the Disney Store without another Eeyore but saw somegreat stuff for my Granddaughter Carissa!Life is Good...

24.description: I like this Disney store but it usually is out of the toys I want. I guess since it's in a high traffic location it goes through inventory a lot faster. I just wish they would realize that and stock more than other stores. The staff is always nice and friendly.

7.description: Upon entering you are greeted by a cheerful cast member. You then walk into a space filled with many Disney things. I wish I was either still a little kid or thinner to fit in the girls clothes (I probably could if I wanted but it would look better on a 10 year old lol). The displays are awesome and very organized and tidy.I wish they still had the media center, with dvds and cds. I guess I'm old fashioned in my desire to own physical copies of things.Prices surprise me. As I recall, the Disney store use to be super pricey. It seems like over the years the prices have come down a bit and they have sales. Score! Also, inventory does change between my visits (which are about once a year).Definitely worth the time to stop in and see if they have anything fun. I wish they would have had more little trinkets such as small toys, key chains and magnets.

40.description: This store is an instant pick me up when you are having a bad day at work.  How can you not be happy when you are surrounded by Disney?  On weekends perhaps when it is filled with visiting tikes and their parents.  Stick to the Disney store during weekdays and endulge your inner Disney Princess.

30.description: This is just like every other Disney Store. It's in a main city and you can fid half of the things at other stores. It's a marked up, but it's a Store exclusively for Disney. Why did I go in here? I don't know....

1.description: First let me say this... I only stopped here because my fried does not have access to one.  It is a disney store like any other Disney store out there.  It is crammed with the House of Mouse merchandise and everything mauschwitz labeled. It really is Disney Personified. I did like the iconic Tink sculptures outside, but other than that.. it was overkill.

9.description: According to the cast members, this is the second largest Disney Store in the US, trailing only behind the massive one in Times Square. Impressive looking with the large marble pillars at the entrance, etched with Disney characters.They have own Chicago merchandise, such as t-shirts, reusable bags, picture frames, ornament, and plushes. No Vinylmation yet, to my disappointment, but they mentioned it may be coming soon. They also have a pretty decent stock of merchandise, but note that if you are buying clothing, they have no fitting room.Definitely one of my favorite Disney stores so far!

26.description: On our way to the Daly Center, my daughter spied this place from a mile away (probably literally)!  She was so excited to go in and pick out something special (what can I say?  My husband and I are softies for that little smile!)So she picked out the world's largest Cheshire cat on sale for $25 for the holidays!  Of course she would need something ginormous like that...But the man who checked us out was SO nice and really great with kids!  I was shocked!  He and my daughter had a lengthy conversation about food, Disney, and teeth (don't ask!!).  So I definitely was impressed with the customer service at this location :)

25.description: You can always find the best gifts for any age. Who does not love Disney items.

12.description: A great store from door to door!  A cast members greets you upon entry and wishes you a magical day as you head off to shop.  The boys and girls sections are nicely split with a mixed clearance section.  The checkout line is organized in the center to help keep things flowing.  I enjoyed the visit and found a couple great bargains!

21.description: Ah Yes.. Gone are the days of Lorelei hanging out in bars exceptfor when I am attending a Yelp Event..Now, I frequent places/stores like the Disney Store for entertainment..Yes.. I know.. kind of sad..Okay, so today I actually visited the Michigan Avenue Store withmy 4 year old Granddaughter Carissa in mind, and they had somuch that I know she would have loved!But then they had this really great sale going on where some itemswere up to 50% off and they had items that grown-ups would lovejust as well.They had some great t-shirts and sleep shirts with Winnie the Poohand Eeyore on them and god knows I love Eeyore for I identify withhis somewhat crabby/sarcastic nature!And I was looking for another stuffed Eeyore to add to my collectionI have about 10 right now in various sizes and colors.Hey.. a girl can never have enough Eeyores!But.. it was not meant to be for I could not find one!So.. I looked around at all the princess stuff.. geez.. there sure area lot of princesses over at the Disney Store.. but.. I have met a few whothink they are princesse'sin real life too.. Geez.. there's no escaping these damn princesse's!And the staff at this Disney Store is really a great bunch of people becausethey had to put up with me taking pictures and all those darn touriststaking pictures too!I actually did take some really great pictures!So.. I left the Disney Store without another Eeyore but saw somegreat stuff for my Granddaughter Carissa!Life is Good...

17.description: It's Disney!  Clean store, friendly castmembers and fun things to shop for.  Love the little movie theater.

10.description: I like  it All in the store our favorite Disney caracters my favorite now is Olaf I like  the clearance seccion too And the staff are friendly

5.description: Great location right on Michigan Ave. Lots of current and popular selections. Unique Chicago imprinted souvenirs. Prices the same as other stores nationwide.

35.description: This is beautiful Disney Store just a couple of blocks south of Water Tower Place.  I miss this "classic" style of Disney Stores.  They all used to look similar to this one, but now they started stripping out the magic (like the fiberglass character displays) from the stores.Also, this particular store carries exclusive Chicago Disney Store items.  The ones in the suburbs do not have this line of merchandise.

19.description: How could I not love going into the Disney Store for a quick spin around? Sure, they have some things for the tourists, and that's fine. The new "City" line that includes Chicago has great merchandise. Whether it's popping in for a quick Disney fix or looking for that special something, this is one store on Michigan Avenue that brings a smile to your face, no matter what your age.

28.description: How could I not love going into the Disney Store for a quick spin around? Sure, they have some things for the tourists, and that's fine. The new "City" line that includes Chicago has great merchandise. Whether it's popping in for a quick Disney fix or looking for that special something, this is one store on Michigan Avenue that brings a smile to your face, no matter what your age.

3.description: I love this store at the holidays!  They have a lot of product to choose from and the sales draw me in every time.  This is a busy location right on the mile with register lines that are very lengthy, but they move the line fairly quickly.  I enjoy the holiday Mickey and Minnie dolls they have every year.

33.description: Besides making my niece and nephew feel good, I shop here to make myself feel good. And how does that work?Christmas 2010. My sister emails me a list of the babies' wants, and I go fetch the fun. The #1 on Madelyn's list was a frothy princess dress number from the "Tangled" movie. I stopped in this location first but they were out of her size. Drats! I put on my superstar auntie hat and drove the 28 miles to Schaumburg. Result: Correct size is found! My niece wouldn't wear anything else for weeks; and overnight, I become St. Jelena. I like this a lot, not gonna lie.A few days ago, I stopped in with my sister and her husband as my nephew's 2nd birthday is approaching. We found adorable pajamas, more Madelyn-approved wants from the "Tangled" flick, and even a fake cell phone that just might fool her little brother. Even though this location is almost always teeming with parents and their tantrum-prone tots, the staffers somehow maintain a smile and move quickly so your ear drums don't take a major hit. I'll be back for as long as the kids are into Disney (hey, I'll take Disney characters over Barney any day!).

43.description: This place is like a cartoon in real life. Any kid, or even adult for that matter, would love this place. It is full of dolls, clothes and toys, from all of your favorite Disney movies.

2.description: This Disney Store isn't very different from any other version, except that it's on the Mag Mile. It looks massive when you walk in, but it's deceptive. Most of the space is taken up by racks of clothes, both for every day and for costuming. I was really surprised at the lack of toys and stuffed animals. I remember there being a jewelry display for adults last time I was there, but when we visited this time it was gone.On the bright side, when we visited they were having a sale, where you buy one plushie and get one for $1. We found an adorable Tramp, from Lady and the Tramp, but were pretty bummed when there was no Lady in sight. I settled for Treasure, the ONLY Palace Pets stuffed animal that they had in the joint. We mentioned in passing that we would have liked to have Lady. The very nice woman behind the register told us that Lady was at the State Street store, and in fact ALL of their coupled characters are split up that way. She told us point blank how stupid it was, but I appreciated that she took the time to tell us.We weren't going to waste effort or money going to the other store to spend more to get a matching set. Shady, shady Disney.

18.description: This is beautiful Disney Store just a couple of blocks south of Water Tower Place.  I miss this "classic" style of Disney Stores.  They all used to look similar to this one, but now they started stripping out the magic (like the fiberglass character displays) from the stores.Also, this particular store carries exclusive Chicago Disney Store items.  The ones in the suburbs do not have this line of merchandise.

41.description: anything you want for any little kid in your life you can find here.. they've got everything disney from life size outfits to the smallest of expandable towels or magnets.  they also always have really good sales.. be careful though because it closes early

4.description: I was walking down the street and eeked "yay, Disney" to myself. I am a big Disney movie fan. They have items related to the classics and the newer movies. As you would expect, most items are targeted towards kids. However, I did see a few things that I would enjoy in my collection and items that my guy would perhaps like. If I had a kid, I woulda been in BIG trouble shopping there. But, in the end, I resisted temptation and left with nothing.

6.description: Thank you Disney Store for not having annoying music blasting like the other Disney stores :)  This store is a bit smaller than the other ones I've been to, but the staff is friendly, the selection is good, and there were some great sales going on.  My son picked out a R2D2 lunchbox that was on sale for $10, and a furry Chewbacca bookbag that was on sale for $15.  Well worth it!

22.description: Every city has a Disney store, but my friend Melanie insisted I come here to check out the store. It's your typical Disney store with the exception of the massively large guard roaming the store. Seems like they have a shrinkage problem (if you ever worked retail you know what the means). The one cool thing about this particular Disney store is that they sell Chicago branded apparel and accessories. I'm not sure if they do that in other cities (they don't in Los Angeles), but that would be a pretty cool thing to do. I grabbed a couple of shirts with the Chicago skyline. Aside from the the specially branded stuff, there isn't really anything special about this store aside from it being on the Magnificent mile.

15.description: My tween relative just handed me a padded muscle suit of The Hulk.No joke. In my size. Meanwhile a cartoon involving a little-animated-princess singing and shopping in a forest for shoes and ballgowns plays on a big screen in the background.Hilarious and by that meaning I want to escape.

20.description: Monster University dolls for grand kids so they can hug them during the movie.

8.description: absolutely love this store...they made store design really fun and kids friendly. They have several buttons to push through out the store like buttons for train to tell you next stop is disney store, button for toy factory to move,,etc Kids really love it.They carry fun Chicago theme stuff like mickey with chicago hotdog and hat, wind city T-shirt.They also have daily event for kids. so check with store manager which event they have for that day.

14.description: HAPPIEST STOREI really love the Disney Store...I may even love it more then my little one. This store has changed over the years. There was a time when everything in here was really expensive. Now they actually run sales and offer discounts for buying multiple stuffed animals. I guess the economy isn't that great if Disney is offering discounts. Okay enough about how far this store is going to set you back economically. Let's talk about the fun factor. This is the Happiest Store on Michigan Avenue. It's like going to Disney World without any of the traveling. All of the classics are here: Mickey, Minnie, Pluto, Donald & Goofy but so are all of the new characters. In fact, Disney is a marketing genius. They even have the toys for movies that are about to be released. That's brilliant to start selling the toy prior to the movie release. Disney fans are nuts and they'll buy anything. Not only does this store carry all of the Disney toys but they also carry clothes.  There are princess dresses for the girls and pirate, cowboy & space ranger costumes for the boys. Yes your little one can dress up like there favorite character. There are also t-shirts for both the kids and adults. I always like to check these out because sometimes there are some real cool ones for me. The staff here is amazing. They are so happy. Yeah Disney has that effect on people. The staff then passes that happiness on to you the customer. It's a win-win for everyone. So next time you are feeling down, then plan a trip here and you'll be happy in no time at all. Just keep your fingers crossed they don't play the song "It's a Small World After All" that will ruin anyone's day! Ha!

58.description: I was here with a group of five other people for the unlimited appetizers deal, which is, obviously, an incredible amount of food for $10, especially because we shared all of our appetizers and got three rounds of each. In case you have less than six people, here are the things we got, in order of how much I liked them: 1. Loaded potato skins. Always the loaded potato skins, which I crave when I can't get, and which I have resorted to buying frozen from Costco in desperate times. These were crunchy, with generous amounts of cheese and an acceptable, if not as generous, sprinkling of fresh bacon. Definitely the favorite dish we got. 2. Bruschetta. One of the things we were on the fence about ordering, but it ended up being a fantastic choice (for those of us who liked tomatoes... so not me). It was the perfect blend of sweet and salty, and really refreshing, especially against the other, heavier things we ordered. 3. Mozzarella sticks. Arrived at the table at the perfect temperature - almost nothing more disgusting than lukewarm mozzarella sticks - and the perfect proportions of coating to cheese. 4. Boneless buffalo wings. I'm not a fan of boneless buffalo wings in general, but these were particularly one-dimensional and featured a very, very thick coating of batter with a small piece of meat. 5. Potstickers. Generic, definitely not something we would have ordered if we had had fewer people. The sauce was the only part of this appetizer that was interesting or different. Would not recommend. 6. Spinach dip. Definitely not worth ordering, it's a huge portion of spinach dip paired with a small serving of chips. The dip was bland and insufficiently creamy, with a weird, buttery aftertaste. Would not recommend. We also ordered a short glass of Angry Orchard and one of 312, both on tap. Our waitress initially brought us two glasses of Angry Orchard, but she was quick to correct her mistake once we pointed it out. Service overall, however, was lacking.
