I understand that, since the bill was so small, she wasn't anticipating much of a tip, but she dropped by our table to check on us only once, mumbling something that only one person heard, and we  only saw her three times more - twice when she asked if we wanted more food (yes), and once when we asked her for the check. Our food was brought out by other people, and she never actually brought us our check. At least ten minutes after we asked, another girl saw us waiting, asked if we needed our check, and brought it to us within minutes. I'm going to give this experience three stars because service was pretty much nonexistent and because of the wait times, which were far too long considering there weren't that many people in the restaurant. This deal, however, is definitely worth going in for - and it ends August 24!

56.description: I absolutely love this restaurant. My boyfriend took me for the first time and I loved it! The food was excellent and the customer service is great. They constantly check on you to see if everything is okay. My favorite dish so far is the Jackdaniels chicken with any two sides! Considering that it was Friday it was super busy and the wait wasn't actually bad. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a nice dinner!

29.description: Terrible bar experience! Watered down drinks downtown? Lost appetite, cancelled order and left. Wow  wish I could have given zero stars. Oh and get an arm for the valet parking you'll make money. Just not my money anymore.

42.description: I love this place. Their drink specials are great and cheap $3 mojito's long islands, martini's, margarita's on selected night. I always get the jack daniels sampler for just 13$ you get jack chicken, shrimp & half rack ribs.

23.description: I would NEVER  eat at this nasty discussing dump again!!!!! Service stunk!!! Food was soooooo nasty had to give it back!!!!! If I was a starving Ethiopian and they were giving away free meals I would avoid them like the plague and eat rocks!!!!!!!!

47.description: Somehow, This TGI Fridays has somewhat devolved. Yes, They still have some pretty decent memorabilia on the walls. But as for the music. It is very unintelligible, And IMO.....Rather inane indie. Not the music that SHOULD be in tune with the franchise, The more older music. The service too was rather substandard. Yet the food wasn't exactly that bad.

8.description: I personally like TGIF, but this location was one of the worst services ever! This is located right off Michigan ave. I would expect them to have the best service ever! My friend and I went here for lunch on her lunch break. It took 30 mins for us to get out beers and water. REALLY!! And the food took another 45 mins to come out,.No one seem to have answers to any of our questions.  I was not impressed!  Please train your employees and work on customer service!

31.description: The food was great but the service was terrible!!!! The waitresses like to take away our food before we finished. Worst TGIF ever

34.description: Late night around 10:30 on a Saturday night. Place was not that busy. Walked in and there was a line because the hostess with an attitude was explaining to a couple first of all that they needed I.d. and  couldn't sit upstairs because they had a kid. I understand policy but never am able to accept attitude, rudeness in a customer service business. Next comes our turn...table for 3 possibly in the 3 empty booths in front of us. Sorry have to wait because server cannot handle more than one table in that section!? Get seated at table, server Sarahson who obviously could care less about wether we have an enjoyable experience takes our order. The plates then proceed to come out at different times from entree first to appetizer(dried up old potato skins) to my entree and then proceed to wait for the third entree which takes forever. At this point we cancel the third order, which our server could care less once more. I tell the rest of my party to head home because obviously at this point she was taking forever to bring my check. Never one apology! Ask who the manager is... She gives the name but per restaurant policy is not able to write it down, I need to walk outside the restaurant and write it down myself. I have been a neighbor and patron of this TGI for over 10+ years. Their service and quality of food has dropped exponentially over the years. How these businesses with subpar service and food continue to stay in business continues to baffle me, but I guess we support the behavior.I gave 1 star for the fact that this evening was the first time in my history that I did not give a tip of some sort. For that reason TGI should be given some recognition for that historic event.Needless to say I will not support our frequent this chain one more time!

16.description: In one word....HORRIBLE!  The food was gross, the service was horrible and slow and the bartender took so long with drinks we left without even getting them and so did other tables.We ate our dried out potato skins and another gross appetizer and still didnt have a drink. Will not go back with so many wonderful places around there to eat and drink.

13.description: Tried to eat here there was a 25 min wait and we could literally see over 10 tables that were empty but needed tone cleaned. Staff was moving slowly and didn't seem to care.

11.description: The food was delicious but I have been to TGI Fridays several times and have never received this terrible of service. Not only have I had to show my ID 3 times for two drinks but I have had to wait over 10 minutes for a server to approach me so I could order. Further more the restaurant was completely dead. I was told our server wouldn't be back but then he apparently turned into the bus boy and our finished drink dishes never got cleaned up which barely gave me any room to eat my food. Never coming back. In addition their valets seemed to be getting high and we smoking cigarettes directly in front of the entrance. As a non-smoker, who is highly against smoking cigarettes I was extremely disappointed that the first thing I smelled was burning chemicals and tobacco and not food.

39.description: This Thursday night my boyfriend and I wanted to go out to dinner. We looked up places thinking we might try some place new but decided on TGI Fridays because we knew it would be good.That being said... We had a great experience! We got seated and then asked to move to the bar to watch the bulls game and the host was so nice and she gave awesome recommendations. Our server Augusto was so great. He gave drink recommendations and was just so pleasant. I'm a server so I think I pay extra close attention to the people who are my servers and he was just great!!! We had the spinach flatbread and garlic parm buffalo wings for an appetizer (1/2 price apps if you sit in the bar area). Both were great. Then we both got the ribeye with lobster tail and it was all delicious! So much food omg! We got the broccoli and the mashed potatoes for our sides. Get the mashed potatoes!!! You'll thank me. I don't even like mashed potatoes and these were awesome. For dessert we had the Oreo madness. So good!For drinks my boyfriend got a house Long Island iced tea and then a blackberry Long Island. I had the berry mojito (SOOO GOOD!!!) and the Barbados rum punch. That was good but I wanted something a little stronger. It took a while for us to get our drinks but whatever that can't be avoided sometimes. Everything was soooo good! Sometimes I feel like it can be a hit or a miss with chain restaurants. They tend to be very mediocre. Our experience tonight was just awesome. Oh I had left my wallet and Augusto ran out to our car to give it to me. I thought that was sooooo nice since I had no idea. He's awesome I think we'd come back just for him. And the drinks!

37.description: Typical chain restaurant casual fast food dining and drinks. In my opinion, the Tostada Nachos, Spinach Dip and Pot Stickers are the best appetizers on the menu. Definitely skip the green beans, which are garbage! I wish Fridays would bring back the steak hibachi skewers, which were delicious!For my entree, I usually get the Sizzlin Chicken & Spinach or the Jack Daniels Ribeye, which is always good.I prefer this location over Oak Park because the customer service and management at the Oak Park location is absolutely awful!The head hostess at this Chicago location, I believe her name is Angela, is ALWAYS very welcoming and accommodating. THE BEST server here is Mireya! She is ALWAYS professional, attentive and friendly and the reason why I return when I'm in the area. FYI...Sign up for their Give Me More Stripes program and get rewarded for food/drink and to receive special offers/coupons.

0.description: Really good food!!! I recommend this restaurant, specially for lunch!!!Recomendado!!! Voltaremos em breve!!!

38.description: I was a fan of TGI Friday's, up until yesterday!  My co-workers and I have been going to this location for years as it is right across the street from the office.  We arrived yesterday at 1:00.  It was not crowded.  We reminded our server that as employees of the hospital, we receive an employee discount (10%).  He said he was unaware of this and went to ask the manager.  When he returned he stated that we could only get the discount on items that are not already discounted, so not on the lunch special we were all ordering.  This was new, we have always gotten the discount in the past.  Fine, it's only 10%, moving on.  Next, the food took 40 minutes to come out.  Keep in mind we are on our lunch hour.  There were 4 of us and my food did not come out with the others.  And the best part was that we all ordered the 1/2 sandwich salad combo.  I ordered the exact same thing my co-worker ordered so the sandwich would have just been cut in half to split between us?!  He said, "Oh they are still working on yours so I brought your salad out."  I ordered ranch dressing, it came with blue cheese.  And it took another 10 minutes for me to get my half sandwich.  That's 50 minutes.  Back to the other gals orders, the lunch special has the option of a garden salad or a Ceasar salad.  They opted for the Ceasar Salad.  When it came out, it was basically a garden salad, with tomatoes, radichio and romaine, with a few sprigs of parmesan cheese and vinegar and oil dressing.  This is NOT a Ceasar salad.  When they questioned it he said, "Yes, that's our Cesar salad, I know it's weird."  Also of note, the "au jus" for our French Dip sandwich was the French Onion Soup that was one of the soup options.  Good thing we all liked onions :)   When the bill came, no efforts at all to remove anything, comp dessert, NOTHING...except excuses from the server on why it was not his fault that our experience was bad. On my receipt it showed a "rush" order on my food.  That tells me that the server forgot to put it in at the time of the rest of the order.  It's a shame Friday's, we been faithful customers for years but we will definitely be taking our business elsewhere and letting others now how you've gone downhill.

51.description: I like Fridays and I understand people being busy, but with that being said. All we came here for was drinks. We waited over 10 minutes to have someone come to the table and another 13 minutes just to get 4 drinks. We almost left right before he came out so instead of leaving we stayed. When he dropped off the drinks we decided to order another round right then so by the time we were finished we would have another round without waiting.

27.description: Went there on Saturday for early dinner, around 5. Place was not too busy, but there was a line by the door due to the hostess taking forever seating everyone. Waited for at least 15 minutes for the hostess to come back from some place, people were just standing around in the front area, not sure how they know who was the next in line. Very confusing, they need to stream line the front area. Dinner was ok. They would not take any of my coupons, which was the main reason for going there. Left my son's hat there, tried to call after leaving the restaurant, was put on hold for 20 minutes, end up hanging up. Never going there again, the food was ok

32.description: My wife and I dined here last night after shopping. We had been here once before in the past and it wasn't too good of an experience. We decided to give it a try again and were served by a young man named Kyle. The service was absolutely outstanding.  Kyle was probably the most attentive server we have ever had.  He made sure we never had to wait for anything ( with the exception of the food taking a bit too long from the kitchen). Although he was a bit busy he still made sure to personalize our experience and made is truly feel like we were at home. My wife got a burger that Kyle recommended and I got a Cajun Alfredo pasta. Although the wait for the food was quite long, it was well worth the wait! We really enjoyed both of our meals and the service that was provided.  They had great specials on drinks and appetizers that both the hostess and our server made sure we knew about.  We will be returning next time we are in the area and will let our friends know of our experience. Thank you Fridays!

54.description: It's been 16 minutes and still no drink (water) or silverware on my table. How long is it acceptance to have no beverage keeping in mind it's water?

48.description: Such bad service. Was charged double for advertised half off beer. Extremely slow and unknowable service. Disrespectful and had to argue with a manager who had no idea what she was talking about. Never coming back again. Ever. Never have I had to sit so long to wait on a check either. Do yourself a favor and not come here.

44.description: Omg i will never come back here again.... my experience  was absolute  bullshit from the time my brother and i walked in the door until we left... we asked and indicated that we'll  wait for a booth the greeter said it would  be at least 40 min but as we were walking to our table we saw at least 4 open booths. So we asked to sit in one of them. Then i asked for the SAME EXACT thing i got the last time I was there (5 days ago) and i was told there was no such thing. So i ordered something else with the exclusion of some things.. then 20 min later the waitress comes back to tell me i couldnt get it the way i asked. 20 damn minutes!!!!! Took her about 5 min to ask if i wanted something else... at this point I'm over it... not to even mention that we didn't get silverware until 45 min into being there...i mean our waitress was a mess. It took the manager to come over to try to fix it...All in all, we will never be back like ever.. we made it clear as we got up from the table..All the servers greeters etc act as if they don't want to work and don't  care about their customer service or lacl there of...I was  so shocked. And my brother normally tries to see the good  in everything  but  he complained  and made it clear  that he won't be back..

24.description: So my family and I went here at around 12. After getting a table we had to wait about 15 minutes until a waitress even saw us to order drinks and it took another 30 minutes to even get them. I ordered the loaded potato skins and the potatoes were hard and the cheese was like rubber. If I could give 0 stars, I would. I would never eat here again even if I was paid to.

7.description: This by far is the WORST TGI Friday's ever!!!! The service is horrible and has been getting worse over the years. I, personally, do not enjoy this particular restaurant; but I will attend maybe once every other year if a close friend insists. On February 25, 2016 (around 9pm), however, my father was extremely excited to spend his birthday evening here with his family. Worst birthday experience thus far. From the moment we stepped in the door , we were not impressed as the host just leaned on the wall barely greeting us. Then we had the privilege to sit at a booth next to a dirty table, that hadn't even attempted to be cleaned until my father spoke up on it 45 minutes into our dining time. Even then, it was only partially picked up with more to come its way later on. Unfortunately, for us there was only one waitress in our entire section and she wasn't particularly ecstatic about serving. To try and shorten what could go on for lengths, my father spoke with the manager about his dissatisfaction which continued with long waits for food, lack of service alertness, incorrect orders, unclean restrooms and dining area, and not so great meals. After being asked to be spoken with a second time, the manager never showed her face and did not even attempt to provide concern for such grievances. To top things off, my sister and I each had one of the chicken selections, and I can't help but to think that our aching stomachs are a result of the food. This is by far a horrible restaurant in its chain and should be shut down, especially, since it is located in downtown Chicago. It gives our city a bad look. I plan to contact the corporate office about this place.-0 stars if possible

49.description: I personally like TGIF, but this location was one of the worst services ever! This is located right off Michigan ave. I would expect them to have the best service ever! My friend and I went here for lunch on her lunch break. It took 30 mins for us to get out beers and water. REALLY!! And the food took another 45 mins to come out,.No one seem to have answers to any of our questions.  I was not impressed!  Please train your employees and work on customer service!

40.description: I had the best steak ever here, and the spinach was amazing.  The steak rivaled any high end steak place in Chicago, which is saying something.  $11.90 for 6 oz sirloin and 2 sides.  The spinach has mushrooms and onions, which I've never had together before.  Perfect with the steak.  The jasmine rice was excellent.  The steak had no fat, cooked perfectly, juicy, thick.  They have 10 oz also.I also had the bacon mac & cheese bites, which I would not get again.  I asked the waiter if the bacon was mixed in with the mac & cheese and he said it was, but that is not the case--he must have misunderstood the question.  They are fried mac & cheese balls with a piece of bacon on top.  4 to an order.  Not worth the calories.  OK to share with 2-4 people, but I was by myself.  Service was great, steak cooked to order.  If you're in the mood for a steak dinner in a casual atmosphere at a reasonable price, check out TGI Friday's in Streeterville!

53.description: I really didn't want to give any stars, but seeing as it won't accept your review without a star... The service here is awful! The staff consist of young, immature, and very unprofessional waiters and waitresses. One of the guys was wearing a do-rag, I could hear their personal conversations around me; This was just overall the my worst experience there. I've dined there the past 10yrs and never has service been so bad.  My waitress did not check up on me nor did she offer me dessert like she did the customers behind me (who happened to be caucasian). Once I finally got some attention and paid for my meal, I placed an order to go. They completely got my order wrong! I traveled by public transportation so I couldn't just go back.  I called the restaurant to speak with a manager and it took three phone calls before I spoke with one. The excuses I kept receiving is it's really busy and the manager can't come to the phone. I was JUST there and it definitely wasn't busy. This manager, some guy named "Johnny" (I doubt that's his real name) did not pay close attention to my complaint and kind of brushed off my concern, but he offered a $8 appetizer gift card. My issue with "Johnny" is he wouldn't give his last name. He ignored me each time I asked, yet wanted me to give him all of my information. I refused to give anymore information until he gave his full name. I gave mine. There was no resolve.I warn anyone thinking of eating here: DO NOT COME!! You will regret it.

30.description: Very bad service and the food is just as bad.  we went for father's day and never again.  I don't recommend anyone going there.

46.description: Horrible service and management by manager Johnny. Steer clear of server Moses. Visited on December 6 with four friends for lunch. We traveled from Hyde Park to near north side, just for TGIFriday's. Our server Moses was terrible. He rarely came to our table which made a lunch, that should've been closer to an hour, stretch into three hours-mostly waiting for him to take our order. We sat dow at 3p and couldn't leave until 6:15p. We also had to track him down for the bill. Service: Moses would never come to our table, rather he would come in the vacinity and we had to actually call him over by name. Again, it was five of us. Moses never explained the endless appetizer deal that wasn't on the menu when we asked about it. A friend at the table, who knew what the deal was, had to do his job and help the rest of us. Once we ordered, Moses only gave us three plates for our appetizers and never brought us napkins the entire time and never brought the rest of our plates. Two of use had to eat using the appetizer dishes.Also he only came to remove appetizer dishes once. So we had to start putting our empty drink glasses, empty appetizer plates on an empty table as he would bring a few more items on the half hour. We didn't have any more room at the table.My friend's were never able to get a refill on their pop in the entire three hours.I do not eat pork and would get sick if I did. I mentioned that I didn't eat pork when I was ordering my appetizer so he could tell me which ones had pork. I came to enjoy a Jack Daniels burger with no bacon/onion, an appetizer, and a dessert. An hour after ordering, he shows up with a dbl cheese burger full of bacon and proceeds to argue that I ordered this bacon burger and tried to shove it in my face because he didn't want to admit he was wrong. Who does that? He took no responsibility, gave no apology, and his customer service skills were offensive. I unfortunately, had to cancel my order because I didn't have another hour to wait for him to get it wrong again and our friend's valet time was expiring after dealing with this nonsense. I spoke to manager, Johnny, who didn't introduce himself nor wear a nametag. We had to get his name from another employee. I informed him of how our service was not good and how I came to enjoy a JD burger and had a bacon burger shoved in my face and the server tell me it would be a "long time" before I get my correct order. The manager did not take responsibility nor ownership of his server's poor service, and gave no apology. All he said was, "I don't think I can get your order out to you faster." I canceled my order and didn't order anything else. I expect better from TGI Friday's, especially since the manager claimed the Erie St location as the flagship. During our visit we also had to deal with gnats flying around. The "loaded" potato wedges were anything but and they looked and tasted like the restaurant ran out of the appropriate cheese and they substituted with an Aldi brand spray cheese. Never dine here.

1.description: As a chain it's typically good.   This location needs major improvements in the customer service department.Bartender was rude, made a crappy drink and basically ignored me the entire meal.The sandwich was poorly made.   one half had zero meat.   The other had all the meat falling out because it was over stuffed.   I left and no one acknowledged I was even there.Won't be going back

55.description: Pay $10 for selected endless appetizers! Service from Tanesha was fabulous, and we ate 3 plates of baked potato skins, 2 plates of mozerella sticks, and 4 plates of boneless wings. Loved the location too.

9.description: I'm a vegetarian but the waiter said I could take out the shrimp and chicken from the Cajun pasta, the pasta was very creamy but I still found two pieces of chicken inside, not sure why. I liked the pasta though, the spiciness was perfect! I also asked for avocado on top of the pasta and they did it. As for my friend she ordered s combo with grilled ribs. Apparently it was a bit over grilled and tasted bitter due to the burnt parts.

26.description: Food was ok....not hot for the amount of time we waited, but just ok. Out of 5 meals 1 was correct the way it was ordered.  Other than the food issues, our server Constance was an absolute delight. She was very courteous and worked hard to ensure we were satisfied.  Will probably return if in the area and wanting something familiar.

25.description: Stopped in here for pick up the other night, per usual. One of the shorter female waitresses, literally was cussing at the hostess in front of many customers. Complaining about how many tables she had, saying all of this is "irritatin!" Asking if she was the only server on the floor etc. So unprofessional, I was actually appaled that she had the nerve to act that way in front of customers. Food is always good though, I guess that's what matters to me since I never eat in the actual restrauant.

12.description: This Thursday night my boyfriend and I wanted to go out to dinner. We looked up places thinking we might try some place new but decided on TGI Fridays because we knew it would be good.That being said... We had a great experience! We got seated and then asked to move to the bar to watch the bulls game and the host was so nice and she gave awesome recommendations. Our server Augusto was so great. He gave drink recommendations and was just so pleasant. I'm a server so I think I pay extra close attention to the people who are my servers and he was just great!!! We had the spinach flatbread and garlic parm buffalo wings for an appetizer (1/2 price apps if you sit in the bar area). Both were great. Then we both got the ribeye with lobster tail and it was all delicious! So much food omg! We got the broccoli and the mashed potatoes for our sides. Get the mashed potatoes!!! You'll thank me. I don't even like mashed potatoes and these were awesome. For dessert we had the Oreo madness. So good!For drinks my boyfriend got a house Long Island iced tea and then a blackberry Long Island. I had the berry mojito (SOOO GOOD!!!) and the Barbados rum punch. That was good but I wanted something a little stronger. It took a while for us to get our drinks but whatever that can't be avoided sometimes. Everything was soooo good! Sometimes I feel like it can be a hit or a miss with chain restaurants. They tend to be very mediocre. Our experience tonight was just awesome. Oh I had left my wallet and Augusto ran out to our car to give it to me. I thought that was sooooo nice since I had no idea. He's awesome I think we'd come back just for him. And the drinks!

59.description: Watched Germany trash Brazil.  Endless appetizer interesting draw.Its great if you like the appetizers that they chose.  I decided against the boneless wings and had the traditional which was perfect and a nice portion.Lots of screens to watch the games.Service was 4-5 stars

21.description: In one word....HORRIBLE!  The food was gross, the service was horrible and slow and the bartender took so long with drinks we left without even getting them and so did other tables.We ate our dried out potato skins and another gross appetizer and still didnt have a drink. Will not go back with so many wonderful places around there to eat and drink.

17.description: Horrible service and management by manager Johnny. Steer clear of server Moses. Visited on December 6 with four friends for lunch. We traveled from Hyde Park to near north side, just for TGIFriday's. Our server Moses was terrible. He rarely came to our table which made a lunch, that should've been closer to an hour, stretch into three hours-mostly waiting for him to take our order. We sat dow at 3p and couldn't leave until 6:15p. We also had to track him down for the bill. Service: Moses would never come to our table, rather he would come in the vacinity and we had to actually call him over by name. Again, it was five of us. Moses never explained the endless appetizer deal that wasn't on the menu when we asked about it. A friend at the table, who knew what the deal was, had to do his job and help the rest of us. Once we ordered, Moses only gave us three plates for our appetizers and never brought us napkins the entire time and never brought the rest of our plates. Two of use had to eat using the appetizer dishes.Also he only came to remove appetizer dishes once. So we had to start putting our empty drink glasses, empty appetizer plates on an empty table as he would bring a few more items on the half hour. We didn't have any more room at the table.My friend's were never able to get a refill on their pop in the entire three hours.I do not eat pork and would get sick if I did. I unfortunately, had to cancel my order because I didn't have another hour to wait for him to get it wrong again and our friend's valet time was expiring after dealing with this nonsense. I spoke to manager, Johnny, who didn't introduce himself nor wear a nametag. We had to get his name from another employee. I canceled my order and didn't order anything else. I expect better from TGI Friday's, especially since the manager claimed the Erie St location as the flagship. During our visit we also had to deal with gnats flying around. The "loaded" potato wedges were anything but and they looked and tasted like the restaurant ran out of the appropriate cheese and they substituted with an Aldi brand spray cheese. Never dine here.

10.description: Typical chain restaurant casual fast food dining and drinks. In my opinion, the Tostada Nachos, Spinach Dip and Pot Stickers are the best appetizers on the menu. Definitely skip the green beans, which are garbage! I wish Fridays would bring back the steak hibachi skewers, which were delicious!For my entree, I usually get the Sizzlin Chicken & Spinach or the Jack Daniels Ribeye, which is always good.I prefer this location over Oak Park because the customer service and management at the Oak Park location is absolutely awful!The head hostess at this Chicago location, I believe her name is Angela, is ALWAYS very welcoming and accommodating. THE BEST server here is Mireya! She is ALWAYS professional, attentive and friendly and the reason why I return when I'm in the area. FYI...Sign up for their Give Me More Stripes program and get rewarded for food/drink and to receive special offers/coupons.

5.description: Generally, TGIFridays is an ok place with fun servers. However, this location dropped the ball on customer service and based on all the other reviews, looks like I'm not alone in thinking that the service is terrible. First, we had to wait over 5 minutes upon arriving before anyone even said a word to us, meanwhile 4 servers walked right past us, no smiles or saying hi. Then our server, Robertin, was very rude. The service was so unacceptable, will not be going back to that location.

3.description: The service was very slow.  The check in texting service was nice and let us walk around while we waited for an available table.  Once at our table, it was 15min until my one took our drink and food order and another 30 min for the food to arrive. The food is typical.  Good but not great but a nice value.  My steak was prepared to order. A side was missed and it took so long we ignored it.  If you are in a rush. It does the job.

35.description: The staff were lovely but the food was awful.  Greasy and tasteless. I had a burger and my friend had a salad both were awful

19.description: The staff were lovely but the food was awful.  Greasy and tasteless. I had a burger and my friend had a salad both were awful

28.description: As a chain I like TGIF, but this particular location needs improvement. Seemed under-staffed on a weekend night. One plate was dirty (out of the dishwasher). The burger was assembled poorly. The Chicken & Shrimp was fine. Portion size is good. Water arrived half way through the meal. The final check was incorrect and had to be re-done. The waiter was polite and patient.

45.description: Stopped by for lunch with my mom while on Michigan Ave.  The food was blegh, definitely not as good as I remember at a Friday's.  The service was good, but almost over-attentive, if that's possible.  The restaurant is a Friday's so full of SWAG and knick knacks on the wall.  The prices were in line with all the Friday's, but the food was just not cooked well.  I had an appetizer trio and my dumplings looked and tasted uncooked.  The boneless buffalo wings were dry and the seasoning wasn't good.  And the cheesesticks were a little light on the cheese and overcooked.  Generally, just not a good experience.  Go somewhere else.

33.description: Really great food (salmon with lobster and tomato salad and broccoli ...yum!!!  ) she Never came back to fill our water or coffee but the food came out quick , was good and she was very very friendly .   If we really wanted it bad and we needed drinks , I guess we would have asked for it hough

43.description: This location is lucky it is getting one star. It is because the bartender was wonderful. I do not remember her name, I am sorry. The problem with this location is everything else. Management is lousy and the food is even worse. I ordered a pecan crusted chicken salad with grilled chicken instead and the chicken was burnt and tough. There were supposed to be cranberries in this salad; there were 5 at most. This salad consisted mostly of lettuce chopped to a killing. Steer clear of this place. I hate saying that...but, I do.

2.description: Do not go to this location!! Service was horrible and on top of that the valet service failed to lock my doors so my shoes got stolen and items in my car were misplaced. DO NOT VALET.

18.description: Stopped in here for pick up the other night, per usual. One of the shorter female waitresses, literally was cussing at the hostess in front of many customers. Complaining about how many tables she had, saying all of this is "irritatin!" Asking if she was the only server on the floor etc. So unprofessional, I was actually appaled that she had the nerve to act that way in front of customers. Food is always good though, I guess that's what matters to me since I never eat in the actual restrauant.

41.description: Great place to hang for late nights.. the only place that's open when I get off work and the good is good, service could be better but all around really like this place

52.description: I just got out from there . It was one of the worse experiences ever . really poor service  . slow waitress.

50.description: Don't normally take the time to complain but this was the last straw. My coworkers and I have been going here just about every week for the past few months because it is steps away from work and the lunch special. We only have a 45 minute lunch break so the location is very convenient. Over time we got used to the slow service and just dealt with it and were usually late getting back because we could not be served and eat in 40 minutes apparently. We would mostly order soup and salad, rarely entrees because of time constraints, and always sat at or by the bar. This particular time it was taking more time than usual to get our food after we ordered a little bit before 12:30. Lunch break ends at 1:00. We started paying our bill around 12:55 because we were trying to save time after we ate and not have to worry about it. Some people got to pay, some people didn't because the bartender walked away. At 1:00 we had to tell the kitchen staff, the bartender wasn't at the bar, to please just box up our food to go because we're already late. This was 5 lunch special orders, mix of soups and salads and 1 chicken tenders. This is Friday's, I don't think the chefs were growing their own lettuce back there or making the soup of the day specially for individuals. The place was not busy at all. It appeared that there was about one employee per every two customers there. People that sat at the bar after us received their food before us. At 1:05, the bartender gave us 2 large bags with our to go food, apologized to us, and we left. We were shocked that the manager didn't apologize, we were not offered anything, and since we all had already paid to save time there was no discount.When we all got back to the office to pass out our food, of course the chicken tenders were missing and a salad was missing. I called the manager and explained the situation and he kept referring to our pick up order. No, this was dine in. He proceeded to tell me that he has my food ready for pick up.  He refused to send somebody over to drop it off after I asked. I had to leave work again to pick it up, no apology, nothing. He just handed me the food and walked away. Unacceptable. Not going back again.

4.description: Walked in on a Friday night and sat at the bar for 8 minutes and was never greeted, wasn't that busy. Very disappointing

6.description: Just like any other Friday's.  Got in and sat down right away. We had to ask for refills. I ordered some ribs had to ask for  water, hand wipes, and the bill. Definitely need so work

22.description: Fruit fly infestation. I mean, really bad gnat situation in this place. Consistent lack of basic service. Dirty dishes. Irritated, non-attentive, attitudinal staff. I have so much to say, but I will keep it simple. Do not eat here. EVER. Take your money somewhere that cares about their guests, and that won't put you at risk of getting sick from eating there.

15.description: I know it is busy on Saturday night -especially thanksgiving weekend....but we waited for 45 minutes just for drinks.

57.description: Food was super greasy and our burgers were falling apart. The waitress ignored us and only got us one drink and zero napkins. Would NOT return.

20.description: The service here is terrible. You walk into an almost empty restaurant and wait for a good five minutes for a hostess to come up front to take you to a table. This has happened to me multiple times. They act like you are an inconvenience to their social hour. I needed silverware and it took me five minutes to flag down the wait staff. Pretty sure they were all in the back on their cell phones. It's fairly inexpensive for a restaurant right off Michigan Avenue and you know the food will be okay because it's a chain. They really need to clean up the management at this location. Not what you would expect for downtown in a major city.

36.description: I am vegan and ordered a starter that sounded like it had no diary or meat in it but it ended up having cheese on top of it. We got it for free and the manager or chef himself came to help me find a vegan option. They were very nice and kind. My mom said her burger was the best she ever ate. Our waiter was very cute, forgot his name. Great experience.

14.description: The food was good, however the service was horrible. The waittress we had never came to check on us. She took forever to bring us the check and never came back to pick up the payment. Finally we gave it to the hostess on our way out and the waittress came out of nowhere,  nearly bone rushed us at the door as if we were trying to leave without paying. I will never go back here.

28.description: Phenomenon ~ This spa combines excellent customer service, wonderful surroundings and great value. I have never been disappointed in the services i have received. If you haven't been go now.... This is a place I have on repeat.... Phenomenon....

1.description: Patrice is excellent at her work and such a warm personality.. She gave me the best pedicure and was so determined to give me the best heels ever ;) Also she has a best trick to calm you/ look away and you can relax in seconds!!! My mani- pedi is great even after a week!!

9.description: Looking at the amazing reviews, I bought a groupon for a no-chip manicure and regular pedicure.  I so much want to like this place. Patrice and Regina both were extremely nice and warm even though I was half hour late due to the crazy friday traffic. Not every place does that. Patrice did my naills and she is such a nice person, so good to talk to! The place was clean and nicely decorated. My overall experience was perfect until my no chip manicure chipped off three days later. I got my nails done Friday and it chipped off Monday. I usually don't blame the salon because I do stuff that chips it off. But I was out all weekend, didn't cook, didn't do the dishes, absolutely nothing and it still chipped! Unfortunately, I won't be going back.

29.description: I came for a facial and wanted to stay forever!What a wonderful atmosphere what a great vibe this place have!The facial was a dream and I will come for more.The service was superb very tactful and professional.A place for relaxation and renewal of the senses.I will definitely go back a million times!

23.description: oh my.... I found my little bit of heaven. This place is so nice. Staff makes you feel welcome and comfortable. they are very professional yet inviting. they are very affordable and Taylor their services to your needs. prices are very affordable. this place just not get any better. they are very clean which is very important to me. and as a customer I'm very appreciative of that!!!!. great ambiance. Muriel give me a bikini wax today and did a fantastic job. she made the whole experience very comfortable considering I've never done that before. I thought it would have been very awkward but she was very professional and kept me very relaxed. I have already recommend this place many of my friends and will be going back in to try out the other services!!!!! and the plus for all the busy moms on the go they offer services for children! Yaaay for patrice beauty inc!!!! Im sending all of my friends your way!!!

5.description: My Mom treated me to a manicure/pedicure in April 2015. I'm not one that gets mani/pedis often, but I do still know when I'm getting a quality treatment. We visited Patrice's "office" after work one Wednesday and were greeted with a smile. It was our first water-less treatment. Having no knowledge of what that meant, Patrice took the time to explain everything as she worked on our hands and feet.Patrice's salon is actually a converted office space with 1 large comfortable chair. With this setup, she is able to give each client her full attention. Both my Mom and I enjoyed our experience. Our fingers and toes were painted with great attention to detail. Even though we were there until after 8 PM, we did not feel rushed to leave. Patrice made sure that are paint was dry before sending us both on our way.  If you're looking for a different mani/pedi experience than what you normally experience, call Patrice's Beauty for an appointment.

25.description: Found this gem from an online deal site and realized it was just around the corner. I'm not sure how I never saw it before, but boy am I glad it has been discovered! I went in for a no chip manicure and also bought a pedicure and a facial. Obviously, I never wanted to leave! Patrice was so nice, so talented, and SO friendly. We had a great time relaxing and chatting. All of her services were wonderful and her studio is so quiet and tranquil. I will definitely be back and can't wait!!!

12.description: Started seeing Patrice for regular facials. I had not found an esthetician for waxing just yet in Chicago. So I booked a full day of services with Patrice at her new location. I loved it!!! I have never found someone perfect with waxing nails AND facials. The drive is beyond worth it!

21.description: just got a brazilian here the other day from patrice & she was great! she was nice & told me exactly what she was doing while she was doing it. she made me feel comfortable & i areally appreciated that. will definitely come back here!

16.description: A friend of mine gifted me with a facial from Patrice. Since I never had a facial before (other than my in home trials) I didn't really know what to expect. Ever since my first facial, I won't be doing any more at home. Patrice was extremely knowledgeable as well as personable. I now see her for my Brazilian waxes. If you go on the regular/on time the price is discounted. I would definitely recommend her and friendly staff. Turned a painful service into a pleasant experience.

17.description: First of all, they were very accommodating with a last minute wax and pleasant even though I was a couple minutes late. Patrice did a wonderful job (I got a brazilian)!  Place is clean all the way around from environment (which is warm) to waxing. I'm glad I came

10.description: This was like no other nail salon I have ever experienced.  It was my first waterless manicure/pedicure and I loved it.  It is a private space with only one huge chair.  At first I asked Patric for magazines, which she doesn't have, but she said most people sleep.  I barely believed her at first but it's true.  It was such a relaxing, comfortable chair that I fell asleep and I woke up with a perfect mani-pedi.  Dream come true! She was very patient and careful about making sure the nails were dry.  It's only been 5 days since I went, but so far, my nails are still perfect.

11.description: I have been going to Patrice Beauty for a few months now and wanted to write a review on the services. Patrice Baker, owner of  Patrice Beauty have been giving me facial over the last few months and I am so happy with the service. Very professional, I highly recommend booking an appointment.

26.description: I bought a groupon for a facial and was very pleasantly  surprised at  what a great deal I got. The atmosphere was calm and relaxing. Patrice did an amazing job! Great customer service and very pleasant to talk with. I can't wait to go back! I highly recommend coming in for a facial, you won't be disappointed.

27.description: Got a chance to meet the owner Patrice, she was incredibly nice and helpful. I went in for a facial and Muriel took care of me, one of the best facials ever! I Highly recommend this salon, not to mention great prices.

0.description: I got my meni/pedi done from Patrice and the service was super satisfying. She did a very neat job. She almost spend 1 and half hour on me and it was very relaxing. My heel cracks reduced significantly. I have a very dry skin and she took extra care about that. She is very nice to talk to and she is unlike other businesses who try to sell their products and try to get a good review on yelp! I am a happy customer and would recommend her service to anybody who doubts it! Thank you Patrice

20.description: I got a groupon for facial. After reading the good reviews on yelp I was really looking forward to it. Patrice did my facial and I am very impressed and made another appointment to go back already!!The appointment process was very easy and they called me right back. The spa opens late, which is great for busy professionals. There are lots of free street parking around the area. When I saw the place from outside I didn't know what to expect inside since the windows are all covered, but once I walked in the space is nicely decorated, very spacious with high ceiling! The whole facial was very attentive: first she started with asking me my concerns about my skin, and then she addressed them by explaining the steps she is going to do and what types masks she is going to use. She did a lot of hard work on my nose and chin area to get the black and white heads out. The coco mask she put on me smelled so good! The face and shoulder massage was great and very relaxing, I almost fall asleep! Then another mask and some arm and hand massage. My facial started on time and in the end it went over because she spent a lot of taking care of my skin and I didn't feel being rushed.I highly recommend it!!

19.description: I got a groupon for facial. After reading the good reviews on yelp I was really looking forward to it. Patrice did my facial and I am very impressed and made another appointment to go back already!!The appointment process was very easy and they called me right back. The spa opens late, which is great for busy professionals. There are lots of free street parking around the area. When I saw the place from outside I didn't know what to expect inside since the windows are all covered, but once I walked in the space is nicely decorated, very spacious with high ceiling! The whole facial was very attentive: first she started with asking me my concerns about my skin, and then she addressed them by explaining the steps she is going to do and what types masks she is going to use. She did a lot of hard work on my nose and chin area to get the black and white heads out. The coco mask she put on me smelled so good! The face and shoulder massage was great and very relaxing, I almost fall asleep! Then another mask and some arm and hand massage. My facial started on time and in the end it went over because she spent a lot of taking care of my skin and I didn't feel being rushed.I highly recommend it!!

2.description: Awesome job, I received the 3d eyebrows technique..even the men I told couldn't believe it wasn't all real..affordable pricing, beautiful tranquil intimate space..call her and book your appointment today.

18.description: Had a groupon for this place, like most folks. I liked the good reviews and they were really flexible about our appointment times so we could go together. I added a no-chip while my friend got her facial, then we switched. Facial was good, but I've had better at a full-on spa. I fell asleep so it was certainly comfortable haha. My no-chip chipped after just about a week, so that was pretty disappointing. I'd say it's perfect for a cheap and easy groupon, but I'd stick to just the facial.

13.description: I am writing this review for the Humboldt Park location, it appears as they have since moved.  I have had waxing services done by Patrice and she is phenomenal.  I have been nothing but pleased with the services provided.  I am not sure if they are still in the Humboldt Park location, if they are not, I am sad to see them leave.

4.description: Can someone please tell me how to get in touch with these people?  I purchased a Groupon a few weeks ago and called them last Tuesday to make an appointment.  TWO DAYS LATER, someone called and left a voice mail message.  I returned the call - NO ANSWER, just a machine.  I left a message and no one has returned my call.  Trying to reach Groupon, but no luck. What kind of business is this???

24.description: I bought a facial on groupon and muriel was awesome!  I would definitely go here many times again.  Everyone is so nice and the salon is really clean and cute.

6.description: This was definitely one of the most pleasant waxing experiences I have had. It was as painless as a brazilian can get. The space is different, but I dig it. I highly recommend Patrice. She was very professional, clean and thorough. I will be going back!

22.description: Patrice is an amazing lady , very professional And pleasant to be around. Her saloon has a wonderful atmosphere... very clean and very relaxing.I have done my nails twice with her and can't wait to go back. Not only to get my nails done, but also because I enjoy chatting with her.

15.description: Found this gem from an online deal site and realized it was just around the corner. I'm not sure how I never saw it before, but boy am I glad it has been discovered! I went in for a no chip manicure and also bought a pedicure and a facial. Obviously, I never wanted to leave! Patrice was so nice, so talented, and SO friendly. We had a great time relaxing and chatting. All of her services were wonderful and her studio is so quiet and tranquil. I will definitely be back and can't wait!!!

7.description: I had purchased a groupon for a signature facial. All I can say is WOW! When I called to schedule an appointment for 7pm, they were booked and after I explained this was the only evening I had available due to an a.m. flight I had the next morning, they were able to shift things around for me to fit me in. I was super happy not only that they fit me in but also bc they offer evening hours- great for my busy work schedule. Patrice gave me my facial and I was overly impressed with her professionalism and most importantly, impressed with the results. She took her time to answer my questions and educated me with awesome facial info. I am 32 yrs. old and had never before had a facial due to friends & family members' stories of bad experiences resulting in horrible breakouts. I am so glad to have  found and experienced Patrice Beauty! I had no breakouts! My face feels cleaner than ever and I have already purchased 3 more facials. I am looking forward to the cocoa treatment she has recommended. Can't wait!

8.description: I called the place during the week after seeing a Groupon but they didnt have availability, later i got call from Regina saying they have an opening on Sunday 3pm. I  was on my way there and got a call to tell me the earlier client came in late so my appointment will be delayed..... already liked the place for being courteous. Once i got there i was extremely skeptical of the salon but all fear vanished the minute i went in, super nice, clean and well done space. Patrice came and apologized for the half hour delay and worked on my concerns during the facial. Most impressive was they gave me the groupon price even though i didn't have one, cant beat that!! will most certainly go back for another facial.

3.description: Patrice is the absolute best. I had a new service she is offering called the lash lift. My lashes are typically very fair and I need to curl them at least three times for the curl to stay. She did the lash lift almost 3 weeks ago and the my lashes are still dark and still curled. She was very professional and her space was extremely clean. I love supporting other small businesses especially run by talented women. Thank you again for the beautiful lashes Patrice!!!

14.description: I came here today to redeem my Groupon for a no chip mani/pedi. The staff was very friendly and made sure everything was to my liking. Patrice was very personable and friendly. I can't stop looking at my nails and feet. I also got my eyebrows and lip waxed as well and was very happy with the results and how little it hurt. I will definitely be coming back and recommending this place to all of my friends. Thanks Patrice!

58.description: All I have to say is - best Black Bean soup ever!  I add some tabasco to it and it's perfect.

56.description: I frequently visit this Panera location given its proximity to work. There is usually a line, but I can appreciate that almost always the registers are all fully staffed so don't be disheartened by a long line - it goes fast!Lots of indoor and outdoor seating here, or if you are looking to take it to go, they will get everything ready for you. A perk in dining in is free refills on soft drinks & tea! The staff is very friendly here, even in the midst of lunch-time chaos. I also LOVE that they have calorie counts on the menu and offer such a great variety of soups daily. And don't get me started on the bread... the French baguette is always served warm, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. One small gripe I have is that the to-go portion sizes are significantly smaller than when dining in. A few times I have gotten a chicken noodle soup bowl, only to find about 70% broth and very little chicken and noodles. This is a great option for lunch time - or even an afternoon pick me up--the pumpkin muffie is a fave of mine. Get a cup of coffee and you'll cruise on through the workday. I have also ordered from Panera Catering for events at work and the orders have always been on time & of great quality.

29.description: Panera is always reliable in my experience and this one is no different. A large cup of hazelnut coffee on a freezing cold day with a bowl of fresh and hot steel cut oatmeal can't be beat. Not as many add in ingredient options as in other restaurants, but I think this simpler approach is in our favor. No temptation to load in everything under the sun.

42.description: My favorite spot for studying. Gets crowded during lunch time and the Wifi works just 30 minutes from noon till 1:30pm, but can't keep me from going there.

23.description: I ordered a tuna on wheat. Got a chips and drink. The 12 oz. fountain beverage was $1.89!  The whole order came to $9. Hardly a good value. While I was waiting for my meal, they told me the bakery had no wheat bread. A restaurant with the word BREAD in it and they have no wheat for a tuna sandwich?!  I got my money back and walked out empty handed. They didn't even offer me any make good. Lame!!!

47.description: Restaurant ReviewFresh sandwiches and salads with a sweet treat to go. I have lived in Streeterville for 4 years now and had no idea that Panera closes at 9 pm and not 5 pm like einstein bagel down the street. I was expecting poor service given locations in chicago, but I was completely surprised. The staff was super friendly and were nice enough to tell me that I had earned a free pastry on my new panera card. Unfortunately they did not help me link up with a permanent panera card. I ended up getting the Chipotle chicken on toasted french with applewood bacon, cheddar, tomato, and chipotle spread. Sandwich was fresh and full of flavor, not too spicy with the chipotle sauce. It comes with either french bread, chips, or an apple. Free WIFI also while you eat. I also got a free cinnamon roll which was large enough for two to share!Pro- super friendly staff, mypanera club that gives you free rewards, fresh, FREE WIFICon- did not offer to link up my temporary mypanera card to a permanent oneHidden deal- Sign up a mypanera card which gets you a free pastry! American express link like love gave a 10 dollar credit after spending 10 dollars. Limit one

8.description: I was in Chicago with a friend from out of town and stopped in to get lunch. Of course after walking around for a while we needed to use the restroom and I was absolutely disgusted. There was trash all over. Water or urine all over the floors. Feminine product wrappers spilling out of the garbage cans, period blood running down the toilet seats, bloody tissue in the toilets. Absolutely disgusting and vile. Myself coming from a managerial position in the restaurant business was appalled. I judge the cleanliness of restaurants by the state of their restrooms. It looked as though no one had cleaned in days. Needless to say I didn't eat or use the restroom. Unacceptable.

31.description: This is the second best Panera I've been to.... all the others are tied for first!I frequent Panera more than I care to admit (probably once a week) as I travel throughout the Midwest.  Panera is always my go-to lunch place because it offers good quality food at a decent price.  Unfortunately I happen to live near this location on Fairbanks and every time I walk out of there I swear I'll never return.  This Panera has the ABSOLUTE WORST SERVICE.  There can be 6 or 7 employees milling about and only one person working the register taking orders which generally means a frustrating wait.  Then once your order is placed that's when the real excitement begins........ you never know what you'll be served because its frequently not what you ordered; although I will admit its usually close.So if you want adventure with your dining experience this is your Panera.  As for me I need to be a little less lazy and walk by their door to some place that cares about the customer's experience.

34.description: Soups are surprisingly good. I tried brocolli cheddar and chicken noodle with french baguette. Visited them 3 times already and have never been disappointed by the taste and quality of their food. I also liked the prices here.

16.description: This is my favorite place to go for soup (comes with your choice of bread or salad)- especially on a bitter cold day like today!  The line can be long at some points during the morning and lunch hours, but the staff is quick to get it moving.  I use their catering services for work and I never had a problem.

13.description: Overpriced, under-portioned food with a staff who regularly play around and ignore the customer. The coffee is very watered down! And to boot, I ordered the most depressing pb and j the other day which came lightly blotted with jam and pb. I asked for a replacement and was promptly given a new pb and j, this time with about a teaspoon of jam and pb respectfully. For almost $5 that is ludicrous!

11.description: Panera's can be found pretty much all over the U.S and the menu is similar across the board. The food (bagels sandwiches, salads, soups, breads and pastries) are all delicious. They also have amazing low fat smoothies which I've become addicted to.The main reason why I felt inclined to write a review was because of the customer service at this particular. The employees here could give a master class on how to make patrons feel welcomed, appreciated and valued. Everyone I've encountered who works here has been extremely professional and so sweet I've gotten cavities. If you come here enough they'll remember your name and what you typically like to order. Top notch services gets this location 4 stars!My favorites are: - Cinnamon Crunch Bagel is so good I'd slap my momma if she tried to sneak a bite.- Broccoli Cheddar Soup in a Sourdough Bread Bowl makes my stomach a happy camper, especially when I get to eat the bread bowl after the soup is all gone and it has soaked up some of the soup. Mmm I'm drooling as I write this.- Fontina Grilled Cheese or the Classic Grilled Cheese Sandwich. If you are a lover of grilled cheese then you can't go wrong with either sandwich. The Fontina is a little more Upper East Side so if you wanna feel like you've moved on up I recommend you try this one.- Asian Sesame Chicken Salad is fresh and a great twist to the normal lame salad. The half portion is huge so I recommend you get this size, unless you are Starvin Marvin and feel brave enough to get the full portion.- Low Fat Strawberry Smoothie is a delicious snack for those who are looking for a healthy alternative to those tempting pastries that Panera offers. In the last month I've had about 9 smoothies so clearly I'm a fan.

39.description: I refuse to return to this particular branch of Panera and advise all my friends who live in the area and work at Northwestern with me to do the same. Worst experience I've ever had at a Panera store, which I've always loved. I only frequent the Panera Cares in Lincoln Park now because of their mission and incredible service. To make a long story a little shorter, I went there one morning to work on a paper and bought a bagel and a small coffee. A man sitting two tables over had bought a small coffee. He exhibited signs of homelessness, but had made a purchase and was NOT bothering any customers, as only one other man was sitting near us. An hour and a half into a peaceful morning, 2 Chicago police officers came in and told this man to leave. He quietly asked why and did not understand as he had bought a coffee. The man was not disrespectful at all. Eventually 4 more policemen came in. Their reason for kicking him out was that "I don't know, management just wants you out and that's what we're here for" Considering what time the store opens, I spent a longer amount of time in the store than this man could have and bought only a bagel more. I somehow did not seem to warrant a police escort out. I restate, the man DID NOT cause any customers ANY problems at all. I sent an email to corporate about the shameful discrimination I saw. I didn't receive an answer until a month later when I resent the email and asked why I had not heard back. They answered the next day this time and forwarded it to the branch. Store manager Gina emailed me back saying this was not a normal occurrence but that this man had a history of problems with the store and had a heated discussion with a manager before sitting down. Apparently another manager called the police to have him escorted out as "safety concerns were high." My next question to her was that why, since I came in the store I was sitting with a somehow dangerous man an hour and a half ago, a high safety risk man was allowed to sit near me for such a long period of time without having any manager come up to him or me about this. I waited 3 weeks for a response about this and sent another follow up asking about it. Her response was that "the police took awhile to show up"...an hour and a half? If he's poses a high safety concern, why wasn't I warned to not sit near him? A quick google search showed that police response times averaged 4 minutes in Chicago in 2011. While I would like to trust Gina that this man was escorted out in a highly shameful way for my safety, I find it hard to believe when it takes them an hour and half to do so. How this situation was handled is shameful, and the manager did not EVER come up to me to tell me about this situation that was apparently high risk OR ask the man to leave himself - both me and this other customer were unaware of the situation until 6 Chicago police turned up out of the blue, which to me is a complete disregard for ALL customers involved, including this homeless man who was so dangerous he walked out without ever raising his voice or getting belligerent. This situation was NOT handled in ANY way that showed this branch cared about their customers. Gina mentioned she was glad I did not see this exchange between the man and the manager, but if this was a high safety risk situation, I would absolutely hope that the manager of a store I am patronizing would be filling me in on any safety concerns, not leaving me in the dark until 6 policemen show up out of the blue. The manager should have told me, or should have had the decency to ask this man to leave instead of surprising him with and embarrassing and DEFINITELY unnecessary police escort. For this reason I will never return to this branch. I waited to hear back from Panera and Gina before posting this review in order to give them the benefit of the doubt, but the inconsistency of their replies and their lack of customer service made this review necessary. I'll get my overpriced bagels elsewhere next time.

37.description: Friendly cashier. Delicious pastries (I'm looking at you, bearclaw). Free WiFi. however, kinda pricey and portions are pretty tiny when you carry out.

0.description: This place knows how to get you in out and on your way. The food is always consistent and the service is fast. The only thing I could suggest is, the employees could be a bit more friendly. All in all I have always enjoyed my experience here.

38.description: Hot soups, delicious salads and sandwiches, great pastries and fresh bread!The staff here is extremely nice, very friendly and prompt. Wait time for any sandwich, soup or salad is less than 5 minutes - enough time to grab some water/drink and find a place to sit.I like that this Panera closes at 9pm, which means that I can grab a nice loaf of bread on the way home. Go in the morning to get one that's fresh out of the oven.

51.description: The cashiers were knowledgeable and friendly, and the speed of service was great!

27.description: Panera's can be found pretty much all over the U.S and the menu is similar across the board. The food (bagels sandwiches, salads, soups, breads and pastries) are all delicious. They also have amazing low fat smoothies which I've become addicted to.The main reason why I felt inclined to write a review was because of the customer service at this particular. The employees here could give a master class on how to make patrons feel welcomed, appreciated and valued. Everyone I've encountered who works here has been extremely professional and so sweet I've gotten cavities. If you come here enough they'll remember your name and what you typically like to order. Top notch services gets this location 4 stars!My favorites are: - Cinnamon Crunch Bagel is so good I'd slap my momma if she tried to sneak a bite.- Broccoli Cheddar Soup in a Sourdough Bread Bowl makes my stomach a happy camper, especially when I get to eat the bread bowl after the soup is all gone and it has soaked up some of the soup. Mmm I'm drooling as I write this.- Fontina Grilled Cheese or the Classic Grilled Cheese Sandwich. If you are a lover of grilled cheese then you can't go wrong with either sandwich. The Fontina is a little more Upper East Side so if you wanna feel like you've moved on up I recommend you try this one.- Asian Sesame Chicken Salad is fresh and a great twist to the normal lame salad. The half portion is huge so I recommend you get this size, unless you are Starvin Marvin and feel brave enough to get the full portion.- Low Fat Strawberry Smoothie is a delicious snack for those who are looking for a healthy alternative to those tempting pastries that Panera offers. In the last month I've had about 9 smoothies so clearly I'm a fan.

32.description: Big space, free wifi, clean bathroom, overpriced sandwiches and pastries.  Typical Panera.

54.description: It's Panera. Or, as I'm inclined to call it forever & ever: The St. Louis Bread Co.... because that's what it is. Anyway... it's a chain, they're all basically the same. The highlights of this particular location:-It's busy. Meaning HELLA busy, all the time. Yes, dear students, I'm lookin' at you, with your laptops taking up a 4-top for 2 hours. Move already. -I generally get take-out here (see first point), and they seem to always manage to smoosh my sandwiches when shoving them into the tiny bag, and that makes me sad. But, it still tastes good... just messier.-They're fast, so if you're in a hurry, the line usually moves pretty quickly.PS. Not location-specific... but... Panera now has a rewards card (making it number 9 on my keychain... holy jeez!), and I'm excited to find out what the rewards are. After spending ~$10/meal for a solid 15 years, I feel like I deserve a freebie or two.

48.description: I love Panera.  Gotta love their soups and paninis!  I wish their salads contained more than iceberg lettuce though.  Some argula or other field greens would be superb, but that's probably feedback for corporate rather than this location itself.  The Panera staff at this location are very friendly and know how to keep the line moving during peak hours.  However this Panera location gets extremely packed during lunch.  I have found myself sitting silently in a booth with a complete stranger due to lack of enough space to sit down and eat.  I did see a lot of people on their laptops, not eating, so maybe if they shared their space or moved to an armchair instead of taking up a whole booth to themselves, maybe other patrons would have a space to enjoy lunch.  I feel this is something the staff can monitor and help with as well.  It ruins my experience when I can't enjoy my soup while it's fresh and hot due to lack of seating space.  Great food. I wish they had more seating though.

44.description: I'm not one to complain, but the manager on duty rang me up, didn't say hello (she was chatting with a coworker instead), didn't smile or say thank you, the cookies were stale and hard, and they forgot my pickle with my sandwich. I'll be going to a different Panera next time.

24.description: I have to agree with the review below mine. I work across the street at Northwestern and I visit this location frequently. The people here are great at their job and they always make me feel welcomed. I love getting breakfast, lunch and dinner here because the environment is very friendly and they know exactly how I like my order.

7.description: Really can't say anything bad about panera. Only issue I had was with trying to use the Kiosk for ordering. Great new tool but they neglected to say that they weren't ready for use. I had completed my order and was ready to pay but couldn't complete it. I asked for help and the cashier, with an annoyed attitude, said they aren't ready. I responded and asked why isn't there a sign? She never responded but instead asked if I wanted to place an order. Duh!!! Once I was pass all those shenanigans... I had to start all over with an actual person. I like the ease of ordering myself and picking it up especially when I'm customizing an order. The rest of the staff was friendly and helpful. My food is always good. I love the rewards as all. I tried something new today which was the chipotle chicken and half greek salad. DELICIOUS!!!

49.description: This is close to where I work so I don't have much choice but to frequent this place. The staff is mostly friendly and approachable except one who I feel gives off weird vibes. Maybe --I-- make her give me weird vibes. The pastries are dry, tasteless and small in portion.It's comfy and cozy enough to zone out for a few precious early morning minutes before I work in the craziness that is the hospital X_X.

40.description: Had me a quick breakfast to hold me over for lunch. Nice place to sit down and people watch.Good meal & hot/cold drinks.

53.description: You know how they say all chains are the same....Meh!. The person took my order was new so I will give her slack, but I ordered no mustard on my sandwich.  Guess what I got all mustard and nothing else.  Simple mistake, but when they remade the sandwich they literally put half tuna on one side and half mayonnaise. Ick. I also got a brownie that was severally underbaked.... But i will say they have friendly service, but I will stick to my regular Panera from now on and venture to other places downtown for lunch.

30.description: This is my favorite place to go for soup (comes with your choice of bread or salad)- especially on a bitter cold day like today!  The line can be long at some points during the morning and lunch hours, but the staff is quick to get it moving.  I use their catering services for work and I never had a problem.

46.description: I recently had an amazing experience at this Panera location. My company office is located nearby and we frequent this particular Panera for lunch. While placing a large take out order recently, when I arrived back to the office I realized I was missing one of the items from our order. I called Panera to let them know what happened and assumed they would let me know they would prepare a new one and I could go and pick it up but this was not the case. Not only did they hand deliver the salad to our office, they included two vouchers, and two cookies in my bag with an apology from the employee that delivered the food! I was beyond impressed by this customer service as I work in a Contact Center! Great job Panera!

1.description: Panera is usually a "ok, I guess I'll eat that" type of option. So I start from a 3-star platform. Its not expensive, its fast, and its relatively different. Now when you take their model of "fast casual" and you speed it up with "tag this vibrating pad" and cram too many tables into too little real estate, you are going to lesson already bare bones quality and you are going to upset a very delicate balance of "this is ok for now" type of customers.This Panera single handedly tipped to  scales for Panera in my book from an occasional option to not even in the back of my mind. Thank you for your failure.

55.description: Free wifi, decent food. I don't frequent Panera because I generally don't like bakery items or sandwiches, but their soups have always been delicious, if a touch on the salty side. But again, that's because I like my soups blander than most. Most people would probably rate Panera higher than I would.

9.description: Pretty good Panera location. I like it because there is usually quite a lot of seating available and because it's so close to Northwestern's Chicago campus (we drop by all the time if we have class in Chicago). Got the French Onion soup here today for the first time and it was decent...what you expect from Panera.

26.description: Extra hot skim latte?!  You know you're a regular customer when you recognize not only the other customers at 7:30am, but you just walk in and they start making your regular drink.  The customer service at this location is really what makes it stand out.  I go almost every morning throughout the week and am always greeted by the friendly and helpful staff.  Apart from their coffee, I am a huge fan of their salads as well.  They always have seasonal specials that are good and during those colder days I always do the "you pick 2" of soup and salad.

25.description: I've ate STL Bread Co all over the country and it never disappoints! Always great fast friendly service with fresh delicious soups, salads, sandwiches, and bakery foods! Love the grilled chicken sesame salad,bacon turkey bravo, Thai chicken, broccoli cheddar soup, it's all good really. Just pick something that fits your mood and you'll love it!

12.description: This Panera Bread is relatively large. There are plenty of tables and the staff is friendly. It's a healthy walk from nearby residences and is a great place for brunch on the weekends. Food was prepared quickly and attentively.The Asian Sesame Chicken Salad is delicious! The combination of sweet/nutty flavors and crunchy/chewy textures is fun for the mouth and it's a plus that the dressing is not too sweet. This salad came as a Pick 2 and the portion seemed pretty large to me. I WAS SO HAPPY WHEN I GOT MY PLATE, YOU MAY HAVE NO IDEA.The Asiago Steak sandwich was like... medium rare. It was dripping with light red liquid and it was juicy... I didn't know what to make of it but it tasted good. I like how the onions are raw as it gives a bite to the taste of the steak and cheese. The sauce on the sandwich was just enough that it got into every bite I took and wasn't oozing everywhere.The french baguette was moist (as in, not dry and hard) and fun to eat. The inside was fluffy and ...chewy but easy to bite in to. I had fun eating the bread. I'm cautious with eating bread because if I bite into hard bread, my sensitive teeth scream.The lemons they have at the beverage table are fresh and the whole restaurant looks pretty clean.The broccoli cheddar soup was hot and tasted good (not too salty and not too floury). The napa almond chicken sandwich had a nice crunch to it and the bread was not soggy. Yay!Thanks for the good service and yummy food, this Panera Bread location!

59.description: I stopped here for a Sunday lunch.  Great location and plenty of seating inside and outside.  The Cuban panini on Focaccia bread is delicious and pretty decen in size!  The Cherry Pastry and Cobblestone (cinnabun with stuff on top) are sweet and tasty as well.  If you buy a meal (sandwich, chips and drink) you can buy the pastries for $1/each instead of whatever price.Btw, if you're looking to hit the Lake Front path or Navy Pier from this Panera. Go south 1 block to Ohio, then East 2 blocks where it ends.  There's an underground tunnel to take you over to the path and to Navy Pier.

21.description: This Panera Bread is relatively large. There are plenty of tables and the staff is friendly. It's a healthy walk from nearby residences and is a great place for brunch on the weekends. Food was prepared quickly and attentively.The Asian Sesame Chicken Salad is delicious! The combination of sweet/nutty flavors and crunchy/chewy textures is fun for the mouth and it's a plus that the dressing is not too sweet.
