This salad came as a Pick 2 and the portion seemed pretty large to me. I WAS SO HAPPY WHEN I GOT MY PLATE, YOU MAY HAVE NO IDEA.The Asiago Steak sandwich was like... medium rare. It was dripping with light red liquid and it was juicy... I didn't know what to make of it but it tasted good. I like how the onions are raw as it gives a bite to the taste of the steak and cheese. The sauce on the sandwich was just enough that it got into every bite I took and wasn't oozing everywhere.The french baguette was moist (as in, not dry and hard) and fun to eat. The inside was fluffy and ...chewy but easy to bite in to. I had fun eating the bread. I'm cautious with eating bread because if I bite into hard bread, my sensitive teeth scream.The lemons they have at the beverage table are fresh and the whole restaurant looks pretty clean.The broccoli cheddar soup was hot and tasted good (not too salty and not too floury). The napa almond chicken sandwich had a nice crunch to it and the bread was not soggy. Yay!Thanks for the good service and yummy food, this Panera Bread location!

17.description: I've been to this location several times, as I live around the corner. I don't know who they have working back, maybe they need to hire somebody besides a bunch of teenagers because I constantly am running into issues with my order at this location. It shouldn't be that difficult to make a salad.

10.description: Terrible service and completely screwed up our order! Forgot sour dough bowl for soup, no extra dressing on side or whole grain bread on side instead of gave French! Just tasted under cooked squashed ravioli and needs more sauce and to be cooked better! Going to go to Cosi next time! Extremely disappointed since Panera is only 2 blocks away from our home. Don't do to Streeterville Panera

5.description: Great lunch spot, fast service with good food! Nice outdoor space for enjoying the city durning the warmer months!

3.description: Not the biggest Panera fan especially when Cosi is right around the corner, but they do have fantastic tea. I like this location because it is in a great area for people watching. Very quiet, and very nice place to read, or catch up with friends.

35.description: Waited in line to place my order. The line awkwardly blocked other diners from entering since it wrapped in front of the revolving doors. Despite it being lunch time, the employees taking the order were efficient and quick; however, it took a bit longer for the actual food to come out. No worries though because you have a buzzer to let you know when to get up for your order. I ordered the Asian sesame salad and the tuna salad sandwich, which were per usual at any other Panera Bread, so I would say quality is great and consistent. No complaints here.

19.description: The attitude of the employees is ridiculous to say the least. I work at the hospital and frequent Panera on a regular basis. I thought maybe it was a fluke the first couple of times but the majority of the workers are plain rude. I know, I've been there...customers can be annoying. Please don't take it out on innocent clientele. Also, the food has been mediocre. All my hot sandwiches have been very cold and the cheese is never melted! Please...calm down with the attitudes!

28.description: My latest experience  to this Panera would have warranted 1 star but for the sake of the other experiences, I'll plop it up to 2 stars.But my latest experience (today for lunch), I ordered the You Pick Two with Asian Sesame Chicken Salad and Broccoli Cheddar soup, with a whole wheat baguette. It took awhile to come out (though they were busy), and the quality of the salad was awful - somewhat old looking lettuce, the wrong nuts, not a ton of dressing and just all around sadness. Then, my baguette was stale and tiny, not a normal slice. My soup was fine, and tasty as always.But then, let's talk about my friend's food. She got a sandwich and soup combo. Soup, again, was fine. Her sandwich though- she took one bite into it and it was frozen! She told them and they said they would bring her out a new one. They did, after like 10 minutes which felt like a long time at Panera. Then later I asked for more bread because I felt jipped and they gave me more after the girl like dropped an entire baguette and laughed at herself. Also, when my order was taken, the woman at the register kept staring at my credit card and commenting about it to the point where I was uncomfortable and almost thought she was trying to memorize it. It was awkward, and everyone just felt like they were acting very unprofessional today. They need new management for this Saturday lunch shift...

45.description: Did you ever know that you're my hero?  And everything I would like to eat?I really loved my panini sandwich....you are the bread beneath my wings.Picture the scene:  A flash thunderstorm while walking along the shorefront.  Dashing toward safety, I need a place to eat.  Out of the shadows of the rain (and thanks to my Yelp app on my phone), I find Panera...a warm, safe haven from the downpours outside.I had a Chipotle chicken panini, chips, a cookie and lemonade.  Okay, it's kind a pricey and you get like seven potato chips in the bag, but the sandwich was so delicious (a bit messy) and the overpriced peanut butter cookie I had was tasty too.The place has friendly staff and is very clean, so I think it's a good place.  They just need to up the chip content in their bags.  Thanks to Panera, I can fly higher than an eagle, for they are the bread beneath my wings.

33.description: I enjoy the "You Pick 2"  combos.  I had the turkey wheatberry salad and some french onion soup the other day for lunch and it was really good.  I think Panera's food quality and customer service have improved greatly over the last few years.  My combo with drink was $10 and change.

43.description: Panera is definitely my go to quick lunch spot and this one is just like all the rest. There is not much space for a line to form but they do a good job of getting your meal out fast and fresh.

2.description: This Panera was the closest place to have a quick breakfast from where we were staying.  It's  basically at the corner of Fairbanks between Ontario and Erie.One thing I wasn't happy about is that they ran out of Asiago bagels which as my favorite so we just settled with everything bagels which aren't the same but would have to do.  My wife usually gets an orange scone as well.One thing I noticed which was very different than every other Panera I've been to is that instead of the buzzers which buzz when your food is ready to be picked up they have a similar looking device but you are asked to place it on your table.  It's tracks where you are and notifies the servers where to bring your order to so you don't have to wait for it at the counter or get up to get it as they know where YOU are and they bring it to YOU.  That's cool.Each table is numbered and each order is marked with a sticker so you know what's what.This new tracking system I have to see if that's in the Panera's at home or not.  Besides that everything else here is just like any Panera which includes free wifi.

18.description: My wife and I were visiting Chicago for a wedding and this papers bread was right by the hotel we were staying at. We walked in after walking around and exploring and the service here was amazing. Esmeralda and Kristif were at the front and they were the reason for this five star review. They made sure to tell us what was on the sandwiches and if we wanted to remove anything. Whenever we visit the Chicago area again. We will definitely choose this restaurant!

41.description: slowest panera ive been to, my panini was burnt tonight and barely had any meat or cheese on it :(

52.description: The thing I like about Panera Bread is that the french bread they make is one of the best french bread I've eaten. And it's the same at every Panera Bread / St. Louis Bread Co that I've been to around the country. The bread is made fresh and late at night, they actually start handing them out. The bagels are also cooked fresh and if you manage to get one right out of the oven, you are in luck my friend. I absolutely love the asiago cheese bagels and was thrilled when they started making the asiago cheese bagel square (asiago cheese bagel squared so you can put them in your french onion soup).The salads are enormous and made fresh in front of you. I am a big fan of the Greek salad and if I'm feeling a salad, I almost always get one. The french onion soup is another mean hit where they melt the cheese into the soup and throw cubes of french onion bread in to further enhance the experience. The tomato mozarella panini is one of my personal favorites and I'd like to say that I made become a permanent fixture on their menu after I ordered it every single time I went there the day the panini made it's debut.The strawberry smoothies are ok. I hate when they add whip cream to it even after I told them no whip cream. The mango smoothie is also decent but not as good as the strawberry. You can def. taste the ridiculous amounts of sugar in the mango one. They do put some chocolate syrup in each mango drink which kind of adds a diferent taste to the smoothie. Not a bad taste but just a bit different.

50.description: We had 6 meals, they were bound to get one screwed up...but 3.  That's not good odds.  The you-pick-two is how I roll.  Smokehouse turkey panini and an Asian sesame chicken salad.  Not nearly the fabulous presentation or portion size on the salad that I've had at some of my favorite Panera's. Solid 3 stars.

4.description: I mean for a place where you can grab a quick lunch/dinner, panera is pretty decent. This place has lots of kiosk where I can order food without spending time waiting in line. What's more, the reason I love using kiosk is because you can customize your own food on it. With my salad, I can easily add or delete any ingredients that I don't like and add as many as I want. For some ingredients, you need to add extra money, but i'm fine with that as long as I can get the salad combination I want:)Waiters are pretty friendly and the food are served really fast. The outdoor seating is nice too. I love to sit outside on a sunny noon for lunch:)

6.description: Was parking my car in a Garage for a 4 h fast visit before going to o hare Airport. Was hungry and decided to have something small for breakfast. Lot of choices available, the rolls looked good to me. Have had a cinnamon roll and a coffee to go. Was OK, the roll was maybe alittle bit too dry but still OK.

22.description: Its okay my first time eating there i really didn't like the ceaser salad i don't know if it was the cheese they used but i wish i would of ordered something else the staff was kind of rushing you the cookie and bread roll was good other then that its okay I'm going to try it again but order something else

15.description: who doesn't love panera bread?staff at this location are always friendly and efficient. I normally get the same thing every time so I can't comment on other items but the napa almond chicken salad sandwich with broccoli cheddar soup is where it's at.bravo panera.

57.description: This review is a little biased, because, on a whole, I think Panera is expensive ... $15 for soup, sandwich and a drink just seems too much.  I wound up going here because it was labor day, and the West Egg closed early.  Panera's sandwiches always look like they're kind of thrown together haphazardly, making a Subway sandwich look like a thing of art.  I got the chicken tortialla soup, which wasn't bad.The other thing you gotta look out for is that it's in the heart of Northwesternville (I mean Streeterville), which means it caters to both clinicians and future doctors of America, who sit there with their laptops jawing about bodily functions.  This afternoon, I got a dissertation on the pap smear, and how it aids in clinical diagnosis of certain female conditions.  Perfect lunch topic as I'm eating my overpriced turkey bravo sandwich.

20.description: who doesn't love panera bread?staff at this location are always friendly and efficient. I normally get the same thing every time so I can't comment on other items but the napa almond chicken salad sandwich with broccoli cheddar soup is where it's at.bravo panera.

36.description: Panera is panera, but this place is a little bit more special.It is located at the bottom of Erie Ontario parking garage, and is a regular stop for myself and classmates before/after class.  There is always free space to read, do homework, or meet.The staff is friendly and the food is panera.  Not much more to say.

14.description: Always busy but quick and efficient. Love the kiosk orders tablets so you can do it yourself to expedite and just pick up your food. Panera is the same everywhere but I always enjoy their coffee, Bagel sandwiches, and broccoli soup. Staff is great and friendly.

58.description: Hard to find fault with this place for what it is.  Get a quality, custom pizza for a great price (for the area).  The order-to-take out time isn't bad either.It's not my first choice when I want pizza in Chicago, but I'll also never be disappointed afterwards.

56.description: I'm always trying to find a gluten-free lunch option that's not a salad, and this pizza was great!  Fresh toppings, reasonably priced and quite tasty!  I like that they cook it once you order (even online) so it was hot and not sitting waiting for me.

29.description: I liked the "build your own pizza" concept. And they have a gluten-free dough! The ingredients are fresh and the crust is thin and crunchy! The sauce is amazing!

42.description: Blaze is the best pizza place in the area. I had went to Blaze before in their Lakeview location and tried their pre-designed pizzas which I thought was standard. Then, this time I created my own pizza (11-inch, roughly $9) which turned out to be a SUPER AMAZING pizza. + The spicy red sauce is the BOMB. It adds that extra kick without having to sprinkle your pizza full of red pepper flakes+ You can add as many meats and veggies as you want. Hint: Want to add everything but don't want other people to stare (and judge) while you order there? Place your order online! They make the pizza ahead of time and fire it up in the oven when you arrive for pick-up. It's only a short 5-10 min wait but it's worth it for that hot, freshly baked pizza. + Top off your pizza with bbq sauce, pesto sauce, olive oil, and/or arugula too!+ They give you a good amount of every ingredient you add! Very impressive.+ A different pizza for whatever mood you are in. Love the personalization option, best pizza around, excellent use of $9, will be back.

23.description: The service was impeccable. Every single employee was attentive to my needs and requests and with genuine smiles they simply served. The fact that the pizza was delicious was a bonus because just feeling so valued as a customer makes me wish I lived locally to come back again and again. Because I would. p.s. They have vegan cheese and a separate sauce that's clear of cheese droppings at the front of the line.

47.description: This is a very good pizza place. The pizzas are thin crust, and you have a lot of topping choices to chose from. There's indoors and outdoor seating. Staff are friendly.Totally recommend this place.

8.description: Blaze is a build-your-own-pizza concept. It's hard to explain because choosing your own pizza toppings is normal. Blaze's toppings are a little different. You follow your pizza down the line (Subway or Chipotle-style) and have full creative control over it. You want more sauce? Done. Bacon? YES. Bell peppers on half? Your wish is their command.You pay a set price (about $8) and you get whatever you want - as much as you want - on your pizza.I ordered the Art Lover but it was the same deal! I still followed my pizza and could add whatever I wanted. No fuss. In fact, the employee seemed a little surprised that I didn't request more customization.They cooked the pizza in an open oven. The customization continued after they removed the cooked pizza. I could add arugula or other similar toppings but I chose not to.My Art Lover was delicious. My gluten free crust was thin. It was crispy around the edges and a little chewy (in a good way) toward the middle. The tomato sauce was sweet.The folks at Blaze didn't seem to mind that my friend and I stayed longer than most people. Just like any other fast food joint with no waiter service, lingering isn't a big deal.The service at Blaze was very friendly and accommodating. There were only a few things that were noteworthy. For example, my friend asked for iced tea and they directed him to the drink counter where there was no iced tea. He pointed it out to them and they rushed to brew it. Then they had to find sugar packets (which were in a box on the floor). I got an extra pizza to go (the pizza was that good) and I had to ask if they had a bag (they didn't offer it to me).

31.description: Good customer pizza with quick service. Kinda reminds me of Subway but a pizza version where you can choose your own toppings in a line.

34.description: It may be a chain, but this relatively new establishment of customizeable, made-to-order pizzas is able to serve up a good product at a fairly reasonable price point. What you'll be getting is a Chipotle-like experience, served in on a crispy, flame-grilled, flour vessel, and fully stocked to your hearts content.So you can order a simple pie(cheese, tomato sauce, dough), for around $5.50, and a one topping pie for $6.50. However if you really want to make the best of your Blaze experience, opt for the make-your-own pizza(or one of their specials). Now this is important, it is the same price no matter what combination you make. So you can choose just two toppings, or you can make a behemoth with everything on the menu, and it will cost you the same! I got spicy tomato sauce, three cheeses(mozzarella, goat, gorgonzola), all the meats, basil, garlic, giardinera, green peppers, onions, and spinach.Surprisingly, after throwing this mountain of toppings into the oven for 3 minutes, it came out still incredibly crispy and perfectly suitable to eat. Usually when I've had made-to-order pizza, the amount of toppings causes the crust in the middle to become wet and soggy, but here that wasn't the case. Also, they give you a full 9in. or so pie, so you may even be able to save some of it for leftovers(hunger permitting). Of the 4 people in my group, I was the only one that was able to eat more than half before getting full(and even then I only had 5 slices; 3 tomorrow for lunch). It may be blasphemy to order a thin-crust pizza in Chicago, but for Blaze I'm willing to make the exception.

16.description: ***I CAN'T BELIEVE YOU ONLY HAVE TWO HIGH CHAIRS!!*** Hoping a manager or someone sees that. We came in on Saturday, I was holding my child and no one I was ordering with thought to mention it, saw a table with two kids eating at high chairs so assumed I would be safe and come to find out the whole place only has two. WTF? Seriously. The people working didn't seem to care at all either. Maybe it's my fault for not checking? Anywho, I won't lower your rating because I realize this doesn't apply to everyone, but I was irritated. The pizza is really good and the prices are great. We got the BBQ Chicken and the simply cheese (only $5!) The tomato basil salad was really good too. Love the super thin crust. I guess if I go back, I will make sure there are enough seats for my kid! (He liked the pizza too, but had to sit on my lap)

13.description: I had dinner here with a friend. This place basically reminded me of Chipotle for pizza. All the pizzas are one size. The ingredients were extremely fresh. I ordered the white-top pizza. The vegan cheese had a unique texture, but didn't taste all too bad. The bacon pieces on the pizza were a bit small, but were pretty crunchy. It is cooked pretty quickly in a pizza oven. While I do not know whether I would go here again, it definitely isn't a bad place to pick up a pizza if you are in a rush. However, one thing I truly liked about this place is the wide variety of toppings to choose from.

11.description: Talk about fast food.  Pizza done in 180 seconds.  I'm sure if you are on your lunch break this is awesome.  If you aren't it is OK.  Wanted a thin crust pizza in Chicago (yeah I know it was almost a sin to say).  New we had one in Louisville so thought we would give it a try.  Neat concept and pretty easy menu.  Just so you know it was safe for my wife's allergies (peanut and tree nut).  It was pretty busy for lunch but things moved quickly.  Taste was decent but we've had better.  Worth the try and wouldn't say I wouldn't come back but there are better options.  I'll try the one closer to my home.

39.description: Great pizza. Simple to customize what you like and you watch them make it. Like Subway except for pizza. Walk down the line and answer the questions. Into the oven at the end and out rather quickly with a crisp crust and hot toppings and cheese. When I'm in the area again it will be on the short list.

37.description: We loved blaze pizza! This was our first trip to Chicago and when we walked in they immediately asked if it was our first time there, when we said yes they directed us toward the different options; their specialty pizzas or a make your own. We opted for the make your own and were very happy with their available selections! Well definitely be back on our next trip!

0.description: I am sold! This place ROCKS! I cannot get over the fact that for just ten dollars I received a full size personal pizza with unlimited toppings. This pizza was made fresh, with quality ingredients, and with love! The cooks here are awesome and so chill. I can't way to go back. What is even better is that it was super fast. I was nervous about this because I was on my lunch break but it was fantastic.I ordered the green stripe which includes: pesto drizzle over grilled chicken, roasted red peppers, chopped garlic, mozzarella, arugula. I also added feta for extra tang. It was heaven. get your Blaze on!

38.description: The Chipotle of Pizza. Owned by the same people as  Wetzel's Pretzels. Early investors include: Lebron James, Maria Shriver, and Arnold Schwarzenegger's son. As of February 2015, Blaze was opening a new franchise every 5 days.

51.description: I don't usually like pizza, but I love blaze pizza! I love the thin crust and the way I can build my own pizza so that I can have lots of veges!!! There are lots of people coming here for lunch from hospital so the line is kinda long. It will be better if you can order online in advance. They will build your pizza for you and once you come and checked out at the cashier, they will bring your pizza to the oven and make it fresh!!!

27.description: I have to say, I found a new fun, inexpensive place to eat!  It's like a sub sandwich place where you go through the line and pick your toppings, they cook it in the pizza oven and $9 and 10 minutes later you have a delicious thin crust, personal pizza!  The spicy tomato sauce was so delicious and such a great idea I don't know why no one thought of it before.  I'm a Chicago girl, but sometimes a the deep dish is too much, but who wants a stale pizza that's been sitting in a window under a heat lamp when you can get this freshly made thin crust slice of heaven.  Service is great, the line moves fast and it's good, and cheap.  I'll be back, especially if they open one in the s. loop.

32.description: This place is the fastest pizza place I've been to. It's thin crust pizza done right. Extra cheese, extra anything doesn't cost extra if you make your own.Prices are also reasonable at $8.75 a pop. Four stars because even though it was good, it didn't stand out as spectacular in this pizza-ridden town called Chicago. Gets the job done if you want a quick and yummy pizza fix instead of waiting for deep dish.

54.description: Fast and furious pizza, a little noisy and tight in the seating, but excellent pies made before your very eyes.   Of course you have to wait a few minutes while it bakes (in what must be a seriously hot oven) but the wait is worth it.

48.description: This is my new favorite pizza of ALL time. They have vegan cheese (I can have pizza now!).  The workers are incredibly mindful, too. After ordering vegan cheese they asked if I wanted them to change their gloves. It was such a pleasant surprise.Trust me, the vegan cheese was beyond delicious! It tasted amazing and was ready very quickly! I'm obsessed with this place and will want to return anytime I can. It's like the chipotle of pizza. I highly recommend stopping in for an individual pizza.

44.description: Fast fresh pizza made to order however you want it? Why am I just now finding out about this place!?!?This is a build-your-own pizza place. For ~$8, you can choose from one of Blaze's signature pizzas or build your own. You go down the line telling the staff behind the counter exactly what you want on you pizza. You choose everything from the sauce, to the cheese, to the toppings. They don't charge per topping like most places, you just get whatever you want. Everyone gets their own personal pizza exactly the way they want it! The crust was very good---thin, but still light and fluffy.My only complaint was that the staff could have done better with wiping down tables. It was pretty busy and tables were turning over quickly without being cleaned since people just grab tables as others leave.

24.description: I had dinner here with a friend. This place basically reminded me of Chipotle for pizza. All the pizzas are one size. The ingredients were extremely fresh. I ordered the white-top pizza. The vegan cheese had a unique texture, but didn't taste all too bad. The bacon pieces on the pizza were a bit small, but were pretty crunchy. It is cooked pretty quickly in a pizza oven. While I do not know whether I would go here again, it definitely isn't a bad place to pick up a pizza if you are in a rush. However, one thing I truly liked about this place is the wide variety of toppings to choose from.

7.description: Fast fresh pizza made to order however you want it? Why am I just now finding out about this place!?!?This is a build-your-own pizza place. For ~$8, you can choose from one of Blaze's signature pizzas or build your own. You go down the line telling the staff behind the counter exactly what you want on you pizza. You choose everything from the sauce, to the cheese, to the toppings. They don't charge per topping like most places, you just get whatever you want. Everyone gets their own personal pizza exactly the way they want it! The crust was very good---thin, but still light and fluffy.My only complaint was that the staff could have done better with wiping down tables. It was pretty busy and tables were turning over quickly without being cleaned since people just grab tables as others leave.

49.description: The absolute WORSTI don't why i decided to give this place another shot. This place is so miserable to the point I couldn't continue with my order. Yes, it is that BAD.  Please do Streeterville a huge favor and close. It is a shame to call this operation a restaurant. Run by filthy kids and a "Manager" who can give a sh**t about any customer. Just do yourself a big favor and go somewhere else. I am definitely calling the city of Chicago on this miserable operation.

40.description: ***I CAN'T BELIEVE YOU ONLY HAVE TWO HIGH CHAIRS!!*** Hoping a manager or someone sees that. We came in on Saturday, I was holding my child and no one I was ordering with thought to mention it, saw a table with two kids eating at high chairs so assumed I would be safe and come to find out the whole place only has two. WTF? Seriously. The people working didn't seem to care at all either. Maybe it's my fault for not checking? Anywho, I won't lower your rating because I realize this doesn't apply to everyone, but I was irritated. The pizza is really good and the prices are great. We got the BBQ Chicken and the simply cheese (only $5!) The tomato basil salad was really good too. Love the super thin crust. I guess if I go back, I will make sure there are enough seats for my kid! (He liked the pizza too, but had to sit on my lap)

53.description: Great fast thin crust pizza.

30.description: Service varies depending on who is working here and I wish the dough was slightly thicker. However, I keep coming back because the pizzas are delicious.

46.description: Very good thin crust pizza.  I made my own and it was awesome!  I will be back!  The store is modern and the staff is friendly and helpful!

1.description: YUM!!! I love this concept. I love pizza. I LOVE that they are gluten sensitive for my fellow celiacs out there.Upon entering I was overwhelmed with the multitude of toppings, sauces, cheeses and combinations. They also have combinations that are chosen for you. The pesto pizza is awesome. Very quick and friendly staff too. I wish Blaze would make its way down to FL!

55.description: Trying to find pizza in Chicago is like finding ants at a picnic..... Difficult it is not. Finding good and cheap pizza may be harder but this place matches those needs. Things to know :1. Unlimited toppings - the good kinds2. Order online, pick up and eat there or get to go 3. Wood fired 4. Fast 5. $8 for a larger size personal pizza Negatives? Not that classic deep dish pizza, this one is all about the toppings. Also, the online payment didn't work right.... But they gave us a free soda to make up for it! Tasty, fast, cheap, service good... Tl;dr? Go!

9.description: Really nice place. The pizza was amazing and very reasonably priced. I highly highly recommend you build your own pizza online before going. When you get there they fire it up and give it to you after a short wait. Totally worth it, the pizza was amazing.Be aware, it's not your traditional deep dish pizza... so this is not the place to go if that's what you're looking for. The pizzas are thin with tons of toppings.

26.description: Pretty awesome and really fast concept. Overwhelming amount of toppings and sauces. The process reminded me of Maddios, Chipolte or Subway. It's about $10 ( I carried out). It was very good.  I'd go back again

25.description: We actually found this place by chance while walking along Ontario street because we were feeling hungry. Although the place looked very busy & crazy, when we walked in right away two staff had cheerfully greeted and welcomed us! we were surprised that we were actually greeted! A complete opposite from another pizza place that we went to yesterday that was not so welcoming initially.The staff was very polite and asked if this was our first time here. It was, so she explained to us how their system of ordering worked. I noticed the staff in this open concept kitchen was very well team oriented! Their work station was very clean and organized!Their washrooms were very clean and the air freshener smelled good!The energy of the staff's enthusiasm was very cheerful!This may not be a fancy pizza restaurant in Chicago, but they made their guest feel really welcomed! All but good vibes in the kitchen and it seemed as if they enjoyed working together as a team!The Pizza was Awesome! We got BBQ chicken and a regular pepperoni! Being a thin crust pizza it was cooked in 180 seconds! COOL!  So far Thin crust pizza has always won me over thick crust pizza.I would definitely recommend this place for tourist looking to enjoy a quick and enjoyable pizza meal with a crew of welcoming & friendly staff! =^_^=

12.description: This pizza is so good. So I went to Italy in the summer and I had the best pizza of my life. I knew coming back home I was going to be disappointed because nothing will ever come close to the flavours in Italy. Blaze pizza is the first pizza I've ever had that came close. It's still not authentic Italian pizza but it's REALLY GOOD! This is my new favourite pizza place in Chicago. I ordered the "Red Vine" pizza and added Italian sausage to it. It's really good. It's pretty cheap like $9 I believe. I had like 2 small slices left over... pizza is big enough for 1 person. Well it was enough for me by myself lol!  Maybe not the average eater, but I'd recommend getting your own if you were thinking about sharing.

59.description: First time to Blaze. Service was superb. They get you in and out efficiently while providing good customer service. I got the choose your own. Half pineapple and ham and the other half sausage and mushroom with original sauce. Flavor was spot on and toppings were fresh and tasty. Can't wait to return to try some of their specialty pizzas.

21.description: Talk about fast food.  Pizza done in 180 seconds.  I'm sure if you are on your lunch break this is awesome.  If you aren't it is OK.  Wanted a thin crust pizza in Chicago (yeah I know it was almost a sin to say).  New we had one in Louisville so thought we would give it a try.  Neat concept and pretty easy menu.  Just so you know it was safe for my wife's allergies (peanut and tree nut).  It was pretty busy for lunch but things moved quickly.  Taste was decent but we've had better.  Worth the try and wouldn't say I wouldn't come back but there are better options.  I'll try the one closer to my home.

17.description: Great pizza. Simple to customize what you like and you watch them make it. Like Subway except for pizza. Walk down the line and answer the questions. Into the oven at the end and out rather quickly with a crisp crust and hot toppings and cheese. When I'm in the area again it will be on the short list.

10.description: The service was impeccable. Every single employee was attentive to my needs and requests and with genuine smiles they simply served. The fact that the pizza was delicious was a bonus because just feeling so valued as a customer makes me wish I lived locally to come back again and again. Because I would. p.s. They have vegan cheese and a separate sauce that's clear of cheese droppings at the front of the line.

5.description: Blaze is the best pizza place in the area. I had went to Blaze before in their Lakeview location and tried their pre-designed pizzas which I thought was standard. Then, this time I created my own pizza (11-inch, roughly $9) which turned out to be a SUPER AMAZING pizza. + The spicy red sauce is the BOMB. It adds that extra kick without having to sprinkle your pizza full of red pepper flakes+ You can add as many meats and veggies as you want. Hint: Want to add everything but don't want other people to stare (and judge) while you order there? Place your order online! They make the pizza ahead of time and fire it up in the oven when you arrive for pick-up. It's only a short 5-10 min wait but it's worth it for that hot, freshly baked pizza. + Top off your pizza with bbq sauce, pesto sauce, olive oil, and/or arugula too!+ They give you a good amount of every ingredient you add! Very impressive.+ A different pizza for whatever mood you are in. Love the personalization option, best pizza around, excellent use of $9, will be back.

3.description: I love Blaze. Seriously though. No hesitation with the toppings and if you select toppings carefully, you can make it two meals. This might be the shortest review I've ever written, but the place is so straight-forward there's really not much to write. Step 1) get in line (the line moves quickly and even when busy, really isn't too bad)Step 2) skip the pre-selected options and do a make your own pizzaStep 3) Pay and waitStep 4) devour your creation!

35.description: Im a huge fan of deep dish Chicago style pizza but when I'm by myself its entirely too much food and takes too long.  Introducing Blaze.  This place is perfect for a single serving thin crust fast fire pizza. The staff is fast and friendly.  The ingredients are always fresh especially since the customer line is often to the front door. Try adding feta cheese along with your mozzarella for a savory burst of flavor. Once your name is called and this tasty little gem comes out of the oven have some olive oil and grated parmesan drizzled across the top. Unfortunately I've spotted two negatives here. Occasionally the crust is burned around the edges and many times the atmosphere is really loud and a bit overwhelming. Otherwise, for me Blaze is a lunchtime staple.

19.description: Okay, I can't think of anywhere else that gives me unlimited toppings on my personal pizza for $10. I love my veggies, and other places that charge like $1 (or more!) per topping make me crazy! I personally add $2 for vegan cheese or go cheese-less and the result has been very tasty. Very fast. Really good lemonade. I can't think of anything not to like.

28.description: Great pizza and concept. Terrible execution. Poor service. Why is there only one person on the line when there are 6 pizzas pending? And why is the rest of the crew just hanging around?

45.description: Blaze serves delicious thin-crust pizza, totally customizable! They also have a pre-designed menu for people a little less creative. I loved the wood fired crust and the basic marinara was full of flavor. I also love the fact that I can customize the unlimited toppings for such a reasonable price. It is close to work and I will make this a regular stop going forward. It was fast and delicious. The only downside is that it can get very crowded at lunch time and hard to find a seat.

33.description: Love Blaze!  It's fast, friendly, and wood-fired. You can build amazing customized pizzas for a great price.  I'm a huuuge fan of the pizzas, especially after the gym.

43.description: This place is great! Build your own pizza, no extra charge for toppings, and you can always ask for more! They also had an amazing blood orange lemonade when I went, I don't know if that's always there but i would go back just for that! The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because the service was just average, nothing bad, nothing spectacular. Can't wait to go again!

2.description: One thing about Blaze Pizza is that it's not just blazin', it's smokin! This pizza is incredibly flavorful, and incredibly cheap. Here's my recommendation:1. Go to the restaurant, you can't miss it2. Build your own pizza. It is very worth itThe price is about $9 for a unlimited topping pizza, and you can get as many of their 20+ toppings they have. If just a simple sauce and cheese is for you, then don't worry because they have a cheaper cheese option. If you like thin crust, saucy pizzas, then Blaze Fast Fire'd Pizza is for you.

18.description: Blaze pizza has great quick pizza from what I've tried so far.  The prices are excellent, and they have a lot to offer for choices.  Tried the regular cheese pizza, simple and tasty and at $5 you can't go wrong.  I will definitely eat at a Blaze fast fire'd pizza again to try other toppings.  The staff was very friendly and looked like they were having a good time there.

41.description: Good pizza done quick.  I had the 1Top with olive oil drizzle, Gorgonzola and artichoke. Compared to the pepperoni and sausage pizzas my friends ordered, I felt they were a bit short with the cheese and choke. Not sure this is representative of Chicago pizza and will look to other restaurants to show me what real Chicago pizza is like.

52.description: My 1st time at this location was good, not great.  Everything was going well at the start with a friendly welcome greeting, and then the things went awry-- the line was moving slower than the assemblers, so they were asking me to choose toppings that I hadn't caught up to visually and couldn't see.  The hold up was at the baking stage and they proceeded to get my pie out of sequence.  I watched 3 pies bake off in front of me and they politely found my a paper and popped it into the oven.  At least with this visit, it was slow casual dining.  The pizza tasted great nonetheless and I enjoyed my lunch-- I hope they get their Ops in order.

50.description: What a great deal for under $8! I pre-ordered my pizza and topping options online to save some time waiting in line (which wasn't an issue that day anyway due to rain), and it was ready to be fired up when I arrived! Really love that thin, crispy crust, which stayed that way even through the several minute walk back to the office. Big enough for leftovers the next day too :) Also tried their pre-made s'more which satisfied my sweet tooth...before I had the pizza :)

4.description: Man, this place was surprisingly super good! My fiancé and I were craving thin crust pizza and stumbled upon this restaurant. Blaze serves thin crust pizza that is cooked within 180 seconds. The BEST deal is the build-it-yourself pizza. You have the option to choose any toppings (unlimited) - sauce, meat, vegetables - you want and it's the SAME price as the regular pizzas ($8.49). They are super generous with the portions too. If you pick wisely, you can potentially create a hefty meal for 2. Totally worth it! You can even split the pizza in half and create 2 different pizzas. You can even just ask for all the toppings if you can't decide. The style of this restaurant is very similar to Chipotle as you pick your toppings down an assembly line. Don't get overwhelmed though. The staff are very patient and check up on you often.  Can't wait to come back here again!

6.description: Make your own pizza is delicious. Everyone who works here was nice and professional. The restaurant was clean and it wasn't too loud.The only downside is the door opens directly to the outside which let in a bunch of FREEZING air but it's all worth it for this delicious pizza.

22.description: Made my own with basil, turkey sausage, and garlic. Love that you can customize and the pizza fills you up without even having to eat the entire thing. The spicy marinara was a little too spicy for me and I'm Indian. Will stick with the regular marinara next time. Only issue is I had to ask for extra ingredients because they didn't put much on (but they didn't charge extra either time I went!)

15.description: It may be a chain, but this relatively new establishment of customizeable, made-to-order pizzas is able to serve up a good product at a fairly reasonable price point. What you'll be getting is a Chipotle-like experience, served in on a crispy, flame-grilled, flour vessel, and fully stocked to your hearts content.So you can order a simple pie(cheese, tomato sauce, dough), for around $5.50, and a one topping pie for $6.50. However if you really want to make the best of your Blaze experience, opt for the make-your-own pizza(or one of their specials). Now this is important, it is the same price no matter what combination you make. So you can choose just two toppings, or you can make a behemoth with everything on the menu, and it will cost you the same! I got spicy tomato sauce, three cheeses(mozzarella, goat, gorgonzola), all the meats, basil, garlic, giardinera, green peppers, onions, and spinach.Surprisingly, after throwing this mountain of toppings into the oven for 3 minutes, it came out still incredibly crispy and perfectly suitable to eat. Usually when I've had made-to-order pizza, the amount of toppings causes the crust in the middle to become wet and soggy, but here that wasn't the case. Also, they give you a full 9in. or so pie, so you may even be able to save some of it for leftovers(hunger permitting). Of the 4 people in my group, I was the only one that was able to eat more than half before getting full(and even then I only had 5 slices; 3 tomorrow for lunch). It may be blasphemy to order a thin-crust pizza in Chicago, but for Blaze I'm willing to make the exception.

57.description: Employees are great, Food is great, service is sub par because every time I ask for my pizza to be square cut they make note of it & some female employee just ignores it even when a co worker tells her that I asked for the square cut, if not for that I would give a perfect 5.

20.description: Haven't even eaten my pizza yet but giving a 5 star review because that was the nicest staff I've seen in a while. All polite, courteous, and all had a smile! I will be back! Kudos!

36.description: Blaze pizza has great quick pizza from what I've tried so far.  The prices are excellent, and they have a lot to offer for choices.  Tried the regular cheese pizza, simple and tasty and at $5 you can't go wrong.  I will definitely eat at a Blaze fast fire'd pizza again to try other toppings.  The staff was very friendly and looked like they were having a good time there.

14.description: This place is heaven. For a fixed (and cheap) price, you get to choose your unlimited fresh pizza base and toppings. Pizza is made quickly in front of your eyes, and tastes very delicious. The staff are welcoming and friendly. They want to make sure that you are having a great pizza experience at Blaze.

58.description: Great quality food and drink.  Chimay on tap and a good wine list - bottle or by the glass. Make a reservation, it gets busy around the lunch hour.   It's on the second floor so a window table looks over Michigan Ave.

56.description: My favorite restaurant in Chicago: their food is homey and comforting, while also inventive and elegant. Their service is also always impeccable-- and warm. Try the macho salad and the skillet cornbread. The macho is a perfectly balanced combination of Bandera's famous broasted chicken, cornbread croutons, goat cheese, avocado, tomato, corn, and dates, all dusted lightly with pepper. You won't be able to stop eating it, because every bite is different, and every combination of the ingredients is delicious. And needless to say, the cornbread is genius. "Fall apart under your fork" toothsome. Crunchy on the outside, moist and cakey on the inside, and the jalapeños are a beautiful touch. Try to come early in the day to try it fresh out of the oven!And save room for dessert. The Oreo ice cream sandwich is a sophisticated version of the Oreo desserts you remember from childhood-- coupled with a perfectly bitter espresso chocolate sauce. And the banana cream pie is easily one of the best things I've ever eaten. The graham cracker crust is laced with chocolate, and the filling is rich and creamy and, unlike any other banana cream pie I've ever had, it miraculously tastes like pure banana while retaining an amazing custardy consistency. The fresh banana slices and drizzles and caramel and chocolate sauce and semisweet whipped cream complete the perfect combination of flavors and textures. This is not your grandma's banana cream pie; it's unlike anything you have ever had.If you haven't eaten at Bandera yet, trust me, you want to.

29.description: Nice service and great food.i been there few times. I recommend it. I will return again and again

42.description: Great atmosphere! Make sure you have a reservation, we waited 40 minutes on a Tuesday night. French dip was outstanding!

23.description: Premise/Intro:A very attractive place with food to go with the gorgeous ambiance.  Located on gorgeous Michigan Avenue you will not be disappointed in this succulent place. Decor:Just plain classic beauty with the layout and hot jazz music. I tell you this place is the essence of Chicago style and feel.  Anybody woild be crazy not come to this place if you're it visiting Chicago let alone living in Chicago.  This place should be on everybody's top 10 favorites list in Chicago Service:Service was great and impeccanke. Everytime I came here it was also sweet and to the point.  Waiters are absolutely the kindest and always curteous. They're one of the reasons why I come to this place. Food/Product:I always get the half chicken with mashed potatoes and vegetables.  If I do a dessert it's the ice cream placed between two cookie sheets and drizzled with chocolate sauce.  Absolutely divine.  I've had friends who have ordered all different things and they always love it  Price:Definitely not bad for what you order here.  It can be typical pricier than the Cheesecake Factory but it shows in their quality of food, ambiance and entertainment for sure. Overall experience/Conclusion:I'd definitely come back here again in a heart beat.  The place is the perfect essence of Chicago.  It resonates style, Chicago flavors and sounds.  A must eat for sure. Enjoy!

47.description: This is probably one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. We were lucky enough to get a seat facing Michigan Ave at night while the Christmas decorations for Chicago were still up. The ambience was absolutely incredible between having the view of Michigan Ave, the dim candlelit dinner, and the jazz musicians who were directly behind us. Even with the musicians being so close, we were still able to have a pleasant conversation without having to yell over the music. Every dish that we ordered was very well-done. We ordered the "house-smoked salmon" as an appetizer; the smoked flavor was definitely very rich and when the salmon was put on bread and covered with the spread provided, it melts in your mouth. We also ordered "today's very fresh fish" and the "rotisserie lamb sandwich." Both entrees were prepared and cooked very well and completed our wonderful experience. I loved absolutely everything about this place and apparently so does everyone else; if you plan on coming here, especially on a weekend, make a reservation. I am extremely impressed with this restaurant and if I find myself around Michigan Ave again any time soon, I will definitely be returning. Absolutely amazing.

8.description: Great date night spot away from the Hubbard crowd scene! Great atmosphere, awesome food and service! Love the ambiance! Really a classic place and miss it! Hopefully going back soon :)

31.description: I recommend you get a reservation here as this place fills up fast. Wait time at 6pm Saturday night was 1 hr. Restaurant is very well setup, great atmosphere and live jazz music. The menu was simple and listed on one page, no fluff and to the point - sign of a good focused kitchen. The food came out quick and tasted fantastic. I had the Very Fresh Fish of the Day (Cod) with  Shrimp, Mashed Potatoes and Broccoli. Megan had the Tuna Salad. We were both very happy in what we ordered. Our one complaint is wishing the food portions were a little bigger.

34.description: I have eaten here twice in the last 2 weeks, the food is not what it used to be, inedible, cold stale fries, fish sandwich and Cole slaw which tasted of refrigerator and lame over priced salads, even the cornbread was dry and tasteless. My plates were completely full when the server came to clear them away, didn't ask me if I enjoyed my meal, which obviously I had not. Will never go back again.

16.description: I love the dark comfy mood of the place, very cozy. All the food is great, but the BEST dish in the menu are definitely the BBQ ribs. INCREDIBLE. I've had the ribs, the salmon, and the burger (which was meh, good). And for dessert the oreo sandwich (dont think twice it's awesome).

13.description: I loved the Macho Salad, seared ahi tuna salad, iron skillet cornbread, prime rib and banana cream pie. We split all of these items and everyone at the table was very pleased and didn't leave hungry!The prime rib was huge and came with a great juice and creamy horseradish sauce to enhance it along with mashed potatoes. The cornbread had jalapeño in it which gave it a nice kick and was a very generous size.The salads had great dressings and unique flavors.This place has great service, ambiance and Jazz music on Saturday night. We ordered wine from the nice bar area while waiting for our table. Our table had a nice view of Michigan Ave. This place isn't that obvious from the street level since its on the 2nd floor but if you use your iPhone it isn't too difficult to find. If you want a tasty steak, great salads and wine then this is the perfect place!

11.description: This place is spectacular !!! Service was excellent and so was the food.I will come back from NY to have it again !!! I truly recommend it !!

39.description: After reading reviews of local restaurants this one popped up on my radar. I was looking for great ambience and I must say this place exceeded all my expectations. Walked in to friendly staff, an excellent (not too loud) live jazz band, and a warm welcoming ambience. During the 45 minute wait for our table I observed the servers and hostesses who all were very professional and focused, like a well oiled machine. Very well run restaurant!! After being seated I looked around again, and thought to myself YES!! Finally I've found what I was looking for!My wife and I split the macho salad, which was the best salad I've ever had. Our waitress was excellent! She was very attentive and even recommended a Pinot Noir which was fantastic and one of our new favorites. The oreo desert was to die for!Anyway, I cant say enough about how much we enjoyed this place and it takes a lot to impress me. Thank you Bandera!

37.description: I would give 0 star if I don't have to give them at least one on Yelp.  Me and my gf waited for over 40 mins. I had a reservation at 7:30pm. We didn't get seated until 8pm. No apology whatsoever.  Worst come to worst, service was a disaster too.  After we finished our  iced water, no severs even came to fill it up.  Food was only OK.  All these negatives accumulate, earning this place a solid 0 star (I don't wanna even give them one star). Too bad that this place has such a high rating. More ppl are gonna fall into the trap.  Thank you but no thank you bandera! Won't ever come again.

0.description: This place is amazing. Paying more for the location/ambiance and definitely a good celebration type dinner place. There is a restaurant in lake view, called Crosby's Kitchen, that has basically the same menu, but not as expensive. Bandera is the fancier higher-end downtown Crosby's. Spinach dip, kale salad and ahi tuna salad all delicious.

38.description: This is a classy, cute restaurant with a great location on Michigan Ave. I had been here once before and had a bowl of amazing chicken tortilla soup, so I got their soup of the day today, which was a chicken chili. It was good but the chicken tortilla soup last time was better. Everyone was slightly disappointed with their entrees, especially the lamb sandwich and the veggie burger. I liked my soup and salad so I'm giving four stars and I would definitely go back and try other stuff on the menu!

51.description: Good food and good service.  They lose a star because even with a reservation for Monday lunch I had a 10+ minute wait.  Don't bother coming without a reservation.

27.description: If you're looking for an upscale place to eat on Michigan Ave, this is a good one. It's located on the 2nd floor, across the escalator from a Men's Wearhouse so I had some trouble finding it at first. Upon entering, I was taken aback at first by the candlelit, dark wooden decor, but it was not as pretentious as it seemed. Service was on the slower side, but still attentive and helpful. We started with the Skillet Cornbread, which was amazing - the buttery flaky crust that bubbles over is the perfect contrast to the moist and delicious center. I was also happy with the White Cheddar and Butternut Enchiladas. Portions were pretty large for all of our entrees, so we didn't have enough room for the Oreo Ice Cream Sandwiches - I'll definitely try them next time!

32.description: I've been enjoying my new favorite restaurant on Michigan Ave!  We have been splitting the prime rib dinner (available at dinner time).  The service is great and the water they offer when you sit down is great!

54.description: Amazing food, great portion size, staff was exceptional, amazing jazz band playing. Perfect date night!

48.description: My cousin and I had lunch here for her birthday!  The place is kinda hidden if you're looking for it on the streets...easy to miss! -- it's next to the men's warehouse. The place is really nice inside, candlelight setting. Food was really good...I had the fish of the day and my cousin had a cheeseburger and we were both very pleased. My favorite thing was the mashed potatoes!!! It was unlike any I've ever had, very flavorful! Cocktails were $10. Definitely recommend for a nice lunch/dinner.

44.description: Beautiful atmosphere, live jazz, and great service.  Be sure to make reservations though, or you will have a ridiculously long wait for a table like we did on our last visit.  Not sure the food is worth that kind of wait (2 hours--seriously), particularly is a great food town like Chicago with plenty of other options.  I had the BBQ ribs on this visit--tasty, fall off the bone tender.  The sides were decent.  Our waitress was outstanding.

24.description: Waiting for a table on Saturday night sucks! Don't bother unless you've either got a reservation or three hours to kill.

7.description: If you've been to a Hillstone restaurant in the past you've already been to Bandera. This is essentially a Houston's with a few different menu items and Southwestern inspired art. Having said that I enjoy Houston's and I'm happy to see the same Ahi tuna salad on the menu at Bandera. Service was good and the live jazz music is big plus. I've only been late in the evening so I can't comment on peak hours, but given the restaurant's second floor rather than street level location it may be safe to assume that this is slightly less touristy than other restaurants in the area.

49.description: LOVE IT. My boyfriend had been planning a date for weeks during our vacation/business trip in Chicago. He raved on and on about the excellent menu choices, a signature dessert, and the thing that swoons me away the most, live jazz. Main Entrees: Bandera met all those expectations and more. I ordered the daily Fresh Fish with Lemon Butter (the one that comes with crispy rock shrimp, broccoli, and mashed potatoes) and it hit the spot! My favorite part of restaurants and dishes is where there is a variety of tastes and palettes, which this dish definitely had. My boyfriend ordered the tri-tip & butternut white cheddar enchilada (we always taste each other's dishes). Very tasty and the meat was perfectly cooked and the enchilada wasn't too cheesy or filling. Delicious and zesty sauce. I would order this next time! Dessert: Then the dessert came and of course we made room for the House-Made Oreo Ice Cream Sandwiches. Never had anything like it and this dessert immediately jumped onto my top 5 of desserts tasted over the years. You could practically hear my boyfriend and I raving over this dessert and how great it tasted. Definitely something to come back for! Ambiance/Service/Music: The service was excellent. The waiter was friendly to when I realized they forgot to accommodate to an allergy (scallions in the mashed potatoes), and brought out a new side dish right away, scallion-free. The waiters cracked jokes to us and made it a good time. Music came out halfway into our dinner and even though we were sitting right next to the band, I was still able to carry on normal level conversation over a glowing view of North Michigan Ave's bustling streets. Tip for ambiance, no athletic wear or shirtless sleeves. Since this surprise date included trekking 5 hours prior in Chicago, we dressed for the exercising and were slightly under-dressed. Was still seated but will keep this in mind for next time! Overall: An excellent experience and date and I seriously applaud my boyfriend for finding this place. Not only was the food delicious, but it was complimented by great service, classy music, and a true ambiance of the city. Will need to return once in Chicago again!

40.description: We loved the Food and live music the first time we  went to Banderas. However, on our last visit we had an unpleasant encounter with the bar manager who refused to accept our foreign id's although this didn't appear to be An issue on our previous visits. Apparently, tourists are not welcome in this restaurant.

53.description: Bandera is an amazing restaurant- perfect for both lunch and dinner. First of all, I absolutely love the atmosphere. It's cozy and quaint. And although it does get busy, there are usually enough tables during lunch time to be seating quickly. And for the food- it's delicious. I've had both the Macho salad and Ahi Tuna salad and they were incredible. The dressings had great flavor and everything was so flavorful. Can't wait to try more things! (Like their famous cornbread )

30.description: We went here last night for our Anniversary and we will definitely be eating here again. We had a few mishaps with the table not being ready, and with them being out of a few of the things we had ordered. However they were incredibly gracious and ended up taking care of our entire meal! Our Server Emily, along with the rest of the staff we encountered were all very nice and attentive. The food was delicious and their Crisp Martini is my new favorite cocktail. 5  stars and a big thanks to Emily and the rest of the staff that made our anniversary dinner so perfect!

46.description: Hands down the BEST service I've ever had. The staff was very professional and friendly from the moment we walked in the door. A big high five to Nikki (sp) who took great care of us the entire night.  Great food, great ambiance, great service. I had the filet and based off how good it was I would have easily been comfortable paying 75 bucks. We will definitely be back to visit this awesome restaurant!

1.description: In regards to my previous review two nights ago, I have had a complete change of heart in my opinion of Bandera management, specifically the general manager, Amanda. Following the unfortunate incident I experienced last night, Amanda did everything she could to remedy the situation and sincerely apologize. She assured me that she had no knowledge of the construction workers plan to work through the night, and that it won't happen again. She was professional and kind and incredibly generous in compensating for this incident. When the construction continued through the following night, she was kind and thoughtful enough to put me up in a hotel for the remainder of the week. Her actions in this situation prove me wrong in my initial impression of the values that back Bandera. This seems like an incredible restaurant under great ownership. If the customer service is anything like Amanda's, I recommend you all to check out Bandera. Previous review:Unfortunately, Bandera is my neighbour. My review speaks to the character, integrity and basic human values of the Bandera ownership. Bandera shares a building with a residential condominium, and to avoid doing their kitchen renovations during business hours, or to maximize their time for renovations, Bandera is inconsiderate enough to be BREAKING CONCRETE, hammering and redoing floors and ceilings in the middle of the night. I will be going to work on 3 hours of sleep because of this. They have no regard for the law as this is not legal, and police complaints were made tonight. I'm sure they have good food, but why support a business that has no consideration for the law or others?

55.description: The center of table is brightly lit, our food was dimly lit. So two of the three of our party consumed undercooked chicken. Management did nothing more than state they cook by temp and assured it was safe. Nothing like 3 days of being sick. What I did eat tasted like rotisserie chicken at any grocery store. The cornbread was better going down than coming up. Never paid so much to get so ill.

9.description: Perfect ambience, great place to meet with friends or chill with an after work drink. I met up with friends for a Thursday night dinner and got to enjoy some live jazz. The staff were friendly, prompt, and professional and had great recommendations for dinner. I ordered the white fish dish and split a bottle of red wine with my friends. For starters, we tried the duo dip which was unfortunately a tad too salty for our taste. When our waiter found out however, he was quick to recommend a replacement (smoked salmon) and got it for us on the house. So very nice of him! It was definitely a much better option and we were happy. Entrees didn't follow too far behind; my friends ordered the prime rib and prime filet and shared some with everyone - delicious! I was wanting their food by the end of the night. One of my friends was new to the city and mentioned this to the waiter, and guess what...he brought her dessert on the house! Overall, fab dinner experience in a great environment. Will have to return for more of the ambience and that prime filet! Mmmmm.

26.description: Very very nice spot. Came here for midday snack and drinks. Our server was Michele , very attentive, patient and knowledgable. The burger was enormous size (almost like 2 burgers in 1). I tried wild rice vinaigrette and red cabbage from sides all was delicious. Drinks were good too !

25.description: My boyfriend and i came to dinner a few days ago and we read all the reviews here. Based on the reviews, a lot of people recommended the MACHO SALAD. The ingredients are very unique which is why i wasn't sure about it. But i am so glad I ordered it because it was DELICIOUS!!!! I can't wait to go back and order it again :) my boyfriend got the Snake River Farms Tri-Tip & Butternut White Cheddar Enchilada and it was also good! TONS of peppers so be advised! Also based on the reviews here, we ordered the Oreo dessert and it was really good! My boyfriend and i were stuffed after our meals so maybe thats why we didn't (or couldn't) appreciate it much. Love the jazz music and the atmosphere. We will be back!

12.description: Bandera is an amazing restaurant- perfect for both lunch and dinner. First of all, I absolutely love the atmosphere. It's cozy and quaint. And although it does get busy, there are usually enough tables during lunch time to be seating quickly. And for the food- it's delicious. I've had both the Macho salad and Ahi Tuna salad and they were incredible. The dressings had great flavor and everything was so flavorful. Can't wait to try more things! (Like their famous cornbread )

59.description: After quite a long day of flying around the country -- this was exactly what I needed. The live jazz band every night is super chill, and the perfect way to unwind. Only the vegetarian burger on the menu for vegetarians (but it was a DAMN good burger). I can see myself going again on my next business trip to Chicago.

21.description: Awesome service throughout. Great atmosphere. No valet so be prepared to park a block away - will validate for $16 parking. We had the Caesar, pine salads, BBQ salmon and fish of the day - all DELICIOUS, especially the Cajun shrimp! Oreo ice cream sandwich was the best part for my husband - next time we'll try the banana cream pie. Old fashioned was a bit watered down for my taste, but wine selection was good. Very highly recommend.

17.description: One of my friends suggested that we have lunch at Bandera's while I was in town.  It's a Hillstone restaurant so if you've been to Houston's then you already know Bandera.  At least it's from the same American/steakhouse bloodline.We sat in a booth near the front of the restaurant overlooking the Mag Mile.  There were lots of large windows letting in a lot of light.  A large mirror behind our booth made it even brighter.  There were no empty tables in our section.  Despite the fact that it was busy, our server didn't rush us through our meal which was great.I wasn't ready for their Iron Skillet Cornbread to be so good!  They brought it out to the table in a mini cast iron skillet.  It was a Tex-Mex style cornbread with corn and jalapenos incorporated into the batter.  I usually don't like anything but plain cornbread but their version was delicious.I ordered the Rotisserie Lamb Sandwich, thinly carved slices of lamb with roasted peppers and arugula stacked on crusty bread.  I had them take it back to the kitchen and cook it longer.  I am not Team Pink Meat.  I like my meat cooked very well even if it is "overcooked" by restaurant standards.  When it came back out it was still very tender so I didn't need the cup of au jus at all.  The arugula on the sandwich was coated in a light vinaigrette or lemon juice that added a bright flavor.  The side dish Corn on the Cob was buttery with a nice kick from seasoned salt.The convenient-to-downtown location, sunny interior, flavorful food, attentive but unfussy service made Bandera's a great pick for our meetup.

10.description: LOVE IT. My boyfriend had been planning a date for weeks during our vacation/business trip in Chicago. He raved on and on about the excellent menu choices, a signature dessert, and the thing that swoons me away the most, live jazz. Main Entrees: Bandera met all those expectations and more. I ordered the daily Fresh Fish with Lemon Butter (the one that comes with crispy rock shrimp, broccoli, and mashed potatoes) and it hit the spot! My favorite part of restaurants and dishes is where there is a variety of tastes and palettes, which this dish definitely had. My boyfriend ordered the tri-tip & butternut white cheddar enchilada (we always taste each other's dishes). Very tasty and the meat was perfectly cooked and the enchilada wasn't too cheesy or filling. Delicious and zesty sauce. I would order this next time! Dessert: Then the dessert came and of course we made room for the House-Made Oreo Ice Cream Sandwiches. Never had anything like it and this dessert immediately jumped onto my top 5 of desserts tasted over the years. You could practically hear my boyfriend and I raving over this dessert and how great it tasted. Definitely something to come back for! Ambiance/Service/Music: The service was excellent. The waiter was friendly to when I realized they forgot to accommodate to an allergy (scallions in the mashed potatoes), and brought out a new side dish right away, scallion-free. The waiters cracked jokes to us and made it a good time. Music came out halfway into our dinner and even though we were sitting right next to the band, I was still able to carry on normal level conversation over a glowing view of North Michigan Ave's bustling streets. Tip for ambiance, no athletic wear or shirtless sleeves. Since this surprise date included trekking 5 hours prior in Chicago, we dressed for the exercising and were slightly under-dressed. Was still seated but will keep this in mind for next time! Overall: An excellent experience and date and I seriously applaud my boyfriend for finding this place. Not only was the food delicious, but it was complimented by great service, classy music, and a true ambiance of the city. Will need to return once in Chicago again!

5.description: Very good place for a work / business lunch.  It's kind of dark in there, but definitely has a 'fancy' vibe to it.  If you're coming for lunch, get the prime rib french dip sandwich.  I had it a while ago, but I still daydream about it.It might not look appealing from the outside and it might be hard to spot, but the inside and the food is very legit.

3.description: What could you ask for?! A gorgeous white tablecloth restaurant with exceptional food and live jazz band playing in the corner was what we needed! I am gonna be straight up honest with you: go for the aged & season prime ribs. Oh. Em. Gee! I ordered it medium and I can not start to explain the thoughts going through my head as I savored the delicious piece of meat! *insert party music for the stomach*  The brussel sprouts were nice and crunchy; would have liked it if it was cooked a little bit longer. My friend ordered the meat loaf and wasn't too big on it. I like it. It was meaty..if you know what I mean. Lol. It wasn't grounded meat that you couldn't actually taste the texture. The iron skillet cornbread was random...but actually very good! It was even better at the end of the night! Lol

35.description: Went with my friend a couple of days ago when we didn't want to wait 40 minutes at the Purple Pig. We ended up being very glad the PP couldn't take us! The Macho Salad (roasted chicken, mixed greens, avocado, dates, goat cheese, toasted almonds) was delicious!! The only part of the salad I didn't love were the cornbread croutons, but I'm not really a crouton  fan. My friend had the Classic Caesar and soup of the day (Black Bean) and was equally happy. Nice atmosphere, good service - will definitely go back.

19.description: By far the best restaurant in downtown Chicago. Prime location right on the Mag Mile. One of the main reasons we spend weekends in the city is because of Bandera. The Beef Ribs are top notch. Literally fall off the bone. And the oreo dessert is to die for. Great service. Friendly staff. Great location. Awesome food. I have nothing bad to say about this place.

28.description: Macho salad is awesome. I swapped out the goat cheese for a cheddar jack combination. The service is pretty great and they have a really good drink menu. You should definitely bring a small group as the restaurant is really intimate.

45.description: I ordered the chili and corn bread which was yummy! the corn bread comes in a little skillet and its honestly the best corn bread i have ever had. The down fall about this place is the menu options, very limited. I ordered the meatloaf and once i tasted it I had a feeling it was not cooked well. It was too mushy, next thing you know my stomach got really upset.. (if you know what I mean) overall it's okay.

33.description: LOVE this place.  Everyone's in a booth.  Superb soft lighting.  Great food and service.  Jazz quartets or live piano.  Overlooks The Mag Mile.  MAKE A RESERVATION.  It's usually packed.

43.description: I went for lunch and had the Macho Salad.  The cornbread croutons were unbelievably good, and the salad was a true entree.  The salad was full of the ingredients advertised, which I really appreciated.  I also really liked the ambience.  Would love to go back.

2.description: Good food overall. Classic American choices, such as hamburgers, Caesar salad, French dip and chicken fingers. They take easy classics are make them in to fancier dishes. I went with a large group to celebrate a birthday and do not know if I would recommend that. The restaurant presents a fancier and quitter appearance, so loud 20 year olds celebrating a birthday was probably not the best mixture.The spinach and artichoke dip, chicken fingers and the veggie burger are all of my favorites.

18.description: Premise/Intro:A very attractive place with food to go with the gorgeous ambiance.  Located on gorgeous Michigan Avenue you will not be disappointed in this succulent place. Decor:Just plain classic beauty with the layout and hot jazz music. I tell you this place is the essence of Chicago style and feel.  Anybody woild be crazy not come to this place if you're it visiting Chicago let alone living in Chicago.  This place should be on everybody's top 10 favorites list in Chicago Service:Service was great and impeccanke. Everytime I came here it was also sweet and to the point.  Waiters are absolutely the kindest and always curteous. They're one of the reasons why I come to this place. Food/Product:I always get the half chicken with mashed potatoes and vegetables.  If I do a dessert it's the ice cream placed between two cookie sheets and drizzled with chocolate sauce.  Absolutely divine.  I've had friends who have ordered all different things and they always love it  Price:Definitely not bad for what you order here.  It can be typical pricier than the Cheesecake Factory but it shows in their quality of food, ambiance and entertainment for sure. Overall experience/Conclusion:I'd definitely come back here again in a heart beat.  The place is the perfect essence of Chicago.  It resonates style, Chicago flavors and sounds.  A must eat for sure. Enjoy!

41.description: I've been here at least 7 or 8 times for lunch or dinner. The staff is very well trained and managed. Food and drinks are always excellent. Great Jazz. Comfortable dining room. Favorite dishes are the Macho Salad, the Burger (it's huge!!) and the cornbread. Bottom Line: Excellent food, excellent service. Every. Single. Time. Enjoy!!

52.description: Yesterday I visited my all time after shopping spot (been visiting for years) and I just have to say the service was exceptional! A server called off and the restaurant was soooo busy that a manger came out to assist and her (wish I remembered her name) disposition was lovely! She was super accommodating....offering a sample of a dish that I desired but was slightly changed. Who does that? This joint! Then once we got a server, she (forgot her name too) took it to another level. We ordered fries that weren't that great (never happened before) and she sent over 2 orders for us to try. Just over the top service! I so appreciated the level of detail and attention! This is how its done!

50.description: Nice soft jazz. That is all I can say nice about this place! Our last night in Chicago and we wanted a burger. After waiting an hour for a table. They were out of burgers!??!  I had the prime rib at a much higher price, to save the night but VERY disappointed! Well this is embarrassing. The prime rib sandwich was very good and the table was served wonderful cornbread. The hostess came to our table as we were waiting for the bill and informed us that the meal was on the house due to there over site  so refreshing to find a restaurant with credibility!  Please go here you will not regret it

4.description: If you're looking for an upscale place to eat on Michigan Ave, this is a good one. It's located on the 2nd floor, across the escalator from a Men's Wearhouse so I had some trouble finding it at first. Upon entering, I was taken aback at first by the candlelit, dark wooden decor, but it was not as pretentious as it seemed. Service was on the slower side, but still attentive and helpful. We started with the Skillet Cornbread, which was amazing - the buttery flaky crust that bubbles over is the perfect contrast to the moist and delicious center. I was also happy with the White Cheddar and Butternut Enchiladas. Portions were pretty large for all of our entrees, so we didn't have enough room for the Oreo Ice Cream Sandwiches - I'll definitely try them next time!

6.description: This place is just at the top of nice fan Ave, it's not that easy to find as its in the 2nd floor via escalator. Once inside the place looks great , nice selection of dishes to choose from , my favorite so far is the ahi tuna salad. Very refreshing when you want a healthy option or something not too heavy.
