22.description: Love this place!  I've been dining at Bandera almost weekly for the past year and come back again and again.  It's hard to beat Bandera for the ambiance, live jazz, friendly staff, attentive service and great food.  And it's overlooking glittering and vibrant Michigan Avenue.  What's not to love?  The Paul Martin Trio on Wednesday nights is outstanding.  Some menu items definitely worth trying:  the Kale salad, great flavor with a little kick;  French Dip sandwich is delicious;  main menu items BBQ Salmon, Spit Roasted Pork Filet, Prime Filet and Prime Rib are all wonderful.  If you typically like your steak medium rare, I would suggest trying the filet rare-plus.  It's awesome!  And at $42, including two sides, it just might be the best deal in Chicago.  As far as sides, the sautéed spinach, mashed potatoes or braised red cabbage are very nice compliments to the meal.  For dessert (if you still have room!), the Apple Walnut Cobbler with a cappuccino hits the spot!  If you're hanging out at the bar, ask Sam, Nicole, Emily, Anna or any of the fabulous staff to make you one of their outstanding Side Cars or Old Fashions with top shelf ingredients and fresh squeezed juices.  They are very busy 6-9pm, so reservations are highly recommended.

15.description: A terrific, trendy spot on Michigan, Bandera (while a little hard to find), boasts some delicious farm to table food. The iron skillet cornbread was sumptuous, filled with jalapenos and cheddar and an easy rival for other cornbreads in Texas. The ribs/chicken combo meal with the coleslaw and fries made for an incredible entree. I believe the ribs exceeded the chicken in tenderness and flavor, while the coleslaw was delicious without being overwhelming. To finish off the meal, the home made oreo ice cream sandwich was suitably epic, with delightful chocolate ganache compounded with crispy disks of oreo and cookies-n-cream ice cream. Needless to say the walk back to the hotel was much slower than the walk to Bandera, but it was easily my favorite meal in Chicago (on this particular trip).

57.description: The review should be 5 stars. Great location, wonderful ambiance (live piano player & guitar) and fantastic food. Our waitress Brittany and waiter Scott were very good. Unfortunately the hostess was rude and disrespectful. Our table felt cold and asked to move to an adjacent table. No big deal plenty of open tables at the time. The hostess/manager? explained that table wouldn't feel any different. My father had walked over to that table and felt differently. She then reiterated her previous statement in a very rude and dismissive tone. We agreed to disagree then said "fine whatever". Hastily grabbing our waters and was clearly or irritated by our simple request. I expected a little more professionalism from the management staff of the restaurant. It's unfortunate to start a Birthday dinner downtown in such a negative way. All that said we all enjoyed our drinks, food and dessert $250 worth with the tip. I prefer to rate a restaurant based on the food because after all that's what really matters. However this review could have been great with a simple "sure no problem". Bummer

20.description: What could you ask for?! A gorgeous white tablecloth restaurant with exceptional food and live jazz band playing in the corner was what we needed! I am gonna be straight up honest with you: go for the aged & season prime ribs. Oh. Em. Gee! I ordered it medium and I can not start to explain the thoughts going through my head as I savored the delicious piece of meat! *insert party music for the stomach*  The brussel sprouts were nice and crunchy; would have liked it if it was cooked a little bit longer. My friend ordered the meat loaf and wasn't too big on it. I like it. It was meaty..if you know what I mean. Lol. It wasn't grounded meat that you couldn't actually taste the texture. The iron skillet cornbread was random...but actually very good! It was even better at the end of the night! Lol

36.description: On vacation here in chicagao and i absolutely loved this place! Highly recommend the cornbread and the homemade ice cream sandwich! Very upscale and classy! I sat at the bar and the hospitality was great! Bartenders were on point!

14.description: I love the atmosphere of this place, which is intimate and fairly dark, with spotlights aimed at the tables rather than the diners. The live jazz is just the right volume, giving the place a supper club feel.The menu is similar to Hillstone's and Houston's, which isn't surprising since it's affiliated. A couple of our favorite starters from there appear here. The spinach artichoke dip is creamy, and served with sturdy tortilla chips perfect for dipping. Also included are sour cream and a salsa with just a hint of heat. House smoked salmon is very smokey, delicate and flaky, served with crisp toast and a mayo and dill based spread.Bandera's Caesar salad isn't for purists, as it uses kale, and the croutons are made from a fairly sweet corn bread. Ours were heavily over-dressed, but when the waitress noticed we weren't enjoying them she immediately had them remade with about one fifth the dressing, and they were much better.A house specialty is the enchilada, which is available with steak or a la carte. It's a bit unusual in that it's stuffed with squash, but is quite creamy, cheesy and satisfying.Much of the menu is given over to burgers and other sandwiches, so the price for dinner and a show can be quite reasonable. Service was super attentive without being intrusive.Waits can be long, so reserve ahead, despite the fact that their reservation system doesn't work as well as opentable.This is definitely a great place for live jazz in a supper club atmosphere.

3.description: Complexions has a new manicurist Girtha Allen. She is fabulous.  I've been going to her for years in other locations. She is professional and always gives great advice for any type of problem.  Her manicures are impeccable, but her pedicures are off the charts.

1.description: Recently came to Complexions for the first time, for a quick upper lip wax. I work down the street and was excited to see a place with such excellent reviews for wax services right down the road. I called, they had an appointment slot available, so that was that. I walked right over. The place is cute and clean. It's on the second floor so you have to buzz to get up to them, by the way. Anyhow, I was taken back to wax room. The asthetichian did her thang. I loved it. It was relatively painful and she knew what she was doing. She was also very very nice. Buttttt, here's the problem. When I went to check out, $15!!!! $15 for 5mins of a lip wax?! Have you lost your mind?? Unfortunately for Complexions, there are a ton of other places in Chitown that I can go to that won't charge this ridiculous amount for JUST a lip wax. Sorry, I won't return.

2.description: This is a hidden gem in the city, better than the big name spas.  Monique is amazing, her facials are top-of-the-line, she uses the best products and is passionate about keeping up with the latest technologies and trends.  Great location.  She also does the best brows in Chicago but the facials are to-die-for!  Relaxing and they TRULY work wonders for your skin.

0.description: Monique is an absolute riot.  Book her and only her.  Waxing, facials, and eyebrow dye are my top experiences with her.  She won't coddle you - if you're screwing up your complexion, she'll tell you.  My favorite quote:  "Christine, you're beautiful girl, don't F*** with your face."  The woman is a master.  The space is teeny but she always finds time to squeeze me into her schedule.  WARNING:  don't get a manicure here.  The chick that did my nails before my wedding shredded them.

28.description: This is my second favorite flower shop.  My mostttt favorite one is in Redondo Beach in Southern California- it's this tiny place FULL of gorgeous arrangements, unique silver ware and antique dishes.   City Scents is like an expanded version of ^ that place.  I like to come in here and stroll around once a week when I'm coming home from class.  Somehow I always find something that I hadn't noticed before.  They have pots, vases, creamy luxurious lotions(they're not spf but they're a lighter base, which i like), candles, one of a kind cards with the most beautiful illustrations, grow-kits, incense, best of the best flowers [they don't have all colors of the rainbow in tacky arrangements.  they have the off white groupings, lavenders, lemons... etc]...... there's a lot to waft, touch, and look at~They're pricey.  Well it's the area, what else would you expect.  At least they do ensure quality.

1.description: Right down the block from home in Streeterville is this cute lil' Ohio Street local florist.They have a good selection of nice fresh flowers of all types...except Birds of Paradise, my favorite. Need to get some of those.They don't have too many ready-to-go vased arrangements. Around flowery type holidays like Mothers or Valentines days they add some more but usually just paper wrapped arrangements for which you'd need to have or add a vase.I'm rarely one for pre-made arrangements, especially ones with "typical" flowers like roses and tulips. Blah! I like exotic Hawaiian looking stuff with colors that pop, no pastel crap for me!So somehow I'm the duke here now and yesterday, a day before Mothers Day '15, I stopped in to do a custom arrangement of non-suckery for pickup the next day. As with an ex-paramour I specified a $60-$65 price range with vase. But this time, unlike with said paramour, they made a nice colorful arrangement but one smaller in size and amount of flowers, I thought, than warranted the $65 price tag, over $70 with tax. I figure vase is about $10-$12, they put several of some type of purplish small orchid in there, maybe $4 a stem, say 5 stems = $20, a few giant marigold looking things, maybe $3 each, and finally 2 pinkish purple things and one yellow pretty flower. It just looks like about a $50 arrangement to me. See the pics anyway and judge for yo'delf!!But all in all fairly happy.

9.description: I was introduced to this gorgeous store by my company who uses it to adorn our office as well as enhance our client's visits. It is dangerously situated around the corner which draws me like a magnet for not only special occasions but random 'pick me up's' for myself and those I hold near and dear. Tachycardia always ensues with their gorgeous, exotic flowers and displays each time I step foot inside. I've been a long time fan and customer and the service and variety are always amazing. This past weekend, I was *that girl* who showed up an hour before closing wanting a spur of the moment arrangement...which quickly turned into 3. Michelle didn't bat an eye and patiently helped me transform three bouquets into tropical works of art, which were all extremely well received. Yes, the finished product/s can easily approach three figures (when you go overboard like me) but the quality, variety, final presentation and ultimately the looks on the recipients faces make it all worthwhile.

29.description: The staff is super friendly and helpful and the flowers always look amazing!  I've gone here a few times and it has become my favorite florist in the city.  The flowers last a pretty long time, smell fragrant, and are picture perfect.  It's worth a few extra dollars to go here if you're looking to impress someone or just splurge on yourself.

23.description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE City Scents...they have an Ohio Street Store and a little shop at the Millenium Train Station that I take to my family in NW indiana...i always try and stop at that little shop if i have time...the flowers are SOOOO pretty and it smells so good.  I usually like to make my own arrangement, but even if its pre-done these flowers last a really long time.  I once got an arrangement for my stepmom, came back 2 weeks later, and they were STILL alive and pretty.  I have to admit they are a bit pricey but every penny is worth it...I am planning my wedding now and I am hoping that I can get them within my budget...i would love to have them do my wedding!

5.description: I have been in this shop before and love their home accessories and their fresh flowers in the store. I have even suggested them to others. I was so very disappointed when I got my flowers for Valentine's Day and they already looked a bit sad. Well, it has been a week exactly and they could be tossed. The roses are pitiful and dried leaves are falling off. Sadly today, a week and a day, I had to throw out the roses because they were crisp and falling apart. Very disappointed in this arrangement. I have to amend my post because today I was contacted by City Scents and after hearing what had happened they provided great customer service and even replaced my terrible arrangement with an arrangement that was fresh and alive. This arrangement is what I think of when I recommend people to use them for flowers. They were very apologetic and I am very impressed with their diligence to make this right. I have posted the new arrangement to show my gratitude. Thank you.

31.description: I ordered from here on the basis of Mindy W's review (and her honest florist review list). Unfortunately, I chose to order online rather than send my fiance to the shop itself to place the order on my behalf. (I couldn't have gone myself as i'm currently living 3800miles away from Chicago right now).Anyway, I had high expectations of this florist because of the glowing reviews. The website was great, the prices were fair, their arrangements looked gorgeous and they deliver pretty much everywhere in Chicago and its suburbs for a very reasonable price- and they deliver very quickly and efficiently too. After some heavy deliberation of which beautiful seasonal arrangement I thought was best suited for my future mother-in-law I chose a small but elegant bunch. However, the reality was not as nice. Sure it was pretty but it was alot plainer (i understand that they have a flower substitution policy but, even so these flowers were below par) and it was a bit haphazardly put together. I haven't lost faith in this florist but I wouldn't ever order online again due to their messy substitution of flowers.I'd love to give these guys a 5- I really think the florists deserve a glowing review- but they'll have to wait til I can come in and actually watch them at work.

25.description: Excellent service (I highly recommend Tiffany who goes above and beyond to make every arrangement simply amazing) and superior flowers make City Scents the premier flower shop in Chicago.

12.description: Save yourself the money and embarrassment of ordering flowers from City Scents.I just received a vase of flowers from City Scents as a birthday gift from my parents in Oregon. I appreciate the thought, but I hope my parents didn't pay a lot for this arrangement! Most of the flowers are: A. Old B. WiltedC. Damaged, orD. All of the aboveIt looks like City Scents put this arrangement together a week ago and stored it in their back room, un-refrigerated, until they got around to delivering it today.As a side note, the black and red balloon accompanying this mostly purple arrangement looks tacky and out of place. So, thanks, City Scents. You put me in the awkward position of deciding whether to lie to my parents and tell them the flowers are beautiful, or hurt their feelings by telling them the truth:  that they got ripped off.*Photos added so you can see what I'm referring to.*UPDATE:  The flowers I received lasted for only 48 hours before they had to be thrown out. I get longer-lasting flowers from my local Dominick's.

37.description: The place has some great seasonal items.  It's kinda expensive, but they have high quality items, and it has a very convienent location to a lot of workers as well as northwestern memorial hospital.  Stop here if you're in a hurry.

21.description: Giving flowers to someone in another city can be daunting. Will they get delivered on time? Will they please the recipient? I have had extraordinarily good fortune finding City Scents, which I have patronized for a number of years. I am delighted to report that their deliveries are always on time. And their arrangements are always beautiful if not stunning. Recipients are invariably pleased and feel honored. Thanks to City Scents, my flower giving gestures have helped me acquire a reputation for good taste. Thank you City Scents!

16.description: I called at the last minute on a Friday afternoon for I needed to send flowers when I "forgot" whose birthday.  And WOW, they quickly told me they are a family owned business for years, and their attitude was nothing but "can do," and they understood the situation giving me ideas to make it all under control.  Laura the gal who helped me took interest in my situation and in the end, they delivered on all fronts where I am very very happy.  Job well done and thank you.

17.description: Could not be easier to work with. A unique request incorporating a personal item was met with open arms and they pulled it off. Great people and easy to work with. They make "scents" to do business with.

10.description: Our organization contacted this business a week and a half prior to our event, we asked if they were willing to donate green clippings so we could make our own garland for the DIFFA (Design Industries Foundation for Fighting AIDS)  Dining By Design Event. The employee sounded delighted and excited to assist us and said city scents would gather greenery over the weekend and contact us when she has a bag for us. After a week of being ignored a member of our group finally got someone on the phone, our group member attempted to assure the donation. The same employee that agreed to this donation handed the phone to the owner to tell us that they did not want to participate or donate any left over green clippings. I feel that this is completely unprofessional & inconsistent for a business. First, If your an employee please check with the manager or owner to assure that donating what you throw away is okay. Making assumptions when it comes to businesses never ends well. Secondly, being an employee and agreeing to a donation that is not approved and then turning around and ignoring the organization for a week till the owner shows up is completely unprofessional. Letting an organization know that your business can not donate as soon as possible is the most responsible thing they could have done, instead of ignoring us to say no.Third, why wouldn't a business donate for a great cause and be recognized for assisting a organization that is participating in a meaningful, not-for-profit foundation that has increasingly brought awareness to society and has actually assisted those with surviving a serious disease. Call me sensitive, but I think that is pretty insensible of a business. Especially when we only what was being thrown away.

11.description: This is a cute flower and gift shop in Streeterville. They have a decent variety of flowers and plants and most recently, a large selection of adorable succulents and terrarium materials. For those that would rather buy a terrarium already made, they have those for sale too (but be prepared to pay a premium).Great shop to pick up some flowers or a small plant to brighten up your desk space or run to for a last-minute gift. Cute selection of decorative mercury glass objects, candles, and vases. They also have great displays so it's nice to walk through for some design inspiration.My last visit I went in for some flowers for a vase at home and the woman was very friendly and helped me find something affordable. She did not try to upsell me and in fact, when I pointed out some flowers I liked, she suggested I not get them because they were not as fresh - appreciated the friendly and honest service! Would like to give them more stars but the flower selection is fairly limited and a little on the pricey side. This is complicated even more by the fact that the pricing of the stems is not always noted. In the summer, your best bet is to go to the MCA Farmer's Market and get some flowers there for a lower price.

26.description: Love this place!  Always friendly & helpful staff.  Beautiful blooms that last seemingly forever, plants, vases - all so pretty.  I come here as often as I can to pick up some long stemmed blooms and have never been disappointed with the selection or the service.  If you are looking to do something in a particular price range they will offer suggestions and help design the perfect arrangement to suit your needs.

27.description: Well they sent me my bear and also included a hand written note apologizing for their error...doesn't really make up for the fact that they screwed up, but it was a nice gesture.

35.description: A beautiful and unique "get well" arrangement was delivered to me by City Scents (apparently, quite soon after it was ordered).  I am not a fan of the color red or the smell of roses, and they were told that.  What they put together was vibrant, colorful, and very well-balanced!  I'm not sure if I felt better, but it certainly cheered me up!P.S.  The "illness" is salmonella poisoning, which I've had for 5 days, including 3 trips to the hospital for IVs.  It was caused by veggie cream cheese (less than one serving) purchased at the Clybourn Panera.  I can't write a review of them yet because I am not well enough to think about food.

8.description: Love this place! Dropped in today to get a bouquet for a fantastic woman who works at The Streeter who really helped us out when we needed. I took my own vase and a sweet woman named Nicole asked if I needed help. I said what I wanted and the price I was willing to pay. Gave her my vase and went off to run other errands. Came back about 10 minutes later to a beautiful display of color and fall for our friend. I was overwhelmed by the talent and easy of which I was able to complete this errands. Any flower that I will need EVER, I will be coming here.

0.description: I'm not a big fan of ordering flower arrangements through websites - generally the options are FTD arrangements that anyone could put together by looking at a photo. These people are professionals with creative minds, so why not let them use their talents to create something special? On four or five separate occasions, I've called them up and given them a price point with the only specification being "throw some roses in there." Every time, they've knocked it out of the park! I really appreciate knowing that a City Scents arrangement is always going to show up fresh and beautiful.

20.description: I think this flower shop is beautiful and have gotten flowers there before, and they are gorgeous. Today, I just stopped in to get a few cards, and the customer service was just terrible. I walked in, two employees were talking to each other, neither one acknowledged me as I walked in. I looked at the card rack for a few minutes, made my selections, and went to the register to find no one there. All employees were upstairs - no one decided to wait around for me to choose my cards and take my money. Let alone ask if I wanted flowers or anything else. I hear talking upstairs, wait for a few minutes, then I ring the bell on the counter. Someone comes down to ring me up. Before the transaction is complete, she gets on the phone saying, "sorry, what was the delivery address?" and proceeds to work with the person on the phone prior to completing my simple transaction. While I'm waiting, a nice man walks in, asking to speak with a man by name, and he is given a very cold response from another employee, as though she is gate-keeping for the owner. Overall, not a warm, helpful environment. I will not be going back, which is unfortunate, because it is very close to my office, and I have gone there before for flowers for coworkers on various occasions, as well as to bring flowers home for myself.

19.description: I needed a couple of last minute bouquet arrangements, and ended up at City Scents as plan B. They didn't have many bouquet arrangements prepared to choose from, but I just told the lovely lady my price range for each and who the recipients were, and she prepared two wonderful bouquets. I'll definitely pay them a second visit in the future.

33.description: Beautiful and creative every time.We've order fresh flower arrangements for parties, centerpieces for dinners, birthday flowers, etc.  City Scents does a terrific job.  I'll typically ask for a few certain types of flowers and a color scheme.  They'll build beautiful arrangements around my requests.  Once the order taker ignored my color requests.  I called when the flowers arrived, they apologies for the mistake (new person on the phone) and within a few hours we received a replacement arrangement.  I am more than satisfied with City Scents.  I'll endorse them to anyone.  I want everyone to use them so they stay in business and keep providing us such great flowers.

2.description: Most of their flowers seem fresh and they have a variety of interesting vases and small gifts. There are some flower stems and grass that appear to have leaves with about 1-2mm of wilting or with cuts in the leaves. Their holiday decor is beautiful and I enjoy walking past to see what they have on display each season.I came in here while I was in the area to buy a vase and flower stems for decor. The staff seems to introduce the expensive stems first, but that could also happen because the more expensive stems are just 'nicer' flowers. The staff could be more friendly and they seem to do their best in attending to many patrons who walk in the store for window shopping. The staff also appears knowledgeable about different flowers and what they may be used for. I appreciated their suggestions in pairing different colors together and adding in certain leaves to the bouquet.The vase and 2 flower stems were all wrapped up, which I thought was really nice of them to put in the time to do that, but I wonder if next time I can just ask for no wrapping so it doesn't go to waste since I'm using the vase of flowers right away. I'm glad they put water in the vase and they told me how to take care of the flowers when I asked. Thanks!I'm glad there is a flower shop in this neighborhood, although I wonder if there are any others I may not know of yet.

34.description: I work with this floral shop on a regular basis. No, they are not perfect, but then again, who is. They have a nice variety of flowers and the staff is usually nice enough to put together a bouquet for you at the price of your choice. What I really love about this store though is the "extras". They have the cutest vases, jewelry, candle holders, pillows, and wall hangings. These are great to buy to treat yourself or to add a gift to your flower arrangement.They don't do the most modern or unique designs, but I love the convenience and the price is right too. Check them out. More than likely you will not be disappointed!

32.description: Maybe I am spoiled by New York where you can get a decent variety of flowers on almost every corner...... I am never impressed with their selection. Sure- it is better than the Dominicks around the corner (why are there so many carnations and roses anyways?)  but every time I walk in I am hard pressed to come up with a decent arrangement (yes, I prefer the DIY)  It also seems like they put their leftover almost dead garbage out for walk-ins. Almost everything I have bought from here dies waaay too soon (less than a week). Maybe they do a better job with bouquet orders and delivery but I don't think I will ever find out.... They are typically pretty nice and apologetic for their lack of a selection though.  They also have plenty of non-fresh flower cute decor stuff too but skip the fresh flowers from here.....

18.description: Beautiful and creative every time.We've order fresh flower arrangements for parties, centerpieces for dinners, birthday flowers, etc.  City Scents does a terrific job.  I'll typically ask for a few certain types of flowers and a color scheme.  They'll build beautiful arrangements around my requests.  Once the order taker ignored my color requests.  I called when the flowers arrived, they apologies for the mistake (new person on the phone) and within a few hours we received a replacement arrangement.  I am more than satisfied with City Scents.  I'll endorse them to anyone.  I want everyone to use them so they stay in business and keep providing us such great flowers.

13.description: I sometimes wish I took more time to share some of the excellent services in the Chicago area. City Scents is truly a stand out when it comes to my experiences with sending flowers. I have used them on more than one occasion and they have wowed me each time. I have never visited the shop and have done my shopping online. They list a photo of what the flower arrangement might look like. In a world where commercials portray food that looks nothing like the actual product, City Scents exceeded my expectation when seeing what they had delivered. The flowers were so fresh. I sent them to my girlfriend who called to tell me that people were coming from all over the office on her floor wondering what the incredible smell was. The most important aspect was how amazing she found them when she received them. She was showing me some unrelated pictures on her smart phone when I noticed she had taken 5 or 6 different pictures of her flowers. In her words, she was stunned and overwhelmed at how pretty they were and how great they smelled. She wanted to capture the moment with pictures. Lastly, I won't list when my special request was because I don't want them to be burdened with similar requests, but I did ask for some special consideration when I called in the 2nd order. They were completely accommodating and even made some suggestions to enhance the experience. Business can be so focused on volume and getting things done so they can move onto the next order. I am thankful I have a go-to for flowers with a business who is focused on their clients and producing a product that exceeds expectation. Thank you City Scents!

4.description: After a nightmarish experience with 1800Flowers, which I will never use again, Theresa at City Scents Flowers saved my day by accepting an order/delivery at 4:50pm (an hour and 10 minutes before they close) and she said she would have my order delivered by 6pm. Their selection is amazing and I cannot say enough about the service Theresa provided. I will use City Scents Flowers again. It is too bad that service like this is hard to come by anymore. Thanks again, Theresa!  An easy 5-stars for City Scents!

24.description: Super disappointing. Used to be my go-to florist. Now not. Not just indifferent, but awful. Asked for a simple red-white striped carnation bouquet for valentines -- the most basic simple thing -- what was delivered was purple, smelly, and turned brown the next day. And - it cost tons. Even worse than calling FTD. Avoid it.

6.description: Always beautiful flowers that last.

22.description: I needed to grab a few hydrangeas to supplement our bridesmaids bouquets, so I called City Scents the morning of to put 5 stems on hold. I even said to the salesperson, "Is it okay for me to put these on hold and then come look at them, even though I might decide not to buy them after all?" And she was like, "Yep, sure, no problem." Whew!When we got there that afternoon, we were able to "borrow" some of their flowers (the ones we had already ordered online) to make mock-up bouquets and decide what flowers we needed. The price was medium ($45 for 10 lush stems of flowers), and the setup was pretty and easy to browse.One note: when we visited, the entire block had some construction and scaffolding over it, so we had to ask a passerby where the store was. No big though.

15.description: Very cute and quaint floral store in Streeterville. Nice arrangements, fresh flowers and great variety of vases. The decor changes every so often and the store is very inviting while keeping up with the trends.

7.description: While their customer service skills (over the phone) could use improvement, their flowers are usually very good.  The size of the roses are huge, and make a great impression.

36.description: These guys were a life-saver for me a few times, because THEY'RE OPEN ON SUNDAYS!  I'm not aware of any other local florists who are.  Thanks, City Scents!

30.description: CityScents is more than a flower shop, they have wonderful home decor items that are always artfully displayed.  You can walk in and pick up some super fresh (vs. ick grocery store flowers) buds and they always will create some fabulous arrangement in a snap.  This is my favorite place to visit when I'm in the North Michigan Avenue area as I'm a decorating junkie and you can always find something interesting to pick up and am addicted to some of their candle lines.  I also chose them to do my wedding flowers and had a blast working on some concepts, but lastly left it up to them and was thrilled with the outcome

3.description: Would use this florist EVERY TIME!

14.description: I needed to grab a few hydrangeas to supplement our bridesmaids bouquets, so I called City Scents the morning of to put 5 stems on hold. I even said to the salesperson, "Is it okay for me to put these on hold and then come look at them, even though I might decide not to buy them after all?" And she was like, "Yep, sure, no problem." Whew!When we got there that afternoon, we were able to "borrow" some of their flowers (the ones we had already ordered online) to make mock-up bouquets and decide what flowers we needed. The price was medium ($45 for 10 lush stems of flowers), and the setup was pretty and easy to browse.One note: when we visited, the entire block had some construction and scaffolding over it, so we had to ask a passerby where the store was. No big though.

3.description: I stumbled upon this branch of Cosi when I was checking out the new LYFE Kitchen restaurant that just opened. This Cosi branch opened in December 2014. Their ad for "pork banh mi" pulled me in but then I ended up ordering the Korean BBQ Pork bowl instead. It wasn't bad. The flavors were there with the gingery soy dressing and I liked the fresh spinach but nothing more to write home about. The original flatbread that came with it was really good.I discovered there are two entrance/exits to this place. The front/main entrance is on Ontario St. but if you go on Eerie, right next to Stan Donuts and through the Northwestern Building, you can access the back entrance without having to open/close door. Perfect if you got a stroller or if you're in a wheelchair. Next time I'm definitely trying the pork banh mi; although using flatbread in place of a French baguette is questionable, I'm willing to give it a try.

1.description: Never been here before so had to stop in and give it a try. Love a good sandwich shop. Warning! Plan on eating again as soon as you walk out the door. If you have any money left. There were two of us eating. The meal consisted of two sandwiches, two drinks and one soup. Came to roughly $30. Hey, if it's good, I'll pay more. Watching the employee make it, carefully placing a thimble worth of chicken, a sad leaf worth of romaine and a tiny swipe of dressing. It quickly became apparent that I made a mistake dining here on an empty stomach. The sandwich was good tasting, but so pathetically unfulfilling. I basically just spent $15 for a child's lunchable. Decent tasting food but way overpriced for what you get. As soon as I got home I raided the fridge and made myself a second dinner. That's just wrong! No reason to try Cosi again. Sorry.

2.description: Wow. I think I may have found my new favorite fast-food breakfast joint! Cosi is delicious! The squagles are absolutely perfect! Made fresh daily, and always so moist and doughy in the inside and crunch on the outside. I ordered the Cosi Club Squagle on a jalapeno cheddar squagle and I was floored. Price point is also reasonable. Quick and easy.

5.description: This review is based on this specific location and not the food in general. I will never come back to this place during the winter months. Whoever designed this store did not take into account the Chicago winters because anytime the door opens, the entire restaurant is subjected to a huge gust of Chicago winter wind.Also, they have a long way to go to get this place in smooth running order. The line process is stupid to be divided up and food takes for-ev-er to come out. Even the employees at the registers were saying that the wait times were unacceptable. Then, the seating is stupid too. If you're planning to dine in, skip this location. It's a poorly designed mess.

6.description: I'm glad to see Cosi open up near work - another nice option for lunch in the area.  The Flatbread Melt sandwiches are my favorite.  Their mac n cheese is really good, too.  You really cant go wrong with anything on their menu.  Great service.

7.description: A-OK. They recently opened at this location and definitely need more time to develop a system. Definitely a nice addition to the Northwestern dining options though!

8.description: More like 2.5 stars, but because I love the chicken pesto sandwich, it gets the bump.Pros: Nice location, the chicken pesto sandwich (not the melt, see below, but the sandwich) is incredible, everyone working here is really nice, every time I walk in, the guy baking the bread (who is right there when you open the door) always says hello. The restaurant is new, modern, and clean.Cons, 2 issues:1. I've eaten at different Cosi's prior to this one opening, and I love the chicken pesto sandwich. I order it pretty much every time. One time, when I ordered from this restaurant, I got a hot/toasted version of the same sandwich, except replace lettuce with what seemed like a half pound of melted cheese. Disgusting, horrible tasting sandwich, not one which I ordered before. I went online to further examine the menu, and i see there is a Pesto Chicken Sandwich (cold, with lettuce, yummy!) AND a Pesto Chicken Melt (warmed, with the cheese, horrible). 4,5 times i've been to this location, when I clearly say "I'd like the Chicken Pesto Sandwich please" they immediately start making the melt.The Employees don't know the difference! It's so frustrating to be so clear in ordering something so good, but you can count on them messing up each time. Even when I take my sandwich to the cashier to pay and they ask what I ordered, I tell them, and the register says "melt". These workers don't pay attention to what I say, and they don't know the difference!2. They seem to be out of ingredients. A lot. Twice when I ordered the chicken pesto sandwich, they were out of the sundried tomato spread, and instead made a Russian dressing mix (ketchup and mayo) which tasted awful when they asked if I wanted to try it. Another time I went for dinner at 8:15 (it closes at 9) and they were out of grilled chicken- an ingredient used to make roughly 1/4 of their menu items. We walked across the street to potbelly instead.Cosi, I love your chicken pesto sandwich. It's so good. But know that it's not the melt, the melt is disgusting. And please have ingredients stocked more often!

9.description: Very friendly and efficient staff. Salads are great, highly recommend it.

0.description: Well that salad's filling...or maybe it was those Doritos TAPATIOS I mowed down before I came down here trying to eat healthy and shih!I really should cook more but don't so I eat out quite often. So tired of Panera am I...and not really impressed with next door Lyfe Kitchen...that I ventured to this forlorn little spot. It's like an inviting-er Panera. They've got bowls, flatbreads, wraps, melts and SALADS.Look, I'm eating it here. Why are you killing the environment with a big plastic bowl? Make like Panera and serve it in washable plateware. But the Smart Fit full size salad ($8.3) was pretty good. My only gripe was its copious use of iceberg lettuce. That's the detritus of the green leaf vegetable world. The kale made it better. It's got corn, avocado, beans, scallions, chunks of sweet potato, roasted red peppers and a lime dressing that's tasty. Filled me up...or maybe it was those chips. I'd come back.

4.description: Techinically, I am writing this before it opens. Today they had a "soft" opening and everything was free. While free didn't for me, make me want to give it 5 stars, I will give it 4 based on the sandwich I got.First off, I don't know if it was because it just opened but everyone was friendly. I got several "Welcome to Cosi" and people were smiling and being helpful. Even though everything was free, there wasn't long line or a long wait. These guys were quick and efficient. I was in and out in about 7 minutes, and I'd say 2 of those minutes was me trying to decide what I wanted!I ordered the chicken avocado with bacon. He told me they were out of wheat but then a stack of wheat flat breads arrived so I informed him, wheat please. It was given to me on white, but no biggie. the chicken was chicken - big chunks. Same with the avocado, big chunks. This was great because the interior of the sandwich was way more than the flat bread holding it together. Typically when this happens, the bread gets destroyed. However, not here. The flat bread was toasted to perfection to hold all the interior in without breaking apart.The bacon, however, was disappointing. It wasn't crisp and really thin. Had I paid an extra $2 for it, I would have been really upset. Nonetheless the overall sandwich was pretty good.They were also giving away desserts which I did not try. The chips they gave away were standard potato chips. The drinks were standard as well.

1.description: This is a dingy looking Coney Island style hole in the wall. When you walk in you feel like this is the kind of place you only buy fries and other greasy food. It just has that kind of feel to it. It's also a great location close to the Navy Pier and Michigan Ave (kind of between the two). We couldn't find any other cheap greasy food places near by so we came in here. Best part was that there was no wait (it was basically empty).We got cheese fries and mozzarella sticks. The food was cheap and hit the spot. The portions were also large. The mozzarella sticks (not sure if they are frozen or made in house) were surprisingly good. They were crunchy and had all of their cheese contained in them with nothing popping out (I hate when a restaurant gives me mozzarella sticks with half the cheese oozing out of them). The fries were good but a bit saggy due to all the cheese on top. The bathroom was pretty gross so I would avoid it if you can. I went up to ask for a cup of water and the worker grabbed a cup, looked inside it, and than cast it aside and gave me a different cup. It made me wonder how they separate their clean from dirty cups.

9.description: A quick serve greasy spoon with a small bar.  You will not be going here for the atmosphere! However, when you are hungover or you are looking for a quick bite on a budget, you will not find another place like it in Streeterville. Gyros, burgers, griddle breakfast, etc. and grab a domestic or Mexican beer. The prices can't be beat either you can get a meal and a beer for under $10!!!! Like I said a unique find in Streeterville! Oh, if you live close they offer free delivery too!

23.description: Flamingo is an interesting little restaurant that seems pretty out of place in Streeterville.  It would probably be more suited to say, a strip mall or a rural town center.  Nevertheless, its presence is a welcome alternative to all the swanky dining options that line this neighborhood's streets.  When you're sick of paying $13 for a sandwich or salad at Fox & Obel or $6 for a beer at D4, Flamingo is a pretty good place to go to get out of the way of Navy Pier traffic and into the closest thing around to a "dive" restaurant.I have been here about ten times and only ever ordered one thing: the steak burrito.  They do this one up right though; for about $5.50 you get a big burrito full of tasty grilled deliciousness, a heaping basket of fries and a beer.  Then you and your friends can see if you can meet the challenge of "buy four pitchers of beer, get the fifth one free".  This challenge is not advisable and nearly impossible though, given that they close at like 9pm.

5.description: LOVE these guys. I live right next door and I order from them on many a hungover weekend morning. I just call them up, ask for a veggie omlet with hashbrowns and rye toast, and when I come to walk my dog in ten minutes, it's there waiting for me! And it's only $9 for a solid meal.I actually was eating this on my building rooftop the other day when a guy stopped me and said, "WHERE DID U GET THAT? That's EXACTLY what I was craving this morning!" and I said, "Flamingo! Right down there!" and pointed to it from my roof.The guy's mouth dropped to the floor. He said he always assumed it was a shitty place, because it doesn't have much decoration and its on a little strip with a nail place and a dog food place. But I told him some of the best stuff is hidden. And that they are so polite, clean, friendly, and quick there. I love that it's kind of a hidden gem, but I hope more people go there to give them business because they deserve it!

25.description: Flamingo is out of the way which is good and bad. It's a nice break from the crowds of people a few blocks away, but kinda out of the way for what it is. Flamingo isn't going for anything special it is a burger / hot dog and fries kinda place. For being a burger place they have a large menu - they have patty melts, tacos, and pizza puffs. Many of the items have a combo meal with them that comes with fries and a drink. My favorite part of this was that you could either get a 20oz pop, or a 12oz beer with your combo. I ended up getting the fried polish combo with an orange soda. The polish was decent, I think its pretty hard to mess up something like that. For what it is Flamingo does it well, personally I could get the same food a lot closer to work so its going to be hard for me to make it Flamingo again.

12.description: Ok so seriously this place has nothing "great" or ground breaking food to offer. However, it is a SUPERB local bar, the bar tenders here are great and so are the customers. This is a great place to go if you are looking for a cheap drink and maybe catch a game. I'm so glad that this place is near me in Streeterville because there are not a lot of cheap options around here!Oh and if you live in the building, they deliver.

21.description: *YUMMY TACOS Y BURRITOS  *JARRITOS SODA  *LOCATION *FRIENDLY *FULL BAR *I've only had their tacos and burritos and they are very good considering it's a burger type restaurant. (I'm from LA so Mexican food has a special place in my heart :P )This place has sooo much potential~! If i could I would highlight their mexican food and stay open a bit longer (late night taco craving). They probably wanted to make it family friendly and cater to Navy Pier tourists passing by. But since i've never seen this place busy I think they need to switch it up.The workers and owner are Latinos, and I just wish that they would go with their roots cuz there are enough hot dog/burger spots in Chicago.Prices are decent as well :)

16.description: Honestly it seems that I kick myself a lot, and my rear is sore yet again for not trying this place sooner.  I got a cheeseburger combo which comes with a massive burger topped with lettuce, tomato, pickle (BIG SLICE), and grilled onions, plus ketchup and mustard, a big pile of fries, and a 20oz pop, or if you're not working (or maybe if you are) a 12oz beer.  Beer on lunch break?  Hooray!  All this for less than the price of a large soup at stupid Fox and Obel.  Damn you Fox and Obel for bleeding my wallet dry for years, I hate you.  Anyway, and this is only because I am crazy, there is a reason for my minus one star.  Here goes.  I apparently have some control freak kitchen issues.  I knew this.  I also like bloody meat, so every passing minute that my burger was still on the grill was sending my delicate psyche into an uproar.  I wish I couldn't see them cooking my burger because it was seriously starting to give me a panic attack worse than the ones that David got in Six Feet Under after he was attacked by that crazy guy in the hoodie.  Luckily, the guy finally pulled my burger off the grill and it came out surprisingly unburnt.  Now maybe I can afford therapy with the money I saved on this lunch.

17.description: Flamingo is a great spot in Streeterville.  They've picked up much of the neighborhood crowd from CND closing down the street.  Their food is GREAT and really affordable.  The brothers that own the place are very friendly and go out of their way to accommodate everyone. It's a must for people headed to the lake or Navy Pier!

10.description: Restaurant update:Please read my prior review for full details including pro's and con's of the restaurant. I went here for a quick lunch with my wife and ended up realizing again that the prices for the combo meal were quite high compared to other lunch choices here. I ended up with the philly steak combo which was cooked well with cheese, shrooms, and green pepper. A bit on the small side and falling apart. The french fries came with skin on and cooked fresh. All and all 10 dollars with get you a meal with a drink either beer or soft drink. I believe the prices are on the higher side because of the added option of beer with your meal. Otherwise I will try other restaurants in this area before coming back here for lunch. On the plus side they have quite a extensive menu from burritos to burgers so if you are looking for a grease joint this might be the place! FYI I also scanned in the menu this time so you can see the specials and cost of everything on the menu.

11.description: Pleasantly surprised- tasty beef tacos and big juicy turkey burgers.across the street from a dogpark on Grand ave- clean small- tables and chairs with two counters- to the right the grill- straight ahead the bar. I ordered to go from the grill. Standard fried food menu- gyros fish sandwich fries tacos burgets hot dogs. Reasonable prices. Not greasy tasting and fresh and quite good!!!

26.description: Honestly it seems that I kick myself a lot, and my rear is sore yet again for not trying this place sooner.  I got a cheeseburger combo which comes with a massive burger topped with lettuce, tomato, pickle (BIG SLICE), and grilled onions, plus ketchup and mustard, a big pile of fries, and a 20oz pop, or if you're not working (or maybe if you are) a 12oz beer.  Beer on lunch break?  Hooray!  All this for less than the price of a large soup at stupid Fox and Obel.  Damn you Fox and Obel for bleeding my wallet dry for years, I hate you.  Anyway, and this is only because I am crazy, there is a reason for my minus one star.  Here goes.  I apparently have some control freak kitchen issues.  I knew this.  I also like bloody meat, so every passing minute that my burger was still on the grill was sending my delicate psyche into an uproar.  I wish I couldn't see them cooking my burger because it was seriously starting to give me a panic attack worse than the ones that David got in Six Feet Under after he was attacked by that crazy guy in the hoodie.  Luckily, the guy finally pulled my burger off the grill and it came out surprisingly unburnt.  Now maybe I can afford therapy with the money I saved on this lunch.

27.description: It's after Bike the Drive.  We just rode 18 miles.  I needed to drop off my bike at Bobby's.  We were hungry.  My friend had a time crunch (conference call on Sunday).  There was a parking spot with 54 minutes on it half a block away.This confluence of events drove us to Flamingo.  It's not bad.  Kinda dinerish with a little fast food flair followed up with a full bar and an ice cream freezer.  Plus, the prices were great!If you are looking for a greasy spoon type of place with no table service (saves some $$) close to Navy Pier, check it out.  The big screen TV is it for decor, but sometimes that's all it takes.Oh.  I had the eggs sunny side up until I saw that the white part wasn't cooked so he flipped'em over easy, side o'hash browns, and some nasty coffee (stay away from the coffee!!).  Overall, pretty good.(It's 3 stars for me because it wasn't the cleanest place even though it is a dive)

0.description: I used to go to Flamingo with colleagues usually once a week (for years!) when my office was located near there on Fairbanks Court. I have a friend who also used to stop in for carry out breakfasts on the way to the office and I recall his huge omelettes or egg dishes with hash browns and toast that had everyone in the office drooling! Now that we've moved from this Streeterville area to River North I miss it, and we still talk about it! Oh and they serve breakfast all day!Walking distance from Navy Pier, it's a small hole in the wall that seems out of place with the other upscale or more pricey restaurants in the area. Yet I know that it's a welcome addition, due to the type of food and the pricing. Think Greek diner, with burgers, gyros, tacos, burritos, and various other sandwich combos and dinners like ribs. And I MUST mention the BEST Greek chicken I've ever had! I'm not a fan or gravy, yet the brown sauce like gravy that they place over this broiled chicken dish is amazing! It's served with rice as a perfect accompaniment. This dish has been their special on Thursdays for as long as I can remember, and this past summer, on my family's way back from Navy Pier, I led them here. My husband looked at the outside, and knowing my taste, really wasn't expecting much. My daughter was just hungry, and when they both looked at the huge board that's the menu, they were both happy.They still had the Greek chicken! I ordered it, while my husband and daughter ordered a Chicago-style hot dog and a philly cheese steak, and they were both dipping into my plate! The combo meals come with fries and either a pop or beer, and in addition to several tables for dine in they also have a bar and tvs. It's a very low key, dive type place, which I'm sure is nice for the people who live in the area. I loved it for lunch, both dine-in and carry out. The guys behind the counter are always super friendly and strive to make everyone happy. Tomorrow is Thursday, and just thinking about it, I'm going to order the Greek chicken...and drive out of my way...to pick it up for my family! You must try it.

20.description: Flamingo is a very unique place given it's location and reasonable prices. It's only 2 doors down from my office which makes it very convenient for me - especially in February! It's got character - the guys who run it are friendly. The food is your basic large menu diner fare w/ a Mexican twist. The atmosphere is pretty basic but suits the menu & prices just fine. There's even a cute little full bar in the back. It's an interesting spot next to a mani/pedi salon and Streeterville Properties.I grab carryout and bring it back to the office. The breakfast is good and the portions are toooo generous, especially the hash browns. My GOD they give you so many it's insane! I have never been able to finish anything from Flamingo because the portions are so huge. So if you're in the neighborhood, feelin casual, HUNGRY, in a hurry and want to save a few $$$$$ this is the place.P.S. I have heard their ribs are the best -  I would never guess they served ribs let alone that they were the best! A lot of guys who work in the area have raved.. Check em out and yelp it!

19.description: My head hurt.  It hurt beyond 1 Advil, 2 Advil, even 3 Advil.  It all started after eating Flamingo's shrimp basket dinner.  They give you a side of creamy coleslaw, french bread, a heap of fries, and lots of greasy, profoundly deep fried hecka salty shrimp.My brain told me to stop. My stomach started to swell (When are you due? would've been a totally legit question at that point). And my head began to pulsate slowly, loudly.Here's the kicker.  I didn't even eat the bread and coleslaw nor did I finish the fries.  Flamingo's might as well be Voldemort as far as my body is concerned.  Stay away.

2.description: I used to live right above the Flamingo, and I wore this place out. Love the burgers, love the giant omelettes and hash browns, and really love the tuna melt. The guys behind the counter will definitely get to know you if you show up often enough, and conversations with them were always friendly and pleasant. I also have to mention the cups...I'm a sucker for pop in a styrofoam cup. Nothing's better.As far as the bar section is concerned, I never actually saw anyone sitting at the bar. But it always looked clean. I don't make it out to the Flamingo nearly as often as I used to, but it's definitely a place I will keep coming back to.

18.description: Flamingo is an interesting little restaurant that seems pretty out of place in Streeterville.  It would probably be more suited to say, a strip mall or a rural town center.  Nevertheless, its presence is a welcome alternative to all the swanky dining options that line this neighborhood's streets.  When you're sick of paying $13 for a sandwich or salad at Fox & Obel or $6 for a beer at D4, Flamingo is a pretty good place to go to get out of the way of Navy Pier traffic and into the closest thing around to a "dive" restaurant.I have been here about ten times and only ever ordered one thing: the steak burrito.  They do this one up right though; for about $5.50 you get a big burrito full of tasty grilled deliciousness, a heaping basket of fries and a beer.  Then you and your friends can see if you can meet the challenge of "buy four pitchers of beer, get the fifth one free".  This challenge is not advisable and nearly impossible though, given that they close at like 9pm.

13.description: Wow, I've walked pass this block many times and didn't know there was a hole-in-the-wall bar right there!  Alright, here's the lowdown:-Pretty darn cheap eats-Standard grease-joint fare (brugers, gyros, tacos)-CHEAP beer-If you looking for ambience, uh, definitely not your place.Overall, I was moderately satisfied with my chicken taco with 12 oz beer combo for my Wednesday lunch.  I plan to come back every few weeks as the craving hits.

4.description: His place ain't bad considering it's just a whole in the wall on the way to navy pier. Large choice of items including breakfast. Service can be a little slow around lunch hour. Tried the Italian beef for the first time and it wasn't bad. Not too spicy. Tried the hot dog which was pretty good too. Lots of seating and a full bar if you are into liquid lunches.

24.description: I really appreciate places like this in town, especially downtown, but just enough to give it 3 stars. It's your typical burger and fires, Polish, gyro, ribs, burrito, fish, pizza and a bar type place. The menu has just about everything but most if it is fried or grilled, so you know how you are going to feel afterward. CNDs has a better atmosphere and is closer to me, so I'll probably just head back there for grease and beer.

6.description: Ok, honestly- if you want good food and drink, this is the place. No joke, such great drinks and food. No, there isn't a background music that you can jive to but honestly so worth the value here compare to what's around streetervle.

22.description: Flamingo grill is a typical fried greasy restaurant. Where if you want something that can be fried, or is typically at a restaurant that specializes in frying then this place can do it. I enjoy  their grilled ham and cheese sandwich because it is huge. In realty this place is really more three stars than four. The reason why it received an extra star is because it's relatively cheap, with a combo you can get beer or soda, delicious fries,  and it's very close to home. So when I'm lazy it is there to save me.

15.description: Great steak tacos! The rest of the menu is rather large, and includes a vast array of grill-type food, like burgers, fries, onion rings, sandwiches, etc. It's also nice they have a bar, but need to stay open later to get more evening foot traffic. Interior could use a little sprucing up however...

7.description: The Gyro meat was so dry I almost choked on it.  The best part of my meal were the fries.  I don't think i will be giving this place my money again.

8.description: We had an hour to kill before going to see a movie at AMC river east, so we walked around.  We walked past this place and figured they probably were decently priced, so we stopped in for a drink.Draft beers were $2.50, and a pitcher was $10.  My whiskey and ginger-ale was $5.50.  The large basket of cheese fries was under $3.Everyone was happy, and it didn't cost much.The bar tender, and the guys behind the grill were both really nice.The fries were fresh and tasty.If you are ever in this area and want somewhere cheap to go, this is your place.  Too bad it's not open very late.

3.description: This place is right across from our apartment, and is our go-to joint for sandwiches, burgers, dogs and unique daily specials. Most plates are around $8-9 and come with fries and either a "pop" or a 12oz draft beer. Try the Navy Pier Burger with bacon and cheese, nine hot wings for $9 or the tuna melt with swiss on grilled rye. Also a nice little bar for watching games or simply tossing back a few cold ones after visiting the Navy Pier. Breakfast served as well, including an egg scramble with chorizo sausage. Certainly worth stopping in!

14.description: Flamingo is out of the way which is good and bad. It's a nice break from the crowds of people a few blocks away, but kinda out of the way for what it is. Flamingo isn't going for anything special it is a burger / hot dog and fries kinda place. For being a burger place they have a large menu - they have patty melts, tacos, and pizza puffs. Many of the items have a combo meal with them that comes with fries and a drink. My favorite part of this was that you could either get a 20oz pop, or a 12oz beer with your combo. I ended up getting the fried polish combo with an orange soda. The polish was decent, I think its pretty hard to mess up something like that. For what it is Flamingo does it well, personally I could get the same food a lot closer to work so its going to be hard for me to make it Flamingo again.

28.description: Boule Mich W's (dubs)! This Walgreens used to kick it old school, going way back to a time (before you were born) when men wore Old Spice unironically and women bought pantyhose in white eggs. It's gotten a small face-lift recently, I mean, that's appropriate for Michigan Avenue, and other than the fact that it's teeming with tourists who can't seem to take two steps without stopping cold, it's a pretty nice li'l stop for necessities.The doorways are now airy plate glass and there's even a little Fresh Market. The lines have numbers and an automated message telling you where to go. (This is good for the tourists, who like to take directions). I used to hope to run into Dr. Robert Hartley here some day, but the improvements are nice too.

1.description: Right on Michigan avenue, this spot gets a lot of traffic. Lines were long, unfortunately. I needed some ibuprofen though, so I stuck it out.**Seems to be a good spot for Chicago souvenirs!**They actually have a beer cave! Never seen that in a walgreens.The store was a little cramped and crazy, but it got the job done in a pinch.

9.description: This Walgreens is awful. Due to its location, it's always crowded, and with tourists no less so they sit and gawk and don't get out of the way.  I never head to a drug store to window shop, but apparently some do...The new set-up is in large part what makes this Walgreens so awful.  Without realizing it, I was in the cosmetic's check-out line which was 10 persons deep.  When I finally got to the front (one very slow cashier), I asked why a store so large only had one check-out.  She explained that I was in the cosmetic line, not the main line.  Well, I'm no idiot; the set-up is weird and the "front" of the store with multiple cashiers is not located where I expected it to be.  And judging by the long cosmetic's line, I wasn't the only confused customer.

29.description: If you need your prescription refilled, do NOT go here.  The pharmacy staff are the most difficult people.  It seems like they try everything in their power not to help you.  I had an emergency and needed my prescription right away.  I was in excruciating pain and they would not call my insurance to get it authorized.  It was their responsibility to call but they kept telling me that my doctor or I needed to call.  This was not the case, they just didn't want to do it.  Their job is to help people. sick people.  And they treat people with impatience and attitude.  The only reason I went to this walgreens was for the convenient location, but if you can avoid them I would say go to ANY other walgreens.  I have never had this problem at a cvs.

23.description: Great for quickpic snacks, water, etc. Crazy busy place but lots of cashiers

5.description: Great store however I gave two stars because this is a tourist area and they only have one wash room:

31.description: Good location in the heart of Miracle Mile. Convenient location for me, just 1 block from my hotel. Had everything I needed and they have this shopping baskets that turn into pull-carts that make it easier when shopping for a case of water. Customer service was exceptional during each of my visits they directed me to the correct aisles I needed. My only gripe is the teenagers that loiter in front and on entrance way.

25.description: "Can I get a pack of Camel unfil...""Sir you need to wait in line until the buzzer calls you over.""I did, it told me to come here.""I don't remember that, get back to the end of the line.""I just want cigaret--""Get to the back of the line."----- It's a Walgreen's with Kinko's employees. Apparently it's eco-friendly too.

12.description: Staff is so rude and store is ridiculously overpriced. If you can help it go anywhere else. It is insane how rude they are there.

21.description: It's usually pretty crowded since it is right on Michigan and Chicago but they always have a ton of people working the register. They have quite a selection of snacks and touristy things but my best find was that they have Mountain Dew Code Red. I've been searching for somewhere to grab a quick bottle for ages and now I have found it. Hooray!

16.description: Store Review:Quick and fast! I am glad they remodeled the Walgreen in this busy area of Michigan Avenue. There are so many register and the service is quick to check out. Beside that, the shelves are well stocked with medication, snacks, and health care items. You can't go wrong. I would like to say that I have never used the pharmacy, but it must be nice having this right in the heart of downtown for tourist who need medication and other healthcare items.Pros- quick check out, friendly serviceCons- expensive fresh food items, small aislesHidden deals- check the weekly ads for items that have register rewards, you can couple them up with sunday coupons for additional savings. FYI only one coupon per item for checkout (i.e. your coupons can only add up to the amount of items you have)

17.description: I hate this walgreens w/a passion. I wish they would close it down. I dont even know where to start...the old man working in the pharmacy will make my blood pressure go up he is sooooo slow. Please don't ask him to do two things at one time or he'll get confused and move even slower This place is just small and u can't find shit in this store. The cashiers suck.....man "F" this place.

10.description: They had a lot of things, but not the thing I came for, which was a pillow. I knew it was a long shot, though. Also, employees didn't seem particularly friendly and people kept on cutting in line, and the employees didnt mind. But it is very conveniently located.

11.description: Always a line.. always. It doesn't matter if I come here at 3 in the morning or at noon. But.. other than that, a typical Walgreens.

26.description: Store Review:Quick and fast! I am glad they remodeled the Walgreen in this busy area of Michigan Avenue. There are so many register and the service is quick to check out. Beside that, the shelves are well stocked with medication, snacks, and health care items. You can't go wrong. I would like to say that I have never used the pharmacy, but it must be nice having this right in the heart of downtown for tourist who need medication and other healthcare items.Pros- quick check out, friendly serviceCons- expensive fresh food items, small aislesHidden deals- check the weekly ads for items that have register rewards, you can couple them up with sunday coupons for additional savings. FYI only one coupon per item for checkout (i.e. your coupons can only add up to the amount of items you have)

27.description: This Walgreens is as much of a Chicago landmark as Water Tower and Marina City. It's crowded, full of tourists and locals, has everything you could possibly want from bedazzled "I Heart Chicago" t-shirts to smokes, stuffed howler monkeys to snacks to flip flops, and everything in between. There's a new check out lane system, which I liked; it opened up the middle of the store so there's a lot less gridlock. And, now they sell hooch!! How can you not love this place??

35.description: They have everything you need to live, 24 x 7 x 365. Gets a little crowded with tourists during a weekend afternoon, so time your visit accordingly. I do miss the old liquor department, but that's a very small complaint.

0.description: My girl and I just got into Chicago this evening to celebrate NYE. We wanted to get some champagne (sparkling wine) for a midnight toast. All of the local wine stores, markets and even Trader Joes were already closed at 8pm. We were informed that the only thing open in the neighborhood that would sell champagne, was Walgreens. We thought "oh crap, there can't be anything good there." We walked from the Drake a few blocks south and found that that in fact, they had a nice selection of champagnes (Moet & Chandon) & sparkling wines. I saw the warm Moet on a shelf up front. I asked a nearby employee if they had it cold. A moment later, my girlfriend walked up with a nice Napa Brut for about 22 bucks. Just then the employee showed up with the cold Moet for $55. We stayed with the Brut and then noticed the long line. It actually moved thru very quickly and we were out there in minutes

20.description: Super crowded! The line blows you away at times, but luckily they're quite efficient with it and it goes fairly quickly. This is my local Walgreens, and I've come here for everything from toiletries (of course) to wine (they have a small selection of spirits for those late-night hankerings). This is also where you can find La Roche Posay products, which I admittedly use (great sunscreen)

19.description: Do yourself a favor and do not come here, unless you love waiting on line for a ridiculously long time.  I understand I'm from NJ and not the most patient guy in the world, but this place is approaching record wait times.  Part of the reason is that the place is incredibly packed, but it seems like there are a lot of people to just come here to hang out which doesn't help anything out.I was originally going to go with 1-star but I'm giving them the extra star because the place is relatively clean for being in a city.  The shelves were actually decently stocked, too, and you don't always see that.  Still, I'm not heading back.

33.description: Despite the aisles being super skinny, I was able to navigate the store alright & find what I needed.  The folks that work here are also very helpful.  The cashier saw that I was looking for something, so he offered to split a pack of lighters to sell me one - great customer service.

2.description: Whoops wrong Walgreens. Stopped in to this Walgreens to pick up some antacid after eating at Gino's East.  The store was a bit convoluted but over all, other than the wait to find what I was looking for and the rude patrons, it was your typical Walgreens.

34.description: This is my least favorite Walgreens. Yeah, there are too many tourist but in this area you can't avoid them! The way they make you wait in line is a pain and usually someone cuts in front of me. One brat kid working there gave me shit for buying a pack of Camel Turkish Silvers instead of menthol cigarettes. One bitchy lady working there snagged my military ID out of my wallet because she thought my Oregon ID was fake...I was only buying a lighter. One young guy working there laughed at me for buying pain killers and lube, although I have to admit that is a funny purchase! However, I wasn't planning on using them together. Two stars for the store hours. Missing three stars because of the store layout and employees.

32.description: They sell booze now. Game over.

18.description: It's usually pretty crowded since it is right on Michigan and Chicago but they always have a ton of people working the register. They have quite a selection of snacks and touristy things but my best find was that they have Mountain Dew Code Red. I've been searching for somewhere to grab a quick bottle for ages and now I have found it. Hooray!

13.description: Wow! The location of this Walgreens is fantastic! This is pretty much the best choice for weary shoppers or visitors staying in the several nearby hotels for quick amenities.That being said:Customer service was horrible. The guy stocking the shelves knows nothing about the location of the products being stocked, I mean, just tell me that you don't want to help me. Next, standing in line, the clerks take forever to do nothing. They finish up with one customer, then take their swwet time before getting to another customer.They get another star becase I asked the pharmacist a question, and she was helpful.

4.description: This Walgreens is one of the better ones in Chicago. It has a great selection of fresh food, snacks, hygiene goods, medicine, and a full service pharmacy. The employees are nice and even when the line is LONG, the cashiers will not make you wait longer than a few minutes

24.description: This Walgreens is great for:Snacks and bottled waterSmall meals (sandwiches, salads, wraps, microwavable meals)Beer/wineChicago souvenirs (that are less expensive than the tourist shops)Not so good for:Travel-sized health and beauty productsLove how there is a line 15 people deep at 11:00 at night.

6.description: Worst passport photos *ever*. *Ever.* And the woman who takes them with her $79 digital camera then prints them, I kid you not, using the self-help printing kiosks, is rude, rude, rude. Would have gotten more satisfaction out of burning my $15.00.

22.description: This Walgreens is awful. Due to its location, it's always crowded, and with tourists no less so they sit and gawk and don't get out of the way.  I never head to a drug store to window shop, but apparently some do...The new set-up is in large part what makes this Walgreens so awful.  Without realizing it, I was in the cosmetic's check-out line which was 10 persons deep.  When I finally got to the front (one very slow cashier), I asked why a store so large only had one check-out.  She explained that I was in the cosmetic line, not the main line.  Well, I'm no idiot; the set-up is weird and the "front" of the store with multiple cashiers is not located where I expected it to be.  And judging by the long cosmetic's line, I wasn't the only confused customer.

15.description: Hey, do you want to pick up some lip gloss, go grocery shopping, fill a prescription and get some touristy Chicago T Shirts all at the same time? Look no further than this one-stop-shop Walgreens.It's right on the Mag Mile and it's impressively large for a Walgreens. It has everything a normal Walgreens has, plus touristy T Shirts and some fresh food.It can get crowded and that can agitate me. But that's par for the course on the Mag Mile.

7.description: ***This Walgreens is right smack dab in the middle of Magnificent Mile; because of that, you can expect to find long lines here, but they have a lot of cashiers and a speaker system to let you know which cashier is open; many hotels are located in the immediate area so this is a very convenient spot for visitors who have forgotten something for their trip***I am not sure what the parking situation is at this Walgreens.

8.description: The location is awesome, right smack dab in the heart of the Magnificent Mile. The staff are friendly, through they need to stay more focus on their customer rather than chat among themselves. Any and everything I need is right their. Love it!

30.description: Horrid. Full of tourists and long lines. Limited selection and particularly lazy, surly staff (this is even accounting for the general low standards of CVS and Walgreens). 20 minute wait to fill a waiting perscription due to understaffing. The Galter Walgreens is staffed by professionals and is much better.

3.description: I  really hate this store to expensive compare to other walgreens  stores but yhea this is down town chicago $$$$$  always long lines not enough  register open wth ????? Then in the line and someone said cosmetics is open you can checked  out and is the  same s#! $/

14.description: Boule Mich W's (dubs)! This Walgreens used to kick it old school, going way back to a time (before you were born) when men wore Old Spice unironically and women bought pantyhose in white eggs. It's gotten a small face-lift recently, I mean, that's appropriate for Michigan Avenue, and other than the fact that it's teeming with tourists who can't seem to take two steps without stopping cold, it's a pretty nice li'l stop for necessities.The doorways are now airy plate glass and there's even a little Fresh Market. The lines have numbers and an automated message telling you where to go. (This is good for the tourists, who like to take directions). I used to hope to run into Dr. Robert Hartley here some day, but the improvements are nice too.

28.description: I love that they opened up a Jimmy John's closer to me! Sandwiches that hit the spot without making you feel like you've eaten a super unhealthy sandwich.I just had a turkey tom from this place the other day. Simple but solid. Not too much, not too little.They really are fast too!

1.description: I love jimmy johns but this location really skimps on the meat. That makes me sad because they were here in less time than it took me to find my credit card to place the order. Literally 7 minutes from ordering until delivery. Guess double meat is the way to go...

9.description: Super nice staff, stayed open a little past 9 so I was able to get some dinner! I'm a big fan of the unwiches because they are so much healthier! Turkey Tom, no mayo with double turkey and add avocado! Yummy, fresh, dependable, and always up to the JJs standard!

23.description: Jimmy John's is something we do not have yet in LA.  That means when we are somewhere that has a Jimmy John's we have to grab a bite.  I of course ordered a #9 without tomatoes as usual.  I was not disappointed.  I love the bread to meat ratio.

5.description: Holy Shnikes! "Freaky Fast" right on the nose!!! And amazing sandwich!
