Got the Smoked Ham and tried the Italian Night Club and both were incredible!  I don't Yelp that often, in fact not in a long time, and the experience I had here was so tremendous I had to!  Amazing food, FASTER THAN FAST FOOD..."FLASH FOOD"!!! And awesome customer service too! This place makes Subway and Arby's look like snails in the Olympic 100m dash! Like WHOA!!!

25.description: I am a Chicago native who defected to LA for a long time and had yet to try the legendary Jimmy John's. The truth is that each time I visited, there was just so much offered, I never got around to it.So I was anxious to try one in my new neighborhood, near Clark/Division.I have to say it was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had! The staff was so friendly, the place was immaculate, and they have a clean bathroom.And -- they offer this great deal on bread -- I got a couple of loaves for just $.50 each ... it's great to use for all sorts of things. I wouldn't dream of trying to make my own sandwich -- I'll leave that to the pros at Jimmy John's! Oh, and they deliver! That's great to know, too!

12.description: I'm a big fan of Jimmy John's.  I get JJ sandwiches often when on the road because they're inexpensive, easy to eat, and delicious.  #12 no mayo to me is about as good as a basic sub sandwich gets.  But in the future, I'm going to steer clear of this franchise when I need my Jimmy fix.  The main issue was the restroom, which was quite possibly the dirtiest public restroom that I have ever seen.  I'll skip the details in this case, because you definitely don't want to hear them.Moral of the story: come here for sandwiches, and hold it in until you get to a cleaner public restroom.

21.description: It took 7 minutes from when I placed my order online today to when the front desk at my office called me that Jimmy John's had arrived. 7 minutes!!!!!!! During peak lunch hour delivery time! It usually takes longer than that to get an elevator in this building! They REALLY mean "Subs so fast you'll freak"!My order was 100% accurate and I had several modifiers on my sandwich. Their website is very user friendly and the delivery guy was also very engaging and polite. I would DEFINITELY recommend this Jimmy John's to anyone!  Standard Jimmy John's as far as taste and quality---I've yet to have a bad experience or bad tasting sandwich at any of this chain's locations.

16.description: I've never met a Jimmy John's I didn't like, and the this location being across the street from my office makes me love it even more. This has to be the freakiest-of-the-fastest Jimmy John's I've ever been to, even during the lunch rush. Consistently top notch & in and out in under 3 minutes... if only I could say the same for ex-boyfriends. JJ's, you never disappoint.

17.description: Fastest service I've had in a long time. My sandwich was literally ready before I finished my order. Tasted great too. This place is for you if you like good, fast, cheap subs.

10.description: Restaurant update:Please read my full review for a full recap. Jimmy John's continues to be freaky fast and da vito hits the spot. Service demeanor is okay, but the best is the speed of grabbing a meal!

11.description: Order from here often as it's near my work. And the commercials are right, they're freaky fast. Sandwiches are always exactly what I order. Delivery guys are always nice. There are really great specialty sandwiches places in the city but it's nice to have this for quick and cheap

26.description: This would be my second favorite JJ in the greater Streeterville area.  After an awful day at work, there it was, a oasis of greatness ... a bastion of hope.  It was little messy inside, but you know what?  It's brand new, who cares.  Their country club was still awesome, as were the jalapeno kettle chips, as ushe ... plus they had Cherry Coke in their fountain machine.  TRIPLE BONUS!Not only that, apparently, Jimmy Johns has started doing sandwich cards, so guess who grabbed some of that action?

27.description: I've never met a Jimmy John's I didn't like, and the this location being across the street from my office makes me love it even more. This has to be the freakiest-of-the-fastest Jimmy John's I've ever been to, even during the lunch rush. Consistently top notch & in and out in under 3 minutes... if only I could say the same for ex-boyfriends. JJ's, you never disappoint.

0.description: the sandwich was delicious. I got the Club Lu Lu. I opted for wheat bread which is a dollar extra. Added cheese which is another dollar extra so my total was $9.11 for the sandwich alone. No pickles come with your sandwich . I thought pickles were a standard item for sandwiches. You have to buy the pickle and hey will slice it for you. Hmm... I love pickles not sure how much extra that would be.   I think this is rather pricey for a sandwich. Will go back. The items were fresh I guess I just got sticker shock.

20.description: not a lot of choices outside the pre-designed sandwiches, so if you want anything different other than "hold the ___" you should look elsewhere. personally i'm not a fan of white bread and the unwich just is slimy. please guys, get some wheat bread.

19.description: Jimmy John's is something we do not have yet in LA.  That means when we are somewhere that has a Jimmy John's we have to grab a bite.  I of course ordered a #9 without tomatoes as usual.  I was not disappointed.  I love the bread to meat ratio.

2.description: Mmmm. I love Jimmy John's! This particular locations always has fresh subs ready to go. The service is  also super fast. We always get our sub within 3 minutes of placing our order.  I recommend the Porker, Italian and Beach Club sandwiches. Their Jalapeño and BBQ chips are also just as good. Don't forget to add a side of their hot peppers! TIP: Sometimes, they will sell their bread for $1 each. It's perfect find when you want to make your own sandwich at home for lunch the next day.

18.description: I have been in this store several times but use them mostly for delivery.  This Jimmy John's has wicked fast delivery! I live about 4 blocks away and live how fast and friendly their delivery people are.  They either skateboard or bike over here and its always less than 10 minutes from when I place the order online to delivery... and I live in a high rise....the elevator alone takes a few minutes. I totally recommend this location and JJ's in particular. I always ask for the softest french bread they have and they never disappoint.  I love to buy their bread (fresh or day old) for garlic bread or anything that needs this kind of french bread. I had my nieces over for a sleepover a few weeks ago and I was about to order us a pizza.  But we were watching The Cosby Show and saw Bill Cosby's character eating a hoagie sandwich and we ditched the pizza for Jimmy John's....Turkey Tom with extra cucumber for me and turkey skims for the kids. The awesome delivery guy is such a sweetheart... and he was here before the episode was over....it was about 8 minutes!! I love this store!! Highly recommend!  Definitely ask for the bread to be carved out if you still want the french bread taste without as many calories. :)

13.description: Freaky fast and even freakier good! Pretty much a Sunday morning standard in my apartment for their delicious sandwiches (I add avocado to pretty much every one).Even in horrible weather or at busy times, they deliver so fast and are always in a great mood when they arrive! I don't think I've ever had them mess up an order, even with special instructions and additions.About to order some right now actually! Yum!

4.description: I didn't know there was a Jimmy Johns in the area until someone from JJs showed up at work with sample sandwiches at 9:50am. Talk about a savory breakfast! =) Everyone here is super friendly and the sandwiches are actually made "Freaky Fast". I haven't gotten JJs delivered yet, but it's a quick walk away and since they are so fast, I might as well pick it up. The sandwiches here are always good and they never screw up my order, so that is a plus! All in all, it's a well run Jimmy Johns and I will definitely be back.

24.description: OK!When they say fast....  They are SICK fast!  I kid you not, they had my sandwich in my hand before the credit card machine finished printing my receipt.  I mean seriously...that is FAST!I can remember back in the day when I was in Austin and we would get JJ at Town North Nissan, the guys at that JJ were so fast that by the time you figured out where to get the cash from; BAM! they were there!So as for the quality of food, it is GREAT and the people are AWESOME as well.  Bottom line:FAST, Friendly, FAST, Clean, Local, FAST, and Big Smiles!

6.description: Watch out for angry delivery guys on bikes! I eat there because its close to my office. I got hit by one of their delivery guys on his bike on the sidewalk. When I told the manager, he was not interested. Food is cheap but not that good. Not worth getting run over for, that's for sure.

22.description: Jimmy John's is awesome.  I recommend the "slim" menu.  But why,  oh why, is this location not open 24 hours?!  Would be great for some post-Hubbard Street feasting.  Please, consider it, JJs!

15.description: The JJ gargantuan is incredible. Nice mix of meat and Veggies. Jimmy's brother Huey invented it.  The different style bread than what I am accustomed to was a nice change.   A little hard to bite through the bread and the meat without the meat wanting to slide out the opposite side. But. I can live with that.   Thanks JJ's.

7.description: The WORST customer service you can ever get !!!!when i asked the very rude worker at this location after i ordered my turkey sandwich and started to eat it if i can get some hot pepper on the side, she refused and told me to bring back my sandwich so she can open it and add the pepper to it !!! I said are you serious, i am half way through the sandwich?? cant you just put some on the side? and she started arguing with me rudely on this silly subject....I truly think there is a reason why restaurants shut down regardless of the brand name or how successful the chain is, and one of the main reason is customer service. For me and all my friends and family we will make sure no one eats at this location any more. It is really not about the hot pepper, it is about how i was treated, and why do i have to leave that store angry and upset.It is a store run by kids who know nothing about good service. Similar issues happened with a nearby home made pizza location right next to that jimmy john's location and guess what they are closed now and out of business.never paying my money there again, after all it is one of the most ordinary sandwich i have tried.

8.description: Its Jimmy Johns! The food is good and fast. I do not recommend the tuna, go with one of the veggies or turkey seems to be where I have the best luck.

3.description: I ordered a Tuna Sandwich which was delivered without Tuna , a stale cookie and a $2 can of pop.I was forced to eat a sprout and hot pepper sandwich. Do not order from here. Nine hours later I had toxic farts.

14.description: This place was super convenient since it was across the street from my hotel. It is located right next to Jersey Mike's subs so I'm sure they compete for customers daily. I have been to Jersey Mike's, here in CA, so I skipped that and tried Jimmy John's. I walked in around 11ish and was the only customer in there. Within 2 minutes of placing my order the sandwich was ready (Turkey, lettuce, tomato, cheese, mayo, onion?) + Lays chips and a drink for $9. The bread was really good and I enjoyed my lunch. Great job!

58.description: I was looking for a place to sit around and drink while I waited to be seated at Uno..Yelp suggested this place as a "dive bar" it didn't say anything about being a gay bar.. nobody tried to fondle my an-noose and for that I am thankful..this place is very small and hard to find, but not a bad place..I'd go back to kill time again.,..

56.description: Love this bar! Haven't been there a lot, but I'll b back x2. Nice refreshing bar downtown. Everyone's pretty chill. I've been there after work on thurs. the bartender there "Brian" is my FAVE. Was talkin' to him--gave me a FREE DRINK. That cutie is funny and so personable. What else could a girl want? Bet he likes me too. Caught a wink my way. ;) Thinkin' bout makin' this my main place after work on thurs... Pretty good vibe.

29.description: Ok, DIVE DIVE DIVE in the deep end of the pool. You could tell that this place has seen plenty of gin and regret, but I absolutely loved it! The people here were mostly over 30, and really relaxed. They weren't there to impress anyone, just to have a drink and shoot the shit, and I admire bars like this. If you want "go go boys" and dancing (and look I'm in my 20's I enjoy this at times) then stay in Boystown, otherwise give this place a try. CASH ONLY = minus one star. Who the hell doesn't take credit cards? I felt like I tripped and landed in the south for only a moment.

42.description: I'm a fan of dive bars, and this is a hidden gem of a dive bar. My friend and I tried this place out after work one fateful night, and almost walked passed it - it's very nondescript from the outside. We trudged up a narrow flight of stairs and found the smallest bar I've probably ever been to - it's the size of one room. We had some good stiff drinks and had a good time. The clientele does skew older, but hey it's a dive bar! And it'd downtown, go to boystown if you want twinks. The only thing I'd change is that the music was blaring so loud that my friend and I had to yell to hear each other. I'd definitely go back!

23.description: Bartenders seemed drunk and high, constantly running around, changing the music several times a minute. Strong drinks! Not what we ordered, but strong. The bartenders, especially Carlos, have tremendous attitude, meth-driven aggressiveness that threatened to turn ugly. This place used to be a divey downtown gem.

47.description: I never had been so turn off in my entire life!  My encounter with a person here made me want to turn straight.  I almost asked my friend, "Do you want to date me?"  After volunteering for Diversity MBA, Chelsey and I decided that it was time for beer.  I suggested Second Story Bar.  I saw this a week prior, and it was suggested by a new acquaintance.  However, we wanted to know the specials.  So I gave them a ring:Me: Hi, do you guys have any specials today (Friday)?Gay guy on the phone: Hon-eee....everything here is special.Me: No....really?!Gay guy on the phone: Either you come in or not? (click):O :O :OI am horrified.  I didn't have a chance to get the person's name.Me: Chelsey f! this place.  Let's go the dive bard down the road.Chelsey: What happened?  Me: (tells her the story)Chelsey: God, really? Jesus.Me: Yea, sometimes I wonder why I am gay.  And this is one of many people I have to deal with. *rolls eyes*  Some gay guys are worse than pregnant women with morning sickness!!!!  Let's stick to straight bars.

8.description: If you like a daddy bar this is the place for you.  I went here before and it used to have a backroom which is now just another place for you to drink.  Anyway Carlos started his shift and said I was cute he grabbed bottle and offered me a shot.  Then we started to talk a bit.  He asked me for my number numerous times.  Now granted Carlos was the only hottie in the entire bar but from what I heard and read reviews on other online sites he is the biggest Hoe in the bar.   That was confirmed when he kept asking for my number.  I was there on two separate visits and the same thing just a dive bar.

31.description: Dive bar by admission....very interesting entrance where you feel like you are walking up an old carpeted staircase in an old Chicago apartment.  The sign to have your IDs out seemed unnecessary since nobody was remotely looking at us when we came in.  First thing you see is a bitchy sign to "stay off the f***ing icebox."   Very divey in atmosphere: old, falling apart, cheap decor, these things can be quaint in the right setting.   Very SMALL: about 50-60 people crammed into an area the size of my living room, nowhere to sit except in the back by the empty alcohol boxes on falling apart stools.   Might try to come back at a less crowded time.  Drinks were so strong they were hard to stomach and we all only drank half of them.  I will try it again, dive charm and convenience to my downtown location make up for the size

34.description: Looong overdue review as I've been coming here for years but ONLY on Zach's shifts (Wed & Fri)! He is a stick of Latino dynamite, dipped in charm and wrapped in a heart of gold! Was introduced by a local legend and love that it's dark, cheap, non-pretentious, welcoming and around the corner from work. I've had the pleasure of meeting some of the greatest, craziest people I now call friends. Walking in and having your drink being poured, without even asking, while greeted warmly by Zach = instant rockstar smile. Zach's Salted Chocolate Pretzel shots are insanely delicious, and insanely addicting...and this is coming from someone who dislikes chocolate. My coworkers and I often pre-game here and come in a large group. Although there are a few undesirable elements (yes, you Keebler Elf) that I would love to bowl down their steep flight of stairs (for pushing me twice and 2 other girlfriends on 4 separate occasions!?), for the most part, I've met extremely interesting, warm, friendly and adorable people here. The regulars all have their favorite bartenders and are extremely loyal. I will often secretly auction off my hottie friends (gay, curious and straight) to the highest bidder and the bathroom sign always, always makes me laugh... never a dull moment! (Just kidding about the auction...or am I? Lol.) Go show some love, you will have a blast!

16.description: Very small and unobtrusive, I've walked past this place on Michigan Avenue for years and never knew it existed. A tiny spot - maybe 10 bar stools around the bar and a few more along the back counter is all the room you have here, and don't even think about sitting (or even looking) at the ice machine - so the sign says.Second Story definitely isn't the biggest, the best, or even the newest, but I'll be swinging by the next time I need to mingle with my own while shopping the day away on Chicago's Magnificent Mile.

13.description: I made a Yelp profile just so I can write this review with the hope that the management would read this and take it seriously.  Now, if you've read the negative reviews regarding a specific bartender that is frequently drunk off his ass and a complete jerk to customers, they are very true.  There is a specific bartender that works almost every night (and anyone who works there or goes there frequently will know which bartender I'm talking about) who has blown my mind time and time again by how big of an asshole he can be.  I have seen him be extremely rude -- and sometimes just plain mean -- to a countless number of customers, as well as several friends of mine that I have brought into this bar.Normally a douchey/bitchy bartender wouldn't be such a big deal, but given how tiny this place is, the way the bartender acts is actually a very big deal to how good of a time you will have.I used to adore this place.  When I first moved to Chicago I thought this was the best dive/gay bar ever.  It is awesome because they are generous with their booze, everything is cheap, and there is a good clientele that likes to have fun with each other.  Everything is good about this place except for that one bartender.  And the worst part is that he works almost every single night! This bar is a good place.  I do like it a lot.  However, the fact that nothing has been done to regulate the horrendous behavior of one of the main bartenders has forced me to give it only 2 stars.  The fact that nothing has changed despite the numerous reviews by people with the same complaints is pretty pathetic as well.  I'm tired of feeling super awkward when I see the bartender be extremely rude to people that don't deserve it.  I'm tired of bringing friends into this place to have them leave agitated because they were disrespected for no reason.  I should just stop going to this bar all-together, but a part of me always hopes it goes back to the nice fun place that it was when I first moved here.Something needs to be done about this bartender, and the management needs to address the issue.  It is extremely unprofessional.  And given that this bar is a hot spot for gay travelers/tourists who are staying in the loop, don't you think it would be a good idea to give them a good impression of your bar, and the Chicago gay scene in general?  Please do something about this.

11.description: Worst bar ever.  Met at the door by a rude greeting.  Place is cash only (which I knew ahead of time). What decade are we in? Bartender was rude and deaf.  Overall wouldn't recommend it to anyone.  Definitely not suited to the neighborhood it sits in as well.  It's kind of a blemish on the rather excellent  Streeterville landscape.

39.description: Awesome place for drinks.  Never too crowded with it's own dedicated regulars, most tourists and out-of-towners completely overlook this place.I prefer it that way, it's a good hideaway spot to enjoy drinks with friends after work or before/after any even near downtown.  Drinks are strong, bartenders friendly, crowd is nice, music is good.  Couldn't ask for anything more.

37.description: They serve their drinks strong and cheap just how I like my men.  Second Story is a great place post shopping break with the "gals."

0.description: We got stuck in chicago after a blizzard came through and came across this bar on our way back to the hotel. What a hidden gem! Everyone is so nice. Plus the bar tender played Jimmy Fallon skits on TV all night and gave us chips, candy hearts, and stickers for valentines day. Definitely coming back next time I come to chicago. Oh and come on, they have a disco ball!

38.description: What a cool bar! Maybe not everybody's favorite, but definitely with its own character. Drinks are very cheap and of a surprisingly good quality. All in all: Worth a five star rating!

51.description: Random alert!  We stumbled into this pretty hidden little bar while just wandering around looking for drinking establishments.  I'm not gay, but I like a dive of any type and this was fun.  It was hidden and made me seem like I'd stumbled on a speakeasy.  The guys inside were friendly and definitely took an interest in who those random girls were that just stumbled in.  We only stayed for a beer but had a good time in the meantime.  Need a small, divey, cozy place to check out men and have some drinks?  Check out Second Story Bar!

27.description: On my first night arriving to Chicago after many year. Decided to go out. Going this bar on gay cities app. I decided to give it a try since it was close to my hotel. Came to the bar and it was cute, small seem like is was nice to stay. Everything was alright until this Puerto Rican bartender asked my where I was from. I responded San Francisco. The bartender with his sarcastic laugh he responded. Why are you ashamed to say you are F**** Mexican. I think that wasn't right because he didn't even know my full background.  He kept giving me a hard time about it which I found that very racial that even he had to invite other guests to the conversation and they all were having fun of me. To me that was very an respectful specially being like that tours your clients, specially not being locals and not knowing them. Will I come back on my future trips to Chicago? Never!

32.description: I haven't been to this place in well over 10+ years.  Very small and quaint.  Great place to stop to get a drink after work before heading home.  Going on a Tuesday, there were a decent crowd before 10p.  With it being a school night and before 11p,  I am quite sure it might not get that crowded but who knows.If in the area, definitely worth a stop by.

54.description: Great fun on a Sunday night!  Out of town visitor who was made to feel like a regular within minutes of walking in.  Cute and fun bartender Carlos keeps it lively.  Had plenty of drinks and bar bill still reasonable.  Good looking men.  Will be back on my next trip to Chicago.

48.description: Cozy dive bar with the best music in town, and these yummy strawberry lemonade shots. $4 beers!

44.description: First word that comes to mind - random. Second word that comes to mind - fanfreakingtastic. Had some friends in town and they wanted to hit up some bars downtown where they were staying. I didn't expect I'd get to enjoy a gay bar in our downtown bar hopping. Random, but what a pleasant surprise!The entryway (a staircase to, wait for it, the second story of the building) was just begging to have a buff dude waiting at the top of the stairs requesting a password, like "black widow" or something equally clandestine. The bar is super small and super fun. Great music, with sexy videos playing, a row of stools overlooking the busy street below and gays galore. Me like. Very boy heavy, but aren't most gay bars (sigh). I said to my friend, I wish I could find a wonderfully divey little place like this that was full of lesbians. My search continues. The boys are friendly and chatty, which I love about our community. And the bartenders keep things bumpin' and fun. I will definitely be back. It's so tight in there you could go alone and no one would know the difference because the whole bar becomes a party of one. The drinks are bigThe crowd is friendlyCash onlySmall, but cozyEasy location if you are downtown shopping

24.description: I had a great time - however the bartender was drunk the whole time and made fun of my friend and refused to give me change in $1 bills. All in all I would've rated it a 5 except that ratchet bartender who changed the song every 30 seconds!!!!!!

7.description: Omg this place was fun! Welcoming and the liquor TOP SHELF but affordable had a grand time and the BOYS loved me ladies get yo life if a gay man says you're FAB you most certainly are! Baby Got Good Bar

49.description: Zach gave me a delicious birthday shot that tasted like cinnamon apple sauce and was incredibly friendly and fun to talk to.  Everyone was welcoming and great to converse with.  I will definitely be coming back.

40.description: Top shelf customer care from all staff here.  You IMMEDIATELY feel welcomed when you enter the bar.  Super high energy from everyone, no matter what the age.  However... the super star, hands down, is Carlos.  I'm still on cloud 9 and Carlos is the reason!  Amazingly engaging and very easy on the eyes - would love to steal him... for the rest of my life.  Also, kudos to Zack, Dakota and all the other employees that made my trip to Chicago a solid 10!

53.description: Free shots with the bartender. $4 beers a block from north mich ave.  Music videos.  Small, dark, cozy, sketchy, and a gay bar? good times.

30.description: Stopped in before a trip to Second City across the street. Empty on an early weeknight, which was fine by us. Gave us a chance to peruse all the naked art and caricatures on the walls -- imagining what kind of people stopped by and what they talked about in Chicago's purportedly oldest dive bar.

46.description: A friend took me to this place for the first time last week. Walking upstairs seemed so seedy, but inside wasn't too bad. I kind of felt like I was on one of those small-town coming out documentaries on Logo. It's a really tiny bar, but for the most part was fun for what it is. The demographic here was sort of older, but mostly I-just-left-my-office-in-the-loop-so-now-I'm-here-drinking-in-my-suit type guys. Meow.There are two bathrooms in the back with, clutch your pearls ladies, "only one person at a time" signs. I wonder what that's supposed to mean. Adjacently, there is a smaller back area by the bathroom as well, but I would have called that the closet.I ordered a couple sweet tea vodkas/lemonades and they were stronger than what I was used to. Needless to say, I was a little bit of mess the next morning. The bartender there took some time to get our drinks but he wasn't stand-off'ish. And if a hooker ever had famous last words about this place, it would be "cash only".

1.description: Woah, what happened to this place?  I used to come here a lot, but have since moved away.  Decided to revisit for some casual drinks while in town. Bartenders were not friendly at all, and one seemed to be blazing drunk.  Killed the music 4 times in succession to scream "who wants a shot?"  To no response, again cuz I think he was drunk.  He kept killing the music and screaming it until a bunch of people raised their hands.  At which point he started singling out those in the bar with their hands raised, insulting them, and saying "ew, but not you bitch."  On top of that, my bf had his fresh drink spilled 5 seconds after ordering, we were given a filthy soaked rag to clean it up ourselves, and then charged for the replacement drink even after an original generous tip.  So you can insult customers, offer shots to an entire bar for free, but not replace a full drink spilled by accident?  ...gotcha, but I'll go elsewhere.  Really a shame, this used to be a very fun, friendly, chill place to go.

55.description: The beat bar in Chicago!

9.description: The funniest and best bar downtown! Carlos serves up some tasty fun delights for your oral pleasure! He always greets me with a smile everytime I come into the bar. I live out of town and sometimes years go by  before I can get back there and he ALWAYS remembers me, what I drink and always makes me feels comfortable and taken care of!! Love this bar. And love me some Carlos!!

26.description: Very small and unobtrusive, I've walked past this place on Michigan Avenue for years and never knew it existed. A tiny spot - maybe 10 bar stools around the bar and a few more along the back counter is all the room you have here, and don't even think about sitting (or even looking) at the ice machine - so the sign says.Second Story definitely isn't the biggest, the best, or even the newest, but I'll be swinging by the next time I need to mingle with my own while shopping the day away on Chicago's Magnificent Mile.

25.description: Maybe the cunt-iest bartender I've ever met. And I live in boystown!!! Was in the area and thought I'd check out 2nd story. Bartender was clearly wasted and didn't have much time for someone that was not a regular. The bar is a dump anyway. I like dive bars but this one smells like open ass! (And not in a good way).Skip it and head to boystown or Andersonville!!!

12.description: Having a blast ... With great drinks and awesome bartenders !! The Drinks are worth it with an awesome atmosphere:) we will be coming  back

59.description: Describing Second Story Bar is easily done in three words: dingy, sleezy, and rude. The outdated decor and music could be looked over if the patrons, or at least the bartenders, were at least decent. Neither were when a friend of mine visited this place. Immediately disappointed by the atmosphere, we quickly realized we were in the wrong place. I was hit on multiple times by the same two creepy old men. As with any bar, I planned on making a tab when I ordered from the bar. After my friend had walked away after ordering her drink and not paying, I assumed the case was the same here. However, when I walked away, the equally creepy bartender raised his voice and hollered for money, startling the patrons who looked from him to me confusingly. He rudely rubbed his fingers together, indicating he wanted cash, and continued his tyraide about there being a sign that says cash only when I offered my card, making rude comment after comment to me. I was cordial and direct with him, so his obnoxious reaction was unfounded and embarrassing. We still didn't see the "cash only" sign when we left, bewildered and disgusted, after our almost liquor-less drinks. Almost embarrassed to post that we went here.

21.description: A group of friends and I were waiting on other friends to come meet us at this shithole of an establishment and we got kicked out for not buying drinks right away. The bartender was really quick to assume where we were from and pass judgement and to top it all off he yelled and insulted us. I'm sorry but I don't tolerate rudeness. Here's a tip for you, always treat your customers with respect if you want them to come back. It's what keeps you in business.

17.description: Wednesday evening.  Bored, and nothing to do.So I went back to the Second Story for the first time in a few months.  Parked in front, walked up the steep stairs to the second floor as someone was coming down.  Had to wait for them to pass; the stairs aren't wide enough for two people.  They passed, and I continued up the stairs.Enter Second Story.  Carlos, one of the best bartenders (and one of the cutest) was behind the bar.  Now I KNOW I'm going to get wasted.  He pours with a heavy hand and will not hesitate to give you a shot or...whatever.The clientele hadn't changed much since I've been there last...your typical guys there to have a good time, your overserved patrons (more on that in a moment), and then those individuals, like me, just there to chill out, have a drink and some conversation.Usually they don't have any issues there and most people know when to cut themselves off....HOWEVER, the last time I was there a certain individual was there "from St. Louis" (aka Uptown) decided he wanted to continue to put his hands on me and get in my face.  Bad idea.  It didn't end very well for said individual.I ended up buying a round of beer to some complete strangers...having conversation...and making new friends.I'll be back, soon.

10.description: I have been there twice and had a pretty good experience the first time. Good drinks, chill crowd, etc. I went there last night (Tuesday), and things started ok. The bartender was playing his own music, and I requested he play Kylie. He said "I'm gay, but I'm not that gay" in a snarky manner. I stood up and told him I couldn't believe what he said. My friend and I got up and left. Will definitely not go back there. I wish I remembered the bartender's name.

5.description: Yeah, my gin and tonic tasted as though the tonic was mixed with gasoline and Satan's tears. The stairway up to the entrance literally looks like it was taken straight out of a horror film without a budget. The air smelled musty and it was so humid that you could barely breathe. (Or was it just the colognes from the older crowd in that night.) The bartender tried way too hard as well. He had an undeserved sense of arrogance that was really out of place in that disaster which was more like an armpit than a bar. So yeah, I didn't have a good time.

3.description: Used to live in Chicago and this was one of my favorite spots to go. Am in town and was very excited to come back. The charming friendly atmosphere is gone. Was in the bar for under 5 minutes and accidentally spilled my drink after only one sip. Bartender saw it spill and I cleaned it up myself which was no problem and was charged for my spilled drink. Seriously?!?  They don't even do that I'm fancy corporate places. What happened to my favorite hole in the wall bar. Horrible

35.description: Odd Place!  Small, cozy and friendly bar.  It's the kind of place one goes to REALLY drink - but not the place to hang if you want 'eye candy'. The thing that struck me as odd was the bartender. I'm sure he was drunk or high or both. He wasn't unfriendly (when you could get his attention), he was just odd!  The music was okay (2 TVs play with music videos); but Carlos would stop the song/video on a whim because he wanted to move on.  It was just odd.  It's not that I wouldn't go back - but there are better bars (including gay bars) close by; and after trying this bar twice, I doubt I will go back.

19.description: Okay, before reading, note I have never actually been here.So I was curious about their hours of operation, and was just calling in (1:30am, hours say 12pm-2am). I wanted go with some friends for lunch, and was curious if they are actually open that early. That being said, I gave a call. I was expecting atleast an answering machine recording with the hours; or get back office for a host/manager to answer my question (like 99% of all bars in Chicago). Instead I just got an extremely rude employee who just kept hanging the phone up on me (only tried 3x, never again).We live in an age of business where customer service is priority. Your product can suck, but as long as you have good customer service to represent you, people will stick with you. All restaurants train their employees to be satisfied from start to finish to ensure they have to most gratifying experience.I have not been to 2nd Story, and this alone is a reason why not to go. If they don't have the time address me, I don't have the time for them. I understand that it might be close to closing, and they don't want to bother - then they can transfer me to an answering machine. Not hang up abruptly 3x in a row.Second Story, doesn't even deserve a 'second' thought.'

28.description: Looked like an ok place through the wire-enforced glass of the metal door. I came for a quick drink an hour after the scheduled opening time, but there was nobody there. Waited for 20 mins and nothing. Lasting memory will be the sign on the bar fridge visible though the door - "Seriously, get the fuck off the refrigerator." Hardly welcoming - I guess that's what you should expect from a dive bar. Pity.

45.description: Less than mediocre drinks with the rudest bartender. I ordered a Cadillac which he didn't know how to do, once I explained it to him he replied "what kind of fruity sh*t is that" at a gay bar! You'd be better of at the nearby bars, keep away unless you are masochistic and like bad drinks

33.description: Drinks were great right; so consistent. I'll be back to enjoy Jack anytime

43.description: Was looking for a local dive bar after getting tired of the overpriced, crowded place we had been at.  We stumbled upon this bar and didn't realize it was a gay bar; not that being a gay bar would stop us anyway.  We had a great time.  The drinks were cheap and the people were friendly.

2.description: Against my better judgement I decided to give this bar a second chance after we determined it was likely the person I was with was drugged by one of the bartenders several years ago. It was a terrible decision to make. I have never been treated so poorly at any place of business. Not only is the bartender, Carlos, a drunk, but he openly insults guest that he finds imperfect in his eyes. After suffering a direct insult about my appearance and the beer I was ordering, I was denied service for what was a mixute of both apparent imperfections. When I talked to the manager the next morning I was told that I must have misunderstood him, which quickly turned into me being told "i can't take a joke". It is apparent that this establishment, its staff, and its manager have zero respect for those that are not their own. Since this time, it has become apparent to me that most of their patrons find it acceptable for a bartender to be obliterated, treat guest the way I was treated, say they don't remember because we're drunk, and move on with life. This leads me to an unfortunate assumption that their patrons are, indeed, just as terrible as the Carlos and his manager.

18.description: Unless you want to pay $5 for a soda (yes, that $5 for a plain club soda) accompanied by terribly rude service, don't go here.

41.description: Wednesday evening.  Bored, and nothing to do.So I went back to the Second Story for the first time in a few months.  Parked in front, walked up the steep stairs to the second floor as someone was coming down.  Had to wait for them to pass; the stairs aren't wide enough for two people.  They passed, and I continued up the stairs.Enter Second Story.  Carlos, one of the best bartenders (and one of the cutest) was behind the bar.  Now I KNOW I'm going to get wasted.  He pours with a heavy hand and will not hesitate to give you a shot or...whatever.The clientele hadn't changed much since I've been there last...your typical guys there to have a good time, your overserved patrons (more on that in a moment), and then those individuals, like me, just there to chill out, have a drink and some conversation.Usually they don't have any issues there and most people know when to cut themselves off....HOWEVER, the last time I was there a certain individual was there "from St. Louis" (aka Uptown) decided he wanted to continue to put his hands on me and get in my face.  Bad idea.  It didn't end very well for said individual.I ended up buying a round of beer to some complete strangers...having conversation...and making new friends.I'll be back, soon.

52.description: Great place for a quick drink...or three!  Zack is a very friendly bartender

50.description: A gay dive bar at it's BEST! Do you love Lady Gaga, Whitney Houston, and all the other diva-licious hit makers found in every karaoke catalog? Well, SSB sure does! Order from their daily specials and sing along, you will find it difficult to leave upright!

4.description: I'm not sure what happened.  Total dive that's cash only.  What do you expect?  Really small.  It is what you make of it.

6.description: I watched the bartender turn in to a dictator while sitting as a bystander. Kicking people out for no reason, etc. Not a chill vibe at all. I do not recommend this place.

22.description: I found this little gem by chance and was in love the minute I walked in.  The music was great, the drinks STRONG, and the people friendly.  It's a great dive bar that doesn't pretend to be anything but.  Zach the bartender was fun, attentive, and made some mean drinks.  I met some wonderful locals that gave great tips and other places to check out.  If you want something different than the normal Chicago hipster lounge where every drink is a double at single prices, then check it out.  I'll be back!

15.description: Very good atmosphere good local people the owner and bartenders was great. I felt like I was among family and friends great place to relax and the drinks was inexpensive and good. Come to Chicago got to visit.

57.description: I had no idea that there was a gay bar so close to my work, and imagine my surprise, when it's a straight friend who told me about this bar!The place is pretty welcoming and unpretentious, which I like. It's a total dive, which I don't usually like, but I liked it okay here. The staff here are nice and they didn't ignore me like the staff Downtown Bar did. That's a plus in my book.

20.description: I made a Yelp profile just so I can write this review with the hope that the management would read this and take it seriously.  Now, if you've read the negative reviews regarding a specific bartender that is frequently drunk off his ass and a complete jerk to customers, they are very true.  There is a specific bartender that works almost every night (and anyone who works there or goes there frequently will know which bartender I'm talking about) who has blown my mind time and time again by how big of an asshole he can be.  I have seen him be extremely rude -- and sometimes just plain mean -- to a countless number of customers, as well as several friends of mine that I have brought into this bar.Normally a douchey/bitchy bartender wouldn't be such a big deal, but given how tiny this place is, the way the bartender acts is actually a very big deal to how good of a time you will have.I used to adore this place.  When I first moved to Chicago I thought this was the best dive/gay bar ever.  It is awesome because they are generous with their booze, everything is cheap, and there is a good clientele that likes to have fun with each other.  Everything is good about this place except for that one bartender.  And the worst part is that he works almost every single night! This bar is a good place.  I do like it a lot.  However, the fact that nothing has been done to regulate the horrendous behavior of one of the main bartenders has forced me to give it only 2 stars.  The fact that nothing has changed despite the numerous reviews by people with the same complaints is pretty pathetic as well.  I'm tired of feeling super awkward when I see the bartender be extremely rude to people that don't deserve it.  I'm tired of bringing friends into this place to have them leave agitated because they were disrespected for no reason.  I should just stop going to this bar all-together, but a part of me always hopes it goes back to the nice fun place that it was when I first moved here.Something needs to be done about this bartender, and the management needs to address the issue.  It is extremely unprofessional.  And given that this bar is a hot spot for gay travelers/tourists who are staying in the loop, don't you think it would be a good idea to give them a good impression of your bar, and the Chicago gay scene in general?  Please do something about this.

36.description: Came here Gay Pride weekend, perfect timing! Cheap drinks, friendly patrons, chill atmosphere. A cute place to stop by and grab a drink if you're in the area. I had my first Redd's Apple Ale here, so tasty!

14.description: You would probably never know it existed unless someone told you about it. That being said, I'm glad it was recommended to us during our recent trip to Chicago. It was within walking distance from our hotel (if you're not looking to make the trip to Boystown), the bartender AJ was friendly and fun, and the drinks were strong and cheap. It is a very tiny bar, but obviously worth the visit.

58.description: Seriously such good food and even better service! Pai was our server and she was super accommodating to our every needs. definitely would recommend for a first date! Awesome atmosphere.

56.description: The food was awesome. It's difficult to get a reservation on a Friday or Saturday but I guess that's to be expected of a great unique restaurant.

29.description: Met a friend for dinner prior to a movie. We got in around 6pm and there was a minimal wait. Service was fast and friendly but the food was only ok. After placing our order the server returned immediately with two bowls of white rice and placed them on the table and left. The bowls sat on the table for about 15 minutes and were cold by the time we were ready to grill. Why wouldn't everything come at one time? We neglected to mention it to the server. We ordered the steamed dumplings, Kalbi short rib, pork belly and assorted vegetables. The dumplings were probably my favorite part of the meal. They were soft and flavorful. The rest of the meal was average. At the same time, I don't think it's a particularly great value.

42.description: Awesome experience. We got the Geisha dinner. Plenty of food and was very good. Our favorite dish was the fried rice type dish. Finished with s'mores which was very fun. Great value and a lot of fun if your looking for something more than just dinner.

23.description: Wow.   We just drove in from GR MichiganWhat a treat!!  The Kobe was melt in your mouth as was the diet minion.  Service was excellent No WiFi - disappointed thereSake was smooth as waterGreat place to eat!  Ambience very Japanese. Ada Mame  was free!  Woohoo!

47.description: Great service and amazing good. Portions are smaller so consider getting multiple meats per per person. The ambiance is great and the servers are so kind and accommodating!

8.description: I'm from the dc-md-va area. I didn't realize how spoiled we were with our food choices. I may be totally wrong but I am so sure this restaurant is Korean but sells itself off as Japanese. We went to the bar before our dinner. They had a bar special which included one beer or sake with two apps for 9$. Great deal! Their food really wasn't that great.... Spicy tuna was a fried rice ball with tuna on top, poke was under seasoned, shrimp dumplings were okay, calamari was basic, wasabi shrimp had a weird mushy ring between the crust and shrimp. They also had liquors deals too. A few that I remember we're macallan 6$, patron 6$, makers 4.5$... Tell me that's not a steal! Being from the dc area patron is at least 10$ a shot. The food was priced fair but it just reminded me of Korean foods. The cuts, the seasoning, everything about it seemed Korean. I've been to one japanese bbq place in md and it was really different.    This place reminded me of the Many Korean bbq places in Virginia minus half the portion and banchans.Besides the point of it not being authentic, the seasoning just wasn't there. Nothing was good except the hanger steak which was their feb special. We ordered about six cuts of meat and a veggie. I can't remember them all but I think we got hanger, ribeye, short rib, spicy pork (special 3$).. Other few I can't remember. Basically, GO TO THE BAR FOR DRINKS AND APPS specials. skip the bbq. Bbq service was fine. Bar service was whack.. He really didn't want us to be there. I think we just didn't understand chi town.. Not the same feel as were used to.

31.description: Where is the liability waiver? I'm kind of shocked that we didn't have to sign one to eat here. Combine alcohol and a hot grill directly in front of you and you've got yourself a risky dining experience. But, we took our chances and lived to tell. This was such a great restaurant! Go if you love to BBQ and when you want a leisurely night.We had to laugh a bit because there is a sign warning you of the hot grill and to keep your babies off the table...and we still managed to singe our fingers. It was well worth it because it was really an engaging dinner. They kind of trick you because as you are grilling your own dinner, you realize YOU are doing the cooking. Well, that's the fun. Make sure you put the timer on your phone to help you remember to turn the meat, even a couple minutes can quickly pass you by and burn your food. The service is great. They replace the grill grate frequently and add oil so you get the perfect grill each time. We got one of the combos for 2 and it was plenty, almost too much (really it was for a famished couple who haven't eaten all day or a party of 3).Great location downtown, so if you are in the area for a conference, just want a fun dining experience, or want to get your grill on, reserve your spot here!

34.description: My girlfriend and I stopped for a late night snack after watching the Lion King broadway musical at the Cadillac Palace (check out my other reivew, a must see show!). We were staying over at a Marriott property a block away, so it was an easy pick. Also, I was craving some warm soup, as it was a cold night in Chicago. It was pretty packed, however we were seated within five minutes of entry. We started with some dumplings and led in with a couple bowls of ramen. We didn't want to eat too heavy as it was late, so we decided to dine lightly and return another day for the BBQ portion. The dumplings were good, not the best I've had but certainly not the worst. The ramen was also good, again similar to the dumplings, very average. I got the spicy kalbi ramen and the spice level was perfect. My girlfriend got the nagi which was heavily underseasoned, but still good. We will be back for the BBQ, at which point I'll have to update this review, so see you soon!Best,Charlie

16.description: My husband and I came here because we had walked by a year ago and hadn't gone in so this time when we visited Chicago, we had this on our to do list.If you go on a weekend, make sure you make a reservation because it gets super busy. We didn't have a reservation so we ended up waiting about an hour.We got seated just in time to order under the happy hour special. I can't remember what it was called but we got 2 soups & salads, dumplings 4 different meats to grill, one vegetable and rice. The soup, salad and dumplings were okay. There were nothing special about it.The fun part for me was grilling the meat on the grill table. You are able to grill it to your liking. It was very fun & very good.I also ordered s'mores for dessert - it was fun for me to grill the marshmallows on the grill. It has definitely been a while since I had a s'more so that's why it made me happy.We would definitely be back....and try some of the other meats they have.

13.description: This place is amazing - we happened to be in Chicago on our anniversary so decided to have a nice dinner before the company holiday party. Food was great, service were amazing (really amazing and quick) !My husband and I order Samurai set, it was sooo much of good food. Appetizers were awesome, we bibimbap and spicy tuna volcano were fantastic. Meat was fresh and plenty. My only wish was that we did not have too much filing before the meat came so that we can enjoy the meat a bit more. Food is a bit costly - $50 each person !

11.description: My group of twelve came here on a Saturday evening for dinner. We couldn't get reservations for a party this big so we put our name down around 5:30 PM and went to check out Magnificent Mile (about 5-10 minutes walk) during our wait. We came back an hour later and still had to wait another thirty minutes for a table. So, we made our way to the bar area of the second floor and grabbed a few drinks. We didn't get seated until close to 7:30..and since we had such a big party, they had to split our group anyways. Once we got seated, we quickly ordered the Meat Lover's package ($170) for six people (even though we only had five people at our table #fatties4lyfe). This package is a lot of food for five starving people but surprisingly, we were able to finish everything! My favorites of the night were:+fried bacon chips: so yummy and just melts in your mouth+filet mignon+chicken basil+shrimp garlicTo be honest, they were all really yummy! The service was fantastic! The servers taught us how to cook each item as they brought it out. They were punctual with changing out grills and refilling our waters and clearing our plates. A good way to wash down your food is with a few sake bombs and Sapparo. ;)The total came out to about $50/person but for that much food and fun, it was worth the splurge!Definitely would come back for the HH deals!

39.description: Came here for some warm food~ Was in time for happy hour. Looks like a good variety of food. Will call more friends to come again~ The premium rib eye steak were amazing. The service was good but slow for that hour. Great vibe. Would like to try again~

37.description: always a fun time to hangout here. love the beef

0.description: There's gotta be crack in their sauces b/c this place is addiiiiicting! The menu is extremely diverse and can be overwhelming b/c there are many options. But you can't go wrong by sticking to the staples which are the grilled meats/veggies and sukiyaki bibimbap - my absolute faves. I could have 3 of those rice bowls. The best grilled meats are toro beef andkalbi short rib, which just melt in my mouth. The best way to use the sauces is by mixing the 3 together and drenching the meat in them. I'm salivating just thinking about it. The kimchi chigae is pretty tasty, too. Service is always top notch, super attentive staff. On a side note, i've been to the new Gyu in West Loop. Service is not up to par compared to this one. The servers normally scoop out all the sukiyaki bibimbap rice into our bowls so it doesn't continue to cook and get burnt in the stone bowl. But ya, that's exactly what happened there. Burnt sukiyaki rice was no bueno.Warning: there's ALWAYS a freaking long wait. Stay sane by making yourself a reservation beforehand.

38.description: Grab a friend (or five) and head over to Gyu-Kaku on an empty stomach - the social ambiance and experience of cooking your own food is something everyone needs to try at least once!This place is all about the fun of picking your meats/vegetables and cooking them to your liking. That being said, everything we tried was super tasty - we ordered pretty much every type of meat offered, as well as broccoli, mushrooms, and sweet potatoes (yum!). Don't forget to go for the bibimbap appetizer as well - they let you specify how spicy you want it, and it may have been the best bibimbap I've ever had.I'll be sure to come back here again soon, as I hear the dessert is also good and I have yet to try it. Great food and excellent experience!

51.description: Went upstairs to the bar which serves a limited menu, not the full BBQ menu. I was in a rush, so this is no fault of the restaurants. The bartender was extremely helpful andwas very friendly. My ramen was delicious, but honestly I don't know about ramen. I was glad to have someone explain the types to me. Will return.

27.description: Nice restaurant. The food is nice but expensive and sort of tiring to eat actually...  because of the yakiniku sort of style of cooking stuff and all. Sauces good. Not much to say. Cozy warm atmosphere. They have Japanese newspapers there to read.You get free edamame sometimes. I don't know why... which is fine. I can't eat edamame though. They have fun specials and menus that probably more or less get you to spend a lot but kind of remind me of Japanese-style menus with specials and lots of promotions and the like.

32.description: Best Japanese grill, great service, fun vibe reasonable price, good for group what else do I need

54.description: Who doesn't like to have some grilled meat and a hot noodle soup during a cold winter day. Heard this place for a long time. We came by around the lunch hour after an event at the Navy Pier. The waiting time was around the half hour. It was kind of tortur sitting there with a hungry belly and smelling the wonderful grill. Need to remember to make a reservation next time.The services were actually great. After the ordering, the food came out pretty quickly. The ramen noodle soup was pretty good but not the best one I have ever tried. The noodles tasted like home made and chewy but the soup wasn't the best. The grilled meat was great however I was not good with the grill.The price was reasonable for lunch. I definitely come back with someone good with the grill.

48.description: I LOVE Korean BBQ.. so I was excited to try this.We ordered the Geisha Course - for 2 people... this includes starters: edamame, fried gyoza dumplings, gyo-kaku salad, miso soup, sakuyaki bibimbop, BBQ Items: filet mignon, premium sirloin Tare, bistro hanger steak miso, pork belly shio, chicken basil and assorted veggies (onion, corn, zucchini, mushrooms), and dessert: s'mores.... we ordered garlic noodles in addition.  This was fantastic!  Everything was amazing - I am not a huge fan of chicken (yep, odd.. I know), but it was fantastically marinated.  And the service was truly amazing!  They are very attentive while not being intrusive.Everything comes out so beautifully presented and they separate it in front of you onto two plates.This meal is the perfect choice for a carnivore and vegetarian meal - it's hard to find that balance, and this definitely did it with both of us being stuffed.This was such an enjoyable meal and a great experience!Definitely recommended!

44.description: I liked it but don't really understand the big hype. My recommendation is to make reservations!!!

24.description: Chicago has been known for pizza for decades. After eating here Chicago will forever be known to me as the place that introduced me to Korean BBQ.

7.description: This place had me all sorts of excited and it delivered pretty well. You sit around these long tables (shared with other people if you don't need the whole thing) and while you're technically sitting on the floor, your feet go down into an area under the table. You take your shoes off before entering the eating area, too, so wear socks or make sure your pedicure is fresh if you have feet fears. The meat portions are pretty conservative...one or two people's worth but they tell you that up front and encourage you to order various things to grill. That's right, grill. On the table in front of you. Yourselves. It's pretty fun and you can cook things how you like. Each item doesn't take too long to cook, but it's designed to be a lengthy and enjoyable meal. Not the place to go if you need in and out. Make a reservation, for sure. **tip: you have to take your shoes off before entering the eating area so plan for your feet accordingly. Also, check with the waitress for any special social media promotions they might have. Example, the promotion at the time I visited was that you could receive an order of edamame when you showed that you follow them on Instagram.

49.description: Tasty and very inexpensive. We came here twice while visiting Chicago.

40.description: I really cannot understand why this place's rating is so high. The soft drink (sprit) tastes like disinfectant. The price on the menu seems very decent in Chicago downtown. But the dish size is super small. I bet my dog need 3 dishes to full. We ordered 2 appetizers, 4 dishes of meat, and sweet potato for vegetable. After we finished all the fish, we still felt so hungry. Then we ordered 2 blow of ramen. The ramen seemed so fantastic, but when we saw the food, I mean really?! So off from the menu picture! Where were my boiled egg? Where were my veggies? The ramen noodle is instant ramen, not the fresh one! The ramen ONLY have noodles, green onions, and 2 piece of meat. And yes it is 9 dollar. Guys, this place is fun for cooking the meat by yourselves, but the food is not worth the money! I have 2 stars only because the waiters are super nice.

53.description: I've always like the concept of cooking your own meat and ordering as you go.  This was my first time trying Gyu-Kaku.  Seeing the consistent 4 stars vs the 3.5 stars here in California, I decided to take my husband and sister here.  I would give it a 3.5.  Planning for lunch, surprised to hear they have happy hour at this time!  A lot of the meats and appetizers were $1-3 cheaper.  They also had set combos and lunch specials but I decided to just order what I liked. I ordered quite a bit.  They have a top ten list.  The first one on the list wasn't so good.  It was miso marinated and too strong to my liking. I like the marinaded kalbi and spicy chilli dumplings. The filet mignon was ok.  The spicy ramen was pretty good. The garlic noodles were ok. Lets just say it fell short of my expectations.  They were packed around that time!

30.description: Great place for parties, birthdays, big groups. Food is simple and healthy but fantastic. Wine not bad and it's super interactive. Been here 3 times now and love it. It's also very reasonably priced especially for this area. Service a little slow but very accommodating. If you haven't checked it out, do it! Great value, great time.

46.description: Bacon chips and steamed dumplings are my favorite items on the menu. That being said, everything we have ever tried has been delicious. On top of that the service is always on point. Have celebrated many events here and at different locations and there has not been a lapse in food or service. The only downside is that they don't seat you until you ENTIRE party is there. So if you have friends who will be late for their own funeral, I suggest telling them to be there an hour before your reservation. Please open locations in Oak Brook and/or Schaumburg, as well as on the Big Island and Kauai

1.description: I love the idea of this place, and I think it's kind of fun to cook on the grill at your table! However both times I have been here the service has been kind of a let down.  The first time we came without a reservation. The place was super busy, and we were told there would be a 45 minute wait. We thought that wasn't too bad and went to wait it out in the bar. It was actually closer to 90 minutes before we were seated, and even after that our service was incredibly slow.  The second time we came I made sure to have a reservation, but this was apparently no guarantee and we still ended up waiting about 20 minutes for a table.  When we were finally seated, the service again was disappointing. Our server was not particularly attentive, and it felt like he was rushing us through the meal. We ordered the Samurai Meal for two. Our server told us that they were out of the Dorayaki ice cream that the meal was supposed to come with, and asked if he could give us the s'mores dessert instead (a dessert served with the cheaper Ronin meal). We asked if we could have the chocolate lava cake instead, and he said that we could have one lava cake with some ice cream. This seemed fine so we agreed.  The food came out kind of piecemeal and in fits and starts. When it was finally time for dessert we were brought s'mores and ice cream. The ice cream tasted like the cheapest grocery store vanilla. It was getting late at this point so we just left it - but still disappointing. In spite of all of that we still managed to enjoy the dinner, as I said there is something enjoyable about cooking your own meats on the grill in front of you.  However  since you are cooking your own tiny cuts of meat on a table grill, you definitely shouldn't expect an amazing high quality meal. I think this meal is most analogous to the Melting Pot. It's fun, but it's not the best thing you'll eat at a restaurant. I definitely recommend the fried rice though! It's called Sukiyaki Bibimbap and its amazing.  This place can definitely be a fun date spot - it's a fun experience and it's also near the movie theater.  But just be prepared for the meal to take a long time!

55.description: We came here Friday night for my boyfriends birthday party with 12 people and I must say I was incredibly impressed. The only reason they're not getting 5 starts is because we got sat a little after 9:30 and our reservation was at 9. But the meal and service definitely made up for it. They brought us up to the third floor where we took of our shoes and were seated at a low table with seats on the floor but there was space for your feet to hang so you weren't super cramped. When you have a party of 10 or more they have you pick a large party course, since 2 of our guests didn't eat meat they were able to order a la carte while the rest of us ordered the matsuri course. Every single thing that they brought out was amazing, from the soup and salad to the filet and chicken and shrimp. There was so much and it was all sooo good! We did have some issues with our grills but it wasn't a big deal, it certainly wasn't slowing us down. The dipping sauces were also amazing, my favorite was probably the spicy one. And for dessert they bring out marshmallows on sticks with Hershey's and graham crackers to make your own s'mores. It was such a good deal and a really fun experience for the group to do together, we already made plans to come back for New Years! I can't wait!

9.description: This was my favorite place we dined at during our most recent trip here. I loved the short rib and skirt steak. They were mouth watering!Each table has a mini BBQ stove in the middle so it was very easy to grill our food.Four of us split the shogun dinner for four which came with soup, salad, rice, and a variety of tasty veggies, seafood, poultry and meats. I was stuffed by the end. It was plenty of food. It also came with s'mores which was a fun way to end the meal. Our waiter was attentive and knowledgeable which made our experience enjoyable. And I enjoyed the atmosphere as well. This is a great place for groups and I can't wait to come back!

26.description: One of the main reasons to come is the bibimbap well, don't bother. Dry, uninspired.  I go to the LA location all the time and this, I guess suffers from lack of fresh I guess.  Anyway.  Awful

25.description: Good portions and nice prices. Had the Lunch combo with Skirt Steak and Toro Beef, comes with a small house salad (#yummydressing), miso soup (HOT and lovely), CUP OF RICE - made it perfect! Ordered garlic shrimp, pig belly, and one more toro beef.. finished off with their yummy Tokyo tower cocktail, Choco Lava Cake with Green Tea Ice Cream and Mochi Green Tea Ice Cream Filling!!!

12.description: Gyu kaku would be a nice place to try if you are new to traditional Korean or Asian food. It's a nice alternative if you are looking for korean bbq in loop, but it isnt the best korean bbq place I've tried. If you're lookin for authentic Asian food, then this is not the best place for you. Plus, I came with my friends and the waiters were keep forgetting about us. It may be cause we were in the third floor and they were busy, but it was still a little disturbing.

59.description: Inexpensive restaurant that offers good food and service. Only drawback is the wait even if you've a reservation.

21.description: Need a place to take out of town guests or have an interactive meal?  This is my go-to for that. The food is very good - not mind altering, mind you, but consistently high quality. But most importantly, it's just a really, really fun time. I'll be back, probably several times.

17.description: Nice restaurant. The food is nice but expensive and sort of tiring to eat actually...  because of the yakiniku sort of style of cooking stuff and all. Sauces good. Not much to say. Cozy warm atmosphere. They have Japanese newspapers there to read.You get free edamame sometimes. I don't know why... which is fine. I can't eat edamame though. They have fun specials and menus that probably more or less get you to spend a lot but kind of remind me of Japanese-style menus with specials and lots of promotions and the like.

10.description: Ok had class. Wanted food so I GOT IT. Yum meat!Rly into uh the. Meat I love meat. When I come to a place like this I rly think about all the meat I can get.You got porkYou got Beef You got stomach you got . No chicken actually hmmYou got beef.I had a bunch of beef I cooked it myself it was GREAT!  We almost set everything on FIRE!Yum what a good fun time I rly loved when.I put all the sauces in my tray too.God my waiter was so hot like RLY he had such a defined buttocks I don't even understand.  Sometimes I dream of a bigger neck but what the heck I could just rly work towards my goals ya know?Kept getting burning oil flung at my face.4/5

5.description: Was ok.  We did the meat lovers and it was a lot of food.  I think for me - I like going out to eat and have someone cook for me.  Maybe this just wasn't a fit for me.  I would suggest ordering some vegetables to go along with all of the meat.

3.description: Met a friend for dinner prior to a movie. We got in around 6pm and there was a minimal wait. Service was fast and friendly but the food was only ok. After placing our order the server returned immediately with two bowls of white rice and placed them on the table and left. The bowls sat on the table for about 15 minutes and were cold by the time we were ready to grill. Why wouldn't everything come at one time? We neglected to mention it to the server. We ordered the steamed dumplings, Kalbi short rib, pork belly and assorted vegetables. The dumplings were probably my favorite part of the meal. They were soft and flavorful. The rest of the meal was average. At the same time, I don't think it's a particularly great value.

35.description: For anyone looking to try something new and are in to DIY restaurants, then this is a good place to try. The service was fast and efficient. They get you seated, teach you how to work the grill, explain the food choices, and how long you should cook each food item, all within a couple minutes. I came during happy hour and ordered the Samurai Special for two which comes with starters, followed by the meat courses and assorted veggies, and finishes with a nice dessert. The appetizers were delicious. Specifically the Spicy Tuna Volcano and the Sukiyaki Bibimbap. The main meat courses were great as they were marinated very well and were quick to cook. Two stand out meats were the Kalbi Short Ribs and the Kalbi Short Rib Tare. The meal ended with a cute dish of S'mores that sounded odd but ended the meal on a good note.I will definitely be visiting this place again!

19.description: Where is the liability waiver? I'm kind of shocked that we didn't have to sign one to eat here. Combine alcohol and a hot grill directly in front of you and you've got yourself a risky dining experience. But, we took our chances and lived to tell. This was such a great restaurant! Go if you love to BBQ and when you want a leisurely night.We had to laugh a bit because there is a sign warning you of the hot grill and to keep your babies off the table...and we still managed to singe our fingers. It was well worth it because it was really an engaging dinner. They kind of trick you because as you are grilling your own dinner, you realize YOU are doing the cooking. Well, that's the fun. Make sure you put the timer on your phone to help you remember to turn the meat, even a couple minutes can quickly pass you by and burn your food. The service is great. They replace the grill grate frequently and add oil so you get the perfect grill each time. We got one of the combos for 2 and it was plenty, almost too much (really it was for a famished couple who haven't eaten all day or a party of 3).Great location downtown, so if you are in the area for a conference, just want a fun dining experience, or want to get your grill on, reserve your spot here!

28.description: The selection of food here is decent. The food my family and I ate that evening was just OK. The meats are supposedly seasoned? I could barely taste the flavor of any of our meats. Maybe I came on a busy night and the meats they had left must've been marinated for just about 30 minutes before serving. It's a great atmosphere here. The staff here are really friendly and helpful. They guide you on how long to cook a certain meat you choose. The last part to the dinner is dessert. I really enjoyed it, it's really cute. S'mores! We as a whole group was roasting our marshmallows. It was fun and really nice. Overall, I'd come back just for the s'mores fun, but if they can season their meats a bit more; i'll be back. Also, the prices for their food is reasonable priced; not so high as other BBQ places.

45.description: This was my favorite place we dined at during our most recent trip here. I loved the short rib and skirt steak. They were mouth watering!Each table has a mini BBQ stove in the middle so it was very easy to grill our food.Four of us split the shogun dinner for four which came with soup, salad, rice, and a variety of tasty veggies, seafood, poultry and meats. I was stuffed by the end. It was plenty of food. It also came with s'mores which was a fun way to end the meal. Our waiter was attentive and knowledgeable which made our experience enjoyable. And I enjoyed the atmosphere as well. This is a great place for groups and I can't wait to come back!

33.description: This place is amazing - we happened to be in Chicago on our anniversary so decided to have a nice dinner before the company holiday party. Food was great, service were amazing (really amazing and quick) !My husband and I order Samurai set, it was sooo much of good food. Appetizers were awesome, we bibimbap and spicy tuna volcano were fantastic. Meat was fresh and plenty. My only wish was that we did not have too much filing before the meat came so that we can enjoy the meat a bit more. Food is a bit costly - $50 each person !

43.description: Came for an early dinner on Sunday afternoon and found happy hour from 3:00 to 6:00 PM.  Most everything was a couple bucks off the regular price.  The highlights were the steamed dumplings in chili oil, kimchi and of course the Japanese BBQ.  The salmon was on of the best salmons we've had.  Also recommend the NY Strip, beef bacon, chicken and Kalbi.  Overall a family of five ate a great dinner for less than $100.  Only wish there was wine on the happy hour drink menu... Not bad enough to take a star.

2.description: I went there on a weekend and it was very very crowded, so make reservations before you go anytime!! I arrived a bit early with a friend so we had to wait at the bar. Our bartender was fantastic. He suggested a sparkling sake...it was their special for the day or something (It was called Banzai Bunny and was sweeter to taste than most alcohol). He told us everything from the history and origin of sake, the makers of the one we ordered and was very hospitable in general. We were seated in a cosy booth in the top floor and ordered the "Samurai for 2". Do note that the lighting is dim on this floor, so ask to be seated downstairs if you don't like that. But it does make for a warm, romantic vibe if you want that. If this is your first time at a Japanese BBQ, they give you instructions on how to make your meal so now worries! My favourite part of this meal was that they served us in perfect intervals - I didn't have to wait too long or rush on anything. Even if you're not an avid beef eater (like me), don't let it hold you back cause its marinated and well done here. Don't leave the meat a few seconds more than their suggested time because it toughens the meat. Don't go to this place for a solo meal or in a group larger than 4-6 people. Get the Green Tea Mille Crepe for dessert for sure if you like Matcha, its great. Get the Bibimbap instead of the noodles. If you get separate plates of meat to grill, avoid chicken because it doesn't grill well and was honestly the worst part of my meal. If you get a set, don't order separate plates to grill until mid-meal or after the set is over because for most, it should be enough. Also, they have valet parking and if you're staying there past 10pm (when their valet closes), there's always parking space on the other side of the street! I think the price range is more $50/person (without alcohol).

18.description: Very delicious bbq. Definitely one of my fav bbq place. Come for happy hr makes it even better

41.description: Pretty good food. Good service. Their tongue is the best. On the pricier end, in my opinion, for what you get, though.

52.description: Given the overwhelming amount of dining options around town this one felt decidedly underwhelming.Nothing particularly inedible but nothing really worthwhile either.Not to mention their suggested cooking times were not even close to nearing a warm temperature.Will not be coming back.

50.description: Food is good, experience is good as well but the quality of the meats is not top notch, they could improve on that. Something that is not correct is that you make a reservation for a given time and they make you wait half an hour.  Reservation time is to be honored no matter what.

4.description: Not your average dining experience. I went with my cousin & we had a great time! It's like a do it yourself Fogo de Chao. It was so cold outside in Chicago so once we sat down we literally started warming our hands over the grill, which was perfect.We ordered the Samurai option for two with the s'mores dessert. Everything was delicious. It was my first time trying the miso soup & the tuna appetizer plus I never had a s'more till this night. Overall highly recommend!

6.description: Good service, okay food.Ordered samurai combo, the meats were just whatever, the miso soup was bland, garlic noodle was just okay, nothing really stood out.
